Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property and Staff”
Reviews.Author: BandG03_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. I travelled March 13 - 20 2012, during busy March break. From our greeting at the front door, refreshing drink, guidance on getting a good room and assistance with luggage etc. Everything was first class. Not an issue all week. Room was on outer side, shaded in the afternoon and close to beach, for easy access. 2nd floor around 1124 - 1118 are just right. Large clean room, great safe, dual sinks, lots hot water. Staff deserve every tip you can afford to give. They all work hard and smile continuously trying to please. People were treated fairly whether tipping or not. Someone mentioned to take a hundred ones and I'd recomend this as no change made at front desk. Minimum wage somewhere around $5 bucks a day. Yes thats right. I slept great knowing I helped these folks who never complained or balked at any requiest. Buffet was awesome. Lots of choices. Lots of seafood. Chillies was a superb steakhouse. Japanese was good, as was Chrystal. Pool bar was staffed by 8 staff daily. Never a wait. Lots of servers around pool and beach. A buck at the the beach keeps you more than properly served. Bring a cooler mug. Pool was large and never crowded. Very clean. Lots of loungers at beach and pool. Lots of natural shade too from the palm canopy. To get front row you had to get out by eight. But it was not necessary to get up early to get a reasonable chair at pool or beach. Shows were ok to. Lots dancing and singing by good musicians. Not over the top and not to long. Enjoyed the downtime relaxing at the show. Social team worked hard, drumming up guests for games. Volleyball was great. Their spirit was genuine and made all kids and adults feel welcome at the events. Overall a geat trip at a great resort with 5 star staff, food and facilities. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Spring break”
Reviews.Author: loristpaul
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the RIU Riviera Maya Palace for spring break. We had five mothers and daughters, and it proved to be an excellent choice. The hotel is beautiful, the lobby spectacular, and the grounds immaculate. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. A special thank-you to Edgar, we had a problem with our flight, the night before we were leaving, and even though he had just gotten off work, he went back behind the desk and time and effort trying to help us resolve the issue. I liked that this resort was a mix of young and old and people from all over. The food was good for an all- inclusive and the buffet is better then the specialty restaurants. I had always heard the wine was terrible at all-inclusives but they had a nice Chilean red Cabernet and Chardonnay. I loved that we could walk the beach into town and that it wasn't overwhelmingly big. The beach is gorgeous and even though it was sold out when we were there, you could always get chairs by the pool and beach. It's also a nice perk that you can go to any of the other RIU'S. All 10 of us agreed that it was the perfect place for a mother daughter spring break!!!

Reviews.Title: “All good but room for improvement in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte A
Reviews.Content: Don't worry about booking this resort, we have been twice and we are really fussy holiday makers. It is a beautiful resort, rooms and grounds are spotless, no bugs or mozzies. Super hot this time of year but not too humid in the evenings which is great. Bar service at the pool and in the evening in fantastic, shows are the usual offering, some really funny but nothing exceptional, we had more fun sat around the lobby bar chatting to people. Food is good both buffet and a la carte, I would give the Brazilian a steer, the worst of all of them. We noticed that since 3 years ago when we travelled last that the premium brand drinks have declined slightly, they still serve Absolout and Smirnoff Vodka but no longer Jack Daniels, only Jim Beam. We booked an upgraded jacuzzi suite as it was our wedding anniversary but dissapointingly when we arrived it wasn't available on our first night, we instead had a suite and he following night was moved to the correct room. If you want one of these rooms I can recommend room 2046 which has a great ocean view and that of the pool and courtyard. The hotel did some things to 'make it up to us', but to me they didn't really go out of their way, not even a note or anything in our room on our anniversary, shame. I think that is what lets this hotel down for me, is that they are catering for the masses and whilst everyone is very friendly they just don't get how to make it special and you feel like you are an individual, small touches could fix this. Also, the gym is useless, really needs updating, only one treadmill working the whole trip (2 weeks), the other squeaked very loudly and the rest of the gym equipment is old and clunky, not easy for my husband to lift weights. Also, we visited the other hotels, the Riviera Maya far outshines all of them, my only wish would be that the hotel would provide a little shuttle bus up and down the road to drop outside each hotel and finally to the end where you can go into Playa Del Carmen. Again, great hotel, great service but personalised service is definitely missing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: scbrown757
Reviews.Content: After much debate, we decided on this hotel. We had been to one of its sister resorts (RIU Playacar) and had mixed reviews. We love the loction, so we thought we'd upgrade to a "5-star" to see if it was better. It was definitely better. The service and the cleanliness of the grounds was excellent! The staff was eager to please - from the front desk to the waiters that offered us drinks on the beach. The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. The rooms were OK. We had two - a standard jr. suite and a "superior" jr.suite. The only difference was the view from the balcony. One looked out over the central pools and gardens and the other had no view at all - just some grass and a privacy fence. If you don't plan to spend much time on your balcony, don't waste extra money on a superior suite. The location is great. It's a pleasant, safe, 15-20 minute walk into interesting Playa del Carmen. We had no concerns about safety at all - either on the resort or in town. The buffet food was very good. The restaurants were good also but don't expect 5-star meals. The wine is served out of a bottle which is a big step up from the casks at Playacar. It's not great quality but it's acceptable. I wish they'd offer more beer variety than the Dos Equis on tap. The pool is very nice. It's a little cramped and noisy with constant entertainment games poolside which for me was a little tiresome. The beach area is spectacular! There were lots of loungers and space either in the sun or under palm trees. You could be on the main beach or the private hotel beach area. The water is clear, beautiful colour with an extensive sandy bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Plac!”
Reviews.Author: kacardenas_12
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The beach and pool were excellent. The buffet restaurant for breakfast and dinner was better than the 2 "specialty" restaurants we had to make reservations for. The Brazilian restaurant had poor service, poor sides and all the meat was way overcooked. The steak restaurant was the same. We couldn't eat at the Japanese restaurant b/c my brother-in-law didn't bring pants. So beware! Otherwise, everything else was fantastic and the other staff very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: LindsT08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 9 - 14 with two other couples. We are all thirty-somethings that like to relax on our vacations and have a good time. This is the second year in a row that we have went to the RIU Palace Rivieria Maya. The service at this resort is amazing. The entire staff waits on you hand and foot. It has a nice beach area and is a brief walk (or a $7 cab ride) to downtown Playa del Carmen. It is in a gated community so we always felt safe. There is also a market area with a Starbucks that you can walk to within 5-10 minutes in this gated community. The room is a decent size however it does have a musty smell (same smell as last year). The food is pretty good, my only complaint is the lunches become boring (almost the same menu for lunch each day). We really enjoyed the steakhouse (Chili's) for dinner. Other member of our group thought that Krystal's was the best. We all had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great beach, great service”
Reviews.Author: knsthompson
Reviews.Content: Our family ( wife, 2 kids ages 8 and 9, parents, sisters and husbands) just gt back from our stay. The service is fantastic and responsive if you are a reasonable person. My daughter celebrated her 8th birthday while we were there and my mother in law her 60th. The staff did a fantastic job making sure their days were fantastic. The food was very good. Buffet was well presented, extensive, and fresh. Botofogo, Chilis, and Agave were all good but limited selections. TIP - contact them before you get there to make up to 2 reservations. Fusion and Japenese are hardest to get so if you want them, these may be the ones to request prior to arrival. The others seemed to have room when we ate there and the resort was at 90% capacity. Bar service was generally good, especially around the pool. The beach was limited or non-existent. TIP - bring your insulated cup. We do whenever we travel south. You can get more quantity and it stays cold instead of turning warm in 10 minutes. The beach was one of the largest and best we have been to. Our kids had no trouble swimming in the ocean and our parents had no problem finding chairs in the shade under a palm tree. The sand was clean and well maintained. The location was great. A short walk to Playa del Carmen for those that want the amenities of a city or to ferry to Cozumel. A 10 minute walk South for our morning Starbucks fix or some shopping. A nice safe neighborhood in which to have a morning run as well. The resort was about 45 minutes from the airport. My only apprehension prior to going was whether this resort would seem to formal or not friendly for the kids. Though not a lot of kids were here while we were, in no way did we feel out of place. I am a compulsive researcher prior to traveling and have utilized this site for years. I have learned to take negative reviews with a grain of salt, as these are usually people with unrealistic expectations and let small things ruin their vacation. Though bad experiences happen, I would take my chances with this place and would not hesitate to book a trip here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ellie96
Reviews.Content: We had a family vacation in october 2011, family flew in from the UK to meet myself and my partner ages ranged from 19-60 years old, 8 of us in total. Pros: nice beach and pool Fantastic location you could walk into Playa De Carmen and around Playa Car which has little markets scattered around Beautiful hotel, quite grand looking nice room with mini bar pretty good service Cons: Maid service was a little spotty sometimes (no big deal) Unfortunatly we had awful weahter for the last 4 days out of 7, I was quite disappointed in the fact that the hotel didn't provide much in the way of entertainment for the bad weather days, you couldn't go into town or walk anywhere as it poured non stop for the four days, with the lack of entertainment there really wasn't much to do other than the sports bar which after a day or two is a little too much. I am not an overly picky eater but have to say I didn't find the food that great, buffet was fine but I can't say I thoroughly enjoyed any of the restaurants. Booking restaurants wasn't too difficult considering there were 8 of us. Would for sure return to the Playacar area, but would try one of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great February Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sunfire30
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace is in the Playacar area which we'd never been in before. Gated area filled with resorts and stand alone homes all packed together, so walking out of the property was easy and was only a 20-30 minute stroll into Playa del Carmen with all the shops & the dock to Cozumel. Resort was very similar to Riu in Guanacaste, Costa Rica which we visited in Dec 2011...identical room furnishings, in-room liquor dispensor, etc. Our room overlooked the courtyard which we liked. Weather was perfect! Grounds are very well maintained and beach was great - plenty of chairs, plenty of palm trees for shade, good service by the pool bar staff who bring trays of drinks for you to choose from, or will take your order. The swim up bar area can get crazy, but the adjacent raised infinity pool was really nice. A few vendors walk the beach selling hats, jewelry and sunglasses, but few and far between and not a nuisance. The size of the resort was smaller than what we've been in previously, but that made getting to your room that much easier/faster. Dinner at the Mexican restaurant was VERY good (had the combo fajitas) and the Brazilan house was a fun experience. Service was very good, particulary Santos and Pedro, bartenders at the pool bar (and elsewhere!). All the staff did a great job. Our Apple representatives were very good too, arranging everything from the airport transfers to the Tulum trip and calling the room the night before departure to remind us when they'd be there. Overall, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Simply AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: JoR50
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are from Vancouver, Canada and have never been on a holiday before. After doing some research and looking at pictures online we decided to stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. What an excellent choice! The resort is located in Playacar (which is a gated community) and not once did we feel unsafe. The resort is absolutely gorgeous. The customer service here is awesome. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. It didn't matter what time of the day it was there was ALWAYS someone fixing or cleaning something. The staff were constantly maintaining the place and making sure everything looked spotless. The pool was awesome! Great swim up bar. There was lots of sun chairs around the pool area and tons on the beach. There was lots of plam trees which made it very tropical and good for some shade. The beach was perfect! Soft white sand and turquoise blue water! The restaurants at the resort were all pretty good. The main buffet was great for breakfast and dinner with lots to choose from. Chillis always had a great buffet for lunch. We went to a few of the specialty restaurants and found the Japanese restaurant to be one of the better ones and I don't even like sushi. Get the deep fried ice cream for dessert it was delicious. The Brazilian restaurant wasn't very good just ALOT of meat. The entertainment was great. They were always getting the guests involved in whatever activity was going on. Either volleyball, dancing, bingo, water aerobics, darts, boccie ball or any other contest they had going on. The courtyard was the place to be after dinner and usually had a band playing until the show started. There was no club at this resort but if you wanted you could go to the Disco at the Riu Tequila which was just down the road. Maybe a 5 minute walk. We checked out the other Riu resorts and saw some monkeys at Riu Yucatan. We did some shopping in Playa Del Carmen which is very close, you can easily walk to 5th Ave from the resort or take a cab. It costs about 70 pesos or $7. Even though this resort is "All inclusive" the staff work extremely hard and are providing you with a service so i suggest you bring extra money to tip. Overall this resort was beautiful and worth every penny and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property!”
Reviews.Author: yesats
Reviews.Content: Great buy for a family vacation! Excellent accomodations, wonderful staff (ALL) great property- Pools, Rooms, Restaurants, Shows-- and did I mention the STAFF! We're going back!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice vacation”
Reviews.Author: DontLikeSnow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from March 1 to March 8. Tour operator was Sunwing and we were flying from Toronto. Having stayed 3 years ago at the Riu Tequila just down the street we were familiar with the Riu setup and Playa del Carmen in general. It's the only southern destination we've ever returned to. Easy access to town, nice beaches and great food make for a pleasing vacation for us. Beautiful lobby greeted us as we entered and very friendly and helpful staff at the reception desk. We checked in to our junior suite, facing north on the outer perimeter of the hotel overlooking "The Reef" hotel. Nice and quiet. The room was very clean with the bedroom (king size bed) on one level and a seating area with Sony LCD flatscreen a couple of steps down. Nice enough room but to be honest I wasn't "wowed". I expected a little more of a Palace. Despite Arriving at 11pm we decided to walk around the grounds and they were truly immaculate. There are two pools - an infinity pool overlooking a regular pool. Both very nice but we preferred the former as it was slightly warmer. Lots of chairs available but the best spots go quickly. Lots of shady spots available under the palm trees for those that need respite from the sun. Swim up pool bar available as well as waiter service. The beach is framed by palm trees on either side for shade and closer to the water it becomes open. It was very windy during our weeks stay and we were happy to have the palm trees provide some protection from the sand whipping across the beach. The beach is very nice. We did find that the ocean floor was very uneven, and in combination with the high waves (due to the wind) and undercurrent meant that you had to be careful. The padding on the beach chairs could do with replacing as some were getting a bit worse for wear. Waiter service is available on the beach closer to the hotel (a fence divides the two sections) but service is a little less frequent than around the pool. Reservations for the specialty restaurants are taken in the south east corner of the lobby bar between noon and 3pm, for the same day and the next. Seatings are at 6.30 and 8.45 (except for the steak restaurant which is 7 and 8.30). We tried the Japanese, Brazilian and Mexican restaurants, the latter two being our favourites. I have always found that the hotels try hard to replicate international flavours but don't quite manage with those cultures that are not similar to their own. E.g. in the Japanese restaurant the sushi had no raw fish - smoked salmon was the closest to raw, and some of the rolls contained cream cheese - a very odd ingredient. The buffet restaurant is excellent for both breakfast and dinner. Lots of options and nobody should have any difficulty finding something that they like. Service in the restaurants and throughout the hotel is excellent and the staff are very friendly - our best experience of any hotel and any southern destination. Claudia, the bartender at the bar where shows are performed was fantastic - very funny and provided excellent drink suggestions and service. We had a few memorable nights propped up at the bar watching the very good shows (Michael Jackson, Broadway and Disco). Internet access is free in the lobby, supposedly for max. 90 minutes but I don't believe it's regulated at all as I was never kicked off. In-room wi-fi costs $10/hour, $15 for 3 hours or $39 for 3 days, although don't quote me on that because I couldn't find it listed anywhere and I'm going on what I was told in person by a staff member. Guests are predominantly Canadian and US with others from South America and Europe. We only encountered one staff member whose English wasn't very good. Guests tend to be on the older side but there's people of all ages staying there. Overall I would definitely recommend the RPRM. Apart from a few minor gripes we were very happy with the hotel. Sunwing on the other hand had a delayed flight to Mexico and another (3 hours) on the return leg - we'll think twice before using them again.

Reviews.Title: “We found Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: SuZztravels
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to spend a week in Febuary! The staff was absolutely amazing to us. My husband wanted to Golf at 4 area courses, the front desk made all the tee times, got him discounts, and cars! The beach was beautiful, turquoise waters, clean , private, palm trees created shade, a shirt 20min. Walk to Playa for some shopping..the accommodations were wonderful, roomy balcony.. We loved it, and will return!

Reviews.Title: “A slight upgrade from the Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: mseifried
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Yucatan and were offered a FREE 3 day upgrade to the Palace Riviera Maya, so we figured why not give it a try. Here are my comparisons to Yucatan. Lobby The Palace is much more grand.... Marble floors vs tile, totally enclosed vs open air, much larger space. The lobby bar has twice as much seating with nicer tables and chairs. Servers will wait on you for drinks vs more self service at the Yucatan lobby. Both offer free WIFI in their lobbies. Rooms The Palace rooms are junior suites with a two level room with a seperate sunken living space with a couch for 3 and flat screen TV. The Yucatan has no couch and has old style TV's. You get the same channels in both. The floors are marble vs tile. We actually had a KING bed vs 2 doubles pushed together and didn't feel the need for a mattress topper at the palace. Both have mini fridges and liquor dispensors. The difference being the Palace bottles are ALL brand names. Absolut, bacardi, Jose and BRANDY.... Yucatan had no brandy. The only downside to the PALACE rooms is that we could hear all the sounds from the long hallways all through the night. This did not happen at Yucatan as the blocks of rooms are small and no interior hallways. You actually get a card for your room key vs an actual KEY at the Yucatan and the safe is electronic with a code vs a lock and key at Yucatan Beaches These resorts share basically the same beach... they are just 500-700m or so away from each other. There are a few hotels between the 2 of them. Both have gorgeous white sand, and beautiful water. There are more Palm trees to lay under at the Palace if you are a shade seeker. Was surprised they didn't offer drink service on the beach. Being a Palace, we were expecting this. It's a long walk from the beach/water to the pool bar. Food We had 1 buffet dinner and 2 ala cartes while we were here. At the buffet they actually seat you vs grabbing your own table at Yucatan. Service slightly more attentive as they seemed to have much more staff. The food quality and how they present it also better. We ate at the Steakhouse and Fancy Gourmet restaurants. Enjoyed BOTH meals. Steak isn't exactly the best I have had but was tasty and cooked properly. They bring a tray of Caesar salad and assorted seafood as well. The wine is actually bottled wine and they will leave the bottle. They offer a Chilean Merlot and Chilean CAB SAV. Again, it was ok but MUCH better wine than the Yucatan. Our fav meal was the Fancy Gourmet. It's a small restaurant but service was awesome and the food was different. Portions are small so if you are a big eater stick to buffet. We had SEA BASS and it was very tasty and well cooked. All the ala carte restaurants offer 2 seatings. 6 and 8:45 I believe.....These need to be booked in the lobby area. We lunched at the restaurant near the beach and they serve very similar food to the Yucatan lunch spot. but they don't allow food to be taken out of restaurant and no barefeet and shirts required I believe - which is not the case at Yucatan Pools Basically they have an Endless pool and the main pool. The main pool is very wide with fountains right in the pool, built in loungers on the 2 ends and a huge pool bar that faces inside to the property. The pools are much bigger than the Yucatan but only 1 pool bar vs 2 at the Yucatan. The pool bar area has seperate horseshoe areas in which you can get a group to sit around and party and drink and thats excatly what happens. The pool bar is VERY lively nd busy ALL day long. Much busier than Yucatan bars. But the bartenders work very hard and you never really have to wait very long for any drink. Tipping will expedite your service:) . There is a 24 hour sports bar in the lobby area. We walked in a few times around midnite and there would be a few young people (20 somethings) there but not a real party place while we were there. I think many walk over to the Tequila disco. The night life is very dead at this resort. The Lobby bar closes at 12:00 whereas the Yucatan Lobby bar is open ALL night till 7:00am. The only place to get drinks after midnight is the 24 hour sports bar. We enjoyed our 3 days here and if you can get a half decent deal here it is definitely an upgrade to the Yucatan. I have reviewed the Yucatan as well if you want to get a more detailed review

Reviews.Title: “Nice value for the money”
Reviews.Author: amyj01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. On the surface, the experience was good. Good service, clean and spacious accommodations. Nice pool. The beach is the greatest benefit--wide,soft sand, easy access and there's space under the palm trees in the shade or directly in the sun depending on your preference. I also never felt like I was sitting elbow to elbow with other guests--something we noticed at other resorts when we walked down the beach. The pool bar is just steps away from the beach and the staff bring drinks around often. Chili's open air restaurant serves lunch and snacks all day next to the pool/bar. There was a good variety of food on the buffets and as it wasn't a busy week, we had no problems getting reservations at 3 of the 5 specialty restaurants throughout the week. We could have eaten at the others but chose to go back to Krystal twice (the best). Breakfast was our favorite meal because you could get made to order omelets, pancakes and french toast. If you stay at this Riu or Riu Palace Mexico a few doors down, you can eat breakfast and lunch at the other Riu's in Playacar. But the food is virtually the same at both. You can't beat the location--it's the best of the Riu resorts in the Playacar complex and closest to town. Just a 15-minute walk past resorts and upscale houses and you're on Playa Del Carmen's 5th avenue. You can get there a few minutes faster on the beach. Five minutes in the other direction there is a quaint little shopping area in the Playacar Complex (complete with Starbucks). The beds were more comfortable than other travellers reported--a nice king. We did ask for the mattress topper when we checked in which housekeeping delivered within minutes. Our maid did an excellent job keeping our room clean and stocked daily. If you want to ensure that your needs are met, do leave a nice tip every day. We asked for extra bottled water and diet soda the first day and didn't have to ask again the rest of the week. The floors and hallways are all tile and are mopped religiously every day. I only had two concerns with this resort--the room, although spotlessly clean, smelled very musty. The smell clung to everthing including my suitcase. In speaking to other guests, they said they have not encountered this in other Caribbean resorts. It was really too hot to leave the sliders open at night to air the room out. My other, bigger complaint is the beach towel policy. They gave each guest a towel card at check in. You could exchange it once per day at the pool for a clean towel. If you lose your card, you pay $20 for another one. There were three days we didn't use the pool or beach. On the last day, we returned from a snorkeling trip to Cozemel at 4 p.m. and were told there were no more clean towels. Our room wasn't close to the pool so I didn't want to waste the time to retrieve a towel from my room. That's unacceptable to me. An upscale all inclusive beach resort should not run out of towels. It may seem small, but I came here to sit on the beach and was really disappointed in the way the Riu horded their towels. The towel boy referred me to the front desk but it was a long walk. When I checked out, the desk staff seemed unconcerned with my complaint saying only with a shrug, 'well maybe we had a lot of people check in that day." But the wait staff in the restaurants were friendly and responsive, always at your elbow to take away your empty plates or bring you another beer or glass of wine. If you are fan of mixed drinks, ask them to pour you a double. Those I had were pretty watered down and I'm not much of a drinker. This is a Dos Equis resort and they serve only two kinds of red Mexican wine--both pretty bad. They do have a Chilean cabernet in Krystal that's better. Several times I got a margarita or daquiri from the pool bar and poured more rum or tequila from the mini bar in our room. Entertainment is over by 11 p.m. and the bars stop serving promptly at midnight. One night we were in the lobby bar surfing the internet and they started turning the lights out on us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent on both visits 2008 & 2010”
Reviews.Author: CJWO80
Reviews.Content: On both visits to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya I experienced excellent service from all staff in addition to a fantastic range of food and activites. I would not hesitate to recommend the RPRM, it is a great resort with excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: bedhead57g
Reviews.Content: We went in August 2011. Sorry for the belated review. This website provides lots of valuable tips so we want to reciprocate. Most of the reviews are subjective so I’ll attempt to keep it brief. We’re intelligent enough to realize that a 5-star resort in Mexico isn’t comparable to a 5-star in Canada/USA. Ignore the majority of the negative feedback. I believe these people have unrealistic expectations for the price they paid. We picked this resort based on the following: close proximity to Playa del Carmen (20 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride), fabulous beach, consistently great weather, decent price and previous experience at a RIU Palace (Cabo). This was our second time staying in the Playacar area in the past five years so we knew the lay of the land. This is a gated community (similar to Florida) with at least a dozen resorts, condos and a golf course. Very safe. I believe the RIU chain has five properties (not all on the ocean) in this community which you have reciprocating privileges. We previously stayed at the Iberostar Quetzal Playacar which was decent and a few resorts down. The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is the nicest resort in this area. Very stately and architecturally impressive. The only neighboring resort that would be comparable is the Royal Hideaway (more expensive, adults only, no swim-up bar, no hobie cats, no buffet). We emailed the resort ahead of time and requested a third floor room and made two dinner reservations. palace.rivieramaya@riu.com Room: We stayed in room # 2135 which was on the third floor. It was classified as garden view and overlooked a neighboring property not the courtyard. Very quiet and clean. Room was a little musty but expected in a tropical location. Bring some air fresheners. Room was nicely appointed. Bed was firm but comfortable. Never saw a bug. Air conditioning worked great. Safe worked great. No issues with theft. Lots of towels. Bar fridge stocked daily. Leave housekeeping a decent daily tip and you won’t have a problem. We didn’t receive turn down service nor did we expect it. Only complaint is the heaviness of the doors that would automatically close behind you. The sound of doors slamming in the middle of the night would carry in the tiled hallway. I blame this on inconsiderate guests. Food: Decent but the RIU Palace Cabo was much better. Great breakfast buffet. Try the cappuccino. As previously stated we emailed the resort ahead of time and made two dinner reservations. All other reservations are made at noon in the lobby bar up to three days in advance. No problem getting reservations. Krystal was the standout restaurant. We ate here twice. The Mexican restaurant was good. Buffet good. Lunch was adequate. No poolside BBQ which we’ve experienced at other resorts. We enjoyed dinner at two other establishments in town to experience some local culture. Sur and Cenacola. Both were excellent. Beach: Oustanding. Sadly after our last stay (five years previous) the beach was wiped out by a hurricane. It’s back and better then ever! No problem securing a lounge chair under a palm tree. Didn’t have to get up early to play the towel game. Beautiful turquoise water. Perfect for swimming- not too rough, sandy bottom, no seaweed. Went for a walk every morning. Even pit stopped at few other resorts for a refreshing beverage. Look at all the other resorts on the beach and you’ll see the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is the nicest. A few vendors on the beach but they never hassled you. Borrow the complimentary snorkel gear and grab some bread from the buffet. When facing the ocean, turn right and walk past the last resort (Sandos). There is a reef about 50 feet from shore in 15 ft deep water. Tons of tropical fish. We took a hobie cat out a few times. Amazing. We would sit on a lounge chair at night with a bottle of champagne and enjoy the sound of the waves. Pool: Gorgeous. Pool was great for a refreshing dip. Looked like the towel game was in full swing reserving loungers early in the AM. Didn’t bother us as the beach is one of the nicest in the world. Who wants to sit beside a pool all day? Can do that at home. Bars: Swim up bar was busy. Only complaint is people leaving their ten year old kids there all day unsupervised. We brought Bubba Kegs from home thus preventing numerous trips back to the bar or having to wait servers to come around. We tipped generously and received excellent service. If you feel the drinks are watered down, tell them. They’ll put more alcohol in them. No problem. The lobby bar had a decent crowd at night. Perfect for grabbing a bottle of champagne or an after dinner drink. Playa del Carmen/ 5th Avenue: The number one reason to stay in this area of Mexico. A 5-minute-$7-cab-ride (non negotiable) or a 20 minute walk in the sweltering heat. We went every night after dinner. It’s a pedestrian only roadway lined with bars, restaurants, cafes, clothing and jewelry stores. Majority of businesses are air conditioned which would provide welcome relief. Lots to see and do. Tons of tourists. Great to experience the local culture. Police presence everywhere. They know tourism is their bread and butter. Very safe. We ate here twice. Sur and Cenacola. Both excellent. Taxis are plentiful. Resort Property: Impeccably maintained. Never utilized the gym (on vacation). Never was around to experience any of the night time entertainment. Service was excellent. If you tip they’ll remember you and bend over backwards to please. Beautiful open square courtyard which would have different activities each night: craft and jewelry vendors, a guy playing a Spanish guitar, casino night. Free WiFi in the lobby but it is slow and sometimes difficult to get connected. Grab a drink at the bar and check your email. Go with an open mind. Relax. You’re on vacation. Not everything will go smoothly. Don’t sweat the small stuff and be that obnoxious, arrogant tourist that everyone loathes. A few bucks in tips goes a long way. These people make a pittance. If you can’t afford to bring 100 US $1 dollar bills for tips then you shouldn’t go on vacation. If you want a true 5-star experience book the Four Seasons and pay double the price. Never did any tours this time as they chew up your whole day. Bring sunscreen from home. It is very expensive in the gift shop. We would recommend this resort and stay here again. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: grierju
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was all inclusive and had a variety of 7 different restaurants. If I had done more research I would have stayed at a different resort. The all inclusive aspect is a bit misleading and I will explain why. The equipment is all inclusive, but not the full use of the equipment. We were able to get the equipment for snorkeling but was only allowed to snorkel within a confined area at the beach, limited to about 50 yards in length and 20 yards in width, this area has no fish or coral to view, so quite pointless. Other all inclusive resorts we have stayed at actually take you out on snorkeling trips at no cost. To go out on a trip would have cost at a minimum of $39 pp. The 7 restaurants are not all inclusive in the sense that you can go and eat at these restaurants at any time of the day for any meal. Only 2 of the restaurants were this way and they were the buffet meals. The other 5 required reservations which could only be made between the hours of 12-3pm, which we had trouble with since we were on excursions during these times, and there were no exceptions to this rule. The staff was hit and miss in attentiveness and politeness. The front desk and bell hops were exceptional in their service but the bartenders and service people were not so much. I would go to a bar and be the only one there and would have to wait for the bartenders to finish their conversations before being attended to. Overall service was quite disappointing. The beach was very nice and well kept, they actually bury the seaweed to keep it nice and clean. The room was well kept and good in size. The tv was old and small. The shower was great. The bed was big but the pillows were quite bad. The area of the hotel was very nice and the grounds well kept. The events that they had were fun including fake casino games, occasional vendors for shopping, and dancing to name a few. The only benefit to staying at a Riu resort in my opinion is that they allow you to visit the other Riu resorts at no cost and even allow you to eat at the other resort restaurants, except for dinner, you cannot have dinner at the other resorts. In conclusion, the beach, the room, and the area were nice but the services and restaurants were poor which is what we looked forward to the most.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Stand-Alone
Reviews.Content: We travelled from February 9-16, 2012. We flew out of St Louis on Frontier Airlines. This was our first time flying Frontier. We opted to pay thru Apple for the extra leg room which was $20.00 per person. It was worth the price. You received your lunch box as well as two alcoholic drinks. I can't same enough good about Frontier. They have televisions in front of each seat. We did the non-stop transfers to our hotel. We had to wait about an45 min to an hour before a taxi came to take us to the hotel. We Checking in at the hotel was a breeze. Our room was not large but very nice. We were in room 3069 and it overlooked the courtyard. The beer of choice is DosEquis. It was always cold. If you want the topshelf alcohol, you have to ask for it. The food was very good. We ate at the Steak restaurant and the Japaense. Both were very good. The steak was very tender at the Steak restaurant. My husband wore jeans and a collared shirt and did not have any problems getting into the restaurants. It is about a 20 minute walk on the beach to Playa Del Carmen. The food at the buffet was very good. We would definitely return. The grounds at the resort are very well maintained. Free internet wifi in the lobby or you can pay $8.00 for an hour in the sportsbar. The service was very good. If you needed anything, they would be there in 5 to 10 minutes. The weather was good but the evenings were a bit cool so a sweater might be necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, food, and service set this apart from other resorts”
Reviews.Author: almostforty
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 kids, ages 7 and 10 stayed at Riu Palace RM 2/18-2/25/12. This was our third trip to the area in 3 years. We all loved the resort and its location. You will not find a nicer beach, with beautiful warm water, and plenty of chairs in both sun and shade. The food was very good. On Sunday night the buffet served grilled jumbo shrimp and lobster tail that was phenomenal. Generally, the buffet food is better than that at the restaurants. We ate at the Japanese restaurant which was our favorite, as well as Krystal, which was good, not great. Drinks at the resort were very good, and you can always get top shelf liquor if you ask. We found the wine to be drinkable, not good, but not bad either. The room was always very clean and comfortable. Beds a bit small and very firm. They gave us a rollaway bed, as the four of us (and we are thin people) would not have fit in 2 double beds comfortably. We had an upgraded junior superior suite with an extra large balcony overlooking the plaza on the second floor. The service at the resort, from the front desk staff, waiters, housekeeping, EVERYONE was outstanding. Luigi, who is part of the entertainment staff looked after my 10 year old son and some other boys he met, without making them feel like they were being looked after. He even ate lunch with them, and kept them entertained playing soccer, volleyball, ping pong, darts, and bocce ball, all of which are located on the beautiful beach. Many of the staff went out of their way to make a connection with their customers. We were able to use the resorts complimentary boogie boards and kayaks for one hour a day. Contrary to other reviews, we found the pool to be clean and warm. Most days I did reserve chairs by 7am, otherwise the pool loungers were taken, and I wanted to be able to watch over my kids as they swam, since there are no lifeguards. There were always open chairs on the beach. The entertainment in the theater at night was fair, with the Michael Jackson show standing out as the best. I would've been happy to go to bed early, but each night our kids insisted on going to the theater. Overall, this was an outstanding family vacation. I highly recommend Riu Palace RM!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jean M
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at a Riu Palace in Playa del Carmen, Previously we stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico., This was our first stay at the Riviera Maya, and we had a wonderful 10-day stay from Feb 3 through.12. We had high expectations because of our previous trips in 2001 and 2003, and we were not disappointed. The Riviera Maya was even nicer than the Mexico. The grounds, rooms and public areas were lovely and meticulously maintained at both resorts. We were, again, impressed by the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. Two weeks after our return, the following stand out: the excellent food and its presentation at all five specialty restaurants and the ease of making reservations for them, the breakfast buffet, the poolside fresh fruit cart, the cute towel animals left by the housekeeping staff, and the free 5-min. massage offered by the Spa staff. Lomas Travel was our on-site travel company, and we thoroughly enjoyed working with Hernan who presented us with a variety of options for day trips, listened to our ideas ,booked the trip we wanted to take, and did not pressure us in any way. My husband booked 6 dives with Scuba Caribe, the on-site dive shop and was very pleased with Lisa who helped book his trips and Javier, one of the master divers. We did not encounter any of the major problems expressed by other reviewers. Upon our arrival, there was a slight mix-up about our room locations (we were 2 couples traveling together), but that was fairly quickly remedied by the front desk staff. All in all, it was a wonderful vacation, and we would highly recommend this resort to anyone visiting the Playa del Carmen area. We are already looking forward to a return visit!

Reviews.Title: “Tips to ensure a "5 star" experience...”
Reviews.Author: natreb
Reviews.Content: 1) Embrace the buffet: Unlike most resorts the buffets are better than the a la carte. 2) Embrace the breeze: Yes as many people comment, there is a musty smell. We brought aromatherapy candles and opened the balcony doors once the mid-day heat was gone. No smell at all and wonderful ambience. 3) Embrace the local ATM and keep it simple. Like others, we had money taken from our safe. Don't bring anything at all of value with you. 4) Embrance the beautiful setting and make it special: We made this trip extra memorable by renewing our vows in the gazebo. Fabulous job Patricia to make this a beautiful event. This resort exceeded our expectations and they were confirmed as we visited other resorts north and south of the Riu! It is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: KieranW W
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good trip, beautiful weather perfect beach and friendly staff. Some of the staff arn't very fluent in English (Front desk primarily) so if you experience problems at check-in ask kindly for a manager as they are more fluent. Snacks are very limited so order room service if you miss the dinning hours. You can only book the a la cartes the day before so if you're planning on doing lots of excursions as I did you may be out of luck for dinning here. The guy that does the spray paint art is simply amazing and I highly recommend you watch him as he makes the art, leaves you wondering how he does it. The maids do beautiful towel art and if you consistenly tip them you will get more and more everyday (5 USD+). When you get ready for the day simply move your towel art off the bed and onto the coffee table and when you get back you will have the original and an additional towel animal placed on your bed upon your arrival after it has been cleaned. DO NOT BOOK EXCURSIONS through the hotel as I found them to be 25-50% more expensive. Instead get an idea of pricing from your rep in the lobby bar and then take that price to the hut in the playacar plaza and they will give you a way better deal. *Tip* walk along the beach and visit the other riu's and be happy you chose this one as it is superior. If you want premium liquor ask for it, especially in the lobby bar as they have no problem handing over shot after shot of don julio, etc. Don't tip the bartenders drink after drink simply tip a good amount 5-10USD after a few rounds...they will remember you :)

Reviews.Title: “Will vacation here again”
Reviews.Author: ksmits20
Reviews.Content: Our second Riu Palace experience, this time Riviera Maya. We wanted a relaxing, plan our day when we get up each day, vacation. Riu Palace Riviera Maya was the perfect place for us. Plenty to do at the resort, lots of lounge chairs both at the pool and on the beach, and close enough to town to walk over and enjoy the shopping and restaurants.Many excursions available to enjoy the local culture and history. We went in January and were a bit worried how the weather would cooperate, but no worries, weather was 80's every day. Riu Palace service is excellent, bar service and quality very good. We enjoyed the food, dinners at the buffet were good, not outstanding. Overall, had a really fun time at a beautiful resort and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect size, great service”
Reviews.Author: JC_Reyes
Reviews.Content: This all-inclusive resort is the perfect size...not too small and not too big. The beach and pool areas are beautiful and clean. Families are friendly. This is NOT a party hotel. If you want to relax and be well taken care of, this staff is amazing at making sure you get the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint”
Reviews.Author: TCMI
Reviews.Content: This was our first "all inclusive" getaway. Loved every minute of it. Staff was wonderful and service beyond our expectaions. The grounds are beautiful and the location is close enough to town that you can walk. Even the meals were great. We booked our trip and got a wonderful deal through Book-it.com. Not sure I'd want to bring my young children here, but there appeared to be plenty for them to do. Be prepared to see some topless gals sunning themselves. Nobody was ever asked to cover themselves, but they weren't flaunting their "goods" either. Great area with hammocks and chairs with plenty of shade as well as a beach area for full sun. More than enough room to sprawl out and relax. Be sure to sign up for a couple of excursions while there to places like Tulum or the area nature parks.

Reviews.Title: “5 star property ..3 star food”
Reviews.Author: Schmootz
Reviews.Content: Well sorry Riu ..not 5 star. Definitely 5 star property and staff but the food was nowhere near. Actually my best meal was at the Cancun airport before going home. This may seem a bit whiney but when you read something and expect something its nice if they are true. First of all I must warn you that if you get a room near an ice machine go right back to the front desk. Why they didn’t put this in its own room I don’t know but they decided to put it a tiled echo chamber which just loves the sound of the door slamming shut at 3 am. Not to mention the bar staff emptying it two to three times a day. Beer lovers beware!! Only DosXX as there is no other choice. Another flaw for families with kids is that you have to walk through the beach bar to get to the beach. Some may not like to expose their kids to this. If you want a spot in the pool get there early or have a designated pool grabber in your group that get up really early. For the food ..Stick with the buffet as I was not too impressed with the specialty restaurants. I didn’t try the fusion or the Japanese but after the others I just went straight back to the buffet. Room service..don’t do it either. Take a 5 minute walk to Starbucks for some real coffee. There are a lot of positives to this property. This is very safe area and walking downtown is a breeze and a nice change. You will get haggled to go into shops so be prepared. As I said earlier, the property is beautiful and the staff is excellent. It almost semed to me that they wanted to do more but were not allowed. The beach is large, clean and in a perfect spot but don’t expect drink service. I know that all the drinks are free but don’t be stingy..Tip!!! You will get your drinks faster and they deserve it. Would I go there again….Yes because I know what to expect and what to avoid but would definitely look at other options. If this is 5 star then I need to look for the 7 star

Reviews.Title: “Best all-inclusive I've ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: FunGirl22
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay!Hotel,beach,views and food amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “More than we ever dreamed of”
Reviews.Author: SuM2012
Reviews.Content: Hotel is like a palace and you are treated like kings and queens. We were upgraded in our room choice and we loved it. Rooms 2017 & 2019 over look the courtyard and are very quiet. Important to stay away from end Rooms near the lobby or Chilies restaurant. You drink and eat all day if you want . They even bring drinks out on the beach or sometimes pizza! My husband loved the gymn and I loved snorkeling and shell hunting. I walked for miles! No problem getting lounge chairs on beach but around the pool is tougher. We didn't spend much time at the pool, it's hotter there unless you want to stay in the pool and sit on numerous places they have, even at the bar. The walk to 5th ave. Is easy either by sidewalk which takes you by some Mayan ruins and has paths that go on and on like a park or walking the beach there. Lots of iguana! 5th ave is fun for shopping and be hard nosed when people approach you, just keep walking. This is located at the first pier where the ferries to Cozumel board or unload. We did take a ferry over and a jeep tour. Would not recommend the jeep tour! Wasn't really impressed with Cozumel. If you walk out the front door of the hotel, go left and you will find lots of shops and markets. Then when you leave there just go across the street to another riu and have a drink. You can go to any of the riu's and get the same free drinks, breakfast or lunch. I also love to bird watch but didn't take a lot of time doing it. Where the gymn is , there is also a spa which is extra. Then there is a cold and hot jucuzzi at your convenience. As for food we loved the buffet and the brazil Ian restaurants. Chilies was ok and really good for breakfast and lunch. Sometimes they would do burgers, ribs etc on the beach. We loved this vacation and will go back. We went thru Funjet and they are there two different times of the day to answer ?? Or help set you up with tours. You must make reservations for the evening dinners except the buffet. You can also not have a reservation and check any restaurant for no shows and you can get in. Bring your iPad and go to the lobby for WiFi.. My husband was there every day checking markets and keeping abreast of the world! The people here work really hard and you would be surprised at how much they do by labor vs. Machines. Although you don't have to tip, you may feel compelled to do so at times. If you are a shell hunter or bought heavy items, be sure you weigh your luggage before you get to the airport. They have a small scale at the lobby desk. If you are over the weight limit it is very expensive!!!! Can't say snuff good things about it, go,go,go. Forgot to add, the wine is not very good.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya - February 1-8, 2012”
Reviews.Author: SkierInAvon
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this Riu with the wife a few times. We like it. Great Beach, food is good, grounds well maintained and lots of Palm Trees for shade (if you want them) near the edge of the beach. All inclusive of course. New for 2012 - they fixed the free WiFi in the Hotel's lobby. It now runs as it should. It's fast enough now to allow your Vonage application on your iPhone to make super-cheap phone calls from Mexico back to the U.S. ~2cents a minute. Sailing is #1 for me and I stay here because they have the (all included) Hobie Cats you can sail right off the beach. When you stay at this Riu you also have privileges at the other 4 Riu Resorts just down the beach from the Riu Palace. VIDEO! Condition of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya Beach 2012 vs. 2010. In February 2010 the Mexican Government paid to rebuild the beach in Playa Del Carmen. Here is the YouTube video I shot just after the 2010 beach re-construction.... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dfN4s11gM1E This February 2012 two years later I shot another YouTube video to see how much beach erosion had taken place. The good news is the beach is still in good shape! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=diix7qeXtKg&feature=youtu.be

Reviews.Title: “Best all inclusive yet”
Reviews.Author: ScotRPh
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling with the same group of people for 10 years now and haved stayed mostly at all inclusive resorts.this is definitely the best yet. We have stayed at many others including Riu Montego Bay. The place is just beautiful and food and drink were better than most . The real difference here was the people, they were friendly , outgoing and would do anything to make your stay better. The 8 of were truly impressed and are planning out next trip back already.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring Tennis Rackets”
Reviews.Author: Beggg
Reviews.Content: Stupid title I know, but it’s something I’ve not read on any advice giving website before. The issue worked out ok, but folks planning to bring tennis rackets into Mexico (at least into Cancun) should know that two of the other couples with us easily and without issue brought rackets onto the country as carry-on items, but were prohibited from exiting the country in a similar fashion. They had to stuff them into checked luggage while at the American Airlines counter in one case and were rejected at security in the other. In both instances, the rackets went via checked luggage on the return fligh. Not a catastrophe, but surely an inconvenience following a very good vacation. Just be aware. This is the second time for us with the Riu chain. It was a great place to relax, with no real drama anywhere. The place is kept immaculately clean and orderly. We’ve been to several all inclusives, and this ones food selection and in-room soda/liquor was superior. The staff was very attentative and unobtrusive. Check out and in was easy (we were Tuesday to Tuesday). We used Apple Vacations which provided the best price and a very convenient aircraft to hotel direct limo service (really a van). I recommend it. All in all – a good value. The beach was large and most folks spent their time there, though we stayed at the one and only pool. There were diversions and excursions to be had, but we just chilled. Weather in early February beats the cold of the northeast US any day. We’ll go back to Riu.

Reviews.Title: “This was my first riu palace trip”
Reviews.Author: Brian K
Reviews.Content: I had noticed this hotel the last time I was in playa. So my next trip me and my uncle booked it. Now this was when it first opned way back when, but looking at the current reviews it is still up to par, although now have added the other riu palace riviera. Food to notch, liked the brazilian steak house. Pools here are a little smaller than some of the other palaces I have stayed at. The best part of the whole package is the friendliness of the staff, and the beach. The beach is unreal, super from the hotel to the beach as far as length. A massive area. Best beach I have ever stayed at. Keep in mind this is an older experience, but it beats all to heck the beach at the Las America's in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: TRACY9031
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed here Feb 5th to the 12th. The beach is beautiful always calm and clear. Our room was always cleaned and stocked. Always found something to eat at the buffet and enjoyed the restaurants. Wish I was still there . I enjoyed it so much i booked another trip, but this time a 6 apple square deal , we leave on the 26th .

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: linT2807
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatly our first impression was disapiontment, as our room was in a terrible position. They did move us the next day but after a 12 hour flight it was'nt what we expected, This seemed to be what most of the thomson guests were experiancing unless they had booked jaccuzi sites. The rooms are tired and out dated.After all this the hotel is great staff are fantastic, and food is too good if you know what i mean!.We asked if we could have a bottle of gin in our room and the bar manager gave one to my husband.ESPN in bedrooms which was a treat for my hubby as he is sport mad, although on saying that it was a shame that on the night of the superbowl all entertainment was cancelled to accommodate the screens for the game, which is ashame if your not a sports fan. Your clothing do get damp but meeting somene who was in a jacuzi suite said they hadnt found that to be so. this hotel has a few issues but nothing is too much trouble for the staff, and if you can get a bargin to this hotel i say go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice holiday but overall disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: alison_empson
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from 2 weeks at the riu palace riviera maya. Overall a nice holiday. Rooms were comfortable and although others complained that there is alot of noise from the corridors at night, we didnt have a problem with this (room 2129). We were facing another complex and I think these rooms are possibly quieter than facing the courtyard. However did find the clothes in the wardrobe felt damp. There was also no lighting in the lounge area or balcony so if you want to sit out in the evening you have to sit in the dark! Location was nice and the beach was lovely but unfotunately we had several days when the sea was too rough to go in. Close to playa del carmen shops (20 min walk) and a small parade of shops (10 mins) if you turn left out of the hotel. Didnt like the pool area at all. All the beds around the pool were reserved early leaving only the shady beds which if you are a sun worshipper, as I am, is a disappointment. Also very noisy around the pool bar with animation team activities continuously throughout the day. I like some peace and quiet in the day so preferred the beach. The food in the buffet restaurant offered a reasonable choice but some evenings better than others. Not enough sea food on offer. Breakfasts offered a good choice and lunch could either be taken in the buffet or Chillis restaurant. Didnt like the Brazillian restaurant (food very salty) or Krystals (just not my taste), Chillis, the Mexican and Japanese were all pretty good. The lobby bar was very nice, cocktails lovely and waiters very attentive. Never had to wait long for a drink! The staff throughout the complex were all very friendly. The complex was very clean but I really do not think the floor needs to be swept in the evening while you are eating (this happened both times we went to Chillis restaurant). Overall had a nice holiday but I wont be in a hurry to go back. Have been to some much nicer hotels and destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay! Everything was gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: MauiBeachBabe
Reviews.Content: My trip to the Rui Palace Riveria Maya was amazing! It holds a special place in my heart as my fiance proposed to me on the beach in front of the resort! We stayed at the resort during the first week of December 2010, for his brother's wedding. This was my first time staying in an all-inclusive and I definitely think I was spoiled. The resort is stunning! The grounds are perfectly manicured and it's extremely clean! Our room was located on the third floor of the four-story building. We really liked how the resort was much smaller than many others we've seen or heard about. We were never more than a 2 minute walk from any of the restaurants, lobby or pool. Every member of our family had nothing but great things to say about their stay. The staff were unbelievably friendly and got to know our family by name which made us feel extra special. Unlike some other resorts that I've heard have the same buffet food everyday, the buffet had endless choices and rarely did we see a dish repeated throughout our stay. We ate at the Mexican restaurant one evening and everyone loved the food and drinks. The wedding reception was held at Chili's (the restaurant where lunch is served) and once again everyone liked the food. The bar at the pool aptly named "Daiquiri" made the most delicious drinks and the bar inside the lobby made wonderful Spanish coffees which we'd have after dinner most nights.The entertainment was great as well. The night of the wedding we all watched the Michael Jackson show which was amazing! The pool is beautiful and enormous (coming from someone who's a competitive swimmer and has swum in a lot of pools)! It was a little cold, but we spent most of our time on the beach and in the ocean. We also loved how the resort was very close to Fifth Avenue (less than a 10 minute walk) which is the shopping hub in Playa del Carmen. The resort was also a five minute walk from a number of shops and the cutest Starbucks you've ever seen! Something we all really liked was how safe we felt throughout our stay. I personally don't think Mexico is the safest place to travel and two weeks before our trip a big resort in Playa del Carmen had a massive explosion and a number of people died. We were so happy that the Rui was located in Playacar where there was high security and any vehicle entering or exiting the area had to pass through a check-point and provide identification. I'm not sure how I'll ever be able to stay at another resort that doesn't have a five-star rating after our trip here! I would highly recommend the Rui Palace Riviera Maya to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Just another day in "Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: TylerTexan69
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd year in a row to stay at a Riu Palace resort, others have been Cancun & Costa Rica. I have never been disappointed by the quality of the food, the friendliness of the staff, the beautiful grounds, the room or much of anything. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was our favorite due to the beach, never had to wait for a lounge chair, choice of full sun or under the wonderful palm trees. Not much of a pool person anyway so I didn't care about saving a lounger by the pool. The only wish I would have had for this resort versus the other 2 is the availability of the elevators being at one end of the complex and not the other. So if you have a room with a view of the sea & the top of the palm trees you have to walk a long way to the elevators that are located up by the lobby. I wouldn't complain at all if I didn't have bad knees and had to use the stairs more than I wanted but again I would go back to this resort (maybe with new knees)

Reviews.Title: “simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: susan w
Reviews.Content: me and my family stayed at this hotel and its phenomenal! its a prime location , the foods to die for and i strongly recommend this hotel , its friendly , the staff are amazing it was just the perfect holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more for our honeymoon......”
Reviews.Author: LeanneM85
Reviews.Content: A bit if a late review - we actually went May 2010. Amazing 5 star hotel!! Beautiful hotel and surroundings. Room was spotless and spacious with a view of the pool and beach. Pool was fabulous - loved relxing in the jacuzzi right next to the pool bar - service from the waiters was 1st class. Plenty of choice in the restaurants - we especially enjoyed the Japanese restaurant and the main buffet restaurant. It was great having the choice to explore and use the other riu hotels in the resort - we went to the night club at the riu tequila and it did not disappoint. Felt very safe and looked after. Would go back in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Riu palace Mayan riviera”
Reviews.Author: dross-7
Reviews.Content: My husband and just returned from a visit at the Riu palace we have been to the Riu palace mexico just down the beach from this one, this is the newer one and is set up pretty much the same except for the pool is larger and you can see the beach from. The rooms are nice, they do have two double beds put together and a step down to small couch with a table , we had a balcony with 2 chairs. The food is good, they have food available at all times. The a la carte restaurants you need reservations for. Each day at noon in the lobby bar is when you can make up to 2reservations. It's about a 2 minute walk into town.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DaretoDreamTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks with eight friends and really enjoyed this resort! Perfect location and a short cab ride to Playa del Carmen! The pools were awesome and the beach was enjoyable as well. Restaurants and buffet was great however, I really wish Riu would change their reservation system for the reservable restaurants. No complaints about the food or variety of food although by the end of two weeks, it does get repetitive. Rooms were beautifully decorated but some nights the hallways were rather loud with drunk guests trying to make their way to their rooms. The halls echoed alot! The grounds are expansive, beautiful and well kept. The property was well taken care of. While we were there, we walked to the other Riu's in the area and checked them out. Riu Palace Riviera Maya is definitely the first class, top of the line resort that it claims to be. The staff was friendly and welcoming and we always felt we were coming home when we arrived back from our excursions. I highly recommend this resort and I believe it is a first class resort with amazing amenities. As a travel agent I would feel totally comfortable sending clients to this beautiful resort!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelJunkieToo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 nights - and overall we were impressed with the place. We requested for an upgrade but denied as the receptionist told us that the hotel was quite full during our stay. We were given room facing the neighboring resort which is OK since it was very quiet and close to the lobby. Some positive aspects are: excellent wait staff, great beach, safe location, relaxing piano bar, varied nightly entertainment, very clean. We were lucky to get reservation at different a la carte restaurants but were pretty much disappointed at how salty all of the food were. i think it's better if we would have just used the main dinner buffet. We also noticed that there is a limited selection of seafood- fish, shrimps, clams, lobster, crab legs. If you are a meat lover then this is an excellent place for you. The other thing worth mentioning is that this hotel is not good for singles as most visitors are family or couples. WIFI can be difficult to connect from 5-7pm as most people are in the lobby using it. other times are ok.

Reviews.Title: “Amaaaaaazing!”
Reviews.Author: TiMo8291
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this place. We stayed in a jacuzzi suite and it was potentially the best hotel room I have ever been in. The staff here are soooo frendly, the beach is one of the best ever, and the food, aah the food - I gained 5kg after I stayed at this place for only 4 days! And I'm a very fussy eater - the Brazilian wasn't that good though, stay away from that. Plus it's a nice walk away from 10th av in playa. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property; Excellent Service. Headed Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFLA
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, I did not know what to expect upon my arrival. However, I must say that for my entire 6 night stay, I was simply amazed at the level and quality of service provided from the moment I arrived to the moment that I checked out. In addition, the overall quality of the property, the attention to details within the rooms and grounds areas, and the abundance of amenities within the resort give the property a great personal touch that makes it a wonderful place to be surrounded by while vacationing. The pool and adjacent areas were meticulously cleaned several times per day, as were all other common areas. Also, the rooms were cleaned at least two times per day, and turndown service was standard. The standard rooms, which are all junior suites, were nicely appointed, and came fully stocked with everything one could possibly need during their holiday away from home. Each restaurant offered quite nice food selections, however our least favorite was the steakhouse, but this was just out of personal preference. Believe it or not, the dinner buffet was one of the best ones that one might encounter at an all-inclusive! The pool and beautiful beach overlooking the stunning turquoise waters were always stocked with an abundance of chairs for the taking, and we encountered no problems securing the perfect spot on any occasion. Again, service at these areas for drinks was impeccable, and the servers were super friendly! **The ONLY negative that we encountered at the property is the LACK of wifi in the rooms. To use wifi, you must be in the hotel lobby, which is a bit of an inconvenience, but not really that big of a deal. Other than that one minor glitch, there were no other complaints to speak of. Overall, great trip...would highly recommend to anyone headed to Playa del Carmen. The serenity and peaceful atmosphere there is one of a kind, and you are sure to have a fantastic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great- had my Iphone and bottle of perfume stolen”
Reviews.Author: meeleymoo
Reviews.Content: Pros- very friendly staff, wide white sand beach decent food in speciality restaurants esp Japanese Cons- Really poor Mexican food and small tequila selectionCheap uncomfortable chaises ie KMart. No bars near the restaurants so you couldn't get a real drink at lunch or dinner only wine and beer No security cameras so really watch your stuff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Playa Riu Palace-Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Will P
Reviews.Content: First time at this resort/hotel, I was very impressed with the layout of the facility and continually amazed at how clean it was. We ate at Agave twice for dinner because it was so good, and at the Brazilan restaraunt, forgot the name. The breakfast and lunches were also really good, buffet style, everything was fresh and authentic. It seemed like everyone who worked there, was on their "A" game all the time, very friendly, someone was always cleaning something! The location was great, right outside the pool area is a beautiful strip of beach, and you could walk the beach in either direction and see other resort/hotels or you could walk the beach to the 5th avenue to take in some local shopping or hop a ferry to Cozumel. Would recommend this to others for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: nolasaints1973
Reviews.Content: I cant believe some of the bad comments i read here... This is a great hotel, great location, food is simply to die for and the staff is nice. Staff couls be friendlier but still, its a great hotel. Some people werent made for traveling....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, shame about the location, birds and tip seeking”
Reviews.Author: jym225d
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at one of the RIU Palaces in three consecutive years. Our initial two visits were to the RIU Palace, Punta Cana, Dominican Republic, so in this review I’ll compare the two, as they are both Caribbean RIU resorts. General This Mexican RIU Palace is a beautiful hotel, with well-maintained gardens and large junior suites. However, despite being in a gated community, the frontage of the hotel was disappointing. The road leading to it contained numerous small ‘haciendas’, many having boards stating ‘for sale’ or ‘to let’ and with some looking a little run down. Not a pleasant sight. Compare this to the frontage of the RIU Palace Dominican Republic, where the hotel is in a smart gated community, reached via lush vegetation and with the hotel being at the end of the road, rising like a great palace in the distance. Arrival When we arrived, there was no porter at the doors of the hotel (apparently his day off!!), so we had to lug our own cases to the hotel reception, where we were asked if we would like a drink, whereas at the RIU Palace Punta Cana, we were greeted warmly, helped with our cases and drinks were automatically brought to us. After some delay, we were escorted to our room, but the porter just hung around in the room staring at us waiting for a tip. This was no surprise, as the taxi driver from the airport had a large notice at the front basically instructing you to tip him, this being placed over a large wine glass containing some money, just to give you the idea! We found it unpleasant to be made to feel like cash cows. Compare this to the RIU Dominican Republic, where we had a lovely taxi ride with no begging for a tip and no pressure to give a tip when our bags were taken to our room. Food As usual, the food was exceptional, with the various themed restaurants being available if required, although the main buffet restaurant has more choice. I had the best roast lamb I’d ever tasted in the main restaurant. We tried the Brazilian Restaurant, but were not impressed. You help yourself to the first course, salad or soup. This was followed by the vegetables eventually arriving at your table, followed by various meats on skewers being brought around to the tables oh so slowly. We had to eat our vegetables first, or they would have been cold! A totally boring experience in our view, so we left. The steak house was very good indeed, but again the service was very slow. The food in the main buffet is so good that we much preferred this, with many choices for first course, mains and desserts being available, so we were never bored. At the RIU Punta Cana Dominican Republic, one of their themed nights involved ‘Langosta’ which sadly was not on offer in Mexico during our stay. Cocktails These were excellent. Beach and Pool The pool was very nice, but the sun beds were old and topped with very faded, tired yellow pads. On the beach, there were numerous sun beds, plenty for all, but again they were in need of refurbishment. Most of their faded blue covers were badly sagging and many were covered in dried bird droppings. Birds These were a real problem for us. Firstly, when seated in the main restaurant, if you sat outside the numerous large birds flew in, stole food whilst you were sitting there and quickly flew away. They also perched in the lighting above the outdoor part of the restaurant, so it was always a worry they would defecate on us whilst we were eating. On the beach, the problem was much worse. A number of guests would feed the seagulls that would arrive just before lunch. Food would be thrown in the air for them, so we were inundated with seagulls. Of course, seagulls do what seagulls do, which is to empty their bowels whilst in flight. On one occasion, having already put up with being nose-dived on numerous occasions, I was lying on a sun bed when a seagull flew overhead, dropping what was probably the entire contents of its bowels over me, splattering my baseball cap, my body, my arm and my face, with the excrement eventually flowing into my ear. It was totally disgusting. Summary of holiday from 25 January - 1 February 2012 The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is a beautiful hotel, with spacious well-maintained suites, lush gardens, excellent food and helpful friendly staff. The location was a let down for us. Sadly, we had no feeling of being in the Caribbean that you get when on any of the islands, but more a feeling of commercial tourism, with tips seemingly being expected, rather than earned for good service. For us, the birds at the restaurant and on the beach were a problem and it’s a great pity they are encouraged by tourists feeding them. We won’t be returning to this RIU hotel or the location, but would gladly return to the RIU Palace, Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA - ROOMS SMELL MUSTY”
Reviews.Author: flashgordon777
Reviews.Content: We were on a short vacation from Florida. We arrived early and our luggage was left in the foyer, while we had to wait for our room to be ready...come back at 3pm. We showed up promptly at 3pm and were given our keys to the room and had our luggage brought to our room. The moment we entered the room, you could smell a musty odor which was terrible. We immediately went to the front desk to exchange rooms, as the odor was unacceptable. Told them they should come and smell the room, and if they thought that was normal in there own house. They told us it was late in the day and there were no rooms available, but they would have us moved the following day. They said they would send someone with a dehumidifier to the room, so we waited for so long for them to bring it. What they brought was a humidifier with some solution which spray a freshner smell which only masked the odor. The next day they moved us to another room as promised, and the cleaner must have been told as it smelled like they had use some kind of spray to take away the smell. It was not as bad as the other room, but still the musty smell was there masked by the cleaning solution. It did not take very long (2 days) for that room to smell musty like the other room, even trying to open the balcony doors to air out the room did not work.
