There must be something wrong with the air conditioning, ventilation system for this to be a problem in more than just one room. I agree with another traveller who has posted simular issue, and yes your clothes will smell musty and when you get home it will smell like the room at the RIU. I personally will not be returning to this resort, for this reason alone as breathing this foul musty smell cannot be good for your health. The beach was nice, the food was good, but they lacked quality entertainment in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: Phil T
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have just got back from a 2 week stay at Riu Palace Riviera Maya and we had a fantastic time. All the hotel staff, from the front desk, Pool bar staff to the cleaners were extremely polite and happy to help. After the first night we asked at Reception if we could be moved as our balcony view was of the hotel generators they were pretty noisey. The front desk staff were more than happy to accomate us and we were upgraded for free to a room overlooking the beautiful court yard. Our room was cleaned everyday to a high standard, little chocolates were left on the bed on 2 or 3 occasions and the mini bar was re-stocked as and when needed. The two pools were really nice but we only used the pool once during our stay as there was a gorgeous private beach area with steps down on to the main beach and the sparkling blue Caribbean sea. Quick tip - if you want sun loungers by the pool or the beachthen you need to get up early to put your towels out. There are a number of water sport activies you can take advantage of.....para-sailing, scuba diving, body boarding and wave runners. We both had a go at using the body boards as the caribbean sea waves were perfect for body boarding but could be a bit rough at times too. All of the food was of an extremely high standard and wonderfully presented, the Riu Palace has 5 restaurants to chose from but you must book these in advance to avoid disappointment. Brazilian - This was our favourite and we ate here on our second night and final night at the Riu Palace. This is a meat restaurant, where the staff bring different types of meat to your table to try. There was approx 6 different meats, from beef, chicken, turkey and sausage. Japanese - The decor of this restaurant was outstanding and the food was amazing; the sushi was delightful. Fusion - The food in Fusion was again of an expectional standard and would be worthy on the menu of any of the 5 star hotels in London. Mexican - The beef and chicken Fajita was really nice but you have to ask for additional wraps as you only get two each. Steak house - We only ate at the Steak house once and were slightly disappointed as this is where you eat lunch each day and it didn't have the same ambience as the other restaurants. However the rib-eye steak I had was well cooked. International buffet - The buffet was really nice with a great selection of food. Overall I would highly recommend staying at this hotel if you are thinking of visiting Mexico and don't want to stay in Cancun. My girlfriend and and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, gorgeous beach, friendly staff, great food, endless activities = wonderful vacation! We loved everything about our stay at the Riu Palace! The resort is a perfect size so that wherever you are heading; the beach, a bite to eat, the pool, it is never a far walk. The staff is extremely hard working and friendly. A special shout out to Suemy at the pool bar, Saul at the sports bar and Antonio who cleaned our room. They went above and beyond to make us happy! Off the resort, we spent a day on the Tulum Xtreme tour. We had ages in our group ranging from 5 years to 45 years old and we all had a fantastic time! It included a guided tour of the Mayan Ruins, zip lining over the jungle, rappelling down a tower, snorkeling through an underground river, followed by a hearty lunch right on site. We had a wonderful tour guide Carlos, who picked us up at our hotel and spent the entire day with us and helped us with every activity. He was extremely patient and kind with our safety always the top priority. We had a perfect vacation and can't wait to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: gryglas
Reviews.Content: Helpful smiling staff, immaculate hotel and room. Staff impressed us with their smiles and freshly pressed uniforms--felt special entering the gorgeous lobby. Entertainment around the pool daily was very fun & happy. The food presentations were fantastic at the buffets--wonderful choices & artfully displayed. Our room was stocked daily, the requested white wine delivered! The beach was gorgeous--no need to leave the property. Be sure to get your preferred cocktail at the lobby bar before dinner--wonderful piano. The restaurants serve beer & wine only. Our lst time at an all inclusive and we were surprised how much we enjoyed it...we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie47
Reviews.Content: Having been to Riu hotels in the past we knew more or less what to expect as to the layout of the hotel and restaurants, and standard of service and cleanliness. Service was excellent, from our arrival at the front desk (thank you Natalie) to the day we checked out, everyone was very helpful and friendly. Our suite was lovely and spacious, the king size bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was huge with white fluffy towels and bath robes. Toiletries were re-stocked daily, as was the mini bar. Cleanliness of the room was to a very high standard, thanks to Edwardo the room boy. Waiter service in the bars, round the pool and on the beach was very good. A special mention to Jorge in the Havana Bar. The animation team worked hard with plenty of activities for all, but were not pushy if you didn't want to take part. We enjoyed the shows, with different acts on every night. The food was really good.The buffet restaurant had some great dishes and plenty of variety for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Late breakfast and lunch could also be taken at Chilis (Steak House). We went to all the speciality restaurants, going back a second and even a third time to some. Our favourites were the Fusion, Japanese and Steak House. The hotel and grounds were kept immaculate, my only complaint was the swimming pool. Some days it wasn't very clean although the water was tested daily. Swimming lengths was a bit of an obstacle course dodging leaves, a drinking staw, a plastic bottle, insects and scum. We could have used the facilities at the other Riu hotels nearby but we were more than happy at the Palace Riviera Maya. It was a pleasant walk into town, about 20 mins, where there are souvenir shops and the ferry terminal to Cozumel. Walk outside the hotel to the left about 5 mins and there is a small shopping centre. We didn't do any trips as we have been to Mexico before, but we did think the Thmson trips were expensive. We have travelled to many places but this is the only hotel we wished we could have stayed longer than the two weeks. An "exellente" holiday. Thanks to the Riu Team.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: msmacher
Reviews.Content: Stayed the second week of Jan. 2012. The resort is located within walking distance to 5th Ave. in Playa del Carmen which is a great place to enjoy. The resort has great food, even the buffets are above average for a resort. The rooms were nice, but views are limited. Our room face the tennis courts (standard room). Would have preferred an ocean view. Beach is very nice. The is only one large pool and lots of "kids", would have preferred a pool for adults and a family pool. The staff was fantastic. The social/recreation staff were some of the best we have expericanced and our servers Rene, Fredree and Joe went out of their way to serve us. The room itself was very good (except to before mentioned view), There were a lot of activities and it was easy to access the activities. We would recommend this for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Mexico”
Reviews.Author: pamnrandy
Reviews.Content: Clean: yes Buffet: food was good but same thing daily, fruit smoothie station comes pre-made, they wouldn't make you a smoothie fresh Restaurants: Excellent! Worth the wait, and MUCH better than the buffet! Beach: very clean and plenty of chairs Entertainment: okay,,,,better for families and the elderly. Staff: efficient and friendly and helpful Beds: uncomfortable,,,,ask them for a topper,,they will gladly remake up the bed,,MUCH better! Not much going on for the younger crowd *teens* I find this hotel dated for a 5 star. Not really a lot of extras for the money you are paying. Stayed at a 4 star for 1/2 the price that was equally good. Nice clean hotel, but quite expensive and a little boring. If you're bored....go into Playa Del Carmen shopping, take the ferry across to Cozumel, go to one of the theme parks *xplor, xcaret, xhel* all excellent and good value! Taxi to town is cheap,,,,there is a walmart VERY close for anything you might need so you don't have to pack EVERYTHING under the sun! Take the taxi to the xplor part instead of the tour bus,,,cheaper and also quicker *you don't have to go to EVERY resort for drop offs!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Tony T
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th "All Inclusive" and 2nd stay at a Riu resort. We returned because of our good experience the 1st time. We really have nothing to complain about. The food at this resort was by far the best we've had at an All Inclusive. We tried all 5 specialty restaurants which were excellent. The buffet had a different theme each night & was delicious also! We had no problem getting reservations, so don't worry about that. The rooms, hotel & property were extremely clean at all times. There were always chairs at the beach. The pool usually had many chairs reserved, but you could find somewhere to sit at all times - sometimes had to rearrange them a little, but we made it work! Our fridge was always replenished & the room as clean as could be. We felt pampered the entire week. You get to know the bartenders, entertainment, servers, etc. They truly go out of their way to make your stay comfortable. Most of them work long hours, 6 days a week. We feel tipping goes a long way to show how appreciative we are of their hard work. We enjoyed our room on the inside of the "U" shaped hotel. When getting ready for dinner in the evenings, we liked opening our balcony door & hearing the music. We could look out & see the employees getting ready for the dinner crowd, the vendors setting up on some nights, etc. We liked our room location a lot! We walked into Playa a few times both on the sidewalks & the beach (both about 20-25 minutes). We were there in the evening twice & never felt unsafe. Sometimes we walked home & sometimes we grabbed a cab for $7. This was truly a great vacation thanks to everyone at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (& the other Riu's that we visited throughout the week). We would highly recommend this resort! Thank you RPRM!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch all around”
Reviews.Author: Burzhui
Reviews.Content: I went here 3 years ago, and was surprised that i did not find a review for this awesome resort. Everything about this hotel was outstanding. The food, the amenities, cleanliness, staff, everything was great. There was plenty of space and even though the hotel was booked to capacity it felt like it was only 3/4th full. At any time you could find space on the beach in the shade if you wanted or in the sun, the choice was yours. This last one is really important to me as i burn really easily and prefer to stay in the shade. The SCUBA shop was good, not great, but the instructors were awesome and friendly. No Nitrox here folks. The entertainment was fun and restaurants served delicious food. I would gladly come back here at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing RIU Palace hotel in the heart of the Mayan Riviera on the coast of the Caribbean Sea”
Reviews.Author: Lance D
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is hands down the nicest Riu Palace hotel I've been to and I am comparing it to the Riu Palace Las Americas in Cancun as well as the Riu Palace Mexico in neighbouring Playacar. I have stayed at all of these hotels. The Riu Palace Riv. Maya is the newest of these 3 "Palace" level hotels built in late 2005 and has everything for everyone. Any negative reviews you hear about this particular hotel are extremely far fetched and are probably the result of our tourists and not the hotel staff. The food on the property in both the buffets and a-la-carte restaurants is amazing - the best! The hotel staff - meaning the man that greets you at the door - the front counter staff - the cleaning staff - the restaurant staff - the bar staff - and the entertainment staff are by far the best staff you could assemble for a resort of this size. The nice thing about this resort is that even when the hotel is at 80% capacity you wouldn't even know it since the property is so large and there are a few giant pools, and huge beach space with tons of loungers to choose from. All in all this was by far the best vacation we have been on for our family of 4! Great for adults and kids! Having such a huge real estate footprint makes this even more enjoyable with much more to do and lots of space to stretch out. Room Number: 0059 Arrival: My wife and I and two children (ages 1 and 3) travelled to Playa del Carmen from Ottawa, Canada for a two week vacation in May 2011 staying at the Riu Palace Riv. Maya. We booked with Sunwing Vacations and from the moment we arrived at the hotel we recieved 5-star service. We asked if we could stay on the ground level of the hotel since we had two small children and they said no problem at all. We stayed in room 0059 facing the interior courtyard and fountains. Here is a tip: Even though we didn't pay for a "superior junior suite"; those that face the inside of the property - we upgraded at no additional cost - since they had the room. The hotel staff are nice this way! We had originally booked the cheaper "junior suite" facing the exterior of the property. Even though we were only in our room to sleep - upgrading to a superior jr. suite is worth it. Rooms: Our room was very nice and very clean, absolutely nothing bad to say about it. Did not see any bugs, did not have any bad odors - room was nice with a nice balcony - had a great view overlooking the beautiful gardens and fountains. The fact that this property only has 3 main levels for rooms makes it visually much nicer - since the palm trees block much of the structures - it's not like some hotels the are so tall they just overpower everything. Restaurants and Bars: There was a breakfast buffet with a beautiful choice of foods and the ability to sit inside or outside on the patio. For lunch we usually went to the area beside the pool/beach - it was fantastic too - lots of choice! And for dinner we would reserve an a la carte meal. There are a bunch of a la carte restaurants, such as steakhouse, traditional mexican, japanese, fusion, bolivian and they are all fantastic! Staff were extremely kind. Always going out of their way to accommodate our family with two young children. The bars were great, they had one in the lobby seen right when come through the front door, then another one off to the side in another room sort of like a games room, as well as a pool bar and an entertainment bar. One of the unique things about this property is that right before dinner you can go and sit in the courtyard around this huge water fountain and the staff would come to you and you could order a drink and just relax and watch the people before going into your reserved a la carte dinner. Beach/Pools/Grounds: Beautiful is an understatement in describing the grounds of this property - these gardens are so well manicured that you would need a magnifying glass to find an imperfection on a blade of grass or palm tree. Every single morning during our 2 week stay the grounds staff would come out and mop up the walkways made of tile. Then you would see grounds staff trimming palm trees etc. The grounds are so well maintained it's better than the nicest magazine cover you'll ever see. The two giant pools (side by side) are very nice - one has a vanashing edge in which you can sit on a ledge and overlook the larger pool down below. They have nice built in tiled loungers in the shallow ends on each side as well as many tables with stools right in the pool near the pool bar. The beach was nicely maintained - clean, with plenty of loungers to choose from. The only "issue" is the fact that vacationers play the "reserve lounger game" by placing a towel or book on a lounger and then never using it. This is no fault of the hotel staff - this is just a case of people being greedy and having no care for others. If you aren't down at the pool before 8am to reserve a spot - you won't get a good spot near the pool plain and simple. It's a game that goes on everywhere and needs a fair resolution. Activities on and off the Resort/Hotel: The animacion/entertainment staff are great - they are fun, energetic, they come out near the pool area for morning excersices around 10am each day and get people going - then they organize activities such as water volleyball or beach volleyball. They also have a little area beside the beach buffet (and steakhouse at night) for kids. It's not big but it's a little hut in which a child can go and draw and play inside and get out of the sun for a little while. The staff regularly included children in the entertainment in the evening before the main attraction events. Although my two children aged 1 and 3 were a little too young to participate in all these events - they still had a great time. The lobby was huge and a good place to meet and get ready to do something else like take a taxi to Playa del Carmen for a shopping trip. It cost about $10 US to get a taxi from the hotel to start of 5th avenue shopping street. There are other Riu hotels nearby in which you can use the facilities as well. If you "stay" at a Palace level hotel you can "play" at any Riu hotel. You can even hop on a bus on 5th avenue and drive north to Cancun (about 40 minutes) and hang out at the Palace Las Americas. All in all a fantastic resort - would highly recommend! Great for adults and children! Amazing food, nice clean wide beach, friendly cheerful staff!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente'- but food and wine need improvement!”
Reviews.Author: BeachGirl00777
Reviews.Content: We returned to Playa for our 6th anniversary (Dec 10-17th) after getting married at the RIU Palace Mexico in January of 2006. Although we love the RIU Palace Mexico we probably wouldn't return there after staying here... this resort just has it all! We toyed with going to Caribbean to maybe a Sandals resort, since we have been the Mexico several times, but we found the resorts to be so overpriced. We ended up booking the BEST room possible at the RIU for about 1/3 of the price of the basic room at the sandals in Antigua, and didn’t regret it one bit. The perfect mix of people: couples, European, Canadian, American, young & older, families and groups. You can walk down the beach to Playa del Carmen or past all the resorts and eventually to deserted beach in the other direction. Service was impeccable! However there were 2 down sides: 1) was the wine not great and food we all felt was average. We went with another couple and we all felt the same way. 2) Was making dinner reservations was a pain and then they would claim the restaurant you wanted a reservation at was booked… when the evening you get in there are 6 tables out of 12 seated, that never made sense to me. Our favorites were Crystal, the Brazilian streak house, and the Mexican restaurant. The sushi was not really sushi on Japanese night in the buffet rest, all cooked fish. But alas, the resort is absolutely beautiful, the beach is a blast, smooth sand, perfect water temp, & it’s always a trip watching the scene walking up and down the beach that’s for sure. So just like house hunting it hard to get EVERYTHNG perfect in one place, if not impossible, but the RIU PRM comes very close and at a great price. One of my favorite things was our room, 2106, the Jacuzzi suite right in the middle of the resort, not to close to the pool and not over the plaza where we would have had no privacy… luxurious and just perfect. See some of our pics from our balcony… Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Kari H
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went Dec 2011 and had a great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were nice. We had booked a king bed, but when we arrived, they only had a room with 2 double beds pushed together, which made a king. They said they would switch us the next day, but we didn't bring it up again. You get a welcome drink when you check in, which is nice. The pool was nice, but too cold for my liking, so we spent most days at the beach, which was beautiful. We got up early every morning, ate at the buffet, then went and changed and headed out to get a spot on the beach. It wasn't too crowded while we were there, but the chairs would definitely go if you waited too long to get out there. The food was good. I would definitely recommend making reservations at each of the restaurants at the resort. They were all delicious. You have to be in the bar/lobby area between noon and 3pm to make reservations and you can make up to 2 at a time. I would also recommend being there at close to noon as possible so you can get the time and place you want. The fusion restaurant was fantastic, but also booked up quickly. We had to make 3 attempts to get a reservation there. It is about a 1/2hr walk to 5th avenue, which is where all the shopping is. It's a nice walk. The resort is actually in a gated community around a golf course, so it's pretty safe. I would definitely go back and have recommended this resort to many people since we have returned.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed........”
Reviews.Author: goodchild
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel based on the fantastic time we had in June last year at the Riu Palace Aruba- how wrong we were to expect the same or better experience .... Hotel - very grand in appearance and certainly stands out from the rest on the strip, inviting lobby and bar area. Rooms are just ok, nothing flash, beds can be quite hard but just ring reception and they will provide you with a memoryfoam topper. Mini bar and coffee maker are supposed to be replenished every day - we had ours done twice in two weeks, despite repeated requests from my husband to reception.Fresh clean towels are plentiful and our room was cleaned daily. Only had turn down service at night once. Main Pool -lovely shape and size but looked very dirty each day, tree debris and scum possibly from suntan lotion etc - sun loungers readily available, although prime position beds do go very early (5:30am) Infinity pool - much quieter and cleaner Pool service - drinks service was reasonable although very obvious preference was given to those that tipped. Beach - beautiful. Clean white sand, plenty of sun beds Buffet restaurant - hit and miss. Week one very good, hot, fresh food with excellent waiter service for tables and drinks. Week two very poor selection, not very hot, poor service. Disappointingly the service in all areas was noticeable better on Saturday which happened to be the day the hotel did their satisfaction survey. Entertainment - very poor. Out and about - small shopping complex 5 minute walk from hotel selling clothes, boots, leather goods etc . 5th ave 15 minute walk - better selection of shops and bars. To sum up - the was no wow factor for us- we spent just short of 4k and have had better holidays spending less than half of that ! On the surface everything looks good - we just felt that whilst staff were pleasant and courteous their smiles didn't quite meet their eyes. Would we go again - no. I think we've been spoiled with our experience in Aruba and won't be going to any Riu hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey M
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home today after an 8 day / 7 night stay at this Riu Palace. I don't know where to start in praising the entire experience here. The overall appearance of the resort is very grand and very clean. They had plenty of very dedicated staff and they were all very good at performing their individual role. There was always someone, somewhere who would be polishing or dusting to ensure the magnificent luster of the hotel was not only present not just in the morning but throughout the entire day. Drinks and food were absolutely delicious and plentiful and always served with a smile. They have several sit down restaurants requiring advance reservations which can be made at least a day in advance but the buffet was beyond adequate. Not at all the 'buffet' style restaurants which come to mind when you think 'buffet'. Dinner buffet came complete with a elaborate ice sculpture and several figure pieces carved from melons, coconuts and other types of food. The large selection ensures every palate can be pleased. The room was absolutely beautiful, crisp, and clean. We did have an room with a balcony overlooking the terrace and fountains. It can be a bit noisy so if you are looking for quiet you may want to stay in an outside room but we rather enjoyed briefly relaxing on the balcony overlooking the action below after a day at the beach or out on the town before preparing for the evening activities. Be sure to tip your maid and you will receive an adorable animal made from towels in appreciation or maybe to find your bed turned down with chocolate kisses on the corners. The beach area is one of the best in the area compared to the surrounding resorts. To the left, you can walk about 20 minutes to the main shopping district of Playa del Carmen or to the right you can walk for close to an hour past the resorts to plentiful beach, rocks and other all natural pleasures. The bi-level pool is very clean and has plenty of sunny spots as well as shady areas for those needing a break from the sun in addition to the swim-up pool bar. Entertainment is plentiful and by a great group of people who ALWAYS seem to be smiling and having fun meeting everyone. Dancing lessons, pool aerobics, horseshoes, volleyball, soccer, Spanish lessons, spa, pictures, children's activities, scuba lessons... you name it, they are doing it. At night, after the stage entertainment they head into town to some of the better popular clubs with anyone who cares to join them... and this gets you priority into the club. Whether you want to find a quiet spot on the beach to clear your head or are looking to socialize with other people, you will be able to find it here. The worst things I could say about our stay is: 1) they were doing work on the roof beginning around 9:00 or 10:00 in the morning (temporary and we shouldn't have been in the room anyways); 2) there were bathrooms to choose from and never any waiting though depending on where you were, it could be a distance to get to one though the resort isn't too big to where this presents much of an issue; and 3) the showers in the rooms could benefit from the installation of a light but were so very beautiful... all very, very minor and did not in anyway affect the experience we had. There was way too many good things to think about the bad. The details put into the design of this resort were amazing and by staying here you have access to the three other Riu resorts within walking distance for alternative nightlife or activities. We made a point to visit the other Riu resorts as well as the competition resorts in the area and there is honestly not much competition. We wanted to know if we picked the best or if there was other comparable options. The others are beautiful in their own way but had flaws in important areas such as the location both on the beach and distance from town or in the the staff, the food, or the cleanliness. This is the place to stay in Riviera Maya!!

Reviews.Title: “xmas break”
Reviews.Author: lilianjane
Reviews.Content: great hotel. was my husbands birthday when we were there. He got a fruit basket in the room. the room was decorated with baloons. the towels were made into a cake. when we went to the beach restuarnt for dinner. we hade singing cabereros(not sure of spelling) and birthday cake. We used the spa had a nice facial and back rub. The pool staff very very good. never short of drinks. The main meals very also very good. We tried to sit in the same area all the time, got to know the waiters. They were over with drinks as soon as we sat down. We never heard of any stealing. And our room was spotless. Ideal hotel for other attractions we went to explore just jumped in taxi and away. overall a great holiday

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year??”
Reviews.Author: thriftygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at theRiu Palace Riviera Maya Dec. 31-Jan. 4. We went with friends and overall we enjoyed our trip, but probably won't go back. The resort is pretty and the beach is huge. Our room was a typical Riu room. Considering its not that old of a resort, the rooms are showing some age. The sink in our room had a huge crack in it and the bedding looked old and faded. Our room was in a horrible location-ground level on the end next to a walkway by the main buffet. The walls are paper thin and we could hear all of the noises any time night or day. we had a window that looked out onto the walkway that people were constantly banging on at night on their way past. Our mini fridge was never restocked while we were there but the room was always cleaned in the morning. The staff were not the friendliest we have ever encountered, except for the manager and the waiters at the Steak house, they were fantastic! thank you ! Breakfast and lunch buffets were good. Always found something to eat. They do not have enough loungers on the beach for the busy season, and a lot of them were broken anyway. One day a beach attnedant brought us chairs from the pool but without the cushions. He said we couldn't use them on the beach that day because "the big boss" was there. Coincedentally that was the day All of the staff couldn't do enough for you, and it was done with BIG smiles. It shouldn't take "the Big Boss" being there to get friendly service. We stayed last year at the RPM down the beach for New Years and the party there was much more like you would expect at a first class resort. This year at the RPRM it was lackluster at best. There were a lot of children running around day and night, more than we had expected. All in all we enjoyed ourselves but not because of the Riu and its staff. For the amount we paid to go over a holiday, we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: This was our 12 th trip to the area and I am planning the 13 th trip in May. This was my second RIU, stayed at Cancun Palace, Iberostar Paraisso Beach, Grand Oasis, ( senior trip for son) a couple others, all about 4 stars, never a 3.5. I don't get where the reviews complain about resort being too large, it wasn't.!!Compared to the Iberostar it is small. Staff was always trying to make your stay memorable. Beach service was that of a queen. It was the best all inclusive food we have had. NI can understand if u are a picky picky eater but my goodness, you can stand at pasta bar, pick your favorite noodles, point to any and every veggie, pick from 3 sauces and who could dare complain about this? breakfast was incredible. I dare you to travel to Destin , Fla with your teenagers for a week and pay for comparative room, food, entertainment. Let's visit that shall we? Comparable condo in Destin $ 2700-$3300 for 7 days, this isn't even with a pop tart.!! Evry night you hand your teens $50 each for about an hour of entertainment.' $ 250 start up groceries and this usually entails at least 2 more trips. $ 100.00 minimum for family of 4 to eat local seafood and that's only 2 drinks for Mom and Dad. Oh and who is gonna cook in your condo that has the graninte counter tops, and clean?? ( We get 2 suites in Mexico). I'm still at a bargain vacation from what is considered top notch condo and still this RIU is 5 x nicer! The grounds were beautiful! The beach beautiful! The dining outside and sitting outside at night was an extra plus for us. The lobby bar was fun, bar tenders eager to please and make my favorite drink from the famous Flora Bama , a bushwhacker . Sports bar was not beautiful but... Tv"s with football playoffs, pool table, fooseball, , bartender who again was awesome. A frig with sandwiches for the late night pros. Pool was small in comparison to other visits at other hotels, this not a problem for me, I didnt come to such a beautiful beach to sit by a pool. The resort was full but pool never seemed crowded and chairs were available but u would have to reserve early if younprfermamprine spot. NNever a problem on the beach, all spots good. Our frig was filled every night with bottled water , soft drinks, requested tonic water and received next day, liqueur and beer as well. Beautiful is the one word I keep saying about this resort, second woukd be excellent service. I will return again soon. Contimplating what exactly my now 20&21 year old will think compared to the Iberostar. THey don't need Cancun but need comparable age kids to meet and have plenty of choices of entertainment.!! Hate I didnt visit the other nearby RIU's to see nightlife for them to go to.!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Doug V
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time there and was close to town . Car rentals at resort or in town for you to take that private tour of the nearby ruins or just for a cruise. On the road peddlers prices are much lower than at markets.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Holiday”
Reviews.Author: glassmanCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIO Palace” Maya “for 2 weeks in Nov.2011. Let me tell you, it was one of the nicest places we’ve been in a long time. It is definitely a 5 Star Resort, right on the Beach with a 15 minute Walk or a $7.00 Cab ride To Downtowns 5th Avenue. The Pros: The Hotel is beautiful, the Service is Excellent & the Food is to die for. There are 4 a la Card Restaurants, we only managed to visit 2 of them in 2 Weeks, because We enjoyed the Buffet so much. Breakfast, Lunch & Diner. Every night a different Show with a repeat at the 2. Week. The Animation Staff is really friendly and helpful, the will even arrange a night out at a Disco after the Show & take you there. The Cons: There is only one central Swimming Pool where all the activity’s are happening. Meaning, it is pretty loud, if you want to read a book, you need to go to the Beach. Would we go there again? In a Heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mathilde T
Reviews.Content: I just came back 2 days ago and I must say that this place is a sure shot! The pool is beautiful, the beach is amazing. The rooms are nice and clean. The buffet is very good. Everybody from the staff was polite and very friendly, we loved the little Marlene who works at the buffet, she's the sweetest girl ever! :-) We had the room 1160 near the reception. Not the best view (view on the tennis court) but it was away from the entertainement and the pool so it was truly quiet! and that means a great deal to me. I didn't spend time in the room anyways and there are no rooms with view on the beach, so I really don't think it's worth it to pay more to have a better view unless you are the type that hangs out on the balcony of your room and want to see some people walking around... The mattress on the bed was a little harder than I'd like it to be... The buffet was so good that we didn't even bother making reservations for the a la carte restaurants! I'm not a wine drinker but my sister liked the cabernet sauvignon wine they had and the Merlot. She didn't care for the other ones they tried to give her at times during the week, she said they weren't that good. I would recommend this place to anyone in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: reggy01
Reviews.Content: So, My husband and I stayed at this RIU from jan 2nd to jan. 12. It was amazing! You cannot put into words how nice this resort is. I was a little nervous because right before we left to go away there were a few bad reviews on stealing and cleanliness etc. This resort could not be more clean, there was someone at any hour somewhere cleaning. Also, we read another review on theft in their rooms, I would watch out more for other guests then I would the maids. We left stuff out at all different times of day and nothing was moved. It was a wonderful location in town also, if you leave the resort and go left, a 5 minute walk will bring you into a little shopping district. If you leave and go right about a 25 minute walk will bring you to 5th ave. ( a huge shopping district and restaurant area ) 100 percent safe to walk to day or night. No need for a cab at 10 dollars. Then there was the beach which held plenty of shade and sun for whatever you would like. We also only tried 2 restaurants ( chillis and Krystal ) I liked both, but the buffet and our waitress Sylvia were over the top. She was friendly and talkative every night and even noticed if we were not there, then asked where we were and if we had fun and enjoyed her country. Although there is a couple of things I think could be said. There was only Internet in the lobby and sometimes didn't even work. I like to get up in the morning and read the news and other things on the Internet and I would like to do so in the room when I wake up instead of walking to the lobby. The buffet was great but didn't change that much. I would have enjoyed more Mexican food, but there was alot of Americanized foods. I am an American but when I travel to another country and also love Mexican food, I want to be overwhelmed in Mexican. Can not wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable vacation”
Reviews.Author: gimmesun
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here a few yrs ago. We had a great time. We picked this resort b/c it was newer and close to Playa Del Carmen so we could go out and party a bit if we wanted. The resort was really nice and new (at the time) and the room was very nice too. Everything was clean. We found the staff was okay but def catered too other that were VIP status or regulars which was frustrating and part of the reason I choice not to book my next vacation with them. YES, I was only 24 going there but I save my money once a year to go to a nice resort and Im not rich. We did tip and are very friendly and I just felt a bit out of place here. We didnt really met anyone around our age (he is 29) until the end of our vacation and it was US spring break and it was 50 spring break rich kids that were crazy and chaotic. It was a bit annoying and I still like to party sometimes. The location is great. Beach is nice but small. I loved that there was ALOT to do locally. We were able to walk to Playa Del Carmen....10 mins! Its a fun place actually! The pools were great and the food was very good at this resort. We checked out the other resorts and this was def my favourite but I think Im spoiled with nicer places. Maybe at another 'fewer star property' we would have had more fun. It was still a fun vacation and I nice resort. I liked that we had 24 hr room service and alcohol in the room which was unlimited.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Brick Township, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace truely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: ChristineAlexis
Reviews.Content: Our friends had a destination wedding at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in November of 2011. My boyfriend and I visited Playa Del Carmen 6 months prior at another resort and it couldnt have held a candel to the Riu! The wedding was absolutely stunning! Ive never seen something so beautiful in my entire life. They had a man playing a harp while the bridal party made their way to the gazebo set up perfectly in front of the white sand tourquoise beach...so pretty! The resort lives up to the Riu reputation and keeps everything classy. You are taken back when you make your entrance and face the spectacular crystal chandelier in the lobby. When choosing which resturant to dine at, rest assured, all of the resturants are unbelieveably delicious. If i had to chose a favorite, i couldnt!! All of the bar tenders are super friendly and remember you by face and name. I promise you that! The beach was spectacular with beautiful white sands and blue water. Perfect for lounging out and catching some sun :) make sure you hit up chilis resturant for lunch afterwards ;) All in all the resort was beautiful, well kept, and the staff make you feel very comfortable and are willing to do whatever it is you need to make your vacay the best ever. Dont hesitate to book a stay at the Riu! You will love it and that's a garuntee! :)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED it; I can't wait to go back in April!”
Reviews.Author: Annibananny
Reviews.Content: This property is simply gorgeous. It tends to be a little more pricey (about $200 per person on average for a week) than others, but completely worth it. Keep in mind, compared to the lower cost mega resorts, there may not be as many children there, so if you have kids, look for the opportunities at the pool for them to make friends. Like every property, there are pros and cons, pros totally outweigh the cons, and in many cases, cons can be avoided by booking smart. Read on. Here are the pros: 1. Food was fabulous and the best we have had at any all inclusive in Mexico; we like the option to dine outside for breakfast lunch and dinner, and they offer this. 2. Beach was awesome! Crystal blue. Keep in mind its a manufactured beach as the property lost their beach in a hurricane (as did every resort down there) about 5 years ago. What makes this one different is the grove of palms that provide great cover for folks with fair skin, like our family. So if you don't get there at the crack of dawn to secure a palapa, there is definitely coverage available throughout the morning; this is not the case at many other local places. 3. Seashells!!! It's one of the few sand beaches on the Cancun side where beautiful shells roll up in the morning - look for lovely "olives" they are a coiled white shell that looks like it's been through a polishing machine - they are treasures, especially for the little ones. You have to be up at sunrise to be lucky enough to pocket a few on your trip. 4. Pool bar was great - keep in mind only the lobby bar serves top-shelf liquor, but all bars serve imported beer :-) Tip the bartender (even as little as 5 pesos per round, which is about a dollar) and beach servers and you will have a drink in hand for the entire stay! 5. The infinity pool was cool; our kids had a BLAST there, and they could swim up to the pool bar for a lime daiquiri and the bar tenders obliged them as though they were an adult patron - we liked that! The pool hours are also much longer each day than at the Riu Tucan property, just down the road. 6. The rooms - they were very nice. Decorated in an older style, and somewhat formal/ opulent. We didn't have a jacuzzi room, but honestly, we don't spend much time in the room, so it doesn't matter to us. 7. The lobby bar - WOW! Service there is incredible, and ambiance is awesome. Servers will remember you and come out to see you. 8. The spa was great!! We just LOVED the quaint ness and modern feel. 9. On Fridays, they have a tienda, where merchants come to sell their local goods - kids loved it. Look for the spray paint artist - he was awesome! 10. The property is situated very, very close to a small market area with gift shops and a little drugstore in case you need anything - we realized this the day before we left and wished we'd known it was just a hop down the road. If you do forget anything, you will likely find it there. 11. It's small compared to the "mega resorts." There are advantages to this - you don't have thousands scrambling for reservations like at other places. You may also go to other resots in the Riu complex (there are at least three others right there in walking/ shuttle distance) to take advantage of nighttime entertainment and family activities at Riu Tucan. The cons: 1. The rooms nearest the lobby area are LOUD! Often, properties cannot confirm where you will be, and booking through a reputable provider like Funjet (whom we did not use, unfortunately), or upgrading to an ocean view (but read previous traveler reviews before booking, though, b/c the definition of "ocean view" differs from resort to resort) will assure you get a "premium situated room" which means not by an elevator or right off the lobby. Many low-rate vacation companies give you that low rate b/c your "garden view" will be of the massive water treatment plant and AC unit, 6 feet off your patio - seriously. Guess how I learned this??? 2. Keep in mind that the King Bed is two doubles pushed together, so if you are booking for four adults in a single room, one room with two double beds simply won't be comfortable for anyone - we experienced this first hand, unfortunately; live and learn, right. A double is an order of magnitude smaller than a queen. If you aren't a cuddler with your bed buddy, it's gonna be tight. OK, that's it - but given this was the first time there, and having not used a premium vacation company, we still had a great, great time. As I said, we don't spend much time in the room, but the sleeping arrangements did pose a problem, and the property isn't much help, so it took a day to get it right. Here are some tips to keep you and your property safe and secure when you travel out of the country: We have never had a problem with theft at any of the properties we stay at, BUT we are smart when we travel. I don't take a lot of expensive jewelry ANYWHERE - if I do, I am wearing it and wear it the entire time. I have used safes and have read horror stories, but have not had an issue to date over four trips. I use only credit cards there - never, ever a debit card. Sometimes we bury our passports within nested luggage, so a person will have to work very hard at HUGE risk of getting caught to find the things that they may expect to see in a safe. I don't carry a purse that is attention-grabbing; that is just not smart anywhere you go in a foreign country. I have plenty, I just leave them at home. I am kind to the staff there, and I pop back in periodically for random stuff (a break from the kids, more sunscreen, a book, whatever) and I always greet them and am respectful; even when I may be having an issue with the room - the folks taking care of the room are not in a position to help and aren't responsible and should not be treated as though they are. When you are in a country where everyone speaks a different language (except you), you never want to be on their bad side, so be a friendly traveler and you will find many people will help if you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Riu”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here October 2011 and it was beautiful. The staff were great and went out of their way to help you. Food was very good, no complaints. I am not a drinker but my husband loved the red wine, said it was the best so far while on vacation. Close enough to walk into town and safe enough as the hotel is in a gated community. Beach is beautiful and you could walk it into town if so desired. I think when people write negative reviews about the staff at resorts they need to take a minute and remember that these people are not slaves and shouldn't be treated as such. They work very hard for very little and should be commended for some of the crap they put up with. I saw some extremely rude "guests" while there and they should be ashamed of themselves. We travel twice a year to all inclusives and have never once encountered a rude staff person. I guess if you treat them with respect they will treat you the same way. Oh and take the kitchen tour while here, it is very eye opening how they operate. (In a good way). Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong.... Superb!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: UkEnglish
Reviews.Content: Just got back from riu palace riviera maya from a 2 week stay. WOW what a place 5 star plus all the way. The place is beutifull, spotless you'd be hard pressed to find a problem here. The resort is staffed correctly so every aspect from entertainement to room cleanliness is looked after. The guys work very hard there to make your stay top notch. Not one bit of litter of dirt even dust anywhere, I kid you not all vaccation. We took our 4 year old and it is perfectly safe. The food in the buffet is treamendous ranging from lobster to paella etc etc. Whoever is running the show there they know how to provide a service. Thanks to all the entertainement team Rigo will make you chuckle, and to the pool bar staff Marlone and Freddie who would walk miles a day bringing you ice cold cocktails wherever you were on the beach. Santos and his funny laugh cant thank you all enough real genuine polite hard working people whos aim is to look after you. Excellent stay cant rate it enough if you like good food good weather good service a better class of hotel customer and excellent dignified entertainement go. You wont be disapointed. Cheers to all at Riu Palace for a great vaccation. Seee youuuu llaaattteeerrrrr x P.s Chichen itza well worth a visit be prepared for the journey tho.... if you can get a taxi or plane do it...p.p.s the taxis are safe just be sure to go with the white ones with light blue writing ..door staff sort that anyhow. Adios and what are you waiting for.

Reviews.Title: “Such an easy and fun vacation”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_W0rld
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my bachelorette party with a group of 7 girls. We chose this hotel because we found a very good deal and it was worth every penny. This all-inclusive resort was easy and fun (and we were told it's the best of the RIUs in Playa del Carmen). They had shows every night, all kind of restaurants (japanese, buffet, steak house, brazilian, sports bar) to basically feed you all day. There were activities by the pool and on the beach and their personnel are the most friendly! Easy check-in, easy check-out, refill the bar in your room every day, pina coladas on demand ... amazing! The best waiter ever was JOE, he was in both the pool area and the beach and he made an effort to come find us every day and offer us drinks always with a smile, a little chant he made for us, and never asking for anything in return. The only thing that was a bit annoying was the smell in the rooms and the sensation that our sheets and clothes were wet due to the humidity, but I guess that's everywhere because after all it's by the beach. The grounds, pool and beach areas are super clean (we walked down the beach about a mile and could compare to other hotels that had sticks, shells and seaweed) and there's lots of palm trees if you prefer the shade, and lots of beach beds everywhere. They have a buffet restaurant (Chilis - but not the one you know in the US) and they had the best Nachos and Guacamole to snack on any time! We all agreed that the food was very good in general, except for the sports bar ... but it's a bar right? I think overall it's a good value for what you pay, there's definitelly upper scale hotels but they're also 3+ times more expensive. Would definitelly stay here again or at another RIU of the same category!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit At RIU Palace - Still Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: justasim7
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit at RIU Palace Riviera Maya, see our 1st review from July of 2008 for more details. Service was still excellent, food wonderful, room and hotel exceptionally clean. I recommend skipping the theme restaurants and just eat at the buffet each night. There were only a few children when we went, but it is a very family friendly place; I did not see any topless women at the hotel or on the beach nearby. There were always plenty of chairs at the pool, but we put towels and magazines out to reserve them early in the morning. You can walk to a few shops nearby for buying souvenirs and get a Starbucks coffee, or take a taxi to downtown Playa del Carmen, but beware of aggressive vendors and high prices in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacay”
Reviews.Author: Dedduk
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the naysayers. Everything about Riu was first class. Not sure what some people expect as far as quality of all inc food, but I would have to say that they have something for everybody. TIP ur bartender and u will be taken care of:) can't t to make it back.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday sadly spoiled...”
Reviews.Author: ollerset
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel, great food and staff. I have just read some of the other reviews and would say: Rooms: Nice spacious junior suites, clean and beds we found comfortable, but avoid rooms near main hotel and sports bar, we asked to be moved. Sadly and very upsetting our holiday was spoiled by items being stolen from our room. We filled the safe with wallets, jewellery, passports etc, but sadly I left some earrings in bedside drawer which were stolen, also my I-pod was stolen from the handbag and my sunglasses were stolen, even though they left the case! Sneaky things that you dont notice straight away. Hotel reception indifferent to my complaints. Thomson rep said had never had any such incidents, not true! ANYWAY - Rooms are clean and spacious, never saw any bugs, mini bar fully stocked, turndown service with flowers and chocolates, all very lovely but who is the thief??? Food is excellent, restaurant booking system a little tedious but not a problem and worth it. Grounds immaculate, but pool area does need a little tlc, word to Riu- move the sun loungers and clean the area properly! Also need to replace beach and pool loungers they have seen better days. Swim up bar needs to be cleaned more regularly and missing tiles in pool repaired. Staff at pool great, entertainment great fun. Beach BBQ - all brilliant. Beach and sea is beautiful. Lots of shade from palm trees if you want it, but yes i agree the boats and jet skis are annoying with the fumes. A few people selling silver trinkets but they do not hassle you. The lobby bar we thought was best, great cocktails and quality drinks, Chili's steak house at night fabulous food, even though all of the restaurants are good. Playa del Carmen 10 min walk away, lively, vibrant, great fun, some fantastic bars and all the tacky tourist shops if you want them. Coco Bongo nightclub is a must, fantastic party atmosphere. We took our two teenage daughters and they absolutely loved the holiday. I would definitely recommend it and would probably have returned had it not been for the theft. Shame.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff made this an amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: Erica M
Reviews.Content: Truly an incredible experience! This was my first time to Mexico, and I could not have asked for a friendlier, more welcoming resort. The staff here were what really made it beyond comparison. Almost everyone speaks at least some English (all front desk workers are fluent), the maids are highly efficient and talented (towel animals!), and if you make an effort to smile at the waiters and laugh at their jokes, they remember you day after day. The personal connections were what really made this experience shine, and it will be what I miss the most. I cannot remember a single person treating us with anything less than full courtesy and warmth, even when we had tall orders. We had an early morning tour once where we had to order room service to be delivered at 6:30am. Even then, the worker was friendly, polite, and on time. Beyond the amazing staff, going all-inclusive was definitely a good choice. The food is wonderful - there was a complaint here that someone found it "completely unacceptable" to eat at the buffet two dinners in a row. What's unacceptable is such an elitist, groundless snub. Even at the buffet, the food had plenty of variety for all kinds of tastes, from pizza to paella to chocolate fondue, and it was my favorite place to eat! No expense is spared in an effort to cater to multiple tastes, and some dishes are absolutely gourmet. We also went to the Mexican and Japanese restaurants, and would recommend them both (though the Japanese one is rather cold, so bring a sweater). Food there was top-notch! Also, about the drinks - the bar makes cocktails a bit weak (wisely, as pools and strong liquor don't generally mix well), but the restaurants and buffet pull no punches when it comes to wines, champagnes, and even mixed drinks. Your glass will be refilled left and right, so keep an eye on it if you're not planning to leave a little tipsy. The only complaint I might have is that the beds are hard and the air conditioning keeps the room pretty cold at night. However, the front desk swiftly gave us extra blankets and pillows to help stay comfortable. The room was beautiful, and while the view was of a service corridor, we still got sunshine, bird songs, and a scenic view of the land, with only an occasionally chef or maid racing by. I had a tough time saying goodbye to this wonderful family of staff members. I would return in a heartbeat, and probably will. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great hotel, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: ThePavman
Reviews.Content: Our 6th wedding anniversary brought us to our first trip to Mexico together. This was the best vacation of our life, hands down. All of the à la carte restaurants were wonderful, and Chili's - the night time steak restaurant - offered the best meal anyone could ask for. If you aren't happy with the entertainment options at this resort, Riu offers full use and access to any of its nearby resorts activities and events. There are about 4 others within walking distance. Do yourself a favor and take a moonlit walk on the beach to reach them... WOW! After reading dozens of reviews, I was reluctant to pick this hotel. But I'm sure many of the reviews aren't even for the same resort. There are several similar named resorts in the area. We were on the top floor in a standard room right behind the theater and noise was not a problem, there is no 24-hour night club or sports bar. We saw no unusual insects or rodents... one ant and one fly in 5 days, that was it... and there was no musty smell - nothing unexpected for the climate. This resort is rated a 5-star, but always consider you get what you pay for... we booked this vacation through cheapcaribbean.com and after discounting the cost of airfare, paid about $90 per night per person. For that $90, wow, we certainly got our moneys worth!!! If you want a $500 per night experience, then go book a $500 per night resort. There is no free lunch in this life.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: marcetclaire
Reviews.Content: All i can say we were there to relax , eat good meals and have fun in the sun...if this is what you are looking then riu palace mexico is for you.....-its not a place that rocks but he you want some of that you can just cross the road and adventure at riu tequilla because they have a nice discotech and because your are staying in a palace you have access to all 6 riu hotels .. the only thing you are not allowed is to eat supper at those hotels but you can eat breakfast , dinner and enjoy there entertainment.....you cant go wrong.... one thing negative in mexico was the hasseling for tipping and the bad information given by the representative for the outside activity..... a word of advice do some research before adventuring into those local excursions... there are some excellent ones close to the hotels but they wont tell you.?. Last thing if you take any hotels i stongly recommend to pay a bit more to have a room with a inside view rather than outside you wont regret it

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Expected -- Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: scarfoda
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Riu Palace Riviera Maya 11/27/11 thru 12/3/11 with my husband. This was our first time at the RPRM, however, we have stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico twice prior. We found the resort beautiful. We had absolutely no complaints. The pool was beautiful, the beach is georgous, the food was just fine (like other reviews, we enjoyed Krystal the most). Never encountered any "insects" as I've read in other reviews, but we were on the third floor. The room was clean, well stocked, not as large as the one at Riu Palace Maya, but we had one king bed, not two pushed together as I also have read and a courtyard view. Last year we stayed at The Royal, Playa Del Carmen. It is very hard to compare. Yes, the Royal is fabulous -- the rooms are much nicer and we loved not having to make dinner reservations. We did not stay at the Royal this year because the cost was approximately $500 more per person. However, if you are a beach person, the beach is much nicer at Riu Rivera Maya. The best thing we found about the Royal is that you are right downtown almost on 5th Avenue. The RPRM is not adults only as is the Royal but we did not have any complaints in that regard as all children seemed to be well behaved. The service was wonderful -- absolutely no complaints whatsoever. I would go back to this resort as well as recommending it to friends. If money is not an issue when booking a vacation, then I'm sure there are much nicer resorts (Excellence Rivera Maya, Valentin, Iberostar Grand or Maroma Beach) from what I've read. Unfortunately, we we book a vacation the price is a major consideration. I feel we were fortunate not to have experienced any problems such as theft while on vacation. We did, however, have some issues with our flights with Delta but that is par for the course and we did arrive safe only four hours later than scheduled. Again, for the money, this resort is wonderful -- go and enjoy your vacation there. We have stayed at many other resorts in the same price range as RPRM and for the money, this one is tops. Best Travel did our transfers and I would recommend them. Our only problem during our stay was the weather and that is not the Resorts fault. It was very cool and overcast, not rain, just a very cool breeze the entire stay. I was very disappointed in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has no atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: EdaD
Reviews.Content: I expected something more from this 5 star hotel. Food was average. Reservation system for the restaurants was ridiculous. Room was nice but nothing exceptional. There were no staff on the beach to help with the beach loungers. There is no shade at all on the beach. Music was non-existent. Activities were lame. Tennis court is terrible. You won't have a bad time at this resort but you won't have an exciting time either. Rooms closer to the front desk are very loud. Crib (for 1 year old) was pretty rickety. I definitely preferred the 4* Iberostar Tucan down the street a couple of years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very, nice place (with some minor but frustrating exceptions). Still, I'd go back.”
Reviews.Author: tramse1
Reviews.Content: We're just back from five nights and parts of six days at the Riu, and we enjoyed our stay immensely. The hotel itself, the grounds, the beach, and the facilities themselves are carefully maintained and manicured (for the most part). One morning in the hotel's lobby we watched a guy on a tall stepladder dusting the individual crystals and lamps of a huge chandelier. It just sparkled! Another was doing the same thing to the elegant crystal column and wall sconces. Our room was beautifully appointed, and when my step-daughter sputtered about the uncomfortable sofa-bed, the hotel staff was only too happy to bring a rollaway with an eggcrate pad. Problem solved. We never could get the housekeeper to leave enough clean towels, though... it was like a room with a king bed should just get two of everything. A call to the front desk would have someone by within a few minutes, though, with additional bath linens. Someone came by and re-stocked the refrigerator each day, but it wasn't the housekeeper. Interestingly, though, the nightly turn-down service was mysteriously suspended after our second night. Do you suppose they plan it that way? A few things were frustrating during our stay. Overnight temperatures were dipping into the low-sixties (the high teens to around twenty, I guess, on the metric scale), and it seemed like the hotel would just cut-off the air conditioning system's central chiller during the night. We'd awaken during the night and the room would be not hot - but just humid, humid, humid - and regardless of the temperature set on the thermostat, there was just room-temperature air coming from the supplies. The air conditioning did funny, unexpected, things when we stayed down the beach at another property last summer. Maybe that's just the way they roll in Mexico. Who knows? When quizzed on the subject the gal at the front desk claimed she was unaware of any problems. The toilet in our room ran a slow trickle the entire time, there was neither any conditioned air supplied nor removed from the bathroom (I sensed all the rooms dealt with this, adding to the humidity issues), and the ice machine down the hall was haywire (but there was plenty of ice available for the asking in the nearby Sports Bar). During our stay, the hotel was having trouble with its internet service satellite uplink, too... as a result the wifi in the lobby would come and go (mostly go). Reliable (and free) service was available at a Starbucks about a quarter mile down the street out front. We managed to score reservations at the Brazilian, Fusion, and Mexican restaurants - and enjoyed great food and service in each. In the Brazilian place the staff learned my step-daughter was a vegetarian, and they went to the trouble to source a special entree more to her liking than the standard beef-, chicken-, pork-, turkey-, and sausage-on-a-skewer standard fare. I never got tired of eating breakfast, lunch, and even dinner on the buffets, either. I thought there was a good - and changing - variety of things to select from, but some of the standards appeared, and re-appeared, every day - and I suppose that after a period of time one could grow weary and critical of the routine. You sure had no excuse for getting up from the table hungry, however! We weren't especially early risers, though... and apparently some are, because if you appear at the pool or beach at nine o'clock, you'll marvel at how many of the loungers are "taken" already with a beach towel or a book standing by to hold and guard one's spot - with nary a human being in sight! I think this is a common occurrence though, and I don't know what the solution is, other than to send someone down early and play the same game. Some of the hotels in the area try to deter this practice; I think the Riu just looks the other way. The water in the pool was just chilly. A hardy few seemed not to mind. The water in the Caribbean was pleasant - but I wouldn't call it exactly warm. It was warm enough to get in on a warm and sunny day, but cool enough to say out-of on the cool and cloudy days. We didn't take advantage of the "nightly entertainment;" I don't even know where or when it took place. I won a round of Bingo one afternoon out at the pool, and brought home my winnings (some swag provided by a local nightspot). We saw lots of children, and the hotel has some staff members dedicated to keeping kids occupied - but I have no idea what they did with them. Many looked interminably bored down on the beach or out by the pool, but I never saw a single, portable, video game in a kid's hand. Here at home in the States, the two seem inseparable these days. All in all, I'd recommend the Riu Palace Riviera Maya to anyone inclined to do the all-inclusive thing. There are more costly choices available - and many less costly. This place proved to be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific family vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: VickyLakeGirl
Reviews.Content: This place was beautiful, fun, romantic, upbeat, relaxing, and more.....all at the same time. From our check-in where we were treated as if they couldn't wait for our arrival, to our last night celebration dinner, it was a week we and our adult kids will never forget. Within walking distance (about 2 miles, easy/cheap cab ride too) to the little town of Playa, which was fun to explore, buy gifts, and hang out. But mostly we stayed at the resort because our rooms were very large and comfortable, and everyone could do whatever they wanted here. Truly fabulous breakfast buffet every single morning....lunch buffet was always varied and MANY cuisines to choose from; dinners were in one of the five restaurants on the property; the Mexican restaurant on site was excellent, and the Christmas Eve buffet that was so lavishly laid out was amazing and incredible; the fusion restaurant was very good, as well; our only "not so great" meal experience was the "steakhouse"; it was just mediocre. Staff was super helpful - this was an all inclusive and we did tip here and there for our favorite servers; each night we met in the top of the bar area to have a cocktail before dinner and everyone could talk about what they did that day; the servers there got to know us personally as did others in some of the restaurants and they were ALL super friendly, warm, and accommodating. This is a first class property; would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 5 star - inconsistent food and service”
Reviews.Author: IndigoOceans
Reviews.Content: I would not go back nor recommend this hotel to friends. Night one we had a room under the 24 hour sports bar and were kept awake by chairs scrapping and other noises. Night 6 we killed 2 cockroaches in our room. From night 1 to 7 was up and down. Front desk staff did move us after 15 trips to complain. The beach is fabulous, the food was really good but went down hill after the christmas crowd left. Pool is unheated and often looked dirty. Service at the restaurants was excellent. Inconsintent across the board. The rooms are not very well appointed - florescent lighting in the bathroom, the bathroom door opens and hits you in the knees if you were sitting on the toilet and shampoo and body wash are not the same thing. Twice they ran out of pool towels (which were in rough shape) and once they ran out of room towels (which were in good shape). Some rooms had only one chair on the balcony and honestly, paying over $5k for 2 adults and one child, you would expect them not to have plastic walmart balcony furniture. I hate having to shake out my clothes to avoid bringing cockroaches home. The bottom line is we were often disappointed and had to work too hard just to have a holiday. I would recommend the Playa Del Carmen area but suggest you stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canada08Canada08
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. We were at the resort from October 21, 2011 til October 28, 2011. A hurrican was expected during this time however we only received a tropical storm. We watched the preparation on how they boarded up the resort and put away all furniture, on the beach and beach bar area. During this whole time we were kept informed as to what to expect. The resort went overboard to keep everyone safe. We have stayed at many Riu resorts. We have also stayed at the Riu Playacar which is located in the same gated community. This area has the best beaches in all of the Mayan Riverira area. Large beach and clear water. We have stayed at at least 10 other resorts. Service was excellent. Food was great. We went for rest and relaxation and got exactly what was needed. Within the gated community you will be able to shop and walk from one location to the next. There is not a single bad thing I can saw about this place. Go and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TonyMount
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed at the Riu over the New Year for the first time but it will not be the last. The Hotel was very clean and the room (Junior Suit) was excellent and very spacious. We did not have a front view but it was not a problem as we didn't spend enough time in the room to let it bother us, and i am sure had we asked to be moved the Hotel would have done so, such was the attitude too please from customer service. The Food was of superb quality and enough variation to please everyone, i would recommend booking the Steak Restaurant as the meal and the service there was top class, we also booked the Brazilian restaurant which was ok. Men do not have to wear long trousers and shirts with collars in the evenings as this rule is not enforced and there were many men wearing shorts and T Shirts for evening dinner. The whole staff can not do enough for you and there attitude is "nothing you require is too much for them" it was really refreshing to have such a great quality of service and this goes down to the standard set at the Riu Hotel as well as the Mexican people in general, who are fantastic. The New Year celebrations were OK but we are used to the UK style so it was slightly different but we enjoyed it and the Champagne was flowing. My only issue was the Sunbeds around the swimming pool which were nearly all taken by people reserving them with towels or flip flops by 6.00 am and in some cases the Night before !!!!!!! when the directive is supposed to be "No beds to be reserved before 7am" but we just went onto the Beach which was lovely and where the Temp of the Sea was much warmer than the Pool anyway and where there were loads of available beds early but which did get taken very quickly after breakfast had finished. My recommendation to anyone staying who wants a pool sun bed is just throw the flip flops and books off and take them, as 90% of the time the people do not use them anyway and the Americans have to understand other people do !! We had a great time and i have stayed in Hotels all over the world and can not speak highly enough of the Riu and the service from the Mexican staff, other Hotels could learn a lot from them, cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Really Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GRAYTech
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with two teenage daughters stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya years ago and made a return trip in December 2011. I read lots of the reviews prior to our last trip and for the most part, would agree with many of them. Some folks however, it seems expect the world and would complain about almost anything. Others like us I believe, have more realistic expectations. I would go back during a non-peak period but our next Mexico getaway will likely be at an all inclusive with more upscale food and fewer young kids. The things I liked: Staff – Tons of help, courteous / friendly never sat waiting for a drink / food whatever Beach – They improved the beach it’s awesome, money well spent Pool – Actually heated and warm enough to sit at the swim-up bar and have one in December No Crowds – This was a peak period and there were always chairs by the pool / beach Clean – at 7AM there is an ARMY of staff cleaning the entire premises, top to bottom Grounds – This is a 5 star location and hotel grounds Issues noted in other posts that weren’t a big problem for us: Bug(s) in bathroom – It’s the tropics, there are going to be a couple of bugs Food not great – No home runs but pretty good for an all inclusive, even room service items Beds kinda hard / rock-like pillows - True but solved with a glass of wine before bed A/C works but it’s slow – Just leave it turned on, the wife was cold all the time Rooms smell musty at times – Again leave the A/C turned on Hotel is aging – Yes, it’s not as pristine as it was years ago Drinks Watered Down – I brought my own 32 Oz mug which they happily filled for me Drunks at the pool – Not me but after 4PM it does get rowdy at the swim up Language Barrier – Learn enough Spanish to ask for a beer and where the bathrooms are Theft – If you don’t put it in your safe you should have it stolen (safes easily held my laptop) Internet – Free in the lobby, not available in the rooms (the lobby is beautiful, go there) Too Many Kids – Lot’s of young kids but it was Christmas. Did I say lots of kids yet? Dinner Reservations – Dumb to have to stand in line but big deal, it only takes a few minutes No Cognac or scotch - Last time it was 15 year old Macallen, this time Johnny Walker The one thing that could be a show stopper for some (perhaps me) - Hallways and Rooms Noisy – There was a young baby crying a lot in another room, screaming like it got stuck with a pin ALL THE TIME. Someone was routinely puking in a nearby room (not my kids I checked) and laundry carts racing down the hallway. It was noisy enough to either to prevent you from falling asleep or keep you awake after a late-night trip to the bathroom. This was different, and much noisier, than the last time we stayed years ago. What could RIU easily do to improve the hotel: They should assign staff or retrain them while cleaning throughout the day. It was evident for example, the staff was told to police the tables, pick up glasses and wipe them down. If something had fallen on the floor like a napkin or straw it often would be there until the next morning when the cleaning ARMY would get it. They are task oriented instead of job oriented like someone would be in the States. Put in WiFi throughout the hotel including the pool area and make it handle the load. This is probably a half a dozen access points or so and a decent connection. The Internet was free in the lobby and it didn’t appear anything was blocked but it wasn’t fast enough. I was able to connect a corporate VPN (Cisco 5.0 client) between about Midnight and 7AM. At most other times the 3mb X 500kb connection was overloaded with ‘Face time’ video connections and other traffic. When saturated, it took several minutes to load a webpage/Email or timeout trying. Limit the internet traffic to certain types at specific times to keep the connection stable or make it a paid service and everyone will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Our Christmas holiday”
Reviews.Author: Joanne P
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The service , food and the beach were all first class. Would definitly return there.

Reviews.Title: “another fantastic holiday at the riu!!!”
Reviews.Author: s d
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time at the Riu, the first time we stayed at the palace mexico and the past 2 years we were at the palace riviera maya. You can't go wrong! I don't know what the people who complain about the food expect, but you will definitely not be let down here. The beach is beautiful, and the service is amazing. Especially Joe on the beach, you'll never be left unattended! (in a good way, not annoying) Great size resort, not too big but never feels crowded. Overall great time, just be sure that if you want a room with a courtyard view that you must request a superior suite before hand. Oh and Santos makes an amazing spanish coffee!

Reviews.Title: “NOT REALLY A PALACE”
Reviews.Author: matou
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed ourselves despite the lack of sleep caused by the noise in the hall and surroundings rooms with slamming doors and screeming children.
