We knew this was a family resort but did not expect the amount of children that were there. There was no adult section. We feel this would be a great improvement for the resort. We were there for New Years Eve. The buffet dinner was wonderful. The party was lack luster. Despite the fact that the resort is fairly new it is showing signs of wear and tear. The bathroom needed an exhaust fan. Looked like a fan was there but no switch for it. For the number of people at resort there was a shortage of beach chairs and a number of the chairs were in disrepair. The beach was nice with a nice mixture of shade and sun. Drink service on beach was good. Fredi was very nice and all attendents came around frequently. The WIFI was not very good in Lobby. Only could connect once. We ate at Mexican Restaurant and it was very good. The only other Restaurant we ate at beside buffet was the Steak Restaurant which was excellent. We ate there 2 nights and the service and food was great. The waiters and manager of Steak restaurant did an outstanding job. The main buffet for breakfast and lunch was very good. The buffet by pool beach area was not quite as good.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Rachael Ray!”
Reviews.Author: terrie48
Reviews.Content: Won this trip from The Rachael Ray Show. Had a fantastic experience! Our room was excellent, the food..Delicous, Service OUTSTANDING!! We loved it so much that our daughter booked her honeymoon and also had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveessex
Reviews.Content: My wife have stayed in this wonderfull hotel twice which we have never done before its call palace and it is it has the wow factor in every way from rooms to food and the staff are second to none i cant recomend this place enough and hope to be back there again on day . keep up the good work riu chain you are the best

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great food!”
Reviews.Author: xwarrior26
Reviews.Content: We booked with Delta Vacations, arranged our tours before leaving the U.S. and made sure that transfers were handled ahead of time. After dodging the timeshare people at the airport, we found our van transfer and arrived at the hotel after almost an hour on the road - we had to drop off 2 other couples on the way. After arriving at the hotel, we were greeted by Mirriam who explained how everything worked, where everything is including a map of the hotel, what time meals are served, etc. The size of the hotel just blows your mind away as soon as you enter the door. We got our drink, our key cards, towel cards and we got our Riu wristbands - this I discovered identifies you as a tourist when you go shopping or go anywhere. We had a staff member help us with our bags to our room, I immediately made a beeline to the Trafic Tours rep to get our pre-arranged tour and return transfers scheduled. After that, I changed to shorts and we walked to see the beach. Unfortunately, our trip to the beach became a sad affair when we saw people and EMTs gathered around attempting to revive a man. We continued walking but we couldn't help but notice the sadness and concern on the guests' eyes. We took some pictures and walked back to our room to get ready for dinner. The lounging area on the beach is huge, there are numerous loungers and a few hammocks. The pool was large with tons of lounge chairs around it and the infinity pool was very inviting. The hotel area is huge - this is probably the largest hotel we've ever visited. Read the Riu Service Directory book - this will give you some valuable insights on the hotel. Restaurants: We tried Krystal, Yashima, Rodizio and the Steakhouse. We enjoyed Krystal the most out of the four, very classy and I personally enjoyed the sea bass. The water is ok to drink on all the restaurants and the buffet. My partner has a sensitive stomach and she survived our trip without any issues. Do not drink the water out of the faucet. The meats served at Rodizio was way better in my opinion compared to the steakhouse. Don't expect steak here to taste like steak in the U.S. because it's just different. Yashima was just ok for us. As much as people criticize Don Manolos which is the buffet, it's actually pretty good and offers tons of choices for breakfast and dinner. For lunch, we went to Chili's which wasn't too bad at all and offered a lot of choices - there were meats and seafood everyday and you can drown in the chips and fresh guacamole and all the alcohol you can drink. We didn't have a problem with the size of the cups either - I think I would get so sick if I had them make me a drink in a large cup. Service is just phenomenal - they take very good care of you here and it is difficult to come back home and get used to cooking for yourself again. Many thanks to Damian for treating us so well during our meals at Don Manolos and Vanessa for getting us reservations ahead of time. Internet Access: It was a pain to use the internet because it is only available in the lobby although it still made me laugh at the number of young kids and some adults who would park themselves on one of the couches and surf the internet all day - amazing to me since we are technically in paradise and yet you'd rather stay inside and surf the internet. It just doesn't make sense. There is an internet kiosk in the sports bar but you have to pay to use it if you did not bring any devices with you. Room/Room Service: We had a third floor room, close to the elevators that faced the ocean so we could see the ocean from our sliding glass window/door. Thanks to Miriam for arranging that for us. The bed was a true king size bed and we slept well each night. The entire hotel is made up of marble and yes, sound does travel but it wasn't terrible for us. All the noise from the courtyard died down around 11pm each night. The A/C won't kick on if you open the sliding glass door, they even mention this in the Riu directory, there is a ceiling fan that helps distribute the cool air but it is humid and I think this is where the smell that most people describe is coming from but it didn't bother us - I even brought some candles and didn't use it. I did notice that if you stop moving and lay down in bed that you do cool down pretty quick. We only had to order room service once which was during the New Years Eve because all the ice machines were empty. I think that most items that can be ordered on room service is available also in the Sports bar. Beach, Pool, Swim up bar, service: The beach and pool are all cleaned by an army of workers everyday. I watched the sun rise 3 different times while I was there and saw these people clean up, pickup, arrange the loungers every day. The pool was cleaned every evening and I am glad they do, a lot of parents leave their kids unsupervised playing in the area near the swim up bar where they order non-alcoholic drinks left and right and they spill drinks in the pool. We only used the swim up bar once and swam in the infinity pool once and didn't want to do it again after we saw the number of kids who goofed around in the pool the entire time. The waiters in the area were wonderful and very attentive. Our number 1 complaint are the smokers - their smelly cigarette smoke would waft in whatever direction the wind was blowing and it ruins the experience for us non-smokers. This and the unsupervised kids were really the deal breakers for us. We've both decided that we will find an adult only place that does not allow smokers next time. This also prevented us from using and visiting the pool/beach area because the one day that we did try it - we would be overwhelmed by the smell of cigarette smoke while sitting down quietly reading a book. I wish Riu would create a specific smoking area and have a separate pool for the kids under the age of 16. Another major irritation are the salespeople who would try and sell you items like jewelry, etc while you are quietly laying down in your lounger at the beach. This was another point of major irritation for us. People that want to sell you stuff accost you on 5th Ave, the Playa Del Carmen shopping area, the area where you catch the ferry to Cozumel, everywhere! We even had one sleazy guy in the shopping are pretend that he waited on us in one of the restaurants in Riu. We couldn't walk fast enough away from him. This is where the wrist bands are used against you because they know what resort you are from based on the wrist band colors. Indoor bars, fridge, alcohol/wine quality: Top shelf liquor will not be used in your drinks unless you ask for it. I don't drink and didn't really enjoy the non-alcoholic drinks they offered so I stuck with 7-up and lime. The fridge inside the rooms had water, 7-up, orange soda, and Dos Equis beer - housekeeping refills these items as you use them. Things to do: There is free intro to scuba diving at the pool everyday, workout classes at the pool, kayaking, there is an entertainment crew that does different activities during the day and night to mention a few - we skipped these and decided to take advantage of rising early to miss the crowds. The activity vendors near the hotel make it a point to make sure that jet skiing, parasailing, windsurfing etc are all within close viewing distance of the beach area which really is pretty annoying but they probably do it to coax you to sign up so you can't help but wish for red flag days which means no traffic on the water. Overall - it was a great trip. We did quite a few tours instead of hanging out at the beach. Outside of the hotel walls - it is non-stop sales, you get accosted left and right and by the time you leave and go back to the airport you hear people saying again and again that they don't have any more money. Although going big and all inclusive was a good way to go for our first time experience, next time we definitely want it to be quite a bit more intimate, no smoking and adults only.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful stay!”
Reviews.Author: IMBANewarkDE
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the RPRM over the Christmas holiday. We booked through Apple, so transfers from Cancun were prepaid and relatively painless. NO problems at check-in. A fruity drink was served while we got our wristbands. One room was not ready (4:30 pm), but the bags were delivered to the adjoining room quickly. We had an outer room, pretty quiet for the most part. We did experience the musty smell, but this is a tropical locale. After a couple days you don’t even notice it. Our junior suite was spacious, VERY CLEAN, and beds were comfortable. The bathroom had a separate niche for toilet and bidet. The shower is in a deep tub which may create difficulties for older folks, and it is also quite dark. The mini bar was well stocked, and always replaced. We had a problem with the air conditioning in one of the rooms, but it was always addressed quickly with a call to the front desk. They called from the front desk after maintenance visited to ask if the problem had been corrected. Pool was nice, not always loud and annoying with games and screaming people that you see at some resorts. Beach is crowded, but we never had a hard time finding a lounger. The guests from the Riu resort across the street have no access to the beach, so they come across to the RPRM, which is one reason for so many people. Drinks are readily available at the pool and beach. Servers are busy, busy, busy. Minor complaints about the beach: the constant presence of jet-skis, and vendors trying to get you to parasail, etc. I hate the noise and smell of the two-stroke engines. I would much rather hear the sound of the waves… would love to find the resort that REJECTS these beasts! We took a 2.5 hour snorkeling trip from the beach; it was better than leaving the resort to travel to a snorkeling destination for the day. Playa Del Carmen is about 20 – 30 minutes up the beach on foot. You can take a cab for about $7. We ate at all the restaurants, and we liked them all because of the variety offered. The property is well staffed and clean. I cannot say enough about the service and the graciousness of all the staff members. Servers, bartenders, maids, EVERYONE is pleasant and accommodating. We were told that a renovation is in the works for later in the year… it can only improve the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Sun Camp 2011!!”
Reviews.Author: jules40Georgia
Reviews.Content: This is a couple of months late, but I needed to let everyone know that the RPRM is an excellent resort! My husband, family, and friends (11 of us in all) stayed at the RPRM in October 2011. This was our third stay and it was still awesome. To break it all down I will start with the rooms. Rooms: We learned very quickly to take air fresheners to combat the moldy smell. You must remember that you are staying in a very humid place and you have to accomodate yourself to the environment. We had a standard room that overlooked the outer side of the resort. The view didn't bother us, we weren't in the room that often. The bed was more than comfortable, slept like a baby most nights. Pool: Yes, we are those people that put down towels early. We never had trouble getting our "usual chairs", even for 11 people. The only negative about the pool is people throwing their straws and other trash in the water, but you will always find ignorant people! Drink service at the pool was excellent. Never had an empty glass!!! Food: Breakfast was excellent every morning. Lunch was also very good. We ate at 3 of the specialty restaurants, Krystal, Japanese, and the Steakhouse. Our favorite was the Japanese. The night we ate at the Steakhouse was my sister's birthday. They made a huge deal out of it, sang and even gave her a birthday cake!! The only one we will not go back to is Krystal. We did not like it, but the best thing about that was we just walked on over to the buffet! So problem was solved. All in all we loved the RIU and would go back again! To get to from the airport I recommend Cancun Transfers. It is a private transfer and worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl N
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a beautiful resort. It is very clean and the staff is excellent. My complaints are minor but worth sharing. I have stayed at the Riu Ochos Rios in Jamaica 5 years ago which is why I choose another Riu resort. I was suprised that the food in Mexico wasn't as good as the other Riu I stayed at. We had undercooked seafood a couple times which forced my husband to induce vomiting so that he wouldn't get food poisoning. I liked that at this resort you made reservations between 12-3pm and you could book two restaurants a day. Other than the under cooked seafood the other food was pretty good. I was disappointed that the Nachos were stale and the cheese tasted like plastic. I really was expecting the nachos in mexico to be good. They were good in Jamaica? Chili's was our favorite restaurant. We went there twice and had the filet and lobster tail. The fusion restaurant sea bass was excellent up until the part of the bass that was under cooked. I did not like the mexican restaurant and my stomach didn't either. The brazillan steakhouse was pretty good too. The sports bar was the best mainly because of Victor and Pancho. We had many fun nights there. We stayed 12/8/11 to 12/13/11 and the weather wasn't the best. The pool was cold but you got used to it pretty quickly if you just jumped in. There was a gross odor by the pool bar and by the theatre bar that I had to keep away from because it was so overpowering. Our room was pretty standard, I did book the Junior Superior Suite, which I expected a better view but instead had a view of Chilis, but it wasn't a big deal, I just didn't want to be by the theatre. The bed was hard and my husband and I had back pain for the whole vacation. I've read some other reviews after going here and saw that you could request a matress pad, I wish I would have know that. It was hard to sleep because the doors slammed shut in the hallways and would be so loud that it woke me up. The light outside our door fell off the wall in the middle of the night and woke me up. One morning there was no hot water to shower, I blame all the weddings that were going on that weekend for that. And the water was completely shut off for a couple minutes which was just weird. I know this sounds like a lot of complaints but we still had a great time, we only wished the bed was more comfortable and that we wouldn't have experienced the undercooked food. One more thing, we booked through expedia and also booked our airport transfer through expedia. Expedia uses Best Day Tours for the airport transfers and tours. Our airport transfer went smoothly but I would not book any tours through Best Day Tours. I would recommend reading some reviews about best day tours before you book any tours with them. If you book the transportation through expedia you will have to meet with Best Day to get your return voucher and they will try to book their tours with you. We did the Tulum and snorkeling, this was not good. Their other tours might be o'kay but just check the reviews first.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Valsboy
Reviews.Content: this was our second visit to this hotel and it did not disappoint us, the staff were very polite and helpful at all times. The food was good, but the christmas eve celebration was out of this world with fantastic food, wine and champagne, and all the staff put their hearts into the celebration. The room they gave us No.1115 was fantastic,clean quiet and a great view.We tried two of the specialaty restaurants, Chilies and Kristals and found them both to be superb, we will definately be trying them again on our next visit in May 2012. we spent most days in the pool area where we were looked after by the ever smiling Suemy who was most helpful and who made our days happy, but all the staff from the gardeners to management were all to be praised.

Reviews.Title: “Absent of class”
Reviews.Author: sjs1234
Reviews.Content: This is the worst resort I have ever visited. I travel very often both for business and pleasure. The best description I could provide would be a sleazy, discounted spring break hang out for drunken adults. The service is indifferent, and the food quality is beyond poor. Even the fruit was horrible. The room service menu was a joke. Stale nacho chips with a funny fake cheese sauce was one of the six items offered. Desserts tasted like plastic. All the lights in the resort are turned off at midnight. We had to use the light from our phones to navigate the halls and lobby for our early morning departure. The resort is extremely crowded not relaxing by any means and there is absolutely no privacy. The majority of the guests are well beyond intoxicated which made for some extremely interesting stories. The rooms and halls smell like they have been cleaned with a dirty mop and there is also an underlying smell of mold from the wood in the rooms and hall. One of our friends asked for bottles of water to be replenished in his room for days and his request was never fulfilled. The sea is breathtaking and the only allure to this cheap, sleezy, mess. It does provide substantial value if you want to walk around in a drunken stooper and get a tan.

Reviews.Title: “wow! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: teddiboo
Reviews.Content: This was by far the most beautiful Hotel I ever have stayed in....wow the cleanliness the service the room....the food.....wow and wow....who could write a bad review with this one...the beach is 6.5 million....who wouldn't want to put their feet in that...yha everything was perfect....I was with my Uncle on this trip and was alone alot during the day and felt perfectly safe all day long...staff and Sunwing staff were unbelievable.....wow again..have to climb Coba if you haven't Chicheniza...which now is closed down...horse back riding was the best....ATV...ing was also the best...thanks David....yes everything was perfect...you want to enjoy and relax here....Do so...wow!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out your belongings”
Reviews.Author: sara B
Reviews.Content: We just got back after a week stay in the hotel,since I'm a loyal fan of trip adviser and most of the times check every where I go ahead of time with TA, I felt I owe it to write this review for the readers that please put your valuable belongings in the SAFE in your room.Our friends Ipod & camera was stolen from the room(they left it out of the safe),we also heard a couple filing a complaint about their wife's watch being stolen from the room and when we I went to the front desk and asked for them to give me a key to open my room(I had lost the one I had) they did NOT ASK MY NAME !!! and just issued one.This is the first time I see a hotel doing this and it's very poor management for such a resort. The resort overall is very nice with tidy & spacious rooms. The Beautiful beach front & gardens but the food is not high quality & the buffet quality can use some improvement.

Reviews.Title: “little expensive for the quality of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: erzurich
Reviews.Content: Service - Service is good but I expect Great Services from a 4 star hotel. Communication with the staff is challenging as most of them are Spanish speaking staff. Value - Expensive for the quality of this hotel. Just one very big pool, no proper pool for small kids. No Youth and Teen programs available at the hotel. kids care is available but it is very small one (just one room facility). Sleep Quality - ok. Cleanliness - ok. There was some smell in the room. Location - good Rooms - ok size. But we had issues with keys, three out of 5 days our key was not working. We had to call the front desk to replace the keys. Balcony doors were not in good condition. Beverage selection - ok. They have not listed lot of the beverages on their menu, but if you ask the bar attendent he will prepare one for you. Food - Bad - not much selection, same food almost every day. If you are meat lover you can survive, there is no hope for vegitarian's. Almost 90% of the food is with some sort of meat (Beef or Pork)

Reviews.Title: “Read this before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ManofBrass
Reviews.Content: While the RIU Palace Riviera Maya was a very nice facility, had I known what I now know, I would have stayed elsewhere. First, the good. The hotel was amazingly clean. Armies of workers out cleaning most of the day. Grounds very nicely kept. If you are obsessive on clean, this is your hotel. Also, I thought the food was very much better than the last all-inclusive I stayed at, at least in the specialty restaurants. More on these later. Service was better in the restaurants than other all inclusives. Now the problems. There is not internet service in the rooms or poolside. It is available in the lobby only. What an inconvenience to have to come down to the lobby to check your email. I read they plan to make internet access available in the rooms next year at an extra charge. Completely unacceptable. FREE internet access in rooms and poolside is the STANDARD, and anything less is completely unacceptable for a resort. Our biggest problem at this hotel was the bed. The king size beds here are two double beds pushed together! No kidding! Complete with a crack in the middle that you cannot lay across. If I wanted to sleep in a separate bed than my wife, I would have booked a room with two double beds. This forces a couple to sleep on one side, essentially in a double bed. (Not a queen, but a double.) We felt cramped on it and had to constantly push together so my wife would not have to lay on the uncomfortable crack between the two beds. What kind of idiot thought this would be a good idea? I looked in the photo book in the room at all the luxurious RIU properties around the world, to find pictures of the same pushed together double beds in all their properties. Enough for me to never stay at an RIU property again. How about this one: no exhaust fans in the bathrooms. When nature called, I had to go down to one of the three public bathrooms to avoid smelling up the room. Remember the excessively clean comment earlier? One morning at 7 AM I went to all three public mens rooms to find each one opened up with female workers inside hosing them down with power washers - leaving no facilities for guests needing to use one of them. I finally found a separate handicapped bathroom that was being cleaned, with no one was inside so I locked the door and went amidst the cleaning equipment. Why clean every single public restroom in the facility at the same time? This seems to be the norm in the area, but when you arrive, you are fitted with a plastic wristband that cannot be removed, like the type you get in a hospital. This is to identify you as a hotel guest. It was annoying to have to wear a wristband you could not remove for your entire visit. Have not had to do this at other all-inclusives I've stayed at. The restaurant situation is horrible. They have a buffet restaurant that does not require reservations. All the other restaurants require a reservation. Try to get one. Here's what happened to us: We arrived at 8:30 PM on Monday night. We were staying until Friday morning - 4 nights. When we got settled in our room we knew we had to go the buffet that night. It was OK, but we are not buffet people. We were told at check in that you go the the lobby bar area between 12 Noon and 3 PM to make your dinner reservations, and that you can reserve dinners for two different nights, up to 3 days out. The specialty restaurants have two seatings per evening, 7 PM and 8:45 PM. We went in at about 1:15 that next day (Tuesday) to make dinner reservations. We were told there were NO RESERVATIONS available at any restaurant that evening! We would have to eat the buffet again that night. HOW COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE !! We were also told that there were only 2 choices available for Wednesday, and 3 choices available for Thursday. We had heard the best restaurant there was called Krystal. We asked about this, and were told "For Krystal, you have to be here right at Noon, and then you can only book it for 3 nights in advance." If we came back tomorrow at noon, you might get it for Friday night" Considering Thursday was our last night, we told her that was unacceptable, but just got a "sorry." At the Excellence resort we stayed at during our last all-inclusive visit, you went to any restaurant you wanted, any time you wanted, no reservation necessary. How much better is that than this sorry excuse of a guest dining plan? Why would anyone choose the RIU with this system in place? I certainly won't. P.S. That evening, we went to Krystal at 8:45 and asked the head waiter if it would be possible to get us in, since we couldn't book a reservation during our entire stay. He had us wait outside until 9 PM in case there was a no show. Fortunately, there was one no show, so he got us in, and it was excellent. Nice food, Bizarre and unacceptable system. Overall, the RIU Palace Riviera Maya is an impressive and clean facility ran by people with no common sense at all. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but...”
Reviews.Author: Kate W
Reviews.Content: 27yo couple went the first week of November 2011 to Playa del Carmen. We wanted an easy, relatively inexpensive trip and we got that at the Riu booked thru Expedia. We knew with the price we paid/all inclusive, that it wasn't going to be gourmet food, however some of it was inedible.. other than the food, it was a great week. Pros: VERY clean, nice grounds, nice staff, big room, easy check-in, etc Beach was beautiful, plenty of chairs Good location, close to Playa del Carmen if you wanted to walk down the beach, also not too far from various sightseeing trips/tours lots of staff around to refill your drinks, offer you more drinks, etc entertainment crew... pretty cheesy, but entertaining i guess Cons: the food at the specialty restaurants was really lacking, we ended up liking the food at the buffet the best drink options limited, wine pretty bad the pool bar and surrounding area stunk! too many spilled sugary drinks maybe? chairs around the pool were all taken pretty early in the AM we didnt see any beachside service, and it was pretty sparse at the pool it'd be great if they used bigger cups so you didn't need to go back to the bar so many times! definitely bring a thermos cup with you, they'll refill anything overall it was a nice week away from work on the beach, we'll go back to the Playa area, but probably not an all-inclusive, just not our scene

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, HORRIBLE Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: wenz4bruins
Reviews.Content: I recently went to this property for my wedding trip. I had over 40 guest staying at this hotel and we all loved the grounds and restaurant services. HOWEVER, as a bride to be they treated me and some of my guests with great disrespect. The front desk manager Jose Luis was a complete jerk to me. He was rude and disrespectful to my wedding guests that just wanted to join us at the PUBLIC beach. They were treated like criminals. They wanted to charge in excess of $200 for each photographer and video person (for ONE hour). I am very happy I had my ceremony elsewhere because the wedding coordinator Nancy was no well organized. She even double booked another group for our "rehearsal dinner" and they kicked us to the main dinning room when we book semi-private. Think Twice before staying here (even if it is beautiful)

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Divemonkey5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beautiful, extremely friendly service team. From the banquet hall to the sports bar everyone in my group had a great time. We unfortunately had planned our trip not knowing Hurricane Rina was going to hit, however the Hotel handled their business very professional. From notifying the guest to taking appropriate actions to make sure no one was in the water, to boarding up the windows & sandbagging the grounds. After the Hurricane had past (two days later) We were able to go out and adventure & we even became dive certified! Overall, very professional hotel and staff... made it a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Overall. Top notch service.”
Reviews.Author: sunsunsunVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec 10-17, 2011. This resort was incredible all around. The beach is the highlight, as it's the best and biggest in Playa Del Carmen. It is fully recovered from the hurricaines - a bit rough a few years ago. The service could not be better. There were no lines. Service was 10/10 whether you tipped or not - we mostly did just because we wanted to. The whole resort is manicured, and clean all the time. Dinners were great. I've had better a la carte, but these restaurants were still very good. The buffets were the best I've been to anywhere. They make a buffet into fine dining in the evening. It's always fresh with different foods every night. This is not a place for a rippin party, nor is it great for kids. Kids will be bored here if they get tired of the beach. The kids club is tiny. This is more of a posh top end place to enjoy yourself. They are very helpful, however, when you bring a young one with you. I'd go back any time. This was my second trip to the RIU as we stayed last time at RIU Tequila. I very much recommend the extra 300 bucks. The value is there, and nothing disappointed us.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great resort”
Reviews.Author: yeager
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this resort Dec 5 - 12, this time bringing my parents along for a taste of Mexico. Usually a return visit brings disappointment, as memories tend to enhance what you experienced. The RIU Palace Riviera did not disappoint. Spotless throughout, with staff constantly cleaning, well maintained grounds & beach. Food was great throughout with usual fare at a-la-cartes. Some complaints of a cold pool, but this resort was built without a pool heater utilizing the sun for warmth, but sadly cooler weather has almost made a heater a neccesity at times. Love Weddings & Children, but with a wedding 4 of the 7 days closing the Steak house and plenty of kids (mostly connected to the weddings) the Palace is losing a bit of its quiet peacefulness. RIU should consider Adult areas for those who desire the option. Will return again, just too nice a resort to cross off the list :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jackosbabe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RPRM from 29.11.12 - 13.12.11 and had a wonderful time. We were lucky enough to stay in a jacuzzi suite at the front of the hotel which overlooked the wedding area, spa and beach and were really impressed with the size, layout and facilities provided. Every member of personnel that we came in contact with from the gardeners, maintenance, cleaners to bar staff, maitre d's and reception were extremely polite, friendly and professional. However we must give a personal shout out to Isaias & Neo who managed the Courtyard area and the waiting staff in the Krystal, Chilli's and Mexican restaurants who made every evening there enjoyable. On a final note I have to say that the food provided here was the best that we have received from any of the Riu hotels that we have stayed at. Please go, try it and I'm sure you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: MMDela
Reviews.Content: -The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly -Food is good at the main restaurant, but you definitely want to go to the "reserved" restaurants (tried Japanese and Fusion - both very good) whenever possible -Pool is amazing; there are 2 jacuzzis in it and you have to arrive early to get a spot -Beach is even better than the pool (IMO), with chairs under the shadows of trees and a turquoise sea -All inclusive means food and drinks 24hr; best drinks IMO were served on the lobby bar -For an extra $$ you can have a massage at the beach or in the spa -Your wristband grants you access to the other RIU hotels, which is good when the pool is to crowded (but you will see that RIVIERA MAYA is the best and newest Riu) -There were not teen groups and families and couples could enjoy in peace -I would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “pro's and con's”
Reviews.Author: warren41
Reviews.Content: After spending 2 weeks at the RIU Maya Palace with 6 friends I have compiled a list of both good and bad based on our individual experience. First the con's ( better to finish with a positive so please read the entire review): The resort, shaped in a letter "U" has a hotel type layout with central hallways. This results in quite a bit of noise in your room. It is not uncommon to hear suitcases being pulled down the hallways at 07:00 am or hear the people above you. The doors on each room close with a very loud bang that will wake you up. The beds are very firm but not as bad as some reviews claim. The sheets did seem to get a bit moist at night due to the rubber sheet on top of the mattress. I fixed this by taking the extra blanket from the closet and sleeping on top of that. There is no pillow menu and the pillows supplied are very flat and hard for my liking. The layout also means there are very few ocean view suites. Most of the rooms face the adjoining resorts on either side which are quite close. Not a particularly good view to enjoy while sitting out on your balcony. You can upgrade to a room facing the interior of the "U" which of course is the pools, fountains etc. If a ocean front room is very important to you then ask for third floor only at the ends of the open "U". The 4 a la carte restaurants are not that good. We were quite disappointed in the quality and choice in each of the speciality restaurants compared to the Imperial Valentine or the Royal Playa Del Carmen . Another thorn in our side was the fact you have to reserve your restaurant between certain hours---impossible to do if you are out shopping or on tours. The entertainment shows were okay but the entertainment group were very very good at interacting with the crowd and getting people involved. When the nightly shows end , thre resort pretty much goes to bed. ( 11:00p.m.) This is due to the number of children etc. If you are into more night life then you will need to walk into PDC or take in the disco at the other RIU property. Twice we noticed the same employee ( capitan) drinking at the resort--once quite intoxicated and a bit rude. Whether he was still on shift or finished working we felt they should not be drinking at the resort. Now for the positives and there are a lot of them; We have visited half a dozen different resorts in the PDC area and without a doubt this one has the best buffets. Plenty of variety every night. Lobster tails and enormous shrimp, whole roasted turkey and hams, pasta both hot and cold of every kind, wonderful soups. Fine eating is on the top of our list when travelling and the buffets here are excellent. The service in this resort is top notch. All employees truly seem eager to please you and make you feel welcome. Very friendly staff and hard working. The beach is wide and beautiful with enough chairs for everyone. Lots of daily activities for everyone and as I stated eariler, the entertainment staff get you motivated. There is a dive shop ( Scuba Caribe) on site and are excellent. The diving is not quite as good as Cozumel but we did not want to have to catch the ferry across 4 days in row. I did 8 dives and found them very professional and safe. The grounds and buildings are constantly being cleaned and tidy. We liked the proximity of the resort to PDC--only a relaxing 15 mins walk on the beach into town. We were never once approached by any time-share reps from the resorts---this was a nice bonus as some other resorts can be very pushy on their time shares. This resort really takes good care of the children who are travelling with the parents. TO RECAP: I would recommend this resort to anyone. We all felt it deserved a 4.5 star rating. Dining: 2.5 stars Buffet: 5 stars Service: 5 stars Drinks: 5 stars Rooms: 3.5 stars Beach/location:5 stars Entertainment: 4 stars In closing I would like to say a special thanks to Victor in the Sports Bar, Rosario, Wilbert,Herbert in the buffets and to Daniel in the Krystal Restaurant. These 5 people went above and beyond in service and made our trip truly enjoyable. Should you decide to visit the RIU Maya Palce please look for these 5 great people. And while there reflect on how lucky you are to be able visit this paradise so REMEMBER TO TIP. These hard working people make 5-8 dollars an day and depend on your tips to make their life a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Anybetter!”
Reviews.Author: thumper1031
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya the only place to stay. The Riu Palace was a perfect setting for a perfect 8 day vacation. The hotel and staff were fantastic. The only disappointments were some of the guests. Vacation is a state of mind and if you are looking for problems stay home. Some folks can always find something to complain about. Arrived on November 11 and with a private shuttle to the hotel, only way to go with no stops. The check in was handled efficiently and we were in our room quickly. We were pleasantly surprised with our upgrade to a suite near the pool. As always the tropics give off a musty smell but a few candles took care of the problem. Our suite was above and beyond what we expected. We made reservations for all specialty restaurants from home so this made it easy. We ate at the dinner buffet twice. Each time there was plenty to choose from and we were not disappointed. We ate breakfast in the buffet and had a great variety to choose from. Cappuccino was excellent as well as the Mimosas. The Chili’s restaurant was our lunch destination and very good – plenty of choices. This time of year the loungers were abundant both by the pool and beach. The serve staff was fantastic and was always there to fetch a cool drink. Traveling in November vs. our usual April was a nice change. The temps were very comfortable and not the intense heat as in April. We did get a short rain daily but didn’t deter anything we wanted to do. It is a 20 minute walk to Playa and the walk is beautiful. The beach walk to Playa is a little shorter and is also worth it. Some folks we met walked back after a football game at midnight and felt very safe. Playa has the typical street hockers but if you walk by they leave you alone. A new one for us was them saying they recognized us and had been our waiter at the Riu and it was their “day off” and they were working at their “family store.” When it happened a second time we realized they

Reviews.Title: “Been to a lot nicer 5 star All Inclusive Resorts in the Caribbean”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Riu is a resort trying to look fancy and high end, but when you look at attention to detail, it really falters. For the "Palace" being their top brand, I would hate to see their lower budget resorts. If you're looking for a middle of the road hotel, then this will suit you fine. But if you are expecting something high end, you will be disappointed. It is tough to get into their a la carte restaurants, and once in the food is very disappointing. After trying Krystal and their Brazilian restaurant, we opted for the buffet for the final two nights. Room service was very poor as well. For value paid, I guess this is a decent option, but if you are looking for somewhere which is nice, I would recommend spending a little extra money. That said, the pools and fountains were the highlight of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Was pleasantly surprised at how much we like this resort!”
Reviews.Author: TravelCindyIL
Reviews.Content: This is at least the 10th resort I've stayed at in the Riviera Maya area and it has the BEST beach of any of them!!!! It's wide with beautiful white, cool sand...lots of lounge chairs...lots of available shade, if desired. I'm usually a skeptic when it says 'beach bar service'....it usually means you'll be lucky to see a server once or twice through out the day......but at this RIU....we had a server come by at least every hour, asking if we needed anything. It is also, by far, one of the cleanest resorts I've ever stayed in. Rooms and public areas are immaculant......bravo to the staff!! We loved the lobby/bar area (and the free wi-fi). It was a lovely area to sit and have a cocktail before dinner....and again, wait-staff here was to be applauded....as soon as you'd sit down, someone was there to take your drink order. We had no complaints about any of the food/restaurants....again.....service was VERY good. The ONLY negative we had....was our room (2020) view.....faced large air conditioning units from an adjacent hotel.....hideous to look at ....and worse to listen to....we didn't use the balcony at all because of this ;( .......SO....be sure and upgrade to at least PREMIUM rooms....so you'll have a court-yard/fountain view. We also loved being able to take a short walk (15 min) straight down the beach to Playa Del Carmen for a little shopping. We definitely will stay at this resort again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only one issue”
Reviews.Author: PlayaDelCarmenFreak
Reviews.Content: This is our second trip to RPRM in two years, both trips in November. The same wonderful service remains at RPRM and the hotel is a great value if you price shop for the perfect deal. Most areas of the hotel are spotless and maintained daily. We love this hotel and feel comfortable in most areas. What does need a mention, we noticed this year that it appears staff is not assigned to cleaning the pool area floors, chairs and tables. In the past, many staff spent a few hours each morning ensuring the pool area was clean for the guest. Using power washers on the floor and chairs. This year, the floors around the pool area were very dirty and the chairs sometimes were covered with spilled drinks for many days. There was a general uncleanly appearance around the pool area. Papers, glasses sand and many of the umbrellas are broken and the chair mats are worn out. RPMR, it is time to start paying more concentrated effort in the pool area. The area could be spruced up quickly with some new mats, umbrellas and daily floor cleaning. Don’t let this place go, you have a gem. This constructive criticism only issue will not spoil your vacation. Bring some wipes if you are a germ-a-phobic to do your own cleaning and ensure you have shoes on your feet when moving around the pool area. This is a great hotel, with many fantastic staff working hard in all other areas of the hotel. We will monitor this hotel and hope to return next year. A big shout out to Joe in the lobby bar and beach service; he exemplifies customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Another good experience at a Riu Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGappers
Reviews.Content: The level of service was excellent there were plenty of very helpful staff and with the exception of one or two isolated individuals they did everything they could to ensure that we had a good stay (8 nights). The food was plentiful and there was a good variety. A number of the drinks are branded however the expertise of the cocktail mixologists varied - hats off to Jorge who was brilliant. We had a junior suite and the room was always cleaned to a high standard - loved the nice touch of the towel animals. Just a word to the ladies travelling you will want a dress or smart slacks for the evening if dining in the hotel. Nothing over the top but this is a smart hotel. There were only a few minor points that stopped this hotel getting an excellent - firstly the swimming pool was extremely cold (the sea was warmer), secondly the headboards on the beds which are a dead give away for nocturnal/daytime activity (yours and others) - they clonk with gusto. This is still a very good hotel and we would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends or family although for those with a very young family we did notice one or two people with buggies finding access routes quite restrictive

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Firemanjon
Reviews.Content: Went for 4 nights in last week of November 2011. The hotel is extravagant right at the entrance all the way through to the beautiful white sand beach. The rooms are spacious and immaculate, although they did smell a bit musty. The service is top notch. There is staff everywhere, all willing to help or serve you. The food was good and fresh and very upscale. I tend to be a picky eater, so I was a tiny bit let down. My wife, who eats anything, thought that everything was delicious, especially the seafood. There was plenty of spots to get drinks and always someone close by to get you one. There was always something going on at the beach or pool and nightly entertainment in the theater. Overall, this resort far exceeded what we expected. Also, being an hour out of Cancun, it was a more peaceful setting and environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at a Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JBRoyalOak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Rivera Maya from 11/22 through 11/27 on a package from Apple Vacations. Check in was effortless. The staff was very attentive throughout our stay. The rooms are very nice although the couple we traveled with said rooms at the Royal were a little nicer. Our first night, our room was near the theater (too noisy), the TV didn’t work, and instead of a king bed, we had two queen beds pushed together. The next morning, we requested a new room, and the hotel quickly moved our belongings to the other side of the resort, closer to the beach. The food was terrific. We ate sit down meals at the Mexican Restaurant, the Steakhouse, and the Brazilian Restaurant. All were very good, but really, the every night buffet was just as good. The pool is truly grand, the beach has nice layout, and the bar staff works non-stop. Overall, the resort is beautiful, and the staff keeps everything spotless. Literally miles of ceramic tile are hand mopped every few hours – amazing. Only a few small complaints. A couple of mornings, the hot water in the room were not hot enough to shower. No brewed decaf coffee and our room safe malfunctioned one night requiring a prompt visit from the security staff to fix it. This is a great place to stay. Even with a few minor inconveniences, our trip was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Tretski
Reviews.Content: I satyed at the RPRM 12-19 Nov 2011 with 2 of my sisters. This resort is very luxurious, with beautiful buildings and well manicured and maintained surroundings. The lobby is grand with crystal chandeliers, marble floors and many places to sit, have a drink and use the free internet. The resport is not overly large, and it is maybe a 5 minute walk (at a very leisurely pace) from the front lobby to the beach. The beach is outstanding - the sand is soft (as compared to other locations in the Riviera Maya where there is more coral in the sand), and it is very wide (from property to the water) with plenty of loungers. Although there are no palapas, there are many palm trees which allow you to enjoy sun and shade with just a few shifts of your lounger over the course of the day. We never used the pool, but it looked absolutley gorgeous with an infinity pool and a large main pool area as well. There is no bar at the beach, but the pool bar is close by and there is waiter service to the loungers most of the time. Rooms: The rooms were fine, nothing spectacular, but we were only in there to change and sleep. We were three in one room, and the staff went our of there way to set us up as comfortably as possible. One nice thing in the rooms is the self serve bottles of alcohol (all top shelf) as well as the well stocked bar fridge (beer, pop and bottled water). Made for a nice little cocktail bar while we changed from beach wear to dinner wear! We had a basic suite, but If staying there again I would ask for garden view and enjoy the balcony a bit more. Restaurants: We had breakfast and dinner every night in the main buffet - which was outstanding! Lots of variety and excellent quality. We ate out on the restaurant's terrace and enjoyed the view, and for supper, enjoyed the live music. We did try a couple of the a la cartes, but we were not overly impressed. Lunch time found us every day at Chili's - a short meander from our sun beds on the beach. The gym was small, but adequate with well maintained equipment, water and towels. One of the things that stood out for me at this resort was the quality of service and outstanding staff that work there. I did not come across one person who did appear to truly enjoy their job and take pride in what they do. It was truly remarkable....we'd like to give a shout out to few who stood out in particular for us: Jesus, Jeanine and Gustavo in the main buffet, Damian in Chilis, Victor in Sports Bar and Elias who always brought our drinks on the beach! The RPRM is one of 5 or 6 Riu's on the resort property. The area is gated and very safe. We walked through a few of the other resorts to visit, and could have eaten breakfast or lunch there is we so chose. There is also a disco at the Riu Tequila for those that are looking for a little more excitement in the evening. As well, the RPRM is a very short stroll from Playa Del Carmen - we actually went 3 times in the evening (when it had cooled down) before dinner. Great shopping, and lots of fun. We would walk there (15 minutes) and take a taxi back ($7USD). All in all, it was a wonderful week. Although I do not make a habit of returning to the same resort twice, this is one resort to which I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: HBM07
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week last April. The weather was getting very hot, but mornings are very nice for a jog/run outside before it gets too humid. Food was excellent - have stayed at many Riu hotels in Mexico and Jamaica before, and find that food is consistently of excellent quality. Beach is beautiful. Rooms were very clean. Service was great, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - should be at or near the top of your list when planning a trip to Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: LPinFL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at this beautiful hotel (11/20/11-11/26/11) and I endorse most of the good reviews posted here. The buildings and grounds are stunning, the food is plentiful, and the service is generally good. Minor quibbles are the horrible pillows and the "line up from noon to three" policy to make, change, or cancel reservations at the specialty restaurants. Also, all five of us disliked the Brazilian restaurant. However, other than that, most of which can be worked around, I'd highly recommend this hotel, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mayanman2002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya on November 14/11 for a much needed holiday after having stayed at this premium resort property in the Playacar district one year ago and we knew from the moment that we were checked in that this vacation was going to be even better than the previous year. Miriam welcomed us with a warm smile and checked us in with efficiency and advised us that we had been upgraded. (second time at this resort and third stay at a Riu resort property.) We had had a long flight and what seemed like a long process to get to the resort because of inconsiderate booze hounds hopping off and on the bus to use the bathroom so upon arrival Miriam's professionalism and sunny disposition took some of the edge off. Upon arrival at our room (1108) we quickly realized that the location of our room was a premium one which was overlooking the fountains and in close proximity to the pool and beach and a lovely view. We dropped our luggage and went to the buffet for supper and then out the courtyard to enjoy the music the band was playing and the spectacular view of the stars. Taking in our surroundings we instantly recognized what had brought us back a second time. Location location location, beautiful immaculate grounds, excellent food and staff who really enjoy people and making your holiday special. We were quickly served and we recognized many of the staff from the previous year. We received a warm welcome from dedicated hard working staff such as Chano, Marlene, Nicko, Nickolas, Maury and Lesther to name a few. We feel what makes this particular Riu resort property such a success is their recruitment of hard working personable staff such as some of the ones we have mentioned. More important though is retaining these staff year to year so we were pleased to see the majority of staff that we really enjoyed from last year were still there. Every day at the RPRM felt like a day in paradise between the natural beautiful surroundings of the resort, the hard working personable staff, the excellent food and the weather. We have been to quite a few resorts in the Mayan Riviera and we feel that this particular resort must have one of the best recruiting systems because the staff not only have excellent people skills but are very good at what their particular job function is. From the cooks to the line staff at the buffets to the staff at the specialty restaurants to the maids. We found the food both at the specialty restaurants and the buffets were even better than last year. The entertainment team and the shows were very entertaining and we did not feel the need to go to Playa Del Carmen as this resort makes a great effort to provide various entertainment options in addition to the nightly shows. Even though we had seen most of the shows for the second time this year there had been some tinkering and changes made to make it very entertaining this time around. I would not pay any attention to the negative reviews. It is a "give and take" world that we live in and if one arrives in another country with a poor attitude than one is probably going to have a negative time. We will be certainly returning to this piece of paradise in the near future and can hardly wait!

Reviews.Title: “I loved Riu Palace Riviera Maya!”
Reviews.Author: Jilla2311
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about my recent trip after reading some reviews, but was so happy to find that the ones I worried about were not true for me. This hotel could not have been cleaner or more friendly. I have to say without a doubt that I would absolutely stay at another Rui.... Everything about our stay was so wonderful!.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Juhedges
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the riu palace riviera Maya with my husband and 2 friends. We all had a wonderful time and cannot find a bad thing to say. The hotel is amazing and from the first time you walk into the beautiful lobby until the time you leave the service is excellent, the staff are so friendly and helpful in particular Victor in the sports bar who is an amazing bar man and a lovely guy. The pool bar staff are also great, special mention to Fredi and Alfredo (lovely jubbly). Do not believe the negative reviews these people are obviously impossible to please.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME VACATION!”
Reviews.Author: adkkl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the RIU Palace. We stayed for a week 11-12 through 11-18. This was our second stay at a Riu. I can't find a bad thing to say about it! the restaurants were great, the staff oh so friendly and hard working, always with a smile, tip or no tip. we stayed on the 3rd floor 3073 near the front of the hotel. If you are not a night pesron, it is very noisy. The rooms were nice, the bed just right, and the service exceptional! It was not a full house at the resort.and thats why we like to travel in October or November. I would recommend this Riu highly. If you walk out of the hotel to the left there is a market where you can buy your souvenirs, and if you walk to the right about 20minutes is 5th avenue lots and lots of shops.

Reviews.Title: “positive”
Reviews.Author: Alex_1440
Reviews.Content: Forget the negative reviews. This is an excellent hotel. OK, so some things are not to everyones liking. There are more positives than negatives. Just go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Riu's do it right.”
Reviews.Author: LJC48
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Like all the reviews before me this hotel was great. The staff was right there at your finger tips. Workers were everywhere cleaning the grounds. Rooms were a nice size, clean. If you go to bed early, try to get a room away from the main building. There is live music in the courtyard till 10p that might keep you up if your room is near. The food is outstanding. We had dinner both at the speciality restaurants and the main buffett. Our top choices were the Japanese and Krystal restaurants, however the buffett had everything to choose from. We decide to cancel our last speciality restaurant for the buffett. Close to other Riu hotels, and town. Beach was very nice, not a problem getting beach chairs, however getting a spot around the pool could be trying at times. I have been to many all inclusives, Riu ranks along the best of them.

Reviews.Title: “Again RIU is the way to go!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluefxst
Reviews.Content: Got back last night from a 6 day stay at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. This is my third Riu stay in the last four years. (RIU Palace Los Americanos Cancun...RIU Caribe Cancun) Check in was on a typically busy Saturday and was very fast. I have been to at least twelve other all inclusive resorts and can say this (buffet) food was by far the best of them all. We did not try the on site restaurants because we were with two guests that booked the RIU Palace Mexico and were not allowed to make restaurant reservations, but they could do and use every other amenity, so we chose the dinner buffets to eat together. The staff were all friendly helpful and smiling...Not sure how they pull off the smiles all day :) The beach was beautiful with more than enough beach chairs and the pool was huge and well kept. There was nothing the staff would not do, or get done for you. I highly recommend this resort, and all the other high end RIU's. $7 (USD) taxi fare to Playa del Carmen is very much worth it....Playa is a safe and extremely fun place to go.....PS, I do have to say the mattress's were very firm and not what I am used to sleeping on, so a good nights sleep wasn't an option for me...my wife slept like a rock tho

Reviews.Title: “Twice in Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: lruizm
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time in Riu Palace Riviera Maya. First time was this last August 2011 with my family and last time was from October 12 to October 19 with my girl friend who lives in Europe. I made the most extensive research to find a hotel that would suit all of my needs, but unfortunately I couldnt find it, so I finished up in this beautiful hotel in Playacar that I already knew. I was looking for a hotel with the following: walking distance from the city beach nice rooms good food jacuzzi big pools no rocks on the beach all inclusive availability of kayak, windsurf, snorkel or whatever less than 20,000 pesos for 6 nights good service medium sized hotel no kids not a couples focused hotel Now if you have read the reviews and looked for hotels you know that you will not find all of the above. There's no way you'll find a good all inclusive adult not for couples hotel near the city for that price! Riu Palace was a good choice, I knew it already, it is not very big, the reception is nice... service in reception is awesome when you make the check in, for everything else it kind of sucks big time. The weather was a huge problem the second time I went because it was raining like hell all the time so there was absolutely nothing to do but to sit down in the bar and drink. Here's a list of pros and cons for you :) PROS food the first time was not very good, just average... but this last time was VERY VERY VERY GOOD. buffet is kind of always the same but i didnt care, food has very good. Specialty restaurants all good. Botafogo de Brazilian is good but food is just too much! Japanese is good, but if you're used to mexican sushi you'll find it kind of normal, nothing interesting. Steak House Chilis is normal good, not average but slightly better than average. Kristal is very good, interesting and unusual menu but very good. Mexican Restaurant is exceptional! This is true mexican food, if you dont like it, you do not like mexican food! and well Don Manolo Buffet for dinner is nice too, they serve different food for dinner every night. I didnt go to the restaurants the first time so I dont know if they were better now or not. Beach is incredible, its color is beautiful and water is warm transparent with fish that you can see even if you do not snorkel! shows at night are fine, youll have a good laugh you can go to COCOBONGO with people from the hotel :D it was GREAT! bars everywhere! room was nice, good size, free bottles of vodka, tequila, brandy and rum. Also water, 7up, pepsi, etc. 24 hour room service first time the lady who cleaned the room was incredible, everything so neat and made towel animals and well attention was awesome. the second time was not good at all. hotel is very clean 2 changes of towels a day kayak, windsurf, snorkel, tennis, etc for sports for free! you can use all of the Riu in Playa and Cancun!!! beach is soooo big! LOCATION IS EXCELLENT, 10-15 minute walk to playa del carmen's 5th avenue (downtown) if the weather is nice, entertainment is great, beach, bars, and everything are perfect CONTRA good service is of luck... some of the servers treat you perfectly and ask you if everythings okay and give you drink or food information, some others do not. I didnt tip anyone though... second time rained almost all of my trip and you could ask for umbrellas in reception, but i didn't know that! when i went to ask for one, they were all gone. drinks by the pool are small parts of the hotel have leaks so when it rains it gets wet 2nd time cleaning was terrible, even if i was staying in a better room. we asked several times to change a blanket and didnt do it until we got mad reception service is terrible. we stayed for one more night but apparently they do not make reservations themselves so they had to call someone to know if there was availability in the hotel. We specifically asked for a room that would be available for 2 more nights so that we could make a late check-out. They told us that they could only tell us if we could make a late check out until the same day we left, and that it could be until 3pm. They gave us until 2pm. We had to call at least 5 times and every time it was with someone different and had to explain everything all over again. second time i went was raining all the time and there was nothing to do, one day they projected movies in the theater but there were no servers, so you couldnt drink anything. palm trees are kind of far from the sea, so if you want shade, you will not be very close from the sea. first time the food was just average dont try the pastries they do not specify that room service orders are for 2 people, so if you ask for breakfast dont order a lot because we ordered 2 of everything and we had food for like 4-5 people! if you want to buy something, dont buy them from the guys that go to the hotel, just head one day to playa and ask for different prices. nightlife doesnt exist in this hotel, after 11pm you can only be at the bar and after 12 just at the sports bar. They turn the lights off the theater even if youre there if it rains the rooms get very humid I think thats about it... overall i had great experiences both times. I wish the sun would have been out the second time, but it was rainy rainy until the last two days, so i couldnt really profit as the first time. The hotel is beautiful and rooms are spicey. I have stayed in the garden view and the hotel view, room sizes were the same but obviously the hotel view is better, and depending on the room you get, maybe you can even see the ocean like i did without paying more for an ocean view :) If you dont know where to go, Riu is a good option, the hotel is nice and food goes from average to great! service could get a little better, but also it could be that me and my friend look young and therefore didnt treat us as good as wed liked. Beach is amazing and I know for sure that Playacars beach is the most beautiful of Riviera Maya. If you can, dont take the tours as they are very expensive, you can reach everything by car or by colectivo for only 20 pesos. It is very close from Playa del Carmen and late shows are fun. I like the Riu and I dont think ill go to a different hotel if I go back to an all inclusive in Playa :) Before my first time at Riu, I used to worked in the Mayan Riviera during the summer, so if you have any question regarding anything, I will be very pleased to help you! Also staying in Riviera Maya is VERY expensive, so the hotel is expensive, but if you compare it to all of the others of the same price, I think this one wins in every aspect!

Reviews.Title: “November 2012 Visit”
Reviews.Author: Lancastersmail
Reviews.Content: We travel normally to Aruba (39 Trips) and other caribbean destinations, and it has been a few years since travel to Cancun area. Overall, it was a VERY positive trip! Starting with airport, inbound was very smooth immigration and customs. Negative was dozens of Timeshare sales people awaiting your exit; just walk past them and head to your assigned resort van. They are quite "pushy"! Outbound airport was easy checkin, USA departures are in a newer terminal #3 with loads of shopping and dining prior to flight. Do allow 2 hours upon arrival. Resort is about an hour south of airport. Riu is a handsome newer property with three other Riu properties in walking distance along the beach, if so desired. Landscape is beautiful as is facility. Beach is excellent. Rooms are excellent, but in a "U" shaped facility, rooms on outside of "U" face other facilities or trees....Food was best I have experienced at a All-Inclusive and I am comparing to four Sandal trips. Specialty restaurants were varied and could use some improvements, but the large evening buffet was varied and plentiful nightly. Breakfast was always my favorite! Lunches were in a dining facility or on the beach burgers, etc... Entertainment nightly was so-so, but we always retired before 10pm! The pool was repeatedly dirty with trash; needs some daily attention beyond what it receives. Drinks were plentiful and service was incredibly frequent and prompt--best I have experienced anywhere, and we are well traveled. My wife "dove" and indicated the dive sights were somewhat overworked. We did not shop outside the resort, nor visit ruins as we had done that previously. There was rum, vodka, tequila and brandy in the suite plus 24 hour roomservice. Checkin was swift and friendly; all service people were incredibly friendly. We were told that most newer resorts had their own chlorination water facilities. We heard no guests grumbling about "The Revenge".....But, we did take Pepto Bismol twice daily and had other drugs if we had need; one should assume you might get this bug and why risk your trip?! We can heartily commend Riu Resorts, this one specifically, and commend Cancun Area as a destination

Reviews.Title: “Just got home and I miss it already!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brije
Reviews.Content: As an emplyer for a tour company, i get to travel to Mexico quite frequently. This was not my first time in playa (which i love) but my first time staying at a RIU resort. Overall, i was extremely impressed with everything the hotel had to offer! some of the highlites were: 1) staff- they were so attentative and on point at all times! if your drink was low at the pool, they were there within a minute to get you a new one. All very friendly and most of them remembered your favorite drinks and didn't even need to ask what you wanted. the lobby staff and restaurant waiters were all so friendly as well. by the end of the week, you feel sad to leave the people who made your trip so special. Miko, choko, and the pool enteratinment staff were some favorites...and Claudia in the sports bar was a sweetheart! we didnt see a lot of people tipping though so please be sure you do because they really derserve it!!! 2) restaurants- good vairety to choose from and the buffetts were large so there was always something for everyone. the only thing is to be sure you make reservations for the restaurants early because they fill up super fast and can only accomodate small crowds. I wasn't able to go to them all but my favorites were the Japanese and the fusion Krystal restuarant. 3) entertainment was good. pool always had something going on. At night there were one hour shows after a band playing the courtyard. I was there with my parents who werent up for late nights so it worked out well and the show would be done at 11. then for those who wanted to go out, they could go into town to the discos for $7 a cab ride. playa nightlife is great too for those who want to party (go to 12th street...all of the late night action is there. its super safe and people walking the streets everywhere.... i love it!) 4) cleanliness- this hotel was immaculate! they were always mopping, cleaning, and keeping the place spotless! our maid was awesome and so polite and kind. any time you called for a maintenance issue they would be over in 5 minutes (i always have to wait about half hour in other hotels in mexico). 5) rooms- good size but note that if you have 3 people, the rooms all have king beds (or two doubles but they put them together to make a king), Request a cot though and they wll bring it. We had 3 adultsin one room and were totally comfortable with the size. Our jacuzzi tub was broke but that was our fault for not calling to get it fixed...we were too busy at the pool to care. you have access to the other resorts but we were so happy there that we barely left! we went down to the other pools one day and that was about it. also, you are about a 15 minute beach walk to town where all the shopping/discos/restaurants are. the location was perfect and i wish i could have stayed longer than a week. My parents have already said they want to go back so looks like we will be returning in a a few months! Overall an excellent trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What A GREAT VACATION!!”
Reviews.Author: baywatchtoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our daughter on an all-inclusive vacation to Mexico in 2009. We stayed at the Riu Palace in Riviera Maya and it was a beautiful property. The room was clean and neat. We had a mini bar and refrigerator in the room. We really didn't use the mini bar that much because the bars in the hotel had the best drinks. We loved the variety on the breakfast buffet in the morning including the Mimosa's already prepared and ready to enjoy. After breakfast we would head to the beach and grab a chair, or take a walk. The view was spectacular. The pool in the afternoon was refreshing and the swim-up bar was fun. There was plenty of entertainment right on the property. We walked across the street to the Riu Yucatan and it really was not nearly as nice as this hotel. Evening meals were delightful and I recommend making reservations well in advance to get the opportunity to enjoy your favorites. We had a bit of a problem with the in-room safe. For some reason it would not open. It took the staff about 2 hours to get it open, but they were prompt and courteous. When we return to Playa del Carmen, this will definitely be a property we will stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sandee_steph
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace Rivera Maya. We were there from Nov 5 to Nov 12, it was our 5th time in the area, in previous years we have stayed at the Riu Playacar, and Sandos. We really like the area. For those who are not familiar with the area, there are 10 hotels in a semi gated community area, about 10 to 15 mins from Playa Del Carmen, a small shopping, beach, hotel district. The other hotels in the area include, The Reef, 2 Wyndhams, Occidental Allegro, The Royal Hideaway, and 4 Rius, Playacar, another Palace, Yucatan, and Tequila. There is also a Riu Lipita, it is closer to the entrance and does not have beach access neither does the Tequila. But both have a small beach location that can be visited. Having the gold band gives you access to all RIUs in the area. There is also a small shopping complex with a Starbucks across from the RIU Playacar. Weather We have never been in Nov, in previous years we have visited in April and June. The weather was nice, rained a bit a couple of the days, 1 day for about 30 mins. It was cloudier then during the other months, but very nice. The sun does start going down a lot eariler, about 3 with it setting around 5:30. Pool There are 3 pools, a tiny one for kids, an infinity pool that overlooks the larger pool with the pool bar. The pool bar area had small areas with tables. It can be at times quite a partying area. The RPRM seems to be the Palace with more action then the other Palace. There are a lot of loungers around the pool and a lot of shaded areas with umbrellas and trees. Even though the sign says loungers cannot be saved, they ARE. I went out every day around 8 and pretty much EVERY lounger directly around the pool was saved with a towel (what time do these people get up at?). The most annoying part is most people don’t come to sit in them until the afternoon. In our 7 days there, we didn’t have one of these loungers, I guess I don’t get up early enough. The bartenders are great and fun. Marvin at the pool bar was such a fun guy. Oh they also have waiter service at your lounger or at the beach, they come around a lot. Gym My full intention was to go to the gym every day, I only managed 1 day, only because the gym is so disappointing. It was very small and very busy, and not a lot of equipment, 2 treadmills. The machines were so close together also. One the day I was there, there were 2 people doing yoga, both were also very tall, so they took up more space in an already small gym. I went on the treadmill, and then looked around to find no room to do anything else so I left. That was disappointing. There have been comments about machines not working, I can’t comment about that since I was unable to use anything. Food We only ate at the buffets. They were decent, lunch and dinner had similar food. Dinner always had a nite, international, mexican. No complaints about the food, I like to eat the same thing all the time. My only complaint is the size of the area, there was not a lot of room to move around. I think that buffets also make people have tunnel vision, they would bud in use food from the pasta bar when they should use the salad area. The staff is excellent, always friendly and accommodating. Please remember to tip them, it really goes along way and they are very appreciative. Room The style is defiantly not what I prefer personally. It was a lot of dark wood and marble with pictures of ancient urns. But it was very clean with a big patio area. It had a little sitting area with a love seat and flat screen TV, the channels had a number of English stations. I have seen complaints on here about the mainfloor rooms and bugs, but I didn’t see one bug my whole trip.We had the main floor close to the lobby. There doesn’t seem to be any rooms with a beach view if that is important to you. The whole area is not very large, so it is not a long trek from the lobby to the beach. Beach The beach is really nice and long you can walk all the way to Playdel Carmen on the beach. There is a hammock area which I really enjoyed. There area a lot of loungers in the trees and closer to the water. We walked up the beach to the last hotel (Sandos) every day, it is a good walk, you can stop at the other RIUs a long the way for a drink or a washroom or pool break. We have been 5 years in a row and I have noticed this year the beach was a bit dirtier, and I directly equate this to the patrons at the hotels. Smokers feel the need to leave their butts in the sand or in one case throw them directly in the ocean, it was disgusting! There was a lot of plastic on the beach also this time. Also one day we had a beach party and I noticed people left their Styrofoam plates and cups on the beach which in the wind will fly away. Now it was defiantly not a trash pile or anything I just noticed more this year then previous years. The Ocean – if you have never been there before the colour can’t be described, it was warm and very wavy on one day, and it was a lot of fun to play in the waves. Directly in front of the RPRM there is a sandbar that goes out pretty far, so the water in the area is not deep but it does create some really good waves. Entertainment, lobby bar, sports bar Every note they seemed to have some sort of dinner entertainment before the actual show at 9:45. The entertainment staffs was super fun. There were a lot of activities but they don’t bug you to join in. We only watched the ‘circus show’ but heard the vegas show was good. We ventured to the other Palace for the Greese show, which I have seen every years we have stayed at a RIU, it was very fun as in previous years, but did not come to our hotel in the time that we were there.
