The lobby has wifi and the lobby bar is large and the bartender is very professional and friendly. The sportsbar has games and TVs and snacks like sandwiches/fruit and is open 24 hours. The bartender there, Victor is great! I have read complaints about it being dark, it is fine, what do you expect from a sports bar in Mexico? Over all the hotel was nice, staff very friendly, and working very hard to make sure that your vacation enjoyable. We will more then likely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “It Just Doesn't Get Any Better Than This”
Reviews.Author: mlcampbellokie
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to enjoy tranquility. So much to do, so much is offer. You are pampered above and beyond. That is why we keep coming back year after year after year. Your first impression of the hotel is the fantasic greeting you receive from Manuel! He doesn't forget you. We also seek out our special dinner server, Eliel ! He is teaching us Spanish!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: skia
Reviews.Content: We booked transfers ahead of time and the trip to playa Car was about 45 minutes and went smoothly. Check-in was quick and efficient and the front desk staff was very friendly and could speak good English with a great Mexican accent. We arrived about 4:30, 2 hours late because of a plane delay and our room was ready. The 2 hours sitting on a plane waiting for repairs was the only bad part of the whole trip. Our room was exceptionally clean and exactly what I had asked for ahead of time. It was on the second floor, with a king bed and close to the pool and beach area. The beds are firm but we are used to that and there were two pillows each, one firmer than the other, a pleasent surprise.We had also e- mailed ahead of time and made dinner reservations at the specialty restaurants for the first 2 nights. The seating’s are at 6:30 or 8:45. If you eat the wonderful breakfast buffet and lunch buffet and drink by the pool all afternoon, I would suggest the later dinner hour. You will get out just about the time the evening show starts. The shows are actually quite good. There is often music before the show outside and that was your only opportunity to dance for about 45 min. Several nights we chose to eat at the buffet for dinner so as to be able to take advantage of this. There is no disco at the hotel but you could walk about 10 minutes or so to another Rui that does have one I understand. Our favorite restaurants were the Bolofogo (woderful assortmant of grilled meats brought to your table), and the Japanese. Krystal was also very nice but the lamb that we both had very tough. The food at the buffet is also quite excellent with many choices. The salad bar, fruit bar and dessert bar were exceptional and always a choice of beef, chicken, seafood and pasta of some variety. One night there was a whole beef tenderloin and another whole salt encruted fish. It really is a matter of if you would prefer a sit down waited on dinner ornot as the buffet is also good. Overall the food is not gourmet but vey good considering the number of people they are serving. We took the opportunty to do the kitchen tour and it is quite a place.I have run a restaurant many years ago and my son is a chef in Boston so it was interesting to see. Be sure to order the Chilian Chenin Blanc or Shiraz, it is not top shelf like the licquer but better than the house Mexican wines. The bar does serve top shelf licquer but you have to ask for it. This is not the highest shelf but Castillo rum, Bacardi, Jonny Walker Red, Absolute Vodka, Jim Beam, Kailua,and you have an idea. You really do not need to bring your own big insulated mug unless you camp out way down on the beach as there is pool service and even wait staff on the upper tier of the beach under the palm trees to take your order. Also the pool bar is close to the beach. Your room is stocked with water, beer and soda and a mini bar with brandy rum and vodka. I did think the brandy was watered down but nothing at any of the bars themselves. The pool and the beach are amazing. There is lots of seating and you only will need to get up early if you wish a lounge chair and umbrella drectly next to the pool. The beach is as clean as the hotel with nice sand and it is wide and long. There are plenty of lounges in the sun on the beach as well us up one level on the sand under the palm trees.You can walk a half mile into the town or also in the other direction past all the other all exclusive hotels. We looked at them all and are happy with The Rui Playa Riviera as our choice. The Rui Mexico is nice also but a little worn around the pool as it is older, and a long way from the pool to the beach. The water sports staff was great and we did the snorkel trip that went to a wonderful reef. The only draw back being there were several beginners and you had to stay together which limited the time to explore. The resort had 4 wonderfully minted Hobie cats and Were happy to let you out twice a day if they were not being used. The weather and winds were perfect and I took advantage of it. The Whole staff gets my compliment for friendliness. They go out of their way to see that you have everything you need. The entertainment staff does a nice job and will encourage you to take past in activities like aerobics, Spanish lessons, dance lessons, but they are not at all pushy. They are also usually a part of the shows at night so you see them all the time. They are very fun and well picked for their jobs. The Lobby bar and the bar at the show operate differently from the pool bar. Orders are taken by supervisors and then handed to waiters that get your drinks and bring them to the tables. These guys get exceptional from me for service. Especially a few, Isaias, Chano and Pedro you guys are great. If you wish for good service you should try talking with the staff as they appreciate not just being taken for granted. Overall the grounds are immaculate, the beach very nice, the staff wonderful and we will be back. This trip was the first week in November 2011 and the hotel was about 65% full as it was off season and a great time to go.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya - Fit for the King that I am”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Edward
Reviews.Content: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome - that pretty much sums it up, everything has been .... Excellent. The grounds are immaculate, well groomed, well laid out and well .. excellent. The service, from the front desk to the beach waiter, to the maids, everyone we came in contact was friendly, happy and made our vacation that much better. The location is great, right on playa del carmen, a 20 minute walk to town, shopping, bars ... The food is first class all the way. The drinks are all good too, premium alcohol available at no extra cost everywhere including your room. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and kept very clean. We were very comfortable in our room. Can not say enough good things about the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We will return. Drunken Tourist

Reviews.Title: “Great experience-would highly recommend this all inclusive resort!”
Reviews.Author: Bertoindy
Reviews.Content: Great service, very clean, great food, and a lot of amenities. I would recommend this for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ash931
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at an all inclusive resort. I traveled with my husband and a group of couples- one brought a 10 month old along so we wanted a place that was family friendly. I usually plan our trips myself and prefer not to do all inclusive but I was very pleased with Riu. With regard to the service- I cannot complain at all! The rooms were always clean, we had more towels than we ever needed (and cute towel animals every day), and they come a second time for turndown service. Our room had a true king bed (not two twins pushed together). There were plenty of chairs at the pool and on the beach all day. I was told we were at 93% capacity and never had to trouble with chairs or towels. The spa has a tiny sauna and a hot tub (that was warm, not hot). We did not try any of the fee based services or the gym. In the lobby they have various representatives from travel companies- unless you are uncomfortable using public transportation or renting a car- I would stay away from these. They are overpriced and after our first tour we realized I could plan more for half the price. We rented a car from the Thrifty representative for $60 USD/d insured but without liability and parked right out front for the rest of the trip. You can probably get a car cheaper if you are willing to go into town and rent from there. The location is great- 20 min walk to town. We drove to Cancun, Chichen Itza, and Tulum with minimal difficulty. The front desk has a free tourist map. It's actually on the Playacar property and near several other Rius that you can go to with your wristband. The food was just ok in my opinion. The buffet had a good selection and I was never hungry- but it was just ok. As far as drinks, they were small so you got stuck going back more often. We tried all of the restaurants except for the Steakhouse-which was closed for weddings frequently (try to book reservations here sooner). Krystal (the fusion themed restaurant) was by far the best and we liked it so much we went back a second time. I would recommend this hotel to others and was very pleased with it for what we paid, even considering the food. After staying here, I am surprised at some of the negative reviews I saw here. Don't let them discourage you!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty for a Week.”
Reviews.Author: j4mbos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for a week, after a hectic but enjoyable 7 day Yucatan Explorer tour and can honestly say it was a fantastic decision to pick this hotel to chill out in. The rooms were first class, the service second to none, and the food at the restaurants was exceptional. We visited them all, but must admit the Krystal Fusion was by far the best and truely outstanding. A similar meal for two back home in Blighty with the wines and aperitifs would set you back at least £150. The resort itself is only a fifteen minute stroll to the centre of Playa Del Carmen and 5th Avenue where their are plenty of bars restaurants and shops. Haggle in the shops and you will pay half the price. The entertainment at night was not the greatest, but they really did try to make it a pleasurable experience, and we made sure we joined in the fun. The Lobby Bar was great for a drink before your meal, and after the first night, our drink was poured before and at our seats before we reached them. We were caught in the storm on the Thursday of our stay. The staff were amazing. We were sent to our room at 1230 and the staff delivered a packed lunch. We were allowed out at 6.30pm. The following morning the work and effort by staff to clear the debris enabled us to use the facilities at the swimming pool by 8am. It is impossible to single out any member of staff - They were all as good as each other. A great stay and well worth a return visit. We have fond memories of the Palace, The Staff, and the wonderful friendships we made with people from all over the world. We made friends with a Mexican Couple from Monterray, who had very limited English, in fact nearly as good as my Spanglish, but we were able to communicate through the bar staff in the various bars.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RPRM”
Reviews.Author: poopoos1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to RPRM from October 19th-23rd for my birthday. We were overall very impressed with RPRM and will return one day. This is our 5th trip to the Riviera Maya area, we have stayed at two other Riu properties, Barceló Tropical and the Bahia Principe Tulum resorts. We have also stayed on the Riu Santa Fe in Los Cabos therefore feel we can give a fair review. Front Desk: The front desk staff was amazing, pleasant and very helpful. We unfortunately lost our luggage and they took care of contacting the airlines and making the arrangements while we started our vacation. We had e-mailed the resort one week prior with dinner reservation and requested a room in a certain block since I did my research prior to our trip. They gave us our requested reservation but were not able to give us the room I requested..No big deal..that was just a nice to have...but did get a courtyard view room which I did not pay for the upgrade so I was very pleased. Room: The room size was adequate, the beds were comfortable enough for us and there was plenty of storage space for two adults. We had requested a room closer to the beach but instead received a room right over the main buffet area (room #3094) which was great. The view of the main court yard was nice and the resort is laid out nicely and is not a very big complex so any room facing the courtyard would have been adequate. The room was very clean, the maids did a great job keeping the room tidy during our stay. Food: The buffet was great and always had many choices as others have commented on. There is always a lot of fresh fish and seafood options for lunch and dinner. I took a picture of the buffet and entertainment schedule which I will post since I find that information valuable for planning your week. We went to Krystal and Brazilian restaurants. Both were ok, nothing over the top that is for sure. The 24 hour sports bar has the best cappuccino ever..different machine then the buffet. Beach and Location: This one of my favourite beaches, the nicest I have seen in the Playa del Carmen area. Lots of shade and loungers. The bar service at the beach was a little slow so would spend the afternoons in the pool area. The location is great too, nice walk to other Riu’s and nice walk into town. Service: All of the staff are friendly and over accommodating. The staff at the bar were over the top but we tip generously so are usually taken care of. The level of service at the Riu chains is what keeps us coming back time after time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: froogle44881
Reviews.Content: Jose Luis Serratos, Thanks for a wonderful stay in room 1046. The service provided by you at the front desk was outstanding. Because of you, we will for sure be coming back to the Palace! Management was also very helpful in allowing us to get a wonderful room upgrade, one of the few who actually replied to our email. Food was great. We tried a few specialty restaurants but found the buffet to be actually better with more selection. I was able to get my SCUBA certification and could not have done it without the help from Lisa, Matt and Lot Miranda, I will be back for the open water soon. I have stayed at this hotel before but was not as pleased as I am now. Some changes must have been made because overall the vacation was perfect. Thanks and I'll be back Regard James A., the old guy.

Reviews.Title: “The best Rui in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: DeckRef
Reviews.Content: Arrived Sunday, October 17th to pouring down rain. The hotel distributed golf umbrellas so we could freely check things out. The rest of the week was beautiful weather! Our room was very clean and the staff catered to our every request such was an extra blanket to aparticular beverages in our refrigerator. The all inclusive restaurants were nice. Found the beef products to be very salty. Our favorite restaurants were the Japanese and Krystal. Previously read on Trip Advisor that these two were similar favorites. The nightly entertainment was predictable after the first night. Not something to write home about. Playa del Carmen was a very reasonable walk and interesting. Be ready to walk away if you see and item and want a better price...the vendors can adjust their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Trini296
Reviews.Content: Well, we began the journey at RIU hotel in Playa del Carmen. When we realized that we wanted something more upscale. There were actually six hotels under e RIU branch but were limited to access if you did jot have the famous gold band. well, the gold band was the token to a good time. We loved our hotel view which was a balcony and of course a suite. It was just wonderful. We not only enjoyed the amenities but the food was excellent. What a great relaxing vacation. People speak about this country, but I loved it. The people, the food and of course the hotel stay. Will love to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Smokers Paradise”
Reviews.Author: SmilinJim
Reviews.Content: This is the prettiest resort I have stayed. Many things about this place is first class; the service, the food, the beach, and for fun, Coco Bongo (not on location). My reason for not rating this place a 5 star is there is no place to Dance and I love to dance. Also, this place has a cigar kiosk right by the entry, so it promotes smoking. I once said that give me no smoking inside, and the smokers can have the outside. That may be fair, but when your at a resort, and the weather is perfect, you want to do everything outside, and one cigar can foul a large area, to which happened while I was eating, by the pool, and on the beach. This is also a big family attraction, and there are lots of newborns. So if you want a great place for a wedding, to which Riu does very well, Riu Palace is great... BUT, if you want to party and dance, look for a resort that has a Discothèque / nightclub and has a lot of rooms (more rooms=more people=more nightlife during the week), and one that is adults only!

Reviews.Title: “The most beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: Lynnievan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 5 years ago and have stayed numerous places since, and none have compared to this resort. It really was a palace.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation at a beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Mistyflip
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a trip to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and are happy to say we had an awesome time! This was our first trip to Mexico and first time at a Riu resort, so we didn’t quite know what to expect… Other than a few little glitches, it was a great time! ROOM: We booked a regular junior suite and we found out that those are the suites that face out towards the other resorts (the hotel is in a big U shape). I was hoping for a view facing inwards towards the pool and all the pretty fountains and gardens, so I was a little disappointed. We went to our room to find that while the view wasn’t completely terrible (the grounds were pretty and we could still see a little bit of the ocean to the left on the balcony), our room faced directly at the roof of the resort next door, which was under construction! All we could hear was drilling and banging. We went back down to the front desk and asked if we could be moved, but all the upgraded rooms were booked for the next two days. They were very kind though, and moved us down the hall away from the construction and offered to get us into a room facing inwards in two days when one was to become available (those are the “Superior” rooms, and they cost a little more). So we spent two days in the room that faced out, and I must say it was a little depressing. You don’t really feel like you are staying at a nice resort with that kind of view. We spent as little time in there as possible! The front desk staff kept track of us and moved us a couple of days later to a “Superior” suite facing inwards towards the courtyard (room 2104). NOW we felt like we were staying at the Riu Palace! The view from our balcony on the 2nd floor was beautiful and we had a clear view of the grounds, beach, pools and courtyard! I actually wanted to spend time on the deck and enjoy the view! So my advice for choosing a room is to spend the extra few dollars and get the “Superior” suite (or the Jacuzzi suite if you can, haha!). It is worth every penny and will change your experience at this resort! Both rooms had sort of a dull musty smell (something we were warned of in prior reviews of this resort). That said, it was not a big issue for us and I can assure you that the hotel staff does an excellent job of keeping everything clean! The regular junior suite had two double beds pushed together, and the “Superior” suite had an actual large bed! Not sure what that’s all about… Both were pretty comfortable. We also liked the double sinks in the bathroom! Please see the pictures I posted of both the regular junior suite and the “Superior” suite – they are identical rooms, except for the view/location within the hotel. BEACH/POOL: The pool area was lively and the entertainment staff kept things fun! They played good music at a decent volume, the swim up bar was cool, and there were lots of fun pool activities! Pool volleyball, bingo (yes, bingo in the pool!), water exercises, dance lessons and scuba diving lessons were only a few of the things we saw going on! We spent most of our time at the beach area, mostly because it was more low-key and less crazy than the pool (which is more our speed). The beach staff came by periodically and brought us drinks from the pool bar so we never had to get up! The ocean water was warm and very clean - almost totally free of yucky stuff (seaweed, coral, etc). Lots of palm trees as well as lots of open beach space allowed for all the sun or shade you wanted at any time. The hammocks under the palm trees were awesome too! There were lots of beach chairs available, but if you want to get your pick of location, you should get there a little early and claim your spot! FOOD: The breakfast buffet was one of the best I’ve ever experienced! Any and every kind of breakfast food was served, and it all tasted AWESOME! I miss it already… The lunch buffet is pretty standard and very good, although we only ate there once as we were usually off doing different water activities or excursions during the lunch hours. We typically caught the buffet during the snack time, which was pretty basic – pizza, pasta, salad and lots of chips, cheese and chili dip! Nothing special, but it kept us fed. You have the choice to eat at the main buffet for dinner, Don Manolo, every night. But if you want to eat at a specialty restaurant, you have to make a reservation in advance, which can only be done between 12:00 – 3:00pm in the main lobby. Not a huge deal, but a couple of the places we wanted to try were taken a couple of the days, so get there at noon and reserve the restaurant you want! The main buffet, Don Manolo, had a really great selection with a theme that changed nightly. You will not have a problem finding something you like, no matter what your tastes! We loved Agave, the Mexican restaurant, as the food was truly authentic and so tasty! Krystal, the fanciest restaurant, was clearly very good, but really not my kind of food (I don’t usually like the super-fancy types of food they serve there, but you might!) Krystal is also the smallest size restaurant and therefore the hardest to get into, so book this one a couple of days out if you want to try it! Botafogo, the Brazilian restaurant, was a disappointment for us. My boyfriend is Brazilian and we know a lot about the food, and the food they served had NOTHING whatsoever to do with Brazilian cuisine. The sports bar was open all the time, but don’t expect anything fancy in terms of food… hamburgers, sandwiches and fruit will keep you fed, but nothing spectacular. The service everywhere was fantastic!! Every server in every location made it their mission to make you happy and they were all so friendly! We tipped them regularly as we went along because they worked so hard! EVENING ENTERTAINMENT: The pools close at 8:00pm and the beach area goes dark, so don’t plan any late-night beach walks or swimming. There was a very good band playing in the courtyard every night during dinner hours, but at around 9:00pm when everyone was gathering outside listening to them and people were just starting to dance, they would stop the music completely and start a children’s show on the entertainment stage nearby. It made no sense to us because there would only be literally 5 kids maximum dancing around to the childrens’ show while about 200 adults stood there staring at each other in the courtyard. There were shows scheduled nightly for adults that started around 10:15pm, but we always got so bored waiting for the childrens’ show to end that we would just go back to our room and sit on the balcony, so we didn’t bother with the later entertainment. All in all, this place was just what we needed – beautiful, relaxing, excellent customer service in every area of the resort, good food, good room (after we were able to upgrade!), and just a fantastic experience overall! I highly recommend it and my boyfriend and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absoluty Amazing Hotel and Wedding!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Agent1610
Reviews.Content: We travellered out here in may 2011 for 14 nights for our wedding. We were a party of 8. On arrival our first impressions of the hotel were "WOW". It had one of the nicest beaches i have ever been to and i am a travel agent so am well travellered. I can't belive the negative reviews for this hotel. The service was fantastic and the nothing was too much trouble. My family and friends were also impressed with the hotel. Food - so much choice and 5 a la carte restarants to choose from. Best ones was the japanese and the krystal. Amazing food and it took away the all inclusive feel that some hotels have. However even the buffet was to a very high standard. The grounds were always kept imaculate and we had a suite which was very nice, Not the best view but hey your on holiday and you don't spend a massive amount of time in your room. Weather was amazing. My wedding day was perfect, It ran so smoothly and was everything i could of hoped for. I got married in the gazebo as it was a little bit more private than the beach and it had some shade whcih at 3pm in the afternoon it was very hot. Everything down to my flowers, Hair, Makeup and the set up of the location was perfect so don't hesitate in getting married here. The location was amazing, only a 10 minute walk to 5th avenue. We spend alot of our time on the beach and in our eyes it was 5 star. your holiday is definatly what you make it. I have worked in travel for 6 years so have been to some exotic places and would definatly return here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: CCJ57
Reviews.Content: Very elegant, well staffed and well run resort. Large, beautiful beach. Good food/drinks. Good service. Only complaints are too much smoking (need to have smoking sections) and bathrooms a bit inconvenient (to beach and restaurants). Pillows were a bit smelly (as stated in prior reviews); some fresher smelling detergent or fabric softener would probably help. There is construction going on on north side of building (October 2011). I suggest you see where your room is before getting keys and moving luggage in. I specifically asked about construction and we were assured there was none near us; we get to our room, look out the window and there are workers hammering not 30 yards away! We were then assured they don't start working until 9:00 at the earliest, so we settled in - only to be awakened at 7:30 the next morning. They did give us another room on the other side of the resort (which I would recommend - next to the Reef), so all was good. I definitely recommend this resort and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Vacation, good!”
Reviews.Author: Holly P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from March 29-April 6 for 9 nights. the property was very impressive and huge. Our first impression was that it lacked the Mexican/Caribbean feel of an open air lobby. Check in was a breeze, front desk was very nice and attentive. Room was small for a suite, but we had a great view of the ocean. Bed was hard, we asked for a matress pad, it worked a little. Food was ok. Japanese was the best, Mexican was ok, not what I expected being in Mexico, steakhouse was not good, over cooked our meat and it was tough to eat, and the Brazillian was amazing! Buffet for breakfast was great, same stuff every morning, but it was delicious. Dinner buffet, horrible! We liked that the property was in a private gated community so you were able to walk out the property and down the road to the right and go to 5th Ave or go left and into the little shopping plaza. Isla at the lobby bar, Victor in the sports bar, and Anthony at the swim up were the best bartenders. They went over and above!!

Reviews.Title: “RIU es sensacional”
Reviews.Author: jkelly611
Reviews.Content: Overall my wife and I thought this hotel was outstanding. We were scheduled to stay at the RIU Playacar but upgraded at the last minute. No comparison. This hotel is like and night and day compared to the RIU Playacar. I also thought it stacked up to the Royal which we stayed at in April. Building/Grounds 5.0 Very impressive with high-grade stone/marble, fancy chandeliers, very well-groomed grounds. In April I walked from the Royal on the beach and ended up checking out the RIU Palace. Based on the photos I returned with, my bonita senorita (of almost 30 years) and I knew we had to stay here. Check-in/Check-out 5.0 Much much better and easier then the Royal. The time of year had something to do with it but, still the check-in staff is very pleasant and all seemed happy in their work. Food 4.0 I didn't think the restaurants were as good overall as the Royal. The food however was very good for buffet style and the main restaurant was quiet nice. The service in the restaurants and bars in general was outstanding. Room 4.0 It did have the musty smell that others complained about, but with the air condition on and a quick candle burning, not a big deal. The room itself was basic with a nice garden view and balcony. What really stood out was the exceptional cleaning by the staff. I'm a slob and often track sand in the room, yet unlike the Royal, the floor was spotless after every cleaning. Beach 5.0 Much better spot than the Royal. Nice stretch of beach with no shortage of palm trees (something the Royal lacked). A quick 10 minute walk to the left facing the beach took you to 5th avenue. A quick 10 minute walk to the right took you to along a great stretch of beach and other nice resorts. Pool 5.0 I really liked the pool area which included a nice infinity pool which we seem to have to ourselves. The pool bar had a old beer smell so we had the staff bring us drinks (in a big thermos). No issue with getting a pool chair. The Royal requied a 5am wake-up to get a good spot. Entertainment 3.0 Typical of these type of resorts. However, the Michael Jackson show was really good. Grease? Yikes Sandi had quite a tan. Service 5.0 Best ever at a resort. Didn't hurt that the resort seemed half-full. Compared to other RIU resorts in Playacar 5.0 No comparision. Absolutely the best and most impressive of the RIUs. If you visit them all you'll see what i mean. The Palace Mexico reminds me of Disneyland.. older not quite as nice as Disneyworld...in my opinion. Safety 5.0 All resorts in this area are part of a gated half-hotel, half-residential area which is very nice. We found a park along the street which had interesting Mayan ruins which we enjoyed (not Tulum but enough to say you saw Mayan ruins :) Transportation back to airport 5.0 Wow what a differance. So much easier than the Royal which was an absolute mad-house similar to the airport. They didn't even bother taking our bracelets (which are now available on Ebay.. kidding) Romance Factor 5.0 Sitting outside in the main restaurant on a beautiful evening with music playing in the courtyard with the most beautiful woman in the world was very memorable. The only complaint here is limited opportunities for dancing. They should add more of that as its cheap entertainment. Sports Bar 2.0 Crappy food, could be improved. Gym 2.0 I like using the treadmill in all-inclusives to keep the poundage off. Their equipment was poorly maintained and limited. Clean though which was such a common theme everywhere. Overall very very satisfied and highly recommend this hotel resort. Do not stay at the other RIUs as the price is not much different but believe me this one is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Not realy a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandyEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we have visited Mexico and probably the last. We decided to go for a 5 star hotel [all inclusive] just see how much better than our traditional 4 star in tenerife. We could have had 2 holidays in tenerife for what we paid for 10 days in mexico. Firstly I know no one can guarantee the weather but 5 days of rain [4 of it torential] didn't help].We booked with Thomsons and were told we could only purchase things with Mexican pesos. What rubbish! in Playa del carmen most prices were shown in American dollars. I was going to take dollars but was told i could not use them. The Mexicans wil also take Euros [of which i had about 250 at home. Come on Thomsons get your facts up to date! Not only that but all the excursions are priced in dollars! Be aware also of the exit tax of 750 pesos[about £40] which of course they will take in any currency.We flew from manchester and because of a head wind the flight took 10.5 hours instead of 9.50. We then spent almost 2 hours in the airport going thru customs and being registered for our exit tax. We took the maximum allownce of cigarettes & cigars our of Manchester and were then quizzed in Mexico about the amount. Fortunately they let us keep our entitlement but this is just what you need after such a long flight! The Riviera maya is a lovely hotel but because of the rain we spent a great deal of time inside. The cocktails and food were in general very good! I am however stggered at the waste of water in the hotel. one is advised to re-use bath towels to save water yet there is no guttering on the hotel so all the rainwater simply runs away, eventually. Also water was actually getting into the hotel and driping down the walls and thru the ceiling! In fairness the hotel did provide umbrellas to cope with the rain. Other people have commented on the provision of drinks & coffee in the rooms. on 3 days out of 10 we were left without any coffee for the folowing morning and several time our optics & soft drinks ran out and were not replaced. Not 5 star service by any means!. The excursions were expensive so we ventured to Cancun on our own one day. A taxi to the bus ststion was 70 pesos[about £3.50] but the bargain was the bus to Cancun [about £8.50,168 pesos return for both of us. The buses are very comfortable with a toilet, reclining seats and a movie for the 1hr 15 min journey. Once in Cancun you then catch the R1 or R2 bus to the hotel , shop or nightlife areas[10 pesos each]. We did find the the fact that we were staying in a Riu 5 star very useful as we were able to luch at another 5 star hotel where the food was superb! The enterntainment in the hotel was average. Having visited a few Thomson gold hotels in Europe where professional acts are flown out from Britain the local enterntainment varied from very good [the Micheal Jackson show on our last night] to poor. There was also no written info on the next few nights shows just an annoucement at the end of each show. Also with 5 other RIU hotels in the area where one could go, there was no info on what shows were on in other hotels. 5th Avenue in Playa Car is your traditional tourist strip and you do get hassled all the time by the shop owners. The food as you would expect was good but strangely there were no baked beans at breakfast. The junior suite we had was comfortable and spacious but looked out to the back of the hotel onto a pathway and the hotel next door. In summation , the weather did not help but I don't really think the hotel is 5 star quality.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: familykins
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel and its grounds are beautiful and the service very good, we were very disappointed with the upkeep of this hotel. This was our second visit to this Riu and our fourth time on a Riu property. All Riu hotels share the same musty, mildew smell that permeates all belongings from suitcases to clothes to leather goods. Even our passports smelled from sitting in the wall safe. The air conditioning in the rooms is not sufficient enough to keep out the humidity making the bedding and towels always feeling damp. The food is plentiful but not "gourmet" and the main dining room was dirty with stained chairs and carpet. The rooms were very clean but the bedding and furniture were stained. We have had enough of the Riu chain and will try another all-inclusive for our next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated and over priced....”
Reviews.Author: Sasha C
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I prefer to go to 5star hotels every time we travel and always try to do a lot of research before we book our holidays. In this case we did and seemed pleased with our research. This is by far the first time we couldn't wait to come home. From the leaking ceilings not to mention the FALLING ceilings we were already not impressed. They do not upgrade anything, just patch oil the ceilings with a garbage bag. It's the whole hotel! There are carpets and buckets everywhere! This is a RUI hotel!!! Are you frigging kidding me! The rooms looked NOTHING like the pictures that were shown on the sites and not to mention the dirty sheets that were on the beds! We wish we didnt choose to go mexico after this experience. The night life on the resort was lame and not to mention short lived! I thought Mexicans like to party... Uh ya, not on this resort! And something I have never seen before... They shut all the lights off in the main lobby by 11:00 pm... I'm not sure wha they are saving money for because they sure aren't using it to fix the leaks! I have never felt so sick to m stomach leaving a resort for a week but after being here i just returned this morning and I'm still burping up the food! We preferred to eat OFF the resort! Thankful the beach was amazing but yet again the resort entertainment during the day was boring. We were more interested in the next resorts entertainment then ours. Off the resort we enjoyed ourselves so much but we have never been so bored and in bed so early from being on a resort. Once again, overrated and overpriced! I'm all about spending but this was definitely not worth it. There was only one worker at the resort that was most helpful and his name was Nemo t front desk. The service otherwise from the other staff wasn't even worth tipping and we always tip well. This is the first time we ever came home with mos of the money we brought on our trip. I suggest if you are planning to book try somewhere else. Put it this way, I've never wrote a review for any trip that we hVe gone to but this was something that upset me so much I just had to let out my honest opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: dkelly27
Reviews.Content: We just returned last evening from a glorious week at the RPRM, so I'm writing this review with the warm afterglow of a fabulous experience at this resort. This was our 4th stay in this area of Mexico...our 2nd this year, but our first at this resort. In April of this year we stayed at The Royal Playa del Carmen (see my review here on TA), which is rated #6 of all of the resorts in the Riviera Maya here on TA. The RPRM is rated #31....I strongly disagree with this rating. The RPRM should be rated much higher and since I've stayed at the #6 and now here, I can offer a very honest comparison. The only Con that I can think of about this resort is that it is NOT an adult only resort. The Royal is and that was a huge plus for us since our kids are grown and don't travel with us any longer. Having said that, the RPRM really doesn't have that much to offer children and I would seriously advise parents to look for resorts that cater to families with children otherwise the kiddos won't have much to keep them occupied at this resort. Now on to the Pro's and there are many. Check-in..... was a breeze compared to The Royal. The front desk staff was welcoming and friendly (don't believe the negative reviews about the front desk staff, remember people will treat you with respect and kindness if you treat them with that same respect and kindness). Our room was ready, we were offered a cold drink and a wonderful gentlemen took our luggage, escorted us to our suite and showed us the mini bar, bathroom, lights, air conditioner, safe etc. (#1130) Great, quiet location located in the center between the lobby and the pool/beach with not much walking to either. Our jr suite..... was SPOTLESS...the floors were kept extremely clean during our entire stay as was the entire suite. We had 1 king sized bed (NOT 2 beds pushed together like we had at The Royal). The bed was firm but comfortable and the linens were fresh and clean. 2 steps down to the living room area with a nice flatscreen tv and a slider out to the balcony with 2 reclining chairs and a table. We had a nice garden view and overlooked the resort next door. It was so peaceful and quiet and we had our coffee out there every morning. The bathroom has double sinks and a combination bathtub w/jets and shower. There is also plenty of storage in the room...a large closet with about a dozen hangers, a safe and a nice sized bureau with 6 drawers as well as 2 nightstands with drawers. The liquor dispenser hangs on the wall above a counter which holds an ice bucket and a small coffee maker, under that is the small refrigerator with plenty of bottled water, soda and beer which is replenished daily. They also provide coffee, sweetener and powdered cream, however I brought my own Dunkin Donuts coffee and filters since I find the Mexican coffee extremely strong. There is an iron and ironing board, clock radio/alarm, blow dryer, magnifying mirror and essentials like soap, shampoo, lotion, comb, sewing kit, shower cap etc. all provided in the suite. The housekeeper leaves a towel animal each day and there is turndown service each evening complete with a couple of Hershey's kisses. The buildings/grounds.... While there we visited the RIU Playacar, RIU Tequila and the RIU Palace Mexico....none of these resorts compared to this resort. We were originally booked at the Playacar but I had the chance to upgrade (for a mere $95 more for the week) at the last minute and I'm so relieved that I did. The Playacar looks old and tired and in need of a facelift. The other Palace is nice but the lobby is not as opulent and the pool is small in comparison. This resort is absolutely gorgeous...the lobby is like walking into one of the mansions in Newport, RI it's that impressive. Beautiful chandeliers, gorgeous marble, granite and limestone everywhere, a breathtakingly beautiful stained glass ceiling and a gorgeous lapis blue domed ceiling that took my breath away each time I looked up into it. The wrought iron railings and gorgeous woodwork and furniture complete this impressive establishment. It's clear that this resort was well thought out and no attention to detail was spared. Right outside the lobby is the main piazza with plenty of seating and a huge fountain in the middle. There is a covered raised structure that serves as a stage for the nightly musicians. To one side of this piazza you'll find the main buffet restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating and to the other side you'll find the theater where the entertainment staff performs each evening at 9:45. The Mexican, Fusion, Brazilian and Japanese restaurants are also all in this area. Beyond the piazza are the beautiful fountains and large towering palm trees which line the walkway down to the pool/beach area. Everything is tiled with beautiful Mexican tiles which are scrubbed clean each morning. The gardens and lawns are meticulously trimmed and groomed...they really are quite lovely. Nothing is overlooked. Dining..... We made reservations at the Mexican, Steakhouse (Chili's) and Japanese, but we didn't end up going to the Japanese because the buffet was so delicious. The Mexican and Steakhouse were both very good. The Mexican starts off with a large hot/cold appetizer buffet and the rest of the meal is table served. Ask for the Mayan coffee and they'll put on a little show with fire at the table. This is also done at the Steakhouse with the baked Alaska dessert. I had the land/sea combo at the Steakhouse and my husband had the ribeye. Both of us enjoyed our selections, the steak was tender and cooked to the desired temperature. The chilled seafood appetizer that they served was awesome as well. No complaints about either of these restaurants. The buffet was the best of any all-inclusive resort that we've ever stayed at. I don't understand the few reviews that complain about the food. Every single item is prepared with the greatest of care and the hot food is kept very hot and the cold food is kept ice cold. The selection is incredible...many choices of meat, seafood, vegetables, rice, potatoes, fruit, cheese, soups, salads and desserts. If you can't find something to your liking then I must ask...what do you eat? I'm a food snob, I'll admit it. I like to dine. I can't say enough about the food at this resort. The Merlot is also very good. lol Pool/beach areas..... So beautiful. Plenty of loungers which is awesome...at The Royal we had to wake up before 6am to save our chairs for the day, that was unnecessary at this resort. Now, I realize it's slow season, but there were literally hundreds of loungers between the pool and beach. There are also many many many palm trees to protect you from the hot sun. The pool is nice and clean...people who complained of many tiles missing and the pool being dirty must have exagerated because I witnessed exactly 2 small 1" tiles missing in the infinity pool and it was always very clean. The beach is MUCH better than the beach at The Royal (which abuts the Cozumel ferry). This resort's beach has nice soft white sand and crystal clear turquoise blue water. The staff..... are all lovely. Every single one of them from the bartenders to the waitstaff to the housekeepers to the grounds keepers are there to make sure you have the best vacation possible. They want to please you, they treat you like royalty. Each time I came back to my seat from the buffet someone would rush over to pull my chair out, it was so touching. They're respectful, friendly, hardworking people...please treat them accordingly. I realize this review is lengthy but I wanted to give my honest opinion. There are a few negative reviews on here from the same time period that I was at this resort and I'm here to tell you I didn't witness or experience any of the things that these reviewers claimed. I did witness a few travellers being rude to the staff and maybe that explains it. Do not hesitate to book this resort. I can say without an ounce of doubt that we will stay here again...I've NEVER felt that way about any of the many resorts we've stayed at in the past. RIU is doing something right. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. Book the RIU Palace Riviera Maya with confidence that you'll have as wonderful a holiday as we did. I know you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not amazing: Everything you need to know”
Reviews.Author: ncoutroulis
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that this is our first (and probably last) experience with an All Inclusive Resort. That said, we were originally supposed to have stayed 8 nights at RIU Palace Mexico. Because it was so terrible, after 3 hrs, we checked out and into this place. This is a much better and much more contemporary experience. Here are the details: THE HOTEL: The hotel is located in a secure/gated area, Playa Car. A short, $7 cab ride, or about 20 min walk to Playa del Carmen. There are 5 RIUs in this area, as well as some other resorts and homes. You're actually allowed to use the facilities at any of the other RIUs, with the exception of dinner. You must eat dinner at this hotel. It's a nice feature if you decide to venture out along the beach and want to stop for a drink at one of the other properties. This is a grand hotel, as most of them are along this strip. Very well kept, both inside and out. The grounds themselves are immaculately maintained, and really beautiful. The hotel sits perpendicular to the beach, so there aren't any beach front rooms. A bit strange, considering other hotels on this stretch of beach do offer this, but the walk to the beach isn't far, and the pool is the best of all the RIUs. The gym is small, especially for a "5 star" resort, and the equipment definitely needs to be updated. The beach is really beautiful though, and weather permitting, you have free use of Boogie Boards, kayaks, catamarans, and snorkel equipment. Very nice. There are plenty of lounge chairs on the beach, as well as palm trees and hammocks. Wait service is available, and the bar is a pretty short walk as well. THE ROOMS: First off, the beds were like sleeping on a rock. You can ask for a mattress pad, which helps a little, but be warned...it only makes the rock you're sleeping on seem like a mossy rock. While much nicer than RIU Palace Mexico, the rooms could definitely use some updating, as well as some personality. They were clean, and didn't smell, but they were also generic and non-descript. Close the window, and you could be in, "insert generic hotel chain here". Remember: this is a FIVE STAR hotel, so rooms with some personality are expected. The rooms are cleaned 2x a day though, which is nice, and the mini bar (beer, soda, water) is free and replaced daily, although sometimes they did need a reminder. We had the Jr Suite Superior, which faced the main fountain area. It had a large balcony which was great. The drawback was the noise. The entertainment at night took place in the area outside the balcony, so it made sleeping a little tough. Our room was 2094, so if you get a room that's closer to the pool, the noise will be much less. We did see the King Suite, which was pretty amazing! But much more expensive, and there are very few of them. THE FOOD: The food was just "ok". Do not expect to come away from this with any type of appreciation of what real Mexican cuisine is. If you're a foodie, in any way, shape or form, you probably won't come home and rave to your friends about the food and how great it was. There is one main restaurant, Don Manolo. It's a buffet, and you can eat breakfast, lunch and dinner here. Breakfast is a massive buffet with anything you could want. No complaints at all. Lunch: Underwhelming and after the first day, you really don't want to go back. Lots of fried food and heavy Mexican dishes that are sitting out for long periods of time. Dinner: Also a buffet, lots of choices, most of which are very average. I will say that Friday night they had a pallea that was actually very good. There are also 5 A la Carte restaurants in the hotel. The bad thing is that you have to make reservations in person, the day of, at noon every day. A bit of a hassle. We were lucky enough to have met a wonderful staff member, Rene, who was working in Don Manolo's. He made our weeks reservations for us, before noon, and without us having to wait on line ever! Try to find him, and see if he'll do the same for you. Just please, make sure you take good care of him! :) These restaurants are Japanese, Brazilian, Steak House, Fusion, Mexican. Why they didn't choose to make these 5 unique Mexican restaurants, allowing us to taste the many flavors of different parts of this great country, I don't know...Also, the menu in these places never changes. There will always be the same 4-5 choices on the menu, so it gets a bit tired. Japanese: Very nice place, probably one of the best. The fish wasn't that fresh though. Brazilian: If you like meat, this place is actually pretty good. Also kinda fun because it's the "ridizio" style of eating. Fusion: This is the "high-end" place. It's French fusion food, and it's pretty good. I had the lamb, which was over-cooked, but I tried all the dishes. Mexican: lots of food, because you start with a buffet, which could easily be the meal itself. The food is "ok", again, not the pinnicle of Mexican cuisine, and pretty heavy. The shrimp ajilo was the best on the menu. THE SERVICE: I have to say, I was very impressed with the service. With the exception of having to ask several times for things like a mattress pad and water to be brought to the room, the service in the bars and restaurants was really fantastic. FOR KIDS: The sole reason we came here was because of our son—we wanted to make sure there were activities for him. It's really hit or miss because it depends on how many kids are there, but they do have RIU Land, which has "counselors" who do activities a couple times a day with the kids. Jocelyn, who is in charge of this, is absolutely amazing!!!! At night they also have "mini disco", where they have a show with the kids. It's only about 30 mins, but it's great for the kids, they can run around everywhere and nobody cares. PLAYA DEL CARMEN: A $7 cab ride, this is the "main town". It's a tourist town on the beach, nothing more. The main street, "Avenida 5", is filled with aggressive and annoying vendors, constantly calling to you to buy their tacky souvenirs. If you come here thinking its the "real Mexico", you'll be wrong and disappointed. It's filled with plenty of over-priced bars and restaurants. We did come for lunch 2x, but seeked out places off this strip that were actually really good. Aguachiles + El Fagon. XCARET: Absolutely amazing. You have to see this place to believe it. Go early and spend the entire day. Take a cab, $15 each way, and buy the Xcaret Plus ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous holidahy/hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn W
Reviews.Content: We were at the Riu 11-18th October 2011 celebrating my 50th birthday. It was our first time in Mexico. We were very impressed with the Riu, with it's spectacular lobby and grounds. We stayed in room 1099 which was on the first floor. This offered us lovely views of the grounds (with the obligatory two little animals which the waiters told us were their native rabbits) and most of us holidaymakers found quite fascinating! Room service absolutely excellent, food absolutely fantastic and the evening entertainment, offered something for everyone. We are looking to go there again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya.......very palatial!”
Reviews.Author: pattiOhio
Reviews.Content: Went to this resort a month ago and loved it. I must say that the pool at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is the best pool out of all of the Riu's in this area, however, it's location is out of the loop a bit compared to the other Riu's. It's a short/maybe 8 to 10 minute walk to get to the other Riu's, however, if it's hot, you will not want to make that walk. It's also the closest to downtown Playacar........so, give and take. This Riu is the newest of the Palaces in the area and has a 24 hour sports bar and an Italian Restaurant both of which the other Riu Palace Mexico does not have. You can stay here and use the amenities of the other or vice versa. I felt that the entertainment was very good at night/meaning the shows. The decor is very ornate and the grounds were amazingly manicured. This is a very easy property to get around and everything is in very close proximity to the lobby area. The jacuzzi suite is well worth the upgrade and at the very least/the suite......but if it's not in your budget/ at least upgrade to the courtyard view......this view enables you to see the main walkway and the fountains from your room...........this part is a must and only a few dollars more. There are a total of 6 Riu's in this area that you will be able to use by staying at the Palace and for a 7 night stay......this is huge for a change of scenery. I feel that this is the best area in the Riviera Maya as far as being mobile .......there are actually sidewalks out front of the hotel and you can easily walk downtown if it's not too hot.......a cab is around $5.00 to get downtown and less than 5 minutes. A great value and wonderful staff.........food was very good as well. Rooms all have liquor dispensers in them and are nicely appointed. You must make reservations for the specialty restaurants/I'm not a fan of that .....however, don't let that stop you from picking this resort. There is free wi fi in the lobby only and there are computers that you can pay for the minutes to use if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: naturalgrass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in September. After staying at the Riu Playacar last year, we wanted to return to the Riu resorts. The "palace" resorts are much nicer than the Playacar, Tequila and Yucatan. Plus, if you stay at either of the Riu "Palace" resorts (Riviera Maya or Mexico) you can "play" at any of these. If you are trying to decide between the Riviera Maya or the Mexico...I think the RM is the better of the two. Much more atmosphere, better pool and beach. The food was great! We choose the buffet most nights for diner because of the variety. The Brazilian steakhouse was good...not great. The fusion restaurant was ok. We didn't try any of the others. Breakfast was top-notch every morning. I enjoyed "eating around the world" every morning by following people from different countries, filling my plate with some of the same items they chose to have. Lunch was always good as well. One highlight of this year’s trip was that the wine was much better than what we were served at the Playacar last year. Top shelf liquor was served at all of the bars, all you have to do is ask for it. One issue I had was the dress code. The Riu has a policy that you cannot wear shorts in any of the theme restraints but they let people do it all the time. That’s OK with me just let your guests know that it is fine. I packed several pairs of pants and two sets of dress shoes and would have liked to have the extra space in my luggage. The room was good. The beds are a little hard but after a long day of sun and fun, I never had trouble getting a good night’s rest. The bathroom could use some updates as others have mentioned. AC worked fine and we never smelled the "musty" odor that some complain about. We used the safe in our room but never really worried about theft. On many occasions, I accidentally left my expensive watch out on the nightstand and it was never touched. I'm not saying it doesn't happen...just that it isn't something that we ever worried about. The service at this resort is excellent. Thanks to Jesus and Islas at the lobby bar, cocktail servers Swemi and Paty, Guillermo at the front desk, breakfast and lunch server Janet and Gustavo for dinner at the buffet. All of these great people made our trip even more special by providing great service day after day. These folks work very hard for everyone, even the rude and obnoxious. Go into Playa and experience the city. It is completely safe and the Mexican people are wonderful. I know this sounds funny but one our favorite things to do in Playa is go to Wal Mart! Not only can you buy vanilla, mexican coffee, tequila and snacks at lower prices...but you get to see all the different produce, meats and seafood. We also had dinner in town one night at Wicky's and lunch on the beach at La Tarraya (see my review on TA for these places). You don't have to go to Tulum or Chichen Itza for excursions...just wander into town. I would recommend this place to everyone and go back in a heartbeat. Message me if you have any questions...I'd be glad to answer them!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Pattileah
Reviews.Content: Absolute Paradise!! Girl’s yearly getaway!! Oct 6th-13th. Wow this place could not have done enough. We would return to this place in a heartbeat. HOTEL: The hotel and rooms are very clean. Rooms are a nice size there was three of us in the room and there was plenty of room. Like all the Riu's they have a stocked fridge with pop, beer, water...they also put a large bottle of water in the bathroom everyday please remember to use this when brushing teeth...do not use the tap water other then bathing. FOOD: The food is the best I have had at an all inclusive (we all agreed on that)!! Most places I have went in Mexico I hated the wine but they gave us a choice of Mexican or Chilean wine and hands down the Chilean wine was the best. Actually liked it!!! STAFF: The staff is fantastic I mean they could not do enough for everyone; they serve you around the pool and on the beach and are always asking you day and night if all is ok. The entertainment is ongoing and always something...loved the beach party. LOCATION: The location of the hotel is great we took a cab into Playa Del Carmen a couple times (5 min cab ride at the most) to shop and the night before we left went to a great Italian restaurant on 5th Ave. You could also walk (about 20 min walk) We also went into Playa Del Carmen to catch the Ferry to Cozumel ...rented a jeep in Cozumel for the day and went around the island... :) THE BEACH: The beach is fantastic, tons of loungers, beautiful white sand and the swimming is great. Personally I think the Riu Palace Riviera Maya has the best beach. I seriously do not have one complaint about this place it was ABSOLUTLY PARADISE!! However I do have a suggestion, for the management…shuttles over to the Riu Tequila (this is where the Disco is at night) I heard a few people saying the same thing. The staff at this Hotel are unbelievably accommodating…please please remember to tip them. If someone at home served you, you would tip them I just seen way to many people expecting service and not tipping and it made me sad. A big Hello to our server at the pool and on the beach Adrian…..you spoiled us rotten…. Thank you Riu Palace Riviera Maya for great memories, we will be back !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: mryesc
Reviews.Content: We traveled the week of Oct 8 - 16th with 8 family members. The first impression of the Riu was beautiful walking thru the lobby. Our check-in was not so easy though. First we were required to present a "print out" of proof for our rooms when they clearly had our names on their computer. A few people (Vanessa) at the front desk were extremly rude and not willing to budge in any way to work with us. I have never experienced such rudeness before and was so mad I wanted to switch hotels because of her treatment. We resolved our issue 2 hrs later but for the rest of the week I refused to even go to the front desk if she was there. We also had the wrath of the travel agents literally fighting over us. (Apple and Cheap Carribean) This is my 6th time to MX and know from experience tell the agents no thank you and your not interested and they don't bother you the rest of the week. Well apparently not at the RIU. Our agent basically was refusing to agree to sign our travel transportation unless we sat thru her 2-3 hour presentation. I flat out told her NO which was very obvious she was ticked but finally agreed to sign. Again not very happy with the treatment. This is something RIU should address because it is a definite turn off as I heard from many guest in the pool, dinner, etc. The rooms were nice and clean but were old and need to be updated. The bathroom is old with a tub you have to step over a good foot and half wall to get in to. I can see where this could be a problem for someone with hip problems or an elderly person. The room (1117) was cleaned daily. We did have little ants one day coming out of the bench, called the front desk who immediately sent someone with a Raid can to spray. She left the can for us if we found anymore which we never did. The bed was very comfortable for us. One of the other rooms the bed was hard as a rock. We called the front desk who sent maid service to make the bed with a mattress pad which made a huge difference. Our AC seemed to be off thru out the day for the first couple of days. By the 3rd day maintenance came to our room to check and had advised if the sliding door is opened for any reason the AC automatically shuts off. (this was never told to us at check-in) Make sure the sliding door is shut tight and the key is in lock position. You will hear the AC kick on as soon as it locks. Another point to remember is there are two buttons next to the inside of your door. One has a red light on it which if turned off will shut off the power to your room. So remember not to hit when leaving your room. Rooms overlooking the main area outside can be loud at night because of the shows and music that go on until 11:30. If you are a light sleeper ask for a room closer to the pool end or facing the opposite side of hotel. This makes a big difference in noise. All rooms are basically the same it just a matter of where your facing and how big your patio is. We had a Jr. Suite Superior but were facing the side of the Chili's restaurant. No big deal because I liked it quite and slept very well all week. The pool is nice but could also be bigger. Since we were visiting during low peak season the hotel was at a 1/3 full with not a full crowd. I can see how this could become very crowded in the summer if full since it's not very large. The beach is beautiful and plenty of chairs. This is the first beach I didn't have to worry about sand bags and rocks. There is a cookout on the beach one day with fresh coconut drinks. You can walk to the other RIU's from the beach which is anywhere from 5 to 10 minutes. The RPRM is definitely the nicest of all the hotels. We checked out the other hotels and found them to be older and smaller. The food was very good and never had any trouble with getting sick. The service is excellent and all of the staff (outside of the front desk) will go out of their way to get you anything. I noticed a lot of people did not tip which is not expected but is greatly appreciated. There were couples who made arrangements for a special setup (flowers on table, champagne, etc) and waiters would go out of their way with exceptional service. I was so impressed with their attitudes even after the guest would just get up without leaving a tip much less a thank you. We were offered a red wine (Deavalo) which was good and not offered to everyone unless you ask for it. Make sure you ask for it....much better than the red wine provided. The buffett was excellent and fresh daily. The Chili's restaurant is good and open during the day for quick bites. The Brazlian is good but lots of meat. (like 7 different kinds) The Mexican is ok but honestly the buffet gave a better selection and much better. The Habachi was good but disappointed they dont cook in front of you. Chili's at night is a steak restaurant and was good as well. Sorry this is so long but felt compelled to give my honest review of the hotel. I enjoyed it but not sure if I we will go back. We went to Riveria Princess last year and it's just so hard not to compare swim up suites to an outdated room. My tips are: - Call for a mattress pad if bed is too hard - If AC is off make sure the sliding door is closed and locked - If no hot water call the front desk; it will be on within 5 minutes - Ask for Deavalo wine. It is not offered unless you ask for it - Get a cab from the guy at the front door. Travel agents will overcharge you - Buy your tickets to any tours online if you can. Agents are expensive. Don't do the pkg deals...way too expensive thru an agent. - Go to Tulum and visit the ruins and beach. The most beautiful beach you will ever see

Reviews.Title: “RPRM- Will Return!”
Reviews.Author: GaVol
Reviews.Content: Short and Sweet- One place I would definitely go back to! Positives: Staff very friendly and helpful. Room was great, 2nd floor, overlooking gardens/fountains. Housekeeping great. Buffets all very good. Mexican and Asian a la carte both great. Did not try the others. Bartenders all nice, and decent spirits available ( Absolut, Johnny Walker, etc.). Beach area very nice. Trees provide plenty of shade if you need it. Plenty of loungers. Towels no problem. A bit long, but walkable to la Avenida Quinta. Pool areas nice and plenty of room. Folkloric Maya dance by the entertainment staff was amazing! Negatives: Too many cigarette smokers in the water around the pool bar area. Come on folks! Reservation system/ e-mail response from RIU a bit sketchy. Requests have to go through "Sales" which is no longer located in the hotel. Overall, a great experience at the RPRM. Hope to be back there soon!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: Quentin A
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is a review three years past due. I went to Playa Del Carmen in October of 2008 and stayed at the Riu Palace. At that time it was just over a year old and it showed. The grounds were immaculate and the staff super friendly. The resort lobby was pretty impressive and ornate. The resort was walking distance from the shopping district with an outdoor mall and you can even take a ferry (which we did) over to Cozumel! The room wasn't quite as impressive, however, but still pretty nice. The room seemed a bit small for a 5 star resort, the bed was a little hard (that seems to be a pretty general consensus among the other reviews I've read), but the view was pretty awesome so it was fine. There was a couple of steps down from the main "bedroom" area to a sitting area with a couch and TV. There was a little half-wall dividing the "bedroom" and "sitting area" which was covered with crayon some previous guest's child had obviously had some fun with. I was a little disappointed in that...but that was my only real concern with the rooms in terms of tidiness. The courtyard of the resort was awesome! Fountains, green grass, flowers, and pools. It definitly did the pictures on their website justice. The swim up bar was a frequent stop for us, and although the drinks were a lot lower quality than the drinks at the lobby bar, it was still a pleasant thing to have while relaxing in the pool. The white sands beach was pretty awesome too. Bluest water I've ever seen! My wife and I did get hit up to buy marijuana from some guy on the beach which we thought was pretty inappropriate but the guy was pretty jolly and didn't make us uncomfortable. Since this resort is all-inclusive the food has to be mentioned...and I'm happy to say that was one of my favorite parts! I'm a bit of a picky eater, very picky actually, and find myself refusing to go to several restaurants in my area because the food just isn't very good. The resort offered a few "restaurants" that you set reservations for on a daily basis and were more "dress up" than the buffet. Due to limited selection (whatever they were serving the night you went was all you had to choose from) we ended up enjoying the buffet more than the restaurants. All of the food was really good. One evening they served beef wellington at the buffet (one of my favorites) and it was excellent! I would definitely recommend eating at the resort when you go and saving money (besides, why else did you go to an all inclusive resort??). All in all it was a very pleasant stay and I would definitely stay there again, or any Riu property, as I feel they do a great job with their hotels and their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want to lose weight from Vomiting & Diarrhoea”
Reviews.Author: mikeymikeyuk
Reviews.Content: This was a very disappointing holiday for us at this hotel as we all became very ill during our stay. There we 6 of us in our group & 4 of us became ill from a parasite found in the water or the food here (Entamoeba Histolytica) Amoebiasis. This has been confirmed from our UK doctor within days on returning home. We became very ill during our stay with severe vomiting & Diarrhoea lasting several days. This matter was brought to the attention of the hotel staff before we left, we gave all our details & our symptoms on a special form given to us by a smiley & very sarcastic male receptionist & we have heard nothing from Riu since about this matter which is quite frankly disgusting. Surely this sort of thing should be dealt with a matter of urgency if guests are becoming ill at the hotel. We only ate food from here & had drinks here, hence it is a 24 hour all inclusive resort. Perhaps it was the water we used to brush our teeth or ice in the drinks or the even food, we do not know for sure the exact source of this parasite, all we know is we caught it here. When we arrived here we were greeted by a curt receptionist who could not understand even the most basic English language, we were not shown to our rooms either. The hotel was very clean in the lobby/corridor areas & first impressions were quite good in general. The rooms are the standard kind of ‘Riu’ basic that you get, nothing spectacular or modern in anyway. Riu really need to invest some money in their hotel rooms. The rooms that Thomson are allocated have no view, they are all at the back of the hotel. The pool & beach area is very nice however perhaps a lot of money is spent here when it could be spent on the rooms & food. The pool area was not relaxing as there was an annoying entertainment team constantly on the loud microphone, the beach was the only option to try & get away from this. The service & the staff in this hotel were on average ok but came no-where near to the service & friendliness of the Riu Palace Las Americas the year before. Some of that staff ignored requests made for extra water, bedlinen, food etc to the room. Drinks orders were very slow & the bar inside the hotel was understaffed especially when the weather took a turn for the worst. The restaurants were ok but again you cannot compare them the Riu Palace Las Americas in Cancun, the standard of food is not as good, neither is the service. No choice of wines were given even though there were 3 of each. The booking system is ridiculous for these restaurants, you have to queue between certain times. The sports bar is dank & dingy & dirty, not a place you’d want to go for drink or eat food at any stage. We have stayed at Riu hotels many times before, had this been the first Riu hotel we had ever stayed at then we would not ever return. This hotel is not anywhere near a 5 star resort, more like a 3-4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Sister got Married here”
Reviews.Author: lifebrand
Reviews.Content: My sister got married here in June 2011 and the decorations and ceremony went well. It was beautiful and the staff were very professional about it. The rooms are tidy and clean, the main buffet is AWESOME and the drinks are really good too. Every night we would sit in the lounge and one of the main "team lead" guy would come chat us up and also bring special multicolour shots to our table. The only downside i would say is that their 24 hr snack bar is not that great - as it's just sandwiches, some fake cheese + nachos.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: Although the common areas were clean and new, our room was dingy and did not smell good. The bed was not comfortable and the bedding was gross. My main problem was the food. There was variety; however, the quality was quite low. If you're looking to enjoy decent food on your trip look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: RP8133
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 nights last February and I just realized I never reviewed it! This was my hubby's first all-inclusive experience. OUr room was very nice with a dropped living room area. The bed was kind of strange - like 2 queens pushed together with something holding them together in the middle. A bit odd. I can tell you hubby thought he'd died and gone to heaven with the liquor dispensors in the room but try to get a bottle of wine in the room and forget it. The pool and beach area were very nice and the drinks were so-so. Some better than others. The drink glasses were teeny and I saw some people walkig around with Bubba kegs in which they had drinks put in. No Thanks! I'd never see 8 pm doing that!! We were told by the group that went before us that the buffet really was the best food of all of the resort and I can say we always had great food there. The Brazilian restaurant was a total disappointment. The steakhouse was OK but again not as good as the buffet. Service was great everywhere. Entertainment was OK but we usually didn't make it much past 10. We had a nice time but would likely try a different brand next time. In fact we have booked Sandals St. Lucia for this March and can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds!!”
Reviews.Author: NoRu03
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at a riu and it wasn't our last. The place was beautiful and the service wonderful. The staff spoke all kinda of languages and were very attentive and helpful. The only thing was that this place was for older couples, a little too fancy for our taste. The shows were really good!! Food was good!! Rooms were clean, beach was nice!! Just not our kind of atmosphere!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: zhuskers1
Reviews.Content: Great Place. Close to the city and shops. Not as tropical as other resorts but all in all very good. Food is consistent and service was good. Drinks are okay. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very good 5*”
Reviews.Author: Subaru12
Reviews.Content: THE AREA The hotel is set within a private sort of residential area, you have to go through a security gate to get into the estate. Lots of houses and other hotels, a very nice area. You can walk into Playa Del Carmen from the hotel, takes about a 15 min slow walk. We walked down 5th Avenue which is full of shops, bars and restaurants. Lots of jewellery shops, etc but if you want Silver, buy it off the people walking up and down the beach. Check that it's stamped (which most of it is), and you will get some great bargains. I have been twice and always bought from them, they still look brand new to this day. THE ROOMS Suites are large with lots of space for you clothes, a king size bed (or 2 double beds pushed together), a sitting area, optics, and minibar. The maids do an excellent job on keeping the rooms clean and fresh everyday, including turning your bed down at night and giving you more fresh towels...including a little Hershey Kiss chocolate on your pillow. They always tidied up our shoes, or if something was just laid on the side they would fold it up. One day we had a dirty sheet, I phoned reception and someone was there within 2 minutes...they were so apologetic, they didn't just change the one sheet they stripped the whole bed and did it all again. RESTAURANTS We ate in all the restaurants and they were all great. Some were better than others, but that was just our personal preference rather than there being anything wrong with the food. We particularly enjoyed Krystal, which is more of a fine dining restaurant, also the Japanese restaurant was very good. The buffet was also fab, you could really want for nothing. The service was exceptional too, the waiters constantly making sure you had water, wine etc. POOL/BEACH The pool bar area wasn't great. However, this seemed to be down to 2 things. 1) There was a very horrible smell coming from the bar, it smelt like sour milk and was pretty gross. 2) People in the pool bar (guest) were putting out cigars in the water, dropping drinks, nachos etc in the water. The bottom of the pool was cleaned with one of those hoover things, but to be honest it could do with a really good scrub. Especially the tiles etc around the pool.
