We tried the scuba diving in the pool, it was very good and well worth a go if you haven't done it before. The Beach was lovely white sand, lots of beds. The shade on the beach is basically the trees. Which for someone who burns was enough. You can just move your bed accordingly as the day goes on. OVERALL It was a really,really good hotel. A few little niggles - you get towel cards which I dont like, you have to book the Al a carte restaurants for the up to 2 nights in advance, and more often than not you get their own branded drinks. Some international drinks they don't stock..such as Jack Daniels etc. To be honest that was my only real quibbles about the hotel. Having said that, I wouldn't stay here again. Only because we have stayed somewhere else in Mexico that was better, and we really preferred it to the RIU. However, the RIU is still a great place to stay. I

Reviews.Title: “Awesome vacation”
Reviews.Author: trp80
Reviews.Content: Outstanding resort! Everything was perfect, beach, accommodation, food, activities.... Typical of Riu Palace Hotels, beautiful Reception, with immaculate Chandeliers and comfortable chairs. Reception staff really helpful and obliging - nothing too much trouble. Junior Suites were immaculately clean and kept that way throughout our 7 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth a Visit! Money Well Spent”
Reviews.Author: Melcar
Reviews.Content: Typical of Riu Palace Hotels, beautiful Reception, with immaculate Chandeliers and comfortable chairs. Reception staff really helpful and obliging - nothing too much trouble. Junior Suites were immaculately clean and kept that way throughout our 14 day stay. Bathroom Towels always white and clean. Drinks served in the Bar were great and staff would go out of their way to make you something special. Pool Bar service was also excellent. Buffet Restaurant had a good selection and the Waiters made sure that everything was in order and your glass was never empty. We used the Krystal Gourmet Restaurant 3 times and the Steak House 5 times - exceptional!!! Fantastic steaks and Lamb and plenty of wine & champagne.. Entertainment Team were fantastic and worked extremely hard. Good 'Broadway' type shows in the evening too. The gardens were a credit to the Gardeners. I have no hesitation in recommending this Hotel and will definately go back it was a piece of Paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation we have ever been on!”
Reviews.Author: gnc9292
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the RPRM, and hands down this trip was the best we've ever had. We e-mailed the resort letting them know it was our 10th anniversary. they gave us an amazing room with ocean views right by the pool. Whenever we needed anything in our room it was there when we got back. We requested breakfast at 7:10 am because we had to get a shuttle to go to coba (Mayan village where they still speak Mayan!) It showed up at 7:11! And that was with special requests. In the first hour of us being there, several of the management staff welcomed us and made sure to let us know if there was anything that we needed, to let them know. wherever we sat down throughout the lobby, common areas, immediately there was a waiter to ask us if we needed another drink. I don't think there was 1 time when I sat with an empty drink. As far as the sports bar is concerned, The staff there was bar none the best I have ever dealt with. One of the bartenders took time out to teach us Spanish in between making drinks and making everyone feel like they were old friends. I have never dealt with a friendlier harder working group of people. We actually gave one of the bartenders our contact info to keep in touch with him. And as in some of the reviews we read before choosing RPRM, the food in some of the restaurants wasn't excellent. Most of it was good, not great. But we didn't go there for the food. Krystal was excellent. The Ala cart restaurants are fairly small, so it is good to get down to the lobby to sign up for the restaurants right when they start taking reservations.The buffet was hit or miss, but overall pretty good. And the fact that you can visit, eat and use all of the facilities ant any of the other RIU is a bonus.We made res at palace Mexico when we couldn't get them at ours. Oh yeah, the coffee was really bad. but we knew that going in so we brought our own with us so that wasn't a problem. if you do, don't forget coffee filters or bring the Starbucks via instant. We were actually amazed at how clean everything was considering we were on a beach with sand and there was never any sand anywhere but on the beach. Then when walking around late night, there were staff with brooms meticulously sweeping and mopping all of the walkways and stairs. We will definitely go back there again. Just like one of the other reviewers said, we travel quite a bit and we never go to the same place twice in a row, but we are considering going back for our next vacation. To sum it up, No place is perfect. We never go into something like this too high expectations. We were pleasantly surprised with just about everything we experienced at this resort. As I said in opening, the best vacation I have ever been on. I would highly recommend this place. I have to mention, Everyone of the staff was great, but we spent a lot of our time in the sports bar because of the wonderful bartenders that worked there. Victor worked evening to midnight,, and pancho worked from midnight to 7 am. they both were hands down our favorite people on the staff at the palace. We would go back there if only just to see them and see how they are doing. I really feel like they are friends of ours. I would say that most of the people that spend any time in the sports bar feel that way as well. They were GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: waldo63
Reviews.Content: Let me break it done to what matters. The property is nice and clean. The food can be hit and miss. The buffet is really good. The Mexican is good, the Brazilian is awful and the steak house O.K. It is a safe area and a nice 10 min walk puts you in Playa Del Carmen. The rooms are clean and adequate. The room service is quick and efficient but the food is not very good. The service is fantastic and the sports bar is more fun than "RIU Tequila". I had read that Tequila was better. Its not and the service is fantastic at the sports bar. What I did find to be the best part and was quite surprised is the beach. The beach here is the best I've seen and this is the 6th resort, I.ve been too in the Mayan Riviera. So overall the resort is OK.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 6 night 7 day stay at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya, which is reported to be a 4 star hotel by AAA. We selected this resort based on that recommendation as well as the reviews on Trip Advisor. Com. This trip was a last family trip for sometime as my son leaves for military service in November and so we looked forward to this to being a special time for the 4 of us. We have all been to this area before, actually twice, but the first time at this property. But a 4 star, AAA property, are you kidding me? I would strongly argue this is NOT the case, so let me explain. Check in. We arrived and were not greeted by a welcome drink. (No biggie, I guess) We were assigned our rooms (2) and were not shown how to get to them. I had requested, via a direct call to the hotel a week before our arrival that our rooms be connecting. I had requested the same in the reservation and was told at the time we made the reservation that connecting rooms were possible. From what I understood when we arrived, there are no connecting rooms, but there are rooms that share a common main entrance to the hallway, but we could not even get that. I had requested in my call that we not be located near the entertainment area rather near the pool, which we were not. The entertainment went every night until 11 PM. Good luck trying to sleep. The lady who checked us in could have cared less about us, she was curt and otherwise could have cared less about our satisfaction and hence we had to find our rooms as mentioned earlier. We arrived to find out that there was no restaurants open and it was now 4:00 PM and we had not eaten since breakfast. We were told to go to the Sports Bar, which we did. The place was dirty, the food was premade and you warmed it in a microwave that was not dirty, it was filthy as was the Sports Bar. The staff person at the bar could have cared less about us. When I asked for mustard for a microwave hot dog, he looked at me and said “no mustard, only Mayo” Overall the food was disgusting in the Sports Bar and the hotel should not even attempted to serve it to anyone. This bar should be shut down. Upon check in we inquired about making dinner reservations for the restaurants. We were told that you could only make reservations between 12 noon and 3:00 PM daily, in person near the lobby. I find this to rather restrictive and not all guest friendly. Never a word about how we could use our $25 resort spa credit. Rooms. We did get the bedding types we requested, I king and 1 with 2 doubles. I asked 3 times for mattress /bed pads since I know the beds are not very comfortable. Finally got them. But here is yet another case where I requested this before we even arrived. By day 2 there were ants in one of our rooms. Went to the front desk and asked to be moved because of the ants and because of the noise at night. We moved the next day after they processed check outs for the day. We were moved to rooms that were across from each other that did share the common door to the hallway as we had originally requested and they were near the pool and away from the nightly entertainment. New rooms, no towels. Had to call 3 times to finally get them. Our bed cushions from our first rooms were not moved as I had requested at the front desk and instead they put new ones on that were worse than sleeping directly on the mattress. The in room refrigerator had an open bottle of water left in it from the people who were there before us so one had cleaned it before we moved in. We requested additional water several times, but it never arrived. The bottle of liquor that was missing from the dispenser was never replaced. Black mold was every where in our shower. Easy to keep under control in this climate with a little bleach each day. Front Desk Staff. Some tried hard to help and some did a good job for the most part. Others like Nathalie could have cared less about you. In fact, we had an issue we talked to her about. She went into the back room to tell someone and came back out, all within a minute or so and when she returned, she completely ignored us. Never said someone will be right with you, never said no one will help you, never said a word, just ignored us until I asked what was going on and she said “oh, I forgot about you” Now I am 6’4” so I am not an easy guy to forget or then again, maybe I am. Pool Area. Went down the first day, they were out of towels and we were told come to come back in 30 minutes or so. The pool itself needs some TLC. The assist handles going into /out of the pool are about ready to fall over. Tiles are missing everywhere in the pool. The dive instructor, Daniel, who gives you a brief free scuba lesson, is a great guy! Knowledgeable and puts you at ease. Resort Overview. Maids and other room staff were great and really tried hard to please. You cannot charge anything anywhere in the resort to your room, so you need to either carry money or a credit card. Most inconvenient. The people at the water sports hut were great to work with, especially the lady who runs it. The gym had water leaking, no actually running from the ceiling as you entered. This was not just 1 day, it was every day, so they had towels down to soak it up. Now I know why there were no towels at the pool! The gym equipment is in bad shape. The weight machine has a pulley belt which is frayed to the point where it’s about worn through. Dangerous situation. The food overall was good. The buffets were changed up nightly and most everything appeared fresh. Overall the wait staff was good to excellent. We did eat in 2 of the theme restaurants, the Yashima Japanese and the Brazilian Rodizio. The Japanese was outstanding as was the service. The other had way too much food, but none the less very good. The service was so, so. Did not attend any of the nightly entertainment, but none the less you could hear it pretty much any where around the resort. Started early and went to 11:00 PM every night. It was held in a semi open air environment, so that’s why you could hear it. So you do not want a room near this location, which is near the restaurants unless you don’t want to fall sleep until after 11 at night. Lastly, Hotel Management. Ok, so here is the topper to the whole visit. On Monday night the resort had invited in local artist to set up booths near the restaurants and the main court yard. We found a local artist who did unusual paintings on tile using is fingers. I asked him to do a custom piece for us, which he gladly did. We are not talking about a lot of money, $20.00 and took him about 2 hours since it was a special request, but none the less the painting turned out just the way we envisioned it and we were very happy with it. The next day we left it in our room to dry. I came up from the beach after the maid had been in the room and found she had placed a piece of paper, which had been laying next to the painting on top of the wet painting and then set a roll of tape, also laying next to the painting, on top of the paper. I was able to remove the paper, but there was damage to the painting. I took the painting, paper and tape to the front desk and spoke with Aaron who was, as I understand it an assistant manager of the hotel. I should point out here that if you asked to speak to the manager; he was always “Out” and was given to some assistant. I explained what had happened and he said that he would contact the artist, since I had his cell phone number on the paper that was placed on top of the wet painting and he would get him in to touch it up. This was about 3:00 PM. I went back around 5 or so and Aaron told me that the artist was in the area and he was going to have him come by. The next day, Wednesday, I went back up to front desk in the AM to speak with Aaron, but it was his day off. Now the day before he said nothing about being off Wednesday and he also knew that we were going to leave Thursday in the AM, so the touch up had to get completed by Wednesday at the latest. So I asked Nathalie, a front desk staff person if I could speak to the manager since Aaron was gone. She told me the manager was out. I asked about my painting and she disappeared into the back and came out with it. Come to find out nothing had been done to fix it. So again I asked to speak with the manager and again was told he was not in. So I asked for an assistant manager and Jose Wis appeared. He did not know anything about the situation, so I explained everything to him and he said he would try and reach the artist. I checked back later in the day and he said he had not reached the artist. Checked back after that and still no resolution so again I asked to speak to the manager. This time Jose told he was on property and he would try to reach him via his radio. Several minutes went by and Jose came out said he could not reach him, so he was going to send someone to look for him. 15/20 minutes went by. My wife and I are sitting and waiting for the manager and we see a man walk into the manager’s office and the light goes on. A few minutes go by Jose walks over to where we are sitting and simply states to me the manager, Xavier Saez will not see us. No reason. I ask again and he once again tells me the manager will not see us. I then ask about my painting and he tells us to leave it there and they will take care of. (Sure, I will………I know how this would turn out. Your gone so no need to take care of this) Ok, I have traveled throughout this country from coast to coast and to other countries including Asia, and others. In all of my travels, in all of the hotels I have stayed at from 2 star to 5 star, any time I have asked to speak to a hotel manager I have always been able to do so, whether it was right at the moment or through an arranged time. This place is different as we had asked to speak with him before on the room issue and were once again not able to. Apparently Mr. Saez feels that he is either one, to busy to speak to a guest that has a real issue that needs his attention or two, he just does not care about his guest or third, he did not want to deal with my frustration regarding the issue with the painting or maybe I was a pain in the back side that he would rather not have to deal with. Don’t really know? Whatever the reason for his complete lack of caring, it’s clear to me that guest satisfaction, recommendations and repeat business is not high on his list of objectives. Not talking to his guest is. All in all, I would maybe rate this hotel a 3 star and knock it down to a 2 star based on the manager, some of the front desk staff and overall condition. Would I go back, not only no, but h*** no! The 2 upscale Barceló properties were much nicer and much friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: loves2travel7
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this hotel and it was wonderful once again. The food was great, rooms were large, and service was incredible. Everyone on the staff works so hard to be sure that guests are well taken care of. Typically we only travel to adults only hotels. This hotel has children and families but during our stay there were not many children and the children who were there were well behaved. I would suggest this hotel for couples since we met a lot of couples there. The bars have top shelf liquor but you need to ask for it because if you dont then they give you the cheap local brand. If you ask for the top shelf, you will get it without hesitation. We are a couple in our late 20's and the hotel has pretty much nothing to do after around 11pm. The entertainment staff took those interested in going out to clubs which were maybe 10 minutes away ($7 cab ride). These outings were well worth it and the entertainment staff makes sure that you are well taken care of in the clubs. There are other hotels that we stayed in where you paid $60 for open bar and you couldnt even get one drink because of the bad service and crowds but that was not the case here. I cant wait to return to this hotel once again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: travelbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late writing this review. I visited in May 2011. It was my second visit to the resort. I was with four girlfriends and we had a wonderful time. Amazingly, the staff remembered us from the previous year and treated us as if we had come home. I was not disappointed the second time around. We relaxed, lounged at the pool and beach, strolled through Playa and ate well. The staff is magnificient, there isn't a bad meal to be had and the rooms are great. The staff here are well aware that it is the attention to detail and the small things that matter. There is little doubt that I will be returning. I hightly recommend the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Sun, relaxation and good times”
Reviews.Author: sweedkrs
Reviews.Content: I'd definitely recommend staying at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. My girlfriend and I had a great time and would love to go back. (Note: we stayed back at the end of May... a little slow in writing this review). We were initially recommended by my brother, who had stayed previously, and were more than pleased with the stay. FOOD: Right on par with the other Riu's that I've stayed at (Riu Palace Cancun and Riu Cabo Santa Fe). For the most part, it's exactly what you'd expect for an all-inclusive hotel in Mexico... The buffets are decent and the separate restaurants have some good menu options at each. Our favorite was the Japanese one... Ask your waiter for the sake bomb! In terms of making reservations, we never really had a problem making those (except we were never able to get the Krystal restaurant). POOLS/BEACH: The main pool was okay, but was a bit "cloudy.” The beach is nice, with a bunch a chairs and a volleyball court. However, the best part of the beach was actually up closer to the pool where you can relax under the palm trees, especially nice when the sun was super-hot. The water was nice and very calm without many waves. On the beach, you can walk to a number of different Riu hotels (since you're staying at a Palace, you can get drinks from all other Rius). In the other direction, you can walk all the way to the town of Playa del Carmen via the beach (about 20-30 min walk). BARS: If you're looking for a rowdy bar scene, this is not the place. The hotel has a very nice courtyard where folks sit at tables drinking at night. The main draw was actually the "show" that the staff puts on every night. Can be kitschy but entertaining none the less (especially when you've got a few drinks in you). At night, it was always nicer to drink outside, rather than in one of the bars (we thought the lobby bar was a bit "stuffy"). ROOMS: Nice rooms... If you've ever stayed at a Riu before, you're getting the same rooms here, too. We had a room on the outside without a sea view. In our opinion, not really worth paying extra for the "ocean view" rooms because we actually had more privacy on our side, especially when relaxing and drinking some cocktails out on the balcony. ACTIVITES/TOWN: You can walk into town from the hotel. It takes about 20-25 minutes, but if it's hot, it feels like longer. The town of Playa del Carmen is nice. The main "strip" is about 10-15 blocks of stores, restaurants, bars, etc. Nice to stroll down and you can pretty much do the town in one afternoon. We also took the ferry over to Cozumel. When you're at the pier, be ready to face the gauntlet of people trying to get you to rent a jeep and what not. If you plan on renting a jeep on Cozumel, would recommend having it pre-arranged before you make your way onto the ferry because it's a bit chaotic when you're there. Cozumel is nice (water is near the top of clearest I've ever seen), but there's only so much you can do on foot. If you go to the island, would recommend getting a jeep/scooter to make your way around the island, or go with an excursion group. We also did an snorkeling excursion called Deja Vu (we booked through Olympus tours). Highly recommend! A bus picks you up in the morning and takes the group down to a marina near Tulum. The reason we liked it so much was that the tour only took out 8 people at a time (make sure to book early in the week, b/c it will sell out). The captain, Roberto, is a great guy. He takes you out to a couple of spots to snorkel with sea turtles, coral reef, etc. Also, you'll go to a cove with fresh water fed cenotes. You also get a light lunch, as well. Great time! All in all, I highly recommend a visit to Playa del Carmen and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “great mexican getaway!”
Reviews.Author: blondephotog
Reviews.Content: we totally enjoyed our 4 day stay at the riu -- its not the most elite or high end resort in playa del carmen (LOVED secrets maroma beach for a more high end stay) but it was beautiful, the staff was friendly, and we had a great time! i noted the mixed reviews regarding food, cleanliness, etc and we had no real complaints -- yes, the food is good (but not amazing) the drinks are plentiful (but not top shelf) and the resort is beautiful and well maintained. our room was clean and pretty! it was an awesome value and i would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a fun getaway without spending a ton of money! what we loved :: the decor + ambiance -- smaller resort with very fast walk to the pool + beach -- stunning white sand beach + beautiful water -- fun pool area + friendly waiters -- big time mini bar in the room -- access to all the other riu hotels in the area. what could use improvement :: the dining reservation system -- you cant choose your restaurant each night, you have to make reservations days in advance, so we didnt get to try all the restaurants, which are more delicious than the buffet (although buffet was good) -- all drinks served in tiny cups (buy a cooler cup in the gift shop for keeping big beverages icy during the day!), only 2 draft beers available (not good for beer aficionados!) slightly crowded beach + pool area...beach has lots of water sports happening, so often the fresh air smelled more like fuel as the jet skis roared by, and the pool water was very warm and not the cleanest by midday. also, room service (boasted as 24 hour) can take a while and the menu is extremely limited compared to other resorts. overall, great value trip if you are looking for something fun but simple, for less than half the price of a more high-end resort experience!

Reviews.Title: “todo bien?”
Reviews.Author: TWO25
Reviews.Content: The most common phrase I heard while staying at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya,"todo bien?" (everything ok?). From wait staff in the buffet and speciality resturants, waiters around the pool area and even occasionally from cleaning personel. This resort is not perfect (I hate towel cards), the pool at bit small, my preferred whisky not available, but if your going to let a few inconviences ruin your vacation then............... My room was spacious and clean. It was cleaned every day, every afternoon the bar was restocked, and every evening turndown service and additional clean towels were provided. I had no problem with reservations for the speciality resturants, but the selection at the buffet was huge and with no required seating times it became my preference. And the buffet dinning room is AIR CONDITIONED! Not so at many all-inclusives I've been to. I particularly enjoyed the live music in the courtyard every evening.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise - I'd actually give it 4 1/2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Aljesbob
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel - The hotel itself is gorgeous, lots ot marble and granite. Beach - We loved the beach and how beautiful it was. I loved that we could walk down the beach for as far as you could see in both directions. It was easy to get to the other beach front Rius and into PDC. I am not exactly sure how far PDC is but it took us about 20 minutes and about 10 to get to the closest other Riu when heading south. The pool bar (Daquiri) was fun but I think that is really a factor of who else is at the resort at that time. We wished it had stayed open a little later, it closed at 5:30pm. Loved Tavo and Tony, excellent bartenders. Love that the pool bar has little seats with tables. You could see the ocean from various locations in the pool not sure if you could from the other Rius. Entertainment staff - Good but not pushy, by the same token if you are looking for events all day long, this did not happen. There was volleyball twice a day, water-aerobics, bingo. There were also some activities on the beach Futbol(Soccer), beach volleyball. We never saw water-polo or dancing at our resort but did down at Riu Playacar. Entertainment area - The area where the shows are presented each evening has it's own wrap-around bar, this is a nice area to be in because you can still carry on a conversation and also watch the entertainment. Note - you do not need to be a drinker to hang out there; there were a lot of people having non-alcoholic drinks. The food in the buffet was really good, this was the third all inclusive we had been to in the past 1 1/2 years and it was the first time John liked the food. We loved the Steak place, Chili's, try the Baked Alaska, it's worth it for presentation alone. We did not care for the Fusion restaurant BUT met people there from the states who loved it so it may have been an off night. I had Seabass and it was undercooked, my comment was if I wanted sushi I would have ordered it but they were very attentive and I should have sent it back. Breakfast inside started at 7 am and the outside restaurant did not serve until 10 am. Lunch "started" at noon but they typically did not have all the food out yet. They also had grilling on the beach three days. They serve lunch both outside at Chili’s and in the main buffet. They will cook your eggs to order. I prefer mine over easy but not over cooked - No problem they made me new ones. Weather was fantastic 85+ and sunny, even though weather.com had called for 30-60% rain everyday, it only rained twice once it began about 3:30 in the afternoon one day and did last a few hours and another it rained about 5 am and was done by 6. Entertainment - I know Monday was Movie theme (it was good), Tuesday was Las Vegas (didn't see it), Wednesday was Circus (lame), Thursday was A Mexican theme but it may have been a special event (appears this was a special event). They had a really fun Mexican Party... Another person we met said that the entertainment was completely different the week before. I do not know if that is true but may be because most of the Europeans we met were there for two weeks. I'm not sure if I could have handled that much alcohol. Also, we enjoyed going to the other hotels but liked ours overall the best. By far, RPRM had the widest beachfront of the four. As John said, there were certain items from each hotel we wished we could have combined. Such as bring the beach bar from Riu Mexico, the pool bar hours from Playacar, the three outside bars of Yucatan, the book exchange at all three, the activities of Playacar. Feel free to ask other questions. We loved it and are thinking of going back in April if we can last that long :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Macsoupdragon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our third stay at the RPRM in four years. when we first arrived we were told that if we were prepared to wait until the following day we could be upgraded to a courtyard view rather than the room we had been allocated overlooking the hotel next door which we agreed to do. Made no different to us, we simply didn't unpack until the following day. Rooms. - firstly have to say that on all of our three visits we have never once seen cockroaches and we have stayed on all thee floors. Maids come in daily to make the beds up, clean and change the towels (even though we put them to use again rather than in the bath which indicates that we want them changing). First Sunday we were there the room wasn't cleaned, we don't make a mess and really the only thing we would like on a daily basis is the bed making. The bed was made that day by the maid who came to turn down the bed. If it really bothered us we would have just called reception and got someone to clean the room then The second Sunday the room was cleaned but no towels were left, however a quick call to reception and fresh towels were delivered in five mins. food - the buffet restaurant was where we ate mostly during the evening. the staff there are great and are very attentive. Food is varied, there are always a couple of choices of joints of meat, fish, soup, salads, vegetables, pizzas, local dishes as well as on the speciality nights where you will have chefs who will make pasta, etc to your preferences. However we were disappointed that the speciality menus in the other restaurants were the same as 12 months ago. We tried krystals, the Japanese, the Mexican and steakhouse restaurants. Have to say that apart from the Japanese the serve we had was below par. Every week you will be asked to fill in a customer survey form. We noted this lack of service and the head waiter questioned us about this as he saw that we had made comments in the service box. He said that if we had any issues we should have spoken to him about it, but a) I didn't know he was the head man and b) he was never in those restaurants. I have to say that I would put this down to lack of experience possibly as the faces we recognised gave us a high level of service. We did tend to use the beach more than the pool, when we did use the pool we had no issues with the cleanliness of the area there was always someone sweeping up or tidying the gardens. I would recommend this hotel/area as being a gated resort it does give you the feeling of being very safe even when you walk to the other hotels at night. The hotel did seem busier than in our previous visits (we always go the same kind of time), if you are celebrating a birthday, anniversary, etc let the waiters know and they will decorate your table with petals and even sing to you, which is a bit of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible - Our best vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: Donbrown2
Reviews.Content: Location: Located on the best beach in the area. Wonderful warm and clear water with sandy beachs with no rocks. Check in and check out: Very smooth, quick and efficient. Rooms: Very nice put together. We liked our outside third florr room because we could sit on our deck "au natural" and sip our wine which the hotel stocked for us in our mini bar after we asked. If you like white sine ask for the "El Diavalo" which is Chilean - the mexican white wine is awful! I tried the Red Diavalo and it was quite drinkable too. Buffet: Vetry nice - lots too chose from. Chiles Restaurant (Steak House): Our favourite. We ate theie twice. Excellent service. Very good Caesar salad and seafood appy, main courses delicious and the Baked Alaska was to die for. Brazilian: Overall very good - but be ready to eat lots of meat. Meal served tapas style. Mexican: Excellent - tons of food!!! Go hungry. Japanese: I never thought I would eat sushi in Mexico but it was very good as was the entire meal. Fusion" Was my least favorite but may have been better if I hadn't ordered the lamb which was not very good. otherwise worthwhile to try. Sports Bar: Always food available (self service). Sandwiches prepared and ready to take out if you are going on an excursion. We took three with us to eat on the plane fou our return trip. We will be back but for two weeks next time!!! Hotel Service: Top notch absolutely nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Matthew L
Reviews.Content: Simply amazing was our stay here at the Riu Palace. The resort itself is beautiful with the full essence of the caribbean. The food in all of their restorants are well prepared although some items were not of my liking on the menues because I am picky, but if you are open to trying great dishes then you will not be dissappointed. They had Mexican, Brazilian, Japanese, and much more. The beach is wonderful and has a great atmospere and very relaxing, although is not a great beach if you like to snorkel. Great staff from the bartenders, housekeeping, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl0582
Reviews.Content: This is my third time staying at a Riu hotel. I have also stayed at a Riu in Cabo San Lucas and Montego Bay Jamaica....all have been spectacular! Now we look to see where there are Riu's and vacation there. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is spectacular, like all Riu's! We stayed for 5 nights/6 days and had a great experience the entire time. The rooms are clean, the maid service would clean our room sometimes 2-3 times a day. The food was excellent! They have 5 specialty restaurants for dinner, including a Steak House, Brazilian, Japanese, Fusion, and Mexican restaurants. You must make a reservation at the hotel lobby between 12noon and 3pm every day to reserve your spot at these specialty restaurants for dinner. Everything is included, though. If you do not want to eat at a specialty restaurant you can always eat at one of their International buffet restaurants, which are also delicious. Our favorite was the Mexican restaurant, followed by the Japanese. All food and drinks are included, even a mini bar in your room! The pools were beautiful! The main pool has a swim-up bar, which is awesome, and there is also an infinity pool, which is wonderful. Everyday they have free activities set up, including water aerobics, airgun, bingo, SCUBA demo in the pool, snorkeling, kayaking, and many, many more! They also have a show every night. We loved the Michael Jackson tribute show....the singer looked just like Michael Jackson! It was awesome! Overall the entire staff was very friendly. They also organize trips into town for those who want to go clubbing. The hotel is located in an exclusive area of Playa del Carmen, called Playacar. This is a gated area and has shopping, homes, and other hotels. We felt very safe the entire time. If you want to do any excursions the hotel staff are very helpful in setting these up and you will be picked up right in front of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a 5 star hotel, without the 5 star price!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great vacation but this Hotel needs some touch-up”
Reviews.Author: GuillaumeDF
Reviews.Content: Me and my family went there the last week of July for 8 days. We checked in quickly. They give us a good drink during our check in :) We found ppl who work there very friendly during our entire stay. Room: They gave us a room on the 1 floor and when I booked a month before I asked for a room on the second or third floor. They change us the next day. I found the room ok, but definitely needs some touch-up and upgrades especially in the bathroom. I found some discusting kind of cockroaches in the bathroom almost every night. Not very fun!! The maid did a really good cleaning job everyday and it was great to have water and alcohol was the min-bar is. Beach and pools: The beach in front of the resort was gorgeous. The pools were very hot during the day so I was always in the ocean all day long...and for ppl who wants activity; they have volleyball in the pool. There's also the animation around the pool all day long and really good reggaeton and dance music. Drinks/food: After 2 days, I was going crazy, the food for breakfast and lunch are always the same.... good for the first day or two but after that it was not really interesting to go eat. And it's not because they don't have a lot of choice, it's full of food in their buffet! I have to admit that I’m not a big fan of buffet too but anyways, to me the variety of good and decent food was limited. It sucks that they don't have an a la carte restaurant for lunch. We booked the a la carte diner every night so we've tried every restaurant that they have. They were all good but the French and Japanese were the best. The room service menu was very very limited and not really good :(( The drinks were really water down and after 4-5 daiquiris you have 0 feeling! Believe me. The ones that the guy made at the entrance in the hall were better and had more alcohol. Thank god....and you can also drink really late at night! That’s a good thing :) Location: They are located in the Playacar district witch is 5-10 minutes from playa Del Carmen downtown. They also have a really great beach in this area. Way better than Riviera Maya. I would say it's far a bit from the airport (50 minutes) but nothing to worry about. During our entire stay, we found the staff very friendly and helpful. This hotel is very clean but unfortunately needs some upgrades and touch-up in the room... I found that for the price we paid, the Royal Hideaway or Secrets Capri could had been a way better place to stay especially with the food they had in the buffet for lunch and breakfast and drinks with almost no alcohol in it. Something that really surprised us was the fact that almost nobody tip at this hotel... Like wtf! We tipped for breakfast; lunch and diner, in the room everyday and for drinks... at least leave a dollar. It makes them so happy, you can tell right away buy the look in their face and they really work hard. If you can't do this, STAY AT HOME! During our stay, they was a whole bunch of ppl from Germany, oh jeezz... so loud and some of them were thinking that they were the kings of the place. Sorry guys but you're just some cheap loser ppl. I will not return to this hotel and hill try the Royal or the Royal Hideway next time for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Chelsm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 4 nights in Aug with a friend. I have to say the resort was better than expected. The rooms were spacious and very nice, the staff was most helpful and pleasant and the food was pretty good for an all inclusive. The property was the perfect size, not too small and not too big, the pools were large and fun. The beach was amazing!! I highly reccommend it to friends, couples or singles.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, Great food, excellent price.”
Reviews.Author: Joan O
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace for four days and I was amazed at the whole establishment. Beautiful spotless grounds, close to the beach, great food with an amazingly large variety. Lovely, friendly staff. Beautiful decor. Great place for some lovely photos. Many activities to keep you occupied. My only problem was with the quality of the tap water and the cleanliness of the bedroom floor. I also recommend that they do something to make the floor more comfortable - it was cold but I guess one can simply walk with a bedroom slipper. We had an endless supply of bottled water so I wasnt too bothered with the tap water. The dining room service in all the dining areas that I patronized was excellent. Maid service was great. As I left the room it was cleaned again. The public bathroom in the hotel was my first encounter - perfumed and immaculately clean. I could not beleive the cost of the room - it was a give away. I plan to return to Riu Palace with my entire family sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: JoFlat
Reviews.Content: we have stayed now at four Riu's and they were all great but this one has been my favorite. The food was awesome, rooms very clean and the staff was wonderfull. We have now booked a Riu trip to the Riu palace Punta Cana. I hoping it will be as great as the Rui's in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “PALACE”
Reviews.Author: love2travel-whitby
Reviews.Content: this is my 10 vacation at a riu chain and they seem to get better and better this resort was amazing from the front desk to the entertainment there was nothing you can compalin about this resort if someone does they shouldnt be travelling as you say you get for what you pay

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth, definitely be back again!”
Reviews.Author: Alex C
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to share my thoughts or write reviews, but I had to do it this time around. My wife and I never took all inclusive trips before as we decided to go with our friends. We were hesitant at first due to the travel advisory to Mexico, but I did a lot of research and decided it was safe for us to go for a 7 nights trip. The deal we got was great, ended up being less than $100 USD a night. Our first impression was grand, it was indeed a palace, spacious and beautiful. The room was spacious (we got the junior suite), can easily fit 3 people if needed. The hotel staff was very friendly and the service was superb; I was shocked the first night when a waiter pulled out my chair for me and offered to take my plates of food to the table. I would definitely say the all inclusive is a must as we felt like Kings and Queens there, ordering anything anywhere, always someone friendly to help you out. There's just so much wonderful things to say about the place, but I'll keep it short and to the point. The buffet was amazing, breakfast, lunch and dinner all were great and changes daily. The A la Carte was very good, but the only knock was that it was very hard to book them, so we only tried two of them. The swimming pool and the ocean front was glorious, it made you feel special for sure. We actually walked the full strip, ocean front and the road side and all had agreed that this was the best hotel out of them all. You can't possibley go wrong with this selection. Last thought... Looking out over the balcony, with the sun just over the horizon, we knew we were in another world.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not great for a solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: soundgarden70
Reviews.Content: I stayed solo at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Aug. 24 - 31, 2011 and was happy with most aspects of the hotel. FOOD - The buffet food was as good as I could expect from a buffet. It was usually cooked well and the selection at both buffets was huge, so you could change up your selections a lot if you wanted to from night to night. I also made reservations for the steak restaurant one night - overall it was quite good, although I asked for my steak medium and it was pretty much well done. The service was very good. I also ate in the Brazilian restaurant and definitely recommend it - the food and service were top notch. I didn't get sick in any way from the food or drinks from any of the resurants, buffets or bars. ROOM - The room was pretty much what I expected from the description and photos and I was happy with most aspects of it. It was large and spacious and while the bed was firm, I didn't find it "rock hard" as others have commented. I did dislike the plastic type cover under the sheet that kind of squeaked when you moved around. I saw absolutely no bugs during my stay. The maids came daily and did a very good job keeping things clean and leaving a different towel art thingy on your bed. But...I guess it's not the maid's fault, but some of the towels and linens were offputting. You could tell they had just been washed, but they had permanent stains on them...they should obviously toss these and not re-use them. I had a 3rd floor room facing the courtyard, with a nice balcony and wonderful view. Be aware that if you want to sleep before 11 pm, do not get a room facing the courtyard. I was halfway between the lobby end and beach end and the evenings begin with a band playing in the courtyard, followed by the nightly entertainment in the theatre. You can hear everything and most people won't be able to sleep while it's going on. I didn't care much because I don't usually go to sleep until late. PROPERTY/BEACH/POOL - The lobby, restaurants, courtyard and grounds all looked amazing to me...quite fancy, well kept, maintained and cleaned. The pool was pretty good, but I think it could be a little bigger for the number of people that stay there. It was really packed in the afternoons, but strolling out around 9 am., there seemed to be plenty of chairs available. The beach was amazing in my opinion...just beautiful...so that is where I hung out most of the time. There's a section where you could find plenty of shade under palm trees and a huge section of open beach if you wanted to be fully exposed to the sun. I never had a problem finding a chair, but I was usually out there by 10 am. The water was clear and blue and a good temperature to cool off a bit when I was there. No waves if you are into boogie boarding though...it's really just for swimming around and cooling off. SERVICE/STAFF: The service was really good and almost all the staff I encountered were extremely friendly. The exception for me was the Entertainment staff...over 7 days I was never approached by any of them to see if I wanted to participate in an activity. I was usually alone and reading, so maybe they figured I didn't want to be bothered...who knows. Drink service at the beach was hit and miss I found. Finally, just a comment on who I'd recommend this hotel for...this has nothing to do with the quality of the hotel itself, just who I think would have the best time there. I am a 40-year-old male, was there solo and it was not a good hotel for me. Most of the guests were couples, and there were also a number of families there as well (although not too many really young kids overall). There were plenty of guests older than me too. If you are a couple, 30 or older, then I think this hotel would be great for you. If you have young kids, I'd think about going somewhere else. There didn't seem to be much for kids to do there. If you are a group of young singles I'd definitely go somewhere else...I didn't see very many groups of singles and saw absolutely no other solo travellers. Overall, I think the quality of the hotel is quite good. It just wasn't right for me, as I was a solo traveller hoping to come across other solo travellers or singles to socialize with.

Reviews.Title: “Second time here and still 'wow'”
Reviews.Author: noswadLeeds
Reviews.Content: Once again we have spent another 2 weeks at the hotel since we thoroughly ejoyed our previous stay in 2009. Cannot believe some of the negative reviews that some are writing perhaps it is a case of ' moaning for the sake of moaning' and have they actually been at the same hotel as us!!! My tip is just ignore the negatives and go with the positives and you will have a fabulas holiday. Please remember you are going to the carribean and the weather can be changeable - thats not the hotels fault but would you believe people did complain though. And yes you will get 'bugs' but deal with it by buying spray and using common sense! There are a variety of restaurants to chose from and yes for the speciality restaurants you have to queue to book but it only takes 30 minutes out of your day! The food we could not complain about at all in the buffet restaurant - lots to chose from and some cooked to order for you. The staff well what can I say they - cannot do enough for you both in the restaurants and bars - take time out and actually speak with them - they dont 'bite' and yes we did tip on some days because of the service that we were given during the day. The hotel is cleaned 24 hours aday but shall I say the 'standards' of some guests is appalling, 'let it drop on the floor as the cleaners will pick it up' - no get up and put it in the bin yourself! The lobby bar 'Ilyas' brilliant service has your drink ready for you before you get to the bar now thats service! Do take a walk down the beach, they have worked miracles on it and now you can even walk down to the 5th Avenue area - 25 mins. We walked every day alternating it between there and the sister hotel where we had a few cheeky beers! Would we go again - without a shadow of a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: jccu
Reviews.Content: the best Holliday of my life the staff is super friendly and helpful ,he had a minor issue and was fixed immediately , Omar that work at the front desk was very attentive and friendly during my stay. They also work with scuba caribe you will find the scuba instructors in the swimming pool (Juan Carlos and lot) feel free to do a free trail in the pool and if you feel comfortable they will take you to the ocean to scuba dive, that was my first time and I can say that was the best experience in my life I wish I could be there right now. For those people who are there right now or going there soon have fun I'm jelous!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of PARADISE!!!"”
Reviews.Author: mzellydean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just what we were loking for: nice beach, good food, good service, close to Playa and other activites, and affordable! Not to mention, the hotel is in a gated resort area which made us feel super safe for out first time being in Mexico. Ammenties include gym, spa, swim up bar, internet access, and all inclusive benefits! I will try to keep it brief...but overall this is GREAT HOTEL for everyone! Rooms: Nice decor, clean, mini bar with hard alcohol & water-beer-soda. Safe in the closet. Jetted bath tub. Maids always kept it clean (although they did come later in the day) and made towel animals for us...also opened our blankets in the evening and left us hershey's kisses on our pillows!! There is an echo in the hallways and when drunk vacationers wake you up late at night....but it is not the hotel's fault. Lobby: Nice ambiance and the decor was very fancy. There is also a lobby bar and sports bar convienantly located at the lobby. Very nice. Beach: The prettiest water I have ever seen! Clean, well maintained, plenty of shade and hammocks to relax on. Also, getting a lounge chair is easy...plenty to go around. Free non-motorized motor sports which is very nice! Staff: Always willing to please you and get you what is needed. They are all very hardworking & it is sad to say that although he tipped here and there....we did not see many others doing so. Never had a porblem with rudeness or being unfriendly. There was always a person polishing the floor, sweeping or cutting the plants. We went to CocoBongo night club and the entertainment staff went with us and made sure we got in safely! Food: Never went hungry! The buffet has a variety of items to chose from at any time of day. We tried room service, but we were not impressed, but then again it is FREE, we just went to the buffet after. The restraunts were yummy. Our favs were the Kristal and the Japanese. The Mexican was just ok. (Tip: to ensure that you get into the resturants, email the hotel one week before arriving and they will take reservations for the whole week!) Overall......this place was amazing and we would recommend it to anyone that wants to have a great vacation in Mexico!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lelechka
Reviews.Content: Because the airports in NY shut down due to the hurricane, we had to prolong our stay in Mexico. We stayed at the exclusive adults only resort, but because they had no room for the 4 extra nights, we had to leave, and ended up in Riu Palace. Of course, comparing Riu Palace to where we stayed is silly because there is no way these two resorts are comparable, but I did stay at Riu Playacar a few years ago, so I am comparing these two. Riu Palace is supposedly a higher class than Riu Playacar, and when we stayed at Playacar, we were not allowed to go to Riu Palace. I didn't know why then and after visiting Riu Palace I still do not know why. The food was average, but the cocktails were nice. Our minibar was stocked up with brandy, tequilla, whisky, but no cognac (??) and some very bad mexican beer. Not even a Corona Riu Palace? really? The halls in the hotel were very dark and smelled damp - that was not nice, but the lobby was huge and AC'd and had plenty of lighting. The staff was very nice, I just wish they spoke better English, but oh well. I noticed that when I tipped them, and I tip well, I had extra attention from the staff. That's understandable I guess. What shocked me is that they do not accept $US anymore due to high possibility of fraud Ummm...ok... The pool area is very nice. It's one big and deep pool, and I appreciated the pool bar. There are a lot of palm trees around the pool area, so you had some protection against the sun. But I was aghast when I saw that the beach had nothing to protect against the blistering sun at all. Not umbrellas, not palm trees, not little huts, NOTHING. This has to be one of the biggest drawbacks in this place. They did plant two rows of palm trees, but they are small. They will grow in some years time. What bothered me also were the reservations for the restaurants. They must do something to improve it. I was not able to make a reservation for ANY place for two days, because they were full. There must be a better way to deal with this. Overall, I would not come back to this place. I would go back to Riu Playacar, but definitely not the Palace one.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: ERCLADY
Reviews.Content: We were a party of 15 who traveled last week to the Riu Palace. Our ages ranged from 20-60. We were clebrating three birthdays. I must say after staying at the Riu Sante Fe in Cabo San Lucas, this hotel was 100x better. It could be that this was a palace or even a differant part of Mexico. Upona rriving at the Cancun airport after a much longer dleay than we anticipated, our shuttle was there waiting. We used Best day travel and I really would suggest booking a private transfer. It costs less and you do not need to wiat for other, do drop offs, or pick ups. Since this was a shuttle, we had to leave 3.5 hours earlier than our flight when we left. You pull into the main gate and it is like its own little town. You see all the Riu's and a few more hotels,shops, restaurants, etc. We were greeted with a welcome drink and shown to our rooms. Appearance: Gorgeous lobby and landscape. Rooms were decent. Nothing spectacular in my opinion. The hotel was able to put all 15 of us in the same side of the building which was nice. The pool was very nice and clean. The beach was gorgeous. Food: You had the buffet for breakfast and lunch. The most pickiest eaters could find something they liked. It was great that you could get snacks at the lunch buffet up until 6. We ate at the Mexican, steakhouse, Gourmet, and Asian restaurant. We had to make reservations which we thought would be a problem for 15. Not one issue at all! In the gourmet restaurant we had to split up due to the restaurants size. No big deal. We had 3 birthday celebrations and the restaurant staff always made them very very special. Food was very good at all restaurants. Room service I felt was a bit subpar. Drinks: They had a large assortment. Somewhat top shelf stuff to. You needed to ask them for the top shelf stuff and also if you would like, ask them to double the booze up. Entertainment: Was great! The pool during the day always had some sort of activities. one a few occasions they had beach parties at noon, with dancing , games, etc. At night the shows were ok, some better than others. After the show was over , they would do a a little dance party and get people moving.. If you wanted to continue the party, the Riu Tequila had night club that you could walk to. It wasn't bad. We went twice and it seemed they played the same music every night. Other than that the sports bar at the hotel was opened 24 hours. We went to Coco Bongo one night. One of the entertainment staff came with us to make sure we got in safely, had a good time, and got home safely. I have never seen such a club. it was amzing, so much fun! Service; I can not say enough!!!! Servers were evverywhere, near the pool, shows, lobby. You did not have to get up for anything. Waiters at the restaurant were very proper and efficient. A few shout outs-Santos, Alex, and Jona (entertainment staff) were amazing! They catered to evey need of ours! Our drinks would be half full and there they were with another drink in hand Now the most amazing thing about this service, 9 family members got stuck at the hotel for another week due to the recent hurricane. They were supposed to leave Sunday and could not get a flight out until friday. Seeing their frustration and anxiety about the whole situation-the Riu comped there stays from sun-fri simply because they knew how stressful it was and how the airlines would not do anything about it. That is the type of customer service that would keep me coming back and back. Side notes: every night there is a different alcohol station outside in the plaza: tequila, vodka, champagne fountain....be sure to check it out, the setup alone is pretty cool! Gym was not bad-had what you needed. If you want to parasail, juet ski, etc-Bargain with them! Only negative thing-when you are sleeping-you hear everything because of the tile floor. If you are a light sleeper request a top floor, corner room! It is very musty in the rooms, it is the tropics but each of us developed allergy symptoms. Definatley would come back!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: sarah33040
Reviews.Content: it was overall a very nice vacation. the staff was friendly and always very helpful. the hotel grounds are beautiful and the food was good. i have stayed at better hotels, but it is one of the hotels i would totally stay again. the buffet always has something for everybody, mexican restaurant was good and the gourmet restaurant krystal was definitly the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this last minute choice”
Reviews.Author: francescaLChicago
Reviews.Content: Originally we were to stay at the Riu Palace Pacifico in Puerta Vallarta Mexico. However, we got bumped off of two flights and missed the flight to Puerta Vallarta. We had booked through Perx. com and contacted them immediately. We were able to get to Cancun and asked about alternative accommodations. In less than 40 minutes, Perx changed our reservations and travel vouchers to the Riu Palace in Rivera Maya. We had no documents upon arrival in Cancun but our shuttle to the hotel knew about this and took care of us. When arriving at Cancun, once you clear customs, by-pass all of the time share people and exit out the right door to the shuttle and taxi people. The Riu Palace is approximately 1 hour south of Cancun in a completely gated complex. Check in was a snap. The hotel is "u" shaped so there is not really any ocean views. If going see if you can request a second floor room. The balconies are much larger and nicer facing the courtyard. The staff is unbelievable at this resort. They could not provide any better service. The service was equivalent to the Four Seasons...unbelievable. We had reservations at the restaurants but passed since the buffet was so outstanding in quality, food selection, and theme night selections. Swim up bar was excellent. However, there are a lot of families at this resort. If you want a quieter, relaxing time by the pool choose the Riu Palace Mexico...which is right down the block. A lot of bingo and other activities in the afternoon reminded me of a cruise ship...I like to sample the beverages and relax and not be hounded to play olympics in the sand. If you want to snorkel, para sail, or jet ski, walk the beach for the best price. You can negotiate price on these activities. For booking excursions, see Omar Rosario in the green pants in the lobby. He will fit the activity you are looking to do into your budget and give you some inside information regarding each excursion...which are newer, cleaner facility, etc. We did the Aktun-Chen at 80.00 per person. This included zip line, tour of the caves and snorkeling in an underground Cenote. It included a delicious lunch, transportation and was an all day activity. The groups were small and the focus was on safety and all the equipment was sanitized prior to our use (all had plastic coverings on them). Bring plenty of singles as you will want to tip many, many times. Another excursion is 5th Avenue which is about 20 minutes from the hotel. You can walk it and it is completely safe as it is located in the gated property. Typical souvenirs which included a mexican zebra....donkey painted with black and white stripes that you can have your picture taken with!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: Minigo
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here for a week and it's the best all inclusive we've been to! Going to keep it simple and tell you what's good and what's not so good. Food - The buffet had great selection and variety. Always had something new to try each day and it was always good! Did find some things a bit too salty though but that's subjective of course. The best a la carte restaurant was the Krystal by far. Don't bother too much with the 24 room service. Food was okay. Snacks in the 24 sports bar included sandwiches, hamburgers, hot dogs and fruit. Drinks - Could be a little stronger but otherwise never had a problem getting a drink! They'll even come to you while you lounge on the beach or by the pool! Rooms - Clean and spacious. Remember to take advantange of the complimentary bar in your room. Fridge is refilled every day. It would've been nice if they supplied slippers and bathrobes. Don't open your balcony door too much. Too many mosquitoes would come flying in. Staff - All were very friendly! Never once did I feel like they were wanting a tip. No communication problems. Location - Very conveniently located. Right on the beach, small shopping plaza 10 minute walk away, and 15 minute walk into center of town. There are also many other riu hotels which you could go and use their facilities. Overall, this was one of the best all inclusive hotels I've been to. Can't wait to go back! Tip: Mention it's your birthday and you'll receive complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries!

Reviews.Title: “good resort”
Reviews.Author: gtrbt
Reviews.Content: food was very good and the beach, room very nice. only complaints and it not the hotels fault but problem, being mostly european lots of kids and there everywhere esp. at the swim up bar and pretty much unsupervised. one big problem is the US dollar is not accepted there for payment of any kind, not your bill or in the store, they will accept any other major countries money but not the US. the iberostar tucan did not have this problem and was a very nice hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingggggggg Place!”
Reviews.Author: Sunandfun82
Reviews.Content: We just got back tonight from our trip to the RIu Palace Riviera Palace and I have to say this is one of the best vacations I have ever had. The staff is wonderful and always so warm and welcoming. They are always cleaning and rarely is there anything left unattended. The only tiny negative thing I would say is that the pool should be kept a little cleaner. Swim up pools are great but sometimes people drop straws or their drinks or food in the pool and I kind of found it to be a little gross. ALSO, STAY AWAY FROM ANYONE WHO APPROACHES YOU AT THE AIRPORT WANTING TO GIVE YOU GREAT DEALS ON EXCURSIONS. THIS IS A TRAP TO GET YOU TO BUY INTO TIMESHARES. I DIDN'T KNOW A HEAD OF TIME AND WAS LURED INTO THEIR NICENESS AND WILLINGNESS TO WANT TO SHOW YOU THE "REAL" MEXICO. They ask how old you are and if you're older than 30 they give you all these great deals and prices and say all you have to do is pick up the tickets at the mayan palace in playa del carmen. They give you a voucher for a free taxi ride to bring you to their hotel and once you get there you would get a free breakfast and a tour of the hotel. This is so that next time you go visit mexico you will stay at one of their mexican resorts instead of the Riu, which are not owned by mexico. And they feed you this story how they want to keep the money in mexico to help their country blah blah blah. Coming off a plane and being blindsided by these people it all sounded good. Paid out $40 to go see Tulum and set the date to meet at their hotel the next morning. I was a little uneasy about the whole thing but just wanted to get to the hotel and then as I started to think more and more about it,, I found it weird that we had to bring a credit card and our passports with us when we went to have the breakfast, and I also didn't like the fact that we were not to tell the hotel nor hotelbeds what we were doing. When I got to the RIU I spoke with a representative from hotelbeds who was our airport service and he told us it was a scam and he's seen it happen before to people and then I did some further research and found some horrible stories of peoples encounter with these scammers and how they actually went and felt like prisoners because the people at the mayan hotel would not let them leave. We decided not to show up for the breakfast and now I am working on trying to get my money back. Chances are I wont see that money ever again but I'm definitely glad we didn't go and waste a day out of our vacation to sit through seminars and presentations. So just BEWARE! Other than that the Riu Palace Rivier Maya is wonderful, food is great any time of the day and day and night entertainment is lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “It never gets old”
Reviews.Author: beach_ready_tx
Reviews.Content: This was my 10th trip to Riu Palace Riviera Maya in the past four years. My girlfriend & here sister were on a Girls Road Trip to the Mountains. I was invited to join them but instead chose the beach. Obviously I love this place or I wouldn't be talking about my 10th trip. But let me discuss a few things others may not mention. 1) Lots of coconut trees = lots of shade on the beach & around the pool. I always get a good tan when I go to Mexico, but after 2-3 hours in the sun each day I want shade and you'll have no trouble finding it at RPRM. 2) A great walk into town each morning along the beach (I walk about 3 miles each morning; it takes about an hour). You can wander off the beach and peak in the houses that are for rent. 3) Full access to all the other Riu Resorts. Every day I'd go for a walk after lunch and spend an hour or two at the pool of another resort. 4) Great bar service on the beach. You don't get this at most hotels (even the other Rius). 5) Live piano music from 6-8 pm at the lobby bar, live music & dancing on the patio each evening. 6) Beautiful grounds every where (not just at the hotel). If your soul isn't singing from the beauty that's in Playa, you're not really trying to have a good time! 7) Safety. I have never felt threatened in Playa. I have never had anything stolen from my room (and I always take 2 cameras, dive gear, a computer, two phones and $400+ cash. 8) Great diving. 9) Great room service. 10) The best people on earth, When people asked where my wife was (technially girlfriend, but who's counting) I said "She's travelling with her sistere and I didn't want to stay home alone." No less than 10 people commented something like "But you are home sir, and we're glad you are here. Is it any wonder I'll be going back in November! Safe travels folks, God bless and keep you well!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever...will take some beating”
Reviews.Author: Tallis1983
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel. From the moment our coach dropped us off we knew our holiday would be pure luxury. Marble and huge chandeliers in the reception hall/lobby, very classy and upmarket. No expense spared here. Rooms:- Our room was on the 2nd floor midway along. The room was a standard double suite and was more than adequate for a couple. The room was very clean with marble flooring. The room balcony wasn't as big as some neighbouring rooms but we hardley went out there. it overlooked the gardens and was quiet. The bathroom is lovely with a good hairdryer provided. The whirlpool bath is definately worth a go. Food/ Restaurants:- The main buffet is fantastic and we would have been more than happy to have eaten every meal here everyday. A huge choice of food for breakfast, lunch and dinner with champagne served if you wish. I would suggest you go here at lunch time and not to the steak house one as that one is packed and the food isn't as good (usually empty trays due to the amount of people using it) The buffet is themed every night and is well worth having the main dish from the cooking station. The chef's are brilliant and will serve you whatever you want. One even helped me make my own taco. The restaurants are lovely our favourite was Crystal which is modern al a carte food. I had Sea Bass which was perfect and the steak my husband had was lovely and tender. The Japanese restaurant was also good. Was not too impressed with the steak house or the Italian really much better food in the buffet. Room service is fantastic too with a lovely porter who brought a flower with the tray of food,. Fantastically presented. Drinks:- The champagne is really nice and is included in all inclusive package. The swim up bar is also good but busy. Staff:- couldn't have met nicer people. The waiters who serve you drinks on the beach/pool are fab and remember your order from previous rounds. The Americans tip heavily so you do feel that they might serve them a little better but cannot complain, we always had a drink. Beach/pool:- both extremely clean. The pool at the end of the day was warmer than bath water. The beach is cleaned every day and is spotless. the sun loungers are always free on the beach but you have to get up earlyish to get a good pool spot but we spent all holiday on the beach. Bit of a tip...we went topless and got a few rude remarks from american people even though the women tend to wear thong bikinis. I felt a little uncomfortable by this and put my bikini top on. The resort is safe and friendly you can walk around any time of day and not feel threatened at all. Mexican people are the friendliest people i have ever met and it is not about the money. Best holiday i have ever had. GO.

Reviews.Title: “YES YES YES BOOK IT!”
Reviews.Author: easyinvestment
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in another review, we checked out of our reserved hotel and paid more money to go here. Never, never had a dissappointment. EVERYONE tries really hard to make you happy. Even when leaving the bellmen waived us off , wished us a safe trip and quick return, it was like our family was seeing us off. The location is in Playacar, right next to Playa del Carmen, you can ride a bike or walk over to Playa. The entertainment was top notch! Food never boring and delicious. Perfect! Beach was lush, tons of chairs, shade, trees. Unlike Riu Emerald Bay, servers walk around the beach and pool area to offer drinks. I suppose it's the extra service of the "Palace" line of Rius. Beds were a bit hard but never stopped us from sleeping. Tip: There is paid internet service in the lounge area next to the reception desk but you can get free good net by just sitting in the reception area. You won't be dissapointed. Book it!

Reviews.Title: “5 STARS SERVICE AND FOOD”
Reviews.Author: VeraBF
Reviews.Content: I tried before Riu hotels at Riviera Maya, but this Palace has a huge difference in the service. Personally the decoration is not my cup of tea, but if you can afford the difference, choose a Palace.

Reviews.Title: “It was great, but....”
Reviews.Author: Kris41003
Reviews.Content: As everybody else said, the hotel was great. It has a beautiful property, beach, pools, and good restaurants. Above all, the services were excellent in any category from maid services to bartenders. I must add the food was also very good. I made speciality restaurant reservations a week before by e-mail, and did not have any problem at all. We tried all the restaurants except for a fake Japanese restaurant. We especially liked Krystal. The only problem we had was, just like many people warned us, "musty smell" and "dampness" in the air and even on the beds. We did not get good night sleep because of this. I am not sure why it was so damp, not only the beds but the sofa as well. However, the room was very clean all the time. This did help us feel better. We had excellent tours including two visits to Mayan ruins and a snorkeling tour. I highly recommend "Mayan Adventure Snorkeling Tour". You get to swim three kinds of water, in the lagoon, in the fresh water in Cenote, and in the limestone cave. This tour only takes a small group of people with a guide. You will see many varieties of fish in three different waters. We booked this tour at the hotel through "Olympus". Isabel was very very patient and helpful to find a suitable tour for our family. We would like to visit there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, good and bad experiences”
Reviews.Author: Nickle222
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan 2010 but I forgot to review... please forgive me :) Beautiful Hotel, good and bad experiences I stayed here with my boyfriend for a long weekend and we had a mixed experience Good: Beautiful property, rooms, beach and pool, these are also kept spotless, I don’t think we saw a piece of trash the entire time we were there. Great drinks and easy to find someone to serve you at many of the bars located around the property, the bartenders were even patient when we couldn’t decide what we wanted with so many options to choose from. Food was average most nights, but Sunday we got lobster and it was delicious! Bad: We wanted to eat in one of the reservations only restaurants but you can only make reservations at the hotel from noon-2, and reservations can only be made in person, this is ridiculous!!! Who is at the hotel all day?? We were out exploring!! So the last night we asked them for suggestions in town as we didn’t want buffet again, and the lady at the front desk gave us attitude when we asked her for a recommendation. So incase anyone else ends up in this predicament ask them to give you directions to the restaurant in a cave (I forget the name, sorry) but it has free parking and it is amazing good food, and you eat in cave!!! Why she couldn’t just tell us this when they have such a great place to recommend I don’t know….

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort - Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel002
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this amazing resort. It is such a beautiful complex. The restaurants and the food were excellent. The staff here is constantly looking after you. Servers bring drinks to you while you are on the beach, always wanting to know what they can get for you. They are friendly and make you feel so welcome and special. The Entertainment group has so much energy! You can not help but get caught up in it. The shows they had every evening were very enjoyable. Loved to see that they are so accomodating to childern. Children have their own programs and even a time each evening to perform and have fun. The main Plaza has a beautiful fountain with cafe seating all around. Not only is there entertainment in the night club, but nightly in the Plaza there is different music events and fun activities. We would definitely recommend this resort. It is the best if you are going to Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “seven days of heaven”
Reviews.Author: grantham353
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we had no idea what to expect and was hoping it would satisfy our whole family. It more then lived up to our expectations. Rooms were spacious. Refrigerators were always refilled. Food was fantastic. We went to the steak house and Mexican restaurant. Had reservations in a couple of the others , but our kids loved the buffet, so that's where we ate. Staff was very accommodating, the place was gorgeous. Great beach. No problem finding lounges. Palm trees at the beach were lovely. Enjoyed the short walk to Playa Del Carmen. Nice little shopping center a couple of minutes from the hotel in Playacar. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Had some activities and entertainment in the evening. There was always something to do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Erin D
Reviews.Content: Over all, the service was excellent. The staff works very hard to make you feel like you're #1. At the pool and in the courtyard (at night, watching the shows) drink service is non stop. We had a few issues in the lobby bar, where the servers didn't come up to us and we walked up to the bar. The bar tender did NOT like that. At first I thought he was annoyed with us, because he would take the order but tell us to sit, and someone would bring it out. BUT I think he was annoyed with the server for making us get up! Anyway, overall, service was great. Loved the food, thought everything was magnificent. Don Manolo's is far from the pool, so many people opt for Chilis for lunch, since it is closer. We found that the food at Don Monolo's was better than Chili's. Buffet for breakfast and lunch had so much variety we had no problem eating there for 6 days. We read bad reviews about the steakhouse (Chilis) so we did not go there for dinner. We did go to all other restaurants, which were all excellent. Agave (the Mexican) was especially good, as was Krystal (french fusion).
