The only annoyance was the fact that you had to stand in line to make the reservations, and there are only 2 seatings per night, so you're eating at 6:30 or 8:45, quite a spread between. You can make 2 nights of reservations at a time, so at least you didn't have to stand in line every day. We never saw a cockroach or bug in the room. Our room was kept clean and the mini bar and shampoos in the bathroom always restocked. The only complaint I have for the room is that there are people in and out constantly. They have so many different people: the maids, people to restock the bar, people to clean the bathroom and restock towels and shampoos, etc. I guess it's necessary to have different people for the jobs, but it felt like every time we came back to our room, someone was in there. On that note, we didn't have anything stolen, which I had seen in reviews happened while using the safe. We kept one of the pockets on our luggage locked up at all times with our money and passports, etc, and no one bothered anything. However, I don't know if it was through the vents or just the walls, but we could hear our upstairs neighbors all the time! Not the best insulation... it may have been the terrible beds that also prevented us from sleeping. It think at one point they were firm matresses, but now they're so worm they are extremely bouncy and overall, uncomfortable. There were a lot of kids, and they always seemed to be doing cannonballs by the pool bar. It seemed like parents weren't watching a lot of the time, and I wouldn't blame the hotel for that. However, there were no programs or anything to keep kids occupied or in certain areas. Just something to keep in mind if you don't have kids. We went swimming around 12 each night, hotel staff walked by, said hello, and basically told you to have fun, they didn't care we were swimming even though the pool was technically closed. Grounds and pool are immaculate, towels that they rented out (using the cards they give you at check in) are good enough. Also, ride from the airport was about 40 minutes with a private transfer. All in all, we loved it, but I wanted to be particular so that you know what to expect. We would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya vs Riu Yucatan”
Reviews.Author: LesleyBTadley_Hants
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend to Riu Yucatan in October 2009 for 2 weeks. We loved the Playacar area so much we went back to the Riu Palace Riveira Maya in April 2011 for 2 weeks and we visited the other Rius including the Riu Yucatan again. This review compares the 2 hotels. Firstly cost. We paid 50% more for the Palace stay so as you would expect the Palace was better than the Yucatan in most ways. The question is was it worth the extra money? I think so but my friend disagreed and would have preferred the extra £550 to spend on something else. We enjoyed both holidays and will go back to Playacar again. Hotel ambience The Palace was much more refined on the whole, with people being less noisy. One evening at the Palace someone yelled out and everyone turned to look at them to see who was making a noise! The pace of the holiday was more relaxing at the Palace for me and I liked it but it was deemed a bit boring for my friend as there were fewer daytime and evening activities than we had had at the Yucatan. The Palace had more Americans than Europeans and the Yucatan had more Brits/Europeans than Americans. The Yucatan was livelier in many ways and had more of a party atmosphere. Outside Areas Both hotels were well laid out. The Palace had better air conditioning in the reception and restaurant/buffet areas. The Palace gardens were very formal whilst the Yucatan gardens had lots of trees which supported a range of wildlife including monkeys which came to visit you on your balcony looking for food. I hardly saw a mosquito at the Palace but had a hard time avoiding them at the Yucatan. Not sure if this was the time of year or because the hotel was in more natural surroundings. Rooms We stayed via Thomson and in both hotels this meant we got rooms facing away from the sea/pools/gardens but our views weren’t that bad. Rooms in both hotels were surprisingly similar (I expected more from the Palace). Both had optic bottles of spirits on the wall, a fridge with soft drinks, beer, a safe, iron. The palace also had a coffee maker. The Palace room was bigger with a step down to a sitting area with a sofa and table and this was where the TV was located – not much good when you wanted to watch TV in bed. The TV wasn’t any bigger or better than the one at the Yucatan. The Palace had a Jacuzzi bath and shower but it was in the same room as the washbasins and toilet. It was also very chunky in design and difficult to step in and out of. I slipped one evening and got a massive bruise on my inner thigh as a result. The Yucatan had the toilet separate to the washbasins and only had a shower but it was easier to share than the Palace. The Yucatan had the TV facing the bed. So overall we preferred the room at the Yucatan. Food & Drink Yucatan buffet was good with a good range of tasty food for breakfast, lunch and dinner but the Palace was superb – there was the same huge range but everything was better quality. There was champagne for breakfast, a chocolate fountain most evenings and every evening and most lunch-times the most tender beef steaks I have ever had on holiday (tried the steak at the Riu Palace Mexico and it was much tougher). Strangely, I put on less weight at the Palace RM. I put this down to the fact that everything you chose was lovely to eat so I just had one plateful and that was enough. At the Yucatan I didn’t always like everything on my plate so went back for more so probably ate more overall. My rule at the Palace of ‘one plate and one layer of food’ appeared to work well. The only fault I can think of with the buffet was that they never made waffles for breakfast but I am sure the Yucatan did. Also, although men could wear smart shorts to the buffet in the evening the shorts were expected to cover their knees. Smart shorts cut above the knee were not considered formal enough. The Palace does a waiter service around the pool and beach which was luxurious. The speciality restaurants at both hotels were good and both required men to wear long pants. Activities Both hotels had excellent animation staff and did water aerobics, water volleyball, bingo, evening shows. The Palace did fewer games and virtually no prizes just certificates and Riu neck scarves every night!! I was gutted. At the Yucatan I won a massage, hats, bum bags, T-shirts and bottles of rum at bingo etc. I was really disappointed with the Palace whose highlight was a games evening and a casino style evening where you tried to win chips and exchange them for fairly trivial prizes. The Palace had a lunchtime fashion show round the pool selling bikinis and sarongs which I bought one of. Pools Both had 2 pools and a swim-up bar, the Yucatan had 2 swim-up bars. The Palace had an infinity pool and a large pool for activities and with Jacuzzi areas and the swim-up bar. The water was usually clean altho’ by the end of the day there was some signs of suncream oil scum by one set of steps. The Yucatan pool was just as large and one of the swim-up bars was separate from the main pool. The main pool didn’t feel very clean and the separate swim-up bar was so murky I wouldn’t go in it. The Palace pools were far better. Both hotels had plenty of sunbeds round the pools but it seemed easier to find one at the Palace then at the Yucatan. Sea/beach At both hotels there were lots of sunbeds on the beach. More shade available at the Palace. Beach and sea similar as you would expect as they are not far from each other. So in conclusion we will definately go back - we may try the Riu Playacar next time.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed Bag....”
Reviews.Author: skibunnee007
Reviews.Content: General: Overall we had a blast! The only real "disappointment" was the quality of room. As mentioned below, the room was adequate, but if room is a driving decision factor in resort, there are likely better options for the money. Everything else met or exceeded expectations. Overall, the staff was very friendly and happy to please. The shows were fun and entertaining, albeit cheesy. The mariachi show was actually something that we would have paid money to see. The resort was fairly quiet at night. We visited La Pinata one night at the Riu Tequilla hoping to shake it a bit. However, no one was in the club. So it's a great place for couples and families. Partiers would likely be happier in Cancun. Room: We had a junior suite on the top level, lobby side of the hotel. Luckily we had no experiences with cockroaches, perhaps due to the upper level room. The room at times felt a bit like a cave due to its lack of lighting and narrow width. There was always a strange smell present which could have been simply the result of the humidity or roach pesticide. Not sure which. The bathroom lacked a fan. The bathtub was very dark since it did not have a light in the shower/tub. The safe was down low to the ground making it difficult to access things, but fortunately nothing was stolen as mentioned in other reviews. Our room did not have a true balcony. There was a small surface on which we could step out. Many of the rooms that were not on the lobby side of the resort had fuller balconies. None of these were major concerns. But together they made the room average and made us wonder if it would have been a better option to save some money and get a room at a less expensive resort. Pool: The pool had a very nice swim up bar. It was not overly crowded and there was never an issue getting a couple lounge chairs. Since other reviews mentioned problems with this. Perhaps we had luck because it was off season. Drinks: The drinks were decent. We asked for brand name liquor instead of the standard well licquor and the bartenders happily obliged. Drinks were not overly strong, but we got the impression from the friendly staff that if you were to ask the bartenders for more alcohol, they would gladly oblige. Gym: The gym was pretty comparable to other all-inclusive gyms. It was good enough to get a basic work out. But not much more than that. There were two treadmills, three eliptical machines, a bicycle, a stepper, and a rower. There were also about eight weight machines, some benches, and a stack of dumbells. We had access to the gyms at the other Riu properties, all of which were within a twelve minute walk away. However, we only used the Palace Riviera facility because we never had any issues getting on any of the machines. This could have been because we were not there during peak season. Beach: The beach was the highlight of the property. The water was a beautiful blue and very warm to swim in. There was no real need for sandals or water shoes. There is an extensive palm tree grove on the part of the beach closest to the resort for those who desire shade. The area also had hammocks. There was free use of body boards, kayaks, and sail boats. It was very quiet most of the time which was nice as we liked to read. The beach was spacious enough that it never felt like people were on top of each other. Food: The buffet had many different options every day from which to choose. The food was very good for buffet style. The restaraunts were on par or slightly better than the buffet food. Given that the you had to lock in times with reservations for the restaurants (made between 12 and 3 in main lobby bar), toward the end of our stay, we opted for the buffet which gave us more flexibility while on vacation. One noticeable thing about the wait staff is they were a little over zealous to take away plates before we were completely finished. It was more funny than an annoyance. But it could bother some people. We visited the other Rius and walked through their buffets. We didn't actually sample any of the food, but we felt that the quality of the food at the RPM seemed to be superior to the other Rius. So if food is a large factor in resort choice, the RPM would be a better choice. Location: Terrific location. The resort and the sister Riu properties are located in the gated section of Playa Del Carmen known as Playacar. It is a seven dollar taxi ride, or a twenty minute walk via sidewalk or beach into the main part of Playa del Carmen. There are many shops and restaurants in town. Also, many of the items such as suntan lotion are much less expensive than at the resort. We never felt unsafe in Playacar or in the downtown section. Excursions: We caught the ferry to Cozumel from downtown Playa del Carmen $30 round trip for 2 people. In Cozumel, we rented a car through Executive car rental for about $60 and drove around the island. There are Mayan ruins and miles of spectacular coastline and beaches to frolic in. We stopped at Coconuts Bar and Grill. It's a waterfront restaurant and they serve Mexican food, but it was nothing spectacular. The margaritas were powerful and delicious! We also did the tour to Chichen-Itza. We purchased the tour through the hotel. While we are typically not tour people, we did so because we were a little concerned about safety while travelling in Mexico. It made for a very long day, though the ruins were a must see for us. They also stopped at a Cenote for a swim on the tour.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: evadlt
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and I 6 stay at one on the Riu Hotel's, and our first stay at Palace Maya. My husband and I called 3 days before we arrived to make sure they had our reservation and room ready. Upon arrival they had reserved a beautiful Garden View room for us, and when we got to our room it was already occupied. We went back down to the lobby and spoke to the manager and they had no other Garden View rooms available, they apologized and told us that they would have 5 suites available the next day and we could pick out which one we wanted, and we were very happy. We got a free upgrade to a suite and our room had ocean view, wrapped around balcony and view to the main pool. We were also welcomed with Champagne and chocolate covered strawberries in our room. It was amazing. The hotel is very beautiful, clean and if you stay at this hotel you can go to the other Riu's and use there amenities too. We love the main buffet and 5 different restaurant's on the propoerty. Yes, they have a dress code and they enforce it. My husband and I like that they have this policy because if they didnt people would walk dressed inappropiate. If you dont like it, just go down to the main buffet and eat there, you wont be disappoint with the food. Also, make sure you get there on time. One night we ate at the Steak house and one table that had reservations for 15 people arrived 40 minutes late and still got seated. The problem here is that every course is timed and the people who got there late disrupted the timed courses. They waiters had to catch up, seving the table of 15 people trying to catch up and they never did. This made the waiters give bad service to us and all the people who got there on time for dinner. Everyone was very upset and I complained to manager. I made it very clear that they should have never allow the people to walk in 40 minutes late and should have never been seated. They should have told them to come back tomorrow or another night. Be on time and have consideration for others. Over all the food at all the 5 restaurant's is 5 stars. The beach is beautiful and the water is warm. There are no vendors on the beach, so I did miss buying doughnuts, jewerly, mexican ice cream's and all the rest. The reason why they dont allow it, is because they dont want the beach to become vendor infested and I understand. The pool is big, but too crowded and noisey. We didnt spend anytime at the pool and didnt care since we preferred the beach anyways. We went down to downtown Playa del Carmen for shopping, most people were walking, but I dont recommend it. Take a taxi instead and save your walking for downtown, because the street goes on for miles. It took my husband and I 3 to 4 hours to walk the whole strip. We went down to Playa Mammita beach, which is amazing, that is where all the locals hang out. We also went to Akumal beach to swim with the turtles and the most famous cenote Christalino Cenote, highly recommend it. There is also 5th Avenue shopping center which is 10 minute walk from the hotel. It was too hot to walk, we should have taken a taxi too, but we didnt, big mistake. The outside plaza entertainment was great. Everyday they had a different band, a jazz musician and other entertainers. The servers were are wonderful. Make sure you take money to tip these wonderful people. They get paided very little money and work 12 hour's per day they rely on tips to be able to feed there families. My husband and I always tip and we receive great service and they take very good care of us. That is why we continue to come back to the Riu's we get spoiled with all the first class service we get. The only complaint we have is the air conditioner in our suite didnt work well. My husband was always complaining it was hot in the room. This was the only problem we had. We are coming back next year and can't wait to return to the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “so nice”
Reviews.Author: mabelfoaa
Reviews.Content: we really haven't been to the riu in 4 years but ta didnt have a date to go back that far. but after reading alot of the reviews i'm surprised about the negativity. when we were there the food was great, the beach great , of course the room wa alittle musty but that wouldn't stop me from staying there. making reservations for dinner can be a pain, but that to is worth it. i would like the resort to respond to some of the complaints,

Reviews.Title: “Nice Family Hotel, definitely we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: accessdenied
Reviews.Content: We went here for our annual family trip but this time with another family as our kids are growing up (16, 11). Our trip was actually last August 2010 but TA is not allowing me to put that in so I put Sept 2010 here. At the check-in we requested adjoining rooms but it was not available. But, they gave us a junior suite which has a full ocean view. We are on different floor (7/8) but it's easy to go to each others room because we're very near the stairs. Better ask for an upgrade but do not forget to tip the guys at the check-in, it works. Food is great. Seafood is what we all want and they served that many times on the 7 days that we were there. They have different themes during lunch/dinner. The shows are great and the people are great. Kids are safe to roam around. Alcohol is very good. We always drink tequila and they only serve us patron during our stay. We went outside for 2 days, one is snorkeling on an island and the other one is trip in the town (for free). We use a different site to book and they have a rep at the lobby who helped us book the side trips. He's a nice guy but I don't think Im allowed to mention the site here. The only thing we did not like are: - brown ocean water, it was ok as the kids enjoy it. it was just after the rainy season so it's understandable - full pool area, we were there when the locals have good deals so it was 100% full. but we did have around 2 days when we enjoyed the resort by ourselves All worth it and will come back. I have another review on another resort in our trip this year in Cancun. This is our 2nd time using RIU and I thought it's time to use another resort. I would say my next trip in the Bahamas I will book RIU again. Good luck and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “o m g”
Reviews.Author: flossiepot
Reviews.Content: if you want a top class hotel with all the comfort of home . well this ist he place to go on the beach and not far away for playa del carmen ( about 15- 20 mins walk in the heat). the service you and not fault if you wanted the moon the staff would try and get it for you . Hotel is very clean the maid wash the floors at least 4 times a day plus they are cleaning in the reception in the evening you will not find ny dust in the place . if you are going to this hotel check victor out in the sports bar ..

Reviews.Title: “The wedding was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: PlanoJay
Reviews.Content: Our son had his destination wedding at the Riu and we all thoroughly enjoyed it. I have been to several all inclusives in Mexico and have to say this one is in the top two. The hotel was clean, the beach absolutely stunning with all of the palm trees, the food was good and the staff very accommodating. We were only there for a few days and therefore never took an excursion. However we never needed to. There was plenty to do at the resort for the three nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip - would surely go back!”
Reviews.Author: MagdalenaTsiri
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 1 week all inclusive. The resort is absolutely stunning - it has fresh spacious rooms, very courteous staff, lovely landscaping and amazing food!! This resort has all the bells and whistles of a large resort - but it is a lot smaller then we expected. Everything was in close proximity - we never got lost - and always knew where things were happening. Day 1 we felt like we knew the place! The beach is spectacular also - water was so warm and inviting - and we took full advantage. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone going to the Mayan Riviera.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEACH!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeagleLoversX
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long vacation at the Hotel Riu Palace Riviera Maya and we had a wonderful time. The beach was beautiful! It was a chore to pry me off my chair to leave it. Pool was nice, but we really are not pool people. The food was really good! Our favorite was Agave (the Mexican restaurant). We tried all the restaurants but 1 and left with happy bellies. The only things I really disliked about the restaurants that 1) you needed reservations and 2) they only had 6:30pm and 8:30/8:45 seating’s. The drinks were very good. Nothing watered down. The grounds are beautiful. The rooms were ok. It was a room. Nothing special. We had issues with the a.c. but that could have just been the a.c. competing against the heat and humidity outside. The one thing I will give it credit for was it was always cleaned well and our mini bar was great and always stocked. The staff is amazing! I mean they went above and beyond for us and were always very friendly. All in all it was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth The Upgrade”
Reviews.Author: David499608
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just got back from a two week stay at the Palace Riviera Maya. When we originally booked our holiday we were going to stay at the smaller sister hotel Riu Playacar. I'd read some reviews that weren't that glowing and knowing some one who had stayed at the Palace I decided to pay a bit extra and changed to that hotel. In my opinion it was well worth the extra money and was totally in a different class to the Playacar. The service we got from all the staff, either in the dining areas or bar areas was exceptional, best service we've had in any hotel. The staff were really friendly and attentive without being in your face. Breakfast, lunch and dinner was great, with lots of variety to please even the most picky of people. In the two weeks both my wife and i put on over half a stone! Rooms were very clean and spacious, fresh towels everyday and the mini bar was always well stocked. The evening shows were good enough to keep you entertained whilst you digested your three or four course dinner. The whole resort is very safe to go out walking in the evening, we walked to the 5th Avenue shopping area and felt totally safe. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and will probably return there sometime soon. There are a couple of things that people should be aware of. Firstly we were not aware that you have to pay an exit tax when flying back, this has to be paid in cash. For the four of us it cost £160. The other thing worth knowing is that if you do any of the trips, we went to Xel Hal, make sure you take insect repellent as we didn't and got bitten all over.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laceylol0
Reviews.Content: just returned from Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Our family of 4 (2boys aged 13 and 16) loved the hotel It was clean, staff very friendly, food was excellent We had no problem getting a la carte dining everynight The Buffett was also good with many many options. Beach was great great great - much larger and more walkable than a few years ago. Safety - no problems what so ever Thouroughly enjiyed our one week stay. Thank You RIU Palace!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Relaxing holiday”
Reviews.Author: fivestarCambs
Reviews.Content: Been to many places but this was the most relaxing place ever. Great swimming pool for the kids and beautiful sandy beach with large shaded area with hammocks and loungers. Sea was warm as was the pool end May when we visited with 2 kids 5 and 7. Bedroom - we were upgraded to a suite – lucky us maybe because we paid for premium class flights or maybe just lucky on arrival. Just think we had more space in our room and extra large balcony. Air con and fan worked well. Great towel arrangements safe and free bar in room. Shower in bath. Nice and clean. For a family room x2 double beds pushed together and no extra beds or sofa beds in the room– fine for us as our kids are small but might not suit everybody. Entertainment OK but could be better mainly as started too late when the kids were exhausted. Restaurants – WARNING you may be kicked out unless you dress formally – Yes even from the main restaurant. My husband wore long shorts and a sleeveless t-shirt (not vest) and we were turned away on our first day!! - And told we could get snacks from the smoky bar!! Not a great start. Normal T-shirts OK but nothing that resembles sportswear!! ie logo on trousers. A bit poor considering we had paid all inclusive. It doesn’t seem to matter what you wear if you are female can have the shortest skirt and all your flabby bits hanging out so double standards here. The food was fine and the ice sculptures amazing in the main restaurant. Can’t comment on the other restaurants as dress code even more strict!! Despite the restaurant nonsense had the most relaxing holiday ever – no hassling for tips – we tipped every day and got extra special service – a few pounds to us is worth a lot more to the Mexicans and they deserve it . Kids club does exist but we didn’t use it and I think it was more of a babysitting service. Beach free non motorized watersports belly boards etc. Still despite the gripes was the best most relaxing holiday ever and even thinking about returning which is unheard of as like to experience new places.

Reviews.Title: “Please stop moaning”
Reviews.Author: jclarsson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 weeks at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya between 24th June and 15th July 2011 and had a fantastic time. I cannot believe some of the complaints that some have managed to come up with about this hotel. I actually met Trip Advisor member Wullie from Mauchline and agree completely with his assessment and review of the hotel. Our whole experience was first class and we would definitely return in the future to this hotel. We had emailed the hotel before we travelled and asked if it would be possible to reserve a courtyard room, as it was our tenth wedding anniversary. We didn't actually expect the request to be met, as I'm sure they get requests for special rooms on a daily basis. However, on our arrival at the hotel, we were met by the Duty Manager, who had arranged for our request to be met. Later that evening we had a special delivery of chocolate strawberries and champagne delivered to our room, courtesy of the hotel. Him and his staff could not have been any more helpful that day and throughout the rest of our stay, which is in stark contrast to what some of the reviews have said about the front desk. Perhaps common courtesy and manners to staff results in getting the same returned! The hotel sits on a beautiful stretch of beach, shared by about 8 or 9 other hotels. Our hotel is probably the best of all of these, especially of the Riu's. Our friends were staying at the Riu Yucatan at the same time as we were in the Palace and we both visited each others hotels. They were completely disappointed with the Yucatan, especially with the food and air conditioning in public areas, whilst they thought our hotel was fantastic. For the person from Texas to complain about the Lobby in the Palace, completely flabbergasts me! I have never seen a grander Lobby and cannot believe that someone could actually complain about it. In fact, the whole hotel looked lovely, from the pool areas to the avenues and restaurant decor. The rooms could perhaps have been a bit bigger and lighter, but we didn't spend a lot of time there and overall were pleased with the room. The air conditioning was first class, and although there was a musty smell in the room at times, you have to realise that this is the Caribbean, Mexico in particular, and that the humidity is brutal. The service throughout the hotel was brilliant especially barman Islas on the Lobby bar, waiting staff Isa at the Lobby, Paty, Alex and Alonso at the Pool, Ernesto and Damian in the Buffet, Tilo and Luis Miguel in Chilis, Kevin in Krystals and Chato in the outside bar area in the evenings. A special thank you to Pedro, who worked predominantly in the Lobby and Theatre as the Captain. Excellent manners, service and attitude to everyone he met. Apologies to anyone we've forgotten, as the service and courtesy from all staff was magnificent. Overall, the holiday was fantastic and for some people to give one or two stars for this hotel is astonishing. This is our seventh time in Mexico and I'd like to think that we know a few things about the country and people by now. We can honestly say that if you book to stay at this hotel , you will not be disappointed. All you need is a holiday head, a manner that involves treat as you want to be treated yourself and a respect for the staff that are working in tempratures that the rest of us find uncomfortable sitting in swimming gear with a drink in our hands, being waited on! Relax, enjoy yourself and forget the negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Time to Move On”
Reviews.Author: swils45
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu Palace Riviera Maya yesterday. I have been there before and also the Riu Mexican Palace down the street. I will not be going back. It seems as though it is for the masses now, as though it gets its food from Sam's Club in bulk down the street and serves it up for a buffet (and some of the restaurants!) The lobby and the outside areas are beautiful. The beach is great. The staff is attentive. There were a million kids, crying babies, exhausted looking parents all over the place making plenty of noise (four kids in the room next to us with their double stroller blocking our entry and they just threw out a dirty diaper into the hallway instead of keeping it in their room!), kids running around the awful buffet bumping into people (I do like kids, but I really like when parents keep them under control!) The bedding in the rooms is disgusting. It smells, it's very old and dated and stained (every kind of stain you can imagine!) I put down a beach towel I brought from home on top of my sheet so I wouldn't have to touch them too much. I don't know if it's an American thing, but I want a pretty, fluffy bed to get into at the end of a day in the sun and I expect that. Instead I was awake most of the night wondering about my bedding history. Creepy! The drapery smelled moldy and sitting on the love seat in the room was out of the question. The pool was hot, and as far as bacteria, that's not good. Didn't go in it at all. Think Seinfeld, bacteria frappe -- Dirty diapers, warm pool water...... The pool bar is located in a bad spot in this hotel. it is very close to the beach. If you like quiet on the beach, the loud music is annoying. The staff get on the microphone and start to shout about bingo and games, bantering back and forth with the guests. I think that's expected if you sit at the pool, but not the beach. The Riu Palace Mexico down the street has their pool bar for bingo and games located further away from the beach so you don't have to hear all of that. And they have a separate beach bar. The Riu Palace Mexico is laid out much better. The entertainment was something to walk past at night after a bad dinner as you finish downing some shots to give you the courage to face the bed again. Sorry, I know this was a lot of negativity, but if these things are important to you, don't go to this hotel. If you have the ability to flop down on any kind of bed after a busy day, eat just about anything, then you will probably be okay here. If you care even a little bit about your bedding, civilized dining in a buffet, you should stay elsewhere. Maybe it's me. Time to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: s_rae_e
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I chose to spend the extra money on this hotel because it looked really nice in the pictures, and it had good reviews... however, we did not enjoy our time there at all. Once you get there, you have to immediately go to an area where you book your formal dinners for your stay. When we got to the hotel, our rooms were not ready for 3 hours because they were running late, so we went to go make our reservations right away. The dinner reservation worker said that all of the good restaurants had already been booked full through our stay, so we were stuck with the buffet and a few nights of actual eating out. When they advertised their restaurants for this hotel, i would have thought they would have been accessible. We had upgraded to a suite, but I'm not sure that our room was really upgraded at all. It was down a damp hallway that was always being freshly painted, so you couldn't touch the walls and it smelt strongly of chemicals. Our "jacuzzi" tub that was advertised was actually just a normal bath tub, and our bed sheets were very damp. The whole room was just muggy and not comfortable. We asked to be switched to a different room, but the staff said the hotel was completely full and they did nothing to find us another room or check back in with us during our stay at all. The outdoor pool was cold, so it was not enjoyable to be in unless it was very very hot out. The buffet food was mass-produced, and low quality, and the drinks were more sugar than anything else. The "free internet' that was promised cannot be accessed from the hotel rooms- you must sit in a specific spot in the lobby to try to catch it. The beach was dirty with cigarette butts, and when we went to use the spa, one of the workers there stole my camera with my trip photos on it! I went to speak with the hotel manager about all of this, and he was reluctant to speak to me at all. When he finally would see me he was rude and not sympathetic. I have read some other reviews confirming that this manager is just awful. I e-mailed their customer service when I got home and I never even received a response. We are not the types to go looking for bad things in hotels, and we were very excited for this trip so the RIU Palace Riviera Maya was a huge disappointment. I'm sure some people would have a different experience here, but you better hope for very hot weather so that you can swim, and hopefully you won't have to deal with any of their grumpy staff members and you will manage to get dinner reservations with some of their nice restaurants there. I am someone who appreciates good customer service, so I would honestly just recommend you go to one of the Palace branded resorts (google palace resorts, Mexico) because they are all run beautifully and that is where I have had my favourite Mexican memories! Good luck in your search!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: downshark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for half of the week (after being upgraded from Riu Tequila). It is very nice the rooms are pretty big and most have nice views and aren't too far from the beach/pool/restaurant. The food there was good, I reccomend going to the Brazilian restaurant, it's very good they come around with skewers with many varieties of meats. Only bad thing is that trash from Cozumel island floats over onto the beach over the night and there is a lot of sea weed.

Reviews.Title: “Theft in the room! And zero responsibility!”
Reviews.Author: Nikto
Reviews.Content: Our 5 night vacation at the Riu Palace in Riviera Maya, Playa del Carmen was a wonderful relaxation w/beautiful beach, great amenities and attentive customer service w/exception of the stolen cell phone! This was our second stay at this resort and we returned with pleasure. But we would not stay at another Riu again. While at lunch I left my cell phone in the room on the bench at the end of the bed. We returned in about 40 minutes and the phone was missing. There was no evidence of break and entry. The balcony door was locked and the front door was locked. After we searched the entire room for about 20 minutes I decided to report the incident to the front desk. After I completed the incident report I was told that it would take 48 hours to conduct the investigation, so of course I expressed my dissatisfaction and requested to see the general manager. To make the story short, I dealt with the manager for several days! The manager finally produced a copy of the key card entry report, which showed what cards were used to enter the room. As a result there were several entries the manager could not explain. The entries stated "Communication Error". It was recommended that I contact Riu Resorts corporate headquarters in Spain to obtain more information. I assume that someone has a card, which allows unauthorized access and it is an inside job. Well, after all it is Mexico! And I get that, but the indifferent and unprofessional behavior of the hotel management is a real issue. So, my advice to the future visitors - PLACE YOUR VALUABLES INSIDE THE SAFE AT ALL TIMES.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away”
Reviews.Author: Beenaroundtheworld2
Reviews.Content: We went with another couple and were pleasantly surprised! It is a beautiful property, even though they were doing beach work when we were there. They only let u get one beach towel per person which was annoying but we bought one cheap up the road. They restocked the fridge and room often. There were issues getting dinner reservations As the they were all booked but we learned there are often no shows so we popped in to see and got seated. It really is a great place with shows and entertainment

Reviews.Title: “Cool Pool, Great Beach and Good Food”
Reviews.Author: chalapete
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week there. The room was very comfortable, had a balcony, a small TV, a free minibar with all kinds of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. We had to change rooms, because the first one smelled a little musty. I have a very strong sense of smell. My husband did not smell it. The hotel has 2 wonderful and inviting pools, with a bar, where people hang out all the time. You can make friends with the bar tenders and with a little tip, or a smile, get quality cocktails and concoctions made to order just for you! There are plenty of lounge chairs to sunbathe or lay under the shade of coconut trees. The beach is clean, the sand is beautiful, the ocean crystal clear and nice shades of blue if seen from your lounge chair. Book your restaurants in advance. My favorite: Krystal & Mexican. The buffets also have a different specialty theme every night.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: rpatel1019
Reviews.Content: The food was absolutely awful and unbearable. The restaurant's were so terrible and we couldn't even eat there. At Mexican restaurant we waited forever for the fajitas and when they came, we only took a couple of bites. We left and went to eat the buffet. At the Japanese one the sushi was very mushi and so awful I had to spit it out of my mouth and the beef filet was so chewy and over cooked, the soy sauce either tasted like an orange or tasted really salty. At the brazilian one the meat was super dry and tasted like chewy mess. The meat had absolutely no flavor. The buffet food was not too bad. Stick with the pizza and you'll be fine. The nacho cheese was so watery and nasty. Even the fruit wasn't nice and sweet and fresh. This hotel was terrible. DO NOT every stay here.

Reviews.Title: “BAD value compared to Rui Vallarta”
Reviews.Author: Vertigo_leys
Reviews.Content: Me and 2 friends stayed here July 21-24, seeing that last year we stayed at the Riu Vallarta July of last year we decided to try the 'next step' in the Riu chain since we liked it there. Unfortunately the price was a step up but the value was spotty compared to the Rui Vallarta. Here are my pro's and con's for those of you looking to stay at Rui but not sure between these two just to keep things simple(discarded Riu Jalisco). Pros: 1. Lobby was a definite upgrade in luxury and with air conditioning. Seems like most of the upgrade is invested to the lobby. 2.Beach area is very nice and slightly better than Riu Vallarta, clean sand's 3.Pool is clean and feels bigger than Riu Vallarta 4.Lobby bar is exceptionally nice, its a HUGE upgrade to the Riu Vallarta. 5.Nicer Restaurant selection. Cons: 1Restaurant reservation system is VERY difficult (near impossible) to work with since the first day you get there is almost guaranteed to be booked so you don't have a option. Then you have to struggle with limited time selections, booking time rules and restaurant options. Unless you stay here for over a week you won't get a return on investment with this system. 2. Buffet is a slight downgrade from Rui Vallarta...this is quite serious flaw since the buffet is a central peice of the system I was expecting it to be a clear noticeable upgrade in selection and quality. The food quality is a wash but the variety is less than Rui Vallarta. All 3 of us got sick (not sure if it was the food or lots of drinking) but I can't say if it was specifically the buffet food. 3. There are no bathroom's visibly close to the pool area... youd think they have at least one close just to promote pool cleanliness. 4. Entertainment was overall poor with few nighttime options

Reviews.Title: “Very good, once again.”
Reviews.Author: ERat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. This was the second time in three years that we've stayed at this resort. We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico last year and they are both very similar. Each has their own pros and cons, but I wouldn't hesitate to recommend either one. Here are some highlights, and a couple lowlights, of our stay. Airport Transfers: GREAT!!! We use Cancun Transfers for private transportation to and from the airport. The company representative was standing outside the terminal with our name on a board. We were quickly loaded and on our way. The ride only took about 45 minutes. The new road through Playa del Carmen really helps a lot. We were given ice cold beers, water, and Coke for the ride. Irma and Milton were our drivers and there were great. If you’re interested in a quick, non-stop, safe, and friendly ride to and from your resort, then Cancun Transfers are what you’re looking for. Check-in: Quick and friendly service. Since we were repeat guests we knew about the resort and we didn't need the extended explanation of how things work. We were in our room within 10 minutes of arriving at the resort. Room: The rooms at the Riu are perfectly fine. We requested a King bed on an upper floor and that’s just what we received. The mini-bar was stocked with beer, water, and soda. There is also rum, vodka, brandy, and tequila available in your room, as well as a coffee maker. Since we don’t spend a lot of time in the room we do not require anything more. Everything worked. The A/C was fine. The bathroom was good size. I really don’t know what else anyone would want. Housekeeping was good. Food/Restaurants: The food was good, as always. The buffet for dinner was our least favorite. It was international night the only time we ate dinner at the buffet and it was just OK. International night is code word for “Italian” night. It was fine, but I didn’t go to Mexico to eat pasta and pizza. All of the al-a-carte restaurants were very good. Krystal was by far the best, followed by the steakhouse, the Mexican restaurant, and the Japanese restaurant. We did not eat at the Brazilian this time. Breakfast and lunch were very good. Breakfast and lunch are served buffet style so you can get whatever you’re in the mood for. The service at all of the restaurants was great. Anything you need, they were happy to accommodate. We stayed for 5 nights and were able to get a reservation for 4 nights. I don’t understand why people can’t get reservations. This was our fourth stay and a Riu property and I’ve NEVER had an issue with restaurant reservations. Shows: Are they great? No. Are they funny? Sometimes. Are they entertaining? Sure. The entertainment staff does a great job and really tries their best. If you want to see breathtaking shows go to Coco Bongo. There is a disco at the Riu Tequila if you are interested in something a little more active. For us, the shows were a good way to end a long and hot day. Drinks: I just don’t get why people complain about some drinks not having enough alcohol in them, order a double or tell the bartender that you want it STRONG! They will, just ask. They were fine to me. The beer was Dos Equis, bottles in your room and on tap everywhere else. You want top shelf liquor? Just ask. Don Juilo is a great, and expensive, tequila and the bartenders will gladly get it for you if you ask. Beach/Pool Service: It is available, but sometimes it can be a little wait. If you expect beach and pool service to be at you beckon call anytime you want then you will be disappointed. If you are willing to wait 10 minutes for someone to walk by and take your order then you’ll be much happier. Never had a problem with this and the hotel was at 100% capacity for 2 of our 5 night stay. Bars and Bartenders: This is where I think both Riu Palace’s shine. The bartenders get to know you and will take care of you. Marvin, Tom, and Lesther always were on the lookout for me to walk by and were always smiling and happy to serve. I just wish they had more time to talk to the guests. I would have loved to talk more to them, but they were way too busy. Please tip the workers. They work from 9am-2am six days a week and for very little pay. They work hard and deserve to be rewarded for their service. The only problem we had our entire stay was that the beach was not cleaned of seaweed during the morning. The other resorts in the area did and their beach looked much nicer. Last time we stayed, the workers were cleaning the beach by sunrise every day. This time, I only saw them attempt to do so once. It would have been much better if the seaweed was taken care of daily. The only thing that truely disappointed me was the behavior of some of the guests. The workers are not your servants. They are not your personal butlers. If you need something they will help you out. But please keep requests reasonable. A beach server is there to take drink orders, not to go get you “pieces of cut up pineapple with just a little salt.” If you want something to eat, go get it. If you want something to drink, they will bring it to you…as long as they’re not busy getting food for other people. Also, please remember that the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a family friendly resort. If you desire to sunbathe topless, that’s your prerogative. Just keep in mind that children are staying at the resort and are often shocked to see what they’re looking at. There are plenty of Adult Only resorts in the Mayan Riviera where you can let it all hang out. Finally, the beach is not your ashtray or your trashcan. I was truly shocked to see all of the trash left on the beach. One morning, I saw a worker that had a large trash bag completely full of plastic trash that people just left lay. Some of that trash gets blown into the sea and is very harmful to the sea life. Please be considerate, if not to the other guests, at least to the innocent sea life that you’re damaging. Pick your trash up and throw it away. Overall, we had a very nice stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We loved the service and the food. We also enjoyed the pool and the bars. There is nothing more we could have asked for. Would we recommend this resort? Yes. Would we return? Probably. We may try somewhere else next year. We met a very nice family from Guadalajara and they recommended the west coast of Mexico, like Puerto Vallarta. Maybe we should try and visit the Dominican Republic also. Time will only tell.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to leave”
Reviews.Author: Texasgirl207
Reviews.Content: The resort property was outstanding. Always saw someone mopping, sweeping, triming the lawn. It was gorgeous. Buffet was enormous. We ate at two restaurants, the Brazilian Steak place and Japanese. My favorite was the Japanese (spicy shrimp). Did a snorkling trip with Bruno at Marina Reef, no complaints. Also husband and son did two scuba trips with vendor on the property. No complaints either. I did not care for the two in one bath gel/shampoo, so bring your own shampoo. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “"Warning" Do not stay here! Biohazard”
Reviews.Author: Mexciolove
Reviews.Content: If there were a zero star this place would get it. Where do I begin? The joke decor of the lobby area should be your first clue AS WELL AS THE ROOM DECOR and the welcome drink hot watered down like all other drinks in this place. Juice right out of a box from Sam's Club in Playa non-alcoholic. Who welcomes you in Mexico without a Margarita or Cerveza? Room was nasty, roaches, no hot water, fridge leaked water in room always HAVING TO maintain that. Front Desk was the worst staff I have ever encountered and they get paid the most per the locals AND other staff members. All other staff was awesome. Marlene who we tipped every day for keeping our room and stocked with extra towels so we could keep up with the leaking fridge. Isles at the lobby bar who was a true native to Playa Del Carmen as he was born there, and was very friendly and everyone loved him. Marvin at the pool bar worked his butt off in the heat and always with a smile. The water was never hot in our room, FAN at one speed, AC could not keep up with local climate conditions, and the bedspread was removed promptly and stowed in closet as we shared with Marlene our house keeper not to put it back on the bed. Every time we tossed and turned at night due to the HOT room the plastic mattress cover made a squeaking noise that would wake a sleeping child.Oh the safe worked one plus for the room and the view to 2 points for that. Had a JR suite with a view which was nice. Had to go to Wal Mart $14 round-trip to purchase bleach, febreze to maintain the mildew, must, and smells that penetrated your nostrils, stomach on a daily basis. Also purchased BIG CUPS FOR OUR DRINKS AT POOL BECAUSE THEY ARE KID SIZE WITH EXTRA LONG 7 ELEVEN BIG GULP Straw's! ANOTHER WARNING WHEN ORDERING A TROPICAL DRINK LIKE A PINA COLODA BE WARNED NOW, NO COCO LOPEZ OR FRESH PINEAPPLE JUICE, IT IS A PREMIXED PRESERVITIVE BOUGHT CONCOUCTION THAT COMES OUT THE THE SODA FOUNTAIN LINE, JUST DOUBLE THE ALCOHOL SO IT KILLS THE TASTE NASTY AND GROSS! Another cheap BULK product( you pay for it though they keep costs low, what a joke) NO COKE PRODUCTS ONLY PEPSI, NO CORONA ONLY DOS EQUIS! Wine selection was HORRIBLE. WARNING wait staff doesn't know the difference between variety of white or red wines, just a tip so make sure you taste all wines before ordering, even though it is free takes time to get it right. FOOD WAS THE WORST EVER HAD. THE BEANS AT THE BUFFET WERE WATERED DOWN, AND RUNNY, ALL BREADS, DESSERTS AND PASTRIES ARE MADE WITH "I CAN'T BELIEVE IT'S NOT BUTTER" (MORE COST SAVING TATICS BY Riu Resorts) More processed food, and hydrogenated oils. All bland no flavor, and cold bread and cold margarine, I haven't had margarine since I was 7 years old. HELLO? TIP-we found flour tortilla's and hash browns, and guacamole for our daily feed at the buffet our version of breakfast taco's. FOOD AT ALL PROPERTY RESTAURANT'S WAS HORRIBLE. STEAK WAS FULL OF FAT AND GRISTLE, AND PAPER THIN AND BURNT. SHRIMP WAS THE SIZE OF A QUARTER AND OH IT WAS WARM NICE! THE SPA BURNED INSCENSE IN THE WAITING AREA NO LAVENDAR OR ESSENTIAL OIL OR RELAXING AMBIEANCE. SO ONCE WE HAD ENOUGH WE PAID THE $14 RT TO 5TH AVENUE TO EAT FOOD WHIPPED OUT THE AMEX AND PAID $100 PLUS PER MEAL FOR 2 ADULTS VERY EXPENSIVE. THIS WAS A VERY EXPENSIVE TRIP COULD HAVE GONE TO A NICER HOTEL AND HAD A WONDERFUL VACATION FOR WHAT WHE THREW DOWN. SHOULD HAVE GONE TO CANCUN ON MY GUT FEELING AND STAYED AT THE ROYAL. THE 2 POSIVITES OF THE TRIP, A DAY SNORKELING TRIP TO COZUMEL, AND WATER SAFARI AT MARONA BEACH WAS WONDERFUL.....I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO PLAYACAR, PLAYA DEL CARMEN OVER PRICED AND WAY TOO CROWEDED THIS TIME OF YEAR.....TRUST ME I AM NOT EXAGARATING....ONE BIT....STAY AWAY, UNLESS YOU HAVE A BOAT LOAD OF KIDS, YOU ARE DIRTY, AND HAVE NO TASTE BUDS AND NO SENSE OF SMELL...YOU WILL LOVE IT...

Reviews.Title: “Riu no more!!!”
Reviews.Author: rodsf
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 days in Playa. Resort was very clean. You can get a better resort for the same price. Rooms were of good size nothing to gush over. Food was ok, Steak house burned my med-well steak. Japanese was ok. Buffet was average. Brazilian was my favorite. Service was mostly good expect for a few employees that didn't want to help an elderly woman in a wheelchair. BE CAREFUL wet floors everywhere, wife slipped in the room, son slipped in the courtyard I slipped in the hallway and no nurse or firstaid station in resort.

Reviews.Title: “BEST RESORT EVER”
Reviews.Author: Sahar121
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We loved it. We'd been to two other Riu's before, in Cabo san Lucas, and Riu Caribe in Cancun. We loved them both, but decided to try a Riu Palace this time, and found the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Best decision we ever made. Since we had been to all-inclusive resorts before, we knew what to expect, but the hotel exceeded our expectations. -The food was GREAT (better than the other RIu's we'd been to) -Waitstaff was helpful and friendly -Service was GREAT (Especially for an all inclusive resort!) -Activities were fun and optional, so you could choose between relaxing or partying -Beach was GORGEOUS! (it looked just like "paradise" postcards) It was also serene, so you could get away from all the noise up in the pool area and get a nice siesta -Restaurants had great service, great food, and wide selection of restaurants! Food also had great presentation -Great buffet food -Nice shows and kids activities before -Building had great design -Not too big, more luxurious and less walking around :) -GREAT CLEAN ROOMS!!! -Always sanitary and clean -Bathrooms were great! Even the outdoors ones and my personal favorite... -BEST ENTERTAINMENT STAFF!!! VERY friendly and got you involved in things you wouldn't have the courage or the support to do at home, funny, kind, not pushy, fun to be around, and well... entertaining!!! LOVED it there and will be going back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “What planet are some people on???”
Reviews.Author: WullieG1958
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Palace. I would only say that the people that have complained about it must be living on an other planet. We found the whole hotel to be absolutely beautiful and well maintained. The staff were the most attentive and friendly without exception.(This may be due to the way we treated them and we never tipped until the end of our stay!) On day one, we were just going to sit down by the pool and before our bums were on the seat the drinks waiter was offering us any drinks that we wanted and this continued for the whole stay. The food in the restaurants was excellent, we were just as happy to use the main restaurant as the specialist. We did not find booking the restaurants an issue, we just strolled up any time between 12 and 3pm. If they were booked we would look in any of the restaurants at night and they would sometimes have free places, (due to people booking and then not turning up, not the hotels fault!). I reckon I had the best steak meal that I have ever had in the Fusion restaurant. The waiters in there were brilliant most attentive and friendly. The pool did get fairly noisy as the day went on but we just sat at the beach side of the pool looking out to sea and let the other people enjoy themselves. In the Lobby Bar after dinner, the staff again were brilliant. When we asked for Chivas Regal whisky, we thought we were pushing the boat out a bit and would incur an extra cost as it is a premium whisky,but no problem the barman brought the bottle to us and poured our drink in front of us. On our second night he saw us coming and had the drink poured as we reached the bar. Our room was kept spotless with fresh linen every day. We were with friends who were in adjacent room and as far as noise was concerned we very rarely heard a thing. Any time we had an issue with the room someone was there promptly to put it right. I would say that maybe as the hotel is now about six years old, things are getting ready for a refurbish but I would still say it was a good standard. May the people complaining should try treating staff as they would like to be treated themselves and they would get an even better service.

Reviews.Title: “Know what you are in for when you book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pokes05
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and would not return. There are much better options for the same price range. This hotel has all the negative aspects of a mega resort - wristbands, lots of children, and buffets. They force you to go to the buffet for dinner when you arrice since you cannot get reservations for your first night or for your first choice most nights. The food is only buffet style for breakfast and lunch – no ordering by the pool or on the beach. Service at the restaurants was mostly good, but the whole reservation system is very frustrating even though we expected it. We showed up at noon on the dot and had only 2 choices or less each night for the next 3 nights and we could only make 2 reservations each day. Tthere was no drink service by the pool or on the beach, so you had to wait in line at the pool bar – not my idea of a nice vacation. Islas at the lobby bar is fantastic though. The rooms were not 4-star. Although our room had a nice location on the end near the spa with a large balcony (and a slight view of the ocean), the A/C could not keep up with the heat/humidity. The weather was unusually cool for this time of year, so I can't imagine how bad it is when it's really hot there. Our sheets were damp and unbearable even though they changed them each day. All of our clothes smelled of mildew when we left. The hallways echoed and you could hear everything in the rooms around you. For the quality of this hotel it should have been much less expensive. The pool was large, but crowded, old, and dirty. It does have a nice beach and shade options, but we could get that at any other Playacar hotel. We spent 2 nights at another hotel nearby for the end of our trip and it did not have any of the problems we experienced at the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Read before you book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: misskitty0729
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Grounds were nicely maintained. I was hopeful the rooms would be just as nice - not the case. 2) Our concierge Jesus was extremely helpful and nice when we tried to find another hotel to move to. 3) Lobby was beautiful. Cons: 1) You are not guaranteed to get to eat in ANY of their restaurants your entire stay. We had to stand in a long line (between 12-3) to make dinner reservations - which most time when we got to the front are told that all restaurants are completely booked - which they are not. We showed up for dinner on the only night we could get a reserv. and the restaurant was over 1/2 empty. Same thing for the 4 other couples in our group. The draw for us to come to this hotel was what we thought were the many restaurant options and bars to hang out in, but they make that process difficult. Hope you like buffets, because that is where you will spend most of your meal time. 2) I'm normally a pool girl and like to look at the ocean from the pool and not deal with sand, but there were soooo many babies and children in the pool next to the swim up bar it drove us to the beach. It didn't appear to have a separate area for kids to hang at. 3) The "entertainment" was lacking. The Sports Bar was not what you would imagine and had florescent white lights and no pulse. I never thought I would spend the bulk of my time at a lobby bar, but they close early so you're choice is the Sports Bar or bar in the theater that has stage acts - we saw clowns and dancing kids on stage. 4) The rooms smelled like mildew, and the sheets felt damp. 5) BE AWARE - there are NO king sized beds...They have 2 full sized beds pushed together, and when we walked into the room and saw the bed we were not happy, so the bag handler offered to bring us a king sized mattress pad so there wasn't an obvious crease in the middle of our bed. The blankets on our bed were filthy and had what appeared to be blood or red wine on it. 6) There were no good views of the ocean from the room. The palm trees covered the view to ocean - the hotel has only 3 floors.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: felixbry
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel,the best staff very warm and friendly.We stayed there as a group of 14 family and friends for my daughter's wedding.The weather was wet for the first 2 days and then a lot of cloud and showers,but it came out sunny for the wedding. Even though the bad weather dampened things the staff did all they could to keep us all happy.I must recommend a one member of staff who said if we need anything to ask him.He was Alex he served us on the beach,in the lobby bar,the sports bar and outside the theatre, he seemed to be everywhere also a very happy waitress who was always smiling(included a photo with us) I cannot fault this hotel or it's staff such lovely happy people.If RIU Hotels ever read this they they should give these staff the recognition they deserve,as without them they would not have the good reputation of a great hotel. thankyou ALEX you made it a special holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/service/beach”
Reviews.Author: Tirasv
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu palace riviera maya. Stay there from 07/04-07/12. Great hotel, owesome service and amazing beach! Sunscreen is a must and very expensive at hotel/shops ($35). Did try brazilian restaurant-did not like it and just went to buffet for dinner for the rest of the vacation (9 days). Great food choices--always something different. Very clean-no bugs in a room. Did leave few dollars for room service and tip for drinks to get better quality drinks/service. Great room #1133-very quiet and facing other hotel/garden view, half way to the lobby/beach area, 2nd floor. Will recommend Riu palace riviera maya to everyone--great service/stuff/bartenders/reception reps.Will recommend "Cancun Shuttle" for private roundtrip transfer-very inexpensive transfer to/from Cancun airport (abt $110 roundtrip for whole family). Do negotiate for good's prices from playa del carmen shops-check small owners shops. In a big market plaza store-higher prices. Great/best prices on t-shirts/hats/souvenirs at Chichen Itza site. Do get umbrellas--it did rain in the afternoon and locals charge $5 for plactic raincoat.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BCMMan
Reviews.Content: If carlsberg did hotels they'd probably be as good as this one! The Hotel is well thought out and staff are fantastic. The amenities are excellent with good standard of room, cleanliness, service and food choice/quality. Other eviews mention noisy "Corridors", not noisy corridors that are the problem, just idiots who shout and slam doors at 4 am, thats the guests fault, not the hotels. We wnt as a party of 14 for a family wedding and weren't dissapointed in any way. The entire team at RIU have got it spot on. Thanks for an excellent holiday, well worth the 10 hour flight and the money.

Reviews.Title: “Our thoughts on RPRM...”
Reviews.Author: HockeyAJ24
Reviews.Content: Ground transfers (A) = Quick and on time. RPRM staff (A+) = from the grounds crew to room maids to wait staff to entertainment staff --- it's clear everyone has pride in their job...outstanding. RPRM grounds (A+) = Beautiful and spacious. Rooms (C+) = nice and clean, no bugs or strange smells. Only complaint here is the room needed more hooks to dry clothes, we used every lamp shade, bed post and was even eyeing the ceiling fan, but it was too high ;-). Also, the hall noise could be an issue but depends on what type of people are in your wing. We had 2 nights that was a bit loud. View was fine for what I paid. Food and Restaurants (A+): buffet was great with many choices and for my kids not to complain, well that tells it all. Restaurants are good, need to reserve early but we also got in (7 people) just by walking up and asking about cancellations -- no problem. Beach (A+) = Huge and beautiful. No issues getting lounge chairs and you are not on top of each other like other resort further South. As far as snorkeling nothing in front of RPRM but if you walk past the last resort going south (about 15 min walk from RPRM) there is a reef about 75 yards from the shore. Some fish that will keep you and the kids busy. Also, if you walk further down, maybe another 15 mins south from that point, nice little lagoons with more good snorkeling. We did also do Yal Ku, Aktumal and Punta Sur (Cozumel) AWESOME. Pool: (A+) = clean and warm Entertainment (A for effort) = Not Broadway but was entertaining. Weather (B+) = weeks weather forecast showed 60% chance of rain; reality was it showered almost everyday (once really hard, couldn't even see gym from chilils) for 30 mins and then it was gone....no problem. Overall A+ rating from us.....we booked a return trip! Cheers....Aj Other: Playa Del Carmen was ok, but I think the shops close to RPRM was a little more relaxed environment, only so much "free medical advice" and "100% discount" (still don't understand that one) one man can take! Also, if you run out of time to get down to Tulum, check out Playacar ruins just 10 mins walk north on street from hotel. It's not Tulum but you will be back at the pool bar in 45 mins!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but beware of the pool bar after 1pm”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaWilts
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel couldn't fault the rooms very clean towels changed every daub location great staff were wonderful. One downfall when the younger holidays makers rise about 1pm the pool bar became extremely noisy we had to retire to the beach every afternoon which was not a problem for us but if you do not like the sand could be a problem. Other than that no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: jayned2001
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the time the taxi picked us up to take us to the airport it was heaven. Staff cannot do enough for you, the room was perfect and the food was outstanding. Anyone who complains about anything here must be a professional grumbler. I e-mailed the hotel prior to arrival asking for a quiet room on the upper floor and reservations for the a la carte for our first two evenings. On arrival we were given exactly what had been requested. The staff are very friendly and do not expect tips. Walked in to Playa del Carmen, took about 15 mins. Go, enjoy and ignore any negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Our room wasn't ready at 4:30 pm...”
Reviews.Author: Loves-H2O
Reviews.Content: Then we find out that you're supposed to make dinner reservations before 3 pm everyday. That meant we were subject to the grand buffet (that wasn't so grand). The halls smelled musty. The room smelled like smoke. We went out to the pool to wait for our room to open up. It was over crowded with self serve drinks. Needless to say, we lasted at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya less than 24 hours and found another resort to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “laugh together with the staff at the bar while girls' bathing suit tops are pulled down”
Reviews.Author: graveswood
Reviews.Content: rooms ending in 012 - 022 have a lovely view of the construction work next door, which includes the workers climbing around on it. And, they are immediately behind the bar area which provides the nightly shows. Perfect. I used riu.com to book our reservations. I booked 'junior suite balcony' in hopes this would net a higher floor than 'junior suite terrace'. Since 'superior suite' faced the pool, I wanted to ensure it was not too noisy before paying any additional price. The day before we left, I re-confirmed my reservations and was told that superior rooms were still available. The reservation agent agreed I might as well wait until I arrived to see what these actually provided, as it was highly unlikely the hotel would fill up in less than 24 hours. I arrived willing to pay for the nicest rooms available. I requested upgraded rooms. I made it clear over and over that I was not looking for anything free, but wanted to pay for the nicest available. I was told there were no superior rooms available so I checked their web site on-line. When I pointed out that there were superior suites, I was told: 1. this was incorrect as they were not listed on the riu web site. (they were). 2. I could not obtain these rooms since I had already paid for the other rooms (I hadn't). I love this: 3. these rooms were actually rooms that weren't available because there were problems with them (no hot water, etc). But my favorite answer came from Omar, the manager, who came out and demanded (a bit loudly) did I think he was lying to me. (umm . . . yes?) Instead, I asked him what he would have done if I had booked and paid for these superior rooms prior to arrival. He responded . . . wait for it . . . here it comes. . . : 4. OVERBOOKING SUPERIOR ROOMS HAPPENS FROM TIME TO TIME AND GUESTS ARE GIVEN WHATEVER DOWNGRADED ROOMS ARE AVAILABLE. What was left to say? I went to inspect the rooms and when I discovered that the garden view included construction workers, I requested different jujnior suite rooms and was told: 5. I had requested connecting rooms and these were the only rooms that connected (they didn't). Angelika tried to argue with me about this, and asked the bell boy who confirmed my story that they do not connect. He had his head down, and I hope that telling the truth did not affect his job. I got back on my trusty iphone, found other accommodations, paid for one night at the riu and sprinted out the door the next morning. Our room, 2018, included a broken phone, and an old apple someone had left in the servi-bar. Our 2nd room, 2019, (presumably it still does not connect with room 2018), included a half-eaten candy bar in the servi-bar. The staff at the pool bar enjoyed their work, joining the laughter when the 20 something year old crowd danced around, bumping into others, and pulled down the bikini top of one (also laughing) girl. And while I was witnessing this with our teen age boys, my husband received a call from Omar offering to buy us dinner that night . . . had he forgotten we were in an all-inclusive resort? I have stayed in 3 star, 3 star which should be 4, 4 star, 4 star which should be 3, 4 star which should be 5, and 5 star hotels, and here's the report: The hotel was clean. The room was large. The staff we encountered worked hard. The beach was a bit grungy, and included vendors selling local wares, but it felt reasonably safe. The drinks were served in 8 oz cups. The pool bar appeared to have a variety of alcohol choices and qualities. The Brazilian restaurant food was not bad. The waiters worked hard and provided very good service. The Las Vegas show would be rated R (not appropriate for under 17.). This hotel is perfect for the high school and college spring break crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Be aware before you go. A must read. RIU is stealing money from you”
Reviews.Author: mauriciok
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel in us dollars pricey as it may be. The peso was 11.45 to the dollar. When we got here they should us the agreed upon dollar price with a conversion to pesos when I got back to my room and calculated the rate it was 13.87 a difference of 2.42 i pesos which amounts to 23% markup. When we asked what the bell they were doing. They gave me a lame excuse that is when you use an amex. The problem is my friend used visa and got gouged too. This hotel is way overpriced for what you get. I have stayed in lower end rius 4 times and the service and food was far better. Save your money stay next door but beware. The people service was excellent. Unfortunately this place tries to sell themselves as first class hotel but nothing along the lines of food operation resembles that. You can get better quality for half the cost and not get robbed. This note should create a great deal of chargebacks and I will love to see their answer to it.

Reviews.Title: “Quite one of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Seary
Reviews.Content: Friendly happy staff, excellent food, very good main restaurant, and a choice of further a la carte restaurants at no extra charge . Spacious rooms with free 24hour room service. all set in immaculate gardens, down to the swimming pool and the beach and spa A good variety of entertainm,ent if required, or quietareas for those who needed it.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Valsboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel and staff were the best we have come across, they could not do enough for you, we had booked a courtyard suite but was upgraded to sea view suite we enjoyed ourselves so much we have booked to return in 2012. We have to say we experienced none of the negatives that other people wrote about.

Reviews.Title: “Can' wait to go back for a third time!!”
Reviews.Author: dtagg5
Reviews.Content: Sorry if this is long, I just want to be thorough. We got back a couple of weeks ago from our second trip to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We were there last November and the second week of June for nine days. Check in: Very fast. We arrived around 1:00 pm and were checked in right away. We were taken to our room which was ready. I was a little disappointed with the view from theroom. The balcony was very small with the rooms on either side having large balconies with solid side walls so the view was very limited (you could only see straight ahead). I know this wouldn't matter to some, but I alwas upgrade our room so we have a view. Went to the front desk to see if we could change to another room. They told us to come back after lunch and we did. Still had nothing and told us to come back in the morning. At that point I didn't think we would be able to change but went back in the morning anyway. Spoke to the manager and we were changed to room 2057 with a very large balcony and a great view. Room: No musty smell in thisroom at all, the first room had a slight odor. Air and fan worked great. The room was extremely clean and was cleaned the same way the whole time we were there.The bed was an enormous king size which was very comfortable for us. I always bring extra hangers when I travel but didn't need them here (there were 20). On the second day, we came back from the pool to find a bottle of sparkling wine, a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a small sombrero with two shot glasses and note welcoming us back to the hotel. Very nice touch. We had to call a few times during our stay to have the drinks refilled, but it was no big deal to us. They would bring them within ten minutes and ten minutes after that the front desk would call to make sure it was done. Great customer service! Food: I know this is very subjective, but we thought the food was great! The first night we ate at the buffet. There is so much food to choose from, I can't believe someone couldn't find something they like to eat. Breakfast: Almost anything you could want for breakfast. Omlets made to order, fried or scrambled eggs, pancakes,french toast,quiche, yogurts, fruits delicious breads and pastries, fresh fruit juices, smoothies, cereals (hot and cold) &a large collection of cold cuts and cheeses. To the person who wrote in thier review "If you wake up late, and was hungry beween 11-12 good luck finding food, that's when they change the buffet". The 24 hour sports bar always has burgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, fresh fruit ad desserts. There is also 24 hour room service (very limited menu though) Try the cappuccino, it was very good. Also, have a mimosa or boody mary. You can make them yourself or the waiter wil make them for you. Lunch: There are two buffet, Chili's or Don Manolo. They have different items so if you don't like the casual food at Chili's you could go to Don Manolo and check out what they have there. Personally, I liked Chili's for lunch. Hot dogs, chili, burgers, chicken, pasta, pizza, salads, fruits and desserts. That was fine for us, we dont need or want a gourmet meal for lunch. Dinner: The buffet has many choices available. Always some type of chicken, beef, fish many salad selections, side dishes and of course great desserts (try the hard serve coconut ice cream (sooooo good). We ate at all the ala cartes except the Japanese. The Mexican was good, but if I'm being honest, it was better last time we were here. Service was great in all the restaurants. Next, we went to Chili's Steakhouse. We both had the ribeye steak (which was enormous)! My husband ordered his medium rare and mine was medium. Both were cooked perfectly. The baked Alaska for dessert was delicious. Next, was the Brazillian. I wasn't sure I would like this, but it was really good. Skip lunch on the day you book this. I don't remember how many meats they bring to the table (6 or 7). We stopped after the fifth lol. If I remember correctly there was sausage, pork, chicken, turkey, ribeye, filet mignon and maybe one more. All we had were very good and needless to say we had no dessert that night! Before our trip I had been in contact with Grecia Sanchez Public Relations) I had a few concerns that she helped me with. I mentioned to her that my birthday was June 10 and I would love to eat at Krystal on that day. She emailed me back saying we were confirmed for my birhday. So that day we ate at Krystal and it was great! We both had the filet mignon which were perfect. After dinner while we were waiting for our dessert three waiters came to the table sang to me and brought me a birthday cake. Vey nice surprise!! When we returned to our room afte dinner there was another bottle of sparkling wine, plate of chocolate covered strawberries, anothe small gift and a note wishing me a happy birthday. Bars: All as great as I remembered. Service was always fast and friendly. Not once did we have a bad bartender, but I have to mention our favorites.
