Claudia and Victor at the Sports Bar, Islas at the Lobby Bar, and Zorita (spelling) at the Pool Bar. They all are excellent! I also have to mention Tom, who ran around the pool getting people drinks and did a great job keeping my Bubba Keg filled! Pool: As others have said, the pool is very warm in the afternoons. I would say the water temperature had to be 90F or above. I don't know if anything could be done about that as the air temp was 90-95 everyday with high humidity. And yes some guests are very inconsiderate throwing straws and other debris into the pool. But all day I would see employees walking around with nets scooping things out of the pool. Alcohol: I don't know if all inclusives buy lower proof alcohol, but it is definitely not as strong as i is at home. That being said, I don't think it's a bad thing. I like to sip on my pina coladas or miami vices all day. I wouldn't be able to do that with strong drinks. We did see some drunk people at the pool, so apparently you could get a lot of alcohol if that's what you want. Just ask for more alcohol. The bartenders are more than happy to make your drinks as strong as you want them. Anamacion: Very hard working! At the pool they start at 10 AM. They have something to do every 15 minutes or so. Spanish lessons, riffle shooting, baci ball, horseshoes, beach and pool volleyball, bingo and some others. They try to get people involved, but if you don't want to they don't bother you. A few times during the week they also had a beach barbecue with a band, the entertainment team dancing with the guests and incredable food! If it rains (like it did two days we were there) they move some activities into the lobby. We are not show people, so I can't comment on them, but people we talked to there enjoyed them. Beach: Absolutely beautiful!! More than enough loungers in and out of the sun. There is now a slight drop before you get to the water (due to some erosion), but it was not a problem. The water was much nicer than when we were there in November, much warmer and very calm. Things that need improvement: It is very dark in the shower, a ceiling light is needed. The tv is bolted to the dresser facing the couch and doesn't have a swivel screen. You can barely see it from the bed (I need to watch tv to go to sleep). I know this can't be changed in the Riu's that are already built, but maybe in future hotels, seperate tub and shower. I think the shower would be very difficult to get in and out of for older people. I'm still giving this resort 5*. The minor things that I think could be improved would just add to what was a fantastic trip. In closing, I would like again to thank Grecia Sanchez for putting my mind at ease about the bug situation a few months ago (by the way, I didn't see one and believe me I LOOKED) and for arranging my wonderful birthday dinner. Also, Mark at Tripguy who assured me if I wasn't happy when we got there he would switch hotels for us. All my worries were put to rest as soon as Hector opened the door for us when we arrived. We've only been back a few weeks and are trying to figure out a way to go again in November for our anniversary. It is a beautiful resort with an amazing staff, you will not be sorry if you choose this one. Any questions don't hesitate to ask.

Reviews.Title: “The most wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: randicisz
Reviews.Content: My nephew and his fiance' celebrated a post-wedding vacation/2nd honeymoon here and 25 of our closest family and friends joined the couple (aka crashed their parte'). They both served more than one tour in Iraq and these high school sweethearts soooo deserved a proper "joisey" celebration. We had the most wonderful vacation! Not one complaint! We highly recommend all of the restaurants. Everything was top notch. While not a complaint, the only advice I have is to ensure that you carefully choose the company you book any recreational activity with because they are NOT affiliated with the hotel. We had a company rep steal $100 from us because when converting the cost of each of our party's cost to enter Wet & Wild to see the dolphins, he charged us for 15 folks but only provided a paid receipt (in converted USD to pesos) for 14. We had to pay an additional $100 because of this crook. We had a great time, nonetheless. We highly recommend BRUNO from Reef Marina Carine to tour the barrier reef (2nd largest in the world). A large group of us (many kids, too) went snorkeling for the first time and worried about how the kids would fare. BRUNO was AMAZING! Everyone in our party had the best time and we credit it to the small family owned Reef Marina Carine and BRUNO. (They are right on the beach next to RIU Palace Riveria Mya....don't use another tour group if you're interested in snorkeling.) Reasonable prices, great service and not one hiccup dealing with this tour company. We'd never take another trip except to a RIU property. The BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Time for a change!”
Reviews.Author: cindyandbill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for the week of June 17th-24th. This was our second trip to this Riu, and our last. My husband and I have been going to different Riu's for the last 8 years and we were so disappointed with this visit. The food was so boring, we have found at different Riu's to be so much better. We have been at different Riu's where their buffet meals were so much better. The themes that they would choose were very festive. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya had none of that. They may have put up a couple of decorations, but that was it. I wasn't even sure what theme night we were even on. We are not picky, honest, but this time we were so disappointed. I have learned from many years to take different items to help with the problems that we have encountered or what we have read. I am going to list a few that might help you when you make your plans. Smell: Remember this is the tropics, I bring a couple of air fresheners to help with the mildew smell in the room. Take a small can of lysol, bug spray, Band-Aids, I take a laundry that zips shut to hold all my dirty laundry, but I also put fabric softener sheets inside to help. I use the air tight bags to bring my clothing, when I leave I put the clean cloths back into the air tight bags along with fabric softener sheets. This helps with the smell of your cloths when you get home. There is a coffee pot in the rooms now, I will now take my own coffee. Their coffee is awful, but that is their coffee and I can not fault them for that. I am picky when it comes to coffee. If the bed is too hard, ask for bed pad, they will bring you one. Catch the maids in the morning or afternoon, (they seem to be there all day) for more linens if needed, they will be happy to bring them too you. We have found that the staff in the buffet was very busy keeping busy setting up the tables instead of taking care of the customers. This is something that we have not experienced before. We always take money for tipping, and this is the first time we came back with tip money. We love the RIU'S, they are a wonderful hotel, we will just visit a different one in November. I will not tell you NOT to go, because it is a beautiful place. We wanted rest and relaxation and we got that. We could go to different inclusive hotels, but I would never change from the RIU's. I hope that I helped you, and if you have any questions, please ask .

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for! But some important recommendations....”
Reviews.Author: IslaMissy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I returned from RIU last week and we cannot wait to go back!! The rooms and grounds are absolutely beautiful and perfectly clean. I personally live in the Florida Keys and Miami and I was slightly concerned that there would not be much difference between our beaches and Playa Del Carmen. I was completely wrong! The water is amazing, the beach is clean with beautiful white sands and the water was perfect. I can say nothing bad about the service, cleanliness or view. I just wanted to send out a few recommendations because we read many of these reviews before we booked our trip and we did find it a big help. First of all...we did not know that all the restaurants were NOT open all nights. We were there for 5 nights total and had no problem making reservations for our first 2 nights...FYI, reservations need to be made between 12 and 3pm. This is kind of difficult if you are going to be on an excursion or shopping in town. We wanted to never wear a watch or know what time it was and we did find this kind of annoying. They also only let you book 2 nights of dinner reservations at a time. So anyway...we booked our first 2 nights of dinner reservations with no problem. On the third day we were on an all day excursion so we ate out and were unable to make additional reservations. We were excited to eat at 2 different restaurants for our final 2 nights and were dissapointed to find out that the only 2 that were open were the ones we had already been to!!! I understand that they need to plan and that reservations were needed, but I do wish that we had been informed of this because we would have absolutely choosen different restaurants the first 2 nights in order to try the ones that were actually going to be open towards the end of the week. So don't make that mistake...definately plan out your week so that you can actually take advantage of all the wonderful restaurants that do exist at RIU, we were just not able to enjoy them. Second of all...the pool is very loud. Blasting reggaetone was not exactly relaxing to me, remember I do live in Miami so I was anxious to get away from that type of music:) But no one had to twist my arm to lounge at the beautiful quite beach! There are lots of loud games and drunk people at the swim up bar so the pool isnt exactly the most relaxing location. But they were having a blast and if that is what you enjoy then you will love the pool area! One more thing...because of 2 days of rain we spent some time at the spa. I actually run a spa so I was anxious to see their services. It was "ok". Very typical massage, very typical body wrap. Not bad, not the best. Definitely worth going if it is raining...but otherwise there are too many other things to do around town than get an "ok" massage. Oh wait, one more thing. You HAVE to go to 5th avenue. The good thing about the miscommunication with the restaurant reservations is that we ended up taking a cap ($7) to 5th avenue. The shopping is amazing, the food is rediculous and there are so many artists to watch and crafts to purchase! We found 5th avenue on day 3 and went back for dinner every night after! Never ate dinner at RIU again hahaha. Highly recommend the authentic Mayan cuisine restaurant on 5th and 22nd, I cannot say enough about this food...sooo different from anything I have ever had and just completely amazing. All in all, RIU was exactly what we were looking for, reasonable prices, very good food, clean, clean, clean, fantastic service, close to shopping and authentic 5 star restaurants, many excursions to choose from. I highly recommend! We felt safe the entire time and although there are many tourists...it is not nearly as commercialized as Cancun and you can absolutely get a real feel of Mexico living. We are actually thinking of renting a house or something in the same neighborhood as RIU next year because we loved it so much and would like to really feel like locals! :) Then again, roomservice, a maid, and breakfast buffet was pretty nice....:) hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel poor entertainment”
Reviews.Author: nffc2011
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel but need to do something about eveing entertainment and should cater more for couples/adults instead of kids disco till 9.45 pm.

Reviews.Title: “wow nice”
Reviews.Author: steve45681
Reviews.Content: let me say it was nice lets get started bad 1st housekeeping was the only thing that i could fined anything bad about and it was little like not replacing towles ,worsh cloth 3 time over 8 days not a big deal went out to the halway and got them off the cart or called front desk took care of it riteaway this place was small and i liked it less walking never had a problem getting seats around pool or beech none all week always open chairs some on here said they seen rouches we never seen 1 not saying they dident but we did not the walk to playa would be more like 30 min but safe we took taxie 7$ party hoopers was fun 3 clube from 8;30 to 3am coco bonggo was the best a do not miss thing must do this food was vary good every day chilles was vary good mexican was not but the buffay was good every meal if you felt you needed anything front desk was there and took care of you fast xtra pillows ect. rooms as nice size i would go back to here in a hartbeet this was our 5th trip out of the us and i must say the best 1 for those of you that had problems maybe look at thing a little differnt i go on vac. to have fun relax and injoy my stay i dont let little thing upset me if you try real hard you could find stuff wrong anywhere you go but why try that hard dont swet the small stuff injoy your stay i have never went to a place and everything was that perfect not even at home but this place is vary nice thank you rprm. any ? hit me up ill give you my opion steve45681@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Good Food, Good Pool - Loud Resort”
Reviews.Author: travelchristie
Reviews.Content: Being a travel agent, I like to review all of the accommodations that I stay in. The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is a beautiful resort, immaculate grounds with excellent food. If you have ever stayed in a RIU property before, then you pretty much know what to expect as almost of their properties are set up the same way. Very “cookie cutter”. The lobby is absolutely gorgeous. All granite, tile and very ornate. Incredibly clean throughout. The Room – or shall I say - Rooms: The room is nicely appointed. We had a king size bed and it was not hard as a rock! My previous stay at a RIU left me sore and tired, so this was quite a welcome change. The room is all granite and tile. The mini-fridge was full of sodas, water and beer. The liquor dispenser was full. They have wised up and put locks on them now. I have had clients tell me that they used to take the liquor home with them… not any more! The LCD TV was a bit fuzzy and the technician tried to fix it but gave up on it. Our first two nights were fine, however, one flaw with RIU – the hallways are so echoey that every drunk going to their room in the middle of the night will wake you up! Also on our 1st night, some drunk pulled the fire alarm at 2:00am and it continued to go off for 30 minutes. I will say, it would indeed wake the dead and you wouldn't sleep through a fire at this resort. Our 3rd night, we returned to our room to a horrible smell and we thought maybe they had sprayed for bugs. The next morning I awoke with a horrifying headache. Turns out they were working on the room next to us and using some caustic chemical that was being sucked into our a/c fan and into our room. We demanded a different room the next morning and were told we would have to wait until 3pm. This did not sit well and we asked for the manager, who immediately upgraded us to a room with a better view and no smell. I was pleased with their quick resolution. There is no WI-FI in the rooms, but it is available in the lobby and complimentary. Pool: The pool is enormous, clean and well maintained. My husband enjoyed the pool volleyball everyday. The beach chairs are ample, but if you want a good one, you better go down at 7:00am to secure one. There are plenty of umbrellas as well. The only complaint is that the towel shack tends to run out of dry towels by 3pm. And this was in the off-season. I would hate to see what time they run out in the busy season. Waiter service around the pool was really slow… might as well just go get one yourself. The cups for the drinks are small, I recommend you bring your own insulated cup. Many folks did and were able to get a larger drink that didn’t melt right away. Beach: What can I say? It’s huge and beautiful. The water is fabulous. White sugary sand for as far as the eye can see! You could easily walk into Playa del Carmen from the beach in front of the RIU. Food: Delicious! We loved the Japanese Restaurant. We couldn’t get into the Brazilian, but heard it was fantastic. The buffet restaurant was excellent. We also dined at the Krystal, which is a fusion cuisine and it was different but quite yummy. The 24 hour Sports Bar off of the lobby had snacks and microwave available as well, in case you were hungry after 1:00 a.m. The bummer about the Sports Bar was we couldn’t watch the NBA Finals as they didn’t get that channel. The drinks were good and the bartenders did a great job. Tips were certainly appreciated. The room service was prompt but the menu is lacking. Overall, it’s a good resort, quite busy and noisy though so I will move onto a different one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I will not go back here”
Reviews.Author: MarcylovesMexico
Reviews.Content: We were there from June 18-24th last year we went to the Riu palace mexico do we thought we were up grading to the RPRM but that was not the case. I read stuff on here and i it cant be that bad but it was close. The day we got there our room was not ready which was fine because we were there early. We finally got the key to our room at 5:30 pm. The room was fine but the jacuzzi tub didn't work and they came and fixed it. That night I got in the tub and turned it on and i smelled like melting plastic and i turned it off and there was smoking coming out of the vent. They moved up to another room and the room they moved us too was a hard bed and we found some roaches in that room and it smelled like mildew. We went to the front desk next morning and they moved us to another room and it was much better. My other complaint is the lack of service at the pool we had to flag people down to get us a drink. The pool where the swim up bar was always dirty and the infinity pool is where we stayed the hole time. There was not a lot of food options the Mexican restaurant was not that great the Japanese was my favorite one the steak house was good too. The sausage in the morning was gross it was like fake sausage there was not a lot of chose to choose from in the morning for that matter lunch was not great either. The good was that you dont have to walk as far to get to the beach and it was nice. You can use any non motorized sports they have boogie boards paddle boats and other stuff. If you bring you laptop or something that has a wifi connection you dont have to pay extra for it. To sum this up the good did not out weight the bad. I would choose the Riu Palace Mexico hands down.

Reviews.Title: “If you have tried the rest try the Best”
Reviews.Author: GrumpyDerek
Reviews.Content: Visited the Riu Palace Riviera Mayo from 2 May 2011 for two weeks and two glorious weeks. WQe arrived at the airport on time and found that it takes time to get through with your case and every item is checked via X-Ray including hand luggage. You then will be asked questiuons and asked to press a button if a green light comes on you can continue out of ther airport, If it turns red then you have your luggage searched by hand. Be aware when leaving the airport there is on the left hand side a service counter with persons behind them they are not the Tour Reps the Reps are outside and will advise you which mode of transport you have. If travelling with thompson to this Hotel it is a Gold Hotel ans transfer is by Taxi. The hotel is approximately 1 Hour in a Taxi but the roads are great. On arrival at the Hotel the Bell man will take your cases and these are delivered to your room for you one you have booked in and put your room labels onto the cases.. The rooms are great and spacious. The only problem with the room is if your are British you finish up on the garden side of the hotel, If you are lucky you may get an end room and be able to see abit of the sea. THere is plenty of room around the beach and there are no umberellas but plenty of parmm trees to shelter if you need to the beavch is great, the water can be a bit rough on certain days and there can be a bit of a breeze stops you getting to hot but you can get burned be careful. There is a lobby bar which we used all the time in the evening and the barman is supperb you can get international drinks at the bars sometimes they run out of J & B. As for food we used the buffet there are restaurants which you can book at the loby bar during the day. This is a fantastic Hotel and worth the trip of 10 hours in a plane. I am a Riu Club member and have previously stayed at various Riu Hotels and this is one of the best. Enjoy it when you go let your hair down it is relaxing or you can go on trips if you want to.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: liverbirduk_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this fabulous hotel for two weeks and returned home on 18 june and are wishing we were back already. We loved every minute we were there.Everything about this hotel is first class.Dont believe any negative reports you read .We thought the buffet and the restaurants were superb our favourit was the Kristal,but we were quite happy to eat out of the buffet most evenings.The staff are really great always a smile whenever y see you.We loved the beach and the pool the entertainment staff work really hard.We took the trip to Tulum which was well worth seeing.We just cant give this hotel enough credit. We miss it already.We met lovely people from all over We miss you all, but most of all we miss the Mimosas.See you all next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Customer Service on a par with 7*Burj Al Arab,Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Mazzariene
Reviews.Content: Fabulous,Fabulous,Fabulous!! We stayed for 14 nights as my brother was getting married at the hotel. Here are all the points I would like to share with you: 1. Food - 5*- too much to choose from and catered for everyone, 2. Customer Service - 5* - extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. 3. Cleanliness - 5* - Cleaned and towels changed twice daily with a turn down service. 4. Beachfront - 5* - Lots of Comfy sunbeds, hammocks,shade ,white sandy beach and bright blue sea. Ping pong table and non- motorised motorsports. Padi diving school based here and did introduction lessons in the pool - good price for diving 12 metres and snorkling on a reef. Also did a fab trip to swim with the dolphins which was half the price the Thomson rep was offering! ( They offered lots more trips but we only did the one's I stated) 5.Rooms - 5* - Standard very spacious with Kingsize or twin and sofa/bed . Dressing area, spacious bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and shower over,, double sinks and very large mirror. Hairdryer was great and powerful (Did not use the one I had taken), Iron and ironing board which was useful. Optics for spirits and mini fridge which was filled daily with soft drinks and beer and a Coffee maker .24 hour room service is foc. Adequte balcony with two chairs and a table. Large flat screen tv with lots of american channels and BBC worldwide news service. Bedside radio alarm clock and spacious wardrobes with foc safe. Air conditioning and ceiling fan ( which were both on all day as it was very humid outside!) Note - We asked to change rooms as our STANDARD room was overlooking the air-conditioning from another hotel and this was noisy . Helpful staff changed us the next day from room 2010 to 2035. All standard rooms overlook the outside of the property ther next room grade is the same room but with veiws over the pool/sea.(My brother had one of these rooms.) The next grade is a duplex room with Jacuzzi on the balcony. 6. Restaurants 5*-There were around 5 other restaurants to choose from (reservations need but included in the all-inc price) our fav restaurant was Cristal which was elegant and served Gormet food ( we left the kids with the grandparents for the night who were also on this trip!) I can recommend Cristal but in my opinion the others were not as good as the main buffet restaurant although we did not try the Japanese restaurant. 7. Pool 3*- The only area which let down the holiday a little bit was the Pool. It was very large and had an adjoining 'infinity pool' which had seating to relax. There were also integral sunbeds in the pool and a swim up pool bar with seats at the bar and booth style seating and a couple of jacuzzi's. The pool was deepish ( upto my shoulders) and was the same depth throughout more shallow near the bar area so no diving anywhere. There wasn't a childrens end of the pool but there was a 'paddling pool' size baby pool within the kids club grounds ( not visable from the main pool area). I purchase a Konfidence swim jacket for my youngest son and we used it everyday until one day he said he didn't want to wear it and started to swim by himself ! He is only 5 Years old and he learnt to swim without any floats in Mexico! The pool on some days was quite cloudy and there was somtimes fruit from the cocktails floating around. I did complain about the pool cleanliness and the staff assured me they would look into it- it did look cleaner for the next few days but then it went back to how it was. I also noticed the pool area was only jetwashed daily and not scrubbed like most of the terraced areas surrounding the hotel. The wedding took place in the hotel grounds by the spa area ( fab treatments in the spa would reccomend!) It was a beautiful location over looking the gardens and sea. The wedding was at 5pm but the sun was still blazing down on us . I would recommend that you take your own music. All in all Great hotel which looks magnificent from the road and is the best by far Riu hotel in Riviera Maya /playa del Carmen and better than the Riu Mexico Palace . You can use all other Riu hotels in the area as Palace hotels have a gold wristband which will gains you entry to any of the Riu hotels. Have looked at them all but was glad to be able to go back to this hotel! WIFI AVAILABLE IN THE HOTEL LOBBY/RECEPTION AREA ONLY FOC.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and wish we were still there!”
Reviews.Author: ooreshoo
Reviews.Content: MY FAMILY AND I JUST RETURNED FROM A 4 NIGHT STAY AT THE RIU PALACE RM AND HAD AN ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL TIME. THE SERVICE, FOOD, AND ATTENTION TO DETAIL WERE IMPECCABLE. THE BEACH WAS IMPRESSIVELY CLEAN AND CRYSTAL CLEAR WITH AMPLE LOUNGE CHAIRS AND SPACE TO ENJOY THE SPECTACULAR VIEW! TIPS: - Book dinner reservations early as spots fill up very quickly. *Japanese was my favorite* - Specialty restaurants (Fusion/Japenese) require men to wear 'long pant's which does include jeans. There is no particular dress code for women. - An excursion to Chicten Itza and a ceynote are must do's! - Bring plenty of sunblock - Bring plenty of singles for tips/purchases as the reservation desk will not provide change

Reviews.Title: “Riu convert!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Pads7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in may. Food was amazing, pool and views were tremendous and you could not ask for better service especially round the pool. All staff were friendly and could not do enough to help! Location was really good and would definitely go back to this area. Hotel itself was beautiful! Never a problem getting a bed round the pool. Bedrooms were large and ok but to be honest little time is spent in them! Room service was also great! This was our first stay in a riu hotel and we loved it! Whilst I would not pay the price for this hotel again I will definitely go back to riu hotel and definitely go back to Mexico!!!!! This is not a hotel for a young couple on an evening which is what let it down for us as very quiet but we knew this before going, just didn't expect it to be so quiet!!!!! All in all it was a fab holiday and could not have asked for more from the staff!!!! I am now a riu fan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Great Location & Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Scrammy1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 12th trip to the Mayan Riviera & 2nd to a Riu resort. Stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico previously. We picked the Riviera Maya because you can easily walk, taxi or bicycle ( available for $5 at the Riu Tequila) into town, which we did 3 times during our week long stay. The beach is unsurpassed, plenty of lounge chairs directly on the sand or under the shade of the palm trees. I must add that the coconuts swaying in the breeze 20 feet above my head did make me a tad nervous. Chairs at the pool area are scarcer, but available as people come & go throughout the day. Enjoyed the daily hamburquesos barbequed on the beach near the pool. The drinks were flowing & the service friendly & quick throughout the grounds. The pool is warmer than I would have liked, not a very refreshing break from the sun & heat. The resort is very clean, with lush vegetation. The buffet is very nice, with a wide variety of culinary options, but it gets repetitive after awhile, as any buffet would. We enjoyed the steakhouse restaurant & especially liked Krystal, the fusion restaurant, where we dined the night of my wife's birthday. The rooms are spacious & we weren't really bothered by the firmness of the mattresses, as others have mentioned. The rooms smell a bit musty due to the humidity, but the room air freshener we brought, helped in that regard. The nightly entertainment was okay, slightly better than a high school production, but still entertaining & energetic. We have previously stayed at the Royal Hideaway & Valentin Imperial Maya, which, on balance we thought were a step above the Riu, but there are differences. The Royal Hideaway is dramatically more expensive & the Valentin is 20 minutes from town by taxi. Also. if you want a day of adventure, sign up for the Extreme Snorkeling package. We swam with sea turtles, rappelled 70 feet, rode zip lines through the jungle & snorkeled in underground cenotes. Whew!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Shabooboo
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first trip to Mexico,where a warm welcome was waiting. This hotel was excellent, the staff were so friendly and helpful,a really good mixture of restaurants to choose from with excellent food, the main buffet style restaurant was also an absolute pleasure. This has been one of the most relaxing holidays in many years, met some lovely people, weather was fabulous too. Mexico and in particular this hotel highly recommended if you are looking for a quality break away in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation and great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Noellcakes
Reviews.Content: I went to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya October 6-14, 2010. I went with my sister-in-law, who was the maid of honor in her best friends wedding, and she asked me to go with her as her “plus one.” We booked through AAA Travel Impressions and everything was taken care of prior to our departure. Transportation from airport to resort was arranged so we didn’t have to worry about paying for a cab. Lobby: The resort is breathtaking from the moment you walk into the lobby. The lobby is huge, with very extravagant chandeliers hanging in three different places. The front desk is off to the right, with the gift shop to the left, and the lobby bar directly ahead. Guest rooms also are on each end, past the desk and gift shop. Rooms: We booked just a standard room, but it was very large and spacious. Big closet with plenty of room for all of our clothes. Two queen beds in the bedroom area. A living room area with a couch and tv. Sliding doors out onto a balcony with a garden view. The bathroom was big, with nice sized tub/shower and comfortable vanity and sinks. There was also a mini-bar that was stocked with vodka, whiskey, brandy, and rum, and in the mini-fridge beer, Cola, Sprite, and bottled water. Pools: two pools - one huge main pool and a smaller infinity pool. The main pool is great, large enough for a water volleyball net and plenty of room for relaxing. There are lounges built right into the water. The swim-up bar is also wonderful. The bartenders are friendly and personable. There are also booths built right into the pool in the bar area, also whirlpools. We took a deck of waterproof cards to play with while in the booths in the bar area. In addition to the swim-up bar, there were waiters running around the whole time, asking people if they needed new drinks while they were lounging in the chairs around the pool, at the booths or under an umbrella in the shade. Beach: picturesque. It honestly felt like I walked into a postcard. Beautiful blue water and soft white sand. There’s not much to say about the beach because it was wonderful with lots of lounge chairs. Food: There was never short supply of food! For breakfast, everyday we ate at the buffet. The selection was large, with something for everyone. Eggs, pancakes, waffles, made-to-order omelets, fruit, cereals, meats, cheeses, breads. For lunch everyday, we ate at the poolside/beach buffet. The selection there was good, salads, pizza, burgers, desserts, fries, chicken, fruits, veggies. I must say that the Riu had a decent selection of food, however there was a lot of “American” food at the buffets, which was a slight disappointment as I expecting some more authentic Mexican dishes. Dinner we ate at different restaurants each night. All were nice, but we had to have reservations at the a la carte restaurants. The Mexican restaurant was great, and we really loved the Brazilian restaurant. There was entertainment throughout the days and into the evenings. Everything from yoga on the beach, target shooting, archery, water aerobics in the daytime, swimsuit fashion shows, dance contests, in the afternoons, and every evening there was a show, ranging from Michael Jackson tribute, Grease, game shows, Vegas show, Mexican dances. One night, before the Vegas show, they had a makeshift casino set up. Each room started with so many points to gamble with, and whatever room ended up with the most points won a prize. My sister-in-law and I came in first place! We won a free massage from the spa! We loved the sports bar at the end of the lobby. Victor the bartender really showed us a good time and made us some fantastic drinks. This bar is also open 24 hours. Room service available for free with a limited menu. The only bad thing about the hotel is that we had some problems with our lock on the door. The battery in the key-card reader kept shorting out and our keys wouldn’t work sometimes, locking us out of our rooms. We would go to the front desk and they sent maintenance to fix the problem. This actually happened to us about three or four times during our week at the resort. Another bad thing was that Hurricane Paula came blowing through during our stay. While it was not Riu’s fault, it was definitely an inconvenience. Our flight home was scheduled for Wednesday, which was cancelled and we were not able to get another flight until Saturday. I had to call off work for an extra two days, and for the extra three night stay, the charge was an additional $600. At first we were shocked and thought it was an astronomical amount, but once we broke it down, it was split between the two of us, so it was $300 each, and then for it to be three days, only $100 per day/night, and it included all of our meals and drinks, etc, so it really wasn’t TOO bad. Once the hurricane finally hit, it ended up only being a storm. The rest of the weather was awesome for the remainder of our extra days, sunny and gorgeous. All in all, it was a good vacation and I would definitely return to this resort in the future and I would feel confident in referring other people to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best food of three Palaces stayed in over the last 8 months”
Reviews.Author: BCBERN
Reviews.Content: Travelled with spouse and another couple. Trip booked at the last moment so booked Monday and travelled Wednesday. I am coming to look for RIU Palaces almost exclusively when scanning for holiday opportunities. They all have their particular charm. Palace Pacifico seemed to have the best staff, Palace Cabo had the best views and lobby bar. The Palace Riviera Maya had the best food. First time I have experienced beef wellington in a buffet. It was declicious. Many hotels charge extra for lobster but at the Riviera Maya one night it was "have as much as you like" and my friend had three. Did the steakhouse for one evening. Service there was great and they do a bit of an act with the "baked alaska" which sees one waiter standing over another and creating a cascading falls of burning rum. Quite spectacular. One warning - if you order the rib eye make sure you have lots of appetite. None of my three companions was able to finish theirs. A true platter full. Ate most breakfasts and dinners outside the buffet on the patio. Found the service there to be quite attentive. Also found the front desk staff to be very helpful. The location of this hotel works great for me since I am a "walker" and was able to go into Playa Del Carment during the day and up to the other RIU's in the evening. All in all a very pleasant experience. Think I will try the other Palace next time just to vary the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ashken5555
Reviews.Content: We had another wonderful stay at another Riu Property. This was our third stay and again, we were very impressed. The food was the best we've had at a Riu property, as well as the beach. If you're heading there, say hello to Victor in the Sports Bar! One thing that we weren't as happy with was the elevator. We stayed at the end of one side, and the elevator was at the very beginning. We never walked so many stairs in our life! Oh well, it was good for us! The room was spotless and we loved the safes with the numbered keypads so we didn't have to carry a key. We also loved the drinks! The walk to Playa del Carmen was so easy and wonderful, as well as getting on the ferry. There's also tons of homes surrounding the hotel, which are so pretty to look at as you walk! If you don't mind walking, as for a 2nd or 3rd floor room towards the beach, and you won't be disappointed. We didn't see any bugs besides ants on the patio. The reservation process may be a little inconvenient, but it's also quick and easy. Hit up Krystal Restaurant, if only for the Chocolate Coulant. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love the Riu!!”
Reviews.Author: shannun711
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were there for one week. It was simply amazing, I would recommend this resort to anyone and everyone. The service was crazy good and the food was delicious. They only thing I'd do different is schedule private transportation. I would have cost us $100 extra....we should have done it! The Riu Palace Riviera Maya rocks.

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tanyatNottingham
Reviews.Content: We tavelled to mexico for the first time from 11th - 25 th May after researching hotels we booked Rui Palace Riviera Maya and so glad we did. The hotel on arrival had the wow factor, it was spotlessly clean and the staff so friendly. We were greeted with a friut juice on arrival and had our cases taken to our room which was also lovely and comfortable. The weather was great for the whole two weeks. We managed to get beds around the pools and also spent days on the beach which was a bit cooler due to the wind from the sea. The food was to die for, we ate in the buffet resturant most day with lots of chioce, the food was cooked to perfection and always hot. We booked to eat in the staek house Chillis which was a great again the food cooked to perfection we enjoyed this and booked it again another night. The opening of the buffet resturant was 6.30pm and the director opened this and welcomed quests in with a speech which was also special and something we had not seen before. We have stayed in many 5 * hotels including Thomsons sensatori but this was truely amazing from the service to the food and staff. We are already booking to come again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Mayan is better than yours!”
Reviews.Author: DaithiG
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back home last Thursday and I've been waiting for the jet-lag to wear off before I write this review. In a word this hotel is 'wonderful'. If I was forced to add more words.......... well, there have already been a lot of words used on this site to describe the hotel and it facilities so I'll stick with 'wonderful'. If I was forced to find a negitive then the water in the Pool was way too warm and the debris (Drinking straws & fruit slices) from the pool bar was a bit off-putting. I understand the sun is beating down on the water all day, but if they filtrate the pool properly, this should help cool and clean the water. If I'm in a hot climate I find myself more of a beach & sea kinda person, so the pool would not my 1st choice. And the times I did try it I wasn't a fan. All I would add is if you are EUROPEAN you may find ignoring all the negative comments from the US reviewers helps. If it isn't LIKE AMERICA, they don't like it! TOP TIPs - If going out for a day trip try Coba, Acumal bay & Tulum. We used the local 'Collectivo' to visit Acumal & Tulum and it only cost us $12 for the two of us to and from the front of Playacar. A saving of around $80-120 if you use a paid-for-tour or local taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon week”
Reviews.Author: baretta_2011
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't go back. with all the talk of how great the Riu was, we were sorely disappointed. we came from the barcelo palace and that hotel was much nicer. the Riu was a very small resort with only a couple bars. the food and drinks were good, but that was about it. the room is very outdated and the room has a bathtub with shower, unlike the separate shower stall of classier places. the rooms were also outdated with mold on the ceilings. due to the layout, sound carries very well and essentially the hotel is laid out like 2 big sound tunnels with all the rooms attached, you can hear every door close and all the outside work. the pool (singular) is very small and was cramped. the only saving grace was the the restaurants are nice and the food and beach were good. i wouldn't recommend this place to anyone expecting a 5 star hotel. one plus is that the hotel is only minutes away from play del carmen....7 bucks for a one way cab ride.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful Riu vacation”
Reviews.Author: swimer7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were there for a week May 20-27. We have stayed at two other Riu resorts in Playa and this was again a wonderful vacation. We arrived before check in time and simply put on our suits and went to the pool and then walked down the beach. We ate lunch and came back to the front desk and were told we could check in then but would have a room with two double beds. We ask for a king and were nicely informed that if we would wait another hour they could accomodate us. OK let me see....spend another hour in the pool or on the beach....no brainer. We came back in an hour and had a great room near the pool facing the court yard. The room was great! We ate the buffet that night and it was more than adequate. I usually can find something I like. Every other night we ate at a sit down restaraunt. Our favorites were the Japanese and the Steak house. Service and food were outstanding. We watched many weddings while we were there and maybe will someday come back and renew our vows at this hotel. My only real advise is take lots of sunscreen as it is very expensive in Playa ($25-$30 US) We ran out on day six.

Reviews.Title: “very nice for couples and families”
Reviews.Author: julestravels2
Reviews.Content: Since there have been lots of reviews I'll stick to our high/lowlights. It'll still probably be too long but I hope it helps: FOOD - We ate at all the a la carte restaurants except Brazilian, and they were not five star but still pretty good. Definitely worth a shot, especially since it's your chance to try things you might not have had before at no extra cost. It's not always easy to plan ahead but always make reservations as far ahead as you can- they WILL be booked by the day of, if not sooner. -breakfast buffet was better than lunch. For lunch, stick to the burgers grilled on the beach. SERVICE - rooms and beds were comfortable and very well cleaned. Maintenance was responsive to our one plumbing issue - Mini Bar guy does not know the meaning of "do not disturb", even though it was on the door tag in 6 languages. Other than that, the personnel were excellent! always a "Hello my friend" or "Good morning", from everyone without exception. They offered to help with luggage, doors, everything. - We got the same excellent service whether the staff knew we were good tippers or not. Sometimes we tipped in advance, other times after, and it made no difference. however, don't expect the bars or front desk to provide you change to tip with. bring LOTS of singles and fives. ENVIRONMENT - Yes, there's a musty smell, and the closer you get to the lobby the stronger it is. we brought a few candles and dryer sheets and our room smelled great! - We got a little creeped out by the comments we read about cockroaches so we plugged the drains, blocked the door with a towel overnight, and left the bathroom light on. I'm sure it was overkill but we didn't have any problem and we were right next door to Chili's. The people across the hall apparently didn't read this page and left their room service dishes outside their door. We did see one of the notorious frog-size roaches on their plate, dead or passed out from eating the crumbs, but again it was in an outdoor hallway. The next night, I moved their dishes well away from our door. YUCK! POOL - The person below who just moved someone's stuff off the loungers does not speak for everyone. Everybody else was polite and there were plenty of chairs around the pool for whoever wanted one. - I have no kids and my holidays are relaxing time for me. I was hesitant to stay at a non-adults-only resort but was very pleasantly surprised. All the kids there who were old enough to swim alone were very well behaved. I was sitting in the pool right among them, and had no issues at all! I hate to admit it but I think it was because the American kids I am used to were in school and the kids there were from England and Australia. - Several people commented on the lack of a kids' pool. The shallow area around the in-water loungers were the only place for babies to play, which is how I ended up hanging out with the little ones. There's a tiny kids club pool but it's too small and isolated to be of use.

Reviews.Title: “BEST WEEK OF MY LIFE”
Reviews.Author: cristalsommers
Reviews.Content: May 21 to 28.. 16 adults and 1 child staied at the Riu Palace .... It was our wedding and let me tell you that it was amazing.. Nancy the wedding corrdinator filled all my expectations and took the worries away .... My guests also had a wonderful fun filled week by enjoying the food and tropial drinks ... All the free water sports were used daily and the sail boat was the number one choice... I could go on forever but i wont ... FOOD 9/10 for all inclusive resorts POOLS 9/10 BEACH 10/10 RIU PALACE LOBBY 10/10 ROOMS 8/10 SERVICE 9/10 WEDDING 10/10 Enjoy and dont worry about the small things . Your on Vacation!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “FOOD WAS AWEFUL”
Reviews.Author: roxi3232
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Riu from May 18th-24th. I would like to begin by saying that this is not a 5 star hotel. Lets begin from the service at this hotel. The service was good, easy check in, front desk was always helpful and always smiling. Sleep quaility, if you want to get any dang sleep, DONT STAY HERE! Doors slaming right and left you can hear people walking in the hall ways, just aweful! The hallways are not at all welcoming while walking to your room, you feel like your at a morgue. Dark, doesn't feel islandy. Cleanliness,the grounds are beautiful and well maintained the staff does a pretty good job keeping up with this large resort. Food, must I go here? Wow, the food was just a joke, me and my husband could not get off the toilet for a week. The buffet in the courtyard area is okay and the Krystal restaurant was better then the others. Everything was either tasteless or cold (ravioli for example) bread was never fresh, there was rotten taste stuck to everything...GROSS! Oh and the deserts are disgusting let me not forget to mention that! Room service is no good, they have like 3 things on the menu, your better off going to the sports bar and picking up a few things from the fride. Drinks, EVERY GLASS OF ALCOHOL I HAD WAS WATERED DOWN!!!! DISCUSTING!!! I wanted to vomit, your paying top dollar for your vacation and I cant even get a buzz, are you for real? Room service was also not so good. I noticed if you have towels laying around they will roll it up and put it back as if its clear. I couldnt believe that. I tipped everyone, I mean everone and I get that kind of service? Grounds are pretty, beach was beautiful (but I got bit by a jellyfish, its mating season), staff is friendly, lots of beach chairs, great location and a really safe town!!! Other then that everything was bad,do yourself a favor and go somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we imagined! Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Flymeaway80
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous to travel to Mexico but we have to say that we never felt that we were in harms way or in a dangerous situation at all. This hotel is so secure. It is located in "Playacar" which is gate controlled. Also, the hotel itself monitors all traffic and does not allow anyone to be dropped off or enter without verifying that they are guests at the hotel. Our room was as pictured and described. We were a little nervous that our room would be noisy because we were fairly close to the theater. We could hear the music but it never played very late at all. The hotel, when we mentioned our concern, offered to move us to a different room. Not only did they move us....they put us in an ocean view suite with a bigger balcony which faced the ocean. No charge! It was wonderful! We loved our entire stay. We decided the later seating for dinner was better overall. Not sure why but the food seemed better. The beach is amazing and the pool is divine. It was very warm and humid but comfortable by the pool and on the beach. They kept our fridge full of bottled water, pepsi, pepsi light, orange fanta and some kind of beer. (we do not drink alcohol) Taxi ride costs $7 each way over to the shopping area. Lomas travel was available in the lobby everyday and that is who we booked our excursions through. Maybe paid a little more for excursions but liked the peace of mind knowing who was picking us up! Very nice place and very reasonable pricing. Staff was wonderful. Will definitely go again ASAP!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation at Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Chicagotraveler42
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu Riviera Maya - Don't hesitate to stay at this beautiful and immaculate resort. We booked through Apple vacation and it was seamless from start to finish no problems, great flight, great transportation to resort, and wonderful room. (Yes the beds are firm but no big deal) The room is stocked with a fridge full of beer, soda and water; vodka, gin, tequila are also provided. Took my 85 year old mom we stayed on the first floor, and she loved it. (not to difficult for her to get around – and she walked the beach every day) They wash the halls, patio and walk to the beach 3 times a day the grounds / rooms are impeccable and clean. They have 5 great restaurants (we really enjoyed the steak house – beautiful baked Alaska presentation, and the Krystal(creative fusion restaurant – high end – also included), with a wonderful variety of food and EXCELLENT SERVICE at all the restaurants, drinks are plentiful and well done and ALL INCLUDED. The beach is FANTASTIC - it's wide, deep and clean with a section for shade and hammocks, and beach loungers, as well as a huge pool. Security is outstanding. You can take a cab for $7 into town from the hotel to walk near a port town where there is a beautiful high end shopping mall which ends at 5th avenue for a mile of more authentic affordable shops interspersed with gelato, pizza, coffee, bars and restaurants. The town is fairly new and progressive. You can take a ferry over to Cozumel from 5th Avenue as well. The resort is set up very well, the nightly music in the plaza each night from 8-10 was lovely, there is a “Show” every night at 10p in the theatre with cocktail service. We can’t say enough about the amazing staff who go out of their way to make you happy. Bring your compputer for free wifi in the lobbly! Thank you to all who work there for an amazing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: vickilaplante
Reviews.Content: We've never travelled outside the states before & it was amazing! The hotel staff were all very polite & helpful! Everything was immaculate (we saw people cleaning all the time), every day we had a new towel animal waiting in our room, (which I loved!). The beach was so awesome (we even parasailed, it was amazing!). All the pools were well kept & never had a problem getting service! Would go back in a heartbeat! The food was also amazing. Fresh pico & guacomle everyday!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO HERE..(UNLESS I CAN COME TOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!) BRILLIANT HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: BrightonBoxer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous two weeks at the Riu Palace, booked for our tenth wedding anniversary after stopping at the hotel on our way to airport last year as it looked so nice!! Originally allocated a smaller room with tiny balcony on top floor, but reception changed for us immediately with no problem. The room itself was very comfortable I normally struggle to sleep on holiday but the bed was really comfortable, no dampness in room as described in other reviews, but this could be down to the air con as had this at a previous hotel we used both air con and the fan to keep the room really fresh! The Thomson Rep Emma was excellent even sending us a card on our anniversary and sending us notes after our excursions to make sure we had a good time, food was great in all a la carte restuarants had our anniversary in Krystal and the table was decorated beautifully, the beach is fantastic as was the infinity pool and the bars are all well stocked and the staff in the bars especially Victor in the Sports Bar were second to none, the place is spotlessly clean (apart from the odd bit of sun lotion residue in the main pool) but we avoided the main pool as most of the swim up bar residents (mostly loud Americans) sat there all day without leaving their seats to answer the call of nature, so decided to swerve that!! Trip wise Xplor, Tulum & Xel Ha were amazing, however the highlight was the Whale Shark swim (however don't buy this from your rep or Scuba Caribe by the pool as we got this for half their prices from the tour stall in Playa Plaza 300 mts to the left of the hotel. Last year we did the Coba Mayan Village and the Jungle speedboat tours these are great too The gym could do with some more updated equipment but it served its purpose. Definitely go int o Playacar and also take time to look round the Mayan ruins which lie 300 mts to the right og the hotel and there are some more just before Playa Del Carmen All in all a fantastic holiday and a place I'd go back to in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure it's a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Karenscruises
Reviews.Content: Boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nts beginning the 14th until the 18th after staying for 4 nts at the RIU Cancun beginning 5/10-14. Overall I'd say this is a very good property but not sure it's for us. Here are my thoughts: SERVICE---Some areas excellent, some could use improvement. The service in the courtyard area at night was pretty slow. Requested a Dirty Martini w/specific instructions on type of liquor and olives....had to get the head waiter to get it right on the 4th attempt. All waitstaff in the restaurants, top notch. Did not have any beach service at all and very little at the pool--only when stopped someone as they walked by...no one came by and offered to take an order. This was a big difference between RIU Cun and RPRM b/c at Cancun, we were constantly brought drinks to the beach as well as the pool area--and no did not tip any extra at either place. Benjamin on the front desk was very professional and courteous. Big thank you to him for our gorgeous room. FOOD---Very good...especially the Mexican restaurant. Kudos to Rene!! Thanks for the laughs. Also Chili's, the Steak House, was very very good. Baked Alaska excellent. Head waiter excellent and very professional. CLEANLINESS---Our room was great. Loved the towel animals and special touches. Would have liked to have more than 2 bath towels but housekeeping brought extra immediately when requested. Courtyard, sidewalks and hallways were constantly being cleaned. Pool area not so great. Water was dingy and noticed serveral tiles missing from wall of pool were the tables were. Swim up Bar area had staws in it and alot of sand on floor. LOCATION---Really liked the Playacar area. Definitely would recommend this area and would return. 5th Ave awesome. ENTERTAINMENT---Altho we were very impressed w/the stage shows, it looked as if there were a few nights that would have been good shows later in the week. The singers and bands in the gazebo and courtyard area were good but definitely not my style. Not alot to do after dinner. Overall, Great property and had a good time! Suggestions....would be nice to have bicycles to rent to go to 5th Ave and sightseeing. Also property very spread out. Could use another elevator in addition to the one near the lobby. I think RPRM is a beautiful property and perfect for an older crowd. Not many singles here at all. A few families but mostly couples 55 +.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday Ever!”
Reviews.Author: sansat
Reviews.Content: My Husband,Son and I Travelled to this Hotel May 7th to the 21st. We decided this year that we wanted two weeks to spend enjoying the sun and sand... Soooo glad!! I'm amazed at any of the negative reviews. From the time we checked in ,it was first class all the way! The staff was wonderful! Vanesa at the front desk,gave us a room with a Beautiful courtyard view. The beach is one of the nicest we've seen. The pool is Huge and there is always a volleyball game happening in it. The food was delicious, especially at the Krystal restaurant (you must try the ravioli as their starter).. We have stayed at Three other Riu Hotels, and this has been our favourite! Don't listen to the bad reviews...We have high standards, but it would be hard to find much to complain about here....Sandy from Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Good but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: paullynsk
Reviews.Content: Great service at check in,room clean and spacious,well stocked fridge and optics(didn't get re-filled for 3 days informed reception sorted in 10 minutes).Tried all the restaurants,mexican and japanesse were our favourites,try a saki bomb the girls in the japanesse restaurants are good for a laugh,the buffet is great for breakfast,salads,sweets had a couple of cold meals where they had run out of certain selections.Pool and beach area are of a 5 star quality,drinks service around the pool superb,not very good on the beach and in that heat it is certainly needed.Entertainment,days and evening not so good same thing every day at the same time,evening shows very limited,dancing to taped music,but the Micheal Jackson show is worth a look.Visited 5th avenue 4 times ,taxi once,walked the other times only a 15 minute walk,the 2nd visit there were 8 police open backed trucks carrying masked machine gun police officers with lights flashing and sirens blaring quite scary,but we were told that this was a show of strength from the police and happens quite often,on 5th avenue i was quite openly offered drugs on 2 occasions,but don't let this put you off,it really is worth a visit and we did feel safe or we wouldn't of walked back and repeat our visits.Most of the staff were really fantastic,i tipped the maid daily and we got fresh towels twice a day and turn down service most nights with the flowers and petals and towel animals.i also tipped in the restaurants where service was 2nd to none and the drinks waiters who were very good once they'd got a tip,if you hadn't tipped any of the barmen you could wait quite a while for a drink which was very noticable and poor service.I like to visit the gym early on holiday to burn off the extra calories but here the gym is the worst i have seen,very old kit and no cold water,but some nice runs on the beach and on the path's around the other hotels if your that way inclinded on holiday.Lastly when we went to Thomsons to change our money we were told that Mexico only dealt in Peso not Dollars,everything in hotels and shops is marked up in Dollars and taxi drivers quote prices in Dollars,I had several Peso left and tried to buy duty free on our Thomson flight from Thomson cabin crew only to be told that they don't accept Peso,watch out for the con,the exchange rate on Peso isn't very good well done Thomson is anyone available to explain.P.S. does anyone know anything about the loser who set the fire alarm off .

Reviews.Title: “Third visit to Riu Palace Mexico and Riv Maya”
Reviews.Author: affordabletrips
Reviews.Content: Both the Riu Palalce MX and Riv Maya are very close to the same properties. The Riu P Riv Maya is the newer of the two but almost mirrored. Both have large beach areas covered with palm trees. THe beds are hard but not unsleepable anymore. Service was really good. Pools are large and have swim up bars. Grounds are beautiful. Rooms are all at least jr suites. Love the suite and its big closet and big bathroom. It also has a bigger living area than the jr suite. This is really nice if you are staying for a week or more. I am a travel agent and feel very good to send my clients here. The food is great and dont mind just eating at the buffet with all the cooking stations and choices. Room service is included and was fast. Would stay here again and going back in 3 weeks! You can use the night club at the other Riu if you want dancing. They do have nightly entertainment at the hotel but not dancing. THe sports bar was fun and has a frig filled with food if you want to take something on an excursion or pick up for your room. You have a frig in the room with a liquor dispenser and the frig is filled every 2 days. Wireless is available in the lobby and saw some computers in the sports bar. The place is beautiful! My suggestion is to go! I would say the RIu Palace MX has the best place for a wedding with the stairway going to the courtyard! Its a great place for weddings!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous yet again!”
Reviews.Author: wildwindcollies
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya - our second stay at this hotel, our 7th at a Riu property-this hotel is still our favorite. The beach is beautiful, the service is FABULOUS, the food is good and plentiful, as are the drinks. The rooms are lovely with plenty of room, considering the amount of time we spend in a room! I still think the "damp smell" folks notice have got to be the tropical climate-we live in VERY arid Colorado and the dampness doesn't bother us, we expect it. We saw positively no bugs-OH WAIT! We saw a flying ant on the patio. They clean and clean and clean all the time. Our son, daughter in law and 3 year old grandson came this time-they were very pleased as well. The 3 year old had fun, I don't know if there is a lot to do for older kids.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - Not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: debbie7205
Reviews.Content: The service and friendliness of the staff was excellent. The cleaniness of the rooms could be improved but the biggest issue was the dampness. The beds felt damp, the plastic cover under your sheet didn't help! The kind a child has for any little accidents. The extent of the dampness was really noticeable upon our return home, It took 2 hot washes to remove the damp stench from our clothes. Horrid. The food in the buffet restuarant had a good choice. However the La a Carte menu's were disappointing and not authentic. Jacket potatoes in a Mexican restuarant? Location was great, directly on the beach but be aware you cannot always swim in the sea, strong currents. The hotel was more comparable to a good 3 star hotel, with 4 star service. Save a few extra pennies, shop around and get the same price to go to the Maldives.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach once again and no bugs!”
Reviews.Author: destination_junkie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for one week and was happy once again with this hotel. I have stayed 6 times previously and while the beach was washed pretty much away a few years back due to the hurricane I am happy to say that it is back! The weather was great and while the resort was busier than last year everything remained on par. The food was good, nothing that a foodie would write home about but it was plentiful and did the job needed. There is top shelf liquor however you need to request it when having your drinks made. If you don't then you will get the lower quality liquor. I was quite surprised that more people were not tipping the staff. I have always tipped a few dollars for wait staff at breakfast, lunch and dinner and especially for the cleaning staff as they work so hard and such long hours! I know that some people have reported that there were cockroaches at the resort but we did not see any, no bugs at all in fact, and never have in the past either. The one recommendation that I have is bring a few extra beach towels from home as the pool towels never fully cover up the chairs. Also not a lot of people knew about the little stretch of stores and shops down the road beside the Riu Tequila. It is within walking distance and I prefer it over 5th Ave down in Playa Del Carmen. The pearl store always has some pretty stuff and you can negotiate your prices at pretty much every store. Overall it's a good resort without breaking the bank!

Reviews.Title: “Perefct wedding & holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Shevz
Reviews.Content: On May 3rd 2011, my fiancé and I flew with 17 of our nearest and dearest to Cancun (a few more met us later). From Cancun airport we were taken to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. When we approached the area of PlayaCar, we were blown away by the other hotels and areas. As one of our friends said "OMG look at that hotel it's amazing!!" we drove into the drive of the Riu and couldn’t believe this was where we were staying. Going inside you are immediately taken in by the welcoming smiles and glistening chandeliers. Getting checked in was easy. My fiancé and I didn’t like our rooms view so I asked reception for an upgrade and got room 2111 with a great view of the gardens. This room did smell a little damp but it had no affect on our enjoyment of the holiday. We visited a few other people's rooms and theirs smelt fine. The beds were absolutely fine. Seeing complaints that they were too firm is ridiculous! Despite a damp smell and "firmness" I slept like a baby for 10 nights no problems! The rooms were cleaned every day of course and many times I left my Tiffany necklace on the side and it would still be there when I got back, so that's a good point. The sports bar was great! only at night though and only if Victor is working! lol. With his friendliness and eagerness to get you wasted, you will be stumbling out of the sports bar at 3am filled with cocktail shots! The restaurants were great! The buffet one is perfect for breakfast and dinner and the Japanese restaurant was great too. The pool was warm and the staff were great getting you drinks. On the odd occasion you might even get the pizza man from Chili’s coming round with fresh slices for you to nibble on. We also had the pleasure of having a BBQ on the beach which was great with a side of salsa lessons! On May 9th....My fiancé and I got married!!! We wed at 3pm at the gazebo and it was the most beautiful day of our lives. Nancy our wedding co-coordinator did everything we asked of her and our day was perfect. The reception table was apparently a little dross before we arrived so my maid of honor and best man tidied it up a bit. so if you choose to get married here, have someone on hand to have a quick look at the table layout. We had our reception at Chili’s and the food was great! we had a private section and the waiters kept the champagne flowing! Our cake was wonderful too. Vanilla cake with strawberry filling and white icing. The only downside with the reception was that dinner was at 18:45 and we had to be out by 20:30. So speeches and gift giving we had to wrap up pretty quickly. But again, no negative effect on our day what so ever! On our last night in Mexico a few of us went to Coco Bongos in Playa Del Carmen and let me tell you that this is an experience not to be missed!!! I can’t say whether my mum or nan would enjoy it but for us youngsters is was AMAZING!!!! Ladies if you go to Coco Bongos wear a tight dress at least thigh length. WARNING: If you wear a light flowy short dress and dance on the bar like some girls did, air will be blown up your dress and everyone will get a look at your private bits! But again such an amazing experience! You have no idea where to look!! There's so much going on!! Balloons falling from the ceiling, paper blown, bubbles floating, The Mask, Chicago, Usher, MJ! The list goes on!!! Anyway, I'm veering off! Look, if you are easily pleased at a fabulous hotel in a fabulous country with a fabulous beach and plenty of things to do, this is the place!! If you are used to la de da quiet, boring 8 star hotels, don't bother. Anyone who has written a bad review on this place has no bloody idea what roughing it is! They don't call it a palace for no reason!!! I will definitely be going back next year!! and all our wedding guests said they will be joining us back at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for our vow renewal in 10 years time! lol.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Overall - Excellent service!!”
Reviews.Author: eloan81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one week and it was our first time to Playa Del Carmen, overall we had a great stay, the best part was the service and location to the beach and Playa Del Carmen, the area Playacar is great!! Best parts: The lobby and grounds were beautiful. The service was outstanding and I work for the Four Seasons, so I know what good service should be. The location was great, within 15 minute walk or 5 minute cab ride into Playa, I would recommend walking along the road into Playa rather than the beach, as you can see some Mayan ruins and Iguanas along the way, and it's easier and quicker than the beach route. Krystal and Agave a la cartes were very good, with great service and ambiance. Skip the Brazilian and Japanese. The worst parts: The main pool was dirty, with drinks straws floating in the water and cloudy-looking water. The pool bar smelled sour and musty every day. The upper infinity pool was much better, alot cleaner!! The power went out at least 3 times during our stay, and once my partner was in the shower and even the water turned off, apparently this happened in the area and was not just the hotel, but was frustrating. Tip: set your cell phone alarm instead of the alarm clock in the room, as the power will most likely go off during your stay. Overall a great stay, awesome service and beautiful hotel. We would rate this hotel an 8/10, but we're going to stay at another resort next time as we want to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with my friends”
Reviews.Author: king_jimmy0
Reviews.Content: Spent on week on the property with a group of friends, had a great time. Grounds, room, common areas were spotless. Food and drink varied by day and preparer but overall delicious. We can't wait to go back. And to the brunette in the Mexican restaurant - you're beautiful! Loved that bronco tattoo! Get back to me!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations EVER”
Reviews.Author: ms_dulce
Reviews.Content: I traveled from April 26-May 3, 2011. Myself and 19 other people, traveled to this resort for my wedding. There is not one thing I would change from my stay. The staff, property, food, drinks...everything was awesome. All of my guests were so impressed with everything. I enjoyed the resort so much, that by the end of the stay, I realized i never made it into town for shopping, sightseeing or anything! I needed another week!! Neither myself, nor any of my guests saw any cockroaches and we were all in different areas of the hotel. Once we got home, my husband literally wanted me to look into booking a trip back immediately :)

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel and Holiday”
Reviews.Author: EssexDiver
Reviews.Content: We have just returned after 11nights at the Riu Palace, and we cannot fault any aspect of the Hotel or Thomson our Travel Agents. The hotel decor is not over the top, the air conditioned public areas were calm and serene, the bedroom big enough and had everything we could possibly wish for. The animation team were wonderful. The music was not too loud, unlike some of the other Mexican hotels we have visited, and the staff friendly and courteous. Everyone we came into contact with was so helpful. The food was great, we tried all the restaurants and no matter what your taste in food, there is something for everyone. The temperature of the pools was wonderful and considering the money it cost for the vacation, we were more than satisfied. We met wonderful friendly people from all over and we loved every moment of our holiday. There is absolutely nothing to complain about, we assure you and we have stayed in 5 star hotels for years, including the 7 star Burj al Arab in Dubai. Well done, Riu Palace. 10 out of 10 for this holiday.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Bobcebob
Reviews.Content: Room was good, beach great, food ok, gym worst I have ever seen. service very good. Great place for older couples, not for singles. Very quiet, good thing playa de carmen is very near. Old . I will not return

Reviews.Title: “Third time still the charm!”
Reviews.Author: kashaFlorida
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying at RPRM and once again it was the best! The service once again was the best. All our friends from the last 2 times were there to serve us again and they came through! Thanks to Santos, Chano, Victor, and Alex! We stayed once again in the jacuzzi suite. E-mailed the hotel prior to arriving and was given the same room number as years past. Also was sent up choc. covered strawberries and bottle of champagne. A couple nights after that a small gift of 2 shot glasses in a holder. This time we ate at the Mexican and Chilli's resturants. You can e-mail prior to arrival and make 2 reservations for the ala cartes. These people do work hard to make your vacation, so please do tip them even though it is all included. They will make you feel like kings and queens! Can't wait til our next trip back! If you have any questions feel free to e-mail

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach - Great for Swimming”
Reviews.Author: sunandbeachSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: 2 couples in their mid-30’s, stayed at RIU Palace Riviera Maya April 30-May 7. This was our 6 time to the Riviera Maya area and we stay at a different hotel each year. Overall we enjoyed our stay and didn’t have any major complaints. Arrived around 5 PM in the evening, check-in was fast, and based on reviews I read over the last several months, I requested a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor and near the end/beach – to hopefully avoid any bug issue and echoing hallway noise. We got rooms 2031 and 2027 - on the 3rd floor, in the middle building. We were both happy with our rooms. Both of our rooms were very clean, never saw a bug and didn’t experience loud echoing noise from the hallway. Our room location was central to the lobby and the beach. Never more than a 5 minute walk to anything – lobby, restaurants or pool. We got a different towel art almost every day in our room – although we did leave tips here and there. Also received turned down service the 1st 2 nights, but not after that. The air conditioning could have been a little cooler in the rooms. This place is located on an AMAZINGLY BEAUTIFUL beach! The beach is our #1 priority when choosing a hotel and this place meet our expectations! The waters have several shades of turquoise water, sandy soft white beach with plenty of chairs either in the shade or sun. The water was perfect for swimming in for hours if you wanted – not too rough, not very deep, sandy bottom, no rocks no seaweed. The beach did have shells washed up on shore so you did have to watch your step. You could find some nice shells. The beach was big enough to walk in either direction to check out other resorts. On your way out to the beach to the right, under the palm trees, you’ll find several hammocks. Very nice and relaxing to take a nap in during the day or even after dinner. The pool was very nice and big - you could be at the pool/pool bar and see the ocean at the same time. We didn’t have a huge problem finding chairs around the pool. One morning we still found chairs around 8 am and other days we didn’t go to the pool area till the afternoon and still found chairs. Good drink service around the pool. On Sunday they even had a “mobile” bar going around the pool area and someone grilling brats and hot dogs on the beach, which was nice. Overall we were all pleased with the food – usually a good selection and tasted good. All the desserts we tried were fairly tasty, which was a surprise. Had buffet our 1st night (Sat) and everyone was very pleased with the HUGE selection - Seafood assortment pasta station, fish, beef, & chicken, make your own pasta. Every night they had 2 special entrée selections – lamb, beef wellington, beef tenderloin, salmon, chicken, etc. Breakfast was always good with plenty to choose from – omelet station, french toast, pancakes, eggs, hashbrowns, bacon, sausage, cereal, fruit, pastries, etc. Dinners: Our second night we ate at the Mexican restaurant – it was decent, but not our favorite. At Chili’s we tried the ribeye (good) and surf and turf (which was shrimp skewers), dessert – baked Alaskan (ice cream) – good. Our favorite was probably Krystal – 2 of us had the beef filet (very good) and 2 had sea bass (good but not as good as filet) – they had the BEST chocolate cake for dessert! The beef entrees at the Japananise restaurant were good as well – but they don’t cook in front of you. We didn’t make it to the Brazilian. It was a drawback having to get to the lobby around noon to make dinner reservations, you could make 2 reservations at a time, waited for about 15 minutes each time, lines moves fairly fast. 4 of the 5 restaurants only had 2 seating times either 6:45 or 8:45. We only caught one of the shows –the Michael Jackson show – very good. The shows change each week. We did see one cockroach on the floor while sitting in the courtyard one night after dinner having drinks. One BIG improvement the hotel does need to make is with the workout room. For a 5 star hotel – this is the worst workroom we’ve seen. Hardly any equipment and all very old and outdated. Even went to the other Palace hotel to use their workout room and just as bad.
