If you like to run outside, there is a nice 4-mile loop within the Playacar gated complex. We took a day trip to Cozumel. Caught the 8 AM ferry ($54 roundtrip for 2 adults) my husband went Scuba Diving at Blue Magic in the morning, we rented a jeep and drove around the island for the day stopping at several bars/restaurants (Wet Wendy’s, Coconuts & Chen Rio)and of course shopping. A fun day trip! No security issues within the hotel or Mexico in general. Felt safe everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but needs work”
Reviews.Author: imacitygirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the grounds were very well maintained and our room was lovely. I enjoyed my trip tremendously...BUT...(sorry Riu but I have to do this) I also had 3 roach sightings...one near the food preparation area near the buffet, one in my room and a third in the lobby. I have to mention this because it's the only way for them to know what the guests see and hopefully they will control this better in the future. I also noticed that musty smell and have a suitcase full of stuff that reaks of it. And lastly, the food was just ok. I was really looking forward to Mexican night in hopes of having some authentic mexican food, but I was hugely disappointed. However, I always found something to eat, but mostly stuck with the make your own pasta and salads. Not what I was hoping for, but it did just fine!!!!!! And unfortunately, the walls are paper thin and you can hear everything going on in the hallway and above you. Aside from those 3 things, this place is amazing. Staff is courteous and always willing to accomodate! I will visit again soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in Riu and Funjet Vacations”
Reviews.Author: sunnybeach95
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Riu Palace - Riviera Maya. The beach was beautiful! We booked through Funjet Vacations and were extremely disappointed with them. We originally booked the Riu Palace Mexico and after researching I realized what we wanted was the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (properties 1/2 mile from each other). I called Funjet and the agent assured me there was only one property and I was booked at the correct hotel. When we arrived, we saw they are NOT the same hotel. The Riu Palace Mexico where we were dropped was a much smaller, very quiet hotel with an average hotel guest age of about 70 years old. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was a younger crowd and a much larger, livelier hotel. We approached the Funjet rep in the hotel lobby who said it would be no problem to transfer us to the other, he just needed to call his office to confirm. After THREE AND A HALF HOURS of waiting and run around "waiting for a call back", we were told the "upgrade" to the other hotel in a LESSER room than we originally booked was going to cost an additional $850 for 4 nights!!!! Funjet/Lomas Travel was extremely unprofessional and con artists at best. We went to the front desk and arranged to be transferred "internally" direct thru Riu without any Funjet/Lomas involvement for $100. We were so disappointed in Funjet for having wasted our first day in paradise waiting in a hotel lobby. The food at Riu was ok. Just ok. Don't expect anything great. We were also very disappointed that they do not allow you to eat at one of the restaurants your first night. It is mandatory buffet. The second day we stood in line for an hour and a half to get on the reservation list for a restaurant for that evening and of course, they were all booked. Buffet the second night as well. We did get reservations for the 3rd night for the "steak house" and it was better than the buffet, but the food was, again, just ok. Waitstaff was very attentive most of the time and try their best. Overall a decent hotel. The grounds are beautiful, rooms are clean and helpful staff everywhere. BUT, if you are expecting nice dinners - this isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Promises but no deliveries”
Reviews.Author: eMBieAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for 14 nights. 10th visit of a RIU hotel, Diamond Class card On arrival, smooth check-inn and wonderful upgrade to a suite room, thank you RIU ! But…this is where all of the service stopped ! After this we never had the feeling we were of a diamond class level. Meaning : no bottle of “champagne” and strawberry’s like other new arrivals received. Not once, (during 14 nights), experienced the turn-down service in our suite room, and they had this service in operation, as we saw ! Noted this to the front desk but without any result. First week the food in the restaurant was great, large selection and beautifully presented. Starting from the second week we taught that we were in a different hotel ! Less selection and, (very clearly), cheaper ingredients were served now ! Clearly the level of food supply is directly according to the price level of that period. Lobster was available in the steak house in the first week but not any more in the second. Also chocolate fountain…first week yes, second …good bye fountain ! During our visit one of the head- waiters “discovered” after a few questions to us, that we had a RIU diamond class card and he promptly suggested to send for a bottle of “champagne” to our room…nothing appeared there. An other head-waiter (steakhouse) promised us lobster at the second visit during our stay…sorry no lobster available any more. We didn’t ask for all these things but, a promise is a promise, and if you cannot accomplish what you’re promising, then you better shut up. It would be a lot easier for us to live with. Being in a Palace 5* hotel, one should expect that there is a minimum of etiquette. Here we noticed that, in contradiction with was is written in our brochure, certain type of guests came to diner in shorts that sometimes looked more swimming or beachwear. Even in a few of the theme restaurants, were clearly was marked “NO SHORTS” they appeared, nothing was said against this, but I’m sure that other guests were not happy with this. Expect a lot of noise from entertainment during your restful ours at the swimming pool. Coming from aerobics in the pool…loud music, bingo every day and water polo game. Some shows during the evening entertainment were good e.g. the Maya show (again…only performed during the first week) was very nice. The performance of the Mariachi’s was disappointing ! We re-visited this show at the RIU Palace Mexico and noticed that there it was completely different and very nice ! Also other aspects we saw there, when visiting our friends, gave us the impression that we had chosen for the wrong hotel, and didn’t supplied us with a feeling of satisfaction although the price we have paid for this. (+6.400 US dollar for two). Luckily you will find also a lot of positive points around… The resort is still in a perfect state, the beach is even more nice than during our previous visit 2.5 years ago, and the drinks they serve, especially in the Lirico bar were of a high quality where in the La Habana bar the bartender was, in my opinion, sometimes quite arrogant. Cleaning of room and all other public areas is perfect, waiter service in (main !) restaurant, la Plaza and on the swimming pool is very good. Food was also very nice during our complete stay, but was exceptionally during the first week.

Reviews.Title: “We were spoiled at this beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: kjmil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya May 1st-5th in Junior Superior Suite. Our stay felt luxurious, not skimpy, even thought its all inclusive. Loved the beautiful beach and spacious pool. Staff was friendly and funny. Food was great. we walked to 2 other nearby Riu's and thought the food at our place was better. Free minibar with sodas, water, beer in room. Enjoyed breakfast room service 2 days. Pool was pleasant temperature, even warm. I am pregnant but still found non alcoholic pool drinks and staff helpful with milk(leche) to drink at meals. Some organized activities- beach volleyball, water aerobics. loved having them bring us drinks at our chairs. The good- food was great, room was comfy and clean with whirlpool tub. Head left out of hotel front door for 5-10 minutes and find small tourist shopping plaza and a starbucks! Cozumel ferry a few miles up beach. we didn't go but fellow guests spent the day over there with rental car. Nice lobby bar at night. Beach and pool super relaxing. Ocean was great to swim/float in, nice temperature and color. Resort is very clean, they clean the floors all over a lot. Enjoyed the steakhouse especially but the non-reservation dinner restaurant was great too. Room service quick and on time. The challenges- you should know its 50 minute shuttle ride from airport but gorgeous once you are there. Room service nachos and tostadas arrived chilled not warm, some milk arrived warmed not cold (apparently customs are different there) so you might specify more than we did. Evenings are a little slow- shows at 9:45pm are ok. perhaps if i was not pregnant and could have a drink might have enjoyed them more?? nearby riu had disco but we didn't go. Noise: after 7am carts with breakfast, etc roll down the tile hall and I am light sleeper. I brought a fan which helped some. As with most mexico places, you have to use bottle water to brush your teeth but bottles are complimentary in room so that's fine. Overall a wonderful beautiful place to vacation and spend time with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: BirminghamNetty
Reviews.Content: stayed a week with husband and 2 12yos as part of Thomson Yucatan explorer holiday. Decor not to my taste - it is grand (marble and gilt everywhere) and a bit over top. Lots of air conditioning where it was most needed. Checkin was pretty efficient. Majority of guests are American. Mainly adult guests - not a lot of school aged children around . Got upgraded to a room with a huge balcony and pool/garden view (2075). Rooms are good with entrance area, bathroom to right and bedroom/sitting area to left. Beds are a bit small for 2 people but very comfy. Execellent choice of drinks in room - bacardi and smirnoff on optics and soft drinks/beer in the fridge. Decent TV station choice though geared to Americans. Everywhere is very well kept. The food is excellent. Managed to try all the speciality ones without too much bother though you have to get there at midday on the dot to book. Best were the Japanese and Chilis. The Brazilian one is the worst - meat, meat and more meat. They don't seem to change the menus though so the food gets a bit samey. Evening entertainment was a bit naff - mostly consist of people dancing or miming to records. Staff are lovely - helpful and smiley. We stayed mainly on the beach where there were no problems getting loungers and they have 6 hammocks to use which are great. Lovely warm sea with a bit of low surf. If you are walking to Playa del Carmen go by road not along the beach - it is much quicker. Thought 5th Avenue was awful - full of tatt. For souvenirs, Playacar plaza is fine with about a dozen shops and is about 5 minutes walk away. Had to stay a night at the Riu Yucatan due to flight delay which made us realise how good this place was. The downsides - the pool is too small for a hotel this size. The awful lounger hogging which the hotel makes no attempt to control. The echoy corridors previously mentioned coupled with a few inconsiderate guests who talk loadly after midnight - have they no sense/manners? So thoroughly recommended. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this hotel is show,and over the rest of them would have to work”
Reviews.Author: Elenachaikovskyi
Reviews.Content: Everything was fine except for some things: Cockroaches crawling on the 6 month old baby, and they offered us a sprinkle them poison!!! Wet bedding, so sleep is not very nice. Strange smell in the room, corridors..... Beach: beautiful , sea, sand..... Everything is fine, but DIRTY. Cigarette butts everywhere, used condoms.... Food: so-so And none do not recommend drinking welcome drink- a chemistry with sugar!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Faultless, Best Riu we've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: brummypirates
Reviews.Content: Anyone who finds fault with this hotel must come from another planet. The food was excellent, the staff were excellent, the accommodation was excellent, the weather (which the hotel can't control) was excellent. There's not must else that I can write about this hotel apart from we couldn't find anything to find fault with it. Please try it for yourself, you won't be disappointed! We've stayed at Riu hotels in quite a few countres around he world and this is the best yet! Also a big thank you to Thomsom. Their flight staff and service was also excellent! Can't ait to return there!!! EXCELLENT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mexico 2010”
Reviews.Author: AnnGuinee
Reviews.Content: Close to perfection! Accommodation, food, services, smiles...

Reviews.Title: “A blast for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: miz_hayes
Reviews.Content: I am 18 years old and came with a family and my two best friends to vacation and of course party in mexico! The age group at the palace though, was no where near us 18 to 19 year olds. Lots of families and couples! At night time we would have to walk a 10 minute journey to the Riu tequila which suited are age group and nightlife. -Service was unreal if you had tip money! -I did not see one bug at all the whole week during are stay. - I have been to Mexico three times and no other resorts had food like the Palace. so yummy! I recommend making the reservations to other restaurants on the resort as well. My favorite was the Japanese, especially if you love sushi. -15 minute walk to playa del carmen which is a lot of fun for shopping and nightlife - down fall was my camera got stolen from our room, but that could have been my fault since i didnt put it in our safe. Its just strange because we had ipods and cash as well which they did not take.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back - good experience overall..."”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier0511
Reviews.Content: We went to Riviera Maya in April 2011. We stayed five nights and were mainly looking to get away and relax after a particularly stressful couple of months. We were a little worried about Mexico in general due to the travel warnings and all the reports of crime and deaths. Despite hearing reports of incidents in Cancun (that happened while we were down there) on our trip back to the U.S., we never had any incidents or times when we felt unsafe or uncomfortable in Riviera Maya. All in all, we really enjoyed our time at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya! This was our first time staying at a Riu property. We were looking for an all inclusive experience and got one. Here are some thoughts: -The transfer from the Cancun airport to the hotel is long. It took at least an hour each way and the road you're mostly on is fairly annoying with lots of speed bumps. -The first impression of the hotel is a very grand one. The lobby area is very stately. -Our room was clean and suited our needs just fine. We had asked for a queen or king bed (can't remember which one) and they ended up shoving two doubles together. It was kind of weird...but it worked. My complaint was the beds were pretty stiff though. A LOT of noise comes into the rooms from the outside hall. That was our biggest complaint about the room. It made it tough to sleep at times. We stayed on the first floor...the main floor. We did have to ask/remind the staff for a couple of things. Our refrigerator broke and we needed them to fix that. We had to ask a couple of times for more towels or all of the towels (e.g., we'd have bath towels but no washcloths.) We also had to ask several times for them to restock our fridge (we wanted more water and beer). We figured out by the end, once we started tipping, that had we done that all along, they might've been more responsive. - While this is all inclusive, and that claims to cover tips, it's quickly apparent that tipping will result in better/faster service overall...anywhere in the resort. You'll want to make sure you have pesos for that. -We don't have gourmet tastes...so we were always able to find something to eat. If you place a high value on food or are a "foodie," you might be disappointed in the offerings. We had read a number of disappointed reviews on the food and we can understand why now if that's something that's important to you. It was nice that you could find something to eat at anytime of the day though. We never took advantage of the 24-hour room service or the liquor bar in the room...but they are cool nonetheless. -I've read that people didn't care for the drinks or thought they were watered down. You can always find beer, wine, champagne and lots of frozen fruity drinks at the pool. Will they have the same drinks you drink at home...probably not...but that was okay for us. Again, we were always able to find something. And if you're worried about the alcohol not packing enough of a punch, just go to the Sports Bar and do shots like we did. You'll be set and packing it in early! :) -You need to pay attention when you check in to learn the rules for reservations for the specialty restraurants. You have to make reservations for these places a couple days in advance and you can only make the reservations in the lobby area between 12-3 I think it was. You will want to plan ahead if your plans for the day take you away from the hotel. The good news is there is a buffet you can always fall back on if you don't have reservations elsewhere. -We found the pool area awesome and spent most of our time there! Pool loungers are hard to come by...so there would be an advantage to getting up and laying claim to some before they're all gone. Each day, we would find chairs, put our stuff there and then go about our activities...whether at the beach or pool. -The beach area is also very cool.. with lots of varied places to relax, sit and lie out. -We never did any off-site activities (e.g., Maya ruins, ziplining, golf) but there are travel reps in the lobby every day if you want to make arrangements to do so. A lot of different activities are offered by a number of different companies. -The hotel is really good about offering activities throughout the day...mainly at the pool area. We participated in some of them. -While there was nightly entertainment offered (and it varied each night), this hotel is missing something more livelier and something that goes longer at night. We had inquired about the nearest club, but it was down the street 15 minutes at another Riu property and we didn't feel safe walking there. A dedicated club or more lively bar, with music and dancing, is needed. -We never took advantage of the spa, but we saw people going in there quite a bit and booking services. We would certainly go back and I would say we had a good experience overall! I will definitely keep Riu in mind for the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Buffalo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at only one comparable all-inclusive, the Sandals Royal Bahamian...this place blows away that particular Sandals resort. Rooms were very clean, no weird smells like some people stated in their reviews Restaurants were very nice. Typical setup where you wait in line to get a reservation. One tip: if you can't get a reservation for a particular restaurant wait until everyone leaves and discreetly show a $10 bill and sit down to talk to the 2 people who book the reservations, tell them what you want and they will give you the reservation...they have a little log book for these reservations As far as tips go, we would drop a $5 bill for the 1st round and a few dollars every round or every other round. Some people were saying that $5 across the whole night of being served was enough, sounded light to me. Beach was great, nice hammocks. Order room service beers if you want some real stock in your fridge, the crew that comes around won't give you more than a couple bottles. We went offsite to Xplore which was a great time. Highly recommended location

Reviews.Title: “Would not return...”
Reviews.Author: kt20852
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my BF back in 2010. Everything about this place is great - the rooms, the service, the beach...However, the food is inedible and the alcohol is way watered down! Would not return as it was not a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: spidergirlMinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend, Thursday through Monday and my only regret is that we couldn't stay longer. The beach area is very, very nice. Lots of places to sit in the sun or the shade. We really didn't use the pool, we went to enjoy the ocean! The food was very good for the most part but the lunches were adequate at best. We ate at 2 specialty restaurants, the Krystal and the Agave. Both were very good, I agree with other posters that the wine is not very good and I would have really enjoyed a nice glass with dinner but there are many other choices. The room was decent sized and we did not notice the musty smell others have complained about. The bed was very firm but after a long day in the sun I could have slept on the floor! We had towel animals every day but never received turn down service. The open square was very lovely in the evening, we enjoyed the beautiful breezy night air and the music after dinner each night. It was a very relaxing getaway but there is not much to keep teens and people looking for a party atmosphere in the evening. It was perfect for us and just what we were looking for. The only sour note were having to witness two negative interactions from (unreasonably) angry guests. The staff was very professional and I was embarrassed that they were obviously Americans. Grow up people! If you have an awful life and a bad relationship don't force the rest of us to participate!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Great Service, One Unfortunate Incident”
Reviews.Author: Hondo2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 5 nights on April 15, 2011. This is our 6th all inclusive – other resorts in Mexico we have stayed at include the Valentin and Grand Palladium. The Riu really should be commended for their excellent service – we remember this from our stay in Jamaica and the RPRM did not disappoint. I have to say that the service we had at the Valentin 3 years ago does not compare at all to the Riu. At the Riu – there is never a long wait for drinks, getting seated at a table, getting coffee in the morning at the buffet, or getting waited on at the front desk. Also, it seems there detail to maintaining the grounds and cleanliness are superb. We saw workers scrubbing down the sides of the pool and pool deck – always working on something. Food was great – nothing above and beyond compared to other all inclusives, but still always a good variety. My favorite restaurant was the Brazilian – great service and wonderful food. The morning buffet had a wide variety of choices – loved the potato cakes. The steak at the steak house was good – the filet with lobster was even better. The Japanese was my least favorite. Standing in line was not ideal to make dinner reservations. The two days we got there at 12 noon- there was a line, and the lady had not even shown up yet – she ran about 15 minutes late both times. Pool and Beach – I love all the palm trees –a great combination of sun and shady spots everywhere. The beach is gorgeous. The animation team was just the right amount of activity – never too intrusive but still a good amount of fun activities and music by the pool. I like the smaller size of this resort – everything is well within a reasonable walk and the resort layout is a U shape. Room – Here is where the Riu could use a facelift. The room is adequate – large, clean and the basic amenities. They really do need an update with their linens and furniture and electronics (flat panels, new lamps are needed). Our bed linens were not soft and noticeably worn with a hole or two. We had no issue with cockroaches –and I did check around since I read about the issue before I left. We did meet another family who complained of one of their rooms having cockroaches. Being it’s a warm, tropical location –I would expect they are around – you just hate to see them. Also I should mention that musty smell---not sure why the Riu has that smell so much worse than other resorts we have stayed at – we met another couple that mentioned the same thing. You get used to it –keep your slider open while your in your room to get some fresh air….and just plan on washing all of your clothes when you get home. We had one unfortunate incident with money being stolen from our safe. Our first night there, we returned to our room to find out our key card no longer worked – very odd they would de-magnetize only 4 hrs. after arriving to the resort. The other key card was in the room – and that was deactivated also. Upon getting that resolved and entering our room, our safe was wide open with about 1/3rd of our money gone. It’s a very weird incident considering not all of the money was taken, and nothing else in the safe was taken. My guess is that the individual doesn’t want it to be appear as if anything is gone. We are 100% certain our safe was locked –the last thing we did before we left the room was lock the sliding glass door, pull the shades closed, lock the safe –and I actually always pull on the safe door to assure it’s locked. They started an investigation and did find out that someone entered our room that evening while we were gone– they are just not sure how they breached the safe since the code is a unique code we picked. The master code is only known by management at the resort and it takes a special computer thing they hook into the safe to open it. We had approximately 4 meetings with the manager & assistant manager and they were actually very responsive (although they did not believe us at first). They ended up taking out our entire safe and replacing it, and reimbursing us. I have to give kudos to our Fun Jet representative at the resort – Joel from Lomas Travel- who was so helpful with this incident. He also filled out a report and helped translate when we needed it. He checked in with us everyday to see if we had an update on the investigation – great service. Please make sure your safe is locked and if you notice it’s open ---count all of your money to assure nothing is taken. Overall this is a beautiful resort --- I would rate it as 3.5 stars compared to the other all inclusives we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Hkmcupcake
Reviews.Content: My family went for spring break. Mostly it was wonderful. We had a suite at the end by the pool/beach so we didn't have any noise. The beds are terribly uncomfortable and we did have hundreds of tiny ants and some cockroaches. The staff came with a bottle of raid that we kept for the week. We didn't have any more ants but the cockroaches kept coming. The room itself was beautiful, a nice big balcony, big bath, and very meticulous housekeeping staff. The pool is nice, the beach beautiful with lots of shade. My daughters were shocked by some topless sunbathers on the beach. The kids club is very small. Basically a dog run. The staff were phenomenal, very friendly and helpful. The food at the buffet was great (especially breakfast) but the specialty restaurants were mostly a waste of time. The Japanese restaurant was ok, nothing special. The steakhouse was horrible (beef doesn't seem to be their specialty). Krystal was pretty good, and the Mexican restaurant was very good. You can make reservations for 3 days when you wait in line from 12-3. We had no problem getting reservations but my husband went up before noon and waited in line. The drinks in the lobby bar are MUCH better than those poolside - worth the walk. The red wine is horrible. Stick to beer and mixed drinks from the lobby. The entertainment was good but starts at 9:45 which makes it hard to see with small children. Excursion travel agents work out of the lobby and were very helpful. We went to Tulum (fabulous) and for an ATV jungle ride to tour cenotes (underground freshwater caves)..also fabulous. We went on the $35 snorkel boat ride from the water sports company on the beach and that was fun as well, saw lots of fish. I agree it's not the best hotel for those with disabilities. Limited elevators and stairs, very slippery hallways! We felt totally safe, enjoyed the staff, immaculate and beautiful grounds, beautiful rooms (aside from bugs and hard as rock beds), and I've never seen a prettier beach. The natural shade from palm trees was plentiful, although there is also plenty of sun space as well. We would go back but would not waste time at the steakhouse. Live music played in the plaza in the evening which was nice. 5th avenue is fun to go shopping. The $30 sunscreen from the store is true (we had to buy it). The water is not safe to drink from the tap. The restaurant water is safe. They stock your mini bar every day. Our air conditioning didn't work all that well, running full blast, turned down as low as possible. It was never cool in our room and they said our room was too big to cool anymore. The room was big for a hotel but NOT too big to cool. I was uncomfortable at night and I like to be warm.

Reviews.Title: “Once bitten....”
Reviews.Author: mambuishu
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in numerous hotels in various locations but never had anything stolen until here. All I have to say is use your room safe. My 1200 levian ring was stolen while I was at breakfast and the hotel manager insisted that i shouldn't blame the poor staff and that it would take too long for the cops to come. They also appeared to lose the ability to speak english and kept saying the only people in our room was us (huesped). All i know is someone had cleaned and dusted my ring right into their pocket because when I returned the maid had been there. We were actually upgraded for free from the riu playacar to the palace which made this even worse. The staff was alot friendlier and did not seem annoyed to serve us at the playacar. Same chain different experiences. I feel if we had not taken the upgrade I would still have my ring. Upon return I emailed the chain and was told that there was nothing they could do. I know hindsight is 20/20. I don't trust any hotels now.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not enough excitement for teenagers”
Reviews.Author: KristalJessica
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent a week at the hotel. The rooms were great as was the service. The beach set up was fantastic. I would recommend this vacation for a family with small children or couples. The entertainment staff did a good job. Our main issue is there were not enough teenagers at the hotel to keep my daughter from getting bored. We traveled with Delta and the traffic tours representative never showed up in the lobby. This created an issue with finding our way back to the airport. Jorge (agua shirt / white pants), the funjet vactions representative went out of his way to help us out and arranged our transportation to the airport (we owe him big time) . Food at the hotel was good - nothing special but safe.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: jhendsbee
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a fabulous trip to this wonderful hotel. We have been to the mayan before and wanted to try this resort as the reviews were good and the place looked amazing online. We were not disappointed. It really is as beautiful as it looks in pictures. From your entrance to the courtyard, it was unbelievable. The food was great. We tried all the restaurants except the Krystal and are happy to say that they were good. The beach restaurant called Chillies has amazing pizza. I am missing it since I came home. The best I have tasted! The main buffet has pizza too, but it does not taste the same as the one by the beach..The rooms were beautiful and clean, A/C was wonderful and not noisy. The beach does not compare to Punta Cana, but it is good. Lots of shells mixed in with the sand and the ocean surf was big for 4 of the 7 days which we loved as it was fun. All and all this place is paradise! We wish we were still there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: HFWSyracuse
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this hotel and it was wonderful. Very similar to other RIU Palaces. Beautiful, safe area. Staff was great. Grounds were immaculate. We had a suite (1046) and couldn't hear any noise or echoing, but we were at the tip of the "U" shape of the hotel. Buffet was outstanding-lobster tails! Towels at the pool area were shabby, but if that is my only complaint I will survive. Some people mentioned little alcohol in the drinks. I did notice this at the swim up bar with frozen drinks. My husband drank rum and cokes which were super strong. I drank pina coladas and after the first few (which I think may have been virgin), I just asked for extra rum and had no problems after that. It was only the swim up bar that we had this problem with. The lobby bar and even the walk up portion of the swim bar were fine. We go to bed early and get up early, so I can't comment on the nightlife, but we had fun at the casino night and just hanging out at the lobby bar. I do not reccomend massages at the spa. I did not think it was that good and we paid for a 50 minute couples massage and it was 45 minutes from the time I turned off my phone before the massage began until I turned my phone on again after the massage and getting dressed. We plan to return to Playacar and most likely this hotel. We like the Palaces and toured the Mexico Palace, which was beautiful as well, just slightly older and farther from the beach. Please feel free to contact me if you have any questions!

Reviews.Title: “Winning, duh!”
Reviews.Author: polohockey
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the RPRM and had a blast. We have been to many Riu s and this was by far the best. The Palace is located inside of Playacar which is about as safe as you can get in Mexico, we NEVER felt unsafe. It was a mile walk or $7 cab ride to 5th street which is a MUST DO, it is a mile long of awesome shops, restaurants and hotels. 5ty street is mellow compared other Mexico markets. There is also a good size shopping area the opposite direction inside Playacar across from the other Rius. On our trip we went to Cozumel and did the snorkeling and tour excursion, was good value for the money and not a lot more than the ferry itself. We took a cab to Mayakoba golf course and also stopped by Walmart and never felt unsafe. (we picked up extra water, Gatorade and Pedialite to keep hydrated, worked well!). Pros: Just about everything. Great staff, clean as can be, great pool and HUGE beach. Very clean beach with only a vendor or 2 a day, very relaxing and the water was amazing! Millions of cool shells everywhere you looked. Victor from the sports bar was awesome! There is also a golf course across the street which is handy. The buffet was great! the food is usually bland and caters to the Euros but this time it was pretty good and there was lobster, tons of seafood and good theme nights. Cons: The entertainment was sub par. The hallways were very loud so bring earplugs. The specialty restaurant was no better than the buffet. If you want to nit pick the wireless signal was poor but note to self you are on vacation.... A few roaches but hey you are in the jungle, duh! Overall it was a great trip, you have to be a real donkey to find things to complain about or your standards are a little above what you are paying for, so if you dont like it go somewhere else. As far as Americans being loud or rude I didnt find that at all and also noticed the Americans and Canucks were the only ones tipping! This was a very affordable, safe, and great location. There is no night life but it is nice to have a nice and quiet night to relax and if you want action 5th street is minutes away. Winning, duh!

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Walking Shoes....”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferreece98
Reviews.Content: I would not say it's 5 stars it's more a 4. With food being a 3. The grounds are amazing and everything is clean and cleaned often. There are 2 elevators in the resort. One on each wing. The problem is, your room is here, the pool is there, the lobby is way up there and if you forget something forget it. We did lots of walking back and forth, pool, restaurants, lobby for wifi. Wich is the only place they have wifi. It was exhausting! Making reservations for restaurants is another issue. You can't just call. You must everyday walk to the lobby and stand in a long line in the middle of the day from 12-3pm and make a reservation. Aftter all of the reservations are full and they fill up fast it's the buffet for you. Breakfast and lunch are always the same. Now evening restaurants are very good. We often went by the two seating times available for dinner and looked in to see empty tables, and very small restaurants. . So if they say they are booked go anyway and they will seat you. We did this 3 times. They don't waste anything in all inclusive. So if you saw it on the breakfast buffet and there was left overs it will be somewhere in another restaurant....the pool was amazing and beach was amazing and they cleaned your rooms well. There is the musty smell that everyone talks about on here. I brought a few air fresheners and it helped. So, the stereotypical "give them a few dollars and they'll do anything" IS SO NOT TRUE. They don't care who you are, they don't care if you give them anything extra. Now at the bar that's a different story. They took care of you! The spa was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, top shelf drinks, fun activities.”
Reviews.Author: MidwestMan81
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights with another couple and had a wonderful time. We played sand volleyball, drank at the pool, boogie boarded, napped in hammocks, scuba dived, massages, shopped in playa on 5th ave, etc. and all was great. Activities: not a place to snorkel off the beach, NOTHING to see. We did do a 2 tank dive from the scuba diving place onthe beach and it was excellent. Jonathan was a great divemaster and found lots of cool stuff (scorpion fish, stingrays, eels, etc.). I would definitely recommend diving there. Sand volleyball was a blast and it's available 2x a day. Wife liked the massage but not the nails/Pedicure/manicure deal (way overpriced). Entertainment was pretty good. It wasnt cheesy like other resorts I've been to. We actually enjoyed watching them. There were no scheduled activities in the pool or loud music which is a huge plus to me. Food was really good for an all inclusive. The buffet was just as good if not better than some of the specialty restaurants. *only 2 specialty restaurants of the 5 or 6 require pants which in my opinion is the way they should all be. Overall, I would recommend going here to anyone that wants to relax. Not too many kids and pool wasn't bothered with cheesy aerobics or loud music.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: fgp62
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in playa, one word PERFECT. do not let all those people who complain about EVERYTHING stop you from staying here. The staff was great, food better than I thought, rooms very clean . the only two little complaints are, no ocean view from the pool and no music at the pool. if you are looking for a lot of action during the day or at night this is not the place. if you want to chill its perfect. we did go on the bar hop (3 bars) if you go you must book with your rep at the hotel you will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation but needs better pool towel service”
Reviews.Author: MikeTC
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, great bar service and great buffet. Needs better Pool Service. Towel service was poor. Great Location. Front desk needs to pay attention to customers better. Needs better wine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to celebrate a wedding”
Reviews.Author: travelcanuckchick
Reviews.Content: The area in which the hotel is situated is very safe and is protected by a guarded entrance, so leaving the hotel to take a walk around neighbouring properties is very safe. The grounds are beautiful, from the grande lobby, to the impresive courtyard, to the nice wide beach. There was a group of about 20 of us who travelled here for a wedding, from the ages of 8 to mid-60's and there was something for everyone. As in other reviews, it may not have a whole lot of nightlife going on, but even as someone in my 20's, I found the atmosphere of the nightly courtyard entertainment to be very nice and the evening theater entertainment was pretty good too. Besides, your bracelet will get you into the disco at the Riu resort across the street. There is plenty to do on and off the resort by way of excursions and water sports. And the prices are quite reasonable. My friend and I really enjoyed the jet skies on the resort, and there is also parasailing and scuba excursions. The wedding my friend had here was beautiful, and the attention to detail turned out a gorgeous wedding, complete with beautiful flowers, a 3 person live band on the beach and a very nice meal for their reception. The rooms may be a bit basic for some, but the high ceilings and heavy wooden doors add character and style. The food and drinks served at this resort were presented nicely and the quality was very good. We all had a great time and enjoyed this beautiful, relaxing resort.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected!!!”
Reviews.Author: clevermom
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous hearing about the situation in Mexico but our fears were put aside when we reached. The drive from the airport to the hotel is about 45 minutes along depending on the traffic. Thats really the only downside about the hotel but once you get here you will forget the distance. Most of the hotels in this area(PLAYACAR) are within walking distance from one another. There is a shopping plaza called 5th avenue with many names you will recognize from the US. However be ready to pay a high price for many things. Inside the hotel...the staff at reception were very helpful at all times. All the staff was friendly and eager to help. We stayed in the junior suit. Unfortunately none of these rooms have a view to the ocean but in my opinion if you are going with little kids you dont want the courtyard or ocean view as there is usually a nightly show with loud music which might cause a problem for some. The maid service was good. They did tend to clean later in the day but that was good for us because we could shower and be ready leasurely and then they would clean the room. The beds were a little firm but firm is good from what I've read. If you require an extra bed they are more than willing to give you a roller bed for no charge. The beach and pool was wonderful. Water temperature was just fine once you get in. We went with two boys 12 and 14 and there was alot of activities to keep them busy,including rifle shooting. They do have water activities such as jet skiing and parasailing but at a cost. Boogie boards and snorkling equipment was free of charge as were the kayaks and catamaranes if you went by yourself. The Selection of food at all three meals were exceptional. They catered for all ages. Something for everyone. The standard of the food was also very high.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay! Top-notch location, staff & meals!”
Reviews.Author: DBLovesTheBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for one week early in April and were very satisfied with our experience. The location is PERFECT in our opinion; a safe (we went for an evening run without issue), gated villa community on a gorgeous stretch of beach. Walking distance (20 mins) to Playa del Carmen and the marina or a $7 cab ride. The hotel and decor are 'grand' with immaculately landscaped grounds - just beautiful. Our room was a ground floor king suite that was spacious, clean with good air conditioning and a balcony. A large closet and electronic safe as well as mini-bar (stocked daily) topped the room amenities off nicely! We found it more than adequate for an all-inclusive stay and the bed was also quite comfy. Most people lounge AROUND the pool and not IN it so we found the size to be adequate. There were kids in the pool but they weren't disruptive at all; those not wanting to see or hear children should probably book adult-only resorts... :-) Yes, there was the typical lounge-chair jockeying going on where people probably woke up at the crack of dawn to 'reserve' chairs, but we always found 2 loungers together and we never got down to the beach/pool area before noon! Takes more searching but it wasn't impossible The beach itself is beautiful and manicured with ample sun and shaded spots...and a dreamy section of hammocks! Beverage service on the beach and at the pool was great - waiters would come by often to refill drinks and clear empty cups. Never got harassed by sales persons while down there. What impressed me the most were the food and staff; best I've ever experienced at an all-inclusive and this was my 4th such trip. The buffet and a la carte restaurants were phenomenal! Always found plenty to suit our tastes and happy to see such varied healthy options. Hardboiled eggs were not cooked all the way through about half the time for breaky but that's my only complaint on food. We ate at Agave (Mexican), Chilis (Steakhouse) and Yashima (Japanese) restaurants and all were OUTSTANDING! By the way, we ordered room service twice and the service was impeccable - food was yummy and when we ordered a bottle of wine to the room, they brought it with a rose 'for the lady'...loved it! :-) The staff were always courteous, welcoming, and very helpful. The entertainment staff are great - so warm and a lot of fun and one of the things we remember most fondly. Evening entertainment was typical 'all-inclusive' recipe including cheesy cabaret singer and evening show which were fun and added to the experience. We would have liked to see more to do in the evenings after dinner and after the evening show, but the resort itself seems to be geared towards 'quiet after 11pm'. Even one of those cheezy little discos tucked away in a corner would have been a good option for those of us who wanted to do a little dancing without going into town...but this too, wasn't a big drawback. Just to make this a well-rounded review I'll mention the minor snags we encountered: - Sound does carry A LOT in the hallways and the doors do slam shut which is disturbing while trying to relax/sleep. Earplugs will be the only way around this issue - it's just the way the place is built. - Hot water in the shower was an issue one day but was restored quickly. The shower pressure is weak but workable. Another pressure issue was toilet flushing...most times good - occasionally a couple flushes required. - Room keys are easily demagnetized (that was the explanation we were given) so we had to make several trips the one day to the front desk to get that sorted out. Turns out our door lock had to be reprogrammed but no issues after that. - I have several mosquito bites from them getting into the room while it was being cleaned but it is a warm environment so bugs come with the territory (advice: bring mosquito repellant and After-bite) - Hotel convenience store is morbidly over-priced ($30US for sunscreen) so don't forget anything at home! hehe Overall a great experience and one we wouldn't hesitate to repeat or recommend to anyone. Often, the spirit in which you undertake things determines what your experience will be - we went with an open mind and determined to have a wonderful time and the resort helped deliver a dreamy vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant vacation”
Reviews.Author: JoeandBrenda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace in march /April for 2 weeks had a wonderful time fantastic hotel and staff. The room was great good size and we had an ocean view, very clean ,maids were fantastic always plenty of towels and bed was changed daily, and we had towel sculptures most days. We enjoyed all the restuarants as the food was first class even the buffet had great food and always fresh. Islas, Romero and the rest of the bar staff could not do enough for you and kept us entertained. Only downside was the pool area which wasn't large enough and had to get up too early to reserve beds. Some of the Americans could be very rude with the staff which wasn't deserved a simple please or (por vavor) would suffice. The resort was beautiful and easy to get around,nice walks and plenty of shops,bars and nightlife nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Gourgeous sandy beach, stinky room and drinks”
Reviews.Author: YuliaS
Reviews.Content: When we entered room we felt smell of chemicals that didn't vent out during our stay. They probably sprayed cockroaches mentioned before here. We never had enough towels and never had any towel designs. Drinks were not made from real liquid, probably half mixed with water. However, we enjoyed beach all days we stayed there. Beach was the reason we choose this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, stinky beer”
Reviews.Author: scottlawns
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with a group of 14, several high schoolers who were probably some of the obnoxious ones people complained about...sorry. No cockroaches, none...ever. Lines for restaurants were long, but you could book for the current day (which was usually sold out) plus the next 2 nights so the only night we went without reservations was the first. Staff was VERY friendly...Islas in the lobby bar was awesome. Hotel guests were super friendly (except the ones who stole our chairs see below). Hint #1, bring your own mug because the little 6 oz plastic glasses force you to run to the bar every 15 minutes and Hint #2 bring your own beer because the tap beer was AWFUL. No trouble getting pool chairs, but we did have a few early risers so that helped. We did have a few lounge chair stealers while we ran for breakfast...Hint #3 leave someone with your chairs. Buffet food was OK, not a lot you can do with mass quantities. Hint #4 bring ear plugs, the room doors slam so loud you get jolted out of bed at 6am every morning. Lobby Wifi must have been charged by a few hamsters on a wheel, kept waiting to hear that 33 baud modem tone. Oh, and with all Riu's (we've stayed in several) the beds are straight out of Bedrock. All in all, nice hotel and staff but will probably go somewhere else next time, didn't love the town of Playa and need better beer!

Reviews.Title: “You Can't go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: lovetravel499108
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Riu - beautiful place. Everyone did whatever they could to accomodate us. As for the loud mouthed spring breakers mentioned in the other reviews - it is not the hotel's fault. This is just a case of too much booze consumed by a bunch of inconsiderate people. Maybe they don't realize that some people actually don't go there to see who can consume the most alcohol and make the biggest fools of themselves. Anywhere you go during spring break will give you the same result. The halls are made of tile so the sound really carries into the rooms when people are coming back to their rooms at all hours of the night. The food was excellent, and so was all the staff. They were constanly cleaning the place, which was never dirty anyway. Within walking distance to Playa Del Carmen. Would go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we tried an AI”
Reviews.Author: cruiserDB
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews for weeks and weeks before we made our decision about our short visit to Mexico. It was really nice to have a first-hand report about the resorts, restaurants, and activities, and it helped us plan our short get-away. We stayed at the Riu for 4 nights at the end of March. Since we usually vacation onboard a cruiseship, this was a very different experience for us. It was our first All-Inclusive resort. Here's our thoughts: The Good: Wow, this place is beautiful! The lobby is stunning, the courtyard is beautiful, and the pool and beach were breathtaking. All staff was very welcoming and friendly. Apple Vacations did a great job of organizing our trip. They were extremely efficient and helpful. The resort, grounds, and pool area was emaculate. Our small room was clean and had all we needed. We went into Playa Del Carmen two of the evenings and had a great time! Carboncitas (right off 5th Ave.) was our favorite restaurant! Poolside activities were fun, and we enjoyed the beach BBQ. The Bad: Both on the phone, and in an email, I requested a room on the lower floor close to the pool and beach. I was assured my request would be honored. We were placed in a 3rd floor room as far away from the pool as possible! While the food was EXCELLENT on the buffets, we were disappointed that we were not able to get into the special restaurants. Reservations needed to be made during the day (12 - 3pm) for the following evenings. We arrived too late our first day to make reservations, and when I went to make the reservations on our second day, all restaurants were full except for one of our available evenings. We did get into the gourmet restaurant on our last night. It was just ok. We enjoyed breakfast in the buffet, but we aren't really "buffet people" for all three meals so this was disappointing. There was NO nightlife at this resort. They did have a show each evening, but that was it. These type of singing and dancing shows are just not something we enjoy. Other than sitting at the bar, there was nothing to do. The UGLY: There were NO poolside chairs available after 8:00 in the morning!! All chairs were empty except for a towel or a book! The signs all say they do not allow saving chairs, but it certainly isn't enforced. Who gets up at 6 am to reserve a pool chair on their vacation?? We did get great chairs on the beach, and they could be moved to your choice of sun or shade. We are not big drinkers and partiers, but we do enjoy a drink or two in the evening. My husband drinks gin on the rocks, and was happy to see the Beefeater's and Gordon's bottles on the bar. However, the liquid in the bottle was definately NOT gin! It didn't smell like gin, and certainly didn't taste like gin! The vodka was the same way. (This was the same at the bar and in the liquor dispenser in our room.) Beer was ok, but no American beer was available. Tequila seemed fine. Based on Tripadvisor reviews, we ate at a restaurant called "Season Bistro" in Playa del Carmen. It had been the #1 choice for weeks. We were NOT happy with our $100 dinner. Service was extremely slow and the food was horrible. All in all, we did enjoy our short trip to warmer weather! We will try another AI some day, but for now, we will stick with the cruiseships!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place...great staff and service, great location and beach.”
Reviews.Author: CDLVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya the week of April 1-8. We chose the RPRM for its beach, easy access to PDC and its apparently high ranking. Generally, this is what we thought of our trip to the RPRM: Pros: Sunwing Vacations = Pleasantly surprised RPRM staff = always friendly and always helpful. Service was very good. Grounds and buildings = Very nice and well kept. Not a fan of the architecture or design, but that’s a very personal preference. Beach = Incredible…reason for choosing this resort/area. Lots of loungers to use and never had a problem finding a spot no matter what time we arrived at the beach. Ala Cartes = very good food and service. Best was Chillis Steak house and the staff there. Great food and great service. Location = Playacar is very nice and the walk along the beach into PDC is 15-20 minutes. Cons: Room Service = Breakfast is limited to continental and has to be pre ordered the night before. Lame. Munchies room service menu is very limited. Overall, the offerings for room service at the RPRM is far below the standard that the rest of the resort has set. Buffets = Average, but good. Expected more given the quality of the ala cartes. Food at 24 hr Sports bar = kept in fridge and then you microwaved it. Blech. Internet = None in the rooms…had to go to the lobby area to use the free wi-fi. Signal strength was very good and was easy to hook up to but could be quite slow. Beds = Horribly lumpy and the plastic “pee sheet” used is gross. Worst part of staying here was trying to sleep in that bed. Worst bed Ive “slept” in by far. Losers playing the towel game at the pool. Disheartening to see so many prime loungers being saved for 6 hours and not being used. Not the resorts fault at all, but I have never seen so many strollers and newborns while on a beach vacation. Never! Too many times the baby screaming was beyond annoying and you seemingly couldn’t get away from them. Opposite end of the “spring beakers”? LOL. Despite my reservations, I booked our trip using Sunwing Vacations for the first time. I was more than pleasantly surprised by the service of the Sunwing staff….the flights were on time both arriving and departing, they used quite modern 737-800’s, and the in flight crew were very nice. A nice touch was that our return flight crew were Mexican! Made the transition back less abrupt to still be speaking Spanish on the flight. Food wasn’t good, but what airline’s food is? The on-site rep was very friendly and helpful even though I didn’t book any excursions through her. Only downside was it was a long ride to the resort via the provided transfer, with one stop before the resort (about 1.25 hours total travel time)…Id take a private transfer next time. That way you can also avoid the dolts who cant seem to figure out how to get to the transfer before having 3 beers at the bar outside the airport, thereby delaying your travel by another ½ hour. A couple days before we arrived, we emailed ahead of time making a general room request, and had put that in our booking reservation as well, for an upper floor unit. We had also requested a restaurant reservation for the night we arrived. Check in was easy, front desk staff was nice, and we were on our way to our room. Room 0032…yuck. Ground floor, facing the Viva Wyndham Azteca, and overlooking a large manhole cover directly in front of our patio . So much for the room request. Our restaurant reservation did go through and we were at the late sitting of the Brazillian steak house. The server was very friendly and very nice as well. Food was very good and we enjoyed the style of service there. Room After dinner, we put in a request to the front desk for a room change. We were told to come back the next day to see if it could be accommodated. We came back the next day and they had changed our room for us…to 2036. A nice top floor unit very close to the beach with a decent ocean view. Very nice. With the upper floor unit, it was a bit drier as well. Room 0032 was musty as all get out. I just unpacked my luggage this am and I can still smell room 0032 on my clothes. Yuck. Room had only the basic of supplies…shampoo, soap, towels. Glad I decided at the last minute to pack my razor and toothpaste. Mini bar was stocked well with tequila, vodka, rum and bourbon. Dos xx was in the fridge, along with water, mirinda, pepsi and club soda. No robes or slippers. An added benefit of this room change was that we met the nicest and friendliest housekeeper ever….helpful, always willing to chat us up, and cleaned the room nicely. I think hes being wasted in a housekeeping position…but maybe they start people off in housekeeping? I never ever remember our housekeepers name, but I remember his. Great guy. Restaurants We had reserved Chilis, Botafogo and Krystal, and all were nice. The surf and turf at Chilis, specifically the filet, was awesome. The baked alasaka presentation was quite the show. Krystal was weird, but the filet was very good there as well (not as good as chilis). If I were to do the ala cartes there again, I would go to Chilis every night and Botafogo a couple times to break it up. Bottle service of decent wines is provided. Had a nice Chilean cab sauv at Krystal and it worked quite well with the filet. Buffets Both Don Manolo and Chilis were decent buffets. One evening at Don Manolo’s it was Asian night and that was the night for the grilled lobster tails, while on seafood night there was hardly any seafood? Weird. But for dinner Don Manolos has bottle service which is nice. Food is generally pretty good, but with generally the same offerings. The carving station would mix it up a bit. Chilis for lunch is the best for location, as youre in an open air restaurant on the beach. Food is ok, but service is great. One instance sticks out…I had gone for another round and came back to my table finding it had been bussed. The place was totally packed and so they were trying to maintain a good turnover. When I sat down, the nice lady that had been serving me noticed that my table had been bussed, so she went without asking and brought me the same drink I had previously. Service here is good! The Beach. Cut to the chase…this is why people come here…it is gorgeous. Some remnants of the sand whales are still out there, but otherwise its perfect. The beach restoration has more than doubled the depth of the beach and it helps a ton. Half of the beach area is covered in palm trees for shade loving folks, and the other half is wide open for the people who want to bake in the sun. We didn’t find it a problem getting loungers in the shaded area. Although lots of people did “reserve” seating in there I do think that it is unnecessary. Lots of “reserved” loungers sat there all day never being used. So we most definitely grabbed stuff from those reserving….like tables, chairs, etc. I have zero problem doing that and others should too. Beach service could be slow at times, but the guys slinging drinks out there did their best and were very friendly. Pool. The pool situation was a disappointment with only one pool where all the chairs were “reserved” by 8am. Good thing Im not a pool person. Evenings. We were somewhat disappointed by the evenings here. Seems to really wind down after late dinner, with hardly anyone around after 11pm. Maybe it was just the week we were there, but we felt that it was definitely on the quiet side for a resort. Overall, the RPRM is a very nice resort in a beautiful location. Good food at the ala cartes, decent buffets, fantastic beach, great service and great staff all around. Somewhat disappointed in some aspects, but overall a nice place. Would I go here again….no. I think if we were to try another Riu wed go to the Riu Palace Mexico just down the beach. We visited one day and one night and it seemed more to our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: BostonGalTraveler
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed at 4 RIUs now and they all have been wonderful. We love the all inclusive style, amenities like the sailboats, and their services and workers are fantastic. We had never stayed at a Palace RIU before, and this one was top notch. It was my birthday and because I had signed up for a RIU member card last trip, they gave me champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries with a birthday card in our room. Rosario, the best steak house manager, hooked me up with a song and a mousse birthday cake. It was very special and these extra little touches are what we love about the RIU. They try really hard to make your stay memorable and fun. The infinity pool here was great, the swim up pool bar was a blast with Santos providing excellent service and great laughs. And this has to be one of the best beaches I have ever been to. White powder clean sand, all shades of blue and green clear water. You can sit on the beach and look out at Cozumel. And at the Palace we loved the beach drink service. One day a worker came around with a variety of drinks to choose from. That was a nice touch. They have hammocks under palm trees on the beach, nightly entertainment and a variety of activities during the day. Staying at the Palace we were able to go to all the other RIUs, which we have done before, so we enjoyed roaming around. All of these hotels in the Playacar district are safe and secure with a security check in for all vehicles. You can be safe going to Playa Del Carmen downtown too, either walk the private road because the Palace was closer than we thought, or take a short cheap cab ride. Great for souvenirs, fun restaurants, and shopping. We love Playa Del Carmen and the RIU Palace is really grand. The food was better than expected and you must try the specialty restaurants: Steakhouse, Mexican, and Japanese, delicious! The fruit, esp. the pineapple for breakfast is the best we have tasted. I love their mojitos as well. We stayed at the Yucatan last year and loved it too, and it's a little more lively, this was a tad stuffy and quiet but absolutely beautiful. Workers are constantly cleaning the grounds. Very impressive and we would absolutely go back. We've been to Mexico 3 times in 4 years and just love it. We feel safe and know this area thrives on tourism. We took a snorkel trip to cenotes and sea turtle cove and also felt safe with a great tour guide. That was a great trip! Book a shuttle service to the hotel in advance so when you arrive you know where you are going. You will be so happy when you get to the RIU Palace, I wish I was there right now.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, but there were 85 highschool spring breakers there”
Reviews.Author: indiabrooke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was highly recommended to us by friends who travel to Playa every winter. We carefully researched it and booked it with a clear understanding from the hotel that they don't allow spring breakers. They advertise that they don't allow spring breakers. There were at LEAST 85 high school spring breakers there the entire week, 40 from one high school alone. Every guest in the hotel complained about the rowdy crowd of teenagers who drinking all day, chanting and shouting in the pool, throwing footballs on the beach that kept hitting guests in the head, there was vomit one morning out by the pool, there was an unconscious teenager one morning in the sports bar, guests were complaining about random knocks on their door at 4:00am, one drunk teenager looking for another. The hotel kept telling all of the other guests that they couldn't keep them out because they came with their parents. The hotel did try their best to keep them under control, and by Monday things were ok. They must have known that all of those teenagers were coming together, there were 40 from one high school, 20 from another....I would stay here again and other guests said previous trips have been quiet, but I was definitely upset about the spring breakers. The good news is that there weren't crying babies and drunk, rowdy, too-old-for-that adults.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic trip”
Reviews.Author: flipflop12
Reviews.Content: Once again Riu Riviera Maya delivered. My husband and I returned one week ago. I was not going to write a review, but there have been a few negative reviews posted and I feel it is my duty to let you know of our experience. We have been to this resort 3 times in the past year. This visit was a lot busier than previous times. There was a group of spring breakers that came mid way our week. Yes it was more rowdy...but never did I have a problem getting a drink. I feel the level of service I recieved was just as good as my previous visits. This is where this hotel shines. The service is awesome. We were given a ground floor room and I did not care for the ground floor. I spoke with Xavier at the front desk and he moved me to a wonderful room the next day. He was very professional and effecient. Thanks to Omar also. The pool bartenders were really great. Marvin and Charlie made us feel very special and made great drinks. Isles in the lobby bar did a fantastice job also and makes a wonderful martini! The food was very good. The dinner buffet has different theme nights. My favorite night had lobster tails, crab claws, and shrimp. Luis in the dining room is the best! We ate at the Japanese restaurant which was very good. The shrimp dish is very yummy. My husband had the salmon and said it was just OK. We also ate at Krystal. It is their gourmet restaurant. We both had the filet and it was delicious. We were so full and did not want desert, but the waiter insisted that we try the chocolate volcano cake with vanilla icecream. ....wow....glad we did not miss it!! The breakfast buffet has something for everyone. Lunch was good too...pizza, pasta, fresh fish, chicken, burgers, dogs, mexican, salad, icecream....etc..... The pools are refreshing. The sun is hot this time of year so that the water is just perfect. The beach is breath taking. The water is the most beautiful color in the world. We did not go to the evening shows this time. We did enjoy the piano player in the lobby before dinner and the band in the courtyard after dinner, It was fun to be able to dance under the stars. This resort has everything my husband and I love. It is not stuffy, yet feels upscale. We can't wait to visit again!!

Reviews.Title: “Was very upset for the 1st time with Riu”
Reviews.Author: jaykay12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my son and some friends stayed at the Riu Palace Riveira Maya from 3/26 thru 4/2. This is the 5th time we have stayed at this resort and have always enjoyed ourselves in the past. This time was different! There were two groups of 40 football players (high school mind you!!) who were there with their parents and girlfriends. This in itself is not bad.....however, these kids were OUT OF CONTROL! There was no way you could use the pool bar. The kids were there screaming and yelling and doing shots and drinking! The issue here to me is since this is a "no spring breakers" resort, the parents should have taken responsibility for these kids when they were yelling, falling or vomiting all over the place. But this did not happen. Not once did I see a parent reprimand these kids. Oh....and did I forget? An ambulance was there on our first night giving an IV to one of the kids who was passed out in the LOBBY! The Riu needs to take notice of this! Other than these kids, it was great to see some of our favorite workers there. There's Alex (Mr. Okie Dokie) who works the beach starting at 10:00 a.m. then the lobby bar. There's also a little cleaner by the name of Candy who you will see cleaning the lobby/theatre area every night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - Spring Breaker Nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: Reeco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I consider ourselves to be very fair and easy going people who dont complain about things very often. At no fault of the hotel, about 100 loud mouth spring breakers showed up with their chaperones the day after we arrived. I realize we were all young once but this was brutal and the parents/chaperones were just as bad. They basically took over the hotel. We tried to enjoy some time at the pool but were interupted with these kids yelling drink orders over our shoulders as we patiently waitied in line. Hip Hop music was playing way too loud which is great if your 18 but not 35. The beach was much better and we were able to relax there. We thought we'd stop into the lobby bar for a drink before dinner and it looked and sounded like someones 16th birthday party. The staff got to a point of not caring anymore about the quality of drinks and level of service due to the lack of respect that was being shown to them by these kids. We checked out 2 days into our stay and spent the remainder of the week at a sister resort (Riu Palace Mexico) at no charge and had a fantastic time with a bunch of good, respectful and fun people. We found the Riu Palace Mexico to have a much nicer beach but the pool was a liitle dated but had a great swim up bar with cool caribean music being played at a nice noice level. Riu Palace Riviera Maya - I would highly recommend if you are 17-21 but not if you are a couple looking to have a nice relaxing weekend with some fun. We are done with the Riu and going back to Secrets next year.............Its worth the extra money!!

Reviews.Title: “pure heaven”
Reviews.Author: lel1_10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and service,couldnt find fault with anything, staff always on hand to cater for anything you wanted, without being overpowering. There was always someone cleaning and maid service was good, the rooms were large and well catered including fridge and toiletries. The beach is brilliant, and you can walk for miles in both directions. The only downside for us was being to near the sports bar, a little noisy as it is 24 hr, we will ask for somewhere different next as we wll definetly return.Thats the only reason for 4 stars on sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Spring Breakers”
Reviews.Author: lmsullivan12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the RIU Palace Tropical Bay in Jamaica last year and were so impressed that we decided to stay at another RIU this year. We chose the RIU Palace Riviera Maya since we visited the area in the past and fell in love with the people, the beaches and the culture. We read a few bad reviews about the resort, but we had read a few bad reviews about the RIU in Jamaica and were very satisfied there, so we didn't give them much creedence. We were wrong. First, the hotel has horrible acoustics. Someone walking down the hallway in flip flops sounds like they are an elephant in pumps. A whisper sounds like a shout. The doors slam shut, and this goes on all day and all night. Don't plan on getting any sleep. Not even a few hours. We were so exhausted we slept for 12 hours our first night back home. Second, the room smelled like mold and there was mold in the shower. They only gave us two towels and one washcloth; that's fine if it's for one person but as a female with long hair I need 2 towels. We had to tip the housekeeper every day and ask for more towels and water otherwise we didn't get any. The room was constantly damp as well. Third...the worst. On day three, about 70 high school students with chaperones showed up. Now, I was young once and remember the fun I had on trips so I usually don't mind the "fun" that spring breakers bring, but this was out of hand. The chaperones were so busy drinking themselves that they didn't pay any mind to the crazy drunk behavior of the teens they were supposed to watch. The 70 teens piled into the pool and spent the next three days drinking and screaming and fighting (of course never getting out of the pool the use the bathroom so where do you think they urinared???), and then spent the wee hours of the mornings running up and down the hallways screaming and banging on doors. They trashed the pool area and were rude to the hotel guests. The hotel staff did nothing to address this behavior and did a very poor job of cleaning up after them for a five star hotel. On 2 seperate occasions I saw used feminine hygiene products on the ground around the pool area. I was disgusted. My husband and I spent our vacation escaping to Playa del Carmen and Xel Ha just to get away from the dump that we were staying at. The only good thing about the hotel was the food and the beach. We will not be returning to this hotel ever. If you are looking for a nice resort look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, great staff, immaculately clean”
Reviews.Author: flojo43
Reviews.Content: Pros: The grounds at this hotel are breathtaking and spotless. The staff will do anything you request of them. There is a wide selection of food to please any palate. Be sure to reserve your restaurant reservations first thing when you arrive. You can book two restaurants at a time, up to three days in advance. We did not run into one unfriendly worker at this hotel. The beach is large with plenty of chairs for guests. You can walk into town along the beach or on the sidewalk in front of the hotel. The location is very pedestrian friendly for exploring Playa del Carmen and hopping the ferry to Cozumel. The location of the hotel is also very convenient for most excursions that Mexico has to offer. For you java junkies, there is a Starbuck's 7min. walk in Playacar and one 20 min. walk in shopping center right when you hit town. Cons: Corridors have marble floors that will carry the smallest sound down the hall. Every time a door closes, it makes a loud noise. ANY sound is magnified. We relocated to oceanfront after the first fitful night. After the switch, it was no longer a problem. The pillows and bed left something to be desired, but at least we could sleep. I was very disapponted with the workout facility. The building itself was great, but the equipment was outdated and in short supply. I did the 10Min. walk to the sister hotel and at least found some free weights. I discovered that the spa/workout areas are NOT OWNED OR OPERATED by the Riu. Subsequently, they have no standards to live up to. READ: IF YOUR WORKOUT IS THE HIGHLIGHT OF YOUR DAY, YOU MIGHT WANT TO CONSIDER ANOTHER HOTEL.( As for spa services, I enjoyed a great massage from Jorge). Now, for the pool. The kiosk for towels opens at 7am. If you wait until then to "save" your spot at the pool, you will be out of luck. Jockeying for pool chaises is THE WORST I HAVE EVER SEEN. It was so obnoxious. The hotel really needs to do something about this practice.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the spring breakers...”
Reviews.Author: livin4dawkend
Reviews.Content: Good- rooms and facility in general- clean beaches were not; a little surprised they didn't run a rake over it like most resorts do in the Caribbean. Drinks in lobby bar- yummo! Dirty Martini! Fair- service at beach- maybe we're just used to going during less busy times or smaller resorts but we got offered drinks maybe 2 times in the morning and then forget the afternoons. Reminder ask for liquor in your drinks when they come out of machines. Beds- hard but anything feels good after a day tanning and hitting the waves. Food- you get what you pay for; this isn't sandals. There's more than enough to chose from and drink service is best at meal times. We're not the kind of people to waste time waiting in line so we never got to go in a restaurant- no biggie, we weren't there for the food. Noise- try to request a quiet room even if it's further away from things- the halls echo because of the wood paneling. *we never saw roaches or any bug for that matter* The only thing bad about our trip were the inconsiderate, ill mannered guests! Seriously- don't come here during spring break! lesson learned. I can't blame a teenager for being loud and getting wasted but I saw of the worst behavior from adults. They wouldn't watch where they're going and one woman even ducked under a waiter that had a massive tray of dishes on one hand! Other than that you can ask and receive what you need; our fridge wasn't filled every day but if you call and ask it shall appear. We'll be back in the fall :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 2010LoveTheBeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RPRM from 3/15 - 3/22. Was impressed as soon as we walked into the lobby. Check-in went fairly smoothly, but once we got to our room discovered that it smelled like a cigar. Went back to the lobby and we were told that if we could wait until the morning, we would be moved. And we were! Mostly ate at the buffet which suited us just fine. Lots of variety and it was very good. Ate one night at the Brazilian ala carte, which was good.
