Wanted to try the Chilis and Agave but just never made it to the lobby at the designated time to get reservations. Used the recommended tour group (TrafficTour) and Dala was a great help! He helped us book a couple of excursions (FatCat catamaran and Xplor) and was fun to work with. Once we made it to our (final) room, we found it to be comfortable. We asked to be closer to the beach/pool so while we had to walk the length of the hotel to eat, we were close to our room while spending the day at the pool so we were able to use our own w/c and it wasn't an issue to run up to something from our room. The hallways were noisy but found that earplugs were very helpful. Make sure you pack some! Did not have any issues with bugs in our room nor was our room smelly. Went out to Coco Bongo's ... what a trip! Make sure you check it out and it's definately worth spending the money to go VIP there! Only one complaint: I managed to get sick and while I was trapped in my room the maid came in to clean. I witnessed her take the glasses in the bathroom and rinse them in the sink then use the towel she had been cleaning with to wipe them. I think I know how I got sick! You cannot drink the water in the room so brushing your teeth with bottled water is somewhat challenging. I used the glass provided by the hotel. Big mistake. I wish I would have packed a couple of plastic toss-away cups! I am glad that we chose this hotel and loved loved loved the location. Beach was great, ocean was beautiful. If you have any questions, please feel free to message me!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you, Riu, for making my wedding beautiful and effortless!”
Reviews.Author: kristinakmiller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I married at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya on March 18, 2011, right on the beach. We stayed at the resort with an intimate group of friends and family, and we were all more than pleased with the service, accommodations, and the resort overall. First, as a bride who initially fretted about working with a wedding coordinator in another country (and via email), if, god forbid, I ever had to do it again, I would have no hesitation with working with Ms. Nancy Hernandez. Everything was beautiful, flawless, and perfect; I could not have asked for a more accommodating coordinator. Everything I requested was met. It went smoothly. There was practically no effort on my end; I was presented with options via email, my husband and I chose what we wanted, and then, for clarification, we met with Nancy a few days before the wedding. Everything went as planned and was better than I ever could imagine. We had cocktails and appetizers in the Lirico Lounge, and Santos took extra special care of us. Our dinner was at Chili's, and our 2 waiters doted on us, hand and foot. Every intricate detail was taken care of. My husband and I were practically walking on air! I think our guests also had a phenomenal time. Also included in the package were room upgrades, a couple's massage, wedding cake, bouquet, minister, etc. P.S. The wedding cake, which was chocolate cake with strawberry filling and white icing, was sooooo rich, fresh, and delicious. They even delivered our flower arrangements (included) and cake up to our room the next morning! We also went during the "high season," and during spring break. Yes, the resort does discourage spring breakers, but since many people have the time off in the States, naturally people take advantage of a warm place like Mexico, so it was probably busier. With that being said, we were not able to take advantage of all of the specialty a la carte restaurants. You have to make reservations between 12-3, and you are definitely better off making reservations a couple of days in advance because spots fill up quickly...especially during the high season. If you cannot get a restaurant, you are still taken care of by an exceptional wait staff at Don Manolo's, the buffet. The choices are endless, and they do feature new items nightly. The wait staff effortlessly made sure our glasses were always full and our needs met between trips to the delicious buffet and whilst eating. The food was plentiful, rich, and tasty. Every time we ordered room service, it was delivered in a timely manner. My friends and I enjoyed going to Chili's for the lunch buffet. A woman named Gina will take exceptionally good care of you! Drinks were also plentiful. One thing I would recommend is bringing a mug or some sort of cup because the ones they offer are tiny....but they will fill up your mug all the way to the top. Islas was our favorite bartender; the espresso martinis and pina coladas were my favorites...as well as a plethora of shots of Don Julio and hot sauce. :) Because of our wedding package, we had an automatic upgrade (based on availability) to a room with an ocean view. The view was gorgeous. We did not have any complaints of our room, and we found our bed to be comfortable. We also found the resort to be very clean; I did not even see a gecko, and I had a friend tell me that they were everywhere! Unfortunately, wifi is only free in the lobby, but there is a sports bar where they have internet usage for a cost, which I am not sure what it was....I was having a little too much fun than having to be on a computer all day. ;) Most importantly, the staff was simply exceptional. They seemed to "know" us right after we checked in. Some even called us by name, and they have great senses of humor. We immediately felt comfortable with all of the staff. Every request we had, it was met instantly. The beach was a bit crowded, but I am not one who enjoys laying out all day either, so if I didn't get a lounge chair the second I was looking for one, it wasn't a big deal. They do open up. It was fun to go running on the beach; the sand was smooth, the turquoise waters were warm, and we even had fun night swimming on a few of the nights. The location of the resort is only about a 10-15 minute walk from 5th Avenue and the ferry to Cozumel. If you walk on the beach, it seems like the walk is even faster. And the shows were pretty entertaining, but a lot of shows in Mexico are similar. They have activities throughout the day as well, for both adults and children. I would definitely go back to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Not only did we have a wonderful experience, but we made memories that we will cherish forever.

Reviews.Title: “Roaches, Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovekoalas
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself will not be returning to a Riu ever in our life time...We purchased this trip and my husband wanted to see Beautiful Mexico for the first time!!! We stayed at the Riu from March 6th through March 12th. We payed a pretty price for a ruined vacation. They had to move us three times because of roaches. My husband and I were very sad about the whole experience. It all started at the beginning of our vacation. We complained, but we still saw those creatures. They managed to get into our suit cases and made it difficult to enjoy the trip through out the whole week!!! The whole thing just stayed with us during the entire experience and vacation..I have been sharing this story with my friends and family to not return to this RIU ever.....No more RIU's for us!!!! The country is beautiful and the people are wonderful and thank goodness for that!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This was one of our best vacations ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bethpinter
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived till the moment we left. We were awed when we walked into the hotel. We were mesmerized when we walked through the court yard to the pool. We were blown away when we had the buffet lunch by the pool. The staff was courteous and always willing to go that extra mile. I didn't like the fact that you had to get a shirt on and shoes before you could get lunch at the buffet by the pool, but I'm not going to let it bum me out when rules are rules. The young kids in charge of entertainment were GREAT. Tania, Hemana, Panda, David, Tony, Leo, Alex, etc!!!!!!!! These young people are why we are going to try to come back over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel... Not a five star.”
Reviews.Author: Chadreece2001
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good.... This Hotel is perfectly located. The beaches are very nice, and the pool area and bar were a highlight. Finding a drink was never a problem, you DO however have to ask for top shelf liquor, or you will be dissappointed. The area is safe and the taxi's are cheap and friendly, and plentiful. The beach party they threw us with the coconut drinks was the highlight of my trip... Now the bad: The restaurant situation is rediculous. They advertise that they have 5... 5 star restaurants... Yeah.. If you are lucky enough to get into one... You basically have to be in the lobby every day from noon to 3 to make sure you get a spot... First of all.. Who wants to wait in line in the middle of the day to get a spot in an all inclusive restaurant?? Secondly... The restaurants seat about 30 people... It is just false advertising.. It's kind of like saying WE HAVE 5 RESTAURANTS.. If you can stand on your head for five minutes and balance a ball on your nose... We ended up paying people off to get into the Restaurants... Which i guess if you don't mind doing that then... They are NOT all inclusive. Overall I love the area and will return, but it won't be to this Hotel. I think my taste has outgrown the RIU brand. Something I never thought I would say. PS. I am very easy to please, but I fealt like I spent my whole vacation catering to the Hotel instead of the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “"beautiful"”
Reviews.Author: Teresa J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from an amazing fortnight in the Riu Palace. The hotel is great, the location couldn't be better and as for the staff - Christina, Alex, Rosario to name but a few where a credit to the hotel. The beach is a gem, we don't bother with the pool - what's the point of sitting around the pool - you could be anywhere. The beach is lovely to walk along and only takes 10 minutes until you are in 5th Avenue. Walking the beach one day we saw a stingray and a turtle. Loads and loads of sunloungers. Alex would even bring drinks down to the beach. The entertainment staff worked hard always something going on if you wanted to get involved - I did try the coconut cocktails. A must. Walking around outside the hotel is great we did venture into the other Riu's - wouldn't give you tuppence for the Tequilla - lager louts and real bad atmostphere. The mexican was nice and we did eat there a couple of lunchtimes and have a few drinks there of an evening. The rooms itself were spotless we had asked for a quiet room and that's what we were given. There are optics in the room - vodka, brandy, whiskey and bacardi aswell as alcohol and soft drinks in the mini fridge. The food in the buffet restaurant is immense and we really enjoyed the ice and the fruit/vegetable sculptures. We did eat twice in the Steakhouse - Rosario is the manager here - I must say the steak here is the best my husband and I have tasted so good that we just had to go back. We tried the Brazillian - very good and also the Mexican twice again very good. We did the trip to Chitzenitza be warned it is a very tiring day but boy was it worth it. The Mayan ruins are immense and not what we were expecting at all. A great day out and a fantastic guide -Rex. In all I can't fault this hotel but then a holiday is only what you make it. We met some lovely people - All Americans who made our holiday even more special. Would I go back - the million dollar question - No - why - there are too many other places in the world that I would like to see. Would I recommend this hotel- most definetly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: BWM1977
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Playacar on March 12 for 6 nights. We were a group of two couples, with no children along. We had booked our stay at the Riu Tequila. When we arrived on Saturday night at 11pm, we were told we were being upgraded to the Palace. The hotel staff put us in taxi's, paid the fare, and transfered us to the Riu Palace Rivier Maya, which was about 1/2 mile down the road. Needless the say, this was quite an upgrade! While I'm sure we would have enjoyed our stay at the Tequila, the Palace was luxurious in comparison. Entering the lobby we first noticed all the crystal chandaliers, and the stained glass design above the largest chandlier. Beautiful. Our room was very comfortable, 2 double beds pushed together, with a step down area where there was a loveseat and coffee table facing the television. Our deck overlooked the tennis courts, and the hotel next door. We had a refrigerator in our room, as well as a coffee maker, and liquor dispenser. The bathroom was spacious and had a jetted bathtub. Our friends were initially offered a room that smelled very smokey. They were then given a different room that was laid out similar to ours. My husband and I have stayed at other all inclusive resorts in the RIviera Maya area. Granted, we had not stayed in the 5 star hotels, but they were quite nice. In comparison, the food at the Riu Palace was fabulous. Breakfast always had a cook making fresh omelets to your order. The fresh fruit was delicous. Lunch was served in Chili's restaurant overlooking the beach and ocean. Couldn't have asked for a better view. One day a chef was making Cerviche, which was a mixture of seafood, vegetables, lemon juice and topped with fresh avocado. Wow!! THe dinner buffet was fantastic, we had lobster, shrimp, beef tenderloin, paella, and more. We ate dinner in the Brazilian ala carte restaurant one night. It was very good, but we preferred the buffet where we could go eat at whatever time we wanted to, rather than at a set time. The swimming pools were sparkling clean and beautiful. The swim up bar was always a popular spot, especially on St. Patricks day. There is a grove of palm trees from the edge of the pool area to the beach where there are lots of lounge chairs. Then it is followed by a nice strip of beach with more lounge chairs. The chairs by the pool and beach did fiil up early in the morning. We put towels on chairs to reserve them after breakfast, because our first day we did not do that, and at 11, it was difficult finding 4 chairs together. The beach at Playacar is beautiful. We walked quite a ways in each direction, one day walking to Playa del Carmen, and the other day we walked in the other direction and explored all the other Riu resorts. Because we were staying at the Palace, we had access to all the Riu resorts. The staff at the Riu was extremely friendly and hard working. The waiters working around the bar area cover the pool and entire beach area for the guests and will bring drinks, and check on guests about every 15 minutes. Extraordinary service. We did leave tips for the housekeeping staff, and gave small tips to waiters and bartenders when they did a great job. One day we took an excursion to Aktun Chen. We ziplined, walked through a large cave, and swam in a cenote. Loved it. Our friends visited Coba, and they loved that as well. We are all hoping to return next year for another stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, or maybe a Riu Palace in another location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, wonderful staff, but could use a few improvements”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler1919
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to this hotel. Obviously, we really like it. The staff is the best of any hotel I've ever been to. And, we recognize the same staff from our prior trips. Everyone is friendly and eager to please. The food is good and the buffet has an excellent selection. The individual restaurants are just OK, but a nice break fromt he buffet. The rooms are spotless. If you want a chair by the pool, you have to get up early and park your towel and possessions on a chair. I'm not sure the solution to this problem, but if you're not there by about 9:30 you can't sit by the pool. After the first few days, we preferred the beach, where there are plenty of chairs and shade. The beach is beautiful and not too crowded. The equipment in the exercise room is mostly non functional and should be fixed and updated. The wi fi situation is terrible. The only place to get it is in the lobby and then it is a low bandwidth that fades in and out. It's impossible to call through Skype since the internet quality is poor or, at best, average. So, it's very difficult or impossible to conduct any business through the internet. Another annoyance is the computers in the Sports Bar. They charge $3 for 15 minutes of use and charge for printing. It 's independent of the hotel and the woman who runs it doesn't take credit cards and doesn't give change. This is really ridiculous and not in keeping with the quality of the hotel. The hotel should take this over and provide a few computers for the use of their guests. If you walk along the beach, you can reach Playa del Carmen in 20 minutes. It's a lovely walk and the town is VERY touristy but nice and safe, at least during the day. I haven't been there in the evening. We walked there twice. The trip to the hotel from Cancun airport is 1-11/2 hours. If this is your first trip to the Yucatan, definitely visit the ruins at Tulum. My whole family likes this hotel. It's safe for the kids and we all recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: lulu40314
Reviews.Content: I always say that after I return I am going to write a review on trip advisor because I use the site before I travel and I always forget , But this time I didn't. My husband and I just returned from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and It was amazing. This was our fourth trip to playa del carmen and oir second stay at the Riu. We were very apprehensive about returning due to all af the safety concerns going on in mexico, but we felt as safe there as we did 10 years ago when we went for the first time. We had great weather with the exception of an afternoon thunderstorm on one of the days we were there. The only ting I did not remember last time we were there was children. Somehow I did not remeber it not being (adults only) ,but all of the children were well behaved. Two excursions that we took and I highly recommend were the steak and lobster sunset dinner cruise and the snorkling excursion with roberto in which we got to see a sea turtle for the first time. we will defininetly return to playa.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: oshawafamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Maya Palace from the 10-17th. From arrival to departure our family trip was incredible. Service was incredible . Staff friendlier than any. Grounds were amazing!!! Food changed everyday and was delicious!!! Beach pristine. Entertainment staff incredible. "I WANT TO GO TO RIU!!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Can't find a thong wrong here”
Reviews.Author: hmiecz
Reviews.Content: Stayed march 11-16. Heres my take: 1) Just the right size. Big enough for all the luxury amenities but at the same time all the restaurants, pool and beach is a maximum 5 min walk from the furthest room. 2) Beach is fantastic, not a rock in site, water is perfect. 3) location is perfect. 10 minute walk from Playa Del Carmen and is safe in a protected compound called Playacar. PDC has a ferry which you can take for world class scuba in Cozumel. 4) Cleanliness? More like spotless. My mother-in-law is a clean freak and she was totally impressed with how much they clean there. I was hard pressed to find a cobweb anywhere. 5) Food was great . Yes you might be able to find a better 5 star restaurant in some other hotel somewhere but the restaurants here are great. 6) room was very nice. A multilevel design was quite welcoming and bigger than expected. Again, spotless 7) Service was fantastic, almost got annoying how much they asked you how well you were doing or do you need something else. Went diving in the cenotes with Dive adventuras (ask for Mario who is the best in the business.) Also did diving in Cozumel with Dive with Martin which was OK. As much as I want to, I can't possibly give any constructive negative feedback from this experience. Yes i might find a better beach or better food in a mega 5 star on some atol in the maldives but not in combination and certainly not for the money. Possibly the best value on earth. Does not cater to spring breakers which was very nice. Kids allowed but only saw maybe 20 the entire vacation. My first perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beware---No First Aid”
Reviews.Author: Iangow
Reviews.Content: I fell on a wet hallway. No wet floor warning sign. It too the front desk 1 hour to send an ice pack for my head to my room. When Omar arrived all he had was a jug of ice. No bag to put the ice in. They have no first aid attendants. You are on your own if you get hurt. For this reason I will never go back to Riu again. Not safe. When I made my report to the hotel I was told the floor was dry even though the cleaner was there with his mop. Nice cover up Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but....”
Reviews.Author: WheeloWirral_UK
Reviews.Content: Arrived in dark following 6.5 hr delay, effectively missing first day in resort (thank you Thomson...see my separate review), check in okay, room fine, beer in fridge /optics on wall, ordered room service, nice end to a long long day. Cleaning staff work hard & room spotlessly cleaned each day, with the odd towel animal on the bed. I was pleased to there were no mosquitoes, but I did have to kill a few small cockroaches in the room, but as others have mentioned, the resort is built in the jungle...just hope I bring nothing home with me.! We enjoyed our stay & overall would recommend the Riu R.P.M., but would make the following observations:- Smoking areas / non smoking areas,..... we are non smokers & don't particularly want to sit in other peoples smoke...unfortunately this happened on a number of occasions, whether it be at the poolside / restaurant or even on our balcony in the room (we had smokers either side of us & couldn't sit out some evenings because of our anti social neighbours). Perhaps the hotel could have more non-smoking rooms together? The dress code for hotel restaurants in the evening need to be more strictly enforced. English men should not bother packing any decent clothes with you...you will be in the minority & will be wasting your time / space in your case.. Most males from 'the Americas' staying in the hotel just wore shorts t-shirts /sandals / flip flops every evening (most looked quite scruffy & looked as though they hadn't bothered changing from a day at the beach). We saw no one turned away from restaurants / bars, despite the fact that they were fragrantly violating the dress codes signs displayed outside each one.. Gym was dated & poorly equipped & needs upgrading. Evening entertainment was bit 'hit & miss' could be better. It was our first stay in a Riu, but speaking to fellow residents who had stayed in their other resorts, felt it was poor compared to others. We stayed in Sensatori Crete last year & Riu didn't match its entertainment standards.

Reviews.Title: “excellente”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter60
Reviews.Content: Well this was our 2nd visit to RPRM and it was everything like the 1st time excellente.The manager Xavier should be very proud of his staff,there is nothing they would'nt do for you.Aslas the lobby barman was was very polite to all his customers and very good at is job making all sorts of cocktails which were very nice let me tell you.Then there was Isias,alex.Ledo.Pedro,Santos from the pool bar. Food was very good,there was something for everyone. The reception staff were also very obliging,we did'nt like the first room they put us in opposite the next hotel with generators going all night,so the next day they moved us to the quiet part of the hotel.Animation team very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here!!”
Reviews.Author: pookieanddd
Reviews.Content: Everthing here is perfect. It is definately a palace. The staff is amazing, the food was amazing, its super clean ( it sparkles). The only thing you are personally responsible for is showering and dressing yourself, everything else is taken care of. Anyone who has something bad to say about the riu palace must have a sharp pole jammed right up their you know what. Its absolutely perfect and has something for everyone. The rooms are all beautiful and kept very clean by the maids daily, everything in the mini bar is restocked as needed (and u dont have to ask). The view depends on what room you get, but in my opinion for the amount of time you spend in the room who cares! But if you want a great view i highly recommend a jacuzzi suite. Its walking distance to downtown Playa del carmen, which is nice but try to shop further down around fifth and 10th street, its a bit more laid back( meaning u dont have people pulling you into their stores driving you crazy). The ferry to Cozumel is about $14 per person one way, if you go here be sure to visit paradise beach and find a shop in town that sells the almond tequilla that they make locally. Its inexpensive and tastes awesome. As far as excurions, we did Xel-ha with the Swim with dolphins, and the 4x4 jungle adventure with the cenotes . Both were awesome! We will definately be going back! you will love this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: romanticrn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose a four night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. After reading many reviews, we decided that this would be a good choice. We have previously enjoyed our stay at the Rui in Punta Cana, DR. We have been to Cancun twice and this was our first visit to Mayan Riviera. Upon arrival, we were greeted pleasantly and then escorted to the reception area by the bell-boy. The receptionist offered us a tropical drink, then proceeded with the check-in process. We upgraded to a suite and were pleased. Our room was spacious and clean. However, it did feel a bit humid and a slight odor of must was present, but nothing unexpected. Our suite number was 1115 and the balcony faced the water, which we were informed that we could not see, and the courtyard. The maids kept the room spotless. The in-room bar and refrigerator were stocked daily with beer, soda, and water. The mattress was firm but, it did not stop us from getting a good night's sleep. The food was abundant and excellent. For breakfast, my favorite meal, the buffet could not have been any better. There were eggs any style, many different meats and cheeses, fruits and juices, all kinds of breads, tea and coffee, and tasty warm doughnuts. Room service was not needed. When lunch time came neither one of us were hungry but the food looked so inviting we managed to try something anyways. All lunch-time goodies were available. We had dinner at the buffet twice which was supplied with seafood such as;lobster, shrimp, clams, etc: meats; steak, pork, chicken: lots of vegetables, and many different choices for dessert. The buffet has something for everybody. Other nights we dined at the Brazilian Grill, where the food was excellent here, and Chilis. The beach had two sections. The upper beach, closest to the hotel, had palm trees which provided shade. The lower part of the beach is where we sat. There were plenty of chairs. The pool was comforting. It had its usual pool chair hogs but chairs can still be found. Something to eat or drink was always being offered or available close by. We all know shopping is within walking distance and tours are available. We chose to spend a day on the island of Cozumel. So, we took the thirty minute boat ride. TIP- remember things always cost less when you get there. We rented a scooter and off we went. About twenty minutes into our ride across the island, we had lunch at Coconuts. It was typical tourist stop. We had fun. Overall we enjoyed every minute of our vacation. We would highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation- clean, safe, fun”
Reviews.Author: jimbo1904
Reviews.Content: I have read a lot of reviews prior to going on this trip and was a little concerned about some of the negative reviews. From a parent of a 6 month old in his mid-thirties, this place had everything.... i really dont get some of peoples negative remarks. But i guess people can say what they want. I was most impressed with the cleanliness, workers, and location. The workers were probably the friendliest people i have ever met. They literally cleaned every inch of the grounds each morning, and you see the same workers each day. The hotel was about 45 min south of airport along a beautiful beach. There is a stretch of palm trees on the beach between the pool and ocean so you can have shade and be on the beach. The food was mostly fantastic but the lunch buffet was only average. They have sit down service (have to reserve between 12-3 so if you are early, ask them at the front desk where to sign up- if you dont get a table, you can do the buffet) and they fill up quick so please ask. The dinner buffet was the best i have ever had- considering its buffet food. All in all i could not have hoped for a better hotel and trip.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Lois40955
Reviews.Content: My husband andI just returned from Mexico and had a wonderful time, food and statt were wonderful top knotch. I do think the beds are horrible and REALLY should be replaced! I think at least during our stay the area of playa del carmen seem geared towards older folks ok for us, but if I was 20 I would be very disappointed! No energy!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda boring.”
Reviews.Author: Zymeout
Reviews.Content: The resort is sadly lacking in things to do. Drinking and eating are the main activities. Walk down the beach to the other Rius. There is life there. I will not stay here again not good value for me.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: woowoo461
Reviews.Content: Not happy with original room since the view was the back of the kitchen. Spoke with the front desk and after awhile they moved us to a better location - the next day. The workers could not do enough for you -- they were the ones that made the hotel! The food was pretty good. The all-inclusive drinks need alot of work. It took four days before I found a drink that I liked. I thought the drinks were watered down and the mixers were terrible. Other than that, had a great stay - beach and pool were marvelous. There was room service which was a real treat. You could have coffee first thing in the morning and a snack late at night if you chose. Wish that there was a disco there as well - which would make the guests stay there instead of going into the town.

Reviews.Title: “"BEST OF THE BEST!" SIX STARS + ******+”
Reviews.Author: gneher
Reviews.Content: We have traveled extensively internationally in many 5 star resorts, but this one should get 6 or even 7 stars. The site is MAGNIFICENT, like being in your own estate or castle! The dining couldn’t be better even if you had a private chef. The main restaurant served numerous buffets for each meal with anything and everything anyone could desire. The service was OVER THE TOP. These employees are not only happy and enthusiastic to provide you with fantastic service, but are truly sincere and treat you like a millionaire and better. We couldn’t have asked for a better place or better anything if we could dream of the most elaborate experience. If you plan on a trip to the Cancun area, this is the ONLY PLACE you will need to go to. A TRUE EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME and we will return several times per year!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach, accomodations; average food, drinks and service”
Reviews.Author: AFlaum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned in the Mayan Riviera 4 years ago. We stayed at the Excellence then and loved it. Recently, when we decided we wanted to book a beach getaway, the Excellence was very expensive and I had heard good things about the RIU Palace Riviera Maya, so we booked it. The people at the reception desk were unfriendly, unhelpful and, at times, outright nasty. The system for restaurant reservations is ridiculous and the fact that we were unable to make a reservation for the night we arrived was ridiculous as well. The fusion restaurant was decent but the other ones were just terrible for dinner. The breakfast buffet, on the other hand, was great. Lots of fresh juices and anything you could want to eat for breakfast. The beach (and beach access) was wonderful. While the drinks were small and weak, the servers were sure to make constant rounds on the beach to be sure we had everything we wanted. If you don't care a lot about high quality food and you want to spend your day at the beach, this is a good choice. We didnt spend any time at the pool but if that's your thing, it looked like the hotel staff worked vary hard to entertain everyone at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOULTELY AMAZING-HAVE NO WORRIES!!!!”
Reviews.Author: natb87
Reviews.Content: Have absolutely no worries when reading up and booking this hotel - it was simply outstanding! Definately a 5* hotel in a brilliant resort (I do not understand why anyone would speak poorly about it!) My boyfriend and I stayed here from Feb 20th - Mar 6. (We have just come home - very sad) We had a wonderful time! Greeted really pleasantly at the reception (no issues wit Xavier - he was very helpful!) and all the staff were friendly and helpful! Had a Junior Suite, which had a step down living area and made it feel very luxurious with a huge walk in wardrobe, massive bathroom (2 sinks and big bath and great shower) Room cleaned every day - yes they were always cleaning everywhere!! You cant say this isnt a clean hotel! And yes there was a slight smell of "sick" on the stairs leading to the coutyard from lobby - but I think it could only be the cleaning fluid as there never was any sick and it wasn't every day. Pools were great (little dirty from time to time - mainly coming from the pool bar - which was always busy!) You do have to get up at crack of dawn to get a sunbed which is just pathetic, however i prefered the beach as it was less noisy and had a lovely sea breeze. Beach beautiful white sand, sea (when not toooo choppy as it was on occasions) was beautiful clear, crystal turquoise in colour. And even some friendly large fish graced our presence on those days! Food was plentiful! Lots of fried, lots of salad, cheese, ham, fruits, pizzas, pastas, fish, steak, meats, etc etc etc! No one could go hungary! Not a single person should have the cheek to complain about the food here! The A La Carte restaurants were brilliant! Our favs being KRYSTAL and the JAPENESE. They were divine. Chilli's as a STEAKHOUSE at night was great too, and the MEXICAN and BRAZILLIAN were fine also, but starters were buffet which i was a bit sad about. However, the buffet restaurant was brilliant also!!! Plenty to choose from, themed nights but still had all the usual stuff, who has lobster at a buffet!! Yes they do!! Tipping we didnt feel we had to do - we tipped occasionally - 20 Peso's here and there. Every other day in the room, The waiters treated us impeccibly even without constantly tipping! CHAMPAGNE all the way - yes it is probably sparkling wine, but so is Champagne - just gets that title because of where its from. Go down the cocktail list, have as many drinks as you like, the waiters are more than happy to please :D Resort was great - about 5 mins away left of hotel is a Plaza with stools and shops, silver, drug stores, clothes, lots of silver! but barter, barter, barter with the silver. Its all done by weight and they want to make a sale at the end of the day so would take a big cut! This goes the same with the shops in Playa Del Carmen, 5th Avenue. They all sell the same things so keep looking round before buying something straight away - you may find it at a much better price! 5th Avenue was a 20 min walk along fancy villas/houses of Playacar (the complex that the hotels are situated in) Beautiful walk and even came across ruins!!!! Book the tours through the company at the Plaza - they're great and soooooooo much cheaper than your travel agent! We got 2 trips for the same price as 1 of the ones Thomson were offering - and they were the same trips! DEPARTURE TAX!! - Has to be CASH - dollars (not sure of the amount) Peso's - 640 and ENGLISH POUNDS - £38. Brilliant Holiday - you'll have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Playa”
Reviews.Author: nmhaag
Reviews.Content: Our trip was fabulous! Even with the stomach bug we both caught towards the end.... We arrived at the Riu Tequila only to be told they had no room for us so we were transferred to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Absolutely gorgeous!!!! The only negative I have is about the beds. Extremely uncomfortable. Other than that, we have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!!!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSun
Reviews.Content: We arrived back March 5, 2011, and thought this resort was exceptional. The service is fantastic, the location spectacular, and the whole trip was top notch. We had a superior room and the front lobby staff was great in getting us the room I requested. It's our third time to a RIU Palace and it won't be our last. I won't go on, but I can basically guarantee you won't be disappointed with this resort. -Graham

Reviews.Title: “All looks and no charm”
Reviews.Author: CornwallBurrows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 21 nights on arriving we did not have a well come drink which we did notice other people got.When shown to our room we had a strong smell of damp we asked for another room but the hotel was full,after a week the smell did go.But we did have problems with damp clothes the whole time we were there and we were on the top floor!! The pool seating area was very limited if you liked sittting right on top of each other you would love it,not for me i like abit of room. Food was just ok did not change much over the time. The waiters were great allways happy to help and the sports bar was good ,Vicktor the barman was the best likes giving you shots! The hotel is about fifteen minutes walk to 5th avenue which is great for shopping has bars and night clubs,be awhere when eating out to ask if the tax is all ready on the price of the food and drink if it is not they will add 10% to your bill. we sayed in the Palace Mexico three years ago and i wished we had gone back there.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: stonemiller
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Valentine’s day weekend and had the time of our lives! Can’t say enough good things about the RPRM. Beautiful lobby, immaculate grounds, the food was fresh, delicious with great variety and the rooms spacious and very clean (if a bit damp). But what made the resort special is the staff. Amazing, friendly and accommodating--they even anticipate what you need and provide it before you have a chance to ask for it! They literally blew us away with their service. Would definitely return and highly recommend this resort. Also, I’ll remark on the great entertainment. Normally resort entertainment is cheesy but I really enjoyed the fire dance performance, the live music on the plaza, the Mayan show and the dance tribute to American movies. I also liked the mobile lobby coffee cart with the flaming coffee/ice cream drinks. The day long excursion to Xplor adventure park is really fun and worth the high ticket cost: the caves are cool and the zip-lining is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort..Great location..Great service! Some tips also”
Reviews.Author: kay2four
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time staying in an All-inclusive resort. 1st 5+ star, and the nicest place we've been to. One of the nicer features of the hotel was its location. It was about 50 minutes from the airport with only one stop right next door to us. The riu is on a nice deep beach in a gated community called Plyacar. Its rather large as there are maybe a dozen big resorts and many homes and a golf course within the walls. Also a small shopping area a 5 minute walk from the riu within Playacar. Playacar is directly south of Playa Del Carmen and you can walk the sidewalk right to 10 ave (one block from 5th), which is the walking area with all the shops in playa. Also the beaches in Mexico are all public so you can walk to playa on the beach the entire way. (probably 20 minutes). The first thing I noticed at the riu was the amount of staff. They wait on you constantly. There are at least 5 or 6 girls cleaning the lobby and straightening the lobby every morning. People keeping the food restocked and cleaning up after the guests at the buffets etc, Yard workers, waiters...You'll see. The palaces are the nicest of the riu's as we went to most of the others and this was easily the nicest. Rooms were all mini-suites and very clean and comfortable. I liked the fact that the safe was large enough for ny laptop to fit. A couple tips: Beware as the timeshare sellers and some merchants are pretty aggresive at trying to get your business. Its still a shopping experience worth doing. We did a timeshare at the occidental, and it wasn't even close. Don't bother to exchange dollars for pesos as they wont exchange back for you when you leave. Most everyone takes dollars (12.3 to 1 at the time) but some give 11 or even 10 to 1. All give back pesos in change. So take like twewnty's as its hard to get us change for hundreds. There is a Walmart in Playa and they give the 12 to 1 . There is really no snorkelling at the riu beach as it is all sand and you need reef for fish. you can book good trips for that. We were there when there was 97% capacity and got chairs by the pool early the first day, and found it really wasn't necessary. As long as you weren't waiting till like 10 or 10:30 there were chairs either on the beach or by the pools. Ok the food: Im not a buffet guy, but breakfast is always a good buffet. They had an omelet station every day, and the usual stuff. I thought their bacon was excellent. Lunch....... we ate either at chilis (the buffet by the pool which had more burgers and dogs) or the main buffet. (which had the better ice cream). Was ok. Always can find something . Dinners...... We only ate at the buffet 2 nights as I much prefer sit down. The japanese I would call good. The Brazilian I would call ok. The Mexican was ok to good. We didn't eat at the fusion. Chili's was the best so we ate there twice and would have again but there was a wedding there our last night. The reservations worked like this: Someone was in the lobby bar area daily noon to three, Each day you can book dinner for that day and the next two. But you can only book two each day. Each day when you get there that day is booked up in all the restaurants, so you book the following 2 days. We never had an issue as we were always booking the following day or two. For example we arrived on sunday and sunday all were booked, so we booked mon and tues wherever we wanted. on monday we booked wed. etc. Also if you really want a specific place and its booked we were told to arrive on time (there are 2 seatings) and let them know and in a few minutes someone always no-shows and they will seat you . We found the nightly shows to be ok(not the best) but was worth doing. A bit surprising was when they allowed vendors to set up in the courtyard (almost nightly) they were rather pushy also. Overall I believe you cannot go wrong at this resort and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Verrrrrrrry Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tankersheboyganfalls
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week ay Riu Palace Riviera Maya and what can I say but Just do it! Everything from the weather to the hotel property to the staff to the food to the service to the location was excellent, Stayed at this hotel 2 years ago and enjoyed it just as much this time. Can't remember ever staying anywhere else that is this clean. I'd like to also give a great big thanks to Nicholas, Gina, and one of the nicest hosts we've met Rosario. Thanks to all of them and the entire staff we had an excellent vacation and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: footballwidow1111
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico & we were originally booked at the Palace Mexico, but upon arrival, were told we were being 'upgraded' to the Palace Riviera Maya (obviously, they had overbooked). No complaints-beautiful surroundings at every turn...amazing beach-definitely could get used to lying under a palm tree every day, listening to the ocean! The service was excellent-the staff works extremely hard & your glass is never empty. The lobby bartender (in the evening), Islas (?spelling of his name) was fabulous & VERY good at what he does, almost too good, judging the way I felt the next morning! I don't think we realized just how bad we needed that vacation until we got there & just had day after day to doing nothing...no schedule (we did not do any excursions & that was just fine!). The food was excellent-always something different & we very much enjoyed the two restaurants we made reservations for: the Rodizo/Brazillain & Krystal. The 'welcome drink' at the Brazillian restaurant became my drink of choice for the remainder of our time there (the caipirenia-I think is the correct spelling), anyway, it's basically a mojito without the mint & tastes like drinking flavored H2O & Islas makes them the best! Do have at least one when you are there! The mattresses could be a little softer, but then again, who is there to sleep! It was very hard to return to a cold & snowy Michigan & I'm already planning our trip back next year-can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Irish89
Reviews.Content: I've traveled extensively in Mexico (particularly the Mayan Riviera). You can check out my other reviews. This place set a new standard. Location: I've always been a fan of Playa Del Carmen. Fifth Avenue is a shopping and tourist's delight. Anytime you can stay withing walking distance of town, it's a definite bonus. The Riu Palace was an easy 20 minute walk up the beach to get into the heart of town. Beach: Beautiful beach. Lots of palm trees providing natural shade. Pure, soft, white sand and crystal clear water. Resort: Top notch. Very classy. Very elegant. Very clean. Service: Here's where this place really excels. Mexican resorts are known for their great service. (As opposed to Jamaica, where they take the phrase "No problem" as little too seriously). But this place was awesome. I had a problem with my coffee maker in my room. It almost felt like they were knocking on my door with a solution before I could even put my phone back in the cradle. In fact, when the gentleman from the front desk realized I had a problem, and he could see that sincere look of coffee-need in my eyes, he had room service deliver up coffee without even asking if that would make me happy. He just knew. I could go on and on with more examples of the great staff there. Clearly, the management is superb. Room: Great beds. Mexican resorts are known for their firm beds. You'll see many complaints of the hardness of the beds on these sites. If you like soft beds, good like finding them in Mexico. As good fortune would have it, I like a firm bed. Slept like a baby. Only complaint with the room was that the TV was way off to the side from the beds. They had a nice little sitting area in front of the TV. But it was nearly impossible to watch TV from bed. A lot of people like to wind down in front of the TV before going to bed. Hard to do here. Bathroom was clean. Jetted tub was a nice touch. I've read some complain about the noisiness in the halls. This is somewhat true here, but is somewhat true at most resort in Mexico. Here the tip: you're at one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. Don't stay in your room anymore than you have to! Pool: Adequate pool. Most places like this have a swim up pool bar. For most this means a couple of submerged "bar stools". Here, it's an entire area with little "booths". They have re-defined the swim-up pool bar. Food: OK. Before I go any further, I must make sure that you don't think I'm being paid by the resort for this review. In the past 5 years, I've been to nearly a dozen resorts in Mexico and the Caribbean. I'm not a push-over, but I'm not hard to please either. I'm a moderate. Why am I giving this disclaimer? Because I'm getting ready to brag on the food. Many all-inclusives have a hard time getting the food right. It's typically "OK". I didn't have a bad meal here. The breakfast buffet was particularly outstanding. The Riu chain has a strong European influence. They had breakfasts appealing to the American, European and Mexican palette. Dinners were quite good too. I recommend making your reservations for the non-buffet restaurants as early as you can (i.e., right after you unpack). They fill up quickly. If you don't get around to that, hand around the front at dinner time with a healthy tip. That helps too. As a final note, I want to re-iterate that I am not a push-over for these places. I am fairly picky. This place is just that good.

Reviews.Title: “Had tears in my eyes when it was time to leave...”
Reviews.Author: Researcher05171992
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. We traveled with my husband, myself and our 4year-old child. The hotel is truly like a palace and when it was time to go and Hector loaded us into our van I had tears in my eyes- he said no one ever wants to go home. He played with our son one last time and off we went to Cancun airport. The room was incredible. Temperature perfect. Didn't notice the smell- but I LOVE humidity so maybe I am biased. The buffet was very good and we did not make it to one of the specialty restaurants but we were with a small child and trying to make him wait for dinner at the end of the long day wasn't in the cards for us- but again we heard the restaurants were excellent. I loved the pool and it was a big highlight for all ages! We didn't get to the spa but next time will! The beach was incredible but the water was rough and my 4 year old could not go in by himself. My husband had to hold him the whole time- we were last there in June (2000) and the water was like glass. Now we know go back in June... I read these reviews for six months. The place is incredible. The entertainment for the kids and adults top notch. The whole lay out was done with the strategy to combine guests so they can mingle and go back up to their room for a nice quiet night of sleep. We stayed in Room 2037. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace was amazing”
Reviews.Author: pmb5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this wonderful resort. Eight of us just spent a week here and it was amazing. The food was outstanding along with the staff. The main buffet was the place to eat. We ate at the steakhouse and the brazilian house...both were good but do not compare to the main buffet. Also we did not want to be tied down to reservations which you must make to eat at the restaurants. The pool was fun and the pool bar is awesome but the pool is a little on the cool side. Didnt stop us though from enjoying several drinks in the pool, The beach was awesome and no trouble getting chairs at all. One of the couples did have a musty room but were able to change rooms immediately without any problem. The whole resort is meticulous!!!! One would have to search really hard to find anything negative with this resort. .

Reviews.Title: “First time at a RIU............Overall nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: markinnova
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to a RIU hotel, having stayed at Iberostars (8x), the Valentin Imperial Maya, and Barcelo (3x) in the past. I guess you can say we are Iberostar fans, but we were anxious to give the RIU brand a try. We choose the top-of-the-line RIU Palace Riviera Maya. The following points are made to assist others planning a visit and are not complaints. We had a very nice time at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya in mid February and do not let the little things bother us and ruin our stay. The Hotel and grounds are gorgeous and very well maintained. As others have said, the beds are hard and the linens very rough. Soundproofing of rooms was nonexistent - lots of noise from the hallway and your neighbors. Our room was nice; although the bathroom had a water leak from above and the bathroom floor was constantly soaked. We advised RIU staff several times, with no response. We then called the front desk (2x) who eventually had it addressed by RIU Maintenance. When we returned to our room after lunch, we unfortunately found that maintenance used epoxy sealant to try to seal the leak (instead of finding the source of the leak). Epoxy is hazardous to breath for at least the first 12 hours. Our room was not livable and we had to be moved to a different room. The bartenders and servers were friendly, engaging, and fun. We especially loved Islas at the Lobby Bar and Antenor (?) at the Pool Bar. The Front Desk Staff, as others have noted, is unhelpful and borderline rude. When asked directly about lunch options, they told us the only place to have lunch was Chili’s at the beach. Two days into our stay, we found out the Main Buffet was open for lunch (1PM -3 PM). The lunch food there was great compared to the lunch at Chili’s. Loungers around the pool were saved VERY early. We woke up at 6 AM on our last day to watch the sunrise and we encountered people already saving their spots around the pool, with many already loungers already saved. The food was overall good. We ate at the Don Manolo Buffet twice for dinner and 3x for lunch. Buffets were very good. For the Specialty restaurants, we dined at the Mexican (Appetizers good, I loved my beef entrée, my wife did not care for her shrimp-overcooked and rubbery), the Brazilian (good overall, except the beef was overdone), the Japanese (good all around), but the Krystal Fusion was very disappointing (tried to be too creative and do too much). Nightly entertainment in the Piazza before the Show. The nightly shows were ok. There is no nightclub on-site. You have to walk about 7 minutes to the Nightclub at RIU Tequila. Note, RIU Palace does not offer a golf cart ride to/from the club (Iberostar does). With my wife in heels, we would not walk the distance. We heard that wireless internet was available in the Lobby. We took a laptop and found the internet excruciatingly slow, almost unusable. The beach was great - manicured and raked every morning, lots of sunloungers, plenty of locations for shade or sun. Overall from our experiences, the RIU Palace Riviera Maya would be on par with the Iberostar Lindo, but it is not as nice as the Iberostar Maya and certainly not the Iberostar Grand. We would stay there again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip, hotel, and wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: manda_3347
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at 3 previous Riu's and we loved all of them. We went to our friends wedding in February 2010 at the Riu Palace Mexico and that's how we decided to have our wedding at this hotel!! The staff was awesome!! Never had any issues with the front desk, wait staff was amazing and very attentive, hotel was immaculate, beach is awesome!! The pool was very cold but when you are in Mexico we could care less. Nancy Hernandez was our MICE manager for our wedding and she did awesome. I would recommend the Caprice package...it allows you to have all you need! We went with a group of 30 people and all of them loved the hotel. My parents and their friends went to a Iberostar last year and they loved this one more. Everyone loved the food at the hotel. So when trvaleing with 30 people I figured there would be some people not happy with something, but I never heard one negative....well except that there was no Corona in the hotel, but we loved the Dos Equis and all the mixed drinks ( I recommend the Carribean Orange and Chocolate Martini). We look forward to going back very soon!! You will love this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Food, Staff and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Acerfox
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were Married here and our stay was awesome. Our trip started out with a damp dark room on the bottom floor facing another hotel. They were happy to upgrade us 3 times! Our stay was 15 days and our last 8 days were in a suite facing the ocean over the pool! Everytime a better room opened up they asked us if we would like to change rooms! The food was better then I could imagine, and everyone was super nice. The pool boys brought us two drinks at time and knew us by name. The maids made us dinosours, swans and elephants out of our towels and spare blankets. The shows at night are cheezy but fun, the night market is a little anoying and way over priced. The only lame thing was our wedding planner was all over the place, I had to call her half hour before the wedding to find out what was going on, she seemed curious as to why i had called. She also forgot to tell us we need blood tests, which we knew we did but read online a doctor would come to our room. We ended up waiting in a group of couples in an upstairs bar above the lobby in RIU palace mexico. Not very personal but whatever. We also did not recieve a wedding gift, which was part of the wedding package. The spa was also a total rip off, way more then I would ever have pay at home and half as good. I had to laugh at makeup it was so bad! My hair was ok and my mani/pedi looked good but don't expect anything but bare minimum attention to you for top dollar. I do makeup professionaly so i fixed myself up no problem but i didn't want to have to do my own face on my wedding day. They had one girl to do all of the above so, there's the problem right there. They over charged us as well so watch out for that!!. The Spa I believe is NOT actually part of the RIU hotel so it is no blame to them at all. The photographer we had was super hands on and really friendly and cool. His name is Carlos and if you get him your in luck! he made us feel really comfortable and even gave us a ride back to our hotel later on! his pictures were great and he made us laugh the whole time!! Joe the bartender was our man, he was even in one of our wedding pics! We can't wait to come back for our one year and see everyone again, It was really great time!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Redhatter-2
Reviews.Content: Once again we choose a Riu Palace for our getaway. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya lived up to and met every one of our expectations. We found the food exceptional and managed to make a reservation for each of the five specialty restaurants without much effort--well worth the short wait at noon in the Lobby Bar. The Buffet is top-notch, serving great food in the morning and evening. We enjoyed unlimited lobster tails the evening we arrived--impressive to say the least. We have travelled extensively throughout the world as well as several Cruise ships having said that our expectations are somewhat high. This would be our fourth Palace vacation, we do always reserve the SUITE which is large and beautiful. The extra space is so worth the extra dollars--seperate living area, walk-in closet, hugh bathroom with jacuzzi as well as a two level outdoor balcony with a jacuzzi for two and in this case a fabulous ocean view. The staff work so hard to please the guests, someone is constantly cleaning something--the place is immaculate. If you're thinking of going, don't hesitate--this Resort is a little piece of heaven--ENJOY!!! Many thanks to management who made our Anniversary extra special and unforgetable.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: myol80
Reviews.Content: We've been to many RIU"S & never disappointed. This has been our very fave. I cannot believe some of the bad reviews we have read. We have nothing bad to say about the place....very clean, friendly & could always find something to eat. the beds are firmer than what we prefer but no biggie. We went with 7 other couples & they loved it as well. We stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico last year & enjoyed that one also. If we go back to Riviera Maya will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: lofor1
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. I looked at some of the negative reviews on here after I had already booked, so was a bit nervous. I just can't believe there are people that would complalin about the food, etc. We loved every aspect of the food, both the buffetts and the specialty restaurants. The only problem is we came home with more pounds on than we started with. The junior sweets were adequate. We were quite comfortable there. We did ask for the additional pad for the bed, which makes a huge difference. We were so impressed with how hard all the people were working there. The service was wonderful! We would definitely stay there again. The only complaint I had was the dicounted golf coupon we had. The coupon was for $70 to golf, but at a course in Cancun (an hour away). The course across the street was $200. One other item........ the wi-fi is only in the lobby, and it is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “bad front desk service”
Reviews.Author: jackie_le3
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and 13 year old daughter. The Hotel was spectacular! There was alot for us to do and the hotel staffs were super friendly and helpful. Unfortunately I can't say the same for the staffs at the front desk. It's amazing how you are staying in a 6 star hotel and have the rudest front desk people assist you. Some advice for those of you who are traveling to this location. 1) Try to convert your dollars into small pesos, this is good for taxi rides into town, phone calls to the spa or tips you are planning to give to any hotel staff. The front desk will not give you change and their conversion rate is not in your favor. Or just bring small dollar bills, $5's and $1's are ideal. 2) Since it is all inclusive and upon checking in, the front desk will not tell you that you will need to make dinner reservations in advance. The buffet serves great food and have a different theme to offer you each night. But if you would rather have a quiet dinner, these reservations are needed to make days in advance and the host would only be in the lobby from 12pm-3pm. By 230pm if there is no one in line to make reservation, she will leave early. Reservations are needed to made in person, you can not call and the front desk don't have a contact number for her. 3) If for any reason you would like to leave the hotel to get into town, go on any tour, or have any questions, the staff at the front door will quickly get you a taxi, or the tour guides in the lobby would give you the best answers to any of your questions, accurately and more politely than the front desk. 4) There is no emergency center in the hotel, please check for the closest doctor in case of an emergency. However there is a pharmacy in that location, but the front desk will not have that number for you. You will need to leave the hotel and go to the bottom lobby to access the pharmacy. 5) The gym equipments are outdated and some of them don't work. But the weather and the location of the hotel was nice for us for our morning jog. Overall our family had a great trip. The hotel is clean and the people are always smiling and friendly. If you do not need assistant from the front desk, just don't use them, they will just upset you.We will travel to this location again but would not stay in this hotel. Everyone have a different experience, this was ours.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. WE WILL RETURN!”
Reviews.Author: mike8758
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but great things to say about this resort. The service was outstanding, the food was very nice and the atmosphere was awesome. Perfect beach. If there was any down side it was a bit lacking in verity of night life. But the other Riu hotels near by had night clubs at the ready which you are welcome to attend under the all inclusive umbrella. We went with 4 couples and had a wonderful time. One thing that I should mention for the modern traveler, the only place with wireless internet is the lobby area. No internet in the rooms or on the grounds. Seems like a minor thing but if you have to check in with the office it can be a pain.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jily43
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two week stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, as always you read some negative reviews, but must say as experienced travellers and this being our third visit to Mexico have only positive comments. The Hotel is a lovely building, as some say based on an Indian theme, inside very opulent, chandeliers etc. It is very clean and well maintained, staff continually cleaning, no tummy problems during our stay. The best rooms look out on The Plaza, we were informed on Reception that Thomson rooms, who we travelled with, only had the back rooms, which was initially a bit of a disappointment, although after speaking to other guests, some of the rooms can be noisy at night, not with the onsight entertainment which finishes at 11 p.m. but noisy revellers coming in at 4 a.m. after the nightly excursion to Cancun, our room was very quiet and for the amount of time we spent in there was adequate. I think the outstanding thing about this Hotel has to be the staff, they are so friendly and cannot do enough for you, not always expecting tips, although when you realize how low their wages are, a few dollars or pesos are very welcome. We loved the beach plenty of loungers under the shade of the palms, a bit noisy for us round the pool, but everyone there seemed to be enjoying themselves and the fact you could have a nice long walk in both directions, about 20 mins along the beach to Playa del Carmen, very touristy but worth a visit, if you like shops. They also run the ferry to Cozamul which again is worth a visit if you haven't been. In the other direction you can get past the Hotels and walk with just the forest on one side and the ocean to cool your feet, beautiful ! The food is great, something for everyone, tried a couple of speciality restaurants, very nice, but the buffet has so much to choose from we were happy with that. I would mention here we were very surprised with the mode of dress in the Restaurants, shorts and very casual ware in the evenings, not usual at a 5 star hotel, so whatever you pack you will not look out of place. The evening entertainment was also very good, usually the chance to dance to some good groups if you wanted followed by a show different theme each night. The selection of drinks was very good, the cocktails were well presented. If you are a Gin and Tonic drinker, this is not standard in the rooms, think more geared to U.S tastes, but you can ask for it at Reception and it will be delivered. The verdict, a good Hotel in an idealic location if you stay at this Riu you can visit and use the facilities of the other Riu hotels in the area, nice to walk out for a drink, this option only for guest at this one, guest staying at the other hotels in this group cannot use the Palace Riviera Maya facilities. I think if you visit the other Hotels, you will appreciate you have made the right choice, would definately return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, OK hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya over the Labor Day weekend in September. We hired a cab service to take us from the airport in Cancun to Playa del Carmen, which took about an hour. The hotel's location is very secure - within a gated, guarded 'neighborhood' with both homes and resort/hotels. We were very pleased with the security of the area, given Mexico's recent reputation for civil unrest. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted by a grandiose, two-story lobby with a bar and various seating areas. The desk staff explained in detail how the "all inclusive" features, including the on-site restaurants/dining options, and use of pools at all Riu locations worked. The rooms are located on un-conditioned, open-air corridors, which, due to the climate, suffer from extreme humidity, which is evident in the peeling of paint and buckling of framed artwork. Our room was very spacious, with a nice sitting area and large TV and the bathroom was large. However, the room was clearly either a smoking room or had been at some point - the smell was so strong it permeated everything in our luggage and stung my nose. The bath/shower smelled strongly of mold. While I am sure that everything was very clean - as evidenced by the efficient daily cleaning staff - the smells were unappealing, at best. Our view was the back of some condos, which wasn't so great. There is a nice variety of places to eat on the premises, although, don't expect anything truly mind-blowing in the way of cuisine. The beachside buffet restaurant was best for breakfast and lunch - second would probably be the buffet in the main hotel. The sit-down, reservation-only restaurants were fine, but we actually hit up the late-night buffet afterwards to satiate our hunger! With the all-inclusive package, there are unlimited drinks at any of the restaurants or bars. We didn't ever use the liquor dispensers in the room, but there are at least three varietals available in the room, with a mini-bar that is fully stocked. We did enjoy just having the bottled water and sodas in the room. Most of the mixed drinks were overly sugary, syrupy and just OK. Stick with the beer if you're going to drink. The best part of this place is the beach. There are plenty of seating options - around the pool, in the shade of palm trees in the sun, nearer the water without shade ... we mostly spent time in the shade - the breezes were nice and the chairs were comfy. Overall, we had the best relaxation outside of the hotel. We tried not to spend much time at all in the rooms - while air-conditioned, they were just so humid and smelly, it was hard to sleep. I'd recommend this hotel for vacationing families with teens (no small children), college students, or twenty-something friends. It's not the place for romantic getaways or small children. Overall, I would say that it was a fine experience for my first trip to Mexico, but I would probably choose a bit smaller, more upscale place for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel09
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Heaven! LOVED this resort!!!! Favorite things: Fantastic Service-we had 2 waiters fighting over who could keep us in drinks at Chili's Clean-after the rain the entire staff it seems is out squeeging the walkways Good Food-Loved the fruit and fresh fruit juices at the buffets Beach-pure heaven, loved walking for miles in either direction Fun to visit the other Riu's, enjoyed Riu Mexico and Riu Tequila Beautiful Pool-Enjoyed sitting on the edge of the pool over looking the beach, close to bar-great breezes Helpful hints: there is a cash station in the parking lot of the Reef Playacar (next hotel to the right when exiting the front of hotel) Bring singles for tips hard to get change Beach party is on Friday at noon (coconut drinks and Palella) Kitchen tour is on Thurs. at noon-fun Pay the $60 to upgrade to a superior view room-we had the 2nd floor center building, had a view of courtyard, could watch the shows, could see ocean if leaned over a bit. Bring earplugs sound really travels You only have to wear long pants at Krystal's and the Japanese Rest shorts ok in the others. We went to all of the rest. and enjoyed them all but the buffet is very good as well. Try the Mango Tango (tastes like a creamsicle) and the Miami Vice (fun pool drink) Beer tastes better with a lime-nice break from the sweet drinks Avoid the wine-I'm a wine lover and the wine here is not very good Watch the pool aerobics class it is hilarious Pool is warm if the sun is shining but can be cool, the ocean is wonderful, fun to body surf. We did one excursion-Edventure tours-so much fun only 6 people on our tour. Overall a wonderful time, it is even more beautiful than the pictures show. Enjoy, we did!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Soak it in and experience what a real vacation should be like!”
Reviews.Author: Dimsky
Reviews.Content: Let me break it out into sections of focus. Overall: WOW and WOW. My wife and two other couples from NYC area decided that we will spend a little more and try a higher rated resort to celebrate a friend’s 50th birthday. So a travel agent friend recommended Riu Palace. It blew us all away. They really know how to provide a best vacation you've ever had. There are some things I/we love-to-have and hate-to-have on these types of trips, so here is my list you can compare to your likes. No resort is perfect, but this one had all that I/we loved. Grounds: Once inside the U shaped garden-like grounds it seems compact and cozy like the European palace garden, but did not feel crowed with people. Lawn is perfectly maintained and picturesque. You could eat off the clean tiled walkways. At night the lighting made the place even more pleasing with a gazebo in the middle and French street café tables to sit and have a sip of coffee or a cocktail or a cigar. Food: I hate waiting on lines – there were none even in the buffet. They said the resort was full, but you’d never know it. A few decent restaurants, “Krystal” fusion restaurant was on a level of a Manhattan restaurant and I do cook myself and my son is a chef. Skip the Japanese if you know what sushi is supposed to taste like. But the best part of it was you did not even need to leave the buffet. Not only that they have a great choice and quality you can sit in a beautiful indoor dining room or on an outdoor patio under an overhang with white tablecloths and Paris street café feel-like atmosphere … AND NO CROWDS no waiting on lines. One night they had a trumpet player in a gazebo play soft music while we dined on a buffet patio. It was so romantic women loved it. Lunch buffet at Chili’s had enough to choose from for everyone. Activities: Snorkeling is right there, after which I tried their free scuba lesson in the pool and then went to scuba the reef nearby. They had pool and beach volleyball every day and a few other activities that we did not get to just wanted to get some leisure time on the beach. Room: The beds could be a little more comfortable, but OK. Room is clean and well maintained; nothing to write home about and you should not stay in it too long anyway. Pool: If you like to sit by the pool in a prime spot, you may need to come out early and place a towel on it. I would not know about it. Beach: Sit on a beautiful, clean beach with palm trees and soft shade they cast. Plenty of lounge chairs for all to bask on the sun. No bugs or mosquitoes anywhere. That’s what heaven must feel like. One morning I saw many coconuts on the ground on the beach that seemed fallen off the trees, which seemed odd. They actually cut them off. Next thing I know they brought them to the beach barbeque area and chopped the tops off and make drinks in them to hand out. Nice touch! Staff: The staff is GREAT and does not make you feel that you owe them a tip for every drink they bring you, though I wanted to tip everyone as I was treated like a royalty. They just let you do whatever you want and when you want it. Surroundings: Close enough to walk to some local shopping. Many other hotels and resorts right there and most are RIU brands which you can use with Palace hand band because it’s higher level than the others. Misc: Drinks are good and plenty. Lobby had WIFI, but a weak signal. You can still use your smart phone or laptop for minor activities, though after a first day will not want to. Close to parks like Xel-Há. We did them last trip there, but it’s a good outing to try. I have left out few other minor amenities, but you’ll need to discover them for yourselves. Kind of makes you think why don’t other resorts do that? Soak it in and experience what a real vacation should be like!

Reviews.Title: “The Riu Rocks”
Reviews.Author: cinnamon21
Reviews.Content: This resort is awesome - Its beautiful, clean, service is great, close to shopping & was a great deal. We booked a "surprise" thru Funjet & this is the resort we were sent to. Must say it was a great surprise. We had stayed in 08 at the Riu Palace Mexico which is one of the 5 Riu's down here that if you stay at one you can visit them all. We left Dallas in a snow / ice storm & returned to a snow / ice storm but the weather here was all worth it, mostly in the 80's. We had left our Netbook on the transportation van & thought we would never see it again but thanks to Marco, at the front desk, and BIG thanks to our Funjet Rep. Beto Ortiz who immediately called & found that Funjet office had it in Cancun & they would get it to us when they could....after 2 days Beto went on his own time to Cancun to retrive it for us & brought it to our resort after he got off work. We were nothing but happy. Our room was cleaned every a.m. & our mini-bar was re-stocked full every day. The food was awesome, one night they had Lobster on the "buffet" & it was great. All the fine dining was yummy however we did not go to the Brazilian but feel that if we had of, it would have been good to. At the bars, they were pretty busy most of the time but never waited more than a min. or two to be served. All the waiters & waitresses were so pleasant & made sure you were not without a drink. Walked several times to the other Rius & to the little shopping mall, which is maybe a 10 min. walk. We travel often, & of course there are certain things you like most about a resort but all in all this resort is one of the best we have stayed at. If you cannot have a good time here then maybe you need to recheck yourself & relax. Life is good & travel is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl059
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a very grand hotel for those who like to go formal. Beach bums are out of place here- they stand out like a sore thumb. The architecture is beautiful as is the garden/ water promenade to the beach. The food selection is immense and very tasty. Staff go out of their way to help. We had no problems changing our rooms to a quieter location away from the evening entertainment area. The close proximity to Play del carmen is a plus ( 1 mile away) and the pathways throughout the Playacar area are an enjoyable way to walk off the food in the late afternoons. The pristine beach goes on for miles and miles and the weather was a perfect sunny 83 degrees farenheit. The courtyard area is very quaint and an enjoyable spot to listen to quartets playing music between 7 and 9 p.m. My only complaint was that the pool area was too noisy with loud pop music.blaring all day. We had to go to the older Riu Palace down the road where there were two pools . One pool was for the party animal/bar types and the other was quiet and serene. We would only go back to the older Riu hotel for this reason as we like a quiet pool when on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The Jacuzzi Suite room is worth the price! Perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: hannahtx
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite and were upgraded to the jacuzzi suite. It was beyond any expectation we had. The 2-story balcony had a very private jacuzzi tub upstairs that looked out at the ocean. The room had a jacuzzi inside that was between the bathroom and the bedroom area. The walk in shower had a glass door and we could look out at the ocean. There was no way to NOT see the ocean from our suite.
