We didn't have any issues with food - I wouldn't say any of it was fantastic, but we were very pleased. A few dollars go a long way at the poolside bar and taking your own insulated mug helps the bartenders remember you (and keeps your drinks from melting)!! They stocked the in room mini-bar with whatever we asked for. The grounds were beautiful, the room was spacious and comfortable. The only minor issue we had was that the a/c wasn't super efficient, but it was enough to keep the room comfortable. I don't think I would stay at this hotel again if I didn't have the jacuzzi suite because we were so spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Great but...”
Reviews.Author: highlanderrr
Reviews.Content: As always, they treated us unbelievably. You could not get better food, pools, beaches or hospitality. I probably will never stay at another all inclusive other than a Riu Palace. Having said that, we managed to find a crappy room-guy doing our daily cleaning. Had to ask for coffee, water and beer almost every day in our mini bar. Small potatoes but I really don't appreciate having to ask EVERY DAY for the same stuff. I think he was just a little off is all lol I love the fact you can walk down the beach and stop at any number of other Riu(5 in this case) when you stay at a Palace. This is a very under-rated luxury. Stay at the Palace and get full access to the Playacar, Tequila, Lupita, Yucutan and the other Palace. Food was to die for. If you can't be happy here you are just not trying. Swim up bar was rocking, although Yucutan and Tequila have this one beat. This is quieter than the others so if you are a late night partier, maybe stay at the others but we love it a little quieter at night and getting rowdy at the other during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, best food, best drinks, best service - heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: conniechick
Reviews.Content: Wish I could write more but I am at work, lol, so must keep it short. My boyfriend and I - 40 and 41 years old - stayed here last week. It was absolutely unbelievable on every level. From the moment you walk into the absolutely incredible lobby to the first-class food, drinks and service, we felt like we were royalty. In fact, at first I thought I was in the wrong place, lol; it was a little classy for me but you get used to it very quickly! The people staying there might have enough money to stay at such a resort but no one was arrogant; everyone we met was laid back and having fun. The hotel was beautiful; nicest I have ever seen. We cannot say enough about the service; you could hardly go a minute without one of the staff members asking if you wanted another drink or anything else. The food was so incredible that we ate TWO dinners per night-- the amazing buffet at 6:30pm, then at 8:30pm we would head to a specialty restaurant that you sign up for the day prior! The food was so good it was kind of a gluttonous situation, lol. If you like good food this is the place to go. The hotel was a very romantic place and I had a lovely time with my smart hot man. :) It was also a 5-minute cab ride to downtown where you can entertain yourselves for hours shopping and people watching. Seriously, it was worth every penny; we would go back in a second! We also took a day trip to the Chichen Itza Mayan ruins and that was an incredible trip. I hope you go so you can have a memorable vacation like we did!!! Four thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Wow...incredible stay A+”
Reviews.Author: pantone77
Reviews.Content: I'm currently on day six of our seven day vacation and this resort was everything I read about in the reviews. The food is excellent (we are eating at the buffet for dinner instead of the themed restaurants as it's really delicious), service is top notch, and there is always someone cleaning something...it''s a little strange at first seeing this place always being cleaned, but it shows they care. They also offer nightly cheesy shows that are worth going to for the laugh (the retro show is so bad it's good) and tonight we're going to the Michael Jackson tribute. There's so much I could say about this resort but it's already been said in the other reviews. I'd only like to say that you should really tip these workers...all of them are so friendly and helpful and more times than not I see them not being tipped. I always made sure to give them $1 for a drink or $5 for dinner...don't cheap out and not tip. Only complaint - only the lobby has wifi and it's faster in the early AM than in the evening when everyone is trying to use it. I wish they had wifi throughout the property because it's a pain to have to go online in the lobby (however there are plenty of seating areas). FYI - to the person who posted a one star review because they couldn't stay an extra night, get over yourself. If the resort is sold out and you want to stay an additional night what do you want the front desk to do, kick someone else out?

Reviews.Title: “disgusted with front desk manager Xavier”
Reviews.Author: abel33740
Reviews.Content: My flight was canceled after staying at the Riu Place for 8 days. On the 9th day, I asked for an additional nights room due to my flight being canceled. Xavier (the manager) did not want to be bothered and told me he had no additional rooms and wouldn't even bother to help my wife and I out to find another hotel. He said it wasn't his job!!! I was so disgusted with the way he treated my wife and I that we canceled our daughters wedding that was to take place next summer 2012. I would think that RIU would be more selective of who they hire for managers in such a high class resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pure bliss”
Reviews.Author: TheNarrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple travelled to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Jan 28 to Feb 04. I must say that my husband and I have travelled to many places which include: Cayo Coco Cuba, Varadero Cuba, Puerto Plata DR, Sosua DR, Punta Cana DR and now Riviera Maya Mexico. I must say, the Riu Palace is by far the best Resort we have ever stayed at... We always book 4.5 to 5.5 star Resorts thus we taught we'd approximately get the same service as we always did but to our immense surprise this was far beyond anything we'd ever experience. The front desk: We arrived very late and we're the only ones checking-in so this was done very quickly without any headache. Alto, once in our room, we were a bit disappointed with the size and location. As such, we kindly asked the front desk to change rooms and this was quickly done first thing the next morning. A bottle of champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries were sent to our room a few days later apologizing for the inconvenience. The rooms: The rooms were very nice, bright and clean, refreshed every day with clean sheets and towels. Good temperature and pressure in the shower. The bar fridge was stocked every day with pop, water and beer. The balcony was huge and it was very nice to open the patio door in the am to let the warm breeze into the room while getting ready for breakfast. The Restaurant: By far the best food I’ve ever had at an all inclusive resort. From breakfast to dinner, the a la carte restaurants to the buffet, the service to the variety of wine, the freshness of the seafood to the quality of the meet all was sublime. We ALWAYS found something to eat and felt satisfied. The only thing I can complain about was the fact that we had to leave the pool area in order to go make reservations in the main lobby. This was only possible between noon and two. I found that to be an inconvenience but when we sat at dinner and receive the level of attention and service that we did, this was all worth it. Pool: Clean, nice, refreshing Beach: The beach was amazing, crystal clear blue water, warm like a bath. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone, it was well worth the $ and we’d go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fluke831
Reviews.Content: I'm not going to write a massive, indepth review on this hotel but just wanted to share with you what a FANTASTIC AMAZING hotel this is.... Which in our opinion is mostly down to the incredibly friendly staff the hotel employs. They are always ready & willing to tend to any needs you have with such smiles on their faces. The pool & restaurant staff are fantastic & enjoy conversations with you, without being intrusive. We can without doubt put this hotel in our top 3 best ever hotels we have stayed in (and we have stayed in quite afew!!!!!) We relay on trip advisor when booking our holidays & realised that we really should start adding our own opinion. We can honestly say that EVERY thing about our holiday was brilliant. Needless to say , we have booked & are returning to the Riu Palace again within the next few months :-) If we were forced to give any complaint about the hotel , it would be almost impossible but I would have to comment about the musty smell on our clothes when opening our cases on returning back to the UK. Hey ho it was nothing my washing machine didnt sort out

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT - Not one complaint!”
Reviews.Author: molly224
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews of different resorts before picking one. I quickly realized that there was always one rotten apple to spoil the bunch when reading about various hotels. My husband & I had a wonderful exerpiece at this resort & neither of us could think of one complaint if we tried! Food - The food was amazing! We tried 4 of the 5 specialty resturants and the buffet resturant. We may actually have preferred the buffet location best, but all the food was delicious. We especially enjoyed the Brazalian steakhouse. There was an amazing breakfast buffet every morning, we usually skipped lunch, but there was a lot of food available all day. They would even cook out of the beach sometimes. Service - The staff couldn't have been nicer or hustled to refill your drink fast enough. The cleaning staff kept everything spotless - from the beach area to the steps leading up to your room. Pool/Beach - The beach area was beautiful with plenty of space. There were several palm trees or space without if you just wanted to stay in the sun. The area was safe & there were plenty of lounge chairs. The pool was big, clean, plenty of space. There were activites around the pool area & beach all day. Great entertainment even if you didnt participate. Room - Room was spacious, clean, nice bathroom with jacquzzi tub. We ddn't have a oceanview room, but we didn't spend much time in our room either. It was cleaned spotless everyday & our beds turned down at night Nightlife - At night there was plenty of entertainment. There were kids activites usually earlier in the evening, then there was an adult show starting around 10:00pm. It was relaxing to have drinks in the plaza before dinner, live music, then enjoy the shows after dinner. If you need more nightlife 5th Ave is a short walk or cheap cab ride away. We checked out the other Riu resorts close to ours, but still preferred the Palace Riveia Maya. Overall this was the most relaxing & fun vacations of my life. I wouldn't think of staying at anyother resort when returning to Playa. It is definately worth the little extra money, a great value. I would also consider staying at other Riu resorts around the world.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: moresunplease5
Reviews.Content: First off my husband would give this hotel a 'terrible' rating but I'm opting for 'Average' for the 'Palace' experience. Well, we were upgraded to this hotel from the Tequila ( long story) but now wondering if we should of just stayed at our original hotel we booked. We stayed on first floor room 121. The Good: Front desk seemed attentive, friendly --fast check in process Waiters worked very hard to please the customers Grounds just beautiful, Beach was Amazing, Palm trees in abundance for shade Lots of chairs available on beach Standard room size nice, sitting area with small couch, balcony Mini-Kids club open 2 hours am/pm--sweet ladies, kept kids entertained Lots of activities for kids--had kids show at 8:30pm each night Entertainment staff also very hard workers--the shows were good Our bathroom had big, almost sunken in bathtub ( great for my 4 year old) Decent amenities for bathroom ( shampoo dispenser by tub) Fresh flowers in room by housekeepers and towel animals ( appreciated by my little one) Wal-Mart close by ( 7 dollar cab ride)..pharmacy just walk to shopping villa by Yucatan Riu No problem getting extra pillows, extra beers in our refrig Flat screen TV ( if you want to plug in a small DVD player or something you could very easily...just need to bring your adapters). Safe was easy to use...kind of on smaller side...only would accommodate a small 'notebook' size computer Small gift store--sells power aide ( lifesaver for us) The Bad: Everything Tiled so watch out, slippery...they wash the floors constantly in the hallways etc. My husband had a sprained ankle from the beach so these wet tiles made it difficult to catch your balance Room service menu very limited...no kid meal choices. If you are sick...no popsicles/ice pops, no soup, no bananas! **Tip ( go to Wal-Mart buy what you need--small freezer could hold some ice pops) Had 2 cockroaches...not a biggie ( we are in a jungle environment) TIP** wanted to mention to close your drain stoppers in the sink and tub at night...both I found coming out of the sink in the bathroom. All seats/loungers around pool seemed to be taken by 8am The hallways are loud from 7am-8pm ...bring ear plugs. No umbrella for us to use ( the Hotel Tequila had one in guest rooms) The Ugly: We were sick 3 out of the 6 days we were there--we are guessing food poisoning. We are seasoned travelers and this has never happened to us before. Did I mention no banana's on buffet line 2 days in a row? room service said they didn't have any 2 days straight. Really? but you have them at the bar in buckets to make drinks ( realized this later) *** No hand sanitizer in public bathrooms or at entrance to buffet restaurants. Gross! Gross! Gross! I kept ours with us but I never saw waiters washing their hands...have you ever heard of Cross-Contamination?!? we never got a chance to eat at the specialty places due to being ill so I cannot comment on them. The housekeepers didn't wear gloves...even when I told them our linens, towels had vomit etc in them...I tried to explain that I would walk the soiled linen out for them but they refused...they took from me, put on floor of hallway etc...sorry folks, I tried not to get anyone else sick out there. We did spray our room with Lysol ( we bought that at local Wal-Mart) ..used the whole can before we left hotel room ( hoping we didn't make anyone sick, including housekeepers). Last morning, they didn't have any water in whole hotel. Again, I'd like to point out/inquire how did the workers wash their hands if they were preparing our breakfast etc...we all know there is no hand sanitizer anywhere in this hotel...hence, we skipped breakfast and a shower that morning. When the water did come out of the faucets it was black. We washed our hands and brushed teeth with bottled water that last morning at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Riu Yet”
Reviews.Author: Josh S
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is only my 2nd Riu, but it was my favorite :). I've read a lot of reviews and everyone has done an excellent job covering the hotel. I can do a bit of a comparison. I stayed at the Riu Palace Las Americas in Cancun last time I did an all inclusive. In comparison, RP Riviera Maya is much better. The size of grounds and the vastness of the beach is so much better. I love the Playacar area in general and felt it was far superior to the Cancun strip. My wife and I aren't clubbers, so keep that in mind. The cleanliness and service were very comparable to the RP Las Americas. The Riu line does a great job with food, drinks, service, cleanliness, etc. I'm a big fan. The rooms are the same except you get an ocean view (or a chance for one) in Cancun... not possible in Playa. I'll take the gigantic beach over the oceanview rooms though. My next all inclusive trip will likely be with a different brand. Not due to any lack of satisfaction, but rather want to experience something new and different. I very much felt like the two Riu Palace resorts were very similar. Food was the same, drinks were the same, service was the same. It really speaks to the overall Riu brand since I actually loved all of those things. With that, I think it's time for change for us. There is no doubt in my mind, however, that we will visit a Riu Palace again one day. We just need a change of pace. Also, we visited the Riu Palace Mexico to compare. I prefer the Riviera Maya hotel. Everything is more spacious and layed out better. You'll love either, but I preferred the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and would highly recommend. As a quick note (if you're still reading which I doubt), the internet in the lobby/piano bar is horrendous. The upload speeds are reminiscient of dial up if not worse. I ran a quick speed test and was shocked. Now, that wasn't a huge deal for what I needed to get done, but keep that in mind if you plan or need to rely on it for any data intensive tasks. At least they serve you drinks while you painfully watch the upload process crawl.

Reviews.Title: “First all inclusive, long distance and what a fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: brudgirl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend I stay stayed here in the summer and we had a fantastic time. I always spend hours researching where to go and tripadvisor is a huge influence during that time. I understand that everybody interprets things differently but we didn't have anything to complain about. Food and drink...Whilst we were there the only additions we had to pay for were tips, which were obviously optionally. There was an extensive bar, including cava and cocktails all inclusive, available 24 hours, as was room service. In the sports bar there is also a fridge and microwave for you to help yourself to burgers, hot dogs, nachos and the like. I am quite hard to please when it comes to food as my parents own restaurants, but with 5 restaurants plus one buffet, you never felt hungry or not satisfied. The service....exceptional. Nowhere have I ever experienced such personal touches. Eating at the buffet, the waitors would fall over themselves to carry your plate back to your table, always pull your chair out for you. One night we were sat at the outside bar listening to the music from the bandstand, our table was wobbly. The waitor noticed us wobbling it, came over to check everything was ok, we said yes fine, and when he left we realised whilst he was talking to us he had slipped a bearmat under with his foot, discrete and actually bothered about making your experience better. Location...10, 15 minutes from '5th avenue' in playa del carman. Or a taxi ride the equivalent of £4. (its a very hot walk!) we personally didn't really buy anything here but it was nice to have a wander out of the hotel. Rooms...clean, serviced everyday, every day towel art, turndown service and stocked mini bar (including liquer dispenser) One day I was gutted as I had lost a diamond earring, could've obviously been anywhere so was long gone, on my return to our room my earring AND butterfly was on the bedside table. I think goes to show how well the rooms were cleaned. The hotel itself feels very new still, everyday they were powerhosing something or touching up paint here and there (I say this as a complement...you do not feel like you are in a building site!) but you get the impression they take pride in the hotel. The bar where you are given an arrival drink is plush, marble floors, huge fresh flower arrangements, furniture which makes you feel like you've stepped on the titanic. The outside of the hotel...white domed...palacial. And I for one felt treated like royalty, would go back one day but so many places to see yet. Enjoy yours hols!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great week!”
Reviews.Author: crackerspaz
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the Riu with my husband and 5 month old son. This resort definitely exceeded all of our expectations. The room was large and clean. The mini-bar was restocked everyday with plenty of beer, soft drinks and water. I found the bed comfortable (though a little firm). They provided a crib for my son. It was a little sketchy, but worked out just fine. My only complaint about the room is the musty smell. You get used to it after a day but upon returning home, all of our belongings reeked. The resort itself was beautiful and well kept. We only ate at the buffet, but the food was great. We are vegetarian and never had a problem finding something to eat. Unfortunately, I did get food poisoning, but I suppose that could have happened anywhere... The beach was the best part. It stretched on forever. Soft sand, clear water and good sized waves. There is a huge sunny area and plenty of shade under palm trees. The pool was nice. A little cold but not as bad as everyone makes it out to be. It was warm enough for the baby to enjoy it. As many other people have stated, people get up early to "reserve" lounge chairs. So irritating! We never had to go without, but by 10 am, it was slim pickings. The staff were amazing. So friendly and accommodating. They didn't seem to be fishing for tips. Some of them actually seemed surprised to be getting tipped! We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect with a few complications”
Reviews.Author: OneK9lover
Reviews.Content: One of the first things I would like to mention about this hotel was their inability to work with our travel company Expedia. A day before we were supposed to leave for Playa del Carmen the North East was hit with a huge storm. Our flights were cancelled and we would have to leave the following day. We were hoping that Expedia could just switch the dates to one day later for both our arrival and departure. However, they were not willing to do this unless we paid for the one night service fee. It turns out if you book with them directly and cannot get to the resort through no fault of your own, there will be no fee but because we booked through a third party they were not willing to work with us. Expedia even tried calling them and was hung up on twice. Eventually Expedia assumed the costs for us, but this was after a 3 hour phone call. This kind of put a bad taste in our mouth before we got there. Upon our arrival the place was magnificent. It was very grand and definitely the nicest resort out of the many we walked through in the area. I would describe the look as very ornate. When we entered our room, it was clean and with a very large bathroom, nothing to complain about there until we saw our view. We had a room looking at a wall on the outside perimeter of the hotel, looking at some construction that was partially masked. We asked for a better room and they showed us a suite with partial view of the ocean and beach for $150 more a night. I would have been happy with a view of the courtyard but they said all those rooms were taken. Eventually we settled on a standard room with the same view as the suite on the first floor. Fifty dollars more and we had a pretty decent view. Everything, was going with any more hitches. Buffets in the morning were plentiful with lots of fresh juices, fruits, pastries and the regular breakfast staples. Lunches were decent as well. And the restaurants and dinner shows were pretty on par as well. But then ---- after returning one night to our room we found a couple cockroaches. Part of me can understand this, I mean we are on the first floor and this is near to jungle like terrain we are in. But we complained and they said there was nothing we could do till the following morning. They send a girl with bug spray but that was about all that was done. The following day we sort of had to wait around. We were told the night before to see the manager in the morning. Then the morning staff told us to see the afternoon staff. Finally we were told to pack up out stuff and leave it in the room and when we came back to resort later in the day we would have a new room. When we came back, we were given a hotel room key only to find a room with no luggage. After a couple of calls to the front desk, someone came to our room to tell us our luggage was missing. At this point, I nearly lost it. I was ready to move to a different hotel and so forth but our luggage was found almost immediately after I nearly blasted the front desk. In retrospect I feel bad about getting so mad, but come on... how can these issues keep happening. After this was resolved, everything else was great... So on to the good stuff.... the resort if beautiful. The grounds are well kept and there are endless employees that make sure each area is perfect. The beach area is the best. The palm trees are wide spread and the area feels so tropical. Also, the ocean is the perfect turquoise color you want. Some of the restaurants we went to were... Japanese - sushi appetizer for the table is just ok, the noodles were delicious and so was the shrimp entrée. Also, don't miss the fried ice cream, I think this was the best dessert in the whole resort. All in all, pretty good. Brazilian - this is like the typical churrascaria but better. The meats here are delicious... try the sauces and the breads as well. I was impressed with everything here. I just couldn't be happier with the taste and quality of the meat. Even the black bean soup was the best I have ever had. I do wish they had an a la carte dessert option instead of the buffet however. But this is the best restaurant in the complex. Chilis (steak house) - the chilled seafood app there is huge and delicious. The steaks are very tender and the lobster is grilled but also good. A sure runner up to the Brazilian restaurant. The dessert show is awesome, full of fire and performance, but they taste pretty bland. Mexican - our entrees were all in all no good. There are two sides of the salad buffet here, a cold side and hot side. If you go, fill your plate with the stuff on the hot side as the chicken was gross and the fajitas were sub par. Back to the Resort, the location is fabulous and was a great reason to stay there. You can walk to a small shopping complex in playacar, or to the city of playa del carmen which is just fabulous. I miss it already. Lots of shopping, beaches and your choice of restaurants. Here are some additional remarks.. if you are active, check out Xplor theme park for a crazy unique adventure, if you have a family and are interested in wildlife check out Xcaret. If you are thinking of taking the ferry to Cozumel, do not go on sunday as almost everything is closed. Also, if you don't have a dinner restaurant bring $5 and ask for the head waiter... you'll have no problem getting in. Also, your bracelet is also a pass into any of the other Riu's should you want to change the view for an afternoon. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation - Nice Spot - Clean - All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: hubertpetroleum
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel situated about 1hr south of Cancun Airport. Lobby is beautiful, really have a sense of being in the "Palace". Location feels very safe, Security is present right from the beginning, never had to worry. The grounds are beautiful, always clean and tidy. There is always a friendly smile cleaning or straightening something. The rooms were great. Large sitting area, large balcony, King size bed. Bathrooms were clean, with whirlpool tubs. Room- Spacious, well mapped out. Beds are NOT comfortable. Couldnt get good night sleep on them, not my style. Sitting area is nice, with couch. Balcony very large, but does not face, or have any view of the Ocean! There are not many ocean view rooms. A lot that do, also face the courtyard, which means people will be watching you, which creeps me out. The minibar was a Great touch. Liquor was nice, but the great part is Bottled Water and Beer. Constantly restocked, it was nice to have water whenever you need it, and large bottles. Amenities - The grounds are nice, not really much there. Fountains are small, but clean. The Spa is ok, fitness room is small. Hot tub area was nice, two hot tubs and some chairs. Pool was nice size but ICE COLD. Also, there is an infinity pool that flows into the main pool, also ice cold. Not sure why, but it is always freezing in there. The swim up bar was ok. Pool chairs are hard to come by in the "prime" areas. Best bet is tipping a groundsman. Beach area was very nice. Plenty of chairs. Free kayaks, boogie boards, and sail boats are nice. Nearby shop has parasailing and snorkel tours etc. Plenty to do. Dining - Sit Down restaurants were all average for the most part. The reservation system is a joke. You have to pick the place 1-2 days in advance, and it can be difficult to get a reservation. Then, most places would give you a hard time if you didnt have one, despite being empty. Very odd setup with that. The buffets however were very good. Plenty to choose from. We stayed for 8 days, so it does become a bit monotonous, you can only eat soo much guacamole. Bars - Great. They really serve you well at all the bars. They dont cheap out. There may not be Grey Goose, or real top-tier liquors, but they have enough. And the service at all the bars was first rate. From the upscale lobby bar, to the sandals and tank top pool bar, and even the sports bar, all went out of their way. Overall the trip was a 3.5 out of 5. The service does "fish" for tips. But they will serve you well if you do tip them. Very nice hotel, near the top of the line, for mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Great All-Inclusive Experience”
Reviews.Author: japindy
Reviews.Content: We are not normally big fans of the all-inclusive concept but decided to give it another try as we came upon a pretty good deal with Funjet. Rooms and property were spotless, pool and beach very nice. Location is ideal being that it's not too far from town. Walked the beach to and from Playa few times and took $5 USD cab rides when dressed up. Food was very good but we did choose to go to Playa for dinner a few times. We ate at the steakhouse, brazilian and fusion restaurants. Our group was all very pleased. Breakfast and lunch buffets had many choices and was always fresh. Liked that you could eat at a different restaurant every night if you choose and never had to buffet it for dinner. Beach chairs didn't seem to be much of an issue although by 10 am most of the pool chairs had the usual towel, book or shoe placed on them for saving. Never will understand that practice, but whatever. We just chose the beach. Would rather listen to the surf than the loud music and occasional game, but to each his own. Beach drink service was sporadic, some days good, others rarely available, but it doesn't hurt to get out of your chair every once in a while to get your own. Staff always has a smile and seem to be happy to do whatever they can to ensure that you're having a good vacation. Victor in the sports bar was always happy and fun, we know that because we spent some time with him everyday. Enjoyable entertainment in the courtyard nightly. Never did attend one of the shows but heard they were good. We all decided this was one property we would definitely return to again. Loved everything about it. Thanks to the Riu for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “wedding and new year at the rprm - fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Emmaleenleeds
Reviews.Content: Myself & partner (now hubby) had our wedding in this hotel, Im so pleased I chose this place, the whole 2 weeks we were here we were treat like royalty! We were lucky enough to stay in the jacuzzi suite (room 2118) Right at the end of hotel, long walk from lobby but meant no noise really from other guests as there were only 3 rooms at the end of the corridor. The Suite "wow" , was prob twice the size of junior suites, walk in wardrobe huge living room area, huge king size bed, large plasma which you could spin round to either living area or bed, huge jacuzzi bath seperating bedroom & bathroom double sinks, seperate shower! Was so impressed with inside but outside was even better! Sea View amazing, breathtaking. balconany was large with spiral stairs up to the outdoor jacuzzi! Room service which is 24 hour & included in your all inc is great, we ordered coffee and cake most afternoons and just sat on the balconly checking out the amazing view & sometimes breakfast! x We also requested champagne to the room on a number of occasions which was a great treat with the jacuzzi!!x We ate at all the speciality resteraunts, could not fault the food at all, we never got bored of being in the resort as we felt we were dining somewhere different every evening. Japanese was my favourite, but my hubby prefered Chilli's as he is a steak man! Champagne served with every meal, infact served all day every day/time! The hotel staff are amazing, they are so hard working as so busy all of the time. Our room was cleaned everyday we left tips most days but sometimes forgot, rooms were still cleaned to same standard and cute animal towels left. Every evening our bed was 'turned down' with chocolate left on pillow too. What a beautiful touch! The manager on reception even lent my husband his belt on our wedding day as he had forgot to pack his!! Wedding - wow, the wedding team were amazing, I wanted a no fuss wedding. I had myself, partner & 10 guests. We had ceromony at gazebo by the pool at 4pm (thought it might be little cooler then), It went like a dream, yes other guests watched from a far but non of them are in the wedding pics its a resort so this is gonna happen. The flowers and set up looked amazing, the judge was great, not stuffy so was so relaxed and only lasted about 15 mins. After few pics we headed to lobby bar for cocktail hour then meal at chillies table looked amazing, was tucked out of the way of other guests. The food again was fab, guests could choose from lamb, steak, seafood or chicken so something for everyone. We had our wedding cake for desert so not to waste it!! I took my boquet and other flowers up to my room and had them as a flower arrangement for the rest of the hol!! There is so many wonderful things about this hotel, the staff and the area Im sure i have not mentioned half of it!! If you want a relaxing luxury holiday where you can do as little or as much as you like, in beautiful settings & surroundings with 5 star staff, food and drink this is definatly the place to come!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Luckywolf
Reviews.Content: The sevice at this resort is beyond expectation......... This is our 3rd year in the Mayan and this year tops the others The food was great..... buffet and specialty restarants. We never had any problems booking the specialty restarants and we actually cancelled one on our last night because the buffet was so good. Service was great; always someone to fill your drinks or get you anything. Make sure you tip them, they work harder than anyone in a restarant back home. Entertainment staff was good at getting people up and moving. They did a great job. Make sure you see the Micheal Jackson show it was really good. We did the Party hopper and was the best time we've had on a tour. Started at Charles n Charge, then Senior Frogs and ended at Coco bongos... Coco bongos was the best, but wouldn't go without a tour... very full and they serve you with the party hopper. also in VIP area of the club. Time flies and we got back at 4:00 am so be prepared for the late night. We booked when the weather the next day wasn't to nice so we could sleep longer and not miss the sun. We also did the Captian Hook dinner cruise out of Cancun. Well worth the trip. We had a blast. Don't listen to any negitive reviews about this resort, becasue those people will never be happy. This place was great and we will go back..

Reviews.Title: “almost impossible to fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jagged01
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The hotel is great and the rooms are really spacious , the staff are really friendly and will keep you well supplied with drinks all day long. The selection and quality of food at the buffet is great but if you get tired of that there are 5 Al a Carte resturants you can eat in as many times as you want. rooms are well cleaned every day and the all inclusive minibar (with optics) is re-stocked. its a 5 minute cab ride or a 15 minute stroll into playa del carmen which is really lively but not too built up . If i had to find some negatives it would be that the pool is really cold and if you want a sun lounger by the pool that is in the sun all day you need to be up early in the morning to secure your place. There is a mix of familes , couples and groups so its always quite lively so maybe not a place to go if you want complete tranquility. I would definately go back to this hotel or stay at other Riu's in the "palace" group

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall and great location”
Reviews.Author: AStraveln
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week, overall this place is great. We have stayed at several hotels here, Dreams PA, Grand Palladium, ect. The resort has a good setup and pools were nice. I thought the food was very good, actually the buffet was Excellent as well. The best food was at the Seafood place by the beach, and really enjoyed the Mexican restaraunt as well. Not much night life her, it was slow time Dec6-14. Martini bar in lobby was very good as well as the entertainment. Overall a 4 1/2 star. Easy walk into town or a couple dollar ride, dont miss Cozumel if your here. Dont hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: emme24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for us for our honeymoon. We paid for ALL of our wedding straight out in cash and didn't want to go for broke on one of the adults only resorts so we chose here. There actually weren't that may children. I think the beach may have been resanded when we went as the drop off into the ocean was like step step 3 ft drop. I stayed in the pools which are very nice. Our fave was the infinity pool. The lobby is wonderful and the staff are great. Our room was cleaned everyday and when we asked them for anything (more towels, water etc) it was always brought promptly. The king room is really just 2 doubles pushed together but it isn't anything one would notice. Playacar is a short walk from 5th ave. Super touristy but lots of shops, spas and restaurants. I wouldn't suggest getting a massage on the hotel premises as it is $$. We tried Sabaii Spa and it was wonderful. They even gave us the option of getting our massages out doors in their jungle like garden. Was a little too hot and humid for that. We enjoyed all the food at this resort our fave was the fusion restaurant. You have to make the reservations early though and you can only do two at a time. We ate at them all with the exception of the Japanese one. The entertainment at the resort is slightly kitschy but what is really to be expected of resort entertainment. Yes there is a slight smell to the air and resort. You ARE by the ocean. You don't notice it after a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: GemMcD
Reviews.Content: I went to this Riu Palace with my boyfriend in November and loved it! I'm very fussy and took ages before deciding on this hotel. We stayed for 10 days and could not really fault it. The service was great- I was very impression with the maid service- the rooms were always cleaned daily and on top of that they would pop in every night to check if we needed anything. All of the restaurants were great, our favourites were the Mexican and the japanese. In the day time, its best to go to the buffet restaurant rather than Chilli's beach side restaurant as it gets rammed in there and the buffet always had a better menu on! We found that the pool was very busy and people tended to reserve the loungers but the beach is so close to the bar and it was always more chilled down there. Joe was the most helpful waiter and he really looks after you. We gave small tips randomly throughout the holiday but the service was great without it. In some of the speciality restaurants, it was good to tip as they would be extra attentive on the second visit.......In the area itself was great- taxi's were cheap into Playa del Carmen. In terms of day trips, we would recommend the speed boat trip in Cancun and the Fat Cat sunset trip. We did the Coba trip but would warn people that it was a very long and was a little boring at times with alot of waiting around, but the pyramid was worth the climb!.....Overall this hotel was amazing and we heard a lot of guests from the other Riu's saying how jealous they were. It is is def worth the extra for a Palace! Enjoy! x

Reviews.Title: “HIgh Praise for Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: ConsumerSOS
Reviews.Content: I echo the positive reviews for the Palace Riviera Maya and shrug my shoulders at the quibbles. My wife, daughters (15 and 19) and I were there over New Year's. We had main floor rooms - deliberately not adjacent. Yes, it was a tad noisy early in the morning - but in some cases, it was the voices of younger folks coming back to their rooms at 4 a.m. after the disco. Excellent buffet, decent dinners at the gourmet restaurant and Chilis (the steak house) albeit neither was exceptional. But then again - this is ALL INCLUSIVE. And one can't expect gourmet meals under the circumstances. A note about the food: our 15 year old is Celiac (intolerant to Gluten) and the chefs and food staff were OUTSTANDING in making sure she was accommodated. They made special meals for her at almost every sitting, and they pointed out the safe and not safe foods for her to eat. It helped that my wife speaks fluent Spanish; but once the point had been made, we had no problem. The buffet meals were the best, in our opinion. Tremendous service overall, great bartenders, nothing but praise. And the animation team (organizing activities) was high spirited; we did the morning stretch class, beach volleyball, aerobics classes, saw the nightly entertainment daily - it was generally top-rate. Like a previous reviewer, I went to several of the neighbouring RIu properties and yes, this one is best. Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Really Went Downhill... Repeat Visitor (Detailed)”
Reviews.Author: tanned-n-happy
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from the 19-26th of December 2010. First I would like to say that I travel a lot, being to the sandos caracole village, viva wyndham Maya, iberostar paraiso lindo, Riu caribe, Riu palace Riviera Maya, now jade, Riu negril and the Riu palace Riviera Maya back in 2006. I can honestly say that this wasn’t the worst trip I’ve been on, but definitely not the best. It was a real let down from four years ago, the hotel really aged. Airport : The shuttle from the airport was okay. Right after we went through security, it was easy to find the sunwing bus to the hotel. It was a long drive, (about 50 minutes) but we knew that coming. We were the last stop on the bus, so it was interesting seeing the different hotels in the area. Check in : It wasn’t too bad. We got the rooms that we wanted (facing the grounds) with no extra fee. (3092 + 3093). We got the bracelets. Although they ran out of the light blue children’s bands, so we had to get one in the morning, there was no problem getting food or drinks without it. The staffs were very apologetic over the smallest things. Really wonderful staff. Rooms : Good: The rooms didn’t smell musty which was good. Because we were on the third floor, we did not have a sofa with a step down, it was all one level with two chairs. We didn’t find this because there was less chance of tripping or falling. It also had a tall ceiling like an attic. The TV was a bit hard to see from the bed, so we just moved and turned it. They have many channels, although most are in Spanish. The best channel was 38. It was Warner brothers, it played the new adventures of old Christine, two and half men, big bang theory, mike and molly nearly all the time. This is a Spanish channel, but the shows are in English with Spanish sub-titles. The movies on the other hand are just Spanish. 35 was Sony, played king of queens and other shows. There was always something you could find to watch before you go to bed. The rooms were cleaned every day pretty early. The toilet clogged the first day we were there, a call to the lobby, and a guy came to fix it within ten minutes. It takes almost no time for the water to get hotel, which was good for a quick shower. Bad: The bathtubs are DISGUSTING. They seem as if they were never cleaned since it opened. We even tried to clean it, but I was just so full of scum and dirt. If you decide to come here, you can only take showers. While the room did not smell, everything was wet. I personally did not mind this, but it was an inconvenience. Also make sure you aren’t too far from the elevator if you can’t go up and down stairs. Lobby : Good: There was free wifi (really slow though), big Christmas tree and tons of sofas and chairs to sit on while you are on your computer. They have plugs all around as well if you have to charge up your computer or ipod. If you can’t find a plug, just unplug a lamp, they don’t mind as long as you plug it back in when you’re done. Bad: Let’s be honest… The hotel smells like vomit. Other places more then others. On the sofas near the gift shops, that’s probably the best spot do go in the computer without gagging. The walk past the bar and down the stairs to go outside is the worst. There must be some old vomit there and no one has cleaned it up yet. It just smells REALLY bad. The floor is also sticky near the bar. I didn’t order one drink from the lobby bar, so I can not comment on the strength of the drinks there. The sports bar also smelt, not so much as vomit, but cigars and vomit, not a nice smell for most people. The food available at the sports bar looks rather dubious; I would not suggest eating it, and ordering room service. The games there you have to pay for, a game of air hockey it’s 2 bucks American. Grounds: Good: They are very well kept. The fountains are nice as well as the benches. There are always gardeners or people fixing the fountains to make sure it’s perfect. At night there are lights on the palms that make it a really nice night scene. Bad: There is nothing bad about the grounds, they are always clean and perfect. Pool: Good: it looks pretty and was clean. The loungers were the best to cool off while still tanning. Bad: It is ice cold. I tried to swim in it once I couldn’t get past the knees. Maybe it was because it was cold at night, but the pool was unbearable. You will see that there are very few people who are in the pool. Beach : Good: it was beautiful turquoise. You were able to walk forever, both ways. The best spot of the whole beach is to the left of the hotel. Once you pass the reef playacar, the few homes, there is a smallish brown hotel. If you go there early in the morning, you can find many beautiful conchs shells. Nearing the end of that hotel, it is a really shallow beach, with no sea shells and soft sand. You almost sank it was so soft. There, the deepness went down and went back up farther into the ocean. Hence you could sit on the sand a few yards it. It was spectacular! (No seaweed either!) Bad: In front of the hotel, the beach had a lot of small seashells, which was that much of a problem. But as you get into the water, there is a strip of really rough seashells. Once you get passed that there isn’t much more. The only other problem was the seaweed liked to grab your leg, various trash bags, and the occasion hunk of coral that I myself cut my foot badly on. Be extremely careful walking into the ocean to prevent hurting and stubbing your feet and toes. Kids Club: They do have a kids club. In the area they have a small playground which I saw various kids using, so I guess it was fun. The kids pool/wadding pool was pretty disgusting on the other hand. I believe they knew that no one was using it, because they obviously did not use and cleaning supplies on it. It was cloudy and green. The building was air-conditioned very well, almost too cold. Tons of activities available for young kids. Food: Good: The Krystal restaurant was very good. I would recommend reserving that restaurant at least once. We eat there on our last night, and wished that we booked it before. The beef was amazing; really tender it melted in your mouth. The appetizers were interesting; don’t be afraid to try anything weird, because you can end up really liking it. The salad was really good; it was interesting to have a salty and sweet salad. The desserts were also very good; the chocolate molten chocolate muffin was amazing, which hot chocolate syrup inside. The Brazilian was also very good. I would suggest reading the menu and choose which one you life to make sure you save room for it. They come around with all of the different meats so you have the opportunity to try everything. Although if you eat too much at the beginning there is no more room left for the last things to come. I feel like they came in order from worst to best. The sausages were really spicy and good. The Mexican was good. The chicken fajitas were nice, because you could add your own sauce and make them how you like. The chicken breast was also good. The breakfast buffet was decent. Like any of the breakfast buffets in any other hotel. There are omelettes, bacon, eggs, sausages, hash browns, all sorts of breads and jams, fruits, yogurts, cold cuts, cheese. The usual. The only thing I would suggest is to not drink the milk that’s in the dispensers by the orange juice. I watched as they poured it in. It comes in a large bucket, which isn’t that gross. But as they poured, the bottom and sides were covered with curdled milk. It was as they say very chunky milk; therefore you could get sick if you use it in cereal. Just be careful. (My suggestion is to eat rice every lunch and dinner, it’s always very good and it prevents you from getting the runs) Bad: The lunch and dinner buffets were just horrible. There was never really any selection. It was the same stuff every day, but it wasn’t even good. At lunch I had a hamburger and pizza every day because there was nothing else. (There pizzas were really good though) I also experimented with the Mexican foods, and the kinds of beef or pork or chicken, but I also ended up spitting it out because it was good or tasted funny. It was really disappointing because the hotel had really good food 4 years ago. Also, do NOT eat the guacamole at the lunch buffet. My oldest daughter ate it, can got EXTREME food poisoning, she was so sick that she missed Christmas eve dinner to be in the washroom throwing up. It was a real shame, because it ruined Christmas. She was also very upset that she missed the whole set-up for Christmas. She was sick for about 3 days, and uneasy for the next 4 at home, so it was pretty bad. One day, there was absolutely no selection at the beach lunch buffet that I went to the one near the lobby. I found some okay beef and pork, which I saw later at dinner. One evening I went to get dessert and someone threw up all over the desserts, the dessert table and floor. It was so appalling. Christmas: The Christmas buffet was really nice. If anyone plans to visit at Christmas, I say the dinner is a much. They really spent a lot of time setting up. Each table had new linens, candles, menus, and amazing staff bringing you drinks. There were too many butter sculptures to count. It was a really nice spread. They were carving turkey, beef and had cranberry sauce. Many selections of sides, with fries, carrots, rice, noodles, tons of vegetables, caviar. It was the best of the buffets all week. Desserts were outside; they had a cracker house, the chocolate fountain with strawberries to dip in as well. Cherries, cakes, cookies (they had no cookies all week!) and every other fruit. They had m any nice ice sculptures as well. There even had a papier Mache Santa with his sleigh and reindeers included. (It was a shame they didn’t have any of the decorations left for Christmas day.) They had music going until midnight (babies be warned) but it was a really nice feeling in the courtyard Christmas Eve. Tons of champagne. Christmas Day: Because in Mexico they celebrate Christmas Eve as the big thing, Christmas day wasn’t really anything special. The only thing that was special was at noon, Santa came from the beach and gave out presents to the kids, as well as a show for kids with really funny (not in the good way) costumes of Shrek, kung fu pandas, ice age, etc. It was really nice that they tried to do a nice show for the kids. Service and Staff: I decided to save the best part of the hotel for last. The staff at this hotel is amazing! They are extremely nice and work soo hard. We didn’t even tip some days, and they were still top notch servers. Around the pool bar, good old Charlie was an amazing server. He would serve the whole pool bar by himself, and came around and asked every half hour. I was never without a drink. Although by the beach it’s a bit slower (they only serve up until the wall) but they comes at least once a day with drinks. The room was cleaned everyday pretty early. We never came back to an un-cleaned room. As for the mini bar, they only came around once the whole week with the trolley. Just go to the front desk and ask for the drink you want. They always came with the drink very quickly. The front desk staffs were very nice and helpful. They ordered you cabs, told you the best places to eat in playa Del Carmen and helped you with anything else you would need. In the buffets, they always brought you the drink you ask for within seconds. The a la carte staffs were very nice, they always tried to joke with us, but be aware that their sarcasm isn’t always the best haha. I have not one bad thing to say about the staff and the service. Even for the chefs or servers that didn’t speak very good English always tried their hardest. Point blank, they are one of the hardest working staffed hotels around. The service could not compare with the service at Riu negril. Conclusion: All in all it is a 5 star hotel with 2 star foods. Just because of the food it should not be classified as a 5 star. Yes, it is a lovely building with lovely staff, but it would be so much better with a heated pool and better food. On the first night we were planning to come back next Christmas for my 20th anniversary to renew my vows, but after the week of bland food, vomit scented lobby and stage area, and food poisoning, we are going to try a different hotel. I think I will stay away from rius until a new one opens up. It is an amazing chain, but hotels just tire out quickly. It pains me to write this but, 5 star hotel, bad food -1 4 star hotel, food poisoning, -1 3 star hotel, filthy bathroom, -1 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a Christmas and New Year”
Reviews.Author: rosieowen
Reviews.Content: This was the best Riu hotel we have been to. Could not fault it, just wish there had been more dancing at night and everything but the sports bar closes at midnight. The staff-all of them were the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Neftist
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at the Riu Riviera Maya starting on Christmas Eve and absolutely loved it. We had never stayed at a Riu property before but had been told by many who had that they were always very nice. Check-in could not have gone smoother and we were taken right to our room. When we were not all that thrilled about the location of the room, they had no trouble switching us to one closer to the pool area right away. For a short stay, a regular room was just fine. Was not worried about what the view from the room was because, really, how much time are you spending in your room staring out the window. For our first night there, the only restaurant that was open was the buffet because it was Christmas Eve, but boy what a spread did they put out. You could have gotten lost looking at all of the choices. We had arrived too late on the first day to make dinner reservations for the following nights so we had to do that on our second day. When I arrived to do it, there was a sign saying "Sorry all restaurants are booked for tonight" Completely unacceptable. I had tried three times to e-mail the resort ahead of time to see if it was possible to make my dinner reservations before we arrived, but not one of the e-mails was answered. (That is definitely something that they could work on). When I complained enough to the person doing the reservations, she suddenly was able to find not one, but two restaurants that had seats available for the first night(We would have normally just gone into Playa for dinner that night, but since it was Christmas, we didn't expect anything to be open). We had dinner at Chilis, the "steakhouse" that night, and boy were we disappointed. The food was only so-so, and the portions were tiny. Also, to our surprise, there had to be at least three other empty tables. After talking with some other guests, they said they had noticed the same thing in their restaurants about there being empty tables. The only other restaurant we ate at was the Brazliian, and let's just say that it was much better than Chilis from the food to the service to not having to shoo away stray cats from your table every two minutes. The resort itself was wonderful. Nice and small so it never felt overcrowded. Very nice pool area. Yes, both the regular pool and the infinity pool were a little on the cold side, but I think that had more to do with the unseasonally cool weather they had been having down there. There is only one bar at the pool which can cause some logjams in getting a drink when the pool is busy, but it was never a real problem. The drink glasses are definitely on the small side, and they make them very weak so the solution was to either order two or three at a time, bring a large mug from home or just order more frequently. As to the strength, once you got to know a bartender or two(Or gave them a healthy tip), they would make them at any strength you wanted. All you had to do was ask. One of the most annoying things about the resort was lounge chair saving. Yes, there are signs that say this is prohibited, but who are they kidding? You pretty much have to have a towel on a chair by 6:00 in the morning if you want one anywhere in a prime location. What we noticed is that most people just didn't return their towels at the end of the day and would have them on a lounge before you even woke up. Then, when they would finally get around to showing up for the day, sometimes not until the late afternoon, they would just take their old towel over and exchange it for a new one. We definitely saw our share of dust ups over folks arguing over whose lounge chair was whose. And as for the limited number of little tables to put your drinks on, we heard of plenty of folks who thought they had saved one when they came out to reserve their chair only to find it gone when they arrived. The beach was most definitely one of the better ones we had seen at resorts on the Riviera Maya, and we have been to a bunch. Very wide, very walkable and not rocky at all. We normally stay at an adults only resort when we go to Playa, but I must say most of the children at the Riu were very well behaved. The mini bar was continuously re-stocked with bottles of soda, beer and water which was nice. There was an open air market outside the front of the resort which we never made it to, but it looked nice. It was barely a 15 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen, we highly recommend La Parilla for great Mexican food and then having a drink at the rooftop bar of the Azteca hotel right across the street, best view in the town.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the staff was awesome”
Reviews.Author: jodus20
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the newest of the RIU hotels, it was always clean and the staff was super friendly. I did notice it was more families and an older crowd, if you are not looking for that. Also, if you want to lay out at the pool, a lot of people go out early in the morning and put a towel out to save a spot. But I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants to have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Let's go, let's go to Riu”
Reviews.Author: beach_ready_tx
Reviews.Content: Oh the weather outside if frightful but the beach is so delightful And since we've no place to go let's go let's go to Riu The night life is non-stoppin' the champagne corks are poppin' The beer is always ice-cold let's go let's go to Riu When it's finally time to leave we'll be rested and tan as can be The memories will be star bright our clothes will fit a little tight The staff is second to none the entertainers are so much fun The walk into town is nice and slow let's go let's go to Riu

Reviews.Title: “great stay in mexico, no major complaints!”
Reviews.Author: mrtjt
Reviews.Content: Food and service is much better at this Riu than the one in Punta Cana DR. The entire staff seem genuinely friendly and want to make sure your visit exceeds your expectations. There is also no musty smell problem in the rooms compared to Punta Cana. Expensive over Christmas, but 60% less expensive in Jan. according to Expedia. Only mild complaint is the beds could be better for a 5+* Premium booze and bottled beer included in the stocked room bars. No one was sick, but bring Immonium in case you drink something off the resort...

Reviews.Title: “This is the Riu to chose”
Reviews.Author: erc5
Reviews.Content: This is my first time writng yet I use Trip Advisor for every trip we take. We (three teens ages 20, 17, 14) plus parents have just returned from a week at Riu Riveria Maya. I spent weeks researching the trip and was was pleased we made the right choice after seeing the other Riu hoels nearby as well as some of the other all inclusive hotels nearby. We chose all inclusive so if the kids sleep through breakfast I don't go crazy like I would at a regular hotel where this would be your only "free" meal. Everything was great;food is good though we only got one late night reservation at the specialty places even though we were in the line early. Service is outstanding but take singles and give them out often as they are appreciated by all the staff. Pool was colder than ocean, waves are great and you can walk for miles.Rooms are fine and the same, beds are hard, it can noisy at night while music is playing if you going to bed before 11.Tennis court is dreadful, hard and pitted and not the regulation size, also located by trash so skip that but there will be other things to do. For parents who would rather their kids not drink alchohol, they will serve anyone regardless of the color of the bands so beware and be forewarned of underage drinking. Fitness center pretty dire with old machines and no towels so I ran on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience at the Riu Palace!”
Reviews.Author: TinaGab
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Riu Palace Playa del Carmen! We had our family from different areas and arriving on different dates, The Riu made sure our whole group was in the same wing of the hotel. Our rooms were beautiful and very clean! In the evening our beds were turned down and fresh flowers and/or chocolates on thee beds. The food was amazing! There was something for everyone at the buffet, which was so nice considering we have several picky eaters. The other restraunts had wonderful food, our favorite was Botafogo (just make sure to make reservations in advance, especially with a large group). We had another family dinner at Agave and the food was fantastic! We were celebrating a couple of things and the staff was very attentive to us. They even brought us a cake at the end of our dinner and sang to us, It made our evening soo special! The shows in the evening were wonderful and a lot of fun! The pool was beautiful and we loved the swim-up bar. The beach was beautiful white sand and the water was crystal clear! We did visit some of their sister hotels and thought they were all very nice but the Riu Palace was the most spectacular of the hotels. Truely a wonderful vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort but we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: sunshine11309
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this area. After reading all the reviews we booked this hotel. We arrived on December 10th and left on December 16th. We were traveling with our girls (2 & 4 years old). This hotel would be perfect for us if it weren't for the fact that our kids are allergic to milk and wheat. Most of the food at the hotel at had been cooked with butter. We had to go the Japanese restaurant every night to request plain rice for the kids to eat. Most of time they ate fries and bacon. Next time we are going to go to a hotel that we can order special food for the kids. Pros: -Free drinks. -Free bottled water -Beautiful beach with coconut trees and hammocks -Kid club had really nice teachers. They really go out of their way to find kids and expose them to the kids club. My older girl actually went up to the stage by herself one of the disco nights (8:30 pm kids hour) and danced. It was amazing to see her like that! -Our waiter Nicolas in the dinning room is super fast. We love the service in the main buffet. The food in the buffet was the best. In the morning they had yummy fruit juices. -Playacar is a nice area to walk around. We would stroll the kids to Playa Del Carmen (5th Ave) and then take the taxi home ($5). -Hector our hotel bell man was great. He arranged for someone to take us to Crococun Zoo & the Aquarium in Cancun for $100 round trip. The driver waited for us where ever we went, it was so nice. No worry of finding a taxi. -Lots of food at the buffets. The Japanese restauraunt was good except that they had immitation crab. Chilis for dinner was OK. Food is probably 4 out of 5 stars. I guess if I want the real stuff I have to go to a 5 star hotel. -Free Wifi in lobby is great when it works. A few times I tried and it didn't work. Computers in the bar costs $8/hour. Cons: -The housekeeper couldn't remember that their are 4 of us in the room so he kept giving us 2 towels. Then when we requested it, it takes more than 2 hours to get some. We got the animal towels for the 1st, 2nd, & last night. My little girl asked how come we didn't get the animals everyday. We tipped everyday! -Chili is so so. We were expecting the same juices at Chili for lunch but we got artificial juices. It tastes really bad, how can anyone drink the pineapple juice there. -Pool is cold. Not really anyone was swimming in it. The beach was warmer than the pool. -Sushi had crab immitation not real crab. Our room smelled fine. The A/C was adequate. We had to turn it down when we got there. We got an extended balcony which was really nice. Don't expect to find any good shopping deals in Cancun. You can probably get everything in the states for 1/2 at much sometimes. Remember to bring everything you need, else you will have to pay twice as much to get it in Cancun/Playa Del Carmen. Recommend you should visit Crococun Zoo. It cost each adults $23. The kids under 4 are free. We got to feel & feed snakes, crocodile, dears. It was only 1 hrs & 20 minutes for the tour, but well worth it. Bring sand toys for the kids or you'll have to go to Playa Del Carmen to buy some. Be aware of timeshare people. They are everywhere, they'll talk to you and offer free maps or so....they just suck the time out of you. We were offer 2 free tickets to Xcaret if we visited one of the hotels they asked us to...but we weren't interested.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martinlloyd69
Reviews.Content: we went there for our 30th wedding anniversary,,well what can i say it was just fantastic. We had a brilliant time and Lester in the theatre bar,what he didnt know about cocktails wasnt worth knowing. The staff couldnt do enough for us on arrival we had fresh strawberrys in our room. On our anniversary we had breakfast in our room then in the evening we went in the mexican restaraunt and they decorated our table. Would definately go back when we have saved enough money. The only downside was having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, there are better hotels for the money spent”
Reviews.Author: Ilovethesunsomuch
Reviews.Content: I picked the RIU Palace Riviera Maya versus the other RIU resorts in the Riviera Maya area for my family of five because I thought it would be a more elegant resort with better food , service and accommodations. We stayed here December 18 thru 26th and had 2 rooms 1001 and 1006. I won't review the food or the grounds or the beautiful lobby, it has all been said before. The accommodations were no where near what they should have been. We had the following issues: The first day we had about a 50 to a hundred flies swarming above the door to the room. I went to the front desk and they sprayed something to kill them. It worked. It worked all week, as we would find a dead fly or two outside the door all week. The room 1001 didn't have an iron, or ironing board. I called the front desk, they brought us an iron (only). The room 1001 the safe broke with our stuff in it. Had to wait for a manager to come by with a special device to unlock it. A few days the towels were not refreshed by 5pm, we had to call for towels, or stop by the maids room for towels. One day my daughter had to use two hand towels to dry off and dry her long hair. We asked for a roll away bed for room 1006 a couple of times, it was finally delivered by 9pm. Most days on the balcony is smelled like a human waste processing plant was outside the door. Christmas night the room actually smelled a human waste processing plant. The smell would come and go from about 8 pm until midnight. The coffee pot didn't work in room 1001. Had to get it replaced. One of my kids misplaced a towel or towel card, and they wanted me to pay $20 to replace a towel. Those towels aren't worth two dollars. Maybe they are worth $20 new, but we never seen a new towel the whole week. We did see a lot of stained old towels. I went to the front desk and told the front desk lady about the missing card and all the problems we had and that she should give me another towel card right now, or go get the manager, she gave me the card. Come on RIU this towel card is a bad joke, and RIU has been doing this for years. We have been to many other resorts and have not had to get towel cards. We were at Beaches Turks and Cacois in the summer, no towel cards. It was nice. If you wanted 3 towels help yourself. They always had fresh towels out. When I complained about a few of the items above, and I asked to be moved, they did try to accommodate us. But it wouldn't be until the next day, and I had to stop by after breakfast to get the new room numbers. Then come back after 12 noon to see the rooms, and then pack and they would move us by 3pm. We decided to stay in the original rooms, which probably was a mistake, but the thought of moving and wasting a good part of the day doing moving and waiting wasn't what we wanted to do. The beach looks nice. The only gripe I have with the beach is there is a 1 to 2 foot drop from the beach to the water. This makes for an unpleasant transition from the beach to the water.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: marpol1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the RIU hotels many times and it was always our first choice in the Caribbean. However, this all changed after our last trip. This time we stayed in RIU Palace Riviera Mayan in December 2010. The premises are very beautiful and clean. Unfortunately our room was broken into. Someone stole our camera, phone watch and money. We were told that our case will be thoroughly investigated and we will be notified upon the completion of the investigation which may take up to 3 days. I left my phone number and e-mail address but nobody contacted me yet. I am very disappointed with the way management of this hotel handled our case. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Barely OK Drinks”
Reviews.Author: BobEsc
Reviews.Content: Hotel - Beautiful structure with lots of (what I think) mahogany. Great location with about a 20+ minute walk or $5 cab ride into downtown Playa Del Carmen where there is a ton of shops and more upscale nightlife. Great place to hang at night or during the days and lots of police around so you would feel pretty safe. The main buffet area was huge with attractive furnishings. The grounds were kept very clean and manicured. Rooms - My girlfriend and I stayed in a basic studio suite but it was very nice with a balcony that overlooked the side garden though you could see the ocean looking to one side. There's a good amount of drawer space and a large sliding door cabinet to hang clothes that also has a safe to keep valuables. A/C worked very well and temperature was never a problem indoors. Bathroom is well lit and ventilated. Beds were as usual for Mexico resorts, quite hard but they were also curiously very comfortable and we slept very well. There was a booze dispenser with 4 battles of various alcohols (all name brand) and the refrigerator was stocked with plenty of water and sodas each day. The cable TV carried a wide selection of English stations with good movie content. You were able to hear out in the halls and the noise from the occasional late night partier getting back to their room could easily be heard. Food & Drinks: You had to make reservations in the lobby for any of the onsite menu restaurants between noon and 3 and as we were doing excursions almost every day or were otherwise busy, we didn't get a chance to make reservations. We ate with a dinner party at Chili's steak restaurant and the steak I had was OK. It was cooked well but not a great cut of meat. Lunch's buffet was served at Chili's and breakfast and dinners buffets were served in the large restaurant near the hotel lobby. Both the breakfast and dinner buffets were very good with a very large variety of foods to choose from. Service in the buffet area was very good as well. Drinks on the other hand were very weak and for such a nice resort they didn't use much what I would consider "top shelf" alcohols. The drinks were always made weak regardless of what bar you drank at though the Sports Bar served the best IMO. If you plan on spending the day at the pool or beach then bring a large drinking mug from home because the pool bar served the weakest drinks in very small plastic cups. The beach in front of the hotel is large and even if you ordered 2 drinks for yourself they wouldn't last long and you could find yourself making a number of trips the pool bar to get a buzz, and I'm a fairly light drinker at that. Service - Great. Rooms were well attended too and leaving a couple dollars every day was much appreciated. All the front desk help spoke good English and were very helpful. Most of the rest of the help spoke some English and being able to speak just a little Spanish made communication no problem. Table service was good at the restaurant we ate at and the bartenders were also very nice. If you could convince them to make you a strong drink, tip them a buck here and there. Misc. - High speed WiFi internet is available in the lobby but I barely call it high speed. I use VoIP for calling home and the connection speed is too slow to make a decent call using either Skype or Magicjack, both of which I tried. The Beach is beautiful and there are plenty of chairs though you have to compete for chairs at the pool and get your towel out early. Room service was part of the AI and they were quick to respond but the food selection was very minimal. Overall we had a wonderful stay at the Riu and would return.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!! AWESOME!! AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: weddingcrashing
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to a Riu property and as before we were not dissapointed..We were a group of 16, ranging from ages 8 to 50ish and we ALL had an amazing time... The food was great, the beach was amazing, could walk for miles and miles. The kids had a blast playing with the boogie board in the ocean!! Rooms were very clean and spacious..Can`t imagine what people could complain about. Those that do must go with the intent of finding something to complain about.. This is rated a 5 star and deserves a 5 Star. Great Job RIU..

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cookiebum1518
Reviews.Content: Hubbie & I just got back from a week's stay here after changing our original booking from the Grand Sunset. WOW what a fantastic place!! Now I'm usually a person who always finds something to complain about but not this time. Its beyond me how anyone can find anything to complain about here. Grounds are fantastic. The rooms are spacious, and the staff are beyond words. Some staff work 12 + hrs a day, 6 days a week and still really enjoy their jobs. Santos & Joe go out of their way for you, gotta love them!! The animation team is fantastic. We went to see the evening entertainment every night and loved almost every one. Food: Buffets are what you would expect. You can always find something. We tried two of the a la carte restaurants. The Mexican, and the Steakhouse. We were quite surprised with the steakhouse. We went in with low expectations, as we're used to great Canadian beef, but were really surprised with the very first bite. It was fabulous. Pool: Ok the pool is really cold.....all the time but hey if you're warm enough, you'll get in. I usually like my pools to feel like bath water but I still went in a few times a day. One tip, charge right in, don't try the one step at a time. At the beginning of our trip, we met a lot of couples who said that it was their 3rd, or 4th, or even 5th time vacationing there. We couldn't understand why someone would want to go to the same place all the time. 3 days into our vacation......we finally got it! One other tip: If you're 20 something and looking to just party, this resort is not for you. its great here don't get me wrong, but not what you're looking for. I suggest trying one of the other Riu resorts down the street. Only miserable people could have a bad time here. We would definitely recommend and definitely go back. HOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera maya Just go there!”
Reviews.Author: Zbeev
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace November 30, 2010 review. Octavio, Luis, Rosario, Veronica - these are the people that make my stay here at the Palace special. Let’s start by saying that this is the third trip my wife and I have taken to Riu Place Riviera Maya. We originally chose this location for the reviews about the beach. And yes, the beach is spectacular. By far the best we have seen on our trips around the Yucatan area. This year is very special because it’s our wedding anniversary. We thought long and hard about where in the world we would like to celebrate the occasion. The idea of the warm service that my friend Luis Cetina offers every time we come to eat at the Don Manolo buffet makes my wife and I smile. Luis has continued to make our stay here a pleasure. He is very professional, very friendly, happy, and is real professional at making us feel welcome. We enjoy the conversations with Luis and appreciate him very much.
