Let’s speak about Rosario for a moment. Here’s a guy that invites us into his world and delivers exemplary service with a smile- we love it. Rosario makes the dining experience at the Japanese restaurant an excellent experience for sure. Octavio greeted us after a long day of travel and his smile and warm personality was inviting. He went above and beyond the call of duty to make my wife and I feel right at home. He made sure we had all the comforts needed to make the visit special. Veronica is a gal with a million dollar smile, it’s fantastic. The glow on her face continues to be a daily pleasure to see here. But let’s be clear she is a very hard worker; non-stop moving at a pace that is amazing how much she gets done, but still seems to have time to stop and say hello and make us both smile. This kind of service is rare and we almost never see it in the USA, I think these four people genuinely care about making us feel comfortable. They even remembered our names from when we last visited in April, 2010. Upon arrival, Luis immediately came to us with open arms and said “Welcome back, nice to see you again! How was your trip?” Now that is why we come back year after year! So let’s move on to the resort itself, it is fantastic, it’s elegant, it’s spotless, it’s safe, and it’s fun. The pools are perfect, not too warm, and not too cool; just a perfect blend. We have stayed in the Jacuzzi suit all the way on the end looking out to the ocean, wow these rooms are the best. And we have stayed in the court yard view room, it is also very well appointed and comfortable. The beach is amazing! We love the freedom it offers. For example, if you’re feeling like a walk, just turn left and take about a 15 minute stroll and you have the beautiful little town of Playa del Carmen. Lots to see and do. There is a modern section, as well as an authentic Mexican section. Catch the ferry to Cozumel, do a little shopping, or just have some lunch. As I mentioned earlier this trip is for my wedding anniversary. We told Luis the first day we were here that Friday was the actual day of our anniversary, and he remembered this, and later told us that he was going to change his day off so he could be here to help us celebrate and be as comfortable as possible. All I can say about that is WOW! It is difficult to verbalize how perfect our trips to Riu Palace Riviera Maya have been, so in conclusion I say: trust me, spend the money and get down there and prepare to be engulfed by a warm, friendly, hard-working army of people that will give you an extraordinary tropical experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMaggie
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya is wonderful and beautiful. We just got back on Saturday and once again had a wonderful time. The staff is responsive and a pleasure to work with. Any thing you request ,or need attention paid to, is responded to right away. The hotel lobby is gorgeous. The food is very good in the buffet. The specialty restaurants add a real treat! The rooms are kept immaculately clean everyday as well as the grounds. The room service is very timely. Your in room fridge and bar are replenished daily. The pool is fantastic with it's two jacuzzi's and swim up bar. The service by the waiters/bartenders on the beach and pool is wonderful. There are plenty of chairs at the beach and pool to relax on. The entertainment and music nightly is pleasureable. This hotel provides great service on all levels. No complaints - can't wait to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “TE AMO the RIU Palace Riviera Maya!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: r0ckymtngrrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from celebrating our 25th anniversary and I can't say enough about how great this resort is. The resort is located in a prime spot on the beach at Playa Del Carmen - absolutely beautiful grounds, maintained to perfection! The resort decor is sumptuous and tastefully decorated, the rooms spacious and so clean!! But the real amazing thing about it was the staff - from the moment you arrive you're treated like royalty! Everyone has a smile and "HOLA" wherever you go and drink & terrific food service galore. You want for nothing here. A big thanks to some outstanding staff - Luis and Leo, Pepe and all the entertainment team make your stay so much FUN - Issac at the lobby bar makes the most AWESOME martinis, and all the AMAZING chefs, waiters, waitresses, cleaning staff etc. are the BEST we've ever seen. The only negative I can think of was that the pool was a tad cold for this time of year - they might heat it during the cooler season. Overall, you can't go wrong with a trip here. We'll be back for sure. >Muchas gracias from Geoff (MJ) and Donna from CANADA!

Reviews.Title: “hotel, staff,and service superb”
Reviews.Author: donaldduck35
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two weeks and apart from the weather being a little cloudy with a few rain showers the holiday could not have been better. All the staff from the cleaners right up to the restaurant ,bar and reception staff were so cheerful and we couldn't have had better service. I would especially like to mention" Xavier" on reception who was outstanding and couldn't have been move helpful, cheerful , and efficient ; a real asset to the hotel Apart from the long flight I would go back tomorrow!!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches; zero customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_sr
Reviews.Content: Long time TripAdvisor user, first time reviewer; will keep this short and to the point. The Good: - The hotel itself is very nice (architecture wise). The OK: - Food is hit or miss. Specialty restaurants disappoint (with exception of Krystal). Stick to the main dining hall. - Beach is OK but dirty and no umbrellas. Hotel staff doesn't seem to pick-up the trash so the tide does it for them. The Bad: - Roaches in 2 rooms we stayed in. - No customer service at front desk or concept there of. - No towels or bottled water (check upon check-in). - 6AM wake-up calls by people leaving their rooms (soundproofing should be better) Details: 10 days ago, my wife and I tried to enjoy a short honeymoon at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The first night we got to our room (#2047) to find a roach infestation (killed 12 of them). Luis at the front desk did not apologize, did not offer anything in a way of a partial refund, and did not even offer to help us move our bags from one side of the hotel complex to the other (#2047 -> #3087). All he promised to do is to personally "check out" the new room to make sure that everything was OK. The new room has no bottled water and no shower towels. Back to the front desk I went (~12:15am)… In the morning I spoke to Havier (day manager) who refused to issue us any kind of partial refund. I asked for the general complaint phone number and was told that there isn’t one. Instead I was offered an email address (customerserviceamericas@riu.com), which I promptly emailed. It has now been 10 days without a reply from this address. I asked Havier for the toll-free Riu reservation number. Talking to the person at the reservation line also did not help as they too referred me to the useless email address (see above). Upon checkout I was charged ~$5 USD for making the 1 minute call to Riu’s own toll free reservation number. The mind boggles… We tried to rebook our flight tickets to leave earlier but the cost of re-booking was excessive and we had to stay. The new room had a much lesser problem with roaches (only killed one).

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: valjohnson
Reviews.Content: cannot praise this hotel enough, our 3rd visit 2nd this year already booked for next year, from location, food, room, service staff to name a few of many who gave us excellent service, Luis, sammy, in the restuarant, alfredo, santos, marcella, saumy isiah chano in the lobby and plaza bars, london Joe and pancho on the beach, Maury in the japanese restuarant, and william in th mexican and also the reception staff who were always smiling and nothing was to much. (hope all your names are spelt correctly if not I apologise).These are to name a few all the staff all seemed happy and there was always a ola as you passed. I could go on and on with recommendations of this hotel but I will finish now. JUST GO AND BOOK IT NOW BEFORE ITS TOO LATE

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at RPRM for Thanksgiving break”
Reviews.Author: lenclan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week of relaxation during Thanksgiving break at Riu palace Riviera Maya. We travel a lot in the Caribbean. we stayed at different properties in the past, including Iberostar Lindo/ Maya , Secrets Maroma etc. We usually book via TriGuy.com online travel agency , which provides an excellent service with the most competitive prices. This time we traveled with friend and two teenagers. Everybody had a great time at the resort. The beach is great, so is the pool. The food was a little worse then we expected, but we never were hungry. We mostly ate at the buffet. We found asian night to be the best. Tried Japanese restaurant- it was average. Drinks are very good with top shelf liquor. It is a bit boring at night, but nearby other Riu properties have disco, if you want to take 10-15 min walk. Our girls ( 17yo) were a little bored at night. We took them out to the 5 th avenue in Playa. There is a Senior Frog there, where they had a lot of fun. Overall, we had a great and relaxing time at Riu. We found the resort to be very clean and well maintained with a good service. The weak points are the food and the evening entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Too short ..... next year 10 days!”
Reviews.Author: petplayland
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived I was in aw of the building very "Palace Like"! The grounds were beautiful, pool and beach was everything I could ask for! The waiters were great especially "Joe" at the pool bar. Pool entertainment was awesome I am still singing the " good morning" song as well at the "i want to go to RIU" song. It would be nice to return next time on my own or with my significant other as traveling with my 18 year old daughter turned out to be not something I would do again. She is very hard to please and there was not enought for her to do there. Maybe would have been differnet with her bf there?? The only thing I would change is the gym....I usually work out everyday and found the gym to be not very appealing and therefore did not use it. More fitness equipment is need and free weights. I chose to walk everyday on the beach instead. Now suffering from lack of exercise! The buffet was always awesome no complaints in fact we chose to not do a ala carte one night so we could use the buffet. The Krystal was the best in my opinion .....lamb was my choice! Our room did not have the best view so make sure you ask for courtyard view we looked at the industrial site next door with smoke stacks and it was also noisey!

Reviews.Title: “Best 10 days of rest and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: ams55
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to the Rui Palace Riveiera Maya and it was better than before. The people who work at the Rui are exceptionally hard workers and always pleasant. Constant cleaning and gardening around the facility. No complaints except maybe the family with four small children under the age of 5 who obviously didn't like their bathes at night! This of course was no reflection on the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, relaxing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: mchin3
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya was fantastic and all the staff was very friendly. I was very impressed with the buffet, the service and cleanliness. The grounds and pool were well kept and the beach was gorgeous. The only major issues are the lack of internet in the rooms and the sheets smelled of bleach. Other than that it was a great value and lovely place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD A WONDERFUL TIME AT RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA!!”
Reviews.Author: Beachmommy2912
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Mexico. We spent five nights at the Riu Palace RM. As soon as we arrived, we were welcomed with a drink, what a nice touch! We were told our room was not ready so went to Chillis for Lunch. There were burgers, pizza, pasta, chicken, salads, fruit, icecream, etc. The food wa very good, veggies were fresh, best guacamole we've ever had! We got our room about an hour later and noticed we didn't have towels!! We called reception and they said someone was going to bring them right away... it took them two hours! But we didn't mind. We liked that we had a fridge with soft drinks, beer and water! Mattress a bit hard as others have said and linens a bit old but we didn't care. The beach is beautiful! Whenever we wanted drinks (beer, soft drinks or cocktails) we had to go went to the pool bar. The guys that worked there were so nice! When we first arrived we thought about trying the specialty restaurants but after going to Don Manolos for dinner (the buffet option) we thought we didn't want to get stuck with just one type of food. The food at Don Manolos was AMAZING! We loved everything and we never got tired or bored. I had the best seafood risotto! so delicious.The breakfast (buffet at Don Manolo) was also very good, we loved the variety of fruit, juices, etc. The entertainment shows were fun. We also spent some time at the La Habana Bar. The drinks were very good, not watery or anything like that. I personally think that what makes this place so special, apart from the location, is the people that work here. They all treated us so nice. They always have a smile on their faces, regardless of whether you tip them or not (we did), they make you feel at home. Special thanks to Pancho (pool bar), Chano (La Habana), Gabriel (Don Manolos), Luis (entertainment venue/patio). All the entertainment crew was great too. I did the water aerobics twice, they were fun! Neither of us got sick. I used tap water to brush my teeth, my husband used bottle water. If I were the Manager, I would replace the beach towels and renovate the gym. The beach towels were kind of old and discolored and the gym equipment looked outdated. We had an amazing time and we would love to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with great service!"”
Reviews.Author: rppp13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Riu Palace in Playa del carmen - we had a wonderful time. The resort is beautiful and the service was great. We were truly treated wonderful, We were there for my birthday and when the staff heard of this the night of my bd - a special table was set up at the buffet with flowers, bubbles, champaign, and a cake! This resort was clean, food was great and the staff we wonderful. I will say the beds... little firm for my liking. Would definatly stay a Riu again!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: sprocak
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing holiday go straight to this resort. The resort is amazing from the rooms to the service to the surrounding area it is perfect. If you scuba dive, I would highly recommend the dive shop on site, the dive master we had there, Lott was amazing. The food was delicious and plentiful and lots of variety. The rooms were big and although I asked for a king bed and got two doubles pushed together I didn't want to change my room because we could see the ocean from our balcony. I have stayed in other Riu's and this is the best one yet. The resort is very close to Playa Del Carmen which is great for shopping, but go in the evening to avoid the heat and frustration. Go and have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of paradise”
Reviews.Author: kencat
Reviews.Content: Many family members and friends stayed at this resort to attend our son's wedding. The setting is beautiful and the staff is amazing. The beach is beautiful and there was never a shortage of chairs or loungers around the pool or beach. The choice of food is very good and many people from our group really enjoyed the mexican and japanese a la carte restaurants. We enjoyed the water activities such as sailing and kayaking. This resort is ideal for couples, and families. It was a fabulous choice for a wedding and it exceeded our expectations. The photographer did an amazing job of capturing the event. I wouldn't hesitate to highly recommend this resort to others. Well done Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Wedding Week at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: mike53226
Reviews.Content: Two weeks ago we were married at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and still can't stop thinking about how beautiful this resort truly is. We spent 9 days at the Riu and capped our stay with an absolutely perfect wedding. The Riu staff treated us and our 80 guests like royalty, catering to our every need and helpful in every possible way. The resort is 40 mins from the airport, best to book a DIRECT transfer in advance and go past all the timeshare/entertainment people after you pass through customs. On 1st impression, the lobby is breathtakingly beautiful. Very fast check-in (I'd recommend a room closer to the pool and facing the court yard). The property is amazing, beautiful and impecably clean. The resort is new, only 4-5 years old with about 400 rooms. Coconut and palm trees surround the resort, pool and beach areas and make for a tropical paradise. The weather was good, hot and in the high 80's and slightly humid, rained about 4 times during our 9 day stay, for 15-20 mins then the sun was out. The resort is U in shape with the pools at the end of the property bordering the beach, There is a main pool complete with swim-up bar and a connected infinity pool. Dozens of lounge chairs surround the pool and there was never any need to "reserve" a spot as quality space was plentiful. Tropical music plays most of the day which adds to the ambience. Wait staff come by often to serve drinks. Between the pool and the beach are rows of coconut trees with lounge chairs and hammocks underneath, a perfect break from the hot sun. The beach is wide, open and very clean, perfect for long romantic walks at night. Since Playacar is private, there are no vendors or timeshare people harrassing guests during the day and there's even drink service right on the beach! The water is turquiose blue, bluest I have ever seen. No more sandbags or beached whales, all gone now, as the beach was recently expanded with more sand, and beach combers roll through every morning. The resort is geared more toward adults but very kid friendly. Just a tiny kids area but the kids in our group had fun just swimming and playing on the beach. Pool and beach volleyball everyday and even sexy Bingo! Be cautious, European sunbathing is everywhere. Rooms are beautiful and very clean, had no issues whatsoever with smell or bugs, complete with a working safe, balcony, twin sinks, shower over tub and full mini-bar stocked fresh daily with tequilla, Dos Equis and bottled water. Bed was firm but comfortable and the AC could easily cool the room to fridge temp. The food was excellent with breakfast and dinner served in Don Manolo (buffet). The menu changed everyday with a huge selection of entres, salads, deserts and smoothies. Chilis is an open-air restaurant serving lunch (buffet) everyday, with American food and local dishes (I recommend the fresh tacos made to order and coconut ice cream). The quality of the food was superb and actually preferred over some of the specialty restaurants. We did try Krystal (fusion) and Botofogo (Brazillian steak), both quaint, romantic and smaller restaurants with average to small portions but unique and tasty dishes and worth a try. Nightly entertainment is perhaps the weakest part of the resort but the folks try hard to entertain with a different type of show every night. Nights with live local music was perhaps the best, people dancing and cocktailing outside in the courtyard. There is a lobby bar open all day and night til midnight but most nights were just spent outside in the courtyard. I do recommend tipping, although not required, the extra service and personal touch they give you will go very far during your stay. Our wedding planner was Nancy and she did everything possible to make sure our wedding was perfect, answering all our questions during planning and making sure that all our needs were met. Our wedding was in the courtyard at the center gazebo (The Plaza) which we felt was most private, the main gazebo off the beach presents with lots of on-lookers and gawkers from the pool and beach. We then had cocktails following the weding in the lobby bar and dinner at Botofogo. Our wedding cake was Tres Leches which our guests loved, unique and very delicious. After dinner, our family and friends gathered in the court yard again for live music. There is no club or place to dance at this resort but the Riu Tequilla is just a short walk away and downtown Playa (try The Blue Parrot) is just 5 mins away by cab. Downtown is definitely worth seeing, lots of great bars and shops and only $5 by cab or a 15 minute walk away, very safe and not too far. I would HIGHLY recommend this resort for anyone looking to relax in a beautiful place, be pampered every minute by staff who remember your name and just treated like royalty. It's also a perfect place for a wedding too! Any questions, pls feel free to message me. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: BehindBars
Reviews.Content: Loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya! It was my third stay at a Riu property (all on the Yucatan peninsula) and I must say that I have thoroughly enjoyed every one of them. This resort is stunning, and aside from the blatant food abuse (great food and incredible restaurants), room service 24/7 and way too much to drink...the staff and service was tremendous. The resort''s beach was like something out of a travel magazine...white sand, warm turquoise water and never ending cocktails delivered right to your lounge chair! I have absolutely no complaints...but if asked what Riu could do to enhance this already awesome property and service, I'd have to say...maybe...increase the selections of premium spirits and beer (just a little limited currently). A side-note: Playa del Carmen was a blast! The diving is awesome, the locals friendly, the town is clean...and we always felt safe. 5th Avenue is pretty cool for shopping, bar hopping and people watching. We were there during the Día de los Muertos holiday (Day of the Dead)...the street party downtown on Saturday night was like New Year's Eve in Lake Tahoe...muy locos!! I'll definitely be back and I wouldn't think twice about staying at a Riu again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: KSW1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from the 29th Sep to 14th of October, and can quite honestly say this was the best hotel I have every stayed at. Amazing from the moment you step through the doors into the hotels air conditioned reception, the bars and restaurants are amazing and the pool and grounds breath taking. Fantastic white beaches. Very safe area walked everyday with family and baby and no hassle at all. The buffet and specialities were great fresh king prawns, steaks everything you want champagne every breakfast. Quality drinks like absolute, finlanda, jim beam etc, every where in the hotel is cleaned and cleaned again, room was cleaned twice a day and the optics in the room were great for when you just wanted to chill out on the balcony, entertainment was repetitive at times but the michael jackson show was good. All staff welcoming and friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel much nicer than the riu palace mexico which looked a lot older than this one, taxi to wall-mart or shops in town 50-70 peso and loads of other riu hotels in area to explore. Perfect holiday as always with RIU

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tropicaldrifter
Reviews.Content: This property left me spechless. It took my breath away. There wasn't one staff member that didn't greet me at every opportunity. My visit couldn't have been more pleasant and the service, decor, setup at the pool and beach, meals, etc. was much more then I had expected. The service was totally outstanding and the property is about the most beautiful and well kept that I've ever experienced. I have been a General Manager in the hotel business with a resort property for 30 years, so, needless to say, I felt I might have been a tough one to please. We stayed for seven days and there wasn't a moment of disapointment. I traveled with friends (5) of us and there wasn't any comments, unless they were positive ones. I viewed my pictures when I got home and felt the same way about the beauty of property. Can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Not many bad things to say about this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nightcrawler71
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 2 weeks here on our Honeymoon. I'm a critic so I pretty much tell it how it is. Trust me. First the good. Great service, pool, beach, staff, grounds and all around atmosphere. We were constantly served our drinks poolside and at night consistantly. We didn't even have to move. Cups or glasses by pooliside very small so I suggest bringing a coffee mug or beer mug which is insulated. They'll gladly fill it for you, no problem. I would sometimes tip a dollar but even when I did'nt the service would still be the same. There always asking you what you would like to drink. The labor is cheap in Mexico thats why they can afford such a large staff. The entertainment employees are great. I met people at this resort who come 1-2 times a year at this resort. They all love it. The bad which is minor. Beds are a bit hard and so are the pillows. We went to Walmart in Playa Del Carmen and bought 2 soft pillows for $10 so I would suggest bringing your own pillows. Tiles everywhere so when there wet very slippery. Food I would rate a 3/5 or 6/10. But typical hotel food. A la Carte I would rate a 4/10. Not very good. After trying 2 of them we stopped making reservations. We just ate at the buffet which was average. Brush your teeth with bottled water to be safe. We never got sick at all. Also AC system isn't the best but does the job. Suite rooms don't have ceiling fan above bed which sucked on those hot days with a weak AC system. Grounds were spottless. Working constantly sweeping and cleaning. They fumigate all the time so not many bugs around. Beach great, no rocks! Walking distance to 5th Ave In Playa Del Carmen (15min) Lots of Excursions near by I suggest Xel Ha , Xcaret ok, also heard XPLOR awesome. So if you want to do something do Xel Ha and Xplor. Parasailing was great . Satellite TV OK, not the greatest. Entertainment at night was good. Michael Jackson Show and Grease was great. Mostly couples at this resort. Playa Del Carmen shopping on 5th Ave was ok if you like tourist stuff which seems like 70% of all shops sell the exact same stuff. Negotiate and don't back down. These guys need money so don't back down. Oh and drugs everywhere. I'm a male who looks fairly young and I was being asked if I wanted to get high or if I wanted to buy weed. It's safe though. Just ignore them or just say no. They were calling my big boy wanna get high? Made me laugh but seriously it was safe. They're trying to make some cash that way too I guess. COCO BONGO was awesome as always. Pool was cleaned everynight but gets dirty by tourists dropping limes , straws etc in pool but very clean none the less. If I didn't want to see more of the world I'd go back to this place! Maid service great. We ran out of toilet paper and water for our fridge and they gladly brought it ASAP. Room service is limited hamburgers , sandwiches etc. Nothing fancy

Reviews.Title: “Excellente.... with a few exceptions!”
Reviews.Author: nicoya-shae
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a one week stay at RPRM. Before we had even left, we obsessed over the news reports about Tropical Storm/ Hurricane Richard that was forecasted to hit the Yucatan on Monday. We left on Sunday. The weather reports were predicting rain and thunderstorms for the entire week. Needless to say, we weren't really too excited about this trip. We flew with WestJet out of Toronto which was probably the best flight we've taken to date. Very friendly, engaging flight attendants and, since we arrived there and back in one piece, great pilots. When we arrived at the Cancun airport, we did not run into any time share people. There was a helpful man working for the airport that tried to sell us "discounted" excursions provided we lived at the same address and could prove it. This happens alot in the area in our experience. This was offered on 5th Ave as well. We got on our bus and began the 45 minutes (roughly) ride to the hotel. The hotel is beautiful. It is located in Playacar, which is a residential type area. It is the last Riu on the road, you have access to all the other Riu's except for dinner at the a la cartes. The lobby is beautiful, check in was a breeze. We went to our room, which was on the ground floor facing the hotel next door. We weren't fans of the room, but we weren't in there much anyway. After we dropped our bags off, we went down the the huge beach and watched a storm roll in. There was a thunderstorm that night but the next day dawned bright and blue. Thirty degree days, extremely hot sun, mostly cloudless days were what we looked forward to the rest of the week. Apparently sometime after Hurricane Richard hit Belize, it dropped to a Tropical depression and missed us completely. The red flag was out on the lifeguard tower for most of the week, but the waves weren't too bad. Room: we requested a king bed, but were given a room with 2 doubles that the front desk said would be pushed together and made up as a king when we checked in. Housekeeping showed up about 2 hours later to do that. There is a sunken living room area with a flat screen satellite tv and a loveseat. The bathroom is very big with a his n hers sink, whirlpool tub/shower combo, and brand name amenities. Bring your own body wash as the stuff they have in the shower doesn't smell very good and is very watery. The bed is comfortable, at least for the Caribbean, and has 4 decent pillows. They also offer two heavy blankets which I loved because when you get burned from the intense sun, sometimes a sheet won't do. There is also an alarm clock in the room. Room service is included 24 hours a day, and it looked like it was a pretty decent menu, although we didn't order from it. Housekeeping didn't show up on day 3 at all, and day 4 our room didn't get made up until 6pm, after we hung our sign out. The first 2 days, no sign was required. Also, a maid showed up at 10PM to offer us one towel on the day our room hadn't been cleaned. Someone obviously came in on day 3 because our towels were gone, but nothing else was touched. The mini bar is stocked every day, but if you have your DO NOT DISTURB sign out when they come around, you won't get a restocked mini bar that day. There are bottles of water, Pepsi and Diet Pepsi, an Orange Crush type pop, and Dos Equis beer, plus a liquor dispenser offering Smirnoff Vodka, Jose Cuervo tequila, Bacardi white rum and some type of whisky. There is also a laptop sized safe in the closet for free and a coffee maker. The halls are tiled so sound really does echo. Suitcase wheels are particularly loud, and if you aren't an early riser, those and the maid carts will probably wake you early. Food: There are 4 a la cartes at this hotel, and a buffet. There is a Brazillian restaurant that we didn't eat in, a Japanese restaurant that we did eat in, a Steakhouse that we eat at, a Mexican restaurant that we did eat in, and a Gourmet restaurant that we didn't eat in. We've never eaten at a Japanese resturant before, so we thought we'd try it. They offer sushi which we sampled, and didn't really care for, warm and cold sake, chicken skewers and a salmon dish which we really enjoyed. For dessert they had fried ice cream which was pretty good. We ate at the Steakhouse our last night there at it was awful! We had the last seating at 8:30pm. We ordered our meal and then proceeded to wait for 35 minutes as everyone else received their salads and we did not. There weren't very many people at this seating and there were 4 waiters but they all seemed to running in chaotic circles, tending first to the groups of 4 or more. We flagged down our waiter as he was about to take the group of 5's order ( they'd already eaten their salad!) and he told us to wait a minute. We found this unacceptable as evryone around us was already finishing their appetizers. Finally, our salad came, followed almost immediately by our main course. We had the chicken which was a greasy leg and wing, not the breast we were expecting. We ordered vegetables with our chicken, but again, did not receive our vegetables until we flagged down the head waiter. Unlike the buffet wait staff, the steakhouse, which is the snack bar during the day, is very customer oriented. Before your glass is empty at the buffet, they are there to top you up. At the steakhouse, we waited with empty glasses for about 20 minutes. When this restaurant is the snack bar during the day, the wait staff is pretty good, and the food then is terrific. Not so good when the sun goes down. We ate at the Mexican restaurant, and it was very good. One of the head waiters is named Rosario and he is fantastic! You'll see him all over, but mostly at the buffet and the Japanese restaurants. The buffet is delicious. Fresh made to order omelette and scrambled egg stations, cooked bacon and sausage, fresh fruit, and a bunch of cereals are available. You have even have a mimosa or just plain champagne for breakfast. There are also 3 resort cats that tend to hang out at the buffet, but they don't beg and only come up to you if you dangle food for them. All in all, you won't starve on this vacation! Entertainment team: these people have the most energy I've ever seen. We caught a few night shows: the Grease show was predictable, the circus show was pretty good, and the tropical show was very much like watching a Victoria's Secret fashion show. The girls wear nothing but bras and thongs and sequins, and it is fairly sexually suggestive. They definitely work very hard and enjoy what they do. The guys you see around the resort from the entertainment team are very outgoing. They seem to be there from 10 am to 11pm. They'll play beach soccer, a game they call sexy bingo, and try to get you to join in the activities such as horse shoes, air rifle shooting, pool volleyball, etc. They also take you to Coco Bongo's which is a Vegas style show/bar in a group. Beach: The beach is gorgeous. The sand isn't as soft as other places we've been... there are a lot of shells, broken and intact, on this beach. There is an issue of irrosion of the beach, but this beach seems to be the best compared to further up or down. You can follow the beach for about 10 - 15 minutes and end up at 5th Ave, which is a huge shopping area. Keep in mind you will be bugged by all the store owners to come in, but a simple no thanks will do. The ferry to Cozumel is there too, so the people will ask if you want ferry tickets. We bought some things here, tshirts and hats are cheaper here than at the hotel. Bring your own snorkel. It is offered by the hotels, but it's $35USD to rent the snorkel equipment. We went out on the JetSki which was $65USD for 1/2 hour. It was pretty fun, since neither of us had ever done it before. You can go out on a Hobie cat if you know how to sail it, and if not, they'll teach you. I don't know if you have to pay... probably... cuz we didn't do it. There are also beach/pool waiters so you don't even have to get up. Just bring some tip money with you. Pool: The pool in huge! There is an infinity pool that tends to be the "quieter" pool: not so much splashing, very few kids, but attached to the "main" pool. There are tables in the pool for you to sit at while you drink. We found that the same people took up residence there for the entire day, and there are a couple of Jacuzzi type areas by the swim up bar. There are also loungers in the pool to lay on. The hotel doesn't allow saving lounge chairs, and we never really had an issue getting a lounger, again, probably due to the low occupancy. General information: if you need to call home, buy the phone card from the front desk. We bought ours on the reccommendation from our Sunquest rep from the plaza down the street. Apperently if you buy it from the front desk, they give you a discounted connection rate. We used the plaza bought card on the phone in our room and we had to pay $4USD each time we used it. There is free WIFI in the lobby, a 24hour sports bar with 2 pool tables and an arcade game. Don't lose the towel card they give you... it costs $30USD to replace it. We didn't have any problems booking our a la carte dinners, probably because the hotel wasn't full. All in all, we had a very pleasant stay. The weather was perfect; it rained pretty hard for about 10 minutes for 2 days but the sky cleared back up and the sun came out, and we got great tans. The drinks were plentiful, although I found that you need to specify if you want alcohol in your drinks. There are vendors that come to the resort 2 nights a week, selling jewelery, sunglasses, blankets, art, etc. Definitely barter with them. A reccommendation from our destination rep was offer 50% of their asking price to start. Change your money at a currency exchange or the banks in the area. You get a better exchange than at the hotel. But USD is widely accepted. The staff were, for the most part, terrific. I have never been somewhere before where the wait staff was this great, especially at the buffet. With the exception of the lousy dinner at the steakhouse, the food was divine. This seems to be more of a couples resort; there were groups of girls and some families, but mostly couples were here. Our rep was only okay. She did not let us know if we needed to pay a departure tax at the airport, didn't talk a whole lot about the excursions that we could go on, but she did give us our money back when the excursion operator changed the pick up location and failed to tell us or her. She said that the company said no to the refund because we were considered a "no show" but how can you show up if you don't know where the pick up is? This was also a $150 per person excursion.

Reviews.Title: “Love this resort!”
Reviews.Author: xraystephosbo
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd time staying at this resort! Nice selection of food, and the drinks keep coming! Staff very friendly and entertaining! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “summer love”
Reviews.Author: stephanie823
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel with my parents and my sister and her husband. i am 19 years old and i was basically solo cause my family were into more of a "chillin" vacation. I was more into partying and meeting people. So this was a great place to stay in because i got to meet other people my age who were also looking for the same thing i was. I met the cutest spaniard and we went to the clubs together, the rui tequila has a small but very fun club to go to and even if your staying at the this hotel you can still go to all the riu hotels that are in cancun and playa del carmen all you have to do is show your bracelet. the food was very good and the staff was friendly the alcohol was very watered down but that didnt really bother me cause i enjoyed my time and i still had a lot of fun. the hotel rooms were always very clean and we always left tip but we made sure the right person got it beacause we later found out that the department managers will go into the room before tha maids and he will get the tip that is left for tha maids so make sure the deservig person gets the tips. the beach was good the only bad thing is that the water beginning to mix since the ocean was going througha small storm i loved tulum it was beautiful. I really enjoyed my stay here will be back soon and meet up with the spaniard i met there. lol

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon in Riu Palace Riviera Maya, EU travelers pls. read the tips at the end”
Reviews.Author: drits74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an excellent place for making your vacations. Positive - As we claimed that we are in a honeymoon they provided a free upgrade for a room with Ocean view, champagne and sweets. - Quality and Quantity of Food and Drinks are amazing. - Staff is excellent and very gentle, especially : Charlie / Santos (Pool Bar) , Angel (Entertainment), Omar (Reception) , Jeremias (Breakfast), Nicodemo (Lunch). - The variant restaurants. - Location and beach. - Extended check-out without any charge. Needs improvement - Cleaning services are making noise with the trolleys, which sometimes bother our sleep. - Internet is not available in the rooms, it is only provided in the lobby area with limited speed. - Pool bar is sometimes overcrowded. - 24h Room service is excellent, but the menu is limited. Some tips for the European travelers - Please be considered that if u use MARTINAIR which flies from Amsterdam, they easily charge for overweights. We were a couple with two luggage of 30kg+16kg which a little bit over the total of 40kg, but they charged us 100€ since they claimed that they do not calculate with the average but each person separate. As the one luggage was 30kg, they claimed that we have to pay for the extra 10kg. It is pretty weird to do this since we fly with my wife for several years and all the time the companies calculate the average. Furthermore, when we left Athens the luggage had the same weight and they did not charge something to us. But as you are outside of the EU and with many souvenirs on your handbags, you do not have many options rather to stay quiet and pay. - If your Amsterdam is not your final destination and you have a transfer flight within the EU avoid to buy Drinks (tequila, rum etc.) from Duty Free in Cancun. The authorities in the Netherlands took the drinks, since during the transfer to the EU terminal we had a second handbags' check and during this check they claimed that the packing is not according to the EU regulation. So all of our drinks were left to the Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “Sun Camp 2010 Couldn't Have Been Better!!!”
Reviews.Author: jules40Georgia
Reviews.Content: My husband and two other couples spent 7 days at the Riu Palace. This was the first time for all of us at Riviera Maya. My husband and I normally stay in Cancun at the Riu Palace Las Americas, but decided to try out this Riu for this year. We couldn't be more pleased with our decision. Check In - We took a private transfer from the airport to the resort. Traffic was horrible, but when we finally made it to the Riu I couldn't have been happier. Check in went without a hitch. We were actually early for check in, but our room was ready and the lady at the desk was very helpful. She gave us a map and told us where everything was. We were in our room changing into our bathing suits within 30 minutes of arriving. Room - I thought our room was a little smaller than those in Cancun, but my husband disagreed. Didn't matter though. We were there for the beach and pool. Our room was close to the the courtyard and where they entertainment performed most nights, but the noise didn't bother us. I can see where it would some people though. I do recommend you bring some type of house shoes because the floors are marble and very slippery. I had read that some people had a problem with a musty smell and was pro-active by bringing air fresheners. Pool - LOVED THE POOL AREA!!! Yes, we are some of those people that went out early and placed our belongings on chairs. If you didn't you sat in the shade all day. We loved the swim up bar and the tables in the pool. Charly, Moy, and Santos at the pool bar are amazing!! They work so hard. We tipped all our servers. Not for better service, but because they work so hard. Beach - The beach was awesome! Cancun's beach is horrible, so we were looking forward to this beach. We were not disappointed. Food - We ate at all the restaurants during our stay. Not a fan of the Brazilian or Krystal. I could have just eaten the salad bar at the Mexican restaurant. My favorite is the Japanese Restaurant. I had the beef filet in chili sauce and it was wonderful!! The buffet restaurant was always good with a great selection. Chili's for lunch was great too. I couldn't wait each day to see what soup they would have. The cauliflower soup was my favorite. Breakfast was excellent too. The fresh fruits, juices, breads, and cheeses were great. They truly try to put out a selection to please everyone. Entertainment - Angel, Leo, and the rest of the entertainment staff are great. They work hard and try to include everyone in all the activities. They truly helped us enjoy our stay. All six of us are very competitive and had a great time playing soccer, bocci ball, horse shoes, and water volleyball. We also enjoyed the shoes in the evening. By the end of our stay we decided that coming to the Rui would be an annual event for us. We definetely recommend the Riu to those that want to relax and enjoy a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - First Class”
Reviews.Author: BoomarangTraveller
Reviews.Content: We where recommended this hotel by close friends, so we new we where on to a winner from the start. Even so we still had a number of wondeful supprises. When you enter the hotel it's has an over the top Foyer with the chandelier and austintiascious decor- But so what. From the time we arrived to the time we left there was nothing we could criticise - No nothing and we did not meet one pewrson who had a complaint and you do meet lots of nice people We where fortunate to be allocated a room over looking the court yard , 1 x very large double bed , optics and a fridge filled daily ,daily maid service, Jacuzzi in the bath / shower, double wash basin – enough wardrobe and cupboards for 6 peoples clothing, TV and 24 hr room service. Enough space to have a party, what more would you want? The service through out the hotel was First class where the waiters / waitresses bent over back wards to "make your " holiday. Yes they are wanting a tip (to subsidise their pathetic weekly wage) and I do believe in typing good service. The food and the several Ala carte restaurants were tremendous. In the main self service restaurant, the selection from the buffet was the best we have ever seen and if you said you could not find anything to eat – get a life!. We loved the Japanese restaurant with the wonderful dishes (Its amusing watching Americans using chop sticks for the first time sorry Americans but it was so funny). What hotel would offer a guided tour round all their kitchens, it was very interesting and I think that says it all - regards to their confidence and standards through out There are 4 Bars ( All branded spirits ). The pool bat opens 10am – 6pm, (2 x swimming pools) were the drinks are continuously offered every minute of the day by the hard working staff.( Dont feel you have to tip evey timne they serve you). The Sports bar – Fun but it gets smokey from time to time – open 24/7 and they have sandwiches etc available 24/7, the bar attached to the main restaurants – no problems where you would sit and enjoy a drink whilst watching the in “house entertainment” (The Entertainers tried very hard), that is if you wanted to be entertained. The lounge bar ( no smoking) with “Islas” as the head bar man – What a great guy with superb service. He makes you feel so welcome and is proud of “his” bar, with his professional service and wonderful cocktails. (Cocktails are drunk at every bar and Wow were they good). Please note – We saw no drunk’s thugs, larger lots etc. - just nice friendly quests from all around the world The beach is clean and not crowded,the sea can be rough , you can walk and enter all the other Rui hotels around the area all within walking distance and have something to eat and drink (nor an evening meal though). We felt for standards service etc Rui Palace Riviera Maya was the best less crowded . Be careful when booking as some guests had booked the wrong Riu hotel. There is another older Riu hotel similar to ours that is 4 year older and layout is so similar. Try the local trips – Cheaper to book in Wal-Mart - £2.50 away in a taxi. Walk or taxi into Playa del Carmen and barter with the locals, get a ferry to Cozumel different scenery, 30 minutes by small ferry (run regularly) No problems and do a little shopping and go off the beaten track and find the local shops and bars/restaurants at half the price In summary the hotel is one of the best we have every stayed in, the Mexicans are lovely people and are not out to “rip” you off. Get talking to the locals and they are so friendly, yes they rely on the tourist industry, but so would you Switch off, chill out, there is nothing to do as such (but you can find lots of trips and things to do if you need it?) and watch how many superb cocktails you have. Contact me direct if you need any other information. Have a great holiday as we will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: frilledille
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The staff is great and you dont have to ask for a refill, when your glass is half empty they will fill it up for you. The only thing thats bad is the smell in the rooms and it will stick on your clothes and bags for weeks!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Riu!”
Reviews.Author: gracylue
Reviews.Content: This is the second Riu property that I have visited (the first one was the Riu Palace Mexico a few years back) and we really enjoyed our stay here! First, you have to set appropriate expectations for coming to an all-inclusive resort - this's isn't Europe people. If you want a subtle, elegant 5 star experience then you need to shell out the cash for Nice or, if you're dead set on Mexico, Banyan Tree Mayakoba (or another place that's $1,000 a night). It's ostentatious, buffet-style and designed to keep you drunk, full of fatty food and on the beach, which is exactly what we were looking for in a weekend getaway. Know this going in to the trip and you won't be disappointed! The service was stellar - the people were friendly and eager to please. Again, if you want stuffy and formal service, look elsewhere - this is a fairly laid back place. The rooms were clean and spacious, though they did have that super humid smell going on (you get used to it after being in your room for 5 minutes) and it's to be expected in a tropical area. The beach was nice, but the pool was fantastic - best one of all the other Riu properties. Also, they have a massage on the beach service through the spa which is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied...would definitely recommend this hotel and would return again”
Reviews.Author: PHX7819
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to go to Playa del Carmen and researched many hotels before deciding to stay at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. We have never been to the area before. We just got back yesterday after a 6 night stay and we were extremely satisfied with this hotel and would not hestitate to return. We also walked around the immediate area and checked out the near-by hotels (including all the the Rius) and we felt that the Riu Palace Rivera was definitely the best (relatively speaking). Here's the low-down: Service -- The service is excellent! Hotel Room -- We had an upgraded room with a full frontal view of the ocean. Not many rooms have full frontal views of the ocean because of the layout. The room was nice and the furnishings were good. The only minior thing was that there were a number of misc. bugs popping up in the hotel room and around the area (hall, etc.). This didn't bother me too much, however, since it is the tropics and bugs are everywhere. I bet all hotels have this issue. Hotel Grounds -- The hotel grounds are meticulously maintained and very pretty. After checking out other hotels in the area we felt this hotel was definitely the best. Pool -- We never used the pool (always went to the beach instead) but it was relatively large and there were plenty of lounge chairs scattered about. There is a pool bar and music, pretty standard affair. Again, relatively to many of the hotels near-by we felt this pool looked the best. Beach -- The beach was great and this is where we spent most of our time. It's relatively wide and deep and there were always plenty of lounge chairs. When entering the water the first couple steps were a little rocky (actually sea shell fragments, not rocks) but after a couple steps it was sandbar. The beach was relatively consistent several hundred yards in either direction, with some areas with more/less shells and clearer/less clear water. There is a guy who comes around for drinks but it's very infrequent. You're better off going to the pool bar. Drinks -- The drinks were good. There are full bars with a full range of spirits for virtually any cocktail. The only beer available was Dos Equis which was unfortunate (not my favorite) and the wine is pretty limited as well. Food -- The food was much better than expected. We actually enjoyed eating at the buffet more than any of the speciality restaurants. The buffet had a really good selection of food for breakfast and dinner. There are several specialty restaurants and we tried the Mexican and Steakhouse. The Steakhouse (Chili's is it's name) was OK. If you're expecting a Morton's-style experience you will be disappointed but it was still good. The Steakhouse was definitely better than the Mexican restaurant (Aguave). Being from the southwestern US we have access to a lot fo good 'gringo' Mexican food and this restaurant was pretty disappointing for us. We just skipped the rest of the speciality restaurants and did the buffet the remainder of our stay. Entertainment -- Every evening there would be live music in the main courtyard, which was borderd by a large outdoor/indoor lounge and the buffet restaurant. The 5th Ave. area was also a 20-30 min walk or a $5 taxi ride from the hotel. This area has a lot of bars and restaurants. 5th Ave. is pretty American-ized but there are also some Mexican shops, as well. The only downside is that the locals chase you down trying to get you to buy enter their shops.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT! EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: zigsmom774
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful. the foos was excellent. The buffett was the best. the specialty resturant were ok liked the buffett better more choices, All the employees treated us like gold.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon in the Riu Palace!!”
Reviews.Author: chrissteel1985
Reviews.Content: We both travelled to the Riu Palace from 28th Sep to 14th Oct and couldn't have made a better choice! The nerves had gathered with the rain clouds as our airport transfer bus rolled up to the hotel but soon disappeared when Victor arrived with a colourful welcome drink and we found out we had our room upgraded to one with a view of the pools/beach. Result. I can't really see any bad points but if I was being picky, the pool was a little crowded (some people tended to reserve the same sunbathing spots everyday which was meant to be forbidden!), Chilli's beach house wasn't so great at times and the entertainment could be a little bit samey and boring.....but these are all very small points. The good bits: 1) The service. The staff here are amazing. They remember your name, what drink you and your partner like, they carry your plate for you, they keep giving you more beer. Polite, courteous and always, always smiling. 2) The room. Not sure where all these damp comments are from as we never experienced that or any bad smells or anything. Bed was HUGE, maybe a king-size? Really comfy and the housekeeping were great and would restock the minibar nearly every day! 3) As mentioned, the minibar. Free 7-up, coke, water and bar-style optics with bacardi, brandy and vodka?? Did I mention it was all free??!! 4) The food. Chilli's was bad and I'm not being horrible on purpose, it gave us a bad belly but might have been a one off. Agave (Mexican) and Botafogo's (Brazilian) were BRILLIANT. Don Manolos Buffet was great and the themed nights always had a good selection of choice. Typical Brit though I had chips with everything!! We had room service on our hungover/lazy days and that was also quite good (turkey sandwich and chocolate cake? Of course Sir!) 5) Beach/pool. The pool wasn't crowded as some people have said, the sun loungers were. We found the pool was nice and empty which meant we had total privacy to mess about etc...The beach was great and the see was warm. Who cares if it was a little rocky? Youre on a paradise-style beach....who cares?? I think that's it. 2 week honeymoon went too quick, would definately go back although we might visit the Tequila more in the future as its a bit more lively but the Princess is that little bit quieter which makes it perfect for honeymoons! 5)

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: breannaashley09
Reviews.Content: the trip was so fun! the workers there were awesome..they always were right there when you needed something. they also made sure you were always safe! can wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great food, great location”
Reviews.Author: shammystar101
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Riu Palace Maya Riviera this past week (October 2nd to the 9th). We had an absolutely great time! We have been loyal Riu followers over the years and we had stayed at the Riu Palace Punta Cana. I must say that once you go to one Riu you've pretty much seen them all. The setup,decor everything is exactly how it was in Punta Cana. Not complaining about that because its not much of a big deal. So what were the good aspects of the hotel? The Good points: 1.Great architecture and decor. Some people complained that the hotel decor was dark and didn't evoke a cheery Caribbean feel but I feel like that would have been in steep contrast with the overall design of the hotel. I felt at times like I was traveling in Europe especially at nights when we sat outside of the stage. 2.The selection of restaurants was great you weren't always stuck at the buffet although at times the buffet was better than some of the restaurants. 3.The service was stellar. Wither we tipped or not we received excellent service from the waiters, maids, bartenders and front desk. 4.The pool particularly the infinite pool was great. 5. The Beach was great in my opinion. Some complained about the sand erosion and the rocks. The beach is clean and really wavy which was lots of fun for us. The Mediocre 1. The entertainment was less than impressive. The Micheal Jackson was the only memorable show. 2. The Food, the food wasn't always great. We ate at the Japanese and Fushion Restaurant. The Japanese was okay, the sushi was pretty good and the tempura ice cream was really nice we asked for seconds. The buffet was okay sometimes the food was overly salty or cold. 3. The room. The bed was uncomfortable and the sheets smelt very moldy. It didn't matter too much as we hardly spent much time there. 4.The Distance from the airport. I believe it was about and 1 and 30 minute drive kind of a long distance after a 4 hour flight. The Bad 1.The Fushion Restaurant. This place was disgusting. The food was uneatable. None of it was good. I strongly do not recommend eating here. 2. Flies and ants. I am sure that we probably ate tons of ants and flies as they were always near the food and i did see ants crawling on my food and on the cups sometimes. CHECK your cups and cutlery to to make sure its clean. In all a great hotel 9 out of 10. Some things are out of control as you can't control the fact that there are bugs and that the food is sometimes cold. I recommend this place if your a family and or couple. Its not too much of a party place which is okay, i mean who wants to be surrounded by obnoxious drunk teenagers. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING! WONDERFUL! MAGNIFICO!!!”
Reviews.Author: keripieps
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8 day vacation & we didn't wanna leave, We had our wedding at the RIU palace Riviera Maya & everything was AMAZING! Our wedding coordinator Nancy was the most help & our wedding was more then we could have ever imagined! The staff was amazing, especially: Victor, Joe, Santos, & Romeo- They were always there and super friendly! The food was excellent especially Chilis! And the nightly entertainment was also a great time, especially to sit & relax and drink!! If you weren't having a good time- it's your own fault! The beach was amazing & so were the pools! All around the best vacation ever, and our whole group of 29 people also agreed!!!! Thanks to the staff at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya for making our vacation, wedding, and honeymoon such a success--- We couldn't have done it without you!!!

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace properties have their own standards”
Reviews.Author: kdstravel_8
Reviews.Content: Send a lot of people to this resort and haven't had a complaint yet. Families, couples and even singles all seem to love the location and the resort has something for everyone. It could use a little more area for the little ones. The breakfast buffet is the best I've seen. I understand the beach has recently been rebuilt and is great.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD FOR AN ALL INCLUSIVE BUT I WOULD DO ROOM ONLY NEXT TIME”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraPraturlon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIU CABO in 2008 and recommended taking my extended family there as their first time at a 'all inclusive' resort. We travelled with 2 parents, 4 over 18's and two 15-12 year olds. The appeal was not needing to worry about finding a restaurant and spending the days trying to feed the boys, so the idea of all inclusive was very appealing. The RIU was gorgeous, the grounds are beautiful however at time the pool became almost overrun with loud people being encourgaged by the 'activities team.' As such i would recommend this resort to either groups of friends 20-40 who are wanting to have a good time as opposed to couples or people who are in search of a relaxing luxury hotel. The food at the buffets was generally quite nice, there was however a lack of seafood which would be very welcomed for lunch during the hot summer days. We were most disappointed with the reservations for the restaurants as we were staying 3 nights when we arrived we were told that either the restaurants were booked out for the next 3 nights and/or weren't opened. We did however manage to go to Krystal which was lovely. It was nice to eat a proper meal as opposed to buffet dining. The beef filet was especailly well cooked and would recommend this. The hotel was only a 20 minute walk into town or a $5 cab ride. The beach out front of the hotel was spacious and there was pleanty of sunbaking room and chairs set up. I am not sure if i would do an all inclusive again, especailly in Playa as there are so so many good restaurants in town which are all very reasonable. However the RIU was nice and FAR better than the RIU PLAYA DEL CARMEN - remember that the RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA is actaully closer to Play del Carmen than the Riu Playa del Carmen and newer.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable”
Reviews.Author: PRobinson
Reviews.Content: We have travelled to quite a few places in the Caribean and this trip was our 3rd visit to Mexico. We just love the friendliness of the people and the scenery and wide variety of attractions there is to do. However this year we did not chose the best time of year to go. As it turned out we were in the rainy season and had several days of heavy rain. Yet regardless of this it did not prevent ourselves from enjoying the trip. Even though it rained we still enjoyed the pool and its pool bar or the beach and the big waves. And when the sun did come out we enjoyed visiting 5th avenue for some shopping which has become a tradition of ours. And on another sunny day we visited the attraction Xplore which I will leave for a seperate review. As for this hotel the staff were very friendly. The hotel manager even upgraded our room for half the value that it would normally cost due to it being the low season. The drinks were fantastic which really made drinking them easier and it helped pass the time and forget about the bad weather. From our past experience hotels usually make the drinks too strong and they usually end up getting wasted. There was great intertainment and lots of activities to keep busy. The food however wasn't what I expected it was good but it was like it was missing the wow factor. The buffets had great varity, the a la carte restarants had good portions but yet the best meals we had while on the trip was when we ate outside on the hotel. Like a stake house on 5th avenue etc. The mattress on the bed was harder then we were use too and every morning both my wife and I woke up sore. As for the spa; my wife went for a pedicure and manicure which was very pricy for the lack of treatment she got out of it. And then I booked a stress cure treatment which she liked. And another thing that we were a bit dissappointed in was the fact that since this is a spanish chain or so I believe most of the people there spoke spanish which is understandable however even the activity staff would speak 3/4 in spanish and only 1/4 in english so it made it difficult to join in the activities. ( We got to learn spanish) So overall regardless of the down sides we still enjoyed this vacation and this hotel. Patrick

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: JennHtheTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed for four nights at the Riu back in May. We were there celebrating our sixth wedding anniversary and were definitely treated very well. We got upgraded to an ocean view room and had chocolate covered strawberries and champagne delivered to our room on our anniversary. The resort grounds are beautiful. The service was great. The food definitely felt a little mass produced, but it was not bad at all. We had a couples massage on the beach and it was very nice and romantic. Overall, this was a great quick getaway for us and I'd absolutely travel back here or to another Riu resort.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time and Still as Good!”
Reviews.Author: TJSkins
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Palace 2 times now and LOVE IT!! Be sure to look for Santos and ask him to make you his special frozen caipirinha. You will not be disappointed!! Also be sure to ask for a room away from the stage.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: DerbyBusman
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from a wonderful two weeks the hotel is good could not find any fault.The staff could not do enough for you and always had a smile on their face.the pool area was good plenty of sun beds.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort- 5 star all the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: g69m2001
Reviews.Content: we just returned from Riu Palace, Hotel was absolutely gorgeous. Rooms soo clean ! The food was incredible. We tried the restaurants 2 nights but the buffet food was 5 star all the way. The service was above and beyond. We were treated extremely well ! The pools were amazing (wish they stayed open later). The beach was gorgeous. We had the best bartender ever in the lobby upstairs (Islam, thanks for everything, great guy and very polite and great at his job) We will be returning again soon to this resort. Its should be a 5 star rating hands down !!!

Reviews.Title: “Silver wedding anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Colinwalton
Reviews.Content: What can we say about this hotel, "WOW". From start to finish this holiday, the hotel and staff were brilliant. The staff could not do enough for you especially Islyen, (the bar man in La Habana), Leister at the pool bar and all the other staff serving drinks and food. Special thanks to our room maid the room was tip top everyday. The food at this hotel was 1st CLASS from breakfast to Dinner, how some people can complain about this hotel is beyond me. We will be back again. Thank you it was brilliant. Top tip, go to Xel-Ha water park for the day, 8th wonder of the world. Couple from Cumbria England

Reviews.Title: “Hands down one of the best 5-stars you'll ever visit!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eshehady
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here (husband/wife/1year old son) and we were treated like royalty. Rooms were immaculate. A/C worked perfectly (some other review surprise me- why not just call and get it fixed). The food was incredible and plentiful. Different themes every night. The pool bar staff was non-stop. Checking on our drinks, clearing empty glasses, smiling, etc. You couldn't have asked for a better vacation. We're fairly well traveled and can honestly say this ranks as one of the top 3 hotels/resorts we've ever stay at. We will definitely repeat this one with family and friends. HINT: Although absolutely not required, tips work wonders and are greatly appreciated by the staff. They certainly go above and beyond every day- even calling you by name and greeting you with a smile. Guarantee you will not be disappointed here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise honeymoon Paradise hotel”
Reviews.Author: nana1984
Reviews.Content: Choosing wherre to go on honeymoon was a long task and deciding that we wanted to go skiing next February and wanted to go somewhere where we could speak Spanish, we had heard Mexico wouldn't break the bank. We went to this resort through Thomson first week of September. A great time to go! It was hot, sunny and humid with a few thunderstorms chucked in for good measure. We were not disappointed!!!!! This was my first time at an All inclusive resort and again I was stunned by the location, the service and standard. I have read umpteem negative reviews about this place and I was slightly skeptical what we would find. Through our tour operator, we arrived first on the transfer and rocked up to a real Palace! A stunning Riu the best out of 5 others on the resort. Check in was a breeze as we spoke Spanish and we were upgraded to a suite as it was our honeymoon. Yay! My husband who works in public health was also impressed with the cleaniless and standard of the hotel having inspected many substandard 5 star hotels in London. The staff speak Spanish as you are in a spanish speaking country so its only polite to give it a go!! But they also speak English and American. The pool and bars were amazing, the booze premium brands served and as an all inclusive if you wanted champagne in the middle of the night the house champagne came up with room service! Local grog was particularly potent!!! It also wasn't really busy by the pool so there was no towel reserving really and there was space for everyone. The beach was very clean, and the water was crystal clear. There were a variety of watersports included such as sailing, but we didnt get round to those! There entertainment program was quite amusing too! My husband did shooting and I did pool aerobics...gin and tonic in hand though! I have never experienced such amazing food. I am not a fussy eater or have any special dietary requirements and up for trying all things, but having a few fussy eaters in the family, I would imagine there would be something there for even the most picky of eaters. I'll be honest, you do hear dubious things about buffets so again I was slightly wary. However I thought the buffet at Don Manolo's was excellent and served better quality food than some of the 5 speciality a la carte restaurants. Especially as we were there on Mexican Independence Day there was a huge fiesta and the food was amazing. Ask for the traditional Habanera sauce if you want the really thing. I don't think I have ever eaten so much in my life!!!!!! The resort was hardly full, as we were slightly out of UK holiday time, there were hardly any children which was great for a honeymoon. This also meant that the resort was not busy and booking for the speciality restaurants was fairly easy. We'd pitch up at the bar from the pool at 11.45 grab another Gin and Tonic and wait for the bookings man. I imagine that in prime time reservations could be harder to ascertain, however we got our choices most of the time. The best restaurant I thought was Yashima the Japanese restaurant and the Krystal Fusion dining, but given a choice I would buffet it in the evening if there is a special fiesta on. It was really odd finishing dinner walking out with not paying the bill! The staff were all amazing from the waiters and waitresses, to the housekeeping staff and conierge. They are all friendly, polite and accomodating. Coming from a culture that doesn't normally tip, I didn't feel pressured into tip giving. I gave tips to staff who really deserved it, ie the guy who came down to our beach spot with countless drinks and the maid that cleaned our room. 50 pesos is about £3.02 and we gave 20-30 pesos a time. We did plenty of excursions, one to Xel-Ha, this was to an aqua eco park. My only advice here is to buy your sunscreen once you get to the hotel. This Riu has a little convenience shop (and a nice Silver jewellry shop to boot) and stocks Biological suncream. All the eco parks ask that you have this, and not Nivea/Soltan/Banana Boat/Piz Buin as they contain certain chemicals. They give you a small packet of bio cream but I got really burnt, so don't be afraid to ask for more as they only give you one per couple at the start. On our last day we went to Chichen Itza, a Mayan/Tol Tec ancient city with the famous Mayan Calendar momument. Amazing. This was where the Mayans and Aztecs joined forces. We didn't get to Coba or Tulum, pure Mayan ruins. So I guess thats for next time! The resort is gated and completely safe. There are safes as standard in the rooms so use it, we did. We got taxis just because they were air conditioned into the local town Playacar. Well worth a venture out for dinner or a drink or two. We are planning to go again to the same hotel next year. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Yaditravel
Reviews.Content: I usually skip writing reviews, but this time I must write about our wonderful experience at the resort. The food was excellent, service was great and the ammenities were spectacular! Special thanks to Santos for making sure our drinks kept coming, Leo in entertainment is a Riot and Veronica at the Don Manolo Buffet was a sweetheart! The only weakness was entertainment past 11:00 pm which is usually when the shows ended. Overall we had a great time and the resort exceeded expectations.....

Reviews.Title: “Still an AWESOME place”
Reviews.Author: alma7lou
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel. Those who write a negative review, will I believe never be pleased. This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and our 3rd at a RIU resort which are so far, all fabulous. It was nicer this year because there were less people and we were celebrating our 4th year anniversary. We did run into some friends from the UK we met on our last trip there which was also awesome. There are more Europeans (more courteous) than Americans that stay in playa which were prefer. Being American, we know how roudy some of us can be sometimes just want to get away from that. The workers there are the best, bending over backwards and always so friendly. The food was great, sure the cups are small so go to the local Walmart and buy a big cup. We did & they had no problem filling it up. The rooms smell musty? Of course they do, you're in the Yucatan where it's humid all year long, anywhere you stay it's going to be the same thing but hardly an issue. We loved seeing "Islas" at the Havana Bar and he's the best bartender always ready with a big smile and something refreshing. Sure tips are included but these folks work very hard to please you, throw a couple of bucks at them anyway. TIP: If you're going to Playa, it's best to get private transportation (Google it) for the same price. Playa is about an hour from the airport so if you take a shuttle that has other passengers, most likely you will be one of the last if not the last drop offs which can take almost 2hours to get to your hotel. Also do not book your trip with the ground transpostation or vacation reps who linger in the lobby. They are over-priced and you can haggle with the vendors in 5th avenue, trust me, there's A LOT of competition. Also if taking a cab, change your money into pesos because it's cheaper than paying dollars or euros.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place in the world”
Reviews.Author: beach_ready_tx
Reviews.Content: This was my seventh trip to Riu Palace Riviera Maya in the past three years. Needless to say, I love it there. Let me address a few issues that other people have raised. "Food is the same." I couldn't disagree more. If you want cheese burgers & fries every day for lunch, they will accommodate you. But I had calamari ceviche, octopus ceviche, crab salad (real crab, not the fake stuff), stuffed mussels, pumpkin soup, broccoli cheese soup, chicken and risotto soup, salmon pizza--well, you get the idea. I also had a cheese burger and a bacon-wrapped hot dog and they were excellent!! "The room smells." Yes, it does. You're at the beach in a foreign country--Mexico does not smell like the US. Personally, the smells of Mexico are the first thing I notice as I exit the plane ... and I love it!" "Things get stolen." No they don't. I always take 2-3 cameras, a cell phone, a PC and a dive computer; nothing has ever disappeared. "The ocean was rough." I don't think this is Riu's fault. When we were there, half the days were rough seas and half were incredibly calm. You pays your money and you takes your chances. "There's no nightlife at the hotel." Agree. If this is what you are looking for, this is not your best hotel. Personally, I prefer dancing with my baby under the stars to the gentle tunes played by the band that performs every night on the Riu patio--but I know this isn't everyone's preference. Bottom line: I'll be back in December. RPRM is the best place in Mexico--and a terrific bargain too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We Have Ever Stayed In - WOW WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: HelenCraig_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks and it was wonderful from start to finish. The rooms are very spacious and immaculately clean. We had no problem with damp or our clothes smelling - do not know what people on other reviews were doing to have these problems. The actual hotel is beautiful and cleaners are going around constantly. The speciality restaurants - Chillies was lovely - Fusion was out of this world you must try it, Mexican lovely - have the beef, Brazilian would not bother with this one again. The meals in the main buffet restaurant was top quality with everything you could think of, we were lucky and were there for the Caribbean night and the food was simply the best. Every day there was so much choice and the quality was brilliant. Chillies during the day was lovely too with lots of choice, go upstairs and you can see the sea through the tree tops. We had pre dinner champagne in the main bar near reception and cocktails after dinner and they are lovely and we made our way through the whole menu always finishing the evening with a Martini. Drinks in the sports bar were great and the barman will make anything for you - try a B52!! Drinks were fast flowing around the pool, we had to actually stop the waiters from bringing another round to us and they always seem to know what you had ordered!! They were continually clearing empty glasses away and asking if you would like another drink.
