Watch out for the coconuts on the trees round the pool and on the beach - while we were there one fell off and hit someone on the head!! We did a hotel crawl along the beach as we could use all of the other Riu hotels - ours was simply the best, with the other "Palace" Hotel a 2nd, the one at the end was not very nice with warm drinks and scum in the pool. Entertainment - great shows the Michael Jackson one in our hotel was brilliant, Grease and the Vegas show were also good. We also went to the Tequila on a night and they had good shows a different Vegas show and Mama Mia, also even the Karaoke as there were some really good singers and it was a change of scenery. I would highly recommend this hotel you will want for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family holiday”
Reviews.Author: hellobabes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 2 weeks and had an absolutely amazing time. After staying at a number of Riu's throughout Europe and the Caribbean, as well as the Riu Palace Las Americas in nearby Cancun, I was worried that this hotel would not be as good but the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is BETTER! Rooms - The rooms are very well equipped with everything that you could possibly need. We were given a deluxe suite with a beautiful view overlooking the fountains and pool area. Fantastic! Restaurants - The food was absolutely outstanding! The best food of any Riu that I've stayed at. The buffet restaurant was fantastic and the speciality restaurants were hit and miss. I'll go through each restaurant in turn: The main buffet restaurant - FANTASTIC! My family preferred eating in the buffet each night as the option of food was so phenomenal. Each night has a different theme e.g. Gala, International etc. Breakfast in here was also fantastic but we preferred lunch in Chilli's overlooking the beach. Brazillian restaurant - Didn't eat in here as we tried the same restaurant in the Riu Palace Las Americas and it wasn't for us. Mexican restaurant - It was okay. The starter is a buffet option but there was not enough food for all of the diners which proved to be a problem. The main meal had options such as fajitas which were great and overall the restaurant wasn't too bad. Krystal's Gourmet restaurant - This was probably our least favourite restaurant as the portions were TINY and my steak was not very good at all. However in saying that, we spoke to many other guests who said that Krystal's was their favourite restaurant so I'd recommend trying it for yourselves as you may like it. Chilli's Steakhouse restaurant - I can't comment on the food here. I sat down at my seat and then saw that cats were walking around the restaurant under the table as people were eating etc. I don't like cats so I got up and left. It was a shame because the steakhouse at the Riu Palace Las Americas was my favourite restaurant in that hotel so I was disappointed not to have tried the one in the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The cats are not a problem in Chilli's of a day (I never saw any). Japanese Restaurant - This was our favourite speciality restaurant. The first course is a sushi board and the starter is an option of tempura prawns, pasta etc. The tempura was fantastic! I had a main meal of steak which was great . I'd definitely recommend this restaurant! Bar service - The day bar service was fantastic. A special thanks to our barman Charlie who never once walked past without offering us a drink. He remembers the drink you like and made our holiday incredibly relaxing! Beach and pool area - The pool area is beautiful and everytime you look around, the staff are cleaning the pool, the fountains and the floor. The area is just stunning! I previously stayed at the Riu Palace Las Americas which had a nice but very small beach due to hurricane damage. The beach at Riu Palace Riviera Maya was huge and beautiful. Yes there are waves and on 2 days the ocean was too rough to swim in but for the other 12 days, the ocean was lovely. Location - The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is located within a gated community called Playacar. I cannot express how safe this resort is for tourists staying here! Even the cab drivers have to give their driver's licence to the security men as they enter and do not get them back again until they leave. It is approx a 25 minute walk to the resort of Playa Del Carmen or 5 minutes in a cab (a cab costs $5 from Riu Palace Riviera Maya). After looking at the other Riu's in the area, we definitely chose the best hotel. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is MUCH nicer than the Riu Palace Mexico which appeared to be empty both times we visited the hotel. We had lunch in the Riu Palace Mexico one day and was not impressed (small food option). I can't wait to return to Mexico and when I do, I will be returning to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaggersBingley
Reviews.Content: We travelled to this fabulous hotel in August this year and were not disappointed. I had my reservations going in the hurricane season, but I was not to worry. There were storms, some of them spectacular, but they soon blew over. I did struggle with the humidity during our stay and often found myself sitting in the lobby bar to cool off. As with some other reports, I will provide an honest reflection of our stay, including the pro's and con's. The hotel is magnificent and very grand. The bedrooms are not what I would class as a 5*, more like a 4*, but the rest of the hotel lives up to its rating. The pool area is spotlessly clean and the staff are excellent in all parts of the hotel, they cannot do enough for you. Our best part of the holiday was the 'speciality restaurants' (the main restaurant is equally as excellent). These are all fantastic, with Krystal, the fine dining, being the best by far. It is a little bit of a pain having to queue everyday to get your reservation in, but definitely worth it. Now the downside. Trying to get into the more popular restaurants is very difficult and quite often you find yourself with the 6.30 sitting (this is OK for us as we have children). What frustrated both myself and my husband was that there were tables free when we were at our sitting. When I queried this, I was told, 'they simply have not turned up'. This, to me, is not acceptable as they could have filled those tables ten times over. I think they need a different system in place to stop this. The beach is beautiful and the kids loved the free use of the boards and went surfing in the morning waves. Now to the alcohol. The saying 'you don't get if you don't ask' is very true here. If you want a gordon's G&T ask for it, otherwise you will be palmed off with a cheap variety that is not very pleasant. The drinks are not very alcholic around the pool, which is probably a good thing because if you drank them all day you would regret it, I am sure. Being a lover of nice wine, I was disappointed that you were not given the option to purchase a wine of your choosing. The wine was acceptable, but not brilliant and I stuck to the red most times as this better than the white. This is something that I would not normally do. Tip - if you tip the staff, you get stronger drinks!! We went on two excusions, Xcaret and swimming with turtles. Both were very good and would recommend them. Tip - keep you air conditioning in your room on low all the time and shut your wardrobes. Because the humidity is excessive, if you don't, your clothes can soon get damp. There is mentioned on other reports about a strange smell around the hotel. We also found this and discovered that it was part of the cleaning fluid. The only place I smelt it was in the lobby bar area, following a clean. Would recommend this hotel. If you don't like thunderstorms and are freaked out by large lizards (everywhere in xcaret), smaller ones in the bushes around the hotel, then this is not for you. If you love luxury, relaxation and excellent food - this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “If your looking for a 5 star, definitely go somewhere else. Let down”
Reviews.Author: hockeybrute99
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Mayan Riviera. Both trips we had before this one, we were very happy, and we're not that hard to please. So since you are all reading this trying to figure out where to stay on your next trip, I'll cut to the chase. Location- Very good, as are a lot of hotels in the Playacar area. 8 minute walk to ferry docks down a very safe, secure beach. All good. Beach- Very good as well, as you may not know, the Mexican government spent over 70 Million rebuilding all the beaches from here to Cancun. The only complaint is........the water wasn't very clear within 100 yards of the beach. When they put the new sand down, the ocean has churned it all up, over and over again, so although the water looks very nice from the shore, it is full of "free sand." It's not an issue to swim in, just don't expect to see your feet when you are in the water. Other places 10 minutes away from our resort where they didn't re-do the beach was crystal clear. Rooms- Here's where we were let down. Yes, they do look nice in their pictures, but the reviews that I didn't believe were true. THEY WERE DAMP AS HELL!!!!!!!!!! Disappointed to say the least. When we flew home to Edmonton and opened our suit cases, they were musky, and stinky. We took every piece of cloths we had and laid it out to dry out. The room absolutely stunk the next morning. It took a few washes to get the smell out. They have no de-hummidifier at this resort. The sheets were damp in our room. Uncomfortably damp to say the least. We never experienced this any where else. Like our last stay at the Royal Playa Del Carmen. If you want perfection, go there. it was unbelievable. They were full when we booked this, so we couldn't go there. It is a big step up from this place in every way. Well worth the extra couple of bucks. Btw, they shut off the hot water boilers late ate night, so if you have an early excursion, there's no hot water at 7am. Service- The service was pretty good. I think the Mexicans do a very good job at trying to please, no matter where you stay. The service was better at the RPDC, but it was decent here. Although, 1 day, housekeeping never even cleaned our room, and I swear we slept on the same sheets for the 8 nights we were there. Disappointed once again. Food- The run of the mill buffet. Nothing special. The same thing every day, over and over, and over again. We did one a la carte, OMG it was a joke. My steak was about 3oz. I'm 255 lbs, so I could have eaten 4 of them. Once again, disappointed. It was no RPDC. Would I go back?? No definitely not. This place is a weak 4 star at best, who are they kidding. We wanted a 5 star, and paid for a 5 star. From the decor, to the so called gym it was just a step below what we wanted, and we are not rich people. We are your run of the mill, middle class, late 30's Canadians. I would go back to the RPDC in a heart beat. We walked through the Playacar Place (big white one by the ferry docks) and it looked very nice as well. It's right next to senior frogs. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “I would go every year”
Reviews.Author: rocknrollin555
Reviews.Content: They have the best entertainment, the best service, if you need anything they will help you, they have many activities for kids and adults, they have anything you would dream of. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the just ok”
Reviews.Author: deenie501
Reviews.Content: Overall... would I go back? Probably, but only for 4 nights. Our trip of 7 nights felt too long and there was not much to do besides sit at the pool or beach. I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from 8/10-8/17 with my husband. We booked through Expedia and got a good deal. Beware of Expedia and make sure you pick your seats on the airline through the airline and do not believe what Expedia tells you. The shuttle that we booked through Exepedia- Best Day- was convenient and at the airport waiting for us upon arrival. However, Best Day tells you to meet a representative in the hotel lobby at a certain time the day you get there to pick up a voucher for the return shuttle. This is a scam, as they try to book additional excursions with you. We know this because we forgot to visit with their rep the day we got there and someone called us by 8am for the next 2 days to remind us to "pick up our voucher" even after we did. We happened to book an excursion through "Hotelbeds" prior to meeting with the rep from Best Day, who, when he found out we booked through Hotelbeds, claimed that we are his "people" and had an argument in Spanish (without knowing I understood) with the Hotelbeds rep that she should not have booked our tour and that she stole his customers. The unprofessionalism was rampant and put us in a very awkward position. He asked us to bring him the ticket so that he can rebook the excursion with his company. In the end, we went with our original rep from Hotelbeds, but we were quite uncomfortable. Now on to information about the hotel. We we arrived, we were given a room with a king bed with an awful view of a grassy area and a factory. We immediately asked for a change, which the front desk granted. This new room had a courtyard view with a very large balcony. However, it only had double beds. They said they can push the 2 beds together and remake the linens and it would be fine. In fact, it was. The bed was huge but worked out well. The room (2088) was quite pretty. However, we saw many cockroaches which was disgusting. The toilet also stuffed 3 times in one week. While the room did not smell while we were there, my clothing "reeked" when I came home and everything had to be washed. We did not have a problem with humidity in the room. Air conditioning was adequate. The hotel grounds are beautiful and well manicured. We would constantly see workers cleaning, pruning, watering, etc. The service was impeccable. We were always greeted and the service was truly with a smile. While I would lay out in a lounge chair the waiters would be hustling to bring us drinks. I did tip every once in a while, but it certainly was not expected or necessary. We just saw how hard they were working and we felt it was nice to give a bit of appreciation. The hotel itself was very safe and the area of Playacar felt safe as well, being that it is gated in. We went out to Playa del Carmen by taking a $5 cab ride. I felt fine, but my husband was concerned while walking around as he was offered "illegal" things by the locals. The food was good. We ate breakfast at the buffet and there was a nice spread, rivaling what I have seen on a Celebrity or Royal Caribbean cruise. After a week, we did get bored though. For dinner, we tried 3 of the 5 specialty restaurants, with Krystal being the best. It rivaled the food served at top restaurants in NYC. We had this one waiter named Daniel who went above and beyond. He was only 17 years old. The Japanese was ok, but if I was served their food in NY and paid for it, I would have been disappointed. Chili's was disappointing as well with very limited choices on the menu. How they could ruin a Baked Alaska is beyond me. The buffet was good, but we did get bored with the selection after a few days. Both my husband and I got sick the last day and it lasted about 5 days after we came home. We had diarrhea, sore throat, cough and cold. We did not eat any raw foods (ie, salads or fruit). While on our tour, the tour guide was coughing and sneezing and we think we got sick from him. We did eat food and drink water on a Mayan Encounter (that we booked through Hotelbeds). They said that everything was purified and safe to eat ("how can we serve you something that would make you sick? No one would come on our tours!), but now I don't believe them. I think the hotel on the surface looks spotless and clean. However, one should note that at the buffet, the servers do not change the tablecloths between guests and if you come towards the end of the seating hours, there are stains and crumbs on the tablecloths. When I pointed this out to the waiter, they told us to switch tables. It was hard to find a table that was not used already. I am a nut about clean silverware and I don't think I ever found a dirty plate or piece of silverware. One point for the dishwasher! If you love to snorkel, beware that the hotel is not situated on or near a reef. We brought our own snorkel gear but still had to take a snorkel tour. We took on for $35 a person from the company right on the beach, but the boat was so small and the water was choppy, that I ended up throwing up and needless to say, did not enjoy it at all. Overall, if you are looking for a week of pure relaxation, pretty surroundings and decent food, this is a great hotel to go to. You will be catered to. Like I said, 7 nights was a bit too much. We would have been just as happy with 4 or 5 nights. Beware of putting on a few pounds!

Reviews.Title: “could be perfect”
Reviews.Author: RJEV
Reviews.Content: Sorry I am a bit late with this review anyway we travelled to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in May. On arrival at Cancun airport after an 8 hour delay and an 11 and a 1/2 hour flight flight due to the Volcano, we then took a further hour to get through immigration which is really a shambles, then after a further hour and a half coach trip we arrived at our hotel. The hotel is beautiful very similar in appearance to the Riu Palace Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic, we stayed there last year so found everything easy to find as its all in the same places. After such a long trip plus arriving at 01:30 we checked in and were allocated our room directly above the 24hr sports bar our friends had the mirror image room on the other side of the hotel both with a view of a tiled roof and the walls of the reception area. My friends and I both asked if it would be possible to move from these rooms as we had paid a lot of money and did not fancy 2 weeks of looking at this view. The night receptionist was very helpful and said that although he could not move us at this time because there were no other rooms available he would pass it on to his boss in the morning and try to get us a better room. So the next morning we went to reception and sure enough he had been as good as his word and we were both offered a change of room but told if we could wait another 24hrs they would be able to offer us an upgrade free of charge. We agreed and the next morning my friends were moved to a courtyard view suite and we were given a full ocean view suite, well worth the wait and much appreciated. Anyway the rooms were now very nice with great views, spotlessly clean with king sized beds a good selection of drinks both on optics and in the refrigerator. The standard of the rooms were kept up by the maids who were constantly cleaning and replacing used towels plus making towel sculptures. (don't know how they found time) The hotel and Grounds were very well maintained and as Playacar is a Gated community with security it is a very safe place and you are able to walk out to the other RIU hotels at night most nights we walked back after midnight then spent time in the sports bar with very friendly staff mainly Victor & Noe who both work very hard and make great drinks. If you meet them give them a tip now and again it won't change the service but it will make a difference to them. We found all the staff very pleasant and very helpful. The Pool area is very nice with a pool bar and waiter service both around the pool and on the beach which is nearby. The speciality dining, Mexican we really enjoyed good service, good choice and good food, The Brazilian was funny but not good and we walked out of the Steak House due to both poor food and service also there was no choice on the starter course you just got the salad and seafood. The Buffet restaurant however was superb both for breakfast and evening meal and it was a pleasure to eat here. The service and drinks were good in all of the bars but be sure to ask for brand names or you will be served local spirits. The beach and the sea are nice but the sand is coarse with a lot of broken coral and shells in it so it's best to wear footwear there are plenty of sunbeds and even hammocks on the beach. We used all the other RIU hotels including the ones in Cancun (you can eat and drink in these too during the day and night ) but this was the best of them all. It was nice to get about and Playa Del Carmen is only about 15-20 minutes walk away either by beach or follow the road turning right from the front of the hotel or a short 5 dollar Taxi ride. From Playa Del Carmen it is possible to catch an air conditioned coach to downtown Cancun for 7 dollars return (approx every 10 minutes) from there you can catch a bus for less than a dollar to the hotel zone and shopping malls, we did its safe and quite easy. As we have been to Mexico before and done the trips that we wanted we only went to the Captain Hook Pirate trip in Cancun which was excellent entertainment and the best Steak and Lobster of the holiday well worth the money. The entertainment in the hotel is the same as all the other local RIU hotels not really that good but they do try. We had a few nights when it rained, if you wanted to go out you only had to ask at reception and they provided an Umbrella. We met some nice people of different nationalities and really enjoyed our holiday after a ropey start and would certainly return here but it would be nice if more effort could be made with the speciality restaurants (they used to be better) and the entertainment then this hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: jokell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 8-22 Aug 2010 for two weeks with husband and two kids aged 11 and 7. The hotel is amazing, it is spotlessly clean, gardens are perfectly manicured and the pool which is heated was a life saver in these two very hot weeks. The staff are plentiful and cannot do enough for you and are also pleasant and friendly, the entertainment team are excellent and have the right balance of being extremely entertaining but not right in your face or over the top. My kids couldnt get enough of them nor the pool. Food is plentiful, a good choice and well cooked with different specialities everynight and the kids just made straight for the chocolate fountain after their main meal. Special mention to Tilo who was lovely and made sure everything was to you liking. Our room was cleaned every day by Jacobob and was immaculate and there was always a special surprise awaiting the kids everytime we got back the room in the shape of teddies, animals or flowers made up from towels which the kids loved. The only complaint about the room was the layout of the beds as it was two double beds pushed together and that was were we all slept, not much privacy, would have been better if a double sofa bed was put in the living area, luckily our kids are still youngish but with older kids its worth thinking about getting connecting rooms. It was safe to walk out of the hotel whether it was day or night and you could use the facilities of the other Riu hotels in the nearby vicinity which were all in walking distance. We would definately recommend this hotel and would go back ourselves one day in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Persophonepb
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 10 day relaxing vacation at this resort. The hotel is large and beautiully decorated. The staff is amazing. On day 2, they know your name and what you like. Joe at the pool was very attentive, and Victor in the Sports Bar was a lot of fun. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Never saw a bug. The "odor" did not bother me there, but it did follow me home requiring me to air out luggage outdoors for a few days. The food was wonderful. I only ate at the Buffett..they have everything that you can imagine and it is all delicious. From shrimp, crab legs, and lobster to great pasta, pizza, steak, etc. The beach was beautiful, but too rough for me...everyday was a red flag.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to go”
Reviews.Author: nmiller0922
Reviews.Content: We have been here 2 times in 2 years. We went for our honeymoon then our 1yr anniversary. We will stay no other place in Mexcio but here. Food is fabulous, staff is so nice, rooms are nice and clean. Love it!!! Can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!! Great honeymoon spot or wedding destination...

Reviews.Title: “totally ama-zing. i would definetly go back!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KaelanSullivan
Reviews.Content: it was clean, great location ( on the beach), nice clean pools, friendly staff, fun pool arobic class! lets just say i could go on and on for a whole week on how great it was!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite a 5 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: llcarpe
Reviews.Content: Being a well-traveled in the Yucatan and having stayed in many resorts - I have to say this definately is not a 5 Star All Inclusive Resort - I was there for a Wedding in August 2010 and to start our trip off we had to change rooms twice because the type of room requested and paid for was not available. The buffets were great and the Sushi they have there beats all the other restaurants that require reservations. I was disappointed that we tried to get into the Japenese for dinner and we were the first ones in line to make a reservation and we were unable to do so. The pool is good a big - just beware that there is not an all inclusive adult pool so you will be dealing with that. There is absolutetly no night life - The best they can do is a Sports Bar whicsh they allow smoking in. There are many more good places to stay such as the Royle Palace or El Cid which is the same price and a lot more ammentities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: curlylauraMontreal
Reviews.Content: We moved after one night from the RIU Palace Mexico. We could not bear the smell at the other resort and also the pool area was horrible. Glad we transferred to this resort. Beach was amazing and clean. Service is amazing. The pool staff and animation team also great. We did not eat at the specialty restaurants because were very happy with the buffet although I must have eaten something bad because was sick to my stomach for 4 days, husband was ok so i assume it was the salad (green leaves) because that is what he does not eat and i ate lots of it so be careful, possibly from the water they used to clean it and left water on leaves??? don't know but i stayed away from it. We would definitely go back to this hotel it was truly an amazing place.

Reviews.Title: “great place to relax and unwind”
Reviews.Author: tinita10
Reviews.Content: we booked for 5 nights in this hotel at the end of our tour in yucatán to relax and get some tan ;) arriving by taxi, we saw already that the hotel was huge but on the inside it is really overdone in decoration, not really tasteful the people at the reception were friendly but explained everything in a hurry, our room wasn't ready at 3 pm so we had a drink in the Havana bar in the lobby the cocktails were said to be prepared with natural juices but everything came out of a tube and tasted artificially - nothing like the pineapple juices we had before in cheaper hotels! the room is big and comfortable, with good beds and a nice bathroom the overall complex is nicely built with a great swimmingpool and a lot of sunbeds available also at the beach there was a bit of animation : beach volley, aqua-aerobics, ... but no too much so it would bother your relaxing day at the pool the swim-up bar was great! the music, the atmosphere, ... a chill place to hang out the evening you could choose between a lot of restaurants but you had to make a reservation in advance, a lot of the restaurants were already full! the free entrance restaurant served really good food too, so we only ate one night in the steakhouse (mm, good meat) and the other nights in the Manolo, where the dishes were very diverse, a lot of fresh made pasta and sauce you could choose, lots of salads and vegetables, ... often we ate too much just because it was all so tasteful! we heard other guests compare the different riu's in the neighbourhood (lupita, mexico, cancun, ...) and they said this riu was far the best!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Good Resort, Could Be Great If..........”
Reviews.Author: Krellijo
Reviews.Content: Other reviews complained about the evening entertainment being pretty weak, they were being kind. It was awful, and that's a shame. Every night there would be 150-200 really well dressed guests milling around in the courtyard area and the best they had to offer was Mexican folk dancing. One night was kids night, they recruited children out of the audience to come up on stage and sing. Come on! Almost every other aspect of this resort was great, but whoever is in charge of entertainment should be fired. RIU Tequila (a 10 minute walk) has Pinata open from 2300-0200, but a resort like this deserves it's own club. Overall I'd say the best food of the all-inclusives I've been to. Krystal is not to be missed. They have the same type of dinner reservation system that a lot of the resorts use (go to the lobby between 1200-1500 and make up to 2 nights worth of reservations). Seating choices are 6:30 or 8:45. A little tipping goes a long way, hint, hint. Beach was great, lots of chairs under the shady palms. Pool was not huge, and they only have one which got pretty warm and oily by the afternoon but I go more for the beach so was not a problem. As you'll read, the hallways are tiled and get pretty noisy at night but the hotel is well constructed, you never hear your neighbors once their door slams. For whatever reason female guests seemed to outnumber the men 5-to-1. The hotel is located within Playacar so every car coming in has to show ID. The only folks walking the sidewalks at night are other tourists like yourself, I didn't see a single sketchy character. Arrange a trip or grab some snorkel gear and a cab to Akumal Bay. Saw more sea turtles than we could count and they are oblivious to the snorkelers.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Amazement”
Reviews.Author: jubjubjulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera last year with a group of 12 friends. I have always chose the Riu's over any other properties as their service, grounds and amenities were amazing! This resort didn't disappoint. Rooms: Stayed in a Junior Suite, rooms were cleaned daily fridge stocked everyday. We only had one day where they forgot to give us more toilet paper, but that was easily rectified. Food: was ok, I stayed at the Riu Cancun and thought the food was better. But breakfast was the best! Unfortunately, our group was sick (my friend decided to bring a "bug" with him from toronto and passed it to everyone in the group). So unfortunately, we ended up missing our a la carte meal at the fine dining restaurant. I beleieve was called st. alexandres or arthurs.. but we had room service which was included in the hotel and it was great. Staff: was amazing! always friendly, smiling and willing to help. We decided to hire 2 of the resort workers to bring us to Tulum and the Cenotes but due to miscommunications, they didn't show. But our group decided to go one our own anyways and created a Choose your Own Adventure Tour! Tours: We paid $80USD for a snorkeling trip on a catamaran that took us out, provided us lunch and took us to a private beach in Cozumel. The beach there was absolutely beautiful! Well worth the money! Although we did, yes we did, encounter a SHARK! but the staff quickly pulled the catamaran up to the group and pulled us in. We paid $50 USD each for a private van and staff to take us party hopping in Cancun. Well WORTH IT as a taxi to Cancun would have been $50 anyways. Our groups choose your own adventure trip consisted of us going to Playa del Carmen and taking the bus to Tulum. The local bus was only $1USD back then and entrance fee to tulum was $9USD? It was crazy hot there, but the beach they had at Tulum was to die for! sooo beautiful! We took a collectivo back to the resort for only $2USD!. In all for that trip to Tulum only cost $12 USD whereas Sunquest was charging $90 USD!! Beach: Beautiful.. calm clear blue waters, where you can see your toes even far out! The town of Playa del Carmen was only a 5 min drive from the hotel or $5 USD we paid for a cab. we went out to eat for my husbands birthday at a restaurant there (forgot the name). food was good. Only Con to eating out, bring cash, do not use your visa, we got our credit card frauded after using it here. I loved staying at the Riu. I would definitely go back! I am going back to the Mayan Riviera staying at the Grand Rivieria Princess this September. Got a deal and after reading all the reviews, I'm kicking myself and wishing I booked the Riu again. Hopefully the princess resorts can compare to the Riu's.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: snickersle
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Great food. Beautiful property. Outstanding value. We were a group of six adults traveling. From the moment we arrived until the moment we departed we were all very impressed by this all-inclusive hotel. The staff was constantly cleaning and maintaining the rooms and grounds. We did not experience any inconveniences. The speciality restaurants were excellent. The Mexican one being the weakest of the bunch. Buffet meals were of high quality. Lots of options. Activities were available. We played tennis and beach volleyball and participated in water aerobics. The guests were multinational in scope. The activities staff were energetic and engaging. English was understood by most of the staff. Tips were included but we were more than happy to dole out some cash as the trip went along. In summary, if you go with the flow and leave your ego at the door, you will have a great time. Small stuff like mosquitoes (some, not a lot), rain and unpredictable events happen. It is not an intentional act of the hotel or the staff. Smile, laugh, enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Sun, Fun, and Total Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: DebbiH
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Riviera Maya this is the place to stay. The rooms are large and comfortable. The staff is friendly and more than willing to accomodate. The beach is one of the most beautiful you will find anywhere with lots of soft white sand and plenty of chairs in the sun or under the shade of the palms if you prefer. The buffet restaurant has an excellent selection and variety for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Don't miss Caribbean night. They offer a wonderful selection of seafood. Make your reservations for the specialty restaurants as soon as you arrive. The Japanese restaurant was great however the service is somewhat slow. The steak house is also very good. I would recommend trying the land and sea entree. The Mexican restaurant was disappointing. We all thought the mexican fare was much better at the buffet. If you go to Krystal, the gourmet restaurant, you may want to try the sea bass. The sports bar is amazing. Victor will make any drink you can imagine. Try a "Crazy Frog" or "Banger" shooter. When you're on the beach in the afternoon, having cocktails in the lobby or listening to the live music in the courtyard in the evening, look for Joe taking drink orders. He'll greet you with a smile and a handshake and make sure you are well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic food, hotel, entertainment good be better, rooms a bit noisey.”
Reviews.Author: caly_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks in March. Hotel room was very spacious with large double bed and a seating area. The food was amazing and such good quality, beef wellington, lobster on more than one occasion. A La Carte restaurants also but the food was so good in the buffet we chose to eat in those. The only thing I could say that were negative points were that the evening entertainment finished quite early and the rooms had quite big gaps under the doors and you could hear every word people said as they were walking down the corridors past your room. All in all an excellent hotel and I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “All glitz no glam...”
Reviews.Author: ASNJCORP
Reviews.Content: On the surface the hotel is gorgeous. Unfortunately the service is poor, if you are looking for high service quality this hotel IS NOT FOR YOU. Based on my discussions with other guests, it apparently could alway be worse, however this is how it goes: Day 1: Cockaroach in bathroom-STAFF SAID SORRY THIS IS THE JUNGLE! Day 2: creepy crawlies around fridge, maid spraid Raid! Day 3: poured during wedding and being in the wedding party we begged for towels and umbrella, BUT bc we didn't have our towel key/room key we WERE TOLD NO!! Wasn't our soaked brides's wedding dress enough? Day 4: INTERNET WAS DOWN, oh well. By the way, the hotel is roughly one hour away from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Surfnorthwest
Reviews.Content: This resort was one of three we visited during our two week stay in the Mayan Riviera this year. We were pleasantly surprised with the excellent service and food quality this resort offers. Excellent location also. Instead of going over everything that others have already said I posted a large photo album of the resort for your consideration, http://www.surfnorthwest.com/riu/index.htm For the price we got this place is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulieWEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I was in RPRM from 26 June to 9 July. There were 9 of us - 6 adults and 3 kids (8, 4 and 3). I have included some comments from a Mum's point of view as there arent too many on the reviews here. We had a few days of bad weather but the entertainment staff set up some indoor activities (ie casino, games for kids) so at least there is something to do. The first day we spent a lovely day at the Lobby Bar while the men were in the Sports Bar watching football and the two boys were at the kids club. Unfortunately the boys didnt really like the kids club. I think the problem was possibly due to them not being able to understand the lady who runs it (coupled with them being Mummy's boys!). They did take part in the kids disco which was on in the Lirico Lounge every night form 8.30 to 9. This consisted of dancing and a variety of games each night (musical statues, a pinata and a fashion show). We just cant get that song out of our heads now (Ch-ch-wa, Ch-ch-wa, Ch-ch-wa-wa-wa - anyone know what it is??). I have to say that the Entertainment staff work so hard. There are plenty of activities going on every day, or you can just laze by the pool. We did the water aerobics most days and it was really good fun. It was nice to meet people from different places as there werent too many Brits there (although we did go just before the start of the Scottish school holidays). The guests were mostly from the USA but we also met people from Argentina, Spain, Poland, Portugal, Mexico and of course Scotland. The pool area is always busy and has a good atmosphere. There is always something going on like aerobics, water volleyball, bingo and quizzes round the pool. The Kids Pool is a bit of a joke - its the size of a paddling pool! All the staff in the hotel are really friendly. You dont have to tip but it does secure a wee bit of a better service. We tipped one of the waiters on the first day and he came up with loads of drinks that we hadnt even ordered including shots and tequila slammers (never again!). The hotel is very safe for kids and we didnt have to worry about the boys sitting in the bar on their own (obviously within our sight) even though they are only 3 and 4. The waiters kept them going with drinks all night and I think they felt very grown up! Only slight complaint is that there wasnt a great deal of a selection of food for kids. Ours mostly ate pizza, bread rolls and ice cream for 2 weeks! I've read loads of reviews where people complain. Yes the drinks may not be that strong in the cocktails - so ask for more alcohol! Yes there is sometimes a musty smell in the rooms but that is probably down to the maids leaving the door open while cleaning the rooms and the air-con being left on. Yes it is over an hour from the airport - so read the brochure before you go and book somewhere closer!! Basically you cant please everyone! You're in a beautiful place and being waited on hand and foot so go on holiday, relax, chill out and stop moaning!

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway”
Reviews.Author: lindsaylou82
Reviews.Content: Everything was excellent. Rooms very clean, food as you would expect from an all inclusive. Beach was being improved while we were there. Was a great neighboorhood for running/walking outside resort, very safe.

Reviews.Title: “I've never been so spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: Lee99Milwaukee
Reviews.Content: Arrival: We arrived over 7 hours late - Thank You US Airways... However, the front desk staff handed us our fruity beverage and we spent no more than 3 minutes checking in. Was so easy I was shocked. My advice... pay for a private transfer to and from the airport/hotel. We booked thru FunJet, it was maybe another $50/person. So worth it. Our 45/55 minutes of driving was only driving, no stopping at other hotels. Room: Our room was pretty basic. It wasn't bad and it wasn't anything special. We were on the 3rd floor over looking the Plaza. We were over the theater but never heard any noise from it. Yes, the halls were a little loud but it's a hotel - lots of people. One plus to our room - we had a cement instead of a wrought iron wall to our balcony. Was nice to have the extra privacy. Was bummed, we only received one towel animal on the first night. BEWARE: The floor in the bathroom can get VERY slippery, put a towel down. Mini Bar: We left a tip right away and asked for lots of water and beer. Was filled with water every day. To my surprise, we barely drank the beer and never touched the liquor dispensers. The Bed: was firm. It wasn't unmanageable, I didn't wake up sore at all. We did not have 2 beds pushed together, ours was a true king size. The Musty Odor... after a couple of days of us "living" in the room, yes it did get musty. Wet swim suits, wet towels, sweaty clothes (REALLY HOT when we were there), started to get musty. I turned the fan on and opened the balcony door before we left for town. The maid came in, cleaned, closed the door so the air was back on and the smell was gone. My clothes were not ruined when I came home due to any smell. I washed them, dried them, all back to normal. Location: We did walk to and from Playa del Carmen almost every other day. It's maybe a 15 minute stroll. It was VERY hot when we were there - take water with you. If you prefer to take a taxi it really is $5US or 50 Pecos either way. No bartering, no other amount was ever asked. There were always taxi's readily available at the hotel, just ask the bellhop. In town, they are everywhere. Food: We ate, and ate and ate. The buffets in the main dining hall were always good, presented well and plentiful. There are healthy options to choose from. Lunch at Chili's was our standard, which we enjoyed. We did have dinner at Chili's (the lamb was amazing!) and the Sushi restaurant, we enjoyed both very much. The food that you can take at any time from the Sportsbar was our savior on more than 1 occasion, was almost 2am when we got back from Playa! Sandwiches, fruit was always fresh. The night that we ate at the Sushi restaurant, the main buffet had a Grand Gala (can't remember the exact name, check the board outside of the door). We were sad that we missed it as it looked spectacular! Drinks: I have a really hard time believing that the liquor is watered down. Even if it is, that's not necessarily a bad thing. When the staff is bringing each of you 2 drinks at a time (Happy Hour, even at 10am), every 10 minutes - watered down could be a good thing. Please whatever you do - order Mimosa's at breakfast. They were a great way to start the day! Try a Dirty Monkey for an after lunch drink and a Martini before dinner at the lobby bar - they make a REALLY good Cosmo. The wine... I'm by no means a wine connoisseur however, it is my drink of choice. It took me many tries to be able to drink the wine... If you must, ask for the Chilean wines first. The white was palatable to me. Staff: Was the most amazing part of the entire trip. The waiters, line cooks, bartenders, servers were all friendly, quick and 75% of them spoke wonderful English. They all seemed to enjoy their job and we got to know some of them as they are there 6 days a week usually for 12 hours or more. It was amazing that they saw us coming and always had a smile, Hola! and usually a drink or a seat at a table. Chairs were always pulled out for me, plates always cleared. We did tip but seriously, we would watch people from the staff from breakfast thru the night time show. They change outfits and keep working! Entertainment: I didn't come to this hotel for the entertainment - Playa is so close if that's what you're looking for. However, we did watch the show a couple of nights. We saw the Crazy Show - hilarious and Grease - was good! One night they were setting up for a circus act and had a huge trapeze in the courtyard but that was a night out at Playa so didn't see the show. The entertainment during the day was just as good. They definitely keep the crowd busy. I didn't partake in the aerobics, dance lessons, shooting range, Spanish lessons (I could go on) but there was something to do all day long... The entertainment staff also got to know the guests as they stayed. I watched them approach guests and greet them in their native language - they never got it wrong. We were there during 2 of the FIFA games featuring Mexico. WOW! Being from the US I didn't realize how big, cool this event was! The entertainment staff REALLY got into that, Mexico won and they ran thru the hotel screaming. Got me excited about a sport I know nothing about. We ended up watch the rest of the games at home! The Pool: Our daily routine was breakfast, 2 Mimosa's (Happy Hour), back to the room to change and then pool! We usually got there about 10am, traded in our towel cards and found 2 seats. Not sure who is having a hard time finding seats. Some times we were right next to the pool, some times we were 10 feet away under the palm trees. We were always able to find a mix of sun (him) and shade (me) either under an umbrella or tree. The pool always seemed clean. I didn't notice any straws, limes etc floating in the pool. The staff works hard to keep it clean. BEWARE: Don't try to walk on the cement with out sandals! It's SO hot you will get burned. And it happens fast. Fitness Area: So I work out, yeah... I walked in and there were 2 marathon runners pounding the treadmills. So I stretched and made my way to the elliptical machine to do my 20 minutes (what does that burn a whole 100 calories?) Fortunately for me, it wasn't working. So I settled for the recumbent bike, worked fine. They had the windows open in the fitness center and it was HOT. I did my 20 minutes and didn't realize that it must have been 110% humidity. I almost passed out on the way back to the room as I couldn't catch my breathe. Really, I do work out but wow! Fitness center was clean and available. After that episode I choose to do yoga (brought my own mat) and lift weights (substituted full large water bottles) on the private balcony. Dress code: This took me a little getting used to... They have a very strict dress code at the restaurants. Ladies always have to put a cover-up on over a swim suit, Men need to have some kind of shirt on at Chili's for lunch/snack. And they don't allow wet swim suits in the main buffet. I saw a couple of people that were asked to change before coming into the Sushi restaurant. I got the feeling I wasn't supposed to be walking thru the main lobby with shorts/swim top (I was heading to the pool). So I assimilated, not a big deal. All in all, I would go back to this hotel again in a heartbeat. In fact we're already planning on going back next year and I highly doubt I'll look at any other hotels. It was perfect for us - relaxing, socializing by the pool and bar during the day - Playa some nights!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxurious Holiday”
Reviews.Author: PammieR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RPRM for 14 nights during June/July. This is a very luxurious resort. the staff cannot do enough for you. Prior to the visit i had read on Trip Advsior that all Thomson guests get put into rooms with less of a view - therefore at check-in I requested a special room as during the stay was my husband's birthday and our wedding anniversary (not a fib). We were put in a room which did have a view over La Plaza and the Habana bar - this was a good position as it was near to the restaurant/lobby and within easy distance of the pools, the only slight downside to this was the room was over the Sport Bar which probably accounted for the 'movement of furniture' sound sometimes - again not an issue. The turndown service at night was a bit hit and miss, but nothing to whinge about -as we tipped at the end of the holiday - maybe different if tipped earlier on. Good location - within easy reach of Playa Del Carmen - a nice morning walk along the beach to the Cozumel ferry. Unfortunately, the weather was unkind in parts - 6 days of full on tropical rain - this didn't spoil the holiday - you just prop up the bar for a little longer!!!! We visited the other Rius in the area - Tequilla for the disco. The evening entertainment in the RPRM is mostly average, with the odd very good - although when the acts finish it would be nice to have a live band or at least some form of a disco. Free WIFI in the lobby is great. The daily entertaiment by the animation team is good. We did eat at all restaurants; Krystal is by far the best, the Japanese next, with the lesser restaurants being the Mexican and the Brazilian. The food in the buffet was of the highest standard we have ever experienced in an all inclusive and we have chosen this type of holiday in the Caribbean for the last 15 years. Outside of the hotel - very safe to walk, never felt under threat. The Mexicans are a wonderful, lovely natiion of people. We have previously visited Xel-ha, Xcaret, Chichen-Itza which are all worthwhile, this time we visited Explor - the park with the zip lines - what a fantastic, full, adventurous day. The ticket was booked through the rep and included all soft drinks and food all day. All in all had this not been out 6th visit to Mexico I would say we would return in a heartbeat, but the world is such a big place there are so many other countires to visit!! Well worth it......

Reviews.Title: “An excellent vacation!”
Reviews.Author: JI33LL
Reviews.Content: Our experience was nothing short of excellent! We were there for an entire week and had a great time. The first couple days we just hung out by the pool and ate at the buffet. We then made reservations for 3 nights at 3 different restaurants. You can make reservations up to 2 at a time and 3 days in advance. Since we were traveling with another couple they made 2 and we made 1. We did this for 2 days in a row to make sure we hit all 5 restaurants. We were there right at noon and had no problem getting reservations. The japanese was excellent. The service was great and we had a great meal. The brasilian restaurant was okay. Probably the lesser of them all. The meat was cut very small portions and it wasn't very good. But it might just have been our taste. The best restaurant overall I think was Krystal (fusion). It was good food and it was different from anything I have had before. The buffet was great too. A lot of selection and the food was always good. The overall service was excellent. There was always someone, usually more than 1 person, waiting to get you something and make your meal enjoyable. Pulling your chair out for you, collecting your dirty plates within seconds of finishing etc. Our room was good. It was always cleaned by right after lunch. We got turndown service with little towel animals most of the nights. The bed was a bit uncomfortalbe but I am also a very light sleeper and don't sleep well in most beds but my own. We did have to get up by about 8am to get seats at the pool. The pool was pretty busy but it's big enough that you don't run into a lot of people. The water aerobics were entertaining around 12pm. We did a snorkeling tour with mayan adventures 1 days and it was a lot of fun. Different than expected but it was fun. My two complaints are that it is a ways from the airport. After a long day of traveling we still had another 1 1/2 hour ride to the hotel. Also, it would be nice to have more activities during the day/night. After the show there was not much to do except sit and drink at the bar. We didn't venture out to the other RIUs because there was no shuttle and we didn't feel like walking. Overall it was our first time at a RIU and I would definately stay at one again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Riu2010Newcastle
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2 week break, had an amazing holiday. On arrival we got a free upgrade. All the restaurant food was amazing, we never waited long to be served, each restaurant had two sitting 18:30 & 20:45. I always laugh as the Americans alway find something to complain about mostly its about being ill, well if the didn't spent all day drinking around the swim up bar or the sports bar, maybe the would enjoy the meals at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jaclynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya with my dad and 15 year old sister (I am 23) from June 24-July 1. We all had a great time. Below is a 100% honest review of the hotel & the area. Upon arrival, we were greeted with fruity drinks and given a map of the hotel and grounds at the front desk. Our bags were promptly taken to our room. We had a junior suite facing in towards the grounds and it was beautiful. Very clean. I can only say that the some parts of the bathroom, such as the mirror and inside of the shower, were a little dated and could use some sprucing up. Also, the beds were a little hard for our taste. None of us experienced a musty smell that some other reviews talked about. Our room was cleaned everyday, however we did not receive the turn-down service every night, I'd say only 2 nights we received it. But we did tip our maid for the week the very last day and not every day during the week, so that may be why. The restaurants were excellent. We ate at each one of them and it was nice because eating at the buffet every day is just too much. When you're inside the restaurants, you really feel like you're in another place so it definitely is a nice change. We loved the japanese and brazilian place the best. As for making reservations, yes there was a line, depending on what time you got there. If you get there a little before 12 pm, you'll probably wait in line for 15 minutes the most. It just depends what time and how many people are waiting that day. You can make reservations for two days in advance. I honestly did not have a problem with the reservation system. We liked that the Riu hotels were in their own private community. We did visit the other Riu properties and had a drink at their bar, saw a show in the Riu Mexico, and went to the disco at the Riu tequila for a little bit. The drinks are a bit watered down, but it's nothing a small tip and a request can't change. We did go downtown to shop two different days. A cab into town was 5$ and there were tons of shopping, restaurants, people watching to do. A key to shopping down there is to BARGAIN! Don't accept prices of the first offer, they will lower them when you bargain. As for day trips, we went to Xel-Ha and Tulum. Xel-ha is absolutely amazing, it's a natural aquarium where you can snorkel, cliff jump, swim, eat, etc. We paid 100$ for the day which included round-trip transfers, unlimited food & drinks, snorkeling equipment, and admission. It really is a good deal and an unforgettable experience. They also have other activities, like swimming with dolphins, for an additional fee. The Mayan Ruins at Tulum is definitely a sigh to see as well. We had a wonderful, relaxing vacation. The hotel does have some minor flaws, but overall, the staff is more than accommodating to each guest's special request and needs. We were always asked if we needed anything, another drink, etc..everyone was very friendly. I definitely recommend this hotel for couples and families looking for a beautiful, all-inclusive hotel in the Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “If you like 3 star Hotels with Watered Down Alcohol, choose this one”
Reviews.Author: Ilkley1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned only yesterday from a 10 day stay at this Hotel. We were in all, very disappointed with the hotel in general and certainly will not be returning. On paper the hotel ticks all the boxes, however in reality, when you look closer, you see its not all its cracked up to be. eg. when you look at the actual construction of the hotel, it appears to have been built 'one the cheap'. I am from the building trade and noticed such things as the tiling was not even flat, flush wherever it was outside the main lobby, especially in your bathroom, pool, spa areas. The bathroom was cheap and poorly designed also, the spa bath (which smelt when used) was recessed within 3.5 walls, this ment that it was very dark and dinghy, especially whilst using the shower. The rooms certainly had a musty odour, similiar to wet dog! Our clothes on our return needed washing, regardless whether they have been worn or not. Additionally the noise from the corridors was very loud, You could hear everything which happened here and it woke both of us up on a number of occasions. The alcohol from the beer, to the bars, to the optics are ALL WATERED DOWN. You will never see a fresh bottle opened when you are there. If you look into the room servicing the 'Habana' Bar, you can see various spirits with corks in them. If ever your optics were changed they would simply take the bottle out of the room and return with a fuller bottle. Considering the largest majority of people staying at the hotel were american, you would expect a reasonable understanding of english, unfortunately this bore some frustration. Both our and our next door neighbours had problems with our room keys. The battery kept failing and the only way to then get access into your room is for the serviceman to gain access through your neighbours room, climb over the balcony and break into your room from the patio, which is reassuring! The buffet evening meals were only part labelled, a problem enough, but for my wife being vegetarian it was a nightmare. If you wanted dinner at the restaurants you had to queue to make a booking. There was only one person you can book with and this happens between 12-3pm. At times you can be waiting 40mins to be able to reserve a table and you can only book as far as 3 days ahead and 2 restaurants at a time. The restaurants themselves had the same menus on every visit, I expect they rotated them monthly, not very good if you fancy a change. Additionally half the meals were also available at 'Chilis' lunch buffet, therefore the variation was somewhat limited. Both my wife and I suffered from 'stomach upsets', for me it was twice after I had dinner at the Mexican restaurant. Speaking about lack of variation, the entertainment also rotated on a weekly basis and lasted from 9.30 to 11.00pm only. The hotel is simply outdated, I was told it is about 5 years old, well the interior designer for it must have been stuck in the early nineties. It is very tired and could do with a refurbishment. The location was flat and featureless, we did travel into Playa Del Carmena few times including for a meal with friends, here we visited 'Mandarina's'Champagne & Pizza' Restaurant'. It looked great, all in white leather etc. However no air con, poor service and we had to send back 2 main meals as they were so appalling, that was after they arrived 20mins after the other main meals! Afterwards however, we did find 'Senor Frogs' which was good fun and the drinks and entertainment were good, both during the day and evening. The beach was very nice and we spent the first few days here, however they do not have any parasols which I found unusual for a 5 star hotel. If you want to stay in a 'pretend' 5 star hotel choose this one. Actually dont, as you can find something much cheaper elsewhere. I do not mean to sound so negative, but both my friends, wife and I were so disappointed with the hotel. We wanted to wind down and relax and instead half the time we were wound up! I would heartily recommend the Iberostar at Punta Cana in the Dominican Republic over this hotel, its much nicer, the service, food and drinks are very good and its a good £500 cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Alright for a one time visit to Mexico”
Reviews.Author: VivieinDFW
Reviews.Content: Our plane was delayed leaving Dallas so we lost the first half day of enjoying the resort. First let me say, the staff works very hard and the place is beautiful. We had a lovely room and great beds and working A/C. I did note that the mornings we left no tip for the cleaning lady that those were the days we did NOT receive a cute animal on the bed made from big towels. They stocked our room to an acceptable level as far as booze and soft drinks go. There is a unique smell that followed us back to Dallas; I have had to launder my clothes twice to get rid of this unpleasant odor. We ate at chili's and the main dining hall every day. We chose not to get reservations for the fancy places because my son did not bring a pair of pants with him. I heard the Mexican restaurant whatever its name was was not very good so we missed that meal there. The buffet is good for about two days and then i grew tired of it; the presentations are lovely but there are not enough signs around the dishes indicating exactly what is in them. The few times i ventured out and tried a new dish I was not impressed; i pretty much just ate salad, fruit, chili with beans, pico de gallo and guacamole for every meal and I am not a picky eater; the meat did not appeal to me; i was so excited when they had large grilled shrimp one night but they were tasteless! i was so disappointed bc i love grilled shrimp. The other problem we had was with communication; even asking for the simplest of items was quite challenging. I think the RIU ought to spend money on training their employees to speak better English. I asked for crackers one night and ended up with a small round bowl for catsup! The room service is fast and very good according to my 17 year old son. We got room service almost every day even for just a small snack. The pool is very nice and crowded. But heck I can swim at a pool anywhere. There are loose straws floating on the water but I tried to ignore those. They use straws that are twice as tall as any glass they have. The drinks were ok, nothing to write home about. We had good luck using Juan Jose of Lomas Travel for booking excursions away from the hotel. He was most gracious at dealing with our requests. The water in the Gulf at this location is extremely choppy. At any given time, I saw no more than 4-6 people in the water. It was rough and hard to do any walking or swimming in the water. You would walk for a lil bit and then the sand would drop off a foot so you and to be prepared. My son almost sprained his ankle in the water. The spa place is OK; i have gotten better massages in the U.S. but they were cordial and on time. We went to Fifth Avenue twice and bought some souvenirs. They had lots of pricey cheesy items but we figured we can't go wrong with buying t-shirts for friends and family members. It was fun to people watch there also. I am glad I had this experience but I'm not interested in going south of the border ever again! This place is definitely overrated!

Reviews.Title: “so so , not all its cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: amy53449
Reviews.Content: we went june 19 to june 25th with extended family, the majority of staff were kind and polite, but many did not speak english especially the cleaning staff , and it was difficult to ask for something specific from them and they have no social skills, they knocked once and then opened our door immediatly which i felt was rude. the rooms were dirty, it was dirty our 1st day, i could tell bathroom wasnt cleaned properly, the sheets and bed spread smelled of musty odor, the floor was filthy , i wore socks and they were black every day, i dont think they mop the rooms, we had to call front desk multiple times about issues in our room, no hot water several days, electricity went out several times, our safe broke, the toilet kept overflowing , our sliding glass door didnt close properly. ok so the room was horrable. i read reviews on the pool and it is gross, i dont think they put clorine in it, i never saw them clean the pool and it feels like you are in a pool of sun tan lotion, that gritty feeling, and pepole do throw straws, peices of fruit floating around and dead bugs also . the food was not so good , yes they present a great display but the quality is poor, also they def. water down there alchol, there is no doubt what so ever --and i know in US thats illegal to refill bottles , but who knows down there , they do get away with ......... the pool bar beer is warm also , that is so grosss when you are thirsty and get a warm beer, also one last thing -about tipping, they def. " take care of you at the pool and while sitting on chairs around the pool if you tip, they seem to expect it and i got the impression they really dont appreciate it, a few bar tenders i didnt tip because the ones i gave money to immed. came to wait on me and when they wernt there the ones who i didnt tip, made me wait and had a bad attitude. i dont think its worth the money to go here, the overall service and hotel i would rate as that of a motel 6 or holiday inn. also 3 of us got GI virus all at end of trip so watch out -i am not sure how we got it but we did , cant track it to specific food etc? i could go on and on but i will stop here,

Reviews.Title: “No, not for us.”
Reviews.Author: Fl0werCat
Reviews.Content: Here is my basic rundown. THE BAD 1. 45 min ride from Airport. Was not informed of this and hotel transportation did not include a car seat for my infant. Spent entire ride terrified for the safety of my child. 2. Room was not ready at 6pm. That's right, 6 pm. We were told to wait "20" minutes, 2 hours later at 7pm, the room still wasn't ready but we went inside anyways while the maid finished. 3.While the room was "ok." Had a king sized bed, nice jacuzzi tub and sofa area to watch tv, the view from our room was HORRIBLE. They must have put us in the worst room possible. Our view from our balcony was a factory next door...well the roof of the factory with the gigantic LOUD a/c units on the roof that hummed us to sleep every night. 4. Cleanliness of linens and towels. TERRIBLE. Stains on everything. Looks like someone bleed out on one of the sheets that we had. I just ripped it off the bed and threw it on the floor. One set of sheets we had was soured as well. Talk about a stinky night. Next night the sheets smelled so heavy of bleach my eyes were watering. At least I know they were sanitized? 5.Food. The only decent meal was breakfast at the buffet place. When we went down there I had jokingly told my husband that I was afraid that I was going to gain 10 lbs, well I actually LOST 10 lbs because I couldn't eat the food! If it wasn't over salted (which most stuff was...) it had flies on it or it was spoiled tasting. The special (Make a reservation at least 3 days in advance) restaurants were laughable. At best the food was not good and worst it made some of us ill. My husband is upstairs now with a fever and sickness from our meal last night at the "Japanese" restaurant. 6. Room Service. Ok I know it's all inclusive and it's free but how about more than 3 items on the room service menu? One cannot live on ham and cheese, cheese cake and cheese nachos alone. (Especially when your restaurant foods are so poor.) 7. Service. While the waitstaff did their best to help and be prompt about stuff the front desk rather sucked. Our room did not have a room service menu and I called down to the front desk and they said that they would send one up right away. 2 hours later, no menu, so I call down again and 20 mins later I get a menu in GERMAN. So I called down again and apologized but I needed an English menu...I never got the menu. The next day I went down stairs, I figured, hey I would pick it up myself but Noooo they can't do that, the maids have to bring it. 1 hour later I finally got a menu in English. (Of course I found out it wasn't worth it when I saw it had a grand total of like 6 items on it, no joke!) Front Desk drama continues...On night 4 at the hotel hubby and I were awakened at 4am to the sounds of a woman screaming bloody murder, glasses breaking and silverware hitting the tiles out side our door. My mother in law tries to call the front desk for help because this was an all out brawl/fight going on and never got an answer. The next morning we went out and there was blood all over the floor the walls, my mother in laws door...it was everywhere. Looked like a scene from a horror flick. So I went downstairs and asked the front desk if they knew about it and they said "Yes, we are going to clean it." I'm like when is that exactly? Its been there all night and I just had to roll my childs stroller through BLOOD to get to the one elevator in this place!' They eventually did clean up the blood on the floor at least...about 2 hours later...but the blood spray on the walls was still there when we left this morning! 8. The ONE Elevator that was 400 miles from our room. Yes, one sad elevator that was 40 rooms down from our room (about 1/2 mile hike) that ended up in the dark, scary KITCHEN Of a restaurant that you had to navigate through the DARK on SLICK WET FLOORS to get your child outside into the main plaza. Really seriously? I know it's Mexico but don't they have any handicap laws? Ok forget that, how about a resort so expensive, lets at least have a safe, friendly way to navigate our grounds with a wheelchair or stroller? Ok...so that was the bad. The GOOD. 1. The ocean was really pretty. (Though as the other poster mentioned it had some serious undertow problems while we were there. Constant "Red" flags.) 2. The pool was pretty. I didn't find that it smelled funny. 3. The wait staff was 90% friendly and prompt with requests. 4. My sister in laws wedding ceremony was beautiful. I hope she had a good time. At least that was positive. 5. Their piña coladas were awesome. 6. The breakfast buffet especially the coffee and sopapillas. 7. The hotel grounds were really pretty.

Reviews.Title: “THE best RIU experience to date!”
Reviews.Author: pamzanski
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 8 night/9 day stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya! I never am sure how to start these reviews so I'll just dive in... For an overview: We have stayed at Riu's twice in the DR and they were fabulous the beach is perfection and service top notch. This is what I will use to compare our RPRM experience. Arrival: We arrived in Cancun at 10:30 a.m. on a Wednesday. The airport was deserted. Seemed as if our flight was the only one...not sure if that was the case or not. We had pre-paid for private transfer with cancuntransfers as recommended by many here on TA. We were not disappointed. They were waiting immediately outside of the airport with a sign bearing our name. Easy to find...once you got past the Timeshare sharks. Just ignore them and act like you know where you are going. Anyway, the cancuntransfers gentlemen were wonderful. They spoke very good english, which we were appreciative though we attempted our broken spanish to bridge the gap...was a great experience. The drive was about 45 min to an hour depending on traffic etc. To give you an idea, we were in line at the hotel making a la carte dinner reservations at 12:05 p.m. (after checking in) Not a bad turn around if you ask me. Check In: Check in was a breeze. The front desk staff spoke exceptional english and made this very easy for us. We were early, so our room wasn't ready. As a side note; This hotel stay was a comp stay from Riu due to an overbooking we experienced in the DR last summer. We did not "pay" for a superior delulxe Jr. Suite (courtyard/pool view), but had emailed several months ago and asked for this (never hurts to try). The front desk asked what room we would like...guess as a courtesy, we said we didn't want the top floor and didn't want the bottom floor and wanted a courtyard view. She was a little mixed up as when we returned at 1:30 to check on the room availability she had assigned us room 41; a garden view on the ground floor. We said absolutely no to that. She then gave us 2077 which was a semi-courtyard view. To explain, the room was on the third floor, not the top floor, and faced from the balcony, the lobby to the left, the lobby bar straight ahead and the courtyard to the right. When we got into the room, we noticed that the beds (pushed together as expected) seemed smaller than the beds in the DR. There, they were queens, here, they didn't even seem like doubles (we sleep on a double at home). There was no way that both of us could sleep on one...we have a teenage daughter who would need the other. We called down and asked if we could be moved to a room with a pull out couch. They said that the room next door, 2078, had a pull out and that would be ready in about 30 min to an hour. We were allowed to stay in 2077 until the other was ready...so we headed for the pool. We checked back in an hour and things were moved over to 2078 and it was perfect. The front desk had said if we wanted, on Saturday, they would move us to a more central courtyard view if we wanted to. We did not. The reason we stayed in 2078...from the balcony or just inside of the room, we could pick up the wireless connection from the lobby. With a teenager, that was very valuable. The Room: I mentioned the location in the previous paragraph and our reason for liking it so much... We also have mentioned about the beds. The other portions of the room were no different than others have described; sunken "living room" that served as our extra bedroom, nice dresser, flat screen TV, nice balcony size (2077 had a smaller balcony), the mini fridge fully stocked with Dos Equis, pepsi, orange soda, 7up equivalent, Diet pepsi and bottled water. We typically tipped the mini-bar guy and he would give my husband 6 beers vs the normal 3 or 4. Also in the mini bar, Jose Cuervo Gold, Smirnoff Vodka, Brandy and something else we didn't notice. Actually, we NEVER used that alcohol as we got drinks from the lobby, pool restaurant... (We tipped the maid on occasion, but our room was spotlessly cleaned daily even without it.) There was a coffee maker in the room which was nice for those early cups before your shower. There was a large closet and the typical room safe, two bed-side tables and of course the bathroom. The bathroom had a toilet and dual sinks and the hydromassage tub/shower. To use the hydromassage, you had to of course fill the tub above the jets. That my friends, takes about an hour and uses a ton of water. We attempted it once and never again as it seemed a waste to us of time and water. We had great showers with only the occasional burst of hot water that lasted for about 1 second. Great water pressure. Please remember the water is not potable. The Restaurants and Food: The Buffet, Don something, (don't recall the name as we always entered in through the side door rather than the front door) was awesome. The only night I wasn't impressed was the Caribbean night...but I found the staples to get me through, salads, pasta and pizza. There was always some sort of Mexican food, my personal favorite, pasta and pizza as well as salads, cold cuts and cheeses. We have alot of pictures of the Mexican Night if you would like to see them...sometimes, it helps to LOOK at the food to help assess the variety. You won't be disappointed. It was always good and much much better than the Riu's in the DR. We also ate at the Agave (Mexican) Restaurant and the Krystal (Fusion) Restaurant. Both were good, the service exceptional, but we preferred the variety at the Buffet. The Krystal had the exact same menu as the ones in the DR...so it wasn't a "treat" for us, though the food was good. I was suffering from a severe Margarita hangover when we ate at the Krystal so I wasn't a good judge of much, though the rest of the family enjoyed it. The Agave was great...the Mexican salad and hors d'oeuvres buffet was great...I actually filled up and couldn't eat all of my beef fajitas :(. We ate daily at Chili's with a table overlooking the beach and ocean...it was great. The food there was exceptional as compared to the equivalent in the DR. Large variety of selections, soup, pizza, pasta, fish, steak, ribs, hamburgers, hot dogs, desserts...the list is very very long. Great food. We often took a paper plate of pizza or fruit to the pool and they gave us no hassle...even provided us with plastic forks. There were also nacho chips and cheese always at the pool for your enjoyment. The pool and the Beach: The pool was of comfortable size, not too big and not too small. We spent most of our time here. There are two Jacuzzis several tables with seats around and sun beds in the water. The pool bar does have seats contrary to one reviewers mention that they did not. The infinity pool was also nice...typical Riu styling and size. The temperature of the pool varied. Most days, it was on the warm side. We had one day of clouds and some rain which made for a cooler pool the next day. My husband preferred the ocean. It was cooler than the pool and warmer than the Atlantic experienced in the DR. Quite refreshing. The surf was rougher than the quiet of the DR but we enjoyed that. The sand, though beautiful, didn't compare to the powder of the DR. There were alot of shells (and the occasional piece of trash and straws)...things that made the sand more abrasive which I don't care for...but that is the Mexican coast and we were acceptant of that and certainly are not complaining. Just providing facts. Even after the restoration, which made this beach huge, there is a drop off just after entering the waters edge...be careful...with the larger waves, it can catch you off guard. I would not let small children venture in alone if I were you...I'm an adult and I had problems. Activities: We were so busy during our 9 days we had no time to enjoy any of the provided activities such as Catamaran, Kayaks or such...we'll do that next time. We did participate in water volleyball and water aerobics which were a blast. The Entertainment team at this Riu is outstanding. The only show we went to was Michael Jackson, which we enjoyed in the DR....The MJ here was not very good at lip syncing but was a good dancer. The backup dancers were outstanding and worth the watching. It was a good time and we enjoyed it very much. Overall, this was a much better performance than the DR...better costumes, music setting etc. Venturing out: We went "downtown" to Playa del Carmen three or four times during our stay. It was fun shopping up and down the streets and eating in the different restaurants. People watching was great as well as getting to know some of the locals. Awesome time!
