Very safe (normal precautions taken regardless of where we travel) and we had no bad times. We ate at two restaurants: La Parrilla and Carboncitos. Carboncitos was my favorite. The tacos al pastor were fantastic and you sure can't pass on the chips and the variety of salsas which is why I went in the first place. Absolutely awesome. The Margaritas were fantastic...they squeeze limes for theirs rather than using a mix and they were great! I would highly recommend not having more than two...the last one I remember was three...'Nuff said there...it made for a long afternoon. Anna, thank you for taking care of me as I drank my way through the Mexico Soccer game. La Parrilla was good...was nice to sit overlooking 5th ave and people watch...my daughter had the chicken sesame fajitas and they were to die for, my husband had the chili relleno which was fantastic and I had chicken super nachos...they were just "ok". Just chicken, beans, cheese and chips. Just to let everyone know, most "salsa" served with chips down there is pico de gallo and not what they often serve in the US as tomato based (like PACE). I expected what I got, but heard some woman complaining that the salsa wasn't salsa...You're in Mexico...not the US...! Other information...The best prices we found for tequila was at Walmart. Though it was fun to shop around, we found that 470 pesos for Don Julio Anejo was the best price we could find...good ol' Wally World. Jose Cuervo was the equivalent of $11 US, alot cheaper than our 17.99 bottles here in PA. We wanted to bring home something other than Cuervo so we opted for the Don Julio. Awesome stuff. We also went to the shops in the Playacar plaza...cool stuff, normal actually. Prices were a little higher and less haggling there...was much more fun in Playa del Carmen on 5th. it was nice to go to in a pinch though. Service: The service at this Riu is beyond compare. We were pampered and indulged at every turn. There are not enough words to express our thanks to the fine people of Mexico that work in these resorts. They work tirelessly and make working 12 hour days effortless. You will not have better service satisfaction any where. I wish I could remember the names of everyone that touched our hearts, plates and glassware while we visited their country...Again, our highest praises and our warmest thanks to you all. Other: We celebrated our 9th wedding anniversary at the Riu on the 16th. They staff at the buffet sang for us, gave us a cake, decorated our table and delivered a bottle of Champagne to the room as well as special towel art. It was fantastic! Made us feel very special. There were about 15 weddings while we were there....on some days...three at a time! Everyone joined in; not sure if the brides appreciated that but we all cheered with them. Most of the guests were great. We met alot of really wonderful people. I only ran into a couple of moaners and complainers everyone else seemed quite happy. The heat was oppressive on the first day to us. We did find however that we acclimated quite fast and by the third day, we were no longer sweating as badly and the 90's were easier to handle. Doesn't take long. Overall, this was our best vacation yet. It is a definite return trip for us. We want to enjoy the water sports next time, maybe the ruins and we never went to the spa or gym...there was so much to do here in this portion of Mexico...it kept you busy and active. We were very sad to leave but know we will be back next summer to continue our new love for Mexico and the RPRM! I have many more pictures and am more than willing to answer any questions you may have regarding anything...just PM me.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MandM_NY
Reviews.Content: After staying with my husband at this resort in November of 2007, we immediately thought of it as our ideal location once we got engaged in 2009. We contacted the wedding department and they were very helpful. They answered all of our questions via email (to avoid international phone charges). We booked our trip through Orbitz for May 27-June 3. Orbitz actually offered us $600 back a month after booking because the price of our trip had gone down. Instead of taking the cash, we put the money toward the master suite, which we HIGHLY recommend. The suite is huge and includes a second-story outdoor jacuzzi. The spiral staircase on the balcony makes for gorgeous wedding pictures! We booked the Royal Wedding Package for 20 guests, which includes the ceremony, decor, reception food/drink, champagne toast, the wedding cake, bride's bouquet, a short couple's massage, and a room upgrade (pending availability). All of our guests stayed at the resort (80 percent of your guests MUST stay at the resort in order to have your wedding there) an had the BEST time! Everyone said it was the best vacation/wedding they'd ever been to! And it is so affordable! We met with the wedding planner the day after our arrival to choose our cake and bouquet and any extras we wanted. The planner was very organized and friendly. She made sure the flowers arrived in my hotel room while I was at the salon and kept checking in with my with weather updates the day of the wedding, as rain was in the forecast. We had the option to move the ceremony indoors, but we're so glad we didn't, because the rain cleared right as our ceremony was scheduled to begin! We had our reception at Bota Fogo, which was great. We ended up having the entire restaurant to ourselves, and they set up a head table for us. We even held a mini concert after the dinner in the restaurant, since many of our guests are professional singers on Broadway! We ordered the chocolate cake with vanilla frosting, which was nothing extraordinary, but very tasty! My bouquet was gorgeous- white lillies and roses. And I paid extra for a lily for my hair. I got my hair done at the resort salon the morning of the wedding. Couples receive 10 percent off all salon services. I had a hair trial with my stylist in San Francisco and brought pictures to the Riu salon. The stylist did an excellent job copying the style! And every strand on my head stayed in place! The stylist knew exactly how to fight the humidity! : ) We got married at 5pm in the gazebo. It was perfect. Things start to settle down at the pool by then. There was a wedding at 3pm the day of our wedding and the ceremony had to compete with a game of pool volleyball! People were VERY respectful for our wedding. Just don't be surprised if you have some onlookers for your beach or gazebo wedding. Honestly, though, we didn't even notice them because our ceremony was so beautiful. We brought our own officiant, which I HIGHLY recommend because the officiants that the hotel provide do a very, very speedy job! We saw one wedding that couldn't have lasted 10 minutes! After the reception, we took a taxi into Playa del Carmen and danced the night away! We did a lot of sightseeing in Tulum, Cozumel, and Playa del Carmen, and got a lot of massages, went parasailing, rented wave runners, zip lined through the jungle... please ask if you need any recommendations! It was the experience of a lifetime! Brides, please do not hesitate to contact me with any questions! I'm paying it forward from all of the brides on TripAdvisor that gave me advice!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: ShannonBeau
Reviews.Content: We got back from Riu Palace on 6-4-10. The resort is beautiful and rooms are okay. Needs to update linens though, stains on sheets and bedspread, not "5-star quality". We had to ask several times during the 5 days for more towels and washcloths. The food at buffet was good, breakfast the best. We ate at the steak restaurant, steak and lobster, ha ha, the lobster was half a lobster and steak was approx. 3-4 oz. small portions to say the least, we also ate at the krystal which is 'fusion' food, this was very good. All in all the food was good but then again no "5-star" quality. The pool was not sparkling clean and had a very odd odor and color. Drinks were good as long as we ask for name brand liquors. The beach was absolutely GORGEOUS!! The best thing about the resort, but the ocean was not swimmable, too much undertow, but good wading. All in all a good vacation, but next time will go back to Barcelo Maya resort, much more for you money and about the same price. I will be glad to answer any questions you have. One last thing, our flight was delayed and we were notified after checking out, mgr. was good enough to let us back into our rooms until 1pm. But then of course check out is not until noon so I don't know if this was generosity or just policy, either way the management was great about letting us back in. for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: chrischarlestaylor
Reviews.Content: This was my first all-inclusive, and I think I’m spoiled for the rest of my of life. This hotel exceeded my expectations in everyway. When they call it a palace, they mean it. The rooms are large with a comfortable sunken living room that opens up to a spacious balcony. We had an extended balcony, this was nice as the other were about half the size, however still a good size. Although the rooms quiet I suggest the rooms that face the outer edges of the resort, or near the pool area, the plaza area can get very loud during the nightly entertainment. The rooms were very clean and very well maintained, daily cleaning was prompt and turndown service provided that little extra something special. Room service is complimentary and was usually delivered quickly, although it was a limited menu, everything we ordered was very good. I suggest tipping your room attendant every day 20-30 pesos, this goes for room service as well, this gets you that little more attention to detail, keeping this in mind they will never provide anything less that perfect service if you don’t tip. The beautiful bathrooms provide everything you expect from a 5 star hotel, except shampoo. Conditioner, yes, however the shampoo is a “shampoo, body and hand soap” all in one, its not very nice, so bring your own or hit up the sundries shop in the lobby. They have nearly anything you need or forgot at home, however for the budget conscious bring your own sunscreen, at nearly three times the price as the local drugstore it was a bit of a shock, this applies to the shops down the street as well. Another sunscreen tip you may have never thought of is, buy biodegradable sunscreen, any of the tours that involve snorkeling or swimming of any kind are usually in sensitive ecological areas and regular sunscreen is not allowed as it my be harmful to the marine life. Our rep was very helpful in providing tour information, however your travel agent at home should be able to book any tour for you and at very good prices. FOOD! Excellent, in every restaurant we tried. There are many a la carte options, you can only make reservations for these from noon till 3pm daily in the lobby, you can only make two at a time, up to 3-4 days in advance. To get the restaurant you want you should be there at noon. Even if you don’t get the one you want, you will not be disappointed, each one was unique and offered great food. Although we were not able to get into the Japanese restaurant people were raving about it, we tried the Mexican restaurant, any seafood dish was amazing, and you MUST try the Mayan coffee. The Brazilian restaurant was excellent, however not if you are a vegetarian, we like meat and there was plenty of it. And Finally the steakhouse, this is an out door setting, so dress accordingly. It can get very hot, the dress code is a little more lenient here. Button up shirts with short sleeves are acceptable, depending on the maitre d you may be able to wear shorts, just head down a few minutes early to ask. The other restaurant however the dress code is more strict, as it should be for fine dinning. One couple as actually asked to leave for wearing shorts and sandals, if you have any questions, just ask, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The beach was amazing, huge and fairly clean. There are a lot of deck chairs and drink service if you are sitting in the Riu’s area. You don’t feel crowded as the beach is massive, you can choose from full sun down by the water or sit comfortably under the palm trees. With access to all of the Riu properties in Playa Car you can enjoy the bar service, breakfast, and lunch in any of the Riu hotels, although I’m not sure why you would want to leave this amazing resort. The Beach at the Riu Palace Mexico was nicer in my opinion, mainly because the bar was closer to the beach and a larger shaded area under the palm trees. The Playa Car area was amazing, with some local shops across the street from the resorts and most of the Riu hotels within a 5-7 min walk from each other you have everything you need. If you want to venture into Playa Del Carmen, 5th avenue is a Mecca of shops and restaurants. Just a 15 walking for 5 min in taxi, pay no more than 50 pesos, this easy access city offers a vast collection of duty free shops, from personal experience check your local governments duty free allowances. From Playa Del Carmen you can also catch the ferry to Cozumel, my favorite stop when traveling by cruise ship. Always check the schedule for the return trip, there are two companies that operate this service and both depart from the same pier on both ends. The best tip we received was only to buy a one way ticket so when you get there you can grab the ferry that suites you, so you are not tied to one schedule. The fare is 280 pesos round trip or 140 one way. You can take out money once you are there from any ATM, I recommend using the Peso, however you can exchange money at the bank or even the hotel front desk, rates can vary however its very little when it comes down to it. They will exchange Canadian dollars, US dollars and several other currencies, if you are Canadian, take Canadian dollars and exchange it there, if you buy US dollars and exchange it there you loose out of exchange rates twice. This resort overall was amazing, clean, great staff, very well maintained great food and very relaxing. If anyone has a complaint about this resort they are seriously mistaken. Any questions just ask.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic honeymoon at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: JerseygirlEngland
Reviews.Content: We are big fans of Riviera Maya after visiting a couple of years ago, so were very excited at the prospect of going back. The Riu Palace was our hotel of choice, as we had heard many good comments. After a long tiring journey (12 hours due to diversion from ash cloud) the staff gave us a warm welcome and we began to relax and enjoy the surroundings. As this was our honeymoon we received champagne and chocolate covered fruit in our room, which we thought was a lovely touch. The room was very spacious, clean and comfortable. But unfortunately you could hear a lot of noise from the corridors, but this died down later in the evening. Bathroom was nice and modern with good lighting. We used room service a couple of times after long day trips and found it was very efficient. The beach was quiet as a lot of people chose to surround the pool area, so this was a nice place to come and relax. Unfortunately the sea in this area is very rough so we did not go in as much as we would have liked. We stayed at the Grand Riviera Princess previously and swam in the sea every day with no problem. The hotel is in a good location. Playcar is a lovely, clean safe area and it was only 20 mins walk to Playa del Carman. We often popped into the town for a browse and a spot of shopping. For anyone who would like a break from All Inclusive we would recommend Carlos & Charlies, fantastic fajitas! Also did the trip to Cozumel (only 30 min ride). If you are looking for a nice relaxing holiday with fantastic service, we would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great service, overall excellent experience for all types of travellers”
Reviews.Author: DiscoD27
Reviews.Content: I have been to Cancun/Mayan Riveria 8 times...this is by far the nicest of the Riu hotels in the Mayan. Do not get this confused with the Riu Palace Mexico-Riu Palace Riveira Maya is newer and closer to Playa Del Carmen-in my opinion much classier! The hotel location is perfect-about a 10 minute safe walk to Playa Del Carmen which I just adore. The buffet restaurant was actually outstanding for breakfast and dinner. I wasn't too crazy about the steakhouse at all. It was a nice hotel with clean rooms and a nice beach. Nice for couples, friends and families. I was impressed by the overall service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter60
Reviews.Content: My husband and i have just got back from here and what a superb hotel,staff are wonderful,polite and they can't do enough for you.They even bring you drinks while you sunbathing on the beach or even if you are around the pool.The rooms are immaculate,clean and spacious.Entertaiment was very good,animation team excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Rui Palace Riviera Maya- Superb!”
Reviews.Author: malcb37
Reviews.Content: We are just back from two weeks in the Riu palace, Riviera Maya. Just go back today- enjoyed it so much, i felt it worth putting a review on right now. First things first, traveled with Thomson non stop fro Glasgow to Cancun, excellent flight, lots of legroom, but why oh why Thomson, do you have to pay £5 to upgrade your video package to be able to see more than one movie- this is a 10.5hr flight after all. Anyway airport transfer went smoothly, just ignore the tickets touts at arrivals and head straight for your coach. An hour later, at the hotel, to a nice cool fruit juice presented my the reception, and also our room upgraded at no extra cost. Room 2074, perfect location, looking inward to the hotel grounds, huge balcony gets the sun all day till about 5pm- by then you need some shade. The buffet restaurants were superb, and to be honest you could have ate there every night and still have been delighted. However we ate in Krystal, the fusion restaurant, was great, and different and well worth a visit, Agave, the mexican restaurant we ate twice in, very good also, Bodafogo the brazilian restaurant was a novel experience and well worth a visit if you like to eat meat, and Chiilis which doubles as a steakhouse at night, also very good. Didn't try the Japanese restaurant as not a big fish fan. pool was superb, always lovely and warm, and generally not two noisy. We also enjoyed lying out on the beautiful beach. Also saw 6 weddings whilst there, grea So some pros and cons:- Pros:- Wonderful location,great food, fantastic staff (and I really mean that), always helpful, always smiling, and always encouraging me to try my limited Spanish! Great aircon in room, just a truly great hotel! Cons:- (and these are extremely minor)- not enough alcohol in the cocktails- maybe not a bad thing if you are at the pool bar all day! The occasional American that doesn't know how to talk quietly- boy can they be loud when they are in a group. The Brit families who hog all the sunloungers with their towels at 7am every morning with their towels round the edge of the pool all day, and then disappear- you know who you are Geordies! But really they were minor, not the hotels fault, thats just people for you i guess. We also rented a car for three days, did it online with easyway rent a car, did it online before I came out, cost me $134 including all insurances, and they delivered and picked up from the hotel. We went to Xel-Ha for the day, its fantastic, and well worth a visit. The next day we had the car, we drove to Chichen Itza, well worth a visit, we went the non toll roads via Tullum, great roads, straight as a die, and we stopped at Valladollid for lunch. Well worth a visit, although it took us 30 mins to find our way back out and that was with sat nav!. We ate at a great little restaurant right on the cornet of the square, can't remamber what it was called but it had black bars on the windows, the food was cheap and fantastic. We then stopped at a cenote at Dinzit. well worth a visit. We stayed over one night at the hotel, mayaland hotel and bungalows, stayed in a bungalow, and went to the light show at night- which was poor, but went to chichen Itza first thing in morning before crowds got there. Finally do go into Playa del carmen, we went into 5th avenue during the day, and at night, great vibrant atmosphere. Long review, but fantastic holiday!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING--Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: stephieshu
Reviews.Content: So, this was my (and the rest of the group I traveled withs) first experience with All Inclusive and we were not let down. The RIU Palace Rivieria was AMAZING!! This is also the first time any of us traveled to the Cancun side of Mexico, we had been to Cabo San Lucas but not Playa Del Carmen. I definately liked Playa Del Carmen better, it seemed much more laid back and relaxing than Cabo. First, the drive from the airport to the resort takes about an hour, but the drive isn't bad, there's alot of jungle and little towns on the way to look at. We got the hotel in the late afternoon so our rooms were ready and we were able to get in right away, the "head" bellhop brought us out a really tasty fruit punch to drink while checking in, which was a very nice touch. When we got to our room we were surprised to see two full beds pushed together, when I phoned the front desk they mentioned they were full so we couldn't get a king sized bed, but that they could make the two beds into one bed. It took awhile for the maid to get there and then about a half hour for her to remake the bed, the result was a HUGE bed, but we didn't mind too much. For the most part, every thing was laid back and slow, but again we didn't mind at all, it was very relaxing!! After reading reviews here, I advised my family to bring small bills for tipping. We tipped all the waiters and the cleaning staff...our room was ALWAYS clean (complete with really awesome towel animals!) and service was always good. The waiters remembered our drinks throughout our stay, and the staff was extremely courteous. Food- I really enjoyed the food. The morning buffet was huge and it was awesome. We only ate dinner at the buffet two nights, the other three we ate at the ala carte resturants. The first night was the buffet, the second night was the steak house (chili's) I was not entirely impressed with the ambiance but the food was good. The third night was the buffet (we planned an excursion for the day...review later). The fourth night we ate at the Brazilian resturant...AMAZING...hands down the best resturant of the trip for us. We loved the food and the atmosphere!! The last night we ate Krystal, the gourment resturant..the food was delicious, but the other patrons (three other tables) didn't seem to like our table having a discussion, so that was a little bummer, the staff however seemed to love having us there. You definately had to get to the reservations desk early for the resturants, they fill up fast!! Activities- we decided that we did not have enough time to enjoy all the activities we could have done (we where only ther for 4 full days and 2 half days). The beach was the place to be for our group, we loved the hammocks and the beach chairs, there was plenty of shade for us (even for my Dad who has skin cancer from lack of sunscreen in his youth). The water was warm and the people friendly. My Mom, brother's Girlfriend and I went to the Spa while the boys played golf...the Spa was very relaxing and reasonably priced, definately worth the experience. The guys enjoyed their golf expedition, apparently there are many lizards on the course and occasionally monkeys would come out the jungle, needless to say there were many hilarious stories from the golf course!! Tours- We scheduled a tour with "Best Day Tours" to go see Tulum and then Xel-Ha. The tour was a joke. Tulum was absolutely beautiful, but the guides (which you don't need) just tell you what you can easily read on the placards all over the park. By the time we were even able to see the ruins we only had about an hour, my family and I broke off from the group to check out the ruins on our own. I would suggest that if you want to see the ruins hire a cab to take you and bring mosquito repellent!! Xel-Ha was an amazing water park, all of us had a fanastic time there, I would definately reccomend it. The resort itself (as well as the rest of Playa Del Carmen) is in a gated community, it felt very safe to be there, in fact we walked down to the "downtown" area just about every day. Overall, we loved our time at the Riu Palace and are already starting to plan the next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would visit again”
Reviews.Author: Raqwella
Reviews.Content: Sorry that this review is a little late as I travelled to this hotel in the middle of November 2009. We decided on this hotel after having a look around a Riu Palace in Dominican Republic a couple of years earlier, whilst staying at another Riu. I'm one of those people that researchs, researchs and researchs their trips. I was not disappointed at all. We booked through Thomson holidays in the UK- who I must say were brilliant and after a very long weary flight, followed by a weary coach trip we arrived at the hotel. I walked in and had the immediat WOW factor. Check in was quite quick and painless. Room - a standard junior suite. This looked exactly as it did in the brochure. Then, the only con I can find : I looked at the view from the balcony and found that we were looking out over the roof top of the neighbouring hotel - this consisted of a massive mobile phone type tower/aeriel with lights on it. A flood lit tennis court with very bright lights- which shone directly into our room, air conditioning units and massive rusty water tanks. I immediately went to reception and told them I wasn't happy. They said that all the rooms of the level that we had booked had an outward view. I explained that I didn't mind that .It was just that , that particular outward view was not acceptable. They were very helpful, explaining that the hotel was full, but guests left on a daily basis and they would move us the next day. I settled for this and true to their word they moved us further along the corridor away from the nasty, noisy view. On speaking to others that arrived at the same time as us , it would appear that they put everyone on our flight in bad rooms. A tactic maybe? The room was kept spotlessly clean. There were his and her sinks in the bathroom and a jacuzzi style bath, which caused a few laughs. The recessed bath area was a little dark though. Food/drink : We ate in the main buffet restaurant, the mexican, the steakhouse and the japanese. I found the food to be very good all round. The buffet and the japanese were our favourites. I probably wouldn't bother with the mexican again as the food was better and not dis similar in the buffet. We didn't like the look of the menu in the fusion restaurant. We didn't try the snacks in the sports bar- these were just burgers and a microwave. Also there were a lot of people smoking in the sports bar. We didn't try the room service. I drink white wine and found this to be a little hit and miss. I think every time I asked for it I got a different one. The magaritas were wonderful though Pool/Beach : very nice pool area, plenty of shade, umberellas and sunbeds. Gets very very noisy too as there were a lot of loud american/canadian groups. We tended to move to the beach in the afternoon as the sun went from the pool at around 4pm and set at around 5.30pm. I did think the beach was a little dirty- littered with cigarette ends , straws and plastic cups. The drinks service was a little hit and miss, but that didn't really bother us. It's no big deal to get off your sun lounger and go to the bar. There have been a few comments previously about the 'grey whale' beach defenses, but I didn't see these as a problems. I actually think they make the beach a little safer from non swimmers and children. Evening entertainment : To be honest I didn't rate this much. Although I know the team work very very hard, it was all a bit samey and typical RIU like. They held a couple of casino nights which were good fun., but if you ate late you could miss all this. And most nights there was a band /singer which was nice to listen to in the back ground. Staff : We found all the staff to be very pleasant and helpful. All in all we had a wonderful trip. In fact we got engaged here (not a reason for the good review). We would defiantely go back and recommed it to others.

Reviews.Title: “They really dont care if you're happy or not”
Reviews.Author: figchef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 4 nights at the end of May. We immediately had problems within the first 20 minutes of our arrival. We arrived early in the afternoon and our rooms were not ready for another hour or so. This was not a problem for us. We used the time to immediately make reservations for the restaurants, and grab a quick bite from the buffet. We were completely baffled to learn that we would not be able to eat in any of their ala carte restaurants. They were completely booked. The hotel clearly advertises that they have multiple restaurants, whether ala carte or buffet. I could understand if one of the restaurant was full, but all of them. We immediately complained to the front desk, and they just stared at us with zero compassion. It was immediately quite obvious that the Riu has a very loose policy on customer satisfaction. Our rooms were clean and fairly new. It had a tub/shower combo with no light in it. It felt like I was showering in a closet. The bathroom was clean, and remained clean during the remainder of our stay, as did our room. The walls are paper thin, and you could hear a mouse sneeze in the next room or hallway. This didn't bother us much, since we were out in town all night. I could see this being a problem for a couples/relaxation getaway. The food was just god awful. Even the Mexican food was terrible. We were all scared to eat half of the items displayed at the buffet restaurant. I basically stuck to rice and chicken breasts for 4 days. They also need to do a better job with serving utensils. It was disgusting seeing the guests hands all over the food, and cross contaminating everything in sight. The Brazilian restaurant was the worst. We saw cockroaches on the buffet/salad table, and the food seemed like leftover items from breakfast. As for the entrees, this had to be the absolute worst meat I have ever eaten in my life. It was so dry, overcooked and under-flavored. There is zero pride taken with the entire Riu kitchen staff. By the end of our trip, we weren't shocked by the inedible food. We just worked around it. We actually went to go eat on 5th Ave because the food was so bad. The beach was very relaxing, and the water was great. However, good luck getting even a cube of ice on the beach. The one and only time I saw a cocktail waiter on the beach, I tipped him $5 USD just to bring me 4 cups of water. He took my money and never came back. Note, I said cups of water. This cheap hotel doesn't even have the decency to give its customers a bottle of water. I had to walk all the way to the bar by the pool just to find they only will pour you water into a dirty glass with ice from God knows where. If you want a bottle, you need to walk all the way back to the lobby, where they dish it out like FEMA MRE's. The bar absolutely smelled of decomposing beer, and was unpleasant to even order a drink. The drinks.........The only place to get a good drink was the lobby bar. Sheila during the day and Islas in the evening were VERY nice bartenders. They seemed to be the only employees in the entire hotel who took pride in their job. The choices on alcohol were sub par. The only good tequila they served was Jimador. Now if we were drinking Jimador, I would be complaining. The sad fact is, we weren't. Every time we ordered a shot, it was a different color and taste. This is the obvious clue that they were refilling the bottles with, well, I dont even want to know. I'll give the Riu the benefit of the doubt that they are serving what is advertised. After all, I didn't actually see them refill a bottle. Lets talk about room service. Since the restaurants food was so terrible, we barely ate. There is nothing worse than going to sleep on an empty stomach. I attempted to order room service on the first night, and was dumbfounded by the whole process. I called the room service number around 2am and nobody picked up. I actually let it ring for a solid 5 minutes. Then, I called the front desk to let them know there was no activity with room service. He said he would call security and call me back. 20 minutes later, and into a deep sleep, my room phone rings. "Room service, what would you like?" Well, since there was no menu to be found in any of our four rooms, I told him. He said that they dont have a menu in the rooms. "Would you like me to read you what we have?". Here is what the Riu thinks room service should be. Club sandwich, hot dog, nachos, Caesar salad, fruit cup, cheesecake. THAT'S IT! I have stayed in many all inclusives before, and I have never been so shocked to be offered such a pathetic choice of items for room service. Good luck getting a chair at the pool area. You literally have to wake up at 8am and put a towel on your chair to guarantee a seat. This is always a problem at most hotels, so I cant complain. Im on vacation and dont need to wake up early. However, after monitoring the enthusiasm of the staff, the pool really didn't seem very clean. We never went into the pool, not even to wet our feet. Also, they are incredibly stingy with pool towels. You cant even get one extra towel without giving them some sort of song and dance. Most of the hotels I have stayed in in Mexico allow you to call the US for free. Not at the Riu. Even with a calling card, there was a connection fee per call of $1.50 US, and then the minutes on your card. There was WiFi in the main lobby, and it was very, very slow. Also, make sure you bring your sunscreen from home. It will cost you $22 at the hotel gift shop. In a nutshell, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya has a good location, being close to 5th Avenue. The place looks very nice outside and in. The rooms are clean, which is the single most important thing for me when on vacation. The beach is very nice, but bring your own drinks. Other than that, you are on your own pal.

Reviews.Title: “Expect high class”
Reviews.Author: JoshKerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December for two weeks. I was also married in this hotel. On entry it is very impressive, I get the feeling that some reviews posted are from very picky people. There is no end of food choice and the speciality restaurants are great also, the best being gourmet or Japanese. The beach and facilities are very clean; the rooms are very nice and spacious. The staffs are friendly, I recommend taking around 100 x 1 dollar notes and save these for tips; they like tips and will be even friendlier if you tip good. The weather was good the whole time; I think we had clouds and rain for maybe a few hours a couple of days. The wedding side of it was fantastic, can’t say anything bad at all. It truly is an amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return RPRM”
Reviews.Author: M&BH2005
Reviews.Content: The resort is pretty and the staff is wonderful, but the air conditioning is horrible. We've stayed at other resorts in the area where the AC was able to keep up with the humidity. Our passports were curled up and they were kept in the safe the entire time. Plus my husband was sick for the last 4 days of our trip...we didn't dare venture far from the resort. He ate salads just before he got sick. The specialty restaurants were nice, but unless you plan to spend your day at the resort it's hard to make reservations. You have to make your reservations between 12 and 3 and can only make them for 2 nights. The buffets were fine, but they were pretty much the same thing every day for breakfast and lunch. The resort was ok, but I'm sure there are better for the money available.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in fantastic location, only a few reservations”
Reviews.Author: CdrMcBragg
Reviews.Content: First off it must be said that this is a gorgeous hotel with immaculately maintained grounds. Unlike other RIUs we have been to, this is not a high-rise, limiting it to 3 floors which mainstreams the look and gives everyone a view of something. Some of the larger ones we have stayed at are so big they look and feel like prisons. This hotel is perfectly situated about a 20 minute leisurely ocean-side stroll into PDC, and a 5 minute walk to Playacar Plaza. The beach is breathtaking and incredibly clean. There are smaller waves, so those with children beware. The pool is a good size to feel comfortable and the bar service is spot-on (although it closes early at 6 PM). Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly counter person who gave us refreshing non-alcoholic drinks to sip on as we checked in. We went to our room on the third floor that was the size of a closet with a puny cramped balcony (reminiscent of old row houses where you can ask for a spoonful of sugar from your neighbor by reaching your hand over the wall), and the tv in a room not visible from the bed. I went down to ask for a room change, and for a small palm greasing we were given a fantastic room that was above and beyond what we wanted on the 2nd floor (Rm. 2129). The room was very clean and well appointed with mini bar, iron, board, hair dryer, built in booze dispenser and 2 queen sized beds that were pushed together (we moved the tv to suit our needs). The maid service was fantastic everyday and we were always greeted in the afternoon with a new towel animal. HUGE KUDOS to EVERY employee working at this hotel. ALL are super friendly and willing to do whatever it is you need to be comfortable. Even though it is an all-inclusive, I always tip which may be why people remembered me, but certainly wasn't the reason for the friendliness. Even though everyone always says that Aruba is one of the friendliest Caribbean destinations, we have ALWAYS had the best of 'service with a smile' in Cancun and the Mayan Riviera. I rate MX way above Aruba in this department. OK, so those were the positives (and they are enough to make us go back in a heartbeat), but there are some pitfalls to consider. This is an all-inclusive, and with that you have to expect certain short comings. Number one for us was the food. The Brazilian restaurant was downright awful. It is not the helps fault because they are all very friendly and cordial. The food is just poorly chosen and poorly prepared. My wife is Brazilian and we go to a Brazilian restaurant at least once a week, so we know authentic fare and this is so far from that. The Japanese, well, don't even want to go there, just not worth it. The steak house was a joke. I am a big steak eater and had to laugh at what I was given - you would get better at a York Steak House! My wife had a different selection with same result. The Don Manolo buffet for breakfast was TOP NOTCH, with french toast prepared fresh as well as an omelette station. We didn't do lunches as we were always actively doing something somewhere else. The buffet dinners were hit or miss, sometimes good, sometimes not so good. If you are a cabernet lover as we are, DO NOT order it here, it is atrocious. We love Chilean wines, but RIU has one brand for the entire place and it is not a good Chilean. They only have one brand of champagne as well, and while not outstanding is certainly acceptable. Dos XX on tap everywhere is great, although some taps are cold and some warm (welcome to the caribbean). The Dos XX in the mini bars in the room are great, although they only supply 4 at a time so we ended up calling room service quite often (sometimes it arrives fast, but usually QUITE slow). The last negative would be the entertainment we saw. Big time hit or miss on this one. The first night was an extravaganza show and that was very good. The second night was a broadway dance show that was incredible, with professional dancers. The third night was Michael Jackson, and while ok, we have seen this guy at every RIU we have been at (not sure what RIU's fixation is with Michael but he will always have a home in one of these places). The crazy show the next night was a Saturday Night Live attempt that was way off the mark. The tropical show was unremarkable, but fine. The Mayan Show was downright AWFUL. VERY loud and obnoxious. Last year we saw one of these local Mayan shows at Dreams Cancun and thought it was fantastic, this was bruatlly bad. The last night, the Mariachi show was fair, and actually had someone from the audience stop the announcer mid-sentence to complain about how bad it was. Although I didn't think it was that good, I didn't echo his sentiment - but at least that gives an idea. Four of our nights were completely rain soaked so we had to ditch our idea of hitting 5th Ave. PDC after the RIU shows, so it made the flaws in the programmed shows even more evident. Bottom-line, we really liked this place (and Playa Del Carmen in general) and would go back. I will say that the PDC 5th Ave. venders are extremely obnoxious trying to get you to come into their bars, massage parlors, buy weed, etc......but moreso during the day than at night. I think being a bigger guy made me an easy target to gain their eye attention (which is what sparks the banter they throw at you). PDC has many choices to hang out in and things to see, but there is way too much thump-thump nightclub music for our tastes. We did find some good live music venues though. Overall, we will probably hit Belize or Costa Rica next year but if a group of friends wanted to go to PDC we would do it, and stay at the RIU. On a side note, we walked to all the other RIU's in Playacar to see them, and there is ABSOLUTELY NO COMPARISON to the Palace Riviera Maya (although we loved the beach bar at the RIU Mexico!). Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Millie070
Reviews.Content: This 5* hotel is probably one of the best we have ever stayed in. The staff, hotel, rooms, entertainers, food, cleaners & local Mexicans were so friendly, helpful & went out of their way to make our stay very enjoyable. The resort of Playa del Carmen was lovely, it was really nice to walk along the beach to 5th Avenue & enjoy a quick drink or to barter with the local shop keepers (who were not over pushy, but extremely friendly). We did not choose to do any of the organised tours but used the local 'ADO' buses from the terminal in 5th Avenue, all the buses were first class(with air con & movies)! & a fraction of the cost that the tour reps were asking. We visited Tulum (fab beach & ruins), Cancun (used the other Riu hotels facilities but they did not come near to Riviera Palace) & Excaret (quite disappointing....once you've done Disney Florida there is no comparison). After reading the previous reveiws on this hotel I would probably agree that if you go within any of the American holiday periods or if the hotel is at full capacity it would be a much different holiday. During our stay we never had any problems with getting a table in the main restaurant, we did try 'Chillis' a la carte but the food was so good in the main dining area we never felt as though we needed to try any of the others but booking any of them would not have been a problem with the booking system they had. After a full day at Excaret & returning to the hotel at 11pm we rang room service who delivered freshly made sandwiches & a flask of tea (great service)!! Overall a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: saffronsmummy
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel - the food, staff, entertainment was amazing. It was my birthday when I was there and the fuss they made me of me - wow! Fab drinks - whats not to like! Typical of a riu palace - perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you're looking for an all-inclusive resort”
Reviews.Author: FakeName19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya where we stayed for a week in early May. It's about an hour from the Cancun airport and we had no problems getting there with the shuttle service they arranged for us (included in the room rate). We drove past several hotels/resorts on our way to the Riu Palace and it's definitely one of the most upscale in the area. Once we got to there, the staff was extremely friendly from the bellhop, to the front desk clerk, to the housekeepers. We spent every day out at the pool or on the beach. They have lots of activities going on during the day and the pool staff does a great job of keeping everyone entertained (water sports, trivia games, music, dancing... all family/kid-appropriate). The beach was gorgeous -- plenty of lounge chairs both in the sun and in the shade from palm trees. The food at all 5 restaurants was pretty good. Our favorites were the Japanese and Fusion places; make sure you make your reservations 2 days in advance though. Both food and drinks (alcohol too) are included in the room rate and they are generous with both. There's a minibar in the room, but not a lot of mixers. The drinks at the pool and on the beach are always available, but they have little to no alcohol in them unless you ask one of the waiters and tip them (20 - 50 pesos). There's really no reason to leave the resort unless you want to, but there is a fun shopping area they call 5th ave about 20 minutes walk (5 mins taxi) from the hotel. The vendors asked 2-3 times what things were worth, but it's easy to haggle them down. If you want to snorkle, scuba, parasail, etc... there is a company that organizes daily trips right on the beach in front of the hotel. There's also a desk in the front lobby where approved tour guides have information if you want to take a trip to see ruins, cenotes, tulum. They really do a great job of making sure your trip is easy and stress-free. Overall, our trip was amazing. Everything you would expect from a Resort like this was there and the staff exceeded our expectations. We gave the "value" category a 4/5 because we aren't big drinkers and this place may be a little over-priced if you don't take advantage of all the free drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - classy, definitely 5* All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: KeyWest77
Reviews.Content: <Overview> We had an excellent stay at this 5* hotel. Its the best All-Inclusive we have been to ever, with excellent food and service. Of all the Riu hotels here the Riu Riveria Maya Palace is the quiet, classy one - great for couples who want 5 star service and a relaxing break. Check out my photos and feel free to ask me anything. -9.5/10- Room - We didn't upgrade and had one of the Junior Suites. It was spacious with 2 x single beds. The beds were OK but not very inviting, the matress covers felt plasticy and the sheets were bobbly. One complaint we did have was the location of the TV - it is fixed so that it faces the small 'lounge area' and therefore cannot be viewed very easily from your beds. Now, I am not here to spent time sitting on a sofa watching TV but I would like to watch the news for 10 mins before bed, ON MY BED. Note to hotel - PUT THE TV's ON THE WALLS FACING THE BEDS!! The bathroom was nice and spacious, with 2 sinks and a hydromassage bath. The minibar was good and re-stocked daily (except on the last 2 days, when it wasn't and even after ringing reception 3 times and being promised someone would come they never came!). Minibar contents - 2 x 7ups, 2 x pepsi, 2 x diet pepsi, 2 x Canada Dry, 2 x 1litre water, 2 x 500ml water, 4 beers. Also Bacardi, Vodka, Whisky, Rum optics. The room service wasn't good - not reccommended. -8/10- Beach - About 10-20% full when we were there. Most people stay around the pool. What this means is that the beach area (shaded by palm trees) was very quiet and relaxing. The beach area nearer the sea (the area not shaded by palm trees) was even quieter and you could be a good 20-30m from the next sunbathers. The sand is a bit grity but stays nice and cool, even in the scorching heat. The sea has strong undercurrents and on the windier days, I believe it is forbidden to jet-ski or para-glide. Waiters from the pool bar do regulary come round with a selection of drinks (not the first week we were there but the second week) -9/10- Pool Area - This is the prefered location for people through the day and so was a little too crowded for us. The pool itself is a nice size with 2 jacuzzis and swim up bar.The pool was not pristine clean and could get quite dirty with used straws floating around (from the swim up bar obviously) but was generally fine. -8/10- Weather - Wow! We enjoyed virtually wall-2-wall sunshine everyday for the first 12 days of our 2 week stay - no cloud. Temperatures reached 34C and alot of people got sunburnt. Then on Friday 14th and Saturday 15th we got more cloud but was still OK and warm. The day we left though, Sunday 16th, the sky was quite overcast and we were glad to be leaving - I wouldn't like to be arriving then. I think we got lucky. -9.5/10- Main Buffet Restaurant (Don Manola) - Firstly, excellent service! The waiters are VERY attentative and will allow you to sit where you want. We liked the main buffet so much that we didn't really bother with the speciality restaurants. We went to Chili's (Steakhouse) and had the steak, which was good, and the Agave (Mexican), which was also very good, but decided the main buffet was just so much better as you could just go up and get what you want and however much you want! Breakfast - American style breakfast, bacon, sausage, hash browns, donuts, crepes, toast, omelettes, salad, loads of fruit, champagne (Whooo!), fresh juices, vegetable juices, so much more. Lunch - Most people go to Chili's for lunch which has pizza, burgers, chips, fruit, salad, fried chicken, hot dogs, fruit, much more. A few people (including us) went to the main buffet where the choice is more limited but still good. Dinner - A lot of choice at the main buffet. There was always chips, pizza, chicken, sald, fruit, roast beef, roast pork, roast chicken, paella, crab legs, strawberries, chocolate fountain, crepes, chili con carne, chicken nuggets. One thing I will say is that all the food was top, top quality and anyone that complains about it needs to get real. -10/10- Entertainment - Take my advice and head down to the Riu Tequilla (5 min walk) for the entertainment. The Riu Tequilla is a less classy hotel (with much rougher looking bunch of guests to go with it - haha, its true!!) but what this means is that the nights there are MUCH MORE FUN. It hosts the same entertainment nights as the Riveria Maya but the stage is much bigger and the productions are therefore much better performed. We saw the Michael Jackson show at both the Riveria Maya and Tequilla and there was no comparison - its a completely different show at the Tequilla, The Tequila also has host fun, audience participation warm-up shows at around 9pm (the Riveria Maya didn't) before the main show at 9:30pm. The best shows were nearly always the audience participation shows (as usual) - Miss Tequilla, Perfect Couple, Karaoke etc.... (At the Tequila) 9.5/10 Playa del Carmen/ 5th Avenue - A 15 min walk away, we were quite dissapointed with what we found here. Its just one street with tacky, cheap shops, with people trying to get you to look inside. It is full mostly of cafes, restaurants, souvenoir shops, cheap jewellery shops, not much else really. Worth checking out but I wasn't impressed. 5/10 Thomson Trips - We were going to do the Chitzen Itza Deluxe trip for $99 but in the end decided against it. Here's why: Firstly the trip included a visit to a cenote cave to go for a swim - why do this? I want to go to see an archaelogical site so either go to another Mayan site to fill the time or skip the swim altogether and head straight to Chitzen Itza, you know, hopefully before everyone else gets there! Thats the other thing - everyone gets there in the middle of the day. Why not start off earlier or skip the cenote cave and beat the crowds? At $99 I don't think the trip is worth it and I would rather spend the day on the beach instead of on a coach. Response to some criticisms I have viewed on this website: Old-fashioned looking - No, it's looks classy with a very attractive plaza area Cockroaches - I will believe people but I didn't see any myself Making reservations - Yes, you have to go to the lobby to make reservations for the speciality restuarants but you can make reservations for the next 2 days so you dont have to do it everyday if you want to eat somewhere other than the main buffet. Also, it takes about 5 mins. Basically, forget any minor negative reviews on this website -- this is about as good a 5* All-Inclusive as you will find.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Place - Exceptional Service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pakrem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I read a lot of reviews about this resort before traveling to this Riu resort. We tried to find a flaw significant enough to dampen our experience and we could not find any that would have lessened our stay. The place is beautiful. All of the staff are friendly, personable, diligent and can't do enough for you. The Beach and Pool are fantastic. I have never vacationed where I felt so lazy that I did not have to swim up to the pool bar! The pool attendants are running around looking to serve you. We would raise our hands in the pool, catch there attention and they would literely run to you to service you and bring the drinks back to you. We did tip the staff and a little goes a long way. Not too much but we both felt that even though we did not feel pressured to do so, they were that good. From the room service, room maids, the waitstaff, pool attendants and waiters and waitresses, they were all so friendly and gracious. The breakfast and dinners were very very good. Lunch is lunch at a resort like this. Nothing fancy but enough of a selection to fill your belly. My wife had mussels every day at lunch and the rest was very good in a casual beach setting. They had a cook out one day and it was a nice mix. We felt safe at every juncture on our trip. Not that we were reckless, but we were cautious to a point but never felt uncomfortable. We actually took a ferry ride to Cozumel and rented a vehicle for the day and had a great time. Just driving up the coast line and stopping for lunch and a few adult beverages at a few places. Never felt in harms way. Many tourists traveling and enjoying the sites. The only encountering problem at the airport and 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen was the selling of vacation clubs. We got selected at the airport and thought it was part of our transportaion. Just watch out for this. They are all over you at 5th Avenue. Just relax and take it in. All in all our best vacation yet. Loved every minute of it and we will go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “PALACE IS STILL A PALACE”
Reviews.Author: kashaFlorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace May 8 for 6nts. This was our 2nd trip to this hotel and was better than the first. We upgraded our rooms to the Jacuzzi Suite and let me tell you the views were breath taking. We had 2 balconys. The first one was a wrap around with a winding stair to the second that had the 2nd jacuzzi with even better views than the first balcony. The service was even better than last year. A little tipping does go along way. Every morning for breakfast our server Victor would see us coming and have our drinks waiting for us on our table. Now if that isn't service I don't know what is. Also, thanks to Joe on the beach, and Santos and Chano at the pool bar. If you see them tell them Mike said to say Hi! We booked 2 of the specialty resturants ahead of time. The brazilian and Chili's. We were not to crazy about the Brazilian. Chilis was great. We ate there 2 nts. Niko was great there. We had the sea and land. Me not being a lobster eater I just ordered 2 filets and had no problems and the rest of the group ordered 2 lobsters. The beach only needs 1 word beautiful! We walked down to the Playacar shopping area and saw a Mayan show. It's only about a 5 min. walk. Took the cab to 5th avenue. We will be returning again to this Palace. Hopefully in the near future. If you need any questions answered feel free to ask. Have a great relaxing time. Vacation is what you make it.

Reviews.Title: “2nd trip to Rui Palace May Riviera - well worth the return”
Reviews.Author: sunday50
Reviews.Content: You almost forget how beautiful the water is here. It is incredible and they have redone the beach area since our last visit in 2007. The beach is BEAUTIFUL and well maintained. Besides the beach and the pool area, the thing I love most about the Rui, is the kindness and attentiveness of the staff. From the people who first greet you when you arrive at the main desk, to the ladies who cleaned our rooms each day - the kindness is terrific. A special shout out to Louis, in the main dining room. He took such good care of us daily and arranged a special evening for us on my birthday. My husband and I have been to Mexico now five times and 3 of those times have been at Rui properties. We would choose this property again. The dining choices were plentiful. We made reservations every night at a specilty restuarant but often ended up later back in the main dining area. The food choices in the main dining area are plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “OMG AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: DaBaronVH
Reviews.Content: April 30th-May 6th of 2010. Absolutely fabulous. I have traveled all over the world and I have to say the service, accommodations, amenities etc. were above my expectations. Thanks to Marvin, Chano, Maria and to Hal Golden from Vacations to Go. The food was EXCELLENT. Contrary to some reviews there was absolutely no musty odors in the room, there were NO BUGS or pests, the water was warm and wonderful. The Michael Jackson impersonators show was very impressive. The rest of the entertainment for the week was OK. Truthfully, after spending all day diving, in the water, fun and sun...I was too tired to stay up. the shows don't start until 9:45 pm. I highly recommend this resort. You don't need to upgrade...the Jr suites are fabulous. Don't worry about room location either. If you are far from the restaurants you are close to the water and vice-versa. Everything you want or need is in the room. Don't believe you have to make reservations every day for a restaurant. You can do 2-3 days at a time. With only 55-60% occupancy SERVICE is unreal! Also you can eat at any restaurant just by showing up. Dollar tips will get you the royal treatment...$5 tip will get you obscenely royal treatment...or tip nothing and service will still be quite good... No concerns whatsoever about safety. The entire resort complex lies within a gated guarded community and the area is well protected for 150 miles in any direction. All the rooms have a locking safe (you set the combination) and it will allow for a lap top.

Reviews.Title: “REALLY NICE BUT NOT FOR ANYBODY”
Reviews.Author: patrickMontreal
Reviews.Content: I went for a week at the hotel with a couple of friends and I loved it. The hotel look amazing, from outside it is definitly the most beautiful one in Playacar, the pool and courtyard are fantastic, the beach is wonderful since the Mexican government did the beach work last Februray. The location is great for people who wants to go to Playa del Carmen many times during the week. The only negative about the hotel is the beds, they are all right, but not for a 5* hotel. The room also are all right, but I saw better in other 5* properties. I would not go there for the room, but since I am not spending much time in my room, I would personnally go back!!!!! I have to say, the staff are so great too!!!! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel good value Wow”
Reviews.Author: divingpro100
Reviews.Content: Went April 14 to the 21 th rain for 3 days only bad part of trip..need a awning for the front of the hotel.. very wet leaving a cab or car.... great food beach service rooms.. the scuba was sub par no boat. and the gym equipment was old.. other than that first class all the way!! $1289 non stop from Detroit you can't beat the price for a 5 star resort.. already booking another trip here at the RIU!! it is a Palace....

Reviews.Title: “Another good trip to RPRM”
Reviews.Author: beach_ready_tx
Reviews.Content: This was my sixth trip to Riu Palace Riviera Maya (RPRM) and it was wonderful! The top ten things about the resort: 1. The people and the service. 2. The food: octopus ceviche, shrimp, oysters on the half-shell, sea bass, shrimp risotto--and trust me, I could go on. 3. The beach. Plenty of shade, large & uncrowded. 4. The pool scene--best in Mexico. 5. The rooms - great a/c, very good water pressue, large closet, electronic safe, excellent house keeping. 6. Club sandwich via room service at 2 a.m. 7. Beautiful lobby, elegant lobby bar. 8. Gorgeous grounds, gardens and fountains. 9. Live music every night and dancing on the patio (if you're daring). 10. Safety. You will feel 100% safe at the RPRM and in Playa del Carmen. Feel free to contact me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed. The Riu brand has been damaged.”
Reviews.Author: Magzoey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace in the Dominican Republic and loved it! We chose the Riu Palace Riviera Maya since we had such an awesome time in the DR. This hotel, although it is a carbon footprint of that in the DR, is not as nice. I will start with the pros: I never had to wake up early to reserve a seat at the pool. The food and drink were plentiful. I am a vegetarian and my boyfriend is a meat eater. We both enjoyed the food and drinks. Lots of selections! The weather was awesome, as was the ocean! We were well treated well at the bars. They all were fun, happy to serve you and helpful. Leo with the Entertainment team is awesome! Make sure you spend some time with him. Cons: We had to terminate multiple cockroaches in our room! Turndown service (I love this service- don't know why) was inconsistent. We only received this service 40% of our 10 night stay. They "forgot" to clean our room one day. The beach still is quite eroded. If you stick your toes in too far, you will hit concrete. The nightly entertainment shows were terrible! The only show worth seeing is the Michael Jackson show (don't miss it). We spoke with 2 different couple who had their rooms broken into! Cameras and phones were stolen in both instances. The Sports Bar has 3 channels: ESPN and ESPN 2 (they both air the same program) and Fox Sports. I enjoy baseball and wanted to watch the hockey and basketball playoffs at night. This was not possible! I may never watch another soccer game again. Most importantly, I am a Hotel Manager by trade. Hence, I enjoy talking with the Directors and Managers at places I visit. The Director, Javier, was not willing to speak with anyone! I witnessed his curtness with the staff which was quite disturbing. He avoided eye contact with anyone and the Guests who had their rooms broken into, told us that Javier refused to speak with them! Don't get me wrong- I had a tremendous 10 day vacation! However, I would not return to this resort again. This resort is missing the details that make a 5 Star resort, a legitimate 5 Star resort. I agree with a previous review, that for an experienced traveler, you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Great All-Inclusive Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Joe1123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 5 night trip to the RPRM (5/3-5/8). The trip met our expectations, and in most instances, exceeded them! First, we booked our trip in March 2010, and went through the Riu website. This was probably the most troublesome part of our trip - the website crashed twice while trying to book the trip. I called the Riu number the following day to make sure we had not been charged. We had not, so we attempted a third time on the website, and had no issues. I would recommend calling the 800 number - they were very helpful in my interactions. We arrived the first day, and were able to check in at noon. The staff at the front desk greeted us with drinks, and were very polite. Our transportation to and from the hotel was included, so we made our way to meet Miguel, who apparently coordinates the transportation. He gave us a brief overview on some day trips without being pushy - we really came to RPRM to relax, not trek. After going to our room, I went back to the desk to ask for additional toiletries, and overheard that the hotel was only at 60% occupancy. That being said, it was a clear sign that our service was going to be extraordinary since the staff was not dealing with their usual large crowds. The room was very clean, but by the end of the week, it did have a musty smell, and our clothes never seemed to dry. The mini-bar was stocked every other day. We stayed in a junior suite, and did not spend much time in our rooms other than to sleep. We did order room service one evening at midnight, and had our food within 20 minutes! As other reviews have stated, the pool is large and beautiful - we found ourselves rotating between the large pool area and the endless pool. It is kept clean for the most part, but by 3 or 4pm, you would see the occasional straw or trash from the swim up bar area. Nothing you can do about that. The staff by the pool were great - if you needed a drink, they walked around every few minutes to assist. There were plenty of chairs in the sun or shade, but as some other reviews referenced, many chairs had towels on them at 7am, although they would not have a person in them until 11 or 12. Again, no fault of the Riu, just inconsiderate people. The beach was large with plenty of chairs. We would typically head there in the afternoon. We seemed to have an exceptionally hot week, but the weather was terrific - sunny everyday, no rain whatsoever. The breeze by the ocean made the heat much more bearable. We rented Wave Runners one day - it was $60 for a half hour, but was well worth it. They offer free kayak rentals, as well as catamarans, which we also took out one afternoon. Looking back, I wish we would have used these earlier in our week, since it was a very nice option. My wife and I are new travelers, so we may not have the highest standards for food at a resort, but we were pleased with all of our food options. We ate at Don Manolo's for breakfasts and lunches, plus a few dinners. It's a buffet, so it is not gourmet food, but they mixed things up nicely. We were happy with the food. We also tried Agave (the Mexican restaurant) and the Japanese restaurant, and were very happy with both. We were able to get reservations with no problems - maybe that was more of a result of the 60% occupancy. I can not speak for the Brazilian, fusion, or steakhouse since we did not eat at them. Chili's (the steakhouse) also serves as a lunch/snack location by the pool, and had more limited food options, but was still a nice option. We ventured out to 5th Avenue one evening, but were turned off by the huge crowds/merchants/drug dealers. There seems to by lots of night life and restaurants, but we visited for an hour or 2 and did not eat out. There were plenty of neat stores, plus plenty of places to get a drink or 2. I was more comfortable on the resort, however. If you need toiletries, this may be a better place to purchase them (rather than the hotel gift shop). The gift shop in the hotel charged 125 pesos for a travel sized shaving cream! We also took advantage of the other Riu resorts, and spent a night at the disco at the Riu Tequila. It was a bit grimy, with confetti carpeted walls and very dark lights. It was good for a laugh. That particular resort seemed more wild and rowdy. The lobby bar was a great time, and the bartenders joked around with everyone. We much preferred our hotel and the openness of our resort, but for one night, we had a great time. The entertainment on the resort was very good as well. The Michael Jackson show was fun - even though we thought the person playing Michael was a little lazy with his dancing. He did look just like him though! The entertainment staff was very friendly, and the head guy Leon got us laughing daily. Not to mention, by the end of the trip, we could not stop singing the "Si Si Si, No No No" song that is played a few times a day. Overall, we had an incredible trip. The accommodations were great, the staff was incredibly friendly and courteous, and the weather was beautiful. I would definitely stay at a Riu again, but probably in a different location (for no other reason that I would like to travel to new locations).

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at a great time!”
Reviews.Author: carissaM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya April 24-May 1, 2010. This was a GREAT time to go: no spring breakers, no crowds, no waits, plenty of chairs, mostly great weather. The resort was gorgeous, the food was suprisingly pretty good, the liquor was all top-shelf, and the staff was energetic, courteous, spoke impeccable English, and worked very hard to keep us very happy. The Playacar area is gated, and we felt perfectly safe at all times. If pressed for negative comments I would say this: 1) It's almost impossible to eliminate the humidity, so our room did smell slightly musty, and the clothes I brought home definitely have a musty odor. I think you'd be hard pressed to find a resort in Playa del Carmen where that is not the case. 2) There's not much for nightlife after the 9:45 pm show, but you get free admission to Riu Tequila if you want to go party after 11. 3) There are no umbrellas for the chairs at the beach - for shade at the beach you rely on a stand of palm trees, but because the sun moves, you may have a shaded spot but then be in full sun after 30 minutes. Not a huge issue when we went because there were always plenty of empty chairs, but that would have been a pain in the neck if there were more guests at the hotel and we couldn't just switch seats. 4) The gym facilities were not great. The one elliptical machine did not work at all and there were no free weights. But there are plenty of opportunities for outdoor exercise. 5) If you are at all "into wine," you will be sorely disappointed with the wines. However, they offer a sparkling wine that's not bad. The beach is beautiful, but the ocean in this area is variable: two days it was perfect for swimming with gentle, rolling waves; another day it was fine for kayaking (free rental through Riu). The other days, the surf was too rough to swim, and our planned snorkel trip had to be cancelled for safety. The pools were top-notch. I've never seen better, or even close. We visited the other 4 Riu resorts to get a feel for our value, and we felt like price difference was well worth it to stay where we did. The only other one in the same class was Riu Palace Mexico. The food seemed pretty similar, and the layout was almost identical. I don't know how the guest rooms compare. The pool at Riu Palace Riviera Maya was much better. Tips if you are staying here: the reservation restaurants are not an extra fee. Go to the Mexican place. It's amazing. The Brazilian one is fine. We didn't get a chance to go to the steak restaurant because they close it down for wedding receptions: if you want to try it, ask at the beginning of your stay which nights it will be open. Drink tip: The cocktails and particularly the daquiris are very weak, but the bartender will add extra alcohol if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “5 star?... More like 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: Harley_girl2003
Reviews.Content: I've travelled around mexico within the past 4 years and have experienced several different resorts... All claim to be 5 stars. There is one thing for sure that I cannot deny... The service and friendliness of staff is top notch and I can't complain. Everyone smiled, said "hola" and was at your beck and call. FABULOUS SERVICE. The pool was HUGE, very nice. I did find it a little dirty though during the day, we must have picked up 50 straws from the pool during our 1 week stay. THe ocean and beach are both fabulously gorgeous! The water activities were fun too $$$. We went seadooing. Our Wedding was fabulous... BEAUTIFUL. The wedding coordinators did everything they could to make our day special, and it was. The rooms are very clean and roomy (except for the occasional roach). Now to the down sides.... The hotel itself is clean but old fashioned looking, where I prefer very light colors and modern designs. It was very darkly decorated with big bold brass framed pictures, dark paints and fabrics etc... Not my thing. Several people in our group were severely ill with Travellers diahrea. This ruined the vacation of some of the guests. 3 of the 6 rooms in our group the guests saw roaches, some alive some dead. Gross. The rooms smelled musty for the most part. My mother had to change rooms several times till she found one that didn't smell. In the end she had to take a downgrade in her room because there was no rooms in her category that didn't smell. Plain annoying. The Air conditionner in 2 of the guest rooms my group occupied worked when it felt like it. Mine was one of the rooms involved. I ended up changing rooms with a free upgrade that ended up being worse. At this time of year it is really hot, and we knew that before going but did expect sufficient air conditioning to keep us cool at night. We spent alot of time awake at night due to the immense heat. The Maintenance guy was fabulous... He did his best to fix the problem but unfortuntely... it wouldn't cool the room off. I think the air conditionner they are using for the tiny rooms is the same size as the Presidential suites... which is why it is so hot in the large rooms and colder in the tiny rooms. Had it not been my wedding I would have downgraded to a smaller room.... but this trip was a little different. The food.... MEH.... Nothing really to rave about. The steak at the Chilly's restaurant at Diner was the best one. For breakfast: There's something not so indearing about hotdog weiners in my morning eggs. I didn't find that appealing at all. This was one of the buffet breakfast options. I must say that some relatives on my husbands side had never travelled and they thought it was fabulous but I've seen WAY better. Personally I wouldn't go back. We were told the RPRM was the newest, most modern of the RIU chain. If that's the best.... I don't want to see the older, lesser quality resorts. I wouldn't recommend this resort to a well travelled person or someone with high standards. But if you haven't travelled much... try it out you may like it. Overall I found this resort quite disapointing for the HIGH cost we paid to travel there from Canada... $2600 per person Canadian Funds.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for & more...”
Reviews.Author: shore525
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife planned this trip in early January 2010 and we were looking for a hotel that offered a great beach, nice pool, great location (close to 5th), all inclusive, and reasonably priced. This hotel met all those categories. We traveled with 3 other couples and the overall point of the trip was to get some much needed relaxation & have a great time with friends. This hotel definitely accomodated that. If you want to relax you just go down to the beach (which is one of the largest/nicest beaches compared to the other hotels). If you want to have some cocktails by the poolside bar there are plenty of tables/jacuzzi's for you to lounge in, or if you wanted to relax by the pool it's large enough where you can stake out a quiet spot. What I liked best about the hotel is being we booked it somewhat in advance we got a great deal (ex. under $1000 per person, where other AI's at the time we booked were more like $1300-$1400 pp) which makes it affordable to leave the hotel and experience downtown Playa, excursions, etc. & not feel guilty because you spent so much on the all inclusive package. Our group loved to go out and hit the local discos and restaurants so this suited us well, and being it's so close to downtown Playa it is like everyone stated in previous reviews a $5 cab or 20 minute walk on the beach. For dinners we hit up Krystal, the Brazilian, the steakhouse, and the buffet which were all very good. However, if you are looking for great authentic Mexican food we tried El Fogon in downtown Playa and that was phenominal!!! For drinks, the lobby bar was a frequent stop to begin the night festivities and we met so many wonderful people from all over the world that really made this trip even more enjoyable. As well as the lobby bar staff, in particular Islas & Jorge, they made it a very entertaining & enjoyable experience. We didn't go to any of the shows, so I can't speak on that. We did however hit up the disco at the Riu Tequila one night which was fun, but in no way as entertaining as the discos in downtown Playa Overall, I would characterize this hotel as a great place for your daytime activities such as the beach, pool, and relaxation. The evening/night activities such as dinner and an after dinner drink are great, but for nighlife such as bars/discos you need to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Magx52
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very friendly attentive staff. The rooms were spotlessly clean with drinks optics carrying branded liquor. The food was excellent although the lunchtime menu was rather limited on some days. I would certainly reccommend this hotel and think it probabaly suits couples rather than families.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace is just that a Palace”
Reviews.Author: kmjelj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from RPRM (our 2nd time) and I was hoping it would be as good as it was when we were there in 2007. It was better! The beach, staff, food everything was perfect! If you are looking for an A. I. resort check out the RPRM from google earth, you will see that it is in a small comunity of Playacar where it is COMPLETLY safe to walk into town or around the other resorts. You are not droped off at a compound where you have to taxi any time you want to go out the front door. They call it a Palace becuse they treat you like Royalty! Yes I will be going back again! KJ from Sacramento

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip - looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: cookiecarter101
Reviews.Content: Okay, at first I was fearful of some of the stories of the hotel and the stuff we'd find there, but maybe we humans gravitate toward the bad stuff too eaily, even other people's reviews. The hotel was amazing, loved every second of staying there. The people were wonderful, wait-staff were there every second attending to our every need and the restaraunts were top-notch. The bed was a little hard, but not too bad where you couldn't sleep. The walls are okay - no really loud noises from the neighbors, but the hallways are tiled, so sound reverberates tremendously. Even being quiet, conversations can carry into the rooms. These really aren't negatives in my opinion, just observations. The buffet was wonderful at each meal.
