Fresh food, variety each day, and a smile and tip of the hat from the supervisors of the waitstaff. The entertainment crew were top notch and kept us entertained each day and night. Catch the shows, they're great and no two days are the same. Anything that uses gasoline costs money. Jetski's, Parasailing, etc. So be ready to spend money to do these things. The snorkling trip was great! I recommend it! A great trip and wonderful sights to see. Tulum (the local Mayan temple) was a great sight to see as well. My only real negative had nothing to do with the hotel, but leaving the hotel for any outside shopping. American/Canadian/Mexican, mid 30's and a credit card seem to be the target for the gentlemen selling time shares. Every where we went, we got hit up for a time-share tour - and I had more Mexican 'friends' than I knew. Everywhere we went was, "Hello my friend, let me show you what I have in my store" or "Hello my friend, where are you from?" Usually the second question was followed up by "why don't you come and take a 90-minute tour." One guy actually told me he could get me anything I wanted and then emphasized "Anything" while holding his hands out making an hourglass figure - the international sign for woman, I'm guessing. Advice: If you're looking to bargain and don't mind the hassle, go in town and get stuff - it's cheaper than at the hotel. Some of it is really nice, too. If you do mind the hassle and the bargaining, stay in the hotel - it's not THAT much of a savings.

Reviews.Title: “never stay at this property unless you want to get sick”
Reviews.Author: ronna
Reviews.Content: My husband, 25 year old son, and I stayed at this property over Christmas break. We were there for 9 nights and sick for 3 of them. We never ate anything outside of this all-inclusive property. The food on the buffet was left out, the food preparers did not wear gloves, and the plates on the buffet were caked with old food. We asked for some kind of compensation for our lost 3 days and received nothing. This property is beautiful but extremely expensive. Spending 3 days in our room with horrible stomach issues is not what we bargained for. I am very disappointed in the RIU properties for not standing behind their poor operation.

Reviews.Title: “25th wedding anniversary with friends”
Reviews.Author: Elianna62
Reviews.Content: We visited third week of April 2010. Despite the torrential rains our first two days, we were VERY impressed with the service and care given to us. We traveled from Maine for our 25th anniversary and experienced a beautiful 8 day stay. Room was wonderful, clean and well maintained throughout our stay. Funny smell when we arrived (in the lobby). So what? Food excellent except for Kristal which we thought was "precious" and not worth the effort. Hubby got sick after and lost a day of vacation. Playa is gorgeous and who cares if women are topless? Love the European aspect of life here. Massages ok but the tent on the beach for massages is distracting, especially with the people arriving to claim chairs. Massages at Aventura Spa are BETTER!!!! They are more private, and I love aromatherapy. Having said that, the masseurs were very professional and MAN! I felt great for 2 days afterwards!!!! (if a bit sore!) Ate at Chilis's, Don Manolo's and. . . the Brazilian restaurant rocked!!!! Sports Bar sucks-poor drinks, lousy furnishings, loud, not fun! . . .RIU needs to provide a CLASSY bar for its smoking patrons.!!!!! We did not take excursions because it is our 5th trip to this area. However, we found the people friendlier than in other resorts of the area. We met a lot of really NICE people. Lots of Brits and Germans. Midwesterners-very few people from New England, but who CARES? Loved the beach-pools small but service good. We did not like how waiters hovered for tips especially when they asked for American cigarettes. Come on!!!!! Cigs cheaper in Mexico than in the US! That annoyed me!!!!! Best Day shuttle fine but I hate the delays dropping everyone off and Riu people last or first on the last day. Favorite things: playa, craft market on the premises, Juan, the Maitre D at Don Manolo's and the Brazilian restaurant, also Victor at Manolo's and Romeo on the beach. Would we go back? Absolutely!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A time i wil never forget”
Reviews.Author: Gdfather138
Reviews.Content: What can i say about this hotel. This is the best experience i have ever had in my life. The service was amazing to say the least. The hotel was incredible. There is not one thing that i can say wrong about this place. My wife and I got married here and i can honestly say that it was the best time of my life. If you are even thinking about staying in Playa del carmen RIU is the place. BTW i am not a review write but this place was so amazing that i had to say something. My new wife and are will be traveling to Jamaica next year and will be staying at the RIU hotel as well. Thank you RIU for making our wedding a dream come true for my wife (you made me look good for picking you lol )

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Crappy Weather”
Reviews.Author: Weimlover
Reviews.Content: 5th time staying in the Riveria Maya area. Stayed 6 days 5 nights starting on April 11th. The Riu was spotless top to bottom staff were cleaning all the time, service was excellent, drink servers around every few minutes poolside. Drinks were watered down ask for more rum. Rooms were nice and clean but the beds were hard. My fridge was restocked everyday. Towel art made everyday .Beach was nice and large but the water was not as clear as the water on down the coast only about 2 ft. visibility. Waves were real rough one day. Plenty of lounge chairs, but if you get up late dont expect a prime spot. Breakfest was great. Every breakfest item imagined was there. Lunch buffet at poolside had a little of everything, no one should go hungry. Dinner was a different theme every night but most everything stayed the same except for the speciality dishes that were prepared for the nights theme. Waiters came around every few minutes to check on you. Dinner at the speciality restaurants was a nice change of pace. Made 2 reservations for the early seating, no problems or standing and waiting in line to make them. The Brazilian was great, bring a big appetite and a love for 10 different types of meat. Crystal was a fusion type restaurant some of the food was a little strange if your a real picky eater skip it. The nightly shows were on the cheesy side tried to watch the Grease and Circus/Acrobat shows but could only stomach fifteen minutes or so. 5th ave is about a 20 minute walk away or a five dollar cab ride, you pass by two small sets of ruins along the way. The only things I disliked about the place (personal opinion only) was that it was just too big and to close to town with hotels up and down the coast. I perfer a more secluded spot ,stayed at the Catolina Royal Tulum (which is not as nice as the RPRM) 3 years ago and loved the smaller secluded jungle feel to it. Also the distance to the highway made it difficult to easily catch a collectivo. You had to walk to PDC near 5th ave to catch one. I would like to note that I am a easy going person and could have a great time anywhere The hotel is great but I did not have a great time there (no fault of the hotel).... it rained constantly 80% of the time we was there(not just a sprinkle but heavy rain most of the time) 18% of the time gray and gloomy skies, 2% sunshine (only 10 hrs of sunshine the entire week) . Went snorkeling at Akumal Bay during the short time the sun shined one day, saw sea turtles and stingrays, this was the highlight of our trip. Tried to visit 5th ave (been there before) to do some shopping while it was sprinkling but after 5 minutes there it came a downpour that flooded the streets after 2 hours of trying to wait it out in a shop we decided to give up and braved the hurricane like rains to catch a cab back to the hotel. Would I go back? Probably not ,It was a little too fancy for my liking. I would choose a resort a little smaller and rural next time.

Reviews.Title: “I Wanna Go BACK!”
Reviews.Author: AtticusFinchHart
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 14th in the rain, more rain on the 15th AND 16th, but that did not dampen our spirits. We were surprised with an upgrade (2063) and it was perfectly located to restaurants and pool/beach areas. The room was clean, bed and pillows comfortable, and plenty of towels! Our room keeper always left "designer" towels on the bed, which was turned down at night with chocolates on the pillows. There was always ample supply of bottled water. As others have mentioned, tipping or leaving a few dollars a day goes a long ways. The sun FINALLY came out (it never rains in April when you're in Mexico -- ha!) and we enjoyed four fantastic days at both the beach and pool. Not sure at what capacity the hotel was at, but we never had to "reserve" a poolside sunbed, and there are ample supplies of loungers both in shade and sun at the beach. Walked along the beach into PDC one afternoon, and peaked in at the other Riu hotels. Of course, Riu Palace Riviera Maya was top notch (I've stayed at Riu Palace Mexico, which was excellent but RPRM is one or two steps above in service, etc.) We want to thank Rosalba, who does an excellent job at the Reception area. Amazed at how they can remember names and faces. There was ALWAYS a positive answer for any questions or concerns. Dania does a very efficient job at making dinner reservations. Rated Krystal and Yashima as our favorite specialty restaurants, with the Agave and Botafogo coming in a close second. The service provided by "CHICKEN LITTLE" (Daniel) is OUTSTANDING. Rosario also deserves commendations. Many others worked exceptionally and always were there to make certain you were treated "special." Rudee and Leo were all over the hotel grounds at all hours of the day/night, entertaining guests with gusto. Personally, I thought the shows were better than average and much better than those on a cruise. Cannot be missed is the Renova Spa treatments. Jorge or Juan David, both were exceptionally well trained, professional, and I recommend the deep muscle massage, exfoliating body wrap, and do not miss the anti-aging facial massage. A bit "pricey" but WELL WORTH IT!!! We did go into PDC, walked there and $5 taxi back. Again, I found 5th Avenue to have changed QUITE A BIT!!! No longer small shop vendors. Now it's upscale boutiques eating away at the locals. High-end restaurants squeezed in beside the "old mom and pop" shops I remembered when PDC was a quiet fishing village years ago. But it was entertaining looking in the windows and received some shopping therapy. (If you want nightlife, it's close enough to walk or taxi your way into town.) Besides, I always make my own good times -- ha!) There are daily programs you can participate in or just lounge by the pool or walk on the cool white sand. Overall, I personally could not find one "negative" thing about the hotel. The price was right for the quality of service, food, entertainment, personnel, spa, beach/pool, etc. Our vacation was made as comfortable as possible by the efficient and pleasant staffing at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Both the hotel's interior and exterior are immaculate as evidenced by the hard workers. The evening activities around the busy lobby bar (La Habana) was always a fun place to "people" watch. Enjoyed the continental flavor of the different nationalities and how easy it is to communicate either by pointing or saying a few words in Spanish. If you're planning a trip to RPRM, I am certain you will enjoy the facilities and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended but...”
Reviews.Author: Conneceur
Reviews.Content: The Hotel its ok for a 4 stars, but not a 5 stars as they proclaim, and definitely dont promiss a romantic vacations. This is a hotel for large groups of kids, american kids drunk, travelling without parental supervision, going completely wild for the corridors. Restaurants: here's one the major problem of the resort. - buffet is actually quite good, but the best meals are outside the resort. And they have the most stupid and restricted policy about reservations... You need to make the reservations between 12 and 2 PM, only for the next day. Forget it... You never do, because you only had sun at the beach until 4pm. And if you do one day, you never have reservations for the best or another restaurants. And that’s the first lie: full of space in the restaurants, but they prefer to put you days and days in the buffet. This is the most ridiculous system.For breakfast, lunch and dinner you get 1 place to eat. Cheaper? Believe me, this is not the Caribbean dream holiday i expected. Service is another big problem, expect to ask 4 times for a glass of water... The rooms are good, but old and the smell of alcohol it’s difficult to hide... And if you asked for a ocean/sea view, they only had 4 rooms with view (450 USD extra.) Oh, forget internet. They only have a bad wireless in the lobby, full of kids, with no computers available. The location its ok, not good! This is an large area, not so close to the town, and you to pay 5 USD to close town (2 mile or 20 minutes walking) and 30 USD to the mall, don’t have another option. We pay more money to this "palace", and when we arrive, and the people from Riu Lupita and another Riu are upgraded for this one. I wish I would have booked at another resort because totally ruined my dream vacation. The point is: I don’t recommend this hotel, but.... that’s only my opinion. You know what the problem is? Riviera Maya its a wonderful place, awsome food and service, and this hotel is very disappointing for first world standards. Try it and you never forget this review and this spanish words: "-No senõr..."

Reviews.Title: “The best place to vacation”
Reviews.Author: danddnorthdakota
Reviews.Content: This whole side is great. People must realize you are in another country. These people work for $10.00 a day. So when they say tips included...this mean they are tipped a little once a week! They all work hard to accommodate everyone. They dont understand are every words or our way of doing things.We bring a bunch of ones and tip as we go. We even tipped the yard/ pools guys.(you would be surprised how far a hundred dollars in tips goes, and the smiles you get)This really makes their day and it shows. The food here and up and down the coast is great! They will make it the way you want it, all you have to do is ask Nicely! The food is fresh and healthy ,which most of us are not used to. Not too much processed junk. The sweats are not too rich . Enjoy the country and their culture.

Reviews.Title: “Traveled With Kids - Super Time.”
Reviews.Author: sarahcole
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and two children, ages 10 and 11. We traveled during Spring Break and were concerned about college kids. Turns out there were groups of kids but this is not really a spring-break destination resort so there weren't that many. And there were no repercussions of them being there - it's not a rowdy place so they fit the scene. Cleanliness: First let me say that I'm completely skeeved by other people's dirt & grime in my hotel room. Well, this place is 100% and absolutely spotless. There are people cleaning ALL day long - washing the hallway floors and walls and everything. You won't even find beach sand on the floors until late in the day. It is super clean. We had adjoining rooms - the kids in one and the adults in another, and the rooms were PERFECT (and I am picky). They change your sheets EVERY DAY. Staff: EVERY single person we passed or met was helpful and polite. We only tipped for one thing and that was the wait staff in the specialty restaurants (oh and $2 per day for our housekeeping staff). I have read that at some places you may feel neglected bt staff if you become known as a "non-tipper" but we found that absolutely not to be the case. These people are extremely hard working and make a ridiculously meager salary so parting with a few dollars a day felt like nothing to us. However, we were constantly being approached - being asked if we wanted anything to drink, is everything ok, etc. Beach/Pool: Again, we were there during Spring Break so the place was at capacity. We didi have to get to the pool by around 7-7:30 am to put towels on beach chairs if we wanted to reserve them. Usually if one of us was up, we'd go down, put towels down get a cup of coffee, go back to the room and then go to the pool after breakfast. There were PLENTY of beach chairs - an equal amount in the sun and in the shade. The beach was gorgeous and the water was calm. Jet Skiiers and boaters have to stay far out of the swimming area, so that's not a problem. Food: I am a cook and love to eat so the food was important to me. There is so much variety in the main buffet for every meal, that you could have something different every day. Let me see what I can remember for breakfast: a cold cereal bar with corn flakes, oatmeal & granola, fruit loops, dried fruits, shredded coconut, chocolate chips and more,; eggs any way you like them with bacon, sausage, etc.; a big buffet bar with cold salads, fruits, cheeses; a guy with a big blender making pure fruit smoothies to order, an omelet station, a panini station, hot Mexican breakfast specialties, a variety of breads and pastries (oh and I am a Starbucks drinker and was worried I wasn't going to like the coffee but it was full flavored and really really good). So much. For lunch, there was another buffet which had a great selection for everyone. A big salad bar - always fresh guacamole, homemade chips, salsa, sandwiches, burgers, pizza, fries, grilled chicken, shrimp, one day there was a guy making fresh quesadillas with whatever you wanted to stuff in there - YUM! So much to choose from. Dinner -In the main buffet, lLots of variety again - Specialty nights too - italian, Seafood, etc. Really fresh and good. By about 3 nights at the dinner buffet though, you're ready for a change of pace. Do make your dinner reservations in advance. The restaurants, though not 5-star were really excellent. "All - Inclusive" - Snorkeling is NOT included - the "equipment" is included. You must purchase an excursion (about $35 a person) to go snorkeling. We didn't do that but did take ATV's into the jungle for zip lines and a cave swim - well worth it. A great trip. There's a guy at the pool who goes around offering it - not pushy or anything - and it was a blast! We let the kids go anywhere in the pool complex by themselves, and we allowed them to eat at the little "steak house" for lunch (adjacent to the pool) by themselves too. They had to get one of us to go to the beach. We felt good and safe there. Night Life: There are shows every night - they are "ok" - some are better than others. We usually hung out in the courtyard in the evenings - before the show they usually have musicians out there who are really, really good. The shows are done by 11 so there's not disturbance late into the night. I whole heartedly recommend this place, and I don't usually do that! We thoroughly enjoyed. You really can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Erinamy
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutly beautiful and Immaculately maintained. The staff at this hotel made our visit! The hosts, servers, maids, greaters, and entertainment crew were some of the nicest people I have ever met. They go out of their way to make sure you are having a good time. So full of kindness and joy! Tips are appreciated, but not expected. US dollars or pesos. My favorite staff members were Rosario, Joe, Moy and from the Animacion entertainment, Angel, Ruddy and Leo. The food was wonderful at all of the restaurants and buffets. Getting a pool chair was tricky, but not impossible. I will be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Some excellent points, but some points to watch out for”
Reviews.Author: ElleMayWales
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within a gated community which is a pleasant area and it is safe to walk around in the evenings with your family. It is a 5 minute walk to a selection of shops and a 20 minute walk to 5th avenue where there are more shops located. I did not venture that far but my husband did. To be warned he was offered drugs and introductions to women!! General: Hotel is in a good state of repair. It has a small shop which sells sun cream, sweets etc. The hotel is clean, the gardens and surrounding area is clean and tidy. All inclusive: There is a wide range of drinks available. The visitors to this hotel are 95% american and there is a culture of tiping staff continuously. The bar staff, waiting on staff, porters etc. This can become quite expensive if you do tip all the time. If you do not tip be warned that staff can sometimes "neglect" you for those that are tipping. We did not tip all the time and did not find this a problem as we just drew their attention and asked for service but it could get you down if you let it. This did not spoil our holiday. Rooms: We were initially given room 2081. If you are allocated this room ask to move immediately. It is situated above the 24 hour sports bar and subsequently the noise continues all night. We travelled with our 10 year old son and had 2 nights with no sleep. I went to reception and asked to move and was told they were having particular problems at the moment as they had groups of teenage boys staying in the hotel. They did relocate us to a much quieter room (1141). The rooms are spotlessly clean and consist of two small double beds (I actually think they are queen size) or one large king size which is double the size of a UK king sized bed. When they moved us they could not provide a bed for our son and said that there was a waiting list for beds! They wanted the three of us to sleep in one bed. Well, after paying £5,000 for a holiday we were not sharing a bed. After 3 phone calls and two visits to reception a camp bed was provided. Restaurants: The main buffet offers a wide selection of food but it can become extremely busy. We tried to be there for 6.30 when it opened as it tended to be quieter there. There is a wide selection of soft and alcoholic drinks available and the waiting on staff are friendly and eager to please. For the 5 themed restauarants these have to be booked between 12 noon and 3 pm daily. You can only book for up to 4 days in advance and can only book 2 sessions at one time. We found that the restaurants are usually booked up for the day you are booking and the following day. All the themed restaurants (apart from the Steak House) provide an excellent choice of food. The Steak House is rather disappointing. Pool area: The area is clean and sun loungers appeared to be plentiful. The area is surprisingly quiet considering the size of the hotel. My son enjoyed the pools. Towels: These are provided daily from a kiosk by the pool. You are given a pool card which you can exchange for a towel. Do not loose this card as you will have to pay for it on departure. Beach: The hotel is situated on the beach and sun loungers are provided. Water sports are available and the sea is sectioned into swimming and water sports area. BEWARE! Many tourists appear to take out boats that they are unable to control and they often cross the swimming area. We witnessed many near collisions and were very surprised that someone was not seriously injured. The sea is not suitable for young children as it is very rough with large waves. The hotel operates a flag system which is helpful. When we were there it was either RED - no swimming, or YELLOW - swim with extreme caution. The sand is golden, there is a lovely breeze. Trips: We travelled with Thomson and went on 3 trips with them. The trip to the Chicha Itzen is a long day (3 hours each way by coach) but worth visiting. We also visited the Mayan Village and Coba. If you go on this trip wear strong shoes as it is a 4 km walk through the jungle to the ruins. This trip was excellent. We also took our son on the sealife experience where he was able to swim with a sea lion, manatee and dolphin. On relection this was quite upsetting for me as I was upset to see them in such confiined spaces but my son thoroughly enjoyed it. All in all a nice hotel, good location with adequate amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: uklassUk
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weeks stay. The Hotel as expected was spectacular. Service is fab and the rooms are wonderfully clean. We walked to some of the other Hotels but to be honest you're in the best one so why look further. It is also easy getting to 5th Ave which is a large shops, bars and rest area and also a bus and ferry terminal. You can either walk along the road or on the beach. A taxi is about $5. Pool is lovley, it was "spring break" week so I assume the pool area is not so busy. Peaople have commented on noisy corridors at night an unruly teens but had no problems, yeah we could hear music from the courtyard if we went back to the room early (before 11) but nothing to stop us all getting to sleep !! We were allocated a room on the second floor over the buffet rest and near the sports bar and had no problems with noise. I would guess that courtyard facing rooms are better than the exterior rooms overlooking the neighbouring hotels. Free wifi in the huge lobby area was an added bonus and adequate for the odd email, facebook update etc etc who wants to sit on their laptop on holiday anyway !!! The food was great and I agree the buffett is better. Entertainment team were fantastic and I was not put off by them in and around the pool trying to get people to participate in activites, If you said no, they always left you alone. Someone mentioned that they were not told about the time change, I saw numerous posters on doors in and around the hotel all that day so not sure what happened. The only bad comment I can make is the reserving of sunbeds. The hotel gives you cards to get free towels from the poolside hut which is open fom 7am till 6pm. By 8am there were never any beds available. People were holding beds with towels, books, magazines etc etc and we noticed most days that some people would not use the beds till the afternoon having spent the morning on the beach or wherever....... I apporached the staff in the pool hut and while they offered to find beds on the beach and bring them poolside they would not removed towels. I took old magazines off 2 beds at 10 am one day and the culprits did not surface till 3pm !!!! This resulted in large groups sitting poolside with feet in water all day long as they had nowhere else to go. All in all we had a great holiday and learnt to get over the minor problem, I just wish pool staff had to guts to sort out the sunbed hoggers so everyone can enjoy their holiday. I would not let this issue of selfishness put me off returning and would stand your ground and take off the books and mags from the bedhoggers !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen 2010”
Reviews.Author: Mike3387
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Good food with lots to choose from. Get to breakfast before 9:30 or you'll be waiting for an omlette(sp). The minibar and fridge were always restocked. Tip or no tip, didn't really make a difference on how our clean our rooms were. Never had a complaint. No weird smells or bugs, and the beds were firm, again, not a problem. Great beach, great beach section with palm trees. Staff members even checked up on us on the beach to be sure things were going well. Do make your reservations early. We missed out, but had a great time eating on 5th Ave. Great food, reasonable prices, lots of fun. We missed the ADO bus when we got there, but used it on the way out. The employee there informed me that the airport bus leaves every fifteen min., starting at 7 am. We took the 7:45 bus, which left at 7:55, made three stops, then we arrived at the airport. All in all, it was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Golf-her8
Reviews.Content: The resort was better than we expected in many ways- excellent beach, gorgeous pool with bar as well as sunken booths and jacuzzis around - all of which are serviced constantly by a great staff of guys. Moy, Arcos, Chano, Santos, Joe, Leo, Raymondo, etc. were all there to make sure you never waited for a cocktail. Regardless of where you were on the hotel grounds, the service was outstanding and friendly. Yes, the pool loungers do get reserved by the crazy people who get up at the crack of dawn to take up all the chairs for their brood. But we simply asked the guys to get us loungers when we arrived, and they were very accommodating. Just be polite and not too cheap to give them something for the trouble. We had no problem getting reservations at the themed restaurants, but much preferred the buffet. It made it more relaxing to go to dinner at anytime, rather than a specified 6:30 or 8:45 seating. The buffet was fabulous! We especially enjoyed the lobster tails, grilled and plentiful one night. Traveling as 2 couples, we met many people in the pool, and elsewhere who were fun and very friendly. Although we had intended to check out the other Rius in the area, we never made it, on advise from the other guests the Palace was not worth leaving. Going to town is easy and quick, by taxi or walking if you need to see the 5th Ave shops. The suite we had was very clean, with a well stocked mini bar, and room service for morning coffee was always prompt. There was really only one night that we had a noise issue- (teenagers can drink here) but it was only for a short time. The night we enjoyed the saxophone soloist while drifting off to sleep more than made up for it. The only thing I regret is not bringing our golf clubs, since Playacar Golf and Spa is directly across the street, we would have loved to try a round. Maybe next time. Although an adult only resort is preferable to us, I have a difficult time finding many issues with the resort as a whole. Whenever we needed anything, Lila, Jose, or Silvus at the front desk were always happy to help. Would love to go back again and hopefully stay longer than the 6 days!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel--Fabulous Trip!”
Reviews.Author: BethWinnetka_IL
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Hotel is beautiful and grounds are immaculate. Workers are constantly cleaning and maintaining the property. It is very impressive when you pull-up to the resort for the first time-- a mediterranean and Spanish influence. Lobby is lovely as well. Hallways are tiled so it can get loud when people come in late at night or yell down the hall. Location: Beach is gorgeous! Hotel is located in Playacar--about a 20 minute walk to Playa del Carmen. Sand is sugar- white and soft to walk on. Water was beautiful blue-green and very warm. Waves were good for swimming and body surfing. Scuba Caribe is on-site for wave-runner rentals, excursions etc. Rooms: Jr. Suites are generous in size for 4 people. Beds are very uncomfortable! Rooms were clean with no pest problems. Bathrooms are good sized. If you are facing the courtyard near the music gazebo you will have to listen to the nightly entertainment until 11 PM every night. Ask to be moved to a different room if this will be a problem for you (or bring ear plugs!) Service: Wait-staff, front desk, maids, groundskeepers etc. were very nice and attentive. Maid service was Ok but there was a problem getting towels when the hotel got the pre-Easter crowd. Food: Food was plentiful and good to very good. We actually preferred the buffet over the specialty restaurants. Breakfast and dinner in the buffet restaurants were our favorite. Lots to choose from and a theme every night. Noise: This was a noisy hotel during our trip--probably due in part to the Spring Breakers who came down with their parents (which surprised me) . The college/high school kids were loud in the hallways as well as by the pool at times. I would imagine it is quieter during non-spring break weeks. Also, there is music by the pool and an entertainment co. that is on the mic trying to get people to do water aerobics, volleyball etc. It got a little old listening to them try to get people to participate after awhile. Attire: Daytime attire is typical resort wear. For dinner, guests wore sundresses, slacks etc. There is a dress code for the restaurants and buffet which most people adhered too.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun hotel, better for teens but still good for younger kids.”
Reviews.Author: smjjjs
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back today from 6 nights. Traveled with 3 kids (age 9, 6 and 4). The good - the hotel was beautiful - almost like a high end Vegas hotel. The staff was great and very friendly. The hotel has 2 pools, one which overlooks the other larger pool. Kids loved jumping out of the higher pool to the lower pool. The big pool has a swim up bar, volleyball net and several in water lounge chairs. There were plenty of chairs. Right next to the pool was a great beach with 2 levels. The top level was shaded by palm trees and had a volleyball net and ping pong table. Then down 3 steps was more beach with chairs right up to the ocean. It was a great beach (a few topless bathers) with lots of activities (waverunners, snorkeling, parasailing, sailing etc). The hotel is a 3 minute $5 cab ride to downtown Playa del Carmen which is a great town especially at night. The buffet restaurants at the hotel had plenty of options for all people. (Omlette stations for breakfast, sometimes pasta station for dinner, different themes for lunch & dinner). They also had a Vegas night with Roulette and Blackjack tables after dinner one night. They have a kids show at 8:30 each night. About 15 kids were there each night. Then a main show around 9:30 or so. We did a few activities. We took a waverunner out for 30 minutes for $60 (I did this twice). We went snorkeling (which was about a 20 minute boat ride away near a small reef). My 6 and 9 year old had never snorkeled before and it was a great intro (we were right in front of 2 sea turtles). I also went with my 9 year old to Discovery Jungle Park which was great (although I didn't feel like the safety standards were there). It was a 10 mile 50 minute ATV which started on a main street, then side street then dirt road then bumpy road. Then 3 zip lines (small compared to Costa Rica) and then a swim in an underground water hole (basically a cave). Then the 50 minute ride back. The bad - no connecting rooms. They do have rooms with a small joint hallway with doors 4 feet away from each other. The non-buffet restaurants and their reservation system. I was told that it was hard to get reservations so my travel agent made 2 in advance. They allow you to reserve 2 reservations at the non buffet a few days in advance at noon in the lobby. They fill up fast. The day we got there most things were booked. Plus the reservations they confirmed via e-mail didn't exist in their book. We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night (no hibachi) - the food was so/so. We also at at the Mexican restaurant which was good (not great). We heard from several people the steak restaurant was terrible. My kids preferred the buffet (and I think I did too). Even though it was all inclusive we ate in downtown Playa a few times. It was nice to break up the monotony of the resort. The hotel was nearly overrun with teens. There were lots of younger kids but a lot of 16-22. The drinking age is 18. I didn't notice a lot of drunk teens, but others did. The worst part of the hotel was the noise levels in the rooms. Lots of other people posted how bad it was and they are dead on. They have a door to the halls where the rooms are. People seems to come in at all hours and their conversations come right into the rooms. We asked them to put Quiet signs on the doors that everyone must enter and they said just call. Almost every night several times a night you heard people. Most of it was over by 10:30pm, but I was awoken by drunk kids at 4am last night. They really need more security to police the noise or better doors, walls, etc. Putting a towel under the door didn't help. Finally while the staff was attentive - there were about 3-4 times I ordered a drink that didn't arrive. Usually wasn't a big deal, but nontheless it was a basic mistake that was repeated. There is no internet in the rooms but free wi-fi in the lobby (not a great signal). They have a sports bar that is overrun with teens and usually an overbearing cigarette smell. Finally they promote room service, but the room service menu is small and not kid friendly. They do allow you to bring food from the buffet back to the room. The king size beds are two full or queen size beds together. You can get a free cot which was put by the step down part of the room instead of the couch (which is not a fold out) We stayed at the Iberostar Pariaso Maya in Riveria Maya (about 20 minutes North) 2 years ago and it was very similar (not necessarily as fancy). They had more pools (Wave Pool, etc) and little kid activities (10 and under). If I had to recommend a hotel to a family with kids 12-22 I'd recommend Riu Palace (if you can deal with the middle of the night noise) and for a family with kids 0-12 I'd recommend the Iberostar Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: PaulRomford
Reviews.Content: Really love the hotel and the staff were fantastic. Our first trip to Mexico and would go back no problem. Not normally a beach couple but the sand here was fantasic and the sea was beautiful. All in all a great holiday and came home very relaxed. One downside is the Yanks who like the Russians in Europe seem to think they own the place and the poor Mexicans. They are very rude & loud espically the teenagers who are drinking for the first time.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT vacation!”
Reviews.Author: toniafirer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Jan.16-23 and were very satisfied with everything the hotel had to offer. It is about a 20 minute walk away from Playa del Carmen, which is far enough to avoid the drunken crowds and close enough to walk there any time you want. The beach was beautiful. We took long walks every day. The food was great! The specialty restaurants, however, are not worth the wait - but that's always the case. The hotel offers a variety of free activities that one typically has to pay for in other hotels. It was a fantastic vacation and we would go back any time!

Reviews.Title: “This is deffinately a Palace”
Reviews.Author: malmag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this hotel for 14 nights, having previously stayed in the Dominican Republic, we decided to try Mexico and we were not disappointed. The Hotel was wonderful and the staff were first class,they could not do enough for us. The food was not all to our taste, but I am sure it would have appealed to many. Our taste is for more plain food..We are pensioners and used to old fashioned English food. However I would not hold this against the Hotel as everyone has differing tastes and I would not lower my rating of this Hotel on this matter. Whatever we asked for was done immediately and we were constantly asked by the staff if everything was alright and if there was anything else they could do for us. Beddng and towels were changed daily and the rooms were always spotless. I cannot praise this Hotel highly enough. The location was also excellent as we could take a 15 minute walk ,either along the beach or by road and be in 5th avenue shops at Playa Del Carmen. Younger and more agile people could get there even quicker, or you could pay $5 (£3) and go by Taxi.. The locals are also very friendly and obliging and there was no fear of the neighbourhood and shopping in the WAL MART Playa Del Carmen is much cheaper than the tourist shops. The Beach is excellent with wide sands stretching for miles in either direction, however the sea was a little rough whilst we were there, no good for children but ok for good swmmers. You are also in easy walking distance of 4 other RIU Hotels ,all of them available for you to use, We had a ground floor suite overlooking the pool and courtyard, and found this excellent. Before I finsh I will mention only one bad experience, the 2nd and 3rd night after our arrival we were awoken in the early hours by drunken revellers, we happened to mention this to one of the staff , who said dont worry it will not happen again and I can honestly say it never did. I have no idea how he managed it unless he placed a guard on our corridor!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: bhfsar
Reviews.Content: The RIU is a beautful hotel. Everything is kept clean and cared for. The staff is top-notch. You will enjoy the fine dining and wide choice of foods. It is a wonderful place to enjoy the sun and surf. The only thing that was below par (in my book) was the entertainment. It was fair but not the type of music that you would want to dance to. The location was perfect for us. We walked to the 5th Avenue shops and to the fairy to visit Cozumel. This hotel was a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip”
Reviews.Author: cm101b
Reviews.Content: This resort is a amazing place IF you want to sit back and let the days slip by, IF you are looking for party this is not the place for you. My wife and I just got back and we had a great time. I will say a few things, the ride from the airport is every bit of an hour, put that on your expectations if you are planning on going to this resort. It is a little out of the way if you like that sort of thing. The food is good, but as other reviews have stated you have to stand in line in person on the lobby level to reserve your spot at one of their 5 specialty restraunts, and more than likely they are booked two days out. HINT: If you dont get a reservation, you have two options: ONE: Go eat the buffet (Don Marlo) it is good, but gets old quick, TWO: You can go to one of the specialty restraunts you would like to go to and just see if they have any open seating for you. We learned this at the end of our trip, but when we eventually got reservations to one of these speacitalty restraunts we could see many open tables. Give it a try. And then theres the noise, you can hear everything in this resort, you will see multiple reviews stating as such. HOWEVER... what is in the month of March? SPRINGBREAK. Hello people! If you go ANYWHERE on SPRINGBREAK you are going to get the noise. If you dont want as much noise GO in the off-season! The drinks here are very weak, this is easily remedied as there is liquior in the room, fill up a empty water bottle with some of that and add some to your drinks as they bring them. FYI, I know that it is an "all inclusive" but tipping really helps the service here, Im not bothered by this, but some may be. Renova (their spa) is fantastic! Get the OceanView Massage for two. Its a fabulous massage for a fabulous price. Prob the best I have had. Thats saying something. All in all the beach: 10, the service: 8, the food: 8, the drinks: 7, the spa:10+, the grounds: 10+, the room: 8 (bit small, but HUGE balcony), beds: 8 (but I like a harder bed, my wife thought it was too hard), pool: 10+ (its beautiful!), OVERALL Satisfaction: 8 We were very pleased, however because this being a family resort I think we will look for a more couples/adult only resort next time. Kids can at times take over the pool, so it can get quite noisey around there, we went to get away from our kids. BUT like I said this is a FAMILY RESORT, so Im not compaining just informing you. If you are looking for a beautiful place and a value for your money, but dont mind the drive from the airport and a little out of the way, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending”
Reviews.Author: atw1946
Reviews.Content: As you draw up to the Rivier Maya Palace you cannot fail to be impressed. As you step into the lobby that wow factor hits you, with space, chandeliers, deep cushioned sofas and chairs, pictures and flowers and from that moment on the general manager and his very willing team, assisted by a great executive chef, do not fail on any account. Their motto in this paradise, in our words, "always trying to please" and they certainly do this. Food, rooms, location right on the beach, two beautiful pools, spectacular water gardens etc with plenty of sunbeds, often a failing of some hotels. Entertainment at night varied, for the ladies a few weddings (we saw 6 in 2 weeks). A plus point, the dress code of no shorts / vests is observed in the speciality restaurants - excellent. We have been to all-inclusive hotels before in various countries, this is certainly the best we have stopped in and we have no hesitation in recommending it, remember you only pay for what you get - a little more expensive than others but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good apart from getting swine flu!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne147
Reviews.Content: Service is absolutly amazing. Hotel is spotless. Beach amazing. It's gonna be hard finding a place that matches this. I think some peoples reviews are mixed up with the riu palace!! The better one is riu palace riviera maya. This is newer. Cleaning in room was hit and miss, if u don't tip then they take thongs away from u. This happened to my parents and me& my boyriend. Oh yeah don't go when springbreak is on, man it was noisey. 5star hotel but not 5star clientel!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry lady, we can't help you.”
Reviews.Author: the_pilots_wife
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Playa del Carmen. I know the town very well and have been there at least 10 times. I was traveling with my son, mom, aunt and cousin, and they were more comfortable staying at an all-inclusive. I am not a fan of the AI, but after reading the trusted reviews on this site and recommendation from a few friends, I decided to go for it. I have never been told "no, lady" at a hotel so many times at a "four" star restaurant. When we arrived, it was a few minutes before the restaurant reservations closed for the day, unbeknownst to us, and we should have been told to hurry and go make them, but we weren't. We tried 5 min. after they closed and they would not allow us to make a reservation. Not a good first impression. So not only were we stuck with eating a buffet that night but the following night as well, since it was already booked up, out of our total of 4 nights. When we finally did make a reservation, we had to wait one night until almost 9pm, which is difficult to do with a 4 year old. Anyway, my biggest problem with the dinners is that there were just a handful of people eating in the restaurant. It certainly didn't look full to me, and it was obvious that they book it for about 10-20 tables a night per restaurant. That is crazy in a resort of 400 rooms. Additional Cons: -The rooms were old and the couch doesn't pull out. -The halls echo and they are noisy until all hours of the night. -The beds are HARD and the rollaway bed is harder. -The kid's program is short: 10:30am-12:30pm and 3-5pm. My son did have a great time and wanted to go to play with kids his own age, but most of the time the workers were late showing up or needed to close early, etc. It would be nice to have an evening kid's club hour too, but they heavily push their $10/per child babysitting. No thanks. -The beds were configured in two standards pushed together which is odd for my mom, my son and I to share. At first, they wouldn't separate the beds either, but I finally spoke to the front desk, and they were able to accommodate. -If we wanted a table outside at the buffet, we were told no because they didn't want to push two tables together for a group of 5. -If we wanted to take a snack outside the buffet, we were told no. -The workout facility is small. It would be nice if there were a few more machine as people were always waiting or hovering for one to free up. Pros (there are a few): -It's close to town either walking on the beach or by cab ($5/car, don't let the taxis con you for more either to or from the hotel) -The public spaces of the hotel are very nice and clean. The waiters are friendly for the most part. -The food is pretty good. -The drinks are pretty good. -The beach has been recently reclamated and you can walk to the pier from here without trouble. -There are kayaks, catamarans (unguided) and paddleboats that can be used for free. Overall, I would rather stay at a regular hotel/resort in town, snack during the day, and have a nice, big meal at a real (non-buffet) restaurant. I think for the price, this place isn't any better than any other all-inclusive. It's not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “noisey”
Reviews.Author: statuesEngland
Reviews.Content: spent 2 weeks at rp in march ,beach good ,uncomfortable sun beds, no umbrellas on beach, pool very busy, best beds always reserved with towels books etc. very noisey at nights with loud guest coming back to their room late. got worst when young american students turned up for their spring break. food was very good sevrvice was good. most of the staff were very friendly and helpful which made up for all the bad bits. did not enjoy as much as i was hoping pureley because of other inconsiderate guest.

Reviews.Title: “not the caribean dream holiday i expected”
Reviews.Author: arniet1000
Reviews.Content: we were worn out and expecting to relax and unwind in what was supposed to be a caribean palace,how wrong we where! the hotel was amazing and the staff very friendly but we where woken every night by people shouting in the corridors and underage kids being sick from too much tequila. the rooms were very damp,uncomfortable putting wet clothes every day. there was no parasoles on the beach which im very suprised at,always had them at other five stars. the maid service was a bit hit and miss with times and standard of cleaning. very dissapointed as having travelled so far and now i feel worse than before the break. will be staying in europe from now on,not worth the ten hour flight.

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort but parents of teens - go to CANCUN”
Reviews.Author: Location54
Reviews.Content: This resort was phenomenal all around.....my family and i stayed there from March 6 to March 18, 2010. We were very impressed with the service, although sometimes on the odd occasion it was difficult to get a drink at night......the service at the pool if served by Charlie was amazing..........the service in the rooms was also incredible.....the service in the restaurants in particular Daniel was amazing......the Entertainment crew FABULOUS - Rudy, Leo, Edna and crew do an amazing job of getting to know their patrons!!!!! The Beach was beautiful and the pool beautiful...only complaint would be the fact that the sign clearly states "NO RESERVING POOL CHAIRS" but we quickly found that this was not true. Being a person and family who enjoy sleeping in we found it somewhat annoying that if you were not at the pool by 7 am to reserve your chair then you had no chance of being by the pool......I wish the resort would stick to its NO RESERVING CHAIR RULE!!! I found the food at this resort fantastic. The buffet was always clean and tasty.....the a la carte's were easy to book if you did ahead of time which just took a little thinking ahead. The only one that I would say was rather awful was the Steakhouse....I cannot recall ever having had such a terrible meal..... I would definetly go back although I have to say the one drawback was the 15 or so teenagers on Spring Break whose parents allowed them to drink excessively, to the point of vomitting and in fact cheering their kids on as they downed shot after shot.....I thought this was a family resort and would have liked to see it true to its word....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Plentiful”
Reviews.Author: ajb288
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Playa del Carmen for the first time and stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya from March 4th - 10th. I've never stayed at an all-inclusive before and really wasn't sure what to expect. Travel there - Although I managed not to have printed out the shuttle pass, we did find our shuttle once we went through the Cancun airport. That was probably the worst part of the trip - I think a lot of planes landed at the same time in Cancun and the airport was a mad-house. It took us an hour and a half to get through customs/immigration and then we had to wait for almost a half hour for the shuttle to pick up passengers at our terminal and another one. So although we landed around 11:30am...we did not get to the hotel until after 3pm...so that cut our first day a bit shorter. As far as the food and accommodations - we stayed in a garden view room which was nice because it was quiet as it faced away from the main courtyard and the balcony was a little more private. The food was really plentiful and had many options for breakfast and lunch. We ate breakfast each day at Don Manolo and we at lunch at Chili's (not the same as the American chain) when we were there for the day. Breakfast was always great...lunch varied but the salad bar was always fresh and I ate a lot of guacamole and pico de gayo. For dinner - you had to make reservations at least 2 or 3 days in advance (which was kind of annoying because you could only do it between 12pm -3pm) for the more popular options (Krystal and Yashima). Krystal was good if you're into that modern fusion type restaurant and Japanese was good. I wasn't a fan of the Brazilian steak house - the Yucatan does not have great beef - so keep that in mind. The Mexican Restaurant was really good...and usually there was always room for a reservation there even on the same day. Definitely ask for the Mayan coffee...you won't be disappointed. Excursions - I'm not sure if this is the same for everyone but we booked our stay through RIU directly and were matched with Hotelbeds for our shuttle and for our local guide to explain things we could do outside of the resort. It's hard to say if we really got the best value for what we did but we enjoyed both. We went on a 'Mayan Adventure' that took us snorkeling in 3 different locations...it was amazing...we went to a cove and saw sea turtles and sting rays...we then went to cenotes and went zip-lining and then we went to an enclosed cenotes which was a cave and got to see stalactites and stalagmites...in all places the water was crystal clear and calm. The whole trip included lunch (which was yummy), transportation and the snorkeling gear...we left at 8am and were back by 2pm...for $86 USD per person. The 2nd excursion we went on was to Coba and the Mayan village...this was a much longer day trip than we were expecting but overall the trip was amazing. We climbed Nohoch Mul and had a great view from the top. We also stopped at an actual Mayan village to see how their descendants live today. It was a great experience. We also walked to the town of Playa del Carmen one afternoon/evening...it's just about a mile away and easily walkable. You can definitely get hustled for just about anything along 5th Ave but there is a lot of entertainment, food and shopping. I never felt unsafe as there were lots of people around and we stopped for cervesas and queso and listened to some live music. It was great and authentic for the most part. If you want to experience some Mexican culture then you will definitely have to leave the resort. The resort itself is very 'Americanized' in my opinion. The evening shows were a bit corny. The service was great overall...all of the staff were very friendly...and you even had a chance to use some Spanish if you wanted to...although not at all required. I would recommend this for anyone who has never been to an all inclusive as a way to start...I think as I travel more I might have more opinions on expectations. Really..all I was looking to get out of my vacation was time in the sun (which I definitely did), drink some fruity/beachy cocktails, not check email and forget what day it was...and I succeeded. This is not a nightlife-type of place...the crowd tends to be a bit older...which was fine by me...I was looking to stay as far away from the college-drinkers.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RPRM”
Reviews.Author: Gottatravel
Reviews.Content: We visited the property the last week in January and really liked it. This was our 4th RIU Palace experience (Cabo, Aruba, Cancun) so we knew what to expect. We were very happy with our resort selection-it was close to Playa, same great restaurants we've been spoiled with and impeccable service. We love, love, LOVE the Mexican hospitality! The resort and beach are absolutely perfect. We visited all of the other RIU properties this time around, which I would highly reccommend. They are all just a bit different and offer their own charm, but, we were really happy we chose the RPRM and will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Top shelf -But why springbreakers/High School groups”
Reviews.Author: mustangs14
Reviews.Content: just got back 7 days with my wife/and parents (68-70)....excellent resort 1st class all the way from the pools,beach ,resort grounds all real nice....try to request top floor for better views espically closer to the ocean(ex rm.2114)geat view ....as far as beer all they have is dossequis ----but anykind of mix drink they will make it...service and the people are amazing (romone-islas-marvin all like family..)restaurants are a hassle trying to book because all the good ones are taken---the buffet is awesome but it would have been nice to try some restaurants....playa del carmen shopping is a waste too many people haggling you/not very nice either- go to playacar shopping alot nicer and cheaper...and you can walk their...good tip bring a big insulated mug for drinks because they give you a plastic 6oz. cup when you are at the pool or beach and your drink gets warm quick alot of people had mugs...good bands at night in courtyard and a show to follow everynight in theatre..... the one major dissapointment was the amount of springbreakers that came in the last 3 days of our vacation(march 8-15)our agent told us this wiould not happen but it did....most of the groups had chaperones but they were noisey,getting sick,yelling shot-shot-shot all the time,,,all night...not the right place- go to cancun do not impose on families and older peolple trying to relax ....... overall outstanding place --bring plug ins for the musty smell..not that bad...enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort... but expected more”
Reviews.Author: drelo
Reviews.Content: As the flagship, newest and most expensive Riu property in Playa del Carmen, our family, traveling with 2 young children, expected more. Other than the property itself and the large beach, which has been immaculately restored, there is simply nothing special about this Riu. It gives a typical cookie cutter all-inclusive experience. Don't get me wrong, the experience was good but when you figure that you pay a premium for this Riu over the other Rius and in comparison to other similarly priced properties in the area, it was underwhelming. To give some background, this is my 4th time to this area. Our party consisted of 2 young children, 3 and 1 y.o, my wife, and the kids' grandparents. To highlight some of the positives first: Great location in Playacar- secluded but close to tourist area of 5th ave. Only a $5 dollar cab ride or 20 min walk. Fantastic beach- easy to get a spot and quite large. Nice touch of having hammocks. Property is remarkably clean. Food is good. Nothing gourmet or great but for an AI- good. Decent variety at the buffet. Pool is ok. Tough to get a good spot so wake up early but many AI are like this. Some negatives: Service is uneven. At times service was quick and attentive, other times expect to ask 4 times for a glass of water. Maid service uneven as well. At times, you got all the towels you needed, other times you were left without any hand towels and only 2 bath towels for 4 people. In general, staff here is hardworking but understaffed. Room was a junior suite, but felt cramped. Again nothing nice about it. Asked for 2 double beds, so got a room with 2 doubles pushed together. They actually give the same room if you ask for a king bed as well. Again not the type of stuff you expect from a premium resort. Also no shampoo in the rooms- weird. Food choices- here's one the major problem of the resort. Not much of variety of restaurant choices. For breakfast you get 1 place to eat. For lunch 1 place to eat. Dinner you get whatever rest. you can get or the buffet, and it has some ridiculous system for reservations. Bars are ho-hum. Nothing nice here either. Yes they perform the basic service of dispensing drinks, but all bars are relatively small, nothing too special. Not a family friendly resort. Kids club- yes they have one, is only open 10:30 to noon, and then 3-5 pm. Basically all they do is color and watch cartoons in spanish. Rest. have no kids' menus. Entertainment is ok. If you have seen one of these shows, you have seen them all. Neither a positive nor negative. Now I am being picky here. When you pay a premium over other resorts, you expect a higher level of service and amenities that are missing here. If you have family with young children- STAY AT THE IBEROSTAR PARAISO MAYA. For the same price, this resort blows the RPRM away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect resort for a perfect wedding :)”
Reviews.Author: robpiotrowski
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got married at Riu Palace Riviera Maya on February 20, 2010 and I must say everything was perfect!! We were married at the gazebo, which is by far the best location on the property, and we had our reception at Chili's. The weather was 85 degrees and sunny, the beautiful scenery was great for photos. Our wedding coordinator, Ael, was excellent; her laid back approach put us at ease from the beginning. The entire staff was very professional and organized, they know exactly how to create a memorable experience. They also have no problem throwing in perks like our reception dinner which they made completely private, although we didn't pay for the "private" option. We had over thirty people fly in for our wedding, so we were a little nervous never having had stayed at the resort before. Overall everyone was very pleased with the service, the rooms, the location (being so close to Playa Del Carmen and so many attractions nearby was definitely a plus), the cleanliness, the food, the activities at the resort- we had no complaints. The service was phenominal (this needs to be mentioned twice)!! I could go on and on about the details of each restaurant, the bars, etc. but others have already done so in their reviews. Instead I will just say this: we had very high expectations for our wedding & vacation and Riu Palace Riviera Maya far exceeded them!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: DSMS2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya during the 2nd week of March and have the following feedback to share: LOCATION - the resort is in a great location. Very safe as you have to pass through a security gate to get into the Playa area. The resort is 5 minutes from a shopping area and Starbucks, 10 minutes the other way from 5th avenue (which is a tourist trap BTW). ROOMS - the rooms are nice, pretty much what we expected. Make sure to ask for a mattress pad - it makes a huge difference. I like a firm mattress, but the mattresses were way too firm for my liking. Also, be careful with showering before dinner. Lots of people are showering at the same time, so you may experience bursts of really hot water during your shower. Make sure to leave some room in the shower to jump out of the stream of water if that happens. Other than those 2 issues, the room was great. The staff kept our fridge stocked and we didn't really have any issues with the musty smell while we were there. We did notice that our clothes were a tad musty when we got back, but 1 washing got rid of the smell completely. POOL - the other reviews are correct when they say that people reserve chairs. Be prepared to put your towels (and a book or other personal item since everyone has the same towels) out at around 7 a.m. to get the best spots at the pool. We put our towels out at around 7:30-8:00 every morning and got the spot that we wanted nearly every day. Also, bring a beach towel per person. The hotel towels are fairly large, but they don't fully cover the chair. BEACH - the beach is beautiful. They did a great job with restoring it. No more sand whales! Yay!! DRINKS - the staff by the pool was very attentive when it came to drink service throughout the day. Several times, we had 2-3 drinks per person because the staff knew what we liked and brought it without asking. The drinks were good and were well made 99% of the time. In the evenings, the lobby bar is the best place to get a drink. The bartender, Islas, is the best bartender in the entire resort. Make sure to try a vodka lemon or watermelon martini - they are fantastic when Islas makes them! You can also get drinks in the courtyard area, but while the ambience is nicer, the drinks are not as well made. We found that it was better to order a beer or champagne when in the courtyard. BREAKFAST & LUNCH - the buffet for both of these meals was very good. Great selection and variety of items to choose from. ROOM SERVICE - the service was very prompt & 100% accurate. The selection is minimal, but sufficient considering all of the other options in the resort. DINNER - we visited every restaurant during our stay. Here is a quick breakdown: Japanese - don't bother going here if you eat sushi/sashimi on a regular basis. The quality and selection of items is sub-par and lacks imagination completely. The only thing we liked at this restaurant was the sesame noodle appetizer. Mexican - very good options on the salad/appetizer bar, entrees were a little boring. Great guacamole. Brazilian - this was our 2nd favorite place. The bean soup at the appetizer bar was amazing. And, the herb sauce for the meat was outstanding as well. Krystal - this was our favorite restaurant. Every course was outstanding and was something we would seek out back home. The pumpkin soup and sea bass were so amazing that we ordered them again on our 2nd night at this restaurant. Steakhouse - saved the worst for last. This was by far the worst meal we have had in years. 1 of our steaks was the consistency of ham - it was sent back and brought right back out with assurances that it was "OK". The bad steak combined with a bad mussel in the appetizer resulted in a day and a half of sickness and nausea afterwards. If you do go to this restaurant, be very careful about what you eat and make sure to pack immodium. ENTERTAINMENT - the nightly shows were much better than expected. The dancers/performers did a great job each night. We have been to shows in NYC and Vegas and found the shows to be very entertaining. It's not broadway, but they do a great job. Make sure to check them out each night. The prime seats in the theater fill up fairly quickly (starting at around 9:30), so get there early to grab a good seat if you want a good view of the show. During the daytime, the entertainment staff did a great job of making things fun by the pool and on the beach. The music by the pool was a little loud at times, but the staff worked hard to ensure that everyone was having fun. IN GENERAL - this is not an adults only resort, so there were a few kids there when we were there. My only complaint was that the parents didn't pay attention to their kids very much. Several kids were very rude and thought that splashing adults was a fun game. If you are averse to these types of antics, I wouldn't stay here. Also, we left right as the big spring break crowds started to hit. This isn't the hotel's fault, but the sheer number of high school kids running around would have made this a very different trip for us if we would have come a week later (lower drinking age in Mexico = lots of drunk high school & college kids = noisy resort).

Reviews.Title: “Sub Par Hotel With Damp Beds and Weird Smell”
Reviews.Author: sanshi
Reviews.Content: I am going to start with the negative aspects of this hotel, because that is why people usually read reviews. Everything in our hotel room was completely damp: the bedding, towels, couch, and eventually, our clothing and luggage. Spending a week sleeping in a damp, dank hotel bed was horrible. If you read the other reviews you will see that this was mentioned by many reviewers -- I should have listened to them and I regretted not having done so. What goes along with this dampness is a moldy smell that persists laundering. I just finished my first load of laundry and it still stinks! I don't know how to explain it other than a dank, pungent odor. The depth of this odor was not really apparent to me until we left the place but now everything we brought with us, from our clothing to our scuba gear to my purse, etc., reeks. I know this dampness is not caused by the mere fact that the hotel is in the tropics, because I've stayed in PDC many times before and never had this problem with utterly damp sheets and a moldy stink. Secondly, this place is run down and the decor is dated. It just seems worn out and used. It doesn't feel like you're in Mexico, but rather some stuffy French hotel. There are way to many fluorescent lights and the ambiance is totally lacking. If you are hoping for modern, contemporary, funky, edgy, cool or trendy decor this place is definitely not for you. Thirdly, the demographic was not what we were looking for. I am a 27 year old female and my boyfriend is 36. This place seemed to have a lot of people aged 50+ and families. Maybe we were just used to the two previous adults-only places in PDC that we've stayed, where there are mostly honeymooners. But anyway, it just seemed to have a much older crowd that places we've stayed before. Not a big deal but just noticeable. Fourthly, the restaurant reservation process is totally bogus. It is a complete pain the butt to leave whatever you're doing on afternoon of your vacation to go stand in line to make a reservation for an over-rated restaurant. Seriously, leaving the beach from 12-3 pm to head all the way to the front of the hotel to fight with other guests for a spot in line ruined the experience of vacation. I have stayed at other all inclusive places on the Riviera Maya where you are allowed to walk into the restaurant of choice at the time of your leisure, not at the two set times like at Riu Palace (6:30 and 8:45). What if you don't want to dine at the designated time or your don't want to leave your vacation activities to stand in line for a reservation? Well then its buffet time for you, in the flourescently lit dining room with boring decor. Also, they only let you make two reservations at once so you're guaranteed to stand in line for reservations at least a few times on your vacation if you don't want to go to the buffet. They also allow smoking in the restaurants which is gross. On the positive side, the food in the buffet was decent for a buffet, with good selection. Not much variety day to day. The service at the restaurants was good. The sit down restaurants were good and the waiters were prompt and friendly. It wasn't anything to write home about but definitely edible. The beach at this hotel is beautiful, better than each place I've stayed before. It is probably this place's only redeeming quality. Lots of spots to sit (many chair-grabbers early in the morning which is unfortunate) and beautiful sand and palm trees. However, again, the pool area is a bit run down and the lounge chair cushions seem to be have lived past their day. The drink service on the beach is nonexistent, which is really poor compared to other places I've stayed in PDC. The accessibility of this hotel to downtown PDC is convenient. It is only a short 10 minute walk and a cheap 50 peso cab ride. Overall, this place is a 3 star hotel, tops. If you have stayed at truly nice places you will think this place is a dump. I regret staying here. We had a wonderful vacation nonetheless but I wished we had gone back to Secrets Capri Riviera or tried a more high-end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - lovely place for a beach holiday”
Reviews.Author: aprilpekoe
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the overall experience at this hotel. We went with a large wedding group and had a terrific time. Food, hospitality, pool, beach were all excellent. My only caution is to utilize the hotel safe and leave instructions at the desk that of who specifically can have a room key. Some bridal party hijinx revealed that the front desk would give your key out pretty easily. One group even specified that whomever requests a key must show ID - problem was that they didn't say whose ID - so the "intruder" got the key anyhow by showing his ID! All fine if it is all in good fun but could be serious otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Riu, a disaster at first, which turned out to be the best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaZav
Reviews.Content: Well, We had a Wedding at Riu Palace Riviera Maya on March 1st 2010. While we were planning the wedding it was very hard to choose the hotel for it, plus we had 18 people with us, so we needed something very very good! We didn't have much time to plan the wedding, so we decided to do everything when we arrive(plus it was very hard to get in touch with coordinators while abroad). When we arrived to the hotel, we were told to meet the main Wedding Coordinator AEL at Riu Palace Mexico, why Mexico when we stayed at Riviera Maya, go figure? Well when we got there, we had to plan everything during this appointment. We had tons of things we wanted to do, to make this day special. Well, but for AEL everything was impossible or no allowed, or just NO! Those were the only responses we were getting from her. As we find out before the trip, we could have bring from outside of the hotel our Photograhper and Video person, BUT Ael said this is not allowed, and we would have to take her Crew, which were ridiculously Expensive! Well, we had no other choice but to take them. The other thing we wanted is to have our first dance during the reception, and music and dancing after it. But she Said NO again. As our Package said "we pay up to 40 people", and the cake was suppose to be 2 tier cake. But Ael said since we had only 18 guests we would get only one tier small white cake, with no decorations on it. Though we paid for the package of 40ppl. Well, last but not least the Decorations. We asked for Bows for the ceremony chairs, 4$ each. And wanted the same bows to be put at the reception chairs as well. Ael said the this bows would fit only the ceremony chairs (what a lie!), not the reception chairs! And that we only RENT them no buying (lie again). Well, then she offered flowers for the reception tables, terrible overpriced, like 75$ or 85$ for three flowers in a small vase. We decided not to take them. Instead we offered from the hotel flower book directly, and they made amazing centerpieces at 25$ each! Well, at the end of this "nice appointment" with Ael we were not happy that we decided to have a wedding at all!! Oh yes, another thing that pissed us, was the "upgraded" room we got with our package, which was just a regular room, with a bad bad smell in it! We were told the hotel is packed and we can't change it. Well, the good thing happened when we met with our hotel's wedding coordinator!!! ANILU!!! I can't thank her enough! She was so helpful! and made everything the way we wanted! We had the cake we asked for, the music, private reception area, and plenty pf room to dance!!! It was so good!!! she put the bows, and made beautiful table decorations with candles and rose petals on the tables! We had our own music , and could dance all night long!!! We had an awesome time!!! We did the ceremony on the beach! I would recommend it to everybody, cause you get amazing ocean view, and great viewers, lols (hotel's guests) Ok, photo and video people. Those were very over priced, even for New york standards. Our video package said 2 cameras for ceremony, and one for the reception (which all would be covered). At the day of the wedding, we met the video person who said ot was a mistake in the package and there will be just one camera, and she would cover only the begging of the reception dinner!!! Well, and of course there was n mistake in the price!!! 600$!!! Well, we had nothing to do, but to make it work. We got 30 mins video, not so well shot, and hardly edited. But I guess its better then nothing. Photo: EXPENSIVE! We had a package of 36 prints, and a CD for 36 prints, for 500$ The photographer was there only at the ceremony and half an hour after it . We bought the rent of the negatives from him for additional 100$! He was not good, took pics from the wrong angles, and his camera gives grainy images. But again, better then nothing :) Anyways, we had many ups and downs, but ended up having an awesome time and great memories! all of our friends and relatives were so happy that they arrived and spent this day with us! P.S. oh yes, forgot to mention, we got the room upgraded the day before the wedding!!! We got the best room in the whole hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “okay....not great”
Reviews.Author: likestotravel5
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 5 star, this is not it. Overall our trip was enjoyable but not over the top. Do not leave your kids at the kids club, the staff would let children leave the club unattended and left to find their parents on their own!!! The food was good and the rooms were standard. This resort should be rated as a 4 star. Bottom line... the place did not live up to our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach and beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rules_17
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya based on recommendations from other family members. The staff were friendly and helpful. We ate at all the buffets, the Brazilian restaurant, the steak house and the Japanese restaurants (noisy). The food was delicious. Our only complaint was the beef was little rare for us at the restaurants where it wasn't cooked to order. There was lot of variety at the buffets. The grounds were immaculate and well groomed. The beach front had more than enough places to sit. I would recommend getting up early if you want to sit around the pool. Check out the saunas and hot tubs in the spa area. Our room was a junior suite and was very nice. We were disappointed in the noise level since everything echoed as people talked or brought their luggage down the hall. We enjoyed walking the beach and especially as the sun is setting. The colors were gorgeous. It's very easy to get into downtown either by beach or by taxi. Don't pay more than $5 per taxi. Overall, we loved the resort and would recommend it to people who want something with good food and a bigger setting. Finally, bring an insulated mug to keep your drinks cold.

Reviews.Title: “This place is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: positano22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our 5 night vacation. We were first timers to an all-inclusive and first timers to the Playa del Carmen area. It was amazing. The hotel had everything you could ever want. Options galore with many things to do, easy to plan trips from the hotel and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. One of the best things about our trip was all the amazing people that we met. All of the other guests there were so friendly and fun to get to know and hang out with.
