We took a few excursions- Chitzen Itza was wonderful, but a long day so be prepared. We also did a Sunset Dinner Cruise with Lobster and Steak. It was nice, but cold. The food was ok, but again we met wonderful people that made it so much fun. The beach was better than the pool because the pool was cold (but unseasonably cold while we were there-high 70's). I would recommend doing your research on hotels...we went to many to pick people up on our trek to and from the airport and RIU was by far the best! Having Playa del Carmen being so close is a nice alternative when you want to get off the resort. It's a 15 minute beach walk which is very nice. I would HIGHLY recommend this resort and this area in general. We are going back with many friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Review to read if you are bringing kids”
Reviews.Author: Minneapolis_MNQGirl
Reviews.Content: This review is for families with small children to read (that intend to bring said children with them to Riu). This was our second trip to Riu Palace Riviera Maya with small kids in tow. On this visit we brought our 3 1/2 year old and 9 month old baby. The wait-staff is EXCELLENT. They knew the baby's name, gave him kisses and patted his head, and always had a highchair waiting for us at our usual tables in the dining areas. They have a Kid's Club with a wonderful woman who keeps the kids busy and having fun (while parents get a break). Staff will babysit for you as well (for a fee). The ambiance at night is so nice, you sit outside and listen to the music or watch the nightly entertainment. Just note that when you go to bed, the music still plays until 11.30pm. We paid for the Junior Superior Suite so we could listen to the music and sit on our balcony people-watching. But for the kids, the noise was distracting during their night sleep. Oh well! The staff's efforts make every day feel special and they dedicate so much of their time to making sure you have a nice vacation. The beach is gorgeous now that the black sandbags have been removed and it is completely swimmer-friendly. While there were only a handful of children at the resort during our stay, we didn't feel alienated or unwelcome by staff or other guests. Other reviews comment about the pool loungersbeing reserved byt towels by 7am--we always found ones available in the shade that could easily have been dragged into the sunlight. And our kids took naps in the shade at the pool everyday, it wasn't obnoxiously loud. We had a nice time and the Riu Riviera Maya comes highly recommended by us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place - Awsome Service”
Reviews.Author: MNTraveler55
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We were a group of 11 (2 couples brought 3 college age kids). Without question, the service and the friendly atmosphere of the staff was the best. The rooms were clean and towel animals were cute. Evening bed turn down service was a nice touch. Relaxing on the balcony for a while with a drink between pool time and dinner was great. The grounds themselves were beautiful and well maintained. We found the same spot to relax everyday, just off the pool area in the sand under the palms. It provided a good mix of sun and shade. People do get up early and reserve chairs with towels and other items. I wish they would enforce the "no saving of chairs" rule more. Since it was not an issue for us, no big deal. We saw 5 beachfront weddings during our stay - pretty interesting to watch and cheer along. Pool was great but a bit on the cool side (refreshing). Most every afternoon, we sat in the pool around one of the several in-pool tables and played some dice games while having some cool drinks. There were pool side activities each day but each day was pretty similar to the other. A little more variety might be a good idea. Whether you were on the beach, in the pool, in the lobby of at dinner, there was always someone asking if they could get you something to drink. Food was very good especially the breakfast buffet. Fresh fruit was awesome. The lunch buffet was also very good. We ate at 4 of the specialty restaurants, Steak House, Japanese, Brazilian & Krystals. Some in our group thought they were amazing, I don't think I would go that far. The steaks were OK but had a unique texture similar to tenderized steak here in the US. I guess they were good by "Mexican steak standards". Sushi was very good as were most of the wines they served with dinner. We never did understand why they chilled their red wines - maybe it had something to do with the heat/humidity. One thing that really disappointed me was that they did not have any fajitas. No fajitas anywere....bummer :>) The Guc and chips were the best. The dinks were good and like I mentioned, the staff was very accomodating. I would say they were on the weak side but that was OK. We did find a bit of inconsistancy in the way they were prepared. It seems like each bartender had his own recipe - some were very good some not good at all. The beer DosXX was very consistant... The 24hr sports bar was pretty cool too. Visited there a few times and even watched a few slices of the olympics. The college age kids with us visitied here a lot during the late evenings and early mornings... We did not spend much time watching the evening entertainment, what we did see was pretty good for a resort. As a side note. We arrived about 2 weeks after they completed the total beach restoration project. It is beautiful. It seems like the sand is more compact and a bit eaisier to walk on. We took a few walks and it was great not to navigate walls and sand whales anymore. I hope it lasts and does not wash away anytime soon. It was nice to walk to the town of Playa on the beach for once. This was a great trip and would recommend it to anyone looking to go. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Even better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: luvmyvacations11
Reviews.Content: This is the first time in all my travels that I have reviewed a hotel. I have been to many all inclusives and felt that this one was better than most. The food and drinks are generally just ok but at the Riu Palace it was very very good. The different restaurants really had great variety of dishes presented beautifully and great tasting. The dinner buffet also very good with a great variety to pick from. The beach here was a huge plus...I was pleasantly suprised with the size and cleanliness of the beach area. The entire hotel facitlity is very pretty and extremely well maintained. The staff is very attentive and eager to keep you happy. I had a great time and the hotel is also withing walking distance of two different shopping plazas. The one drawback and area they need to work on was their entertainment. It is very basic and nothing at all to speak of. Overall, I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific trip but unusual at the same time!”
Reviews.Author: Nancynu
Reviews.Content: Nancy from "Little Rhody" We stayed here from 2/21-2/27. This was our 1st time to this particular Palace. We have been to the Riu Palace Mexico several times before. Just wanted to try this one on for size! What can I say differently that hasn't already been said in many of the previous reviews? I mentioned above that this trip was unusual. What I mean by that is we have never been to Mexico in February before and upon research, we saw that this was supposed to be one of the best months to go. The weather was the "unusual" part of this. The 1st 2 full days, the sun was blaring! That's the way I like it! But on Wednesday it rained most of the a.m. & part of the p.m. The sun peeked in and out starting between 2-3 p.m. Thursday came with peeking sun and clouds but by evening it was downright chilly. Seeing all those little Mexican people trying to keep warm, well, it was a sight! Even a sweater didn't cut it for me! Friday was supposed to be sunny all day. Wrong!!! Overcast most of the day w/sun trying so hard to peek out!! Of course, on Sat., the day we were leaving around 7:30 a.m., the sun was blaring the way it should have been the whole week. We questioned some of the workers at the hotel about this and they said that the weather was "unusual". We knew something was up with the weather when we saw the surf. It was sooo rough! It's NEVER been like that before when we have visited. But enough about the weather. I am a Riu Class member and contacted them ahead of time like I was supposed to according to their policy about rooms. Needless to say, like almost every other time we have gone to PlaydelCarmen, they screwed up! After much haggling and only after demanding to see the supervisor, Karla, did we finally end up with great situated rooms. But we couldn't get into them until the next late afternoon. So no unpacking for that night! The food I felt was very good! Loved the "Krystal" restaurant (most popular) and "Chili's", the steak house! Our standard joke was that "George" went a long way. (the 1$ bill!) We didn't eat at the buffet the 1st night because we made VERY nice with Jesus @ Chili's and were able to eat there. After that we made nice again with Dania for reservations. Thank Goodness for that, though, since it was a very "unusual" time to do them. Between 12-3 p.m.!!! Mostly everywhere else we have been, it's early in the a.m. but this was nuts! I was more than delighted when I saw that the beach was back to the way it was before the hurricane damage...We had gone there after the hurricane and it was devasting to see just how much damage it did and how it wiped out 1/2 the beach. So I was excited to see what a great job they did in restoring it. Entertainment: Well, not the greatest but that didn't surprise us since the shows in all of the Rius are mediocore. Now here comes the real "unusual" part of the vacation! My husband can eat and drink with the best of them. He has a cast iron stomach or so I thought until he ate 1/2 a hamburger at lunch on Wed. He became violently ill for the whole rest of the day and evening. He didn't start to feel quite like himself until Sat., our travelling home day. Now that I think of it, he could possibly have gotten the nurovirus and the hamburger may have just been the topping on the cake. But he did say that the burger didn't taste quite right. So just a warning, if you eat lunch at Chili's beware of the hamburgers!! Other than that, everyone was so accomodating for every 1 of your needs. How can you complain about that? Oh! One more thing. If you want to get a lounge chair by the pool, people were putting their towels on the chairs extremely early in the a.m. I would say around 6-6:30 a.m. So if you want one, you know what time you'll have to get down there by to get it, ok? That's it for my review! Hope it helped!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at Riu Palace Riveria Maya and still worth it!”
Reviews.Author: CascadeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here two years in a row for several reasons. First, its proximity to Playa Del Carmen. A short ten minute walk leads you to some incredible food/drinks and shopping! Also, the hotel is beautiful, clean and the staff is courteous. The 24 hour room service was convenient after returing from town after a long day. Unfortunatly, much of the beach has disappeared from last year and was in the process of being replaced however this didn't bother me as I am more of a pool person. All of the Playacar area is safe and easily accessible. Can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: Shri78
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at this hotel. We were at the hotel from Feb 13-17. Really friendly staff, amazing food at the buffet and speciality restaurants. The beach was beautiful. Would definitely stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like quiet and relaxing this is the place to visit”
Reviews.Author: TLDyer
Reviews.Content: If you like a big party atmosphere this is not the place to go, you would be better off to go to Cancun. This resort was relaxing and peaceful. They had the typical volleyball, water areobics etc. but the night life was low key. They had a Michael Jackson look alike, who didn't really look like MJ and didn't sound like MJ. They also had a poker night. They gave you chips and you could play black jack or routlette. We enjoyed the food at all the locations, but unfortunately we could not make reservations at Krystals. I didn't like the fact that you had to make the reservations 3 days in advance. The line for the reservations were very long and you could only make 2 reservations at a time. But the food at the buffet had a good mixture so you won't go away disappointed. The sushi was excellent and of couse the Mexican restaurant was very good. The sports bar has only sandwhiches, hot dogs and hamburgers and fruit in the refridgerator . The drinks at the bar in the lobby bar were excellent. Our room was nice - kings size bed, garden view even though we upgraded. The lady at the front desk promised us a view, but it never materiallized, but for us the room was a minor factor. We took a tour of Tulum and then to Xei-Ha. Which was fabulous. If you go to Tulum you might want to pack a towel. They have a stairs that lead down to a littlve cove and lots of people were swimming. It looked absolutely fabulous. After Tulum our tour bus took us to Xei-Ha where we rode bikes to the top of the lake and snorkled back down. Lots of things for the kids to do. You can jump off a 6 - 10 foot cliff into the water, you can swim with the dolphins. See the Manatee. They have hammocks if you just want to take a nap. They have a little play ground for the kids. All you can eat lunch buffet that includes drinks, including alcohol drinks! Just a perfect day. The bus ride was a little over an hour because you had to pick up other guests from other hotels. The beach water was actually warmer than the pool water. If you like to lay out by the pool you better reserve your spot with your towel early because the sun hits one side of the pool better than it does the other side. (Sunny side by the Chili's restaurant.) We didn't care for the gym. A couple of the machines were broken. They didn't provide water in the gym or towels, but it is safe to run outside the resort. Once we ran downtown where all the shopping is located, but that area was pretty crowded so we mostly stayed away from that area. I'm not a shopper so I can't tell you if it was any good or not, but it appeared that a lot of people went shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Wow...I wish it could be rated higher than 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: husbandnotatraveler
Reviews.Content: We originally had reservations at the Riu Playacar...when we got there, we were informed that they were bumping us up to the Palace. What a stroke of luck. There were 8 of us and we couldn't have been more impressed. I don't know that we would have paid the price had we not gotten the bump, but I have to say, I don't know how we could go back and stay at a 4 star hotel now after seeing this 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay nothing that special”
Reviews.Author: MnSarah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort February 2-8th for our 6 year wedding anniversary. Our stay was interupted by the beach restoration so the beach was closed for 2 days during our stay. When the restoration is done it will be a very beautiful beach but during our stay all we saw on the way to the beach and our walk along the beach was bulldozers, sewer pipes, and orange flags lining the beach for miles. They did upgrade our room upon check in to an oceanfront room which was actually restaurant front since if you stood on tiptoes and looked over the roof of the restaurant you could see the ocean. This ended up not being much of an upgrade since the beach renovations mostly took place at night while we were trying to sleep so all we heard was bulldozers for 3 nights straight. Room was okay. Definetely musty smelling. The couch had holes in it and the mirrors had rust spots. They did a good job of keeping it clean but it needed updating. Our bed was very hard. We requested a pad be put on the bed the second night and it took 3 askings and a tip to finally get it done. There were a lot of small lizards and bugs on the ceilings in the hallways but I guess that is the carribean. Food in the buffets, restaurants, room service was all average. There was a lot of variety and it definetely filled you up but nothing that made us say that was the best meal ever. Getting reservations to the restaraunts was a time consuming and annoying process. You wait in line for up to 30 minutes to find out there are no reservations left. We ate in the buffet almost every night because of this. The pool was big but very noisy. The pool DJ did not speak English very well and was constantly saying something into a microphone and the music was very loud so it was difficult to relax around the pool. If you were there to party and drink which a lot were then I guess it was okay just not our thing. There is a sign saying pool rules that no loungers can be reserved although if you weren't up to reserve a chair by 7:30am you weren't going to get one. There were towels laying on the chairs all day to reserve them but no people sitting in them. Staff did nothing to prevent this. This was especially a problem on the days the beach was closed. You are able to visit the other Riu resorts and we did but they were awful. We were glad we picked this place after those brief tours. The staff were friendly and all greeted you with a hello. It was within walking distance to Playa Del Carmen which is why we chose it. Don't count on the evening entertainment it was cheesy at best. We watched 10 minutes of a Grease rendition and had to leave it was so bad. Mostly lip synching and dancing at its worst. There wasn't much at all for entertainment during the day which was fine with us since we just wanted to relax. We did have overly priced massages at the spa which were good but the spa looks a little run down. This was an average resort. Nothing horrible but nothing great. It is a little on the formal side for us as it is designed to look like a palace. We prefer the tropical feel resorts so will be looking at other options for our next trip. Beautiful area just not thrilled with the resort. Minus the beach restorations we may have enjoyed ourselves a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back!”
Reviews.Author: SpudIowa
Reviews.Content: We were sooooo looking forward to our second trip to Mexico and had looked at this resort online many, many time. I can't tell you how disappointed we were with the people at the main desk and the reservation policy. We arrived at 2:30 on Friday afternoon and sat at the lobby bar to have a few drinks while we waited for our rooms. At that time we decided we'd make our reservations for the following three nights, BUT there was NO ONE around to take any reservation so we ate at the buffet that night. The next day we tried to make reservations again at 1:00 in the afternoon, but AGAIN NO ONE was around to take any reservation. We complained at the front desk and nothing was done to appease us. VERY DISAPPOINTING. Because we had no reservations and didn't want buffet again, we went downtown and spent $300 on dinner--ridiculous. Our trip was already paid for--your reservation policy is awful--you have open tables in all of these restaurants and won't allow any customers in.....RIDICULOUS!!! The beach was awesome and the bartenders are the greatest, but that is ALL you have going for you. Oh ya, just about forgot---we had a leather jacket stolen from our room and nobody seemed to care to do anything about it! WE WILL NOT BE BACK, AND WE WILL BE GIVING YOU BAD REVIEWS!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just a few issues....”
Reviews.Author: imbrugliasboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from the 31st Jan to the 14th Feb 10. We were celebrating our 15th Wedding anniversary and upon check in we were upgraded to a room with a part view of the Ocean. The room was very comfortable, King size bed which was soft enough for us, LCD tv and small sofa. The room was kept very clean by our hard working maid. The minibar was also kept well stocked with beer, water and soft drinks. We tipped the maid and the minibar stockman the first day and then a little throughout the stay and received towel animals every day! Room service menu was small but the items were always tasty. On a few occasions though the food we had ordered was not delivered at all. When I phoned to ask about this they claimed to not know what I was saying so I just re-ordered and received the food eventually! Our first few days of the trip coincided with the beach restoration works that were taking place. This didn't adversely effect our holiday as we are very much pool people. Now if you like the pool then you'll either love this place or hate it. Firstly if you like shade around the pool this is the place for you. They have a lot of loungers but they are 75% in the shade of the palm trees. To get a lounger in the sun you had to be up by 0730 at the latest. Secondly if you like a loud party type pool again you'll be at home here. I really like to relax and read on holiday. Unfortunately due to the very loud music played at the pool I found this impossible. I would never come back to this hotel mainly for this reason. The waiter service around the pool area was very hit and miss. On some occasions the drinks were delivered quickly within 10 minutes. On others they would either not come at all or would arrive after 30 minutes by which time i'd already gone to the bar myself. This was even after tipping the guys. I think the problem was that they'd get the drinks then get called over by other guests and they would then give those guests our drinks ( I actually observed this and of course there was money exchanged!). The restaurants at the resort were on the whole pretty good. We dined at all the speciality restaurants and found the Krystal to be the best for the quality of food but a little amiss on the service. We dined there twice and on the first occasion everything was first class. However on the 2nd evening the waitress took our drinks order but drinks weren't served until i'd eaten most of the entree, even after reminding her on 3 occasions. The best restaurant for service was the Steakhouse which would of been first class but for their inability to cook a steak to medium. If you want medium you need to order rare in here! We also found the japanese to be good. The other speciality restaurants are ok but nothing special. The buffet restaurant was generally good and served some very tasty well prepared food. I did however have one incident which I thought was poor. On our 11th night, after being shown to our table, the waiter lent onto the table and gave me an earbashing about the shorts I was wearing that evening. Now he couldn't tell me what was wrong with them, I had worn them on a few occasions previously, but he said I shouldn't be wearing them to dinner. I found him to be rude and he left me feeling like a naughty child. I spoke to one of the head waiters and he said there was nothing wrong with my shorts but they were stopping people from wearing swim/bermuda type shorts. It was just an unfortunate incident which should not of happened. The breakfast service was excellent I especially liked the omlettes which were made in a unique parcel type way. Lunch was of a better quality in the buffet restarant but you had more choice in the chilis restaurant. The evening entertainment was ok. It was mainly different dancers who were always nicely skilled but not my cup of tea. We were looking forward to the Michael Jackson show but i found him very cheesy, he can't dance and doesn't sing, he just looks a little like him! The back up dancers were good though. We found the resort area to be very nice, clean and very safe. We visited the other Riu resorts in the area and thought they all looked very nice. We also went into Playa Del Carmen. The shops and restaurants were reasonably priced and it was a nice break from the hotel. I however wouldn't be interested in staying in any of the beach hotels in the resort as they seemed really crowded and didn't look very relaxing. We visited Chichen Itza and had a great day. The ruins and the stories behind them which the guide will tell you were really great. All in all we had a good time. I wouldn't recommend the Riu Palace Riviera Maya because for the money we spent it didn't deliver in a few too many areas. This is not the place to come if you wan't to relax around the pool during the day. If they'd just drop the volume a little i would of been happy to endorse this hotel. If you are looking for a party at the pool everyday though by all means go to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a wedding and vacation”
Reviews.Author: rileyMexico
Reviews.Content: We came to the resort with about 30 family members and friends of our son and daugher-in-law for their wedding. Our daughter-in-law had worked with a wedding planner prior to our arrival. I think they did a great job as the wedding was absolutely beautiful. The wedding took place right on the beach in the late afternoon. Beautiful background with the ocean. Spectators from the resort were off to the side and very respectful and told us how they enjoyed the wedding. What a great memory. All the details taken care of. We just showed up and enjoyed the ceremony. We can't say enough about the staff at the resort. Always had a smile and a "Hola" (hello) for everyone. We commented on how we did not run into one staff member that did not appear as if they were enjoying their jobs and helping to make our vacation memorable. GREAT staff in all deparments. The resort and grounds were spectacular. We were very impressed with how staff was always grooming and cleaning around the resort. Very clean rooms and kept up resort. Food at all the restaurants was great as well as the many choices of foods available at the buffets. Again, staff at all the restaurants were great. Everyone in the group seemed happy with the food and no one was every hungry or thirsty. Bartenders were great at all the bars as well as wait staff. Most of the time we didn't even have to go up to the bar to order a drink as the waiters/waitresses came to us. Staff on the beach were always quick to see an empty glass. The ages of our travelers were 20 months to 78 years old and everyone said they had a good time. We would definately return again. Great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “will return again”
Reviews.Author: canadaJR
Reviews.Content: let me start off saying this was our third trip to this area 1st to Catalonia Yucatan 2nd to Sandos and returned from Rui palace Maya on Feb. 2/10 weather full cloud one day, bit of shower one night and the rest of the week was sunny and hot , food was very good two nights we had a late res. for dinner and just walked up and asked to eat early and were seated, We had room 2116 which was great for us top floor facing the ocean, Beach was great and will only be better now after restoration, pool bar was always good for late afternoon fun some say this place is just for older folks not true, Santos is the best around the pool keeping everybody happy and hydrated,the shows are good by AI standards,ya it can get a bit quite around courtyard in evening but that's why its great to have Playa Del Carmen steps away If you are thinking of staying here you will not be disapointed

Reviews.Title: “best all inclusive in area---Ive stayed at 5 others”
Reviews.Author: laurieTexas
Reviews.Content: Definately the prettiest resort. Ive stayed at 3 different Iberostars, Sandos, and Barcelo. I really liked them all, but this was the nicest. It can be confusing with the 5 different Rius. one is Riu Palace,,,, and the better one is Riu Palace Riviera. you can walk to all of them. this one is on the end of the line of hotels, sandos is at the other end about 12 hotels down. about 30 min beach walk to the end of hotels and then if you have the energy to keep going....it really gets pretty with no hotels. Beach great- way better than the hotels a few doors down that have hardly any beach. Beautiful shade with palm trees and hammocks for after noon nap after being down front by the ocean. No problem getting chairs. Food - really good for all inclusive. You of course have to go wait in line to get your reservations. We stayed 7 nights. you could make reservations 2 nights at a time. we always got what we wanted, but I did get in line right when they opened at 11am. Room - nice,,,, we did upgrade (had to pay $50/night more). We didnt like our first room that was a view of the other hotels roof. our upgraded room was courtyard, could see pool and ocean and fountains. Entertainment - it is a quieter place, the Swim up bar was a blast , but it shut down at 5pm just when things were getting rolling. then had to wait until 8pm for dinner, which was alot of time inbetween for me after "happy hour" My husband would nap and I would walk around with the kids. not much to do at our hotel, so we would walk two hotels over and play ping pong. Ive never paid much attention to shows at these places, but these shows were good..... at least if you are a dancer. My daughter is really into dance and they were VERY talented. not just the HOTEL staff perfoming (except one night, and it was funny). Sports bar - very disappointing. Was hoping our 12 and 14 year old could hang out there. it is very light and off the lobby. no fun. not much for teens, but they should be able to have fun with the beach and all the food! We went off property to scuba dive and Zip line,,,,,kids loved that. We also alway go into town one night. My daughter and I like to shop,,,,my husband and I sneak in a few drinks at cute places,,,,, my son doesnt really enjoy town. LOVE the whole area.... this hotel the most $, but the nicest

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Resort - Absolutely Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaSouthernNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya with three girlfriends and we had an absolutely fabulous time. The resort is absolutely gorgeous, clean, the staff bend over backwards for you. There are servers that walk the beach all day long taking your drink orders. The resort is all-inclusive and there is always food available somewhere at one of the many restaurants or the one main (enormous) buffet. Directly past the huge pool is the beach, tons of beach, and the ocean. The more affordable rooms at the resort do not have an ocean view, you will pay more for that, but our rooms were very spacious and very nice. There is breakfast, and lunch served every day at the humongous buffet and there are many themed restaurants on property with two nightly seatings. They have a muscial stage show every night around 8 in a room just off the large oudoor seating area behing the main building. No matter where you are in the resort there are servers waiting to take your drink order :) And if you should need more bottled water or towels in your room, as we did at one point, just call the front desk and they were there in literally 5 minutes. In the building the gym is in there are also two large hot-tubs that were very nice. One drawback we noticed is the lack of night-life. There is a sports bar with pool tables in the main lobby building that seems to be where the late crowd hangs, but 5th street with a ton of clubs and bars is littlerally a 10-minute or so cab ride away and very safe. There are also a few other Riu Palaces right down the street from this one and one of them does have a night club. This Riu is literally the nicest out of them all - as a guest you can visit any of the other Riu's and use their facilities - the same is not true if you are staying somewhere else and would like to visit this Riu. Most nights local vendors also set up tables selling a various amount of things and jewlery on the property and there is an outdoor market about a 5-8 minute walk away. I will post some pics and overall would HIGHLY reccomend the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for travel with friends, a romantic getaway, or even solo - it's wonderful. One thing you also do not see hardly any of at this Riu are kids (a huge plus to me) and be warned that the beach allows topless sunbathing if you are a prude in any way or are thinking of bringing your kids ;)

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: pauka
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks there, our honeymoon, to be exact. Don't have much to complain, it was awesome, the staff, the cleanliness, the food - everything was just awesome. one could complain about the beach, but i hear they are working on it, and maybe its better already, at the time of our visit, the beach was quite eroded, and was little uncomfortable to use for people with not so good swimming skills. Multiple theme restaurants and the buffet were excellent, buffet changed menu every day of the week, and the food was always good, even on the seafood day (we dont eat seafood) we could find things that we liked.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect”
Reviews.Author: SarahBE
Reviews.Content: Travelled here the last week of September The hotel is beautiful, clean, and has a great layout. Everything is a decent walk from the rooms. You have access to all the Riu hotels in this area, but after checking them out we stayed at ours. It was the nicer of the 5. The rooms are very nice if you upgrade to a superior suite so your facing towards the courtyard. It is best to get a room halfway between the lobby and pool. We had an issue with the fan almost falling off the ceiling, but after several attempts with dealing with the front desk, they sent a technician to fix it. He didnt think it was broken, but it was. After we persisted, he fixed it and realized he was in the wrong. This was the only issue we had. They weren't very nice about it. The food here is 10/10. Honestly, with the amount of 5* places I have been over the years, this place had the best food for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Even the room service food, was great. The have club sandwiches with chips. Ordered one most days. The service is also a 10/10, minus the people at the front desk in the lobby. The pool guys, the restaurant staff, entertainment staff, bar staff were super nice and efficient. The pools were warm, and the infinity pool was my favorite. The beach at this hotel was one of the best in the Mayan. No rocks, and they had sandbags to break the waves, which made it nice to lounge in the ocean. Lots of fish so bring your own snorkle gear. There are lots of beach beds, and palapas. There is a beach bbq with some of the best ribs Ive ever had in Mexico! I couldn't believe it. The drinks here are all premium brands, never a problem. The entertainment was only a 5/10 since there wasn't much going on during the day, few activities, and the nightly entertainment was just ok. Worst that Ive seen at the resorts Ive been too. It is a quiet place. It is not a party place. Most people at this resort are older. All the younger people go to the Tequila. I would go back here in the future. The prices are great for this place in the fall. It is a 5 plus hotel. It was perfect! Any Questions -let me know

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of heaven in January”
Reviews.Author: stefaye
Reviews.Content: While I realize everyone has different standards in regards to their likes and dislikes, this place is a wonderful vacation spot. A vacation is just that... a vacation. Take things in stride, relax, and you'll have a great time. The grounds are spotless, the restaurants and buffet are typical of all-inclusive restaurants, but are delicious, and the staff was super friendly. We had a fabulous vacation, and stayed there from 1/24-1/31. It was only cloudy one day, and the weather was mostly warm and sunny the entire time. We tried every restaurant there, and we enjoyed them all-- although there is some overlapping depending on what night you eat at the buffet. I actually really enjoyed the Brazilian restaurant (I'm not big on meat) but it was fun and highly recommended. While Kristal was good, I don't think it's worth it's wait (it took us 4-5 days to get a reservation there)... So overall, food is plentiful, perhaps breakfast was a little repetitive-- but no major complaints. Service was simply wonderful. We tipped, and had no problems getting excellent service, whether that meant a stronger alcoholic beverage, to non-stop service at the restaurant. People are friendly and outgoing if you make the effort, and the environment is very relaxed and enjoyable. One thing to note: the Mexican gov't is working on the beach, and when we arrived, we were one of the only resorts within 15 min. walking distance that had a nice, large beach. A lot of the other areas surrounding have a tiny beach, or it's been closed for a few days to try and place more sand there. So, this may be a problem if you are booking soon-- but the beach area at this resort is large, just be prepared to maybe look at some large pipes for a few days while laying on the beach. Walking to Playa Del Carmen was fun and safe, and only 15-20 min away. It was easy to navigate to, and there's plenty to see and eat and do there. There's also a small plaza for shopping towards the other Riu's-- where there's a Starbucks if you're craving it, about a 5 min. walk from the hotel. Otherwise, I thought that area was overpriced for shopping. Also, it was helpful to realize that in the sports bar at the resort, you can pay a few dollars and use the internet, plus there's boxed food in there-- which was much utilized when we left for our airplane ride home. The pool is nice, although typically crowded, while the beach area has much more seating. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs anywhere though. Plus, in the resort itself, there's plenty of bar/martini lounge seating EVERYWHERE, which was great. Our room was pretty basic, nothing special. We had a junior suite, and our mini-bar always seemed to be filled. Plus, there's 4 full-size bottles of liquor in there, which was pretty sweet. You can make a rum and coke right there! Our room was always clean, ours wasn't damp. We were on the 3rd/4th floor, so maybe that made a difference, but we never had any complaints. One recommendation: if you take a shower in the morning, expect hot/cold fluctuations in the water temp. I found if I took a shower between 3pm-7pm, I rarely had that problem. The resort is fairly quiet, we didn't really stay awake too much for the "nightlife." We're in our late 20's, haha, and just enjoyed relaxing mostly. Plus, we ate most of our meals pretty late, but I heard the entertainment was just ok. I heard some people went into town, or went to other Riu's for more entertainment. We had more fun just chillin. Basically, this resort had superb service, had immaculate grounds, the food was tasty, the drinks plentiful (recommend bringing your own larger glass- as the glasses they serve are tiny). Plus, it was close to town, had the nicest beach in the area, and is really easy to find your way around. One other thing to note: the water/waves are a lot stronger than other places I've been to in the Caribbean (such as Punta Cana)-- I'm a little bit of a chicken and was only able to go in the water 2 days-- the rest of the time the waves were too big/choppy. Also, you can't really walk for miles down the beach, which we usually like to do. That was probably the biggest downside. However, that's a small gripe in comparison to having a wonderful Mexican getaway. You can walk through some pretty nice neighborhoods nearby, so I didn't complain too much. Overall, highly recommended. Would definitely stay here again, or at least another Riu Palace. If you have any questions, feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value but Not a 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: GregandJill
Reviews.Content: Fifth time to Mexico, second time staying at a RIU resort. Past resorts that I have been to in the Cancun area include Gran Caribe Real, The Royal, Krystal Cancun, and the Flamingo Cancun. Riu Palace Riviera Maya offered the following benefits for the price: 1) Very good food and five different restaurants that had various fun themes. One night even had langosta lobsters at the buffet. 2) Close proximity to other RIUs that can be visited. 3) Nice beach, friendly staff. 4) Short walk to Playa del Carmen for shopping and night life. Following are some disappointments from the trip: 1) The hydro-jets in the bath tub did not work. 2) There was a constant drip of water from the bathroom ceiling onto the floor. Didn't cause a problem but still annoying. 3) The mini-fridge is only restocked once per week, despite their twice a week claims. You'll run short on bottled water. 4) Limited selection of top shelf liquors (no Jack Daniels, exotic liquors other than Kahlua, etc.) 5) The music at night was not very good. It was keyboard synthesizer music intermixed with children's shows such as people dressed up as Eor from Whinnie the Pooh. We wen elsewhere for our evenings. 6) The internet service was down for a few days. The crowd at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya was not as social as other places I've been. Mostly European, there may have been a language barrier issue. I'd recommend this location for people who want a relaxing vacation, a nice beach, good food, and who aren't interested in the night life. It is not a place for an active night life or good bands (neither ethnic or contemporary) in the evening. Here's how I'd rate the destinations I've been to in the area for likeliness of a return visit: 1. The Royal (definitely a true 5 star) 2. RIU Palace Riviera Maya (4 stars, better food and rooms than Caribe)/Gran Caribe Real (3.5 stars, better night life and music than RIU) 3. Krystal (2.5 stars), Flamingo (2.5 stars) Overall, RIU Palace Riviera Maya is a solid four star choice. Would be the ideal destination for early risers in search of a getaway without distractions.

Reviews.Title: “RPRM Stay”
Reviews.Author: OooEee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (RPRM) from Jan. 21st - Jan. 28th. Booked the trip through Apple Vacations flying out of Baltimore for approx. $1300 per person. Here are my thoughts on the good and bad about this resort. The resort is very clean and beautiful. Our room was always cleaned in a timely manner. The room didn't have a musty smell but we found that everything stayed damp. Things never dried out (bathing suits, towels, etc). The food was OK. We always enjoyed breakfast at the buffett and never had any problem finding things we liked. Lunch was either at Chili's or the buffett and the offerings were (for the most part) the same each day. We ate at three of the specialty restaurants. The steakhouse (Chili's) was our favorite. The waiters were really good...make sure you or someone at your table orders the baked Alaska for dessert so you get "the show" that goes along with it. The Mexican restaurant and Krystal were OK. We at the rest of our dinner meals at the buffett. The beach was really nice. Plenty of chairs. The waiter service was hit or miss each day on the beach. We aren't pool people but as we walked to the beach each morning (around 8:30am), we saw that most of the chairs were already claimed by the pool. It seemed that if you wanted a chair by the pool, you would need to get up at the break of dawn to reserve one. We enjoyed going into Playa Del Carmen for shopping on a couple of days. We went once in the evening and once during the day. It's very nice and 'lots of shops to visit. I also did the Dolphin Swim at the Dolphin Discovery site. It was fun and was nice that my husband was allowed to take pictures while I swam with the dolphins. Overall, the resort and surrounding area are very nice. If anyone has any specific questions about this resort, please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kugorets
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Riu Palace. When we arrived the people at the front desk were very friendly, welcoming and thoughtul. The room was very clean and spacious. Overall the food was good. The hotel has five sit down restaurants and two buffets. The food at the sit down restaurants is tasty , but when meat was ordered it was always well done and a bit salty. The dinner buffet has theme nights, a lot of food varieties and plenty of tables to sit at. The bars have a big selection of drinks on its menu and the service is great. Servers are very quick to bring out the ordered drinks and always check up on you when your glass get empty. The beach is very big with a lot of shade from the palm trees. It was not very crowded during our stay, as the majority of people were around the pool area. The pool is pretty big with a bar in the middle. It did get a little bit loud at times with music and dancing people. During the day there are numerous activities: beach volleyball, aqua fitness, kids activities, etc. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. One thing to be aware of, the hotel has a Thrifty Car Rental inside. Be cautious when renting a car there. The Thrifty representatives quote ridiculous prices (completely different from the ones on the website) and lie about the insurance that you need to get.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: shellnason
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week-long stay. It was a family vacation for our family of 4, (50 y.o. parents, 20 y.o. daughter and 13 y.o. son) We are from Portland, Oregon, so we were looking forward to a warm, sunny relaxing break from the rain. We booked the trip through TripGuy travel, and our docs said "Funjet vacations" The representatives in Mexico are Lomas travel, who provided our transfers. Transfers: Lomas travel reps were very easy to find outside the airport, and we were taken directly to the resort via a new Lincoln Navigator. Our driver did not speak much English, and we were exhausted, so it was a quiet 40 minute drive. Our return to the airport, was via a mini bus, with about 8 other passengers. Our hotel was the last pickup, so we drove direct to the airport. Our only complaint was that we got to the airport too early, and check in and securiy went very quickly, They picked us up at 2 p.m. for a 5:20 flight. I realize they need to allow for potential traffic delays and long lines at the airport, so it wasn't a big deal. Reception/first impression: The massive lobby is very impressive. Beautiful fixtures and furnishings and everything is immaculate. Our check in went very smooth, and we were greeted with a non-alcoholic fruit drink. (Tasted like Tang to me, but our son raved about it the rest of the week!) We had reserved a Jacuzzi suite and a Jr suite for the kids and had requested that the rooms be adjacent or connecting if possible. We made the long walk from receception to the very end of the building, excited to see our rooms. I was a little nervous, because we were on floor 2, and I knew the jacuzzi suites were on the top floor. Turns out, we were on the top floor, (near the lobby area there are a few rooms on an upper floor, which explained why the elevator showed a floor 3) The jacuzzi suite was absolutely amazing. At the end of the building, with a beautiful view of the ocean and pool area. Two huge windows on the ocean side and a smaller window on the side wall. The room was huge! (Bigger than our first apartment) The entrance is a hallway with the mini bar and liquor dispensers. There is a second door into the suite itself, which opens into a large sitting area, which has a couch, chair and tables and a large dresser. There is a ceiling fan over this portion of the suite. Off of the sitting room is a large walk-in closet with tons of hangers and shelves and the safe. The safe is on the floor, which made it a little difficult to read the instructions, or look inside to take items out. Would have been nice if it had been elevated on one of the shelves. From the sitting area, there are 2 steps up to the bed/bath area. There is another dresser at the foot of the bed, with a flat screen TV that could rotate so it could be viewed from the bed or the sitting area. Seperating the bed and the bathroom is a huge spa tub. The bathroom area is huge, comparable to the bathrooms at the Venetian in Las Vegas. there are 2 sinks, a huge, walk in closet, (kind of dark) and a seperate toilet/bidet area. The best part of the room are the balconies! The main balcony wraps around the edge of the building, and contains 2 chairs, a table, and a drying rack for wet bathing suits. Then there is a spiral staircase to the upper balcony where the jacuzzi tub is located. There is a chair and a lounger on this level. The view from this balcony is awesome! The jacuzzi tub took about 30 minutes to fill, and the temperature was a little hard to regulate, but it was very nice and private. There was a plate of chocolate dipped strawberries, a bottle of champagne, and not one, but 2 towel animals awaiting us in the suite! There was a new towel animal every day, and champagne and strawberries one other day during our stay. The junior suite was 2 doors away, and it was overlooking the resort next door. We had requested 2 beds for their room, and I was a little disappointed when I saw they were pushed together. They were huge, and our kids didn't mind, so we didn't ask for them to change the arrangement. Their room, while not as big as ours was nicley furnished and immaculate. It was comparable to any 3..5-4 star hotel in the US. There was a standard closet, and dresser, and a small sitting area with a loveseat, chair and table. The same TV that we had in our room. The bathroom was much smaller, but contained 2 sinks and a seperate toilet area, (no bidet) There was a tub shower in the spa tub. There was a towel animal to greet them, and they had a new one later in the week, but not a new one every day. The beds are quite firm. My husband and I found it to be quite comfortable, but after a couple of nights, the kids requested toppers and they were more comfortable with them. Our only complaint with our room was the air conditioning was not adequate. The kids room was much cooler and drier than ours. I think our room was warmer because of all the windows letting in the sun all day, but my husband thinks it was due to being an end unit, the system didn't have the capacity to adequately cool our room. We spoke to the front desk about it on our second day, and they said they would have someone take care of it, but it was the same for our entire stay. In any case, it was usually more comfortable to leave our slider open at night and get some fresh air. We were never really uncomfortable, as the ceiling fan kept the room pretty cool, and the weather was pretty Wi-fi: There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby area, but it is spotty. We had our I-phones and sometimes it would take several tries to get connected. Our last day, it was down completely. There is a business center in the sports bar, for pay, but we never needed it. Service: The service was fantastic, and we can't say enough nice things about everyone we came in contact with, from the doorman who first greeted us, to the front desk staff, to the waiters, bartenders, cocktail servers, housekeepers, and entertainment staff. If you needed something, you merely had to make eye contact with a staff member, and they were right there inquiring into your needs. They were all very friendly, and greeted you as you walked past. The pool bartenders and waiters were especially friendly and hard working, and knew our names after the first day. Our son, was very impressed by how friendly and attentive the pool bartenders were. You can imagine a 13 year old boy doesn't generally recieve a high level of respect from resort bartenders. Away from the resort, and even at the Riu to some extent, we encountered more people that did not speak English than on previous trips to Mexico. This is our first visit to the Yucatan, our previous trips being to the West coast of Mexico. It was never really a problem, but I think I'll brush up on my Spanish a bit before we retun to Yucatan. The hotel doesn't have a concierge desk, but there are representatives from different travel and tour companies in the lobby area every day. We met with the rep from Lomas travel, and arranged two excursions through him. Food: The food was good and plentiful, and available 24 hours a day. Though I have to say it was not as good as I expected. We had the breakfast buffet every morning, and ordered fruit, coffee and rolls a couple of mornings from room service. Lunch is also a buffet, out near the pool area. We ate dinner in the buffet a couple of nights, and tried the Mexican, Japanese and Steakhouse specialty restaurants. We could never get reservations for the gourmet, and weren't interested in the Brazilian. The variety of food available at the buffets is tremendous, but the quality is not exceptional, (especially of the meat) There was an abundance of fried things available, and always pasta, pizza, and a salad bar. Our 13 year old loved the buffets, and will especially miss the homemade donuts, and endless supply of pizza and french fries. The specialty restaurants were just OK. The meats were fair quality, and there was nothing exceptional about any of our meals. The seafood was especially disappointing, as it was obviously frozen. The room service menu is very limited, but is certainly adequate, and has something for every taste. We recommend the club sandwich, and the fruit plate. Our kids loved being able to order a snack in the middle of the night. The service was very quick, and after I tipped the waiter on his first visit, he always brought me a long stemmed rose! I realize that food preferences are a very subjective thing, and I should disclose that we are foodies, accustomed to dining at fine restaurants in the US. I was expecting food on par with that on a cruise ship, and it was nowhere close. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't the highlight of our trip. Beach/Pool The pool area is absolutely spectacular, one of the best I've ever experienced. Yes the water is unheated, but I found it refreshing. We did have to do the early morning towel run to get prime location chairs, but it wasn't a problem and there were always tons of lounges available on the beach. The different features of the pool area were all very nice, from the infinity pool to the in-water lounges, to the swim up bar, and the bubblers. We thought the beach was great too, but it will be nice to get rid of the sand whales, so that you can body surf and really play in the waves. It would be nice to have an outdoor hot tub near the pool, since the only ones available at the resort are indoors in the spa. (they look very nice, but we didn't use them) Spa: While the guys were fishing, my daughter and I decided to have a spa day. First, we had a scrub/wrap, then a massage on the beach. The spa facilities were very nice, comparable to top spas at resorts in the US. The scrub/wrap was OK. I felt like they rushed through the scrub, but I was a little sunburned so that was probably a good thing. The wrap was nice, but what made it heavenly was the scalp massage. They asked if we wanted the massage on the beach or inside. It was a really windy day, but we had never had a massage on the beach, so we opted for outside. It was a little weird, because we had to walk through the pool area in our spa robes and messy spa hair in the middle of the afternoon to get to the little massage hut under the palm trees on the beach. When we got to the massage hut, we realized there were no walls or curtains, so we had a moment of panic contemplating the transition from our robes to spa tables. Not to worry. The masseuses helped us manouver under the towels without providing too much of a show for the nearby beach loungers. The massage was fabulous, but the combination of wind, beach and pool noise was not really a relaxing atmosphere. We concluded the beach massage would have been better in the early morning before the wind and pool noise kicked up. After our massage, we relaxed in the sauna a bit, before heading to our rooms to shower. There are showers and restrooms in the spa, as well as a full service salon and the hot tubs. Entertainment/Nightlife I regret that we only saw one show the entire week. It was the Vegas/Casino show. At first I thought it was a bit cheesy, but it got better and better and we realized the dancers were really good. We usually ate dinner around 6:30 or 7:00 and were in bed by 9 or 9:30! We were just too tired to stay up late, and the shows started at 9:45. The entertainment staff were friendly, but other than a few activities that our son participated in, we weren't really involved with them. I would have gone on the kitchen tour, but it was on a day that we were away from the resort. They did have live music in the plaza every night, and most nights there were vendors selling their wares. Personally, I felt the vendors cheapened the atmosphere, and a few were pretty aggressive, which was annoying, but I'm sure some people enjoyed the opportunity to shop right on the premises. Sorry this is so long, but I like reading detailed reviews. We loved the resort and hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Had the most fantastic time here”
Reviews.Author: kristynlu
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from the Riv Maya's Riu Palace. It was our first time staying at a Riu Palace and we absolutely loved it! This place has the most amazing staff..they are all so very friendly and willing to do whatever it takes to please you. We were very grateful for the service and made sure to tip where it was deserved. This only increased the level of hospitality that we received. Aside from the service this hotel is kept immaculately clean. They do a great job in cleaning your room every day as well as every other area around the resort (we saw people even sanitizing and washing the courtyard every single day). Around the pool each day there are endless activities that you can take part in...or if you would rather relax then can just sit around the pool or beach and enjoy the drink services. We loved all of the restaurants that were at the Riu Palace...our favorite was Crystal's if you go there try the beef....our least fav was Chili's (but only when they turn into an ala carte at night). all in all we loved our experience at the Riu Palace and arent sure if there is any other resort that could top it. We feel confident in all Riu's now and will more then likely be traveling to many other Riu's around the Carribean and Mexico in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Awsome Hotel & Sweet Faces”
Reviews.Author: PpprHoney
Reviews.Content: I seen lots of complants about the beds & how hard they were well anything is different than home your on vacation of course it wont be like home we sleep on a water bed & the beds there were'nt that bad at all we slept good every night the people there were great they catered to your every need & waited on you like kings & queens, what more could you ask for? When we first arived at the airport we were greeted by these people that said we have such great deals for fun here & our price will beat the hotels so oh yeah we bought into it & bought it and later found out it was a time share thing for the mayan rivera thank goodness we didnt take the advise of those people at the airport & they told us to not listen to the people at our hotel we went & talked with them & found out we got scamed we were even told by the people at the airport to not pay our driver to the hotel nothing no wonder he was pissed poor guy he hiya hiya us in the hotel sorry driver, thank the people at the airport there the rip offs, but any way we were saved by the people at the hotel and they were the best they saved us from a whole waisted day with the mayan rivera timeshare crap and booked us the best excursions we fed & petted turtles looked at the coral reefs went to a place where the cove was clam & quiet and swam & fed pretty fish that were eager to get close to you then we went , ATVing and went in a cave & swam in it , it was all relaxing and wonderful.The tiping part is this, these poor people hardly are paid enough for what they do so your stay is wonderful we are middle class people so we are not the riches but we did our part as far as tipping as much as we could & when we did it it was greatly shown back in everything they did for us & we want to bring our family back & our friends to show them the great time we had there. we always felt safe & the people there were great & very different I guess you could say the spice of life hope to visit again next year thank you Hotel Riu Palace Riviera Maya.OH 1 more thing they made our 25th anniversary the best thanks for everything you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great but odd place, Americans need to be more considerate...”
Reviews.Author: connect2source
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you like garish, Vegas / Dubai architecture. The hotel design really doesn't compliment nor does it lend itself to the jungle surroundings.. for that, stay at the Iberostar Quetzel / Tucan. Hotel lobby is Spanish Colonial but somehow the interior hallways remind me of a hospital in Cuba with it's dank colours and echos. Enjoyed a 3rd floor, courtyard view, jr. suite, nice and private up there with vaulted ceilings and great ocean views. My only complaint was that the hotel was filled with loud Americans who had no respect for anyone else's trip, they seemed to yell across rooms, the lobby the pools etc., the Europeans and Canadians were much better behaved, dress more appropriately for off beach activities.. perhaps they've travelled more, regardless, I'd avoid this hotel if this concerns you. Rooms : Spotless, fairly new, great jacuzzi bathubs, huge king beds with great mattresses, new Sony Bravia LCD TV's with over 50 channels and at least ten English language ones. Decor, however is more reminiscent of a chateau in a cold climate and does not convey a tropical, fun, holiday mood. Pool : Large with tonnes of loungers, no need to get up @ 5:00am unless you want one at key locations poolside. Great pool bar staff, a little tip goes a long way, you'll get chairside service with you favourite drinks every time. Terrible, loud music, rap and oldies from a bygone era, I thing they have about 3 home made CD's that they repeat constantly. Pool is not heated, people seem to complain but the purpose is to cool you off, it feels great once you're in a does the trick. Why would people want a hot pool when it's 30C outside? Beach : Massive hotel beach from, with huge coconut grove ensures loungers and shade for anyone, anytime, no need to panic. Buffet Food: Best we've ever had at any all inclusive, period. High quality, huge variety and changes nightly. International night was phenomenal, with massive payayas, carving stations, freshly made dessert crepes. Town: Get to town and blow a few bucks on the great collection of modern, slick and hips bars and restaurants a few blocks down 5th Avenues, go past the first few blocks of tacky Mexican shops and you'll discover a jet set, stylin' scene! In conclusion, if it wasn't for the Americans that seem to take over and are oblivious to anyone else's space, this place would be great and get a full five stars from me. Aside, RIU does a first class job with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place/good food/loud yanks/loud pool music”
Reviews.Author: harleydavidson
Reviews.Content: still here for another 10 days so happy to answer any questions Not a 5 star, neither are the other riu in the vicinity,although they like to say so over the door . This hotel is byfar the better, of the other Riu's have visited them all now, and although Grand splender at first sight in the foyer and nicerooms/ bar .... But just some of the other things you might not read in other reviews 1. Hotel full of noisey loud Americans, especially at night and around the bars I was advised by hotel staff to make sure you choose your times around there holidays big problem with the kids as it's legal to drink here at 18 so they make the most of it 2. Hope you like tecno and rap music as it's all that's played around the pool at a loud volume don't get me wrong it's a nice place but be warned it's not the place for a quite break 3. It's taken 6 days to refil the room fridge 4.in the sauna there are loose screws just ready for you to catch your legs on, not to mention missing floor boards and loose seating. The spa was luke warm at best and most of the gym equipment was poorly maintained. 5. Wife went to toilets near pool and three of the toilets were overflowing and full!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation! Well worth the money spent!”
Reviews.Author: onlymyexperience
Reviews.Content: When we arrived it was a little hectic at the airport It was our first time and we did not know where to go or what to do. The airport staff was not helpfully at all. When we finally arrived at the hotel we were very tired. The hotel took great care of us. We requested and received a very private and quit room. The service at the hotel was great! When in the morning before breakfast I asked them if they could give me a bottle of water for the beach, the staff told me that they will take it to my room and when I come back from breakfast it will be waiting for me there. True enough! it was there. We wanted to change beach towels in the middle of the day, no problem. The room service at first was so so. The lady pretended to not understand me when I asked her for more towels and showed her the towel by picking them up from her cart and taking them in. I went to the front and asked them to translate to her that I wanted two more bath towels for my room, from then on we had not issues at all. The food was great. It tasted fresh delicious and varied greatly from day to day. I gained ten pounds in ten days, so be careful! The service at the buffet was very good. We did not have to wait in line to get in at all. The specialty restaurants were not that great. Considering that the food at the buffet was so good and the fact that we had to get up at 6 am to get reservations! not worth it. We did it only twice! Japanese restaurant was not very good and the sushi as well as the service was so much better at the buffet. The beach was fantastic. The white sand was pumped up from the ocean every day. The beach was clean with plenty of room, so it was not at all overcrowded. They had huge bags filled with sand dumped in the ocean to break the waves. The beach was calm and the bags became the attraction to which people tried to swim to and get on. We met so many different people from all over the world. The hotel staff made everyone fell very comfortable. For the first time in my life I played darts and had fun doing it. Since everyone was in the same boat we all had fun. The Service at the beach was fantastic. Servers with the drinks were walking around all the time. At first I did not feel comfortable waiving them down. I would go to the bar to get my Margaritas, which by the way were very very good! By the end of vacation I did what everybody did and got my drinks from the servers. The food was great. We did not even have to leave the beach. There were two restaurants right on the beach, as well as the hotel would bring out the barbecue right onto the beach and cook right there in front of us. They would bring fresh fruit and cold drinks as well. To go to the beach restaurants you need shoes and a cover. By the end we were to lazy to do it and ate lunch right there on the beach. It was great! The resort has swimming pools. They were very nice but we spend the whole day on the beach. We were scheduled to go on a trip and I asked them if I could take some food for the road. There were not problems with it at all! We were the only onces who had decent breakfast that day on a bus. If you do decide to go on a trip make sure that you choose a company with the large tourist bus. It has good air conditioner and has comfortable seats. You will appreciate this later when traveling on Mexico roads and the bus going above speed limit! Little buses like minivans are to be avoided! We went to see the pyramids and had great time. One thing, the tour company takes you only to the shops that they have agreement with. BARGAIN AND MORE BARGAIN. I do not usually feel comfortable bargaining so I was out of my comfort zone and did not buy anything. At the pyramid there is a market. When at the end of the day we were leaving and I still did not buy anything I got bold. My husband was laughing at me. The was a stone statute that I thought my parents would like. At the store before and at the market they wanted between $75 and $100. I told them at the end of the day at the market that I will pay only $25 and prepaired to walk away. I thought that yes,yes or no,no, but at least I tried. At first they tried to bargain with me but when they so that I was serious they run after me. So I was very proud of myself. We had a GREAT time. I want to take my whole family there, I think the kids would enjoy themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: manc48
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks at the end of November with my partner. We stayed at the RPM a few years ago and do prefer this hotel. Although this a beautiful building the resort doesn't have a very Mexican feel to it and some Mexican music would have a good way to putting this right. The main plus for this hotel is the staff, they are fantastic, without exception, from the "maids" to the drinks and restaurant waiters. Rooms were spotless and we never waited for service anywhere. There was a slight difference the second week we were there when I think our room was placed at the end of the daily cleaning schedule and following a couple of trips out, our room hadn't been cleaned before we returnd at 16.00. We're not very good at sitting still and went out of the hotel most days. The hotel is well situated for the short walk (15 minc) into Playa del Carmen or to go to places such as Xcaret, Akumal, Tulum etc. The beach was exclellent and in much better condition than I'd expected, although the sand whales are not pretty. If you turn right on the beach you can walk to the undeveloped part of the beach which is stunning and even stop off at one of the other RIUs along the beach for refreshments. We had a view over an adjacent hotel which was rather dull but just provided some balcony space for a short time with dos equis from our well stocked mini bar. We found the food to be good overall but it did get boring towards the end of the second week. This is the 4th AI I've stayed in and the only one where I've actually enjoyed drinking the wine - I tried the white and the rose. If you are going out for the day then the Sports Bar has 2 fridges stocked with fresh sandwiches and fruity that are easy to carry out. Overall this is somewhere I'd book again if returning to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect, But Fantastic Holiday All The Same!”
Reviews.Author: Rosiek28
Reviews.Content: First time to RPRM (actually, first time at a Riu ever - never thought they were what we wanted). First time also to the area, having done Cancun without child years ago. Chose hotel for its all inclusive factor and its location to Playa Del Carmen. Used Thomson package holidays which again, not something we usually do, but thank god we did (see snowstorm/flight delays). No delay going out from an extremely cold and snow-ridden UK. Had a First Choice flight (rubbish) but we were going to Mexio so put it behind us. We pre-booked private transfers to hotel which were fine and journey to hotel takes about 45 mins. Upon arrival, we received cold drinks but were given a bad room. Apparently no courtyard views available apart from for an extra $50 a night and even then, we would have to wait two days. Said no thanks and got on with it - never in room anyway and it turns out the room is right by the pool and beach so shorter walks when something was needed from room midday. Long walks to main building but nice at night with Christmas lights up. Did get the impression that Thomson holiday makers do not have much push here, despite it being a "Thomson Hotel". That mean't nothing when requiring a little upgrade or extra help... This I had suspected before booking. The hotel is nice - all crystal chandeliers and old-style glamour but newly built. It is large but after two weeks, you got used to it and realised that being so big would mean that it never felt busy - apart from pool area... We arrived on Boxing Day and it was nice to see all the Christmas displays up - our daughter said it made her not forget Christmas Day so quickly. We ate in the buffet that first night. We were actually impressed! The last all-inclusive place we had been to was 12 years ago in Cancun, which we remembered as being quite nice but it didn't ever feel so "special". Deciding to cut costs on this trip, we chose the all-in option but had vowed to eat out assuming the food wouldn't be up to scratch. In fact, the food was so up to scratch that we actually got fed up with eating! I admit that nothing was really hot unless served up by the chefs up front, though for me being semi-vegetarian (let's just call it extremely fussy) and my partner having a penchant for fresh seafood and top notch sushi, we found it more than acceptable. I even ate their Chilli Con Carne and found it fine whereas you would never see me eat meat or chicken in most decent places. They made an effort and would alter something if required. We ate in the Steakhouse, Japanese and Krystals and can honestly say, that there is nothing more demeaning than having to wait at lunchtime to try and get into restaurants that are actually cooking the same level of food that is being served for free every night in the buffet. We waited once and agreed never again - simply ridiculous! All Krystal had done was make haute cuisine portions and added a little foam/jus here and there! It is a little nicer to be served, though we found ourselves wanting to get the whole food process out of the way and just plot up somewhere nice to drink and relax. Lunch is buffet style but noisier and with people wearing swimwear - this didn't bother me as we were in an all inclusive and I get the impression that casual and relaxed is what they were going for. You could still get a drinkable glass of wine and it mean't that kids could get their refills on drinks and ice cream. Must point out that we never saw a fly or wasp near the food during the whole two weeks, but were unable to eat at Xcaret because of their insect takeover. Beach was nice - water warmer than pool, but that was freezing so that says nothing much given the time of year. Sea was clean though not as clear as you might expect. The sand-whales are merely a slight eye-sore, but nothing worse than clocking us podgy types walking around with bikinins on!!!!! We didn't let our daughter play on them as they appeared slippery, but many did. There was fantastic waiter service on the beach though I wish their cups were bigger - one coke when thirsty doesn't touch the sides! The pool area - well, what can you say? The bed reserving situation was the worst that I have ever witnessed. We bagged some beds once only because we sent Daddy out at seven a.m. to get them. He was not amused and therefore we used the beach 90% of the time - we don't like the noisy pool and they music going, entertainment team making announcements and there is also the fact that they cram the beds together so you have to get up close and personal with semi naked strangers. This isn't a favourite past-time of mine. My biggest moan: PLASTIC SUNBEDS!!!! I understand that it would cost some money for the hotel to deal with this, so I will leave it at that. Maybe just the pool beds... Room had ants in bathroom. I can deal with this as I understand that we might have sweet smelling toiletrires in there (and once, we poured away the last of daughters' orange drink - big mistake!!!). You would think the maids would spot the little bu**ers and use an insectocide on them, but no. We overlooked the hotel next door, so quite private but not an enjoyable view. Plastic balcony furniture.... Our daughter received a Towel Animal/figure daily, which she looked forward to seeing every afternoon. We tipped them every other day about £5 and they really looked after us (apart from ants!). We found that small tips here and there didn't make a difference at all. The staff worked so hard in all areas to be punctual and professional and it was only the front desk that I felt had this "I should be working in the Rosewood Mayakoba" attitude. Big tips made them thankful but they couldn't smile or work any harder than they already were. There is soooo much to do around this way - trips/excursions etc. We will return to complete our Thing To Do list. You only need to do things the once, like swimming with dolphins or a day at Xcaret, but you remember those days more than the sunbathing. TIP: We flew to Chichen Itza in a tiny plane that seated five. We are a family of three and the allowed us to pay for an empty 4th seat to have the day exclusively. SO worth it!!!!!! Riu Palace Riviera Maya was better in appearance than the Palace Mexico but we were told the nightlife is better in the "less star rated" hotels. We went in to Playa Del Carmen for shopping many nights and ended up eating and drinking there. Its safe and casual with plently of walking. Nothing major shop-wise but some nice little boutiques. We will return to the area but maybe try somewhere different. Our daughter had a fantastic time - plently of kids to play with (all nationalities) and loved the shows at night. We met some fabulous people which really made the holiday for us. Finally: The snow in UK meant a 16 hour delay for us. We met with the Thomson rep, Emma, who had already been more than helpful with other issues and with booking trips etc. She let us know about the delay, what to do and was on hand at all times. Being booked with Thomson meant we stayed at the hotel for the extra day and did not have to do anything other than prepare for the new flight time. She was that helpful that we may revert to package holidays/tour operators again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property in need of some "tender, loving, care" but staff could not have been friendlier.”
Reviews.Author: ssjamiso
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our grown children and 4 year-old granddaughter for 10 days from Dec. 30, 2009 until Jan. 9th, 2010. Having stayed at the RIU Palace Mexico last year, we wanted to try a newer version of the resort so opted for the more recently constructed Palace Riviera Maya. The grounds are immaculate, entertainment top-notch and the staff outstanding. That said, we asked to be moved after the first night due to cockroach infestation of our room. We were immediately relocated to an upgraded room. All rooms could benefit from mold and mildew removal and updating of furniture and bedding. The pool, likewise, needs attention to maintenance. The food was good in the buffet but we noticed some cutbacks in variety and quality from the previous year. This may be a reflection of the current economic downturn. We would love to stay here again but need to know that improvements have been made before we return. Hope that management reads the comment cards and takes action!

Reviews.Title: “Our Christmas at the RPRM”
Reviews.Author: darlsay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I from Phila. arranged to meet our daughter from Phoenix in Mexico for Christmas.
