Phila. had a snow storm the day before our departure and we were fortunate to get out with only a 2 1/2 hour delay. We hired Cancun Transfers for our private transfer to the RPRM. Our daughter (being by herself) didn't see them when she arrived and waited outside for almost 3 hours till we landed. I was really hoping that she would have gone ahead and went to the resort. It worked out. Check In: We arrived around 6pm and we not greeted by anyone with a nice cold cocktail. We previously asked for connecting rooms but none available. We booked a courtyard view but when we got to our rooms we were looking into the back of the steakhouse rest. on the first floor. (we requested 3rd floor) We were very unhappy with this room so we went back to front desk. They then gave us two more rooms over looking the courtyard 2096 & 2098. beautiful rooms but 2098 had peoples belongings in it. Our key took us inside. Luckily our bellman was still with us and he called the front desk. They then switched us to room 2090 which is above the buffet rest. with a larger balcony. Rooms: very nice. no problems with musty smell or bugs. Water temp and pressure was great. Housekeeping very prompt. Pool: very cold, not heated. Hate to say but people were out by 6am reserving chairs. We were there for 7 nights and only had 2 days were we had good seats at the pool. That's only because I played the game. hated this. Towel keys are the only way you can get pools towels and only 1 per key. Rest.: Out of 7 nights we were only able to book 2 nights at the ala carte. We ate at the Mexican and Krystal both being very good. You have to make your reservations between 12 & 3. They did a Christmas Eve buffet (only rest. open) with 2 seatings. We opted for the 1st seating. It was very beautiful and very good the only proplem being it was very crowded. We tried waiting till lines went down but when we were enjoying our dessert they asked us to hurry so they could turn the room for 2nd seating. Beach was very nice. Sand bags were not bothersome at all to us. Water was a beutiful blue and water temp. was warmer than the pool. Shows: We were told the Michael Jackson show was the best. It was never scheduled while we were there. Other shows just ok. Location: We loved walking (20 min.) into Play del Carmen. Great being able to walk into the other RIU's. We like the animals/jungle feel walking thru the tequila property. We also thought that our hotel was the nicest of all the other RIU's. Drinks. They do only serve Dosequies (spelling?) beer. Liquor selection ok. Absolute, Finlandia Cranberry was what we usually drand. We had our 20oz bubba kegs which were great! Our flight home was canceled due to the flight crew being timed out. So we opted to stay another 3 days but we moved to Cancun and stayed at the westin. Cancun transfers were prompt picking us up and taking our daughter to the airport and us to the Westin. That was very much appreciated with no extra charge. All in all if you are on a family vacation this is a very nice place. My husband, 28 yr. old daughter will only stay at adult only properties from now on. It seems as though there are to many rules at the family properties. ie: wrist bands, rest. reserv., towel cards, top shelf liqours, beer selection. We have previously stayed at Secrets Capri, Excellence Riviera Maya, El Dorado Casitas and Secrets Maramo all being adults only and really enjoyed these properties to the RPRM.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing vacation but”
Reviews.Author: Reuel-London-Canada
Reviews.Content: The Palace is very impressive in the outside and inside architecture. The Escorial in Spain serves as a model. The staff is hard working and very friendly. The grounds are immaculately maintained as is the interior, with one notable exception--the 24 hr. "sports bar" which is very dirty as the hours go by--the prominent draft beer tap is permanently nonfunctional. ---the staff is obviously under remunerated. It has a nice beach with shady palm trees and many solid lounge chairs. The downside has to do with the steady noisy stream of air, ear, and water polluting jet skis and other motor boats. They are a liability to the hotel and could easily be banned from the immediate vicinity. Special commendations to the Havana Bar evening bartender and the staff who was willing to share a fraction of their knowledge of Maya with us. The food was adequate but in the lunch restaurant often tired and super oversalted.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, friendly people, clean, comfortable and yummy.”
Reviews.Author: vpbetho
Reviews.Content: Considering the last trip I was on was a total bust, I really wanted to write about how great this place was. The hotel is beautiful, the people who work there could not be more friendly, and the food was delicious. We went with teenage kids and found that it was the perfect mix of families and couples. Food was always available and was very good. The only things I found lacking was some things for kids to do with their free time (there were some pool tables, etc., but more would be better). If you go with teens - get them their own room. It's cheaper than upgrading and there is no way you'll all fit comfortably in a regular room.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel with Excellent Service at a Price”
Reviews.Author: ThomasLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at different hotels in the Riviera Maya this was probably one of the best,Rooms were immaculate we didnt experience the musty smell I have seen in some reviews. The service is excellent if you tip (only 50 paesos now and then) if you dont its still good,look for Charlie by the pool or at the patio bar in the evening he is fanatastic. The restaurants are very good didnt try the Japanese or the Fusion,the buffet was certainly the best we have experienced in the area. Take a 20 min walk into playa its worth it but be prepared to be hassled to look in every shop,be careful if there is a cruise ship in port as all the prices go up !!! Entertainment is great you have to see the Micheal Jackson tribute

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: hotsummer
Reviews.Content: Just returned on December 28. Experience was great. Beach was awesome - pool was even greater. Positives - very clean, buffet is very good for a buffet, pool and beach were awesome. Specialty restuarants were great. Christmas Eve buffet was great - They had ice sculture reindeers with a sleigh and Santa Claus. It was beautiful. They had a gingerbread house shaped like Rui Palace. The staff really worked hard for this night. Tables were set up beautiful with gold and red. Very impressive. Staff was very friendly. Negatives - diinner reservations were a hassle, Some nights they had no openings for reservations. Good tip - We ended up going at 6:30 and seeing if there were any no-shows and was able to get a reservation that way. If you can't get one then, you can come back at 8:45. Communication was a little scarce. Christmas Eve only had one restaurant open - if you didn't know to make reservations there, you would not have any where for dinner. Rooms were musty and did feel damp most often. Just keep the door shut and the air on and it got better. There was not much to do in the evening. After dinner, everyone just sits outside and watches people until the show starts at 9:45, which was a little late for us after a day in the sun. We did see the circus show and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: colbyMass
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days and felt guilty after 5. Like everyone else said, the place is spotless. The staff cater to you and if you need something just wait and somebody will come by and ask if you need anything. Even on the beach if I got up to go to the bar I didn't make it half way before some one was right there to ask if I need another drink. We had a ground floor room which was nice because you didn't have to walk to far to get anywhere. If you like it quiet ask for a room closer to the beach or pool. It gets loud with a band or show at night in the courtyard. Get to know the waiters/bartenders! They remembered our names and a small tip can work wonders. We will go back next year

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 10th anniversary trip!!”
Reviews.Author: henschen100
Reviews.Content: The resort was spotless, the service was incredible, awesome beach and great food! We loved that our hardest decision was whether to be on the beach or at the swim up bar! We had the best time and we will go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short 3-night stay at the RIU Palace RM. Overall, I would say that it is nice. Just some pointers: Cleanliness: very clean. As noted by other reviewers, staff were always cleaning the public areas. We even saw two women mopping outside under a balcony while it was raining! Food: the main buffet we thought was great and ate there for every meal except for one night at Chili's, where I had the tenderloin and lobster tail...melt in your mouth steak. On a side note, there were a few stray cats begging for food by the tables which I, as a cat lover, didn't mind and probably encouraged by giving some morsels away to one who waited patiently at my feet. My spouse, who hates cats, was not so amused. It is an outdoor restaurant, on the beach. The lunch buffet there was also good too. Room: nice. I loved the jacuzzi tub, but as others noted, the water temp in the shower was sporadic during peak times. Be careful if you have children and you allow them to shower because the temp is way, way, way too hot at times. Better luck using the tub, in my opinion. The balconies and patios are pretty private, with high walls between, which is always nice. We never received towel animals or turn-down service during our stay, although we left a tip every morning of $3 (maybe not enough?)...the room staff seemed like they were short-staffed or something. Beach: nicest in the immediate area, as far as I could tell, but we only walked south a ways to the RIU Yucatan. The sand "whales" are ugly, but the water itself was that gorgeous shade(s) of blue, so we didn't mind. Room service: used that every night. was just ok. very small menu and not the best of food, but we were usually too tired by then to care. Try to hit the buffett before they close at night. Bars/nightlife: We did see the Michael Jackson show, was pretty good impression of him, and the dancers were very good. The sports bar was nice for my spouse so he could get his sports fix, but I liked the ambience of the lobby area more. The red wine at the main buffet is very, very smooth...wish I had thought to ask what it was. Playa del Carmen: We took a cab in and back, very efficient. We just walked 5th Avenue. We both thought it was interesting and unique, but both of us disliked some of the vendors who were very pushy. If you're like me and have a hard time with seeming impolite, practice saying "no, no, no..." or you will be dragged into shops. I even had vendors physically blocking my exit, I felt, to keep me in their shop. I liked the bigger shops, where you are left alone, and I'm always amused by Mexican pharmacies, so that was fun. Overall: My spouse liked the resort very much, but it was his first all-inclusive and first trip to Mexico. I would go there again, but I would like to check out other places also.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: HANDSCardiff
Reviews.Content: The staff were great, very friendly and as stated earlier a small tip of 50 pesos smoothes the wheels and means you get fantastic service. Previous reviews have noted this , but then they say they did not tip the staff themselves . Doh ! The building is very grand beautifully maintained and very clean. The food is very good and if you can make the effort of walking 50 metres then you can book one of the restaurants. Krystal and the Mexican were the best , the Brazilian was the worst and is to be avoided. I can recommend the soups which are always available at all restaurants. The rooms are fine , as in all hotels the location of some rooms are inevitably going to be better than others . Rooms towards the sea and overlooking the plaza on the upper floor can be recommended. Keep the balcony doors closed and the air conditioning on at all times and the mouldy smell which was present when we entered the room went very quickly. It is a warm humid climate !!! I have enjoyed reading some of the whinging reviews written by people who were at the hotel during our stay. We stayed at the hotel for two weeks , therefore we may have rested longer and chilled a little more than the short break folk who seem to have had a totally different holiday to the majority of people who were there at the same time. Overall all the staff tried very hard to make our stay enjoyable, every member of staff always say Ola . Treat them with respect and they will become your friends , talk to them and you will be the wiser . Many of the staff have Mayan heritage of which they are very proud.The Mayans used to use chickens as currency - the Mayan word for a chicken is k'ash , which we know as cash ! The trip to Coba we organised by taxi ourselves by organising with a taxi outside the hotel the day before we wanted to go , it cost $100 , we went to Coba , got ourselves a native local guide inside the gates , he was born and bred there he was 73 years old and was fantastic and cost 300 pesos.On the way back our taxi took us to a great beach bar at Paraiso , which was a lovely spot. We did not fancy the 7 hour round trip on a coach so we flew up to Chichen Itza which was a 1.5 hour round trip. Also we got there nice and early and missed the crowds!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: jr1992
Reviews.Content: This resort is a wonderful place to stay. Here is a list of all the great reasons there are to stay here. -The food is great. There are 5 different restaurants and a buffet and all have excellent food. There is a very large selection and the buffet and the food is made fresh, area kept clean, and nice atmosphere. -The service is unbeatable. All the people helping, either cleaning the rooms, helping with check in, or serving food and drinks, were always working very hard and being extremely friendly. If you ever needed anything, it was easy to get help and they would get it done quickly. -Everything is kept very clean. Everyday they did deep cleaning on everything. The walkways, beach, restaurants, bars, and hotel rooms were kept very clean. -They had different activities to participate in or watch on each day. -The beach is beautiful and the swimming pool area are both very nice with a swim up bar at the pool. -The bed is comfortable and the room is very clean and has a pretty good amount of space. - The resort is only about a mile from town so one can easily walk in if they want to shop. - They do have free wireless internet services but you have to be in the main lobby area to use it. If you want it in your room you have to pay for it. - This is more of a review of the area but there are many different attractions to see (Tulum, Chitchen Itza, etc.) and they do sell trips to the different ones in the lobby. They are a bit more expensive in the lobby than in town but that way they pick you up right in the lobby and drop you off there which can be convenient. ONLY TWO COMPLAINTS: - The shower's water temperature would not stay constant if showering at a time when many other people are showering. (sunrise, sunset) The temperature would be constantly going from cold to hot the entire time. It wasn't happening rapidly so one could step in and out without getting cold but it was frustrating. -This complaint is not from me, but one of the people in our group was discontent because the only beer that they offered was Dos Equis. I was usually drinking mixed drinks so this did not bother me and they had a good supply of different kinds and brands of hard alcohol and the help made any drink you could think of.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: ElizabethS8
Reviews.Content: I read many reviews on Trip Advisor when I chose the resort and before we travelled. I have absolutely no complaints about the staff, resort, food or entertainment. ...OK maybe one comment, the evening entertainment could have offered a little bit more variety but that's all because the standard of the entertainment was very good. There are things to do out of the resort (and in other hotels in the RIU group that are next door, nearby) and it's very safe. Fito, the guy who served us at the pool bar and on the beach was a cool guy...so are the water sports team...they have some really good deals!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER! Honeymoon from hell. Infested with bugs.”
Reviews.Author: lpm1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went in October of 2008 for our honeymoon. Checked in our room smelled like mold and everyhing (even the bed) was wet and moist feeling. They gave us a new room....now I wish I stayed in the 1st room.....INFESTED WITH BUGS (and also everything in the room felt WET!!!!!) They told us room service would spray ....Never came. Everything about this hotel was terrible. I swear we not hard people to please. They did noting for us wouldnt even give us a new room. WE left after 2 days (Paid for 8!!!) Please look at pics. Still fighting today for some money back! You had to wait on long lines everyday to book dinner Food was ok

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort! I want to go back now!”
Reviews.Author: europrince
Reviews.Content: I am very diligent in my research and chose this resort, regardless of the unfounded negative reviews on here. I wanted the best resort in my price range that was walking distance or a short drive to Playa del Carmen. Wow, were we impressed. My wife has travelled extensively and was thoroughly impressed with the entire experience. She was pleasantly surprised at how many staff spoke english, and well at that! We checked in late on Saturday, November 28th for a 7 day stay. The hotel was at capacity, so we got a ground level garden view room. We upgraded to a second level courtyard view room on Monday. The view was fabulous. We had views of the pool area and the terrace patio. The beds were hard, but we sleep on a hard bed at home and prefer that over a pillow-like mattress. It's good for your back, remember. There is a bar rail in the room, but we only used it when we got there and once more. There are bars everywhere and who wants to stay in their room? The breakfast buffet was great with sufficient variety for everyone. We found the coffee to be horrid, however. There is a Starbucks 5 minutes down the street for those who want it. We just 'settled' for a mamosa or two everyday :) The lunch buffet was great. There was enough there for me to like to avoid having to eat what I didn't like. I especially liked the serving station in the middle, where the guy made wonderful tacos and freshly tossed, customized seafood salads. His dish changed every day. The pool bar and wait staff..what can I say. They were fabulous and always a hoot. Word to the wise: bring your own large, insulated coffee mugs. It will save you from going to the bar frequently. We drank our Mojitos in the coffee mugs, and had sufficient quantity to walk the beach and refill at Riu Playacar or Riu Palace Mexico. We personally found the Mojitos better from the guy at the beach bar at Riu Palace Mexico, but it's all good :) The beach was fantastic. We spent most of our time on the lower beach, as there isn't much room on the upper beach that isn't obstructed by palm trees. For those wanting shade, lying under a palm and reading a book while hearing the waves is a wonderful experience. You will see some topless women on the lower beach and at other resorts we walked past. What's wrong with a little European? We only spent the first full day at the pool area. We found it a bit loud with kids and activities and preferred the beach. The well located loungers get reserved very early, so you must be an early riser for a good spot. The dinner reservation system needs improvement. Who wants to line up between noon and 3 to make reservations? You've paid to be in the sun, not be indoors. At the very least, they should move it to a morning slot, let's say 9am. My wife stayed in the sun and I got there at 11:30 to beat the rush. I was in the first five every time. I say the men should suck it up and do the deed while the women stay in the sun. Krystal is by far the best restaurant there. It books up the quickest, as a result. Eating there three times, we had pretty much the entire menu. The beef tenderloins are to die for. The tuna on hummus was very good, but could be cut thicker. The shrimp ravioli and Chillean sea bass were both great. We would go there every night if they had a larger menu. The Japanese place was good. I found the sushi to be acceptable, but hey, this is a Mexico all-inclusive, not some fine restaurant in Canada or the U.S.. My beef dish was very good. The steak house is apparantly the second most popular, but I found the steaks to be unexceptional. My lobster tail was overcooked and difficult to scoop out. The side dishes of fries and ceasar salad were unimaginative. Again, it's an all inclusive, not a fine dining restaurant. We didn't bother with the Mexican and Brazilian restaurants, but were told the Mexican is good and not to bother with the Brazilian. We did a lot of walking on the beach, and checked out all the other Rius, as we had free access. Riu Palace Mexico is essentially the same blue print, but on a smaller scale. The pool area is broken up and underutilized by patrons. Everyone there was on the beach, and what a walk to the beach! Wow! Make sure you don't forget anything in your room, or it's a long trek. As such, our Palace is better. Plus, its newer. The other Rius don't even compare to RPRM. We spent one evening just walking at Playa Del Carmen. Although friends absolutely love 5th Avenue, we found it a bit tacky, reminding us of typical tourist oriented shops selling tacky stuff to tourists, like Clifton Hill in Niagara Falls. Next time, we'll try a restaurant or bar, but really, can it compare to Krystal and the experience at RPRM? Just my humble opinion. Would we go back? Definately! Without a doubt. Is it worth spending a little more than for the other Rius? Definately! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Dream wedding and vacation in one.”
Reviews.Author: BAHooper
Reviews.Content: Before visiting the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, I read alot of the negative reviews on this site. This worried me, especially since my hunsband and my families were accompanying us on this vacation. I picked the place and it would have been all my fault if this place had turned out to be a dump. But, I ended up being a hero! The Riu Riviera Maya is AWESOME. The service was outrageously wonderful. Of course a couple of dollars here and there went very far with them. To those who comment the service was bad - I honestly think you got the wrong resort on your review. Many reported that there was a "musty" smell - but I'm pretty sure they must have stayed at the Riu Palace "Mexico" - which, while still nice was not like the Riviera Maya. We visited the Riu Palace Mexico and definitely noticed the smell right away. On the contrary, the Riviera Maya smells like oxygen and roses - if that makes sense. If you stay at the Riviera Maya, you get to visit and eat at the other Riu resorts which are all lined up on the beach - each walking distance on the road or beach. The buffet was nice. Some reviews said the food was just "ok". That depends on what you like. They serve a variety of foods to appeal to both American, Mexican, German and British clients - and some Americans might not be too keen on the German and British fare. I'm American and my husband's family is all British - we all LOVED the food, though. The beach was glorious. I don't know what people were talking about when they suggested that water shoes were a must - a "must" for who? My feet were fine...the entire 10 days we were there. The entertainment was entertaining. I wasn't expecting a "Vega" show - so maybe that's why I wasn't dissatisfied like some of the other reviews I read. The only negative review I can agree with is that the beds are hard. But, then some people like that... All in all - we will return. And hopefully with my family again soon - it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!! Riu never lets us down!!!”
Reviews.Author: CONatureGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 fabulous days here the week of Thanksgiving and had a great time!!! Staff: extremely friendly and accommodating! Quick check-in and every time we needed something they responded quickly. We had a plumbing issue in our bathroom and they responded within 5 minutes of us calling them. Never had any trouble getting drinks or service in the restaurants...there were a couple of times when it took longer, but we understand we are not the only guests in the hotel and don't expect to be waited on hand and foot. Entertainment is typical resort entertainment...they brought a few vendors to the resort to sell stuff. You're much better off going into town or down the street to the little market to buy souveniers, prices are better. We watched the Mayan show and the Mariachi show and both were entertaining and fun. Please tip the staff...they work very hard and deserve it very much. I have worked in the hospitality industry and can tell you it is NOT an easy job pleasing people! Pool: awesome!!! There is a big pool with an infinity pool above it, and the swim up bar. We enjoyed just lounging by the side, they had a few activities and a volleyball net. Good service at the pool for drinks, etc. Always greeted with a friendly "hola"! Clean and the water was just the right temperature...very refreshing after laying in the hot sun. Beach: awesome!!! I was worried that the sandbags would ugly up the beach and limit access to the water, but it wasn't like that at all. There were always a ton of sea birds hanging out on the sandbags and the occasional pelican or two! I did miss being able to play in the larger waves, but no complaints. Water was warm and beautiful, and there were even some little fish swimming around out by the sandbags that would swim right around your feet. Food: typical buffet food you would expect at an all-inclusive. Remember they are feeding large quantities of people so the food is not going to be gourmet. Never had a problem finding food that we liked...and the pico de gallo and guac were so yummy! Lots of fresh fruit and veggies and awesome desserts. Breakfasts were exceptional, the omelet station was nice, and always a good variety of food...and fresh fruit smoothies!!! We ate at two a la cartes...Krystal and the Rodizio. Both were good...if you go to Krystal you MUST EAT the passion fruit bon bon...best thing ever! The chocolate cake dessert was very rich. Rooms: very nice, we weren't in our rooms much anyway. There is a musty smell, but it's that way at any beach area due to the humidity. Not a big deal. Balcony was nice, we could sit out there and overlook the resort. The only drawback was that our room was right above the courtyard and the nightly entertainment was very loud...and went until about 11 p.m. But we accepted that and didn't request to move...we're pretty content travelers. We did have towel animals and turn down service a few nights, very nice touch! They even brought us new towels with chocolates one night. Other: we went to Cozumel one day to snorkel and I would highly recommend using Eagle Ray Divers! It only ended up being my husband and I and one other couple...so nice to go with a small group. It was pretty much an all day event, we got to snorkel for about two hours on an uncrowded reef. Our guide, Said, was amazing and showed us lots of cool stuff. Highly recommended, and not overcrowded on a big, speeding boat like a lot of snorkel tours...it was very leisurely and fun. Afterward, they took us to the Money Bar Beach Club right on the shore and lunch was included. Best food we had the entire trip...highly recommend the chicken tacos and the steak burrito. YUM! All in all another great stay...we have also stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico down the road, and the Riu Club Hotel Negril in Jamaica. Love the Riu and we always have a great time when staying at their properties!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: KateLouise275
Reviews.Content: Overall we thought this was an excellent place to stay and we were more than happy with the experience - but we do agree with a few of the negative comments made - see below. On the positive side, the hotel is very luxurious and clean. The staff can't do enough for you (and this is despite the fact that we did not tip any of them until the last day). The main buffet was good - sometimes some of the items were a bit hit and miss but there is so much to choose from it really doesn't matter. The reservations system worked well (although perhaps that's because we were there for 2 weeks - I can see how it becomes a problem if you are only there for a few nights). Krystal was the best - in terms of both food and service. The others were ok - mexican was good, the others were not quite so good but still worth the experience. Some of it did replicate the main buffet food but just in a more intimate setting. Room service was great. Yes, the choice was a bit limited but the quality was high and the food/drinks delivered were plentiful. Always delivered on time and with a smile. Staff more than happy to deliver bottles of wine to the room. Mini bar was handy and stocked regularly. Room was turned down every night (except the few nights we stayed in). Room was cleaned to a high standard every day. Everything was on hand - not far at all to walk to any of the amenities. We had an outward facing room - balcony overlooking the next door property. Not the best view, but more than aceptable, particularly given that we didn't upgrade the room option. Front desk staff were more than helpful. We needed replacement wristbands, room key cards and change on a couple of occasions and they were great. We also cheekily asked them to make our restaurant reservations for us on the days we were away from the hotel and they did so (without being tipped!). Room quickly got damp due to humidity but only if we were daft enough to leave the balcony door open! Provided we left it closed and left the (highly efficient) AC on, the room was perfect. Xel-Ha was a nice day out - we saved a lot by organising this from a stand on 5th avenue (Eagle Rider/Ricardo - recommended) - we paid $90 each. Our Thomson rep wanted $119 each. The entertainment in the hotel was good. The entertainment staff never seemed to stop! Some of the shows were a bit predictable but some of them (especially the Michael Jackson tribute!) were brilliant. There was also loads of stuff going on during the day but only if you chose to get involved, we didn't. Plenty of loungers always available both by the pool and on the beach. On the slightly more negative side, my partner tells me that the matresses were too hard (I liked them!) and it did seem to us that the beach bar staff operated on a tips basis. We didn't tip and he made it obvious he wouldn't be bringing us any more drinks! This was the only occasion of this. We also noticed them taking bribes in exchange for drinks/food from other beach sellers (especially when the beach/mobile bar was in operation). Note that there is very little hassle from beach sellers generally. I was only approached a couple of times and they just walked on by with no fuss. My partner booked a pack of 8 dives with the 'Scuba Caribe' outfit on the hotel beach and was disapointed with the experience. He has dived all around the world and never experienced such problems/hassle with entry and exits from the water/dive boats. Really quite dangerous - especially when the sea is rough/choppy. The dive staff were friendly and the Cenotes dive was good (although operated by another company) - it's just that the Scuba Caribe facilites and equipment don't make overall for a very pleasant experience. We did a day trip on the ferry to Cozumel - not the best use of time. Although it's a nice place, the whole of the town is really just shop after shop selling the same junk to tourists/visitors from the cruise ships. So, unless you are going to hire a car and get out of the town, I wouldn't bother. We intended to hire a car and booked one in advance but on arriving to collect (Rooster car rental) were told that no matter what we paid for in terms of insurance, we would never be 100% covered. The best they could offer was 80% (which we thought was insufficient, given that he told us the vehicle was worth some 80,000 pesos!). We therefore left the car and walked around the town instead. Shame, but in our view, not worth the risk. Perhaps other companies would be more helpful -but definitely worth checking this out in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed relaxing at Riu”
Reviews.Author: KGE
Reviews.Content: My review is a total contrast to the previous one, especially since the title was 'Worst Hotel Experience EVER!' I still don't understand what qualified it for that distinction, we must have been at different hotels. Anyways, onto my review. This is the 2nd 'All Inclusive' I've been to, the first was Sandos Playacar Riviera last year (check out my review of that place). We would have gone back to Sandos but found a great deal for Riu so decided to try that, plus we would have access to all other Riu properties in Playcar. We stayed a total of 3 nights. We checked in early (~12pm), which wasn't an issue, they just kept our bags until our room was ready and let us head out to the resort. We also used that time to book our restaurant reservations. Nothing was available the 1st night so we booked for the following 2 nights. A nice thing to note was that no time share agents were in the lobby like there were at Sandos, it was a easy check in process. As was the case with Sandos, the grounds and buildings were in great shape, very clean, well kept, the gardens, lawns and water features all maintained well. The pool area was large, plenty of chairs, as well as in the large palm-shaded beach area. The beach was nice, wide, plenty of room to move around and enjoy the water and sand. There were also hammocks under some of the palm trees, great for an afternoon nap. Beach-side waiters weren't out in force so you didn't always have a drink handy, but i didn't mind the 10-20 meter walk to the bar at the pool to get my own drink! The bar tenders, although very busy at times, were happy and helpful, made drinks as requested and a few seemed to enjoy themselves quite a bit, having fun and kidding around with some of the guests. I never had to wait long for a drink and sometimes got 2 of what i ordered. The crowd was pretty laid back, mainly older european couples, very few kids. This place does not have a 'party' atmosphere, much more relaxed. I found the food to be quite good. Plenty of selection at the buffets, dishes constantly being made, refreshed. I found that the cooks were happy to cook something up for you to your preferences if you liked, e.g eggs to order, toasted sandwiches, pasta dishes, tostadas, queadillas, etc. Lots of salads and fruits. Different things were served during lunch and dinner. I love to eat and always found something I liked that was of good quality, no complaints at all. The restaurants were ok, the Japanese was my least favorite, just not of the same quality as you'd expect from a good Japanese restaurant in the states for example. The mexican restaurant was pretty good, and the margharita they offered as you entered was a nice touch. I just like the casual atmosphere of the buffets, the wider selection and variety. The service was top notch as well. Staff were very helpful and friendly, appreciative of any attempts to speak spanish. Similar experience as I had at Sandos although I'd have to say the food at Riu was a bit better quality. We also got to eat at the other Palace resort, the Mexico, and found it to be pretty good as well. Our rooms were well appointed and comfortable, spotlessly clean. The bed was on the firm side as is usually expected in this part of Mexico for some reason. Included was a well stocked mini bar with beer and soft drinks and water along with a 4-bottle dispenser of various liquors. We ordered room service once and it arrived quickly. The room service menu is somewhat limited, but hard to imagine you'd rely on just room service with the selection of food available during the day at the buffets and restaurants. I can't comments on phone or internet service as I didn't use them, I was on vacation :) I did note that there was internet available in the lobby and also at the sports bar for a fee, as was also the case at Sandos. More affordable internet access is readily available in Playa at many internet cafes, along with callings services. The only negative I can think of was the pretty ordinary gym that they had. Very basic hotel like, not much in the way of weight equipment and limited cardio. Sandos had a very nice gym with hot tub, pool, steam room etc. All in all an enjoyable stay at The Riu Palace Riviera. Great value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: trevorsmommy3
Reviews.Content: Ah, where do I start... from the very beginning this hotel was a nightmare and proceeded to ruin our vacation. 1. All-Inclusive. The room service consists of 5 items (all bad except the nachos). You can only book a reservation at one of the restaurants between 12pm-3pm IN PERSON which means if you have plans during the day or just want to relax by the pool then you have to go to the lobby to make your reservation and hope there's a spot open. We were too lazy/busy doing other things to do this so I don't know if we would have been able to get one if we had. The restaurants seem popular since the buffet which is the only other option is HORRIBLE!! 2. Room Comfort. NOT!!! The A/C unit barely worked and it felt humid and the sheets felt wet the whole time. The bed and TV are not across from each other so if you want to relax in bed and watch TV like most people then you actually have to rearrange the furniture. Housekeeping also sucked since we noticed a pair of red lace thong panties in the closet which did NOT belong to me (see attached photo). GROSS!!! Mattress was uncomfortable. Iron left white paint chips on clothes. Temperature in shower went from scalding to cold quickly. 3. Can't use a calling card from the hotel room phone. We actually had to walk down the street to a noisy shopping area to make calls home or pay $2 a minute. Not convenient at all. There are resorts in Mexico that actually have free calls to the US from your hotel room phone. Definitely going to stay at one of those places next time. 4. Internet. THERE IS NOT AN OPTION TO ACCESS INTERNET FROM YOUR LAPTOP IN YOUR ROOM!!!!!! This is kind of a big deal for us since we both are self-employed and need email for our business. You have to go to the lobby and use the free wireless internet there. ARGHHHHHH! I've been to Mexico before and stayed at the Sun Palace and LOVED it! If this was my only experience I would probably not like Mexico at all. Do not ever book a stay here! You could not pay me to go back to this place and NO ONE looked happy.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantistic Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: riupalace
Reviews.Content: Just got back from two wonderful weeks, we could not find fault with this hotel, we have stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico which we love, the RPRM is even better, we would go back in a heartbeat but will have to wait until next year. This is the fourth time in Playacar and love the location to Play del Carmen and the wonderful beach and fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Service, Location was Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: pejman50
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my parents and brother. We stayed the week of thanksgiving for a total of 4 nights. We were amazed at the level of service we got, amazing service, very nice staff, and perfect location. This hotel is perfect for anyone looking for a relaxing vacation, family oriented hotel, and great service and food. The food in the buffet was amazing, nice staff, and a lot of activities. Walking distance to Playa Del Carmen downtown, very nice staff. We used American Express shuttle service, and took a tour to Tulum, it was perfect, and they were great. I highly recommend using American Express services. Don’t buy any timeshares when you get off the flight, just come to this hotel and enjoy. We visited all the Palaces from RIU in this compound and by far Riviera Maya is the best. Even the others were amazing with good food, staff and location. I will definitely revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: twji
Reviews.Content: My two sons, 18 and 19 and I stayed here for 3 nites during Thanksgiving week. The hotel was luxurious. In like-new condition. The rooms were excellent. We had two adjoining rooms with courtyard views. I walked the beach and looked at several of the nearby hotels and this was by far the nicest of the Riu hotels in the area. I don't believe this hotel was much more money than the others. Food was excellent in the buffets. Ate at the Brazian steakhouse which was above average. Staff was outstanding. Used Best Day for shuttle to and from the airport($190 round trip for VIP service which maybe was not nessesary) which was about 1 hour each way. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent holiday”
Reviews.Author: chrisat45
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 2 week stay at this wonderful holiday location. Free upgrade for everyone arriving with us. Lovely large clean rooms with well stocked bar that was restocked daily. Turn down service on a night was a nice touch. The food was great loads of choice at all meals and sncks available 24/7 in the sports bar. The staff were good if you tipped but equally good if you didnt.No pressure. Beach was great and the sand things actually added to the fun when the waves broke over them. Had a great holiday, weather also good.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was still there!”
Reviews.Author: elfgrl17
Reviews.Content: We had a 5-day stay at the Riu Riviera Maya, and it definitely wasn't long enough. I had stayed at the Riu Santa Fe in Cabo San Lucas a couple years ago, so I knew the Riu would be nice, but the "palace" version was definitely worth the extra money. Rooms--We booked through Funjet and upgraded to a garden-view room. The rooms were nice and clean, and the mini-bar was great. We tipped a couple days, but it didn't seem to matter. They still stocked 2 or 3 beers each day. I'm sure you could call and ask for more, but we weren't in the room much. The view of the courtyard was gorgeous, and we could see the pool and a little bit of the ocean. We were close to the courtyard and entertainment, which was loud until 11 or 12 every night, but we stay up late, so it was no problem. Entertainment--The entertainment was actually pretty good. They had a couple dancing shows and one night had some kind of arial acrobatic show outside. The bartender at the bar in the entertainment area is named Quique, and he's great! We sat in the courtyard area and drank and watched the entertainment almost every night. The cocktail waiters and waitresses are great, and we never waited long with an empty glass. Food--Breakfast and lunch buffets were good. The food was comparable to the Riu Santa Fe, but at the palace there is wine with dinner and mimosas with breakfast. We only ate at the dinner buffet once. We ate at 2 of the restaurants, "Krystal" and "Chilis Steakhouse." Reservations are a pain, and when we went to make them, Krystal was full; however, my boyfriend found that tipping the reservation lady magically opened up a spot at Krystal. Not sure if the tip was worth it. The tapas at Krystal were good, and the service was excellent, but the food was just okay. We hit up the buffet afterwards. The Steakhouse food was better (my steak was cooked perfectly), and the service was excellent, but I'm not sure it's worth making the reservation. It's a nice change from the buffet, so if you get a reservation, fine, but don't be upset if you can't get one. 24-hour room service is included, but there aren't a lot of options. You can get a piece of chocolate cake at any time though, and that was nice! There are 24-hour snacks somewhere, but we never looked for them. Beach--Beautiful!!!!! Plenty of loungers available. There are also waiters coming around taking drink orders, but they're pretty busy, so it was easier to just go to the pool bar. The sand was nice, and the water was pretty calm. The sand-bag things aren't too unsightly. They really don't look man-made. Pool--Beautiful!...but we're beach people, so didn't spend much time there. Excursions--"5th avenue" is a 20-min walk or a $5 taxi ride. Lots of restaurants and shopping (the same stuff they sell everywhere). We ate at La Pallia, and it was okay. It's a cool area to go to one night. In the opposite direction from the hotel is "Plaza Playacar" which is only a 10-minute walk. They have some shopping there, an ATM, and a Starbucks. We booked a couple excursions through Funjet/ Lomas Travel rep at hotel. The first was a sunset lobster dinner cruise, and it was AMAZING! The van picked us up and took us to the El Dorado Maroma resort (hope to stay there someday) where we went on a sunset cruise on a catamaran with a bunch of other couples. Champagne, beer, cocktails, and canopes were served on the boat. The music was a weird mix of wedding reception-type music, but we were entertained. The staff were great! Once we got back, they had tables set up on the beach that were partitioned off in these cabana-type things. It was so romantic. The food was great and the service was great!!! I highly recommend this excursion! The other excursion we booked was a tour to Chichin-Itza (mayan ruins). It was a looooong day. We started out at 8 am, and didn't get back until 730pm. We spend half that time on the bus. If you want to see the ruins, I would recommend renting a car and going yourself or booking a private tour. We had many drop offs/ pick ups at other hotels and other unnecessary tour stops (like lunch that wasn't very good). A half-day tour would have been better. I was nervous about the negative reviews, but I was completely satisfied with my stay at the Riu. The front desk was always helpful. Our safe needed to be reset so we could set our own code, and they came up and fixed it right away. The housekeepers don't speak English very well at all, but they will find someone who does if you're trying to communicate with them. I recommened tipping...even just 20 or 50 pesos. While it is all-inclusive, we tipped our bartenders, housekeepers, and waiters, and you can tell it was much-appreciated. Have a great time! (Feel free to contact me with any questions.)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the staff expects tips. Bring tip money if you want service. Food was hit or miss.”
Reviews.Author: albutt27
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying I am HIlton Diamond Status and Starwood Platinum as I stay in over 100 nights of hotels each year. We booked a 6 night stay at the RIU Palace after getting a good travel package. Checked in around 5 PM and was given probably the WORST hotel room. We were next to the service door over looking the tennis court. I knew this would be bad, but we gave it one night's shot. I woke up the next morning hearing lots of noise and my back had a knot from the hard beds. We asked to change rooms and we were given a room much closer to the beach, however it was a smoking room. We decided we'll just take this as the location was great and it didn't smell too bad. The food at the buffet was terrible. I would rather pay to go into town to have something decent. This was one of the worst meals I've ever had. However, after making reservations at the Mexican, Steakhouse, Japanese, and Krystal - we enjoyed eating at the hotel. Our favorites were Krystal, Mexican, Steakhouse, and Japanese in that order. You need to make reservations in advance and I noticed that people were pulling tricks to get multiple reservations. Krystal is really good, I will say that. I did notice that the restaurants we ate at were only half full, yet they were 100% booked. I think this is to keep costs down because the service and quality is 10x better. Lunch we ate at Chili's, and that was hit or miss. Some days they would have pretty good food, the other days it was bleh. The pool and beach was outstanding. We lucked out and had sunshine throughout the trip. As for the staff bringing you drinks, they will if you tip them. However, I gave this one guy $5 and said it was the tip for the day, and he didn't bother coming back after he delivered our first round of drinks. I think the servers stereotype who to look for when serving drinks so they'll get a tip. They did not bring any food down as other people have said in the past. Also, the first day we didn't tip this one server as we thought it was included and he didn't serve us anything the next day. He would walk over to all the tables in the courtyard and bypass us. As you can see, they have their hands reaching out for money. Overall the hotel is pretty nice. The pool needs a real jacuzzi. I would defintely visit Playa del Carmen again but I'm not sure if I would stay at the RIU Palace as if this is their flagship hotel it didn't deliver. The staff was good but if you tip them. It's about 15 minute walk into town which we did a few days of the week.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel...but....”
Reviews.Author: lucy55newyork
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very beautiful tastefully done. the staff was excellent. constantly cleaning. restaurant service was great very attentive. the food was very mediocre but lots of it. the drinks were also very mediocre all this could be overlooked because the hotel is so pretty and so it the beach except that our beds were the most uncomfortable that i have ever slept in. they were extremely hard and the matresses must have had a plastic cover on them under the bedding cause every time you moved or turned the bed made that crunching sound -very uncomfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great beach!”
Reviews.Author: majmatt
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights here to attend a friend's wedding on the property. First, the wedding: the staff did an excellent job and our friends said the planning was fine. As for the pool and beach... they were excellent. The beach is wider and better than anything we have seen farther north in Cancun. It was our first time in Playa del Carmen though, so we can't compare to any other property there. The food was fine... about what you would expect for an all-inclusive. Drinks were watered down... again, about what you would expect for an all-inclusive. The staff is what makes this property stand out... everyone was extremely friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful (Gluten Free Accomodation)”
Reviews.Author: ExcelTrip
Reviews.Content: I want to assure anyone out there who subscribes to a gluten-free diet that the professional staff at RIU Palace Riviera Maya will do absolutely everything to accommodate you. My wife and I traveled with our three year old child who has celiac. After informing the reception of our gluten-free needs, the director of public relations personally took us to the food and beverage director JJ who then daily had either himself or his supervisory staff review the items on the buffet and presented us with custom-made meals. On daily basis, we were asked what type of special meal can be crafted for us by the head chef. Everything was done with the most professional courteous black-tie service I have enjoyed at other finest hotels in the world. We will definitely come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “best time”
Reviews.Author: snymets
Reviews.Content: This place is great!! People are friendly and the food is terrific. From the moment I walked in this place I knew it would be a fun vacation. I had Victor from the sports bar pouring drinks to Sheyla the cocktail waitress serving drinks. I would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great food and staff”
Reviews.Author: erinstone
Reviews.Content: I got married last December at this hotel. The staff was incredible and the food was excellent. There was a wide selection of restaurants. They do require reservations, but there were 5 to choose from. We had no problem trying them all during our 7 day stay. My guests thought we chose a special menu for the dinner the night of the wedding, but we were ordering from their normal menu. The beach was very relaxing and had great drink service. I would not reccomend this hotel for kids or people looking to stay up late and party at the hotel. Downtown Playa is an easy 15-20 minute walk and has plenty of shopping, restaurants and entertainment. You can also take a taxi for $5 (one way). I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for an all inclusive resort with great food, drinks and service within walking distance to Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: tadv211
Reviews.Content: Great service at check-in, and all bars and restaurants. Great food - highly recommend Krystal and the Sea Bass. Japanese and Mexican restaurants also good, would return to these restaurants (only ones we visited). Great beach, lots of palm trees and shade. There were plenty of loungers available at any time of the day at both the pool & beach. Free WiFi in the lobby, so bring your laptop or you will have to pay a small fee to use their computers in the Sports Bar. Chocolate covered strawberries & champagne delivered to the room for a birthday celebration. Birthday song & cake received during our night at the Japanese restaurant. If you let them know you're celebrating a special occasion, they will go above and beyond. There's always someone offering you a drink. We were very spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Best so far!”
Reviews.Author: scheevers
Reviews.Content: I'm going to get right to the point. We were very impressed with Riu Palace Maya. Beatiful and clean. These people keep this place pretty much spotless! The rooms are nice and the stocked bar. The resort is beautiful and the beaches are the prettiest I've seen. We went thru a travel agent and everything was pretty well taken care of. She picked the resort and arranged all transfers to and from the hotel. Did not want to take care of any of that since I am not familiar with the area and don't speak Spanish. We are already planning a trip back and will be staying with Riu again. Another thing incase you don't already know this. There are like 4 Riu's around the area. So if you want to go to another one? You can. As long as you have your bracelet you can go check all of them out. All of them have something to offer and besides it's great walking the streets at night. This area is extremely safe and you will see people walking all over. Theres a small sections of shops a couple blocks from here, wait to spend your money on 5th Ave. You can take a Taxi for $5.00 to 5th Ave and shop. This area goes on and on. Night Clubs, Restaurants shops, you name it, its there. What I did learn is this. Stay somewhere at Playacar. You are like 20 min from Cancun. A 30 minute boat ride from Cozumel. 20 minutes from Meroma Beach for excursion's and 5 minutes from 5th Ave. This is a safe beautiful, convenient place to stay. You will not be disapointed

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: SeaRayBill
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a relaxing vacation, with great service, friendly people and spectacular views, this is it. We stayed just 5 days/4 nights at the end of October 2009, and we couldn't ask for more. We did arrive early at the resort and the room wasn't ready, but no problem.... we had a suits in our carryon, changed quickly and went right to the beach. The staff is amazing, so friendly, and thank you Jose, Charlie and Ramon for your excellent service! Food was good at the buffets, and restaurants. The room was very clean, yes, the beds are extremely hard, but we got used to it. Our view was on the second floor facing the hotel next door, no big deal, we didn't upgrade, but how much time are you really in your room? The resort is immaculate, the beach is great, and the "whales" out in the water were no big deal for us.Yes, there was a mild odor of seaweed, but it passes.( maybe being Floridians, and living on the Gulf, this was not an issue for us, compared to others). Entertainment was good, but we weren't there for that, we went for a relaxing vacation, and we got it! Just a tip........bypass everyone in "blue" at the airport when you are exiting, go right outside and look for Olympus Tours in the orange shirts. Olympus Tours were very friendly, timely, and prepare for an hour ride to and from the airport. All in all, we will return, and if you are looking for a beautiful resort with excellent service the Riu Palace Rivieria Maya is it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average food, very mixed service”
Reviews.Author: garpts
Reviews.Content: Hello - I tend to write long reviews, so if you want the summary skip to the bottom. If the review wasn't helpful, please send me a message as to what I could have done to make it better. I value the reviews from this site, and want to give back appropriately. My wife and I had been trying to get to Playa for a few years, we first were snubbed by Hurricane Wilma, then in May by the Swine Flu outbreak. The May situation moved us to Jamaica where we stayed in our first RIU, and we thought enough of it to try this property, the newest RIU in the Riveria Maya for a 5 night stay from Nov 1 - 6, booked through Delta Vacations, with Trafictours for transfers. First, if you are flying in on a high traffic day, expect to spend at least an hour at the airport for immigration and customs. Once through, we walked right past the time share guys who had many victims to choose from, and found our transfer service right past the bar outside the door. We chose a non-stop shared ride transfer, and due to the location of the resort that wasn't a bad idea. It's a good hour and a quarter minimum (we had a very fast driver) so not having to stop a bunch of times gave us more time to spend at the resort and less travel headaches. The resort is in a very secure area, with a gates at all access points to the entire neighborhood. We arrived and were able to check right in, it was about 3:00pm. Check In - At first, we were happy with the way things started. The woman who checked us in did so efficiently and we were on our way to the room, which we were under the impression it would be king bed, garden view (we had requested inside garden view) room. The room ended up overlooking the roof of the resort next door, with two twins pushed together. There was a half empty bottle of soda next to the door, and a previous guests shampoo in the shower. The worst part was the room smelled terribly of disinfectant. So - not happy with the room, we went back and were politely told that was the type we were going to get, but she offered to move us to a different room with the same make-up and view. We asked about moving on the inside, and this became an "upgrade" situation. She could move us to a room that we had expected, but it was $50 more per night. She gave us a key to look at it and it was what we had expected so we paid the money and took the room. Honestly, this would not have bothered me but the first couple we met had the same exact situation and she had argued about it and was moved to a similar room for no charge. I felt a bait and switch occurred, and I wasn't the only one. The Room, 2108 - The room we 'upgraded to' was very nice and clean, with no smell to it. The air works fine in the rooms as long as you keep the glass door shut. We didn't feel the bathroom was dark at all, and the mini-bar / fridge was stocked daily with water and diet pepsi, which we used mostly. The liquor dispenser had decent brands of alcohol. The toilet filled slowly, but overall water pressure was good. The shower had some MAJOR hot / cold fluctuations so be careful. We had a partial ocean view, which most rooms had on the east end of the complex on either side. Too far away to hear it. Maid service was good, we tip $5 a day and received towel animals most of the time and also a few extra towels. We had a sub one day and didn't get anything extra. We had turn down service 3 times in five nights, no ryme or reason. As stated elsewhere, the beds are very hard, even with the mattress pad I had trouble sleeping and slept on the pool lounger the last night on top of the mattress. The hall noise is very noticeable. The Food - we didn't care that much for it, and thought both the food quality and service from the RIU in Jamaica was better. We did enjoy the Mexican Buffet and thought the steak at Krystal was the best we experienced. We didn't see any difference in buffet quality / choice from the Clubhotel in Negril to the Palace line. We ate in town one night at the Blue Lobster, which was phenomenal. We did like that sandwiches and fruit were available 24 hours at the Sports Bar. The Bars - We spent a lot of time in the sports bar for football and the world series, and thought Victor gave the best service in the resort so we tipped him very well. The wait staff at the pool and near beach were good, but the bartenders in the pool bar were not friendly, even after a tip. The lobby bar was also nice, and we did like that there were extra wait staff at the Palace as opposed to the Clubhotel. We did not see one show, so I don't know about the other bars. Drinks were mostly poured well. We had Don Julio margaritas which have spoiled all other future margaritas, and the mojitos were also very tasty. The Spa - we had a spa credit and I had a deep tissue and spouse tried aromotherapy. I would not have done the massage without the credit, there are other great massage places in Playa like Veronica's that are less than half the cost. The only thing I didn't like, and another couple we talked with agreed is that they use A LOT of oil for the massage. My wife thought the aromatherapy was okay, but was just a message with scented oils and she expected incense or candles, something more. The Beach - It's a great beach, way better than Negril, and better than most of the other RIU's down the way. The water is a mixed bag - very clear, nothing to look at snorkeling, feels clean, but the sand whales are close to shore so it's not open. You can swim anywhere though so if you walk a short ways down the beach it's more open. We only saw one beach vendor and he didn't bother us. No problem getting loungers at the beach or pool. Some people reserved early, but not enough to be a problem for those of us who follow the rules. Check-out - took about 30 seconds. One thing, if you're leaving on a low traffic day and your transfer service tells you that you need to be at the airport 2.5 hours early, they are wrong! We spent 15 minutes going through the lines at the airport leaving on a Friday morning, and over two hours waiting for our plane. If you can find out what the traffic is like, plan accordingly. We could have eaten breakfast and walked the beach before we left if we had known. I would recommend buying your take home alcohol at the airport in the duty free, it's much less expensive than we saw in town. We had very poor weather for 3 out of our 5 nights, as there was some hurricane influenced rain and thunderstorms that went through. The grounds absorbed the water well, but the building already has some major leaks, one in the south end of the lobby was so bad they had to set-up a gutter system. Even with that humidity our room was fine and our clothes did not smell when we got home. We walked downtown and it took about 20 minutes to get to 5th avenue and Calle 12, which is around the heart of the tourist area. Shopping is less expensive there than on the resort or the mall down the street, but not enough to pay for a cab there and back. SUMMARY Check-in - Okay, but if you don't like your room keep an eye out for the bait and switch. My wife throught the front desk staff were awful, but I thought they were just indifferent. Room - Our final room was great. No real problems other than the hard bed and occasional scalding water in the shower. I would recommend requesting a 2nd floor room, facing the pool area if possible. Never hurts to leave a tip for the housekeeper, but keep in mind it will not always be the same person. Expect to hear people breathing in the hall, sound carries very well. If you're a light sleeper, ear plugs would be a good idea. Food - from poor to excellent. Buffet was good on Mexican night, Krystal was great, the Mexican restaurant food was not as good as the Mexican night buffet food. Lunch and breakfast are okay, but the same choices for the most part each day. Bars - Never had a problem getting a drink! Service at the pool by waitstaff was great, bartenders not so great. Victor in the sports bar was our favorite. Lobby bar was nice, and they have servers out there a well which is better than regular RIU's. Activities - we did nothing but relax, however we did hear that the people that did them enjoyed them. I would have snorkeled on the resort trip, which is 1.5 hours daily at 1:00 but the weather prohibited it, parasailing was $120 for two people, which is way too high. Spa - you would do better to go into town unless you have a spa credit. Beach - very nice beach, clean water, no good snorkeling at the resort, nice walk down to the other RIU's. Check-out - quick and easy. Remember your towel cards. If we go back to Playa, we would consider staying again if we choose to stay at an all inclusive. The location is great, the beach is great and the pool was also the best we saw of the other RIU's. The food and some service issues could improve, but we didn't feel they were deal breakers. Thanks for reading, and let me know if you have any questions or input.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mvw0fa
Reviews.Content: To give you some basic background - I went with 2 other female friends. I have stayed at RIU in Cabo (nothing to complain about) and my friend stayed at a RIU in Jamaica (also nothing to complain about). We were looking for a beautiful place to stay that was all-inclusive (we did a lot of research), and had a great beach. The RIU had the best price and was a great location so we booked it. Our arrival - The RIU was absolutely beautiful. We had no problems checking in other than our room wasn't ready for a 1/2hr (not a big deal at all). The room - The room was very clean and was true to the pictures. It was stocked and cleaned everyday. The beds were turned down at night. We had a courtyard view and I think it was a great location, we overlooked beautiful gardens, fountains, and you could see the beach from our room. Be careful about getting a room close to the pool cause it can be loud down there. This hotel was being cleaned everyday by tons of staff, I mean every inch of it. Reviewers that have complained about musty mildew smell, it's ridiculous! The hotel is right on the beach and it's hot- you're going to have some smell but it was nothing to complain about. If you have issues with this then I recommend not staying at hotel on the beach. The food - The food was great. We ate every meal either at the buffet or the restaurants. We were full and happy! If you are looking for 5 star dining every meal and everyday, this isn't the place for you. We are not picky eaters. There was always good food and all kinds of options. I would recommend going out a night or two for a great seafood dinner! The beach - gorgeous, well-kept, and always had an area with a lounge chair. I know I've read complaints about the waiters not getting out drinks when reviewers wanted them. We didn't care, if we didn't see a server we just walked up to the bar and got drinks. Not a big deal. A great thing was there were no vendors trying to selling you crap! Overall - it was a beautiful hotel with great service. We enjoyed every minute of it. Many thanks to the RIU staff!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Salado
Reviews.Content: Originally we booked to stay at the RIU Playacar. My husband and I had stayed there beofre and love the smaller, more intimate atmosphere. This time we travelled with my sister and her husband. The rooms there were a little on the warm side, and my sister did not like the idea of no bathtub. So we switched to the Palace. The Palace is indeed a very nice hotel. It is large, but laid out well. You do not have to walk forever to get from one area to another. The junior suites are nicely furnished, with double sinks in the bathroom. They are exceptionally clean, as is the entire resort. The large pool and infinity pool are adjacent, and very clean. While we were there, the pools were too cold to go into for a couple of days, but were nice. The buffet food is good, with a wide array of choices. We tried all the al a carte restaurants, and they were fairly good. I think we enjoyed the buffet food more, but the atmosphere is very nice in the specialty restaurants. Service there is overall good. The only disappointment was in the entertainment area. We have stayed at RIUs before, but first time at a RIU Palace. I honestly think the lesser RIU properties are more fun. At the Palace, the daytime activities were minimal. Two or three days, they didn't even bother to get a volleyball game going as was scheduled. The night time entertainment was hit or miss, but this is generally the case anywhere you go. A couple of the shows were very entertaining. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a relaxing stay in a very nice resort. But if you enjoy more poolside activities, I would recommend the RIU Playacar or the RIU Tequila.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: gat0
Reviews.Content: We went to this resort from the 16 of October to the 30 of October for a 2 week stay at this resort and all i can say this place is amazing. Check-in Took 10 minutes to get my room and got our bags 5 minutes later . Room verry clean Fridge filled with some soft drinks and some nice cold beer and thats were we had our first cerveza but this fridge was noisy they came twice to repair it but the problem was never solved but hey it had something cold to drink so we kept the darn thing even if we had a headache the next morning as this thing was loud . Buffet know this place had some great food allways found something good to eat and for a buffet it was the best one i ever had waiters and cooks do a great job at this place and never had any problem with none of them and also at the buffet you have some good choices of wine as most buffets will give you the cheap wine . A la Carte Restaurants they have 5 of them but we only went to 2 of them as the others we did not care much for them so here is the 2 we went too as for reservation well its open from 12 to 3 so go after 1 pm and you will ok that way no waiting in line . Krystal this one had some great food we went there 4 times and this place was our favor never had one plate that i did not enjoy and also they had some great wine as my favor was a white wine from California and another thing the waiters working at this place funny and professional which you can see they love there job . Japanese this one was a surprise as the food was also pretty good never expected to be this good . Pool Bar i never had any problem with them to get my drinks as i waited my turn and got served like all others never took long to get my drinks and if your at the pool or resting in your chair well there is waiters going around taking your order and our favourite was Charly great kid that remembers your drink and it does not take long for Charly to get you one as he runs around the pool all day . Animation what can i say i met this great guy Joshua who use to play pool volleyball with us and he use to make everybody laugh as he is a cheater yes cheater count your points or Joshua will count for you and if you play against him well to bad you will never win ......as he says its Mexico and you go by his rules and also had an amazing time playing pool volleyball with our Canadian and americans and European friends which we had a blast as people only wanted to have fun and we sure did that . Habana bar or lobby bar Know this is the best one there and ....Islas.... the barman what a gentleman allways trying to please his customers and he makes the best drinks at the resort as we allways had our drink with him before going to dinner thank you Islas for the greast drinks and Cappuccino . Islas also works around the pool during the day as you see him with his small buggy going around making drinks and they are darn good. Beach this was not bad but not great either and the sand bags lets just say its not pretty when looking at them . I was reading some reviews were people were saying that staff were not friendly lets just say i never saw one person there that when i needid help did not help us these people would do anything to make you happy so maybe we did not go to the same resort . People at this resort are what you call verry friendly and im sure most people that went there know what im talking about and for those that want to go there go you wont regret goint to this place Would i go back there if i could i would go back tomorrow as they made us feel right at home and we did not get enough of our great vacation and only have one thing to say . Thank You Riu Palace Riviera Maya for making this the best vacation we ever had and can,t wait for the next time to go back .

Reviews.Title: “Five Perfect Days!”
Reviews.Author: linksladdie
Reviews.Content: Visited all the beach front Rius, Yucatan, Playacar, Palace Mexico and of course the Palace Riviera Maya. Pools at all four were crystal clean, and received excellent service at various bars and beach side restaurants. Third trip in the last 18 months and the sand whales seem less noticeable each time. Two rain showers, each of less than 5 minutes duration during the 5 days. Otherwise hot and sunny with refreshing breezes off the sea. Vendors in town seemed more aggressive than previous trips. Probably a sign of the economy, and a quieter time of year. RPRM - Main buffet continues to serve excellent food. Champagne and orange juice at breakfast helps get the day off to a good start. Plenty of choice at the two evening buffets we attended. Also ate at the Mexican, Krystal and Japanese. Wonderful food and attentive service. No problem getting drink service on the beach. Enjoyed the yogurt and fruit salad cups at the pool bar in the morning, and nice spicy Bloody Mary's. Don't know of any place that's as convenient to travel to that gives you more bang for your buck. Favorite beverage this time = Mango Tango We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: SandyKMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a lovely relaxing week at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya....we thought that the grounds, common areas, pool, beach, food, restaurants, employees, service and our room were all fantastic! We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico last year, our only complaint was how they have you reserve the specialty restaurants each day ( get to the theater by 8 or 8:30 am, hopefully, you will get the number that corresponds to your actual arrival there when the 'number person' shows up, then wait till your number is called, and finally, book your choice, if it's available, and mind you, you had to do this every day if you wanted to eat at a specialty restaurant!!!!) And the pool area at the Mexico doesn't compare to the Riviera Maya.... The Riviera Maya lets you book for 3 days at a time, and the time to do this is 12 noon to 3 pm, so much better than the Mexico, we thought! I was intruiged reading some of the complaints that others have had, one person said that the drinks were served in small glasses!!! So get another one, or order 2 at a time!!! One minor complaint I have (along with the usual annoyance of many toweled covered chaise lounges at the pool and their owners are nowhere to be seen, and I'm talking hours!!!) about the Riviera Maya is that because the hallways are tiled, any noise or voices in the hall transmit quite loudly into a room....for us this meant that our afternoon naps weren't exactly ideal....also, our room overlooked 'The Plaza' area...so when we were in our room in the evening, we could hear the band playing and the music of the shows extremely well, it was actually loud...keep this in mind if you like to retire earlier than 11pm (shows begin at 9:45 pm) But we loved sitting outside in The Plaza area in the evening, listening to the Riu and other bands...we didn't care for the shows, too spoiled by Vegas-like productions, I think! Overall, we had a great time, the plusses definitely outweigh the minuses at the Riviera Maya, nothing is perfect, but this resort is about as close to paradise as you can get!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience, loved it”
Reviews.Author: debrick22
Reviews.Content: Friend recommended- glad she did. Place was totally upscale, staff was top notch-waiting on every need and want, always staff cleaning- saw one supervisor checking behind other staff cleaning- all but giving the white glove test. Food was very good- even the buffet. For the other resturants, you needed to make reservations between noon and 3pm and you could make them up to 3 days out. We ate at each of them. They were excellent. Liquor was top shelf and free flowing- many times another was there before you finished your last. Beach was great, white sand, no rocks, crystal clear, plenty of palm trees giving shade, plenty of lounge chairs, with drinks brought out to you. Pool was very nice with a swim up bar. Entertainment was good -not great but pretty good. Rooms were great and comfortable and always cleaned. The bed was somewhat firm, but not "hard"- comfortable. Visited another Riu down the beach- it was nice enough, but ours was well worth the little bit more we paid. No one bothering you to buy anything-especially any stupid timeshares. If we go back to Mexico, this is where we are staying.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time, but my expectations were a little high.”
Reviews.Author: sonotechsusan
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was expecting the royal treatment but was a little disappointed. We were there for our anniversary w/ my dad and my brother, after reading the reviews of how they did special things for other guest I guess I expected the same, but nothing, no wishes, no flowers, no upgrade. Oh well no big deal. The room was ok, no problems. I did smell that smell, but it wasn't that bad until I got home, I could still smell it on my stuff, what can you do, it's humid there. After visiting the other Riu resorts I couldn't figure out why I spent so much more to stay here than the other places, they seemed to have the same alcohol and food but with better and more friendlier service at the bars. If I was to return I would stay at one of the other resorts for less money. The bars at the resort were ok, the service was pretty bad, the bartenders were not that friendly especially in the lobby, the female one was the worst.
