I saw someone ask them to make them a special drink and the bartender seemed really annoyed. Fito was the only server that was working hard and friendly. Also they only have dos X amber and regular, no other beer at any bars. The steakhouse was my least favorite of the reservation rest. The lobster was small and not that good (overcooked) and the service was REALLY bad! My favorite was Krystal (get the filet and the lobster ravioli w/ shrimp), then the Brazialian (there's lot's of meat) then the Japanese. Breakfast was really good at don manuelo, was so/so at chili's. Lunch seemed ok, same thing everyday. Here are some tips if you are going, bring a big insulated cup, if you want a taxi to the other resorts, only pay $3, they will ask for $5 but will do it for 3, don't swim behind the sand whales, it is really dangerous (someone almost drowned when we were there), tip, cause I think they expect it, and see the Michael Jackson show and the Mariachi's . If you are a light sleeper like myself, bring earplugs, everything echoes in the halls, had a hard time getting a full nights sleep. Overall we all had a great vacation, the food was my favorite, the grounds were really clean, people always cleaning, you will have fun, the ocean is beautiful and we had fun playing in the waves. Also we went to Rio Secreto-wouldn't suggest, long drive out there, you hike in dark caves, I was thinking that it was all lite up inside. Nice experience but wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: 20lindy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30th Sept for 2 weeks. This was our 4th Riu hotel but the first for my daughter & her partner & by far the best. On arrival we were met by a lovely tasting fruit punch & a very friendly quick check in. Our rooms were junior suites next door to each other with very comfortable beds. Our luggage arrived at our room within 5 minutes & within 15 minutes a plate of chocolate covered strawberries, a bottle of champagne & a birthday card were delivered to my daughters room as her boyfriend was celebrating his 30th birthday four days later. We had emailed in advance informing them of this occasion & if they could arrange a birthday cake for us but this was a very pleasant surprise. On his actual birthday (4th Oct) we had booked the Mexican restaurant & 2 days prior we asked again if there was a possibility of a cake. When we arrived at the Mexican they had decorated a table in rose petals & metallic 30 confetti, we were given champagne & at the end of the meal they brought out a beautifully decorated cake complete with candles & all the waiters then sang happy birthday. We were so pleased. How wonderful was that. I can only reiterate all the wonderful reviews that have been made. The alcohol was plentiful, never watered down (I am aware this practice does happen at some hotels) The service was second to none sometimes drinks arrived before we had even finished the first. The quality of wine varied from restaurant to bar I personally preferred the chardonnay in the lobby bar. My husband enjoyed the Don Pedro brandy, my daughter adored all the cocktails & her partner well he just enjoyed alcohol in general. Waiter service on the beach was brilliant & I would like to say a very big thanks to Fito & Jose for keeping us all well hydrated. The food let the hotel down a bit for me, although always a big array of different foods, on a number of occasion’s food was either raw or overcooked. One morning when I cut into my omelette raw egg mixture poured out, Prompting me to always ask for it well done after that. Another time the chicken was still raw in the middle & my fish was so over cooked it could not be cut with the knife. I would advise everyone to watch everything they put on their plate. We always did & avoided any upset stomachs. One fish I absolutely loved was Grouper this really is a must try & they always cooked this perfectly. We tried all the restaurants & enjoyed them all. The Brazilian was a different eating experience were meat & poultry is brought out in different stages on large skewers & they slice it in front of you directly on to your plates. Having been to Brazil we found it quite authentic but a bit long-winded. My least favourite was the Japanese there was nothing at all wrong with it its just that im not a lover of sushi but my husband loved it so really is personnel preference. The air con in the buffet was quite powerful & a welcome relief most days, but it did tend to make the food cool down on your plate very quickly. The entertainment finished early & I enjoyed the sax player but always managed to not see his entire act due to us still being in the restaurants (as we preferred the later sitting) Once 11pm came that was it for the night. All the bars shut at 12 except the sports bar, as this was the 24-hour bar. I didn’t like this bar as the seating was all bar stools & I didn’t find it very relaxing there. My daughter preferred this bar, as it was the only indoor area that you could smoke. Stalls would set up in the courtyard around the hotel but we found them very expensive. We bought a doll in Playa del Carmen for $8 & the same doll on the stalls were $15 & they wouldn’t go lower. My advice is to visit PDC & get the same things cheaper. The stallholders are quite persistent & get on your nerves after a while. The walk into PDC took approx 15 minutes or 50 pesos in a taxi (2.50GBP) it is well worth a visit or two as it has lots of shops bars & restaurants. Coco Bongos has opened there so is easier to visit than Cancun which is well over 1 hour away in a taxi. There are some shops in Playacar if you turn left outside the hotel & walk for about 5 minutes you will come to them, they are worth a look round. But PDC I thought was still cheaper. On the walk to Playacar we called in at Riu Playacar & stopped by the pool for a drink but we found the bar tender really rude & he demanded to see all 4 wrist bands before he would serve us, even though they were clearly on show. He did not seem happy that we were from the palace, this I found odd because as palace guests we were supposed to be able to use all Riu’s. Im sure this is not the typical greeting I just think he had his awkward head on that day. Other Riu guests were using the facilities of our hotel even though we were told none palace guests couldn’t. Often different colour wristbands were in the hotel & this went unchallenged. The air con in all public areas is fantastic & despite the heat outside made you feel so much more comfortable. This hotel ranks with some of the best we have stayed in for comfort service & quality. We all felt very spoilt & didn’t want to come home. I hope this review has helped.

Reviews.Title: “Overall had a great time, but probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: jcsanchez
Reviews.Content: •The room: was overall very nice. My only complaint is that the first night that we were there, we discovered that the room hadn't been cleaned properly from its previous inhabitants. ALL of the bedding was stinky, like bad B.O. + mildew stinky. Reception brought us new stuff, but as their housekeeping staff was off for the night, we had to make up the bed ourselves (which I was happy to do if it meant getting to sleep on non-stinky bedding). Some of the soap/toiletry items hadn't been replaced from the previous guests as well. After that one yucky night, every night thereafter, the room was in good order: clean, not stinky, and air conditioned. The bed was neither either good or bad. You might want to consider bringing your own pillows as theirs seem old and imbued with the odor of the past however many previous guests---not even kidding. The TV had lots of great channels, even several in English which was nice on those nights you didn't want to have to struggle to make sense of what was being said. •The place itself/decor: The lobby area is very nice except something about it reeks "cheap." Despite the high impressively high ceilings, marble this and that, and the wooden wall accents, the lobby's brothel-pink painted walls, red upholstered seats, and cheesy 80s chandeliers detract from the hotel's could-be sophistication. The other areas of the hotel (e.g., restaurants) are generally nicer-looking than the lobby •The beach/location: The beach is pretty nice except for the fake sandbar that stands in the way of swimming out just a little bit further than I'd have liked to. The Hotel is near Xcaret, Xplor, & Tulum. •The food: Pretty good, but not something to rave about. I recommend eating at Don Manolo's rather than the reservation-in-advance restaurants. The ones that require reservations have very small portion sizes to already mediocre food. At Don Manolo's you get more for your buck, not to mention a lot more variety than the other restaurants. Roomservice menu has VERY few items available. The food in the sports bar is flat out disgusting, period. •The staff: Overall, very nice. We were greeted and treated very well by the staff, even when we didn't have tip available. Tips are not required for this all-inclusive, but we did give it when we could. •Amenities: wireless internet works, but only in the lobby. There are ample plugs for laptops available.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing. Solidly 3-star.”
Reviews.Author: MIleHighDee
Reviews.Content: Lower your expectations or you may be dissappointed!! My husband and I are NOT picky people and we really wanted to like this hotel! We tried hard but there was just too much lacking for us to give it the great review most other posters have given it. HOTEL: The hotel was just ok. The decor was a bit over the top and outdated. The hotel and grounds were generally clean, except for the restrooms off the lobby which were disgusting and smelling of a port-o-potty in high-summer. The entire hotel and our room did smell musty, probably due to humidity. However, I have stayed in several hotels off of the ocean that did not have such a permeable, overwhelming stench. (You will bring it home with you). The rooms were spacious, but dark and gloomy. POOL: The pool was nice and clean. Be prepared, of course, to play the "towel game". BEACH: The reason why you would go to the Riu Palace. The beach is fantastic for the area. The waters were as beautiful as the pictures advertise with soft, clean sand. The only dissappointment was there was not a waiter in sight to bring drinks the entire week we were there. SERVICE: Quite dissappointing. We tip, and well, but the service was consistantly bad from the front desk to the towel person. The drinks are small and lacking of alcohol. The quality of service did not improve regardless of 20% tips. The people not tipping were treated as poorly was we were so we finally gave up toward the end of our trip. (The bartenders at the swimup bar were the worst). FOOD: From simply ok to dismal. If food is important to you, you should consider staying elsewhere. The specialty restaurants would not worth the (annoying) wait in line except you would go crazy if you had to eat in the buffet every night. (Which did not change their offerings the entire week were were there). The Japanese was ok. The sushi was surprisingly good. The mexican place was also ok. The steakhouse was a joke. It was our 6th anniversary so I was hoping it would be special. Alas, after an hour wait to eat, the lobster tail was tiny and burned to such a crisp it was inedible. The stonecrab claws were still partially frozen and also inedible. My steak was decent, but I was so turned off by the poor service and food that I could not enjoy it. Even though my husband told the head waiter about our celebration, nothing was one to make our evening special. That was our last night there and it was the nail in the coffin for us. In all the hotel is nice if you can get past the " Ladies of Dallas meets the Caribbean" decor. The beach is fantastic! Our Anniversary week was not ruined by the bad food, service, and drinks, because we are generally upbeat people, however we were consistantly dissappointed. If we got a screaming deal we would return with drastically lowered expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all-inclusive”
Reviews.Author: chicagoTRVLR
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RPRM with 2 friends from 10/14-10/18/09 and had a wonderful time. We recently visited the Riu Palace in Cabo and the RPRM was just as nice. I would encourage people to use private or non-stop transportation to the resort to maximize your pool side time on the first day as the drive from the airport is almost 1 hour. We had a bit of trouble initially in securing 2 beds instead of a king for our room, but after some discussion with the front desk personnel we were placed in an ocean view room. The pool, pool side service, and swim up bar were excellent. The “whales” were everywhere on the shore line, but they encourage plenty of fish which you could see when swimming in the ocean. During low tide you can walk the beach to both ends of Playacar. You can easily walk to 5th avenue in Playa Del Carmen and see the sights without taking a taxi. The buffets at our resort and the RP Mexico (sister resort) were excellent and had plenty of options for the pickiest eaters. We visited the Chilis steakhouse and the Agave Mexican restaurant at this Riu Palace and they were good. As on previous posts, there was a wet/moldy smell that got pretty strong toward the end of our stay emanating from our bathroom. Since we did not spend a lot of time in the room, it wasn’t too bothersome. Our room was cleaned daily and if the mini bar did not have enough Pepsi Light for us, we just called down to room service for a refill. On the second day of our trip, one of the Animacion staff offered a kitchen tour. We were treated to an inside look at the operations of the main RPRM kitchen which was very well run and exceedingly clean. Again as on other posts, the staff at the RPRM is friendly and hard working. I would return to this resort in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT AWESOME PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: peskyCapeCodMass_
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing .We had perfect weather. When we got there I was amazed how beutiful this place is. You do not have to leave the resort everything is right there. Food was very good , rooms great, service awesome.The beach ,the water, the pool. We go to the carribean twice a year,mostly cancun. I have to say this was one of the best places we have been too! I will definetly be going back. I plan to try the RIU in aruba in april I was really impressed by the RIU resorts

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very friendly staff , stomach bugs help keep the weight off!”
Reviews.Author: Shelley033
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya for 14 nights, this was our honeymoon. The hotel is beautiful and very grand. The staff are very helpful and genuinely friendly. The beach is great but the sea can get rough, the hotel does have warning flags to advise bathers when it is not safe to swim in the sea. The two swimming pools are excellent very warm normally but they are not heated (not in October) so the water temperature will drop with a decrease in the air temperature. The choice of food and restaurants is very good, the only negative comment is that both myself and my husband were ill , he is still quite ill after a visit to our GP in the UK. We spoke to several guests who reported having the same illness (stomach cramps etc!). There are lots of Americans who holiday at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Riu Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rolex47
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th time in Mexico, twice at the Riu Caribe,Cancun, twice at the Riu Palace Cancun and this time at the Riu Riviera Maya Palace in Playa Del Carmen. As soon as we arrived it felt right,we were welcomed by one of the Reception team and given a free room upgrade, I whispered into the wife's ear "that will do for me". It has typical Riu Palace type standards, in that it was very clean, great variety of food but what was most impressive was the friendliness of the staff, nothing was too much trouble and from the Receptionist down to the Gardeners and everybody in between you couldn't get past them without hearing the word Ola!. Okay it;s a great hotel and we would go again, but whilst the animation team do a super job, the evening entertainment (with the odd exception of Kenny Gee )is very similar to what we've seen at all the Palace hotels; for e.g. The Michael Jackson show (which the Americans love ) we've seen at a Palace hotels in Mexico over the last 3 years and this wears a bit thin after a while. Restaurants: The Don Manola is the main Buffet restaurant and it's great , but if you fancy a special meal there is a choice of Theme restaurants to try.Our particular favourite was "Krystal" although we also tried the Japanese which we found interesting but rather rushed,there are another 3 which we heard varying reports of but it's down to personal choice, but talk to people that have tried them to get a feel for them. For lunch time you have to go th Chillis which is right by the main pool and there is a waitress there called Maury who is really attentive without being intrusive and so efficient. The beach we loved complete with the beach waiter offering you fruit in joghurt in the early morning to one of the Chefs coming round the beach handing out pizza to people laying on sunbeds taking the rays by the ocean .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: smias
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights/7 days in October with husband, sis and bros in-law. All of us totally had fun. The service, as usual for a Riu, was excellent. What surprises me time after time how much all the employees seem to enjoy their jobs. When we asked, we received it and if it wasn't there, they would go and get it! The staff said the hotel was at 85%, but we joked and said more like 85 people. But by the end of the week it was much more crowded. The room was the normal room. We thought we upgraded, but evidently not. The room was always extremely well kept each day and the bar was always restocked (an important fact for an all inclusive). You may want to ask for extra towels. We walked to 5th Ave three separate times. GREAT shopping and we ate dinner down there one night. A seafood meal for $60 US dollars with lobster, a whole fish, shrimp and hard shell crabs. Delish! You must always barter on the price. When you walk away, it will always go down even more. An umbrella started at 25 pesos and went to 5. We always love Riu's and will continue to visit them throughout the world. They give the same service where ever you go and you know what to expect. Great vacation - as always.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation by far”
Reviews.Author: Mellybabexo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the resort last week. I was there for one week in the junior suite and all i have to say is this is the best resort I have stayed at by far. I havent travelled too much but I have been to cuba and dominican and both have been 4 1/ 2 stars but nearly came close to this one. The service was the absolute best, the staff was so friendly, the room was clean. I had no complaints. The one thing I must say is the hallways can get a little loud with the doors slamming and such but its not too bad, its okay it didnt happen too often. As for the restaurants, I really enjoyed the Japanese. I do not like sushi or seafood but they still had the option of the chicken teriyaki which was amazing. The buffet food was always good, the breakfasts were even better. There is a 24 hour "snack bar" as they call it but its in the sports bar and its just a fridge full of food and there is a microwave to help yourself. The pool was amazing, especially the relaxing one that overflowed into the main pool. If anyone does visit this resort you will not have any regrets and please do visit Victor in the sports bar, he is the best bartender there and Tono at the pool bar. The beach was excellent, although as you probably know they have man made sand bags but they wernt an inconvienence for me because i could barely touch the ground after them. As for entertainment, it was good... nothing crazy. If you are looking for a party this is not so much of a place to go. There are a lot of honeymooners because its really romantic. Overall, I had a blast with just my boyfriend and I. For now on we are sticking with the Riu chain, :)

Reviews.Title: “First class,but”
Reviews.Author: toppar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay,everything was as we have come to expect from Riu,first class,but,we booked into the steak-house resteraunt and the steak i had was rubbish fifty percent fat,a speciallity steak-house should be able to do better,in the mexican we had to share a menu with the next table,Two minor problems i know,but it spioled the night for us.But don't let this stop you booking the hotel it's fantastic,

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax and have fun.”
Reviews.Author: MoChex
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation with our 6 month old daughter and it was great. The staff was extrememly friendly and the food was good. We spent most of our time at the pool or beach and there was plenty of room and shade for our little one. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellente Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: MYFLOWERGIRL1
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd visit to this hotel because of the excellent service, layout, cleaniness, food and staff! We went back as our anniversay trip this year> We emailed ahead to the Riu resorts if we could have a decent room because of the occasion and what a surprise- we had a ocean view room! Only thing I could even complain about was the minibar was unstocked which was resolved with also a bottle of champagne and choc. strawberries. Thank you Ottavio (front desk)for your friendship and kindness. Since we new some of the staff, bartenders from last year they became like family this time as far as extra special treatment. We ended up with 3 bottles of champagne sent to the room by the end of our visit. I would like to thank one of the doormen at the buffet - Geovancy? who went to all the trouble of asking the chef about a friut I had last year. He ordered it and then the next day sent a plate to our room- Talk about service at its best! Thank you to all the bartenders who made our stay special once again- Marvin, Chano, Rene, Alfredo, Santos, Jose, and Isalas (who of course makes a killer drink everytime- hold on to this guy!). This has been the best place I have ever stayed, the location is great and you can walk into town if you want, the beach/pool area is wonderful. You can enjoy both at the same time. I have read other negative reviews and can only think that some people are very picky and nothing will make them happy. Life has bumps in the road so make the best of it. A little kindness will get you alot in return. I can't wait to go back next time as a family trip. This is truly a great hotel so you should book it.

Reviews.Title: “Really Magical Trip”
Reviews.Author: annika_tx
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend and had such an amazing vacation! The staff is really nice- they knew our names within hours, made great drinks (beleive me we tried ALL of them) and everyone was extremely friendly! The entertainment crew was the best, loved dancing on stage with them, and the shows were really good- especially the "crazy show"! The hotel was very fancy, decorated very well, clean, lots of fresh flowers, very impressive, the pool was perfect- huge and not too crowded, great bars! The beach is amazing- plenty of chairs, and huge area under the palm trees with hammocks and plenty of chairs. The upper part of the pool gives you a great ocean view, and its not a long walk to the water at all. I suggest- bring (or buy at the gift shop) a large insulated cup for drinks, order the mango daiquiri (its the best), espresso martinis, making the breakfast buffet everyday, shots from the best bartender ever at the sports bar, and seeing all the shows. Also 5th ave downtown is a quick taxi ride $5 or decent walk, for great shopping. Good mix of people, at least half european, mostly couples, few young kids, mostly young people. We walked down to the other rui resorts, they are about 4 hotels down on the beach- not next door, the other palace (rui palace mexico) was the only one that seemed even remotely similar in terms of how nice the pool/beach was- but honestly its pool was not nice at all- its a wierd flower shape, with the bar in the middle, not big and open like ours, plus the beach was far from the hotel and pool. I would have been VERY dissapointed if I had stayed there honesltly. The food was very good- the lunch buffet was good, the breakfast and dinner very good, and it wasn't hard to make reservations for the nice restaurants, just 12-2 in the lobby bar, you signed up, for 2 reservations at a time, we managed to eat in all of the places.That food was really great. Overall- I'd recommend this hotel if you want to relax, be around young people (not too wild, but not boring), with really fancy and nice bars/lobby/restaurants etc, and really good food (like japanese the best). Great for relaxing and having a girls trip! Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Awesome! Just Go!”
Reviews.Author: Marisky1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya in early October and absolutely LOVED it! We would recommend this hotel to anyone and don't understand any of the negative comments you might have read on other reviews. This place is first-class, especially for the price range, and were thrilled that it exceeded our expectations in every way. Following is a summary of some of the areas that we feel may be important to other people considering a stay here. Beach and Pool - The pool was beautiful and never too crowded. We loved the infinity pool that was separate from the main pool. It was always quieter than the main pool but close enough to the pool bar to get a drink whenever we got thirsty. The beach and ocean were MUCH better, however, and we spent the majority of our time there. The sand was white, the water was clean, clear, and calm. We didn't even mind the sand whales, which are there to protect the beach from erosion, because we enjoyed snorkeling around them and watching the fish that hang out there. The lounge chairs were plentiful and a couple large stands of palm trees provided plenty of shade. Room, Grounds & Facilities - The hotel is gorgeous and MASSIVE in scale. When we first walked into the lobby we felt like we were in a fine European/Spanish (as in Spain) hotel on steroids. We were forunate enough to get a great room at the end of the hotel nearest the beach and pool (we requested an upgrade and/or a location near the beach and the front desk was kind enough to do so at no charge), and this was the perfect location for us. If you'd rather be close to the lobby and specialty restaurants, you might want to request this because it's a long haul from one end of the hotel to the other. :-) Everything was in excellent condition - our room, the grounds, and the hotel in general. The grounds and maintenance staff work their tails off to keep the hotel in such good condition. Everything was also immaculately clean thanks to an excellent maid staff who were constantly present throughout the hotel. Service - The staff at the hotel is second to none. We had EXCELLENT service everywhere we went, but especially in the specialty restaurants. Someone was always asking if we needed anything, bringing us drinks, pulling out our chairs for us, and generally spoiling us rotten. Food/Restauants - The food here is the best we've had at any hotel. The buffets (Don Manolo for breakfast, lunch, and dinner and Chili's for lunch) were excellent and had a great variety of food to please even the pickiest eater. We also ate at several of the specialty restaurants (but would have been okay with eating at the buffet only since there were different themes each night). Chili's turns into the steakhouse for dinner and we ate here our first night. The food was good but the dessert presentation of their baked Alaska is something you shouldn't miss! We also ate at Krystal, the fusion restaurant, where the staff bent over backwards for us (thank you Rosario!) and gave us special attention because it was our anniversary. We had a beautiful table decorated with rose petals, candles and our own bottle of wine. The sea bass and fillet were both excellent and made for a very memorable dinner. We were less impressed with Agave, the Mexican restaurant, but the food was still good and offered a nice salad and appetizer bar. Lastly, we ate at Botafogo, the Brazilian restaurant. This place is a carnivore's dream come true, as the servers came by at least 6 times with skewers of various grilled meats sliced at the table for you to sample. Vegetarians wouldn't starve here, though, because they did have a salad bar. Safety - We were a little concerned with safety before arriving at the hotel, but our concerns soon disappeared before we even got to the hotel. The hotel is located in a secure area where traffic is monitored like a private community. We also saw security personnel at the beach and never felt worried about leaving our beach bag and camera while swimming in the ocean. The bottom line - Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a wonderful place to stay for a relaxing vacation. If you're considering staying here - DO IT! Chances are you'll have the vacation experience of your dreams, like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: annie8849
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best Rui hotel. The staff are unbelievable, all of them, Maury at Breakfast, Vicor in the Sports bar, Jose on the beach, Fito,Mimi and Santos too. The reception staff were the best I have ever encountered, helpful and so friendly. One special thanks to the lady in the rest room near the bars at night, she worked so hard and never failed to smile. The Rui chain should be proud of their employees here. As for cleanliness, nothing could beat this, rooms smelt clean, king size bed was fresh and comfortable, our fridge was stocked every day. Air/C worked perfect. The food was unbelievable, we travel a few times a year, but have never encountered the quality of this hotel. Breakfast, lunch and dinner was unbelievable, and the staff in the dining rooms were the best we have seen. Beach was great, clean, lots of beds, lots of shade and the little bits of seaweed were fun, the waves were awsome and I felt safe with the beach whales keeping me near the beach. Pool bar staff were awsome, they knew our names and drinks within an hour, we never had an empty glass. The staff put on shows at night that were very good, especially when you consider that they had been working all day, they had such energy, fun and entertaining. Their Titanic imitation is the funniest I have ever seen. We laughed our heads off. The grounds are so well groomed, clean and a pleasure to walk through. The employees here work really hard to make everyone feel like they are special, and my partner and I both appreciated their hard work. It does not hurt to tip them, a dollar here and there goes a long way, these employees deserve this. We are looking forward to going back to this hotel in May next year, cant wait to see all these wonderful people again and be treated like royalty. Well done Rui, and thank you for a spectacular week.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: RitaShort
Reviews.Content: We went in the middle of 'swine flu' hysteria which turned out to be no big deal. We had to fill out a form when we got to Mexico and they took our temperature on the return flight home that was pretty much it. This hotel is awesome we have stayed at the palace Mexico before which allows you hang out at the palace rivieria so we were familiar with the resort and it's great. About the only thing we could fault is they were operating with reduced staff, and only 2 of the 5 resorts were open (because of the swine flu and less tourists). So there didn't seem to be the variety of food on the buffet as there was before and the entertainment and events were scaled back. Also we discovered they had upgraded a lot of the guests who had booked into their other hotels that were closed so there were more children and the pool area was louder than our previous trip. However it was still more than satisfactory and our friends who went with us who had never been before thought it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Katiepooh2
Reviews.Content: The most fabulous resort I have ever stayed in...all inclusive, all the food was delicious, and the staff was curteous and friendly. Not a bad thing to say!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another great experience at the RPRM!”
Reviews.Author: dreaming*of*a*beach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the RPRM for our anniversary in late May 2009. This was during the hysteria of the spring swine flu outbreak, so there were basically no tourists in Playa del Carmen. It was a disheartening that what was traditionally peak vacation season was absolutely the opposite. This was our second stay at the RPRM. We travel to Playa del Carmen quite often, so we have an idea of the typical Mexico standards and what other hotels offer. Here are the general feelings about this property: 1. The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff is prompt and eager to please. 2. The food is excellent quality for an all-inclusive resort. (Believe me, I know as I have been to many other AIs. Some are terrible.) 3. The beach has been renovated from past hurricanes and there are large sandbags to prevent further erosion. It is not too bad, just not what Playa del Carmen used to be. 4. The specialty restaurants are good, especially the steak house and Brazilian steak house. Not so good comments: 1. The fact that you can only make so many dinner reservations at a particular time is irritating. 2. There is no beach drink service anymore, so it is advised to take a large insulated cup with you to fill up before heading to the beach. That will keep you from making many trips to the bar for refills. 3. The shop keepers in town are desperate for money since tourism is so down this year. I felt a little intimidated by their overly aggressive tactics. Overall, this is a primo property in a beautiful setting. You will not be disappointed with your choice in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kalaboy
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful place to spend your vacation. It's beautiful, very clean and the staff is very helpful. I would recommend this resort to anyone. My husband and I will be going back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent - Ok, but definitely NOT LUXURY!”
Reviews.Author: maybethatswhere
Reviews.Content: We're a mid-thirties Houston couple who travel frequently. We like to stay in nice places during the off-season to get a good bargain. The nicest hotel I've ever stayed in is Mandalay Bay in Vegas, 6 years ago, when it was fairly new. We stayed at Riu PRM from Oct 1-5, 2009, during a long weekend getaway. Overall experience: Inconsistent - we had a great time, but this was not a luxury vacation by any stretch. There are lots of staff working hard to keep things clean, and they are all polite, but services were very inconsistent. Check-in: You're given a small, no frills glass of an orange-y fruit drink by someone behind the check in counter, definitely not fancy or even especially welcoming. The front desk rep helping us also answered the phone each time it rang, which was 5-7 times while we were there, so it took about 10 or so minutes for us to check in. She also went into the back room a couple of times, leaving us just standing there. When she gave us our room key, we walked over to the bellman who had haphazardly tossed our bags onto a cart with a few other bags and was chatting with other bellman - not exactly top-notch welcoming service. The room: Nice, big, clean, smelly. We had room # 2039, a junior suite near the beach. The room was clean, but showed obvious wear, especially the bathroom, which is probably why they keep it a little dark in there. The room was super humid, even with the a/c on the entire time. This lead to a strange, slightly moldly smell. I brought a Plug-In, but it had no effect on the odor. It wasn't awful, but that, plus the humidity factor, made the room uncomfortable for anything other than for the absolute basics. We had turn-down service 1 of 4 nights, and towel animals 3 of 4, even though we tipped the maid each day. The linens were old and worn - scratchy, nubbly, and had stains. Definitely bring your own toiletries - they only have a hair & body combo wash along with a few other marginal Italian toiletry items. Oh, and forget romance. There's nothing romantic about the room. Neither the tv nor the radio have any music stations (or an IPod dock), and the smell is not so conducive to romance either. The food: It's as good as I've ever had at a buffet, but it's still a buffet! And it's your only option for breakfast and lunch (except for a very lame room service menu). Fortunately, we were able to skip the buffet for dinner and eat at the "gourmet" restaurants for each dinner. We didn't have reservations the first 2 nights, but we went to the restaurants to see if there any no-shows. Each night there were many empty tables, so if you're willing to wait for about 15 minutes after each seating, you'll probably get lucky, at least during slow season. None of the restaurants were great (I live in Houston and we have many WONDERFUL restaurants), but it beat more buffet eating. Service was inconsistent, overkill in one area/place, non-existent in another. One big plus - no upset tummies the entire stay. The activities: We only did what was included (nonmotorized sports) - they are open from 9-4:30 each day, but you'll need to sign a waiver near the ping-pong table before you can check out a boogie board, catamaran, kayak, etc. The guys are great and helpful some days, not so much on the others. The beach service: Inconsistent! We had great beach service the first day we were there (Friday). It waned a bit the following day, and had completely dissappeared by the next (Sunday), even though the guests in the pool were being served. They serve drinks outside in tiny, juice-sized cups, but will use yours if you bring your own keep-cool cup. They will use thier premium liquor if you request, but when they run out for the day, it's gone. Sometimes you get a pineapple slice, sometimes a lime, sometimes nothing. Very inconsistent. The beach/pool bar closes promptly at 6 with no apologies. The pool: It's big and has a swim up bar. But they allow kids/babies to swim naked and people to eat nachos at the swim up bar. Gross. Also, the pool is pretty warm except for late in the day. The pool and jacuzzi closes promptly at 8 each day! There was definitely an older crowd here (read: 50+). It was quiet, laid back, easy going. There were only a few kids, a few singles, a few large groups, and a few gay couples. A little boring actually, but that's just what we wanted on this trip! We probably wouldn't stay here again, or suggest it to friends - for a couple hundred dollars more, I would try something more upscale next time.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun....”
Reviews.Author: carm424
Reviews.Content: , but I would stay at a different hotel next time. Something with a bit more class. We certainly stayed at the best RIU in that area. The food was OK. Drinks were OK. My favorite drink is the Mojito, and they ran out of mint leaves for two days at the pool. Second fav. drink is a Chocolate Martini. I made a special request with that one and they did it with yummy success. Our room was okay. In the middle of the week it started to smell like smoke. Most likely from a neighbor. We complained and they didn't care. Beach was okay. better than others onthe strip. I loved the location. We felt safe walking around Playa. It felt like a neighborhood. This was our first all-inclusive, and we would do it again. We didn't really feel "special" as we have on our numerous cruises that we have taken.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: NCgirl1
Reviews.Content: A quick review for traveling with a 6 mo old. Of course, we were very nervous with the first time out of the country with the little one. I think we read every web site out there to prepare. It all paid off, when we checked in we had a great week. We had emailed ahead of time to request a crib and connecting rooms. The first night they did not have the connecting rooms, but we were moved the next morning. The crib was waiting in the room. We asked for extra water bottles for the babies food, they made sure our refrigerator was stocked every day. The only complaint, as mentioned in others, the door slamming. It really did not bother us in the morning because the baby was up at 6. She stayed on her East Coast time schedule. Beware travelers from the US on the East Coast. Be prepared to have to put them down at the same time you do at home, in just a week, it is hard to change habits. We had connecting rooms, which was wonderful with a monitor and keeping the second door open. The buffet dinner was great, we could rotate through dinner with someone being upstairs with the sleeping little one. They also have a microwave in the sports bar to sanitize bottles. We have been to the RIU in the past without little ones and enjoyed it just as much this time. The day time activites by the pool are always exciting. I have to say, the RIU is a great family get away!!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel makes 'All Inclusive' great value”
Reviews.Author: billbaty
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for the second year running in Aug 2009. Slight changes from the previous year, but none that really affected the quality of this 'Palace' hotel in the Riu group. The attention of the staff and the service certainly justify its 5-star rating. The bedrooms are huge with a mini-bar and optics in each one. You can tell it caters for the American market from the quality of everything it does. Sports Bar open 24-hours, food available 24-hours, six themed restaurants, quality produce in the 'all inclusive' package, entertainment of the highest standard from 6 entertainment staff with the shows being of exceptionally high quality. Food was fantastic and the choice was magnificent. But what makes this hotel special are the staff and their friendliness and willingness to serve and assist their guests. The hotel also has a gym, is right on the beach, has a swim-up pool bar, full daytime recreational activities and Spa facilities plus the fact that a golf course is just over the road makes it even more special for me. Given the choice, we would return to this hotel every year and the fact that you can freely go to the other six Riu hotels in the resort makes it even better. Bill Baty, Newcastle

Reviews.Title: “very nice,can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: smartblond56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our trip through expedia after much research by me. We have been to Playa del Carmen three times before at different all-inclusives in the area and had noticed this place the last time. I must say it was beyond my expectations! I thought the room was very nice, we were upgraded to a jucuzzi suite which we only discovered upon seeing our room and took that as a good sign. I loved the food at Don Manalo which is where the dinner buffet is nightly and breakfast. They had some world class chefs there and while there was some of the same each night they also had different themes. We never tried the specialty restaurants as we dont like to be tied down to a seating time. The resort looked to be maybe half full, plenty of space on the beach and the service there was excellent. We never had to get up for a drink they even brought fruit and yogurt cups and pizza was brought out in the afternoon. They somehow reclaimed their beach as a short walk either way showed us that other places we had stayed at had hardly any at all. The only part that needs improvement was the sportsbar but we were only there to play pool during a short rain storm. I thought the pool tables shouldn't require money to play! If you are looking to relax on a lounger by the water and just forget your stresses back home then this is the ideal place to go! My husband and I are in our early 50's and we enjoyed the Riu Palace so much. Dont try to do an early check in for your flight home its a fruitless effort b/c you have to do it at the airport anyway! We were there from Sept 28th thru Oct 3rd.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, Amazing, Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wildwindcollies
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at a Riu, 3rd at a Riu Palace and our first to Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We have been delighted with every trip to a Riu-especially the Palaces, we believe they are worth the little extra money over the regular Riu's and still do. Upon Check In we were given a welcome cocktail at the desk and were quickly given perfect rooms with beautiful courtyard views-we had room 1107 on the second floor. We had the king sized beds we had requested and my husband and I had chocolate dipped strawberries and a wonderful bottle of champagne in our refrigerator-I assume because we are Riu Class members who have had several trips to Riu's? I don't know, but it was a wonderful surprise. We had very little problems making reservations for the "ala carte" restaurants, and we LOVED the food. Our favorites were the Mexican, Brazillian and the Steak House. The buffet was always overflowing with wonderful food-I've got to say that anyone who cannot find wonderful food at this resort is WAY picky. The deserts here were amazing, great cheesecake, wonderful ice cream, the Brazillian restaurant had desert crepes! I am on a diet after coming home-but it was worth every moment-what are vacations for?? The breakfast and lunch buffet's were wonderful too! We really enjoyed sitting in the lounge drinking all kinds of martini's before dinner every night. The staff was amazing. The front desk people were so welcoming and helpful for ANYTHING we needed, the best of any Riu we've ever stayed at. Our favorites around the place were Maury in the breakfast and lunch buffet areas-she waved us in every day-she REMEMBERED after our first day or two what we wanted to drink (coffee and Mimosa's at breakfast were always there for us!) and she never let our cups/glasses be empty. Wonderful Ivan in the evening at the shows and in the lounge was a BLAST-he delighted in teaching us new spanish words-we loved the peanuts they brought out and whenever Ivan saw us, he would race peanuts to our table-these people are amazing. TIP these people, they work SO HARD. A dollar or two goes a long way-and they sure apprieciate it! I've never seen harder working people than those at these resorts in Mexico. We never wanted for ANYTHING! We enjoyed many shows and the little band that plays at the RPRM. We were told that the Entertainment staff would take guests to clubs in Playa if asked, well-we approached Rudy about going to Coco Bongo's and with us we figured out the best night. Rudy, Pepe and David took a small group from our hotel, got us the BEST seats in the house and Rudy stayed with us all evening (night and into the wee hours of the next AM) making sure we got drinks and were happy-AMAZING! All for the $50.00 fee to get into Coco Bongo's-of course we gave Rudy a nice tip at the end of the evening-WOW it was amazing. Rudy was fantastic too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time at Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: eyelive2travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a week the end of September. This place has it's pros and cons like any other resort. The top 3 pros were 1. The service we received from the following 4 people: Jose, our waiter by the ocean and poolside, Victor in the Sport Bar, Pedro, the hotel watersports activity director, and Santos, who we seemed to run into in a different location everyday was a class act. The 4 of them made our vacation extra special. 2. Views from the room (we had a courtyard view room) and the music in the evening from the balcony 3. The food was abundant, delicious, fresh. We enjoyed the Mexican restaurant, and the Steak House Chili's. The 3 top cons: 1. Need more elevators and restrooms. Stairs are a killer in the heat if you are on the second floor. The only elevator is by the lobby. It was a pain if you were in the Sport Bar or the main dining room and had to use the restroom. You had a long trek. 2. Bugs are bad!!!! Need to spray or light bug candles or something. I realize it's the jungle but a little bug spray would go a log way around the pool area. While eating our steak dinner, we felt more like the meal, the mosquitos were terrible. 3. Minibar was not stocked. Terrible minibar service even after tipping. Front desk staff were rude too. All other service was very excellent. This resort is spread out so there is a lot of walking involved. I would recommend requesting a room near the spot you plan on spending most of your time. If you are a pool/beach person, you'll want to ask to be placed on that end of the resort. It is very hot so I would also recommend asking for morning sun. All of the rooms allow smoking on the balcony only which is good. There is a laptop size electronic safe in the room. The beach is very swimmable. No reason to worry about swimming in the ocean here. It's clear, warm and shallow. If you plan to do any activities like wave runners, parasail, snorkel, etc..., talk to Pedro. He will probably find you but if not, he is down on the upper beach where you get the kayaks, hobicats, etc...He works for Riu, not like one of the vedors on the beach. His prices are great! Jose, our waiter by the ocean, was a hard working, friendly, very fun loving, person. He was there early in the morning and went home after dark every night and always had a smile on his face. He was a great waiter, he always remembered what we were drinking. Fito was a good waiter as well. Victor, the bartender in the Sport Bar was fun and always kept the crowd going. He has a gift for this. He makes awesome drinks too! The food was great for the most part. We did not like the Brazilian. We found this restuarant to be daunting, dark, and unfriendly. The "bosses" standing around were very intimidating. I know they were watching the employees slicing the meat, but it felt like we were being watched. I hated it and the food wasn't that great for as long as we had to wait. The soup was my favorite here. It was very good. We didn't even stay for desert. The Mexican (Agave) and Steakhouse were good. The service here was better as well. Daniel made our Mayan Coffee at Agave and he did an excellent job. He was a very good waiter. He made a piont of coming up to us at the resort wherever he was working that day to say hello. The presentation of the Baked Alaska in the Steakhouse was pretty impressive too. I would also like to say a little something about the women that went topless. There were many. Maybe it's because I am born and raised in the midwest USA (thank God) but with little children/teenagers running around, and knowing the Hispanic culture like I do, I found it disturbing, tactless, and disrespectful. There are other resorts that cater to that sort of thing. The Sax player in the courtyard during the Circus show was fantastic! We danced on our balcony. We really enjoyed our stay here. It was just all the walking that we were not expecting. We came home wore out instead of rested. Thank you Riu. We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way”
Reviews.Author: Laurence Zing
Reviews.Content: I was recomended to visit this hotel for our 25th Wedding anniversary. Both my wife and I enjoyed our stay. There is so much good food, the service was beyong belief and the hotel was immaculate. We loved it.... can't say anything bad about the hotel at all...... It is a liitle remote, but we wanted nothing to do. Trips to Chichen Itza and Tulum were long and the coach trip was tiresome so be warned, but they are woth a look if you like history and ruins. There is no shopping so to speak, unless you want to be overwhelmed by the locals wanting to sell their goods... which I found rather cheap and tatty.... Having shoped in New York and Vegas, this was very low key, but then we didn't go for that anyway. Cancun is not much better for shopping either so be warned. Overall 99.9999 out of 100

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing - couldn't have asked for more. UK honeymooners.”
Reviews.Author: SLGood
Reviews.Content: We went to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for our honeymoon - 11 days all inclusive with Thomson. Everything was perfect! The hotel is amazing, the food fantastic and the staff never let your drink get empty! Hotel rooms are fantastic. Remember that you need to leave the air con on because of the humidity - it is not the hotels fault! Everything is so clean, with staff cleaning throughout the day. Our Thomson rep was so lovely - Emma - and nothing was too much trouble. We did six excursions throughout our stay and they were all fantastically run and worth every penny. Quiet entertainment in the evening - perfect for those who just want a relaxing holiday. Excursions are available into Cancun for a night out, but we didn't try it. We went in all the booked restaurants as well as the buffet and couldn't fault the food or service. I actually think we came back a lot heavier as it was all so delicious! Everything was in walking distance - shops, the beach is straight off the hotel. One of the smallest hotels in the Playacar area too with no separate areas. Pool was never busy and over run, and you could always get a space on the loungers by the pool or on the beach. Towels you could change up to twice a day. I would like to point out to people that a little Spanish goes a long way. Most people work full days, and in the height of season 7 days a week. A smile and being polite costs nothing! Would definitely recommend to anyone! If anyone from the hotel reads this - thank you for the honeymoon of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever Experienced with no resolution”
Reviews.Author: kpolase
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding on June 6th at the Riu Palace Mexico, which turned out great. I was responsible for bringing a group of a bit more then 75 people with me as well. One of the bridesmaids in the wedding also followed our footsteps since we praised Riu's services, and she too just recently had her wedding on May 29th, 2009 at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. There were about 25 people who turned out to this wedding, most of which attended mine the prior year. In total, I have brought this chain a little more than 100 people, resulting in hundreds of thousands of dollars in revenue, within the past year alone. Unfortunately, our last trip was not one to remember. From the start, the front desk clerk, Luis, was extremely rude. He would constantly sigh and roll his eyes when asked for assistance, and would make the guests feel like they were idiots. The Bride and Groom also had a nonfunctioning air conditioner for days. Even on their wedding day, they did not have a/c and the Bride had to get ready in my room (2101). Every time Luis was asked to have their a/c fixed, he came up with excuses. He also refused to help them change rooms. This was just the beginning. There are many Riu Resorts nearby, and the "Palace" ones should have free access to the other's restuarants, clubs, etc. We come to find out all other resorts were shut down due to the swine flu. We spoke with other couples that were to be staying at the other Riu Resorts for a wedding, and were told their hotels were changed, after they arrived. I feel bad for the bride and groom. My main issue is the staff you employ at this resort. The security on the resort is horrible, and not helpful. The staff at the SPA went into my locker while I was getting a message, and stole money from my wallet. Before heading to the SPA for my 7:00PM appointment, I took exactly $100 cash with me, all in twenty dollar bills. I was told to arrive at the SPA about 30 minutes before, so I could relax in the hot-tub before hand. When I arrived, I was asked if I would be paying cash or credit. I said cash, and then asked what the total was. As I counted out the $100 in front of the receptionist, she replied the total was $106. I then said I would have to pay with my credit card, and I put the cash back into my wallet. I was then handed a robe, towel and locker key, and was told to go change and leave my belongings in the locker (13A). I did so. After my massage, I got dressed and returned to the SPA lobby. I then reached into my wallet and took a $20 bill out to tip my masseuse…not knowing I had already been robbed while getting a massage. I returned to my room to shower and change, and get ready for our dinner reservations. After dinner, I took out my wallet to leave a tip (even though this place is all-inclusive I still tip the staff well as they work very hard), and this is when I noticed I was missing two $20 bills. I only had $40 left in my wallet. I retraced my every step over and over again, and I never once used any of the 100 dollars, besides the $20 I gave the masseuse. After being in shock that hotel staff not only stole from me, but had access to my locker at the SPA, I became extremely angry. I called to the front desk and explained my frustration, and was told to fill out a report. The person at the desk at this time was Raul Valdez. He said there was no security on staff at that time, and that I would have to speak with the person who handles the “internal investigations”, Marcos, but Marcos would not be in until the following day. I told Raul I was leaving the next morning, so this would not work. He said to fill out the form (see attachment), and someone would get back in touch with me. I still to this day have not received a call or email from any Riu staff member. I even had Raul sign that he received the report on the copy I had him make for me (bottom right corner of attachment). After no response for months, I called Riu to speak with management. I got the run around the whole time. I then asked for an email address for management so I could make a complaint which I sent on June 29, 2009, only to receive an error that the email address (customerserviceamericas@riu.com) was invalid. I am now planning on returning to Mexico again, with a large group, and my disgust of Riu's lack of professionalism has risen again. I am new to trip advisor, and felt I should let everyone else know my negative experience, and Riu's lack of resolution. I have brought Riu a whole lot of business and do not understand why I have not been contacted about this issue…especially during a time they were hurting with the scare of the swine flu. Customer service should be at its peak to ensure repeat business at these times. It is very disturbing to know that, even in a locker, my personal belongings were scavenged thru by Riu's staff members and I was robbed. This makes me second guess the security of the safes in the rooms too. I really wanted this issue taken care of, and am really upset with the lack of follow-up Riu has put into this matter. I did not expect the staff to be so rude, and for security not to take my situation seriously. I strongly request for someone at Riu to contact me with some resolution to this issue. I will post the resolution to this matter on Trip Advisor, if there is one. Until then, I will strongly advise anyone NOT to stay at any Riu Resort.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: art1139
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I just returned from RIU Palace Riviera Maya, and had one of the best time ever. We are retired and travel about three times a year. This is the first time to an all Inclusive, and plan to return to the Riu in December this year. We were at ground level and found no security issues. Security in the room included deadbolt door lock, security lock on balcony door, and in room safe where U program personal combination. At our arrival at the desk, we received a friendly welcome and given a tropical drink. The hotel was beautiful as were are room and public areas. The buffet was good and had something for everyone. We especially enjoyed the specialty restaurants ( try the noodle side dish at the Asian restaurant J and all the side dishes at Mexican restaurant also J Breakfast Buffet always a plus. Room service is very quick. The beach is beautiful at the hotel and throughout the adjacent hotels ( no private beaches in Mexico, all beaches are federal property so explore). The pool area is great, plenty of lounge chairs, swim up bar with in water stools, music and excellent service. The bar serves quality liquor just ask, ( Beefeater, Johnny Red, Absolute, Don Pedro, etc). Nightly entertainment exceeded our expectations. We cruise a lot, and we feel the entertainment at the hotel is as good if not better. Aside from the entertainment at the Palace you can use the facilities at all the RIU in the area that includes the disco at Riu.Tequila all inclusive. Transportation : Taxi to the town of Play Car is about $4-$5 each way and less from Palace to Tequila hotel price includes tip. Now for the best , the Service, I only wish I could mention every employee at the hotel but believe me, they will go out of the way to make your stay enjoyable, from the bell boy to the omelet girl at breakfast, the pool, lobby , and sports bar bartenders etc.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT RESORT”
Reviews.Author: WillieC
Reviews.Content: We were at Riu Palace Riviera Maya the third week of September 2009. We found the resort to be excellent in every respect and really find the negative reviews puzzling (the few that there are). We were in a standard room on the ground floor of the south wing almost in the center. The room was garden view and was very nice. The bed was one of the most comfortable we have ever had in Mexico (none of the infamous hard Mexican bed). The room was nicely appointed and was kept immaculate by housekeeping. We were very happy with the room. The main lobby is very nice and the lobby bar, with piano music in the evenings, is a nice place to have a drink and relax. The area just outside the lobby building, called La Plaza is also a good place to relax in the evening before dinner with a cocktail. Each evening there was musical entertainment here and it changed day to day. Just off the plaza is the theatre where shows are presented in the evening. We found the shows to be pretty much like any show presented by a resort in Mexico – not spectacular but none the less entertaining. The pools are excellent as is the swim up bar. The drinks made at the pool are generous and well made. Those people that accused the drinks of being watered down must be hard core drunks that like their liquor straight up. Every drink we had was extremely strong. The strong point of this resort is the beach and beach sitting area. It is huge with many chairs (and beach waiters taking drink orders). The beach is actually two levels, with chairs on both levels. The upper level is completely private and access is allowed only to RIU guests. The lower level is on the public beach. The sand is soft and white and there are no rocks to speak of. The water is clear and the sand stays white and soft akk the way into the sea. The only time we ever saw sea weed was very early in the mornings before the staff had raked it up. During the day the water was clear and very clean. Snorkeling is very good right off the beach, especially around the sand bags out in the water. All in all one of the best beaches we have spent time on in Mexico. We found the food to be of high quality and very well prepared. Breakfast is served buffet style and offers a wide variety of items, including cook to order omelets and tortas. Each day the items were changed up a bit so a nice variety was always on offer. Lunch is served in an open air area by the pools and offers pizzas, burgers, hot dogs as well as a wide variety of other foods and a salad bar and dessert bar. The food here was excellent as well. We ate in the reservation ala carte restaurant “Krystal” twice and the Steak House. Both were very good but we liked Krystal best. We did not eat in the other ala carte places or the evening buffet. We were quite happy with the food. The staff of this hotel is without exception excellent, from the front desk to the bartenders to the housekeepers to the dining wait staff. All were friendly and helpful. This was our first visit to a RIU hotel and it will not be our last. We give the hotel big thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: crazigerl
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned with some of the negative reviews, however we got such a good deal I thought I would wait and see. The one thing I didn't see was the time share issue in the airport. There are a bunch of guys that approach you asking about your transfer to the hotel. They then direct you to the guys at the side which try and get you to go to the presentation, they ask you to plunk down 100 dollars cash which you supposedly get back at the presentation. We talked to some people at the hotel who did do this deal and they said they got a great deal on trips to Tulum and Chichen Itza as well as a spa visit. The presentation was 3 hours. Just a warning. As for the hotel, it was very nice, clean. The sheets were crisp and clean. The beds were firm and I didn't like feeling hubby's every move but I slept well. You can ask for different pillows. The bath tub is a bit darker but just pull back the curtain a bit you have enough light to do what you need to do. The tub is a very big step over almost two feet. The toilets didn't work great. However, I didn't know that in Mexico there are waste bins to put your toilet paper in as tgeir septic system doesn't do so well. I couldn't bring myself to do that. The fluffy drinks at the pool are not the greatest, I drank 5 and did not feel anything. Stick to beer or hard liquor. The drinks at the bar and the restaurants are much better. The sport bar has excellent sandwiches and desserts in the fridge, you just help yourself. The buffet in Don Manolo was good. Stay away from the lettuce that sits in water and ask for your omelette to be well done as they tend not to. Same with the burgers, they were pink in the middle. There is a information session in the bar and night entertainment at 9:30. The service was good. They did come quite early to clean the room but if you put the do not disturb they don't bug you. Don't wash your clothes and dry them outside, they stink. I took air fresheners and that did help with the smell. The 5th avenue streets are out the front door and to the right, there are a couple very small ruins on the way that were interesting and there is a bird aviary as well. The walk is 15 minutes at a slow steady pace. Silver should be 3-6 dollars a gram depending on the detail. We made them weigh and dealt from there. A silver filigree locket they wanted $78 and I got it for $24. Silver is mostly plated unless in the hotels, They call it el paca and if you ask some will tell you it is. This hotel gave us 30% off for cash and even better deals if you bought more than 1 item. We had a bit of problem making a local call due to language and the fron desk helped us. Our local call for 5 minutes was 38 pesos. We went to cozumel for the day, scooters are 20 bucks for the day. A ride in the cab around the island was well worth the 45 bucks as the driver stops at all his friends stores at the beach. Good shots for the camera. The flea market had some good prices on blankets.

Reviews.Title: “Slamming Doors”
Reviews.Author: GregStLouis_Missouri
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that the room doors are very loud when closed and we were awakened every night by slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, great resort, great location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnTraveler77
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Rui Palace Riviera Maya and would recommend the resort for those looking for a combination of good food, a very nice pool and a large sandy beach. Some resorts in Playa del Carmen have better pools, or better food, or a better beach, however for us the RUI gives you the best overall for the price. Several items to look out for: 1.) This resort has a low key night live. If you are looking for a disco, then you might want to consider another resort. 2.) While the dinners in the buffet are nice, you should try several, or all, of the special dinner restaurants, but be prepared to put up with the pain of the process for reservations. 3.) Consider upgrading to a room with a view of the courtyard / gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...no need to ever leave it!!! Miss I could live there.”
Reviews.Author: dghudson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 25 fellow managers...I know...I'm soooo lucky. We had the best time ever. The hotel is amazing, the staff superb, best pool ever, and next to the best beach ever with white sand and warm water. It's all inclusive so food, drinks, and alcohol are included. They also stock 4 bottles of hard liquor in your room which gets refreshed every 2 days. I've traveled to several destinations in Mexico and Central America and this one is tops on my list. My only minor complaint is about the lack of good Internet at the hotel. It's only available in the lobby over wifi. I tried many times to use Skype to call home to the US on my laptop. The call was dropped many times so that was a bit frustrating. There's no paid option in the room either for Internet so it's the lobby wifi or nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it -”
Reviews.Author: tysara
Reviews.Content: The bad: I stayed at the RIU for 4 nights - the main complaint I had was the rooms. the first room the gave us faced the AC Unit on the next door hotel - not a good view or sound. The fridge wasnt working and the floor was wet so we asked to be moved. The next room had a nice garden view but at night we encountered problems with the power. The electricity kept going off ever hour or so - which ment the fan and AC would also go off. We would switch the breaker and it would come on - temporairly. We tried to call the reception desk but no answer at 2 or 3 a.m. The next day we told them and they had someone come and look at it - but that night it happened again. And then again the next night - so someone came to look at it again. It didnt help and finally they offered to change our room, but we didnt want to move all our stuff. The good: service, the entertainers and wait staff were all super friendly, fun activities (water volleyball, beach party, snorkeling, kayaking, night shows). The bartenders and wait staff were great -- yeah Islas! It was my friends birthday and they brought her champange and chocolate strawberrries which was a nice touch. The beach was very nice, the relaxing loungers in the palms were great. Nice beach service for drinks. Would be nice to have food service as well, but that would be hard to keep up with. Swimming in the ocean was nice once you get past the large sandbags - they cause the water to be a little dirty. The water was very calm when we were there and very refreshing. We did a snorkeling excursion through the hotel (no good snorkeling unless you take a boat to a reef 20 minutes) and the guide was great. It was only $30 per person, so not too bad. We also took out the kayaks, did a snorkeling demo, played beach and water volleyball, and did some of the activities. The ok: food at the restaurants were just ok. We tried the Mexican and it was decent, you would expect better in Mexico. Then we tried the Fusion which was pretty good. The buffets were ok - I just have a weak stomach and couldnt find out what was getting to me. The drinks were ok if you like sweet stuff - I dont, and had a hard time finding something that I could drink without being syrup tasting. They had a gym but the ac was always not working so it was too hot inside. Free room service 24-7 was nice -- the food wasnt too good, but it came within 10 minutes so that was GREAT! I walked around to some of the other RIU properties and this was the nicest - we went to the Disco at the RIU Tequila and that was fun as well. There were a lot of couples and not many families, but it might have been because school just started.

Reviews.Title: “It will be hard to beat this holiday!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dandog_9
Reviews.Content: Best holiday ever!!! On the transfer form the airport to the hotel the guide was selling coronas for just $2 and water for $1. What a start!!! Lovely hotel, great staff, good food, puddings to die for, margaritas on tap (or any cocktail you can think of!!!), waiter service by/in the pool, you would never go thirsty!!!!!! Wall to wall sunshine!!! Gorgeous beach. Loads to do, shops within walking distance, water sports on the beach. Activities through out the day around the pool and on the beach. Buffet next to the pool area so you do not have to go far for snacks during the day or ice cream!!!!!! Rooms were beautifully kept with all you could need and more. His and hers sinks in the bathroom, hair dryer (actually quite good), iron and board, mini bar fully stocked everyday!!! Full size optics dispenser with 4 spirits!!!!! Ice machine at the end of the hall. Digital safe in room, free to use. We had a great view of the court yard from our balcony. All the gardens and courtyard were always immaculate, staff were always cleaning, sweeping, mopping, and they were always smilling and saying 'hola' all the time! Shows at night were good, and John the waiter was great. He remembered what we liked to drink and had them brought out to us before we had even ordered. Buffet was excellent, as good as the a la carte restaurants. These were easy to book too. When you walk through the doors the reception area will take your breathe away, fresh flower arrangements on huge tables and huge vases, stunning. Checking in was quick and the staff were brilliant, even giving us a free room upgrade on arrival. Overall this holiday was amazing, as good as it gets!!! I would go back there tomorrow no questions. Everything was perfect. There were alot of American groups there, most of them for weddings, but they are all very friendly and funny. Go on book it!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd trip back to Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Heather W
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Playa but the first time with my husband. So I'll start from the very beginning. You can book your travel through www.riu.com, but I recommend you sign up with Riu Class as you will earn points and there are some perks with the card which is FREE. Now when booking you can book just the hotel or hotel and flight. Either way you are given FREE Transportation to/from the hotel ... this is where the fun begins! TRANSPORTATION: My recommendation is to use Cancun Transfers (www.Cancuntransfers.com) for your round trip shuttle to/from the airport. We paid $110 for 2 people round trip to/from the airport/hotel. After we got through customs a gentleman was standing there with our names, just outside the airport. He took us to our shuttle (a NICE new Excursion with leather interior). We arrived at our hotel in exactly 50 minutes. At the end of our trip Cancun Transfes were in the lobby waiting for us and we arrived at the airport in plenty of time. Now if you choose the FREE shuttle service, do not expect to arrive in 50 minutes, but rather about 3+ hours. The FREE service is there to pick up ALL Riu customes and until the bus is full (typically) they don't leave the airport. RPRM (Riu Palace Riviera Maya) is the LAST stop so, the $110 (tip was not included) is well worth the extra money!!!! HOTEL: This trip was to celebrate my husbands birthday and our anniversary. Upon checking in we were immediately upgraded to a garden view room and inside our room awaited champaign and chocolate covered strawberries. The room was very clean. Our mini refridgerator was making a humming noise so I called the front desk and within 15 minutes maintenace was out to fix the noise. We were in room 1065 which is right next to the nightly entertainment. My only concern was the noise level if we had decided to turn in early; however, one night we were in bed by 10 and could not hear anything inside our room. The view was perfect, as we could see the entire court yard, watch the entertainment from our balcony, and even see the pool and a small portion of the ocean. ALCOHOL: Last year they provided Corona this year its Dos Equis. There are no light beers on the resort, so if you're watching your figure, forget it you're on vacation enjoy a few extra calories. The drinks were too sweet for us to really enjoy, and this is what I also experienced last year. The trick to the drinks can be two fold. One if you're wanting to drink at the pool, purchase a large mug (we bought a Bubba Keg 34 oz <www.bubbakeg.com> which kept our water, beer, drinks cold for over 8 hours!!!!). The humidity will melt your drinks before you get the 1st sip, so the insulated cup is worth while to take with you. Now if you can find a bartender to make you good drinks, then pull a few dollars out as they will go a long way on your trip. We loved the bartender 'Islas' (aka: Pape) at the La Habana bar just inside the hotel. His mojitos and expresso martini were to die for. Everything he made was to perfection, not too strong, not too weak, not too much simple syrup!!! In your room you have a selection of Bacardi Rum, Smirnoff Vodka, Jose Cuervo Tequilla, and Brandy. The refridgerator will be stocked with 4 beers, and several mixers (only sodas no juice), such as Pepsi, Pepsi Light, Orange Soda, and 7up. If you like cranberry juice or others you should go down to 5th avenue and purchase some to keep in your fridge! ENTERTAINMENT: The entertainment is good considering you're in Playa. Do not go with the expectation of a vegas show! We watched the Michael Jackson show and it was actually pretty good. There were a few others that we watched from outside in the courtyard, but this year the shows didn't impress me as much as last year. All shows start at 9:45 PM and last approximately 1 hour. DINING: This is the tricky part so pay attention. There are a total of 5 restaurants, Don Manolo (Buffet style breakfast and dinner), Chilis (Buffet style lunch/snacks and at night opens into a restaurant), Krystal (fusion), Yashima (Japanese), Agave (Mexican), and Botafogo (Brazilian Rodizio). Every morning Do Manolo serves breakfast from 7 am - 10 am. The food is excellent and provides something for everybody. There is only coffee and no expresso! Now onto lunch. Lunch is served at Chilis which is located just across from the pool and has ocean views (not many). The food is pretty good (fish, salad bar, calamari, french fries). They serve a little of everything just to fill you up. Onto dinner...this is the tricky part. Dinner at Chilis, Krystal, Yashima, Agave, and Botofogo ALL require reservations. Seats fill up quickly and reservations are taken from noon - 3 pm upstairs near the La Habana bar. You can make reservations for up to 3 nights. Dinner is served either at 6:30 or 8:45. Each dinner lasts about 1 1/2 hours. If you can't get reservations then you can eat at Don Manolo which in my opinion is excellent food (considering you're at an all inclusive!!).
