While on this trip our favorite in order was Chilis (steak and lobster), Agave (mexican), Yashima(Japanese), Botofogo (Brazillian), and Krystal (fusion). Men are not allowed to wear tank tops to any of the restaurants. Shorts are allowed at ALL but Krystal and Yashima as these two allow only men to wear pants. If you try to enter in shorts you will be rejected. Women can wear an array of anything from shorts and tanks, to sun dresses. EXCURSIONS: This trip the only excursion we took was to Cozumel. If you plan to go, plan ahead, take the 7 am ferry so you can have time to really enjoy the island. There are two ferry companies, so my recommendation is to buy a one way ticket so you're not confined to the time restraints of every 2 hours (arrivals and departures). Besides there is no savings to buy round trip with the same company. The trip there and back was $48 per person ($24 each way) and takes about 45 minutes. We rented scooters from Charlies at the docking area in Playa. We paid $25 US and once we were in Cozumel we paid an additional $15 US for the insurance (to cover the comprehensive/collision). The $25 paid for the helmet, liablity insurance (coverage if you hurt somebody else or damage property), gas, etc. Bring a backpack so you can wear it if you rent scooters, with your snorkle gear, money, passport, etc. There are several nice areas along the way to stop and snorkle, and lots of photo opps. My husband saw some amazing coral and fish life! It will take all day to travel around the island so plan to be gone about 10 hrs if you really want to enjoy all the sites. Oh and bring cash, if you don't buy round trip tickets on the ferry they will only take cash no credit cards! We had JUST enough cash to buy tickets back, not a penny or peso more! The clerks working at the Ferry dock were not very friendly. It's definately a trip worth taking!!!!!! All in all the trip was amazing, we will be going back. We stayed 5 days and 4 nights which was just enough time. Next year we're thinking of going to the Riu in Cancun for 3 days then heading down to Playa for 3 additional days. If you have questions please feel free to ask, this is my 2nd trip to the same resort and in my opinion this place is top notch! There will always be those who find something to complain about, I'd just ignore most of the negative comments because if you read most of the reviews over 90 - 95% are positive!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were in a Spanish Palace, set on a gorgeous beach!”
Reviews.Author: traveler266
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous 3 night stay at Riu Palace Riviera Maya, June 2009. We were greeted and "welcomed home" when we arrived -- check-in was quick and easy -- and we were offered a refreshing fruit drink and cold towel. The bellman took our luggage and escorted us to our room -- what a beuatiful view of the stunning landscaped grounds ! The bellman made sure everything was in working order and the room was to our satisfaction before leaving. We easily made dinner reservations for 2 nights by going to the lobby and speaking with the maitre'd , and then we headed off to the pool and beach. You won't believe this -- the beach has bar service -- waiters come by on a regular basis to take drink orders ! The beach has a ''forest" of deep green palm trees that provide some shade for those who want to lay on the beach chaises . There are also chaises out in the sun, too. NO problem getting a chaise, any time of day !! The pool is huge-- and has in-pool tiled lounges and jacuzzi jets at the in-pool tables set up for having drinks IN the pool ! We saw the free introductory scuba lessons taking place in the pool, but didn't participate. Dinners were wonderful -- our favorites were the Mexican and the Continental Fusion restaurant -- great choices -- well prepared ! (Make sure to try the guacamole and salsa when you visit the buffet -- the recipes are wonderful ! ) As for drinks -- Margaritas and Cosmopolitians were perfectly made -- and the Mexican beer served was outstanding! Service is excellent , everywhere at this resort ! The staff is so friendly, and ready to help ! What a difference from our stay at a Florida resort .... !! At night, there is a jazz pianist playing during the dinner hours, near the lobby bar. Evening entertainment is offered in their show lounge --- the performers give the audience a great show -- we were not sure we would find the fire dancers to our liking -- but we were amazed at the skill and daring those guys showed, as they put on an hour-long show! Another evening, a Mexican mariachi band gave a great performance, too -- highlighting the culture of the region. This Riu resort is perfectly located if you want to walk into Playa del Carmen -- just a short 15 minute walk -- walk along the sidewalk, in the "million dollar golf course community" of Playacar, and in 15 minutes you are at the shops in Playa del Carmen. Along the way, you will walk past some Mayan ruins located just off the sidewalk -- great photo opportunity ! We can't wait until December --- we loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya so much, we are going back for a week ! ( One note -- we have friends who visit Cancun often -- they told us to make sure to use the bottled water provided in the rooms for brushing teeth and drinking -- we did -- and didn't have any problems with upset stomachs . Resort bars use purified ice, so ice in drinks is not a problem. )

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience-Read for honest opinion”
Reviews.Author: lvazcona
Reviews.Content: Worse experience ever I went with three other girls for a long weekend to Riviera Maya and decided to stay at RPRM after reviewing a lot of options and prices. It was a complete nightmare, I just couldn’t believe why people would ever return to this hotel. The “24-hour all inclusive” deal is a scam. Breakfast is only served from 8 to 10 and after that you will only find snacks in the restaurant (Chilis) by the pool. The same happens with lunch, schedule restricted and the only thing available is cold, dry, old “snacks” in the same restaurant by the pool. The service is awful, the personnel there just don’t care about customer service, seriously they have an attitude problem. We arrived at 3:20 at the front desk for check in and we were informed that to have dinner in one of the “a la carte” restaurants you had to make a reservation but only until 3:00 PM. So the first night we had to eat snacks again for dinner. The next day I went to the hostess to make a reservation for dinner that night and I was very rudely informed by this lady that all restaurants were already booked and there was nothing left! Even though the hotel was clearly half empty! I assume that they make your life difficult to force you to have lunch or dinner somewhere else to cut their costs. The rooms are really hideous, we booked two doubles and we found out that all their rooms are extremely small, with two double beds pulled together in the middle of the room. That was really uncomfortable. Trying to save space by doing this is really cheap. The toilets in the reception area –for guests- were repugnant, I tried to use one and had to go out to report to a manager the state of all the toilets. Drinks are good and they just keep coming but, once again, schedule is very restricted. Service in the beach area stops at 5:00 PM, while service in the pool area (including towels) stops at 6:00 PM, when the sun is still fully shining! I seriously recommend to read all reviews and focus on those mentioning any of the highlights above. I did that prior to my trip and even when I found a consistency in the “poor service and lousy food” comments, decided to take a chance and try it. OH BOY, DO I REGRET IT!!!! It is not worth your money, there are zillion of other options in Cancun and the Riviera Maya area! I promised myself to advice all my family and friends about this horrible experience, please take my word for it.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya Si` Si` Si`”
Reviews.Author: ichogger
Reviews.Content: First time reviewer here. Just got home last night, was there Tuesday-Saturday. Been on 6 or 7 cruises and 1 other all-inclusive in the Dominican. This trip was great. Any really negative reviews you read are most certainly flukes. We were a group of 4, 3 female and 1 male, that'd be me :) Ages from 28-32, like to have a good time but fear our best crazy partying days are behind us. Arrival in Cancun was painless, we used Cheap Caribbean and had set up private transfers with Olympus. About 45 minutes to get to our hotel. When you first walk in it is amazing, palacial even, but the best part was it is airconditioned. We requested two adjoining rooms in the Jr. Suite Superior category which just meant we had a courtyard view instead of exterior view. Didn't spend much time on the balcony so no biggie, not sure if it's worth the extra $100 or so. We were on the ground floor, rooms 103 and 102, middle building, perfectly placed between the pool/ocean and the lobby/restaurants. Come to think of it, if you are trying to sleep early, you may want an exterior view as the shows and music after 9:45 can be a little loud, not noticeable if you have the TV or fan on, but if your room is quiet, you may hear what's going on outside. The room was well appointed with marble everywhere. Stocked mini-bar with Orange soda, club soda, Pepsi, Diet Pepsi, Dos-Equis beer and 4 bottles of water. They were refilled everyday, plus you can get more water at the sports bar off the lobby. There was a liquor dispensor that had Absolut Vodka, Cuervo Tequila, Bacardi Rum and some sort of Brandy. Two double beds were pushed together to make a King, not the greatest if you and your partner are snugglers as one would have to be on the crack in the middle, but my wife and I have been married long enough we didn't need to be that close. Ha ha, just kidding honey. There was a Sony flat screen TV that had a few English Speaking channels. The A/C was COLD! I don't know if other people left their balcony door cracked or something because that shuts off the A/C, but ours and our friends' worked wonderfully. I swear I could see my breath a few times. I love the cold, I hate sleeping when I'm hot. Pool was great! We spent more time in the "Infinity" pool which was calm and away from the party part of the main pool. Chair availability didn't seem to be a problem. Overall the resort seemed at about 60-70% capacity, never had to wait for anything. Waiters were constantly walking around asking you if you needed a drink. The main pool had water volleyball set up throughout most of the day. They also had concrete tables and benches as well as concrete loungers on both sides of the pool. The water was lukewarm I'd say, not too cold, not too hot, just about right. Pool cleanliness didn't seem to be an issue. The beach had an upper and lower section, the upper had trees all around it so you could stay in the shade, the lower part was all about sun. Loungers seemed in good supply in both sections. Drink service was adequate I'd say, seems like when I really wanted one it was scarce, when I was feeling blah, the waiter was there every 5 minutes. Yes there are beach bags or whales in the water but there is PLENTY of open area for playing in the ocean. Beach seemed clean to me, sure there was some seaweed but it is the ocean, not a filtered swimming pool for Pete's sake. We ate breakfast in the Main Buffet every morning, food was good. Not gourmet, but it is a buffet. Lots of options though. Lunch we ate in the Main Buffet as well, once we ate at the Beach Buffet which turns into the steakhouse at night, food quality was just as good, but selection was lacking a little. For dinner we ate at the Buffet the first night and it was excellent, we then tried the Brazilian, Steakhouse and Japanese. They were all excellent. We had a very picky eater in our group and she seemed very pleased which shocked me, this girl doesn't eat cheese, vegetables or fruit for crying out loud! If she can be happy, anybody can be happy. We went to the shows every night. The Michael Jackson show was very good, the others I would call not quite Cruise ship quality. Cruise ship quality of course is not Broadway Quality. They were entertaining, but as long as you don't expect the London Cast of Phantom of the Opera, you won't be disappointed. Everything is lip-synched. They are really trying, the "animacion" staff are there from 9am until 11pm. I mean wow, that a long day of smiling and being entertaining. One day we walked down the beach to check out the other resorts, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is by far the best on the surface anyways. We went into the other Riu's and the Riviera Maya was superior in many ways. I guess the "Palace" class is the top tier. We had better choices of top-shelf booze than the other Riu's. The biggest difference is that our Restaurants, (except the beach buffet/steakhouse), Lobby and showroom were air-conditioned! This is huge as it is very very hot and steamy. It's nice to have someplace cool to sit and have a drink. There is a little jewelry shop in the lobby as well as a gift shop that sells essentials. Rather high priced but they'll have most of what you need if you run out of say suntan lotion. They have an abridged version of USA Today available if you need your daily news fix. My biggest cautionary tale, watch the exchange rate. It is currently about $1 USD = $12.5 Pesos. So a $20 bill should be $250 Pesos. Watch your change. I tried to get change at the internet station, I wanted to change a $10 US bill for $5 peso coins for the pool table and he tried to only give me $100 pesos in return. I would actually suggest changing out a hundred bucks or so into pesos for small purchases. $20 pesos bills are perfect for tips. A cab ride anywhere in Playa is $50 pesos or about $4 US. We took a cab into town to shop on 5th Avenue or La Quinta and go to Senor Frogs. The shop keepers are quite pushy there, just keep walking and say No Gracias. If you want a Henna Tattoo, your hair braided, weed or cocaine though, they'll gladly oblige. The little shop area in Playacar next to the hotel has the same stuff and not as pushy sales people. Theres a currency exchange at these shops as well. There is a US dollar ATM as well as a pesos ATM at Senor Frogs. As we only had 4 full days we didn't do any tours so I can't help you there. The resort kinda goes dead after the show lets out at 11pm. The only bar open after midnight is the sports bar which is where we spent most nights, it is 24 hours. Victor and Antonio were good bartenders. There were nachos, fruit, sandwiches and hamburgers and hot dogs in the refrigerated case in there you could heat up for a late snack. The trip back to Cancun to the airport was uneventful. I know I'm jumping around a bit but if you have any questions, email me.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: buzzgarr
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice, beach, water, palm trees. I've been to several all-inclusives, Sandals being the best. The main reason is they don't allow kids. I knew there would be kids here but when their throwing footballs and jumping in the swim-up bar area without of coarse any supervision it gets a little frustrating. Food was ok, everything basically tastes the same. Mexican Resturant would be better if they offered some dinners with some mexican flair(spice )Service was very good, bartenders, house keeping etc. Entertainment is not real good at night, nothing much to do after 10:30 or so late night piano bar might help. Other than the kids the place was very nice

Reviews.Title: “Not Much to Complain About Here :)”
Reviews.Author: DallasLilly
Reviews.Content: Had a great time, staff was very courteous and helpful. The only big problem was with the coffee, it was virtually undrinkable. The only place to get a decent cup was the Sports Bar where they had a machine that brewed individual cups. So, I would recommend in room coffee makers!! Room turn down was skipped a couple of nights, which didn't really bother us,and the towels in the bath weren't all replenished daily, but little things matter to some people.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Holiday, Wished we had stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: minihaha22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on the 29th July for 11 nights, I work in the Travel Industry and had really spent time looking at different Hotels before deciding to stay here and are really pleased we did, Hotel was stunning, gave us a lovely room on the ground floor, no upgrade to oceon view!! but still a lovely room, mini bar stocked everyday if used, A/C worked great, Bathroom a little disappointing for a Palace but still OK, Food and restaurants are really good with plenty of choice, pool bar was really good and plenty of choice of drinks & cocktails, only moan could be it got a little noicy with a couple of wedding party's!! fun watching them! Entertainment team are a credit to the Hotel they work so hard and all so friendly especially Edna from the childrens club. One good thing about staying at the Palace is you can use the facilities of the other RIU Hotels and after visiting them we had made the best choice to stay here. Travelled with Tui and upgraded our seats to Premium can highly recommend this, well worth the money on such a long flight!! Would we go back, yes most proberly but it is such a big world so may be try another Caribbean island next time, but certainly worth a visit, ENJOY!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Read for a good honest review."”
Reviews.Author: NorwoodDave
Reviews.Content: I stayed at two different resorts for my honeymoon. RIU Palace Riviera Maya and Iberostar Tucan. I will write the tucan today as well for everyone to see. Background: Just got married, two social drinkers who like to have a good time Check in: Flawless. We checked in about an hour early and they had a room ready for us. The people at the front desk were very professional and explained everything that was included and gave us our keys, called a bellman, and we were on our way Room: We actually switched rooms. We had room 99, which was on the bottom floor, but wanted to move, so the front desk didn't have a problem with it, moved us the next day. **there was a snag. Our toilet had to be manually flushef for the first few days, but we are on vacation, so who really cares. Other than that, we had a great view of the pool and courtyard from our room. I would highly recommend upgrading to courtyard if you get a chance. Also, you can keep your room at a brisk 65 degrees which is great for sleeping. Pool: Honestly, I think there were way too many people that decided that the pool was a bathroom, since it was warmer then the 100 degree weather we had outside. The pool bar is great though, although the bartenders weren't all that friendly. The infinity pool was the way to go if you could get a good server to get you drinks. Beach: Outstanding, if you have snorkel equipment, bring it, as you can see fish around the beach guard things in the water. Entertainment: we saw a show or two but I think I have seen better. The people on stage are great, but the set up was a little odd. Bars: What is nice about the RIU is you get to use all the other resorts. We counted 15 different bars that you can walk to. It was great. They have the best bartender at the lobby bar, Islas, the man. He remembers what you drink and your name everytime you see him. He makes a good Kamikasi's. Sports bar was fun as well. Food: The food here was decent. It had some great moments and some not so good ones. I like the buffett. Stay away from the Brazilian. Mexican was great. Steak house is great. One thing I like about RIU RM is you can make two reservations a day, which allows you to eat at all the specialty restaurants, unlike all other resorts. Service: Mediocre - I thought the specialty restaurants were a mixed bag for service, and the pool bar staff weren't too friendly. I do think the staff works hard, and overall they were good. People at the resort: Awesome. We met some great people, Jake & Caitlyn, Okey and Sheli. We have to say that there was just some great people at this place. We were sad to leave. We even met a Harry Potter look-a-like. Everyone is extremely friendly on this resort, unlike other places I have stayed. You will run into more of the English, American, Canadians, Scottish/Irish here. Overall we had an amazing time at the RIU thanks to the beauty of the resort and the people we met. I can't wait to go back. If you are a fussy eater or a non-sociable person, or a family, I would say this might be a 2nd choice for you. For families, I found the Iberostar much better than the RIU ***FREE WIFI in the loby is key*** Iberostar $13 a day - Cheers

Reviews.Title: “tropical parasdise that not even swine flu could spoil.”
Reviews.Author: holidayWorcester
Reviews.Content: We have just returned back from a truly wounderful holiday at the riu palace, before we chose this hotel, we read the reviews on this site, and i would say do not be put off by what some people write, we found this a great hotel and holiday from start to finish. We arrived at Cancun airport and found immigration no problem at all, quick and easy, the coach journey was also good, beer on the coach very cold and refreshing after a long flight, it cost 3dollars, and worth every dollar. On arrival at the hotel it looked stunning from the outside, but it did not prepare you for what it was like on the inside, some other reviews complained of a musty smell, yes you could smell it but what would you expect in a country that is hot with a high humidty, but honeslty this was not a problem. The lobby area is breath taking and once inside the air conditioning is just what you need. The staff made checking in so easy and no hassle. The room was lovley, very clean with a well stocked optics bar and fridge, this was also re-stocked every day.The room was cleaned to a high standard every day, room service was great and very quick, unlike what some reviews had said on here. The grounds of the hotel are spotless, the swimming pool's are great, although we did not use the pool's as we chose to spend our time on the wounderful beach, and what a beach it is, there is no problem getting into the water, again we had read some reviews of people complaining of it being very rocky in the water, let me tell you, there is no problem with this at all, we would recommend you take your snorkel set, as the fish to see are amazing. When down at the beach the waiter serivce is unbelievable, one person in particular was always there when you needed light refreshment, Jose, he worked all hours of the day and night, and nothing was too much for him, or any of the other staff, we found them all very friendly and always willing to help, they work so hard and still remain very pleasant. The buffet resturant was very good, altough you must try the speciality resturants, we tryed the mexican, brazilian, steak house and the gourmet, steak house was lovley but our favourite was the gourmet, this was truly remarkable and a must, my only regret was not going back for another sitting. Overall i would truly recommend this hotel, you will have a wounderful stay, i cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace is a land cruise.”
Reviews.Author: TexasBella7
Reviews.Content: I knew when they slapped a wristband on my arm at check in, that this was not the place for me. Here are the reasons why I would never stay here again, nor recommend it: 1. The service was terrible. Our a/c didn't work and they refused to fix it, and when I called to tell them about it, they told me to walk the 2 miles back to the main lobby. They wouldn't change our room even though it was uncomfortably warm. The service at the restaurants and bars was just as bad, if not worse. They were extremely unaccommodating and smug. Cocky and rude. Why should they care? It's all inclusive and they don't receive tips. 2. The place is HUGE. Disneyland huge, and just as cheesy. 3. The food was HORRIBLE. The only thing myself and my friends felt comfortable eating was nachos. The buffets were full of unidentifiable foods that reminded me of the lunch line back in grade school. 4. They wouldn't give us bottled water at the restaurants or bars. 5. If you are in college or fresh out of college, and you want the feeling that you are on Spring Break, then you will like this place. Otherwise, stay somewhere else. I am too old to feel like a Spring Breaker when I go on vacation. I am sure that there are some smaller, nicer all inclusive places to stay, if all inclusive is your thing. This place is a nightmare and I would not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “total paradise”
Reviews.Author: hinnhermanchesteruk
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel having before been to a few palaces but this one is the best yet from as soon as you walk in the lobby with its decor it is a palace on arrival we were made welcome with cocktails while checking in and our cases taken to our room where then the poter opened our mini fridge opened us a beer and welcomed us to riu palace. our room was spotless good veiw, tbed comfy fridge stocked dailey and also optics replaced when almost empty,moving to pool the service was good drinks brought to your lounger or down to the beech there is a swim up bar and also seating with tables in the pool . the food is very good plenty selection at breakfast,lunch,dinner .the evening entertainment is good with a lovely courtyard to sit and be waited on in the evening. like us you may hear reports about the beech yes there are large sand bags on the beech this is to reclaim the beech due to errosion it did not bother us as this hotel has a large pool then its own very large private area with lougers and hammocks and then the beech with a 15 mtr walk to the sea and you can walk along beech calling into other rui hotels for a drink if you wish,we can not find fault with this hotel and will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit in 2 months - A little dissapointed this time!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaFreitas
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this resort was in June 2009. As I loved the hotel so much I made sure to come back with family instead for a 7 night stay (17-24 August 2009). However, I have to say that they are definitely cutting costs in the food! First, at breakfast they don't have anymore a sandwich station, where a chef did make to order delicious sandwiches. Also they don't have the same variety of natural juices. My favorite juice, which was the tangerine one, wasn't there anymore. Also I noticed that they reduced their seafood stock. In my last trip they had shrimps at almost any meal, caviar at least 2 times a week and this time I only found 1 dessert with caviar the whole 7 nights I was there (shrimp only in speciality restaurants). Also no strawberries (only in syrup) or mango this time. Also, not even once was I approached at the pool or at the beach to be asked for drinks. Last time I got offered drinks without even have to ask! I don't mind to walk a few meters to the bar, however it was supposed to have a beach/pool service which I didn't see this time! The room I got has better than last time (a 3rd floor room with an awesome ocean view) with no musty smell! However this time got only towel animals twice (last time it was everyday) and also got no gift (last time got a kind letter by the reception with a miniature of the Chichen-Itza pyramid). Also, the last night I was there (Sunday) it was supposed to have a show with professional singers (tradicional mexican songs, which I saw last time), however without notice they had a dance competition instead with guests of the hotel. It was fun, however If I had known this before I would have gone to the Palace Mexico for the Mayan night! These were definitely the most negative points I found out this time. However not everything was bad! This time, they had 2 fantastic beach parties held by the animation team! Speaking of which, they were amazing as always! Working 12-14 hours a day isn't easy, however they have so much energy that I'm always amazed with! Also the service at the restaurants was very good as always! Even though the self-service drink machine was down most of the days at the beach restaurant, they were more than happy to bring you anything you want! Please dont' get me wrong about this hotel, I did have a fantastic stay there and my parents too! However If after my stay in June I wouldn't hesitate to come back to this hotel, next time maybe I'll try another one...

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews Are Wrong”
Reviews.Author: NoUnrealExpectations
Reviews.Content: The 2 reviews before mine that deem this resort anything less than a 5 star must have stayed somewhere else. These reviewers had to have been there during our stay. I would suggest that readers ignore them as they must have unreal expectations or me impossible to please. The Hotel is easily a 5 star, the staff was excellent, food great, always something different at buffet, if you cant find something good at the buffet you must be the worlds most fussiest eater. Yes there was some mold smell occasionally, but guess what your in one of the highest humidty areas of the world, why do you think everything is made out of concrete and there is all marble and no carpet???? We had 1 problem with a drink being watery and guess what? We asked for it to be stronger, it took no effort and they remembered us for the rest of the trip never had to ask again. The front desk staff was wonderful as well as the room cleaners. Honestly this place is great, I have to wonder if anything would make the people who wrote the bad reviews happy?

Reviews.Title: “As far from luxury as you can get”
Reviews.Author: kmurphy81
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I understand there are a lot of positive reviews on this site, but for anyone looking for luxury travel…. stay elsewhere. This place is as far from luxury as I have ever seen. The food was awful, the service abysmal and the bed the most uncomfortable I have ever experienced. Our AC did not work in our room and we reported it multiple times, it was never fixed. We asked repeatedly to move rooms, with no success. Beer was served in a small glass a bit larger than a Dixie cup, they refused to give us full bottles of water (even after we offered to pay for them), and they do not even have filtered ice at the outdoor bars. A must for Mexico. I felt almost like being on a cruise with all buffets, theme restaurants and timed dinner seatings. They actually kicked us out of the restaurant while we were still eating because of the next seating. We relocated after the first night. You get what you pay for in this situation. If you are looking for college spring break, this may be what you are searching for.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya Is Phenomenal!!!”
Reviews.Author: JCBurnett
Reviews.Content: I flipped through a few of the negative reviews prior to booking this hotel, and several days later, after a stay of eight nights, I have to think that some people are either impossible to please, or at a minimum, being way too nitpicky. "Showers a little dark"? Did anyone stop to think that after being in the hot sun all day, it's nice to get into a little darker, cooler place (and there is plenty of light)? "Musty smell"? I didn't notice it. "Cups around the pool"? It's a gorgeous pool with a pool bar, how about faulting the tourist crowd for leaving things around, rather than the extremely hard-working hotel staff working to keep up with them? Have a room "that opens up onto another hotel"? That other hotel is a few hundred feet away, and is separated by a beautifully manicured garden setting the Riu Palace maintains. In other words, ignore any bad reviews you might see of this place (and from what I've seen, you'll have to go a ways back to find any). I've stayed at some extremely nice hotels around the world (Fairmonts, Four Seasons, etc.), and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya easily matches up. From the moment you walk in, you're treated like royalty. Anything you want/need, is at your fingertips in an instant. The rooms are beautiful and spotless. Housekeeping left us with a different towel oragami animal every day that delighted my wife. The pool is gorgeous, beach is beautiful and right there next to the pool. The beer is good and cold, food excellent, service great. Get up early any morning and witness a virtual army of help and cleaning staff working to keep the Riu Palace spotless. The location cannot be beat -- far enough from PDC to be away from it all, while easily walkable to Fifth if one chooses (we did this most days). My wife and I loved our stay at the Riu Palace, and look forward to returning. Keep up the good work Riu!

Reviews.Title: “Not what is used to be...”
Reviews.Author: kimmyToronto
Reviews.Content: We just returned on Aug 23. We are frequent travellers to the Riu Palace and this is why we decided to go back. Although the resort itself if quite pretty, and the grounds are nice, thats where it ended for us. First off...the beach...there are these huge sand bangs...and visually they are horrible...but the issue is that these bags are moldy and have algae and they smell horrible...as soon as you walk towards the beach, the stench becomes quite apparent. The seawood is everywhere... The food and service was far superior than other times and it just wanted up to par this time. The pools had a lot of mold between the tiles and other than the staff taking out some debris, I never once saw them being cleaned. Everything was substandard. Maybe if you have not travelled to the resort before then you may not see these issues. After going several times, I would never ever return...in my opinion, this is no longer a 5 star resort....and it was quite dissapointing.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is a "10" star!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LucyR46
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was married at this fairy tale resort. There were 23 of us who flew down for the event. The outstanding service started as soon as the doors of the hotel slid open, and it never stopped until we walked through one week later. The whole staff is top notch. You never met a single person who did not greet you, stop and talk to you or ask how you were doing. They tried their best to speak in our language. They could not do enough for you. Whatever you wanted, you got. I felt like a queen in a palace. I have never had that feeling from any other place I've travelled to. Our room was gorgeous. Absolutely spotless everyday. Very comfortable beds and always comfortable temperature. There was something there for everyone, from computer service to fitness centers, yoga classes, pool exercises, and an afternoon by the pool that was always filled with music, dancicng, games and fun. Or if you wanted a little more quiet you walked down the stairs and found a lounge chair under a swaying palm and just watched the world go by. Para sailors, jet skiers, windsurfers, catamarans, or just stare at the crystal clear aqua waters. What I liked the best was the fact that we were there for one of the most important events in our life, our daughter's wedding. The fact that she chose the most beautiful place I have ever seen, is just a bonus! There was one part of the trip that I did not like though. That was when those doors slid open for the last time and I had to walk through them. This was the first time in my life that I have never wanted to go home from a vacation. I actually cried!!! P.S..... I am already saving for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: KennedysHampshire
Reviews.Content: Spent 10 days at Riu Palace Riveria Maya with my husband . . . and we felt like lottery winners and at the very least, a second honeymoon! Our stay at the hotel was faultless. The food was superb with a wonderful buffet restaurant or for a more intimate atmosphere, we could book (free of charge) one of the five other restaurants - Mexican, Japanese, Brazilian, Steak or French. All inclusive entitled us to food and drink 24 hours a day if we so desired. Waiters would even bring cocktails onto the beach. Not to be missed, the kitchen tour - spotless - and very interesting. The hotel are proud of their level of hygiene. The staff were very attentive and worked hard. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble so we were only too happy to tip those staff who had served us. The buildings are palatial and spotless. We had a standard room which looked onto an adjoining hotel, but it was again cleaned daily to a high standard and was spacious, with double sinks and a spa bath with shower in bathroom. The only negative I can say here is that the ceiling fan needs to be on constantly to reduce humidity, and this can be rather noisy at night. We did purchase one trip to Xelha and Tulum which we thoroughly enjoyed. The trip was expensive but the guide was very knowledgeable and concise. However he had a stock of waterproof cameras for sale at $15, which were supposedly cheaper than Xelha; we gave him $20, but never received change . . . so that was his tip! Then, a WARNING for shoppers at Xelha . . . we purchased a couple of souvenirs and confirmed with the assistant beforehand that she could exchange $50. Change was given in Pesos and by the time we had converted to sterling and checked receipt we realised we had been given the change of $20 instead of the $50! Expensive learning curve and the moral of story for fellow travellers and our next trip to Mexico - take Pesos or Dollars in lower denominations. Another WARNING - Taxi to Playa del Carmen should be $5 from hotel. Check with driver beforehand that this is the fee as one wanted to charge us $200! We loved the fact that we could walk between other RIU hotels on complex and use their facilities, but Riu Palace Riveria Maya was in our opinion, definitely THE BEST!! Fantastic holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sasha88
Reviews.Content: We went to this resort to check it out for my son's wedding next year, we were very pleased. We travel a lot and have been to many All Inclusives and I must say this is the best I have been to. The beds were not awesime but they were fine, we have slept on some beds that felt like you might as well sleep on the floor and these were no where close. Sure they aren't like our pillow top at home but we slept great everynight. The air conditioning was great as well. The food was very good at the buffet, always lots to chose from and I loved how you could help yourself to champagne and orange juice. Also like other reviews have said the staff is wonderful, you feel very pampered. We tried three of the resraurants and they were fine we didn't go away hungry and it was a nice change to be waited on. I also really liked Chillis went there everyday for lunch. The pasta was amazing. We really enjoyed the entertainment outside at night and sat there beneath the stars and had cocktails (again service amazing) and listen to wonderful entertainment. Some people even got up and danced. Never went to any of the night shows so sorry can't report on that. Lots of room at the pool and on the beach, never had to fight for a lounger which was a very nice change compared to other places we have stayed. The lobby bar was stunning, we didn't spend too much time in there because we wanted to be outside but when we did they had someone playing the piano and they served amazing martinis. Again wonderful staff. All and all can't wait to go back for my sons wedding. I think the only thing that I could complain about if I was going to be picky was that our room was never cleaned until around 4:30 and they made the bed and that was about it. It was not a big deal to me but I know it might be to others thats why I mentioned it. I am sure if I had said something to Diana (Public Relations) she would have done something about it . She is a very nice lady and willing to help our anyway she can. Loved the beach, the pool, the room and the location. You would have to be really picky not to enjoy yourself here.

Reviews.Title: “best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: gillybaker25
Reviews.Content: wow wat a place, i could not find one fault with it..... the staff were amazing an the food was incredilbe... will definatly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MumfordMastiffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled back to the "Riviera Maya" this summer without the kids. I searched and searched for places to go in the Carribean and decided to go back to the Riviera Maya where we had spent the previous summers vacation. I read tons of reviews regarding the hotel. And once we arrived....I knew I had made the right choice! The one thing that stood out the most was the staff. They were so friendly, kind and happy. They literally always had smlies on their faces all the time and were pleased to oblige. I felt very comfortable in this resort. There were no pushy timeshare people around....I dont think the the hotel allows for that sort of solicitation. There were a few agencies around during certain times of the days that offered excursions, tours and such....at very reasonable prices...and again, they were not pushy at all. The room was gorgeous and so was the property itself. It was all inclusive and let me tell you....we lacked for nothing. The food was fantastic! I was ready to come home after 7 days of food, fun and sun....but, all in all. I would definitely go back! This hotel gets 2 thumbs up from me! Trisha Mumford Seguin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Wedding and Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mwimmer
Reviews.Content: I relied heavily on this site in deciding on where to go for our wedding/honeymoon, so I feel I must share my thoughts. We visited this resort from July 18 thru the 29th. We were married on July 23rd on the beach. I must say it was the most amazing wedding....it was everything I have ever dreamed about and more. One thing you should know if you decide to get married here on the beach.....your wedding will draw a crowd. Our wedding was the first wedding that week....it was at 5pm on the beach....I was so amazed and touched by how many people came to watch our wedding. When I walked out on the sand and all those people started clapping and cheering.......I got so choked up. It was a very special feeling and memory. I felt like I had known all those people forever. Diana at the resort, I have to personally thank her for going out of her way to make sure that me and my husband and our guests were all taken care of the entire time we were there. She made sure that everything we wanted for the wedding, we got....Thank You Diana!! Everybody there was so friendly. I can't say one bad thing about the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. I read hundreds of reviews before I decided on this resort and I am so thankful this is where we went. Jose at the pool bar, AWESOME!!!!! The lobby bar is great. Everything is great. If you are looking to get married in Riviera Maya, you should pick this place. You will not be disappointed!!! The beach and water in our wedding pictures are amazing. That is all I can say about everything here...AMAZING!!! We will be going back, soon I hope. We met lots of nice people, went snorkling, hung out by the pool and beach all day. This is a very relaxing resort. We had kids in our group (ages 6 to 12) and there was something everyday for all of them that kept them busy and having fun. The entertainment staff do an amazing job during the day. It is great to go to a place and with in a day or so, the staff remembers your name, remembers who all is in your group and what you like to drink. Once again...AMAZING wedding and AMAZING vacation!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just Beautiful with Incredible Service & Decent Food”
Reviews.Author: mspinnato
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the Mexican Riviera and also my first All-Inclusive. Upon entering Playacar (the gated neighborhood the hotel is located in), I knew it was going be nice. Playacar is loaded with beautiful homes and condos. When I entered the hotel lobby, I was amazed at its grandeur. It was breathtaking. Crystal, marble, mahogany, stained glass, granite and wrought iron all over. It is nicely done. We had a Junior Suite that was really nice as well with a huge 10x12 terrace overlooking the courtyard. The terrace was my favorite room amenity. The hotel is shaped like a U so there arent many ocean view rooms. It is either Courtyard or Garden view. Courtyard is a really good view. The grounds are amazing. It is spotless wherever you go and they are constantly cleaning and grooming and polishing. The pool is huge and we could always get an area with available seats. There were plenty of market umbrellas to get away from the sun. Even on the beach there were plenty of palm trees to shield the sun. The beach sand was fine and white and the ocean water is crystal clear. My only complaint about the pool was that it wasn't cool enough. It didn't give that refreshing feeling you want from being soaked up by the sun all day. My kids loved every minute of it. the pool bar was great as well. Service. Bar none, it was great. We love Rosario and Gustavo. They hooked us up all week long. Even though tips are included, tip anyway. $5.00 every fre rounds goes a long way there. You become like a celebtrity. Over the whole week, it was the best $150 I spent. In my room I needed more towels and more pillows. both calls were delivered within 3 minutes. The food was average at best. There are two buffets. Don Manolo is the main breakfast buffet and it was filled with variety and was plentiful. Don Manolo & Chilis do lunch. It was basic and food was boring after the 2nd day. Regarding the restaurants, We ate in every one except the Japanese restaurant. The Mexican was great as well as the fusion restaurant Kristal. The Braziallan was really good as well and the steakhouse was OK. still, the service at the restaurant was great. The nightlife is not that great. There is usually a band in the evening from 7:30 or so until 9:30 then there is some sort of show in the theater. Most of them were amateur at best. We were cool with that because I had an 8 and 10 year old with us and we weren't looking for that crazy spring break-ish nightlife. The overall client was right up our alley. It was mostly an upscale crowd that I felt very comfortable with. As for the drinks... The grade of alchohol needs to be better. I didn;t love the drinks, although I consumed many of them. My kids loved being able to go get non-alchoholic beverages whenever they wanted. I highly recommend doing the Dolphin Discovery. We had a blast doing that. It was the most costly thing we did on the trip but worth every penny. I would go back there or to another Riu in a heartbeat. If I were travelling with just my wife, I would not do an all-inclusive though. I would want the freedom to go to any restaurant I favor. The one thing that you must do if you go to the Riviera Maya is go to the beach at 5:30 in the morning and watch the sunrise. That was my own personal highlight of the whole trip. I have some amazing pictures of that. I hope this helps you out in choosing a destination. Overall, I give it an 8 out of a 10. One point was lost due to the food and the other is the lack of nightlife. i highly recommend it if this is the type of trip you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip”
Reviews.Author: moe40moe
Reviews.Content: We went the first week of August and had a wonderful time, there was fourteen in our group. The rooms were clean and the air conditioner worked very well, just remember to keep you balcony door closed. The food was wonderful I enjoyed all of the restaurants but Krystal was the best. The waiters at all of the bars did a wonderful job of making sure you always had a drink. If going on an excursion I would not use Best Day to make my reservations, they tend to forget to tell you about extra fees that need to be payed. We booked the Captain Hooks Pirate trip and was told that of the fees had been payed but when we got to the ship were told we owed an extra 8 dollars each. That trip was ok the food was good but the ship was to crowded and the trip was to long, it is more for a younger party group. The staff at the resort worked very hard to make our stay great. Overall our trip was great. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding/Honeymoon stay was amazing here!!!”
Reviews.Author: pdcbride09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married here on Saturday, August 1st and we were joined by 25 guests who also stayed here. We all had a fabulous time. I don't see how anyone could complain about this resort. The place is beautiful and the staff work very hard to please you. The food is very good. There is something for everyone. The buffet Don Monolos is great and offers a large selection each day. The specialty restaurants-steakhouse, mexican, and japanese were very good. My husband, myself, and our guests have all traveled a lot to different all inclusives and this was by far our favorite. The servers are very nice and deserve tips. We tipped them well because they work so hard and deserve it. We would order a drink and then they would have another one waiting on us. Our favorite drinks were the miami vice and mimosas. We stayed in the 2 story jacuzzi suite and it was spectacular. There was marble everywhere and we had a fantastic view. The bathrooms and closet were spacious enough for all our things. I went into my guests rooms as well and all were very nice. The suite is worth the money. Room service is prompt and good at the hotel. The bars are very fun and the bartenders work very quickly. The entertainment was very good. I was impressed. We saw the Vegas show and liked it a lot. The beach is gorgeous and the sand whales help with the waves. They didn't bother us at all because they blend in as they are covered with barnacles. Our wedding was so beautiful at the gazebo and the staff went above and beyond our expectations. Our guests had a great time and they pampered us endlessly. I am a very picky person and I loved this hotel and I definitely will be back. Please say hello to our favorites: Jose, Chano, and Gustavo! They were the best!!! We did the Delphinus swimming with the dolphins excursion and it was great. The dolphins were so sweet and gentle. Also, our favorite excursion was the Catamaya catamaran excursion. They served us great drinks, we snorkeled (I saw a sea turtle!), serve lunch (lobster, steak, or hamburgers, and we danced the day away! The hotel has a parasailing company along the beach-this was fun and we had a great view from above. Please disregard the negative reviews and go to the RIU Palace Riviera Maya!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: manuscornelius
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel from 15 to 29 July 2009 July 2009 for two weeks. It was simply a fantastic vacation. We really don't have anything to complain about. The only problem that we had was the lock of the door of one of our rooms constantly stopped working. After 3 days I have complained and the manager (Anilu) helped us solving the problem in the end. But, the Mexican people are simply wonderful, always friendly and the service was therefore unbelievably good. We were served with drinks from the lobby tothe entertainments to the swimming pool and even on the beach. The restaurants are good and easy to book between 12 and 3 every day. We went to all of them and loved the Japanese and Mexican the most. The Crystal is a very posh type of restaurant and it if very hard to get a booking, but the kids loved the other more relaxed restaurants better. We also loved the theme nights (Asian, Caribean and Mexican) at the buffet restaurant and for the kids it was nice to go at any time and the food was still excellent. The beach is really good and we did not have any problems with the whales and we fully understood that they were put there to protect the environment. We also went snorkeling on trips for $29US and we went parasailing for $60 per person and also jet skiing for $60 per ski. As for excursions we went on a private (for eight people with 3 friends) excursion to Chichin-itza combined with a swim in a cenote (must do) and a visit to a real Mayan village. It cost $100 per person and was worth every penny. We also did an excursion during which we could swim with sea turtles and that we booked with our tour operator Arke, but that was not good at all. Rather book at one of the guys that are sitting in the hotel. This was really one of our best vacations ever (we go to these kinds of 5 start all inclusive hotels every year). So if you have any questions don't hesitate to ask me. My e-mail address is manus.cornelius@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suprise!!!”
Reviews.Author: solok77
Reviews.Content: First off this was an all inclusive trip so I expected some sort of hiccups along the way. This was not the case, at all. Hotel staff was very nice and so were the waiters and waitresses. The room was clean but the bed had a plastic cover over the mattress I assume to keep the mattress from being soiled by some sort of bodily fluid. Great idea but it made for very noisey moving when in bed. Also the rooms location was not the best since the view was of another buildings rooftop and the was very noisey. Other then that cannot complain about the room. We did not spend much time in it besides sleeping and getting ready. The buffet food was not bad. I love fresh fruit and salads and they had it here. Freshly cut with different cheeses and meats. They have junk food too cheeseburgers, pizza and hot dogs. Juices, soda and alcholic beverages. We actually preferred buffet over the restaurants because first off the reservations were a pain. You can actually reserve reataurant up to 2 days in advance. So we reserved 2 dates one at the Japanese resaturants and the other at the mexican. I thought the whole system sucked. First everyone should be able to get a chance to reserve a restaurant at least once while they stay at the hotel. Not be told all their dates but two are booked. Next we went to the Japanese Restaurant food was ok but what bothered me was the menu is set to only a few dishes and they bring everybodies food out at the pace people are eating. So if you scarf down your appetizer you have to wait until everyone else eats theirs to get your next dish. The buffet was much better food and much easier to just go get what you wanted. We did not even go to the mexican restaurant after the Japanese restaurant. The beach was beautiful very relaxing the pool was great kind of a pool party scene. Dont go to the pool to relax there are more people and it has a party vibe. The beach is where you go to relax. We paid $110 extra for private transportaion from Cancun to the front door of the Riu Palace. it was worth it driver was on time at the airport and at the hotel when flying back. Cancuntranfers is the name of the company I highly recommend them they have a website. We paid cash when they picked us up and had no problems. We paid $1400 for 5 days 4 nights all inclusive( airfare Hotel and food at the hotel). Overall I cannot complain it was a fun trip and the Hotel was fine. If you are going to spend all you time in the hotel room this might not be the place for you. If you are going to expect 5 star fine dining this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: valand
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Riu. I went with my two teenagers kids. The hotel was very nice, very clean and the people who works there are very friendly specially the guys from the entertainment stuff. The food was just o.k I think they have to work a little more on that . The restaurants in the hotel... well what I can say about it they are not too good specially the Brazilian, don't even bother is horrible. The location is great!!!! you can walk to Playacar and Playa del Carmen or if you can't take the heat just take a taxi for $ 5 dollars. Please Do not use Olympus Tour for transportation from and to the airport they are not good not only that they dropped us off to the wrong Riu and also they told us that to fix the problem that we had we will be the last pick up on the day of our returned. OK not only that they lied but we almost missed our flight. So please be careful with that. Great restaurant in town La Casa del Agua a little expensive but very good food and very nice place . If you like to drink anything and everything this is it!!! Overall this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'll sit right her and have another beer in Mexico. Do my best to waste another day...........K. Chesney”
Reviews.Author: DavidSicher
Reviews.Content: I entered into un chartered territory as a father, taking my daughter and her boyfriend on vacation. I requested adjoining rooms and we were very pleased with the arrangement. The rooms were large and the A/C was very good. I like my room like a polar bear! The room refrigerator was always stocked with plenty of Dos Equis, water and soda. I read some complaints about the firmness of the beds but my wife and I found them to be very comfortable. The Jacuzzi bathtub was large with powerful jets. What a way to end the day! The restaurants were very nice and the quality of the food on a scale from 1-10 was an 8.5. We ordered lobster at Chili’s and got a 2oz tail. I use bigger crayfish for bait. You have to go to the lobby every 2 days to make reservations this is a nuisance. The Brazilian steak house was not that great either. I thought Crystals was the best, had an elegant formal dinner. Now the positives and there are many. The pool bartenders were great make sure you order your drinks with top shelf liquor or they will use a house brand. They have some very good special tequila if you ask. We never had a problem getting a spot by the bar or pool. A short walk from the pool and you are on the beach. We went to Punta Cana last year and there were sharp rocks everywhere so I was hoping for a nice beach and this one is nice. There are large hurricane sand bags but it really calmed the water. The color of the sea is unreal blue, green, and turquoise beautiful!! We took an off resort trip to Xelha. XelHa is very nice, go to the website and check it out. I also golfed across the street at Plyacar an 18 hole course very tough nice and was very hot. One rainy afternoon we took a cab to Playa del Carmen for a shopping trip. One TIP do not wear a t-shirt with a name on it. (sports team, state ect.) The street vendors will be all over you. But it was fun. Lots of jewelry, a shopper is in paradise. We paid $1050.00 USD PP for 6 nights with two rooms including airfare from Philadelphia through Apple Vacations. We paid an extra $70.00 for a courtyard view room it is worth it.(included in the $1050) Our room was right by the pool. Rooms 47 and 48 nice large balcony. If we can get this type of deal next year we will return. Go there and R E L A X !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank god it was only for 1 day!”
Reviews.Author: Mrmercedes
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to stay at the Iberostar Grand Paraiso for 5 nights beginning on July 22nd. My wife received an extra day off that week so we decided to fly down to Riviera Maya a day early. Being a travel agent with AAA I have stayed at many resorts in this area including the RIU Palace Las Americas and the RIU Cancun. I booked a one night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya using points that I had earned for selling RIU properties. When we arrived at check in we were told that our room was ready and that I needed to go make dinner reservations between 12 and 3 pm. We were taken to our room only to find it overlooking the air conditioning units on top of the restaurants at the Riu Palace Mexico. The sound from the units running in the evening made it impossible to sleep let alone to leave your balcony door open for a nice breeze. When I went to the desk to ask to be moved I was told that I would have to come back later and talk with the manager. We proceeded to the lunch buffet which was o.k. and then to the pool. When noon came around I went to the maitre'd to make a dinner reservation for that evening. It was only 12:15 and he informed me that there were no restaurants open for that evening or the next day so we would have to eat at the buffet again. I tried to explain to him that we were only there one night and that we already ate the buffet for lunch. He said there was nothing he could do. When I returned to the pool it was a very chaotic situation. The music was so loud you could not relax, even on the beach. The pool itself was filthy, there was fruit, glasses, straws etc floating everywhere. When I went to the bar to order a drink the bartender informed me that I would have to wait for clean glasses to be delivered. There were about 100 of them sitting all around the edge of the pool dirty and floating in the pool. Perhaps they should dive in and retrieve them? When I came back to the bar I was greeted by the sight of a 13 year old boy throwing up in a waste can due to "too much tequila" according to his mother that was screaming at the bartender. Now I dont' know what the drinking age is in Mexico but I am sure its not 13 and this young man looked every bit of his age. My wife and I finally had enough of the pool mess so we went back to the room to change. We went to the front desk to find the manager and was told that they could not move our room until the next day. ( Did they not see I was only staying one night?) Although I could upgrade to a suite for $150 per night if I wanted to! Also the manager seemed not to care that no one could get a dinner reservation for that evening as well. We talked to two other couples at the lobby bar who checked in that day and were only staying for 3 nights. They were told there were no reservations for the next 2 days as well. I hope they got a reservation for the third night because I would hate to have to eat that buffet for 3 days straight! Finally my wife and I decided we were going to move hotels even thought it was 4:00pm in the afternoon. The front desk clerk was gracious enough to look up the phone number for Secrets Maroma AND EVEN OFFERED TO DIAL IT FOR ME! There are many resorts to choose from in the Riviera Maya that cost the same as the RIU Palace Riviera Maya and I would recommend that you do your homework before booking here. As I said in the beginning I have had great experiences at other RIU Palace properties in the Dominican Republic and Cancun and hope that some day they could made this resort worth visiting. For the same cost you could stay at the Valentin Maya which is adults only and the food, service, and cleanliness is outstanding! P.S. Our following 5 night stay at the Iberostar Grand Hotel Paraiso was nothing short of spectacular! it is truly the best resort in the Riviera Maya!

Reviews.Title: “riu palace riviera maya wonderful”
Reviews.Author: scotlandmags
Reviews.Content: this hotel is wonderful staff cant do enough for you the beach is great nice and calm brill to swim in never tried pool so cant comment food is good just used buffet and survived 10 days ( thats good for me as i suffer from ibs) woud go back tomorrow, trying too bribe other half into taking me next year. cant say enogh good things about place rooms were excellnt always things made out of towels pn bed and bed was turned down at night scotlandmags

Reviews.Title: “I will go back”
Reviews.Author: VinceNy_Ny
Reviews.Content: Okay, I just came back from the RIU yesterday. The staff was very accommodating and cordial. The housecleaning staff was always cleaning something. I was somewhat disappointed with the pool. The pool water became dirty early in the morning it was contaminated with straws and other drink paraphernalia, I don’t blame this on the RIU however, it’s the guests that were inconsiderate. It became worst towards the end of our stay when a wedding party from Texas just through cigarettes into the pool indiscriminately, RIU staff should have stepped in but they ignored it. Bar service (waiter older man) only responded to tipping and beach service was vertically nonexistent, they need to do something about the bees at the pool bar. I found the buffet staff in the morning to provide world class service, Giovany & Alfonso two of the head waiter’s were the best. Most all of the staff were not looking for tips but they appreciated the offer. Clean, clean, clean they obviously value this reputation and it shows. Now to the food, Victor in the Sport Bar looked after my 3 children and knew without any signal from me that they were not to be hassled and he provided advise as to where to go without getting into problems, viva Victor. All the restaurants we went to were good and the staff attentive. The hotel lobby and other public area’s are beautiful. They need more elevators closer to rooms. The beach is wonderful the water sports are pricy don’t loose your towel card it will cost you $20.00 US at check out. They triple the cost of sunscreen in the gift shop and you need it. If you are careful and wise you can make this a very pleasant stay, it is not a Ritz Carlton but the staff treat it as if it were. As always don’t be ready to travel be prepared for travel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW !”
Reviews.Author: noswadLeeds
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from this hotel all we can say is what a fantastic 2 weeks holiday we have just had the pleasure of completing. I must agree with others that when you enter the lobby there is the wow factor and the staff were very efficient and professional and before we knew it we were in our room. The second WOW factor are the gardens and ornamental pools leading down to the pool and beach - which was another WOW factor. We alternated days around the pool and on the beach. The staff at both cannot do enough for you and yes if you tip they seem to remember you especially on the beach so that you don't have to get up of your bed and go to the bar - bliss! The food - well what can we say - WOW the buffet restaurant how anyone can complain of the variation is unbelievable, everything that you could possibly want and if there isn't then you can ask one of the managers and they will provide for the rest of your holiday but you need to ask in the first instance. The other restaurants were sampled and out of them all the Krystal came tops, chillis 2nd, brazillian 3rd, mexicon 4th we didn't sample the fish restaurant as my husband does not like fish, buth others said it was very good. Take advantage of being able to walk along the beach to the other hotels, gets you out and you don;t have to worry about carrying money just pop along to the beach/pool bars and get a drink. Yes the rooms did smell alittle but you are in hot temps with the humidity jsut make sure the A/C is on and wardrobe doors are closed. However now I would take a plug in for the room. The staff cannot do enough for you and are genuine, having never seen so much cleaning taking place. The only down fall were other guests who chose to take tins of drinks etc around the pool and seemed to lose the use of their legs to put the emptys in the bin - standards! All in all a fantastic, relaxing holiday and we didn't do a thing as we had done it all previously - we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “RIU RIVIERA MAYA MEXICO”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyGirl999
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best vacation we had. The hotel was wonderful. The staff was very accommadating and the food was excellent. There was always some place open to eat if you were hungry. The only thing bad about the whole trip was that the pool bar closed at 6 pm and the pool closed at 8 pm. We thought that was a little early for vacationers. We also went to Hidden Worlds when we were there and it is definitely some place you want to see that isn't yet commercialized like most places. The cenotes were beautiful and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this vacation for anyone who like to relax and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent hotel , Wonderful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: adrimom
Reviews.Content: How anyone can complain about anything at this hotel, i don't know! The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and elegant. The staff is AMAZING!!! Great costumer service all around! Beach and pool beautiful,big, perfect. Buffet restaurants really good. Rooms very nice.Drinks, alcohol, GREAT! There are people of all ages and from all places. Not too many little kids,some. Not too many teens,some. Overall. EXELLENT! There were 6 of us ranging from the ages of 17 to 61 and everyone said they had a blast ! O.K. The fine dining at the restaurants, not so good.We ate at the Japanese, Steak, and Brazillian. AWFUL! But oh well.We would just walk out of there and straight to the buffet restaurant and eat. One more thing. DO NOT buy any excursions from Oliver! You'll be very dissapointed, waste money, and precious time! . We would definitely reccomend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “An "A" for effort..”
Reviews.Author: Jayne58
Reviews.Content: The staff was super, very attentive, and polite. Very clean. Someone was always sweeping, dusting, or wiping tables during our trips through the lobby. Our room was on the 3rd floor right above lobby, great until the elevator broke and was not fixed by the time we checked out. The place was beautiful, and location great, loved the beach area, shaded by palm trees, and much quieter than the active and crowded pool. Food at the restaurants was good, not great, except our meals at Kystal, where the sea bass and chocolate dessert were excellent, and as in the entire place, the courteous staff was very attentive, but not hovering. I agree with other reviews about the nitely entertainment, pretty lame, we just sat out in the couryard and played cards with our friends. Would definitely venture outside the confines of Playacar in search of good local entertainment next time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Nic066
Reviews.Content: Met lots of different people from around the world. Staff are friendly and welcoming only too happy to please and refill your glass. You can always find something to moan about but nothing really bothered me except for a wedding party group which got rather drunk very quickly at the pool bar. Staff handled them extremely well and moved on without offending anyone. Enterntainment staff got to know us well and didnt mind if we didnt want to join in. The food was plentiful, lots of variety, didn't like all the speciality restraunts but that is my personal taste. Enjoyed it so much I will be going again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: nkivy
Reviews.Content: I was a part of a group of 10 that visited RPRM from July 12-17, 2009. This was our second trip to Playa del Carmen. We had previously stayed at the iberostar Quetzal in 2005. We thought that was fantastic, but we had no idea how much better it could be! We arrived by private shuttle from the airport (having taken a big bus last time, in my opinion, private shuttle is the only way to go). When we deove up to the resort we were in awe of the outside. When we walked in the front doors, I promise, our mouths just hung open! It is gorgeous inside! We arrived about 2:15 and 3 out of the 4 jr. suites we reserved were ready. The 4th one (ours) took about 30 minutes. I'm going to go ahead and do a list like others have done since I really appreciated that! ROOMS: We all had Jr. Suites. Decent sized rooms. However, be prepared that they come with 2 double beds that are pushed together. They are a bit hard and the pillows are rather thin. The small sofa also makes out into a bed. The bathroom was nice- it's a big step over the side of the tub to get into the shower though. And the toilet doesn't always seem to have enough pressure to flush. The in room safe is there and we used it without any trouble what so ever. The mini fridge was stocked as was the liquor dispensor. It was a little musty smelling, but having read that on this site, I packed Plug-ins in my checked baggage, and so we had a room that smelled like cinnamon and apples! Our balcony looked over to another resort, which wasn't prety- but we didn't go there to stay in the room and look out the window! RESTAURANTS: I took the advice of another trip advisor user and emailed ahead for a reservation for the night we arrived. Got it without a problem, and was told to print a copy of the confirmation to bring with me. Good thing I did as they did not have us on the list. That was at Yashima. Hmmm....first problem was they did not want to puchs tables together to accomodate our group. Understandable if the place was full. It's a very small place. But after 20 minutes, it wasn't even half full. We ended up asking another waiter and they did push the tables together so we weren't separated. The service there is not the best. I would'nt even say it was good. From the time we ordered to the time we actually got served was an hour. I ate the teriyaki chicken skewers, which was very tasty. Good food, but it took way too long for a meal. Our second reservation was at the Brazillian restaurant ( I can't remember how to spell it). If you go there, go very hungry! It is a A LOT of food- and majority of it is meat. Slow service also, but not as bad. I thought it was good also. Our third reservation was for the Mexican. This was my favorite. Service again was pretty slow though. The food was very good- I had chicken fajitas. We ate at Don Manolo's for breakfast everyday- yum, yum, yum. We had lunch there or over at Chili's- again- yum, yum, yum. The food at both places was very good- even my teenagers liked it! POOL: Fabulous! Never had a problem finding a chair. Visited the pool bar quite often. Didn't take advice that I had seen on here that I wish I had. Bring your own cup- the cups they give you are the size of a juice glass! Sometimes the drinks were so [--] strong I couldn't drink them, but for the most part they were just yummy! The pool was wonderful in the mornings when the water was a bit cooler. Don't forget to use your towel cards- however if you didn't get out there right when they opened at 8 a.m. they would run out of towels until around 10. BEACH: is absolutely gorgeous!! The sand whales are there- but they really kind of blend in after a while! Twice they pumped water up onto the beach through a big tube from the ocean- don't know what that was for but we got to see cool shells! No problem finding chairs there either. Got to see a wedding on the beach which was beautiful. If you get tired of the sun there are plenty of palm trees to lay under. There is volleyball, ping pong, and water sports to do. Talk to Bruno at the scuba place- he's very nice! RESORT: Again- it is just a beautiful place! Their attention to details is amazing! Like others have said, there really is always somebody cleaning something! The wait staff was so friendly! If you get Santos in the evenings outside- tip him well. He does a great job! We went to the Michael Jackson show and were pleasantly surprised. I only wish we had seen the schedule sooner in the week. If you go out the back of the lobby through the bar and down the stairs, the schedule is on your right side around the corner by the Mexican restaurant. Remember to tip- it is really appreciated! Unfortunately, we booked an excursion to go snorkeling from a catamaran. The guy- Oliver- who sold it to us told us it was a 65 foot catamaran that was smooth sailing because of its size. Knowing nothing about catamarans, we believed him. We shouldn't have. What we should have done was just pay the $25 more per person and gone to Xel Ha. It was a 35 minute or so ride to the catamaran, which is a very pretty boat. This package came with lunch of either steak or lobster, and 2- 45 minute snorkeling sessions. Well, we got under way, and after about 10 minutes, the nausea started. The crew had me go up to the roof of the cabin, and that is where I, along with my kids and about 10 other people laid for the duration of the trip. I don't knw when I have been that sick. I didn't snorkel- and according to my family that did- it was very rough, unsafe and the guide wizzed through it. There was only 1 snorkeling session. I didn't eat my steak- I know 4 of us out of our group didn't eat. After 4 miserable hours, we finally got off. I started feeling better on the ride back to the resort, and when we got back we went and ate with no problem!! All in all, it was a wonderful vacation. Bring comfy walking shoes to walk into Playa del Carmen- only 20 minutes. Be careful of the people who you pay to hold a monkey while you get your picture taken- the monkeys stink. My sister in laws' shoulder stunk even after a shower and perfume. Yuck. I would totally go back for another vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: atd13
Reviews.Content: My sister gave this trip to me as a birthday gift; and what a gift it was! The hotel is fabulous; truly a palace. The staff could'nt do enough for us and kept saying " Welcome Back". They had been hit hard by the flu epidemic and Americans' consequent reluctance to travel to Mexico. The property itself is beautiful as is the beach. The 24 hour room service is great and provided at no additional charge but the menu is a bit limited. The entertainment staff worked from 10am until close to midnight with energy and enthusiasm. There was a show each night. Of the seven shows there were only 2 that were duds. The mariachi band appeared bored stiff. "Grease" which was "Vaselina" in spanish was cancelled and the fill in show, a musical trivia game was no good. But, the rest were great, with the Michael Jackson tribute show a standout. There are 3 buffets,one that opens for breakfast through about 11am, then another for lunch until 5 and then the dinner. The food was great! Additionally, there are 5 themed restaurants, Mexican, Japanese, Brazilian, Steakhouse, and Fusion Gourmet. You have to stand in line to make reservations from 12 to 3p for these specialty restaurants and cannot make reservations for more than 2 days in advance which is kind of a pain. We ate in all except the Steakhouse because it was the only one that was not air conditioned. We liked them all except the Brazilian; it was all meats and the service was substandard. The staff at the Mexican restaurant made a big deal out of my birthday and it was great fun. We went back to the Fusion Gourmet because that was a favorite. We traveled down the beach to the Riu Playacar for lunch and there is no comparison. That hotel is depressing, the beach is ugly and the food was horrible. The weather was very hot and VERY humid. Bathing suits didn't dry overnight so bring two. Also, as mentioned on a previous review, a thermal mug is great at the pool because everything melts so quickly. You get a towel card that you turn in at the pool for a nice big towel. If you get the right person at the front desk, you can get another card. We took 2 excursions. One was a snorkling trip on a catamaran. The boat was full which, when snorkling was a negative and there were very few fish. But reef was beautiful and the staff was great; they even put on a little show which was lots of fun. The food was good. We also went on a "Swim with the Dolphins" excursion with Dolphin Discovery that I would not recommend. We got a "bonus" swim with the manatees which was in a small, dirty pool that made me sad for the animals.
