The dolphin swim was in a lagoon, slightly better than the manatee pool but all about the photos, do this, pose this way etc. with a sales pitch following. There was very little education about the dolphins and, again, I felt sorry for these beautiful creatures. All in all, I loved this resort.

Reviews.Title: “love'd our stay , exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentMickey
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Rivera Maya ........ simply beautiful having travelled to many many different parts of the world and in many different resorts , we loved this place upon arrival , and once in the lobby a big wow came out of my mouth the front desk was nothing but professional and accomodating ( and not because i m an agent ) very kind and very friendly our walk to our room on the 2nd floor felt like i was going to be staying in a museum could use so lighting in the corridors , the room was superb and spacious ( junior suite ) huge balcony and great location. the hotel grounds are impeccable , huge pool ,can accomodate lots of people without feeling over crowded the beach area ... very large area with lots of chairs and hammocks as for the beach , yes many sand bags but well positioned leaving pleanty of room for swimming and yes they keep the waves under control little tropical fish and even seen a small plate size stingray as for the bars ...not much of a drinker , but let me tell you they always come aroung to see if you need anything , whether a hard drink , a smoothie or even a capuccino anything your heart desires ,,,,, they are there to serve you the restaurant , offer variety and great food ..impossible to say that one did not eat well at this resort only let down ,,,, not so much in the food , was the daytime Chilis restaurant it does not fit in with the resort and belongs to a 3.5 star resort ..service FORGET it there was none , get your own glass of water or what else you prefer out of the drink fountain because somehow the staff at this restaurant prefered to chit-chat then to do anything else .... good ribs the one day i found some , its okay for noon i guess but still does not belong at the RIU PALACE RIVERA MAYA what else , shopping the plaza acros the street on your left hand side is expensive wanna buy a few thing take a cab 50 peso or 5 usd ( best pay in peso ) and then you have endless choice of where to spend your money BARGAIN AWAY , THEY LOVE IT ! *** excursions in the area woth doing ......XCARET , get the pass with the supper very much worth the experience and go early there is so much to see and do AMAZING FUN ......and if you have a few dollars to spare don t miss the swim with the dolfins an experience not to miss !!!! anyone have any questions , don t hesitate to let me know VIVA MEXICO !!!!! Mickey

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience at the RPRM”
Reviews.Author: bird08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RPRM for our Honeymoon July 2008 and decided to stay here again to celebrate our 1st Anniversary (July 2009). Once again we were very pleased with our decision to stay here. The price was right at the time we booked. We ate at most of the restaurants and the food was outstanding, including the breakfast and dinner buffet. Just because it's called a buffet doesn't mean the food can't be good. There are so many varities of food at the buffet it's mind blowing. We never had a bad meal. Drinks were perfect and the service was outstanding. Remember to bring some one dollar bills and tip your servers. Although it is not necessary to tip, the staff appreciates it and they will remember you the next day on the beach or the next night at dinner and they will make sure that your glass is never empty. If you want top shelf booze or top shelf tequila...just ask. Room service is great whether it's coffee in the morning, more towels, a bottle of wine, etc. All you have to do is pick up the phone and request what you need and it shows up at your door in no longer than 15 minutes time. I don't understand the poor reviews that people give this resort and I must be lead to believe that these people have stayed at very high dollar resorts in the past where they are spoon fed everything. Yes, there is a slight smell in the rooms, but remember the A/C is running 24/7 and the outside temperature is 92 degrees with high humidity. Nothing ever completely dries in these humid conditions. We brought a small scented candle for the room. We used Cancun Express for our transportation to and from the hotel with no problems. Our incoming flight was delayed due to some minor repairs and Cancun Express was still there waiting for us. You can go to their website by Googling "Cancun Express" and book/pay online using a credit card. They utilize PayPal so it's secure and safe. $115.00 roundtrip is not a bad price for piece of mind, plus you don't have to wait for other travelers to arrive before you are driven to your resort and additionally you don't have to wait for countless numbers of people to be dropped off at the different resorts enroute to yours. This is the best Riu in the area and remember you can visit/drink at the others when you stay at the RPRM. Try to get a room closer to the beach/pool area. We have stayed in 2104 and 2114 which offers a great view of everything including the ocean. One more thing.....you can go snorkeling, scuba diving, parasailing, jet skiing, etc. from the resort beach. The beat picks you up right on the beach so you don't have to pile in on some huge bus with 75 other people and drive an hour to a reef. If you're lucky you may even spot the resort cat and his close buddy, "The Rat". We fed the two fruit and granola bars every morning. We've never seen a rat and a cat play and interact with one another, but I guess anything goes in Mexico! I'll try to post some photos of the two together.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: nessieFifeScotland
Reviews.Content: two years ago we stayed at RIU playacar , had a fantastic time there and would also recommend it . However we saw this hotel and knew we wanted to stay here. The room was spotless, wonderful bathroom (two sinks and lots of towels) and the usual riu optics and well stocked fridge. Grounds were clean and perfect, staff were so friendly and attention to detail was noticable. The pool bar servcie was extended on to the beach, food was 100%, champagne available even at breakfast. We did do room service and it was quick and fresh. or balcony was rather small for 3(in fact only 2 seats) but we never really sat out that often this time. Pool is massive and you can either be part of the fun entertainment or sit in a quite area relaxing. Saw a few weddings, lovely. Really will save hard to go back, have now been to Dominican Republic, Jamacia and Mexico twice, and mexico is the best.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: stuart1e
Reviews.Content: Juat returned from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and we had a great time. We think this is a fabulous resort and didn't really have any complaints about it. Coming from the UK, the temperature in June was probably a little warm for us but the a/c in the rooms and public areas was excellent and there was usually a nice breeze down at the beach. Apparently it's a bit cooler in the winter months so other Brits may want to consider going then instead. The food and service were excellent at all restaurants. Our favourites were Krystal and the Japanese - they were exceptional. We didn't use the buffet restaurant until the second last night but it was much better than we thought it was going to be so we would probably use it more often if we return. The waiting staff were all very attentive and we were never long without a drink - this went for the bars as well. The organised entertainment was generally good and lasted until 11pm. This was usually late enough for us as the heat seemed to tire us out a bit. There were plenty of bars in Playa del Carmen opening to 2 - 4am if you wanted to stay out later. Bodeguita del Medio was a good night out with live Cuban bands and salsa dancing lessons. The golf course across the road is excellent if a bit difficult. It's carved out of the jungle and there are plenty of lakes so you may lose a few balls on the way round. We paid about £80 for an afternoon round which I thought was great value as it included buggy, clubs, balls and free food and drinks before, during and after the round. We'd be more than happy to go back to this resort and will be doing so whenever we get the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome 1st All Inclusive Experience!”
Reviews.Author: rlm0620
Reviews.Content: Well, as much as I have used this site for my research, I owe a review! My honeymoon at Riu Palace Riviera Maya was absolutely wonderful! My husband and I were going to go to Excellence Riviera Cancun for $3000, but when the swine flu hit, the rates for RPRM were unbeatable for the quality. We paid around $2700 through expedia.com for the best room at RPRM (the jacuzzi suite with ocean view). The hotel, room, food, service, and entertainment were all great. The hotel grounds were immaculate as many have noted, and all of the staff was friendly. When we walked into our room, it was a bit damp from the humidity, but it was not a big deal for us. The room had a king size bed (bed was extremely firm), jacuzzi, walk in shower, sitting area, toilet and bidet room, 1st floor balcony, and a spiral staircase that led to the hot tub on the second floor. Our room definitely made our honeymoon special, but we would still return to RPRM if we had a standard room. The food was delicious at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. My husband is very picky, and he thought the food was great, especially their steaks. Neither one of us got sick from food. The buffet was very good as well at Chili's and Don Manolo. I tried everything, and it all was delicious. We failed to pay attention and assumed Don Manolo a specialty restaurant but it was actually a buffet. So we spent most of our honeymoon thinking Chili's by the pool was the only buffet. The Agave, Chili's, and Krystal were the specialty restaurants we had reserved. All were great in their own way. The entertainment was good, but my husband and I were more of the lounge/relax vacationers so we didn't take advantage of all the options. We mainly went to the shows at night, and Las Vegas was the best show. I would highly recommend making that show. One night we walked to Playa del Carmen which is about a 15 minute walk and went through all of the stores. We took a $5 cab back. We also did an Alltournative tour to the cenotes and zip lines. It was 1/2 day and I am glad we didn't do all day. It's a great tour, but we were ready to be back at the resort towards the afternoon hours. Keep in mind that RPRM has a store on the ground floor where the parking is that offers medicine and other products for your needs. We ended up walking to another store to get some stuff that was already offered at RPRM at the same price or less. Overall, our trip to Playa del Carmen was fantastic. I would like to explore other all-inclusives just out of curiosity, but my husband said he wouldn't want to risk getting a lesser quality all-inclusive than the RPRM so he would want to stick with RPRM. We both loved it and would recommend this resort to anyone. We have to make a shout out to the pool bartender, Enrique, he was the best and made our trip great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Riu is definitely no 5-star resort --”
Reviews.Author: Bigdog
Reviews.Content: This is a rather long, detailed review of the resort, but since we use Trip Advisor regularly in planning our vacations, we thought it was only fair to provide our detailed review for others. This was our first stay at a RIU, but our 6th time at an all-inclusive resort in Mexico. The first 4 times in Mexico, we stayed at an adults-only all-inclusive resort, and the last 2 times (including this visit), we had our infant daughter with us. We have found it difficult to find a resort of the class of Royal Hideaway or The Royal (which are adults only) in a resort that allows children, but we thought with the prior reviews of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya perhaps we would find the same 5-star quality at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya resort. We were wrong. The entrance to the hotel is very impressive, as is the lobby area. It is indeed very pretty and your initial impression is that you have made the right selection in a resort hotel. That impression can quickly change. We booked our trip through Apple Vacations. We had wanted to book the Suite, but Apple advised that they could only book the Junior Suite or the Superior Junior Suite, but that if we booked the Superior Junior Suite, it would not be any problem once we arrived at the hotel to upgrade the room to the Suite, paying the differential as shown on the Riu Palace Resorts website -- which showed approximately $350 difference for the entire 7 nights between the Superior Junior Suite and the Master Suite. So at check-in we requested the upgrade and offered to pay that differential, only to be told that we would be charged not $350 for the entire week as shown on their website, but $150 per night for each of 7 nights, meaning a differential of $1,050. When I questioned this further, I was told that the reason that they would charge more than advertised on their own website was because we booked through Apple and not through Riu itself, so they could charge whatever they wanted. We were certainly not willing to pay an additional $1,050 on this basis. So we went to the junior suite room assigned, which was rather small, considering we had to include a crib in the room. When we advised the front desk that we paid for the upgrade to the Superior Junior Suite, we were told that simply meant that you face the courtyard rather than the buildings on either side of the hotel, and there was absolutely no difference in the room. At check-in we were given 2 towel cards to be used daily to retrieve towels for the pool/beach area. When we presented them at the towel booth by the pool, and asked for a towel for our infant to use when coming out of the pool, we were refused a towel for her, and the person at the towel station was very rude about the situation, even though he could see me holding my daughter right in front of him. Another guest who heard this suggested that we go back to the front desk to request a 3rd card so as not to experience this problem once again. Why did the front desk not give us the 3rd card to begin with, since our daughter was at check-in with us and they were providing a crib for her so obviously were aware of her occupancy at the resort? At lunch in the buffet the first day, we requested a highchair for our daughter. When it was given to us, we looked in the seat to find it filthy, with leftover food. We checked 4 additional highchairs, and found the seats in each of them in the same dirty condition. The staff in the restaurant looked at each one and agreed that they were dirty and so went to get a towel to clean one of them for our daughter to use. We reported this to the front desk and asked for the high chairs to be cleaned before presenting them to a guest for their child to sit in. Following dinner that first evening, we returned to the room since we were very tired from the trip and had an infant with us who needed to go to sleep. Only upon returning to the room we found there was no electricity at all working in the room (no fan, no airconditioning, no lights), and the room was located directly behind the plaza where live music is playing until 11 p.m., not allowing our infant to sleep (since our infant was certainly with us upon check-in, the front desk should have taken the location of the room into consideration when initially assigning the room, but clearly did not). We called the front desk, and they sent maintenance to fix the electrical problem, only the repair person discovered a short in the fan which continued to cause the electricity to go out, and so went to locate a part and replace it which took about an hour, during which time we sat there with no lights or air conditioning. We also then had a plumbing problem in the bathroom, and called the front desk for repair once again. After complaining to the front desk, and asking for some accommodation, we were told we could move down the hallway about 10 rooms, but when I requested a possible upgrade to the suite as originally requested, I was flatly refused any type of upgrade. After what we had experienced with the filthy highchair, the loss of electricity, no air conditioning, plumbing problems, and the towel issue, that is the least that Riu Hotels could have done, but they refused (and considering the resort may have been 65%-70% occupancy, they could have made that accommodation). The following morning we met a travel agent/guest in the lobby and told her of the problems we were having at this resort (after all, she brings many guests to the Riviera Maya area), and she (although a total stranger) offered to assist us by asking the front desk to switch us to her room as she was checking out within a half hour, and her room was located at the end of the resort, the furthest from the music at night. The front desk said we could not have her room, but offered us another room close by in location, which at least solved the issue of the music keeping our infant awake at night. The location was indeed much better, but still no accommodation made by the hotel as a result of the first night with no electricity and plumbing problems, the filthy highchairs in the buffet, and the refusal of a towel for our daughter. The front desk advised us to talk to the Apple Vacations representative, and the Apple Vacations representative said that they could do nothing as it was the hotel making the decisions regarding our accommodations. Location - The resort is conveniently to downtown Playa del Carmen (5th Avenue), and is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel to 5th Avenue. If you prefer, you can spend $5 and take a taxi into town. Pool - There were plenty of chairs around the pool, but there should be since the hotel was far from full occupancy. However, at least 6 of the chairs we looked at to use by the pool were broken and unusable. But the 7 days we were there, no one removed them or replaced them with working chairs. The pool itself is not kept clean at all. It does not appear that they use any chlorine, and so the pool continually looks scummy and full of sunscreen. and there are dead bugs floating on the water as well as pieces from the trees which fall into the water, with no attempt to clean the pool regularly. The walking surface around the pool area is extremely hot, so you have to wear your shoes to walk even from your chair near the pool to the steps to enter the pool. Not good planning in the design of the resort. The pool hours end at 8:00 p.m., but when we went to return our towels to the towel booth at 6:30p.m. to retrieve our towel cards for the next day, the booth was closed. So you have to carry your wet towels to your room to hold for return the next day. If the pool is open until 8:00 p.m., why would they close the towel booth at 6:30 p.m.? Beach - The beach is very wide, and has plenty of chairs. The water was beautiful and fairly calm the entire stay. Food - The buffet gets tiring every day. We did try the Brazilian, Chili's Steakhouse, Mexican and Krystal restaurants for dinners. The food is "okay" at each of these speciality restaurants, but far from spectacular and not 5-star as we have had at other specialty restaurants in the resorts in the area. We did not try the Japanese restaurant. Given that the place is not fully occupied, they are closing one of the specialty restaurants each day, so it makes it even harder to get reservations for these restaurants than normal. In addition, the prior write-ups which describe how you have to leave the beach or plan your day so you can get in line in the piano bar area between Noon and 3:00 to make dinner reservations at a specialty restaurant are correct. And you can only make reservations for 2 days at a time, so you have to repeat this process several times in a week's stay. This is a crazy system for getting restaurant reservations. Otherwise, if you choose not to stand in line, you can eat at the buffet 3 times a day every single day, which quickly becomes repetitive and boring. They change the decor daily in the buffet for that day's "theme", but the food itself changes very little. Personnel - The waiters and waitresses and very nice, and work very hard. They were all very kind to our daughter as well, and we showed our appreciation to them by providing tips. The front desk personnel, however, could use some lessons in public relations. Room cleaning -- It appears that they clean the rooms needed for incoming guests in the morning, and so get to the existing guests' rooms late in the day. Our room was typically not cleaned until late afternoon, which meant if you came in from the pool to clean up for lunch, you had no clean towels to use. And again, when we first got into our room, there was ONE bath towel for 2 adults and one child. We had to call for more towels almost every day, or go down the hall to find the cleaning people and try to get the towels ourselves. We had asked for extra pillows the first day, and did receive them, only to have them remove one of the pillows for no reason when cleaning the room one day and never replacing it. And of the 7 nights we stayed there, turndown service was provided exactly ONCE, and used towels replaced. Which means that 6 of the 7 nights we were left with the same used towels from the evening to use in the morning until the room was finally cleaned late in the day. Turndown service and clean towels were provided each evening at every other resort in this area we have stayed at previously. WI-FI - At every resort we have stayed in previously, WI-FI is available in every guest room (you may or may not have to pay a charge for connection, but it is always available). Not here. If you need to use WI-FI, then you need to carry your laptop to the lobby, and sit in front of the reception desk to try to get to the "hot spot". And the connection is not always good. Otherwise you can go into the sports bar and pay to use one of their computers. In today's world, this lack of availability of WI-FI in guest rooms is unheard of and especially in a resort which is 3 years old. We will definitely consider a different resort (and not a RIU hotel) on our next trip to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: SDgirl5
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitate about traveling now with the recent swine flue. There are NO signs of any type of illness that we could tell. We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Riu Palace Riviera This was our 5th trip through Apple Vacations. 2 to Costa Rica and 3 to the Playa Del Carmen area. I would highly recommend Apple. We have Never had any problems with this company and we always book our excursions through them. Our first visit to Riu Palace. Check in was a breeze. I mentioned to the front desk that we were on vacation to celebrate our daughter's 18th birthday. Within 2 hours of check in, she received a birthday card and chocolate covered strawberries delivered to our room! Wow, impressive! I also emailed Diana/Public Relations director for the hotel a week before asking if the hotel could do something a little extra for our daughter's birthday. She did email me back and told me to connect with her upon arrival; which I did. She made dinner reservations for us for the night of her birthday. Our room was decorated on the day of her birthday with streamers, balloons and a "towel "cake with rose petals sprinkled on it. The steakhouse had a special table (decorated) waiting for us and the waiters sang Happy Birthday to her and brought out a cake! In summary, very impressed with the attention to detail and...at no extra charge! Overall service was excellent. The hotel did not seem to have a very high occupancy level during our stay. We never had to wait for table, plenty of room by the pool, etc. Room was very clean and we had no security/safety issues what so ever at the hotel. There was a wedding on property while we were there. It was on Friday late afternoon on the beach. Absolutely beautiful! What a great idea! Out of all the all inclusive resorts we have stayed, we found this location to have the best pool area! Spacious, plenty of room, mini tables in the pool along with pool loungers. There is also a swim up bar and an infinity pool. Only complaints -- gym is small. Only 2 treadmills and an eliptical. No free weights. There were people waiting for it to open up in the mornings so we opted to walk on the beach because we could not get on a machine.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to RPRM - still highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JBizzle76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited RPRM for the second time. We booked through Expedia for 3 nights, Jul 2 through Jul 5. Overall, we were very pleased. We went in May 08 for a week and decided to go back now for a couple of days away over the July 4th weekend. We were very impressed with the resort last year and remain impressed with it today. We were in 3165 which is directly above the front desk. It is one of the few rooms that faces the ocean. The food is actually very good. I read many complaints on Tripadvisor, but we found the food (at both the buffets and at reserved dinners) to be consistent and very good. This is an all-inclusive resort and not a 5 star restaurant, so keep your expectations in check and you wont be disappointed! Besides, if you ever want higher quality food, downtown Playa is a 10 minute walk and filled with restaurants. The Playacar complex is an excellent place to be. We recommend you hire a private transportation company to take you NON-STOP directly from Cancun airport to the resort. We used Playa.info to book transportation and would do it again. Excellent communication, drivers friendly, on-time, even offered to stop on the way to the hotel for food/beer/etc. :) RPRM is about 1 hour south of the airport. I cannot speak highly enough of the staff at this resort. They really go all out to make sure you are happy. At the pool bar, I asked for one beer, and the bartender just makes two. The beach is excellent. The pool is excellent. Get a RIU Class membership - it gives you discounted water activities (25%) and doubles the amount of time you have on the business center computers. We did venture offsite a couple of times. Once to XCARET. It was well worth the $99 per person and just 5 minute taxi ride south of the hotel. Another couple of times we went to downtown Playa for shopping and drinks. Highly recommended. Take a taxi because it is hot - even at midnight. We'll go back - it will be hard not to just book the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Thank you Riu for an excellent product.

Reviews.Title: “Some what dis-appointed this time!”
Reviews.Author: jll1102
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to this hotel. My first visit in June 2006 for my honeymoon was great. We decided to return for our three anniversay with the same expectations, and even choose to stay 4 more nights. Our reservations were made in February, before the health scare, so we paid close to $4000.00. Our travel agent notified the Riu Palacce that we were return guest celebrating an anniversary and requested an upgrade or at least the same kind of accommodations that we had our first stay. When we checked-in we asked about the upgrade and was just said no! No explanation(you would think with all the folks deciding to not go to Mexico, that they would be glad we still keep or reservations). We were give a smaller suite than what we thought we had paid for, the ac didn't work well and it was above the nightly activity center(which can be noisy very late). No view of anything! After two days we were moved to the suite we should have had in the beginning. But this was only after complaining about the ac. After one day in the new one, money was taken out of my billfold in a locked safe! We made a report, and basically was told that no one could get in the safe. (I'm sure they have way to get in after a guest leaves and they close the safe!) I ended up with food poisioning on the 4th day and found out that several other visitors also had done so. On the second to the last day there, we had made reservations for dinner, we were seated and already give our drink when we were asked to leave because they had made a scheduling error--the restaurant was scheduled for a wedding group(you would think they knew that ahead of time). So we were left to do the buffet all dressed up!! The positive that I can say is the food prep folks/bartenders/waiters and cleaning people work really hard, long hours to keep the guest happy. The Palace is a pretty place, it has gone down alittle in the last three years though. I'm sure it's a huge up-keep. Upon leaving we were told that the management was investigating the safe issue--asked for my email and told they would get back to me. Still waiting! All in all, we were dis-appointed this go around, probably will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend here. The entire hotel was beautiful! Beautiful lobby, pools, grounds, room, etc. The food was as good as any all inclusive resort that we have been to, and the drinks were even better. There were always available chairs on the beach and around the pool, but this could be due to low occupancy. The service was very good. Each evening a good band played in the garden area and there was evening entertainment at 9:30. Although we were happy with our stay, there were a few negatives... we had to wave down waiters in order to be served drinks on the beach, there was a bad odor near the lobby bar at times, beach towels weren't available until 10:00 or 11:00 a.m. and we had a leaky pipe in our bathroom (it was repaired within a day). Overall it was a nice hotel and we would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Palace fits well”
Reviews.Author: takeaction
Reviews.Content: Why some of the picky complaints? The RIU Palace Riveira Maya looks like an elegant Spanish Palace. That's the syle and service they emmulated here. We are seasoned over 25 years of vacationing at All-Inclusive (AI) resorts. While we haven't attended any adult-only AIs, we can honestly say that this was the best so far. Others might have better kids programs. However if you're a couple or a group it works well. PDC is so close for those who desire a night life beyond dining and a show. Beach was great... the palm grove is the ideal shade compared to palpas that you must dance around to follow the shade. Overall resort size is medium so all walks are less than 5 minutes. *Food excellent, esp. Krsytal french fusion restaurant. Others were one and offered variety away from buffet. *Beach-while not the prettiest, very easy to swim in and whales help protect it. Yes if you like to walk for distanced it's not the beach for you. No snorkeling at beach. Good Scuba program with boat dives near by. *Booze- good selection for AI resort. If your drink is too weak simply ask for more booze. Don't expect good wine at AI resorts. *Pool-beautiful lay out for social & games *Staff-friendliest on par with many high end American hotel chains sometimes better Given the excellent experience and reasonable pricing have recomended it to many friends. Take a private ride to/from airport with Lomas travel.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: ERat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful six night stay at this beautiful resort. I can honestly say this is the best resort I have ever been to. The resort is located in Playacar which is a resort area just south of Playa Del Carmen. It was about a 1 hour drive from the airport. We used private transportation from cancuntransfers.com which was great. I'd recommend them to anyone traveling to or from the Cancun airport. When our driver dropped us off at the main entrance we were very pleased with our choice. You enter the front lobby to the sight of fresh lilies, large crystal chandeliers, marble floors, and a wall of windows that allowed people to sit at the lobby bar and look out onto the courtyard area and the Caribbean Sea. Check-in was smooth and quick. When we arrived at our room it was still being cleaned, which wasn't a big deal. The bellhop just placed our luggage in the closet and told us that they would be finished in about 30 minutes. Just enough time to walk around and enjoy this wonderful resort. I was truly impressed with the courtyard which had lovely fountains leading the way towards the pool areas and beach. BEACH: The beach area is divided into two different sections. The area next to the ocean is a public area where you'll be offered many different excursions like parasailing, waverunners, fishing, boating, snorkeling, scuba diving, etc. The upper beach area is on the resort property and the only think you'll be offered here is a nice cold drink. The upper part had lots of beautiful palm trees that could be used as protection from the hot tropical sun. Yes there are sandbags in the water, but they provide protection for lesser swimmers and children. The bags even added a little character to the ocean. They are starting to look like rocks instead of sand bags. If you want to swim in deeper water there is plenty of space past the bags where you can swim in deeper water which was always uncrowded. POOLS: The pools were very nice. We didn't spend too much time in them because we're more beach people. We never had a problem getting a lounger by the pool, if we wanted one. There is an infinity pool which is about 6 feet above the main pool. One of the only complaints I have about the resort is that the pool bar closes at 6 pm and both pools close at 8 pm. We would have spent more time in the pools if they permitted swimming in the evening. The reason they closed the pools early were that they cleaned them each night. Still it would have been nice to swim a little at night. RESTAURANTS: There are plenty of dining options at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The buffet was good, lots of options and choices. We only ate there one night, but it was very good. We did eat breakfast at the buffet twice. It too was good. Anything you'd want to have for breakfast was available. Our second night we dined at the Japanese restaurant, it was good also. It is not a Japanese grill like many are used to in America. I thought meal was very good. Remember, you're in Mexico not Japan! The Brazilian restaurant was our least favorite. The food was good, but just not our cup of tea. Chili's, the steakhouse, was great. We ate there the third and sixth night of our stay. The setting is outdoors just off the beach where you can see the very blue Caribbean Sea and beautiful palms. We had the steak and lobster each time and were pleased both times we dined there. Our fifth night we dined at Agave, the Mexican restaurant and this was our second favorite, just behind the Chili's. We could not complain about any of the food we ate at the resort, it was all very good. ROOMS: I did not find the bed hard or uncomfortable. I was curious as to the previous guest’s reviews saying that the beds were rock hard. This is not true. Yes, they are firm but it's good for the back to sleep on a firm surface. Our room had a lovely balcony that overlooked the courtyard. The bathroom was marble, had two sinks, a bath with jets, and shower. The room was cleaned daily and smelled clean, not musty, each time we entered it. STAFF / SERVICE: This is where I was truly impressed. The workers at this resort go above and beyond the call of duty. Anything you want or need, they will get for you. Anytime you need a drink, someone is there to serve you with a smile. Someone was cleaning something all the time. Workers were pleased to serve, which isn't the case very often in the US. I loved the service and I tipped them each time I was served. I was very surprised at the number of people that didn't tip. If the service would have been bad or slow, I probably wouldn't have tipped either, but I wouldn't be able to sleep at night if I didn't tip them, knowing the efforts the staff goes to in order to make your stay special. I got to know several of the bartenders and servers, Santos, Javier, Martin, Marvin, Jose, John William, all did their best to make you feel like you were the most important guest at the resort. Thank you. I have no idea how this resort is rated #17. It should be, without question, number one. The only people that complain about this resort are the type of people that find something to complain about all the time. They are the ones that try to get something for free and don't, so they write bad reviews. I could find nothing at all to complain about at all, other than the pool closing early. My wife and I both loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We took a walk to the other Riu resorts in Playacar and they don't even come close to the Riviera Maya. The Palace Mexico is nice, but the pool is much smaller. If you want true luxury then the Palace Riviera Maya is the only choice. I'd stay here again in an instant. I can't wait to go back. If you have any questions about this resort please feel free to IM me. Thank you very much Riu Palace Riviera Maya for making our vacation perfect. We'll be back soon. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: MrsGoosse
Reviews.Content: We had a blast staying here. The room was AWESOME, however we had the jacuzzi suite. We had two floors/balconies...our top floor was the second jacuzzi and we could see the pool and ocean from it. The room was always cleaned early. The food is okay...we had to eat at the buffet a lot (don mon.) because we were usually too late to reserve a place early enough. The spaces are very limited so go early and make a few in a row. The best place to go is Krystal where you can get a decent steak and shrimp ravioli. There was so much to do around Playa and we highly recommend that you take advantage of it all. Akumal has the best snorkeling around and it is about a 30-40min south....It is highly worth it to go without a tour group. Coco Beach also has an area to snorkel as well as kiteboarding if you are interested. 5th avenue is a short walk down (1 mile) the street with a ton of shopping and things to do like ferry to cozumel and sky diving. We never felt unsafe here and we walked a lot outside of the resort. We even took a cab ride to the outdoor cenotes about 20 minutes south and jumped/snorkeled there. It was a 20 dollar cab ride and our cab driver came back to pick us up at no extra charge. You may need pesos to get in here since some of the people at the cenotes are mayan and don't know english. Ajua Maya is a great rest. on 5th avenue and 4th street..

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: popdisplay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the property for an extended weekend (3 nights). The facility and grounds are beautiful. We paid an additional fee for a full suite. Per the hotel's website, the room was to have a courtyard or ocean view. That which we received was a beautiful view of the buffet restaurant's (Chili's) roof (see photo). A bit of the ocean can be seen beyond the roof. The room itself was very nice. The bed, as described by many other guests, was rock hard and very uncomfortable. Housekeeping didn't clean our room until 3-4pm each day; so we always returned to our room after lunch or swimming to find it as messy as we left it that morning. Also, as many other guests have posted, the rooms and the hotel in general, smells musty/humid/smoky/sour. Our clothes and luggage reeked of the stench when we returned home. I realize that the hotel is in a tropical area, but there is no excuse for this kind of stink. The room's air conditioning was at best minimally effective. The downfall of the facility is its food and drink. Stick to the beer and wine. The hotel uses the lowest level of liquor available. Combine the cheap liquor with the cheapest mixers and the result is acidic pina coladas, bitter margueritas, and horrid daquiris. The food was right on par with the drinks. Conceptually, the food was great. But, when you take a great culinary concept and ask a minimally trained and low paid staff to execute the recipe, the results are laughable. Among the dining options is the Japanese venue, "Yashima". Each meal begins with a preconfigured plate of "sushi". Riu takes the word "precongigured" to the extreme. The plate and its contents was served refrigerator cold. The sushi was assembled by somebody possessing an iron grip as each roll and mound of rice was as solid and heavy as a brick. We ate no more than a half-bite and left the balance for the trash can. The next course was an assortment of fried items that was supposed to be Tempura. Again, the concept was great while the execution was a disaster. The coating was wet, heavy, greasy, and totally inedible. My entree was supposed to be some sort of a shrimp stir-fry. I received 6-7 small shrimp in a nasty/sweet sauce that tasted as though it came from a can. All of the dishes are served with rice that's sprinkled with an odd mixture of seeds and herbs. It's very off-putting. For dessert I ordered a banana egg-roll. I received a burned assembly of black bananas. Again, totally inedible. We also "dined" in Krystal and Agave, their "fine dining" and Mexican themed restaurants. Put into context, Krystal was their best venue. But, let me be clear, if I received the food served at Krystal, in any other US based "fine dining" restaurant, I would have ran for the door. The most offending dish was their molten chocolate cake. It was actually a rock-hard muffin with a warm blob of frosting dropped into the middle. The muffin was so dense and heavy that it remained uneaten. The buffet restaurants made up for lacking quality with quantity and variety. Bottom line-- would I return? NO There are many other resorts in the area that exceed expectations; both in terms of facility and cuisine (Le Blanc, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tcornwall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riu Palace Riveria Maya in July 2008 for our anniversary. What a beautiful resort! This was both my husband and I's first time to Mexico and also our first time to visit an all inclusive resort. My in-laws had rented a Villa a few blocks so we really didn't stay at the resort during the day but came back to the resort in the evening for dinner and bed. The 2 ala cartes that we ate at were good and the buffet in the morning and in the evening had a great selection. The room was not big but suited our needs perfectly and the jacuzzi tub was great for relaxing. All the bar tenders we encounted were good and accomodated any request we had. Overall we had a wonderful time at this resort and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy with RIU!...Loved Playa-Here's my detailed review”
Reviews.Author: newschick
Reviews.Content: June 3-10 Let me start by saying I never thought this vacation would happen, thanks mainly to the swine flu scare. United canceled our flights 2 weeks after we booked. Then when Sam's Travel re-booked us with Frontier (thanks Frontier) they accidentally canceled our hotel reservation. We finally got our hotel back....but, we were originally supposed to stay at the RPM, and got transferred last minute to RPRM because of lack of visitors. This ended up being a blessing in disguise. All along people said RPM is for beach people and RPRM is for pool people. After this trip we realized we are pool people and out of the 2 palaces RPRM was the best option for us. We are an active mid 30's couple. That being said...we made it to Cancun safely and were shortly on our way to the resort on a Best Day shuttle, which I would recommend. Check in was easy. We told them this was our 5th RIU and we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary, so they upgraded us to a top floor fountain view room free. We hit the pool bar 5 minutes after we were there. Then we decided to walk the beach down to the other RIU resorts. That took about 15 minutes. We decided if you're on a budget...the Yucatan or Tequila would be great. Fun and tropical...but apples and oranges when comparing to a palace. They're more tropical....a palace is a palace. We were treated like royalty. It had been awhile since we had been to a palace. But, you definitely notice the service. We had turn down service, excellent dining staff and pool bartenders. The staff decorated our room the night of anniversary with petals, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. They even lined up our shoes when they cleaned the room. For those of you wondering... here's my comparison of RPRM to the RPM. RPM opened 2 days after we were there. We did check it and its rooms out so I could have an educated opinion for future trips. *RPRM is newer and has a better pool, especially if you like pool volleyball. It's about a 15-20 minute walk to downtown Playa...which we loved. Men can wear shorts to dinner at the buffet. I think the beach is plenty big. *RPM is older and has more character. I also like the layout of the rooms better. The bathrooms have separate commodes with bidets and a hallway separating the bathroom from the bed. The gym is better at this one....free weights and air conditioning that works. Men must wear pants at night...no matter what. The beach is about twice as big and has a beach bar. But, if you want to walk to Playa it's going to a be a hike...I'd say almost a half hour. It is right next door to RIU Yucatan and Tequila...which are fun to visit especially at night because they have outdoor bars. Their pools are also fabulous and you can use them. *So, if I went back which would I choose? Probably RPRM again. RPM needs to update its pool and we spent a lot of time at the pool. Plus we enjoyed the walks at night to the other resorts. It gave me another reason to eat dessert because I knew I'd walk it off. If we stayed at RPM we would have taken a cab to downtown. I enjoyed walking. (FYI-RIU Palace Las Americas in Cancun is the nicest RIU we've been to) OK Back to RPRM *ROOM- everyone gets a Jr. Suite unless you upgrade. Flat-screen tv, living room, pretty hard bed, but you're usually too exhausted to care. I brought a LED taplight for the shower which I heard was dark. It did help light it up a bit. We did see one of those Jacuzzi Suites on the corner and they are fabulous if you can afford the upgrade. Jacuzzi in your room and outside up a spiral staircase. *POOL-fabulous! We played pool volleyball almost every afternoon. It's a great way to meet people and cool off. We never had a problem finding a chair to throw our stuff. Waiters bring you drinks. *BEACH-great...sand is super soft and won't burn your feet. They also have hammocks. *FOOD- We have been to other Rius and did the sit down restaurants. They are good. But, we decided we didn't want to be on a schedule and since the buffets had so much to offer..we stuck with them. Caribbean night was the best..lots of shrimp. Every night there is a special station with a chef. I had a create your own pasta several times that rivaled the Cheesecake Factory. We also had fresh crepes and fried bananas. We had French toast and pancakes every morning. It depends on who's making them, because some days they were out of this world...other days they were just good. We took a time share tour to another all-inclusive. We had lunch and the food was a little better...but, just barely. We are not picky and we are always happy with RIU food. I say it's always good, sometimes great...but, never bad. If you don't like something...get something else. We got room service and were pleasantly surprised. It arrived within 5 minutes and he even brought me a rose. We got the chicken toasties, a sandwich and fruit..mmmm. You can also grab fruit or sandwiches 24/7 at the sports bar for a late night snack. Despite all the food and drinks...I only gained 2lbs....thanks to all the walking and always using the stairs at the resort! *ENTERTAINMENT-We watched Grease (a little cheesy) and Michael Jackson (great). But, we spent the rest of our evenings walking downtown. RPRM didn't have any audience participation entertainment while we were there. That's my favorite..."the Newlywed Game, Miss Riu, or Mr. Riu" It's a hoot. Maybe they did it the following week or at one of the other resorts????? *EXCURSIONS...I got a tip from the trip advisor forums to go to Akumal and snorkel. Best thing we did! We took a cab to the downtown collectivo station. ($5) Then we took the collectivo, a van, to Akumal ($5 roundtrip). A cab to Akumal would cost $50 roundtrip...so it's well worth taking the collectivo. It dropped us off on the highway, but we just started walking toward the water which took about 10 minutes. We waded in and found turtles 5 minutes after we started snorkeling. We have our own gear. But, I understand you can rent it at the dive shop there. We also took the ferry to Cozumel and went on a glass bottom boat/snorkel ling trip. It was ok. But, I thought they would take us further out on the reefs. We were very close to shore for each of the 3 reefs we visited. You could probably do that by yourself as well. Just look where the tour boats are. We rented a scooter and rode around the island. WOW..that's a long ride...probably 2 hours. I recommend a jeep or dune buggy instead of a scooter. We only spent $20, though. We also decided to rent bicycles at RIU Tequila. But, as we were walking to the resort we saw bikes at the Playacar Shopping Plaza halfway there. Get this....the Mexican Government is encouraging "going green" so it supplied bicycles free of charge. You just need to leave a deposit. We rode around Playacar. But, if we did it again....we would take the bikes on the Cozumel ferry and ride around Cozumel. We loved walking to 5th Ave. I wish we would have had dinner down there one night. It's like a flea market that turns into NYC's Greenwich Village. *What I would change.....**very minor** Pool bar needs to be open longer. They start closing around 5pm. We got back from Cozumel around 5:45 and were dying to hit the pool with a drink. We were a little disappointed. I can't believe I'm saying this...but, I wish they served breakfast earlier, too. It's at 7am and I like to get up early on vacation so I can get in more activities for the day. I wish RIU's had coke products instead of Pepsi. The gym could use free weights. (but you can always walk down to RPM and use its gym) Neither palace has an outdoor bar. Every other RIU we've been to has one and it's great in the evening. We are not heavy drinkers, but we enjoy the social aspect. But, again.... that's another reason to take a walk and check out Yucatan or Tequila which have them. Overall...this was one of our best vacations! We love RIU's and we would definitely go back to RPRM. The staff couldn't have been nicer. If you have any questions don't hesitate to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: MJF3
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the RPRM June 7-14. We flew American Airlines via O'Hare and had an easy, breezy check in and security line process. The fastest...ever! After a bumpy flight with a rough landing, we arrived at CUN went thorough immigration and customs easily, both got the green light, and headed to the money exchange. Changed our bills, were approached only once by a timeshare rep, politely declined, went our way to Lomas out the door. The Lomas people, there were at least a dozen of them, were very helpful. We were loaded on to our transfer with one other family after about 10 minutes of waiting. We were at the RPRM in 45 minutes. Place is impressive right from when you pull up. Looks like a huge white palace. It's located in Playacar, which is a nice, gated community about a mile and a half away from 5th Ave downtown, PDC. Great location. Check in was easy and efficient. They brought up our bags while we made dinner reservations. We had already made a reservation in advance for Chili's Steakhouse via email. I would suggest anyone staying try to arrange for a dinner reservation in advance as they allow only a couple of reservations to be made at a time. This way, we had three reservations for the places we wanted: Chili's (Good food, BAD service), the Japanese place (Excellent food AND service), and Krystal, gourmet-fusion (Good food, EXCELLENT service). Our room was 2053, great view of the property and ocean. Comfortable bed, plenty of space for two. The bathroom was not up to par with the rest of the room. It was dark, dingy and needed some caulk work. The tub was nice and big, but looked so dingy that I didn't dare take a bath. Mini bar was a nice touch, although we didn't partake in any of the liquor, but did have a few beers and plenty of water. The room was cleaned nicely, some times twice daily. We had some towel animals. We did tip the maid (was a guy...what do you call a guy maid??) and a couple times we left a buck or two for the minibar lady (for special requests). The room had an electronic safe. No issues with that. Worked well. Nice flat screen tv, too. The beach was beautiful, water was a bit choppy the first few days, but calmed down later in the week. The area of beach at the RPRM is the nicest in the vicinity. We checked. Great swimming, and good areas to play in the waves. Plenty of loungers at the beach AND by the pool and upper beach. The pools were big and fun. The pool bar was ok, but there were neat little areas off the bar where you could relax with your drink in the water. Very nice. Lots of lively pool volleyball being played. I thought there could have been at least one other bar that served the beach crowd. It was a drag to have to hike it up to the pool bar to get a drink. There was scarcely any drink service down at the beach. That is an area of improvement. Another area is the noise. When it was not very full, the hallways were nice and quiet, but the doors slammed a lot at night when it was fuller. I do think some people were just rude and slamming doors, but the issue is that the doors are very heavy and just slam closed if you don't ease it shut. May seem like a little thing, but on vacation, you don't like to be startled out of bed at 2 am by slamming doors. Drinks were plentiful and tasty. Beer is Dos Equis which is a favorite of my husband. I only drank beer, pina coladas, champagne and red wine, all the types they had, the merlot was dry, but the Mexican red was very smooth, as was the Chilean Cab. Oh, that's not true, I also had a few palomas (tequila and squirt...get the Don Julio!). Husband had beer, red wine and Cuba Libres (rum and coke). Champagne was very good. A Spanish Cava, forget the brand. Will look for it. Food was good. Buffet had many choices, but all started to blend towards the end of the week. I imagine it would be that way anywhere. We did eat off the resort a few nights for dinner or snacks. We ate at Los Carboncitos (Loved it! Great tacos al pastor, great service. Located just off of 5th ave.), La Caprichoza (Flambe, didn't realize it...they made my camarones a la diabla at the table! Awesome and tasty), and...our favorite place La Bodeguita del Medio (went there three times, twice for drinks-the BEST mojitos, and once for drinks and apps.). We visited the B del M in Puerto Vallarta and LOVED it. We were so excited to be able to come and visit another. We hope one day to visit the original in La Havana, Cuba. B del M is located right in the fancier shopping area at the start of 5th Ave when traveling north from the hotel. The shopping area is very nice. Hmmm...what else. The hotel was not at all crowded for the first 5 days, then BAM. Lots of people. You could tell at the buffets, but still had plenty of room at the beach and pools. More families than I expected. Seeing the kids made me miss my girls. I think we'll do adults only next time. I had been told that this wasn't really a family place, well, it is. There's nothing wrong with it, other than it made me miss my kids and didn't have the "vibe" I wanted. Also, this isn't a "party" place at all. It's all about relaxing and it caters to families. They have a very nice plaza area that can be lively at night depending on the live band that's playing. The Vegas night was the most fun. We stayed for the show which I thought was very good. The dancers were fantastic, and I am VERY CRITICAL. There's a kids club and a kids mini disco at night, which is cute at first, but after many nights, kind of annoying. Again, my fault for going to a family-oriented place. If you want to bring your kids, it's really great. We would bring our girls there in a heart beat! If you want a place where you can walk from your door right out to the beach, this is not the place for you. There's a bit of a walk as the resort is big and spread out. I liked the layout, but missed the closeness of the beach we had at El Dorado Royale. We walked into the town 3 afternoons. We were hot and sweaty, but enjoyed looking at the wildlife and the Mayan ruins on the way in. Not a bad walk at all. We even walked to WalMart (sunscreen!) one afternoon, but cabbed it back ($5). Some of the vendors on 5th are a bit much in the evenings. We went into town a few nights and were offered "pipes" and "a little something to smoke" a little too much, which irritated the heck out of my husband when they wouldn't get the hint and move on. They usually did when we replied in Spanish. Now, these aren't the hardworking folks in front of their stores, these are annoying dudes just hanging out around 5th trying to sell you pot and Lord knows what else. We are not uptight people, but it's just a bit much after a while and takes away from some of the enjoyment of strolling through town. We took a snorkeling trip with Scuba Caribe through the resort to Akumal and the Cenote Dos Ojos. We booked through Matais (very nice guy) and GJ (Super nice Dutch guy) was our guide. It was almost like a private tour. It was my husband, myself, Vin (a Dutch traveler) and GJ our guide. We had a blast. Akumal was great. We saw probably 6 turtles (amazing creatures!), squid, a few rays, a large barracuda and some assorted fish. Lovely area, would return for sure. Dos Ojos Cenotes were amazing, something out of a dream. If you are claustrophobic, use caution, you have to snorkel through a tight, dark area to get into the "bat cave." The water is also very cool, but is refreshing after a while. I highly recommend GJ and this trip. I think it was $80 per person. We also get beverages and a sandwich, nothing fancy, but good enough. RPRM is very beautiful, in a great location and has wonderful service. I don't know, however, if we'll return. There are many other places on the Riviera to stay, and I feel we could have gotten a bit more for the $$$ especially since many of the guests were upgraded from other RIU properties which were closed due to the H1N1 hysteria and we were offered nothing in comparison like an upgrade or spa service, etc. I will say this, if you want to relax and enjoy the beautiful weather and surroundings, this is a great place to do it. Cheers, Michelle

Reviews.Title: “A week of indulgence”
Reviews.Author: Duncanwhiskerface
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week at this hotel. It was the first time we have gone all inclusive so it was a real treat to have cocktails around the clock and food and drink whenever we felt like it. The service was excellent, all the staff really cannot do enough for you and they fill your glass up before you even realise it is getting empty! The hotel was also spotlessly clean at all times. The evening entertainment was a bit so so but you could always sit at another bar if it wasn't your cup of tea. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Riu palace Riviera Maya – like going home.”
Reviews.Author: Garlic_Addict
Reviews.Content: This was our eleventh trip to the Playa area and our tenth at an all inclusive hotel, fourth time to Riu palace – like going home. Flight: Continental cancelled flights so the planes were packed. Crying baby the whole flight to Mexico. We were the first ones through customs from our plane and we breezed through as no one else was there. Missed a half day of vacation because of Continental changing our flight from 3 p.m. to 12:15 coming back. Check in: We arrived about noon – way before the 3 p.m. check-in time but got our room immediately. Offered a cold drink right then. Room: upgraded to courtyard view, second floor room with large balcony near the pool/beach. There was a second door shutting our room and another off from the hall, which helped with the noise. We tipped daily and several evenings we got turn down service. Beach: saw lots of weddings on the beach. Whales in the water didn’t bother us. Loved the hammocks and they had palm trees instead of umbrellas or palapas. Food: Ten days of buffets for breakfast and lunch got tiring. Lunch buffet was OK, nice variety. Fish, lamb, beef, etc. – not just hot dogs, hamburgers, pizza like some resorts(although those were offered). Often the lights didn’t keep the food hot. Evening buffet very nice, good variety and excellent table service, cappuccino and brandy! No reservations were available the day we arrived. The special restaurants had a very limited menu – maybe 4 main courses and limited to two seating’s: 6:30 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. Our favorite restaurant was the Krystal and we ate there twice. We were unimpressed with Agave (the Mexican). We liked the sushi at Yokihama but the tempura was greasy and cold. Loved the seafood platter at the steakhouse (about the only time I got my smoked salmon). The only reservations available for the last Friday and Saturday were for the Brazilian and steakhouse @ 8:30 p.m. Hated having to decide a day or two in advance what time to eat – we prefer eating when we are hungry. General: Preferred the old piano bar at the Riu Palace Mexico better, more closed off and private, new one is too busy. The music at the pool included a few songs every day. I heard the “chicken song” and the “si, si, si, no, no, no” song multiple times a day. There were lots of activities hosted by the animation team. Hotel gave certificates and prizes (such as a Riu visor for winning (including dart tournament, air rifles, sexy bingo). I enjoyed the kitchen tour and Spanish lessons. The hotel charged $3.35 for a local phone call to Cancun Valet to confirm our private non-stop transportation to the airport. Because of the other Riu’s being shut down, we missed being able to use their pools. Enjoyed the nightly shows and the drink service was excellent. For the money we spent, the Riu Palace Riviera Mexico was one of the best all-inclusive hotels we’ve been to. It’s not all adult and it doesn’t offer a la cart restaurants without reservations, but you pay a lot more money for all-adult, all a la cart resorts. There is a big money difference to move up to all adult/all a la carte restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Super Awesome and Funny >Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Genamotion
Reviews.Content: Hello!!! I am from Mexico City sorry if i made any spelling or gramaticall mistake. I just return from 1 week at the RPRM it was the perfect relaxyng vacations ever. Starting with the 2 min wait at the Airport, shuttle to the hotel really fast (only 35 min). When we arrived to the hotel it only takes 3 min to be register and then we were at our really clean and big room. We had the minibar with vodka (Absolut) tequila (José Cuervo), rum (Bacardi) and brandi (Solera). Also sodas and bottle water. Living in Ciudad de Mexico we hate the Flu epidemia I think the goverment really exagerate amd overreact at the situation. Go to Playa del Carmen is great, Wow the Staf, all of them. At the pool, at the restaurants the cleaning lady, the gardeners, the bar tenders, all of them great people, they treet you as loyalty always with the biggest smile and the best service ever. Thank you Enrique, Marvin, Javier, well all oy you guys. The food incredible, very big viarity, you have shrimps, lobster, beef, lamb, octopus, salads, friuts, etc. You can not miss the restaurants all of the are great including Don Manolo if you are moody choose this one it has a great variaty. The pools are big and warm, the beach is beautiful, if you go to the Scuba Stand at the beach ask for mask and fins and go and snorkel by the “ballenas” (big sand stuff) you will find a lot of fishes and crabs it was great. The weather it was realy hot and sunny. If you dont like to get burn just pull a sunshade and you will be fine. At the pool always are waitress and they bring your drinks. Also if you feel hungry at night (like 3 am) you can ask for some sandwich or cake you have room service At 9:45 starts the nigt shows i catch the Michael Jacson´s it was great, also the Latino and the Mayan. My boyfriend knows how to sail and we took a Katamaran it was great you can see everything like the ferrys to Cozumel or the cruises. We went to “la 5 avenida” fisrt knight we walked its a 25 min walk it was reaally funny the second time we take a cab. They charge you 5 dollars. Over there you can visit really good restaurants or only take a Starbucks cofee if you feel a little homesick. You can also take the Ferry and arrive to Cozumel just fir the fun of it. It was a great experience just go and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: VixVix
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this amazing resort. We were with a group of 8 people and had no problems getting dinner reservations and rooms close together. We stayed from May 31-Jume 6. The grounds are immaculate and the employees are always eager to please. It is in a gated community which makes you feel very safe and secure. We never had any problems getting a chair by the pool or on the beach. Business still seemed a little slow due to the swine flu (which doesn't seem to exist in this part of the country). By the end of our stay it was picking up a little. The room is equipped with a hair dryer, iron and ironing board, There is also shower gel in a dispenser in the shower that worked quite well. The mini fridge is fully stocked with Pepsi products and Dos Equis beer. The fridge is restocked every 2 days. There is also various liquoer dispensers in the room. The drinks by the pool are served in tiny glasses so you may want to bring your own larger cup from home. They are happy to fill them for you. There is no drink service located on the beach which is a little bothersome. We took turns going to the pool bar to bring them back to the beach. We ate at every restaurant and the food was outstanding at each one. The lunch buffet was typical for an all inclusive resort. We had no trouble finding something edible. My one and only complaint was that the pool bar shut down at 6 pm each evening. We were never ready to go in. After 6 you have to go to the sports bar or the lobby bar to get a drink and they are both indoors. That was a real bummer as we were not finished enjoying drinks outside at the pool and on the beach. Aside from this, the resort was wonderful! We visited Tulum which is a nice trip that won't take up your whole day. We also visited Hidden Worlds for a day of adventure. I definitely recommend this to everyone. Visit their website hiddenworlds.com for more information. They have skycycles, ziplining, repelling, cenotes(beautiful). Go and have fun!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip ever to Mexico Business or Vacation”
Reviews.Author: CajunKing
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Mexico for 40 years. This last holiday was the best ever: Food: 5 Star (Champ Breakfast, Fusion, Japanese-(Jesus is a fantastic person) Service 5 Star ( The smiles and greeting made the trip for us Rooms: 5 Star (Clean, Cool and nice king size bed with jet tub) Music and Nightshows: 5 Star (Maya, Mariachi, Horror Musical and pool side crew-Great the Baby Grand Piano Player and night live dance music-Like Dancing with the Stars Front/Reservations Desk: 5 Star Antonio/Aldo and Norma- Great Job helping us" The comment do not worry everything will be OK" is true at the Riu. People at the Resort:: 5 Star (We danced and made chatted with people the whole time) Walking in Resort Area, Shopping at the Market, Visit to the Riu Yucatan- Fantastic Wedding Watching: They really treat the wedding party nice.... It seemed this trip everyone was there to have a "relaxing" time.....Everyone needs to experience this quickly while the push is not on at Cancun Airport and the Riu Resort Area.

Reviews.Title: “People -- GO TO MEXICO - STAY AT RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA”
Reviews.Author: LaPlume
Reviews.Content: Just returned May 28 from a one-week all-inclusive at the Riu Palace. This stay could not have been any better. Of course we benefited from the low occupancy rate because of the ridiculous coverage the US media gave to the so-called flu epidemic. How absurd it all was. There was no flu evident in the Playacar/Playa del Carmen area. The hotel was wonderful in every regard. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly kept. The staff was friendly and attentive. Management responded when we had two special requests. The food was delicious and imaginatively presented. The two specialty restaurants that we used (Brazilian and Mexican) were superb. The pools were crystal clear and warm and comfy. And we benefited from the best weather we could have imagined. My husband had been skeptical but he is no more. We are already planning our return trip. The "little" people in Mexico (hotel employees, market owners, etc.) are the ones suffering from the lack of tourism. Please people -- GO TO MEXICO. They will welcome you and your US money with open arms.

Reviews.Title: “As always, the RIU was dependable and fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: TiffanyHansen
Reviews.Content: My (now husband) and I just returned from an 8 day stay at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya in Playa del Carmen. We arrived on a Wednesday with his two children along with 20 other guests consisting of family and friends. We have stayed at 3 other RIU's in other location and have always been impressed with the service and friendly staff. This location was no different. The waitstaff is unmatched. Our room was always cleaned, sometimes more than once a day. I will continue to return to RIU because of their staff's friendlieness and willingness to please their guests! The food was fabulous, especially Chili's! We plan to return with a large group again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: doobs1
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th stay in Mexico but our first stay in the Riviera Maya area and we LOVE IT! It was the best time ever, the people are very friendly even out on town they were not overly pushy. This was refreshing and a pleasant surprise knowing the economy there is taking a worse beating than ours. The wait staff went above and beyond! The food was magnificent. The whole staff were friendly and helpful. It is a very comfortable area to stay as far as the town, and going into Playa Car for shopping. It was almost like shopping at home. The cenotes here are amazing, our snorkel trip with the snorkel/scuba company on the hotel grounds was great! We saw the most and varied fish ever! We even saw a cuddlefish and a cow fish. WHile in the water wading I had a small stingray swim by me! We did the Tulum extreme! which the word extreme says it all!!! Our Olympus tour staff as always took excellent care of all our travel and extracurricular activities. Our atv trip was a fun expierience followed by the most beautiful cenote we have seen so far. We will definitly be coming back to this hotel and this area of Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with the whole experience! Hated to leave.”
Reviews.Author: JillDPeterson
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, grounds, pool and beach and impeccably clean everywhere. Professional, friendly staff, accommodating, don't nickel and dime you. "Everything is possible" is their motto. Hotel was only about 60% full when we were there week of May 22-29, 2009 and it was perfect. Plenty of beach chairs and pool chairs at any time of the day. Reservations for restaurants had to be made in the lobby bar between 12:00-3:00 and could be made for a couple days in advance (although the brochure said only one day in advance). Chilis, which is near the pool had great rib-eye (which we ordered rare but came medium rare and was quite thin). The baked Alaska was great to watch being prepared but tasted only so-so. Botafogo, which is a "Brazil" type restaurant serves different types of meat on long skewers following a buffet salad bar with a pretty long line. It has a nice low-light ambiance and men are supposed to wear long pants and no sandals. The food was okay. These were the only two restaurants we tried because we were always gone during the day and couldn't make reservations for dinner. So we always ate at the buffet. You can eat inside (air conditioned) or outside. You can dress up or down. The buffet service was OUTSTANDING. We were seated immediately. There was always a different variety every night. They took our empty plate off the table immediately. They filled our empty glasses immediately. Buffets are never our favorites but this one was fantastic! We fixed sandwiches a couple times and took them to the beach and took ice cream up to our room a couple of nights. They also have room service. There is a refrigerator stocked with water, Pepsi, 7Up, Orange soda & Diet Pepsi in the room. There is a liquor dispenser above the mini-frig with full size bottles of Jose Cuervo Especial Tequila, Presidential Solera Brandy, Smirnoff Triple Distilled Vodka and Bacardi Superior Rum. No Coca-Cola products.They will also bring you other types of liquor if you ask. Our Junior Suite was on the fourth floor near the lobby with a small deck and a slight ocean view. We had a small sitting area with two chairs for watching TV. The air conditioning could have worked better and the toilet did not flush very well. The first night we got there, the jets in the tub did not work and I reported it. They fixed it the next day. The jets were not in very good locations though (two near my thighs, two near my ankles) so I didn't really use it much). My husband has a bi-pap machine for sleep apnea and must sleep with it at all times. Power was going to be shut off on one side of the hotel between 2-5 am so we told the front desk about his special needs. They happily moved us to the other side of the hotel for the night so we would have electricity for his machine. There is free high speed internet in the lobby, which isn't so high speed at times. The pool bar closes at 6:00 and the pool closes at 8:00, which we thought was way too early. The towel shack was closed almost every time we went there, but we went in the evenings, not mornings. The rooms over by the pool are pretty noisy starting around 7:00 am so if you're not an early riser get a room nearer the lobby. This hotel is a bit of a party place so if you have a problem with drinking and loud people, go somewhere else. We visited ruins at Tulum and Coba (we rented a car), we went to Akamul and snorkeled with sea turtles, we went scuba diving nearby and in a cenote (not for claustrophobics) with Scuba Libre (much better rates and service than those in the hotel or in front of the property). We checked out at 12:00 noon, stayed in the pool until 2:00, showered in the hotel (with hair dryer) and ate lunch at no additional charge. The black birds that live in the palm trees around the property are beautiful (though noisy) and really comical to watch. Check out Playacar community surrounding resort--really a beautiful place to live. I want to move there. There are 5 other RIU resorts nearby. This review is about the Hotel RIU Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS hotel!”
Reviews.Author: letsgo12
Reviews.Content: The food was amazing here. We tried Krystal, Chili's and the buffet. They were all great. Of course at Krystal we tried some very unique things, but it was fun! Our room had vaulted ceiling (on the top floor) and was big! We had a little balcony that faced out to the pool, fountains and ocean. We ordered room service just one morning, but decided the buffet was better! The grand lobby was perfect, we hung out in the lobby bar one night, it was fun trying the martini's. I loved that we had a completely stocked bar with full size liquor bottles....and all the pop you want! The staff was friendly, but didn't bug you either. I had a massage at the spa and it was one of the best I have ever had (from Gladys). The beach is beautiful, except for the large sandbag things along the coast...they are all along the playacar coast, helps with resturcturing the beach due to the hurricane Wilma. Other than that, it is perfect. We took the ferry to Cozamel and did the Fury snorkeling tour. It was fun, but if it is your FIRST time, don't do that one, the water is deep and rough. Try learning at the beach maybe then going. We were fine because we have snorkeled a lot. But, others were scared. The money you spend at Riu is worth it. We stayed next door at the Reef for 3 nights and I got sick and so did about 10 or so other guests. So, that is when we moved to Riu. I wish we had spent the money up front and stayed there the whole time. Lomas Travel people are so nice to work with for booking excursions (they are in the lobby by the shops). =) Oh, also the show we watched was sooooooo good. It was the Maya one, the dancers were great. I didn't want it to end!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort”
Reviews.Author: DianeChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Chicago. We were guests at Riu Palace, in Playa Del Carmen, along with three of our friends. The service was amazing! The friendly and polite employees. The hotel was always neat and clean!. Food was awsome. Can't wait to go back next year with our whole family. No sign of any Flu virus what so ever!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back for another visit!”
Reviews.Author: BDOGGETT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. It looked beautiful online, and it was even more beautiful in person. The resort as a whole was magnificent. The grounds were well kept and beautifully landscaped including the courtyard fountains. We had a regular room and it was larger than a typical hotel room... had a tv/sitting area, good size closet/storage, and a bathroom with double sinks. The shower was fine with good pressure and never ran out of hot water. Our view was of neighboring properties, but we were never in the room and that didn't matter to us at all. We were outside from breakfast until bedtime enjoying the water and entertainment. The food was great. We ate breakfast and lunch at the buffets everyday and never had to eat the same things. Their pancakes, french toast, and mimosas at breakfast were the best! Always lots of choices. We only ate dinner at the buffet one time and tried numerous specialty restaurants. We ate at Krystal, Yashima, and Chili's (twice). I had steak & lobster at chili's and some form of steak or beef every other night too. Our meals were always great and we were stuffed after each one. Dessert was always wonderful too! The one night we ate at the buffet for dinner we had numerous choices..... and the coconut ice cream was heavenly!
