We did not do any excursions or trips, but chose to spend our time at the beach and pool everyday. The beach was relaxing for the morning hours, then we liked to move to the pool in the afternoon for the music and entertainment... and the swim up bar!! We loved to sit outside after dinner and listen to the band play before the scheduled show every night. The entertainment was so-so, typical of resort shows. We enjoyed the "horror" show and its' dancing. All in all, we loved the resort and what it had to offer. We had exactly what we wanted... a relaxing, beautiful vacation with great service, food, and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “If you love being pampered, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: LisaDenver_CO
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one week stay (May 8-15) at this wonderful resort. We had the place to ourselves! The resort holds almost 500 people and there were only about 200, due to the cancellations from the non-existent flu. There have been no reported cases in the Playa area. I know that this a super positive review, but we travel 2-3 times a year to big resorts, and this was our best trip since Hawaii! The service was excellent from the moment we walked into the lobby. Everyone was so friendly and eager to fulfill our every request. If we asked for a bottle of wine to be sent to our room, it was there in minutes! The food was excellent at the buffets and were full of variety so we did not eat the same food at every meal. Yum! The staff was so helpful and always had a big smile for us. The specialty restaurants were very good too, especially Krystal. I liked that you could make reservations up to 4 days in advance, as some resorts will only do reservations for that day only. Even the deli, burgers, hotdogs at the sports bar were good in a pinch. The room service was prompt and delicious as well. The pool bar staff was great- Enrique was so fun! Make sure to be there for "sexy" bingo at 4pm, as it is a hoot! Also, make sure to order a "dirty monkey" a yummy banana, chocolate, frozen cocktail. Thomias at Scuba Caribe was very friendly and helpful with scheduling our diving and sailing and wave runnners. See Thomias at Scuba Caribe on the beach instead of the guys in the lobby of the resort for any water activities. As for the beach, it could not have been better. There were tons of chairs right next to the surf, and a huge palm tree shaded area for those who do not want fun sun. We spent most of our days under those gorgeous trees! And the beach was huge compared to some of the other resorts. The resort is a $5 short cab ride to Playa, which you must see for shopping. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “A Really Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Delandlyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel starting on 22nd April for two weeks. We loved everything about the hotel; the lobby area is out of this world and if you take time to look around (and up at the ceiling) you see how much care has been taken on the detail of the decor and the excellent workmanship. We found the food to be excellent and the food selection in the main buffet restaurant was that good that we only ate in one of the speciality restaurants once. The service was first class, from guiding you to your table to making sure that your table was cleared and that drinks were replenished (do not understand earlier complaints of the service, but you always get one who will moan about everything). A special thank you to Niermas (apologies if spelled incorrectly) who made a special occcasion more special for my partners birthday and arranged for all the choir (waiters!!) to sing a birthday ditty. Also, the service around the pool and beach area was great and another special thank you to Joe who was everybody's best friend (and called all the ladies "Princess" - very sweet. The hotel was spotless, even before the drama of the swine flu. Cleaners were constantly around and the public areas were given much attention. We were given the option of leaving the hotel early when the flu first broke but we were happy to stay in the wornderful hotel for the duration of our holiday and we are now glad that we did. We cannot comment on the entertainment at night as we found it difficult to stay up that late!! A full day on the beach or by the pool and following dinner, it was difficult to stay awake until late, but that type of holiday suits us fine. A special mention for Pedro in the sports bar who remembered our drinks and was eager to keep everyone happy with their choice of viewing on the multiple TV's. Overall, we thought the hotel was excellent and would recommend this for couples. As mentioned before, lively nightlife is available ten minutes away if you want it.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing place in the Mayan Riviera”
Reviews.Author: mtnmia
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace is the flagship of the Riu hotels in the area, and upon arrival to the lobby that is very clear. The staff is extremely attentive, friendly and always happy to help. The food is excellent, there are several fancy dining choices from sushi to steak, and of course the incredible buffets feature all one could dream of. The pool is top notch as is the service around the beach (thanx Joe). The entire hotel is very clean and the rooms are exceptional. The most magical place I have ever visited. I will always go back to the Riu. Plus a short taxi ride takes one down town Playa Del Carmen for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation all the way.........”
Reviews.Author: Sharona63RhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu April 23-30th and had the most relaxing vacation. Upon our arrival to the time we left we have nothing negative to say about our stay. The rooms were immaculate and continued to be so every day. We were there during the start of the "dreaded swine flu" and if we hadn't turned the TV on, we never would have known. It's the flu! Happens everywhere, every year! The media blowing it out of proportion did not ruin our trip in any way at all. The grounds were spotless and the staff, everyone from the waitstaff to the groundkeepers to the housekeepers were constantly working! We had no complaints. The pool was spectacular and based on what we could see after a walk down the beach, our beach was by far the best. We had no problems at all making reservations for the restaurants and don't understand all the negative comments about it. 5-10 minutes, and you're done! We truly loved the Mexican the best and went back more often than the other restaurants. We took the $5 cab ride into Playa del Carmen 3 times and had a ball every time! The smaller shopping area down the road in Playacar was also worth the trip and we got some great deals after negotiating. For those complaining about the entertainment, come on! The entertainment staff was out by the pool at 9am and then at 10pm, here they are STILL busting their butt on stage and working to make your stay more enjoyable. You're not in Vegas, people! All in all, this was our 2nd time to Mexico and our first time at a Riu. We would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Italian_08
Reviews.Content: We spent our first anniversary at the RIU Palace Riviera during the swine flu pandemic amidst many people advising us not to go. We are so glad we didn't listen! The hotel was only filled to about 30% capacity which meant we didn't have to hunt for a lounger by the pool and we were waited on hand and foot by the staff who were thrilled that we were there. Our goal in going was to do nothing but lounge, relax and enjoy each other. We were able to do all 3. The facilities are gorgeous and kept spotless. If we had an issue with our room (musty smell), it was taken care of within 5 minutes of calling. The staff at the pool bar were almost fighting over taking care of us so no more than 3-5 minutes went by without someone stopping to check on us. A few who stood out - Joe (okey dokey), Javier (with his incredible smile and great sense of humor) and Marvin! We stopped by the pool bar on our way to our room one afternoon and my husband asked for a few glasses of Jim Beam straight to mix cocktails in the room. Marvin told him to open his bag and he placed a full bottle in there! He was, of course, tipped very well for that! We were only there a short period of time and therefore didn't check out all of the restaurants. We had the buffet the first evening. We didn't like everything we tried but there was plenty to try and went back for seconds once we landed on what we did like. We had dinner at both Chili's and Krystals and were very pleased with both. The pumpkin soup with scallop at Krystal's was great! And the steak and lobster at Chili's - YUM! My husband and I have traveled worldwide and have stayed at many, many hotels and all inclusives. This one ranks high on my list and I would definitely return as well as recommend it to anyone who asked.

Reviews.Title: “vacationing with two college sons”
Reviews.Author: lbuggie
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Mexico, all visits were to al inclusives. RPRM cannot be compared to any of the other resorts I've visited. The Rui is in a class all by itself. Highest level of professionalism from the wait staff to the grounds keepers to the chefs, bartenders, front desk attendants ,maids, etc. I felt like a princess in a castle. From pulling the chair out for me at every meal. laying the napkin on my lap. removing my empty plate and making sure my cocktail was always freshened. Marble and granite pillars and crystal chandeliers illuminated the lobby with cascading flowers in vases...Tiffany's jewelry store on the premise lets you know how up scale this resort really is. Not one complaint from me...I can usually find something I didn't like but not at this resort...Felt like I was in a dream, looking forwart to visiting the Riu in Costa Rica soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Lucy2703
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya 7-21 April and had a fantastic time. This hotel is absolutely fabulous it really is a Palace! The room we stayed in was on the top floor and had a courtyard view. The fridge was well stocked. Air con worked fine, no problems with the water pressure and no complaints about the matress. The room was kept spotlessly clean by the maids and the toiletries (shampoo, shower/bath gel and body lotion ) always replaced. Other people on this site have complained about noise but we slept soundly and had no problems. Nor did we experience any bad smells that other people have also made reference to on this site. All the staff were brilliant , Alfredo especially, and could not do enough for you, you honestly never have to lift a finger. They pull out your chairs, take your plates back to your table when returning from the buffet, bring you your drinks wherever you are be it on the beach, at the pool, in the restaurant etc etc. We had no security problems but always made sure that our valuable items were locked in the safe. The food was superb, we ate at the buffet and didn't try the speciality restaurants. I think most of the food served in the restaurants was available at the buffet anyway. The choice was vast and there was something to please everyone. The entertainment in the evenings was a bit hit and miss, some nights good and some nights pretty dreadful but this did not bother us. The beach was large and not overcrowded with plenty of shade. The ocean was beautiful, turquoise water but a little choppy and the red flag was out most days. Please take care when the red flag is flying as there were quite a few hotel guests who ignored this, swam out a little too far and got into difficulty and had to be rescued by the lifeguards. All in all this is one of the best holidays we have ever had and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Simple....its the BEST in PLAYA!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CancunTravel2Much
Reviews.Content: Been to the area many times....this place is the best....make sure you tip the same as you would at home. The Flu scare has not affected this area....I will return many times....

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could go back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: stamana
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived at the hotel, it was simply paradise. The hotel is clean beyond clean. Everywhere you look there is someone cleaning something. The service is great--we had great bartenders....Pedro is the best bartender around!! The waiters and waitressess were there getting anything we wanted all the time. The rooms are very nice. We were in a junior suite. The only drawback was it was two full beds pushed together, not a king. The restaurants are great. People say it is hard to get reservations---it IS hard to get a reservation your first night. But after that, just go and book them two days in advance and you will be all set. We arrived late Thursday. So on Friday, we didn't get to eat in their specialty restaurants. But we booked Friday afternoon for Saturday and Sunday. Then on Saturday we booked for Monday and Tuesday. Then on Monday we booked for Wednesday. So we were all set--no problems at all. The buffets were all very nice as well.....food was all over the place all the time! The only drawbacks were the drive from the airport to the hotel--it was about an hour to an hour and a half. Also, the entertainments shows at night weren't the best. The value was great- I wish we could go back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Clare_Ade
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Mexico on 31st August 2008 (my birthday too!) and upon arriving at the Riviera Maya was wowed by the reception, after the heat of the day it was lovely to enter the very cool air conditioned reception, our room was upgraded to a sea view and what an amazing view of the gorgeous Caribbean sea, I agree that the food could be repetitive but, that said there was still a very good choice. The service really was second to none the staff cannot do enough for you from bringing you drinks when you are in the pool or on the beach to cleaning every area there is to be cleaned. The only letdown was the choice of the room service but, that is not a huge deal we only used it once and after the breakfast and dinner you probably will not want anymore. This was our 1st trip to Mexico and it won't be our last we have already booked to go back next April (to a different hotel) but, we will definitely be back at the Riviera Maya but, not in September it was much too humid for us!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: KatieK13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (we are 31 years old) just got back from our trip to the RIU Palace and I couldn't have been more pleased. Certainly the highlight of the resort was the service. Everyone there was extremely attentive and friendly. We rarely waited for a drink and there was service staff everywhere, so we rarely had to even go up to the bar. There were even people walking around the pool taking orders and bringing trays out to the beach. Not to focus too much on the drinking, but the booze and beer was actually decent stuff as well. The beer was XX Lager (and cold) and there were name brand liquers. Often at an all inclusive you get imitation everything and that was not the case here. The food was very good. As is the case in any resort, the main restaurant was a buffet, but the atmosphere of the buffet restaurant was much nicer than most with cloth napkins, table drink service and very fast cleanup of extra dishes. There were a lot of different options. We also ate at several of the 'specialty' restaurants including the Brazilian, The Japanese, The Steakhouse, and the 'modern'. They were all very good and lent to a more quiet dinner style than the usual buffet. The only thing I didn't love was how close the tables were together at various places, but that is something that can't really be avoideded. The beach and pool were both great and there were so many chairs available, no matter what time we went out there, we were always able to get a seat at either place. There was also a lot of umbrellas available by the pool and palm trees on the beach, so you could always find shade if needed. Our room was very nice with a king bed and a separate sitting area. There is a stocked fridge and booze dispenser and if you run out of anything, they come immediately to replenish. They also had 24 hour room service which was a nice feature. Our rooms were cleaned very well every day including the floor being washed, which you don't always see and after time on the beach, it was appreciated. One day we forgot our safe open and the cleaning staff locked it for us and we had to get the front desk to open it. I thought this showed a lot of integrity as we had a lot of cash and our passports sitting there. They had shows each night which were ok, but if you want some real night life, you would have to head out of the resort. We were out to relax, so it didn't bother us. The only thing we needed to pay for was phone calls. There was a $4 charge per call to use the phone in your room even with a calling card. Also, there was wireless internet available in the lobby only. When I had called ahead of time, I was misinformed about this. Overall, I found this to be a great place to vacation and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we picked this Riu”
Reviews.Author: MossCarr
Reviews.Content: Short review as people have already covered most points, but felt I had to keep the ratings for this hotel up! Booked via vacationstore.com as they had the best deal, we booked a junior suite for the price of a standard room. The location of the hotel is a an hour by mini bus, we booked a private transfer with a2b.com (part of Hola Tours), they were waiting outside the airport. As you exit the airport hang on tight to your bag and just keep walking! Check in was a breeze, ($10 tip secured us a fab hugh sea view room with jacuzzi bath). All areas of the hotel are clean, comfortable and spacious, plenty of chairs to relax in. Nice pool area, enjoyed the swim up bar and loved the beach with plenty of loungers. Yes you do have to get up early in the morning for a sun lounger by the pool. But hey do as we do, if the lounger has not been used for an hour or more, fold up the towels and enjoy. The staff are without a doubt the best I have ever met, they could not do enough for you, they appear as if by magic (or could it be the $ tip) when you have almost finished your drink! The food is vey good, but it's a bit repetative, as we were only there for 4 nights we only ate in the buffet restaurant, didn't fancy the reservation queue for the other restaurants and also being tied down to a time to eat. Come out of the hotel, turn left approx 5 mins, takes you to the small market square of Playacar, turn right approx 20 mins you are on 5th Ave (fab fire show at the Blue Parrot) taxi $5, a must at 3am when your disco legs are tired! Took th all inclusive combined day trip to Xe-Hal and Tulun approx $140, great day, well organised and good value. You can only use bio degradable sun screen in Xe-Hal, buy it before you get there! Don't let negative views put you off , this is a surberb hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Don013
Reviews.Content: Food. Very good. Ranking them, my wife and I had Krystal , Yashima, Chilis for steak dinner, and Agave last. The Mexican food was just average at Agave. The buffet was also very good. Service was outstanding. You might have to wait for a drink on the beach., but around the pool there was a drink cart that went around taking care of your needs.Staff was always cordial and smiling. It was really nice to see people take pride in their job, and enjoy what they were doing even when some did not receive tips.Rooms.Ours was always very clean and restocked, room service was very prompt with a limited menu. I would advie to get a room facing the ocean and fountain.Outside rooms face other hotels, not a very good view.We paid the extra $50 us to have a fountain view. 2056 was Our room. Beach .Very nice, please make sure You pay attention to the flags, the rip current can get bag if You swim East of the sand whales. We had the red flag up for a couple days, then the sea settled down to a green flag. Location was very good. If Yu like longer walks on the beach, head to to the Riu Mexico , and head South, you can walk for ever even to a place where there is no hotels and the water is like glass .One last item, if You head over to Cozumel rent a car and drive around the island. There is many little bars Albertos, Raftas, San Franciso Beach Club, and Carlos and Charlies.Take You swim suit.These bars are quiet and great spot to chill and eat and have a drink or 2.If You have any questions please email me at donnyandrews@comcast.net. Enjoy this place it is Great.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: bettyb
Reviews.Content: My fiancé and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Mon Apr 13-Thurs Apr 16. We came in thru Cancun Airport during the height of the spring break season—extremely busy. If you are traveling during Spring Break be prepared for a lot of long lines and bag checks—very tiring after a 4hr flight. Right as we were about to exit the hotel to look for our transportation—Olympus Tours—there was a host of men wearing shirts stating, “Tourist Information.” We were approached by one of them and they asked us what transportation are you looking? We replied, “Olympus Tours and RPRM.” He then stated that once you go thru the exit look for a crew wearing orange and blue, that is Olympus. Then he asked us if we were interested in going on excursions…. BASICALLY, after this point the gentleman tried to get us to come to an informational session for Timeshares under the guise of a free excursion. WATCH OUT FOR THESE GUYS and WARN YOUR GUESTS ABOUT THEM! There’s at least 40 of them situated right at the exit door and you can be sidetracked into trusting them b/c they all have the “Tourist information” shirts. They’ll even try to tell you that if you book an excursion at your hotel the price will be far greater then booking w/ them, which is not true at all. Transportation from the airport to the hotel took 1 hr and 45 mins b/c we stopped at three other hotels to drop off other guests. On Tues, we met a nice family from NY while having lunch and they told us that based on other traveler’s advice on Tripadvisor, they had arranged for private transportation to avoid all of these stops---they paid $125 for a family of 5-roundtrip, which is extremely cheap. Basically, ARRANGE FOR PRIVATE TRANSPORTATION FROM AIRPORT TO HOTEL and back. What was supposed to be a 40 min trip to Riu Palace Rivera Maya from Cancun Airport took us twice as long which made us very cranky when we finally arrived. While riding thru Cancun and Playa del Carmen we were able to get a sense of city. In Playa, the streets got a bit tight and was bustling w/ locals and tourists. I was a little worried of how our hotel was going to look situated in such an area. However, to get to RPRM, you have to enter a gated community of nice hotels and homes. There are 2 security checkpoints which made me feel very safe. Arrival To Rprm Now, in Aug 2008 I stayed at the Riu Palace Punta Cana for a destination wedding and had a blast. I was completely sold on Riu and my fiancé and I decided to also have a DW. Thus, the purpose of my stay at RPRM was to assess the grounds, beach, accommodations, customer service and food. Grounds When we pulled up to RPRM you truly feel like you are approaching a Palace (just like the Riu in Punta Cana)! With all of the castle posts it kinda of reminds me of the Taj Mahal. When we first walked into the hotel, there was a musty wet socks smell. I was really bothered by this, but I just wanted to check in. The next day I really didn’t notice it much. I guess it comes and goes. Hotel lobby, like RP Punta Cana, looks palatial! Beautiful chandelier, semi spiraling staircase, just grand. The grounds—indoor and outdoor—are very well kept. Everywhere you turn there’s cleaning staff either mopping, dusting, or brooming. The courtyard, again, exactly the same as RP Punta Cana--picture perfect, greener than green shrubbery, etc. Beach The water is just beautiful! No seaweed, rocks, etc. Just clear as day. In waist deep water, my fiancé even saw a fish swim by. Although we didn’t go scuba diving, we overheard others say that they did and that they enjoyed it. As other reviews have reported, there are these huge ugly sand bags AKA “whales” installed all along the beach to prevent beach erosion. These whales are a monstrosity b/c it ruins your pics and the scenery, however, its a necessary evil. I met w/ Juan Carlos Magellon, the hotel wedding photographer, and inquired as to how wedding pics will come out w/ these ugly whales? He said he has a specific area where he takes pics where the whales aren’t too visible and that he redacts/retouches the whales out, this was comforting. From the shore to the “whales,” the water will only reach about chest level, however, when a strong wave comes in, you can get covered. All in all, to get a good swim, you’ll have to go beyond the whales. On Mon and Tues of our stay, the waters were tooo rough for any water sports. Also, I regret that I have to report this, but, unfortunately, I was informed by numerous guests that on Mon a guest actually drowned in the ocean due to the strong undercurrent. He left behind a wife and child. The hotel staff rendered 15 mins of CPR, but to no avail. I was also informed that the gentleman may have been drinking and that he swam past the whales—alcohol + a strong undercurrent=potential disaster. There was a lifeguard on duty when I went to the beach, so I made sure we swam in his general vicinity and I recommend that everyone do the same. By Wednesday, the water was much calmer and all the water sports resumed—parasailing, banana boat, paddle boat, sailing, and jet skiing (the FI and I only went jet skiing and it cost $60—great price and a lot of fun. Pool Pool-- nice, swim up bar, plenty of pool chairs and umbrellas, but get there early for the good spots! Pool wasn’t heated in the evenings when it got a bit cooler, RP Punta Cana was. Accommodations, Food, and Alcohol The rooms were exactly as I remembered them. Junior Suites, King size bed, balcony, and living room w/ a flat screen TV. Bathroom was spacious w/ double sinks, beautiful countertops. Huge closet w/ a laptop sized safe electronically accessed w/ your own personal pin code. Fridge and liquor dispensers, modern decor—open layout, dark mahogany wood. Rooms were cleaned everyday. Air conditioning could have been stronger, but if you also turn on the fan you’ll be fine. The staff was friendly. We had no overt problems. Check in was smooth, we were greeted with drinks while we checked in, and our bags were brought to our rooms by a bellboy. Food at the sports bar sucks—refrigerated hot dogs, burgers, sandwiches that you warm in a microwave. Food at buffet and chili’s outdoor grill was great. Only got to go to one specialty restaurant--Chili’s Steakhouse—steak was alright, the seafood platter was good, really liked the baked Alaska dessert. Alcohol--they had all top shelf liquor, but if you want a drink with a certain brand you have to ask or they will use the well options. Dislikes Three things disturbed me: (1) water in the bathroom tub did not drain properly so when we took a shower bathwater accumulated around our feet I hate this, so I quickly called front desk. Someone was sent right away, but he had no plumber tools or drano. Disgustingly, he tried to pump the drain w/ his hand. He then swished around water in the tub and then told us that everything was ok. We knew this was impossible, so I tried to ask him in my broken Spanish if he could get access to drano. He couldn’t understand me so we left him go. We didn’t call the front desk again b/c our stay was short, we didn’t want to wait around for wrkrs to come and fix it, and we didn’t want wrkrs coming in and out of my room while we were gone for the day. It was truly bothersome to have to turn the water off half way thru a shower just to allow the bathwater to drain; (2) the air conditioning in the room could have been better, but as previously stated if you turn on the fan you’ll manage. (3) Lastly, the customer service at RPRM was like an assembly line w/ no wiggle room. For example, our first night in Mex my fiance and I mistakenly thought that the buffet closed at 1030pm we were running a little behind that night, but made it to the buffet at 10:18pm. Well, the buffet closed at 1015 pm rather and we weren’t allowed to go in and get a couple of scraps. We were told to go to the sports bar or order rom svc. I mean 3 mins! This would have never happened at RPRC. Overall Assessment If I had to compare the staff, grounds, food and customer service at RP Riviera Maya to that of RP Punta Cana I would definitely say that RPPC takes the cake hands down. My sentiments were echoed by/ 3 other guests that I talked to while at RPRM (another guest preferred RP Aruba). Notwithstanding this comparison, our stay at Riu Palace Riviera Maya was still terrific. The food was good, the beach was clean and when the water was calm it was very enjoyable, drinks were also good. The nightly entertainment was great—very talented crew. The excursions look super exciting, but we didn’t have time to get to any. We did take a cab into town and brought a lot of souvenirs—Clothes, jewelry, cohiba cigars that are way cheaper than the ones sold at the hotel, and masseuses offering $30 massages.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Maxine10
Reviews.Content: Have just returned form a week at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya which we booked through Thomson. We usually use Kuoni, but could only fly cetain days so ended up with Thomson. Plus points - two good sized pools, nice beach area, Negative points - service, staff attitude, restaurant reservations, complex layout,expensive for what it was The flight was ok. Plane branded first Choice. Seats were comfy and there was plenty of room. Our screens did not work for the entire flight and the food was poor. In standard class, you have to pay £5 to get your tv screen upgrade to watch more movies. play more games and to be able to pause & rewind. All drinks are chargable. Athough if you pay for premium seats (extra £200) both these are included. Transfer to the resort took forever. We had to wait in a hot mini bus at the airport for over an hour for two more guests who god knows what they were doing. The actual transfer time is around an hour. The road has lots of topes (speed restriction devices) these are either two rows of very evil domes or worse still two dug out pits which really make for a rocky ride! At the hotel, got the welcome drink on arrival and assistance with luggage to our room. We were in 3066 - not the greatest location. On the third floor overlooking the plaza. These rooms have smaller balconies that the lower rooms and are smaller in size too. Lots of stairs or a long walk to use the lift also! Cleanliness was ok, not five star standard. There were hairs in the bath and nail varnish from the previous occuapants. Grouting around the bath was poor and the clothes drier was missing from the balcony. As we had no restaurant reservations, dinner was in the Don Manalo restaurant (main one)This is a large buffet. Lots of choices of food available, but very noisy and busy. To make restanurant reservations you need to visit the lady who sits in the main lobby bar area between 12 noon and 3pm. You join the 'line up' and if you are lucky enough to have some availability left when you get to the front you are allowed to make two reservations for the other restaurants, BUT, there are two sittings - either 6.30pm or 8.45pm. During our week we ate at The Steak House (Chillis), the Brazillian (Botafogo) and the fusion (Krystal) Although these are quiter and the service is a little better, the menus are very limited with maybe only the choice of only two or three dishes - all of which you order at the begining of the meal - including dessert! Not really a five star experience. The steak house (chillis) was fine, but the seating is very uncomfortable. The Brazillian was just starters from the salad bar or soup (the smae food as in Don Manalo) then they came round with skewers of meat - sausage,pork,turkey,rib eye steak, fillet steak. A dish of veg is on your table and they carve a small amout of the meat on to your plate. The skewers do not come all together,so the process is long. Dessert is from the buffet and again is the same as DonManlo. Crystal - was the best dining experience, but the menu was very limited and not the best. We thought overall the best food and cetainly choice was DonManalo, but it was the worst dining experience. The service is too efficient in all the restaurants. As soon as you have emptied a glass Or on some occasions not quite emptied a glass or finished with a plate (or they decide that you have finished with a plate) they swoop in and take it away even though the other person is still eating. This really got on our nerves in the end as we found that we were protecting our crockery, cutlery and glasswear! we did not dare venture to the buffet together as when we returned our other items would have been taken from us!!! After a week, the food was begining to get a bit boring, even though there was always lots of choice. Desserts were generally prefrozen and the same ones were available at almost all meals, lunch and dinner. Staff on the whole were good, but reception staff in particular - there first responce to any request always appeared to be No, but we generally manged to get what we wanted in the end. It was maybe just not quite as customer friendly as we would have liked. MiniBar in bedroom - 4 optics - Bacardi, Smirnoff, house Brandy and tequila. In the fridge were beers, coke, lemonade, orange and water. We asked for Gin, Whisky and Tonic water. First told No by reception, then Gin appeared that evening, but no tonic or whisky. Asked again. Told we had to fetch tonic from the bar. Went to bar to get tonic, said they would send some up with room service. We never managed to obtain Whisky. There is a sign in the room saying drinks will be topped up every two days. Our fridge was but our spirits were not. Service at the other bars was Ok, nothing outstanding and no real personalities to comment on. Entertainments Program - this is inflicted on you where ever you are in the resort. On an evening there was live music in the plaze (just below our room) from 7.45pm to around 10pm when the show started. During the day there were events taking place around the pool and beach and music was blasting out all day long. Games included - sexy bingo, water polo, darts, crazy games, water volleyball, volleyball, table tennis etc. We spent the first few days wishing we were somewhere else then decided to go with the flow as we had little alternative! The entertainment team (Rudi, Joshua, Danielle, Pepe, Leo etc) work very hard and are actually a really nice bunch of people. The shows were suprising good, except one - which was drumming and screaming for an hour. We had access to all the Rui hotels with our gold wrist band. You can use the facilities and eat lunch etc at the others but Must have dinner at your own. We had lunch at Tequila and were surprised to find the food was exactly the same. The only difference was the service. At Tequila it was totally self service where as at The Palace it was waiter service drinks. The only other difference we spotted was that the chairs in the plaza area were plastic at Tequila and Wrought iron at The Place. It is worthwile noting that although you have full use of the other hotels there are quite a walk from the Palace. We also visited the Playacar, but prefered the Tequila to this. If you stay at Tequila (which we would do if we did go again) then there are two other Rui hotel much nearer. We did hire a car and driving was fine. Went snorkelling at Yal Ku lagoon, well worth a visit. Had lunch at the restaurant on the way back up the road at Half Moon Bay, cant remember the name though. Had wanted to go snorkelling from here too, but the sea was a bit too rough as it often was. Visited some cenotes and went snorkelling there. WARNING - Mosquitos. 24 bites! Also visited Tulum. Super beach area there, but to gain access we needed to go via a beach restaurant. Mexico itself is line Benidorm for the Brits, to the Americans. Its a long way for somewhere not very different than mainland Spain or the Canaries. Considering the week here cost us in the region of £2500, would we go again? - Probably not. There are better places to go for the flight time and money.

Reviews.Title: “If I could give it less than 1 star, I would”
Reviews.Author: Ladybug71
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel, this is not. I am used to staying in fairly nice hotels and resorts and thought that my stay at the Riu Palace would be similar to other resorts in the area. It was not. First of all, the hotel room was never very clean. The maid service was spotty, especially in the bathroom. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, and the sheets never felt clean. The air conditioning barely worked. And most days the room wouldn't be "cleaned" until well into the afternoon. In addition, on more than one occasion, the mini-fridge with sodas, beer, and most importantly, bottled water, would not be restocked daily, so that we would have to call room service to request more. The size of the pool is wholly inadequate for the large size of the resort. All of the lounges around the pool were utilized every day, making it impossible to get a seat by the pool (instead of the beach) unless reserving one early in the morning with a towel. The beach area was fine, although it could have been cleaned more regularly. And drink service on the beach was very sporadic; it was quicker to walk to the pool bar to get drinks. Trying to make reservations at the restaurants was a nightmare in itself, and we really shouldn't have bothered, because the food was terrible. It still amazes me that a resort in Mexico has terrible Mexican food. Some of the dishes were truly inedible. In addition, the public restrooms of the resort were not kept very clean, and oftentimes toilets would be clogged and when staff was told, nobody spoke English well enough to understand and do anything about it. The linens (towels, sheets, tablecloths) had stains on them. It made me not even want to eat in some places, which was fine anyways, because the food was so bad. To add insult to injury, the service was deplorable, with or without tips. Only a few of the employees at the resort seemed to care at all about the guests, and were justly compensated. My supposed relaxing vacation was not relaxing at all. I will never visit a Riu Palace resort again, and do not recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “One word: WOW”
Reviews.Author: gm2013
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace was our best vacation ever! The moment we walked into the marble lobby with crystal chandeliers and plush couches, all of our stress melted away. The moment we walked in our room and saw the “mini bar,” which consists of a bottle of Tequila, a bottle of rum, a bottle of vodka, and a bottle of brandy, we knew we were going to have a lot of fun. This place is amazing! My husband and I stayed for 5 nights in March and we are looking forward to going back and bringing our friends! HOTEL: Lobby is very elegant, and similar to five-star hotels we’ve stayed in, with a gorgeous bar and lots of cocktail tables for indoor imbibing. GROUNDS: Lots of trees and gardens. Very well kept, constantly being cleaned, we didn’t see one single insect during the week we were there! BEACH: no need to get up early to reserve a chair – there are plenty! You can lie on the beach, on a sandy area shaded by palms, or around one of the two pools! We preferred the beach, which was beautiful and clean. There are volleyball nets if you want to play. Kayaks, boogey boards, and windsurfers are free, but you need to pay for lessons. The sand bags do interrupt the view a bit, but also prevent the waves from being out of control. POOLS: our favorite part was the swim up bar. The pool is a good place to hang out and socialize, there are in pool tables and stools, and two pool-temperature jacuzzis. There is also a shallow pool on an upper level, which is less crowded. SPA: we had a massage, which was very good and cheap at $68 for 60 min! There are hot jacuzzis that are available for everyone, whether or not they buy a spa service. BARS: The best all-inclusive bars we’ve seen! Choice of martinis, Cognac, mojitos and caipirhinas, and fresh fruit drinks. Top shelf liquor. Never needed to ask for extra alcohol, the bartenders are very generous and friendly. ROOMS: large with nice bathrooms. It was difficult to make it completely comfortable as it is humid, and the AC just makes it cold and humid. The safe seemed secure and we used it without any problems. Lots of drawer space if you want to unpack. A flat-screen television is in each room. ROOM SERVICE: 24-hour room service is free with a limited menu. We ordered once when we first came in and it was a great intro to the hotel, but there was never another time we needed to order, and since there are limited choices we preferred to go the buffets. FOOD: The food was very good, but not excellent. The key to the restaurants is to make the reservations as soon as you get there for the next two nights. Also, if you show up to the restaurants at the time of the seating (6:00 and 8:30) and ask nicely, they may seat you without a reservation if there is space. Our favorites were Krystal (upscale fusion) and Yashima (Japanese) for dinner, and Don Manolo for breakfast and lunch. The quality of the food at Krsytal is better than any other place in the hotel. I would recommend eating there more than once and skipping the Brazilian restaurant, which was very mediocre. The lunch at Don Manolo has a lot more variety than Chili’s and is less crowded. Mexican was okay, but had similar food to the buffet at Don Manolo. Chili’s for dinner has surf and turf but it wasn’t anything to write home about. You could skip it. The Spots Bar has food 24/7 and is a good place to get bottled water if you run out. They also have foozball and Internet access ($8/ hr). ENTERTAINMENT: this was the one area that we were not as impressed with, but the evening entertainers did put on a show. We saw two shows, but didn’t stay until the end of either of them. There is a band that plays in the evening outside on the gazebo, and they were very good and very professional. We enjoyed drinking and listening to them after dinner. TIPS: We did feel the need to tip for good service on the resort. At most of the restaurants, the service was simply impeccable, so we tipped 100 pesos or so, and it was very much appreciated, but not expected. We had a few favorite bartenders (Santos and Rene, especially) and we made sure to tip them for their hard work. SUNDRIES: Bring your own suntan lotion! Spray suntan lotion at the resort went for $20/bottle! If you walk down the Playacar street a little, you’ll come to a few stores sandwiched between a couple of resorts. One store (the furthest from the main road and closest to the Rui Palace) sold those bottles for about $12, a much better deal and worth the five-minute walk. TALUM: We did a half-day Talum trip through out travel tour people on Travelocity (Olympus Travel). It was approximately $60/person, and included van transportation, bottled water, and admission to and a tour of the ruins. Talum is the closest of the Mayan ruins, and it’s a good excursion if you want to see some history while you’re in Mexico. FIFTH AVENUE: We walked to Fifth Avenue in Playa del Carmen twice from the hotel (and then took a $5 cab ride home both evenings). While we did not eat or drink there (why bother, when we had a gold bracelet that allowed us to eat and drink to our heart’s content at the Palace?), we did shop and purchase a few items of clothing in a few stores. The area is really touristy and caters to the cruise crowd. Overall, you can’t miss by booking a stay at this resort. A friendly staff caters to your every need, and the resort grounds are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place and such a great value.”
Reviews.Author: arlenenruss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya the first week of April 2009. We arrived at the airport around 3pm, but by the time we got to the resort, it was close to 5. We were welcomed with a drink, given our room key, and the belman took our lugage to the room. We stayed on the bottom floor and had a great jr. suite. I didn't smell anything out of the ordinary like others have complained about. The room was clean although we did see some type of small flying insect on the bed. The room was stocked with beer and soda along with some lower end alcohol (vodka, tequila, rum, and brandy). Again, no complaints about the room except that it was pretty far away from the nearest ice machine. I absolutly loved the location of the room as it was closer to the main building than the beach. If you are night people and want to sleep in, I would recommend a room closer to the main building. The pool area can get pretty loud early in the morning. We ate at the buffet the first night and they had an excellent spread with all sorts of different types of food. After dinner, we relaxed in the courtyard listening to a band and mariachi group. Excellent service by the wait staff who quickly offered another drink if they saw you were getting low. The entertainment ended and we went back to our room. My only complaint was that the entertainment during all the nights ended pretty early (10 pm) and there was really nothing to do afterwards at the resort as the pool is closed. We woke up the next morning too late to make it to breakfast. We had lunch instead at the buffet next to the pool. Great food again. We then hung out at the pool and beach. The ocean was a bit warmer than the pool water but the pool water was easy to get used to after a few minutes. It was not cold as others have complained. I had to wait in line for dinner reservations and got there about 30 minutes after they began accepting reservations. That night the only restaurant seating available was at the mexican restaurant for the late seating. I took that one along with a reservation for two days later at the Japanese restaurant. The food at both restaurants was delicious although I heard some not so good reviews about the Brazilian restaurant from some others at the resort. After dinner we walked over to the RIU Tequila and went to the dance club. We are in our early 30's and the place made us feel old! It was full of 18-21 year olds who obviously don't know how to dance any other way than grinding on eachother. It was quite disappointing. We walked back to the hotel (about 1/4 mile) had another drink and called it quites for the night. The next day we went to XCaret and went swimming with the dolphings (highly recommend it). Got back to the resort exhausted from the excursion. Had a couple of drinks inside the main building and called it quites. We spend the next day at the pool. The water was much colder this day but it had been pretty windy the day before so this may have played a part in the temperature. We eventually got in, had several more drinks at the pool bar, hung out with new friends and relaxed. Dinner at the Japanese restaurant and then off to the Michael Jackson show which was great. We really had a good laugh. Woke up the next day, had breakfast (finally made it to breakfast!!!) and found the selection to be small but adequate. We walked to the small shopping area nearby, bought some stuff to take home, and headed back to the hotel before our ride picked us up to take us to the airport. Had one last drink (mojitos and miami vice are delicious) and said farewell to the resort. This was an excellent vacation and a bargain at under $1400. We walked through several of the other RIU resorts nearby and with the exception of the Palace Mexico, they do not even compare. I sill prefered Palace Riviera Maya over Palace Mexico because the beach was nicer at Riviera Maya. We went to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and the wife and I are already talking about going back again.

Reviews.Title: “We're back after round 2 in a 3 month period, another great trip”
Reviews.Author: Docobee
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am writing another review after returning from the RIUPRM from our stay 4/3/09 to 4/13/09. I submitted a review 1/2/09 with a lot of pictures and detail so if you want to look back you can see my pictures. I will say the atmosphere at Christmas and New Years was different and the mixture of guests was different for Spring Break. There were not unattended high school or college kids there, they don't allow it. There was more glitz at Christmas and New years and a wider selection of upscale food but I would expect that too. The price in April was 1/3 less and summer is 2/3 less than Christmas and New Years. We had another wonderful trip and there were 5 of us ranging from 11 to 50. I will say the 11 year old, 19 year old and 21 year old has as much fun as the parents. The weather was spectacular and there was always a breeze to wind which made the 85-87 degree temperature easy to tolerate. The sun was hotter than December so you could surely burn easier so beware. The other interesting observation, at Christmas the Caribbean was warmer than the pool and now the pool is warmer than the Caribbean, both refreshing. Having been there 3 months ago everyone still remembered us and the service, from management to the cleaning staff, was just as friendly and helpful as before. They bend over backwards for you. There were a few bumps this time which were a minor inconveniences but still a nuisance since we had been there before and had made requests 2 months prior to arrival. The rooms we requested were not available the first night and we were placed in a noisy second floor room near the entertainment which was changed the next day. Octavio, at the front desk was very helpful in orchestrating that move. As for the rooms, they are always very nice and clean and I always tipped the cleaning staff daily. It didn't seem to matter as for as your care but they must say Hola to everyone that walks by a 1000 times a day. As I mentioned, our first room on the south side near the entertainment stage was loud, but the show that night was extremely loud. It is over by 11 PM. Our next room, which was 2 doors down from the room I had requested, on the north side 3rd floor was a Superior Junior Suite with a view of the Caribbean over the palm trees and courtyard. The problem there was the air-conditioning was not functioning properly so they came immediately and worked over 1 hour. It never cooled like it should have but it was comfortable just more humid than before. And the final minor problem was that 1 night we were visited by a cucharacha, roach, on the floor which being from Texas originally was no issue but my 11 year old freaked. So it is in an area which is hot and humid. Yes there is a smell which when we came home is distinctive as before. We didn't really notice it there after the first day. The restaurants from Don Manolo's buffet, Japanese, Chili's Steak House, Mexican, Brazilian and Finally Krystal's the gourmet restaurant were very good for an all inclusive. Krystals had Chilean Sea Bass which was excellent. Chili's Steakhouse is outside and , as noted before it was very good, and yes you may get a mosquito bite. Krystal's and the Japanese restaurant were my favorite. The sushi was very good and I eat sushi all the time. The salmon was excellent as was the beef tenderloin. Also, as for the Manolo's buffet at night, there is a wide variety of food which changes each night with certain specialty nights. The food is good to very good and the service is excellent. Alberto, Rosario, Jesus and the rest of the staff were superb. They made you fill like you were their most important diner. The breakfast buffet also had a wide assortment of food from custom omelets, pancakes, waffles, fresh fruit and freshly made fruit smoothies of all types. You should note that Krystal's and The Japanese restaurants require pants for the men. At lunch time Chili's, open air by the pool, has a buffet for the the entire afternoon. I think it is repetitive in a lot of things like burgers, pizza and hot dogs but there are hot items which change through the week. I would say the food is good to very good for an all inclusive. The best hidden secret is tha Manolo's, the main buffet, opens from 1 PM to 3 PM and has different food. It is always open, quiet and air-conditioned if you want to get away from the pool. Most people are not aware. The grounds are beautiful and immaculately groomed. You might see an iguana as we did and a small brown mammal that they have a name for but looks like a chocolate colored kangaroo rabbit. There are plenty of Geckos.I can't believe how hard these people work. The beach area is beautiful and of the 5 RIU's in the complex it is the best. In fact it is the best of all the resort beaches. Sand whales are there and were made to protect the beach from erosion. They are a necessity but respect them. We saw kids jumping off of them and they are slippery and can have barnacles so it is easy to get cut. Also, you must respect the Caribbean and I wouldn't venture out past the sand whales. The current can get strong and changes outside of them. We had a blast crashing some big waves and with a mask saw schools of smaller fish. It is not a reef though. The pool is huge and there are 2. The upper, infinity pool is quieter and the lower pool has water volleyball. Of course you have the swim up bar and swim up lounge tables to drink at if you are so inclined. The bar staff and pool waiters are excellent. and really have fun. Our only problem was some drunk must have dropped a glass cigar tube into the pool 1 night and a 10 year old girl and someone in our party cut there foot but management was all over that with divers to get the glass out and no further problems. Why would glass be allowed anywhere near a pool is my question. The activities staff are a lot of fun. Jimmy, Pepe, David, Joshua, Ruddy, Leo and Edna work hard to make it fun. Edna is fantastic with the younger kids and they all like kids. I think at Spring Break there was more drinking by the the guests and less participation but there was always something to do from pellet gun shooting contests, volleyball, beach soccer, horseshoes, ping pong tournaments and regular volleyball. The shows at night were good but there were several that were new from Christmas and excellent. They had a Michael Jackson impersonator from Pueblo, Mexico, who you would guarantee is Michael Jackson. His face, body, dancing and even his voice when he talked. He lip synched most of the songs but sang 3 and you could not tell the difference. It was one of the best shows I have ever seen. They also had a show with the trapeze which was very good. One night there was an ad lib show because of rain and that was the funniest of them all. All I can say is be careful if they ask for volunteers on stage at night. I went once. Also, ask yourself if you really want to win Sexy Bingo at the pool. I learned my lesson at Christmas. I also wanted to add about safety since so much is being written about Mexico today. The Riu is in Playacar which is essentially gated. There are beautiful homes on the same road as all of the resorts are on. You cannot just drive in there without a special sticker on your car. The drivers from the airport have to leave their id's their when they come in and pick them up when they leave. We walked around day and night and it never felt unsafe. Hopefully, I have helped you and please feel free to e-mail me. I think you would enjoy the resort since it isn't huge and you don't have to walk all over creation to get somewhere. Playa Del Carmen is a 20 minute walk north and it was worth visiting. We hit Senor Frogs one day and had fun. Xel Ha for snorkeling, Coba if you want to climb a Mayan ruin, the only place to do that, and scuba diving, offered right at the pool for those who would like to try it or do a resort course and go out for a reef dive. My daughter loves the RIU Palace RM and we will be back in June and for 2 weeks at Christmas again. I think it is a great place for families or adults but if you are looking for night life and partying you will have to go outside into town. You can get whatever you want there. Coco Bongo's disco if you want to be up to until 6 AM.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T even THINK of going anywhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: bellaperkins
Reviews.Content: Just returned after one week at Riu Palace Riveria Maya and didn't want to come home! We even called our travel agent to see if there was any way we could stay an extra week. From the moment we arrived and were greeted by Hector, the doorman, we were enthralled! Not a single, solitary thing went wrong during the entire week. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and I've never seen a cleaner resort. The entire staff, from housekeeping to the waiters to the bartenders, everybody was extremely pleasant and helpful. You were made to feel as if you were the only guest. Our room was spacious and spotless. The towel animals left on our bed were a nice touch. The buffett food was the best, although we tried 2 of the speciality restaurants - the Mexican and the steak house. Get a margarita from Claudia in the Sports Bar - the best ever! I truly can't believe that people can find something to complain about, but I'd like to address a few. Musty smell - you're at a tropical resort. Small room - how much time do you spend in your room when you're on vacation and just how much space do you need? Bad food - I'll never understand this one - I thought the food was excellent and gorgeously presented. Dirty beach - could be the result of the rude slobs who leave their drink glasses and dishes down there for someone else to pick up. Sand whales - they serve a purpose. Unfriendly staff - I never, not once, encountered ANY staff who did not smile and say hello when you passed them in the hall or ANY staff who did not go over-board to make you feel as if you were the only person they were waiting on. We asked for a mattress pad because our bed was too hard and they replaced the entire thing with a brand-new pillowtop mattress! In the restaurants, your dirty plate is removed almost instantaneously and your drinks are constantly refilled. We never had to wait for or ask for a thing! I loved this place and would go back in a heart-beat! In fact, we're going back to Mexico in October and wouldn't think of trying out another resort - this one has it all. My one and only complaint (and it has nothing to do with the hotel but the guests) is that it's hard to get a lounger by the pool when you've got people who get up hours before they intend to use a lounger and put a towel on it to reserve it, then go back to their rooms to get dressed and go to breakfast, confident in the fact that their lounger will be there for them when they finally get around to going to the pool - pretty rude. Although there are signs that say you aren't allowed to reserve loungers, it's done every morning. Wish the hotel would enforce this rule. 5th Avenue is a $5 cab ride away. One tip - arrive with plenty of ones for tipping - it gets you extra special service. DO NOT expect to get them after you arrive. And if you need extra money, the only ATM that we could find that dispensed American dollars is inside Senor Frog's off 5th Avenue by the ferry landing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Sparcl
Reviews.Content: OK where do I begin, I read all the reviews before I left and now I'm going to return the favor. We had a great vacation, we stayed for a week arriving on April 6th, 2009. There was not one thing during our trip that made me even a little nervous about being in Mexico considering all the stuff that has been on the news so don't worry about that. We went to 5th Ave twice, once during the day and once at night we also walked to the little shopping area up the street a bit twice and never had any problems. The hotel was clean all of the time, the room was nice and clean no issues at all. The only thing I didn't like was having to get up before the crack of dawn to get descent chairs by the pool that were in the sun. There were plenty of chairs on the beach so you will always be able to get a chair somewhere. The drinks were always available and they made them however you requested, Jose Cuervo, Jim Bean, Absolute, Bacardi, Cointreau. The beach was very nice, water was like bath water but a little ruff most days. The food at the buffets were good, we went to three of the specialty restaurants and the only one I enjoyed was the Japanese, I left the Mexican restaurant and went to the buffet and the steak restaurant was just ok, my steak was too salty so I ate bread it was too late to make the buffet before it closed @ 10pm. The food that is available 24/7 in the Sports bar was not good, cold hamburgers you warmed up in the microwave and soggy sandwhiches. I also visited the spa and had two massages which I enjoyed but thought were a little expensive but it was my birthday. I'm already planning to visit another Riu in Jamaica. We also walked around the other Riu hotels in Playacar but the Palace Riviera Maya was the best. I will be happy to answer any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: snakeman56
Reviews.Content: This was my first time, going to an all inclusive. I would recommend this to anyone. The service was awesome. So was the food, we ate at several of the Specialty Restaurants and what a wonderful experience. I know there have been other comments about the food but We had none. The buffet was great with lots of choices. If you plan on getting pesos wait till you get to Mexico, I got some at the airport and the exchange rate was better in Mexico and no service fee. Also take travelers checks, but if you go to the front desk to change them, they will only give you pesos. We took several tours and they were great, had a blast. The beach and pool were great also, with plenty of lounging chairs. We will be doing this again for sure. We spent 6 nights at the resort. The room was great and big. I was completely satisfied with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, But Not 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: CalVacLovers
Reviews.Content: Nice resort, rooms were very small especially since we paid full adult rate for our children (we were not impressed). This is the kind of place that would be best suited to a couple with no kids who enjoy the party life. Would not call it a family resort. Service was poor to average and the staff were not that friendly. We have been to the mayan riviera numerous times and decided to try this resort out because it is close to Playa Del Carmen. The lounging area on the beach was beautiful, but the beach itself was not. There are big huge bags of sand/concrete everywhere to prevent the tide from washing the beach away. If you walk down the beach some of the resorts have lost their beaches entirely. If you are looking for beautiful beaches, I would recommend staying in a resort further south (ie near Tulum or Puerto Adventuras). Pool loungers are snatched up by 8:30 in the morning and people will reserve loungers for hours before showing up to actually use them. The pool however has a beautiful view of the ocean. We felt that the value for money just was not at this resort. We have stayed at much nicer resorts for the same if not less money. Not overly impressed with the Riu chain either. Would not stay at this resort again or another Riu resort.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Resort and Service”
Reviews.Author: bfaber
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little hesitant about this resort before arriving there based on a few of the bad reviews I read. Please ignore all those!!! This place was amazing! If someone would be disappointed here, it would have to be because they are never quite satisfied. The food very tasty with a huge variety. The Japanese restaurant was fantastic. The beach was beautiful. Would have like to enjoy the waves a little more, though, without the sand barriers. Our room was great. Yes, we had two beds pushed together, but they came up and made it into one with a king size mattress pad, etc. and you could not tell it was two beds. Did the room have a musty smell? Maybe a tad, but nothing unusual for a hotel in the tropics. The room was very spacious and clean. You can definitely tell tourism is what they rely on because the service was out of this world. Drinks were great! Just bring your own larger plastic mug and they'll fill it up. Much better than the smaller cups they have. Channo at the swim up bar makes the best Tickets to Fly. You must try it! The pool area was very nice. The water was maybe a little chilly at first, but you easliy got used to it after a few minutes. The shows were just ok, but the Michael Jackson show was outstanding! Trust me, you will not go wrong by staying here!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beautiful beach, great food, great!!”
Reviews.Author: bluewater9
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews I settled on the Riu Palace Hotel for our trip to Mexico. This was my first trip to the Riviera Maya and I loved every minute of it. From the moment we got there, greeted with tropical drinks at the hotel desk. Our room was ready early and we were able to get to the beach right away. The hotel staff was amazing, so friendly and catering to all your needs. The food at all the restaurants was great, I would highly recommend getting reservations for the specialty restaurants. The breakfast buffet is great, comes with a mimosa station!! We never had to wait long for a drink at the pool bar and didn't have a problem finding lounge chairs. The sand bags in the water were not a problem, they blocked the waves and created a cove. There was always someone making sure the beach was clean. The hotel also has a cheerful entertainment staff that made our stay fun. The hotel also has free internet access in the lobby which was very convenient for communication to home, just bring your laptop! Our mini bar was always stocked with bottled drinks and our room had a liquor dispensor in it. My only complaint was that the walls of the room were thin, we could hear all the commotion going on in our hallway. I would recommend requesting a room on an upper floor with a beach view. Overall, this is the best all inclusive that I have stayed in, I would absolutely recommend the Riu Palace!

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: The_TravelerUSA101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and we really enjoyed our time there. Some reviewers criticize the Riviera Maya for not being a 5-Star resort, and it’s probably not. However, it’s a great property and the staff goes out of its way to make your vacation an amazing experience. In all honesty, the hotel and its grounds are 5-Star quality. The staff is friendly and helpful, but not efficient enough to compete with most Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties. Notwithstanding, I would still rate the staff as 4-Star + (the effort is there). The buffet food is 4-Star quality at best and the specialty restaurant food is probably 4-Star + quality. The bottom line, this is a grand resort with solid service and it’s an excellent value. The Good: The grounds are impeccably clean. Our room was kept very tidy and we appreciated the creative towel animals our maid left for us. The wait staff was always eager to provide us with cocktails and the tropical drinks were excellent. Not all liquor was top shelf, but it was good enough for us. The wine selection was creative (some off the beaten path selections from Mexico and South America). All liquor was included in the room price. We especially loved the Havana Bar with its old world style. The food was solid but not spectacular. The buffet dining options were cruise ship quality. The specialty restaurants generally had better food and more creative selections; we especially enjoyed the fusion restaurant. The Mexican restaurant and Steakhouse were very good. We heard good things about the Japanese restaurant and most people did not love the Brazilian venue. The food in the Sports Bar was basically 7 Eleven style. But, it was fine for a late night snack. Again, all food (including the specialty restaurants) was included in the room price. The hotel and its surrounding grounds were grand and well maintained. The pool was large and cleaned on a nightly basis. The resort’s beachfront was a short walk from the pool area and had plenty of room and chairs available for guests. The “Sand Whales” did not bother us at all. In fact, they helped break the waves and made swimming more fun. The wide, clean and quiet beach was a huge plus for me. The resort’s security was effective. We saw them expel at least one visitor who tried to crash from another hotel. Please note, most Spa items were not included in the room price. However, they were reasonably priced compared with other resorts we’ve stayed in. The Bad: The room did have a musty smell for the first couple of hours. However, we listened to other reviewers and raised the air conditioning which essentially eliminated the odor. Some nights were humid and that seemed to be the cause of the odor. We had a first floor room and we had a couple of unwanted pets visit us during the last few days of our stay. Again, it wasn’t a cleanliness issue, we were basically on the first floor of a tropical hotel and a couple of insects decided to pay us a visit. Next time we stay at this Riu Palace, we’ll request a room on an upper floor. It was hard to get a lounge chair at the pool. People seemed to get up pre 7:00AM to put their towels on chairs to reserve them. Sometimes, chairs would remain empty the entire day even though guests reserved them—somewhat frustrating. The first couple of days of our stay we were not able to reserve a specialty restaurant because they were completely reserved. We were able to obtain reservations for the last 4 nights of our trip and we generally liked the specialty restaurants better than the buffet dining. Many guests found the specialty restaurant reservation process to be annoying (must reserve between Noon and 3:00PM each day and you can’t make more than 3 reservations at a time). It was only a slight annoyance to us. The fitness center was weak. They need to add more cardio machines and weights. They have the room to make it much better. The Ugly: N/A The walk into the town of Playa del Carmen takes about 10 minutes. It’s a lovely and safe walk. Don’t forget to take in the Mayan ruins along the way. They are really interesting. Also, we booked 3 tours with Best Day (Rodrigo is an extremely helpful tour rep!) and we loved them all. Tulum is cool, but Chichen Itza and Coba really blew us away. The grand scale of Chichen Itza was awesome and shouldn’t be missed. Coba was discovered more recently and is still partially covered by jungle. We climbed to the top of the pyramid at Coba and it was a breathtaking experience. Don’t miss these great trips. If you take the express trips with Best Day you’ll be back at the hotel by mid afternoon so you can enjoy the resort. It’s really worth your time. If you have travel insurance with another tour company, you may want to use them for your excursions. If not, we highly recommend Best Day. The water used in the hotel restaurants and bars is safe to drink (including the ice). However, the water in the bathrooms is not filtered. Use bottled water (which is provided by the hotel) to brush your teeth. To sum up, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya succeeded at one very important thing, it provided us with a fun and relaxing vacation at an excellent value. The staff, the grand resort buildings/grounds and the awesome beachfront were huge pluses. My wife and I are likely to return to this gem of a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday - Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: live4thebeachOntario
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from our holiday at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya on April 3rd and are counting the day until we return. To begin, you must accept that you are travelling to Mexico, their first language is Spanish, so.... yes there will be some language barriers and yes the tv channels will not be in English! Please adjust yourself and your expectations and you will have an incredible visit to the Yucatan! Check in was a breeze, Luis was waiting for us with our reservation in hand and we were in our room within minutes of our arrival. The Bellboy was not too far behind with our luggage. We had a Junior Suite, it was facing another resort, however, the Riu has done some beautiful landscaping and we had some palm trees between us. and OH YA, we didn't go tor the view from our hotel room, we went for the beach and good weather! Our sheets were changed throughout the week, fresh towels were replaces as we placed soiled towels in the bathtub (there's a sign in the bathroom explaining), double sink in the bathroom, VERY clean bathroom. The maid thoroughly cleaned and mopped our room every single day, no complaints. We didn't even tip everyday, just at the end. We had great service. We did use the electronic safe without issue in the room, enjoyed the liquor dispenser and our beverages in the mini fridge were stocked promplty. The person who stocks the fridge is different from the maid, just an FYI. If something wasn't replaced just call room service! The facilities are incredible, no picutures will do it justice. I can not estimate the countles hours of scrubbing and moping the tiles happens daily. Everyone is friendly, I can only speak a couple of phraes in Spanish but it goes a long way to demostrate your friendliness and respect for people. The food was wonderful, breakfast is a top notch 5 star buffet. However, if you need a very specific breakfast to start your day then be practical and learn how to say it in Spanish just in case. I watched a frustrated traveller curlty request "fried eggs" to the omellete lady and walk away from her when she requested assistance from a colleague. He was upset and so was the omellete lady. Just google it for your comfort or try new foods. I had warm rice pudding for breakfast with cinnamon and sugar for the first time and it was amazing! Lunch at Chili's (at the beach) is also good, burgers, pizza etc, coffee maching, icecream maching, quality salad choices. You can also have lunch at the main buffet Don Manolo's Dinner at the a la cares were by far the best food, good cuts of meat, signature drinks at the door and champage on the table if requested. We fostered some good relationships with some of the servers and were treated with some nice flowers on our table throughout the week. You have to line up at 12 noon at the lobby bar and can reserve 2 a la cartes at a time. it's worth the couple minutes your spend in line. Just send one person from your group, there's always one person in a group who is willing to leave the beach for a couple of minutes! We tried them all except the Brazillian, we ate at the Japanese twice because it was so good! We always booked the 8:45 dinner slot, at first I didn't understand why there were only 2 dinner slots but after some asking we learned that there was a lot of prep involved (wait until you see the presentation of the food), if you get hungry go the the dinner buffet and grab some snacks! they even had chocolate fountain one nigh! This resort as the best beach, we went for walk one day and realised how lucky we were, most hotels have had there beach wiped out by the hurricanes and can only offer the pool to their guests, the sand whales did not bother us one bit, the water is still a gorgeous turqoise blue. There was always a cooler full of bottled water at the beach bar, we would always bring a big bottle with us from our room. We never had to walk 3 city blocks. The service here was immpeccable, can't say enough. Tipping although not expected or required was always apprciated. Staff here work 6 days a week (typical work week in Mexico) and long days. We always had a host tend to our table and ask us how are meal was and offer us a drink after eating, a really nice touch. I did hear people from time to time in the hallways but nothing that bothered me, I brought earplugs with me from reading all the reviews here but I never came close to using them. This is a fantastic hotel, definately not a party place for spring breakers (which we like to avoid), if you want fun days in the sun, quiet days by the beach and relaxing evenings with delicious food, and live entertainment every night then this is a great option. I saw 3 brides in one week and there were all dancing the in plaza with the live band on their respective wedding nights, it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING VACATION!!”
Reviews.Author: jndbrown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and 4 days at the Riu. I was not ready to come home. We didn't do any excursions and enjoyed the beach and pool area. The beach area was most amazing. The resort was not over crowded and had a relaxing enviroment. If we had stayed longer we would have done a few excursions.The buffet for breakfast and dinner were great! Breakfast everything you could possibly want you had. The chef would make fresh omlettes to order in front of you. During the day the Chilis resturaunt was a buffet and had great food. Service was great I can't complain. Our room was stocked everyday with beer, soda and water. When we got home I wanted to start planning another vacation here. This was a great vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Some very good, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: johnthebog
Reviews.Content: Very good staff but if you don't pay a premium, you will be assigned to a very unimpressive room. We had to check out at least 4 rooms before finding one that didn't overlook the roof of another building or have a very undesirable view. The manager offered a better room if we would pay $50 more per day. The manager told us "if you had booked directly through RIU, you would have gotten a better room" (we booked through CheapCaribbean.com). Staff was superb but the policies don't seem very user-friendly. If you go to the beach and want a bottled water, you can't get it at the beach bar, only in the lobby (nearly 3 city blocks away). Only one elevator goes from the ground floor to the top floor and it is at the lobby end of the complex. Count on a lot of walking and even more if you are older or handicapped and must use the elevator. I would definitely NOT RECOMMEND this resort to any handicapped person. Mixed drinks were not available in the buffet or specialty restaurants, only wine and beer. The specialty restaurants we tried (French, Japanese, and steakhouse) were EXCELLENT. Very limited room-service menu but the fruit is excellent. I would recommend this hotel to a friend but only with many caveats.

Reviews.Title: “average at best for price”
Reviews.Author: aagent
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel. Overall a 7/10. Pros: - good beach area and nice lunch/dinner buffett. Good food choices.
