Good evening entertainment, they bring in some outside Vendors which is nice. room clean and well maintained. Cons: no coffee in room, very noisey in the passage ways. The cleaning staff chatter away at the tops of their voices in the mornings and really make a noise with their cleaning carts. also very loud with doors slamming from guests leaving their rooms. The doors do nto have any door stoppers and with tile floors, it can just be very noisey in room. no ability to select movies - just basic local TV and some US channels. Lots of focus on keeping the place clean, but less focus on service. We had requested a King size bed in advance but it had not been processed. We were told on checkin it would be done. Had to ask/followup three times with the front desk to have this done. did not like the fixed evening times for meals, either 6:30 or 9:00pm. pool can be very noisey with a bit of a loud/party focus which appeared unusual for a 5star ++ resort. lots of teenagers with parents/lookes like a place of choice for march break no robes very limited room service menu as well as limited snacks in Sports Bar. Surprisingly poor english skills for wait staff. They also allow various vendors onto the property to try upsell you on various activities which can be annoying if you are trying to relax at the "private" beach. the "spa" is a bit of an embarresment - a basic sauna in the mens area - no steam room and an out door jaccuzzi. very basic, no separate pool for kids which is what we understood the brochure reflected

Reviews.Title: “Went without the kids...will go again with the kids next time!”
Reviews.Author: KKLNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel because of the great deal and also heard how beautiful Playa del carmen was. We were so pleasantly surprised when we arrived at the Riu that words cannot describe it. It's like entering a palace when first going into the lobby, the staff couldn't be friendlier (loved the drink at the check-in desk) and the rooms were lovely and quite clean. We didn't have a balcony, but did have a nice view facing the ocean. Despite the rainy and cloudy weather the first few days, the staff was very attentive and eager to please. Room service (for breakfast) was very quick (even though they didn't know what a bagel was!!), and the food at the restaurants was fairly good for an all-inclusive. The best was the Brazilian restaurant with all the meats served on skewers. The Mexican restaurant was also very nice. Surprisingly, the buffet dinner wasn't bad and had a decent selection of food that changed nightly. I personally loved their sushi night which they were rolling fresh in front of everyone. The only down side was the reservation process, which they wouldn't allow people to call from their rooms. There are designated times that you have to go to the lobby and make reservations and a lot of times, the restaurant that you want is booked up, or you have to take a later reservation time than you preferred. My husband and did that for the steak place at 8pm which we didn''t really choose, but ended up going to the buffet restaurant and grabbed sushi as an "appetizer" to hold us over til our later dinner reservation. Worked out perfectly. You have to love all-inclusive! Also loved that a short 15 minute walk takes you to Fifth Avenue to do some local shopping. That was a nice way to spend a morning. We went in January so ocean and pool were chilly, but just laying out in the sun was good enough for us. We would go again with the kids next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: jhawkrn
Reviews.Content: This was mine and my spouses first trip to Mexico and first time at an all inclusive. After many hours of researching for places to go stay we decided on the Riu due to all the great reviews from friends for their great service. I was a little skeptical but we decided to give it a try. I must say it met all of my expectations and beyond. We stayed at the height of spring break (Mar. 15-20) - and were worried about the crowds. There really turned out to be no problems with this (although people we talked to said it wasn't as busy this year). Here are my pros and cons: Pros: the staff is fabulous- always coming by poolside to see if you needed anything and constantly cleaning up, the housekeeping and garden crew were always out keeping things looking immaculate, the pool and beach area have beautiful views, I had read that the water was too cold in the pool - but while we were there it felt wonderful due to the heat (and I am extremely cold blooded). We ate at the buffet mainly which was ok (my husband loved it), we also went to the mexican resteraunt and steakhouse (I preferred the steakhouse). The room was very nice - not a great view as we were on the backside by what I think was a water plant of some sort and a little noisy if you were on the deck - but we really weren't in the rooms much. We did enjoy hanging out by the gazebo at night and listening to the bands/ singers as we sipped on martinis. The minibar in the room was nice - and they came by everyday to restock!! Cons: Our room did allow for quite a bit of noise from the hallways due to the tiled hallways - but it really wasn't a big deal. We liked the room service option but wish the menu had a bit more on it. The toilet took some figuring out to flush all the way and occ. needed extra water to get it to flush - but not a big deal. We will definitely do this again and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great week!”
Reviews.Author: lmack37
Reviews.Content: I am a self professed hotel snob and was concerned about how I would like the Riu Palace Riviera Maya as my last all inclusive experience wasn't great. This hotel was fantastic. Everything was very clean, beautiful lobby, courtyard, landscaping and pool area. The food was very good and we enjoyed all the specialty restaurants we went to (Krystal, Brazilian, Steakhouse and Mexican). The rooms were nice and were typical size. The reports of noisy hallways is exaggerated (you get that a bit in every hotel). The beach is fairly nice, but not a great spot for beach walks due to the level of erosion up and down the beach. The ocean was extremely rough and we were not able to take advantage of the inclusive water sports as the red flag was out all week. Our kids ages 6 & 9 participated in a few of the kids club activities and really enjoyed it. The shows at night were better than I expected. We did walk down to the Riu Palace Mexicio and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is definitely a step up.

Reviews.Title: “Had a terrific time”
Reviews.Author: dseesel
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya, and had a great time. (Had two older teenage daughters in tow, they thoroughly enjoyed it too.) Not ultra-luxurious but sets a high standard for accomodations, cleanliness and value. Would compare the room quality to a Hyatt or Hilton resort (not a Ritz Carlton, etc.) but there is nothing wrong with that. Unbeatable location (10 min. walk from Playa), high standards, good if not great food (very nice buffets, we enjoyed the Japanese and steak restaurants the most). Excellent beach and pool setup, very enjoyable "plaza" outside the restaurant venues for after-dinner entertainment or just enjoying a drink. Crowd was a mix of families with kids of various ages and couples (older and younger), Americans and Europeans, not a ton of spring-breakers at least during the week we visited. Our first all-inclusive and would compare the experience favorably to the sort of value you get on a nice cruise.

Reviews.Title: “7th trip to Playa del Carmen and best hotel yet!”
Reviews.Author: vallelde
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling to Playa del Carmen for the past 7 years. This year my daughter and I went on her senior trip. We paid and were booked into the Riu Playacar and when we arrived got the pleasant surprise of an upgrade to the Riu Palace Rivera Maya! They even paid for our taxi ride over. We have stayed at the Riu Yucatan, The older Riu Palace, The Iberostar Quatezel and the Bahia Principie Tulum. This was by far the best all inclusive by far. The best part probably was the 24 room service. We had breakfast in the room every morning. Very elegant public areas (all air conditioned). Staff was wonderful (check out Ilyas the bartender in the lobby bar....best martini ever). Food was good (specialty restaurants not that great), beach was beautiful and the rooms are all junior suites and huge. Lots of great people staying there and we had no problems with the "so called" troubles going on in Mexico. Walked often and at night into the city of Playa and had great fun on St. Patrick's Day at Senor Frogs. I haven't even been home a week and I miss it already.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole quite good”
Reviews.Author: nand123_99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here between 3-17 and 3-20. In general we had a good time at this hotel-- below are our pros/cons pros: very clean, good spacious rooms/bathrooms, quite good room service given its a really large hotel. Great pool, pool bar was also good, however, did not enjoy the cocktails they served there- found them to be too sweet-- however, the good part is that you can tell the bar tender how to make your drink. Good gym also and kids camp was enjoyed by our daughter. Staff is friendly and works hard to please you. cons: breakfast and lunch was not good-- lots of quantity and choices, but found the overall quality to be low-- hence we went into Playa del Carmen for our lunches. Dinner was generally a lot better especially at the reservation required restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: MES6588
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the RIU Palace Riveria Maya. It took a little while to get there from the airport but defintely worth it. The property was clean, the staff we friendly, the food and drink we excellent and plentiful. The staff went out of their way to make sure you were having a good time. We have stayed at all inclusives before, this was the best by far. The beach was big and beautiful. In past reviews people complained about he sand bags in the ocean. If they didin't have the sand bags you probably wouldn't have been able to swin. Also, the sandbags are there to perserve the beach. All in all one of the best vacations we have ever taken. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in Playacar!”
Reviews.Author: Whitewater99
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at many all-inclusives and Riu Palace Riviera Maya is the best yet. Situated within Playacar, this resort was the most beautiful of all the others surrounding it. If cleanliness and attitude of the resort staff is important to you, this is the place to stay. Surrounded by white stucco, water fountains, and large palm trees, the courtyard is so picturesque with an elegant Mexican flair. The lobby and lobby bar are incredibly elegant too. The granite floors shine as do the numerous crystal chadeliers. The rooms are very large with a large bathroom, and the beds were very comfortable. About the only thing we can complain about is that the water pressure wasn't sustained to keep the shower head running constantly, which really isn't that much of an incovenience. Every day the room fridge/bar is replenished so potable water was always available. The beach is one of the largest on this stretch of beach and the swim up bar is just a short walk. The resort staff leave you wanting for nothing. They are so attentive and more than willing to please their guests. We fell in love with their smiles! The food was absolutely fantastic at the buffets and the restaurants that require reservations. The entertainment in the open-air theater made for a wonderful evening in the courtyard every night. We will definitely be returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Trip”
Reviews.Author: beilop
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from RIU Palace Rivera Maya and had a wonderful time. The hotel is gorgeous, the food was great, the beach was beautiful and the staff was outstanding. I cannot say enough about the staff they work their tales off. We had gone on a tour to Chichen Itza and lost our camera. Since the tour was through another company we weren't sure if the hotel could help us but they did and we had the camera back the next day. The trip was excellent and I would highly recommend RIU Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Hits and Misses at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: OilmanTexas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights at the Riu. We were there from March 13 to March 19. We had 2 rooms on the second floor that faced the hotel next door. My wife and I just returned from a week at the Iberostar Grand Hotel Paraiso. It was a great hotel and I think it spoiled us. That being said there are some big positives but also some negatives at the Riu Palace RM. Service - The Riu has great service. In some ways I think it beat the Grand. The restaurant service was great at both the buffets and the specialty restaurants. The maid service was very good. Everyone we met was smiling and very positive. I always tip for service. I was disappointed to see many people not tipping (at the restaurants, at the pool bar, at the lobby bar). Come on folks! A few pesos...por favor! Food - While the Grand had some very upscale choices (lobster for lunch and dinner), I think the food at the Riu was better. We ate at the Japanese, the Mexican and Fusion specialty restaurants. Fusion was our favorite with the Japanese a close second. We ate at the buffets for breakfast, lunch and 2 dinners. There was always lots of choices. Everything was fresh and hot. The only thing that was disappointing was the limited room service menu. There were only a few choices and they are mainly focused on basic kids type food (chicken nuggets, etc.). It was nice having the option of picking up a small salad at the sports bar. The sports bar is open 24/7. It is a good place for early risers to get an morning coffee before the breakfast buffet opens. Rooms - Yes you get that musty smell on the first day. Just put the AC way down and keep the fan running 24/7 and it goes away in a few hours. Our rooms did also have a dampness that did not go away. The sheets felt wet at night. The beds were on the hard side, but we slept fine. The room furnishings were typical of a nice AI. The flat screen TV was nice but the quality of the cable service was just OK. Hotel Facilities - excellent grounds, pool was great, the beach is the largest in the area. We didn't mind the sand whales. You have the option of sitting in ths shade under the palms or out closer to the water. One of my daughters loved the hammocks. Both daughters were very disappointed with the workout room (A few old tired machines). It's time for an upgrade! We liked the open courtyard at night. There was always some music playing (either a small band or a singer or a trumpet player). Drinks were served. It was a nice place to start or end the evening. We usually went before dinner (we had the late sitting at 8:45). And speaking of a late dinner...let's talk reservations. Who came up with the idea of making customers stand in line in the middle of the day (12 - 3 pm) to sign up for dinner reservations? Come on....buy a $10 computer program and make it electronic. Allow customers to sign themselves up online or at the front desk anytime of the day. So overall it was a good vacation. We relaxed, got some sun, and ate too much. It sure beats working!

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further This Is It!”
Reviews.Author: primadonna11
Reviews.Content: I usually travel to PDC every year. I have stayed at many of the resorts in PDC and Riviera Maya. I like to try different places every year, but now that has to come to an end. I will only be staying at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from now on! I traveled with my sweetie from March 11-15th, the weather perfect, except it rained one day. I will do the best I can on the review despite the fact that we both came down with the stomach flu-(bad) starting on the first night and lasting for most of the time we were there. This had NOTHING to do with the resort, (as no one else there was sick and this virus takes about 4 days to get a hold of your system) I think I got it from work before we left-figures! AIRPORT: For first timers, when you land in Cancun, after you go through customs keep walking out of the airport. Do not talk to anyone, even though they are asking about your tour and look official. These are the time share people, and they will carry your luggage outside and wait for a tip. Keep walking until you get outside where the vans are parked. If you booked through a tour, Olympus reps will have orange shirts, Apple Vacations will have dark blue flowered shirts on, and Sunjet will be wearing turquise. Sorry if I missed anyone. They are the only ones to talk to at the airport, but they cannot go inside. The ride was smooth and quick. We were the 2nd ones dropped off, about 45 minute ride. RESORT: Drop dead beautiful. I have been to several resorts in the area, some more expensive than this, and let me tell you, this is worth every penny and more. When you enter the lobby it looks so grand and beautiful and everyone greets you with a smile. The other vacationers all got quiet when our van pulled up, and one exclaimed that their resort better be as beautiful as this one! Check in was a breeze, super fast, and all reps speak excellent English. They even provided a cold MaiTai, nice after a long flight. The check in time is supposed to be around 3:00 p.m., but they gave us our room at 11:30! No waiting at all-couldn't have asked for more. ROOM: Great, had everything we needed and excellent view. We had room 3070, on the top floor with a vaulted ceiling, strong AC and ceiling fan. For those of you complaining about the smell, you may want to stick to cruising, because there is not a resort in the area that does not have a bit of a musty smell. Hello, its the tropics with AC blasting all day and closed doors, it is unnoticable after a few minutes, please do not allow those complaints to affect your decision. Anyway, it also had a small balcony perfect for two which got great sun all day. Small fridge fully stocked with water two sizes, sodas, beer and club soda. Also the full bottles of liquor to pre-game before going out is great-although we couldn't partake! The shower did have its ups and downs, it seems at times, the water pressure couldn't hold up, so it may take you longer in there. Bed was great, my back felt better than it had all year long! Flat screen tv and 24 hour room service, closet with plenty of hangers, ironing board and iron, small hair dryer, what more could you need? (The only thing I missed was a coffee maker, but I'm sure if I asked they would have found one for us!) As for the noise complainers, can I just say, that these people are up before dawn working hard so that you have a wonderful vacation, its unfortunate that the floors are tiled and the carts make noise, but come on! Wear ear plugs if you are easily awaken, but it didn't bother us at all. BEACH: This is the show stopper! Some of the resorts in Riviera Maya have smaller beaches with choppier seaweedy water, but not in PDC! (Don't be confused by the name, this resort is right in Playcar, with the best beaches in the entire area.) If you want postcard colored calm water, soft sand, tons of space, and many water activities this is where you'll want to be. Plenty of chairs and tons of palm trees for those who want shade. There are two levels to the beach, an upper and lower, the upper is good if you get some windy days. The bar is right next to the upper beach, and the pool is behind it. The entire day there will be servers to take your order, never expecting a tip, although we did tip all servers-it was hot and they run around all day for us. The sand whales are there to be sure that the beach can last through another storm, they even look indigineous to the area (better than a bunch of sandbags) and swimmers enjoyed climbing on them. POOL: There are two, the infinity pool, which we preferred, it was quieter, and the activities pool that you could look down on from the infinity pool. Water temp was refreshing and water clean. There was a swim up bar with swim up tables, benches and loungers, and even a whirlpool. Water aerobics looked fun, there was always something going on in the main pool if you are looking for fun. There is also a small kids center with a baby pool by the clubhouse. Not many kids at this resort though, so good for those looking for a quiet, relaxing vacay. SERVICE: Second to none, the best in the entire area by far. Everyone greets you with an Hola and a smile, and will got out of their way to provide you with great service. I think this is the same for all Rius because I stayed at the Tequila several years back, and got the same great service. Every day rooms cleaned spotlessly, towel animals and flowers left, fridge stocked. (We tipped a few dollars every day because she did such an outstanding job) Every night we got turn down service with chocolates, one night they even brought us a cold platter of fresh fruit, another night some extra towels fresh from the dryer. That's the best, service even when you don't even ask for anything. Room service was also super fast and good. FOOD: Excellent. The buffets changed every day so that there was variety, tons of selection. The breakfast buffet was the best, even though I don't like breakfast, I couldn't resist. Smoothie bar, freshly squeezed juices, fruits, yogurts, eveything you could imagine. We also ate at Krystal-wonderful food with outstanding service. We got the filet and sea bass, both were excellent. I think this is another Riu thing, because they definitely have the best food out of all of the resorts I have been to in the area as well. Its a shame we couldn't enjoy more of it! 5 AVE: If you go into PDC it is a five minute cab ride or a 20 minute walk, eat at Hotel Basico or OHM, both have awesome food with great atmosphere. There is definitely night life, just not obscene like in Cancun. There is a Carlos n Charlies, Coco Bongo, Senior Frogs if you want to do the touristy bar scene, you'll have a good time. We like the smaller low key places like the parrot bar and Hotel Basico for drinks. Make sure you bargain for your purchases with the vendors, and wait to buy liquour at the airport, it is cheaper there believe it or not! EXCURSIONS: We didn't do any this year, but I would definitely recommend the horse back riding, we do this every year. You go through the jungle out to a private beach, and then can actually swim with a horse. The cowboys are entertaining and expert riders who can handle those first time riders. You get a snack and cold drinks back at the ranch before you leave. Make sure to bring $ for tips for the cowboys, you will get a locker for your belongings if you don't want them with you when you ride. Excaret was great, you can also bring change of clothes and towels because you will get a locker for the day. The underground river was cool and the whole park has something to offer everyone. Make sure you stay for the evening show, it was the best part-really worth it. The swimming with the dolphins was also the best. Great if you have never done it before, so worth the money. You should definitely book online if you are going during Easter break as they are usually sold-out for this time when you get there. Snorkeling-I didn't like it, but I am not the outdoorsy type, and not a good swimmer. The best is near Cozumel but Xel-Ha was ok too. Chichen Itza was amazing if you are really into history because you will learn so much about Mayan civilization, although they don't let you climb the pyramid anymore. This will take up an entire day, the bus ride alone was about 2 hrs and 30 minutes. I haven't done Tulum, that was on the agenda for this time, but from what I hear it is a must with history and the most beautiful beaches and cenotes in the area. OVERALL: This place has everything you could possibly want, and the best luxury for the price. You will have a great time, Mexico can always be counted on for the best weather! If you are looking for sun, sand and service, Riu Palace Riviera Maya has it all! Also, please don't be alarmed by the recent news in Mexico, this is not in PDC, only near the border of US. This worried me a bit before we left, but we did not feel unsafe in any way, plus Playacar is a gated resort community. If you have any questions about other resorts in the area, or any other questions feel free to contact me. Enjoy yourself, this is what we work so hard all year for, so have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice upscale Hotel ...You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cootsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our 40's. We loved this hotel. The grounds are very well manicured. Staff is friendly. Drinks are plentiful and service is great! Our rooms were very nice, non-ocean view and very quiet. The King size bed was very comfy not hard as others have said. Location is good as it is a short distance to the town of Playa del Carmen. Fun to go and spend the afternoon shopping. Kind of dirty though! We cabbed it for $5.00. Would recommend the $30 massage in Playa. Bargained with them to give my husband and I each a 30 min massage for $35.00 total! Dual massages in the same room. Must do! Ours was done by Oasis Massage. Food at the hotel: Make reservations early for the specialty restaurants! We waited in line at 11:45 and always got in. Reserv start at noon..... Our fav was the steakhouse (Chili's) at night for dinner. Get the steak (filet was excellent) and lobster! Next favorite was the Fusion restaurant called Krystal. Mexican Agave was good too. Buffets are always excellent choice too! Did not really enjoy the shows at night. We missed the good show Michael Jackson. Took excursion to XEL-HA. This was definitely worth it. Beautiful eco park with snorkeling, kayaking, tubing and cliff jumping. Would recommend. All day affair. Walked to neighboring Riu Hotels to check out and the RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA is the best of the bunch by far! Weather was great ..... Mar 7-11 Sunny and low 80's

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad, but won't return”
Reviews.Author: BooMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace RM March 6-13th with my partner and 12 year old daughter. We enjoyed our stay and just left the resort twice to visit Playa del Carmen. We only ate at the buffets and never made reservations at the specialty restaurants as we felt it was too much of a hassle to mess with leaving the beach area in the afternoons to make the reservations and did not want to be locked into a specific time to eat dinner. The food at the buffets was good and we always found something to eat that we enjoyed. There is always tons of fresh fruit, salads, breads and pastas for the picky eaters. We ordered room service some afternoons, although thought the menu could be expanded a bit more. Our favorite was the toasties. A couple mornings we order coffee, juice, and fruit for room delivery and it was very good. Although one time our breakfast order never made it to our room and one afternoon our order was delivered to the wrong room. We called and they had a new order up to us fairly quickly. All the wait staff is wonderful and always quick to clear plates and bring refills. We stayed in room 2124, which is actually on the 3rd floor. It faced the back of the property, but since we were in the building closest to the beach/pool we had a great view and could see the ocean from our patio. As mentioned before the doors slam loudly and the carts make a lot of noise. The only time we had issues was when the drunks came back to their rooms around 2 am. I thought with this level of resort we wouldn’t have the drunken issue, but we did. We heard loud talking, swearing in the hallways and on our last night was treated to a drunken fight between the couple across the hall. Their voices carried through the ventilation system so it was like they were standing right next to our bed arguing. Not really the hotels fault, but I think the construction could have been done a bit better. The AC was very bad in our room. There was no happy medium between being too warm or too cold. Plus it was damp all the time, so bad that the sheets at night felt wet. We have been to Mexico several times, Belize, Guatemala and Honduras and never experienced having the sheets feel this way. We didn’t think the room was too musty, but when we got home, we could certainly smell how bad it was on our clothes and suitcases. The maid service was okay. We always tipped, but never seemed to get enough towels. They did not change the sheets everyday, which was a problem for me because I hate sand on the sheets. Also, one day they did not clean our room. I called the front desk three times and finally at 9:00 pm someone came to “clean.” Our frig was not restocked everyday. Finally, we just called room service and had them bring up what we needed. All workers are very accommodating. We spent most of our time on the beach. The only issue we had is on the lower section of the beach there are no drink service down there. Again, for this level of resort they need to have wait staff down there too. The pool area was too crowded – I have no idea when people put the towels on the chairs, but it must be pretty early. This behavior makes me so mad! The worst part is, most of these reserved chairs go unused for a good portion of the day. This type of behavior needs to stop. On our last day we went to the pool at 7am and barely found 3 chairs in the sun. At 10:30 am most of the reserved chairs closets to the pool were still empty. The resort needs to start taking the towels off the chairs and not allow this to go on. I don’t mind if people hold their chairs when they are eating, but having them empty for hours at a time is ridiculous. The pool is cold and not very clean. If we went in, we went into the upper pool. The lower pool had stuff floating in it from branches to band-aids to straws and even a scummy slime in one corner. There is algae growing on some tiles and overall needs some attention. On our last day we finally saw some people cleaning the pool. If you are going to this resort to hang out around the pool, I would look else where. There are not enough chairs available in the sun and if you do find one, you are so close to your neighbor it is uncomfortable. Overall, we did have a nice vacation and I wouldn’t let a few bad things ruin our time away, but I don’t think we would go back to this resort. If you have tweens and teens, I also would not recommend as there were no kids in that age range. There is topless sun bathing on the beach, so beware if that type of thing bothers you.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful Resort an Excellent Holiday!!”
Reviews.Author: ANGELTORONTO
Reviews.Content: excellent resort the staff was awsome and very attentive to your needs they really make it the perfect holiday. The rooms are very nice and the food was good. We will definatly be back the the Rui palace

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel thieves at renova spa”
Reviews.Author: craigdwoods
Reviews.Content: We really like this hotel and would have given it 5 stars except what happened at the very end of our trip. My wife did not use her credit card at all on vacation until the end because I was concerned about idenity theft. She went to the renova spa twice the first time she paid cash and the second time she went she didn't have enough cash on her and put it on her credit card. This is the only time she used it on the trip we then got a message from our credit card company that there was a problem. Someone at a gas combination convenience store in cancun tried to use our credit card on the satruday 2 days after. The credit card company turned down the charge and contacted us. The name of the spa is the renova spa and I would never go there again. We had met someone while we are at the hotel who had left their jacket in the exercise like an hour before they went back and couldn't find it and no one at the spa exercise room had seen it. We didn't think anything about it at the time but after what happened to us someone working that spa is a thief.

Reviews.Title: “best ever holiday”
Reviews.Author: urlrybird
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the riu palace riviera maya in january,its the best hotel we have ever stayed in,a very relaxing holiday in lovely surroundings,good food ,excellent service,the only trouble is its probably spoilt us for anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort...Great time...”
Reviews.Author: picruiser
Reviews.Content: We had a great, relaxing time at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. A girls only 4 night get-away, left the guys home with kids and pets and cold weather!! We paid for bus transfers, but since there were only 4 of us and early in the morning, we were given a private van and driver. We joked around that we would like to stop for a beer along the way...and he did!! Twice!! He went into the 7-11 to make sure that we got the correct change, even!! We tipped well after that! Rooms weren't quite ready, but we changed into our summer clothes in the change rooms at the main lobby. Rooms were spacious, but we had the construction view at the next hotel, oh well. The refrigerator was well stocked and replenished daily. Beds were very hard, but fell right asleep after a full day in the sunshine. Room service ws top-notch and right on time...red roses every morning with our coffee!! Surprisingly, the buffet food was great!! We were able to reserve 2 restaurants for the 4 night stay, the Steak house and the Fusion. The steakhouse was ok...we had steak and lobster, lobster didn't have a very good taste, but I'm used to Maine lobster..Steak was great. At the Fusion restaurant, the service was great as was the atmosphere. Sea Bass was excellent! Everyone is very friendly. The pool area loungers were always reserved well before dawn. I was surprised that the pool was a little dirty. Limes from drinks, lots of palm branches, sandy bottom...this is usually taken care of in the morning, but didn't seem to get done. Drinks were plentiful and good. If they're not strong enough, just ask for more!! Th beach is the best in that area. Wide beach and plenty of room in the shade and sun. No umbrellas, bur plenty of palm trees for natural shade. We went "bar hopping" every afternoon around 4pm...took a stroll down the beach to the other RIU propeties and bellied up to the beach bars...best drinks by far at the RIU Playacar Beach bar... Our room attendant was great...for 3 days, but forgot about us on the last night, no face cloths, no clean towels, no tissues. The only thing is that he may have been busy getting rooms ready for the Friday night arrivals...and we even tipped. Took the 1/2 day excursion to Tulum. Glad I went. Lots of history. Walked to Playa del Carmen one evening. About 20 minutes. Had a good time checking out the shops and having drinks on 5th Avenue. Great sax player at the property one night. When returning to the airport after our trip, we took the standard shuttle service. Never again, as our flight didn't leave until 6:30pm and we were picked up at 2:20pm, and spent an hour visiting other hotel properties to fetch people to the airport. We will get private transfers to and from. it does make a difference. All in all, a great time..felt very safe at all times. A few little hiccups along the way, but not enough for me to not come back... Will definitely reccommend it to my friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - However watch your wallet.”
Reviews.Author: iowacaribbeangal
Reviews.Content: On the first day of arrival we put our stuff in our room and quickly retrieved our sandles to head for the beach. We also made sure all of our valuables were in the safe(we have traveled to other Riu's and knew that this is something that is recommended). The next morning we made sure the safe was locked and went down for breakfast, our group decided to go shopping for the day. Upon our return to retrieve money from the safe...it was EMPTY. I went down to the front desk and reported this...they looked at me like I was crazy. They said they would look into this and get back with me. That day and into the night....nothing from the staff. My husband and I quickly learned that three other people had money stolen from their safe as well. The thief got away with at least $6000.00. I had to go to the front desk and wait as they located the management they would take me into an office everytime and It was always the same song and dance....We dont know what we can do for you. We will have to check with our insurance company. My Husband spent an entire afternoon at the police station and I spent much of that same day in the office.. Then they were trying to tell me that I had to wait 1-3 weeks to get the money from the insurance company....Who is to say that if I left there that I would ever see it again. They were trying to buy us off by giving us a free room upgrade and free massages which were great however we now had little to no money. An employee of their decided to drill into the safes of 4 peoples rooms and that is how they got the money...We did finally get our money the night before we left however it consumed our entire vacation. Needless to say I will never stay at this hotel again.. We have stayed at the Riu Las Americas and the Riu Cancun and loved both of them ... but not this hotel the management had every opportunity to take care of this incident(especially since there were more than just us to report such an incident) and they chose not to.. The manager said "We do not handle things here like they do in the states" well im sorry customer service is customer service no matter where you go.. You can choose to handle the situation like a 5 star hotel should handle it or you can handle it like a super 8 would handle it..That is what deturmines the quality of the hotel that you are at....customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Caveat Emptor - Buyer Beware”
Reviews.Author: RichTexas
Reviews.Content: I felt it was necessary to make future customers aware of our problematic observations of this Resort. The biggest issue that was experienced during our stay was in regard to water ressure for both showers and toilets. We had a jet type tub in the room, but impossible to use due to low water pressure. We could only take showers once we saw water pressure was restored for that moment in time. There were several power outages for short periods of time, but I can live with that for a few minutes. The water pressure for the toilets was horrible. You could not have multiple use of any toilet anywhere following previous use. I had to use a large water bottle to fill our toilet tank in order to get it to flush. It took forever for tanks to refill. And in many cases in public areas the toilets got back up inside due to frequent failed uses and flushes. The doors close very hard in the hollow halls of Riu Palace. With our neighbor coming back drunk at 2pm in the morning I had to call security to get them to let her in the room after she bounded on the door for several minutes since her husband was already passed out in the room. The rest of the time they argued and yelled and used many "F" bombs. Not great if you had a family. I was disappointed that on arrival after 3pm on our first day we were not able to make a resturant reservation. Even when we did, they had to be made 2-3 nights later. The food, especially all beef was unhealthly due to heavy salt alone. When you had fish, it ran out fast and you had to stand watch over the buffet line to get the more popular items. I don't think the quality was very good and preferred my previous 4 cruise experiences over the all inclusive experience at RIU Palace. We were told that we could visit other RIU properties but they could not come to our property. However, that was not the case. I saw many people in Buffet Line and Chilis at lunch with different color bands on their arms. The show or entertainment as they called it was bad. The groups performing outside in gazebo were more entertaining. The golf resort course across the street was $190 per round. That was a high price to pay for that experience. It included all food and drinks, but didn't see the cart for this until final 9 holes. I do not think this resort is worth what we paid and was a disappointment. While they tried to send us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary, they waited until late our departure night and it was impossible to drink or eat after midnight when we were leaving the next morning. This would have been a nice gesture on our arrival day. I guess they don't depend on repeat customers and that is a shame. They should want brand loyalty during difficult financial times we are in and that means consistent value and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, But Lacked the Tranquility We Were Seeking”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRoy
Reviews.Content: Executive Summary: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a good value, especially if you book a deluxe courtyard facing room and take advantage of the top shelf liquor offered 24 hours a day. The food is diverse and tasty enough for a week’s stay, but is not 5-star quality. The staff is friendly and well intentioned, but inconsistent in delivering information or enforcing resort policy. The pool area is impressive, but the cold temperature of the water and the incessant merengue make it less than tranquil and relaxing. The beach area is beautiful and one of the highlights of the property. I imagine this resort would meet the expectations of a lot of people, but if you are looking for a more secluded and quiet stay, I would recommend looking elsewhere. My wife and I booked a weeklong "babymoon" stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya through a local travel agent in New York. Our first piece of advice is to skip the airport transport offered through these travel agent packages - they often make several stops at different hotels, delaying your arrival after a long day of travel (hire a car for your trip back to the airport as well). Like other reviewers, I was surprised at the lack of tropical feel for the property - Riu is a Spanish company and the interior is more like an old formal Spanish decor, less a traditional Mexican feel. That being said, it is fairly nice, especially the lobby bar, the rotunda, and the view through the large glass windows toward the ocean. Our first junior suite room had no view, was musty, and had several plumbing issues. We stayed in the room for one night and then requested an upgrade to a better room - after some heated exchanges with the front desk staff, we were upgraded to a deluxe ocean view room at no additional cost - a vast improvement. The manager on duty did right by us, but it should not have been so difficult for us to get the room we wanted. Although it costs $50 extra a night, I recommend reserving the deluxe courtyard facing rooms ahead of time, especially if you can get one closer to the pool and ocean. Overall we were happy with our junior suite room – the king size bed was quite comfortable, the bathroom was functional, and the sitting area with a sofa and flat screen TV gave the room just enough of a suite feel. The balcony with the view of the sunrise, the pool, the courtyard, and the ocean was by far the best feature. Like other people, we ordered room service from the limited menu and received our items very quickly – it’s nice to even order breakfast in the room and drink coffee on the balcony. The room did have a few issues: the AC was a little spotty, the room was a little musty, and the cleaning service could have been more thorough. A word of caution about the rooms – the slamming doors, the cleaning carts rolling on the tile floors, and din of the pool and nighttime plaza music make it difficult to find peace and quiet in your room. In fact, a major theme of this resort is the challenge you might have in finding tranquility and privacy. The pool area includes an infinity wading pool and the larger swimming / daiquiri bar area. Taking a swim in the infinity pool is like walking into a fountain and swimming around – it’s really refreshing. The larger pool is a bit too cold and contains too much sunscreen in it, making it less inviting. Although the wide angle photos on the Web site exaggerate the enormity of the pool, it is still pretty expansive – but most people are not in it, because it is too cold or not quite as clean as you would expect. The pool daiquiri bar, complete with pool bar stools, is fun, but the hotel insists on blasting incessant merengue throughout the afternoon, making it difficult to find peace and quiet – you can hear the music far away in your room and on the beach. The Riu “entertainment staff” are a little too microphone happy as well, trying to generate enthusiasm for water aerobics, dance lessons and the like. It seems like a majority of the people would rather sit quietly by the pool to sleep, read, or relax, but the resort seems dead-set on trying to generate a “party” when it’s really not necessary. And as others have reported, you will find obnoxious people waking up at 6:00am to “reserve” their lounge chairs by the pool, despite the signs warning against it. Blame the resort – they don’t seem to enforce any of the rules of the pool. As you walk away from the pool to the beach, you’ll find rows of mature palm trees serving as great giant umbrellas shading the plentiful lounge chairs. The “palm tree umbrellas” are unique to the Riu and make for a great alternative to the poolside – if you’re lucky, you’ll get one far enough away from the merengue and still close enough to take in the sounds of the breeze and the ocean. While most reviews for the food have been fair at best, my wife and I were actually pleasantly surprised by the quality and selection. Presentation is not necessarily their strength, but I would describe the food overall as “tasty” and sufficient. There aren’t a lot of healthy options, but just enough to get you through each meal. The breakfast at Don Manolo is probably the best meal – we got their at 7:00am each morning and enjoyed the omeletes made to order, fresh fruit, excellent bread, delicious coffee, great guacamole, and friendly and attentive service. We enjoyed sitting outside, but had to dodge the smokers each morning. For lunch, we ate at Chilis, the outdoor restaurant near the pool. Again, you won’t be blown away by the buffet presentation, but you will find a good salad bar and enough grilled fish and other healthy options to get by. Despite what others have said, I actually found the Mexican white wine and the champagne to be pretty good. I had a harder time finding a frozen specialty drink I liked as they were all too sweet, but if you are a drinker, you are really going to be impressed with the number of top shelf options available. As for the dinner options, people are right to complain about the resort’s reservation policy and 6:30 and 8:45pm seating times, but we were able to eat at all the restaurants we wanted – and if you arrive a little later than your reservation time, it won’t be a problem. Here is our take on the restaurants: Yashima Japanese: The sushi is not quite as good as you’ll find in your local supermarket. Enough said. Agave Mexican: By far the best – the fish, the chicken, and shrimp dishes were all very good – and the salad bar offered a great selection of Mexican favorites – our waiter was excellent. We ate here twice. Krystal Fusion: For some reason, they haven’t updated the décor from the former French restaurant – it’s a little more formal – and the portions, as you would expect, are “fusion small,” but tasty. We both had the sea bass – worth a try. Chilis Steakhouse: It was nice to eat outside – and the steak was good, but the raw seafood platter and the side dishes were average at best. Don Manolo: Believe it or not, given the wide array of choices for the buffet and option to sit outside, you really can’t go wrong with their main dining area. Their hard ice cream is surprisingly good! One night we did spend some time in the lobby bar – it’s a little formal, but they play great piano music, and it’s a good alternative to the music playing in the plaza. Each night they play a different type of music in the plaza – you would hope they would stick to local Mexican or Latin music, but you’ll hear your fair share of Lionel Ritchie, Kenny G, and believe it or not, Pink Floyd and other depressing and out of place genres – the resort needs to work on this. We didn’t stay up late enough to see any of the nighttime entertainment – but as I mentioned earlier, you’ll be sure to hear it in your room at night! One of the nice things about the Riu resorts is that you can use the facilities at the other 5 locations which are all within walking distance. We spent an entire day at the Riu Palace Mexico and found the beach area to be more expansive and secluded and the pool area to be more laid back and quieter. We also utilized the Renova spa facilities and had lunch at “El Patio” which was not quite as good as Chilis. Our overall sense was that the Palace Mexico had a slightly older and more relaxed atmosphere, which was closer to what we were looking for. We did take a walk through all the other Riu resorts and came to the conclusion that the Riviera Maya and the Palace Mexico were by far the nicest. We also decided to take a tour of the nearby Royal Hideaway resort that is part of the Leading Hotels of the World conglomerate. You can immediately tell this place is 5 star in terms of it’s décor, layout, amenities, and services. A friend of ours had recommended the resort and if you’re willing to spend an extra $2,000 for this level of service and tranquility, it is probably well worth it. Overall, for the money, the Riu is a good value and met our expectations of getting some relaxation for the week. But we found the incessant music and the novelty t-shirt and tattoo totting crowd took away from our experience just enough to make it a place we would not recommend to a friend. If you decide to stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, here are out best bets: 1. Get a deluxe room facing the courtyard on the upper 200 level toward the pool and ocean 2. Get up early and take a walk on the beach before 7:00am 3. Despite the windy and rough conditions of the water, take a swim in the ocean – the water is a lot warmer than you’ll find in the pool 4. But if you do take a swim in the pool, try the fountain-like infinity pool 5. Take advantage of the underutilized Renova spa, including the heated Jacuzzi, the great shower facilities, and the massage on the beach 6. Take a 15 minute walk up the road to the Aviario Xaman Ha bird sanctuary where you’ll see parrots, flamingos, and toucans, among many other beautiful birds 7. Spend a day at the Riu Palace Mexico where you’ll find more tranquility, hammocks, and an additional Renova spa 8. Eat as much papaya, mango, and passion fruit as you can – it’s delicious! 9. Try the hard ice cream, especially the chocolate and strawberry – it’s surprisingly good 10. After each restaurant meal, take a walk back into the Don Manolo restaurant in case you want/need something more to eat

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever! would defo reccommend it”
Reviews.Author: Justmarriedlovedit
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 3 fantastic weeks honeymoon. This was by far the best hotel we have stayed in! We were upgraded to the suite which had a hot tub in the room and on the balcony. The room was huge! all the staff were very friendly and could not do enough for you. The food was great offering such variety to cater for all tastes. But don't expect much from the wine. Champers was a plenty though to make up for it. We could not believe there was free room service, yes the menu is limited but its free! there was also a supply of sandwiches, hot dogs, burgers, fruit and cake available in the 24/7 sports bar if you get peckish. The nightly shows were really good and there was quite a bit to do during the daytime. Please be aware though that the beach over the last year has been erroded away and to prevent this from happening further there have been large sand bags added to the beach. If anything this hotel's beach has been least effected, there is more than enough beach to keep, well me please. Some hotels have not been that lucky and there is vvery very little beach left. The other Riu Palace hotel's beach is not badly effected either. We loved every minute and was devestated to have to leave. I would definately reccommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, definitely met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: amkl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya for a week in December 2008. All we wanted was a relaxing vacation in a nice hotel with a nice pool area and by the beach. We also made sure to choose a hotel that had good restaurant reviews as we weren't willing to each bad buffet food for 7 days in a row. I surfed the web extensively before choosing this hotel and we were very happy with our choice! The hotel is well kept and even if the standard room that we stayed in was not luxurious, it didn't disappoint either. Having a balcony was great and the bathroom was relatively big and nice. We were also happy with the pool area and free cayaks and catamarans that were always available. We played tennis as well and the court was free most of the times when we wanted to play. We really liked the buffet restaurant! Believe it or not but it was actually better than the a la carte restaurants the hotel has (and we are not usually buffet eaters). I wouldn't recommed the Mexican restaurant at the hotel (I didn't like what I ordered but can't even remember what it was) but then again the Japanese restaurant was good. Still the best of all I think was the lunch buffet which is served by the ocean. Lovely location! And even after 7 days I wasn't fed up with the options as there were plenty of different courses and they rotated them daily. By the way, if you are a wine drinker (and know your wine), don't bother with the free wines they offer in the resort restaurants. The wines are not really good, and neither is the champagne (sparkling fine for you Europeans, definitely not from Champagne...). But hey, drinks were good, and you can always drink beer! My husband and I stayed at the hotel our whole vacation :) except for one day when we took a tour offered by one of the tour operators in the hotel lobby. The tour took us to see Chichen Itza and coming back stopped in a colonial town etc. It was good to get out of the resort for a day, and I'm happy that we took the tour, but I would still stay that the best part of our vacation was to relax by the pool or at the beach! The service was really good, too!

Reviews.Title: “First Time at RIU Palace compared to 5 times at RIU Playacar”
Reviews.Author: caseymarie
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 7 night trip to RIU Palace Riviera Maya. We have stayed at RIU Playacar 5 times, once to RIU Negril in Jamaica and wanted to try the Palace. I will give the good, and the bad and compare. Love the location, only 5 dollar cab to town. Walking distance to other riu properties. The beach at the palace maya was wonderful, not difficult to find a chair. The rooms at the palace were a little better, had a tub but only showered anyway so that didnt make much of a difference. They had a sofa and small sitting area that the playacar did not have, but that didnt matter much either. The one difference I noticed was the mattress was better at the palace, and the safe was electonic so we didnt have to carry a key around. I heard not all the mattresses had been updated though, and not everyone had a safe like that either. The booze was top shelf at the palace. The service was good, ran out of beer and they came right away with an 8 pack of dos equis on ice. That was nice. The lobby was on a much grander scale. The place did seem a little stuffy to me, but then the playacar could be a little too on the rowdy side, do oh well. They do have more restaurants but we did not eat at them even one time. The gourmet had stuff like pumpkin soup and beef with coconut foam. Did not sound too appetizing to my hubby who is a steak and potato kind of guy. The pool at the palace was so much larger than the one at the playacar, but for all of you arrogant sses who ignore the rules and lay towels on every chair by the pool and leave them there for hours I would really like to tell you what I think of how rude you are. The rules are posted not to do that, but not enforced. So unless you plan to be an arrogant ss and get there early to put towels on the chairs and then leave them there for hours, dont plan to sit near the pool. I really didnt want to sit near those types of people anyway and much preferred the beautiful ocean view so I had no problem. After too much sun, you can find a chair somewhere near the pool to relax. The food was surprisingly not as good in the buffet as it was at RIu playacar, I also found that the staff was more outgoing and friendly at the playacar, but maybe I just have been there enough to get to know them better. We did no excursions this time, just went to town and had a couple drinks at a bar that was fun. Most time spent just soaking up the sun and getting away from the cold here in Illinois. Here is the gross part. On the night before leaving I got up at 2 am and saw a cockroach on the bathroom wall. Then something hurridly scurried under the bed, looked like a centipede, but not sure it was so fast. I think the staff at the front desk was very nice and accomodating. I would stay again, but think I am ready to try a new place. The riu playacar seems to be going downhill a bit, my air conditioner did not work right and never was fixed when I was there in August, and the Palace did not really impress me as much as I thought it would. Maybe I am just tired tonight and crabby, it really is nice, and the beach and weather couldnt have been better. I am just ready to try something new next time. If you ae considering it you will love it I am sure. Take a lot of small bills and make sure to tip. The workers all deserve it and I dont see many who do tip. If you have any questions, dont hesitate to contact me and I will be happy to help. We have been on several excursions, and have gone on the ferry to Cozumel several times. I will be glad to help with more details if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and easy to plan. Not the best, not the worst.”
Reviews.Author: cbeggs81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya with my husband's family. The trip from the airport takes about 1 hour and there is really not much to see along the way, but overall it is not a bad ride. The hotel has a beautiful lobby, very clean and well kept, just not very tropical or something you would expect to find at a beach resort. My mother/father in law had purchased an upgraded suite which after spending 30 minutes trying to check in, the staff finally let them know they were overbooked and one would not be available for 3 days. So they stayed in the jr suite for 3 nights, then after persistent inquiries to the front desk, the staff moved them to a grande master suite for the last 3 nights. The hotel would not provide them a refund for the error, so that was frustrating having to move part of the way into the trip. Also, the 30-45 minute check in process upon arrival was exhausting after travelling all day. My biggest complaint is that you absolutely cannot sleep in there as the hallways are tile floors and each morning about 7:30am the housekeeping service sounded like they were running carts up and down the hallway. Plus the very large wooden doors to the room SLAM as you shut them so it is a combination of cleaning carts and slamming doors. My husband and I recommend brining ear plugs as they helped us get some rest. We ate at 5 restaurants on site and ate in Playa one night. The reservation process is a bit of a pain. You can only go make reservations between 12-3 for up to 2 restaurants at a time and usually there is a long line of people trying to make reservations for the restaurants on site since there is not a sharing program with the other Riu resorts which are within walking distance. The food at the restaurants was pretty good, about what you would expect to find on a cruise ship. The reservations are only available for either 6:30pm or 8:30pm, so you either eat early or late. We did try the room service as well. It comes very quick, but it was a big joke with our family what you would end up getting when you ordered room service. What I mean is that for a menu with only about 6-8 options on it total, it is amazing that when you order a veggie sandwich for example, they always bring you the club sandwich or when you order the cheesecake, same thing, club sandwich. Since there is a bit of a language barrier with the person receiving the orders, it would be good to just number the options so you know what you are getting. Also, providing room service is a bit misleading since there are so few things to choose from. The property is very long and narrow, more like a rectangle, so the beach front is at the front of the property and almost all of the rooms face the interior courtyard. I would not spend the money to get an upgraded suite as we have seen the jr suite all the way up to the grande master suite and really all you are paying for is a bigger room literally. It is not like at other all inclusive resorts where you would get butler service or preferred dinner reservations or some other upgrade for having a better room level (or a better room service menu for that matter). The hotel was immaculately clean. The grounds were very well kept and the beach had plenty of shade and places to lay in the sun. The staff was friendly overall and they did offer a full selection of drinks in the bar. The best drinks we found were the starter drinks at the restaurants (margaritas at the Mexican restaurant, Sangria at the steak place for example). I love champagne but theirs was not good at all, so I stuck to the mixed drinks. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the value. It is an easy vacation to plan, we enjoyed lounging on the beach and taking an excursion to the X-Carat and Mayan ruins. It is basically like a cruise on land. We have been to Sandals in the past and I think the experience there was better (room service, rooms were quieter, more pools, sharing restaurants with the other Sandals on the island) but Riu Palace Riviera Maya was not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bostongirl34
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Riu Palace and had a terrible experience. I have traveled extensively and can appreciate a nice hotel. Don't be fooled by the website and description of this hotel. By no means was it "luxurious". At the most, it should be rated a three star. From the moment we walked into the hotel, we were greeted by the smell of sewage (which followed us througout the hotel). We were told that a pipe had burst. The decor in the hotel was dark and depressing. It didn't have any sort of tropical feeling. The rooms were below average with uncomfortable beds and plastic chairs on the balcony. We actually tried three different rooms to get away from the noise of an outside airconditioning unit. The pool and beach areas were pretty nice, however, the water outside the hotel is very rough, so you can only swim in certain areas. The food was mediocre with the same options at the buffet every day. Even though the hotel has 5 restuarants, they only offered two seating options in the evening. You have to make reservations in advance so it lacked flexibility. We were so disappointed in the hotel that we checked out after two days and moved to the Fairmont Myakoba. Although this hotel wasn't all inclusive, it was beautiful and amazing! We spent about an additonal $500 for the week, but it was well worth it. If you get limited vacation time like I do, don't waste a valuable week off at the RIU!

Reviews.Title: “Great First Time All Inclusive Experience”
Reviews.Author: bosox1010
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was a great all inclusive first experience. I have nothing to compare it to, but I am probably now very spoiled. I went with a wedding group and the service was impeccable. Although we didn't have much luck with the a la carte restaurants, but the buffet (Don Manolo) was unbelievable and constantly changing for variety.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous All Inclusive Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Herman001
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our early 30's and just returned from a 2 week holiday in the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. It was the first time we had been to an all inclusive hotel and also first time to Mexico. First of all, the weather was great. We arrived on a cloudy day, had one other day of cloud (still 80oF though) and rain on 2 occasions (which didnt last 20 minutes and the sun came out afterwards), but the rest of the time it was hot and sunny. The evenings were warm and balmy as well. (Ladies just remember to take anti frizz hair products - the humidity really takes it toll at night on the barnet and you cant get much there) The beach is lovely, and the sand bags in the sea didnt effect the view in my opinion. At the end of the day, they need to be there or eventually there would be no beach at all!. Sand was white and clean. It was very windy down on the beach and the sea was quite choppy most of the time and with it, full of bits of seaweed, but fun if you like big waves. The pool area was very busy and we found most of the best spots for sun beds were taken very early in the morning. But if you like shade, there is no problem for a bed. The pool bar was very busy in the afternoon and quite noisy but not excessively so. The rooms were large and air conditioned and very comfortable. We didnt have the best view, but was quiet and we didnt spend alot of time in there anyway. If you ask though, reception will change your room where possible. Very clean and mini bar stocked nearly every day. You need to keep your air conditioning on 24 hours though otherwise the room becomes damp and begins to smell musty. The all inclusive deal was great! It was 24 hour and all food and drink was free. That included all local and imported brands. Baileys, Courvoisier Cognac, Gordons, Jim Beam, Absolut, Finlandia, etc etc etc. And of course several types of tequila. The only thing we didnt see was imported lager. And the shots are as big or as small as you like. There is a cocktail menu but if you have want something that isnt on there, they will make it no problem. For bar staff, they were all great but Pedro in the show bar was brill (try his crazy frog shot), as was Chano in the Lobby Bar and the very patient and kind Javier in the 24 hour sports bar who did the night shift. They will also make you something up if you cant decide. Although, as on any holiday all buffet food begins to taste the same, the food in the main restaurant was great. You can eat very well 24 hours! It was the best buffet i have have had ,although found the lunches better than the dinners. We did try one of the speciality restaurants but being a veggie we didnt try the steak house, or the japanese as it was fish based (but heard good reviews from other residents) Again staff in the restuarant were very good. I didnt really think the Maitre'd's did a fat lot apart from showing you a chair (and they didnt even do that towards the end of the holiday), but all the waiters were great. The majority of the holiday we had Russel as our waiter in the evenings and our glasses were never dry. The champagne i thought was very good. Evening entertainment was hit and miss. All entertainment finishes approx 11pm as there are rooms above the main stage. After that you have to go into Playa about 15 min walk away (albiet the clubs are very expensive - US$20 a shot in Coco Bongo apparently) or the Riu Tequila up the road if you want music, and dancing. Day entertainment is there if you want it but they dont push you. Again, the entertainment team worked very hard and were very pleasant. The British are minority as the majority are American and Canadian. Didnt see any loutish drunken behaviour and everybody we spoke to were very pleasant, chatty and just having a good time. Many seem regulars which is always a good sign. Tipping isnt compulsory but we did. Not sure if did make any difference to our service but it was the best we have had on any holiday. Also and very importantly we felt very safe. Walking around Playacar is safe and so are the main streets of Playa del Carmen. Did go on ferry to Cozumel which was a good day out as was the trip to Coba. Xcaret was ok but i didnt feel it was value for money. I heard good reviews about Xel Ha though. We do feel that we have been spoilt now at this hotel and wary about trying out other all inclusives in the future. But i do hear they have very good Rius in Jamaica, Cuba etc.....

Reviews.Title: “Started out rough but ended nicely....”
Reviews.Author: tarazan33
Reviews.Content: We take a trip to an all inclusive resort in Feb. every year. I got married at the Riu Cancun in 2005 but we have not been back to a Riu resort since. Not because we didn't have a great experience but we like to try new places. We arrived late Friday nigh at the RPRMt and recieve rooms that our group was not together or even on the same floor, our rooms were facing another resort and they put us in heavily smoked in rooms. I cleary stated to the public relations clerk previous to arrival that under NO circumstances can we have a smoking room because my husband is really allergic. When we went back to the front desk we were told they were booked, nothing they could do, come back in the AM and change my rooms.... Needless to say, my husband pretty much slept on the balcony, two minutes into the room and his head was clogged. We went back in the AM and they changed our rooms and this time we were right next door to one another and had non-smoking rooms:) The rooms are adequate but nothing special but how long are you in your room? Okay here is the good.... The beach was beautiful, I didn't mind the sand bags as others have criticized. It actually created little lagoons to wade in. Plenty of chairs at the beach but get one early by the pool. The pool was a great temp not too cool and refreshing. The food was great. The buffet Don Manolos was awesome, tons of selection, lines were none existent. Lunch by the beach at Chilis was nice as well. Chilis is also the steakhouse at night and that was really good too. The Japanese was great but DO NOT WASTE your time at the Brazilian.... YUCK. We left and went to the buffet afterwards. The bars were efficient and Marvin at the pool is Awesome. By the end of my stay, he had my drink ready for me before I even got to the bar. There is service by the pool which was good as well. By the restaurants, you can sit out at night and there is a band playing in the gazebo,the nightly shows were mediocre at best but entertaining. The location is good, about 5 minute cab ride to 5th ave. and 20 minutes if you walk. Overall, the experience was great.. The service was probably the best at out any resort I have been to. Even though we had a rough start it ended up being a great experience. I would return and recommend it. If you have any questions, email me... I can fill you in.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WanderlustCochrane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Riu resort from Jan 28 - Feb 11 and enjoyed ourselves, however, we would likely not return to this resort considering the overwhelming choices of all inclusive resorts in this area. FOOD - Very good with always an excellent variety. We only ate at 2 of the a la carte restaurants as it was very difficult to make it to the hotel lobby between noon and 3. The Brazilian restaurant was not very good. Chili's was better but nothing could beat the overall choices and accessiblity of the main buffet. POOL - Swim up bar was nice feature. The pool was quite cool and not very large considering other resorts we have stayed at. Plenty of loungers, but to get a spot in the sun did require "saving" a seat. ROOMS - Clean and well kept. We were in two rooms, the first on the main floor and then the 2nd. We did find cockroaches in our main floor room every day. Friends we were travelling with, who remained on the main floor during the entire 2 weeks, had roaches in their suitcases, in their books, clothes, hats etc. They were in room 0040. We moved to 2049 and had an excellent view of the pool and ocean - and no bugs! The rooms are a decent size. But the bathrooms could use a little reworking. The toilet sits right behind the door. The shower/tub is almost too high to step into, likely a challenge to folks of shorter stature. No in room internet - that is a deal breaker for us when we travel. We will not book any resort in the future without in room internet access. OCEAN - The beach has been severly eroaded by past hurricanes, but this beach appears to have survived in the best shape. The sand whales do seem to be doing the their job, but create hazards on their own. Out of the 2 weeks, only one day was yellow flag. On nearly every red flag day, the lifeguards had to rescue people who had ventured too far past the whales and were endangered of drowning. The resort is in easy walking distance to Playa del Carmen for great shopping and eating. Be sure to watch the sidewalks as they are very uneven and present tripping hazards. We went to Cozumel - warning to those prone to seasickness - take your Dramamine or Gravol. The ferry bounces and rolls for the entire trip. I nicknamed it the "vomit comet" considering that 1 of 5 passengers spent the trip with their heads in the bags provided by the ferry staff. Trip back was no better. If you are inclined, there is an awesome caving adventure that is quite new. Rio Secreto - it's 10 mins by taxi from the resort. What an incredible trip - it's an entirely underground river system that you walk, swim, crawl, scoot and crouch to get through. You are outfitted with wetsuits, life vests, helmets and lights - and you need them all. The cave surfaces are incredibly sharp. There are no lights or overhead openings, so if your headlamp isn't working, get it replaced. This is an adventure for those of decent physical fitness and not appropriate for those with claustrophobia. To exit the caves, you will be walking on your hands, floating your legs and bumping your head. But what an experience. The resort does not compare to Majestic Colonel in Punta Cana, facilities, room or beach. However, food, service and access to town certainly would set this resort aside from other 4 star rated resorts. Not a 5 star, I'd give it 4.2 because of beach (not their fault). But when you are travelling great distance to park on lounger, all resorts in this area would be disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Sun, a pristine beach, great food and a whole lot of pampering...the RIU has it all!”
Reviews.Author: L_N_M
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week of bliss! Before the trip, we read the reviews and felt ready for OK food and great service, but instead we got so much more. The place is far more beautiful & impressive than the pictures online and the food was delicious! We arrived quite late on Valentine's Day. It was after eight yet the front desk help were all smiles and handed us a much needed cold drink! We were quickly checked in. We got such a good price on this trip that we weren't expecting much with the room. The rooms are large with a living area and bed area. The bathrooms are huge. Our room faced a well groomed garden area. It was peaceful. We spent many an evening and morning relaxing on our deck. An ocean view would have cost so much more and we were happy with our quiet room. We enjoyed the pool and the beach. We never had trouble finding chairs. The entertainment crew kept everyone busy with activites. We also ate at each of the specialty restaurants except the brazilian. Each one has a theme. Chili's is a steak place on the beach. Norman at Chili's kept us laughing. My lobster was very flavorful. Don't expect a US steak, Mexican steak is not the same. The Japanese was a big surprise. All of the food tasted very well, except for the soy sauce. My favorite was the new Krystal fusion place. It was a true dining experience. Each course was a presentation. My sea bass was tasty and fresh! We also spent time in the sport bar playing pool and such. There are five other RIU properties within the Playacar area. You can walk to each and eat or hang out, but the prettiest is this one. We worked out one morning in the gym. There were two treadmills and a couple of bikes (not a whole lot!) so we ran in the mornings around the loop of Playacar. Also, Playa Del Carmen was a five minute walk from the hotel. We went one night into town for shopping and dinner. Another day we took the ferry over to Cozmel and spent the day on the beach snorkeling and eating, yum. The water was lovely. We also rented a car and drove to the ruins of Chichen Itza. It is easily a three hour drive there and a three hour drive back. The rental "guy" told us it was only one road to get there, not true! We had a tiny map to go by and after a few turns and round abouts, we arrived at the ruins. The ruins are amazing and very interesting to see up close. They no longer allow you to climb up the ruins, however they are very interesting to see. Yet, I loved the ride along the way because you see so much of the real Mexico. If you are brave, do it but get a detailed map! On the way back to our hotel from the ruins we took a ride futher south by Tulum (another ruin you shouldn't miss)! There is a quirky restaruant called Zamas right on the beach that you have to see at sunset! You sit under a thatched roof and watch the waves crash nearby. They have music there, as well. But the most incredible sight is when you walk back to your car from the restaurant. Look up at the sky and you will see billions of stars. Wonderful! As you can see, the trip was fabulous and I can't say enough about the RIU. You would have to work hard to have a bad time (as many people do!).

Reviews.Title: “A Place To Remember”
Reviews.Author: jlhkm5
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent five days at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The place is spectacular. From cleanliness, to service to outstanding cuisine, it's virtually impossible to find a bad thing to say about this resort. And this comes from a very nitpicky traveler. If you're looking for a relaxing, luxurious resort, then this is for you. It's not too crazy and not too laid back, The entertainment at the pool is perfect without being obnoxious. I found it to be just right. We brought our 8 and 6 year olds, and they always found something to do. The resort isn't crowded with too many kids, and I did'nt mind that at all. The service is wonderful, especially at the bars. The one thing that stood out for me was the food. I've traveled in Mexico numerously and always found the food to be medeocre, The food at the Riu Palace was superb. If you're not into buffets, you are going to love theirs. From fresh fruit smoothies, made to order as you watch, to beautiful presentations, you will be overwhelmed with choices, one more delicious than the next.
