The specialty restaurants were just as delicious, especially the French Restaurant. I think the Riu Palace has gotten just right. We were in a group of nine, and none of us wanted to leave at the end of our stay. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort, great food, freezing pool”
Reviews.Author: 7asprinter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace from Jan 18-23, we were suppose to stay at the Yucatan, but they upgraded us to the Palace...... 24 hr roomservice (the menu is limited) but it was good Food excellent everywhere, we have been every year for 6 years to Mexico and The Dominica Republic and the food was the best here of anywhere...... The weather was perfect and so was the resort....... I have no complaints at all~~~ please feel free to email me if you have any questions........ One thing I want to add about the shopping in general in downtown Playa is if you go shopping there, they will automatically take you to 5th ave, if you notice on the way there, there is a couple shops on the street right before they drop you off, go back and shop there first, We found things much cheaper there, they said it was because they don't have to pay a fee for being a "downtown shop" they have 2 shirts that were 4 for $10 , the same shirts were $17.99 downtown.... There is also a store called Jelly something and they sell Gourds that are made into lights, they are so much cheaper here then downtown I got 4 of them for around $60.00 usd and they wanted that much for 2 downtown, HOWEVER CAUTION, if you buy from here ~please watch them when they pack your gourds because 2 of mine were hanging light gourds and they sent the electric cords with them that were unfinished... so please use caution there..... The only negative I have is that the pool water was freezing (the only people that were in there besides my daughter had wetsuits on)!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place overall was very nice but the smell of the musty rooms awful !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbmass
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought that the Rui Palace was a 10 until it came to the rooms,The musty smell that was in our first room was absolutely horrible. The location could not have been nicer but we couldn't stay in that room and had to move with a little bit of trouble. The second room was a little better but the minute we put the air condition on we would get the musty smell. We had to just use the ceiling fan at all times which was hard to cool the room down after we took our showers for the day. We went so far as showering at the spa so we wouldn't heat up our room. I think they have a problem with the air ducts or maybe they need to be cleaned well. I would expect thta from a basement but notin a fairly new resort. I don't think I would stay at a Rui resort .

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Riu!”
Reviews.Author: caribbeantraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here February 6 - 13, 2009. Flying for the second time with JetBlue which is great, compared to the Canadian Charters which are pathetic.The previous three reviews hit it right on, it's exactly how we found it. The one thing we have found with the Riu's is their unbelievable service. It does not matter how full the resort is their service is always great and the staff are among the friendliest I have ever encountered. We checked out all of the other Riu's in the area and they were all very nice, the food and service at them was also great although more crowded than the Palace. We had a great time and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “What a week!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyharry
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have done many cruises (Royal Caribbean, Carnival, Norwegian, Celebrity) and she wanted to try an A I. We stopped in Playa for a cruise and wanted to come back so we did. We decided on Rui Palace Riviera Maya because of the reviews here on Trip Adviser. Our review will compare past experiences with our cruises. Overall we felt it was much more relaxing than a cruise in that you were not rushing off and on the ship during port days. It was a much more inimate feel as nothing ever felt crowded. Except the daily early morning chair hogging/saving, which I admit we also took part in. Chair hoarding was much worst on a cruise ship. The most sought after chairs were at the pool and the over flow was the beach. Not a bad situation at all. The food IMO was much better here than any cruise I have been on. The Specialty restaurants we tryed were, Brazilian, Japenese, and the Steak House. I would compare these to a specialty restaurant on a cruise which you had to pay extra for. The major difference I saw was the fact dinner at these restaurants were only an hour compared to two hours on a cruise. We had no problem at all with that. The entertainment crew was great. We got to know several of them and always had a great time, dancing, horeshoes, darts, kyak racing in the pool(yes the pool is enormous) and just talking to them. We did tip and as stated in previous reviews they were recieved with sincere thankfullness. The main reason we chose Playa was for the location. We walked into town at least once a day. We loved the freshly squeezed orange juice and home made tacos from the food carts. Our one day trip other than walk to town was a trip to Akumel. We hired a driver for $100 US and had a great day snorkeling and visiting the lagoon (I forget the name of it). This was some of the best snorkeling I have seen. We saw large sea turtles, sting rays, barracuda and tons of fish. Just a warning to all. Be travel smart and watch you belongings at all times. While eating at a sports bar in town our friend had her wallet stolen. This put a damper on our night but not our trip. I am sure there could be thieves anywhere but we felt much safer in the resort. We will still be cruising but not as much.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace Riviera Maya: an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: highnoonPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 10 days at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya and like many of you we spent a good deal of time researching various hotels in Playa del Carmen prior to making a decision as to where to stay. I don't believe you'll be disappointed should you choose the RIU Palace Riviera Maya as your destination. Is it for everyone? Perhaps not. If you are a young single looking for a go-go atmosphere and frenetic activity this hotel may not be your first choice. However, for those looking for a quality resort property in a wonderful location with above average "all inclusive" food and drink this hotel may be a truly excellent selection. The property is very pleasing both visually and in its service levels. For those unfamiliar with the Playa del Carmen area the hotel itself is located in a gated community just south of the town. This community, known as Playacar has numerous hotels, condominiums, commercial and shopping areas contained within its borders. Security in Playacar seems to be very good. The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is located about a mile and a half south of the town of Playa del Carmen. Walking into town does not present any particular challenges as the land is flat and there are sidewalks. Should you choose to walk there are a number of Mayan archeological sites to be found along the route. If you're inclined to take a cab from the hotel to town it will cost 50 Pesos or $ 5.00 USD each way. Paying in Pesos will save you a little bit of money due to the Peso/Dollar exchange rate. The town of Playa del Carmen is certainly worth going into. The main pedestrian walkway of 5th Avenue has many shops, restaurants and boutique hotels. In the evening many of the restaurants have mariachi bands playing which may be enjoyed by those passing by. Prices at the shops in Playa del Carmen tend to be less than similar stores in Playacar. There are also several mega stores in town including a WalMart. The junior suites at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya represent well above average accomodations. Designed in a split level fashion the bedroom and bathroom are at the entry level and the sitting room and balcony are several steps below. I would estimate that the junior suite has in total about 480 square feet of room not including the balcony. Balconies vary in size depending on room location and building design. There is a good size clothes closet in the bedroom area and a large chest of drawers in the sitting area. There are also end tables with drawers on both sides of the bed for additional storage. One quirk in the junior suites, albeit minor, is that the television is located on the chest of drawers in the sitting area. The television does not swivel toward the sleeping area so if you're used to watching it from bed it presents a viewing angle problem. Bathrooms in the junior suites are large and contain double sinks and a Jacuzzi tub with european style shower. One caveat in the bathroom. Because the tub is very deep there is a rather high rise to step over in order to get into and out of same. There are assist bars in several places to aid entry and exit. Food and service is always important when staying at an "all inclusive" resort. Both are superior at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. There are a wide range of restaurants at the hotel with reservations required at the "specialty" restaurants. These reservations may be made with relative ease but a little effort is required. The reservation desk is located in an area adjacent to the lobby bar and requires that someone go there between noon and 2 PM (approximately) to make specialty restaurant reservations for the next several evenings if desired. Specialty restaurant choices include a steak house, Japanese, Mexican, Brazilian and fusion venues. We ate at all but the Brazilian and found each to be excellent in quality of the food, service and ambiance. There is also a buffet restaurant which does not require reservations. It serves breakfast, lunch and dinner and is quite good insofar as food selection and variety are concerned. This restaurant has both indoor and outdoor seating with the outdoor area overlooking the hotel's main plaza and fountains. Lunch is also served in a large structure near the pools. Here too the selection is good with both hot and cold choices available. This building serves as the steakhouse in the evening. To summarize this review if you're looking for a well designed, well run resort with above average amenities, food and service the RIU Palace Riviera Maya warrants your attention.

Reviews.Title: “If You Can't be Happy Here, Consider Staying Home”
Reviews.Author: rjnewengland
Reviews.Content: As the title indicates, someone who complains about the Riu Palace Riviera Maya should donate their trip money to their favorite charity and stay home. This place is really beautiful in many ways and someone would have to look hard to fault-find. Check in Easy, friendly, quick. From the curb outside our bags were handled courteously with a welcome and a smile. The front desk had a fruit drink for us and our bags were quickly brought to our room. Room Clean, spacious, modern. The beds were very comfortable and roomy. We needed a third bed and a twin roll-a-way was immediately brought to us with a smile. Our view from the balcony faced the courtyard and we could see the ocean, pools and most of the rest of the hotel. Our toiletries were restocked and everything replenished every day. Beach and Pool Clean and manicured daily. Every night the workers mopped tile, raked the beach, straightened chairs, and completely prepared the areas for the guests' next day of leisure. Each morning always looked as if these areas were never even used. . The beach is two tiered with plenty of chairs under the palms and on the beach offering something for everyone. The beach has sandbags to protect from erosion It never bothered us, and has nothing to do with the resort. Food We ate at one of the specialty restaurant Chili's one night and enjoyed it, although my fourteen year old enjoyed the buffet more. The buffet food was always good and varied sufficiently that we didn't tire of it. Breakfast was always good too. Service All of the staff did as good a job at treating guests like royalty as is humanly possible whether we tipped or not. We tipped often and always received a genuine thank-you in return. The help was always friendly, attentive and energetic. Almost immediately empty glasses and plates were whisked away from our table (after being asked if we were done). We almost never waited for more than a couple of minutes before being asked if we would like another drink or refill no matter where we sat, except at the beach. We preferred walking up to the pool bar anyway to see every one having fun swimming, laughing, water aerobics or whatever. Grounds/Buildings The buildings were cleaned and maintained meticulously. The huge chandeliers never had so much as one bulb out and all of the areas were extremely clean and well kept. The bars and show hall were lavishly decorated and tables and chairs always perfectly straightened and clean. Gardens, lawns and walkways always well-groomed. Activities Xel-Ha for snorkeling and general all inclusive fun. We sailed, snorkeled, scuba dived, para-sailed, rode jet skis, played volley ball and swam all at the resort. A walk to fifth avenue to check out Senior Frogs is a tourist must just to experience the shop keepers and vendors vying for your business. Entertainment From water volleyball, then dancing on the beach with guests, then the nightly shows, the tireless animacion crew was great. Always happy faces, great personalities, providing all day fun. The team obviously enjoy their work and it showed. Great place, great staff, great time. Don't listen to nit-pickers who give this palace bad reviews. It is as good a resort as it gets in my opinion, and as good as service gets as is humanly possible!

Reviews.Title: “A week in paradise at the Mayan Riviera Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Always_a_smile
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen - Riu Palace Mayan Riviera - "Magnificient". My husband and I spent the first week of February there arriving from snowy Nova Scotia. The weather was perfect and not as humid as I would have thought and wonderful temperatures for beach walks, ocean swims, pool activities and lounging. The property was gorgeous and the food and service - awesome. A perfect place for rest and relaxation but also planned activities if you wanted to participate. My new happy place is yoga on the beach with the beautiful torquoise ocean, swaying palm trees and sunshine in my vision and the soft, lyrical voice of the young Mexican yoga instructor, Octavio, who also conducted our water aerobics. The staff at the Palace were the best and the food was beyond perfection. All the choices you could possibly want and prepared beautifully and served with such ease and efficiency. We had a tour of the kitchens and were duly impressed with the cleanliness and smooth organization of the operation and talent of the food preparers. 600 on staff at any given time with 3 eight hour shifts and 80 for the kitchen and wait staff. What seemed effortless and relaxed to us was a well-oiled machine so efficient and geared to maximizing the enjoyment of the Palace guests. Our week went quickly and we met wonderful people from all over the world and fell in love with the resort - so much so, we didn't leave it until it was time to fly home. We'll be doing this vacation spot again for sure and for other locations, we'll be sourcing out the Riu Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and bad”
Reviews.Author: prolantis
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of nice things about the hotel and at the same time, they could improve a lot of things as well. The hotel itself is beautiful with plenty of swimming pools and most importantly, beach is right there. In contrast, rooms are not as pretty as the hotel and it smelled. Rooms are fairly spacious though. Their service is fairly decent however, they have serious theft problems and we were one of the victims. Fortunately(?!!), it happened on the last day so, it didn't ruin our entire vacation. I could understand it could happen but, the way they handled it was disappointing. Even though they had the record of their staff entering our room 4 times in less than 20 minutes and that person never returned to work, they offered us $100 which was fraction of what we lost. Receiving $100 meant that it was not their fault so, we declined it entirely. As for their food service, it's edible, not great, not bad. Over all, it's not a bad place but, I personally had a bad experience so, don't expect my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “The truth about RIU Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: fool4travel
Reviews.Content: I looked at these boards nervously for months before our trip. In our group of friends, I am always the "travel agent" and I people trust me to find a great value! And that is exactly what we got here at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. So here is my opinion in summary: SERVICE: The absolute BEST SERVICE I have ever had in my life!! I have been to five star hotels in the States and have been on 7 cruises with Princess, Royal Carribean and Celebrity. The service here blow them away! I did not expect it to be SO much better! Everyone was absolutely charming and inviting! Just had a blast here! But I cannot say the same for the other RIUs. There was a very noticeable difference from the RIUs Palace resorts and the other ones. I don't think I would stay at the other RIUs unless the price was crazy cheap and I was going to spend my time in town. FOOD: The food was EXCELLENT!!! This is what I was most surprised about! I didn't have high expectations. But I certainly will next time! The assortment was incredible! Really! RESORT GROUNDS: Wow, wow, wow!! The prettiest beach and the prettiest grounds of any that we walked by!! I mean by far. Even the swanky Royal Hideaway looked puny next to this place. Spotless!! The only negatives are the pool was quite cold in December. We stayed in the ocean. And the other negative is I did not see any lounge beds outdoors. But those are not very common anyway. I was not expecting them. Oh, and the whales that everyone grips about? PLEASE!!! They were a wonderful barrier to being swept out to sea on the rough sea days!! I actually prefer them. Some people! LOCATION: Again, it's a 10!! Very easy walk to Playa Del Carmen's main street, pleasant walk at that. And I love how you have to show your wristband upon re-entry. It made me feel more secure. SPIRITS: We were worried about the drinks being weak or having to chase down someone to get a drink or the alcohol being "lower end." We were all very pleased with the alcohol. Don Julio tequila and Absolute vodka amongst others. And drinks being weak? Heck, they would bring you straight shots to go along with your cocktails if you even hint that is what you would like. But, trust me, you will get sick of all of the never-ending alcohol! ACCOMMODATIONS: This is the only area where I would say it is not a five star hotel. And they do not bill theirselves to be a five star, anyway. The rooms was immaculately clean. The room service was stellar!! Absolutely no problems. The shower/bath in the regular rooms is very large and so comfortable! In fact, the bathroom was my favorite place. The balconies are quite roomy. The downsides are probably true to all hotel rooms in the area. The aforementioned complaint of the musty smell is true. You will not smell it for the first two days. But after that, it does get a little old. We should have kept our door open more often though. And it was difficult to get the room temp the way I wanted it. It was either too cold, and I was curled up on the couch with a blanket or too humid. The bed is the most comfortable bed that I have had in Mexico, but that is not saying too much. But you won't have a problem sleeping. You just probably won't want to spend a whole lot of time in the rooms cuddling in bed. To my knowledge there were not movies on demand, you know, "pay per view" movies. So we watched a lot of weird television in Spanish. But that was kind of fun. So I would compare their rooms to, say, a Doubletree. Not a Westin. They were very very spacious, though! I would absolutely return!!! I would just go when it does not get dark out so early and the pools were warmer so I could spend less time in the room! Plus, the deal I got on this place was great! Five nights with air from San Francisco for two people, basic room, 1660 USD!!! I really don't know if you can beat that!!! We will be back!! If you have any questions, don't hesitate to message me and I will try to answer them!! Have Fun and Don't Worry!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Adored the Riu Palace Riviera Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: NJloves2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here August 2007 and absolutely loved everything about this resort. Rooms- beautiful rooms, fridge is stocked daily, maids always did a great job. Air conditioning turns off when you open up the sliding door. Resort- lovely! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Even those who did not speak alot of English made the attempt to make conversation. Reservation system is not the best (you have to go during a certain window of time to make a reservation for one of the ala carte restaurants, but I felt it was definitely worth the effort. Drink service on the beach is a nice touch as well. Excursions- Chichen-Itza is a must. It was so much fun, and it was such an amazing sight. It is a long day (8-10 hour excursion) so plan according. Also, in August when you are at Chichen Itza there is little shade so be prepared. Afterwards we had a mexican lunch at a restaurant and then went to a natural cenote to swim. Mayan Adventure tour was fun as well. This involved biking through a jungle area, zip-lining, and then swimming in the underground cenotes/caves. I have seen that lately there are sandbags in the water. I am a beach person and love taking pictures so I don't know how I feel about this new addition, but they say it's to prevent the beach from being completely ruined during the hurricanes and swept away. You have to go with the knowledge that the sandbags are there and you will see the top of them in the water. The pictures I have posted are from before the sandbags.

Reviews.Title: “Waiting to go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveTheSun48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Reviera Maya from Jan. 27 through Feb. 6 and we loved every minute of it!! We were initially a little disappointed in the location of our room (1021) but we were only there for a few hours everyday anyway. The room was always clean and only once had to ask for face clothes. We didn't use the bar, only drank the beer and water but from what a few people told us, they asked for special brands (Beefeaters Gin and some type of whiskey) and they were brought right up and put in the bar. We have no complaints about the food--we ate at three of the specialty restaurants--went about 1:30 in the afternoon to make reservations were able to get into each restaurant when we wanted. The service in the restaurants and the buffet couldn't have been better. We joked around with Fernando in the Brazilian restaurant and he was there to greet us every morning at the breakfast buffet. Everyone was always very pleasant and helpful!! The bar service on both the beach and at the pool was good. We tipped every other time they brought us drinks and our glasses were never empty for long. Be sure to go to the lobby bar and get acquainted with the bartender by the name of Islas. He was the best!! We had a lot of fun sitting there in the evenings visiting with him and all of the other customers!! The evening entertainment was typical most evenings, but the "Grease Show", "Las Vegas Show", "MIchael Jackson" and "Crazy Show" were really worth watching and the waiters and waitresses were very attentive there also. We stayed at the Riu Nayerit last year and loved it there so weren't surprised at the great trip we had this year!! We would definitely return to the Riu Rivieria Maya on another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya!!”
Reviews.Author: Liveforvacationgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Jan 31-Feb 7, 2009. This is only our second AI property we have been to. We previously stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico. We booked through Traveloni (Funjet) out of Detroit. We booked a non-stop transfer, not private, with Lomas; however, on the return we were the only passengers in a Lincoln Navigator! After experiencing that, we will definitely book a private next time. By the way, the Lomas Representatives were fantastic both when arriving in Cancun and departing. Very helpful, courteous and were safe drivers!! Check in was quick and efficient and we were placed in room 2086 which is a Superior Junior Suite. Our view was of the courtyard and fountains. The room was closer to the lobby than the beach which was fine with us. Our room had an extra large patio with two chairs and a small table where we had our morning coffee and our cocktails in the afternoon. I think all the rooms have a patio, but some are larger than others. My only disappointment in the room was that it had two beds pushed together rather than a real king, but we made do!!! We had room service most every morning for coffee and it was delivered within 10 minutes each time along with a long stemmed red rose!! We used room service other times to order additional cervezas which were also delivered promptly and with a smile! We had an occasion to call maintenance as our refrigerator was not keeping cold. They were there within 10 minutes. Can’t ask for much more than that! The reservation system here for the restaurants could be improved. Waiting in line to make them seems silly to me. That being said, we had no trouble getting reservations to any of the restaurants when we wanted them. Reservations are taken from noon-3:00 in the piano bar. Before giving you our thoughts on the restaurants, I want to emphasize that we have never seen such excellent service from all the waiters, bussers, waitresses, etc.! You can drop a fork and before you even realize it, another one is in its place! This is true at the ala cartes AND the buffets. Service is top notch!! Okay, on to the restaurants: Krystal: We liked this one the best. The service was excellent and the food was delicious. Try the pumpkin soup…awesome! My husband had the filet and I had the Chilean sea bass which we both enjoyed. For dessert I had some chocolate thing like a warm brownie with chocolate sauce inside served with ice cream…excellent! Agave: This is the Mexican restaurant. It is not real Mexican food if that’s what you are looking for. I had the beef tenderloin and my husband had pork tenderloin. All of it was good, but it didn’t have the ambience of Krystal. But again, the service was great! Chilis: This is the restaurant that serves lunch but turns into a steak house in the evening. I had lamb chops and I can’t remember what my husband had, but the food was good. We loved eating lunch there everyday. Great selection and variety each day. Buffets: We ate at the dinner buffet 4 times and had wonderful food! The best buffet is on Thursdays which is the Gala. We had shrimp, lobster bisque, beef wellington, crab legs, lamb chops, etc. etc. There were wonderful desserts including a chocolate fountain! On Friday, there was a beach party where they served cocktails in the coconuts they cut down and had a buffet set up with spareribs, burgers, salads, etc. Very fun! They had a small band playing in the beach bar and games. We felt the beach was very nice. It had lots of shade if you needed it and lots of sun, too. The pool is incredible with lots of chairs and umbrellas. The sand whales did not bother us but we’re not into swimming in the ocean anyway. There were few children here, but the entertainment staff kept them busy playing soccer, face painting and whatever else! I would say this resort is more geared to 30+ couples. There were some young people, but I bet they went to Riu Tequila or Playa Del Carmen in the evenings. There are a lot of European guests here and it is in their culture to sun bathe topless. If that bothers you or if worried about your children, I would say that they are very discreet and are not doing it to show off their bodies. The Europeans didn’t bother us but there was one AMERICAN woman who paraded around topless in front of everyone and enjoyed the attention she received. We had a fabulous time and are already planning our return! I know I left out a bunch of stuff so if you have any specific questions, please email me.

Reviews.Title: “The best RIU hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: coryw89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Maya January 14-20th. We arrived at the airport and we had one bag missing. The airline misplaced our bag. We panicked at first but the airline assured us they would find it at some point. Was not too reassuring but he gave us a number to call later that day to see if it had been located. Long story short, we called the airline 4 hours later and they found the bag. They delivered it to our Hotel so all was good. We then proceeded through customs which was a breeze. We went outside and located our transfers (which are included if you book direct through the RIU website). There was a clean comfortable van that took us straight to the hotel. The drive is about 45 minutes from the airport to hotel. Check in was a smooth effortless process. You are greeted with a cocktail as well. We went to our room 1058. GREAT room and wonderful view of the courtyard. The room has a safe for money, passports, etc. It was electronic so you do not have to carry the key. The mini bar is stocked with Corona, Soda, and plenty of bottled water. The bed was very comfortable. Not sure how anyone could say these beds are hard unless they just changed the mattress. We slept like babies. There is 24 hour room service as well. We always got our food in less than 20 minutes. The grounds at this hotel are absolutely beautiful. The landscaping is perfectly manicured and the beach is spectacular. The staff is friendly and will get anything you need. I can’t say enough about the staff. There is a sports bar and lounge bar with all top shelf liquor. I drank my fair share of Don Julio. They have Modelo on tap if you get tired of Corona. They serve you drinks on the beach too! The buffets are actually really good. We ate at Chilies most of the time for lunch. We tried a few of the theme restaurants as well. The steakhouse was very tasty. The rib eye had great flavor. They start you out with an appetizer which has some king crab legs and cerveche. Very good! We also ate at the Japanese restaurant. This was our favorite. The Crystal restaurant was wonderful and highly recommend. Very classy. We did not try the Mexican or Brazilian because we heard from a lot of people that is was not all that good. Everyone has different tastes so try them if you like. We did a few excursions. We did the “Jungle Jims ATV” excursion. You basically ride atv’s through the jungle and have the opportunity to see monkeys and a lot of other wildlife. You walk through an underground cave which was pretty cool. My girlfriend got hit in the head by a fruit bat. Kind of funny but she didn’t much care for it. You can also take a dip in the fresh water pond as well. Overall I would recommend this to anyone. About a 4 hour excursion. We booked this right at the hotel. My girlfriend also booked a swim with the Dolphins at the hotel. Delphinus is the name of the excursion and it was freaking awesome! She spent over an hour with the Dolphins and she actually got to ride them……….unbelievable and highly recommend to anyone wanting to do this. Make sure you do the Delphinus tour. There are other dolphin swims that don’t allow you to actually touch and ride them. The hotel is just a 5 minute cab ride to the famous 5th avenue. You have all the shopping you could want. Plenty of night life and the ferry to Cozumel is located there as well. We went out to the Blue Parrot bar on 5th avenue one night. They have a fire show that starts around 10:30 p.m. or so. Words can’t describe this. I highly recommend you check it out. No cover charge and a fun place. I have been to the RIU Cancun and RIU Santé Fe in Cabo and this was by far the best RIU hotel. I wouldn’t put too much weight in the negative reviews here. Read all the positives because they are true. We will be back to this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room, roaches on the buffet table”
Reviews.Author: krisdodd
Reviews.Content: Verdict: This is an overpriced mediocre hotel with lack lustre service and cleanliness. I will never go back to this place again. We had requested a room with 2 separate beds while booking but were assigned a room with 1 king size bed. On request we were given room with 2 beds however, these were rooms at the very front near the restaurants. Please avoid the rooms at the front since every night the hotels generate a lot of noise (whistling and shouting staff, dishes being thrown around, etc). Apart from this the hotels clear their trash every night at 10 pm and a dump truck arrives and starts compacting trash just below rooms 1001 and 1002. For about 45 minutes every night you will have to endure this terrible noise. As I was told by the front desk manager Jose Luis Serrato, this is something that the city government decides and they have no control over this truck's schedule. That means, I would avoid the first 4-5 rooms closest to the elevator located at the front end of the property. Since the only elevators on this property are located near the front desk if you are in any room other than the first 10 closest to the front desk they are useless. The entertainment provided by the resort in the evenings is very lame. TV in the room has only a handful of english language channels, rest are spanish channels. There are no english language channels for the kids. Since you have to use cards to get towels, you are limited to one towel per person at any given time. We saw roaches on or near the buffet 2 out of 3 nights. Even though the choice of food in the buffet is very good, this is one choice I do not want. This is not something that they can fix just by spraying given the volume of food they serve. Processes and procedures need a change to fix this long term ... perhaps under different management! Good luck to anyone who decides to stay in this hotel. Pros: 1. Good location 2. Lots of beach space 3. Somewhat helpful staff at the restaurants Cons: 1. Attention to detail missing at Front Desk 2. Arrogant and callous front desk manager 3. Cleanliness should be improved 4. The elevators are only available at the front end of the property. 5. Shortage of towels 6. Lack of children's english language TV channels 7. Very few english language TV channels in general

Reviews.Title: “great service, beautiful property, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: smnornes
Reviews.Content: We flew on Sun Country nonstop from Minneapolis to Cancun, Mexico. We had arranged a trip partially through Apple Vacations and partially on our own. As we were preparing for our trip, we considered the new luggage fees implemented by Sun Country and other airlines ($15-$25 per bag, per flight) and decided that we would try to fit what we needed for the week into a carry on suitcase. Boy, was I doubtful! But, we did it! We have learned that we live in our swimsuits all day long and change into dinner clothes in the evening. A few mix and match dressy outfits was all we needed. Packing liquids was tricky. We needed to have all bottles be 3 ounces or less and they had to fit into 2 quart size baggies, one for each of us. Try finding sunscreen in small bottles! Walgreens! So, yes, we were successful with using carry ons only which made arriving in Cancun quick and easy. The flight was uneventful. Sun Country no longer serves a hot sandwich for free. Their service and friendliness was outstanding as always. We landed in Cancun 10 minutes early, collected our belongings, and made our way through immigration and customs. We were soon on our way to find our Apple transfers. Here's where it got bad. I know that there are time share people everywhere in Cancun. We were approached by a lady asking what transfer we were looking for. I told her Apple Vacations. She said to follow her and she would bring me to Apple. I protested and said no, I just want to find my Apple transfer. She said "Ma'am, I need to confirm your transfer and will then bring you to the right Apple Vacations bus." Hesitantly, I followed her, sucked into her scheme for about 90 seconds before I got mad for her lying to me and walked away. Be careful! Once you clear customs, go straight outside! DO NOT stop until you get through the big doors and are outside. Avoid the podiums and desks at all costs. Once outside, we found the Apple reps, got in our shuttle and were on our way. We rode in a 12 passenger van, cool and comfortable. We arrived at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya within 45 minutes. Check in was quick and we were given a room, 2139, immediately, even though it was barely noon. Our room was a standard room, facing the outside of the hotel towards the Reef Playacar. The rooms at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya are junior suites. When you walk in the door, you enter into a foyer, which is your dressing area and has a large closet with electronic safe and bar area. The bar has the typical Riu liquor dispenser and fully stocked refrigerator. To the right is the bathroom, complete with a jetted tub and shower, double sinks, marble tiles and hairdryer. Further into the room is the bed (we had a king) with a new, slightly softer mattress. Riu beds are hard! But this one was better. Beyond the bed is a sunken living area with a sofa, coffee table, credenza and a flat screen TV. There are also patio doors leading out to a private balcony with outdoor chairs and a table. If we really tried hard we could see the ocean, making it "oceanview." The grounds of the Riu are beautifully maintained. There are plenty of pool and beach chairs. You get a towel card to use and must check your towels in and out. Pool and beach waiters are everywhere. Don't forget to bring your travel mug or covered mug! The beach is split into an upper and lower beach. They are divided by a short wall, maybe 3 feet tall, and a white railing. We found that if we stayed up on top by the railing, we felt like we were on the ocean but weren't bothered by the beach vendors. Yes, there are huge beach sandbags, called whales, out in the water and along the beach, but this is to preserve the beach and bring it back after the past hurricane damage. These sandbags are found up and down the entire beach, not just in front of the Riu. We walked the beach all the way to the Riu Yucatan. It was nice the whole way. On the Riu map, it appears that the Riu hotels are side by side. This is not the case. Heading south from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, you pass the Allegro Playacar, Viva Wyndham Azteca, Royal Hideaway, and the Viva Wyndham Maya before getting to the Riu Playacar, Riu Palace Mexico and Riu Yucatan. Directly across the street from the Riu Palace Mexico is the entrance to the Riu Tequila. When you walk north, there is only the Reef Playacar before you hit a residential area that you can't walk past. We walked up the 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen on day. It took us 18 minutes to walk. There is a sidewalk the whole way. The Riu is located in a gated, residential area, so it is very safe and clean. We could have taken a cab for $5, but opted to walk. 5th Avenue was great! It goes on and on, so be sure not to stop and buy the first thing you see. The pier is also right here if you want to take the ferry over to Cozumel. We stumbled upon even more shopping when we walked the road from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya to the Riu Palace Mexico. Right across the street is the Plaza Playacar Shopping Center. It is an outdoor shopping mall filled with little shops and street vendors. Everything we bought up on 5th Avenue could have been purchased right here. Both places were fun to see. We only ate at the buffets, and ordered room service once. There was always plenty to choose from. The service at the main buffet was outstanding. They were always there to full our glasses and pull out chairs for us. Very nice. Having a destination wedding at one of the Riu's? Check out myriuwedding.com for a ton of information. We met with the wedding coordinators while we were there and witnessed a beach wedding at the Riu Playacar. I was impressed with the coordinators. I'm uploading a few photos, but the rest are located at http://shellistravel.com/TravelogueViewer.aspx?N=Riviera%20Maya%20Mexico%202009&TI=P1100046.jpg&F=RivieraMayaMexico2009. I have a number of room and resort photos. I would definitely stay here again. And after seeing the other Riu hotels, I would be happy to stay at any of them! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: mkjkvac
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (1/21-1/28). The hotel was magnificent, clean, and we had excellent service from the front desk to the maid. We stayed in the Jacuzzi Suite room number 2055, which had a great ocean view, we didn't find the beds to be hard at all (and we have a tempurpedic at home), the room was always clean (no bugs or smells as others experienced), and in a great location (right in the middle of the hotel layout). The food was great and always something different to eat. Each night has a different theme at the buffet. Don't quote me but I think Mon was Caribbean, Tue International, Wed Mexican, Thurs International, Friday Asian, Sat International and Sun International. We preferred the buffet over the specialty restaurants. We found it a bother to stand in line and wait to make dinner reservations when we could be at the beach so we only made reservations the first night (and you can only place two at a time). We did eat at the Steak House and Mexican which were both good but like I said we preferred the buffet. The pool is big but was rather cool. It was refreshing on a hot day but we liked the beach much better. The sandwhales weren't a problem for us. We felt Riu RM had one of the best beaches around. When you see how hard some of the hotel's beaches have been destroyed by the hurricane we were very happy with the beachfront we had. We had no problem finding a chair and we didn't wake up until 9-10am. The night time entertainment is on the down low. We are in our mid20's and it was fine with us, but we enjoy quite nights. They have some shows at night, live music, and some nights they have local shops set up. Overall I would say this is hotel is a great choice for families and couples wanting a quite getaway. Tip if you like Mexican cuisine: Eat at El Fogon across from the Mega mart 3-4 blocks off 5th avenue. Great food, great service, and CHEAP. We would get 2 orders of steak faijas, 2 beers, 2 cokes, and it only came to $202 pesos.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Service, Can't Say Enough!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaMG
Reviews.Content: It's not just the crystal chandeliers, the gorgeous flower displays in the lobby, the landscaped grounds, in-room jacuzzis and flat screen tvs, and the servers in tuxes that set the Riu Palace Riviera Maya apart from the other resorts in Playa Del Carmen. It's also the service with a smile and the staff who remember your name and your drink that make this place feel special. Little things like higher end booze (Don Julio tequila, Jim Beam and Absolut vs. no-name Mexican brands) and champagne at breakfast make a difference too. My husband and I came for 6 days at the end of January to Playa Del Carmen for a fun, kind of last minute getaway. I had been there previously in April 2008 for a girls trip and stayed at the Riu Tequila. For this trip, my husband and I were booked at the Riu Yucatan, but upon arrival were upgraded to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Let me tell you, now that we've experienced the difference, we'd never stay at any other Riu in Playa. Here's what I think sets the RPRM apart: Service: This was by far the best part of staying here. The service is always with a smile. If you are friendly and interact with the staff, they will go out of their way to make sure you are happy. One of the biggest differences between here at the Yucatan or Tequila is that drinks are brought to you. Not a big deal, but I like to be catered to a bit on vacation. My husband and I both feel strongly about tipping--it's never necessary for bad service, but should be given to reward good service. Rooms: Lovely, clean. Bathroom door, which is nice, as the Tequila had only a curtain. Jacuzzi tub and shower is very nice. Sunken den area with a couch, coffee table and 30 inch Sony Bravia flatscreen tv with plenty of channels. General Facilities and Grounds: Sparkling clean. Comfy furniture. Entertainment: There's definitely something for everyone. During the day, there's water aerobics, beach and pool volleyball, spanish lessons, shooting contests, table tennis, etc. Plus you can get a free scuba lesson, take water kayaks, boogie boards, or a Hobie Cat out, all for free. (You've got to be a sailor in order to do take the Hobie out). During the evenings, we really enjoyed listening to the live music from the bandstand. We also enjoyed the shows, although maybe in a more ironic way when it comes to Grease. Food: Breakfast: This was the best meal. The pickiest of people can always find something. Lunch: This was a bit hit or miss, to be honest. The days when there was someone out making tacos to order were better. Dinner: We ate at the buffet only once but liked it--there was stone crab on the buffet, which was a nice treat even though it had been previously frozen. We also ate at the Japanese and Krystal--both were not really better than what you can get on the buffet. Town: We love the town. It's so much fun to grab a drink at the open air bars and then a nice dinner at one of the many nice choices. Tulum: This was the only excursion we did and enjoyed it. However since we booked last minute, we got put on a big tourist bus. Not our thing. But Tulum is very interesting and the beach is beautiful. Safety: We felt very safe here. Didn't feel like we had to watch our things like hawks while we were away from our beach or pool chairs. We also noticed that the couples with kids were able to give their kids some freedom, which hopefully made for a good vacation for everyone. Overall, only a couple of dislikes: Noise: Both at night and in the morning, sound really carries from the hallways outside your door. Especially with the staff's carts and with people going in or out of their rooms. Lunch: we got a little tired of the crowded lunch buffet, as we found people to be a little pushier than necessary during this time. My husband and I both felt that for the money, you can't do better than here. We loved it and would go back in a few weeks if we could. We give it a 4 out of 5 only because we've stayed at some resorts that are true 5's--but they were MUCH more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love Riu!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ewok20
Reviews.Content: This was our first all inclusive and we loved it!! The food and service was great!! room was very clean and up to date. Most workers spoke English very well. I defnitely recommend this to honeymooners, couples,and families. If you don't mind tipping the waiters and maids would love that!! They'll give you extra attention. Heads up! I don't recommend that you buy your excursions at the hotel as you know they'll mark up the price. Go to 5th/6th street its a main shopping/ restuarant. There's alot places for you to go and book your excursions. You can bargain with them!! We got a great deal deal witha combination of Xel-Ha and Tulum. Overall we can't wait to go back and this time I'll bring my family :) Checkout our pics!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Appearance Outside, just look a little deeper!”
Reviews.Author: Adcarp08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I looked for months before deciding on a place to go. Neither of us had been to Mexico, and we didn't have a lot of time so we decided to go to riviera maya. The exterior of the hotel and the public areas were Very nice and clean. It was an all inclusive trip, which was very convenient. However, you had to book reservations daily and one restaurant was closed the entire time and another was booked the whole time. Also, our bed was almost as hard a piece of plywood. I had read this and thought, "it can't be THAT hard", but Oh it can! Overall it was a great trip. Tips: As far as Excursions go, the Cenotes or underground caves are a MUST. The ruins however were not so exciting, good history but a VERY long drive from the area. Downtown Playa Del Carmen isn't far and is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Exellente”
Reviews.Author: paulpma
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay for married couple from cold New England. Would recommend to friends and relatives. Staff and entertainment team works hard to make your stay pleasurable. When we stayed the weather wasn't cooperative, for 4 out 7 days it was cloudy and you couldn't;t go to beach. But I am glad that we got this hotel because there was a lot of stuff to do. There is shopping plaza outside of hotel within 20 min walk, and boarding area to the island Cozumel. Tip: When windy and waves are bigger then normal then you can get sea sick very easy, found out from experience. The only thing that I didn't like was those sand bags that you see on the beach pictures. But if they are no bother to you I would say the beach is nice. Food is very good. 5 restaurants. Favorite is Crystal and Japanese. In one of the other restaurants they serve a lot of different kind of meat (not my fav), but would be excellent choice for a meat lover.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Week”
Reviews.Author: oma89
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, our stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya was absolutely perfect. We were checked in quickly and found our room to be spotlessly clean. Our junior suite was roomy and the beautiful tile patio was very large. The beds were comfortable, the plasma TV had great reception and the bar was well-stocked. The staff at this hotel is very friendly and accommodating. No request was not answered in a timely manner. All of the staff, from front desk to groundskeepers to restaurant personnel , were impeccably attired, cordial and eager to please guests. We ate every meal but one at the Don Manolo or Chili's buffets and we were well pleased with the quality and variety of the food. Dining at Don Manolo in the evening felt like fine dining, thanks to the attentiveness of Rene and all of the wonderful headwaiters. We ate once at the steak house, where the food was ok but service felt a bit rushed. The ambience of this hotel is very elegant, but not at all stuffy. Every public area was so clean it sparkled. There was a nice variety of entertainment every night. We especially enjoyed the Mayan show, which gave us a real feel for the culture of the Yucatan. We did one tour - Chichin Itza, which I recommend to everyone. What you will see there is absolutely phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Asked For More”
Reviews.Author: EZ149
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the at the RPRM and we both absoulutely love it. We're usually very picky eaters so choosing a resort with food that had edible food was a must and based on the reviews of the TripAdvisor community, we picked this hotel and I'm glad we did. There are many different varieties of food. The Japanese restaurant was okay but do not miss Asian night at the buffet. VERY good! The 2 pools are gigantic. One is an above ground and the other was an in-ground and you can jump from one to the other. The beach wasn't bad. Don't let the haters discourage you about it. The sandbags are actually a good thing because they keep the fishes and seaweed out. The rooms are big and equipped with its own liqour dispenser. I felt safe there because it's situated in Playacar, which is a bit of a closed off residential and resort community. It's about a half hour ride from the airport but it's halfway in between Cancun and Tulum. It's close to Puerto Aventuras and 5 minutes from the Ferry to Cozumel. The dock is actually in walking distance. Great location, absolutely perfect ambiance for romantics, and the staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: heam0301
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week stay at the Riu Palace-Riviera Maya. It was a fabulous vacation. Check in and check out were done in a matter of minutes. It took a day to learn the schedule of the hotel's dinning. They shut the buffet's down between meals but you can always grab a snack in the sport's bar. The buffet food was excellent. Lots of different things to choose from and they would specially make you something if you asked such as an omelet or speghetti. You needed to make reservations to eat at the main restaurants at least 2 days in advance but we never really knew what are plans were going to be so we only at 2 restaraunts. Both restaraunts were good but we prefered the buffets. Our room was always cleaned everyday with fresh towels and a restocked fridge. We had our own balcany but our view was the neighboring hotel. The bed was a huge king size that was rather hard so we struggled to sleep very well but that is just our personal opinion. The pool was great with a swim up bar and benches and tables to sit at in the pool. It was hard to get a pool chair because people got up early and claimed them with their towels. There are alot of palm trees around the pool so it is very shady. There were 2 levels of beach and it was nice soft sand and always plenty of lounge chairs. There is very minimal vendors walking the beach so that was nice. We parasailed from our beach through Scuba Caribe which is located right on the beach. It was awesome and only $55 a person. The service was great, they seat you at every restaraunt and bring drinks constantly. They had a show every night at 9:45 so we tried to stay up for those. They also had fun games at the pool during the day like volleyball, bingo, and water aerobics. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Playa Del Carmen shopping was only a 20 minute walk away or $10 taxi there and back. 5th Avenue had tons of shops and lots of places to eat. You could also take a ferry to Cozumel for the day but we didn't go. We booked an excursion to Tulum and Xel-Ha through a vendor at the 5th Ave shopping and we had a great time. There is lots of things to do around the resort and you can go to the other Riu hotels along the road and use their facilities and restaraunts for breakfast and lunch but they didn't supply towels. Overall the trip was fabulous and the hotel was fantastic. We would definetly go back. There is a good mixture of people and ages so everybody fits in.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, a wonderful time at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: MicleleL
Reviews.Content: Third Thanksgiving in a row spent at the Riu and still absolutely love it. We were in a group of 16 (some first timers to the area) and all loved it. We were upgraded to a courtyard suite and loved watching the sights from our balcony (the few times we were actually in the room)! Beautiful rooms with comfortable new bedding, great beach, excellent food and top notch service. If you can't enjoy yourself here, you may have trouble enjoying yourself anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “very surprised”
Reviews.Author: skippyjonjones2008
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the resort from 12/19-12/26. resort was very nice,extremely clean. the grounds were well manicured and the pool and pool bar very nice. good beach but as with all the beach in playa del carmen the hurricane from a couple years ago erroded alot of it. the buffet was surprisingly good with a nice variety at all three meals. the wait staff was very good and attentive. the christmas eve buffet,activities and decorations made for a festive time. two things- i read that most people dont think tipping at an all-inclusive resort is necessary but it truely goes along way to make sure everything you could want is there for you. a five dollar a day tip to the pool bar attendent assures you non stop dedicated service all day. and secondly, beware there are many europeans that stay in the area and they are very rude ,pushy and cheap. all in all a great hotel and we are planning to go back next year. you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “1st AI Resort & Trip to Mexico - Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: eDDChang
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just came back from our first Mexico trip to celebrate our anniversary and we stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Dec 18th - 24th. It was also our first AI resort. Boy oh boy we were treated like royalties. Drinks, food, and entertainment at your disposal. Why Riu? Friends and coworkers have stayed here and gave rave reviews and we wanted our first trip to be memorable and wanted to try out AI resort. I've been reading good and bad reviews at TripAdvisor and been somewhat cautious on my expectations, but I was not disappointed at all. Transportation - Took ADO bus from Cancun airport (90 peso or 8 USD). Then then took a taxi (50 peso or 5 USD). We insisted on paying in pesos since we already withdraw the money from ATMs. We got 12.98 peso to 1 USD at the airport ATM. Very reasonable rate. Front Desk - I had previously emailed the resort requesting high floor room and easy access to the beach. We were accomodated. Arrived around 2pm. We got a Trainee to help us check in, and that took longer than expected because she couldn't find our reservation and thought we already checked in. The trainee did give us the towel cards and explained that it's $20 USD fine each if we lost it. When we arrived at our room, I realized that she didn't give us the keys to our room. Luckily there's a house keeping lady and got us to our room. Small glitch not a big deal. Next time I'll try to avoid any trainees I guess. Room - We booked a junior suite and got the 3rd floor, we could see the fountain below and the ocean to our far left. We got a King size bed (not pushed together) and no musty odor. The floor is a bit sticky for some reason. It seemed like it was just mopped, but we felt it didn't dry soon enough. We had to wear our sandals in our room most of the the time. Our room had a fan on the ceiling, Sony 27" LCD TV, nice and spacious bathroom with hydromassage/jacuzzi tub. I would recommend bring your own toiletries. We weren't too impressed with what the hotel provided for a 5* resort. The towels were somewhat scruffy, even to my taste as a guy. You'll feel the difference especially after spending a whole day baking in the sun. House keeping cleaned up the room twice a day, during lunch time and dinner time (usually after 6.30pm). Mini Bar in the room include Smirnoff, Jose Cuervo, Bacardi, and coronas, sodas and water (very important). We didn't even get to try the mini bar liquor as we had enough drink throughout the resort already. Restaurant - We tried all the a la carte restaurants during our stay. Krystal (Fusion) would be #1 on our list as the head waiter (Johnny) is really nice and make us feel very special on our anniversary day. He even picked up some flowers and spread them around our table and later made us a heart shaped whipped cake with candles and fruits. Make friends with the head waiter as they could make things happen like Johnny did for us. He got us the seat at Chilis for a 7pm seating even though we didn't get a chance to make reservation ; ) Next on the list would be Chilis (Steak House) and Yashima (Japanese). Steak house because they have the surf and turf (mini lobster with beef tenderloin) and also king crab legs appetizer. Yashima - we had the beef and salmon both are pretty good. Although you can get the sushi appetizer at the Don Manolo buffet during Asian night theme. So check in advance. As far as the tempura, it was just okay, not the kind I'm used to. But very decent dessert for the tempura ice cream. Brazilian Rodizio has pretty good desserts selection, especially the coconut ice cream. The appetizer included corn cobs, potatoes, chicken wings, and broccoli in a skillet which was later flamed with tequila. Yeah you can really taste that tequila. I've been to many Brazilian restaurants before, but haven't had this kind of appetizer. For the meat skewer, pork and sausage are pretty good, but the beef was very salty. Mexican Agave has variety of deep fried appetizer. I had the mahi2 fish with some rice, wife had the beef and also some sort of rice. I really liked the rice. Probably should have tried the deep fried burritos. Of all the restaurants, we noticed that the Mexican restaurant is the easiest to get in without reservation. Try Krystal or Yashima first if you don't have reservation for 6.30pm and if you still can't get in then try the Mexican. The earlier you arrive, the earlier you will get served and thus finished earlier to enjoy the rest of the evening. Buffet - We ate there once for dinner, but wished we had tried it during the Asian night theme. The food is definitely abundant and has good variety for everyone. But it is a still a buffet. However, for lunch we prefer Don Manolo compared to Chilis. Service - Definitely very friendly and top notch. Once you are seated, someone will come and ask if you'd like a drink. We do tip at a la carte restaurants, but not so much during lunch time as we usually do not bring anything with us. Pool - Towel service is open at 7am and most likely you will find the sun soaked section reserved by the time you get there. There were some kids running around and jumping from the top pool to a lower pool, but still tolerable. Great pool scene though. Beach - There are two sections, the top section has lots of trees for shades and also some swing beds. The lower section is for serious beach bums like myself. We never have any problem getting the loungers. Probably because of the size of this resort. The sand whale actually helps prevent the rough sands and rocks on the beach. Every morning, there is a hotel staff that cleaned up the seaweed and the beach. I didn't notice too many cigarette butts on the beach though. But compared to other hotels, RPRM do have older crowds and more family oriented. Entertainment - We always find locals setting up stands right in front of the Don Manolo restaurant around the fountain. You will also find pilox painting of Chichen Itza, which we got for 20 USD or 250 peso. Apparently they are everywhere in downtown as well. We only watched two shows: Mayan Show and Grease. We really liked the Mayan show with all the cool feather costumes and fire play. We even got on stage to take some pictures with the cast. Downtown - You can actually take a FREE RIU shuttle from Riu Lupita (right next to RPRM). The shuttle runs every 30 minute at 15 and 45 past the hour. The last shuttle run at 6.45pm. It's basically a relatively small and white color shuttle bus (no marking of RIU at all). You essentially want to get of the shuttle at the first stop, which near the circle (round about) and walk 1 block to downtown PDC. It definitely saves us 20 min walking or 50 peso taxi ride. If you are lucky, you may catch one on your way back to the hotel, but we never did. Shopping - You just have to walk with a straight face if you are not interested in these street merchants. Some may get obnoxious, but that's all part of the fun in Mexico. You should get used to hearing "Hey Sir! Sir! Give me 10 dollars... " "Taxi? Mayan Palace?" We found a pretty nice and cheap selection of gifts near 5th and constituyentes ave. Sorry, can't remember the name. In the same area, we also got a 60 minute massage for 30 USD at Veronica's massage. It was a pretty nice, clean room with AC. We requested for female masseuse. There's a free banos (restroom) in the same building, right inside the cocoa place and walk to your left. Something that I didn't see too often, unless you plan to eat and dine at restaurants there. Lastly Excursions - Tulum & Hidden Worlds. Really loved Tulum, the beach and the wave is just awesome. Make sure you pack towels and swim suits. You can even grab some cold sandwich or hot dog from the sport bar before you leave. Hidden Worlds is also awesome. Very nice people, lets us do the zip line splash over and over again. Each time I try to go faster and further... hehehe... Wow...it's pretty long, but I hope it helps. My way to contribute to TA.

Reviews.Title: “the real deal”
Reviews.Author: biffofridge
Reviews.Content: my self and susan stayed hear from the 8th to the 22nd of December. stayed in room 2113, the best holiday experience i have ever had. i dont say this lightly as i am a well seasoned traveler. the room was on the top floor, and virtually in the pool it was that close..... booked with Thompson, paid £1330 each, and a supplement of £119 for the premium seat upgrade........money well spent, flew from birmingham via manchester [the long way down]. all went well, even filling out immigration forms which were in spanish was a hoot......THOMPSON; we do not appreciate being taken to the resprt in a baeten up, well past its date mini bus.....you need to get this sorted, as do you the aggresive and abusive driver who asked for a tip, and the cused at you in spanish for not complying...... a lot has been said about this hotel, all i can say is supperb, the treat you like a prince and princess, sue loved the little things, like escorting her from the the buffet to her seat, and carrying her plate for her.....trust me, this was not unusal. the rooms were very good, always cleaned, with 4 fresh towels left each day.....i requested that, and it was not a problem. the hotel was quiet, it was full, niut the people in the main had manors and mutilal respect fro the fellow guest's.... this is not to say that fun could not be had, it could and in big heaps if you wanted it. had little difficulty booking the speciality resturants, all of which were excellent, but with a buffet as good as this one was, it would not have been a problem if they were rubbish. the buffet is excellent, each day, morning or evening, just first rate, enough choice for the most discerning. the beach was probably the best in the resort, a lot has been said about the sand whales, i think the give the area some additional charecter, but trust me, they can be very slippery. the beach is on 2 tiers, the upper being more for shade, the lower being for serious sun lovers. never cramped, never a problem getting some sun beds. when you are on the beach, look out for JOE, what a guy, arranged with him to come and see me once a hour for drinks, and he sure did.....PACO was also a star in this department....the beach bar guys allways liked a laugh, and a big up to all of you.....'JESUS, what time is it? its miami vice time amigo' the piano bar in the evening was allways very refined, and again this is Isla's domain, just think of any drink, and the guy will know it, and probably produce the best version you have ever had. a true showman being a guest at tthis hotel meant that you had the run of ALL of the riu's in the resort, and the palace and cancun in cancun....did all of the hotels in resort, and my prefference would be as follows palace riviera, palce mexico, yucatan,tequila,playacar did not visit the lupita.... did not do any excursions, i am a beach bum!!!!! did go to 5th avenue frequently, very safe very nice, go in the evening to get the full full visuale effect....50 peso in a taxi [less than £3] go into the shops and bars, have fun with the people, try to speak some spanish, even if its badly!!!! if you want a truely great holiday, go visist mexico, and make the riu you home for a while....i will be going back around novemebr/december 2009

Reviews.Title: “This place is NICE!!”
Reviews.Author: tracygoo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over Thanksgiving. What a great resort. We booked through Apple Vacations and, as always, were very satisfied with the fights and transfers. Transfers were done by AC van and we were dropped of first and picked up last--which was nice--but I'm guessing just lucky. Check-in was a breeze. I slipped the clerk a $20 and she gave us a nice room on the second floor near the beach and pool and away we went. The rooms are very nice and spacious. All of the beds now have new mattresses and flat screen TV's. We found our bed to very comfy. The bathroom was probably one the of the nicer that we've had--nice jacuzzi/shower and plenty of space for your stuff. There is a sunken sitting area by the TV and a very roomy closet. We were very happy with our room. Only drawback is the key operated safe--kind of cumbersome. We had NO musty smell! The pool is nice-though a little chilly. But it felt good to get cooled off and also had a sobering effect (if you catch my drift) Marbin at the pool bar is excellent. We are in the habit of tipping for good service and these people really appreciate it and you'll get taken care of much quicker if you do. The bartenders and waiters even remember your name during your stay which is nice. We found the beach to be adequate. Not like the pre-hurricane days but still very nice. The sand whales are placed in such a way that they create a small 'bay' for calm swimming but you can easily get through them to the open water. Take some bread from the buffet and feed the fish--they will flock to you. We walked the beach to the south as far as you could go. RPRM is the nicest resort of them all by our judgement. We were glad that we didin't stay at the Riu Mexico. It did have a nice beach but everything else was just not laid out as well. The food was as good as any AI that we have been to. Daily buffet was good, if you can't find something that you like you are way too picky! Steak house was good-suprisingly good cuts of beef. Japonese was our favorite--good sushi. Crystal was also very nice. Don't forget your pants and a nice shirt-it is required although there were a few slummers who didn't abide by the rules (very tacky) The grounds and facilities are quite pristine and kept in good repair. I'm sure you can find faults but remember you are in Mexico. All in all we would definately recommend this property--you shouldn't be disappointed. Oh yeah.. you can walk to 5th avenue. Out the front doors of the lobby and take right. Takes about 15 minutes through a nice subdivision. Eat at Carboncitos in town. (see restaurant reviews). There is also a shopping plaza to the south (down by the other Riu)

Reviews.Title: “An excellent honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: KCrUwME
Reviews.Content: We are a couple, mid-20s that just returned from Playa del Carmen and a stay at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. We used BestDay Travel for transfer to and from the hotel and they provided excellent service, were on time and very courteous. Arriving at the hotel we found a beautiful manicured property with an amazingly beautiful lobby. We walked though the other Riu properties nearby and the only one that compared in regards to the property was the Riu Palace Mexico. We were great with drinks and were checked in and up to our room within minutes. The halls did have a distinct odor from the humidity. The rooms were very nice, the bed was on the firm side as per other reviews on Trip Advisor. They were very clean and the balcony was excellent. After leaving a tip for our cleaning lady she made beautiful sculptures with the towels which were very nice. We went on one excursion through Edventure Tours, the #1 rated thing to do under Tulum on here. It was absolutely the best part of our trip and I recommend checking out their review. The buffet was excellent but did get old after a while as it seemed as though little changed. The reservation restaurants were excellent, we enjoyed the presentation, service, and food. Our favorite was the Mexican. Drinks were always being offered and arrived quickly. The staff was always friendly and said "hola" every time you walked by. The pool was very nice and we never had a problem finding a place to sit. The prime spots did get reserved early in the morning. The beach was beautiful white sand, although the "beached whales" for erosion prevention were unsightly, they did allow much better wading and swimming on the windy days. One very nice thing about the Riu is being so close to both the city of Playa del Carmen and the end of the hotel area. We walked down south past all the hotels (2 miles maybe?) and felt as if we were on a new beach entirely. It was positively beautiful with jungle on one side and the ocean on the other. Well worth the walk and remember to take your camera. The town of Playa del Carmen was ok. We were not fans of the shop owners being aggressive trying to get you to come look at whatever they were offering, but it is Mexico. It was still worth going and seeing the different stores but we bought very little. If you get a chance get up in the morning for the sunrises. I saw three of the most beautiful sunrises on the beach of this property. I would absolutely recommend this resort to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing time at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJr
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from December 15 until the 22nd. It was our first time at an all inclusive and we did have a fantastic time at this hotel. The food is good -- there is a wide selection of things to eat at the buffet, and every night is a different 'theme' so that the food isn't the same each day (during the day, the steakhouse is a buffet by the beach). The specialty restaurants which we tried, on the other hand, were mediocre at best. Chili's steakhouse served a steak of average taste and quality, yet the service and atmosphere more than made up for what was missing in terms of taste. It was a pleasure drinking San Gria and eating a plate full of seafood, while we waited for our entrees to arrive. The Mexican restaurant was my personal favourite. The burritas (though deep fried) were very good. They have a selection of appetizers that you go up and help yourself to, but for the most part, they are the same items that you can get at the buffet (mostly fried foods, see photo we posted for the mexican appetizer buffet spread). The Japanese restaurant was the least impressive of the three restaurants, yet the large plate of sushi was very good. I had chicken as an entree and it tasted like something I could whip up in 10 minutes, in a rush, when I'm at home. It was basically chicken smothered in a bottle of sweet chili sauce. Those are the only 3 speciality restaurants we tried (there is Krystal, which is more fine dining and people said was good, and the Brazilian steakhouse which others also raved about, but based on the menu, we figured we'd be just as happy eating at the buffet (i.e. different kinds of sausages and chicken breast or chicken leg). We typically didn't stay for the desserts at the dining restaurants, as we found they were identical to the desserts served at the buffets, except the presentation on the plate was nicer (the japanese had different desserts, such as fried icecream which wasn't at the buffets). We preferred to sample a little bit of each of the desserts at the buffet, rather than wait for one kind at the restaurant. The chocolate fountain with marshmallows at the buffet was excellent and a real treat each night! The diet pepsi (aka Pepsi Light) is out of this world! The white, sandy beach and the clear, blue water is absolutely stunning. There is ample shade available as well. There are hammocks on the one side of the beach (the man-made part) which are so relaxing to lay in with a pina colada in hand. No complaints. There are huge sand whales in the water, though they did not impact negatively on our experience at all. In fact, these sand whales seemed to break the waves, making swimming more pleasant. During the first half of our trip, the resort was not full at all, and it was very easy to get beach loungers by the pool or beach with little trouble at any times of the day. This was also true during the last half of the week, when the resort was at capacity, which was great as we had read other resorts where if you didn't "reserve" your spot early in the morning, you woulnd't have anywhere to lay. Our one concern was that, upon checkin, you are given a "towel card" in order to collect a beach towel each day. When you return each day, you get your card back. At the end of your stay, you return the cards. If you lose the cards, you pay $20US for a new one. We were concerned that if we left our towels around and went for a swim, the towels would be taken, but this never happened. The beach is wonderful, and the only "bad" thing about the beach is how guests treat it. There are cigarette butts everywhere, and oftentimes, guests will not bother to clean up after themselves (i.e. leave their empty glasses or bottles on the beach, expecting somebody to pick up after themselves). If you want to be picked up after because you feel that is what you paid for, at least leave your empty contents on one of the tables so that it is easily visible, rather than throwing it in the sand. The hotel is really beautiful, though I would not reccommend it for those wanting a romantic getaway. There were many obnoxious (and dare I say, sadistic) children running around who were rude to both staff and other guests while their parents looked on or were not around. When I say obnoxious, I am referring to such behaviours as being disrespectful of other guests in their attitudes and overt rudeness; when I say sadistic -- I saw groups of children throwing sand and things at birds; this was both in the outdoor lunch buffet restaurant and in the sea. While children do play, having to watch where one sits/stands/walks because one's bratty children are throwing sand is not fair to everyone else. Another kid was smacking the ping pong paddles against the table every time the other kid got a point, ruining the paddle. Another kid was throwing sticks around and hitting various people standing around the beach while his mother was playing the darts tournament. If you are a parent and plan on staying at any resort with your kids, please teach your kid some manners so that they don't ruin/annoy other guests vacation. The rooms were good, which the following exceptions. Some of the rooms (unfortunately, the one we stayed at), had an old-school lock-and-key safe rather than newer safes where you program in a code. Therefore, we had to carry a key around with you at all times, which is a bit of a pain when going swimming, unless you are comfortable with leaving your stuff by your chair. If you lose the key, there is a fine (i think $50 or $100). Another complaint would be the fact that the hallways are quite noisy (walls are thin). We were woken up in the early morning daily (6-7am) with either kids screaming in the hallways, or other vacationers wheeling their luggage to/from their rooms. Because the floors are concrete, you can really hear the wheels rolling and it is LOUD. There is a notice in the rooms to be respectful after 11pm and not make a noise in the hallways, but when groups of people come in from a night out late, they do tend to talk loudly to each other in the halls.
