Also, you can hear when neighbours (either beside or above you) are showering, in the washroom, etc etc. One neighbour either had food poisoning or drank too much, because we heard him vomitting while laying on our bed. Once again, if you are a parent, please tell your children to use their whispering voices until they are outdoors at least. This was quite a nuisance and did affect our experience as well. The last thing we suggest is - whenever you leave or enter your room, make sure the door is closed and locked. At least for our room, you had to give it a good pull in order to close it, as sometimes, we'd think the door was closed but it was actually a crack open. Also, when you leave your room, give the handle a pull and make sure it is locked, as it should lock automatically when closed. One time, we tried the door and it was still unlocked. The entertainment was consistently excellent on all levels. Our experience therefore is not "excellent" (five star) though it was better than average, making it a four star trip for us. Next time, we may try an adults only resort since we did find that many kids were extremely disrespectful, lacking in manners and appropriate behaviour. Yet, it must be stated that there were some very cute and well behaved kids as well. As you can see, the comments and criticisms above were either as a result of the hotel, or a result of the guests. Please do your part and treat the resort as you would your own home.

Reviews.Title: “We made the best of it--not enough variety for us”
Reviews.Author: adbradley
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu for 5 nights and six days. We are in our mid 20s and are moderately active with medium to high expectations of a resort. Airport/travel: We flew NWA and had a direct flight from MSP airport—I recommend this-its worth the extra money. Its about a 4 hour flight and then a 50 minute ride to the Riu—that was kind of hard because we just wanted to be there already, but it was fine. The Mexican airport is nice—as we were waiting to fly back home, we ate at margaritaville—very expensive!!! We paid $35 for two hamburgers and fries and a bottle of water—BRING LOTS OF SNACKS for the way there AND back!!!!! Staff: Very friendly—always greet you with “hola!” Always offering you a drink on the beach or in the restaurants. Deci was especially accommodating in the buffet and Krystal restaurant. Most of them speak English (with the exception of the housekeeping/maintenance staff we think) so you won’t have to brush too much up on you Spanish. The entertainment staff weren’t as enganging as the Sandlals resort in Montego Bay, but it was still fine. Keep in mind, Sandals Montego Bay, Jamaica is the only all-inclusive we have to compare to the Riu. Food: 5 nights was maybe a day or so long as we got sick of the food quickly. We liked the Japanese restaurant the best, but all the buffet food began to taste the same after a few meals. Breakfast was the only buffet we really enjoyed. The snacks in the sports bar were not good. Be sure to make reservations for the specialty restaurants between 12pm and 3pm—you can make reservations for two days at a time even though the pamphlet only says one. Resort: The property is beautiful-lush vegetation, lots of lights, gorgeous lobby, etc. Well maintained grounds… Room: However, our room was very musty and each night that we went to bed, our sheets were damp. I know that going to Mexico is different than living in Minnesota, but when I pay for a five star hotel, I like to sleep on dry sheets. Our shower smelled musty and pretty gross all around, but our balcony was very nice. We were switched rooms on our first night there because our keys didn’t work. We walked back and forth between the front desk and our room several times because our keys continued to not work. The manager was supposed to contact us about this and never did. We weren’t able to get into our room on 6 separate occasions. And one other note…we still can’t get the smell out of our clothes, suitcases etc… Beach: Only okay—the beaches in Jamaica are better. The huge sandbags really take away from the senery. We weren’t able to participate in any water activities (snorkeling, kayaking, sailing etc. on the resort) because the yellow and red flags were out for caution and they didn’t allow anyone to use their equipment if the caution flags were up. We had to go elsewhere and pay for activities (discussed below). Activities/Shopping/Shows: The only thing we got to do at the resort is boogy board in the ocean, lay on the beach, play bingo, swim, and go to the nightly shows. The shows were all musical and didn’t really very from one night to the next. The only one we really enjoyed was the Michael Jackson show. We shopped at 5th avenue (walked there and took a taxi back—I would recommend this) and at the Plaza mall located to the left of the resort about 2 blocks down. Shopping really isn’t any cheaper that where we live so we only bought knock off sunglasses and a t-shirt. We booked an excursion right in our resort (I WOUD NOT RECOMMEND YOU DO THIS!!). We paid $139 per person to go on an all day excursion to Xel-ha (water park) and Tulum (Mayan Ruins). We found out later that you can get this same exact trip at the Plaza mall for $90 per person. We got taken for a ride by our resort which was disappointing, but you live and you learn. We enjoyed Xel-ha and would go there again if back in Mexico-it was a 45 minute drive from Rui, but it was all in all worth it. We got to snorkel, ride bike, jump off a cliff, see dolphins, and eat lunch. We didn’t float on the tubes, scuba dive, or walk across the ropes, but it all looked fun. We went to Tulum on the same bus at 2pm and got to see the Mayan Ruins—I would definitely recommend this. It is so gorgeous! The pictures we got are some of the best we took on the trip. Other: I don’t plan to go back to this resort mostly because of the room and the food all tasted the same—we like variety and we really didn’t get it from this resort. We also want to see more places so that definitely plays a part too. I wouldn’t recommend this resort to my best friend. If you have questions or want to see pictures I’d be happy to share.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: PhillyTraveller007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Dec 9th to Dec 13th and had the best vacation ever. The hotel is magnificent and the staff is absolutely friendly and courteous. We arrived at the hotel around 12:30 pm from the airport. We were immediately greeted with drinks and though we arrived before the check in time of 3 pm, we were told that our room will be ready in 5min. Within no time we were whisked off to our room which was spacious and the bathroom had a jetted bathtub as stated in the room description. There was also a liquor dispenser in the room which we never found time to use much as there was always lots of alcohol served every time we went out. The resort itself is beautiful. The walls are decked with magnificent paintings and the ceilings have beautiful carvings. There are magnificent chandeliers in the lobby and the whole resort is artfully decorated. The main area of the resort which has fountains looks especially beautiful at night with the lights on. There are 2 pools and the main pool is really big and has a swim up bar. There are plenty of pool chairs around the main pool and the moment you take a seat you will have someone taking your drink order. The beach at the resort is also very big and beautiful with lots of beach chairs. Most of the reviews complain about the restaurant reservations. We never had a problem with this. You can make reservations for 2 nights at a time. You can do this between 12 and 3 pm everyday. So the moment we checked in we made reservations for 2 of the restaurants. Some of the reviews complained about the drinks not being served enough. I think we were really sick of drinking by the end of our vacation. We tried almost all the cocktails in the menu and the drinks were never watered down. The moment you took a seat at any of the restaurants or bars, someone would immediately come over and take your drinks order. And the moment your glass was half empty you would again have someone asking you if you want more :-) We especially liked the food and the hospitality at this resort. The breakfast spread was the biggest one I had seen. They have something for everyone...and they are open till 10:30am for breakfast so even if you get up late you can always catch up on breakfast. The lunch buffet is also very good. They have a lot of variety but some of the items are repeated on most days during lunch. We did not eat at the buffet for dinner as we always had dinner reservations at the other restaurants. The first night we ate at the Mexican restaurant Agave. The food was really good and there was a huge spread for starters which we especially liked. The second night we ate at the Brazilian restaurant which was a fun experience. The food again was magnificent. We also got to try the Japanese restaurant which again was very classy. We did not have a very good experience at the Chillie’s restaurant however. The food was no doubt delicious but the service was rather slow. At all the other restaurants we were treated to excellent service so this one was a little bit of a let down. Apart from this, every night there was entertainment programmers organized. We enjoyed these lots, especially the Vegas night and the Mexican night. Overall, it was the best vacation we had. There was never a moment to complain. The resort is beautiful and the service staff is excellent. The food is delicious and drinks are plentiful and its total value for money. Don’t go by the bad reviews you have read here. I had read plenty of reviews on trip-advisor about this resort and was a little skeptical about my choice but I am happy I did not take them too seriously and did not change my reservation. You will have a great time at Riu!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lucked out and loved the Apple Square Deal”
Reviews.Author: stupidity79
Reviews.Content: We booked the five Apple Square Deal in the Riviera Maya area about 3-4 weeks before we left. As with all square deals, we did not know our hotel until the morning of the flight -- but the price was at least 35% cheaper than the regular rate. We lucked out and got the Riu Palace -- full sandy beach and five restaurants. We had a great time, and had a very helpful Apple rep, from whom we booked three excursions. The food was great, the service was great, the beach was fabulous, and the excursions went off without a hitch. When visiting the other hotels in the area, many had no beaches, fewer restaurants, and fewer activities (if you're into that sort of thing). We would do it again, with the understanding that we'll probably not get this lucky (by having a full beach). Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cat89Nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 11/8/08-11/15/08. We got a great deal on Orbitz, but I believe it is off season too. We arrived on time. The Cancun airport is very crowded and you have to go through another security check after getting your bags which took about 30-40 minutes. The hallway outside of where you get your bags is full of timeshare representatives. Walk right past them to the outside to get your transportation. We booked transportation on Orbitz (Grayline) for $90.00 round trip. It was a good deal, but we needed to wait over 30 minutes for the bus to come. It took about 50 minutes to get to the hotel from the airport. We were the first to get off the bus. Check in was very good. There was no line, and they did not even request a credit card. We had read about the hard mattresses on previous reviews. Our room was not ready though because they were replacing the mattresses in it when we arrived. So we had to wait a little while to get into our room, but the new mattress was very comfortable so it was worth it! The room was very nice. There is a musty smell throughout the room and the hotel. It is probably due to the climate. It may also be due to some furniture polish they use for the dark wood paneling as there is a lot of it in the hotel. One thing I would have liked in the room would be an electronic safe instead of the key type. The pool area was very nice, but the water was a bit cold. The beach water was warmer. There is less activity on the beach if you want some quiet time. There are not too many locals on the beach selling things like we have experienced in Cabo San Lucas and Puerto Vallarta. The sand whales do take a little away from the appearance of the beach. We walked down to the other Rius (Yucatan, Palace Mexico, and Playacar) and this Riu definitely has the nicest pool and beach area! I would rate the lunch and dinner buffett average. Breakfast buffett was good. Maybe I am just not a buffett person, so we booked all of the speciality restaurants. They were all excellent! Our favorite was the Fusion. We were able to book 2 nights at a time in the lobby area at 12 noon. Arrived at 11:55 and did not have to wait that long in line. We went into town one night for Mexican food and I think we actually had better food in the hotel! They really try very hard and service was excellent so we did feel good about tipping each night! We booked Tulum for a half day tour through an Orbitz representative (Tulum express) in the lobby for $90 for both of us. We left at 8:30 AM and was back at 1 PM. We enjoyed it, but it is hot and crowded. Went in the water at the beach there to cool off. It is a beautiful site and the tour guide was very good, so it was definitely worth it. The day we left our transportation was one hour late (you are supposed to get to the airport 3 hours before your flight). The lines to check in and the security lines were very long (about 45 minutes each), so we had only about 5 minutes left to shop (I had some pesos I wanted to spend) and then they were boarding the plane, but we could have missed our flight! We might consider arriving and departing during the week instead of Sat next time. Overall, the hotel was great and service was excellent ! We had a very relaxing stay! Go and enjoy yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Read this review, it is fair and accurate.”
Reviews.Author: Neverfales
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just returned from a five-night stay at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya, and were, overall, very satisfied with the place and would not hesitate to recommend it to almost anyone. However, as the other reviews clearly state, this place isn't for everyone. Make sense? Keep reading. We took a belated honeymoon with two other couples, and all six of us had been to all-inclusive resorts in the past. A huge, all-inclusive resort in a third-world country dependent on tourism the way Mexico is is never going to be perfect. The RPRM is no exception. The beds are on the firm side (though we slept pretty well even without the "mattress pad" which we requested but never received), the food can be hit and miss, and there are various bad smells to be occasionally encountered in odd places (in the corridors, in the stage area of the large lounge where the dancers perform each night, etc.). This is an inexpensive, all-inclusive resort that is open 24-7, 365 days a year. I would imagine that these resorts tend to "wear out" before they can be thoroughly cleaned and redone. That said, I never found any part of the place to be dirty or even unsanitary. The rooms get musty in the humidity, but not to an unpleasant degree. There is plenty of bottled water, the buffet food is hot enough to stay safe and sheets and towels can be changed as frequently as you wish. The bathrooms are spotless. What RPRM has going for it first and foremost is service. Everyone from the front desk, to the chambermaids, to the waiters and bartenders are sincerely cheerful and thoroughly helpful. I have been to all-inclusive resorts and cruises in the Caribbean and Mediterranean, and the service at the RPRM blew them away. No attitude and tip-soliciting like Jamaica, just pleasant, genuine attention. I brought $60 in ones and fives to hand out in tips and ended up wishing I had brought twice that much. That said, no waiter, bartender or bellhop ever suggested, asked or waited for a tip from me. The waiters and waitresses there seem to work 12-hour shifts, too. We'd see them throughout the day, from morning until midnight. How they maintain that level of friendliness for that long is amazing. On your first morning there, expect a wake-up call from a man in the lobby wishing to confirm your transportation back to the Cancun airport. We had paid for a shuttle to and from the airport, so I was actually glad to hear from him so quickly, and he did make sure our return shuttle was booked and confirmed. The REAL reason for his call, though, was to sell us an "excursion". The lobby of each RIU Palace resort will feature several of these men, sitting on couches with binders of excursion brouchures in front of them in the mornings and early afternoons. They have a legitimate purpose in booking ground transportation for guests, but also receive commisions for booking snorkeling, parasailing, scuba diving, zipline and horseback riding trips for several area excursion companies. I booked a snorkeling trip for our party and was disappointed with it. We had to take a 75-minute van ride over the excrutiatingly bumpy roads of Playa de Carmen--dashing back into other resorts to pick up other passengers. The man who booked the trip for me, "Manuel" told me the trip to Puerto Morelos took 30 minutes. This is not true. It took us 45 minutes to get there via airport shuttle, and that was without making all the stops to pick up the passengers at other Playa resorts (stops that you will always make if you book an excursion, as the same trips are booked at all the resorts). Once we got there, the snorkeling boats were small, the water cold, and the reef scenery was disappointing. I've snorkeled all over the world and understand that reefs never look the way they do in the pictures, but the Palancar reef is particularly gray. It has been designated as a national park recently, and the guides were particularly careful to preserve it by requiring lifejackets (so snorkelers can't dive down and touch the coral) and biodegradable sunscreen. Perhaps under these new parameters, the reef will improve. I would advise booking only those excursions which leave from the beach at RPRM. There is parasailing, jet skiing and scuba diving to choose from. You can learn to scuba dive at the resort. Food at the RPRM is best I've had at an all-inclusive resort. Far better than what I ate at a far more expensive Sandals resort in Jamaica a year ago. The specialty restaurants (Japanese, Mexican, Brazilian, gourmet) book up very quickly, but we found the standby buffet, "Manolo's", had wonderful food. We would have been happy eating there every night, and we know good food. Late night, there are good hamburgers, odd looking hotdogs and bland nachos at the "Sport Bar" which is open all night. The beach is among the best in the Riveria Maya region. We walked almost a mile down from the RPRM through 10-15 other resorts, and didn't find a better stretch of sand than the one we had at our place. The water is wonderful, though sadly devoid of much sea life (lousy snorkeling). The door on our bedroom door would not always lock completely. I was concerned with this at first, but obviously didn't worried too much about it, as I never even called to have it fixed. We had put all of our valuables in the safe and it locked just fine. We never had a problem. Fridges are restocked every day (or more often if you wish) with Corona, soda and bottled waters. The hallways are very loud in the morning. Lots of marble tile and hardwood panels and zero rugs or carpeting will do that. I would advise bringing earplugs if you plan on sleeping in. An Ambien or some melatonin would also help you get better sleep. Overall, I would go back to the RPRM in a heartbeat. Cancun is very accessible to all parts of the U.S. (as there are many flights), the airport is nice and safe, the shuttles are reliable and every person I dealt with with friendly and helpful. I also felt that it was an exceptional value (I paid $2600 for a five-night stay for two people including airfare and shuttle service). My four-night trip to the Sandals in Jamaica would have been over five-grand. That's a no brainer. Best of luck to you and drop me a line with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Travelers Beware!! Big Theft Worries!!”
Reviews.Author: Windsome
Reviews.Content: My family of sixteen recently returned from spending Thanksgiving week at this property. I regret that I am compelled to recommend against visiting there, even though it is a pretty nice all-inclusive beach resort where, if you're lucky, you can enjoy a lovely vacation. Unfortunately, owing to the woeful state of security here, as well as to the indifference of the staff and management, one runs a significant risk of being unlucky, as was my family. Stated simply, a stay at this resort bears a real risk of its participants returning home with fewer belongings than those with which they originally departed. In the normal rhythm of a day at resorts such as this, one puts on a bathing suit and a coverup upon arising, and following breakfast, heads directly for the pool/beach area for most of the day. During those hours, guest rooms are serviced, as one would expect, but are mostly unsupervised. The hotel does provide a safe in each guest room for the protection of valuables, but these safes are miniscule, certainly inadequate for storage of tempting electronic items such as personal laptop computers, etc. The safes are not electronically keycoded, requiring that guests carry a manual key around all day and hope not to misplace it. The "scam" by which we were victimized works this way: When the staff enters one's room for servicing, the door to that room remains wide open at all times. Because several rooms are often being attended to simultaneously, a number of doors are left open at one time, so that any opportunistic individual can enter such a room at will. Generally unnoticed, he or she can then freely help himself or herself to whatever he or she wants. In our own case, incredibly enough, the maid who cleaned our rooms actually happened upon, and observed, or so she claimed, the burglary of my son's backpack, laptop, Blackberry, and other items. The man she claimed she witnessed perform this crime merely acted, she stated, as though he belonged there, and brazenly proceeded to remove a few unimportant things from the backpack to make more room, put the electronics he fancied in, and calmly walked out the door.....with the backpack. I have no way of knowing whether the chambermaid was "in on" this scam or not, whether the alleged burglar, of whom she offered a detailed description, was fictitious or not. I would like to believe that this person is honest, and made an understandable mistake. But, since all this took place when the hotel staff had our room doors wide open, and since the crime was allegedly witnessed by that staff, I have adopted what I think is the understandable posture that the hotel bears some responsibility for our loss, and that we should be compensated accordingly. We travel enough to know that hotels bear expressed limited liability from room theft, but, in our opinion, there exists a qualitative difference between a routine room burglary and one that occurs while the hotel staff renders one's room fully accessible. The hotel apparently sees this differently, and absolves itself of all responsibility beyond filing a police report. We were told that our complaint would be forwarded to Riu's "Customer Services" department for further action. I am skeptical as to whether or not such a department exists, or was invented on the spot to make us go away, but we certainly haven't even been rendered the courtesy of hearing from them, much less any more favorable action. This posting is being offered only to protet fellow travelers. While we can understand how, in innocence, a lapse on the part of possibly honest staff might be made, we cannot accept that the hotel management wishes to separate itself from any related responsibility. Our vacation was ruined, and wound up costing us a couple of thousand more than we thought it would. One might justifiably ask, where was the hotel's video surveillance during all of this? A good quetion, but, as we learned, this property has no video surveillance. So, while I don't wish to endorse criminal activity, if you are a potential hotel guest looking to upgrade your electronics, this is one place where you can do so with apparent impunity. If, on the other hand, you are honest, and just looking for a terrific beach vacation, there are lots of nice all-inclusive beach resorts in Playa del Carmen and you can do better than this one. Give it a pass, and try to find one with better security, unless you're willing to lug all of your nice stuff around with you wherever you go, to the beach, to the pool, to lunch, etc. That's a big price to pay for the kind of trip you're probably hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Saintsfan49
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week stay in this amazing hotel. On arrival the reception staff made us feel very welcome and when we got to our room there was a plate of chocolate coated strawberries from them to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. During our stay the cleaning staff kept the room immaculate, it was cleaned and the towels changed every day. A towel sculpture was left on the bed most days[ one day we returned quite late to find our bed turned down and chocolates left on the pillows]. We went to the Mexican,Brazilian and Steak House alacarte restaurants but mostly used the main buffet as choice of food on offer was excellent . The entertainment was first class especially the night time showsand the bar and waiting staff couldnt do enough for you. The outside areas of the complex were also kept very clean. Our overall impression was of a very well kept and managed complex

Reviews.Title: “A good Stay”
Reviews.Author: TorontoWelltravelled
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at a Riu Palace (the other was in Punta Cana). We had a good time, but found it to be the exact same hotel, same floorplan, same restaurants, etc. The food was great, the only thing they could do better is have more variety for lunch, as it was the same buffet choices every day. The beach was beautiful and good swimming, no seaweed on the beach and the water was warmer than the pool. The pool was huge and beautiful, but was cold and no one was swimming in it, even the swim up bar was empty daily, they do not heat the pool. That was my biggest dissapointment as I love to swim. The hotel is very clean, service is excellent in restaurants and at the bar. We had a few hiccups when we checked in as we asked for a quiet room when we made our reservation, and upon check in they put us in a room above the main theatre where the loud entertainment was held every night until 11pm. I requested a different room and they found us one the next day which was nice and quiet, but they failed to have the bellman move our bags from the old room so we had to go do it ourselves...not a big deal but inconvenient. We also asked for fresh bath towels 3 times one day and they never arrived. But I consider these things minor compared to our overall experience. Riu is a reliable chain, and a good value for the price. We will go back but probably in a couple years as all Riu Palaces are cookie cutter versions of each other, and we like a bit more variety. So we had fun, ate and drank alot, slept well, and met some nice people - so overall a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good place with some problems”
Reviews.Author: scouterbruce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the RPRM in November for 8 days, 7nights. We arrived at the hotel at 2pm on a Friday. We had a good time but there were a couple of problems. First of all I emailed them and asked for a true king size bed on the first or second floor. We were given 2 doubles on the third floor. After rejecting this room, we were given a room on the first floor but had to wait until 5pm. No explanation or apology. Also upon check in I gave them my RIU Class card and they would not accept it. Again, no explanation. After settling in we did have a good meal and a couple of drinks and found them to be of great quality. During our stay we found the specialty restaurants excellent and the buffets were also very good. No complaints about the food at all. We did have a problem one night with housekeeping, We had left our room at 9am and returned at 5pm to find it wide open. Noone around and nothing missing but the door was open. NOT GOOD! Went to the front desk and no help. No suprise. With the exception of the front desk, the most special thing about this resort is the staff. They cannot do enough for you. The resort itseft is super clean, the beach is great and the pool wonderful. The nightly shows are fun, not Vegas, but fun. Overall we had a great time and would go back but I hope they fix the problems before we return.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace - return stay...may be the last”
Reviews.Author: masseytravels
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews everytime I travel and I hope that I can give some advice to those of you that are in your mid-30's celebrating a honeymoon - STAY AT THE PALACE MEXICO.....this resort of all the palace resorts was the most stuck-up place I have been to. We have stayed at top notch resorts..but Riviera Maya is for people over 40, who want to sip champagne and relax. If you are looking for a more upbeat, very nice and enjoyable palace resort go for Palace Mexico... we walked there everyday (which is about 3 blocks south). LOCATION: 1 hour from Cancun Airport (55.00 cab ride or private transfer thru cancun valet for 65.00) It is a 5 minute cab ride to 5th Ave in Playa at the ferry location to Cozumel....FOOD: very bland , good variety each day, but more of the same thing each day.... dont know about the specialty restaurants since we were gone every day between 12:00pm - 3:00pm when they take reservations (which totally suck,,, you pay this kind of money and then cannot eat at the restaurants you wish) ROOM: It was very clean and well made every day... they did not replenish the shampoo and body wash ..ran out and asked for more and it did not get delivered. BUGS -- yes you heard me - BUGS -- small ant like bugs all over everything in the place. I dumped my suitcase in the garage and washed everything when I came home. Oh yeah... room service was hit and miss.. .sometimes you get what you order and sometimes you don't. I ordered food one night and Paco wanted to argue about what I ordered.. like it matters... just give me a Club Sandwich (it is all inclusive) ... well I never got the club sandwich. Again..this was just our experience...I would trade this trip for a cruise anyday. Good luck and you will never see us at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and needs serious improvement”
Reviews.Author: besita74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace this week for 3 nites. It is a very large all inclusive resort that is outdated and I do not recommend spending money here. This is not what I would call a vacation. Also, fyi.....One hour from Cancun airport. CONS The lobby and corridors smell terrible Hardly any rooms offer ocean view if any The phones are from the 1970s no concierge! The sheets are old and grimy (felt itchy in bed) also the beds are 2 twin beds that make a king??!! The food was disgusting, like something you find at Sizzlers (I cannot emphasize this one enough) Drinks including beer are all watered down and carbonated The beach is littered with dirty napkins and cigarette butts, the entire resort is not clean at all. PROS Some of the staff are very sweet So far we did not get food poisoning 5 minute cab ride to downtown Playa del Carmen which is cute Don't waste your time or money!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but ........”
Reviews.Author: Sandrarw
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two weeks at this hotel, and had a really lovely, relaxing holiday. The hotel itself is beautiful, and very well kept. The staff were all excellent, with nothing being too much trouble for any of them. The room was kept spotlessly clean, with clean towels every day, and most days towel sculptures left on the bed. Our mini bar was always fully stocked every day, and as a previous reviewer said, we had more beer when we left, than when we arrived!! With regards to the bed - we had no problems. We found the bed to be very comfortable, and we even got a new mattress after a few days!! The corridor could be noisy, but only occasionally when other inconsiderate guests decided they had to speak really loudly coming along the corridors. It wasn't really a problem! How anyone can say the food in this hotel is not good is beyond me. What do people want? The food here was excellent, and as far as I could see there was something for everyone. Okay lunctime could be a bit repetive, but after a huge breakfast, didn't really need to have lunch every day! We tried two of the a la carte restuarants - the Mexican and the Brazilian. The Mexican was really good, but the Brazilian wasn't really our cup of tea. People complain about the portions in these restuarants being too small - we thought they were about right. I can see how some might think so when you consider the amount of food piled onto plates in the buffet (and then left untouched). WE had not difficulties booking the a la carte restuarants. Went up at 12, stood in line for a bout 5 minutes, and booked for that same evening. There are TVs in every room with a good variety of programmes to watch. They are in the process of all being changed to plasma screens! Can't comment on evening entertainment as we didn't bother with this. My only problem with this hotel, was the beach. At first glance it looks great - even the sand bags don't detract. In fact they created quite a nice swimming area. However, on closer inspection, the beach was a bit grotty in places!! Why do smokers not use ashtrays instead of stubbing cigarettes out in the sand! I thought to start with ashtrays weren't available, but then I did see some guests with ashtrays so there really is no excuse for this! It really does make the beach look quite dirty when all around are fag ends!! There was also old straws, napkins, empty cups, and even broken glass on the beach! It really was a shame as it could have been a really lovely beach area if it wasn't for this. Okay there weren't alot of bins around, but if you walked a few yards you could find one to put your rubbish in! It it wasn't for this, I would have no hesitation in giving this hotel 5 stars. With regards to waiter service at the beach, this was available, but the only time we used it, we felt pressurised into tipping as one particular waiter made it obvious he wanted a tip by hanging around until we gave him one. Well, we thought why not, at least he will come back again - wrong!! We never saw him again until one day a member of the management team was hanging around the beach area, then he came to see if we wanted anything. I should point here, though, this was the only time in the two weeks we spent at the hotel, we felt we had to tip. At no other time did any waiter, or member of staff make us feel they were working for tips - quite the opposite in fact, and we left tips at the end of our stay for the good service we received. The area of Playacar where the hotel is located is a lovely area. We walked around it a couple of times - it is bigger than you think!! It took us just over an hour to walk around the area. Play del Carmen is a 15 minute walk away and is worth the walk - try to go early in the morning or in the early evening when it is not quite so hot! Anyway, would I go back here. Probably as apart from the beach area (the water was lovey by the way - could get a bit choppy though - and you could see fish swimming around your feet occasionally), we really liked this hotel and its location, and who knows maybe we were just unlucky with the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! You must go!”
Reviews.Author: Lucie777
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Our experience was wonderful. We have traveled alot and this all inclusive thing you can really get spoiled with. The hotel was beautiful! I felt like I was really living it up. The pools were beautiful and I didn't find them cold. How can you go wrong sipping on a pina colada in the pool jacuzzi! I never had a problem getting a lounge chair on the beach and when the sun is too hot you sit under palm trees and look at the aqua waters! People have said there is no beach there-I disagree. It is not a long stretch that goes for miles but there is a beach there and it was a blast to go in the water especially when it got windier the last few days of our stay. The waves crashed in and you could ride them. People, this is a gorgeous place. Don't believe the bad reviews. I found the hotel the best of all the Rius in the area. It was very clean. Our room was always promptly kept clean and stocked and we had little surprises of towel figures on our bed. I did not meet one staff member who didn't smile and say ohla or bend over backwards to please us. Our favorite meal was the steak house and the evening buffet. There was entertainement every night. The Mariachi night was the best. They had fake casino games one night and the staff were a hoot. A short $5 dollar taxi ride to Playa del carmen was fun. Just enjoy the people, the town is so much fun. I would recommend taking a side tour to Chichen Itza. It is something everyone should see. We booked with Apple Vacations and were very satisfied with their tour. It is a long day but our tour guide made it so much fun. We even got to see some of the Mayan villages on the way home. You will never complain again about life after you see how these people live. I guess I would describe this vacation as a cruise on the ground. You get food and drink anytime you want it without opening your wallet. You get the freedom to lay all day on the beach or take fun excursions without time restriants. You bond with the staff and fall in love with the wonderful people in the Riviera Maya. Don't take the little things so seriously. Get to know the people and culture, enjoy the sun and aqua waters, make wonderful memories. This is the place to do just that!! It was a little bit of heaven on earth!!

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at a Riu Palace-this one top drawer as well”
Reviews.Author: NorthofTorontoBruce
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Riu Palace, stayed week Nov.10-17th. We travelled with another couple, we are in our early 40's. All comments from other reviews regarding the high quality of service, hotel amenties, grounds and staff are shared by us. The food is exceptional, I can find no merit in anyones comments that they disliked the buffet food. There are numerous varieties, different international/country theme nights and simply there has to be something you like being prepared at every meal. I have read reviews were people have said there was nothing to eat. I am not sure what their diet is at home, but, there is plenty of quality dishes. I believe the odour is a fact of life in that area and no matter where you went on or off hotel grounds you occasionally smelt it, so what, when walking through any city in North America and/or out in the farm land/country, do you not get odours there as well? Only complaint would be against the rude guests. I cannot understand, how, if you choose to go down to the beach after dark for some fun, you would need to leave your drink glasses (not plastic, but real glass), garbage, tissues on the beach. Early morning walks would have the beach area littered with the previous nights escapades. There are ample garbage cans and tables right off the beach that one would think you could put your refuge in. The guests that choose to walk the beach, then ignore the mulitple fresh water showers to wash the sand off their feet also baffle me. There would be trails of sand all around the pool, right on into the doors and up the stairs into the main lobby. There are plenty of black plastic ashtrays all around that you can take to the beach, but, there would be people just using the beach as an ashtray or there would be crushed smokes on the walkways, several feet from an ashtray. The staff as others have said are constantly cleaning up, so they would always clean up after the rude ones and then back to general cleaning duties. People have written that the resort is not a five star. Well, they are wrong, it is in fact an excellent facility, we would not hesitate to reccommend it to anyone. If people continue to treat the place like a garbage dump, it will no doubt erode in time. The beach is fine, the sand whales as they are called are necessary. We stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico last year but due to the strong waves/minimal beach, swimming was tough. We walked down and saw that they are there now as well so I'm sure it helped out. The beach here is good for swimming. We walked and had a drink/lunch at the other area Riu's. This place was by far visually the nicest. Did the usual tourist things, parasailing, snorkling and used the personnel right attached to the beach infront of the hotel, all was worth the money. The tour guys set up in lobby, provide good insight as to area excursions. We did the Tulum Extreme, $96 per person. It is an 8-4 day, van ride to jungle, repelling, zip line, snorklin in a cavern, lunch provided, off to the ruins/beach. Good day overall. I canvassed other people offering the adventure during the stay and the price was always within 5-10 bucks of what we paid. So you can shop around but don't waste to much time. We haved stayed at the Riu Palace in Cabo San Lucas and as stated above the Palace Mexico and now this one. All worthwhile, but this one is a flagship. Unless you are the most critical hotel guest or a chronic complainer/whiner, then there is no reason why you would not have at least a very good time, but would suggest you would say excellent upon the completion of your stay. Good luck and have fun if you choose this facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveler100
Reviews.Content: I have to say that any complaints concerning the grounds and the service are hard to understand. The hotel and the surrounding area was kept up very well and the service was incredible. I've traveled a lot and have never been to a place that has the service that the Riu has. Beach service for a tip was exceptional, and we were continually asked for orders while around the hotel. Excellent service!! The food was decent, but most of the specialty diners were skimpy on the portions. Very small steaks and small portions at Japanese. The dinner buffet was pretty good and the lunch buffet was decent but didn't change their menu. a little better than most I guess. The only issue I had with the hotel would have been the same issue I would have had with any hotel on the strip. I understand the beach erosion problems they have since hurricane Wilma, but the speed bumps in the water REALLY detracts from the scenic view. Once the sand returns it will be a geat place, but I'm not sure I wouldn't go elsewhere until it does. These "speed bumps" are all over the place and looks like beached whales from a distance and huge asphalt bumps up close. I would say the average size of these things are about seven feet wide and 40 feet long. Some parts of some are covered up but most are in full view. You won't see any pictures of this. There were around seven of these things in front of us in the water and they are BIG. I walked over a mile on the beach and probably saw at least 50 more of these huge asphalt looking barriers. Really took away from the beauty of the water. I understand the entire area has them now, or is getting them, including the beaches at Cancun. Everything about this hotel gets a five star rating, but the area right now doesn't compare to the beaches at Aruba, Punta Cana or anywhere that has white sand and blue water until the beach erosion issue is solved.

Reviews.Title: “Why do people whinge? It is excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A3B
Reviews.Content: Well, where do I begin. As usual with my reviews it'll probably turn into an essay. As TripAdvisor members we always consult this site when choosing holidays so hopefully this will help others make an informed decision when choosing their next destination. The Riu Palace Riviera Palace Maya exceeded my expectations. My darling wife bought this 11 night holiday as a surprise present to celebrate my 50th Birthday. JOURNEY. Our journey started at Birmingham where we stayed overnight in a hotel to ensure our early check in at the airport. Eventually we found ourselves on a 2 hour bus trip to our plane as the Birmingham plane had developed a 'technical' fault and our replacement plane was in Bristol. Not to complain as I would rather that than, take off only to find ourselves plummeting into the Atlantic!! Nevertheless it was an addition to an already lengthy journey. Upon arrival at Cancun I and a fellow traveller found our padlocked cases had been 'investigated' somewhere en route, the padlocks being nowhere to be found. I had nothing removed as there was nothing of value in my case, sadly the othe case had jewellery removed so be warned about valuables in cases. On arrival the transfer was speedy taking the expected hour, the transfer was by mini bus and effortless not lifting one bag. Arrival at reception was also effortless and the staff fantastic as they realised (without being told as we were 5 hours late) we had been underway for some time ensuring check in was speedy. The hotel itself? The exterior and reception was pretty ruthless in it's attempt to create an impression as my jaw dropped and didn't lift again for a full 5 minutes. 'Palace' pretty much sums it up. THE ROOM? Clean and comfortable.......smell? Hhhhmmmmnnn...yes there was a faint odour....a mix of woodpolish, detergent and maybe damp but, hello people......these are the tropics...try avoiding it?!?!?! The Bahamas was worse. The aircon was pretty ruthless and, is probably mainly responsible for the smell...........but it is only faint and, well, surrounded by this level of luxury, who gave a damn anyway? Not us, the room was immaculate. If any of you really really want to complain........hit the spirits optics harder..........I'm sure enough Tequila will dull your sensory perception. (We visited the original Riu Palace 'Mexico' during our stay and were happier with our choice as the age mix was better aswell as the more modern facilities). The room fridge was topped up daily and, we even ended up with more beer than we started with astonishingly as beer was the one thing we didn't touch!!!!! An American couple who became friends had complained their mattress was hard, next day a new mattress was put in the room. As has been described elsewhere, mattress toppers are readily available on request. The hotel is very well cleaned/maintained and regularly upgraded as, one day we found our room had become home to a new LCD televison replacing what was already a good TV!! One warning, Mosquitos........my legs looked pretty bad after a couple of days..........when entering the room just beware of the flock of the little blighters around the exterior light which zoom into the room as soon as you open the door................the balcony at night is probably also not a great idea. But, the hotel 'mini mart' in the car park sells my new best friend.....'after bite'. DO NOT - EVER - switch off the AirCon, that WILL make the room damp!!!!! FOOD - Mediocre....is one comment I've read on here........NO WAY mediocre..........a more realistic description would be....Superb!!! It always worries me when our American friends bang on about food standards as, well, just TRY getting all inclusive in the States....the food MAY be of a higher standard in the US but, at a price. We tried all the A La Carte Restaurants (except the Brazilian) and, on personal tastes some would be better than others (Sir Oliver's/Krystall easily the best) but, all were really good quality!!! I personally wasn't over happy with the choice at Chilli's for lunch but, convenient for the beach/Pool it was. The food was always cooked to a high standard albeit I found the burgers to be a bit on the 'pink' side for my English tastes. There was always a fantastic choice on offer and, if someone wanted something other than what was on offer, I saw the chefs supply 'one off' dishes plenty of times personally delivered to the waiting diners!! FACILITIES - Don't dissappoint, we needed to iron clothing and, when we found the iron leaked, it was replaced within 10 minutes. Room service........superb..........first couple of days I was a complete pain in the butt, Jetlag causing my ordering of coffee to begin at 03:30am...............delivered to the room within 15 mins....staff...........too happy to have been real when greeted by my grumpy face peering out at them. Tried a room meal late in the holiday and it was superb. Another great thing was that, although check out is noon, the all inclusive only ends when you actually leave the hotel. STAFF - Can't say enough good things about the staff. The entertainments crew worked like troopers trying to motivate people into activities, they just seemed to go on and on until finally, the evening entertainment was over at 23:00 ish each evening. The Hotel staff all work a 10 hour split shift 6 days a week!!! So if anyone wants to complain about the hardworking and eternally cheerful staff.......think carefully about it. I have never, met such a cheerful, courteous, unflustered and generally friendly bunch of people in my life, I now feel like saying 'Hola' to everyone I meet. My special thanks go to Alfredo, Santos and Luis for, each evening ensuring my glass never seemed to get empty. How the hell they managed to remember what I was drinking I'll never know given how many people there were drinking!! Tips.......at no stage did we feel under pressure to provide tips.............the staff do not 'play for tips' either, it was more, a pleasure for me to give a tip on the odd occasions that I did. Note to the USA - STOP running around tipping everyone across the world....unless they deserve it. I saw Americans tipping barmen for doing NOTHING more than their jobs in the Bahama's then here in Mexico too, they have to serve you........they're stuck behind the damned bar!!! The waiters are the ones doing the running and, even then they are that quick they sometimes miss a tip because they're not still long enough. When, however they do receive a tip, they are most grateful but, if you guys keep throwing dollar bills at people it will become 'expected' and not a 'Tip'. You know this as that's exactly what already happens at home in the US and look where it's got the poor staff....decreased wages as tips take the place of your basic wage!! THINGS TO DO............... HOTEL BEACH........powder white sands, azure blue waters..............I'm going to cry if I carry on! Oh yes, the 'whales' to slow erosion, not a problem for us, they've weathered nicely into the surroundings, anyway, enough people were on them using them for diving practice to prove they weren't a problem to the majority. Once more, drinks service too but, not always to surf side unless you grabbed a passing waiter and bribed him to come that far from the poolside bar..........still, 20 pesos for about 8 to 10 visits, no problem. EVENING ENTERTAINMENT - great.............VERY professional but, I wish after the organised entertainment ended, they could have left a DJ on so we could have enjoyed a bit of a club dance!!! The walk to the neighbouring Riu for their disco was just too much effort that late at night. Excursions - shop around in the lobby and at the PlayaCar Plaza for best deals.........cheap is not always best especially for Chichen Itza which is a long day where you want the comforts of a good bus. Did XEL-HA...just had to....................so do you, really good albeit an obviously slick tourist machine when you're there. Did 'The Jungle Place' having read about it on TripAdvisor. There is no excursion so Reception booked us a taxi for $US130 for the day..................extremely good value as Roberto the driver fed us a wealth of info about life in Mexico. He didn't even get flustered when we found ourselves lost in the middle of the jungle having missed the entrance due to a large piece of machinery being parked across the gateway during the laying of new watermains. I would recommend this visit, Heidi and her husband Joel do excellent work here looking after their Spider Monkeys which are all orphaned/rescued and are unable to return to the wild. They don't want to have huge excursions to their site choosing instead to slot small parties by appointment only in as, the monkeys and their privacy come first. The taxi then took us to Tulum where he waited while we realised sadly, we should have chosen to take our swim gear as we stood numbly staring at one of the world's top ten beaches below us!!! Oh yes, the ruins were interesting too! Did Chicken pizz.....sorry, Chichen Itza having thought about the length of the day first.......glad we did as the site is awesome. Pity about the rows of vendors...........and our total lack of English prowess to haggle massive discounts with them. HAD TO DO - Senor Frog's in Playa Del Carmen....what a hoot............laugh? I nearly passed the cigarettes round!!(English joke). Oh yes, bought the T Shirts!!! Unfortunately, due to massive 'shot' intake at Senor Frog's that night, we missed saying goodbye to our American friends on their last night and, we slept through the departure of our last excursion the speedboat 'Fast blast' experience. Never mind, the beach was good enough!! So, having battered on at length...the summary Hotel, Fantastic. Staff, Fantastic. Facilities, Fantastic. Staff, Fantastic. Staff Effort, Fantastic. Food, Fantastic. Staff, Fantastic. Time, Fantastic. Staff, Fantastic. Friends, Fantastic, thanks to Rick and Ashley for becoming our 'friends from California'. Thanks to everyone at the Riu Palace and oh yes.... "We'll be back!!!"

Reviews.Title: “Smelled Like Vomit”
Reviews.Author: bekkita21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace for a wedding and were told it was a five star hotel. The rates were pretty high around $300 a night for most people in our party. We got it for about $200 a night. The food was mediocre, except the Krystal Restaurant which was decent. The buffet was ok, but got boring. The main problem was the nauseating smell of vomit in all of the hallways/ common areas. It was as if people were throwing up all over the place and we couldn't figure out why it smelled so badly. Everything was just ok, but not 5 star. Beware of bugs while in Mexico. Also, they were in the process of changing out the notoriously bad mattresses. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Go to the RIU...”
Reviews.Author: CONES3333
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel,great employees,value for money...go and relax,dont be toooo picky,you will have a ball.Playa is an awesome place to visit,explore and meet new friends from around the World . My kudos to the RIU family .

Reviews.Title: “Wedding of my dreams”
Reviews.Author: Emm76
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 10 day stay (and wedding) at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. It was beautiful, clean and the service was like I've never experienced before. I've traveled to many islands (St. Johns being my favorite) but I was worried about having a wedding at a resort thet ran on "island time" and after some research this hotel had everything we wanted without being a huge, cheesy mega-resort. We had 32 guests attend and we all had a great time. The food was great, the size made it comfortable and intimate and it was very clean. I was concerned about the sand bags. Trust me this beach is breath taking. The sand bags look like rocks and can be climbed. They break waves further out so in my opinion they actually added to the beach. It was beautiful. The people are what really make this place paradise... all the staff and wedding coordinators were wonderful. They could not do enough for you. I had a hard time not knowing what to expect. I like to plan things out but once I met with the wedding coordinators I had no doubt that they would make it perfect ...and they did. A special thanks to Rebecca and Diana who made sure every detail of my overplanned wedding was perfect. I packed 3 suitcases worth of wedding decorations and welcome bags and the hotel set everything up with a smile. The DJ was worth the money and better than most in the states (Very advanced equipment, kept things rolling and had everyone dancing all night). The wedding was beyond my expectations. I'll post some pictures soon. Feel free to contact me with wedding questions. We will without a doubt be visiting this resort again!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: UKtoDC
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I just returned from this hotel having stayed there for our honeymoon from Nov. 3rd to Nov. 9th. This is a fabulous hotel and great value for money, definitely a great option for newly wed's like ourselves! We have been on several all-inclusive vacation all over the world, but this one I would definitely recommend! The hotel was ALWAYS clean and immaculate, with grounds keepers and hotel staff working around the clock tending to the gardens, sweeping up sand that had been dragged in from the beach and keeping it looking great! The activities staff also worked incredibly hard to provide entertainment around the clock, with games and fun activities during the day and shows every evening. The shows were great, we saw several and they are definitely worth checking out. Don't expect to see Broadway style productions but they did a fantastic job given the small stage they had to work with, and there is free table service too with the waiters constantly bringing you new drinks if you would like one, my glass was rarely empty before a new drink came round for me. If you partake in the activities or the evening performances I would encourage you to leave them a tip at the end (it's not expected for you to do so), they work really hard and probably don't earn much. Same for the bar staff in the lobby bar and at the pool bars, the service is very fast and the drinks are great quality with top shelf liquor, and they're very friendly! The room maids always kept the rooms in top shape too! We did not use the spa service but we did get a couples massage in town for about 600 pesos (about $50) total for both of us for an hour, it was great! 5th Avenue is a good place to look for these. 5th Ave is also a great place to do some shopping and take in a nice restaurant. Although the hotel is all-inclusive, we like to get out and about and try some of the local fare sometimes too. Speaking of restaurants at the hotel, check out the specialty restaurants they offer, they're great! The buffet was always good too, but their Mexican restaurant (Agave) was brilliant! The best of them though has to be Sir Oliver, fantastic meal in there, worthy of any major restaurant! You have to make reservations for these restaurants and they sell out fast so book as many as you can when you arrive. The beach was great as was the pool area and pool bar! There are several shaded areas too if you don't want to be right in the sun. We rented a car and took a day trip to Tulum, Cobo and Chichin Itza, it's the only way you can see all three in the same day and not get rushed. You can book organized tours to each place if you prefer (well worth going to see the ruins) so do that if you don't want the stress of driving yourself, although it was pretty easy to do that and very cost effective. All in all, this is a fabulous hotel! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Mexicans!”
Reviews.Author: Sally-7
Reviews.Content: We booked with Thomson for an 8 night stay. The hotel itself is luxurious, the rooms are very spacious and clean, and the lobby/bar areas are stunning. The mexican staff were always helpful, efficient and friendly and counldn't do enough for us. The main buffet restuarant had an endless choice of high quality food - something for everyone, and something different every evening. We ate in the Japanese restaurant which was great, the Mexican restaurant which as good and "La Oliver" which was a Fusion restaurant with lovely food and very posh. The choice of restaurants was great as it gives you a varied dining experience. The "Plaza" with a live Mexican band was great - it was a shame when they finished and the usual hotal cabaret started at about 10 o'clock. The only slight disappoinment was the beach area. We did have the impression that this area was quieter but it was just one hotel after another. We did manage to find a quieter area but only after walking about a mile along the beach. So don't expect any secluded bays or beaches within easy walking distance. We went out on the cattamarans which was great (although the watersports people try their best to get you to pay for jet-skis or parasailing). The boats, body boards etc are all complimentary at the hotel. We didn't see anything of the 'real' Mexico. All the main attractions nearby did look a bit 'touristy' and other sites would mean a few hours travelling. Also, Playa del Carmen is a whole mile of shops and people trying to sell you things. Overall, the hotel, people and standard of service and food were excellent at the Riu Palace, and we had a very relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMaggie
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a wonderful place to stay for a fully relaxed vacation. The food was great - The Specialty restaurants were a real treat. Best of all the service is A+++. The staff really makes you feel that your comfort and enjoyment is priority one. We stayed two weeks and just returned on November 7, 2008. The rooms and surroundings are very clean, the grounds are beautiful, the beach is very nice and what great pools!! If you are looking for a great all inclusive resort - this is the one. We could not have asked for more perfect vacation accommodations or staff. There is nightly live entertainment, adult day activities and children's activities. We cannot wait to return. RIU is the place to go..

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: axonic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 27/09/08 to 11/10/08 and had a wonderful time. This was our fourth time at a Riu, but a first for a Riu Palace. We find some of the negatives posted by other reviewers hard to believe. The service from all the staff is second to none. Our room was spotless, as was the rest of the hotel whether it be the hotel buildings or the grounds, everything was immaculate. We tried all of the resturants, our favourite being the Japanese and Gourmet and had no problem with reserviations. Other nights, obviously, we used the buffet restaurant which fulfilled all of our needs. So much choice, I think if you do not find something to suit you must be an extremely fussy eater. Everything was cooked to perfection, and as with prevous stays at a Riu, have never had any tummy troubles. Excellent pools and clean beach, the "whales" are not a problem. Plenty of sun loungers both around the pool and on the beach. A few people would reserve loungers early on but we always found a suitable spot, although the hotel appeared to be only half full it may be a problem when full. I noticed on one review someone stated that the pool service was poor, but we did not find this to be the case, in fact the waiters around the pool worked incredibly hard and as soon as we had finished a drink a waiter would appear asking if you would like another. Same drinks service on an evening, Islas made superb cocktails etc. in the lobby bar. Again, a few reviews stated that drinks are weak, but we did not find this to be the case, if you like your drinks stronger you could always ask for an extra shot. Did not watch many of the shows at night but the ones we did were quite entertaining. Animation team work really hard, joined in a few of the games during the day and had a great time. Hired a car and drove to Chichen Itza one day. Set off about 7.00am arrived at about 10.00am had no problems getting there and back. We used the toll road 180, the journey was a bit boring but well worth it. Amazing place, although we had seen pictures on the internet beforehand, nothing prepares you for the size of El Castillo and all the other ruins. Be prepared to be pestered by the people selling their wares, they are all over the site. Also visited ruins at Tulum, smaller than Chichen Itza but well worth a visit. Make sure to take insect repellent, mozzies are rife. The only problem we had was with the fridge,on restocking it the door was left slightly open, therefore the ice box was solid. Reported this to reception and it was dealt with promptly. We would definitely return to this hotel again, so ignore the negatives of the minority of reviewers and have a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “One word. FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: JillybeanBuffalo_NY
Reviews.Content: I have read some of these reviews, and have seen some VERY VERY picky ones. Therefore, I felt the need to share our experience. Bottom line-this is PARADISE. In paradise, the glass is ALWAYS FULL. If there was something not up to par, we didn't notice. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was far beyond our expectations. My husband and I were there for our honeymoon. Sadly, Mexico was having a very rainy season. We made the best of it. This hotel made it easy: The second the rain stopped, the staff was right there to dry off the chairs so you could sit down, and get you a fresh drink. They were tireless. Almost immediately, the staff knew our names and what we liked to drink. The drinks were awesome. The pool is gorgeous. The beach is really neat. You can lay in the sand under the trees, or down by the water. Because there are different specialties in each restaurant, you have to go with what you like. The Mexican Restaurant was WONDERFUL. The hotel is just beautiful. Everyone we talked to there was in agreement, that this hotel was great. The front desk staff were very kind and very helpful. Also, you have access to all the RIU resorts in the area, which are within walking distance. Since this was our honeymoon, we wanted the hotel to be just right, and it was even better than that. We had no problems, thought the place was gorgeous and enjoyed our stay tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: lumaxx007
Reviews.Content: Overall the Palace was amazing. The food was excellent and the service outstanding. The beds were firm, but I had no problems sleeping on them. The only drawbacks or things that I would change would be to upgrade the in room safes to electronic instead of the key. And an exhaust fan would have been nice in the bathroom. In my opinion if these were the only things that I could come up with to improve my overall experience, I would recommend this resort to anyone staying in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya Is More Than Amazing!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TN25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the most wonderful and blissful honeymoon I could ever imagine! Our stay at the RIU was excellent and I have ZERO complaints. We booked through a travel agent, who in turned went through Apple Vacations. I had checked reviews on the RIU for 2 months prior to our stay and found the 3 most common complaints were: Smell, Uncomfortable Mattresses and trying to get specialty restaurant reservations. Trust me, if you want to be nit-picky, you will find something to complain about no matter where you stay...the smell is nothing out of the ordinary for any resort in a climate like Mexico's. As someone else mentioned, you will have that smell no matter where you stay and believe me, that is true...as this was my 2nd trip to Mexico, different resort on the first trip. We didn't even notice the smell until we got home and smelled our clothes!! And, it will launder out of your clothes when you get home. We slept perfectly fine on the mattresses...however they did switch the mattresses out for brand-new ones two nights before we left. (They were doing this throughout the hotel). Getting reservations for us was NO problem AT ALL!! We ate everywhere except the Agave Mexican restaurant and everything was decent. If I were going to do it over again, I would pick two places I wanted to try and eat the buffet the remainder of the time because the buffet is excellent and you can dine when you want rather than trying to make a seating at a specialty place...which is usually either 6:30 or 8:30 each night. The service and friendliness of the staff is top-notch. EVERYONE is friendly, easy to communicate with, and eager to please. They are constantly working around the resort to make it impeccable. While we were there, they were even painting faded spots on the building (which were few and far between) and sprucing up the outdoor furniture. The nightly entertainment is completely entertaining and the staff work very hard to make it that way. No, it isn't broadway but no one should expect it to be!! The "sand whales" on the beach are not at all an eye-sore as some people will say and if you walk down the beach to resorts beside the RIU Palace, they are there too. As a matter of fact, we were glad they were there as the Red Flags were out our entire stay and they kept the waves from knocking you down everytime they hit. Had it not been for them, we couldn't possibly have enjoyed being in the ocean. Weather (although it was the supposed "rainy season" couldn't have been more pleasant. The only day we saw any rain was the day we arrived and it was in and out in no time. The rooms and hotel are beautiful! Rooms are very spacious, and not at all outdated as I had read. The place inside is truly like a Palace as the name suggests. We were very pleased w/decor and accents of the hotel and our rooms. And finally, Apple Vacations did a wonderful job (contrary to what I had read about them). They were waiting for us at the airport and had us to our hotel w/in 1 hour of our arrival. When we were picked up from the hotel to go to the airport, we rode in a brand new Suburban which was extremely nice. It was just my husband and I and they were right on time picking us up. As far as booking a trip, we did go through them and had zero problems. I do recommend meeting w/them when you get there b/c they will call your room and come by to remind you if you don't! Other than that, everything was a positive! Overall, GREAT HONEYMOON, GREAT RESORT and I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND it to anyone traveling the Riviera Maya!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Estella20
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Riu's over the years but I have fallen in love with the Palace Resorts. This was my third trip to a Riu Palace and I can only say wow!. Beach / Grounds very nice beaches and soft white sand. They do have sand whales along the beach due to damage from the storms but the swimming was still great. There were 2 areas to sit near the beach one level offered lot's of natural shade that is lined with palm trees. The lower level is for the sun lovers like we are. The grounds have a nice set up with it's gardens and fountains. It looks large but you can find most things near the main building like the lobby bar / 24hr sports bar / the bueffet restaurants and some a la cartes are just a few steps down along with the night entertainment area. The other wonderful feature is the courtyard with it's lamp posts and pavillion that provides live music everynight. It had a european feel to it. After dinner it's a great spot to relax with a cappuccino and enjoy the live music Rooms Jr. suite - nice with sunken living room / tub has jets if anyone wants to kick back and soak / double sinks / shampoo dispenser / and all rooms come with liquor dispenser's and a mini fridge stocked daily with bottled water / pop and beer. the superior Jr. Suites give you a view of the fountain walkway for a little extra $$ Food We never tried the a la cartes as we were very happy with the buffet. The themed dinner night's also helped to change the variety of food as well. Lunch buffet is located near the pool area. This was good as well with lot's of variety. Service One of the main reasons I keep coming back to the Riu Palace's is that amazing service that I always get. Jesus and Felix are wonderful and Islas was the crowd pleaser. He always had a smile and entertained the crowd no matter how busy it may have been. The drinks were always made just right. Some properties tend to overkill on the alcohol but Islas and the rest of the staff made them perfect. The staff was very hard working and were eager to please and kept the jokes flowing all week. We would see them early in the a.m and they would still be there at night working with a smile on their faces. Playa del Carmen was close by with lot's to do. Hit the Blue Parrot at night for some dancing or you can shop on 5th Ave. I can't wait to book my next trip back here.

Reviews.Title: “This Is PARADISE!!!!!!! Best place i have ever been!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaerae99
Reviews.Content: First off i would like to start off by saying that if you didn't like this resort......you must be one of the pickiest people alive. Me and my husband went here for our honeymoon this year, sept. 2008. I was so obsessed with getting on trip advisor and researching places before i picked somewhere to go for our honeymoon. Even my husband was like....just pick somewhere! But i wanted our honeymoon to be perfect. I had it narrowed down to a few places....the valentin, the coba, etc.....and i was so extremely happy that i choose riu rivieria maya!!!!!!!!!! We actually saw some of the resorts on our way to our resort because the bus that takes you to the resorts from the airport has to drop off other people to other resorts. I saw some of the resorts i was actually considering and boy was i glad when we drove up to the rivieria maya palace!!! Even the rest of the people left in the bus were like omg! It was definitly like a palace and from the moment you get there to the moment you leave you are treated like true royalty!!!! I have never been so impressed with anywhere in my whole life and i have been to a lot of places!!! It is a gorgeous paradise like resort that is beautiful inside and out!! From the floors and chandeliers, and the grounds, it was all so much to take in and look at! The grounds looked like something off of edward sissors hands as my husband said.....cuz the bushes and everything were so perfectly clipped and kept up. You always saw people cleaning and working. This place was the cleanest and most kept up place!Even my husband who doesn't get excited about much...was very impressed and excited. You just can't quit looking at everything. Ok but anyway and the rooms are also very clean and beautiful....just ask for a bed topper cuz the beds are hard.....but thats how they are everywhere but they had like these mattress topper, you have to ask for one, and it was much better! And they clean your room everyday and have turn down service if you want it. It is so awesome..you go down to the pool or beach and go back up to your room and it is spotless again. They also have 24 hour room service which was awesome...try the cheesecake and chicken tostados! So good! So thats about the rooms and we stayed in a junior suite and it was very nice. Its true that you really aren't in your room that much anyway. So cleanliness, 5 stars, rooms 5stars, and the food and bars, def 5 if not 10 stars! The food and bars are just extrodinary and awesome! There are two buffet style restaurants which you can eat at anytime for all meals. Then there are five restaurants which you make reservations for in the lobby, don't forget to do that betwn. 12-3pm. The restaurants are absolutely fabulous. I have never been or ate at anywhere like this. Best food we have ever had....we liked the mexican restaurant best and the brazilian. But they were all good and you are treated like absolute royalty!! Seriously! The staff waits on you hand and foot all day and night! Next the bars are awesome too! There were like 5 bars and all excellent. The pool bar was awesome and huge....along with the pool which was so awesome...the actual pool has these built in loungers on each end that we loved and then there was another pool that overflowed into the main pool and that was called the infinity pool! So AWESOME!!! Pool was immaculate! ten stars, if you can give that many! Beach was just as great as everything else! Beautiful white sands and the most aqua looking water i have ever seen. i have seen alot of oceans and this was the clearest, greenest, blue ocean i have ever seen i was very impressed. There are loungers everywhere and all you have to do is lay there cuz staff will come up to you and bring you whatever you want. Entertainment........5 stars.....i was so astounded at the staff at this resort.....they are constantly keeping you happy and treating you so well and friendly. They have daytime and nighttime entertainment everyday and it is so fun. They keep you entertained and if you don't want to be invovled then you just don't. It's perfect.......the nighttime entertainment takes place at the stage and nightly bar area outside....so awesome...its like something out of a movie! There is also a hammock area down by the beach that is heavenly and they have spa and massage areas but this costs extra! Nothing else does though. We checked out the other rius to see if we were missin anything....and not at all the riviera maya palace is by far the nicest of all of them!!!! You will not be disappointed i promise!!! There is one thing........whoever you book through will offer you expeditions the first day you get there in the huge lobby and i heard some are excellent but we went on the aquatic expedition and DON"T DO IT!!! The mosqitos will eat you alive. It has nothing to do with the resort. It is seperate vendors that take you. But do not do it....go swim with dolphins or something. =) Well i know this was long.....but i figured after researching for so long..i owed it to trip advisor to put in a excellent review for this place because i can not say enough about it!!! GO! YOU WILL THANK ME!!!!! Oh yeah there is also lots of little cute shopping areas...lobby will let you know where they are! have fun!! WE did and are going back....SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, piece and quiet. Some let-downs”
Reviews.Author: jimmi2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a 4-night vacation at this resort. I will give you the good and the bad as we saw it. First the GOOD: -Beautiful hotel. No doubt best of all the Riu Palace's in that area. Everything looks new. Gardens are perfectly kept.
