The palm trees along the corridor from the lobby to the pool/beach are nothing short of paradisiacal. -The rooms are all large and very nice, even better if you get one facing the garden/pool area. -The main buffet was more than adequate for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The buffet at the Chili’s restaurant by the beach was much better in our opinion for lunch. -Staff is very friendly, always saying "Hola". -The beach is beautiful with the exception of the sand whales. The beach has two main sitting areas, one near the water with no palm trees, full sun blast, and another sub level up one step where there are lots of palm trees and hammocks so you don't have to roast under the sun all day. -The pool was beautiful, we stayed away from it since we prefer the beach, and there was always this LOUD group of Americans hanging by the pool bar as if they owned it. -Older, couple-adult oriented resort. -Night shows are entertaining and fun to watch. Just keep in mind these are NOT professional cabaret-grade/Vegas shows. Now the BAD: -Lomas travel was our on-site agent and transportation provider to the hotel. They packed way too many drops enroute to our destination making our trip from the airport to the hotel over 2 hours long. We booked from Funjets, so if you use them, you will get Lomas Travel...unfortunately. -DO NOT book tours with Lomas Travel!! You will pay through your eyes, and second, if the weather is bad the day of the tour, they don't cancel, reschedule or refund. You paid for the tour, OH YOU WILL GET A TOUR even under torrential rain!! It's that "take your money and run who cares about customer satisfaction" mentality. This happened to us. We booked a tour to Tulun with them, and woke up to a rainy day. Throughout the trip, and at the ruins it was incessant torrential rain. When we got there, no rain gear was provided. They took us from the bus right into the rain. We had to hassle with street vendors for ponchos. All the tour guide had in mind was to sell us these over-priced Mayan pendants of our names stamped in the "Mayan alphabet" to fulfill his "civil duties" (his words), which we turned down. At the ruins, we had to walk a mile under the rain, and through an overflowing river of brown smelly water to get to the ruins. At this point we decided to abandon the tour and go back to the hotel. This was a $30 taxi ride. We ended up not seeing anything. When we tried to get our money back, we hit the typical Mexican trickery slippery wall of "we are investigating the facts, we are gathering info, come back latter I should have an answer" so forth and so on. After 3 days of asking, all we got was a refund for one person. They claim the tour provider said no one had left the tour! So there you go, we could've fallen off a cliff and no one would've found out we were missing, yet another reason NOT to book with Lomas Travel. Your best bet is to wait for a sunny day, take a walk down the beach, and book the tour for that day right then and there with one of the many guys you will see at the beach. It will be cheaper and under your own terms. -Hotel's lobby smells like a funeral home. No kidding. Not sure if it is all the antique furniture or the flowers on the lobby, but you can't escape it. Musty smell follows on the hallways and your room (and your clothes-typical of the tropics). -When we arrived at our room, first thing we saw was a guy's underwear on the bed, along with a suitcase and other personal belongings. This was obviously someone else's room still in use. We had to go back to the front desk. They didn't attempt to comp us for the unpleasant error, instead proceeded to give us a dungy room. We complained and after making it firmly clear we were NOT satisfied, we were upgraded to a nicer room with a balcony and a view of the garden/pool area. -Beds are rock solid. You can cough up a kidney if you don't ease your way onto them. We had emailed the staff in advanced about accommodations for a king bed and bed toppers, and neither of the two requests were honored. Safe in the new room was broken. Took a crew of 3 about 2 hours to get it fixed. -Floors in the halls are always slippery. This is normal in the tropics, but be aware because you will fall if you don't pay attention on how you walk. This is the same issue when you walk from the lobby to the buffet. -You CAN hear everything through the walls of the room. Everything! from people coughing/dropping stuff next room, walking on the hallway, talking outside the room. -Drinks are a mixed bag. They are mediocre at best. Many times we had to put them down after one zip. Don't even say the word wine! -The specialty restaurants are awful! specially the Brazilian-style one. We walked out after the Philippine sausage that smelled like dirty feet, and the turkey wrapped in bacon. We went right to the buffet. In our opinion, don't waste your time in line trying to get reservations to these restaurants. They limit you on what time you can have dinner, either 6:45pm or 8:45pm, and you WILL end up going to the buffet anyways. The stake house (Chilli's) by the beach was a little better, but don't expect Perry's style stakes. The ribeye stakes you grill on your backyard grill are way better. Besides, the same cuts are served at the buffet. Another thing, at Chilli's people are allowed to smoke, and you will come across the selfish rude "individual" of an "unmentioned" nationality next to you who decides because an ashtray is in site, it is ok to light up in the middle of you dinner. We had to move tables twice because of this. -Pool/beach towels after lunch are impossible to come by. Get your set early in the morning and never let go. They don't cycle the dirty towels fast enough. In many occasions we came back to the towel booth 3 times to get towels and we got the "in 20 minutes", back in 20 minutes we got the "ran out". Meanwhile you could see a mountain of dirty towels behind the booth. -The elusive site of waiters coming by the pool or beach area to take your drink orders is that, well elusive. You'll be lucky to get one round of drinks, so order up! -The people that sell the jetsky rides on the beach frequently rev up the engines and do pirouettes right near the entrance of the beach to call on the attention of tourists, so as a result you will get the pleasant nauseating intoxicating aroma of burnt diesel exhaust up your nose as you sunbathe on/near the sand. -This is more of a general observation- Buy Mexican Pesos at the airport. You will get a better rate ($13 to $1). In Playa del Carmen you will get $10 tops $11 to $1. Everything is open for negotiation if you go shopping. The faster you walk out of the place, the faster the prices drop. 5th ave is a nice area. Cabs are $5 each way. And there you have it. We are still not sure if we will ever return here. More likely try the Riu resort in Panama city. Use this review objectively to assume your own conclusions. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the RPRM!”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice all inclusive property that had comfortable rooms,a great pool, and a gorgeous beach area with plenty of loungers. We had an excellent 6 night stay. Restaurants: We had planned to dine at all of the a la carte restaurants, but actually found the buffet far superior in quality and variety.The Japanese restaurant is the only one that we liked. The gourmet restaurant was awful and had ridiculously small portions. I am not a big eater and had to go to the buffet after we were done there. The Mexican Restaurant was bad a well. We luckily were VERY happy with the food at the buffet, for breakfast,lunch and dinner.The service was also excellent at the buffet restaurants. Room: We had a fountain view room on the 3rd floor with a small enclosed balcony, which was nice for privacy. We were in the main building which made it convenient for going down to the lobby to use our laptop that we brought. Make sure when you check in that you ask for a mattress topper for the bed.It made the hard bed really comfy. Beach: The beach was really nice and was very pretty with all the palm trees, which also provided plenty of shade for those who want it. There were also loungers set further down by the water for those who want full sunshine. The water was so warm, and we didn't find that the sandbag "whales" detracted in any way from enjoying the water. Pool: We only went in the pool a couple of times, once for water aerobics which was fun. The pool was really nice, we just preferred the beach where it was much quieter. If you like a lot of "contests" and fairly loud music, the pool area might be for you. Shows: We went to the shows every night and found them to be good. They were over by 11, which was plenty late enough for us. Gym: The gym was not that impressive. It was pretty small, with only 2 treadmills.We were told at the desk that it opened at 7, and for the most part it did, but 1 day we were there at 7 and it didn't open until 8. Also, no towels are provided, so bring the small one from your room. You might have to ask for antiseptic spray to wash the machine with. We didn't try any of the spa services since we found them to be expensive. Tip: The cab ride into town is just $5. If it is not to hot it would make a nice walk as well. If your luggage is lost (like our friends was), and you have reservations for one of the specialty restaurants, ask the head waiter for some pants. They will give you some elastic waisted "one size fits all" that you can pull on over your shorts.They are very strict about men wearing long pants in the restaurants. (not the buffet).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation (even in the rainy season)”
Reviews.Author: matthomp
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I needed a last minute get away from the Midwest. My travel agent suggested looking at the Riviera Maya as it was warm, and far enough outside Cancun to avoid major crowds. She was right. This hotel is a few years old and is very well taken care of. As we pulled up the long driveway, we both had the look of shock on our faces thinking we hit the jackpot in terms of hotel.... We did. Other people I talked to staying at other RIU hotels kept coming to ours during the day to eat here because the food was much better (in terms of selection) and the pool was better. The place was great, the rooms were huge, the pool was great as was the food. The themed restaurants offered something for everyone. And the beach was great as well.... perfect sand. The weather could have been better as well, but we made the best of it. One small down side.. The ice machines in the hallways in the hotel stink. None of them worked when we were there... Funny thing is they look new!!!! So they need to work on that. One tip.... If you choose to book excursions, do not do it at the hotels. The agents at the hotel have to pay a 30% commission back to the hotel making your trips very expensive. We walked down the street to the Grey Line booth and saved $45 per head on a trip to the Mayan ruins. Also dont come here if you think you can play here by day and go to Cancun and party by night. Its over an hour away (in good traffic). Thats a $50 cab ride there and more coming home if the cabies try to screw you over at 3 a.m. If you want to party, go to Cancun. There is also some good night life 5 min from the hotel. We partied at PURE Nightclub for $35 for unlimited booze and cover. Well worth it!! Overall, this place is great. Go enjoy it!! Dont let anyone talk you into staying at the other RIU hotels close by. We checked them all out.. None of them come close to comparing to this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Sharky-E
Reviews.Content: To start, this was my second stay at a RIU Palace resort. I thought the first stay was wonderful, but this was ‘THE BEST VACATION EVER” My wife and I took a 5 day get away for her birthday. We arrived on Wed. Oct. 15th to a wonderfully sunny 86 degree day. We could not have asked for more, but to top it off the next day, Thursday was even better. This was great because Thursday the 16th is my wife’s birthday. We started the day with a walk of the property shortly after the sun rose (we are both early birds). We then had a wonderful breakfast at the buffet. We followed that with a walk on the beach and then resting on the beach chairs on the beach. We then took up residence by the pool for a couple of hours. The weather was gorgeous probably close to 90 with a cool Caribbean breeze coming from the beach. We then decided to go into downtown Playa Del Carmen. A $5 cab ride from the hotel puts you right in the heart of the shopping, restaurant district. It is called 5th Ave and it is wonderful, full of merchants selling their “junk” as they call it and lined with all types of greenery, restaurants etc. There is also a public beach which is beautiful. You can catch a ferry across to Cozumel, if you want, for a couple of hours of shopping or site seeing. After a couple of hours in downtown Playa we return to our Palace. The Palace has several specialty restaurants, Steak, Brazilian, Japanese and Mexican. We ate at the Steak, Japanese and Brazilian. The steak house was our favorite. Overall food was good, but when you come to Mexico I would want to eat the Mexican food, since this is their specialty. (just my preference) On our way to dinner I informed the front desk it was my wife’s birthday. When we returned from dinner the room was decorated with balloons, towel art and rose pedals on the bed. About 15 mins after we got to the room someone knocked on the door with a delivery of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne. We Loved all the personal touches and service they gave us. The hotel in itself is a PALACE. The architect and attention to detail is awesome. The place is immaculate. (see the pictures) Our room was wonderful, but the view not all that great. As one of the other visitors mentioned the room was overlooking the hotel next door. It apparently over looked the kitchen so there was not much of a view from the balcony. Overall the Palace is a WONDERFUL RESORT for couples. I would not recommend it for parents with small children or teenagers as it appears to be geared toward couples. They do have a kids club but I did not see many children or notice any activities geared toward children. They do have live entertainment each night which was very good. Everyone was extremely friendly always speaking when you past them (hola). This was our BEST VACATION EVER and we will definitely stay at another RIU Palace and/or this one again. If you are looking for a nice quiet vacation get away for you and your special person or if you are looking for a lively up beat vacation for you and your special person. The RIU Palace Riviera Maya is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at Riu Palace Mexico , Honeymoon at Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Elisa08
Reviews.Content: As the title states , I got married at the Riu Palace Mexico , and had an incredible time. Myself , my groom , and over 50 guests had an amazing time ! The Honeymoon was 10 days at the Riviera Maya and it was right on par with the Palace Mexico , although obviously newer and more updated . The rooms are fanstastic . Spacious , clean , no bugs , mosquitos, ants , nothing . Sure you will have a certain musty smell, but thats to be expected at any and every Beach front hotel that you stay at , regardless of where you go . Bring a travel candle , light it up , grab a Corona from your own personal fridge and chill and relax . In no time your room will be smelling great , you will have relaxed enough to be in vacation mode and let your adventures begin !! The maids come twice a day , first to clean your room and then again in the evening for the trun down service . They were outstanding . We left $1 or $2 every morning . Nothing was ever taken from our room , including my gold necklace that I carelessly left in the bathroom and cash left on the counter . My mother even said that my Papa left his wallet , passport and money all lying on his bed one night , and when the turn down service came while they were out , the maids just simply placed it neatly back at the top of his bed when they were done . You are of course given a lock for the safe in your room but we really didn't even need it . The grounds are incredible with beautiful landscaping . There are groundskeepers and staff constantly cleaning and looking after everything . The pool is amazing ! Just like the pictures . There is an infinity pool , and then there is a swim up bar , swim up tables , chairs and yes, even beds ! All this look sover the incredibly soft , sandy beach , with the beautiful warm torquoise water. Of course there is Sand whales , but understand that they have to be there in order to protect the beach from any further erosion . So much to do , parasailing , jet skiing , dance lessons , water games , volley ball ......or just order a nice frozen blender drink from one of the many waiters walking by , and grab a good book and lie in one of the many hammocks they have nestled amongst the palm tress . No joke ! Staff is constantly walking around seeing if you need a drink and that includes on the beach . These guys walk in the heat , in the sand , carrying trays of drinks ...thow them a buck or two will ya ? Buffet food was plenty , there is always something for everyone and it changes on a nightly basis . Including a Sushi Station ! The A'la Cartes were all really good but the one that stands out in my mind was the gourmet restaurant , it has a menu that says " Krystal " but the name of the restaurant is Sir Oliver , definately worth checking out . Every night there is a show , around 10pm for adults , it is like your typical resort animation crew show , but they work really hard , the outfits are great and they truly do entertain . I really have nothing negative to say about this place . From Hector the doorman , constantly greeting you and calling taxi's for you ( we went into town a few times ) $5 one way , so much fun , for nightlife and for shopping . * Tip * if you are into the club scene and/or want to get out and do some dancing, head into town and go to the Blue Parrot , its a great place and even has a dance floor right on the beach , it is incredible to be under the stars , with the Ocean in front of you , dancing the night away . So from Hector , to the staff , constantly cleaning , fixing , smiling , ...always saying " Hola " ...this place was great . I would go back without question !! Email me if you have any questions , I am always happy to help out my fellow Trip Advisor Members !! p..s . I have posted a long review of the Riu Palace Mexico so you can go there and see more info . My wedding was incredible and all my guests loved their stay at the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Islandkids5
Reviews.Content: We loved the Riu Palace. The accomodations were great. Even though it rained our entire trip, we truly enjoyed ourselves. The food was excellent, especially at the Mexian Agave and Chillis Grill for Dinner! The staff was so friendly and invoved with the guests. Thanks to Islas for those awsome drinks and good coversation at La Habana! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...poor weather”
Reviews.Author: ans5368
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous and as advertised. We were warned however, that October is the rainy season on the Yucatan penninsula. Although it did not rain all the time, we did have rain every day. The resort is fantastic. Everyone who worked there was very attentive. Food was excellent, especially in the themed restaurants. Lunch was the same everyday...about average. If you are not a smoker, stay away from the sports bar... Ask for a room towards the main building. Ours was further out and we had some flooding in the entry way after a long night of rain. Overall an excellent resort and piced about right.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: love2binthesun
Reviews.Content: This was the best vacation we have ever been on. We went during the rainy season and it did rain, but it only lasted for about 10 min then back to beautiful blue skies. I would recommend this resort to anyone. The staff were pleasant and bent over backwards to make sure the met your needs. The rooms were really clean. The beds are a little on the hard side but that was my only complain. If you plan on doing any water sports such as using the wave runners or parasailing. Go with the resort, there are people on the beach who will try to sell you these packages who will often sell it for less than the resorts, but they usually end up ripping you off in the end. Use only the resort! Again I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “5* Vacation”
Reviews.Author: HarryRCT
Reviews.Content: Overall we had a great time at this Riu. We did have to request to be changed to a different room at check-in since the one they offered overlooked the roof of the resort nextdoor. While we expected a Garden View room, we didn't expect the view to be of the roof nextdoor with tanks and pipes everywhere. The first guy who checked us in was totally unhelpful but luckily one of the women offered us an alternate room. The second room overlooked the fountain and was on the third floor with a small enclosed balcony. We found the food at the ala carte restaurants ot be inferior to the food on the buffet which was just great. We heard from others that they also preferred the buffet. The buffet was first class and offered items like Beef Wellinton, Frogs Legs, Lamb, Turkey, Fish and just about anything else you could want. The beach was GREAT and offered so many lounges that there was never a need to be there early. The pool was very nice but tended to be too noisey for us so we usually stayed at the beach. The gym was pretty nice but it was almost impossible to get them to furnish towels and a disinfectant spray for the equipment. The gym is operated by an outside company that also runs the spa so I guess that is why they aren't as easy to deal with as the hotel itself. After getting a topical rash on gym equipment in the Dominican Republic I now insist on being able to disinfect the equipment. The hotel should insist on better service for the gym clients as it relects on the hotel as well. The location of the hotel was great for us. It is less than 2 miles into Playa Del Carmen and an inexpensive 50 peso taxi ride. We would definitely return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “*Absolutely AMAZING*”
Reviews.Author: alaw1
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel, and my only complaint would be that it wasn't long enough. Even though the resort had mostly couples, I went with 2 of my girlfriends and we had the greatest time. First of all, this hotel is by far the best all inclusive I've ever stayed. -There are a bunch of restaurants (which you have to make reservations for dinner which can be annoying), but the buffet is by far the best and no need for reservations there- the buffet has sooooooo many options, is a bit different each night so as to keep your favorites but also add new options, and there's a chocolate fountain (what's better than that?!) -The fridge is stocked with drinks, and there are premium bottles of liquor in your room -Everything is included- we would order room service anytime we were hungry, ask for bottles of wine, bottled beer, anything. The hotel is absolutely breathtaking Everything is immaculate, and there isn't a spot of dirt to be found. The pool is huge and gorgeous. The beach is big with endless chaise lounges. The hotel feels so safe. Although the marble floors do get slippery when it rains so you have to be careful. The staff is all so friendly and helpful. The customer service is amazing-they will help you out with anything. I ordered a type of soda that one of the restaurants didn't have but she said yes and a minute later I saw my waitress running in the rain to go get me one. Also, one night we ordered a sandwich from room service which they didn't have-it was super late and they brought something else. We thought nothing of it but the next day the manager called to apologize and made sure we had reservations at any of the restaurants we wanted. Although there weren't any happening bars for 20 somethings at the hotel, 5th ave is a $5 taxi away, has great restaurants and bars and we went every night. If you are young singles looking for a crazy, spring break kind of time in the hotel, this isn't for you, but if you want to be surrounded in luxury and waited on all day long, it's perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation, Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: 4Deans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at RPRM from 10/3 - 10/8/08. I faithfully read everything on TripAdvisor that I could before we left and I was not disappointed at all!! The resort is beautiful, service is outstanding, rooms are great, etc, etc!! I have noted some of the positives and negatives below, although the negatives are nothing that would keep me from returning to this resort in the future, other than the fact that we may bring our kids back with us. This resort does have a kid's club, but I never saw it occupied and did not see any schedules of activities for kids. POSITIVES: - The service was fantastic. I had e-mailed the resort ahead of time to let them know that we were celebrating our anniversary and my birthday. I had asked for a room with a king size bed on the top floor. While I had booked a courtyard room, they ended up giving us an oceanfront room! I was very surprised. They wished us a Happy Anniversary upon check-in. That night, the maid left us a platter of chocolate covered strawberries, a bottle of wine and a note wishing me a Happy Birthday! Drink and food service were wonderful with a few slight exceptions noted below. The bartenders never left you with an empty drink and always had a smile. Plates and ashtrays were cleared from the table as soon as you were done. Everyone that you met said "Hola" and were more than willing to help you with whatever you needed. - The food in the buffets was excellent. There was always a variety and different things to choose from each day. I have never seen so many fresh juices and condiments, sauces, etc.! All of the food was fresh and the temperature was good. My husband was more than happy to have dinner at the buffet every night. We only ate at 2 reservation restaurants, the Steakhouse and the Brazilion. The Steakhouse was OK and I did not care for the Brazilion. I think that we would have both preferred the buffet over these restaurants. I wanted to try the Asian, but we did not get a chance to go there. We did not try the room service, but it is great to have that option 24 hrs a day. - Our room was beautiful. Plenty of room to spread out. Large double sink and tub with shower. Large king-size bed and couch. - The pool was beautiful with plenty of loungers by the pool and other loungers with palm tree shade behind them. The Animacion Team worked very hard from early in the morning until late at night. There was always something to do. They even had free massage demonstrations by the pool one day that we were there. That was the only way that I could get my husband to try it with me! - While others have said that the beach was small, I had no problems with it whatsoever. While we did not walk all of the way down to RPM, we did walk down to Riu Playacar and I thought that RPRM's beach was much better than any others that we saw. One place had NO beach, only concrete that we had to try to maneuver around. The sandbags do take away from the beauty, but they are necessary and provided for very calm waters for swimming. The beach was very clean with no rocks at all. The upper beach is great for relaxing in the shade on a lounger or hammock. - We loved the 24 hour Sports Bar. We stopped by there most evenings for drinks and a snack and watched some football and baseball. It is nice to have this option for drinks and food at any time of the day. NEGATIVES: - While drink service at the pool was fantastic, drink service on the beach was nonexistent. I did see a waiter several times, and one time I ran him down and asked for a drink, but that was it. They need a bar or at least a large cooler of drinks down by the beach as it is a long uphill walk back to the pool bar. - There are no ventilation fans in the bathrooms. Getting ready for dinner was a very hot and sweaty ordeal in the bathroom after a shower. I felt like I needed another shower once I was ready to go out! - We were on our 4th day there before our mini-bar was restocked. And that was after 2 notes for the maids with tips and a request at the reception desk. Overall, this hotel was wonderful, and if we ever go back for another adult vacation, I would definitely consider this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Alcohol Work Around”
Reviews.Author: commadoor
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Riu Palace 10/11/08. After reading many reviews of being served (weak drinks), we were sitting on the fence comptemplating wether to book or not. First of all they do make really weak drinks but here is the work around. If you are sitting in front of the bartender, he will give you anything that you ask for. For example we ask for a pina colada with a double dose of Bicardi rum.and thats what we get. if you give him a tip tell him you want to be on the automatic refill program. and he will usaully have the next drink sitting there before you even finish. If a waiter is bringing you a drink to your table or beach chair thats when you really get weak drinks. all you have to do is also ask for a shot or two on the side and add it to your drink yourself, and you cant go wrong. Also note: that there are full bottles in your room,, what we did was: fill and empty water bottle and carry it with us to spruce up our drinks. they will refill the bottle in your room when asked. Problem solved. On another note the service was superb at the whole resort. as soon as you take your last bite, the plate, ashtray, ect. is removed at once. The buffet is excellent and will fufill your every desire. So if one of the specialty resturants do not meet your expetations just think of them as an apetizer, take a few steps away and hit the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “5* Hotel - 5* Holiday”
Reviews.Author: K80_KLL
Reviews.Content: ***** WONDERFUL HOLIDAY ***** Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Riu Palace from 18 Sepember until 2 October and had a fantastic time. After having stayed at the Riu Palace Macao in Punta Cana, Dominican Republic, the Riviera Maya had a lot to live up to and by no means did it let us down. On arrival and check-in at the hotel, all staff were warm and friendly, in fact we felt rather special when Hector the porter, made it clear to the check-in staff that we were Thomson guests. We were allocated our room and our luggage arrived approximately five minutes after us. The only criticism that I have, is that when we arrived in our room at the Macao there was a plate of fresh fruit and a bottle of champage waiting, but when it's 24 hour all inclusive you can forgive them. All of the staff across the hotel in general were extremely friendly and could not do enough for you. Even the maintenance and gardeners would not pass you without a 'Hola!'. All of the restaurants were superb - the buffet restaurant offered something to everyones tastes (take it from a picky eater) and the five speciality restaurants were just that - special. My favourite was either the Mexican or Japanese. But my boyfriends was probably the Steakhouse or the Brazilian. We both enjoyed Sir Oliver's gourmet restaurant however my boyfriend wasn't happy with the gourmet sized portions - no class I'm afraid!!!! After reading some of the other reports on here, we expected problems with making reservations for the restaurants, however did not experience any and could have easily booked to visit them more than once had we so wanted to. My little tip to anybody visiting soon though - make sure you go to Mexican night (wednesday) or Asian night (saturday) in the main buffet restaurant. There was always plenty of choice in the buffet restaurant for breakfast and evening meal (we only used Chilli's of a lunchtime). The fresh fruit was in abundance and there was never any food that looked as though it had been sat there for long. The waiters/waitresses were all warm and friendly, constantly topping up your drinks and cleaning plates away quickly and efficiently - just a tip though hold on to your cutlery even if you're only having a second or two between bites or else your plate will go and you'll have to start again! The bars at the hotel were also excellent. La Habana bar of an evening after a meal was lovely to enjoy a Kir Royal in luxury of air conditioning. My boyfriend really enjoyed the Sports Bar (I did for the internet access) however, I didn't like to spend too much time in there, due to the smoking - something that we are no longer used to in the UK. Our room was beautiful - right at the end of the hotel by Chilli's. The maids cleaned excellently and we often came back to our room of an evening to find the bed turned back, although not every night like the Macao. I can appreciate however that we were in a good position and would agree with some comments on here that I wouldn't have liked to be above either the theatre and bar or the sports bar! The only real noise we had was one evening when a wedding party was being privately held in Chilli's, however the disco finished by midnight! I can also agree with the musty smell, however when humidity is at 80% you have to expect some damp smell or even clothes feeling damp. This was nothing that wasn't fixed though by good old Persil as soon as back home! All back to normal now. The beach was beautiful - shame about the sand bags, but these are there for a reason and you soon see past them. The water is beautifully clean and warm - almost as good as a bath at home. (Speaking of baths, if you use the hydromassage tub in the bathroom, just make sure that the water is well above the jets or else as soon as you switch it on you will have water and soap suds everywhere like we did - ooopps!!!). We enjoyed spending time at the beach due to the breeze, although the drinks service was a liitle slower here. I hardly joined in any activities as I was on holiday to chill, however the other half had a go at Beach Volleyball, Pool Volleyball, Football, Rifle Shooting etc. He had a great time. At an extra cost, I do recommend the parasailing! One day we walked up to the Riu Palace Mexico for lunch. Whilst the beach had a bit more space there, the pool area and lunchtime restaurant was disappointing compared to our hotel. Away from the hotel, we ventured into Playa Del Carmen. Lots of shops including Diesel and jewellery shops to name but a few. Just make sure you haggle for jewellery - I knocked a silver ring from $120 to $45. Nice ring though! The perfume shop is slightly cheaper than that at the airport, but not by a great deal. And I must recommend a day trip to Xel-Ha! Whilst you're there, do Sea Trek - you'll see why! Overall a fabulous holiday and my biggest regret is that I got on the plane to come home! I have been to Cancun before but as a little commercialised would probably not stay there again, but I would definately return to Playacar and the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. If you're going or thinking of going, have a great time!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience this place, while you are still alive!”
Reviews.Author: iamarda
Reviews.Content: The most beautiful place my wife and I have ever been to. We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, for our honeymoon and it was absolutely PERFECT! We would highly recommend this place for honeymooners, our even for a getwaway. The all inclusive package really made this place worth staying at. Everynight, we had something different to eat, and there was plenty of entertainment and shows to see at nights. Go and lay on the beach by the beautiful sky blue waters, and dream away. This is a must do before you die! Go see this place!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: thomas21de
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Riviera Maya and I must admit it was even better then I had expected. I have been to many hotels and countries before, but I have never seen such a service, great food and a beautiful hotel before. Even after being for couple hours at the bar :), everybody was still friendly. I am positiv to go back to the same resort next year.

Reviews.Title: “The best resort we have ever stayed at - hands down!”
Reviews.Author: Karen_WI
Reviews.Content: The husband and I stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya from Sept 13th through the 19th. We are both in our early 40's, and have traveled to the Playa area numerous times. (as well as Jamaica, Cancun, Puerto Vallarta, and the Dominican) We have stayed in lower budget AI resorts to the "Ultra" resorts (Sandals) This resort, by FAR, has every single one of our previous vacations beat by a long shot. (especially Sandals!!) Service, staff, cleanliness, overall appearance, food, room accomodations....all were fantastic. If there was something we wanted, or needed, it was taken care of. In stead of going into all the little details on everything, I wanted to add a few helpful hints for anyone staying here. Bugs: the only time I really encountered any bugs was when we ate at the steakhouse restaurant, as it is open air. Yep, brought the bug spray...nope, forgot to put it on. My legs were attacked! DO bring the bug spray and DO wear it if eating at this place. Lobby: the lobby area is a non smoking area. No ashtrays anywhere. Very nice, if you still want to hang out at night, but not put up with cigarette smoke. (there's a non-smoking bar in the lobby area as well.) We spent our time in the sports bar, as we're smokers. Had to watch the games on the tv, too! Room service: nice menu to choose from, if you ask me. The portions are good sized, so don't make the same mistake we did! Thought we'd each get a "starter" salad, and a club sandwich, and chocolate cake for desert. WOW!!! Full plate of lettuce with chicken strips; club sandwich was HUGE, and the rest of the plate was filled with potato chips, and the chocolate cake was the size of two normal slices put together. We had so much to eat, we could barely finish! The "mildew" smell: yes, it is there. And yes, you will take it home with you, and on everything you take with. Once home, I set the luggage outside, after spraying with some Febreeze, for a few hours. It seemed to help a lot. As for the laundry, I did a presoak with baking soda, then washed as normal with a little extra detergent. Worked great! Common sense: what I mean by this is, please; use common sense when it comes to how you act, and react to things. Men DO need to wear long pants at the specialty restaurants. We saw them turning people away because they weren't dressed accordingly. It clearly states the "rules" in the welcome book in your room. Also, if you feel the need to BELCH at the top of your lungs while eating (to the point where everyone stopped eating and looked) at least have the decency to say "excuse me"...not "what??? I don't care!!" (sorry, but that to me was rude) Pluses: a few of the nice touches I saw that this hotel offered while we were there. Nightly turn down service, which included fresh towels Bottles of wine sent to your room via room service Coffee POTS on your table for breakfast (I loved that!!) Pool and Beach wait service - these people ran thier butts off!! Plenty of bottled water (need more? the sports bar has some) I could go on and on, but I'd start babbling! We had a wonderful time, and I KNOW we will return to this Palace. (by the way, we did tour the other RIU hotels in the area...and know we made the right choice with the RIU Palace Riviera Maya) If I could change anything......only two very small things I would have liked to see. A venilation fan in the bathroom (which would also cut way down on the humidity in the room, hence the mildewy smell) And coffee pots in the room. I know we could've had room service bring us coffee each morning, but to me that seems like such a bother to these hard working people. Besides, we were in the restaurant for morning breakfast and coffee within five minutes from our room each day, so it wasn't a really big deal. GO TO THIS RESORT!!! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!!! Karen_WI

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.... A*”
Reviews.Author: foxyladytiger
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say... returned from Honeymoon at the RPRM last Thursday. I honestly can't find one thing to complain about - even if I try. The food is nothing but superb... something for everyone and cooked well. If I were to complain it would be to say there is too much to choose from! Our room was great, no problems at all - other than we did find the beds too hard and requested mattress toppers on our first day - they arrived within the hour and solved the problem! We did hear of some couples who had moved room because their room smelt of damp, but we did not have that problem at all. The entertainment staff work really hard and the evening shows cater for all tastes. All in all - a great place for a honeymoon or just a lovely holiday. We will definitely be going back to another Riu for our next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LJWNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with three other people returned on 9/19/08. The staff was great. Pros: The pool and beach area was great and beautiful. There were plenty of lounge chairs. Pool side lounges filled up quickly, but there were plenty of lounge chairs by the beach under the palm trees that made laying out wounderful because you got sun with shade and a nice breeze. Some reviews commented that the sand dunes were an awful site to see, but I was glad they had them there because they helped with not having bad waves. The breakfast buffet was great. The restaurants were great. Make sure that you get in line between 12:00 to 1:00 to book reservations for the restaurants. The rooms were cleaned continuously. Cons: The smell of the hotel (rooms) was moldy, mildew like. Some people said it was the wood that caused this smell and because of the damp, humid air, but I did not think so. It was hard to get this smell out of my clothes and luggage when I got home. The only thing about the food, was I wish that for room service that you could get hot grilled food. They only serve sandwiches. I really had a great time and so did the people that traveled with us. I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “This Riu is Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: soonerlaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Riviera Maya for a few days at the end of August. This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. Even more, Playacar is gorgeous. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, every staff member from front desk to housekeeping was polite and always said hello and asked if we needed anything. The rooms were clean and stocked with beer, liquor, water, etc. The food was always great. We tried 3 of the restaurants, all of which I loved, except the Steakhouse, which was marginal. But then again, being from Dallas, Texas, I don't think any steak could compare to the steaks here. The pool area was always a bit full, but the beach is where we spent most of our time. They have a lot of free water activities, including kayaks, paddleboats, snorkeling, etc. you can do. The water is clean and beautiful. You can also use the facilities of all the other Rui's in Playacar, one of which has a great club. This place really makes you feel like you are in paradise. Overall, would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “RIU Palace was GREAT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandilyn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Palace from Sept 7-13, and had an amazing time! Staff-They were all wonderful! So friendly, helpful, and hard-working. Pool bartender Mavin and Josh from the entertainment staff were the greatest! Cleanliness-This place is spotless, the staff is always cleaning. The smell in the rooms that everybody complains about is definitely from the extreme humidity. Pool-awesome!! As others have said, you can always find a lounge, but we were also told that Sept is their slowest month. My only complaint about the pool is that it closes too early. Beach-the water is the prettiest I have ever seen. There are tons of lounges, some in the sun and some under the palms. Food-loved it! We ate at the buffet the first night and were so impressed that we almost didn't try any of the a la carte resturants. The buffets have a huge selection. They did serve some things all the time but there were other things that changed daily. The breakfast buffet was repetitive, but the food was good. We tried three of the a la carte resturants. Chili's- was excellent, but don't forget bug spray. We got attacked by mosquitos while we were eating. This is the only resturant that is outside. Brazilian- very good. You get small portions of all kinds of different meat. I really enjoyed this because I have never had a meal like this. Sir Olivers-also very good. If you have a big appetite, you may not get full here. The servings are kind of small, but definitely delicious. The reservation process was not as bad as I thought, but that could be because of it being a slower month. Shopping-when you go left out of the resort, there is a small shopping complex very close by. Remember to bargain with everything!! We went to Cozumel to shop which I wouldn't recommend. The vendors there were way too pushy (annoying) We didn't get the chance to shop around 5th avenue but I wish I did that instead of taking the ferry to cozumel. We also went to Xel-ha and we were not impressed. It was pretty expensive and we didn't really think there was that much to do. If anybody has any questions, please feel free to contact me, I would be happy to help!

Reviews.Title: “The Good & The Bad”
Reviews.Author: Prettygirl5401
Reviews.Content: If you are like me, you are probably booked the RIU and you are keeping up on the reviews as I did the days before we left. My boyfriend and I just got back from a sun-filled relaxing week at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya (Sept. 7-13). Upon reading review after review of people raving about this particular hotel, I had no reservations or hesitations about our vacation. But since I've been there, I have mixed feelings towards it. Let me start with the POSITIVES: -ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL hotel. Spotless, clean, neat and meticulous grounds. Staff is always cleaning and making sure the hotel looks its best. -The staff could not be more attentive and accommodating. Wether it was refilling your drink immediately after your last sip, answering questions, or taking a picture for you, everything was done with a smile. Every SINGLE employee we passed was sure to say HOLA with a big smile! -Housekeeping was really great. Never had a problem. Extra towels, turn-down service & the mattress pads for the bed did make a difference (just call housekeeping when you get into the room-they will bring you one to put on right away) -Amazing pool area. Always seats available in the sun or the shade. -Even more amazing was the beach and the crystal clear turquoise water. Although the "sand whales" were a little strange, they did their job of keeping the water calm as the water did get somewhat rough due to hurricane IKE. -Anything you wanted to drink you can get. ANYTHiNG! just ask! -There's a 24-hour small medical clinic on site if anything might happen during your stay. And now for the NEGATIVES: -An hour drive from Cancun airport. -We had to switch rooms at first because our air wasn't working right, not a problem at all. Upon arrival, we noticed a strange mildew-like odor. We thought it was just the room but it wasn't. Its actually just the smell f the hotel itself possibly from the extreme humidity. Believe me, you and all your belongings will retain this distinct smell and you will smell it when you get home in your luggage and your clothes. -The sheets always felt moist-very weird and somewhat disgusting. -The food was just not GOOD. My boyfriend will eat ANYTHING and enjoy it and he just did not enjoy anything. The buffets were okay for breakfast but consisted of the same food day in and day out. Nothing was spectacular. We met couples from other resorts that raved about their food but we could not do the same. The Mexican specialty restaurant, AGAVE, was decent. Thats about it. If your going to book the specialty restaurants-you can book everyday between 12-3, you can book two nights at a time and choose either a 6:30 or 8:45 sitting. -Lack of night-life. There were shows every night at 9:45-dancing numbers and some interactive games but thats about it. There's NOTHING to do after 10:00 pm. We were usually in bed by 11 pm. -I'm 22 & my boyfriend is 24-I would say we were probably the youngest people there. This hotel is more for older couples and honeymooners. -Many topless women on the beach-just a heads up if you plan on staying with children-you should stay by the pool then. THINGS YOU MUST DO! -Book excursions with OLYMPUS TOURS-reasonable prices, many excursions to choose from, highly knowledgeable staff: We went on two excursions-The first was TULUM EXTREME-it cost $96 per person and was worth every penny! It was from 8am-4pm...they took up to see Tulum for about and hour then we went rapelling, zip-lining (!!), and snorkeling in a cave. Awesome experience! Try to get NOEL for your guide. He was the man! We also booked the PARTY HOPPER for Friday night to go into Cancun. It costs $80 per person. Lasted from 8 pm to 4am. They take you into Cancun to 3 different clubs-Corona Bar to warm up-then off to SENOR FROGS and then to CITY. Alot of fun and a great way to party. Admission and open bar in all 3 places included in the price so you pay nothing while your there. Awesome! -GET OUT and EXPLORE! The RIU is located in the PLAYACAR complex which is like its own little town consisting of hotel after hotel along with condos and homes. Absolutely safe and very nice. We went out at night to go to the shops and felt very safe. -Go to 5th Avenue! A cab pulls right up to the door of the hotel and for $5 and 5 minutes, you are at 5th avenue with consists of about 15-20 blocks of shops, restaurants, and bars. So much to do and see! There is also a smaller area of shops within walking distance of the hotel. Just walk out and to your left about a half mile down the road they are on your right hand side (open till 10 pm). -Bring small bills. $1's for tipping-and just $20's and $50's to go shopping with-Its hard to get change of bigger bills. You can ask at the front desk but you will most likely get pesos as they don't really have US $ on hand. The peso is 10 to every $1 us dollar. So if something is 200 pesos-its $20 US dollars. Well, if you are booked at the RIU and anxiously awaiting your vacation like I was-you will have a good time. If you're researching hotels to book a future vacation-I recommend SOL MELIA resorts. They have all-inclusives all over the place and a much better overall experience. Also, a few people from the IBEROSTAR Tucan about four hotels down said that it was absolutely amazing-food was excellent and exotic animals throughout the grounds like a zoo. Look into that one. We were a little jealous hearing them rave about their hotel=) Hope this helps! Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “It was a Palace and I was the King”
Reviews.Author: giruip
Reviews.Content: Well....what can i say? Best hotel ever....best employees ever. Best staff ever... Best beach ever, best food ever... I just dont understand how some people dislike this hotel...its looks like a palace and you are treated like the kind.... The staff just dont stop triyng to please you.The drinks were always fast..even in the beach , the maximum time waiting for a drink was 5 minutes...and believe me it was what the staff needed to get from te beach to bar. Food: 6 restaurants...2 buffets...the buffet was always diferent.. The breakfast was the best....enormous amount of choice.... The beach: i had already knew that the beach in riviera maya had some "whales" because of the 2005 hurricane... yeah...it seems that spoils a litle beauty to the beach, but even so the beach is ASWOME...i had never seen such blue water in my life...and i have been in Brazil. I went for jet ski and i was amazed by the blue water under my jet ski....i Recommend a jet ski trip..... In the beach it had always a nautic sports crew to assist you on what you wanted to do . Also you have a hotel fotographer..(sorry about my english) My arrival: I went on my honey moon ... on arrival we had a welcome free drinks...they were good. Then we had a 3 floor room with a awsome view to the hotel and sea... And the we had a fruit basket welcome. The room was enormous and had a jacuzzi tub...just perfect... The pool: Best pool ever....you have always chair in the pool...ALWAYS...The pool bar was great...the staff too....the entertainment crew was great also.... Night: Well...after dinner we had always a small show on the "praça" and the at 21:45 it started the principal show in the "liric room" ,After that there wasnt more too do.... Thing that was the only thing i didnt like to much.... But dont understand me wrong...the shows were good.... but in the end the only thing to do was going to your room.... for luck i was always tired so i needed always to go to sleep.. But if you didnt want to go to sleep they had a Sports Bar open 24 h serving drinks and a fridge with hot dogs, cheese burgers etc , pool table, Pc with internet.... The hotel also had some shops...i recomend the gift shop because it was no expensive and had some great things. What more can i say?? Outside the hotel we had some tour trips that were the best of the best...Xcaret ; Xel-ha ; Chichen Itza; Tullum. I recommend it all....in fact i recommend MEXICO....its on of the paradises on Earth.... Great Hotel, great Honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Things to remember when visiting this hotel”
Reviews.Author: farni
Reviews.Content: Hi. My friend and I decided to stay at this hotel for 5 nights after reading prior reviews. The Riu is beautiful, has great service from the moment you arrive to the time you leave. The staff are ultra friendly and accomodating. The food is great, especially the restaurants at the hotel (make reservations at 12 that same day). The location of the hotel is great too, just 1 mile from the famous Quinta Avenida or 5th avenue, where all the shops, bars, clubs and restaurants are located- make sure you visit the famous Blue Parrot for the fire show and Bali. The weather was superb. There is one caveat: I came back with large bites (insect bites) from the hotel and yes it was confirmed that there were from bed bugs! So, please please take heed and take bug spray (even though we applied it) and take antihistamines of epinephrine with you. The hotel seems to change the sheets quite often in the day, but make sure you check the bed for bugs, literally. Oh and make sure you ask for mattress pad as the beds are rock hard! Otherwise, it was a great trip with lots of activities at the hotel. The best part was that the food and drinks were all inclusive, including rum, vodka, tequila and beer. Great place to go if well prepared!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!! You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: christina8592
Reviews.Content: We went to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya during Labor Day Week 2008. We had 6 adults and a 2 year old in our group. It was a great trip and we plan to take our extended family back next year. The grounds were immaculate. Every morning they pool area was cleaned thoroughly. I got to watch them while I was running on the treadmill and noticed how detail oriented they were. The pool and pool bar was nice. Excellent would be a good way to describe the beach, pool side bar service, all service and personnel, food (and we had picky eaters and a 2 year old), rooms, room service, and the list could go on. We really have no complaints. Our group had two different types of rooms and they were both nice. We have stayed at other all inclusives and were disappointed by watered down drinks and poor food quality. We actually were disappointed eating in Playa de Carmen two nights and preferred to have stayed at the resort. The kids area was tiny. The pool was the size of a spa and a tiny swing set that the sun was beating down on the plastic. But, my daughter enjoyed the main pool area so much so it didn’t matter. I was told entertainment at night was minimal but didn’t experience it since we have a two year old. We went and checked out the other Riu resorts, including Mexico Palace and we liked our hotel the best. We were told by multiple people that our resort was the best so there was no reason to go anywhere else. You will pay a little more for this Riu Palace but it is worth it. I won’t go to another all inclusive. Although tipping was included we tipped our room service, maid, and poolside bar service because they all did such a great job. Also, I thought I would be disappointed by the “whales” in the ocean but I was actually surprised how much I wasn’t bothered by it. Also, make sure you get the egg shells put on your bed. The beds are hard! You will not be disappointed by this hotel!!! We took Cancun Shuttle (off of the airport’s website) to the hotel and they were reliable and had private cars.

Reviews.Title: “This Palace is a Palace”
Reviews.Author: dmac99
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay the RIU Palace on September 5. We went with another couple for their 20th anniversary (Yes, we went with them on their anniversary!). Anyway, this resort was excellent in every regard. The lobby alone will let you know that you are staying at a top of the line resort. The service was fantastic. Everyone was polite and willing to help with every request. The front desk called us every other day just to make sure we were happy and didn't need anything. The rooms were clean and provided an excellent view of the garden and fountains. The grounds were beautiful and the pool and beach were top notch. The food was, well, how you say, Yummy! The buffett had a large selection for all meals and the speciality restaurants were a lot of fun. If you can't find anything to eat at this place then there is something wrong with you. The drinks were also very good and made with name brand stuff (Try the bloody mary at the pool bar. You won't be disappointed!). Don't pay attention to the reviews here that are negative to the extreme. I'm thinking they stayed somewhere else and are rating the wrong place. There is no way this place should ever be rated below "Above Average". As my wife would say "This is the best place EVER!!" If you are looking to have a great time with friendly people and a staff wanting to serve you, then this is the place for you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanchor
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel! We just got back from Riu Palace. It is a great place to relax. The food is excellent, great service with a smile and they do make you drink. The break down of guests is 35% Europe, 20% from Canada, 20% from USA, 5% from South America, Rest are mix of locals and people from other continents. We went with 2 kids under 3 years old and had no problems. If you have kids, ask for a room on the ground floor near to the pool as access to Elevators is limited. There are only one or two elevators near the reception. The beach is nice and the blue water is breath taking. Don't go to Xacaret. It was a waste of money. It is a marketing hip. The entrance is $99 bucks per person and there are hardly any fish to see. Also, the snorkeling through the dark caves can be claustrophobic and it takes a long time to finish it. Do take a short boat ride to the shallow reef around for Snorkeling. It was fun.

Reviews.Title: “place to avoid”
Reviews.Author: divaMichigan
Reviews.Content: Looking at the hotel,it was beautiful. There were 6 restaurants, only 1 you could eat at w/o a reservation for dinner. Tried to eat at the French restaurant,called every day and couldn't get reservations for any of the 10 days we were there. If you want to eat past 10pm,forget it. Only choices were cold hot dogs and hamburgers w/a microwave. If you want to drink a beer your only choice is Corona draft. The kids club consisted of a swingset and pool so hot kids couldn't even go into it. Had 62 people with us and over half the rooms had no air and never got fixed. Kids entertainment was same thing every night. Waitstaff and maid service were excellent. Room service menu consisted of 4 items,and sometimes you got it,other times you didn't. Bugs were in many of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous vacation destination!!”
Reviews.Author: dsheridanq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RPRM Aug. 21-25, 2008 and had a fabulous time. The hotel is a palace! Marble, crystal, mahogany. Beautiful rooms, nice pool, great beach, very good food (both variety and quality). The service was great. Tips were appreciated especially two dollar US bills. Mexicans consider it good luck. Joe provided GREAT beverage service around the pool area literally running our drinks to us in 100 degree (F) plus heat and humidity. Going into Playa was fun. Advise going very early in the a.m. or in the evening as the heat is too strong during mid-day. We had no problem making reservations at Krystal (Sir Oliver's) or the steak house or the Brazilian restaurant. Highly recommend Krystal and the steakhouse. Buffets are also great - NOT your typical buffet food. We found the price to be very reasonable for what you get, which is a lot. We did e-mail the hotel ahead of time and request a quiet room away from the bars and the shows and a mattress topper (like an egg crate on top of the mattress), both of which were accommodated. We went with two other couples and they thought they we in heaven. What a great time! Hotel does all their landscaping by hand so you do not hear hedge trimmers, lawn mowers or other distracting noises. We VERY HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. Incidentally, in the Cancun airport we ran into a honeymoon couple who stayed in one of the just opened Secrets hotels and said it was a disaster, undercooked food, toilets backed up everyone, stench in rooms, water leaking onto their clothes in closet, etc. etc .etc. - so bad they cut their honeymoon from 7 days down to 3. What a contrast with our experience. Kudos to Riu Palace and its employees!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent AI experience (long review)”
Reviews.Author: strudelganger
Reviews.Content: We were pleased with the hotel overall. I read many, many TripAdvisor ratings and was apprehensive, given several very negative remarks. However, we felt that although we could see where some of these reviewers were coming from, we were satisfied. We would probably not stay here again, but this is because we loved the town and would prefer to mix and mingle with the locals a bit more, even if only in the touristy areas. We found the hotel satisfactory, but much like staying in a hotel in the U.S. in some ways -- why travel outside the country and not see more of it? We knew this going in, however (it is an all-inclusive hotel, of course!), and I don't blame the Riu chain -- it was a lovely all-inclusive experience overall. I'm glad we got to stay at the resort. I felt spoiled and happy the whole time. Minor negative issues: -- Pool bar seemed very rushed, and was usually crowded. Not nearly as bad as I'd feared, but we didn't go there that often. It was great just for the novelty! -- Drinks made at the pool bar and hotel lobby bar were very weak and the margaritas were just odd -- like lime juice and ice. I'd think it was just me not knowing what a real margarita was like, but I had one in Playa and it was great. -- Occasionally table service at the lobby bar was quite slow. -- The ride from the airport was a little slow getting going, and the driver forgot to turn on the rear AC until we were almost there! -- They charge for printing in addition to Internet usage in the sports bar. The page I needed to print to get on the airplane (!) wouldn't print correctly and it took a good long while and many tries (ended up using Internet Explorer instead of Firefox) and printer jams. The guy tried to charge me for the extra time, but I pointed out (mostly in sign language) that it was due to their technical issues, and he didn't try to argue over it. If you're paying for printing, though, they should have that working a bit more smoothly. Positive issues: -- Polite service. No delay with room service or housekeeping requests, even though my Spanish is ... minimal and their English was sometimes only a little bit better. We were impressed by everyone's friendliness and willingness to help out. We left small tips for the maid and drink-provider every day. We didn't use the alcohol dispensers in the room as much as I'd planned! We did like having the beer in the fridge (Corona). -- The buffet was very good, if sort of generic. VERY extensive. We were only there for a short visit, and the one time I was able to get in line to get a restaurant reservation, none were available during our trip. I mentioned this to the woman taking reservations and she made an exception for us, which was much appreciated. We went to the Mexican restaurant, and the food was very good. It was more like fancy Mexican dining than a particularly authentic experience, but nothing to complain about. Excellent service from a very young, very helpful, very friendly waiter. The room service menu is limited but tasty, and it's hard to complain about limited room service in a place with so much to eat at all hours of the day! -- Absolutely lovely accommodations. The room was clean and did not smell at all that I noticed. The AC was very cold, and the ceiling fan helped chill the room nicely. The bed was hard, but I expected this. We never got around to asking for the foam mattress, but I slept very well without it. The bathroom was gorgeous; I wish it was here at home with me now. -- We had a garden view and loved it! Apparently we are in the minority, I realize. I was disappointed at first, until I saw the garden view. Yes, it was of another hotel. It was peaceful and the garden outside our patio well-manicured. I preferred this to having to listen to people marching by and screeching from the pool. I might have switched for an ocean view, but I liked our little terrace (with a convenient drying rack) and spent a lot of time sitting quietly and reading in the shade. I sound older than I am . . . ! -- I did not hear anyone in the room next door or hallway, which surprised me -- I am sort of picky about this. Maybe we just lucked out and it was mostly empty while we were there. -- The beach was excellent, even with the sand whales. The pool was startlingly warm -- I guess heated -- which I hadn't expected. It was also a shallow, hanging-out pool, not particularly my style, but definitely fun. Miscellaneous: -- The safe everyone has asked about is SMALL. Like wallet, phone, few small other items small. Not small laptop small. I have a really small Mac laptop and it wouldn't have fit in there -- I was glad I didn't bring it, even though I missed being able to use it. -- I recommend getting away from the hotel and taking a tour. -- We did not get any intestinal disorder. I'm mentioning so that you don't think you'll automatically get one. It sounds like you could still get one if you're careful, but it's not guaranteed either way! The hardest thing for me was not swallowing water in the shower. -- If you dress up a bit for the buffet, you'll be more comfortable. I packed several casual dresses and was comfortable at both the buffet and reserved restaurant seating. Some people wore very casual clothes to the buffet, and another example of me getting old prematurely is that I thought they looked like slobs next to everyone else. If you're staying at a fancier resort, dress up for it a little. I'm not at all sorry we stayed here, and I'm not sorry we started out in Mexico at an all-inclusive resort -- it was a good introduction to the area and a comfortable way to get familiar with our own preferences and travel style. I'd avoid any AI next time, but if you're considering them, this is a nice place. If I were doing the AI thing again, I'd return to this RIU. I'd also consider a more affordable RIU! This resort was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing!”
Reviews.Author: RKOhio
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to the region together and my 5th. Since we had not had a bad experience with them, we booked through Apple), as usual. They rated this with their highest - 6 golden apples. We normally stay at this type of highly rated resort. The hotel service at check in was ok, but the staff seemed bothered by doing their job, which was found to be the most common attitude the entire stay. Even though tips are supposed to be included, we have always made it a habit to tip (housekeeping, servers and of course bartenders) during our stays and this was no exception, Until the room wasn't cleaned and the service at the outdoor bar diminished to almost self-serve on the second day (first day at the sports bar). The property was reasonably clean but many times we had to ask for things that should have been at hand for such a highly rated hotel. The worst part we think was the CONSTANT banging noise the plumbing made 24 hrs. a day. Moving to another room made NO difference. The buffet was the best by far, as the specialties restaurants were not even as good as the street vendors in Playa. They had early and late seating’s for dinner service was slow even then. The entire hotel seemed understaffed. The evening shows were good and the bar and staff there was very good (quality liquor and prompt, pleasant service) OK overall, but NOWHERE near the rating or price. We would give it 4 apples - NOT 6 golden We looked at the other RIU properties in Playacar and had lunch at another. We will NOT be staying at any RIU again after this disappointing experience. RK from Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Never going back...”
Reviews.Author: Trevdg1379
Reviews.Content: After hearing good things about the resort and looking at thier website, we decided to go to the Riu Maya Riviera. We ran into problem after problem. From the 2 1/2 hour ride to the resort (realistically it only takes 45 minutes) to horrible check-in, hard bed, horrific service, not able to get reservations at included restaurants on the property, lack of gym equipment in the fitness center, and crowded pool (so crowded we were told that they had no more towels to come back tomorrow). It got so bad that while filling out a comment card (that they handed out to us in the dining room) an employee saw our responses and started heckling us about our "anonymous" comments. Management was advised and did nothing when we spoke to them on two occasions. For an all inclusive, it was really not worth it as not all the services were not available. Would have checked out early if we were able to get our money reimbursed and flight changed. Don't waste your money at the Riu, but definately go to the Riviera Maya as the setting is beautiful. For a better resort, we recommend the Fairmont Mayakoba, they know true service and appreciate their guests. Don't forget to visit Fifth Avenue in Playa del Carmen, Xel-Ha and Tolum while there.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Mamababs
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is beautiful, I will give it that. However, our experience was nothing to write home about. I have read numerous reviews on this hotel through TripAdvisor, and I thought I was in the clear, but this was not the case. When we checked in we were given a "garden view" which I would not recommend. This means you are either looking at a "backyard" with only grass, the neighboring hotels, or the water purification unit. Not really picture perfect. We came down to the front desk and asked for a different room, pool or ocean view, and were told to pay and additional $250 for the "courtyard view" or and additional $1250.00 for ocean. This is funny considering our travel agent told us we would have the "run of the house" which means to me that if there is a "courtyard view" avail then we can have it. That was the first issue. We paid the extra $250 and got the courtyard view. When we arrived at our room the lights would not work. After a call down to maintenence, it was about a 45 min wait (which seems to be the case for everything, room service, towel service, beverage service, etc.) The maintenence guy arrived, and spoke no english. He flipped a switch and sparks flew all over the bed from the ceiling fan above. We then had to wait an additional 2 hrs to get our lights fixed rather then having them move us to another room. The room smelled wet, and moldy. I looked up at the ceiling and above the door, there was black mold. Even with the air cond on, it still was damp. All of our clothes had to be washed, when we returned home, including our clean ones because they smelled so bad. Our travel agent failed to inform us of a dress code for the non buffet restaurants. Men, make sure you bring pants. However, these restaurants were in my opinion a lesser quality then the main buffet, which I liked a whole lot better. But the food in itself was not par with a upscale hotel. The "entertainment staff" I would relate to the staff in the movie Dirt Dancing. By this I mean totally cheesey! It was not impressive and after 3 days I would border on annoying. I will not be returning to a Riu in Mexico. I would almost say I will not return to a Riu. I have stayed at a Beaches resort, that was way better. I have also cruised and that was better too. Bottom line, nothing to write home about, so do not get sucked into thinking this is a high end resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mondon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 10 days at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya. We booked on hotwire and I was concerned about what room we would get. I emailed the hotel before leaving home and requested a king size bed, no smoking room, on the top floor of the resort with a courtyard view. Upon check in we were granted all of our requests. Our room had an amazing ocean view!!! From start to finish we had a great experience. The staff were so friendly and even went out of there way to do anything to help. If you go make sure to visit Islas (the bartender) at the lobby bar. We plan to go back again next year. We also used USA Transfers for a ride to and from the airport. They were also excellent. The drivers were early to get us and they were very friendly. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation - Don't let the negative feedback scare you!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravler52
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace for 7 nights in late August. I am a very frequent traveler and somewhat of a hotel "snob". If you are considering the Riu Palace Riveria Maya, don't let the negative reviews concern you too much - the resort is wonderful choice if you want AI, just be aware of a few things.... 1) Mattress - Yes, it is too hard for American standards. Get a mattress pad upon checking in. I promise, you will need it. It's not bad once you have it put on... 2) Bring at least $50 in singles (USD) for tipping. 3) The Playa Del Carmen area is an attraction for Europeans and S.Americans - women often go topless and men where speedos. 4) The service is great. 5) Don't purchase excursions from the beach vendors. Go with one of the vendors from the hotel lobby (Lomas Travel, etc.) They are more expensive, but much more organized and professional. 6) Buy antiacids and sunscreen in the US - dont plan on buying this kind of stuff in Mexico (Suncreen will run you about $30USD)! 7) The pool is very warm, so if you are looking for a refreshing dip - go to the ocean! 8) The pool and bars close at 8pm - very early. When booking your dinner reservations, choose the later dinner option so you have more daylight and pool time. 9) Sir Olivers is great; Chili's Steakhouse is pretty good; The Japense rest is very good and the Brazillian steakhouse is good as well. 10) My wife and I drank the hotel water/ice - we had no problems whatsoever. However, we used bottled water in the room when brushing our teeth (room water is not potable). 11) The sun is really strong - you need at least 30SPF unless you want to fry. - - - Oh, and by the way; if you do any outdoor tours (regardless of the time) - be careful, you will melt - No Joke! 12) English is a real barrier for the service staff - some of the reviews say "I called and asked 3-4 times for this or that...". More than likely the person didn't understand you. Be patient, they want to help so they can earn a tip! 13) When shopping - make sure you bargain! Start out at least 50% lower than the original price - don't budge and walk away if you have to. They will give in!! 14) The sand beach whales are ugly - but it slows the wave activity which makes it nice for swimming. It's not pretty, but it works. It's not that big a deal! Just remember - you are in another country. If you want an American experience in Mexico - stay at the Hilton or Marriott. If you want a true Mexican vacation - this place is a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: cybershaz
Reviews.Content: I'll caveat this review by saying I had zero expectations for this trip / resort. We won a free trip from Apple and I'm not a big vacation package / charter person so was expecting to not really enjoy it. That said, we had a great time!! The most annoying part of the trip was the flight on USA 3000 (I truly hate charters), but that's for another story. We decided to forego the free group transfer to the hotel and booked our own return transfer through USA Transfers for only $105. I would do that again in a heartbeat. We don't check luggage so we were speeding our way to the hotel while the rest of the resort-goers were still at the airport. I was pleasantly surprised with the hotel - it's very clean and all the staff is super-friendly. We got there at 11:50am and they had a room ready for us. Our trip included a garden room (looking onto other hotels), but we asked if we could upgrade and were given a courtyard room on the 3rd floor (which is only in the center part of the hotel) at no extra cost. Awesome! My other dealing with the front desk was to fax some statements to the US for a police report for a friend (car accident the week prior) and again they went out of their way to help and did it at no charge (thanks Fernel)! We were worried about booking dinners since we were only there for 3 nights. Upon getting our room number at checkin, my husband bee-lined it for the lineup (getting there at noon) and managed to book us into the Brazilian restaurant for that night (Thursday) and Sir Olivers for Saturday. No problem on Friday either, we got the Steakhouse for that night. Downside was there were only early seatings (we prefer later) but it's better than nothing! For the restaurants, here's my 2 cents: -Brazilian - It was ok. I'm not a huge meat-eater and have had churrascuria style food in Brazil so I'm being picky. -Steakhouse - Really good. The surf and turf was really good, as were the crab legs -Sir Olivers (or Krystal, as the menu said) - My fave.
