The food was really nice - something I'd expect in a upscale restaurant The room was nice, and being on a high floor there was no humidity or mouldy smell at all. Many have commented that the beds are hard, but I didn't mind it at all. I guess I'm weird. The balconies were nice, as were the rooms overall. No complaints at all! As far as the pool, it wasn't crowded in my opinion, and there were always beach chairs open by the pool and on the beach, even later in the day. The swimup bar was great, and they would make drinks as weak or strong as you wanted. There were also lots of activities - we weren't into that, but it's good of you like that. I do prefer adults-only, but there weren't too many children. It would just be nice if they weren't at the swimup bar. We've stayed at other resorts where under 18s can't be right at the bar area, which provides a bit of a spot for those who want to party. I'm sure I'm missing other things, but that's the most of it. The sports bar was fun, although wish you didn't have to pay for the games. Not a big deal though. And finally, we loved speaking Spanish with the staff. They always started in Spanish and stayed with it if you responded alike. I could see that being frustrating for those that don't want to practice Spanish, but we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would go back anytime”
Reviews.Author: andreaDD
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at this hotel with my boyfriend. The service was really great, they tried to fulfill all our requests and were really nice and friendly. We have decided for this hotel because it is not far from the center of Playa de Carmen, you can walk or take a taxi for 5 USD and on the pictures it really looked great. I have to say it was really beautiful!!! I was concerned, because of the sandbegs on the beach, but it really did not bothered us at all, it protects the beach, and therefore the sand is really nice and soft and the water clear. There were lot of little fish around as well. We loved playing in the water, because there were no rocks like on many other beaches. My favorite meal was the breakfast, there was always a huge selection, but we were more than satisfied with dinner and lunch too. The rooms were nice, I have asked for king-size bed, and there was no problem to get it. Our room looked to an other hotel, but we had no problem with the view, so we did not upgrade for 50 USD to a garden view. It was quiet and cold, how we needed it after a hot day. Don't miss a day-trip to Tulum! The ruins are beautiful and unforgettable. Take your swimming suits, because there is a great beach with huge waives. Take plenty of water with you, because if you are at the ruins, there are no more possibilities to buy food or drinks just were the taxis and buses stop. This was our second visit at this beach, and I would go back any time! In overall I would suggest the hotel to anybody and would go back next year, because our holiday was like a dream at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: swimforme
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 6 nights here. After getting there a day late (flight was cancelled for unknown reason), getting through the hectic airport, and the hour 1/2 van ride to the resort, my fiancee and I were appalled to discover they did not even have our room available, even though we had booked it three months in advance. We weren't the only ones, many other people were being told to "come back in a few hours". Well we're stuck with all this luggage in an unknown place, easy for you to say. After 3 hours, they had a room--but not the room we paid for, they had to push two beds together as they didn't have a king bed available (I doubt this), and we were on the first floor (which is very smelly and extremely loud at night due to the shows by the way). Called three times asking politely for mattress pads, the beds are as hard as a rock. Had to go to the desk as no one ever came. Food is OK they have a lot of the same stuff, but be ready to pack dress clothes--men can't be seated without long sleeved shirts and slacks, and I was turned away after being seated for wearing "beach-like clothes", when others around me were more scantily clad, I assure you. Pool is very nice, very crowded. The beach is better, although we were weirded out when a few women took their tops off and pranced around. Free wifi. Cheesy shows at night (Michael Jackson impersonators?), but fun. There is a playground for kids. Rooms have a fridge stocked with water, soda, beer, and tequila. Jacuzzi-like bath tub, two sinks, iron and board, TV, porch, and a safe. We had a nice scuba diving experience with Scuba Caribe there, but they are pretty disorganized, especially when we went jet-skiing and para-sailing. Most of the staff there did not speak english and gave us faulty information. Everything is very pricey, but what do you expect at a place this expensive. If you take a cab into town (downtown playa), expect to be heckled. Everywhere. Multiple times. This was very annoying and took some of the experience out of it. We liked Mandarina's Restaurant for dinner down there, pizza and crepes and sorts. Very friendly staff. All in all, I wouldn't shell out a whole lot of cash for this place, but if you get a good deal, go for it. Also--only drink bottled water (no ice cubes!)

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: oklamartin
Reviews.Content: When I booked this resort, I had read all the comments on here. I thought it would be a great place to take my family...wrong! Let me start off by saying we had a fun time, but would not go there or any other riu resort again. I was traveling with my husband and two toddlers. don't get me wrong, this resort is beautiful, but needs to do differently. not a place for small childdren, maybe couples. the only part of the hotel that is enclosed is the front desk area (lobby) and the 4 restaurants below it. the hallways to the rooms are open air, and VERY stuffy! there is no air flow through them! Front desk we checked in, went to our room, and was told it would be ready in 30 min. mind you, we carried all of our luggage, and children to our 'suppose to be ready' room, we got that fixed and moved to another room, no biggy. Rooms we stayed in 0137, which is on the bottom floor, needed to be updated. they were large and had a well stocked fridge and liquor dispensors. we had ants in our room from day one, and got worse as the week went on. we finally asked for some bug spray and they gave us an almost empty bottle, so it must be pretty normal. they cleaned our rooms once a day. anything wet in the room never completely dried...it stinks after a couple days! we finally put everything out on our balcony! we have washed our clothes 2 times, and the smell is stil in them, it's a musty smell, that is hard to get rid off!! i think this hotel should have been fully enclosed, that would have aleast helped with the ant problem and odor (musty) smell! Service everyone was friendly. we asked for a mattress pad for the hard as rock beds 3 times in one day, before they finally told us they were out. they did bring extra blankets, and thats what we put ontop of the bed to make it bare able to sleep on it. my husband called for more toliet paper, and hadn't received it after an hour, so he just took some off of a cart in the hallway! when you and your child are needing the toliet every 30 minutes, you need your toliet paper! the room service menu sucks! you can only order certain items, Food the food was nothing special, same things everyday. i ended up getting sick (montazuma's revenge) the second day i was there, and still am having the problem. it had to been the food, because we didn't go anywhere else, and i did't drink the water! my kids and husband are having it now that were home. this made for a not so great vacation! Pool we didn't spend anytime at the pool, we have one at home. it seemed to be fun...always music, games, and drinking going on, just not our scene with young children. Beach the beach was great! we had the best time out there! the sand bars are an eyesore, but it does help keeps the waves down to swim and have fun! no one on here has said anything about it's a topless beach! we were surprised when we first got there...now we know most guests there are from europe and other counties, where this is normal. It wasn't bad, just surprising! they did have drink service on the beach, which was nice! the water is beautiful, and the best thing about that place! we booked an excursion through a lady there (erica) with worry free vacations. my husband and i wanted to go parisailing. they were going to let our kids on the boat to watch us, as we went one at a time....sounded great! the night before we were suppose to go is when the diaherra started. i was up all night, along with my son on the toliet! we tried to contact the lady before our scheduled time, but no one knew her number. my husband finally went to talk to her, when she got to the hotel, about getting a refund because i was not going to take my toddler son and me, being sick out on a boat! she told my husband i must have been scared to parisail, and he and my daughter could pay $4 and go with the dolphins instead. my husband was pissed! he was not going to leave us up there in the room, and take my daughter there...we just wanted out $140 back, we never got it! she told him sorry! moral of this story, don't pay cash for excursioins, that way you can dispute it with your credit card company, instead of being out of luck! actully the lady told me the couple before me, missed one of their excusions, and she was talking to them about refunding the money......they paid by credit card! this was with traffic tours by the way! after all of this, we just wanted to go home! There are a thousand other resorts in this area (cancun, cozmel, riveria maya). we would defintly choice another chain! this was no where near 5 star or even 4 star, and i sure other resorts have great beaches too!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: musthavatan
Reviews.Content: me and the wife stayed at the riu palace for 2 weeks and i have to say it was fantastic. on arrival we were told we had been upgraded to a courtyard view room which i have to say was lovely. we have stayed in the riu tequila and in reefclub next door both were good hotels but thi is the real deal . food is great ,especialy the steakhouse. they can,t do enough for you at this hotel you just have to ask and its done. tips . use the room service thats what they want you to do and it costs nil. well a little tip for the guy whou brings it. the night time entertainment we thought was poor and usually had a drink in the air conditioned piano bar with 2 couples we met . so if youre reading this jamie and alison or micheal and tracey we had a fab time and enjoyed youre company. if ure on youre way here you wont be dissapointed enjoy...

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time and Twice as Nice.”
Reviews.Author: sammy14eales
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the holiday was prefect. Everthing seemed better than last year. Rooms-Excellent and cleaned daily with an evening turn down service with fresh towels, fridge re-stocked every other day and if you leave a little note the bottle boy will leave you what you want. Pool and pool bar-excellent this year because there were not so many drunken people, so the atmosphere was more relaxing, only problem was some of the pool towels were thread bare for a Palace hotel. Beach-what an improvement from last year yes there are sand whales there but they caused us no problems and the beach has grown so much from last year, there is a drinks service on the beach if needed. Spa-used it only once and the staff were very nice. Food-Very good at the buffet restaurant, we eat at the steak house and it was excellent it had improved by 200% since last year well worth the visit. Sir Olivers what can I say the food and the service is to die for, eat there as many times as possible. Staff-front desk staff if there was a problem it was sorted out asap,the waitiing staff were excellent where ever you eat.And the bar staff what can i say, Islas remembered us from last year and could not believe that we were visiting again, I think we have a friend for life now, he's the best bartender in town nobody comes close, also Beltran and the rest of the staff were wonderful making our stay so special. The only bad point of the holiday was coming home, the flights were great with loads of leg room (thanks Thomson). Already planning for a visit to this hotel next year nothing comes close, we met so many wonderful people. What an amazing holiday.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pigsmum
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and two daughters (aged 17 and 12) have just come back from 2 fabulous weeks at this wonderful hotel. The staff were lovely (whether you tipped them or not) and the hotel, restaurants, pool and beach areas were all as lovely as we expected. As an English family (and perhaps somewhat reserved) what did spoil it for us a bit was the loud entertainment around the pool area from lunchtime onwards. - sexy bingo etc. We understand that this sort of entertainment is great for some, but would have preferred to be able to escape it, and as the pool area and beach are next to each other it was necessary to go up to our room or the bar in the hotel to read a book quietly. The animation staff worked really hard to entertain the customers and on the whole did a fantastic job, the evenings were fun, but we felt the the loud drinking people around the pool in the late afternoon were encouraged to be even noiser by the entertainment on offer and this seemed to be available to entertain perhaps 50 people who wanted it out of the vast number of guests who probably didnt. The all inclusive was exactly that, whatever you wanted whenever you wanted it, all served with a smile. We had caviar, lobster, sushi,every fruit you could imagine and the steaks in the Sir Oliver restaurant were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort, but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Lovestotravelgirlie
Reviews.Content: My husband an I visited the Riu Riviera Maya July 17-21 for a much needed quick getaway. I booked our trip (I am a TA) using the Funjet Fun For Less 5 star, where they pick a resort for you a few days before you leave for a discount. The grounds are lovely and the hotel is pretty in a goddy-peach-walls kind of way, not the modern decor that many of the Riviera Maya resorts go with, but it was kind of a nice change of pace. We arrived around noon and check in was quick and efficient and our room was ready around 2pm. The beach really is lovely by any hotels standards and the giant sand "whales" are necessary so that our children can also enjoy these beautiful beaches, and they don't really bother me at all. There were always chairs which I really liked. My biggest problem with this hotel are the rooms. The rooms are really outdated, especially for a newer hotel. The towels both in the room and (especially) at the pool REALLY need to be replaced they were thin and had strings hanging all over them. The beds are very "firm" (ie, as hard as rocks) but you can, and should, get a matress pad it helps a little. The bathroom was average, but our camode broke once and the "whirlpool" did not work in our tub, no real biggie, as I really didn't come to sit in the bathtub at all. This hotel just isn't 5 star, and that is fine, but Funjet should not sell it as if it were. The food was decent and I did not mind the reservation system really. Going at 8:30pm to the restaurant you want and checking for cancelations worked once for us as well. By the way, the tortilla soup at the Mexican place is fantastic and if you eat Brazillian save room for the last meat, the prime rib, it is by far the best thing I had at the resort. Other than that the food is just Okay and almost never warm. My husband never got one hote meal, everything that came out was luke warm to down right cold, and not just on the buffet, a true 5 star must have better food than this, it just does. The service overall was friendly and fast, nothing spectacular, service should be at least that at a nicer resort. The shows were entertaining and the entertainment staff was one of the highlights of the trip, you could tell they really enjoyed what they were doing. The courtyard is a great place for a drink in the evening and the sports bar isn't half bad. We enjoyed the lobby bar in the evening as well. I really did like this resort, but I did not love it and have other resorts in the area that I would suggest before this one if you are looking for a true 5 star. I am sorry but there are certain things a resort MUST have to be 5 star, and this hotel just isn't it, but htat is okay, as long as you know what to expect. I book honeymoon clients and I don't know that I would send a client here, but it would be great for a family trip and you can't beat the location if you like to be near the city. Happy traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Service”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovers58
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 6 day visit to this hotel. We were greeted at the entrance and our bags were placed on a cart for us while we went to check in. We arrived later in the afternoon and the adjoining rooms we requested were not available. However, Augustin was extremely helpful and did the best he could to get us into rooms that were close. Clean rooms, disinfectant smell, but not that bad. Mattress pad not available either, but a very kind maid did come up and placed blankets under the sheets to soften it a bit. My husband called down to room service for some red wine and within 10 minutes a full bottle was sent up along with someone to open it and pour it in the glasses for us. Service never let up during our entire stay. Anything we needed was provided from a staff that was very eager to please. Food was hit and miss, but more enjoyable than not. The Steakhouse food was wonderful, although it was a bit humid that night to be eating outdoors. Sir Olivers was fabulous. Great pumpkin soup and steak was to die for. Brazilian was OK. The line to get reservations was short on the day we did it, however next day people were waiting in a very long line. This is something I agree they should resolve. Beach chairs were plentiful and after taking a walk down the beach, I have to say that this was the best beach in the area by far. It was clean and spacious, unlike the resorts close to it which were small and very crowded. I dragged a chair into the water for my mother and she was in heaven. Snokel gear was available and my daughter was lucky enough to see some nice fish, although there weren't many of them. Playa is right down the road. We walked down once , but took cabs every other time. ($5) Nice place to stroll and shop at night, but every shop shuts down by 10PM. Hotel entertainment is underwhelming. Location is central to many things. Recommend you bring mesquito repellant. We used it and were glad we did. They are prevelent in the area. Overall, nice vacation and would return. My husband loved it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: xoashlee264
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and we were thoroughly impressed. We absolutely loved this resort. I can't even begin to describe how nice and accommodating the entire staff is. We are definitely laid back people and this was definitely the resort for us. Our favorite restaurant was the steak house; we ate there 2 nights. If you love steak and lobster like us, this is the place for you. The tails are quite small, but we each ordered 2 instead of the 1 that is given and they were fine with giving us extra. If you are unable to make a reservation don't fret, because the buffet is great. We also ate at the Mexican and Japanese restaurants and they were great as well. It is unlikely that you will be able to make a reservation on your first day for the specialty restaurants, because they are usually full. You need to book at least a day in advance. You can make reservations each day from 12-3. We usually got in line about 10 minutes before 12 and never waited longer than 20 minutes to make a reservation. You can book for 2 nights at a time, so be sure to do that to save yourself the trouble of waiting each day. Athough gratuity is included in the package, it is nice to have small bills to tip some people. BE SURE to bring a lot of small bills; they are great to have in order to tip bartenders, drivers if you decide to go on any excursions, maids, etc. We went on 2 excursions. One was the Tulum Extreme which was really fun. We visted Mayan ruins, snorkeled in a cave called a cenote, zip lined through the jungle, rappeled, and were fed lunch. I would recommend finding an excursion where you are able to do many activities in one trip; it saves time and you seem to get more for your money. This excursion was $96 per person including transportation. We left at 7:30am from the lobby and returned by 3pm. A second activity we loved was swimming with the dolphins. It was about 15 minutes away and there are a few different packages you can choose from. We left at 7:30 am and returned by 12:00 pm, so we still had time to hang around the resort. The beach was great. The wait staff is very accommodating especially if you give them a small tip. Our waiter brought us drinks when we didn't even ask and even came into the water to deliver them! The pool is a really fun atmosphere. The swim-up bar is great and there are tables in the pool where you can sit, relax and have a few drinks. There are also activities going on throughout the day including beach volleyball, water volleyball, ping pong, sexy bingo, etc. The night time entertainment wasn't the greatest, but there are shops within a 10 minute walking distance. You can also take a $5 cab ride to 5th avenue to shop (it is only about 5-10 minutes away by cab). The shops are fun, because you can bargain with the vendors and find some really good deals. Overall, our stay was excellent! We didn't want to leave and are definitley thinking of going back. All of the negative reviews I have read on here are minor details. Just to add, we did not order a special mattress pad and our bed was fine, but we really aren't too picky when it comes to those kinds of things. Riu Palace is definitely a great choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Irene0609
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Riu for 7 days from July 20 to July 27. We booked it as an Apple Vacation and were pleased with the flight, transfers, and service. The hotel's facilities, accomodations, restaurants, and beach were impressive. All our requests for the room (mattress topper, extra towels, etc.) were quickly met. The sand "whales" in the water that others have remarked on were no problem - in fact, they lessened the height and intensity of the waves which made it more comfortable in the water. We spent most of our time at the beach area and there was never a problem getting lounge chairs or moving throughout the day to follow the shade. Drink service on the beach was fairly quick. We also did not have a problem making reservations at the specialty restaurants and got to try each one of them. The Brazilian was our least favorite. The buffet restaurants for breakfast, lunch, and dinner had really good selections and new items every day (including sushi one day!). The beach party with barbecued food, drinks in coconut shells, and games was a lot of fun. The bar in the lobby had friendly and efficient staff and was never crowded. The only negative (and not a really big one) was the quality of the nighttime entertainment, always enthusiastic, but not professional quality. The young people on the entertainment staff are working every day from about 10:00 until after the shows around 11 PM, yet are always smiling and full of energy. We visited a number of other Riu properties in Riviera Maya and Palace Riviera Maya was by far the nicest. Two years ago we went to Dreams in Cancun and the Riu was much more luxurious with a far better beach and pool area.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME, lengthy review”
Reviews.Author: JimmyBones50
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife just got back from our honeymoon at the Riu Palace. We were there for one week, and had selected it based on other reviews on trip advisor. I was concerned because it did not start off too well. I had contacted Riu prior to our trip to ask if they provided transportation from the airport to the resort since it was about an hour south. They told me that they did, and that I should call back 5 days prior to landing so they could arrange to pick us up. Well, I call back and they told me that they only provide transportation if I booked directly with the hotel, but since I booked with orbitz I was on my own. Thanks! Since round trip transportation was 120 dollars by car I was not happy. Since we did not have a lot of money, I looked into any alternatives available. I found some links with folks talking about taking the ADO busline which was 8 dollars per person to playa del carmen. I decided for better or worse we would try it. Turned out to be a great idea. The bus was right there at the airport where all the taxis pick up. It was nice. The bus was a mercades and looked brand new. It had tv's, reclining seats, and cold air conditioning. They load and unload your luggage for you, and all this for 8 bucks a person. We went straight to the bus station in playa del carmen which took about an hour. Once at the station there is a line of taxis waiting to take you to your resort. The taxi ride was only 5 dollars. We finally arived at the resort in the pouring rain, due to tropical storm dolly. We didnt mind because we were so tired. The resort was beutiful and everybody was extremely nice. We asked for a mattress pad at check in because all the reviews I read said the beds were hard. They told us they would send one up. We got to our room which was nice except we got 2 double beds, not great for honeymooners. Within a few minutes housekeeping arrived with several large blankets and sheets. She told us they were out of mattress pads until the next day, but she would put the blankets under the sheets. These beds are like sleeping on concrete without the pads. The blankets helped a litte, but first night we did not sleep too well. However, the next day when we did get the matress everything was ok. The pushed the double beds together and arranged the sheets so that you could not feel the crack between the beds. We were happy. Now back to the resort. The place is truly beutiful. There are plenty of lounge chairs at the pool and the beach, so that nobody if fighting over them. The beach did have large sand bags out in the ocean to prevent beach erosion, but this was true of all the resorts on the beach. Another nice aspect was the fact that there are 5 other riu resorts in the vicinity that you can go to with the same all inclusive benefits outside of dinner. Two of the resorts are land locked and we did not go to them. The other 3 are right next to each other, and only about a 5 to 10 minute walk down the beach. The riu yucatan had wild howler monkeys all over the place, which was pretty cool. Back to the palace. Food was a concern after reading some of the reviews, but we thought it was absolutely great. Breakfast and lunch are buffet style and had something for everybody. For dinner the resort has 5 restaurants and one buffet. The restaurants require a reservation and a dress code of no shorts or tank tops. Getting the reservations were not as hard as I thought they would be after reading the reviews. We were able to eat all of the restaurants within six days, so no problem. They were all really good, with the best being Sir Olivers. The first night we ate the buffet, because we did not have reservations, and honestly I could have eaten it every night, the food was so good. The only thing I can really complain about are the mixed drinks. It was really hard to tell if they had any liqour in them at all. I did read of others complaining about this online, but they said with tips the drinks would be ok. Well from our experience it did not matter if you tipped after every drink, they would still be very very very weak. I would ask them to make it stronger and I would get the same thing. I eventually gave up and drank only corona. You have 24/7 room service available with a limited menu. It always seemed very prompt and easy to do. If you ever needed anything, the front desk always helped. We would just call and they would immediatly send someone up. We asked for a bottle of wine to be sent to the room one night, and it was there within minutes. Another night we asked for a couple more coronas for the minifride, and they brought up six of them right away. Entertainment was ok, all the evening shows were dance themed, which is just not my cup of tea. I thought the vegas show was really good. All in all we had a great time, and thought the resort was excellent. The other guests were not the cancun party type and were more family oriented and couples. There were more kids than I expected, but we dealt with it. GOOD TIME, GOOD TRIP!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back to the Riu Palace Riviera”
Reviews.Author: wenpar
Reviews.Content: We travel with a group of friends each year right after Thanksgiving. 2007 was our second trip to this resort. We were there in 2006 as well. We love this place! I can't say we've stayed at many resorts, but our group was thoroughly impressed the first time we went, so made a return trip in 2007 and will most likely return in 2008. The Good- The resort is beautiful and the from the moment you step out of your cab, car or shuttle, the service is pleasant and professional. The grounds are large and awesome. Big enough, but not so large that you need to take a golf cart to get anywhere. The location can't be beat, ocean front, and a 15 minute walk to town, and it is safe to walk day or night. We were brought fresh fruit juice while we checked in. Most of the restaurants are wonderful. We especially enjoyed the Steak house. Drinks are plentiful and tasty and the pool is clean and refreshing. The pool staff is attentive and fun. The lobby bar serves very good martini's. The pool area is large. We never have a problem finding a space for 6+ people, even in 2007 when the resort was completely booked. The beach is growing as the surrounding area is still recupperating from hurricanes in 2006. The rooms are large and airy. The less than perfect, but still not so bad- It is next to impossible to get reservations at the specialty restaurants the day you arrive, but the buffet is awesome. The gym is small and the equipment is somewhat limited and outdated in some cases. The staff cleans with Amonia, and the smell lingers. Plan on washing everything you brought when you return home. The Mexican restaurant was not very good, but the others were very nice. Evening entertainment varies from comedic relief to enjoyable. All in all, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: bottomfeader
Reviews.Content: I was there for five days with my wife and parents and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful. The staff was great. Food was good. The only complaint anyone had was there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom. If your going to this resort and are worried about negative reviews, don't. The vacation was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Pefect Stay! Would Go Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: justasim7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary at Riu Palace Riviera Maya July 21st – July 25 of 2008 and had a perfect time. In summary: Wow! We were never so pampered and enjoyed ourselves on vacation like this before, the staff, hotel, food, pool and beach were all amazing. Pros: Service/staff is beyond belief, have never experienced anything like it. The grounds and beauty of the hotel Food Pool Beach Cons (these are so minor compared to the positives above): If you have very loud neighbors, you'll here them. Ask for a mattress pad at check-in. Service/staff: Outstanding! In fact, this was the best part of the stay. You do not have to know any Spanish, but a few words and phrases are helpful. When someone did an exceptional job, I gave them a small $2-$3 tip. The hotel grounds: Beautiful, perfect layout, there is always an ocean breeze when you are in the courtyard or down by the pool. The lobby area is as amazing, I always saw people cleaning, even late at night. Food: Great, we only ate at Sir Oliver once, otherwise just enjoyed the buffet. However, this was not any ordinary buffet, tremendous selection, all items were fresh, and a different theme each night. Pool was wonderful: plenty of chairs, it does get a little crowded during mid-day but still plenty of room to have fun. Beach, there are large areas of Royal Palm trees between the pool and the ocean to relax in chairs, great view of the water. Forget all the points mentioned in the bad reviews, we did not see any bugs, everything was exceptionally clean, food was outstanding. We were glad to see no topless women around the pool, however, there were a few down by the beach. We had a great time and would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Beach Area”
Reviews.Author: MimiSophia
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the hotel are gorgeous. The staff takes immaculate care of the grounds. I woke up early a few mornings to use the gym, and the staff is up early ridding the hotel beach area of seaweed, constantly sweeping water away during rains. 24 hour room service was great for my boyfriend and I, especially after a night out at the beautiful beach front clubs in the area. We especially enjoyed the Mexican Toasties (chicken tostadas), and the chocolate cake! 24 hour room service arrived under 15 minutes every time we ordered, no matter what the time. Food: Breakfast is excellent. A large selection of yummy food. Their coffee was great, especially with their freshly made donuts coated in sugar. Lunch: Lunch was not so great for us. It seemed to cater to a different palate, perhaps a more euro flavor. We saved banana's from breakfast to munch on for lunch. Dinner: We only visited the steakhouse, which was alright. A couple who had visited Riu 3 other times told us to just eat at the buffet and we followed their advice. We preferred the buffet only because you can get lots of what you like. PLUS they had an amazingly tasty CHOCOLATE FOUNTAIN every night with every fruit, marshmellow (they had STRAWBERRY marshmellows!! yum!). They also fried up plaintains in batter that were just about the most delicious treat I ever had. Entertainment: My boyfriend and I are in our mid-late 20's, so we felt the bands were a great addition to the dinner atmosphere. I especially enjoyed the band that played Santana tunes. We would watch the bands for a bit after dinner before we headed out to the clubs (which are AWESOME). The music during the day by the pool and beach were very fun, I heard them play one of my favorite Selena songs! I recommend younger visiters leave the hotel and go out to Coco Maya and Blue Parrot (recommended by bartenders in the sports bar). The blue parrot has the famous fire show at 11:30. Lady's night are tuesdays and thursdays at blue parrot. The hotel dies down at night but if u wanna have fun without going out, go to the sports bar. The Bartertenders were so kind, made great drinks. When it rains, go see a movie. Playa has very very nice movie theaters, and the movies are in English! (with spanish subtitles or sometimes dubbed over). Booze: Ok, I keep reading reviews saying the drinks were watered down. You must not be ordering the right drinks! Although I'm not a drinker, my boyfriend had NO problem getting shots of Don Julio- his favorite tequila. If you want it stronger, ask for a double or on the rocks, because they are more than happy to get you drunk - ask my boyfriend! :) Speak up and tell the sweet bartenders you want it strong. You have no one to blame but yourself on that one. sorry. Rooms: Rooms were beautiful. My only advice for light sleepers like myself, ask to be far away from the lobby where the nighttime entertainment is. Also, we unfortunately got placed directly above the sports bar (room 2083). The sports bar is open 24 hours, so we eventually asked to move because of the loud bass from the music, to a room closer to the beach which was perfect. Staff: the staff at the front desk very sweet and cool. They suggested the two awesome clubs we went to. The bartender at the sports bar also recommended the same two clubs. Very helpful. Additionally, they were very accommodating with us wanting to move rooms and with any question we had. My boyfriend speaks spanish, so that helped to build good vibes any time we engaged with the staff. We tipped the staff normally in dollars. Overall, we had an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace has highs and lows”
Reviews.Author: MLK1222
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying this was our third trip to RM Mex and have stayed at Iberostar Lindo and Adventura Spa Palace in 2005 and 2006. This was our first time ever at a RIU and we Stayed 7-16 to 7-21. My husband and I travel twice a year and stay at only higher rated hotels. We both currently work in the hospitality industry and I feel are very fair in our reviews. I had did much research reading all the good and bad reviews so, I want this review to help you so here are my honest thoughts. Hotel Property and Apperance; Stunning! - Beautiful grounds imaculately kept. The location was perfect right next to town the best! Spa ; We did a detox body wrap - This was SO worth the money - make sure you get the RIU class card and they give you 15% off. Pedicure was just ok. Pool Area; Very Large well kept - There is not a kids pool area so if this is not your thing it can be a bit overwhelming at times. Rooms; We stayed in 3089 and glad we were up. If you go request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. The rooms on the 1st floor all are outside and I am sure this is where the musty rooms are. When you go up there are no outside corridors so that said - no musty smell or humid rooms. The room was okay - The beds are very hard ask for the matress pad! Our bed spread was very dirty with stains - gross! Our toilet was no good - to get it to flush you had to flush it three times. House keeping; HORRIBLE! The room was never really cleaned they just made the bed - They never once washed down the shower at all! The shampoo dispenser stayed broken on the ledge the whole time we were there and funny the couple that we went with said the smae thing?? The last day we were there they never clesned the room at all (nor our friends room) when we found a house keeper and asked him he rolled his eyes and was like ok!- We NEVER once got a towel animal and we all know how much we look forward to those in mexico. Restaurants; SIR OLIVER is Amazing!!!! - My husband is a Chef for Marriott and he LOVED- We went there twice and it was excellent both nights! Go there as many times as you can. The steak house; was good to they give you this chilled seafood appetizer and it was VERY GOOD! Two of us ordered our steaks very rare and when delvered they were well done but, the manager quickly saw our dismay and changed out our steaks for rare ones - we also told him the lobsters were too small (cause they are) but he brought us extras on plates - It all was very nice in the end. Mexican restaurant; The appetizer buffet was good it is the only "mexican style" food you will get since their menu is not?? Well that is if you call jalapeno poppers mexican food! - LOL I am not kidding you. They did have some tasty sopes and calamari were both good. I had the Fruit and nut stuffed pork it was over cooked - my husband had the fish which we were quite sure was a frozen fish and not fresh our friends had the beef and shrimp - The shrimp were super small! - Over all not very good we were starving by 11pm and had to heat up the nasty food from the sports bar. Buffet - Good breakfast - Lunch so so it's a buffet -so what right! My bigest problem with the restaurants is they only have 12 tables in each restaurant with two seatings so you do the math this means they only have 120 reservations per night for a resort that at a minimum has 850 people in it. It's truly messed up the way they do this and the restaurants are WAY TOO SMALL! We were lucky b/c we had two rooms we could make all of the reservations at once but the first night we had to eat in the buffet b/c they had no more reservations. We never got to the Japanese or Brazilian Service- EXCELLENT!!! Bartenders/ Servers - Claudia and Islas were the best! Rosario at Sir Oliver awsome! Beltran and Santos - servers amazing! Charley at the Pool seriously he ran with our drinks - They all rocked!! I keep seeing people complain about watered down drinks - and yes if you order the Foo Foo drinks they are watered down but all you need to do is ask for a double and they give you plenty of booze! This is how most A-I do it! Warning!!!- The Bar by the entertainment had cock roaches all over it. This happened the last night we were there - It was weird b/c we sat there every night previous and never saw one the last night there were seriously at least 50 that we saw when they started crawling on our sideof the bar we left and went to the lobby bar. GROSS!!!! The entertainment got better the more you drank I guess that is all I can say. I Hope you find this helpful! I do want to stress we had a wonderful vacation and none of these problems stopped us from having a good time. I am glad the cock roach thing happened on the last night that is for sure.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ad803
Reviews.Content: have just returned this morning after a 14 night vacation. Family of 3 including teenage daughter, all had a brilliant time. The hotel from the moment you enter is stunning. The reception staff were very helpful and were available anytime to answer queries. My husband and daughter took advantage of the diving and had a superb time, the diving team were excellent We had a junior suite on the first floor overlooking the the neighbouring hotel kitchen, not the best outlook but l wasn't intending spending that much time on the blacony. The staff kept the room immaculate and the towels were renewed usually twice daily. We enjoyed all the meals we had at the hotel, we eventually just kept to the buffet as it offered such a wide variety. The staff at the restaurants were very helpful and attentive and couldn't do enough. Spent alot of time by the pool, always clean with plenty of staff to serve you with rereshments. Disagree about the watery drinks, l tended to order alcohol free as they were so strong. Would agree that a larger pool or separate childrens pool would be an improvement, as it can get busy in the afternoon with children. Only complaint l had and l made it to the reception whilst there, the fact that on a number of occasions usually at 2 or 3 am, loud drunken and l hate to say but on all occasions american teens. shouting down the corridor. After speaking with reception this stopped as they patrolled the corridor. So my advice, any complaints let the staff know, they will try their utmost to rectify the situation. This in no way detracted from the excellent holiday we have had and it is our intention to hopefully return soon

Reviews.Title: “Five Star”
Reviews.Author: belky
Reviews.Content: My husband celebrated our eights anniversay with nine nights beginning July 2nd through the eleventh and loved the entire stay! My husband is a travel agent and I am a photographer and this was the fourth Riu Palace we've stayed at. We rate this Riu in the top two. The staff were all wonderful and a very clean palace. The food and entertainment were also great. We would definitely tell everyone to go here for no problems. Brenda and Clay Montgomery. Owasso, Ok. www.envisionsphotography.com...for photos to view.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time.....BUT......Not at all impressed with Riu”
Reviews.Author: jjph80
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a 5 night stay at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. This was our 5th trip to the Cancun/Riviera Maya area. We booked through Apple Vacations, as we always do. I can not say enough great things about Apple Vacations - definitely the best way to travel! However, I strongly disagree with their 6 golden Apple rating for the RPRM. Based on the service, food, drinks and pool area, the hotel is at best a 5 red Apple. Food: The streakhouse had good food and a nice atmosphere. The Brazilian restaurant was just okay and the Japenese restaurant was not very good. The buffets offered a ton of selections for breakfast, lunch and dinner. However, the food was just not enjoyable. Though we were never starving, we did not really enjoy any of the food during the course of our stay. Service: I have read reviews raving about the service, I must say I can't Disagree enough. As far as we were concerned, the staff was very unattentive, unfriendly and less than impressive. If they only spent as much time serving guests as they did cleaning up, they would be in much better shape. The service at the pool bar and buffets were by far the worst! The service in the specialty restaurants and in the lobby bars was ok. Drinks: Oh, where to begin..........The drinks were so incredibly watered down and it was near next to impossible to even catch a buzz after drinking ALL day (and from past experiences this is NOT typical of all inclusive restaurants). The beer was surprisingly good (Corona) but the mixed drinks and frozen drinks were nearing on horrific. Property: This was the saving grace of our trip. The hotel property is amazing and it is truly breathtaking. We had a superior junior suite on the first floor right near the pool facing the courtyard. The room was simple yet nice and our view was well worth the money for the upgrade. Only complaint about the room was the smell. We didn't pay much attention to it while we were there, but now that we are home, our clothing and suitcases have retained the smell. I am afraid I am going to have to trash some of our belongings as I can't seem to get the smell out of certain things (despite being washed numerous times). Pool: The pool area was nice (though it got very crowded throughout the day - for a hotel this size, there should have been more pools). There are tons of palm trees surrounding the pool area which makes it impossible to get any seats that are in the sun all day. But after hours in the sun at times the shade was a welcoming break. The infininity pool was relaxing and offered a great view of the pool and the beach/ocean. Only warning about the pool, there is no children's pool area which means all the kids are in the main pool, infinity pool and in the swim-up bar area. After a few days, this definitely became annoying. Entertainment: First of all, let me say that the entertainment staff appeared to work very hard morning, noon and night and I must commend them for that. However, they are definitely not professionals and that really reflected in their daily activities and nightly performances. Definitely by far the worst All Inclusive entertainment I have ever experienced. Spa: My husband I endulged in a couples massage one evening. Overall our experience at the spa was very pleasant. The staff in the spa was very attentive and very pleasant. The massages were great and I would definitely recommend utilizing the spa. Overall, my husband and I had an enjoyable trip and did not walk around complaining all week (I promise we didn't). Just looking back at it now, I would have without a doubt booked a different property. With that being said, if you are considering a RIU property, I would think twice about it. After this experience, I will never again consider another RIU property. From past All Inclusive experiences, I highly recommend Iberostar or Palace chains..............They by far are in a different league than the RIU's (despite their similar ratings)!

Reviews.Title: “CANNOT WAIT TO GO BACK NEXT YEAR!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BEC258
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this resort is Fabulous!!!!! We stayed for 6 days and it was great!! The staff is wonderful. Always making sure you dont need anything else. We did ask for the mattress pad and did get it the first night and did not have a problem sleeping. There is plenty to choose from on the Buffet if you cant get into the restaurants. We ate at Chilis, The Mexican and the Brazalian. All were good. I cannot imagine anyone not loving this resort. We will be going back next year for sure!!!! Oh and if you are not a RIU rewards member go to RIU.COM before you go and join.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience - Long Review”
Reviews.Author: Grim11
Reviews.Content: Returned from RPRM on Monday and thought I should share some of me experiences. I spent a lot of time reading reviews and comments in the forum and felt I should give a little back. This was our third trip to Playa Del Carmen. We stayed at the RPM the first two times and decided to stay at the RPRM this time, so you will probably see a lot of comparisons between the two in this review. Hotel in general The hotel was very nice. Always clean and everyone was incredibly friendly. The hotel was very similar to the RPM, but was a little less worn. The grounds were perfect. Room Very similar to RPM. Had a King sized bed which was nice. Asked for the mattress pad which made the hard bed very comfortable. Pool We are not pool people, and I think I spent a total of 10 minutes in the RPM pool in 2005 and 2006. However, I really enjoyed the RPRM pool. We would sit in the elevated section (infinity pool) in the afternoon for an hour or so before we went up and started getting ready for dinner. The pool seemed pretty clean, but I did notice a little scummy build up in the lower pool one afternoon when the pool was very crowded. There were always a lot of people in the pool, but you could get chairs if you wanted them. Beach The beach was as expected. The giant sand bag whales really took something away, but you could tell that the beach was getting better. The water was not as clear and there was a little more seaweed type vegetation than before. I think this was due to the whales. We did enjoy the beach and spent most of our time there, but it's hard not to compare it to the glory days of 2005. The beach was closer to the hotel than at the RPM which was nice. Bars I did quite a bit of drinking, so I consider myself a bar expert. I loved the lobby bar. It was so much nicer than the RPM lobby bar. No thick cigar smells and plenty of room. The sports bar was nice. Played a couple of games of pool one afternoon for $3 each. Pool/beach bar was good. Food I think the food was my favorite part. So I may put too much detail in this section. Breakfast - Had the buffet every morning. Omelets, pancakes and sausage were my favorite. Had to have a Mimosa every morning with breakfast. Lunch - We had lunch everyday at Chilis. I was a little surprised that the Buffet was not open for lunch. I'm pretty sure it was at the RPM. Chilis was good, but did get a little repetitive. They always had one or 2 new things, but a lot of the same stuff. My favorites were the mussels. They only had them 2 days out of 5. Dinner - We only ate at the buffet on the first night and made dinner reservations for the next 4. However, I made it a point to stop by the buffet and see what they had every night. Night 1 - Buffet. It was Mexican night which may have been the best buffet we saw. Tostados were great and they were making Chiros (sp?), fried cinamon bread sticks. They were both great. Also had a pig. It tasted good, but I tried not to look it in the eye when they were carving. Overall, the buffet was above average, but it was not as big as the RPM and the variety from night to night was limited. I would recommend going to the specialty restaurants as much as possible, and if you get something you don't like then go to the buffet. Night 2- Mexican. This was the only restaurant available for the evening, so we booked it and didn't expect much. However, we were very pleasantly surprised. The appetizer buffet was great. My wife loved the burritos and the shrimp was pretty good. Night 3 - Japanese. Always a favorite for us. Everything was great. The shrimp was the best dinner and the fried ice cream was the best dessert. Night 4 - Sir Oliver/Krystal. The sign over the restaurant says Sir Oliver. The menu says Krystal. This place was a little too fancy for us, but we enjoyed it. Thebest appetizers were the shrimp and vegetable ravioli and pumpkin soup with scallops. Stay away from the cruncy vegetable thing. Not so good. The steak was very good, but my wife did not like the lamb. She normally loves lamb, but thought the flavor was too strong. Chocolate dessert was amazing. Night 5 - Steak house. Not very excited about this because we hated the steakhouse at the RPM, but we were very pleasantly surprised. We had an awesome table overlooking the beach. The seafood appetizer was good. The filet and lobster was very good. I loved the baked alaska dessert.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kdkeating
Reviews.Content: Sorry It took so Long!! We Took our first " family" Vacation wiy=th our 14 month old daughter, we were nervous about how she would travel. Well... No Worries!!! The entire resort accomadated us!!! I could not have felt less akward about traveling with a child!! I think she may think she is a lost Mayan princess!! They met our every need and insured that we felt on vaction, not like nervous parents for a minute!!! I read the bad/luke warm reviews and worried!!! To no end folks My daughters first word was AGUA!!!! Great trip!! Faciliteis were impeccable, staff was compassionate & attentive. We are looking to book again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Wedding”
Reviews.Author: GoShockers
Reviews.Content: Stayed June 27 through July 2, 2008. We were married here on July 1 and had a wonderful wedding! I booked the wedding and communicated w/ the hotel online without any problems. We picked the middle wedding option because it fit our needs. Including us, there was only 13 in the wedding party, so we wanted a simple laid back (stress free) wedding. Our room was upgraded to a big wonderful suite and was very quite and odor free! It was located in the middle of the hotel and we thought we wouldn't like being on the first floor, but we loved it! When we arrived on the afternoon of the 27, we made reservations for 11 the next night at the mexican restaurant (good) and for 13 the following night for the brazilian steak house (awesome). Both reservations at 6:30. No problem making reservations. Buffet had a huge selection and most of it was pretty good. The day after we arrived we met w/ the wedding coordinator and finalized the details....everything went very smooth and we added a few extras. One extra we loved was live music by the trio! We were just going to use the recorded music but the trio played at our table the first night at the hotel and really enjoy the music! Wedding went smoothly but was very hot at 4pm on July 1. We hired the photographer for extra photos and he was wonderful, Carlos. We stayed at a different hotel for the honeymoon (The Royal) and Carlos brought the photos to us! We had the reception dinner at Chilis and we were given our own personal dinning area, everyone seemed to really enjoy their meals! Overall, this was a perfect hotel for our wedding and all our guests seemed to really enjoy themselves. In fact, some are already talking about going back next year! Staff was friendly, food good, and great drinks! ***If you want to go out for an awesome dinner, try Hotel Fusion! You sit at small tables on the beach and enjoy good food and cold beer! So good, we went back to back nights! The only bad part of the vacation was that one of our guests stepped on some type of critter in the ocean and his foot was swollen for about 24 hours. My other advice is that once you book the trip, stop reading reviews because the good ones make you feel good, the bad ones will add unnecessary stress to your vacation! You will not go wrong w/ this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Knowing what to Expect/Plan For”
Reviews.Author: chari_us
Reviews.Content: Overall very good experience but needed to use the advice previously seen in other reviews, as mentioned there the staff was absolutely amazing, especially the restaurant and bar waitstaff who took it upon themselves to learn our names and greet us when walking around the resort. Don't expect 5 star food but there was plenty of variety so you could always find something you did like. Not to repeat old reviews, but here were the highlights that were useful to us: - Request a room not on the ground floor, it'll be much more quiet, also ask for one not facing the main courtyard if you want to sleep before 11PM otherwise you'll hear the entertainment. Ask for the mattress topper for your bed, expect you'll have to ask 2x to get someone to actually come put it on. - Take along scented candles in case your room has a mildewy smell, ours didn't but several people we spoke to did just from all the humidity there. - You can only make restaurant reservations between noon-3PM in the main lobby, if you go a little after noon there's no line. There's 2 sittings for each restaurant, one around 6:30 and another around 8:45. One alternative we found was that you can ask the maitre d around 6:30 if they have any unfilled reservations for the late sitting, they probably won't but will tell you to check back around 9PM and if there's no show's you can be seated, this worked 2 out of 3 times for us so we only ate at the buffet 2x and all other nights at a restaurant. Oliver's is probably the nicest one. The Japanese was ok, Mexican was good but don't expect Taco Bell type choices it's not Tex-Mex like most americans are used to, Chilis steak house was ok although again not a 5 star steakhouse, I'd compare it to Texas Roadhouse restaurant quality. We didn't do the brazilian place. - The night entertainment was nothing to write home about but was sufficient to serve as background music/commotion while out drinking in the outdoor lobby bar area - Speaking with other guests who were coming from other Riu properties the consensus definitely was the Riviera Palace Maya property is the best Riu one with second place being the Riu Palace Mexico. You're allowed to go to the other Riu properties although you can't eat dinner there - The beach was fine, we never had problems finding chairs out there (although if you want pool side ones you might have to get there before 10). The sandbags are just like big rocks, they are not appealing to the eye but they're along the whole coast from the hurricane so you can't really blame the hotel, there's plenty of room to swim regardless. The water is NOT clear like across the way in Cozumel so don't bother bringing snorkel gear

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing visit to Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyfromTX
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Riu Place in Riviera Maya. We had stayed at two Riu's in Cancun before, and let me tell you, Riviera Maya blows Cancun out of the water. We'll never stay in Cancun again. The Palace was very pretty. We were waited on very well, as you would expect from a hotel of this magnitude. Like others said, there is minimal night life, this is definitely a quieter resort, but we made friends in the sports bar and had a great time. Chano is the best bartender ever!! Same as with all all inclusive places, the more tips you leave, the better drinks you get. We left a dollar on top of the fridge the first day and got lots of beer and sodas stocked. We also tipped the pool bartenders and would get much better drinks. A taxi ride to 5th avenue is only 5 dollars, and is worth it to go shopping or to Senor Frogs. You must go down there at least once...great atmosphere. The beach at the Palace is great. Lots of hammocks and chairs, and was never very crowded. Very peaceful if you want to get away from the noise at the pool. We were very pleased with our stay...the negative reviews I've read are just from people who are never happy with anything. Go to the Palace ready to relax, eat, and enjoy the beautiful scenery, and you'll be very happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you want”
Reviews.Author: WoodsyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace June 26th, thru July 1st. While we were given a confirmation on a upgraded room, they said they had to charge us because they had given away all there free upgraded rooms away, and if we want a room with a view of the courtyard we needed to pay an additional $50.00 a night. This isn't my first rodeo, they just want to charge me instead doing what they said they would do. The service other than that was fantastic. But they didnt start off on the right foot. Maybe there managers should follow the examples of great service there employees give. Restaurants: Pain in the @#$. You had to wait in a line between 12:00 and 3:00 everyday for a reservation at one of the restaurants. What if I wanted to go on an excursion, then I was forced to eat at the buffet. Now the buffet was great, but not a nice peacful quite atmosphere like in the restaurants. Now I wasn't able to eat at the Brazilian Rest., which I wanted to, but everyday regardless of what time I got in line it was full. All inclusive, I should be able to eat at whatever restaurant I want or at least try all of them in weeks span. Not here, got to imagine this is how they control cost. While they said it was all booked up everytime I walked by it half the restaurant was empty.. WTF. Staff: I couldn't have asked for more they were simply awesome, they knew my name, my wifes name and gave them a few extra dollars everyday to show my gratitude. Cocktails: This is the one reason and pretty much only reason I will never visit this resort again. You can't get a buzz. The small little plastic cups can be sucked down in two seconds, I don't want to have to order a cocktail every 5 minutes, very little alcohol in them, cheap alcohol unless you demanded. I honestly drank all day and never got a buzz, I got full of drinks but never a buzz. Good Luck. The best cocktail I had was when I was leaving to go back home from a a rest. in the airport. I would have order less drinks, gotten a buzz and they wouldn't have had to wash 50 glasses a day and make me 50 cocktails a day. I've been coming down to Mexico for 20 years, and normally mexican resorts make great cocktails. I was almost tempted to get back behind the bar like the old days and just make it myself. Pool: Great Layout, Plenty of Chairs and Room in the pool. Beach: Was Great, lot of things to do. Breakfast: Great Buffet, Lunch at Chilis plenty of offering for everyone, including children, vegetarians, etc. If they could fix the reservation situation and make a better drink they could charge me $100.00 a day more and I would gladly pay. If you are going to enjoy a good cocktail. WARNING!!!! Rooms: Room was good after I payed for it. Stay away from the area where they have the nightly entertainment, or you won't sleep early if you chose too. Very Clean, Well Stocked with the dependable Corona Extra. The bed was like sleeping a concrete. Glad they had a spa, after two days of that I needed. No wonder why the spa busy with sore backs. Sports Bar: A couple of Pool Tables. Now why charge $3.00 for a game of Pool, when you are including everything else. This makes no sense. Is that what keeps them profitable????? Just let me play as much pool as I would like and tack on a few dollars to the daily rate. Duh!!! Charge me the $6.00 for a Pina Colada or $6.00 for a Mai Tai and I bet you make a good one. You are trapped. I am ready for a good cocktail when I go home tonight. Just 1 1/2 ounces of a regular quality alcohol with a decent mix and I will be in heaven. Thanks, Mr and Mrs. Broke and Sober

Reviews.Title: “Every item of clothing ruined...”
Reviews.Author: norwegian_icegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 weeks and had mixed feelings about the place. But the main impression is that we will never stay at this place again. Outdoor areas were beautiful, well maintained and clean. We felt safe wherever we went, including evening walks to town. That was wonderful. The entertainment crew were lovely, lively and did their best to keep people happy and entertained. Indoor areas were pretty, but the heavy use of strong smelling cleaning products /artificial perfume was quite in a league of its own... ROOMS Indoor areas did not impress me as much. Our room smelled extremely damp the night we arrived, but we were so tired and jetlagged that we thought it was us. But it soon dawned on us that it was the room. 2 days later I asked to change rooms because of the smell, but got the answer that the hotel was full... The bathroom had black mould in the ceiling, and in the corners of the showerrom. The painting was also peeling (perhaps in an effort to scrub the mould off???). There was no fan/ventilation in this room. First day we had to contact maintenance, as the bathtap fell off. Gradually the smell began to take to our clothes. We could not keep anything in the drawers. Nothing ever dried up, the entire room was damp, no matter how low the AC was turned on. In our last week they painted the walls in the hallway outside our room, and we had to zigzag between (abandoned) ladders and wet paint to get out. Still no chance of changing a room, and getting one off the ground floor (other guests told us that the moist feeling was less higher up). Three weeks after our return, and 5 washings later, I have thrown away several pieces of clothing and a bag, as the smell of mould will not come out. It "clung" to everything, shoes, bags, and linen... :( Tv-signals fell out regulary. When asked for anything sugarfree beverages for the minibar, they could only give us water. FOOD For someone with lactose intolerance it was difficult to manouver around food, as the waiters/chefs all assured me that there was no milk in so and so products, only for me to end up sick in the bathroom afterwards due to being misinformed. We both got food poisoning from a "fiesta" at the beach where they handed out coconuts. I had three sips, was sick 3 days, partner 5 days... We were not alone, the next week they cancelled the fiesta... Almost all of the restaurants had buffet-style service (sic). Plus for the japanese and the gourmet place, which both had a la carte. The lunchbuffet was riddled with birds, that landed on your table, and (loudly) tried to take their pick, meaning literally that if you sat and turned your back, they would land on your plate. The staff at "Chili's"made little or no effort to chase them away, whereas in the morning the staff at the main breakfast area managed to chase them off. All in all, not what we expected from such a place, and many, many steps below similar (and much cheaper) places in Croatia, France and USA.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome, RELAXING trip”
Reviews.Author: ramph
Reviews.Content: Great time. Great service. Great buffets. Restaurants were overrated, but who cares. My wife and I had a marvelous time! Pool was Great. Bars were great. Beach was great. If you go here and don't have a great time there's something wron with you. This was the first vacation I've gone on and could have stayed another week. I came home and booked another RIU within a month.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mainiac
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I and our daughter & niece spent 10 nights at this pretty resort (June 10-20). We've been to the Barcelo Bavaro, IB Tucan, Lindo, & Maya, Blue Bay, rented a villa in Jamaica, and 4 diff. places in the DR. This Riu ranks right in the upper middle of this group. Entrance and lobby are simply lovely - chandeliers, coffered ceilings, plants, lighting. Slight mess up with our reservation (Funjet had only sent paperwork for 1 room) was quickly corrected after we showed our papers. Email sent in advance with room request (we got a riu class card in advance) didn't seem to make a difference. We told them it was our 20th anniv., and strangely enough, a few days into the vacation, we got a fruit plate with "happy honeymoon" on it. Explained with our simple spanish, and they told us to keep it anyway. Hope we didn't get some poor couple's fruit plate. Everything here tells you to try to get a courtyard view. We didn't, but found our outer facing rooms fine (2134, 2135). View of the Reef resort next door was pleasant in the morning, and it was quiet. Courtyard view might have been nice, unless you overlooked the evening entertainment, in which case it might have been noisy at night. As others stated, you do hear doors slamming, people walking down the halls - kind of echos. Not a big thing. Room was clean, heavy, dark furnature; coffered ceilings, even in the shower. Shower had jac. tub which we didn't use (the girls did and loved it). Plenty of hot water, and none of the cold surges I've noticed elsewhere. Beach: Sand whales as stated, didn't bother us much as we know there wouldn't be much beach without them. We went in most days, floated on tubes or just hung out riding small waves. Sand bags look kind of like huge rocks, and we thought our beach was much better than those around us. Lots of chairs in sun or shade, no need to reserve, and small beach bar set up daily. Drink service was frequent and prompt. Drinks were your average AI, but hit the spot. Pool: Very warm in June. We felt that the Riu pool was too small for the resort, because the water would be dirty (sunscreen slime floating on the surface, some straws, etc.) by the end of the day. Lots of people hanging out by the pool bar, fun, nice crowd most of the time. Watch out for sexy bingo and the winner's pole dance if you're not into that. Again, frequent and prompt pool drink service. A little harder to find chairs around the pool, but there were always 2-3 together for us at any given time. Get your towel cards at the desk at check-in (we had to go back for them) - easy to trade for as many towels as you need. Most days they seemed to want to give us more towels than we needed cards for, which ended us up with 6 cards. Food: They really need building concierges for dinner reservations. Line up at noon took at least 1/2 hr to get to the reservation person. Shorter line after 1:00. You can book 2 reservations at a time, but only for 4 days out. Usually they're full 1-2 days out. We were able to try all of them (6:30 or 8:45 sittings with 6:30 filling up faster). Japanese has no show tables - hubby enjoyed sushi. Mexican, like most places we've visited, had a better appetizer selection than the menu - you could have just eaten there. Gourmet had limited selection (girls didn't find anything they liked and ate at the buffet). Hubby and I enjoyed it (vegetable puff pastry appetizer was great). Steakhouse is the only outdoor restaurant (hot in June). Seafood and salad appetizer for everyone, small selection of entrees, but surf and turf was good (daughter was able to get extras of the surf portion, which made her happy). Baked alaska at the end for everyone, which was tasty. We enjoyed the Brazilian the most with the never-ending skewers of meat. Tried to go there again, but it was full. We ate 3 times at the evening buffet (spent one night away from the resort in Valladolid). Best night seemed to be customer comment night where the staff leaped over each other to serve you. Otherwise your average AI buffet with a good variety of choices and plenty to fill you up. Breakfast buffet had omelet station, fried, boiled and scrambled eggs, lots of breads and pastries, fruit (mango one day - where did it go after that?), salad stuff, bacon, sausage, etc. Plenty to fill you up for the entire day. Lunch buffet at Chillis actually seemed to offer better variety than the main one. No one got sick, and we all must have gained from all the food and drinks. Overall, we had a great time. Special thanks and a hello to Sandos and John Williams at the bars - they are great guys. Also to Hector the front door person, who was sweet and unfailingly polite.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmcmac
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in June 2008. This was the best of the Riu's in Playacar. It was absolutely fabulous. The food was to die for. There was the main restaurant, Don Minolo which was lovely and the choice of food was extensive and cooked to a very high standard. In addition to this restaurant, there were 5 specialty restaurants of which I would recommend the Japanese and Sir Oliver's gourmet restaurant. You received exceptional service in the latter and it was really special. You do have to book for each of the specialty restaurants but this was no problem. The rooms were large and spacious and kept exceptionally clean. The grounds were beautiful and the staff are continually cleaning and keeping immaculately clean and tidy all areas of the hotel. The staff were so friendly and overall we had an exceptionally good holiday and would rate this hotel as one of the very best we have stayed in and we have certainly visited many in the past couple of years. Highly recommended and would love to return

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: poochie-girl
Reviews.Content: We had a great time here - staff are all really friendly and take the time to remember your name, what you like to drink, where you like to sit etc and what things you have planned for your stay. The food was good, excellent choice in the buffet, esp at breakfast and the gourmet restaurants were allgood, we had no problem in booking for the specific nights we wanted. The drinks are a little weak, but you only have to ask and they ll add more alcohol to them with no problems. I guess its because some people are drinking from 8am to 2am so I they like to be a bit cautious. Pool area was lovely, plenty of space, there is constant music but it didntbother us. Entertainement was the standard RIU fare, ok for a bit of a laugh but nothing special - similar to the sort you get in the pubs/hotels in Spain/Balearics etc. All in all a good holiday. One word of caution, I wouldnt get married there, a bit of a conveyor belt of weddings with everyone at the pool getting up to have a good look at the bride and listen to the vows.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - great time-despite a little rain.”
Reviews.Author: jvnj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 6 night stay at this hotel and had a wonderul experience, regardless of other recent reviews. Hotel - beautiful, extremely clean, stylish, 5/5 stars! Room - We opted for the upsized suite and it was definitely larger. Walk-in closet, living room, HUGE bathroom w/jet tub, balcony and King sized bed. Pool - Large enough and plenty of chairs. Yes, a few loud/drunk people at times but it's vacation-get over it. Plenty of young couples meeting each other, pool volleyball, swim up bar, etc. It's not Cancun so it wasn't too crazy. Lots of families too. Beach - Awesome beach set-up, plenty of chairs you can move as you want. Wait staff on the beach too! Water was basically enclosed by some rocks so it's good to just dip in and cool off. No real waves but it's not Hawaii. Activities - Hotel constantly kept people busy with plenty of pool,beach,lawn activities- daily winners would even get prizes at night. Food-Yes, you need to make reservations during the day and they fill up fast but if you're staying for 4-6 days, I suggest just making res. for a couple of nights and hitting the buffet the other nights. Buffet breakfast was pretty good and we ARE "foodies" and enjoy good food. Plenty of choices, (there was bacon, sausage, pancakes, etc every day by the way). Lunch was perfect selection to fill you up from a hot day of sunbathing. Staff was extremely pleasant, attentive and fast at all times. Bottomline, great place for young couples/families with older kids. Not recommended for singles. If you want 5-star food, go to Italy. If you want pretty good buffet food that's available practically 24hrs., this is perfect. All staff was fully bilingual but if you at least try to speak a little Spanish and are friendly, you'll benefit much more. We made friends with the activity staff and bar tenders during the week and had exceptional service. Don't recommend getting married here if you're high-maintenence, too much to chance with weather, crowds, etc. But we saw at least 2 weddings and they looked very nice. We've stayed at other all-inclusives in the carribbean and this is by far the best we've been to.

Reviews.Title: “A good resort”
Reviews.Author: sooner68
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya June 12-18. Overall I would say that this is a nice place to stay. Let me start with our arrival. We arrived around 9:00 pm with our children, ages 14 and 6. Check-in was slow because there was only one person at the front desk. However, they were friendly and answered all of our questions. We booked a room with a court yard view. I am glad we did. Our room was on the third floor overlooking the courtyard and pool area. The room looked a little dated and was in need of a face lift. However, it was very clean and didn't have a musty smell. Our room had two full size beds that were pushed to gather. When I saw this I got worried because our 14 year old is bigger than me, and my husband is over 6ft. When our bags arrived the bellman offered to bring a rollaway for our son. This worked great, they set up the rollaway in the small living area and everyone had plenty of room. The resort is very pretty and well landscaped. The staff is friendly and helpful. There were plenty of chairs at the pool and on the beach. We would usually arrive at the pool around 10:00am and had no problem finding four chairs to gather. The beach was nice and we didn't have any problem with seaweed on the beach during our stay. There are large sandbags in the water to help with beach erosion. Some people have said that they found them to be unsightly, but to me they look like large rocks with moss on them. Our children enjoyed climbing on them and jumping into the ocean. The food was average. Breakfast is really good, they have a large selection. We ate lunch at Chili's and it was good but they had the same thing everyday. The way they have the reservation system set-up needs to be changed. Some reviewers have said they had to wait in line for over an hour to make reservations. I didn't however, you got to stop what your doing in the middle of the day and go make reservations. Because of this we only ate at two of the specialty resturants. The mexican and the steak house. Both were average. The kids liked the buffet the best because they could get burgers and pizza. Overall we would go back with the children, but for a couples vacation we would go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay...”
Reviews.Author: watering30
Reviews.Content: We were there the June 10-15, 2008. I agree with much of what a few of the others who were there that week wrote. So, without repeating everything, here's a few things off the top of my head: 1) The hotel: really is very beautiful. The rooms were gorgeous. But, note-the walls are not very soundproof.
