Also, DO NOT let them put you in the ground level rooms, around 013 because the entertainment bar is RIGHT across the hall and every night they perform and are very loud. The performers leave the back stage-door open and talk very loudly. I can't tell you how many times I had to get out of bed late at night and keep asking them to shut the door and not talk in the hall--which reminds me, the hall echoes quite a bit, so when people walk by it can get very noisy. I guess the noise would be my biggest complaint about the rooms. The other complaint--the musty, moldy smell. We tried to air it out, but to no avail. Also--the air conditioner stopped working in the middle of the night twice. Last--our balcony overlooked a courtyard and the resort next door. It could get loud at times and when the workers were out there they would whistle and yell profanities at us when we left the door open or smoked on the balcony! 2) The food: YUCK. Read other posts for details--it's all true. Bland, undercooked, boring. VERY disappointing and for us a dealbreaker. It looked pretty, but absolutely nothing tasted great. Even the fruit was bland. And it's true--the drinks are very weak and very sugary. Again, nothing exciting. Service was pretty good. I noticed that many of the buffet servers worked all three shifts--that's about 15 hours. I tried not to let it bother me, but it did. Day after day they worked those long hours and always smiled and treated us well, so I really appreciated it--I would be very cranky! 3) The beach: It was rougher than I expected. Too murky to snorkel. At times too many people. And way too many water sports going on--it always smelled of gasoline and exhaust and it was loud. Oh, and Americans--there are topless sunbathers, so beware! 4) The pool: I agree with the post about the loud drunks--they overtook the swim-up bar area and made it generally unpleasant to hang out in the pool. Also, another huge disappointment was that the pool bar shuts down at 6pm and then no swimming after 8pm--that is so early to shut down! I would have loved taking an after-dinner swim. 5) Playa del carmen shopping: Too busy, too touristy, and way more expensive than expected. We also got heckled and were called some pretty nasty names when we wouldn't go into some stores. NOTE: Alcohol is CHEAPER at the AIRPORT--so wait until you go to the duty-free shop there to buy. Also, walking to town really does take a good 15 mins at a moderate pace. It's a safe and interesting walk, but when it's hot out you should probably just take a taxi. Oh yes--I noticed that taxis would charge more when they found out we were staying at the RIU Palace. So, you should go to the street and catch one on your own if you want to save a few dollars. 6) GO TO COZUMEL! That was the highlight of my trip. Everything was cheaper there, snorkeling was a dream, and they have many free beaches where you can eat and drink and snorkel (or swim). Taxis are cheap and convenient from the pier. It was only half an hour on the ferry. Oh, and DON'T buy round trip tickets because there are two companies which operate the ferries; thus, they only operate every other hour--so, you might get stuck waiting two hours to get back.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GET MARRIED HERE”
Reviews.Author: mzf0307
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredibly disappointing in many ways. I have never written a bad review before, but I feel like I should warn people. First the website is very deceiving.... there is only 1 pool, the hot tub is in the spa and covered. The restaurants you need reservations for and you can only make reservations from Noon until 3, if you are only there for a couple of days you'll be eating at the buffet the whole time as all of the reservation restaurants fill up 2 days in advance, sometimes 3. Very misleading. I actually got married there... which was the poorest service I've ever had in my life. They have a very bad spa, I paid $80 for pedicure with no massage or soaking whatsoever, it took 10 minutes. I opted to get my hair done there, but they didn't have room for my bridesmaids because another wedding booked up the spa all, which was good for my bridesmaids in the end. They sat me in a chair with no mirror as I explained to my non-english speaking hairdresser what I wanted (which was a down, natural looking do), she used aqua net on one strand and sizzled it with a curling iron. That's all I have to say, worst hair do ever! Then the other bride in that room was supposed to get married that previous Friday on the beach, but postponed it to Monday due to weather and her wedding time was scheduled at 4:00. This should not have been a problem as my wedding was a different location at 5. It turned out she got married at my spot, at my time, my 45 guests were arriving at a different wedding, very confused. Pretty bad there, no apologies from the staff whatsoever. I got over it. so we moved on to the reception where we paid $400 for a private area for dinner and $1000 for a DJ for 3 hours, which was a rip off to begin with. Dinner started 1/2 an hour late, they turned the lights up 1/2 an hour early in the middle of a song, with no notice and staff waited with their arms crossed for us leave. Ridiculous. No apologies from the hotel at all. Any hotel had to have better service than this. In the end our guests had a great time, but they didn't require as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “hotel awesome but rainy”
Reviews.Author: scout3434
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the RIU, loved the hotel and staff. The only complaint was it rained every day but the last. My family and I have been going to the Carribean every summer for 19 years, we only stay all inclusive. With this said, this hotel by far had the friendliest and most hospitable staff we have ever encountered. They work their tails off day in and day out but will stop at anything to help or serve the guests. The hotel itself is also gorgeous!!! There is a few problems we encountered. My mother has a hard time climbing stairs and there were only 2 elevators located at this huge hotel and they were close to the lobby. We had to do a lot of walking to go back and forth to the elevator. I would recommend that if someone you're traveling with suffers from the same, that you ask for a room close to the elevators. By the way, the elevator stopped working the last 2 days so my mother was forced to climb the stairs. The beach was beautiful but because of the rain there was a lot of seaweed. I read other reviews that complained about the huge sand bags on the beach. Yes, it is an eye sore but seemed to be a lot of fun for the beach goers. Every day people were having a blast trying to get on top of those and diving off. The entertainment was good, it is what you expect at an all inclusive. Nothing outstanding but nothing poor. The food. The first couple of nights we were forced to eat at the main restaurant, which we were not impressed with. But the last couple of nights we ate at the Brazilian and Steak House and loved it. I would recommend that the day you check in you go and stand in the 30 min. line for reservations. They only let you do 2 at a time and when we did the first couple of nights were already booked. So out of 6 days that we stayed, we only got to eat at the specialty restaurants 2 times. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. We loved it, of course I had a few complaints but anywhere you stay is not perfect. This was as close to perfect as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “Watered-down vacation”
Reviews.Author: marcy512
Reviews.Content: I just returned from four days at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, and overall had a really good time, although there were some issues. CONS: They water down their liquor. The first two days we were there, I found myself drinking shot after shot of tequila and never feeling the slightest bit tipsy. The drinks menu says they have El Jimador, Absolut and Kahlua, but when you order these it's definitely not what you get. It's frustrating not to be able to get drunk on vacation! We finally walked down the street to the shops and bought our own, non-watery tequila. They also only serve Corona and Negra Modelo for beers. The Negra Modelo tastes very watery, and not at all like the bottled Negra Modelo we drank outside the resort. Waiting in line to make dinner reservations is a huge waste of time. You can only make two days of reservations at a time, the only time to make reservations is from 12-3 (prime pool/beach time), and it takes over an hour to make it to the front of the line. They only have one staff person taking reservations for the entire property. When I did get to the front of the line (after over an hour), they only reservation they had for the following evening was at a restaurant we'd already tried. No food after midnight. They say that room service is available 24/7, but when we called after midnight no one answered. If you get hungry for a midnight snack, the only option is a fridge full of hamburgers and hot dogs in the Sport Bar. PROS: Plenty of seating. There was always plenty of room on the beach, and it was easy to find a table at the buffets for breakfast and lunch. We also never had a problem finding a seat in the bars or on the patios throughout the property. Quick staff responses. When we called for more towels and for someone to look at our broken shower, they were there promptly and we got several follow-up phone calls to make sure we were satisfied. Room service also arrived pretty quickly, in about 15-20 minutes. Beautiful beach. The water was clear and the sand was white and beautiful. We went swimming every day, and it was wonderful! Beautiful surroundings. There was a wide Spanish-style square in the middle of the resort that was so nice to sit out on and watch people, while enjoying a watery cocktail. The La Habana bar in the lobby was also very nice, with attentive waiter service and piano music before dinner. Free wi/fi in the lobby. The hotel also provides several computers with internet access that can be used at $8 per hour, but wi/fi was handy if you don't mind toting a laptop. NEUTRAL: Food. The reservation-only dinner restaurants were fine, and the same can be said of the lunch and dinner buffets. Neither provide reasons to to stay away from, or choose, this hotel. Entertainment. There were several variety shows (Grease, Vegas, and a comedy medley) and a casino night, but having drinks in the piano bar or on the patio won out every night for us.

Reviews.Title: “Plan ahead to make it perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FuninPlaya
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor, we were well prepared for the specific nuances of this hotel as they all have them! This is what you should know: Before you go: Bring some 2 dollar bills. They love them and believe they are good luck. Bring your own beach towels. Book your tone way ransportation to hotel. See below... Transportation: (Airport to Hotel Transfers) Don't book "shared" transfers from airport to hotel through your travel agent. There are much less expensive and very efficient options available on the web. Try USA Transfers to the hotel but do not book a round trip. Simply get a cab for the return trip 45-50 usd. Collectively we (2pp) paid 100 usd and saved so much time and money. So many persons stated they opted with the agency transfer package deal (50-100 usd pp) and it took them forever to get to the hotel due to the multiple stops at other hotels. Our driver stopped by our request at a gas station to pick up a 6 pack and was at the hotel in 30-35 minutes. The return trip is cheaper due to the airport restriction on who can do business from the airport. (Renting a Car/Jeep using Taxi) Safe, good roads and reputable national chains at your disposal. Parking is free at the RIU. We elected not to rent the jeep we had intended to use throughout our stay when we realized taxi services is 5 usd into town. If ya just want to get lost in Mexico rent a jeep but there really is no need unless you go to Cozumel to explore the island... of which I strongly reccomend!!!! Checking In: 1) Check in on a Mon-Thur. Room options are much better. 2) Ask for a room immediately above the lobby facing the beach!!!! The rooms/patio are smaller however this puts you in the bottom of the hotel's horseshoe . You can't beat the view, quiet, and the ability to peoplewatch in the center court and it's convenient to everything! 3) Insist upon a mattress topper install within the hour. Don't let them fool you into, "we'll send someone up". We had to ask twice. Tip the the person who put it on the bed because it is quite the chore. Don't pass on the mattress topper or you won't be happy with the beds! 4) Make reservations at the restaraunts. If you dont, no big deal, the buffet is great! Where to go: (Playa) Definately have to go to dowtown and do some shopping. SHOP AROUND! Please don't see an item for the first time and think that due o your excellent negaotiations skill you got them down by 40%. Walk around the corner and the price you just paid will be the starting price elsewhere. Trust me I know! :) At the far north end of 5th Avenue it becomes a bit more sparse. That's actually good for prices. Ther is a hotel/restaruant named "Los Tulipos". They have a Cenote' in the reataurant/bar area. Have a seat next to the cenote and have a great strawberry margs. (Cozumel) Great day trip! Take the ferry RT for 24 usd pp. Don't get trapped in the towns center. Rent a jeep for 50-65 usd and travel around the island. You won't regret it! The absolute best part of our trip! There is only one road that will take you around the island. It is absolutely amazing. Waves crashing against the coral/limestone cliffs. Breathing hole where the water explodes up and out. the water is beautiful. There is little to no development on the south/eastern coast of Cozumel. What is ther is a guy selling cold coconuts that he chops with a machete and hands to you. When you are done he extracts the coconut and give you a lime and chili powder... amazing. There is a restaraunt called Senor Iguanas. One of only a few but certainly worth the wait! they have a seafood platter that will feed a family of 10 for 18 usd. Looked amazing! Back to the hotel: The hotel was booked to capacity but you couldn't tell by the looks of it! The buffet was great. Sitting in the center court to dine was fabulous. Never ate at the other retaurants. Beach was beautiful and plentiful seating. The pools were great. It was nice to see normal people. It was no hardbody show... there were a few but mostly normal folks who go to work everyday. Made us feel comfortable not being 21 anymore! :) I have so little to be negative about. I been to many 5 star resorts and this one measures up as long as you are not looking to stay in the room for your entire stay. The rooms are more than what anyone needs in a Riviera Maya. Not the Ritz Carlton/Four Seasons Honeymoon room but more than adequate for anyone... anyone! The only improvement I would reccommend would be to either have more wait staff around the pool bar or hand out larger drinks! :) This is a great place. Have a wondeful time!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in Many Ways”
Reviews.Author: Mahidoodi
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Long Report I just spent a week at RIU Palace Rivera Maya and my experience was nothing short of fantastic. To make this report a little more sensible I break it down to ‘Reception’, ‘Food and Restaurants’, ‘Room and Overall Cleanliness’, ‘Bars’, ‘Beach and Activities’ and ‘Service’. Reception: I arrived on Sunday June 1 at 1 PM. The front desk personnel were very friendly and gave me a room that faced the outside on the lower level. The hotel is shaped like ‘U’ and is 3 levels. The room numbers starting with zero are at the lower level where all the restaurants are. The rooms on the first level start with 1. The main reception is at this level at the bottom of the ‘U’. And finally the rooms that start with 2 are at the top level. The garden on the lower level is within the 2 legs of the ‘U’ so if you get a room that faces the garden ‘Inside’ consider it a good room. The rooms facing the ‘Outside’ are same as the others minus the view. There are 4 rooms on each level at the top of the ‘U’ that face the ocean. Having said all of this, I asked for a different room and was told that at 1 PM that’s all they had and I should return at 3 to get a better room which I did. At 3 they gave me a room on level 1 but still an outside room. When I checked in my room I found out that it was a smoking room and I noticed the paint on a small part of the wall was pealing off. I returned to the front desk and told them that I had asked for a non-smoking room. This time the receptionist named ‘Xavier’, a very nice guy, apologized and changed my room to an ocean front room. So far so good. After this encounter every time I went to the front desk for exchanging money I had a pleasant encounter. Food and Restaurants: There are 5 specialty restaurants that you have to make a reservation for. The reservation is taken everyday between noon and 3 PM at a corner of the bar called ‘Havana’ located on the main lobby. The line gets to be long and you can only reserve for 2 nights at a time. There are 2 seating for each restaurant each night. I informed one of the two men taking reservation on my first visit after standing in the line for about 15 minutes that since I would be diving every day during those hours it would be impossible for me to make reservation. He said it is no problem and come to the main dinning facility that night and make your reservation for entire week. That suggestion to me deserved a little gratuity which in many instances made things easier and more pleasant and I thank senior ‘Jesus’ for that. The food in general is very good. The specialty restaurants offer good food and plenty of it. However, I found the main dinning ,which you do not need a reservation for, to be better with better selection and the food that was nothing short of gourmet food. The Seafood night had a selection of seafood that was fantastic and plenty. Room and Overall Cleanliness: Rooms were cleaned routinely twice a day and on top of that I would get fresh towels every night on top of what they changed during the day. A little tip to the cleaning ladies would go a long way. Each room has a bar with 4 bottles of liquor that is replenished once every 2 days, plus many bottles of water and sodas. The property overall is in a very clean state. The only complaint here is the water temperature and water pressure that changes frequently while you’re taking a shower. But nothing that you can’t live with. Every morning before I went to my dive sites I would see an army of cleaning people, who would literally scrub every tile in this hotel. Bars: The Havana bar in the lobby is good for afternoon drinks and smokes. If you are into cigars and smoking this is the place for you. There is a Sports Bar also in the lobby that has pool tables and air hockey as well as computers set up for internet access. The charge for the internet access is $3 for 15 minutes. Cheaper if you go longer. If you bring your own laptop the WiFi in the main lobby is free. There is the Daiquiri swim up bar by the pool that opens at 9 AM and closes at 6 PM. The drinks are generally good and you can also ask for name brands. Again a little tip would guarantee ‘Don Julius’, ‘Finlandia’ and ‘Absolute’ with no problem. The guys that run around the pool and the beach to bring you drinks are absolutely amazing in making sure that your glass is never empty. Beaches and Activities: There are at least 300 beach chairs around the pool and probably 2-3 times more at the beach. I never had a problem finding a chair around the pool or the beach. The pool is a large pool that has water volleyball net and you can actually do laps. There are all kinds of activities during the day around the pool including water volleyball, sand volleyball, soccer, rifle shooting, bingo, and so on. Every night at 9:45 PM there is a show at the theater located on the lower level. The local entertainers perform during the shows and they are pretty good. On top of that the activity coordinators, and there are many, including ‘Rosa’, ‘Joshua’, ‘Pepe’, ‘Rudy’, ‘Carla’ and others would go out of their way to make sure you have a good time. Service: The service is first class and everybody makes sure that you are well taken care of. As I mentioned many times a little tipping would go a long way and personally I believe after spending so much money to book a week of vacation what is an extra few bucks to ensure good service and good food. I was there to go Scuba Diving and I used the onsite dive shop called ‘Scuba-Caribe’. I am posting my diving experience on the Scuba Board. But in short they are great to dive with. If you need more info feel free to send me an Email.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!!!”
Reviews.Author: momsproblem
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this resort. The Staff is the best !!! and goes out of their way to make you feel at home. Food was fantastic. Five specialty Restaurants and the Buffet gives you all the variety you could ask for. We went down for our daughters wedding and there were 30 of us in the group. We booked through Sunquest vacations and the rep was in the hotel every day to help us organize excursions. Some of the group took scuba lessons, went deep sea fishing, Tulum and xcaret, quading in the Jungle and catamaran tours. Fun was had by all. The wedding went off without a hitch and was beautiful. The hotel was located just 10 minutes walk from the open air market in Playa De Carmen where you can shop till you drop. There is also a small market just a hop, skip and a jump from the hotel which has a bank and a variety of souvenier stores. The best part is that there is another Rui hotel across from this market so you can take advantage of the all inclusive at this hotel as well and have a few wobbly pops before you make the long treck back to your own hotel. (about 5 min walk). The second week we went to a different resort and it did not come close to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. Best all inclusive vacation ever........

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: TeessideNorthernlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10th May for 10 days. On first impressions the hotel is very impressive. As many other reviews point out the staff are very attentive. The food cannot be faulted - each night in the buffet were themed nights and there was always plenty of choice. Of the speciality restaurants we only ate in the Gourmet restaurant but would highly recommend anyone trying it. The pool is nice, but there is music playing ALL day long. If you want to relax around the pool this is not the place for you! On an afternoon you are subjected to “Sexy Bingo” along with other numerous "fun" activities such as water volleyball. As previously mentioned Shania Twain’s “I feel like a woman” becomes EXTREMELY annoying. I witnessed 6 weddings in 4 days and would not recommend a wedding here unless you like the idea of having to walk through the Pool area to get to the area where the wedding takes place. Then to have 1/2 of the pool area either stand and watch and/or have to listen to very loud people during the ceremony playing volleyball in the pool/screaming kids etc... Night time enterainment left a lot to be desired. You could not get away from it If your room was above the music area or faced the courtyard. The rooms were definitely NOT 5* - I have stayed in plenty of 5* hotels and there is no comparison. Considering this hotel has only been built since 2006 I felt the rooms were very tired. We were on the 3rd floor with a tiny balcony which had high solid concrete walls and therefore you could not sit and enjoy the view. If you wanted to view the courtyard you had to stand up. In 10 days I came across 4 couples who requested room changes due to the noise, no balcony and even insect infestation.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort!”
Reviews.Author: mjballet
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from 3 nights at RIU Palace Riviera Maya, and it was an Excellent vacation. The resort was beautiful and very clean, and the service was excellent. All the staff went out of their way to make your stay very pleasant. The food was very good, for an all-inclusive. We ate at the Mexican Restaurant (very good) and Sir Oliver, the gourmet restaurant (excellent atmosphere and top-notch service, but the food was just ok). The buffet was very good for breakfast, but we ate mostly at Chili's (informal pool restaurant for lunch, and they had a good selection). They brought ice cream around the pool each day in their cart, which was a nice touch. The drinks were very good, and the liquor was typically excellent brands. The staff works very hard, and I tipped everyone I came into contact with, and they were most appreciative. The resort is very convenient to the town of Playa del Carmen - only about a $5 cab ride away, which was very nice to be able to go into town whenever you wish. I have stayed at other RIU resorts in Playa del Carmen (RIU Tequila, RIU Palace Mexico), but this is by far my favorite. I will definitly stay here again, and would most definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “WOW what a great place to visit!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbiehawk
Reviews.Content: This place was excellent! We flew in from Des Moines with a layover in Houston. Once we landed in Cancun it took a good hour to get through the line at about 3:00 in the afternoon. Once outside the airport our Apple Vacation rep was waiting to get us to the resort in a van. This was nice because some go in a bus, and have to wait for every stop for the various resorts. Once at the resort is was breathtaking. Pools, beaches, beautiful people, and happy workers. We can not say enough about one particular incident. We did not know that at the specific restaurants when a reservation is required long pants are required. This was our travel agents fault. When we were turned away from the Mexican place a lady named Diana (she handles all hospitality and wedding's) made us feel like the most important people ever. We were given special exception to eat at the steakhouse a little less formal than the other 4 places. The food was clean and delicious (Brazilian, Mexican, Japanese, Steakhouse, and Fine Dining). There is also a buffet that is available without a reservation any day. If we ever missed our reservation we went there. The buffet has everything meat, pasta, fruit bar, salad bar, French bread, ice cream, etc. The hotel bar and swim up bar are fun, and a great way to meet other fun people. We met a fun couple our second night that we spent a couple night out with that made the stay more fun. I keep rambling, but we showed up one night, and got in our room to chocolate coved strawberries and a bottle of champagne for our honeymoon. The activities are kind of cheesy, but a good time. Things like water volleyball, darts, sand volleyball, ping pong, etc. The resort has all the reps to signing up for excursions at a great price so don't do it ahead of time if possible. We went on the Talume Extreme excursion, and we will remember it forever. Zip lines, Mayan ruins, repelling, snorkeling, lunch, and only $97 p/person. Right on the beach you can sign up for anything you want parasailing, scuba, etc. Another great part of RPRY is location. Only 15 minute walk or $5 cab to Playa Del Carmen. Lots of shops, bars, clubs, and the ferry to Cozamel if you want to go there for a day. The other resorts are close and all around, and all their amenities are at your all inclusive disposal (except the reservation restaurants). Just two hotels over is Riu Tequila with the night club that is kind of a disco tech. Some things to know that I wish I had known are following. The resort is shaped like a horseshoe, and our room was near the end of the horseshoe. It was a LONG walk to our room from the lobby. Every time we needed to get our camera, change cloths, or anything else it got old. Also there are free liquor bottles in the room, but the ice is at the stair wells. From our room it was like a 5 minute round trip walk to get ice....I guess I could have just drank it warm. We started putting tips $5 on the fridge, and it was filled everyday with water, corona bottles, pop, etc. It is supposed to be filled every other day. TRY TO GET A ROOM THAT LOOKS OVER THE COURTYARD! We were on the other side, and it would have been nice for people watching from the patio. We were looking at a neighboring hotel. Things I wish I knew: Bring laptop internet is free in lobby. Bring higher SPF sunscreen than you think the Mexican sun is HOT. Do parasailing when you have a chance (it is cancelled for wind and we only had one chance) Bring lots of small U.S. dollars otherwise you get pesos for change. GUYS BRING SOME LINEN (long) PANTS FOR EVENING. Get room near lobby and facing courtyard. Bring Aloe Vera. Sign up for RIU rewards before getting there. Bring cash for souvenirs at Playa. Shops give a way better deal if paying with U.S. dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, love the Riu”
Reviews.Author: jwhitec40
Reviews.Content: Second time at a Riu, first time at the Riviera Maya Riu Palace. Loved it! Better then the Riu Palace of the Americas in the Cancun hotel district. Sure the drive is longer but is so worth it. The grounds are spacious, pool and beach wonderful. No problems with finding chairs and not right on top of everybody else. Made it very relaxing. The food is what you would expect, doesn't knock you off your feet but overall very good. Liked the japanese cuisine especially, but we like suishi and they brought extra. Rooms are comfortable, not extravagant. Ordered room service one morning and was prompt and well presented. We love the grounds and the staff. Tipped a little extra and never has a problem with drinks. We spent almost all our time by the pool relaxing. Our perfect vacation. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best ......”
Reviews.Author: PaulHullENGLAND
Reviews.Content: Paul+ Debbie from Hull East Yorkshire England. Just returned after 2 week stay at RPRM and it amazes me how anyone can write anything negative about this place. Everything and every member of staff are first class, nothing is to much trouble they do all that they can to make your holiday special. If youve allready booked dont worry you wont be disapointed . Trust me this place is the dogs bollocks.....

Reviews.Title: “All that you need”
Reviews.Author: Razor2009
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Riu in Cancun & absolutely love these places. It really is a great bang for the buck. If you enjoy the all inclusive, these places are great. They do not skimp on the details and the service is spectacular. Everyone on staff is friendly & willing to meet your every need. The food in the restaurants is wonderful!! The buffet is good, nothing spectacular but more than adequate. As with most places where booze is included it seems to be watered down. But, you can always ask for a premium brand - no problem. There are tons of chairs around the pool, on the beach & a sections of hammocks in the shade. No shortage of places to lounge away the hours.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Robinatthebeach
Reviews.Content: I have just returned after a 5 night stay with a girlfriend. We are in our 50's and love to have fun. I have stayed at the Iberostar ( which is a beautiful complex with great food but more expensive than the Riu and far from Playa del Carmen) and wanted to stay at the Barcelo(although I think the beach here could be much calmer) but after the reviews I changed my mind. I contacted the Barcelo manager and told him about Trip Advisor reviews and he did not seem to care which concerned me. Anyway I am a flight attendant and have traveled all over the world for 30+ years. The Riu is above average. The pool is much bigger than it looks in the pictures. The beach/pool has tons of room for everyone and shade too. The "rocks" manmade are fine, they are saving the beach and they do look like rocks now. But the surf here is pretty rough. We only went in the ocean a few times. And we got a sunburn in just 45 min w/o sunscreen after using sunscreen for 2 days so be careful. We wanted to take a snorkel and parasail trip but in the 5 days there was only one day w/o strong winds and we missed it. So if you get a good day get out and take the water trips otherwise you may not get a chance. I was told by other guests that the parasail was a blast because you are taken out by wave runner to the boat which adds some extra fun. The price was as good at the hotel as anywhere else on the beach or in Playa. Worse case is you can go into Playa Del Carmen and there is a beach there that you can rent equipment and walk out. Check out a snokel/ parasail stand on the beach at the around 10th street. There is a small round bar next to it and a massage area. I felt very comfortable with the guys running the place and would have gone out with them their prices better than the hotel. Due to rough surf in Playa we got a cab for 30.00 each way and went down to Akumal for a snorkeling park there. It was just ok but crowded with locals on the weekend. On the way home from Akumal we stopped into Puerto Adventura. We were really impressed with this area. There are smaller hotels and the beachs are much less rough. There are fun restaurants and bars being a port for boaters. And there are dolphin/ seal parks that are beautiful right in the town, you can swim with the dolphins. I would consider this area next time. Great for families or Singles. Ok as for the Riu restaurants everyone avoided the Brazilian because it was too much meat. The rest were very nice with attentive service and nice atmosphere. We were suprised that the buffet was as good as it was so don't stress if you don't get all the reservations you want. The shows at night were pretty good. Don't miss the Michael Jackson show. I don't like Michael but everyone loved the show. The sports bar leaves a lot to be desired with poor lighting. But it is a place to go after midnight. There is little activity after midnight and unfortunately the disco in the other Riu is pretty bad unless you are under 30. The Riu Palace needs a night spot. MAKE SURE to sign up for the Riu resorts frequent user card at the front desk. You will immediately be able to get a 10% discount on tours and the spa. But you must tell the spa ahead of time that you want your discount. The massage therapists were very good too. The advantage of this hotel is location. You can walk into Playa del Carmen in about 20 min or take a 5.00 cab ride. Its fun to visit the shops and bars with the old/new mexico flavor. Lots of fun at night for the younger people but great for us too. ALWAYS ask the front desk for suggestions. We wanted to go to a bar in Playa that would be better for our age group. We ended up having a ball in a bar with a 10 piece band playing salsa thanks to the front desk staff. The cab drivers are pretty good and if you know the rates they will not rip you off just pay them what they are listed to get from the book in the hotel. ALSO you can hire a driver for the day just at the entrance to the hotel. We met Rodrigo for our Akumal trip. He told us for 125.00 he would spend 8 hours with us taking us to Tulum, Akumal, etc for the day. Chitizentzan(?) is more because its so far. But if you want to get out and plan your own trip look for Rodrigo he mostly parks at the Riu. The rooms are not as upscale as I would have thought for such a new hotel. As 2 single women the beds are close together but not bad. Most of all we had a great time meeting so many people, mostly couples or newly weds. But that was not a problem, people of all ages come together here in fun and you will be invited to join in on the fun. This hotel although not perfect is a great vacation for the price mostly due to the staff who really puts a smile on your face and the location.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad, the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: VA12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week’s stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Unfortunately, our stay definitely did not warrant more than an average rating. Warning: this is a long and detailed review!! Service The service was very sporadic. At times, it was excellent and immediate, whereas many other times it was nonexistent. For example, I called to ask for a room service menu because we did not have one in our room, but we never received it. We requested a wake-up call one morning before a day trip – and never received it. Thankfully we had set our alarm. One evening our toilet would not flush, so we called around 5:30pm and asked that they come fix it. When we returned to our room after 10pm, it had not been fixed. I called again and said that someone needed to come immediately, which they did. However, my husband had to fix it twice more over the next couple of days. These are just a few of the examples. Dining Overall, we were extremely unimpressed with the food. For breakfast and lunch, only one restaurant is open and it is buffet style. For dinner, you may either make reservations at one of the specialty restaurants or eat in the main dining room (where breakfast is), which is buffet style. As far as the buffets were concerned, I felt this food was barely better than cafeteria food. There are a few exceptions – like fresh fruit or the hot, chocolate fondue with homemade marshmallows – but overall, it was not very good at all. We had dinner at all of the specialty restaurants except for one, Chili’s, and that was because we just weren’t interested – the menu didn’t look too appealing and it’s also where you had to eat lunch every day. The Japanese restaurant was decent. Sir Oliver’s was the best, though still not spectacular. This is sort of an Asian-Fusion - not French. The Brazilian restaurant was pretty weak, especially if you’ve ever been to a real Brazilian steakhouse like Fogo de Chao! The “salad bar” was merely the same thing that’s at the buffet every day – lettuce, a few veggies, and mystery salad dressings. Same at the Mexican restaurant, which was not good at all. Beach The beach, while certainly not earning any awards for “Best Beaches,” was not as bad as it was made out to be. You can walk a decent length down the beach to the south, past many resorts until you reach a completely empty area. However, walking the beach is not for everyone – the sandbags, pipes, tubes, jet skis, etc create quite the obstacle course. In addition to the sandbags, there are these pipes/tubes that pull in water from the sea and empty onto the beach. You will be asked every five minutes if you would like to jet ski or para-sail, and the equipment sits along the shoreline for you to walk around. (If you are just lying on your beach chair and pretend to either be asleep or involved in a book, they usually leave you alone.) Also, there is an issue with the kelp, though it seemed to only be an issue at this particular resort. Every morning, workers would be out on the beach and dig these massive holes, then rake up the kelp and put it in the holes and cover it back up. The effort was appreciated, but it didn’t smell very good if you got too close! Pool The pool is nice, but there is music playing ALL day long. If you like to relax in the quiet until happy hour rolls around, you will have to go down to the beach. The pool gets very busy in the afternoon and you can usually only find chairs in the shade along the outside edge. “Sexy Bingo” is every afternoon, along with other activities like rifle shooting, futball (soccer), etc. Shania Twain’s “I feel like a woman” got a little old after it was played for the 50th time during “Sexy Bingo.” The pool closes at 8pm every night to be cleaned and treated. Based on the size of the hotel, we were surprised there was only one pool. Excursions We had booked our trip through our travel agent and there was a company, Olympus Tours, which had two representatives on site every day. We ended up booking our one-day trip through them, even though it was $60 more to do so instead of booking it online before we left – try googling cancun-discounts or entertainment-plus. You do, however, have to be careful with many companies offering reduced price or free tours, because they are trying to sell timeshares. Our trip was to Tulum and then to Xel-Ha. Tulum was great. Xel-Ha was fun, but be warned that the snorkeling is practically non-existent and the water is very murky. We also took a cab ($5) to 5th Avenue in downtown Playa del Carmen. (This is also where you can catch a ferry to Cozumel if you like.) We had a good time, but don’t expect to get any really good deals – we (nor anyone around us) seemed to really be able to negotiate and haggle like we thought we would be able to do. Plenty of tequila to taste and bring home if you like! Overall… We had a good time – after all, it is vacation and the weather was beautiful. However, we will not be returning. At one point I made the comment that it was like seeing the previews for a movie, and then watching the movie – but all the good parts were in the preview. Even though it housed 400 rooms, the resort grounds were not very extensive – it is literally what is within the U-shape of the hotel. The food was not good. The noise level was very loud, and it was impossible to sleep through the night – we could hear every person that came in after us and got up before us, as well as cleaning and room service carts. When we arrived, our first room (2069) was above the music club, which is open until midnight, and was SO loud. We requested to move, and they told us they were booked to capacity (thought they definitely were not.) Then they moved us to a different room (1053) the next day. The floors on the top level are definitely the best as they offer the best views, and even if you get a “garden view” room, if you are on the top level you most likely will be able to see the ocean as well. The beaches in Playa del Carmen are not very good either – and this resort had one of the better ones. This was our first time to Mexico, so this may be mainly due to the hurricane damage suffered several years ago. Either way, we will not be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Riu Plcace”
Reviews.Author: teeniesmom
Reviews.Content: This was our 25th wedding anniversary trip. I was apprehensive having never left the country before but to my surprise it was the best vacation we have ever had. We got to the Riu Palace and were treated like royalty as soon as we hit the lobby. We had no problem communicating with the desk. As soon as we checked in we were taken to our room where I was stunned with the marble flooring, shower and tub. The refridgerator was full bottled water, assorted sodas and a 6 pack of Corona. The mini bar had 4 fifths of liquor , tequella, vodka, rum and brandy. The pool was beautiful, complete with swim up bar. Plenty of chairs for everyone and the waitstaff was great. The beach was amazing. Plenty of palm tress for shade and lots of space without trees for the sun worshipers and some hammocks too for the hubby. Beach service was great with no shortage of drinks being served. Very rarely had to ask for a refill. The buffet was there every day with wonderful food of all kinds. Out of the 5 seated resturants there were we at at 4. My favorite was the brazilian. You actually had to turn food away and the flavor was amazing. The shows in the courtyard in the evenings was a lot of fun and the show inside was like a vegas production only smaller. Playa is within walking distance, about 15 - 20 minute walk. If you need there are plenty of cabs - costs about 6 bucks american. I recomend the hot tub after a long day. It was soo relaxing after charter fishing ( where I caught a 43 inch king mackrel). No matter where you go or what you do there is someone always there to help. Tipping is not required but with the treatment we recieved we could'nt not tip. We are already making plans for our next trip. I recommend this wonderful place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Live life like you are on vacation every day!”
Reviews.Author: cparunnergirl
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our say at RIU Palace Riviera Maya! We would go again. Pros: ~Access to beach beautiful with calm water (RIU Palace Mexico has a bigger beach, and bigger waves). ~Good Customer Service. ~Deliver campaign and strawberries and make dining a special experience on anniversary/ honeymoon/ birthdays. ~24 Hour All-Inclusive. ~Cabana boys to serve drinks on the beach. Cons: ~Activities & shuttles booked at the resort are overpriced (shop around for a good price before you go on vacation). ~Limited # or restaurants for dinner. ~Tips left on your pillow may not go to the maid (may go to beverage stocker or other staff entering your room). Tips: ~Walk 15 minutes down the street to your right for "5th Avenue" shopping, dining and ferry. Walk 5 minutes to your left for "cheap" souvenir shopping. ~Go to Hawaii instead of Mexico if topless is a problem for you. ~Buy sun block outside of the resort because it is $15(U.S.) a bottle at the hotel gift shop.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: ldt5ada
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace is very nice. Check in was quick and easy. The food was good with gauc and pico available bfkt, lun, and din. Lots of shade available at the pool and on the beach. I was quite dissappointed with the service at the pool. We have traveled to Mexico many times and the staff work very hard for their money. We always tip to encourage frequent stops but at the Riu there didn't seem to be enough waiters to cover the pooland beach area. I was somewhat surprised by this due to the fact this is such a nice resort. After good tipping and poor service the first day, we chose chairs close to the bar to serve our needs. Hammocks on the beach under the palm trees made for great naps. 5th Ave was alot of fun and not so commercialized as Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Just Grand - Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: polyester1970
Reviews.Content: I think the best word to describe this resort is "Grand." The atomosphere, service, food, pool, beach, etc... is top notch. I'll start with the positives - but there are some negatives towards the bottom. Details: The Crowd - Split between Americans and Europeans for the most part. Not many children, but some. Fairly diverse age group, lots of seniors, lots of couples young and old, some groups, overall a good crowd to vacation with. Hotel / Design / Atmosphere - The hotel is absolutely beauitiful from all angles, but especially from the front and the courtyard. It dwarfs the slighly older Riu Palace Mexico which is also nice, but not this nice. The lobby is also very grand, and very beautifully designed. I'm not sure about the pink, but it's OK. The courtyard is beautiful and a great place to sit in the evenings, have a drink and listen to the band (which is usually pretty decent). Rooms - We stayed in the Jr. Suite. The rooms are very nice, not the nicest I've ever seen, but still very nice. To make it perect I would have an LCD TV, jacuzzi spa, and internet access. Food - The food is very good for a resort. I actually thought the buffet was really good and sometimes wished I was eating there than some of the special restaurants. It had a good selection of very fresh, slightly exotic, and high quality foods. We had Brazillian, French (strangely named "Sir Oliver") and Japanese. The only one that lacked noticably was the Brazilian place. Service - is excellent. Very attentative and friendly staff. They understand their guests expect the best and they deliver it. Drinks & Bar - lots of fancy tropical cocktails. Nice bar. I only wished they made aqua de' fresca like cantelope, watermelon or strawberry juice since i was doing a lot of diving and couldn't get hammered every night. Pool - big pool - lots of room for everybody. Beach - Beauitful - there are some but without them people would be getting hurt The Negatives: * Internet only in the lobby - which was a really far walk our room. Not having internet in my room is like not having a TV or a telephone. I know some people don't use the internet, but a lot do and like the convenience of their laptop being online when they need it. * Plumbing / Hot Water - It seems like our shower plumbing was sharing with someone's toilet or something. It would suddenly get really hot then really cold. I hope this doesn't require removing walls to fix. * Fairly big hotel - so pick your room strategically. There's only 1 elevator and that's near the lobby. * The safe uses a key so it's another thing to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelMa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya from April 29 - May 5. (2 adults ages me(36) husband (43). Warning* long review & info ahead! Little info on our past travels for comparisons... Mostly do all inclusive resorts and a couple of cruises. We have stayed at almost all of the Sandals resorts (with the exception of their 3 hotels in Montego Bay), Beaches, Super Clubs properties (Grand Lido's & Breezes), Iberostars, few other all inclusives, all Walt Disney World Hotels, Bellagio & MGM in Las Vegas. Airport - We arrived in Cancun Airport on a Tuesday around 11:30 A.M. It was great being a weekday because we were in & out of Cancun Airport within :10 minutes. We do not check bags (we each carry on 1 suitcase that will take us for 8 days). We walked right through immigration, then didn't have to wait for bags so we sailed right through to customs. We had to take a taxi to the resort because we were not eligible for transfers due to a special rate we were given. I believe taxi's are regulated at Cancun airport and the cost for a taxi to Riu Palace Riviera Maya which was about a :50min ride was $82 ! yikes.. + tip. (the return taxi ride from hotel to airport was :45 min and $45...more info on that later. Hotel- Arrival to Riu Palace Riviera Maya- beautiful property, very well maintained, sparkling large chandeliers up above. Friendly front desk & bellmen. Although it was well before check in time our room was ready. We were given a room up on the 3rd floor overlooking the resort next door. (we asked for a quiet room and didn't want to hear nighttime entertainment noise) so the location worked well for us. It was also closer to the pool/beach than quite a bit of the other rooms. Also, when we checked in, & I walked over to make our dining reservations. We arrived on Tues. and the earliest they could get us into Sir Olivers was on Friday night. So if you are interested in dining there I would make those reservations asap. Rooms- The rooms were nice. (I would say comparable to a 4 -4 1/2 star property. Tile floors, double vanity in bath w/ granite, nice hairdryer, sample size containers of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, rain cap, sewing kit, comb & bar soap. Inside the shower was a dispenser which had an "all in one" liquid soap, shampoo. We had a king size bed which as soon as we got into the room I felt the bed and it was too firm for me. (thanks to past posters for mentioning). As I unpacked I called to ask for a mattress topper. Living area had a couch (seemed like it was the foam kind of couch), plenty of storage space in the rooms, and lots of hangers. (the good kind that don't have to be attached to the rod). Outside balcony had 2 chairs, table, and drying rack. The refrigerator in the entry way was wonderful. Stocked with Corona (our personal favorite beer), sodas, and 2 different sizes of bottled water which they replenished daily. Above the refrigerator was a bottle dispenser with Tequila, rum, and can't remember the other two. (can you tell which ones I drank?). That night the phone rang..it was the front desk calling to make sure the bed topper was put on our bed. (very nice for them to call & check up) Beach- I was surprised to see what great shape the beaches were in. Since this was our first stay at this property I don't have anything to compare it to for last year, but in our past experiences at other locations we thought it was fantastic. Yes, they did have those large sand bags out in the ocean, but they are obviously working, and by walking up and down the beaches we thought it was one of the better beaches. Especially because the sand bags are further out, some of the other resorts theirs are along the edge of the ocean entry and I thought looked pretty poor. There was not much seaweed. They flew the red flags for 2 days out of the week due to very high surf/winds.. and water sports were not available those days, but made for a beautiful breeze. Drink service was abundant at the Beach & also the pool areas. Some days my husband didn't even ask for another drink and they were bringing another one to him. Plenty of beach chairs & tables. No need to reserve them earlier in the day. They set up a secondary bar down on the beach in the shade with a blender, lots of bottles of stuff, bottled water/soda, and bottled beer which they poured in a cup. If you want to drink Corona and prefer bottled to draft come here to get your beer. (pool serves draft) Pool- We enjoyed spending most of the day at the pool area because that is where activities were going on. Most activites started around 10am, and included air rifle (shooting with a pellet type gun), darts (not your usual darts..spin around in a circle 3 times then try to hit the target!...much fun), beach & water volley ball, horse shoes and much more. They had stretching classes & yoga on the beach, aqua aerobics in the pool daily, bingo with the name "sexy bingo" poolside...this is not a game you want to win. The winner has to get up on the pool deck and do a "sexy" dance that they teach you..while the music from Shania Twain "lets go girls" complete with a little pole dancing. Alot of laughs...if you win, do what we did and give the "winning" card to the new people that just showed up that day! (look for the guests without a tan!) ha ha.. worked like a charm. In the pool they also did activities such as bringing in an ocean kayak and having guests do races across the pool to see who had the least amount of time, and they took the sail off a windsurf board and brought it in the pool. They would hold onto it and try to shake guests off. The one who stayed on the longest...won. As you can read they did a good job at keeping people entertained. By the 2nd day a couple of them knew us by name which was very nice considering all the guests at the resort. Pool had alot of space to sit inside the pool & sip a cold cocktail. Drink service was amazing..never waited more than 1 minute for a drink. For drink service at the pool bar they had about 3-5 bartenders, and about 5 servers walking the pool area. Out of all the other resorts we have stayed at this resort BY FAR had the most servers and was nice that they offered the drink service at pool/ beach. Alot of other all inclusives do not offer this service. They do not allow blow up loungers. Restaurants- again as previous posters have mentioned to get a reservation for dinner be at in the lobby starting at noon. You can make 2 reservations at a time. I have to say... This resort has some of the best food than all the all inclusives we have been to. Specialty restaurants did require that men wear long pants. (My husband work khaki's but some men were in jeans). Usually we are not a fan of buffets, but the food was cooked right there and there were so many options...it was REALLY good.. We ate at: Steakhouse- rate:"A" We had the rib eye, but they also had on the menu beef tenderloin with lobster tails, and the appetizer they brought out was sushi and shrimp. We were so full that we left before dessert. Japanese- rate "A". ALOT of sushi, and shrimp again, but with other things...rest of the food was really good too. Sir Olivers- rate "B-C" I would rate this a "C", but my husband would rate it a "B". I am a plain Jane kind of eater, but my husband isn't. I had a tough time here.. Alot of sauces... We did not eat at Brazilian or Mexican. Alot of guests were saying that the Mexican didn't seem "Mexican"...and the Brazilian was just way to salty... Buffet- We did eat at the buffet a couple of nights and really enjoyed it. They had a different theme night every night. Because there is so much variety here even if its "Italian" night there that means there are some italian dishes, but they still have a ton of stuff....alot of seafood, lobster tails..(huge with melted butter), salad bars that just kept going. They also had pizza at every meal available. My husband actually said a couple of times that he was sick of eating... (but we couldn't stop because it was so good) Sunday night was Mexican night and was ohhh so yummy.. Breakfast - Buffet had ALOT of choices. In addition to your usual omeltte station, sunny side up eggs, flipped eggs, scrambled with different ingredients such as shrimp,etc they also had a "sandwich station" where you tell them what you would like & they make all kinds of breakfast sandwiches... A couple of different options for potatoes, (instead of one kind), pancakes, french toast, pastries with bagels/cream cheese/ muffins/ crossaints/ toast..and a ton of fruit ...much much more. If you are looking for something else other than the buffet you can order room service, or they have continental breakfast served until 11:59a in the other buffet by the pool/beach area. (also known as Chili's steakhouse at dinnertime). Lunch- again...alot of variety....everything from burgers, hotdogs, nachos, seafoods, salads, etc...every day the seemed to change a cooking station. One day you would order burritos, another day quesidilla (can't spell)..you tell them if you want it with chicken, beef or shrimp, peppers, or whatever. If you want to have any laundry done I grabbed a price sheet. Prices are approx. because they are in pesos and I did a quick conversion. (conversion was about 10) Women: dress $5.50 pants $3.50 blouse $2.50 t shirt $2.50 skirt $3.50 Men: shirt $2.50 t shirt $2.50 pants $3.50 *page also states available mon-fri. If given before 9am, returned within 48 hrs. express service add 100%, ironing only 70%.. My husband would put on pants, we'd go down for a drink then dinner and go right back up to change. He got to wear his pants a couple of times since we pack so lightly. I inquired at the front desk how much a taxi should cost us back to the airport and they said about $60. When we got a taxi (they have a couple at the foot of the hotel and whistle down when you need one) I asked how much. He said "$45". (woo..hoo!) If you are standing in the lobby and walk out to the left about a 5 minute walk is a cute little marketplace called Playa Plaza. We enjoyed walking down the road after breakfast and stop to shop a little. And if you took a right (instead of a left) about a :20 min walk or 5 min cab ride is 5th ave with plenty of shopping (stores & shops), bars, restaurants. This is also where you can catch the ferry to cozumel. This resort in our opinion was a overall "A". The only negatives which I could say are: Inside the pool could be cleaner. There are little mosiac tiles along the areas where you sit in the pool that you can see have a film of oil, mildew & grime. It really should have been cleaned. -Night time enterainment left alot to be desired. Most nights we just milled around and went up to bed. Something with an audience participation would make a world of difference here. -After a couple of days we started noticing our room (especially the bathroom) really smelt of cigarettes. (husband is allergic to smoke)..(we knew the room it was coming from) I went to the front desk to inquire if we were in a smoking room (there were no signs posted) and was informed we were in fact on a non smoking floor. I asked if anything could be done and they offered to move us. I asked if it were possible someone could go up and inform them it was a non smoking room and they said no. They gave me a room to view that was available so I ran up to take a "lookie, lookie" as they call it. It was on a floor higher, directly above the stage, it was smaller, and the balcony had a solid concrete wall instead of metal so it got very little ventilation, plus if you sat down you were looking at concrete. Needless to say since we wanted quiet we were not interested. I went back to the room and wrote on a peice of paper very nicely that they may not be aware that this is a non smoking floor. Please contact the main desk if they would like a smoking room. We never smelt them again for the rest of our stay... Unfortunately, we felt like it was up to us to take care of the matter. And can't imagine it being a problem for them to have asked the guests themselves. I'm sure every week the clientele changes, but during our stay I would say that the guests primarily consisted of: 85% couples 10% groups 5% families Nice variety in ages from 20 somethings to about 70'ish. If anyone has any further questions you can contact me and would be happy to help. I would stay at this property again, and in fact met MANY people that have stayed here multiple times. ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: marianne013
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at this hotel, it certainly exceeded our expectations again, we dont normally go back to the same hotel twice but we are so glad we did. We had a fantastic room virtually overlooking the pool it was spotlessly clean and was kept that way all week. We ate at Sir Olivers from the new Krystal Menu which was really gorgeous the service was attentive and the Champagne was flowing. We also ate at Chillis Steakhouse which had an improved menu from the last time we were there. The other nights we ate at the buffet the choice was superb, The Beach is much better than the last time we stayed, the big Sand bags in the sea have certainly done their job, we spent most of our days on the beach it was less crowded. The only downside (and this was nothing to do with the hotel )was the absolute chaos at Cancun Airport, if you can avoid it dont go at the weekend arrive mid week . I think we will go back one day but might try the riu palace pacifico when it is finished next.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning on a return trip”
Reviews.Author: DFWTrippers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya the last weekend of April. We planned our trip around our friend's wedding at the resort and we're so glad we added a few extra days to our stay. I'd been reading Trip Advisor reviews of the Riu and was a little apprehensive. Most of the complaints were unfounded. We never smelled the "odor" some reviewers mentioned. Our room smelled clean and the open air halls smelled like the beach. The beds were hard, but nothing a nice in-room cocktail won't fix. Everyone on staff was friendly and service minded. The desk clerks were nice and efficient with check-in/check-out. The bartenders were all super attentive. We tipped the bartender at the bar in the lobby and he definitely remembered us. Fabulous Mojitos! The rooms were spotless, but as previously mentioned, the beds were pretty hard. We absolutely loved our courtyard view and spent a good deal of time on the balcony in the morning and evenings. I meant to take pictures of the room, but it looks just like the Riu's pictures. Contrary to some other reviews, we thought the beach was outstanding. Most other guests thought the sandbags were natural rocks. The sand was soft and well groomed. Yes, it's a man made beach. But, if you're staying at an all-inclusive...chances are you're not looking for an authentic Mexican vacation or beach. We took a short walk down the street to a little shopping area near the other Riu resorts in Playa and took the opportunity to walk through the other resort's beaches walking back to the Riu Palace beach. The Riu Palace was by far the best! We enjoyed all of the restaurants we had the chance to try. The only one we missed was the Japanese restaurant. One thing to keep in mind, you CAN make reservations days in advance. We overheard a few people trying and failing to make reservations the same day . The buffet (Don Manolo's) was just as good as some of the reservation required restaurants. They had some great mahi-mahi and salmon options every time we visited the buffet! The Mexican restaurant may be a disappointment to those expecting Tex-Mex. It's great as long as you don't go in expecting chips and salsa with quesadillas...that's Tex-Mex. The cuisine is more authentic Mexican/Yucatan. Our favorite was Sir Oliver's (also the toughest to get a reservation). We had the sea bass and salmon entrees. Fantastic! The chocolate dessert was my favorite and I'm not usually a chocolate fan. Overall, we loved our experience and will recommend the Riu Palace Riviera Maya to all our friends...and strangers too. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Service”
Reviews.Author: SpanishRootsToo
Reviews.Content: This trip was to celebrate our 30th anniversary, and it turned out to be a beautiful place to do it. We usually do not go to "all-inclusive" resorts, because we like to eat in many different restaurants, but we were very satisfied with both the buffet restaurant and the speciality restaurants on the property that we tried (Brazilian, Japanese, and Sir Oliver Gourmet). The staff is very friendly and helpful, offering fast service will special little treats like rose petals on our bed and our table at dinner on our anniversary day, chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne in our room the evening before, etc. Our room, the beach and the pool were all very clean and nice. The only things we didn't like were that the water pressure and temperature in our shower was inconsistent and unpredictable (perhaps the variation was caused by other rooms using their showers at the same time?), and we got tired of wearing our "armbands" which identify you as a registered guest. One nice thing about staying on the property was that we could avoid the harassment of the Cancun solicitators who are trying to sell timeshares or steal Riu's customers to come to their competing resorts. Every time we ventured into town or down the street to shop we were bugged by these guys (and girls) who just didn't want to take no for an answer. We wondered if our armbands made us an obvious target. Overall, however, I would highly recommend Riu Palace Riviera Maya for couples of any age.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Bachelorette Party girls getaway at Riu Palace Riviera Maya!”
Reviews.Author: bergadon25
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Riu Palace Riviera Maya last week. Stayed April 28- May 2. The trip was for my Bachelorette Party and there were 6 of us. We booked 3 rooms and at check in, were given connecting rooms without hesitation. Our room was very clean and had everything we needed- nice bathroom, seperate sitting area and of course the mini bar and liquor dispenser that was never used:) We first ordered room service.. the menu was short, but more than adequate. There were a couple salad options, nachos, tostadas, dessert, fruit , sandwiches, etc... I HIGHLY recommend the nachos- the guacamole is amazing.. I could do without the cheese:) Next stop was the pool- LOVED IT! It was the place to be! The swimup bar was fabulous and many places to lounge both in and out of the pool. On previous posts, people named their favorite bartender... Our group grew fond of Marvin- who does not like people who ask for water at the bar, LOL and he makes a STIFF drink! He made the girls multiple versions of the "Marvin Special" and he makes a mean margarita:) The grounds were beautiful and were kept spotless- always being cleaned.. That aside, what really MADE the trip was the amazing staff at RPRM. The servers were far better than the majority of servers in the states- they were entertaining and always went above and beyond. We had so much fun trading language lessons and laughing until our cheeks hurt! The Entertainment Staff really worked it- so funny and they really seemed to go out of their way to get to know the guests. You could never be anywhere without a drink in your hand or without a door being opened for you We didnt' do reservations for any dinners b/c we wanted to play dinner by ear. The buffet was really good.. and I HATE buffets. I am a very healthy eater - a vegetarian and I don't eat wheat or gluten. I keep my diet clean and unprocessed and I had plenty of options- breakfast was my fave The beach was ok- water was beautiful, but I have Maui to look forward to in a few weeks for my honeymoon , so I didn't pay much attention :) If you have any questions feel free to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Descent stay but better suited for young familes or people over 50!”
Reviews.Author: carokrim
Reviews.Content: I stayed at RIU for a wedding last November and can honestly say that I would not have booked this resort if it werent for the wedding simply because I personally prefer smaller resorts with character. I must say that overall it was OK, a little good and bad. Good- Beach was not as bad as I expected. I felt there was plenty or room and not too crowded. Overall not too bad considering how big the resort is. Breakfast- this was the only meal that I looked forward to or enjoyed. Very good- I also thoroughly enjoyed the Mimosas! Cleanliness- our room was spotless and overall I felt the resort was very clean. The grounds are kept very nice. Staff- overall pretty friendly- the waitstaff was great but the bartenders- not so much- probably b/c all the complaining about the crappy drinks started to get to them. Spa- the spa did a great job with the bride and bridesmaids- they were very pleased Ok, now for the not so good- Drinks were VERY watered down and not at all good The decor while nice is very cheesy- no sure why they went with such a cheesy Eurpoean look when the Mayan and Mexican culture is so beautiful. There is absolutely nothing to do after dark- not that I need a big party or anything- but you cannot even get into the pool. The beachside open papala are with cheesy buffet does not allow you to come in for an icecream cone/ drink without a shirt on (guys)- give me a break!!!!! The beds are extremely hard as other have mentioned and it took 5 phone calls over 4 hour time period to get a matress pad. I asked the front desk if there was any way to get a bottle of champagne since it was my anniversary and they said, well we dont normally do that but OK we will send one up- they never did even though I called back twice to confirm it was on the way. DONT tell someone you are going to do something and then not follow throuhg- just say NO, we canot do that! Not that hard! You have to walk a mile to get from point A to point B. Go ahead and plan 30 minutes to walk back to the room to grab those sunglasses you forgot once out on the beach. Re-cap Again, overall not too bad- I didnt hate it or anything I just found it OK and a waste of money- The wedding turned out OK I guess- I am not the type of bride that woudl want kids screaming 10 feet away and 500 strangers spectating the whole thing but she seemed Ok with it. Would I go back- NO

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Hotel, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: Soop
Reviews.Content: This hotel to say the least was great value for this time of year. Anyone that has a bad thing to say about this place has obviously had a personal issue while at the hotel. We have been all around the world in 6 star hotels and we planned this vacation as a "quick get away". To say the least we were happy with everything. The food is excellent, the rooms are large, clean and stay cool with air conditioning. We were shocked with how clean the resort is kept...again we have been to much more expensive hotels/resorts where things were not as clean. We were VERY concerned after booking and looking at the reviews...but to our surprise things went great. Some of the issues that people raised are true: Beds are hard The noise in the morning "can" wake you up The beach is not as good as it used to be All of this being said - they were overshadowed by a very good vacation at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it a lot”
Reviews.Author: linda23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and we liked it a lot. There was plenty of things to do and very relaxing. Resturants: we tried 4 out of 5 and they were good. Our favorite was Sir Oliver. Buffet was ok. Entertainment: most of them were very good. Excellent group of entertainers. They have a show for the kids everyday at 8:30pm. Serivce: Excellent. Tip: if you have kids make sure they don't play with sand on the beach. I toke my 2 year old to the dr after a week of returning from our vacation because she had all these bumps on her hands and feet, and the dr told me that she got bitten by mosquito form the sand. If you have a baby in the stroller make sure they give you a room close to the elevator, becasue there are only two elevators in the whole hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: dandktulsaok
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya April 12-19. This was our second trip to this resort (You can see my review from last year on this site.) We booked through Worry Free with private transfers and were pleased with the service. The hotel is beautiful, the grounds manicured and everything very clean. The resort is in the Playacar resort community in Playa Del Carmen. It is just a $5 and five minute cab ride to all the shopping and dining in downtown Playa. Across the street is the resort community’s golf course. Just down the street is the Playacar shopping center which has some souviner shops. It’s a good place to get forgotten essentials without going into town or overpaying at the hotel gift shop. Check in: There was no line at the check in counter when we arrived, and we were given fruit juice drinks. The official check in time is 3pm, but we were there around 1pm our room was ready. We were quickly in our room, and our bags were brought up within just a few minutes. Room: We paid for the upgrade to a courtyard view room, and were not disappointed. Although the view directly out the balcony doors is of the courtyard (which is great), from the balcony we had a breathtaking view of the beach and sea. FYI, garden view rooms are identical to courtyard view, but the view is of the resorts on either side of the RPRM and the lawn and fence in between. The room itself is spacious with the closet (which has the safe and iron inside) and minibar in the entry way. To the right is the bathroom which has a Jacuzzi tub, wall mounted magnified mirror, and double sinks. (Note that the water is not potable but you are provided with large bottles of water in the fridge) To the left of the entry is the bed, ours was a king, with night stands and a dresser. There is also a sitting area with loveseat, coffee table, dresser and TV. The balcony has solid walls between each room and metal railing in the front. There were two reclining chairs and a small table. On one wall is a convenient rack to dry swim suits and towels. Food: Breakfast buffet is great with almost anything you could want for breakfast. Made to order omelet station, made to order egg station, smoothie station, pancakes, bacon, sausage, fresh pastries and breads, fruits, yogurts, cereals…..you get the idea. Formally seated either inside our outside with choices of coffee, water, soda, juice, bloody Mary and/or mimosas. Lunch buffet is Chili’s on the beach. No formal seating just grab a table, but we had quick drink service. Lots of selection and varying stations daily, one day fresh made sushi another day was made to order quesadillas etc. One day there was also a beach grill set up on the beach with burgers. Dinner buffet had lots of selections as well, with nightly themes. On the Caribbean night there were lots of ice sculptures. Formal seating was used and you were given the choice of wine, beer, or soda. If you don’t like your first choice on the buffet, just try again. There were also fresh made to order stations tied to the theme of the night. Again seating is inside or out in the open air. Reservation restaurants were delicious. We ate at the Brazilian, Asian and the gourmet restaurant. The reservations were made in the lobby bar lounge between 12 and 3 daily for up to three days in advance. The gourmet, was Sir Oliver’s now Krystal’s, are the most difficult to obtain. There are two seatings one at 6:30 and another at 8:30. We always ate early, but never felt rushed. There is also a steak house and a Mexican restaurant, but we didn’t try these. Pool / Jacuzzi: Pools are great with lots of room. There is a smaller infinity pool above the main pool with seating overlooking the large pool and beach. The large pool is open with loungers built in on each end. The main pool is connected to the swim up bar which is also connected to Jacuzzis. These are pool temperature. The hot tubs are located in the spa, and use is included for no extra charge. Beach: The upper beach is huge with palms located on either side of an open central area. One side has hammocks in addition to the loungers. The lower/natural beach is larger than you might imagine with the ongoing beach erosion south of Playa. It has a nice entry into the sea, and plentiful loungers. It is probably the largest natural beach in the Playacar resort area until south of the Iberostar resort. I took daily walks south along the beach all the way past the resorts to a great undeveloped beach. Most days there was a bar set up on the beach with ice cold water, soda and beer. In addition, waiters came by every hour or so for drink orders and to remove empty cups. We were pleased with the drink service, especially considering that how big of an area the servers had to cover. Beach/Pool Towels: The resort provides pool/beach towels in exchange for towel cards that are issued when you check in. After using the towel, you are allowed to exchange it once a day for a dry towel. They track towel usage in a log book at the counter. Then in the evening you trade the towel back for your card. Knowing the policy from last year’s visit, we also brought a beach bag and a couple of beach towels this year. Bars: We enjoyed all of the bars, but found the best drinks are made at the lobby bar or the bar in the entertainment building in the evenings. Top shelf liquor is used when asked, as we mostly did, if not the no name well bottle is used. In addition to the many bars, most evenings the resort set up a pre dinner drink display in the courtyard which was a nice touch. These had a featured drink, and was a great opportunity to try something new. Excursions: We booked the Coba/Mayan experience with Alltournative through the worry free rep in the hotel lobby. We very highly recommend this tour. It is a small tour group (traveled in a van, not the big charter bus.) Morning at the ruins at Coba, and climbed the pyramid..just amazing. Afternoon was a swim in a Cenote, rapelling down a cliff and then zip lining over a ravine. We had a late lunch prepared by the ladies of the Mayan village we visited. It was a great day. I also did a two tank dive with the resort dive shop. They have nice equipment, 4 local dives a day and small groups of about 6. They also have packages with diving in Cozumel and cenotes in the area. The dives were great. The guy who signed me up, Alex, and the dive master were great.
