The regular staff at the watersports counter were best described as less than enthusiastic. I recommend them only if you don’t want to look around at the local dive shops. (The service at the scuba shop was the only kind of negative about the entire trip.) Conclusion: The RPRM is a great all inclusive resort that we highly recommend. Compared to other all inclusive resorts we have stayed and visited this one is top notch. Also no matter which resort you choose to stay with, be sure to visit downtown. In addition to this site, you should also check out playa.info for lots of tips on the area. We would be glad to answer any questions. Have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace”
Reviews.Author: NewtravelerfromCAN
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my spouse and 3 other couples for a week in paradise. This was mine and my spouses first time travelling, along with another inexperienced couple, a moderately experienced couple and a very experienced couple. We booked through our travel agent with Apple. We were booked to stay at the Riu Yucatan, but were upgraded, at no cost, to the Palace. It was extremely beautiful everywhere you looked, from the grand lobby, to the restaurants, to the beach, to the rooms. The food was amazing. We were never bored with the selection and only ate at the buffet. We never had a problem finding a beach chair at any time of the day. The rooms were cleaned daily and we were often left with towel art. Our jacuzzi tub did not work the first day but within 24 hrs it was fixed. The fridge was stocked daily with Corona, soda and water. The key cards to the rooms often would not work for ourselves and one other couple. You would have to swipe approx 25 times before it would register. We eventually got replacement cards. The staff work extremely hard to make sure everything is kept very clean inside and outside of the resort. Everyone greets you with a warm smile and "Hola" . EXCURSIONS We ventured into Playa to 5th Ave shopping twice, dinner at Senor Frogs once and had a great time. The guys loved bartering with the shop owners and found an excellent dive supply store on 6th Ave. Going to 5th Ave was just a quick taxi ride of which the doorman would call a taxi on his walkie talkie for us. We took the ferry to Cozumel and enjoyed the 45 mins ride and shopping there. We went on an ATV adventure and that was probably the highlight of the trip. The 4 of us ladies went swimming with the dolphins for a day and it was amazing. The guys went on a 2 tank scuba dive that day and loved every second of it. For each of our excursions the tour company picked us up and dropped us off at the lobby. We loved staying at the Riu so much that we booked our next vacation at the Riu Jalisco for Oct '08.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: froggirl76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a wonderful, relaxing trip to Playa. We stayed at the RPRM and loved it. From the moment we walked in the door, we were amazed by the beauty of the place. Trust me, the photos do not do it justice. You have to see it for yourself to appreciate it. When we checked in, they offered us an "upgrade" to an ocean view room at the Riu Palace Mexico because the view from our room wasn't "that great". They offered to let us look at the original room there (RPRM) and make our decision. Well, we were pleasantly surprised by the view. It overlooked the courtyard and we could see the ocean and palm trees. We were so tired from our travels that we decided to stay at the RPRM, and we don't regret that decision in the least. The staff were friendly and always smiling and helpful. Almost everyone who worked there greeted us with a warm "Hola" or "Buenos Dias". The drinks were great. They can make a mean Mojito or Piña Colada. The wines weren't that great, but that seems to be a common theme in parts of Latin America. In each room, there are full sized bottles of top shelf liquor that you can help yourself to throughout your stay. The food was mostly very good. We were expecting more from the Mexican restaurant, but it wasn't terrible. Our best meal was at the Japanese restaurant. We were very impressed. We unfortunately did not get a chance to dine at any of the other a la carte restaurants, but we were only there 4 nights (and we arrived too late the first day to make any dinner reservations). The beach was nice. Yes, there are black sand bags in quite a few locations, but it didn't take away from our beach experience. I highly recommend doing the Mayan Adventure snorkel excursion offered by Scuba Caribe. They have a location there on the beach at the resort. The bed was pretty comfortable... not what I was expecting from reading the reviews. It did have a foam egg crate pad on it, so I'm sure that helped. Overall, this was a great vacation. Be sure to check out 5th Avenue (Quinta Avenida) in Playa (about a 50 peso/$5 US cab ride from the resort). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: sandacre922
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 4 nights in April '08. I went with my sister and we were just looking for a few days to relax in the sun and not worry about a thing. We didn't want a place with lots of singles or partiers, and at the same time we didn't want to be surrounded by families and/or honeymooners and feel totally out of place. We couldn't have been happier with our choice. RPRM had the perfect mix of guests for what we were looking for - about 60% couples, 20% families, and 20% young friends/singles. This meant that when we wanted to nap in the sun there was always a quiet area, and when we felt like being social there was always a crowd gathered drinking & chatting somewhere (usually by the swim-up bar). The best part of the resort is the service, which was incredible. How the bartenders, waiters, maids, etc. are able to keep such positive attitudes with so many guests coming and going boggles my mind. And they work some looooong hours; the same people who brought us drinks by the pool all day would often be the same people who worked in the restaurants all night. So many people went out of their way to say hello and make sure all our needs were met that by the time we left we felt like we were leaving family. There isn't much to do late at night, but the sports bar was just fine for a few drinks, a couple games of pool, and some air hockey (pool and air hockey require a few pesos each but are worth it). We spoke to a few people who ventured out to clubs and/or bars and they said that worked well for them. Some of the food was disappointing, some of it was good, and a couple things were great. The most disappointing by far was the breakfast buffet. A lot of stuff was cold and it was usually the same stuff every morning. But even if it meant just having a bowl of cereal and some bacon (which was really tasty) we were never hungry. We only had lunch at Chili's, the buffet by the pool. There was a lot of variety and I always found something that impressed me, even if it was just really good french fries! The dinners in the specialty/a la carte restaurants were the best and I recommend making reservations as soon as you arrive. Our favorite was the "gourmet" restaurant. We also liked the steakhouse. If I had it to do over I would skip the Mexican restaurant and try the Japanese place (which a lot of other guests raved about). As for the food available 24 hours… this consists only of burgers, hot dogs, and sandwiches kept in a fridge in the sports bar. There is a microwave to heat the stuff up. It is not good food. If you think you'll get hungry late at night (or maybe need a snack after a night of drinking) I suggest ordering room service (before 11:00) and reheating it in that microwave when you want to eat it. If you don't go expecting too much when it comes to the food (and who would at at AI?!) then you will be plesently surprised. If I could give any 2 pieces of advice, they would be to bring a few extra dollars for tips and to brush up on your travel Spanish. It's not hard to say "hello" or "thank you" in Spanish, and trying even these 2 little words shows respect and is appreciated. I read many forum discussions on tipping before left and know it is a touchy subject when it comes to AI's. We tipped the pool waiter 10 pesos (about 5 USD) the first day (this particular waiter worked faster and harder than any of the others) and the next day we never even had to ask for a drink - he brought new ones before the old ones were even finished. At the end of the trip we had given away about 500 well-earned pesos (less than 50 USD). Not a lot, but the best we could do, and every one of them was very much appreciated. I HAVE TO SAY… Please take the extreme reviews - either claiming this is the best place on Earth or the worst place on Earth - with a grain of salt. It is just a very good AI. I would never recommend the RPRM to someone looking for pure "luxury", and at the same time I truly do not understand how someone could visit and not have a single good thing to say. We spent about $900 each total (including air & transfer) by booking through one of the travel deal sites and have never gotten more for our money. The RPRM is perfect for anyone looking for great service, beautiful scenery, a great crowd, and pretty good food. P.S. I'm sorry we didn't take photos!

Reviews.Title: “The palace is royalty at its best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: apricky
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Riu Palace April 10-13 for a short getaway. We have stayed at All inclusive resorts throughout the caribbean and nothing comes close to this hotel. From the moment we walked through the door it was oohs and ahhs. The architecture is so beautiful and the staff tries so hard to make your vacation perfect. We are nitpickers to say the least and we'd have to try real hard to find something to complain about at the palace. The only thing that prevents this resort from being PERFECT is the sandbags in the ocean but the water is so beautiful that we forgot they were even there. The sandbags have definetely served thier purpose because there is so much beach now. There is not another hotel in the riviera maya with more beach. Food: All resturuants are great. Sir Olivers/Krystal is french gourmet at its finest. Chillis Steakhouse is wonderful at night with the ocean breeze and romantic atmosphere. Don Monola Buffet is wonderful for breakfast lunch or dinner. The Brazilian resturuant is unique in that they bring you out several different grilled meats on these long forks one after the other. Everry thing is wonderful. If you enjoy good food You'll love the palace Pool: very big with an awesome poolbar. Santos is the best bartender. Ask for one of his "special margaritas". There is also an infinity pool that flows into the main pool. At the spa you have free access to the jaquzzi 's and they are set in a very private atmosphere-very romantic. Beach:Plenty of beach chairs for everyone and never too crowded. There is an upper level and lower level and both are great. The water is amazing with many hues of blue as you look out into the horizon. Many water activities including kayaks, paddleboats, snorkel, and windsailing if the water is calm. Service: This is what makes this hotel so wonderful. Smiles on everyone's face and they try soooo hard to please you. It's like you hurt thier feeling if you are not happy. You are waited on hand and foot. I never had to wait more than a minute for anything. A very charming and funny staff. They work so hard and never ever complain. Entertainment: The entertainment staff kept us busy all day. Pool parties, sexy bingo, darts tournament, volleyball, on and on. The guys had us cracking up all day. At night the place becomes so romantic. Live piano at the lobby bar and before your drink is empty the wait staff is offering you another. If you smoke a cigarettes, when you put it out in the ashtray the come by and take the tray and bring a new one as soon as the cigarette is extinguished. I say this just to give you an idea of how we were waited in there. The shows in the night club were great everynight. The mayan show is a must see.Try the sports bar if you are up late night it is open 24/7 and has great drinks and food Landscape: Immaculate!! fountains and perfectly groomed grass, shrubery, and trees. It felt like heaven all around us. Rooms: very well kept. beds are kinda hard but this is common for mexico. There is a liquor dispenser in every room with top shelf liquor. the mini bar is always stocked and all is included. Try to get a room facing the main courtyard it is well worth it. weather: Don't pay attention to the weather forecasts. It said that it would rain everyday we were there and we didn;t see a drop. THE WEATHER IS ALWAYS PERFECT IN PARADISE. Overall: This is a great hotel for couples to go on a relaxing vacation. There is no riff raff or loudnoise, no large groups or rowdy young kids getting drunk and loud. Nothing at all like cancun. It is a wonderful getaway from the stresses of life. My girlfriend and I needed to get away and have time alone and at the riu palace riviera maya we fell in love all over again. Don't let the traveler photos fool you this place looks so much better in person. you can't capture it 's beauty in a snapshot. Choose riu and go to The Palace riviera maya it is far and beyond the other riu properties in mexico. ENJOY!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort!”
Reviews.Author: Gruvin_1
Reviews.Content: Loved the place and will be back again...want to focus on tips as that is what most people want to know besides whether you liked the place (which I did VERY MUCH!) Bring a koozy so you can bring the Corona's out of your fridge down to the beach. If you order down there, you get Corona that comes in a plastic cup that gets warm in minutes. If you like COLD beer, bring a koozy (sp?) -- you know what I mean....other booze tip, Don Julio is their good tequila and is stashed away. Unless you ask for it, they certainly won't volunteer it and you'll be drinking the cheap stuff. Bring biodegradable sun tan lotion because if you go on any excursions (Xel-Ha, other snorkling trips), they all require biodegradable lotion. We did not, and were forced to buy some which was a waste since we spent 50 bucks on the other stuff. Don't let the cool breeze fool you!! I saw more blistered folks at dinner than I cared to see often because the sun is so sneaky and people don't lotion enough because they "don't feel hot". It probably ruined a lot of vacations from what I saw by those folks having to sit in their rooms all evening in Aloe instead of enjoying the festivities. Excursions -- the Half Day Tuluum excursion is a TON of sitting around, picking up other people at hotels, etc. In hindsight, we wished we would have rented a jeep, cruised down there - see what you need to see in about a 1/2 hr - 45 minutes and then maybe hit Xel-Ha for the good chunk of the day. It would probably be more expensive that way (I did not run the cost comparisions), but I personally want to maximize my time on vacation and will pay a premium to not operate at group speed. The roads are well-marked and not that complicated so I would not have the trepidation of driving in "foreign land". Others were frustrated on our tour as well as to why it took being picked up at 7:45AM and not returning until after 2PM for what should have been 3 hrs max inclusive of travel to and from (excluding any other side trips). Again, note we did not do research on the logistics of this so if someone else looks in to it and does it, your comments would be appreciated. Food: It was very good. If you go in with reasonable expectations that you are not dining at Morton's, Ruth's Chris, McCormack and Schmicks etc, you shouldn't be disappointed. They have a lot of variety. If you must have top, top end food, why are you staying at an all-inclusive?? Call Four Seasons and pay their prices. Enjoy!! My e-mail is brian@ercllc.biz if you want more details.

Reviews.Title: “Riviera Maya's best if you love food!”
Reviews.Author: retiretotravel
Reviews.Content: We booked a 6 Apple Square deal in Riviera Maya for 10 days, March 5 to 15th. We got the 6 Golden Apple Riu Palace. This was an outstanding hotel. Even more outstanding was the food - it was as good as it gets. Example of items on the buffet some nights: lobster, crab, shrimp, frog legs, tenderloin steak, pork tenderloin, ribs, chicken, turkey, ham. Wonderful selection of food every night at the buffet. There are also restaurants you can make reservations at. Didn't do any of them because the buffet was so good! We've been to Mexico/Punta Cana 8 times and I think we will never top this one!

Reviews.Title: “Playa del carmen, Riu riviera maya”
Reviews.Author: mckinsman
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Riu palace Riviera Maya. The hotel is amazing. Very clean from the lobby, bars restaurants and rooms. Staff are very friendly. The hotels are behind a security gate, so you can feel very safe walking up and down the streets to shopping and along the beach. After hurricane wilma, they brought large sand bags in to help save the beach, this was the only downfall for our whole vacation, just because they obstruct the beach and view, although needed to help save the beach from erosion. For our excursions we went horse back riding to la marona ranch, and we also went to Xel ha. for snorkeling, dolphins and it also is all inclusive if you pay a litle more. we did the Xel ha and Tulum ruins together, next time I will do them seperate, as you need a full day at Xel ha to see everything. Back to Riu now, the food is good, I am picky and could always find something to eat. We had so much fun can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Palace”
Reviews.Author: JonMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya over Spring Break from March 15 to March 22. From the moment my party arrived we were greatly pleased with the environment and the services of the Palace. We arrived before check in so we had to keep our luggage off to the side in the main lobby where everyone else kept theirs before check in. We changed into our suits and went to eat at the Chilis buffet and spent the day on the beach. After reading many reviews I was a bit leary about the beach. I was very pleased with the state the beach was in. There was plenty of room to walk down by the water and the giant sandbags made it possible to enjoy the water without getting thrown around by the waves. People were always on top of the sandbags playing in the waves so it added some extra fun. The rooms were very clean and spaceous. I was in a room with 3 other guys and we had plenty of room to keep our things seperate. The two double beds pushed together made one huge bed so the sleeper arrangments were a bit tight but we managed. There is also a small love seat down in the seating area which is sleepable if you dont mind having your feet hang off the edge. New towels were brought daily and beds were turned everyday. The mini bar was fully stocked each day so we had no worry about running out of water or beer. The restaurants on the property were always being reserved early so you need to get in line early to get a spot. The Japanese restaurant was our favorite. I never really ate sushi until I ate it here. The entrees were just as delicious as well as the desserts. The steakhouse was our second favorite. The grilled lobster and steaks were full of flavor and fully cooked. The Brazilian restraunt was nothing special. The food was salty and had spices in the meat that dont settle well. If you decide to give it a try, my advice is to stay away from the sausage. The last restraunt we tried was the French one. By far the worst one on property I thought. Many people in our party ordered the sea bass. It was served to us undercooked so we returned it only for it to come back uncooked yet again. The waiter apologized and was angered by the chef's lack of service. The portions are very small so you will be left hungry after you leave. The buffet does not need reservations and it tunred out to be one of the best places to eat. They had a wide variety of food every night and their theme changes every few nights. The pool is a great place to relax and catch some rays. I didn't think I would as much time as I did in the pool because the beach was so close but majority of my time was spent at the pool bar. Peter or "Pedro" is the BEST bartender you could ask for. Islas is also fun but I found Peter to be my favorite. The drinks are small so order in large amounts...ask Peter to make you "especial drink" and you will not be let down, he takes good care of you. The sports bar is a great place to close out the night (or morning). Eduardo takes good care of everyone at the bar late at night and knows how to have fun if the noise level is kept quiet or else security becomes involved. Ask for Eduardo's Tequila Boom Booms for a little fun. The lobby bar is the place to go for a pre-dinner drink. The piano music is soothing but can become repetative if you stick around too long. All in all the Riu Palace Riviera Maya was a fantastic experience and a destination I plan on returning to soon. Since we visited over Spring Break it was very busy but the staff handled everything exceptionally well. You won't see as many teens at this resort because it is one of the more pricier resorts in the Riu chain but there is still plenty for all age groups to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palace”
Reviews.Author: Sariana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace for 7 nights in January with our 20 month old. The location is fantastic. We walked to Playa del Carmen in less than 15 minutes. Upon arrival, check-in was quick. The hotel is extremely clean and the service is exceptional. We enjoyed the food. Our favourite restaurants were the Japanese and the Gourmet. The dinner buffets were outstanding too, especially the LOBSTER NIGHT BUFFET!!! Its a MUST! All 3 of us enjoyed relaxing on the sand, near the ocean because of the numerous palm trees. There was constantly a breeze. We never had a problem finding lounge chairs at the pool or the beach. There is Bar Service on the beach area of the hotel. The infinity pool is great. However, we were very disappointed with the children's pool and playground area. The hotel is very quiet in the evening. The Riu Palaces are known to have a more relaxing and tranquil atmosphere, which we enjoy, especially with the little one. We are big fans of Riu Palace Resorts. We find them to be very accomodating and luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “I'm SO Spoiled!!!!”
Reviews.Author: llilly57
Reviews.Content: This was my 8th trip in the last 11 years to this area and this was the best resort I've stayed at. It was immaculate, friendly, the best service, and more. We always choose 5 & 6 star/golden apple resorts because we want to be pampered. The food wasn't bad but it's not like you get here in the states. But then again, we're not in the states when we're in Mexico. We found many delicious things to eat, some were not so special, and the biggest thing lacking is the desserts. I'm a baker and I was dying to go in the kitchen and show these folks how to make a cake. We took 1 excursion and that was a snorkeling excursion thru Maya Adventures and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend that to anyone. It was outstanding. We spent some time at 5th Avenue shopping as well as walking to the local shopping area right in Playa del Carmen. Overall...just totally relaxing and nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review - Mexico Newbie!”
Reviews.Author: cmeller
Reviews.Content: Since I read every review of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (and Riu Palace Mexico) for over the past 2 months before we left for our trip I felt it only helpful if I post my own review for others. Background – My wife and I are both 28 and this was our first trip to Mexico (actually first trip Ex-US). We have never been to an all inclusive. We stayed from 3/16/08-3/22/08 Overall Resort/Area – The Riu Palace Riviera Maya was easily the most impressive resort from the exterior that we saw. It was very clean and employees were consistently picking up trash, maintaining the landscaping, and painting. We were able to walk to all the Riu properties and down the beach at the Riu Palace Mexico and where most impressed with our hotel. Wireless internet in the lobby worked well. Rooms – We were given a garden view room initially but there was already someone in that room, so they upgraded us to the ocean view room. This room was on the end of the “U” shape on the first floor looking out at the ocean, just to the side of the spa. The view from this room was GREAT!!! Much better than both a garden view and courtyard view. There must not be many of these (very lucky!) As nice as the view was there were a few issues. The smell of the room really bothered me but my wife didn’t mind. It seemed to be a stale musty scent, but when the wind was blowing the first couple of days the ocean breeze made it much more bearable. There were a few very tiny ants that were crawling on the steps down to the sitting area but nothing too bad (they were coming from the cranks in the stone steps). The beds were very hard and the cover was worn out a bit(should have been replaced). However, all in all the view made up for any negatives. We used the safe and felt very safe at all times. Beach – I was worried about this the most because my wife was very much looking forward to the beach and ocean. Also, the past reviews seem to have indicated a great amount of erosion. We felt that this hotel had one of the nicest beaches (if not the best) in all of Playacar. There was always room and chairs on the lower and upper beach. The ‘whales’ really break up the waves nicely and it was a lot of fun to climb on them. Note: The first 2 days the water was very rough and there were no water activities other than swimming allowed. After that the water was much calmer and there were boats, parasailing, and water ski’s galore! (I actually preferred the sound and the fun of playing in the rougher water) Food: This was the most disappointing part of our trip. A lot of the food was made very ‘runny’ so things didn’t look all that appealing and the buffet selection didn’t change much. The first morning I had one of the over easy eggs (my wife did not but everything else we ate was similar) and I got bad food poisoning. I was very sick the whole night and I believe this had to have been caused by the eggs not being cooked enough. Even the scrambled eggs always seemed to be under cooked. Luckily, this hit me early afternoon so I was able to pass out around 10pm and recover the next day but needless to say we lost some valuable vacation time due to this incident. Anyways, I ate a lot of watermelon for breakfast that week and no more eggs. The buffets for lunch and dinner were ok with the ham being the best meat I had all week (but they only had it once). Everything was very runny and the tables tended to be a bit dirty. I would have liked more consistency to the food preparation but I was leary all week from my ‘egg experience.’ We ate at two restraints the Mexican and the Steak House. We accidentally slept though our Brazilian dinner reservation. The Mexican restaurant was ok nothing great and the steak house was good. Actually, my steak was very tasty but it was served with French fries instead of a baked potato. All in all they could improve the food so make this resort EXCELLENT! Drinks were good and plentiful but my wife and I aren’t huge drinkers so at most we had 4-5 drinks a day and all were tasty. Excursions: Since this is a Riu review I won’t get into them too much but we did the Tulum/Xel-Ha and Jungle ATV tour. Both were excellent with the ATV tour and cenote being my favorite. I would recommend both of them as must do’s! We went to 5th Ave later in the week and wished we would have went sooner and more often and tried more of the restaurants/bars down there. Overall: I think if I were to return to Mexico I would stay at the RPRM again because of the environment and beach. However, we might get a better deal if we didn’t go the all inclusive way and did more excursions and ate on 5th Ave but if I had to advise someone who wanted an all inclusive this would be the place. Any Q’s please feel free to contact me at cpmeller7751 (at) yahoo.com Hope this helps….

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place! :-)”
Reviews.Author: Worldwide707
Reviews.Content: I cant say enough about this hotel i loved it. polite employees, beautiful beaches, pools and rooms !!!!PROBLEM!!!! wished we could have stayed longer!!! haha

Reviews.Title: “WOW Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dumblonde51
Reviews.Content: This Riu Hotel is fantastic. When you enter the hotel you cannot help but take a gasp. It is awesome. The lobby area is so big with lovely chandeliers and great seating areas. FLIGHT - We flew out to Mexico with our two friends on a Thomson Flight and it was very good. The extra leg room you now get with them is much better. The tv at back of seats is great. We enjoyed the games and played who wants to be a millionaire (which a lot of other passengers were doing too) quite a lot. Food was good too. Service was also good. CHECK IN - This was very fast and efficient. Staff very pleasant and English speaking very good. ROOM - Our room was a very good size with plenty of storage space for all your clothes etc. Bed was fine for us and had no trouble falling a sleep. Maid kept room very clean and tidy. Towel service was good, towels twice a day. Loved my towel animals they left me too. Fridge was kept stocked on a regular basis. No complaints at all. No musty smell either. BEACH - Plenty of beds to be had on upper and lower levels of beach. Was a worried when i read other reviews about there being no beach at all as my friend loves to swin in the sea. No need to worry as yes although there has been erosion you can still get into the sea and my friend enjoyed herself. If you want a nice stretch of beach go to Riu Yucatan and walk right of their beach and you will find a lovely stretch of beach there. As our friends husband loves to fish we went there and he did catch some fish. Now stretch of beach to walk along too. POOL - A good sized pool. Water a tad cold for me but did go in. You cannot beat sitting in a jacuzzi sipping champers ooh i do miss that. Pool bar area very good. Never stayed around the pool area as prefer beach only for the fact you can get a nice breeze. BAR - The bar in lobby area is a great place for pre dinner drinks and meeting up with lots of people. We met some very nice people while on holiday from England ,Canada, America. Loved my champers. Islas is a very good barman and he knows exactly what everybody drinks, amazing. You can sit around the bar and watch him make all the different cocktails etc., or you can sit at a table in the bar area and watch the world go by. The service is very good. RESTAURANTS MAIN BUFFWET - The main buffet is great for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. Plenty of food to choose from. Lovely atmosphere. The artistry they do with the water melons and the ice sculptures are brilliant. The service you get is very good. You will never go hungry. BRAZILIAN RODIZIO - We did not eat here so cannot comment. We heard from other guests that is was very salty and too much protein in one hit. So we decided to give it a miss. CHILIS - Grill and Steakhouse. Very good food and great service. Be aware that this themed restaurant is outside (Pool area) and me and my friend got bitten here. Remember to put on your insect repellent. AGAVE - Mexican. This is a nice restaurant and the meal was very good. We were expecting mpore Mexican food though, but it did not spoil our evening. Service again very good. YASHIMA - Japanese. Have never had sushi before and will not have it again. I am glad i tried it as always wondered what it was like to eat raw fish. Not our cup of tea though. We enjoyed the rest of pour meal there and again service very good. SIR OLIVER - Gourmet. WOW is what i say. We had a fantastic meal here (went twice) and i would suggest you book this one as soon as you can as gets booked up very quickly. The food was outstandingly good. The service was 1str class. I could go on and on. Just go and try it and see what i mean. Our favorite themed restaurant. POOL BEACH RESTAURANT- Great for lunch. Your normal pizzas, hanburgers, salads etc. Food good here. SPORTS BAR- Well this was obviously very noisy. Lots of tvs and some pool tables, another game and the Internet service was in there as well. You could get a snack from the fridge and stick it in microwave. Nachos and cheese also available and of course your drinks and coffees. Lobby bar shuts at mid night so used to go here on our way back to our rooms. Youngsters love this place. OVERALL VIEW - We all loved our holiday here and did not want to go home. We did have an extra day as our flight home was delayed by 8 hours so that was a great bonus. It is the best RIU hotel me and mt husband have been, it was a first for our friend's and they loved this hotel and i am so glad as am always telling them how good RIU hotels are so they said they would come here with us and they were so glad they came and we were too. The staff are so friendly and the it is kept really clean in fact it is spotless. If you decide to go here for a holiday you will not be disappointed. Try it out and ENJOY WE DID

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: carmen8
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have traveled to so many wonderful places and this resort is just another one to add to the list. I read several reviews and knew going to the Riu it would be nice, but there is nothing like actually getting there and having all your expectations fulfiled. You walk into the lobby, someone greets you as if you owned the place. The marbel floors the chandeliers and beautiful arrangments of fresh flowers are there to welcome you too. Ok this might appeal to the women a bit more, but then you step to the lobby bar that is surrounded by lots of seating and you get your first Mojeto and decide you made the right choice. You can read all the rest of the reviews for how great the pool was, how clean, and how really great the staff treated you more of those details in others----- The only thing that is the tip portion of this review- go to the lobby when you first get there to book the specialty resturants. In the book ,in your room, ( you know the one that tells you about the services in the hotel) it will say that you can go to the resturant early in the morning to go that night - NO, that print is old news. At 12 noon there will be a small line (near the piano, in the lobby)and there will be a young women sitting at a table to book your reservation. It may take a few nights to get the one you want, so do it early on. It was 4 days out before we could get the Sir Olivers( we had heard that one was really good) - so we started with the others and none where disappointing. And even if you can't get the time you wanted there is always the next day or the Buffet that was just fine. I am sure you will have a great time- if you don't think this place is wonderful - then you are a person that might not be happy anywhere. Happy vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Service!”
Reviews.Author: travelangel1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six day vacation at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and were pleasantly surprised. In the past, we had stayed at the Iberostar properties, but were looking for something a bit closer to Playa del Carmen. I was a bit nervous from reading prior reviews, but felt that the positive opinions outweighed the negative and decided to give it a shot. From the moment that we entered the lobby until checkout on the last day, the service exceeded our expectations. Although, it is all inclusive, we did tip, but I would imagine that the staff would treat us the same whether we did or didn't. The entire property was immaculate, including our room, which was located near the pool, spa and beach. This was just luck of the draw! We made reservations at three of the restaurants - the Brazilian, the Gourmet and the streakhouse. The Brazilian was our least favorite due to the oversalted meat and the Gourmet was absolutely fabulous. I had the Chilean sea bass and my husband had the lamb. The presentation was outstanding! The steakhouse was pretty good, too. We enjoyed breakfast at the main buffett every day and I must say they served the freshest fruit that I have ever tasted and their pico de gallo was so good that I had it in some form at every meal. Another reviewer mentioned that the lobby bar had the best cocktails and I would agree with that. We never had an issue getting a chair near the pool or on the beach no matter what time we got there. It was a great vacation that ended too soon. Next year we plan on trying a Riu property in Puerta Vallarta as we hear that they are opening the Pacifico this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: Diane08
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Riu Palace in May, 2007 because my daughter booked her wedding there. We were skeptical about Mexico at first and it wouldn't have been our first choice, but that all changed when we arrived. The hotel is fabulous and the view is spectacular. I thought I arrived in paradise. It just got better as the week went on. The food was great, the staff couldn't do enough for you, and the beach wedding was beautiful. I would highly recommend having a wedding at that hotel. We had 30 to 35 guests and they all had a great time. I didn't hear one complaint. In fact, they didn't want to leave. It was so great, that my husband and I rebooked for this May at the Riu Palace. We can't wait to get back to paradise! Diane

Reviews.Title: “First Class Booking and Sevice”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels45
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip on www.canadatravels.com - the booking was easy and fast. All questions were responded too very quickly. The resort was better than we expected. The food was great every night which really surprised us - the rooms were spacious and extremely comfortable - the bar in the room was restocked daily, The pool and beach at this resort were top notch - the service was very good without being over the top. I will continue to book my travel with canadatravels.com and will definately return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “very good resort”
Reviews.Author: planet5
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel and staff generally excellent. Rooms were good and at no time did we feel the service was anything less than excellent. The beach was non-existent really and the sandbags used for the breakwater really detracted visually. The 15 minute walk to Playa Del Carmen was a daily event for us. The walk itself is very pleasant day or night. Playa Del Carmen also has an excellent beach which we enjoyed. Food was just average and frankly was below expectations based on other RIUs we have visited elsewhere. Breakfast in particular was disappointing. There is a very good golf course right across the street which we enjoyed. It is quite a step up from most golf courses in this part of the world. Note that the slope there is 148 I believe so if your game is not where you would like it to be I might select the Hilton Course in Cancun as an alternative. Yes you will be hassled non-stop by vendors outside of the resort but if you deal with them with a quick remark or a smile they will smile back and relent. Remember they are just trying to make a living. Overall for an an all-inclusive this was a very good resort in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: cruiserdavy
Reviews.Content: Great Place, grounds were well manicured, along with pool and fountains. Meals were above average with the buffett(s) better than the specialty restaurants. Personel above average with pleasantries. Though no tipping was needed I was being treated so well that tipping was a pleasure. The waiter at the one dinner buffett we went to was so good to us, I not having any cash on me went to my room and retrieved some for him (he deserved it) Watched head manager keeping a watchful eye on all facilites. Beach was roomy with sun and shade equal. TIP: Courtyard view rooms are $50.00 more (gardenview is more privite balcony) we had both, but not sure if it is worth it to all. Water sports/specialty dinning need reservations from the get go. Shorts were worn by many men at the buffett. Remeber to bring something to eat on the Plane (airport food plentiful but not of quality and very $$$). Entertainment nothing to make us wait for. SUNSCREEN. Insulated cups for coffee of course. Hotel is hour away from airport (transportation for a 11am flight out, left hotel at 7:40am) lots of sitting so bring reading material.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable - tryi it you will like it!”
Reviews.Author: MDAdvisor
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel as part of a large conference (175 people). While not everyone in the group was pleased, I thought it was a wonderful resort and can highly recommend it. The hotel facilities are lovely with a very impressive lobby and lobby bar area that our little subgroup gathered in every night for before dinner cocktails or after dinner drinks. The grounds are kept up on an ongoing basis and you can see the staff hard at work keeing things neat and clean. I think this attention to detail helps the guests to value the property, too. I was up early every morning walking around and picking out our perfect beach location so I could see the effort the early morning crew took to sweep and wash all the tile areas, manicure the lawn and shrubs, etc. The pool areas are lovely with a mixture of palms and umbrellas to protect from the hot sun, if so desired. There is a tendency for people to reserve seats early in the morning, so if you want the best seats get out there around 7 am to place your towels and belongings. Not all guests knew the basics of pool manners, so there was some nastiness from time to time about chairs, umbrellas, towel snatchings, etc. This doesn't have anyting to do with the hotel, just the manners of the guests themselves. We arrived at noon on the first day, and the only seating we could find around the pool was at the bar gazbo. There weren't any lounge chairs available at that time. The beach chairs were shaded by palm trees. There is also a lower beach area with full sun. The water is lovely, the beach is not perfectly seashell/debris free, but is tolerable for wading or walking or swimming. Other reviews that I read before going critizied the beach, but I thought it was just fine. Our room was on the main floor, but not facing the courtyard as so many TripAvisor folks recommended. Our view was very private with lots of grass and bushes. It was very adequate. Some people we were with had ocean views (at no extra cost), or the courtyard views for the same money we paid. There were a number of people on our trip that had to change rooms. There was nothing wrong with the room contents, but the views were either very poor - overlooking air conditioning systems or in noisy locations. Some people had paid for room upgrades to true suites, but their suites were not available at check-in and were only available several days later. This did cause some issues. While at the pool, I sat next to a couple not with our group, and they had changed their room 3 times because of the poor view or noisy conditions, so this seems to be a consistent theme. The rooms look just like the pictures on the internet, so no surprises there. The food is very first rate. They had an unbelieveable array of foods to choose from and everything was always fresh. The hot foods were hot and the cold foods were cold and we weren't afraid to eat any or all of it. The are constantly putting out fresh bowls or platters as they dwindle down. My only complaint, if it is a complaint, is that there is so much variety, yet the same variety is served both at lunch and at dinner, so that it is easy to become bored with the selection if you take a little bit of a lot of things everyday. I would recommend limiting yourself to a few things at each meal and then trying something else at the next meal. The desserts were not spectacular, but we didn't mind since it would have caused us to overeat just that much more! The best ice cream is at the main buffet (not the one near the pool). Not known by a lot of guests is that the main buffet is open for lunch, too. So, if you want a bit more of an upscale lunch, pass up the buffet lunch at the pool restaurant and walk up to the main buffet for a white table lunch. We ate at several of the special restaurants for dinner that require a reservation. I would not recommend the Brazilian restaurant at all. No one at our table of 8 walked away pleased. However, we had much better reviews for the Steak House, the Oriental restaurant and the Mexican restaurant. The steaks at all 3 of these restaurants were wonderful. Steaks are not served at the buffet. However, the main buffet has wonderful food and if you only ate there, you would do just fine. The best part about the speciality restaurants is that they provide table service and you can sit down to eat with controled portions! The drinks are unlimited, very good and the bar wait staff service is excellent. Just make sure that at the pool you let them know if you do or do not want alcohol in your mixed drinks. There is enteratinment every night that is lovely and above average for these type of hotels. You can sit outside in the courtyard to see and hear the show or you can sit inside the theater area for a closer look. There is also live music throughtout the day and night either at the pool or in the courtyard area. If you are a doer, there are many planned activities to participate in: yoga, water arobics, dance lessons, darts, volley ball, etc. You could be busy all day if you like that sort of thing. Try this hotel, you should love it.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomBBaltimore_Md
Reviews.Content: This is a wondeful hotel.My wife and I just returned from a week long convention there. The rooms were large and well maintained. The staff was uniformly friendly and competent, although some of the front desk people are not perfect. The beach, as best we could observe from our walks, was better than any other in the Playa del Carmen area, with plenty of palm trees for shade and always chairs available. The pools are good, not great, and bothersome with the excessive among of loud speaker music. Best of all was the food.The buffet at Don Manolo was always plentiful and highest quality; especially for vegetable, fruit and salad type of preferences. The specialty restaurants were also good. There's golf across the street ( walking to golf and to the beach is a real treat), but it's pricey ( $ 190 a round) and very difficult

Reviews.Title: “My favorite all inclusive in Mexico”
Reviews.Author: Jojoo
Reviews.Content: We just returned this week 2/27/2008, from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, and it was one of the best all inclusives that I have been to in Mexico. The hotel is gorgeous, chandeliers and marble all over the hotel and it is spotless. The employees were exceptionally nice. I find that if you do not demand things (as sometimes people from the USA do) you get treated alot better. We did tip, but alot of people did not. The restaurants were all good. You have to make reservations, and you can only reserve two restaurants at a time. They have two seatings--6:45 and 8:45.and you are never rushed. There is a Brazilian, Mexican, Steakhouse, Japanese, & Sir Olivers which is very elegant. When you go to the Mexican restaurant you will see that they have a salad bar and a appetizer bar which you can make a meal out of that. We ate so many of the appetizers that we couldn't eat our entree, and it is very authentic Mexican food. There are two buffets the main one is open for all three meals but you can't go in with wet bathing suits and at night no sleevless shirts for men. In the pool area there is a buffet for breakfast and lunch and snacks but not dinner. You can go in there wearing anything. They constantly are cooking so the food is always fresh and not laying around. The pool has plenty of lounge chairs and you can always find shade because there are plenty of umbrellas and palm trees. The same goes for the beach. We didn't have any problems getting drinks, there were plenty of waiters and there is a swim up bar at the pool as well as a regular one. There were plenty of activities going on all day. In the evening there was music in the main courtyard and they had nightly shows which were your typical shows that you find at resorts. Sometimes a little boring but you can take a taxi into Playa de Carmen which costs $5 and there are plenty of places to go to--restaurants, clubs, shopping and this is on 5th Avenue. If you bring your laptop, you can use it in the lobby free of charge. The rooms are like mini suites and they have a stocked refrigerator and liquor dispensers. The only thing I hated was the bed which was hard as a brick. You can ask for a mattress pad which helps. As far as the drinks go, I liked the drinks made at the Lobby bar best and they were open day and night. Overall, this place was wonderful plus we had perfect weather. You can also go to the sister hotels which are on the same street which we didn't do because everyone said ours was the best. I will be going back next winter, it is at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Beach is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: asdf098
Reviews.Content: The beach was great for little kids. Other reviews have mentioned problems with lots of rocks as you enter the water. The beach has been built up since Wilma and these rocks are no longer a problem. In addition, eight or ten massive sandbags are situated in the water, creating a kind of breakwater. They look like big weathered rocks until you get out on top of them. Each sandbag is probably 20 ft long x 5 ft high. The sandbags don't sound great - who'd want to go to a beach with massive sandbags in the water? - but they were actually fun. Climbing on and off of the sandbags, getting knocked off the sandbags by waves, going out all the way to the farthest one, etc. were major pastimes for swimmers. Because of the sandbags, this hotel has more beach than those surrounding it. You can walk from beach to beach, but some nearby hotels have almost no beach. This is not your destination if you want a wide idyllic beach for long walks. Miami Beach this is not. However, it was great for us.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Doubleeagle
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is likely one of the best all-inclusive resorts around. About a sixty minute drive from the Cancun airport -- away from the craziness of Cancun but with enough local activity to be fun. As a new hotel, it was immaculate , kept that way with an impressive work force. Would highly recommend getting a room facing inward toward the fountains etc. Also, the further the room is located from the lobby the less the chance the hallway will be noisy. We also had rooms on the top floor which eliminated the probability from noise from above. The beds are hard as described but a mattress pad which the hotel is happy to deliver and install makes the beds acceptable. The water pressure tends to fall at high volume times so don't wait until the last minute to take your evening shower. Bottom line - if you were expected the Four Seasons, this isn't it but for an all inclusive it is really quite nice. The food is plentiful and varied. Breakfast in the main buffet will appeal to all. Lunch at the beachside Chili's (no relation to US chain) is also appealing and with enough variety to even appeal to our persnickety daughters. The specialty restaurants for dinner are OK with decent steak & lobster @ the American Grill, decent Mexican (not Tex-Mex) at the Mexican, Brazillan only so so and quite good at the "gourmet" Sir Olivers. Evening buffet will appeal to all. The liquor flowed freely including beach attendants walking around asking for drink orders. There was zero attempt to make it difficult or cumbersome to get drinks - somewhat surprising in that increased consumption decreases profits. Overt intoxication was quite rare and never bothersome. The beach was better than expected - the actual beach is about 25 yards (23 meters) deep and several hundred yards long - see photos 1 &2. The "fake" beach - although it actually doesn't have any overt appearance of being man made - is 5 steps raised from the natural beach and is 65 yards (59 meters) deep with two generous areas laterally placed for those who enjoy some shade afforded by plentiful palm trees and a wide central area devoid of trees for those wishing to bake in the sun. The water is clean and nice. The pools (although contiguous) are freeform giving the impression of spaciousness. Pools are clean and attractive. There is very little of the "towel game" for saving of seats - there are more chaise lounges available than hotel guests - and the hotel was full - we didn't even have difficulty getting four chaise lounges together after a morning trip to Tulum. The only place that it was evident was the grouping of chairs immediately encircling the pool. As for the preoccupation on this site regarding topless women, the proportion of topless women increased with proximity to the Caribbean - some but rare around the pool, scattered on the "fake" beach and somewhat more prevalent on the beach. Never to the point that it would be offensive to even the most prudish of guests. The staff was exceedingly accommodating. A call to the desk assured our mini bar was over stocked with bottled water. The bar staff and the wait staff was excellent. Tips are very much appreciated - several dollars to the beach waiters and bar staff for a round of 4 drinks, $10-15 for the waiter at on of the specialty restaurants and $3 daily in the fridge of the mini bar. Also to the cocktail waiters in the plaza-type courtyard - a very pleasant site for evening cocktails before & after dinner. So to bottom-line this...no all-inclusive could ever attempt to be a Ritz or Four Seasons and I have been fortunate enough to stay in these luxurious hotels in the past...but it does deliver top flight all-inclusive experience. Many or most aspects of this hotel exceeding expectations. Side trips to the Mayan ruins are fun. A half day to Tulum is nice - but go early as it gets crowded and hot. Be wary of a fellow named Erwin from Olympus Tours in the lobby of the Riu - a real slickster who freely partakes in the bait & switch. There are plenty of other options. Shopping in Playa del Carmen on 5th Avenue is the expected free for all. Much more sedate is the shopping in Plaza Playacar which is located in the opposite direction from Playa del Carmen and a 5 minute walk from the Riu. The Cancun airport is the most efficient I have experienced in the Caribbean - but once clearing the arrivals section and within sight of the outdoors be wary of the desks of shysters who will pretend to be the focus of almost anything including ground transportation but in reality are representatives of time shares. There is no concern for security at the Riu or the Playacar area. At the Riu we freely left valuables such as sun glasses and digital cameras in our beach bag while swimming and never had a probelm. In addition we never heard any commotion that would likely be indicative of any issue with other guests. This evaluation was long-winded but I feel indebted to the previous evaluators and hope to add to the knowledge base. The real bottom line --- We would and likely will return to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “"No zzzzz's for me at the Riu"”
Reviews.Author: momdeplume
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long all inclusive vacation with my family to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. I would give the experience an overall thumbs up, but a few things prevent me from giving this place a glowing review and from choosing this hotel again in the future. This Riu Palace is an attractive looking resort. The lobby is grand in scale and glitzy with large chandeliers, loads of granite, marble and pseudo neoclassical style paintings set into walls which have a pink colored faux finish in attempt to appear from centuries past. There is an piazza like feeling to the outdoor public area once you have exited the lobby on the lower level. There are fountains and with some landscaping which some of the guest rooms overlook. The rooms are spacious and nice looking. The bathroom is a good size with two sinks and a tub/shower. I appreciated the wall mounted make up mirror with magnification. Each room has a mini bar which is restocked daily and a dispenser with several varieties of alcohol which is part of the all inclusive deal. There is also plenty of bottled water in your room for drinking and teeth brushing. (There are signs posted above the taps saying that the water isn't potable). Our room and that of the family we traveled with were identically furnished with Spanish style dark wooden furniture. The two beds in the room were pushed together to make a massive size bed united by a huge wooden headboard. I believe each bed was less than a queen (probably a full), and I'm not sure if they could be separated. There was also a sitting area on a lower level (one step down) which led to a small balcony with 2 plastic chairs and a small table. There was a television and a small couch in the sitting area. Unfortunately, the couch didn't have a pull out bed, something that I think would have made an enormous difference as far as sleeping configurations go. If you have more than one child, or don't care to sleep in close proximity, this would have been nice. Okay, now for the negative part. The bed was truly as hard as a slab of stone! I had difficulty sleeping as a result. In addition, the acoustics in the hallways and the rooms were horrible as a result of no noise dampening materials in the halls and little in the rooms other than the bedspreads (ours had stains) and the drapes leading to the balconies. Any conversation or room service cart in the hall could be heard very loudly. Early risers and returning late party-ers were disturbing, and at one point, since I was so uncomfortable on the petrified wood object that masqueraded as a bed, I was able to clearly hear the late night return of the guests in the room above mine including the clacking of their shoes on the floor and the clattering of a dropped small object. For me, vacations are a time to get caught up on rest, so not being able to sleep comfortably was my biggest complaint. The staff at the hotel were mostly very accommodating and friendly. One concern I had with this resort being all inclusive was that there would be no incentive to do the little things that make a vacation pleasant, but this was not the case here. I would add that our tour representative (Apple Vacations) had suggested on the bus ride from the airport to the hotel that tipping the waitstaff in the specialty restaurants was a good idea, so we did even though I'm not sure it was necessary. This Riu has a number of options for dining especially at night. As I mentioned before there are specialty restaurants. There are five in all, and I tried 3 of them before deciding that the buffet was a better choice especially when dining with children. It is necessary to stand in line to make reservations at the specialty restaurants 1 to 2 days in advance for either of the two sittings available each night. The Brazilian and Mexican restaurants were just fair. The Brazilian restaurant seemed to be all about too many types of meat which our waiter served to us from long swords. The steak house restaurant was better, but nowhere near the quality of a good steak house in the States. We decided to skip the "gourmet" restaurant called Sir Oliver's in favor of trying a well reviewed Mexican restaurant in town. The buffet style dining was somewhat overwhelming catering to a variety of tastes and the resort's international crowd. One can always find something, and there were always opportunities to try new things. The food, on the whole, was good. If you're a decaf drinker, forget about it unless you go into town where there is a Starbucks. The stuff they serve here tastes like Sanka. Yuck! The advertised Kids Club was very weak. The woman running the program seemed less than enthusiastic and didn't speak much english. My child is almost 9 and wanted nothing to do with activities which included a very lame Mini Disco run by 3 staffers in silly outfits. My spouse and I had hoped for some "adult only time" while our daughter was happily engaged in fun activities with other children. This did not happen the entire week since there was no programming for her age group. The family we traveled with had a 5 year old who participated in some loosely organized craft projects. The most inexcusable event, however, was when I spotted our friends' 5 year old alone in the shallow end of the pool (no life guards here) having been released from her craft activity early when the woman in charge had to leave to set up for a lunch event. Another family we met told us a similar thing had happened on a different day with their 3 year old! The water and beach were beautiful. I believe there has been some work done to restore this area since destructive storms of last year. There is also a grove of palm trees with hammocks to relax in. It was not difficult to get a lounge chair on the beach. Around the pool was more difficult, but usually spots were available on the fringes. There are two main pools which are adjoining. We spent more time in the upper one since it seemed cleaner. The lower one has a swim up bar area which explains why you might run into a floating soggy nacho chip or the occasional cigarette butt. My daughter loved being able to swim up to the bar to order non alcoholic daiquiris. My spouse used the gym equipment and found it to be adequate. Although I did not have the opportunity to use the spa, there seemed to be a number of services and treatments to pamper yourself with. There are 2 nice jacuzzis as well as a sauna available if you haven't gotten your fill of heat. Shopping is either a short walk or a 5 dollar cab ride away for a better selection and the opportunity to hone your negotiating skills. Bargaining is elevated to a fine art in the Fifth Avenue district where it possible to purchase some cheap souvenirs as well as nice silver jewelry and Mexican handicrafts. Bring dollars with you especially in smaller denominations unless you want change in pesos. The dollar still has some clout here. There are opportunities for a number of excursions to archeological sites, beaches, adventure parks, etc. My daughter wanted to swim with dolphins which wasn't too long a bus ride, so we did that for an afternoon. A number of tour package operators have desk hours in the hotel lobby and are available to describe and sign you up for these activities (additional fees apply) if you want to participate. So although I have a few gripes about the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, I would say that it is a nice resort. If you are a sound sleeper and don't have younger children, this resort would be a good choice for a warm weather vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Did not love ths hotel at all.”
Reviews.Author: DelMarGirl
Reviews.Content: We love to travel, and have traveled at many all-inclusives as well as regular hotels. We and 2 other families were meeting at this hotel as a reunion. Let me start by saying, we really were excited just to be able to meet as a family because this was sort of a reunion for us, as we hadn't had a vacation together ever. We pulled up to the hotel, and our first negative experience was that there was no bellman to greet us, nor anyone to help with our luggage. We do know now after spending 5 nights at the hotel, that this was not usual, as we saw a bellman the majority of our time after this arrival. (Also, the entire time we were registering, we didn't see the bellman either, and that was about 45 minutes total). We arrived at around 4:00pm, and their were other guests as well arriving, that didn't have a bellman either. We were then given our room cards, and again, lugged our luggage up to the room without the help of the bellman, as the front desk told us that we had to wait until he came back, again it had been almost 1 hour, and we were ready to change our clothes as go to the pool/beach. We walk up the long corridors to our room, and our all of our card don't work (we had 2 rooms, the other family checked in the day before.) So we had to go back down to activate our cards. Needless to say, we had already been to the hotel for more than 1 hour (with kids in tow) and hadn't even gotten to our room. Basically, to shorten this already long story, the rest of the trip was just one poor customer experience after another. They give towel cards to each person in your family, which allows only 1 towel a person. The lounge chairs were long, and I felt more comfortable having two on the chair, but they never allowed us more than our four towels, even if we needed another one to go to the beach, or whatever. I never dreamed that giving towels to guests would be such an issue. Every time I asked, they flatly said "no", without any explanation or apology. I was appalled when the towel girl (very rude!!) started giving me dirty looks every time I came each subsequent day to pick up my four alloted towels for my family. There was a restaurant next to the pool, and there were a few times we liked to take a plate of food next to our chairs. On one occasion, we went again to bring a plate of food, and they refused to give me a fork. I was so numb from the extremely poor service, that I just walked away shaking my head. The pool itself was very nicely designed, but it was freezing cold, and took some time getting used to it. The ocean water was actually warmer than the pools. The ocean was very rough most of the time we were there, and prevented us being fully enjoying the waters. The sand was soft and beautiful. The bar service at the lobby and the sports bar was the best, and we really enjoyed our pre-dinners sitting there and having drinks. But I really am disappointed that the only beer they served in the entire hotel was Corona only! Especially in a country which has such amazing and tasty beers. For the price we paid for all-inclusive, I am quite amazed at the food as well. While the buffet was visually beautiful, I felt it was just a variation of the same foods from day-to-day. In fact, they had so much fried foods and every vegetable dish/meat dish was just swimming in butter or oil. We went to eat at the Mexican restaurant, and the food was horrible. The fish was fishy, dry, and too salty. Chili's Restaurant (which was the lunch restaurant converted into a steak house at night) was quite good, from the beautiful and tasty seafood appetizers, down to the beef medallion which was cooked immaculately to the lobster which was a little chewy, but tasty. We mostly went to the dinner buffet at the main restaurant, due to the kiddos. Anyway, overall, I would not return at all to this hotel, nor to any Riu properties, as I have been scarred by this trip in a way due to such poor customer service. The hotel industry is supposed to be a service industry, and I am quite appalled at how poorly the staff knew about this key aspect to tourists. We spoke with several other people while on the trip, who did express similar situations, and therefore, knew this wasn't just isolated to our family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time, Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Voodoo7
Reviews.Content: Well, where do I start? This place was awesome! From the time we arrived until the time we departed we had a great time. The staff is very friendly and always checking to ensure that you're having a good time. We never had to wait for a drink and any of the bars. I can only think of one time in our entire stay where we said, "Where's the drink guy?" My wife was hooked on the "Passion Dreams" and I tried a little bit of everything. (I did find myself ordering either a Mojito or Caiprinia quite often) They were not skimpy on the alcohol either. As for the food, it was very good. There were plenty of choices at the buffet at all meals. It never got boring as I have read some people complain about in past reviews. It really is what you make of it. I come from Atlantic City where the buffets are huge. Don Monolo was 100 times better. The gourmet restaurants were great! We tried Botofogo (good), Agave (very good) and Chilis Steak House (excellent!!!) It was very easy to make resevations too. We just went down at noon and booked for that day and one day in advance. The entertainment is a little limited but we liked that. They had a show at 10:00 and a band before that. It was great to be able to sit out in the courtyard and enjoy the weather, the show and of course a few drinks. There were no rowdy crowds which is good. If you're looking to "party" go to Cancun. There were a few kids but they were no problem. We only saw one couple become annoyed because the kids were right up on top of them in the pool while the rest of the pool was empty. No biggie. As for the room: It was really nice. A little small but not bad at all. Nice and cool with a decent stock of cerveza and soda. Our patio was nice. We had the garden view which was in fact looking at the property next door but we found that we had more privacy then the courtyard view. IWe liked it. As for the now infamous "musty smell", it was there but not a deal breaker at all. It is the tropics, I've been to Panama three times so I was ready for it and my wife was bothered a bit. We did have one issue. On our last night we had a leak in our ceiling due to our AC freezing over. the floor was soaked. The desk did not answer the phone so we had to go down and tell them about the leak. They immediately moved us to another room, which was really bad. It was on the ground floor and had a tiny patio with no breeze. Due to the language barrier we opted to stay in our original room. We asked if someone would be looking at the leak and we were told it's late (11:00 pm) That was unexceptable. It was late for us as well, we were to depart in the morning for the airport. Well, needless to say, a maintnance worker did come up and fix the leak. It took all of 30 mins. No biggie. Hey, &$%^ happens! As for the desk. Check in took all of 5 mins but they do not answer the phone as others have stated. All in all a great stay! I would go back again without hesitation. I feel that reviews here have been very helpful. I do not understand any bad remarks. It really depends on your mindset. If you go in looking for problems, you will without a doubt find them. You really have to be snobby to have serious issue with this property. It is an excellent resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Relaxing and Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: chad10
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the RIU Palace, Riviera Maya on 02-10-08 for six nights. Check in was smooth and quick with no problems. Very impressive first impression from the inside and out. Beach was much better than i thought and pool was also good. Staff was always getting volleyball, ping pong and other events going. Buffet was very good. Ate at Chili's and Mexicana and both were excellent. Breakfast buffet good but old after several days. Rooms were very clean and beds weren't as hard as the RIU Cancun. The toilets don't flush well at all and had to have maintenance come twice and they were very prompt. Went to fifth avenue twice and Senor Frogs which was very happening at night. there is also some shopping if you make a left after exiting the resort. about a five minute walk compared tow 15-20 for 5th avenue. Bartenders and servers were excellent and we tipped them because they make you feel so relaxed and are overly accommodating. some topless sun bathers at the beach and also surprisingly around the pool. The resort is very calm and has lots of couples and families and is not for singles. There is not much night life here and if you want excitement at night you have to find it else where but we weren't really looking for that. Overall, the resort is great and I wouldn't hesitate about going back but might try an Iberostar because I have heard good things about them too. but RIU's are great places.

Reviews.Title: “Canadian Travellers paying for the SUN”
Reviews.Author: kathybalen
Reviews.Content: We basically paid for a suntan for two weeks, we could have saved $7,000 and went to the tanning booth and stayed at home! I was so, and I mean so excited to go to this hotel and location only to find that our American cousins get treated better than Canadians. First they put us in a room with the view of the a/c room 1021, yeah right, so we complained then she put us in 2133 overlooking the Reef hotel on the side, better but I asked for an upgrade because I'm a RIU member; and it did not matter she said. Other Americans upgraded no problem, one couple paid the front desk guy $10.00 and went to the courtyard view, and lots more.. In the change of rooms, 2 hours or so, the porter took our luggage but forgot my running shoes at the end of the bed ( I changed into my flip flops). It took 3 days of asking and finally my boyfriend bought me new shoes and complained to the asst manager, Anilu, and she got Marco to track them down and sure enough by 5:30pm I had my shoes, now 2 pairs LOL. The people who work there are very young, especially the room cleaners, ours was a young boy named Fernando who is 16. Thats who I tipped and Elsa who cleaned the stairs and the bar area, and the washrooms. When it rained a couple of days, the lobby area where the washrooms are and the big hanging mirrors, the ceiling was leaking and there were buckets and towels, and the floors are granite so if your weren't careful you were going for a ride. The beach is terrible, what beach and broken shells that are very sharp on your feet. The buffet was way better than the restaurant's that had to be booked in advance. Every night had a theme, International, Oriental (great sushi), Italian on Saturday, Mexican, and a couple others I can't remember. Downtown was ok, but all those vendors bug you to no end, we went first thing in the morning when it's calmer. The ferry to Cozumel is packed all the time and the waters are choppy so if you don't like that then take gravol. The plane ride was terrible, crammed in like anchovies not sardines and the way back we had no audio or video. If you can deal directly with the hotel and seperate flight then do it, don't do the package deal especially with Sunquest. And do it online, you will get an upgrade and better price. This place is fantastic to plan a Wedding, I've seen about 10 in total and Diana is the planner and she goes all day checking everything. Do your homework and check most of the write ups on trip advisor or other advisory websites. Thanks for listening and happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: JNCDetroit_Michigan
Reviews.Content: We just completed a week at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya and it was great. The service was outstanding. Although other reviews indicate that the front desk was slow, they were quite prompt with any request. This is the third All-Inclusive that we have stayed at, and it was the best. The grounds were quite clean, and the food was very good. We have found that the food is generally not as good at an All-Inclusive as say, a cruise, but this was very good. There were a few things not great, all covered in previous reviews. We brought air freshener, this eliminated the musty smell. The toilets do have a foul odor. And the beach was badly damaged by hurricanes, and is in the process of being re-built. We were aware of these things from reading other reviews, so we were prepared to deal with it. We also found the beds to be hard, but the mattress pads they provided made them just about right. Suffice it to say, we did not lose any sleep during the week. I find that a lot of the complaints that I have previously read are a matter of personal taste. We found the food quite good, others may not agree. Please keep this in mind when reading any or all of the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Family”
Reviews.Author: DiVe_FaMiLy4
Reviews.Content: This being about my 5th time to Mexico and being somewhat familiar with the properties and what you get for your dollar (or peso) in this area, overall it was a good experience. I can't say I am doing back flips, and it's probably just not fair to rate or judge this place after staying where I stayed in Fiji just 2 months ago, so you may want to elevate your expectations 1 notch when reading this. The value for the dollar is good. We usually watch the usual vacation mediums to try and secure the best deal we can when we are using our vacation days. Usually the deal dictates where we go. If the Caymans are running specials, we go. If it's Hawaii, then we go,ect... In this case, we were attending a wedding and were required to stay at this particular resort. We tracked it for about 9 months before finally deciding to pull the trigger on a travel deal to this resort. Over the course of 9 months, RIU ran many specials to many resorts, but not this particular one for the travel days we needed to be there. In fact, over the course of 9 months I only saw one special, so we ended up paying top dollar for our package. With that said, the value was still good. When you first get there the first thing you notice is the lobby. It's huge; it's beautiful and has lots of Marble and a true palace theme. The resort is very well manicured and the property is immaculate. The rooms were large and were able to accommodate myself, my wife, my 2 year old girl and my 1 year old son without suffering much claustrophobia. The rooms were well kept and the bathroom generous. The only problem was that it seemed that some rooms had a "musty" smell like you always seem to run into based of age of a resort and some did not. Just a general observation, but it seemed as though the rooms on the north side that weren't getting as much direct sun suffered this problem, and my wife and son were slightly allergic as a result. I was in several rooms on the property due to the fact that we were attending a wedding with lots of family and friends, so the difference was noticeable. If you are allergic, I would ask for a room change if you happen to get a room like ours. Otherwise, the room was great. The resort itself has many amenities. It has 2 large size pools, a dive operator onsite, and many activities and excursions can be booked right from the property. They also have a rental car company right in the lobby, and fast affordable internet. The beach could have been better. The beach is a decent size but they have barriers to help calm the incoming waves, and they are just an ugly mess. While they serve a purpose, there must be some way to quell the eye sore factor of these beasts. Also, they could have done a better job grooming the shore line as there was a noticeable but not abundant amount of seaweed, (and other regurgitation from the sea).
