The view was great and you could see Coz in the background. They also had a great Jacuzzi area with 2 large sized Jacuzzis inside the Spa section which I truly recommend. The pool doesn't go over 5 feet, which is a personal complaint, but certainly not a deal breaker by I don't think, anyone's standards. The poolside service was OK. I think they might have been a little understaffed, or maybe just slow. It could take anywhere from 5 minutes to 45 minutes to get your order. Choices were limited and you had to physically walk to one of the theme restaurants that were opened during the day for any real poolside sustenance as poolside had Nachos, and that was about it. The food was hit and miss. The breakfast buffet was as good as a buffet I have had at any resort at any level. The lunch buffet was extremely average to slightly above depending on the day. The choices Dinner time was hit and miss. When they were running a theme night, the food seemed to be better. Mexican night was great and actually authentic. A lot of resorts even in Mexico seem to dumb down the menu for the tourists pallets, but they seemed to go authentic and it showed. On other nights the buffet was just average. We only had time to go to one theme restaurant just because the length of our stay and the fact that we could never seem to make enough time for a reservation, but the theme restaurants as expected seemed to be a little better. The service, (food wise) was also hit and miss. When ordering room service, the choices were slim and the wait was an eternity. The theme restaurants were completely on point and the service was first class. The buffet was normal. Poolside sucked. The bars were average. It just depended where you were. In a nutshell, they needed more choices for poolside and in room dining, and needed to do it faster. Everything else was fine. This was the first time we brought the kids along oversees. This resort was very accommodating and kid friendly. There was plenty of room for them to run around, and plenty of room in the pool that we could play with them safely and away from adults without kids. They also had no problem getting a satisfactory bite to eat. Overall, we found this place to be a good solid deal. You get what you expect for your money, and probably not a lot more than that (unless you find a deal); certainly nothing less. It was great with the kids and the food was fine. The amenities above average and the resort is beautiful. You add in the magic of the Maya experience, all to see to do around there, the ease of getting to Coz or the cenotes for diving, and the proximity to Xel-Ha, Tulum and Excaret; it is a definitely a resort worth returning to.

Reviews.Title: “Make your Stay Even Better”
Reviews.Author: MyBoston
Reviews.Content: As I type, I'm currently sitting in the lobby of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. I am coming to the end of my stay here at the palace and wanted to pass along a couple things I’ve learned from my stay. First of all I would highly recommend the hotel, as other reviewers have stated it is only a few years old and is very grand. Lot's of chandelier’s and marble, the staff is constantly cleaning the entire place including mopping down the walkways seemingly ever other day. Each room has a daily stocked mini-bar re-filled daily with soda, water and 5 Coronas. I tried to drink my coronas ever day, I wanted to feel that I was getting the most from my vacation. Additionally there is the Legendary Alcohol Dispenser in ever room, Yup, you heard right. Every room has a dispenser of 4 bottles of alcohol which you can drink, guzzle of just stare at. Mine had a bottle of Bacardi White rum, Quervo Tequila, Brandy and Vodka. All popular brands. The only bad part is that unless you want a rum and Pepsi, theres not much to mix the alcohol with in the room. So feel Free to bring your mixers and a few aspirin for your headache the next day. Order yourself a Dirty Monkey (or 6) from the lobby bar. It's basically a Mudslide with Chocolate and Banana in it. Very Tasty. The beds are hard, so do yourself a favor feel free to ask for a Mattress Pad to be brought to your room. I slept the first night without the pad and the remaining with and it makes all the difference in the world. Also, ask if you you can have a Courtyard view as opposed to the garden view which looks out over the backs of neighboring hotels. I'm sure all the rooms are nice but I’ve heard that some of the garden view rooms are too close to the water purification plant on the outer edge of the property. I asked for a courtyard view and whether it be by good fortune or my request I got a great room on the first floor overlooking the courtyard fountains near the pool. I was very pleased. Be sure to book your reservations for the Restaurants in front of the lobby bar between 12 and 3. If you don’t, you will be either dining at the buffest again (Which is still very nice) or you can take a 5 dollar taxi ride or 20 minute walk to the 5th Ave which is very cool and offers lots of Restaurants and shopping. If you do take the taxi Ride, don’t feel the need to tip the driver. 5 dollars is much higher than the 12 Pesos (Roughly $1.20 ) that the very same length taxi cab ride would cost in a non tourist area. I learned this from a local. If your going to be paying with cash, you will get the best exchange rate at a bank. Everywhere else will round down to roughly 10 pesos for every US dollar which while easy to do the math, means your losing money every time you pay for anything in USD that is priced in Pesos. Have a Great Trip and remember to leave any tips that you might have picked up in your travel for others. Viva Las Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation, minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: blue_waters18
Reviews.Content: I've been to Mexico 3 times and it has all been good. My experience at D.R was terrible simply because I had bad weather, food poisoining and a few other bad experiences, and i wonder if it was cause I stayed at 4 star resort? This time I decided to stay at a 5 star resort, the Riu Palace Maya to see if it was worth the money. I will base this review into a few categories. Resort: Yes, the resort is a 5 star quality...beautiful place and super clean. The staff is always cleaning and keeping the resort looking good. Only problem is that it did stink a little and I wonder if it was cause of the water they were using. The Rooms were very nice and comfortable - I know a lot of people were complaing about the hard beds, but I found them comfortable. Although, I do like my bed a little stiff. Service: The service was perfect! I found that the service around the bars and restaurants were excellent. They're always making sure that you;re happy and always making sure that you;re taking care of. You can even get a drink laying on the beach, one of the bar staff will come around and get you one..that was great! Food: The food was good. The buffet can be a little repetitive at times but you do have 5 restaurants to eat at. First, I only had the chance to eat at 3 out of those 5 restaurants. I was a little disappointed with the steakhouse, however, the mexican and sir oliver were amazing. Those two were a 5 star quality! Activities/beach/pool: The activities were ok, they weren't much going on and I wonder if its due to the fact that we went during a slow season. The beach was good, I know that they've been hit by the recent hurricane but because I actually walked on some other beaches I really appriecated our beach and the resort did a good job of maintaining it. The pool was awesome, very large pool plenty of room and chairs to go around. Overall: I thought my vacation was awesome, perfect weather, perfect resort, problem free. I'm giving this place a 4.5 stars only a few minor things such as the Buffet food being repetitive and not enough activities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but...”
Reviews.Author: Wkdrn
Reviews.Content: My gf and I stayed there for 6 days in December, before christmas.. I booked the hotel through Orbitz, because I got $200 off from Retailmenot.com! Make sure that you check out the websites: retailmenot.com or couponcode.com before you purchase the ticket. In general, it is a really awesome hotel in playa del carmen. Pros: Great Location (I mean, the playa del carmen), really Clean, Swimming Pool, Employees smile, Variety of food selections, spa, landscape, and the building itself. Cons: Beach (it was not like what I expected, but good enough), Food (it is okay, but definitely not for 7 days or so), Room (The room was really nice....very clean/huge bed/nice furniture/clean bathroom, but the room was REALLY humid...I don't know why, we had to open the door to circulate the air, but still HUMID) Overall, It is an excellent hotel in Playa del Carmen, I think that money that I spent is totally worth it...I definitely recommed here! FYI, we spent about 400-500$ for Xcaret and Xel-ha...they are really worth to check out.... Oh, I took a Taxi from Airport to the hotel, it was $85, but on the way back to airport, I paid $55...I have NO clue where 85$ came from,...swindlers!? :P

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better for the money”
Reviews.Author: swan325
Reviews.Content: We had a lousy room location overlooking the noisy, neighboring hotel a/c and water osmosis. No chance to change because they said they were sold out. Our bad luck I guess. Our maid would clean OK but forgot to leave any towels or washclothes twice or restock H2o without asking. (Beds are great if you ask for a mattress pad!) On our second day someone entered the room and varnish or painted a surface with a very noxious smelling substance that forced us to leave the doors open to air it out... it took most of the rest of the day and night. We ran into the guy trying to enter our room the next day with a big pail of something and a brush so I asked maid supervisor to not let anyone do that again during our stay and they complied. The restaurant reservation system needs to be improved because they seem to book up yet we never saw any restaurant completely full. Some of the restaurants didn't have any piped in music during the meals which was disappointing and the lighting wasn't adjusted for the evening (more romantic please). For the most part the food was very tasty and plentiful. Lots of places to sit by pool or on the beach. Grounds were really lovely. Location was easy for exploring, walking for exercise (remember the food is plentiful) and shopping. Overall we had a very nice time but for the price we expected better.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler23
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a 3 star property at best. If you are into excess with no mind for quality this would be fine. On the positive side, the pool and reclaimed beach area were large and always had plenty of chairs for the high season crowd. The activity staff at the beach was very friendly and fun. They were the highlight of the trip for my 2 children who played soccer with them each day. The food was simply just ok. What was on the menu for dinner seemed to reappear in some form at breakfast. The lunch buffet stayed the same each day. Dinner, even at the specialty restaurants, were mostly a buffet set up. Negative - the rooms were really worn. The bed and pillows terribly uncomfortable. We booked and paid for a party of 4. The room did not have a sofa bed and only one rollaway fit in the room. One of my kids ending up sleeping proped up on a love seat. The hotel shampoo/soap is a large dispenser in the shower. The walls are very thin and you hear everything going on in the hall 24X7. The room keys never worked. I also heard of a guest whose room did not have a ceiling in it. Since it is all inclusive the majority of the guests are fairly intoxicated by early afternoon, so if you don't over indulge I would not recommend this place. The pool is not heated and there is no hot tub other than a dirty one in the spa. The front desk never answers the phone so if you need something you have to walk down to the desk and stand in line to request it. The front desk staff is extremely rude. Housekeeping is hit and miss - some days we had towels somedays not. This place is definately not worth the $900/night we paid. I would rather stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation!”
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, our four children (ranging in age from 11 to 17), my siser-in-law and niece (21) went to the Rui Palace Riviera Maya the week in between Christmas and New Year's. We had a fabulous time! The hotel was gorgeous! The grounds were immaculatey kept. The rooms were very nice and very clean (there is a disctinct smell in the rooms but we did not find it unpleasant). Our one complaint was with the showers (which we noticed other people experienced also) and that was when you were showering, the water would become scalding hot without any notice. The staff (with the exception of the front desk) were wonderful and took very good care of us (especially Damian, Xavier, Alex, Martin, Jesus and Rosario). They were helpful, friendly and always had a smile on their faces. The pool was very clean and the area surrounding it was sufficient for the amount of guests. There were always plently of chairs at the pool and on the beach and plently of shade with all the palm trees around. There were not many staff members on the beach to take drink orders but the bar was within close proximity to the beach and you never had to wait long to get a drink (which by the way were excellent). The beach was sufficient for our needs and the water was gorgeous. There was some seaweed but it was actually kind of pretty seaweed (nothing like what you find in the Atlantic ocean). The food at all of the restaurants was exceptional. Our favorites were the Japanese, Mexican and Sir Oliver's. We would recommend making your reservations for dinner at least three days ahead and opt for the early seating. That way, if someone is not happy with the meal, they can go to Don's for the buffet (which was always great). The breakfast buffet at Don's and the lunch buffet at Chili's were also excellent. Plenty of variety at both. The shopping area in Playa del Carmen is about a twenty-five minute walk (which was pleasant) and the shopping is great! The hotel threw a really nice party on New Year's eve. The food was wonderful and there was a huge variety of things to choose from. The dining room was a little crowded since everybody had to eat at Don's because the other restaurants were closed, but all in all, it was a nice time. The nightly entertainment was a lot of fun. We especially enjoyed Michael Jackson Night. We would highly recommend this hotel for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A vacatoin with Class”
Reviews.Author: TroyCathy
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa with 21 other people traveling as a group but able to go off alone anytime we wanted. We were upgraded to this hotel from the Riu Yucatan just prior to leaving. What a nice upgrade, this hotel was built two years ago and of all of the five Riu Hotels in the area (we toured all of them) this one is the nicest. Extremely clean, very friendly employees (fyi they are on Mexico time). We were told tipping was not allowed however I did it anyway and guess what it never got turned down. Food ranged from ok/good to great. We made reservations at three of their sit down restaurants. Make sure if you stay there to find out what night they are serving their seafood buffet, they had all you can eat lobster, crab claws and jumbo shrimp along with racks of ribs and full roasted turkeys. Great for families, singles young and old. 15 minute walk to town (hey you need some exercise when your at an all inclusive.) They do have two HOT tubs, they are located in the Renova spa bldg, find out where they are, they are a nice way to relax after a lonlg day. Do yourself one more favor, take advantage of the free SCUBA lesson in the pool. I did and the next day I took the discover dive and dove to 35 feet in the ocean for 30 minutes for $99 usd well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Holy Guacamole!”
Reviews.Author: MissBonie
Reviews.Content: I ate fresh guacamole from the buttet at every meal. In fact, we thought the food was pretty good for a large resort. Sometimes when catering for so many different nationalities, the quality suffers, but we found they covered the bases pretty well. The breakfast buffet was the best and just outstanding. We tried three "gourmet" restaurants...the Brazilian grill, Mexican and Chili's. It was so cold the night we had steaks at Chili's it was hard to enjoy the meal. But, my steak was quite tasty and the wine flowed freely. Be sure to ask for the "Chilean Merlot" which is better than the house red. As indicated on other reviews, the property is lovely. The entrance is grand and the pool and grounds are meticulously cared for. But, the beaches have been washed away by the hurricanes and access is limited. You also have to wade through seaweed to get to clearer water. Check-in was long and tedious. Don't lose your key to the safety deposit box or they'll charge you $50. Lost card keys for the towel locker will also cost you. I was disappointed that none of our rooms had a view of the courtyard or the Caribbean, only of the complex next to us and a water purification unit. I complained immediately of an odd smell after we got to our room; only to find out that our "new room" down the hall had the same odor. It must have been their cleaning solution, but it ended up permiating our clothes and the smell followed us back to TX . As stated in previous reviews, the beds aren't "heavenly", but we slept pretty well despite the firm mattress. I don't like "bedspreads" and the blankets were old, but this is a beach resort and not the Ritz. The fitness center was quite inadequate for the size of the resort. Only a handful of machines at best. It did have the nicest view, which made an ordinary work out routine more enjoyable. But, get there early or wait till mid-afternoon when everyone else is at the pool. We played golf once across the street. The twilight rate was $130 pp and we didn't finish the round. Toughest course I've ever attempted. Lots and lots of sand and other natural hazards...large iguanas! Several par 5's were over 500 yards. But, the course was well kept and more than a challenge for this duffer. I would recommend this property for families. The decibel level is pretty high. The corridors are noisy and no matter how hard you try not to wake up your neighbor, the door always slams shut. No use trying to take a siesta during the day, there are always kids running up and down the halls or suitcases being rolled to rooms by guests. There isn't much to do at night. One evening's entertainment was the "Michael Jackson" show, which was a very good impersonator. But,, the other shows reminded me of "cruise ship" entertainment. In fact, the whole experience was like being on a cruise ship without the motion sickness. If the weather had been a bit more cooperative it would have been a better time. But, the company was delightful and we kicked off 2008 in grand style.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not Great”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnn123
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, this resort has a beautiful lobby and a great swimming pool, and that's about it. We had a good time because we were with friends and we always have a good time, but it was almost an effort. We had more fun the night we decided to check out the other RIU's. They seemed much friendlier and intimate, and it looked like people were having fun. The disco was fun, but very crowded and very dark. It's like a small night club. Definitely the place to go if you want to party. The service was not good. The guy at the front desk was downright rude. We had one bartender who was very nice, his name was Silas. Other than him, the staff was busy and stressed and we felt guilty to ask for anything. The waiting periods were too long. There was no beach service. It's a long way to the bar from the beach to go get a drink. The beach was lovely for swimming, but you couldn't go for a walk. The beach was small. The pool was very nice, but also very crowded and it was hard to get a drink at the pool bar. The other guests were not very friendly, actually, they were almost snobbish. I don't think I got one smile during the whole week, even though I smiled at everyone. When we checked in, we were ignored, our rooms weren't ready, and they left our luggage sitting in the middle of the lobby for four hours. The rooms were kind of dingy. No extras. Not even clean. I had to dust the divider which separates the bed from the couch. There was no water in our fridge. I had to take an Advil, and when we told them we had no water, they told us that we did. Well, guess what??? No, we didn't!!! There were also hundreds of little ants in the rooms. I know they can't help this, and I saw a can of Raid on all the cleaning carts, but the ants were pretty bad. Our room was only cleaned twice through the week. And they didn't scrub the tub (the same scum was in it all week), or change our sheets. I even left extra money on the bed one day, hoping to get a better cleaning job, but it didn't happen. The food was okay. Some of it was even good, but it wasn't great. There wasn't much to do, it was kind of boring once the sun went down. We were disappointed because we had been to the Royal Playa del Carmen, which was fantastic. The highlight of our trip was our day on the Fat Cat Catamaran. The staff on the catamaran was awesome, they were great! They were so friendly, fun, and entertaining! I would suggest that you go to the Royal Playa del Carmen if you want a nice, relaxing vacation, in luxury. -Carol

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jumar42
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a family vacation at the Riu. We were a family of 5 (3 adult children) We all remarked that we have never had better service at any hotel. We loved the food and the service most of all . The place was beautiful. The restaurants were not crowded. We had the jacuzzi and the main bar to ourselves most nights and the staff could not have been more accomodating. We felt like royalty. Yes the room did smell- I guess that was the cleaning fluid they used-kind of odd. It was a wonderful vacation and We highly recommend this resort. By the way we visited the other Rius in the area and they were not half as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: schweinbeck
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from RIU Palace Riveria Maya. We were there through Dec.20th through the 25th. Overall everything was very nice. There were some good things about the hotel but also bad ones. The food was good just a normal buffet for breakfast and lunch. All restaurants had delicious food! I recommend going to all of them. The pool was clean and the bartenders are nice. The rooms were well kept but the beds are incredibly hard. Also the walls are paper thin, so you can hear everything very early! For some reason they like to start lawn care at 7 AM. They had entertainment every night and it is poorly done. Also some of the staff is quite rude, if you want to have a fun dinner and be able to laugh do not go to the Japanese restaurant, we were scolded for laughing. Very rude. The front desk is not much of a help either. Every night they allow vendors to set up and the prices are very high on the jewelery, do not buy anything! We bought a very nice ring that was originally ~135 and they sold it for ~50. That night all the jewels popped out. The beaches were okay, rocks were in the water so you would have to walk a little to get to a part with no rocks but were then forced to walk through a lot of sea weed. That resort was hit by the hurricane so they have ugly big bags of sand in the ocean. If you take a left out of the resort they have a HUGE market about 2 miles down. Worth going too, you pass a small one but if you just keep going you will be very impressed. The hotel itself was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: JD17
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya In November 2007 for one night. I have stayed at the Riu Yucatan the year before also in the Mayan Riviera, so I knew what to expect with regards to dining and resort standards before I arrived. Riu's are great value for your dollar. The lobby was very nicely decorated. The service was also very nice as most employees were very quick to serve. The food was amazing. I truly enjoyed the buffet! I cannot comment on the a la cartes as I did not visit any. The room was very large and nicely decorated. Whirlpool tub and double vanity, in the washrooms. The beds were a little hard, but nothing out of the ordinary for a Mexican resort. The grounds are kept immaculate and are cared for very well. The pool area was very nice, and the bars were kept clean. I especially enjoyed the infinity pool. I was extremley disappointed with the beach however as there is no beach. It has been completley erroded away, so if you are an individual who values the long walks on the beach, it is non-exisistent here. You can however, take a 10 minute walk over to the Riu Yucatan and use their beach which is still not the greatest, but is much better than the Palace. The resort is also very large and it can be confusing to get around at first. My room was located at the front of the resort furthest from the beach. My room did have a balcony but it was about 1 foot long and I could not go onto it as it was so small. The location of the resort is great. Being located in the resort/community of Playacar was very nice. It was a quick cab ride to the lovely town of Playa Del Carmen ($5 per way) and about a 30 minute walk. I do highly recomend visitng Playa Del Carmen for shopping, especially at night. It is a very nice and quaint shopping/dining strip. Over all I did enjoy the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, but would not return due to the beach situation. I would not hesitate, however, to visit a Riu Palace resort elsewhere. They are truly great properties!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hollidays”
Reviews.Author: bh7h
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited this hotel twice already. Both visits were awesome. Here is a short review: Rooms: It is a all suite hotel. The rooms are large with a separate living room. Our rooms had a super size balcony. The maid were very good and fast (our room was always done before noon every day) and we had a nightly turn down service. Restaurant: Buffet were good. Always had something to eat but nothing great. Our favorite À la carte was the Brazilian. We brought our own wine from Canada since the wine selection is less than good. Beach: Not the best. It was wash out. But still better than some of the other hotels at Playacar. It was next to impossible to walk toward the Iberostar. There was no more beach at some of the other Riu. PDC: Very close. Walking distance (about 20 minutes). Drinks: Good but not excellent. Staff: Awesome. This is what we liked the most. They are friendly and always a smile on their face. You will have a great time there. JF

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: Keigan
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation through a travel agent for the same cost as many discount websites were offering, Sunquest was the carrier and they took care of airport transfers to and from the Cancun airport. We arrived at noon adn check in time wasn't until 3pm, so the front desk staff took our bags to an area where they were securely stored and we were able to enjoy the resort at leisure until our room was ready. There was a beautiful buffet luncheon where some of the the tables over look the beach/ocean which was a welcome change from the tight aircraft accomodations. The hotel was beautiful, clean and had well appointed rooms with all of the necessary amenities. Every evening there was a buffet, I recommend checking with the front desk about the theme of the evening, as well there were 5 al a carte restaurants (Brazillian, Japanese, Steakhouse, French and Mexican), we tried the French (more formal atmosphere), Mexican (dinner starts with a buffet of appetizers, careful it's easy to fill up before your meal arrives) and Japanese (dinner starts with sushi and the beef is quite tasty) and were pleased with the food and the service at all. There is plenty of space for those who love the sun, loungers around the pool and on the beach as well as built in tiled loungers...we never had a problem finding a spot together but I would suggest checking out the pool area for "your" perfect spot and getting your towels on the way down to breakfast, and placing them on your favourite chair, perhaps with a book or hat to save your spot...we did this after a few days of choosing random seats and always found our things just as we had left them. You can walk up to the Daquiri bar to get yourself a beverage but they also have chair service around the pool, the wait staff are quick, efficient and friendly and you may find as they get to know you that just as you finish your drink they've arrived with a fresh one. La Habana bar in the hotel lobby was a favourite of ours for before and after dinner cocktails, there was one particular bartender named "Islas" (pronounced exactly how it's spelled) who will make you his own concoction if you tell him what your tastes are, and they lso have a very nice cocktail/martini list with many choices to suit everyone's palate...my favourite was the chocolate martini and my spouse's was the cosmopolitan or and something that Islas called "pimp juice" We read many reviews about the hotel before booking and were nervous about trying a couple of the on-site restaurants because of negative comments (steakhouse), but people we spoke to at the resort during our stay said it was fantastic. Another guest actually made a wise comment in that if you book your dinner reservations for the early seating, you can always head to the buffet afterwards if you're not completely satisified, I would take any negative reviews you read with a grain of salt, keeping in mind that if you want things to be exactly as they are at home, you are probably setting yourself up for disappointment and wasting your money travelling, regardless of the destination. Relax, enjoy the surroundings, the culture, the food and drink and the company of some friendly, welcoming people that will make your stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JackiePaper
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here from Dec 7 thru 11th. What a lovely lovely relaxing time. It's a very beautiful resort. The food... wow. We did one night at the Japanese spot- fantastic. We always prefer buffets because you eat only the amounts you want, and their buffet had everything one could want. The pool was super , the beach was great because it has a TON of palms on it. Important for the winter-pale northerners like me who can't lay in the sun, and need to find the spot of shade. The staff was very friendly. We stayed in an outside room- who spends any time in their room anyway, but for sleep? There were plenty of opportunities for snorkeling, scuba diving, windsurfing or , ferrying to Cozumel- which I didn't do this trip- I was there for total relaxation. I took an hour massage- very nice. We sat outside every night, sipping a nightcap, and took in the lovely weather and the nightly shows and music. The ONLY thing we found to complain about was the shower. The water temperature kept changing. YIKES. Made it hard to take a shower. The beds were hard, but a request for a foam pad fixed that perfectly. The pillows were awesome. I'd go back to this place, it was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week at RPRM”
Reviews.Author: atic96
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful week at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. This is our 3rd time in Cancun/Playa area, and the best so far. Riu has done a great job at this resort. The grounds are beautiful with truly palace like setting. The pool was big and nice, plenty of manmade beach, and service was impeccable. To simplify our experience: The bad: 1. Noise: walls are thin and can hear noise in the morning from hallway. We didn't find it overly bothersome. 2. Beach: hurricane did damages, but of all the resorts nearby, RPRM probably has the best manmade beach, and useable natural beach with sandbag blocking the waves. It's the best in the area. 3. Water activities: 5 out of 7 days there were no sailing or any water activities due to wave conditions. Bummer. The good: 1. Service: it's the best of all the RIU we visited, including Riu Palace Mexico and Las Americas. Victor at Sports Bar, Miguel at the Buffet, and shaggy haired Carlos kept our stay very pleasant and interesting. PS: Victor is the guy to ask about all the best clubs and bars in Playacar, and he can get preferrential treatments for RPRM guests. 2. Room and resort condition: room was junior suite, so it's large and very nicely decorated. Resort was kept in top shape (seemed nicer than Royal Hideaway). 3. Location: very close to the town, and many ppl walk to 5th ave. We had a rental car, so it's extremely easy. Best of all with RPRM is the ability to exchange to different Riu properties. This allowed us to experience different restaurants and beaches. We had a day in Cancun, and enjoyed visiting and dining at Riu Palace Las Americas. Evening entertainment was surprisingly good, especially Maya Night. Other nights were entertaining enough that we didn't bother going out. Riu has done a great job with this resort, and we hope everything will get better. We look forward to returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: hamarcus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya in early November during the low travel season. The resort was busy enough to have acitivities going on poolside and dinner shows in the evenings. There was plenty of seating around the pool and the large sand/beach area. Vendors are not allowed in the beach area, which made it easier to relax. Service throughout the hotel was fabulous. We received a Champagne greeting upon check-in. Much of the staff spoke English and were helpful in orienting us to the resort. The hotel was quite new when we visited, so of course everything was immaculate. Rooms were very clean, beds very comfortable. Food was good, but as with any all-inclusive, gets somewhat repetitive after 5 days. The specialty restaurants were great. We had a great stay and would definitely return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A fancy resort...”
Reviews.Author: miss_the_beach_CO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort with a big family group. It was incredible,but seemed more like a Vegas hotel, with marble floors and crystal chandeliers. Much of the service was good, but small details were missed- no pillow cases, not enough towels in the room. The food was excellent, and the ground were immaculate. The beach left much to be desired. Throughout the water were giant plastic tubes (6-8 feet high) that were put there, I assume, to break the waves. There was very little natural beach, and not much room to swim in the ocean- the hotel photos are not accurate! I don't think I would stay at this one again, but would reccomend it to people who love a pool (which was huge) and the more fancy aspects of a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: april95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Nov. 12 to Nov. 20 and had a great time. Weather was a problem a couple days but we still enjoyed ourselves. The resort itself is spectacular. The grounds and facilities are very well kept and we found the staff to be very helpful and attentive to our needs. The lunch and dinner buffets at Don Manolo restaurant changed daily, and the breakfast buffet offered every choice imaginable each day. (Isabel at the omelette station makes great omelettes). Making reservations for the a la carte restaurants was not difficult (thanks Dania) and the food in each was very good. We didn't try the Japanese restaurant so can't comment on that one, though. Our room was a garden view on the back side of the resort facing the Wyndham next door but it was perfectly fine with us. As with any beach vacation, you aren't in the room that much anyways. Bed was a little hard but after a long day on the beach and walking to other resorts or Fifth Avenue, the bed felt great. Staff was very friendly and appreciative of our efforts to speak a little Spanish. We ended up having a lot of fun with some of the staff (Gregorio and Edgar, hosts at the restaurants; Miguel, a server at Don Manolo; Dania in reservations; Alex, head bellman who ran everything out front; Isabel at the omelette station, to name a few.) Turn-down service in the evening was a nice touch. We had a couples massage at the spa and it was terrific. There are also 2 jacuzzis on the back side of the spa that are available to everyone, not just spa customers, but we didn't know that until late in our stay. There is a very nice beach at the Riu Lupita beach area next door to the Palace, and during our stay the Palace was working on rebuilding the beach directly in front of the resort and was making good progress. So either way, access to the water is not a problem at all, as some have said. And if you just want to sun yourself on the beach, the Palace has a very large area for this. In fact, it was much nicer than the beaches at the other Rius we visited nearby. All in all, it was a great getaway. The Riu Palace is a notch below some other places like Secrets Capri, but we thought for the money it was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: ldeo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great week (11/24-12/1). Service- Excellent, not a single complaint! Though most of those working at the resort work six days a week and long hours everyone had a smile on their face and went out of their way to offer an 'hola' (hello). We found the staff very appreciative of tips, one waiter who had served us nearly every morning and evening was rewarded with a modest tip at the end of the trip and was truly grateful (as opposed to expecting . . .) Beach- Yes, access to beach is limited, but not nearly to the extent I expected. I would estimate that nearly 50% of the property has access to beach, though one does need to walk around a seawall. There are loads of lounge chairs and we never seen more than 60% of them in use and in most cases you would never know the beach did not go directly to water in front of you. Personally, I think to much has been made of the beach issue; their is no problem accessing the ocean and the ocean views are beautiful from almost all lounge chairs. BESIDES, only a small amount even ventured into the water, most just lounged on beach or stayed poolside. Food- Good, no complaints. As others have noted it does start to get tiring after a few days but we always found something we enjoyed and food was fresh. Tours- We went to Chitzen Itza and highly recommend this trip. Yes, it's a long drive but between the guide talking most of the way out and movie on the way back the time went by quickly. Also went to Xcaret after much deliberation between it and Xel-Ha. We enjoyed Xcaret and will try Xel-Ha on next visit. Internet- For those who simply can't leave work behind, like myself, there is high speed wireless access in the lobby in addition to internet cafe in Sports Bar. Just open up laptop and you're good to go. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “great service but bad beach”
Reviews.Author: mike437
Reviews.Content: We went to the RIU PALACE and were pleased with the property in general and the service specifically. The bartenders, room service people, and front desk folks were great. The only people we found really overbearing were the people at the restaurants and mainly the maitrede at the specialty restaurants. The food was getting a little old after 5 days though. The desert table was the same every day but the variety of the main tables was pretty good for lunch and dinner. Breakfast was the same every morning which may not be a bad idea. Lobster was served on three of the five nights we were there and it was great. We called room service one evening and asked that our refrigerator be restocked with Corona as it had rained all day and we had finished it off and they showed up with a 12 pack and loaded the fridge up in just a few minutes. The beach is nice and clean but the access to the water is greatly limited due to large rocks all along the water line. It would be nice to be able to walk directly into the water from your chair instead of having to go down the beach a ways to get wet. I had been to the MAYA before and found this resort way above most any other I had stayed in but not as fun as the Barcelo down closer to Tulum. The staff didn't really do much in the way of getting people into the daily activities. Kind of laid back and quiet for the most part but all in all a great place to stay. It did rain a couple of mornings and one full day while we were there and there really wasn't much activity provided for rainy days. We did go for a walk one morning down toward the other RIU resorts and on our way out the front door the doorman provided us with an umbrella as it had been raining. The bartenders by the way will make your drinks really strong unless you tell them otherwise. Great resort and great experience. I have traveled quite a bit in the carribbean and this is the best resort for service and food quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: BOLOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time. My wife and I (we are in mid 40's), our two kids (14 & 11) had nothing but an excellent experience. the staff treated us like royalty, the hotel is like a palace, hence the name. The service was empecable. The pool was very nice. The food was excellent at any meal, snack, etc. Buffet had everything from lobster to Asian, to Italain, to Mexican. The reservation restaurants were fanatastic: steak, Japanese, Brazilian. The bars never let my hand be empty. Full bars, bartenders were very personable and knew how to make excellent drinks. My kids loved the virgin drinks all day and night. I loved the not so virgin drinks. The beach was eroded from past two hurricanes, however, there is enough to have fun (my kids loved the sand) and we were able to walk to the other RIU's via the beach. Staying at the RIU Palace Riviera allowed us access and services (food & bevs) at all other RIU resorts. Entertainment is fun. Our kids compared this to the Disney Cruise for the FUN level. We are already planning our next RIU vacation: back to Playa del Carmen or perhaps Puerta Vallarta. We know it will be great wherever we stay if it is a RIU! You will not be disappointed at the RIU Riviera Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Want Sleep? Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: jamaicanlovers
Reviews.Content: We went to Mexico for a large family reunion. For us, the only good part was being with our family. My husband and I brought our 3 children, ages 5, 3 and 18 mos. The two things I would warn anyone who is considering this resort about are: The food and the sleeping arrangements. The Food: It seemed that because the food was all cooked by Mexicans it should have been only Mexican food. They "tried" to cook American food and it was VERY disappointing. The only reason we ate was because we were hungry. We have experienced Couples Sans Souci resort in Jamaica and Riu's food was like eating at a Luby's compared to Couples (which was excellent...gormet, and very flavorful). I also had stomach problems by the end of the trip which I'm sure can be blamed on ALL the buffets. Even when going to a "sit down" restaurant in the evenings where you would expect to be served, you are only served the main course. You must go through a salad/soup bar and desert bar. Children are welcome at this resort, but getting them fed was far to much work. Sleeping: The buildings are designed in such a way that any noise in the hallway echoes (all tile floors) and goes directly into the rooms. Although the hotel information clearly states that guests should be quiet after 11 in the hallways, everyone was so drunk that no one followed this guideline. The staff obviously could care less and did not inforce this. I got about 3 or 4 hours of sleep each night. Another point of concern was the language barrier. Very few of the employees spoke English. When traveling to a resort where so many Americans visit, we would have expected to be able to communicate our needs without having to use sign-language. This is definitey NOT a child/family friendly resort. If you are going to party all night and sleep it off all day, then this is the place for you. But if you want a vacation where you eat good, gormet food and experience a restful, quiet night's sleep, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Coconut?”
Reviews.Author: MoonFlower16
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful vacation at this Riu and loved being able to walk into Playa del Carmen to shop and watch football at the Tequila Barrel. TV stations at this resort are limited if you get reception at all...but that's OK... why watch TV in your room on vacation, right? But we were able to tune in on the one day of rain we had. A highlight of this trip was coming across a fallen coconut on our way into town. We carved our names and contact info. into the flesh and found new caretakers for it before we left. A lovely couple from Canada fondly adopted the coconut for their 5-night stay and then were to pass it on to others who would care for it. Where or where would the coconut be now?

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: suntans24
Reviews.Content: My husband's mother took us on this wonderful Trip in March 2007...If you are looking for a wonderful hotel this is it! Actually any of the Riu properties are all worth while. The service awesome, the waiters at the piano bar, before dinner, remembered who we were and what we drank! Amazing!! and the people who worked in the dining areas, can't say enough nice things about them as well, and let's not forget the POOL BAR GUYS! You ROCK!! What an excellent property, the nightly entertainment was AWESOME! A nice varity of shows each night and a Disco too! We had such a restful vacation, we would come back to this resort again. Also, the area the hotel is located in, Playacar Village, is very safe to walk around, with an area to shop not far from the hotel..but if you prefer more you can hop a taxi into town! Nice experience too...Overall, 5 STARS! Nothing bad to report back... I highly recomment this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Straight up - pros & cons”
Reviews.Author: TONYfromTO
Reviews.Content: We spent the week here as we got a good deal and it looked nice. Read all the reviews and decided to give it a go. Overall, I would rate this hotel a 3.5 to 4 star. Reasons are below. Without re-hashing all the other reviews, here is the straight goods (as we experienced it): PROS: Staff - Excellent and attentive. (one exception - late one night we tried to call the front desk to complain about a lot of noise from a bunch of drunken yahoo's down the hall but no one was there to answer the phone. I had to walk to the front desk to get someone to address the issue) Rooms - large and clean (Tv didn't work but who cares). Some mustiness but a few quick sprays with Febreeze cured the problem. So much moisture it is impossible to keep it fresh smelling. I took advantage of the in-room liquor dispenser!! Food - first rate overall with a great selection at the buffet and the A La Carte restaurants are also very good. Building - impressive architecture, well appointed with great pools and amenities. Spa and sauna nice, pools were clean and well attended, grounds were excellent except beach was not always kept clean. CONS: Very Noisy as little insulation between rooms and the hallway. The doors had no closers and slamming of the doors could be heard loud and clear up to 12:30 AM and starting again around 6 AM. People leaving early for the airport could be heard dragging (Klack Klack Klack) over the tiles. Bring earplugs and you will be OK otherwise prepare to be awoken many times during your rest. Towels and bed linens were worn and no better than in a 2-3 star resort. Often the towels were not properly washed and several times we had to ask for clean towels as the ones provided were smeared with stuff which had not washed off (like lipstick, eye-shadow, god knows what else) Beds: They are hard as compared to other hotels but we did not mind as we are used to hard beds. We asked for clean bed linens one day as we spilled something on the bed. I discovered two days later they just turned the sheets around and put the stain at the foot of the bed. So, we slept in the same sheets for 6 nights. Entertainment - Well, sort of a hit and miss. Hard for me to comment here as some people seemed to enjoy the silly shows while others were very bored and left early. Some of the local talent brought in seemed to be very good. I guess if you go there for the entertainment, don't expect Las Vegas as many of the shows are put off by the local hotel staff and are not much above a high school production. Beach: Although the actual beach was eroded and you really could not swim in the sea, we didn't mind as there was a man-made beach at the end of the hotel which was fine. I did notice that the beach area was often littered with cig butts and empty glasses. Overall, I would probably return if I got the deal I just did but I would not recommend paying full price for this hotel based on their rating of 5.5 stars as it is a 3.5 to 4 star at best. However, in comparison to other hotels in the area (which rate themselves as a 4-5 star hotel), I suspect it is one of the better ones. We met several people who had stayed at other 5 star resorts and complained about the food, the service and the amenities. Last but not least, the local attractions: Xcaret is a great all day event and gives you a quick taste of everything local plus a great evening show highlighting local talent and costumes (very professional and entertaining). Several of the Mayan ruins are worth seeing and we choose Chichen Itza. A long day as it is a 3 hour bus ride to and fro plus several hours on site. We really enjoyed the guided tour and would recommend this to anyone interested in history. Shopping is OK in Playa Del Carmen but beware the street vendors as they will start very high in price and can usually be reduced by 50 - 80 percent. Also, once in the store they will become a real pest if you choose not to buy and in some cases resorted to name calling when we walked out of the store. Not in the mood to haggle, there are several decent malls with moderate priced goods for sale but anything with a price tag on it is usually not up for negotiation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Imaginable”
Reviews.Author: kdmcgann
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews like a crazed maniac for the months, weeks and days leading up to our trip, I thought I would write about everything that no one else mentioned. Well the fact of the matter is, it's just not possible. This place is absolutely perfect. I will try just to hit on the highlights of our trip. There is a bit of a musty smell in the room and the hotel in general, however, you are in the tropics. And when I got home I didn't have to wash my clothes over and over. One round of Downey did the trick for me!! We didn't even really notice it after about 5 minutes of being there. The biggest advice I can offer is to make sure you get an egg crate from the front desk for the bed. It is quite hard. They were actually out of egg crates when we arrived, but put numerous blankets on the bed to soften it up and it did the trick. The food overall was pretty good. We had no problem whatsoever making reservations. The "table" is the busiest right at 12:00 when they open it up. We ate at the Mexican place, Steakhouse and Japanese. I really didn't think anything was Mexican about the Mexican place other than the salad bar. My husband and I liked the Mexican the least. The steakhouse was awesome. If you want a good ole Ribeye, this is the place for you. It was very tasty and tender. Japanese was pretty good. It was my first sushi experience. We found the buffet at breakfast, lunch and dinner to be great. Sportsbar food was nice to have around too. My biggest advice regarding food is to try new things. I ate things that I thought I would hate, but loved. Dress code: I didn't see that it was that strictly enforced, but no shorts for guys at specialty restaurants, but at the buffet for dinner, anything goes. The pool is great. The entertainment staff is like none other around the pool. We had a great guy doing water aerobics one day! All of these people seem like they just love their job. Pedro is the nicest poolside server ever!!! I've seen a lot of posts about the beach. It's true, there isn't that much sand right at the beach, but it's still fairly decent access and we still enjoyed the ocean! I can't say enough about the staff at this resort. Everyone greets you whenever you pass and just genuinely seem happy to be there. My biggest complaint about the hotel was that the rooms are not very soundproof. We woke up one night to someone's clock alarm going off and when the maid or bellhops go by with rollers on the tile, it's a bit loud. However, I will be the first to say that this was not a huge damper on the trip in the least bit. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me at kristenmcgann@verizon.net ENJOY YOUR STAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!!”
Reviews.Author: kjbuzz
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from Nov.7-14. We have been to Cancun 9 times but this was our first time in Playa Del Carmen so we were not sure what to expect. The trip from the airport took almost two hours because of having to drop off other vacationers but we did get to see a lot. We have stayed at all three Riu's in Cancun so we thought we knew what to expect. The check-in went fast & we were given our room cards as soon as we got there. We were put in a garden view room & were not very happy with it. We could not see the ocean or the pool. We looked directly at the hotel next door and as for the "garden view" it was not very good. A couple of trees but no flowers. We went back to the front desk & asked for a jacuzzi suite & we were told that we could be upgraded on Sat. so we only had to stay in the garden view for a couple of days. When we moved to the jacuzzi suite it was like a totally different hotel!! The room was amazing! It had a living/sitting room, a walk-in closet, a huge balcony with a great view. The jacuzzi was in between the bedroom & the bathroom & was open. It was well worth the upgrade. There were a few ants but it was no big deal. As for the food we thought it was very good. We ate at the Japanese restaurant one night & the steakhouse another. They were both good. It was not hard to get reservations, we had to be in the lobby bar between 12:00 - 3:00 which was better than having to get there at 7:00 in the morning like we had to do at the ones in Cancun. The buffet was very good with a lot of different choices. The Riu has room service from 7:00 AM - 11:00 PM which I think they should change to 24 hour room service like most of the other hotels offer. The beach was not all that great but we were in Mexico so we could live with it. We did prefer to stay at the beach instead of the pool though. We loved going down to 5th Ave. It was so different than Cancun. People are more laidback & don't hassle you as much when you are shopping. We went to the Blue Parrot Beach Club & had a blast. The Firedancers were great. There is a ton of stuff to do downtown but we ran out of time. Cancun has always been our favorite but we think we have found a new place to love. We are already planning another trip in a couple of months. I think we are going to give the Royal a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya needs an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: MichaelArlington
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Riu Palace Rivera Maya, and it sure was not what it used to be. We went here just after it opened last year, and found the place had changed. Room. The mini bar refrigerator broke down the first night and leaked water all over the floor. This was repaired when reported to the front desk. The water pressure in room 2096 was very weak in the shower. We asked if we could be moved to a room that had better water pressure and we were told to ask again the next day. This was for a hotel that was in low season and had plenty of rooms. The next day we again complained that the pressure was low and were told that it would be reported to maintainence. This problem was never resolved after speaking politely to 3 front desk staff. The toilets do not flush very good. You have to hold the flush lever down for a long time to empty the bowl of even liquid waste, other material is even more mechanically challenging! Food. Not as good as last year. The quality of the breakfast and lunch buffet at the pool was the same as last year. The lunch and dinner at the main buffet restaurant was lower in quality and selection with few if any seafood offerings. Mussels and pan-grilled whitefish or salmon at the main buffet. The rodizio was good, but not great. The japanese "Yashima" was the best with an outstanding salmon entree. They even had cold sake. The pool was COLD! REALLY COLD! Sadly, the erosion from the surf has virtually destroyed the beach at this hotel, and the surrounding properties as well. You may well have to go north or south of the Playacar area to find even a fairly nice beach. This is not the fault of the hotel, but if the hotels in this area do not make a concerted effort to restore the beach they will eventually lose out to other hotels that have beachfront. I did go out of my way to be nice to the staff at this hotel, but I was put off by the lack of hospitality by the front desk staff and the bartenders at the pool. My encounters with the housekeeping staff were the most positive, and our room was kept immaculate. I'm sad to say I will probably not come here again, considering there are many other places to go in the area that have a nice beach and good food and friendly attentive staff. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price...”
Reviews.Content: The water was GORGEOUS! But you cannot walk along a stretch of beach - which I knew from all of the reviews on trip advisor. But the beach was very nice. And there was plenty of shade by the beach and the pool. The pool was enormous! It could have been a bit cleaner, but not bad. And they always had fun activities around the pool and music. Very fun activity crew - and not too annoying. Downside - they only give you one towel - and it is not a typical beach towel size. And there were plenty of chairs - you don't need to go down at 6:00am to get a spot - eventhough some did to get the poolside chairs. The rooms were very nice - the bed was not too hard in my opinion. Most people complained about that in the reviews. I thought it was fine. The resort itself was very nice and quite clean. The food was okay. But for the price, I cannot complain! Breakfast was the best. The only restaurant that served lunch was the buffet by the pool - and it was pretty much the same every day. And the dinner buffet was actually my favorite. I did not like the restaurants much. The Brazilian one was awful. The steakhouse was the best. I am spoiled living in Ohio with the no smoking in restaurants and bars - smoking was everywhere there - just like anywhere outside the US for the most part, so that was a bit annoying, but I expected it. I only left the resort once - to walk to Playa del Carmen. I was very impressed on the walk there. Very nice homes, condos, resorts and very clean. And Playa del Carmen impressed me. It was much larger than I thought. The only thing I was sad about was the lack of fine jewelry stores. And just as I read, all the drinks by the pool are in very small plastic cups. But they will fill a large cup if you bring it - no glass. And the only beer they have is Corona - nothing else. The staff was very nice. The Funjet representatives were not very nice - long story. But when they had to speak with my husband-they were nice. Interesting... Overall, it was worth the money. It was very relaxing. And the views were gorgeous. I would recommend this resort to anyone looking to get away and relax with no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejones88
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the RIU Place Riviera Maya and I have no complaints. This was our first trip to the Cancun area of Mexico. The Hotel was beautiful and the staff was great. The staff waits on you hand and foot. These people work about 12 hour days and work hard. My husband and I did tip a dollar to the staff and they really appreciated it. I found no fault with the Hotel food or grounds, it was perfect to me. The only problem is no access to the water from the beach BUT you can go to another RIU property within walking distance and use their beach to get into the water. The pool is a great hang out during the day, so I did not miss the beach too much. There were several Travel Agents at this Hotel and they all recommended it to their clients. That should tell you, this is the place to go. My husband and I will return and stay longer on our next visit and we cannot wait to go again. Take the negitive reviews you see about this Hotel with a "grain of salt" and not believe all that you read. The staff were great and did all they could to make you feel safe and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!”
Reviews.Author: MMTmichigan
Reviews.Content: After being an avid reader of the previous reviews of this resort on TripAdvisor, I must say that I was very pleased with my experience at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. My husband & I stayed from Oct. 20th-26th to celebrate our first anniversary. The front desk staff were very friendly & accomodating...we were offered an upgrade from a garden view room to a superior courtyard room for $25 a night. We accepted it, and even though it was only 10am, we were given our room keys and were ready to enjoy the resort well before regular check-in time! I assume we were able to do this because October is still off-peak, rainy season and normally the resort isn't at full capacity. We arrived in our room to find that our mini-fridge only had one Corona and a few Pepsi's ... so I called down to the front desk, and within 3 minutes we had a fully restocked fridge! Even throughout the week, if we ever ran out of anything in the room (more Coronas, towels, etc.) all it took was a quick call down to the front desk and within 5 minutes, we had whatever we needed!! The staff - no matter if they were part of the housekeeping crew, landscape workers, pool servers, restaurant waiters - were all so friendly and you never passed by someone without seeing a smile on their face and a friendly "hola!" I will agree with previous reviews that the rooms do have a musty odor when you first walk into them ... but we didn't have any issues after the first minute or so that you enter the room - we got used to it without any problems. By the way, if you're worried about the beds being too hard, just call down to the front desk and request a foam cover for the mattress and it will help to make the bed more comfortable. We ate at the Brazilian & Steakhouse restaurants and we enjoyed both ... the Japanese restaurant was good too, but our favorite place to eat was at the buffet (I was surprised at the variety of tasty food choices they had!) and each night had a different theme at the buffet. Don't think that since it's a buffet, that the staff skimps on their service ... the waiters are always pulling out chairs for the female guests, refilling empty water & drink glasses before they are even close to empty - the service was fantastic! My husband & I went parasailing right from the ScubaCaribe station located on the beach at the resort ... very fun even though I'm afraid of heights!! :) We also booked an excursion through our Apple Vacations Rep - we did the Mayan Adventure Snorkeling trip ... it was a good excursion, although it makes for a long day because we were picked up at the hotel at 8am and didn't return back until 4:30pm ... alot of that time is spent in the van going between the 3 locations that you snorkel at, as well as dropping off other guests at other resorts on the way back. But, all in all, it was still a good time. The walk into the town of Playa Del Carmen only takes about 15 minutes, and it's a very safe walk because the resort is located within a community that has gated, guarded entrances. There are plenty of things to see and do in the town of Playa Del Carmen if you like to shop, go to some bars (Senor Frogs, Carlos & Charlies) and do some tequila taste-testing!! You can also catch a ferry to Cozumel - we didn't go, but I think it's about $7 each way per person to take the ferry. One morning we took a walk down to the other Riu properties and walked through the Riu Palace Mexico, Riu Yucatan & Riu Playacar ... although I didn't see anything wrong with those resorts, I'm just so glad that we choose the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. It's nice to know that the other resorts are there if you want to visit their pools or beaches, but just remember that you can't use your beach towel card at the other resorts ... bring your towels with you if you're visiting the other properties. I would definitely recommend this resort, and I would love to come back and visit soon!! You won't be disappointed ... and remember, you are on vacation - so sit back, relax, have a drink and enjoy yourselves!!

Reviews.Title: “No Worries Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: JDMopar
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort ,very clean and the staff was friendly and made you feel welcome. The food was great both the buffet and special resturants, very nice resort area lots of shopping on 5th Ave and the market place in Playacar for you shoppers out there. Check the other Riu resorts we did it was fun you can use the beach get drinks and see how the others fare to the Palace Riviera Maya which is the most elegant in my opinion. For you sports fans there's a great sports bar with lots of tv's and it's open 24hrs we watched the world series there. I'll agree with other reviews on the room smelling musty it did, this is really noticable when all doors are shut and the a/c is on high. What we did was open the slider and let fresh air in at night when we were in our room, the nights there are comfortable it cools down and the smell would go away. This is a tropical area and there's not much you can do about the humidity not the resorts fault. All in all this is a great place we had a wonderful time and wish we could have stayed longer. We will definitely go back to this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to be Waited on Hand & Foot !”
Reviews.Author: Melster1
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here in the first part of October and would without a doubt stay here again. It was a beautiful property that was spotless. I would get up early in the moring say around 6'ish and there were always people out cleaning, polishing, clipping, trimming the landscape. Perfect place to relax, enjoy the water and a wait staff that could not have been any better. The people who worked here were very friendly and you could easily get spoiled by their attentive service. If I went again, I would take large amount of $1 bills for tips. These people earn them with fast, friendly and always polite service. Also if you are going to be taking cabs - make sure you get some small bill before leaving the US. example lots of $5's. It is hard to get you hands on smaller bills. Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Great time - But beware of the noisy Americans!”
Reviews.Author: westMidlandsMaximus
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 1 week stay at this resort. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff are brilliant! We ate at Don Monolo, the Japanese, The Steak House and the Mexican restaurants. All were good, but the Japanese was the best. The pool staff were friendly and the entertainment staff were great fun! Only complaint in this area is that the shows were "same old, same old" for people who have previously stayed in Riu resorts in Playa Del Carmen. The Michael Jackson Show was rubbish - not helped by the fact that the intro music leading up to the show was an old Gary Glitter hit from the seventies. (Maybe mexicans don't know his recent history ), but I suppose it tied in well, as Michael is no stranger to kids! (LOL) The rooms were great, all with sitting area and and balcony. The maid service was good, they called twice daily - once to clean and then in the evening to turn back beds and deliver yet more towels! The down side for Brits? Very noisy Americans! Most of the noise emanated from middle- aged groups who appeared to be constantly enebriated morning, noon and night. I have never seen so many drunken women! I watched one man throw his wife in the pool and leave other guests to bring her back to the surface!! They hogged the swim up bar and when me and my husband ventured up to the bar to get a drink, we were given filthy looks by a group of them as if it was for their exclusive use only. Even at breakfast, they would holler at each other whether standing next to each other or not! The corridors late at night echoed with the sound of them returning to their rooms, calling out to each other and generally making a din. (I think part of the problem here though is the corridors are very echoey) Having said all that, the ones that travelled as couples were generally more sedate and friendly, and the noisy ones probably aren't used to 5* service. There weren't many kids there either, which I was suprised at considering it was half-term week in England. Our 15 and 13 year old kept themselves amused without a problem though. Would we go back? Certainly!..............But we'll wait til the Americans have found another piece of Paradise to frequent!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeding expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tron1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to PlayaDel Carmen, and this trip definitely exceeded our expectations. The Riu Palace is a beautiful resort. The grounds were in wonderful shape, the staff was very friendly and always went above and beyond to ensure that my family was having an enjoyable stay. The rooms were very clean but the mattresses were a bit too hard!) The meals were amazing. Not only were the alternative restaurants excellent, but the main buffet was always different and enjoyable. The buffet dining room was quite elegant and had choices that every age group enjoyed. The staff was very helpful at recommending a few great excursions for our family. The childrens progam was geared a little too much to the 5 and younger crowd, so my 10 & 12 year old were not too excited about the activity choices. After comparing this trip with our last visit at another resort in Playa, we will definitely choose to visit this location again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!!”
Reviews.Author: FunGirl1973
Reviews.Content: We were @ the RPRM from 10/12-10/20. I was a little fearful of the forecast because all the internet showed was rain. Fortunately it rained sporadically the first 2 days but not enough to run you into your room. It mainly clouded up in late afternoon & showered a little almost everynight but it didn't ruin a thing. I had read a lot of reviews prior to visiting this Riu & yes the rooms tend to be moldy smelling-probably a lot to do with the humudity. I took a recommendation of bringing a candle & Febreeze & it did the trick. You ignored it after a couple of days until you get your belongings home & they all need to be washed & aired out!! We did have to change rooms the first day. We were given a smoking room when we requested a non-smoking room and also it was 2 double beds pushed together not a king. They were very nice accomadating our request & were moved quickly. This is definitely a hotel for those wanting to relax with no kids & no partying @ night. I would say 35+ age group. Everyone is very nice there & remember you day to day. Daytime is great. Relax by the pool or on the beach & have drinks served to you all day long. Great pool bar! Oh & nacho bar for the munchies! There basically is 2 beach areas. One above the water behind a retaining wall with plenty of chairs & hammocks. Down @ the beach is ok. A lot has been eroded by the hurricanes but they are trying to pump sand up on the beach to rebuild & there is a lot of sand bags out to minimize the breaking of the waves & more erosion. This is not the only resort suffering from this, it has happened all along the coast line. It is not as rocky as others have claimed. The buffet was great all day. The only restuarants we tryed was the Mexican & Steak House. Mexican was good! The shows were every night @ 9:40pm. They were just ok. Michael Jackson show & Crazy Night were the best. Nightlife dies @ 10:45 unless you just want to relax by the bar or play pool in the sports bar. We're young & were ready for bed by 11:00 after doing excursions & being in the sun all day! We did go to the disco @ Riu Tequila one night. It doesn't open until 11:00. It was very small & crowded & the drinks weren't all that great! If you go to this area of Mexico to find a deal shopping it isn't here. There is the Plaza 5 min. from the resort but they don't barter much. Oh & if you need anything for the weather (bathing suit, shorts, flip flops, sunscreen) your going to pay for it!! Sunscreen is $15-$20 there unlike our $4-$8 price in the states. We checked many locations & it was the same everywhere. 5th Ave. shopping was a joke! $5 cab ride to an outdoor mall that is outrageous & not real friendly people. Just on the outskirts is bartering shopping but you really have to stand ground to them. They can be very pushy & rude & if you go to one vender all the ones down the road won't leave you alone. We also went about 5:30pm to the area & it didn't feel real secure/safe. Another thing I didn't find out until our last day is whatever a cab driver quotes you it includes their tip. Excursions to try: Tulum Extreme, Mayan Adventure, ATV excursion! Fun! Bring tip money for your driver/guide. Also, most excursions take photos of you to buy @ the end so if you want them then have an extra $20-25 dollars on hand in cash only! Don't waste your time on dinner cruise in Cancun!! Long drive & small overcrowded boat w/ok food. Bring lots of $1's & $5's for cabs & tipping those you feel deserve it even though it's all inclusive. They rarely would exchange USD for USD. Mainly pesos only!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: shaycor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RPRM Oct 7-12. It was a special treat for a special Occasion and I spent 3 months in deciding where to stay. I read every review, every forum and every little detail. I want to share my honest opinion. After reading all these posts, I was expecting something very extraordinary. That does not exist. I did have a good time, but it was not a unique, one of a kind experience to be catered to and lavished in luxury that I expected. RPRM was a beautiful property. I give the the front desk staff and housekeeping an average rating, the F&B attendants and food preparation 5 stars! I tipped and tipped and tipped, but the service and lack of service from the front desk and housekeeping is not there. This, however, did not ruin my trip. Just that everyone notes on these posts about the welcome drink, towel art, special upgrades, special surprise cakes if it is your birthday,etc etc etc. and I am telling you, this was just not happening. The rooms were sterile feeling and I determined the cause of this to be the marble floors, no softgoods and very unattractive beds. The beds were hard but they did not affect my sleep because I slept good, as I was tired. They are just not the nice, fluffy mattresses that we are use to in the USA. The bed coverings were old and hard and should have also been a nice fluffy alternative. It just wasn't very attractive and pleasing to the eye. The softgoods in the room were just non exsistant. I saw one post where someone complained about falling and twisting her ankle. It rained on us in the evenings and when it rains, the outside corridors are slicker than ice. They do put signs up and try to mop it up, but hey, it's marble. The Pool scene was nice. Lot's of action in the pool, especially the volleyball games. Did the intro scuba in the pool, that was fun, but only lasts about 20 minutes. I wish I had time for the pay dive service that takes you out in the ocean, but you make sure you have at least 24 hours before you are to depart property because of the oxygen(I suppose). I waited until the last day of stay which would have put me less than 24 hours, so this wasnt an option. Tried the snorkeling but they were suctioning sand off the ocean floor to use in thier sandbags, so the water was extremely cloudy. We tried to use the beach at one of the other RIU's (Yucatan) only to be told by the towel attendant that she could not give us towels even though we showed her our towel card. She said we had to use the towel service at our RIU. I knew this was wrong and just a "lazy" employee, but what do you do...we all have them! The entertainment was good. At least is was something to do. I did not use the Spa. I thought they had advertised a steam room, but when I got there, they did not have a steam, only sauna. I thought the Buffet to be above average. There is something for everyone. I am a dessert eater and the dessert was the same everyday/night and not that great. I did not feel like the variety was different each day at the buffets, however, that did not keep me away..it was still good! The buffet is your only option for breakfast and lunch. I was not aware of this until arrival and don't remember anyone posting about this. THere was no high speed internet that you could use with your laptop in the room. You had to pay $8 for 44 minutes in the bar area. It took the computer 5 minutes to load and get online with my email, so I ended up spending about $24 on internet usage. The phone service is non existant, unless you want to pay $4 to dial an 800 number. We bought cards($10 for 60 minutes) and would have to go down to the shopping center to use them. I did rent a car. If you plan to do this, don't do it at the airport. I think it is cheaper from your hotel or snag one of those books from the girl as you are exiting from the airport, it has coupons in it. I rented from AVIS and paid $40 per day. The car is only $15 but the insurance is $35. The driving was very easy and I don't read spanish. The RPRM is very convenient to park and retrieve the car. At the end of the stay, I cannot say that I had a lousy time because of the RPRM and thier lack of inconsistencies. The F&B attentants work very hard and are so pleasant. Should I return, I would probably chose another location, but I was not uncomfortable at the RIU.

Reviews.Title: “RPRM was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gina33
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the RPRM from Oct. 6th - Oct. 13. Our stay was wonderful, and I would agree with most of the 5 star reviews on this board. Check in - completely smooth.
