I had emailed the hotel a week prior to arrival to request a certain room. When we arrived, that particular room was not available, so they gave us an upgrade to a better room. (For free) Room: Absolutely wonderful. Very clean, nice and cool. Balcony was wonderful. We had a fabulous ocean view, and I spent a lot of time on the balcony just relaxing and having drinks. Always had extra towels and nightly turndown service. Staff: The staff exceded our expectations with thier generous personalities and eagerness to make our stay wonderful. The entertainment staff, bartenders, and front desk staff all spoke English, so there was no problem with language barriers. Our favorite bartender was Antonio at the swim up bar. He made rainy days so much fun. Pool: The pool is huge. Much bigger than those of the other RIU properties in Playacar. We enjoyed the infinity pool, as well as the swim up bar. There were plenty of loungers. No towel games were necessary at the pool, or the beach. Beach: Nice upper level beach with palm trees/loungers. Lower level beach was no doing great due to erosion, but you were still able to walk a little ways, and get in to swim. And NO, the beach is no rocky as others have indicated. I brought water shoes thinking I would need to wear them to swim after reading reviews here, but didn't need to use them at all. You were not able to walk very far to the left. Only to the next resort. To the right, you could walk down 3 resorts or so, but not all the way to the other Palace resort. We walked the road one day to go to the other Palace, and their beach was in much better condition. Dining: The food was great. The buffets had a million choices, and I had something different each morning. Lunch at the buffet was delicious as well. As far as specialty restaurants, my favorite was the steakhouse. The gourmet was also good. The Brazilian was good, but omigod! I have never eaten that much meat at one time! The Japanese was okay. We didn't eat at the Mexican restaurant. Nightlife: As some reviews on this board suggest: the hotel is very quiet past 10 or 11. They do have shows in the theatre each night at around 9:30. The other end of the resort closer to the ocean is pretty much like a graveyard at this time of the night. Very dark, and nothing going on. This didn't bother us at all. We were there to relax, and we had a lot of cocktails during the day, so we were ready for bed by 11:00 or so anyway. The lobby bar was fun. Also, the sports bar is open 24/7. So you could go in there to drink, play games, eat snacks at any time of the day. Playa nightlife: If you are looking to party, it is definitely worth it to take a cab into playa for $5.00. You can walk, but it takes about 25 minutes. There is a ton of shopping, cute bars, live music at some of them, and various dance clubs. We went to Playa one night and had a blast. Summary: This hotel is beautiful, and definitely worth the cost. It lives up to it's 5 star rating and reviews. Although the Palace Mexico has a better beach, this is a much nicer hotel. You can walk 4 minutes down the road and go to the other beach for the day if you need to. We didn't even find that necessary. The beach was fine in my opinion. If you stay here, you won't regret it. I have a ton of pictures, so if anyone is interested, send me a message and I will email you a link to them.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Service”
Reviews.Author: jenniferw70
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a four night vacation at this resort. This was a terrific experience! The staff couldn't be friendlier. We had one issue with our ceiling fan actually hitting the ceiling and they quickly gave us another room which was actually in a better location. The staff goes out of their way to make sure you have everything that you need. You hardly have a chance to put down a glass before they are at your side asking if you would like anything else. The hotel is clean inside and out. I recommend Agave (the Mexican restaurant) and Chilis (the steakhouse). I did not care for Sir Oliver (the gourmet restaurant). The buffet is also very good. We did not have a chance to try the other two restaurants. Not too much of a beach if you like to go into the ocean, however, due to erosion, etc. There is a very nice beach area if you just like to relax and hang out, though. The infinity pool and adjoining pool make up for it with the view you have of the sea. You can spend hours there easily relaxing in the sun. Based on this experience, I definitely will try other Riu locations.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: hap36607
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the RIU palace Riviera Maya for our honeymoon, and couldn't have been more pleased. The cleanliness was wonderful, and the staff amazingly attentive and friendly. The food was good and plentiful, and had plenty of variety. The beds are quite hard, so do ask for a foam pad when you check in, and they will be happy to accommodate you. (Jill the concierge was wonderful!) It was very nicely located, and walking to either the Playacar Plaza shopping area (5 minutes) and into Playa Del Carmen itself (15 minutes, Mayan ruins and beautiful iguanas sunning on the way) was easy. I found the lack of constant programs and people trying to corral you into activities quite refreshing-there were activities for those who wanted to join, but not so many that they took over the beach or pool area everyday. Very well-trained staff, and tour companies represented in the hotel at your convenience. There was hot coffee available from at least 6am on, so I don't understand that complaint from someone else. The property itself is stunning, and does not show excessive wear. Rooms are large and comfortable. Our mini-bar was re-stocked daily with water, sodas, etc. A terrific value for the money paid (the rate we paid for 2 people per night would barely get you a Hampton Inn in a metropolitan area)

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace, a Little Slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Tweety_1789
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a six day vacation at this resort. We were so pleased with our holiday. From the moment we checked in to the moment we left, our stay at this hotel was nothing short of PHENOMENAL! The staff was absolutely wonderful. The employees were so accomodating and polite. They were helpful and did not mind going the extra mile when we needed something. For example, we had a problem with our room door about four days into the vacation. The key pad did not work. . We called the front desk and within minutes the maintenance man showed up and fixed our problem. I have never seen such fast service. My boyfriend and I were shocked. We have stayed at many hotels and have never seen such a responsive staff. At breakfast, lunch and dinner the staff was extremely attentive. My favorite was Rene at breakfast. He made sure that our water glass did not go half empty. He always brought the coffee and milk out for us with a smile. After our second day at the resort, we didn't even have to ask him for the coffee and milk, he just brought it to our table when he saw us approaching. He was wonderful and so was the rest of the staff at the restaurants. We made reservations for dinner at Agave, Sir Oliver, and the Japanese restaraunt. The food was good- my favorite was the Japanese. The service was even better. The staff at the restaurants treated us better than we have been treated in some five star restaurants in Fort Lauderdale. We left tips for the staff because they work so hard. They take your order, bring you your food, clean up the dirty dishes, and do pretty much anything a normal server does at a restaurant. I would recommend bringing some tip money. The staff works really hard and they seem to appreciate it when you give them a little extra boost for their hard work. Not only is the staff great, but the hotel and the accomodations are beautiful. The Riu did not miss a detail with this resort. Inside it has a European and Spanish Flair. It is very elegant and has a grand entrance. It is quite impressive when you first arrive at the hotel. The rooms were nice, but a little on the small side. We booked a junior suite. The balcony had a gorgeous view, which made up for the small size of the room. We were very happy with the view. The property was gorgeous inside and out! The beach is lovely too. It has lush palm trees and plenty of lounge chairs for soaking up the sun. The beach itself is not a very big beach. There is a sea wall that blocks the sun bathing area from the actual beach. The reason the actual beach area is not big is due to the fact that the Yucatan has experienced many tropical storms. Unfortunately, I understand what happened to Playa Del Carmen all too well. I am from Fort Lauderdale, Florida and have been through enough storms to know that beach erosion is just a fact of life in the tropics. The water is so stunning and it makes up for the erosion. We enjoyed the beach and our holiday. We will definitely go to another RIU property and I highly recommned this resort. I was concerned because I read some bad reviews on this resort. I don't agree with any of those reviews. When you read all of these reviews you have to be objective and take the good with the bad and go see for yourself. Once you go, you will know what I am writing about! It's a great place. And by the way, don't miss the Michael Jackson show. It was the best nightly show at the resort. My experience at the RIU Palce Riviera Maya can be summed up as Sheer Paradise with a Mojito that makes it just right.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Wonderful, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mlymd
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this resort in Sept 2007. From check-in to check-out, it couldn't have been any bettter. We have never been to a resort that was so clean. You could eat off the floors. Everything was wonderful. The pool, the room, the food, the service. It was way beyond my expectations. Islas, the bartender at the lobby bar was incredible. Pistel, our waiter at lunch was so attentive. We wanted a resort where we could relax and that's just what we got. We checked out some of the outher Riu resorts in the area but none of them compared the the Palace. The only down side is if you want to walk on the beach it is not very long at all. It was one of the best vacations we have ever had. I would highly recommend this resort. For the price we paid I expected a 3 star resort but this is by far a 5 star. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENTE!!”
Reviews.Author: MariaJosephine
Reviews.Content: This place is magnificent! Just pulling up to the hotel makes you feel that you have arrived to a palace. The lobby is very elegant and impressive. Check -in was different than what I expected as they took you over to the bar sitting area and gave you a welcome drink, then instructions and your keys. Only negative experience I can say was that we were given a room that was already occupied, so than we were quickly given one on an upper level. After unpacking I noticed a mildew smell in the sheets, so I contacted my representative and housekeeping changed the sheets on the bed immediately which made a big difference. I bought a candle to help keep the room smelling good too. You might want to travel with an air freshner in case this happens to you. I wish I had asked for egg crates for the bed- I just read a review about that. The bed was a little hard, but OK. Other than that I had a fabulous time and excellent service and wonderful food. We tried the steakhouse which was very good, but found that we prefered to go to the buffet where the food was just as good and maybe sometimes better. They had theme nights at the buffet along with mexican serenade players going from table to table We enjoyed having the option to dine inside or outside and it was just a elegant as the restaurant with white linens on the table. The shows were very good and we enjoyed them every night. Service was excellent and the waiters were very friendly and enjoyed conversations. After a while they became more like a friend. The entertainment staff was great fun and always would come around and take to you. Drinks were great- I tried the whole menu. Pool area hand plenty of chairs, plus the beach area with plenty of sitting area. In all, I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “great property!”
Reviews.Author: Chica46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this resort while I was inspecting other hotels in the area for my job as a travel agent. It is a stunning property, very beautifully decorated, wonderful grounds and gardens etc. Unfortunately, the 2nd morning we were there, I fell on a very slippery floor and twisted my ankle badly. The hotel staff was very slow to react until they found out that we didn't plan to make a big deal of it and only wanted some ice etc. They did try to tell us that the area was marked with a "caution" sign. It was not until after the incident! We did enjoy the oriental specialty restaurant very much. I felt that the buffets were very good and had nice variety. It is a huge property so plan to do a lot of walking!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: compasstruenorth
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time. All the reviews really helped. Things to know: 1. Ask for egg crates for the bed - big difference 2. bring extra $ for tips. The average employee makes about $8 US a day - a few dollars gets you extra great service 3. buffet is great for breakfast and lunch - try some restaurants in town for dinner as the buffet is tedious for dinner 4. the a la cart restaurants are so so 5. hotel is beatiful - get a room overlooking the courtyard 6. Hotel is a $5 cab from town - easy access to everything In all a great hotel with great service. We stayed for a week, and we would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Riu rocks!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDiveDiva
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in april 2006. I know this review is coming really late. This was the best vacation that we ever took. The employees bent over backwards to make us happy. The food was awesome. They always had something for our kids to coose from. The beach was beautiful! The room was great. We have only good things to say about this resort. We are planning to go back one of these days. Riu is the best all-inclusive that we ever stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Not A Palace”
Reviews.Author: kaslcsw
Reviews.Content: Rather than write a lengthy minute by minute account, I will simply provide a pros and cons list. Family of four (2 adults, one small child, one infant) just returned from Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Pros: Exterior of hotel is beautiful. Grounds are very nice. Pools are magnificient. Buffet was good during the weekdays. Housekeeping cleaned room adequately. Adult activities (water volleyball, soccer, bingo) were fun. Ocean colors were beautiful. Cons: Hotel rooms are mediocore. Many areas of the hotel are not air conditioned (hallways, some restaurants). Hotel staff was either extremely nice or down right nasty. The front desk staff was not accommodating. Buffet was not as good on the weekend. Room service menu was extremely limited. Mini bar only had drinks. Pool water was extremely hot, so it was not refreshing. NOT a family resort. Kids program barely existed. Drunk people at the pool (needed to be escorted away from the pool due to the behaviors displayed). Several nude women on the beach and at the pool. Hotel arranged transfers to and from airport, but did not tell us the transfer was provided by a tour company "hotel beds" trying to gain our business. "Hotel beds" did not show up for our transfer back to the airport. The agent stated she called our room and someone said we did not need it. However, doorman arranged for a taxi and "hotel beds" paid the fare. Other guests stated things were stolen from their rooms (we were fortunate this did not happen to us). The beds were extremely hard and actually hurt our backs. One night, another guests alarm clock went off at 3am. We heard it all night until 8am. (Would have called the front desk if we weren't so tired.) Restaurant next to pool (CHILI'S) manager stated we could not eat because our bathing suits were wet. Meanwhile, almost everyone had wet bathing suits and he said nothing. Beach area was small and water was cloudy (did not see any fish). The hotel is only about 1 1/2 years old and looks very worn for the age. Overall, we will not return. This was not a five star hotel. We are well traveled and have stayed at many superior resorts. We do believe this was the best of the Riu properties in the area from what we saw and what other guests said while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay! Going back in a few weeks!”
Reviews.Author: koshka6102
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon May 20-25th and had a great time. I have stayed at other Riu properties (and other hotels) in Mexico and this one was by far the best! The room was very comfortable, food was excellent and the staff wonderful! We loved it so much, we are returning in a few weeks! Worth EVERY cent!!!

Reviews.Title: “the Riu was Average/ Islas the bartender was awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: booziePittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Relaxing vacation, but thank goodness we found friends to hang with b/c of the lack of entertainment. Pool was very nice, not superbly clean, but nice. The Pool bar was clean, and the bartenders were very efficient and nice. The beach, well, what beach pretty much eroded. In fact a lot of the beaches in playa were eroded. The ocean is still absolutely beautiful. The staff at the Riu--- bartenders were great, especially giving props to Islas and Victor they made the nightly entertainment. Oh, and to play pool/any game in the sports bar it was like 3.00, ridiculous, considering they didn't really have any nightlife. Front door staff, were very accomodating at first, but as the week progressed service kinda changed in general. In fact, one day our room went unclean and there was barely any wait staff by the pool. Pool service in the beginning was very good, Marvin/Islas were great, however service by the pool tapered very much soo by the end of the week, no liquor cart going around asking for drinks. Didn't like the fact that the pool closes at 7pm, and the towel bar closes even earlier. Didn't like that they wouldn't let us put our plastic tables in the pool to set our drinks on, guess they don't care about people spilling their drinks in the pool. I do agree, that the pool towels weren't the best. There's not much to do at night, cept the typical mexican shows, nothing sooo special. Night life definitely not for the late 20s crowd, we checked out the nightclub, it's okay but rather small and a 10minute walk from the hotel. Thank goodness we found some other fun couples to hang out with. I did take advantage of the spa, the massage was good, not great and not sure if it was worth 90.00 but we were on vacation. The pedicure was below average, but the girl who did it was very sweet, they don't even have the big chairs to sit in while they are doing it. A girl we met down there said she had the body wrap, and it was fabulous. The Spa in general as far as facilities goes, was prob. below average in my standards. The food- The breakfast buffet was good, pretty much the same everyday though. The lunch buffet was good the first day, but got very very routine after that. Dinner- The steakhouse-we walked out on after waiting 10 minutes to be greeted/and an hour for our food which the steak ended up being rare/when we ordered medium/well, wasn't taking any chances in mexico. The Gourment restraunt-beef was very very good (our favorite). The Japanese-no steakhouse, but was very good. The Mexican restaurant, average/not the greatest. Nightly dinner buffet, which we ate at 3 times was pretty good/very good. We did report the issue at the steakhouse and our room not being cleaned, the two young people behind the desk had no idea what to do about our complaints, in fact the one boy just walked away and let me continue c/o to the other girl. Oh, and the room, well that was great, very very well airconditioned and very spacious, bathtub/shower were great and our refrigerator was almost always stocked. Loved having Corona at the hotel. . I will say, though, my husband and I still managed to have a great time. And if you are a frequent traveler to Mexico, you know all of the resorts have their pros/cons. I would say, honestly, this resort's pros/cons are pretty much equal. But i would say 7 days is definitely enought time to spend at this resort, considering the lack of things to do. And I would prob. rate if a 5 red apple not a 6 golden apple.

Reviews.Title: “Loved RIU Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: wmm1954
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from The Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We were scheduled to stay from August 15-22 but unfortunately we had to cut our trip short by two days due to the impending Hurricane Dean. That was one of the few dissapointing parts about our trip. I have to admit I was a little nervous about staying here after reading some of the reviews posted. Now I wonder if I stayed at the same hotel as some of the people who posted negative reviews. We booked our trip through a travel agent and arrived at Cancun Airport and were transported by van by Olympus Tours. Everything went great as they brought us to the hotel without a hitch. When we pulled up to the place I was impressed as we drove in to the driveway. That was just the beginning. As you walk in to the lobby you can't help but be impressed with how beautiful this hotel is. They certainly did not spare any expense in the construction of this place. It is just very appealing. When we checked in we were pleasantly surprised to find out our room was an ocean view room. We had upgraded to a mini suite so maybe that was part of the reason we had an ocean view. The room was beautiful with a very large bed and a sunken living room area. The patio looked out to the gorgeous grounds and the ocean. I had read so many reviews about an awful odor in the rooms. I have to say that I did not notice anything at all in regards to an odor. Yes the bed was a little hard but nothing that bothered us that much. Each morning we would order a pot of coffee from room service after I returned from a nice walk. One thing that I liked about the area that the hotel is in is that it is very safe to walk around.The street that the hotel is located on is gated. I would go out each morning for my walk and felt very safe. There are several other hotels and villas nearby and plenty of people out and about. Because our stay only lasted 5 days instead of 7 we were not able to try all the restaurants but the ones we did try were very good. Because we arrived around 4 p.m. we tried the buffet dining room on the first night. They have a different "theme" each night. We went on Mexican and Italian night. The food was excellent.There is a great variety of items at the buffet that were deliscious. We also ate at the Steak House, The Brazilian and The Mexican restaurants. All were very good. One thing that I must also say about the waitstaff at the restaurants is that they can't be nicer and more accomodating. They are so friendly. On our last night we had a new waiter at the Mexican restaurant named William who was very nice. He told us how he was going to school to learn the English language better. That is one area where I could see room for improvement. Some of the help could speak better English in order to communicate with the guests. This was a bit of a problem at the pool or the breakfast buffet but not at the dinner restaurants. I realize we are in their country. It was just a minor inconvenience- no big deal. We took a cab in to Playa Del Carmen one night. What a busy area that is. Lots of bars and restaurants. I would recommend it if you are looking to do something different. We also took a trip to The Mayan Ruins one day and it was interesting but HOT. Of course it is August! One thing that we enjoyed was having a few drinks at the bar in the main lobby either before or after dinner. Now that I think of it, some nights we had a few before and after dinner! Oh what the hell, we're on vacation. We had two great bartenders.The first night we had Pimintel and he was very nice.The rest of the time we had Islas. He is quite a character.Very entertaining. We had some fun with him. The only dissapointing things were when we were leaving we had asked for a wake up call that never came. Thankfully we set an alarm. Also when we were leaving because our flight was early we had to carry our own bags down because there are no bellhops available at 6 a.m. I thought that was not good for a hotel of this caliber. One last thing I would like to mention is booking through a travel agent. Ours was very instrumental in helping to get us a flight out of Mexico. When we decided not to risk staying through the hurricane, I contacted him and at that time he could not find any available flights. We also checked ourselves and had no luck. The next morning our travel agent called me back at told us of a flight on JetBlue and we booked it. I know that these days many people book on the internet and save money but I'm not sure I would have been able to get that flight without my travel agent's help. To sum everything up I would love to go back here or possibly try a RIU in another location. If anyone wants any feedback, feel free to e-mail me at WMM1954@WMCONNECT.com.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: Yonis
Reviews.Content: - 5 star plus - Wonderful service from the staff. - The rooms are all suites and beautiful, though the beds are hard - Beautiful Beach - Engaging and interactive entertainment. The theatre was and indoor/oudoor theatre. - No tipping required - We were there for our honeymoon. It was peaceful and relaxing. The staff made us feel as though we were VIPs. - The food was creatively displayed, and there was quite a bit of variety. - You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “100% best service ever !”
Reviews.Author: Wibbles01
Reviews.Content: Having worried about whether or not reviews on this site were accurate, I must tell you that the RIU Palace Riviera Maya is an absolutely awesome experience. We were warned by others that this place would ruin us, as you experience the best of the best every single day. Fun: Nightly themed shows, Pool acitivites, Volleyball, Pool, Vendors, etc etc. This resort always shows you something different each night for you to experience. Cleanliness: they wash the resort top to bottom every day. Very impressed! Pool is clean and always checked daily. Service: Full service all the time everday. All inclusive is obviously the way to go. You don't even have to get up to get your own beers.. there are staff at every bar that wait on you hand and foot. Very friendly and personable (you learned their names versus just viewing them as a bartender) even with Hurricane Dean rolling in. Food: Onsite restaurants are amazing! Even the buffet thats available every nite (the other restaurnts require reservations) is great food with different themed nights. Steakhouses are top notch (try the iguana meat = superb!). Gourmet and fresh fish, seafood and meat... can't complain about it at all. Nachos/sandwhiches and snacks available 24/7 in the Sports bar. Free room service (try the Chicken Toasties!) Ate everything without any stomach problems -- water is always bottled and ice in the blended drinks didn't seem to bother anyone's stomach. Beach/Pool - Beach is awesome!! Don't worry about any sort of erosion, cause it's not there. The only time we saw sandbags by the seawall was when hurricane Dean was on its way in. Stunning beach with lush palm trees. A real treat to the eyes and senses.. tho bring lots of sunblock! Pool is absolutely huge and always clean. Swim up bar is always busy and staff seem to keep up with the traffic just fine. If you stay here, you will be ruined on other resorts. We stopped by the Riu Tequila (part of 6 hotels in the vicinity that you get access to) and it's much busier over there with no 'full service' (you have to get your own beers ! :P Recommend you walk to the plaza (5 mins away) for some good souvenirs, and go to Playa Del Carmen for some more bartering style shopping (very safe, don't worry). Also recommend Xel-ha/Tulum trip.. you will have the time of your life!!! Trust me! P.S. - I was there when the 'Americans' were there too. They weren't a bother as some have reviewed. Some families are there as well, so there are some kids in the pool later on in the afternoon, but the resort is so big that you will not notice (we didn't and we were on our honeymoon).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...Shame about the Americans!”
Reviews.Author: nickifoxy
Reviews.Content: Well what a lovely hotel this is! The rooms immaculate, optics in the rooms, is a good idea too! the staff work very hard indeed...One thing about the hotel is the smell...Musty! All of our clothes had to be washes when we arrive home! Now on to the Americans! How arrogant they are, and loud! They do not say please or thank-you to anyone! Manners do not cost a thing! this has put me off stepping one foot into America! Please try the Formula One boat trip! this is great fun! 2 boats race out to sea, they take you snokling, and on to a beach resturant for lunch, then race back!, but dont book with your rep, is much cheaper if you go to Playa Plaza and book there, there is a kind of hut with the guys in to book excursions...good company though.. Also another thing i did forget to mention...Entertainment is rubbish! but hey guess what the americans were easily entertained!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but NO internet access in rooms!”
Reviews.Author: loudtravel
Reviews.Content: The reviews that have been written are accurate, but no one seems to have mentioned the fact that there is no internet access in the rooms. You must go to one of the bars and pay for access which at the time was USD$4 for 15 minutes; USD$8 for 1 hour; USD$15 for 24 hours from time of initial log-on. At the bar you have to deal with alot of smoke, background noise and activity. GAMES, such as billiards, air hockey etc. cost USD$2-3 per game.

Reviews.Title: “riu palace riviera mia”
Reviews.Author: p098679
Reviews.Content: the worst service we have ever recieved, the staff was also incompetent and unhelpful. food was cheap and alcohol was watered down in my opinion. reort itself looks good but very poor upkeep for a new location. i would not recommend this resort to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a RIU good time”
Reviews.Author: lfgart
Reviews.Content: Returned last night from a 4 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya, Playa del Carmen. We highly recommend this location to anyone wanting a hotel that is situated on a beautiful beach, top notch service, views of water that are incredibly beautiful, food and drink that go on forever, people that couldn't be nicer! We took our sons, ages 25 and 21, for a little family rendezvous. Day one we lounged by the pool, Day two we went on snorkeling adventure to Puerto Morelos (Dive Puerto Morelos, ask for Sylvia, $25 US/person) had lunch at her recommendation - AWESOME, took a cab back to the Riu for $25 (great bargain!) and then lounged by the pool, Day Three - you guessed it, lounged by the pool and the beach. The water scenery is breathtaking. The best water we have seen. (we travel a lot! Hawaii, Virgin Islands, etc.) Learned how to play Euchre in the Bar Lounge one afternoon, water volleyball and even water aerobics. FUN! Lots of European influence. Not crowded at all. Don't drink the water in your hotel room. Plenty of bottled water provided for you in your inroom refrigerator. Japanese restaurant VERY GOOD, Gourmet Sir Oliver, again very good, especially the ambiance. VERY attentive service in both locations. Buffets for dinner were good, not great. However, No one in this family starved, let me tell you! Breakfast was the best! Must haves: Mango yogurt and the Banana Juice! AWESOME! The city of Playa del Carmen was charming. "Fifth Avenue" was very friendly. Deals??? Who can really say! But definitely fun to experience! A $5 cab ride from the hotel. We would have walked it but it was HOT and VERY HUMID the whole time we were there. It was AUGUST remember. We have decided that maybe staying at a hotel that would provide breakfast only would be the way to go. Then we could experience more of what the town had to offer in terms of fine dining. There were plenty of restaurants that I would have liked to try but after paying the all inclusive rate, didn't want to spend more on the outside. Drinks - certainly watered down. But still fun to try all of their different concoctions!!! You could certainly be busier than we were - we went there to be together and enjoy the beauty. I must add that we booked with VACATION EXPRESS now for the second year in a row. This company will get our business again in the future as well. NOT A SINGLE FLAW! Use them with confidence! We hope that you have a RIU good time on your trip to Playa del Carmen, too!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LMVOLINO
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I LOVE THIS PLACE!! I must have said it a hundred times during our stay from 8/4/07-8/10/07. When we first arrived our rooms were not ready until the 3:00 pm check in. I had planned ahead and packed a bag so we can start to enjoy our stay. We were given our bracelets and immediately were told to go to eat, drink and use the pool. Promptly at 3:00 all 3 of our rooms were ready. One of the rooms had a king bed for the two teenage boys. Within minutes they changed there room, no problems! The rooms are spacious with lots of granite and dark woods. Very sheek. During our stay we enjoyed all the activities, food, resturants, drinks, and shows. Water sports, sand sports and the ocean were all within expectations. The shows were pretty good for resort style shows. One night we wanted to go down to the ocean and enjoy a bottle of champagne. Not a problems, within 10 minutes we had a fruit platter, champagne and 2 chlled glasses sent to our room! The pool and pool bar I think were our favorite. The drinks were excellent (the fruit de something was terrific). Not waterered down at all. The mix of people was enjoyable as well, meeting alot of fun sociable people. Not too many young children. I have traveled 3 times a year for the past 10 years, mostly to resorts and Caribean Islands. I must say this resort was a first class operation. The food was terrific (no episodes with the fruits, water or ice out of a group of 6), the staff was pleasing and pleasant, the resort itself was gorgeous (pictures do not do justice) and overall a wonderful experience....I am already planning a long weekend return in two months!!! Hope you all enjoy as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: OfficePrisoner1
Reviews.Content: We sepnt 7 nights at the RPRM Jul 21-28 and loved every minute of our vacation. From the moment we arrived and felt the nice cool air conditioning in the lobby until the moment we left we were pampered and treated like royalty. The service was impeccable and delivered with a sincere smile . Location: is perfect-a 20 minute walk into Playa, or $5 cab ride. It was wonderful to be so close to town-we never felt isolated and had easy access to all the wonders of Playa town. The decor of the resort is spectaular-very opulent and beautiful. The rooms were beautiful and spacious for the 2 adults and 2 children. Maid service was great-room always cleaned by noon and a fresh set of towels and turndown service in the evenings. Food: wonderful. The sit down restaurants and buffets were delicious. We actually prefered the selection and quality at the buffets and the flexibilty of dining when we wanted. Alcohol: All top shelf brands served at all the bars. No no-name liquor here. Also, the mini fridge in the rooms had cold bottles of Corona-heaven after a long hard day at the beach. The pools and pool bars were wonderful.. The beach area is small, but the top tier of the beach is very large and has hundreds of palm trees providing shade. This area was just beautiful and the site for 5 weddings during our stay. Air Conditioning: Perfect! The entire resort has full a/c with the exception of Chili's - the outdoor restaurant. It was wonderful to escape the heat ( high 90s and very humid during our visit) and retreat to the coolness. ( We met up with a few couples during a day trip to Playa that were staying in other resorts that didn't have a/c in the public areas. Needless to say, this put a real damper on their experience). We have stayed at9different all inclusives in Mexico and the Islands and the RPRM has set the standard for us. We will absolutely return to this Paradise in Playa!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: travelbeetch
Reviews.Content: My 18 year old daughter and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya July 31-August 4, 2007. We have an excellent trip. Airport to hotel transportation was booked through Lomas travel. We booked the private transfers so it was just the 2 of us and we went non-stop to the hotel. Definitely the way to go. Hotel check-in was smoooooth. I had requested in advance to have lowest floor closest to restaurants due to recent knee surgery. Our request was granted and we were in room 0152 in the main building, bottom floor. The room was awesome. A/C worked GREAT. The mini bar was full and re-stocked every day. We had a towel animal on the bed each and every day. The bathroom had a jetted tub and the blow dryer was the best hotel room blow drier I've every used. Bathroom also had a magnifying mirror for makeup and such. The room had an iron and ironing board and a safe (they give you the look and the key when you check in.)The only concern I would have is the 2 steps down to the sitting area. This could be dangerous for families with smaller children and I know of one guest who fell down them during our trip (in the dark). She was ok, but very badly bruised. We only ordered room service once. The menu was limited, as is typical, but adequate. We had our meal within 20 minutes and the waiter apopogized profusely for it taking so long! Upon arrival we made our reservations for the ala carte restaurants. Gentlemen, be aware...you need appropriate dress for these restaurants. Khaki slacks and a collar shirt are fine. Shorts and jeans are not acceptable. We ate one night at the steak house, one night at the Japenese. Both were excellent. Sushi at the buffet restaurant was excellent. I found the buffet to have a varied selection with more than enough to satisfy even the pickiest eater. Wait staff at all restaurants was exceptional. However, I could live without them pushing my chair in for me every time. There is 24 hour food and beverage service available in the Sports Bar. They have burgers and hotdogs that you can microwave, sandwiches and nachos and a full bar with bartender. Bar service EVERYWHERE at the resort was incredible. Several times we had to ask for LESS rum in the Pina Coladas. Watered down drinks are definitely not a problem here! Pool and beach chairs were plentiful, however you do need to stake out your pool chairs before breakfast to get the best selection. the pool was wonderful with a swim-up bar, separate infinity pool, sunloungers built into the pool and several fountains. The waitstaff at the pool was also incredible. There are activites going on around the pool during the day but we chose not to participate this time around. the beach has suffered due to the severe storm surge last December. The beach where they have the chairs and palms trees is still huge, but the swimming beach is fairly small. the only downside to the hotel is the lack of nightlife. After the show ends in the evening, there is nothing to do. You can go to the disco at the Riu Tequila, but we didn't feel like leaving the hotel. The Tequila is either a 15 minute walk or a $3 cab ride, so it's not too bad. All in all, it's a wonderful hotel and we had a great time

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: superstran
Reviews.Content: as far as hotels go...I'd say it's better than cozumel's best hotel.....much more grand and refined....(cozumel is an island though and might be harder to build something like that in scale over there) food was excellent...breakfast got kind of boring cuz it's the same everyday though........Lunch also........but dinner u had to make reservations for their restaurants and no complaints on the restaurants....just gotta book them early when u get there they go fast..... I've been on better beaches,,half of it was rocky.....some topless women nothing distasteful. U have to pay to have someone teach you how to use the windsailboat...we didn't have to in Cozumel.. Rooms no complaints...my wife thinks the beds were hard but i didn't think they were that bad... Gym was average. Pool was good. the poolside bar closed by sunset which I didn't think was cool but maybe its' for safety reasons or pool maintenance. great place, from what i was told by cab driver it's Playa del carmen's newest hotel and the pics on the brochure don't lie.

Reviews.Title: “A Great All-Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: weathergirl29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a trip to Riu Palace Riviera Maya for the July 4th week. We were supposed to go to Destin with friends, but that fell through, so we got on a website and looked up places near Cancun. We had friends go to a Riu in Cabo, and they raved about it. We booked the trip quickly and left four days later! The flight from New Orleans to Cancun was relatively easy...got there by noon. Then an hour trip by van to the resort. I loved the town of Playa and the relaxed feel...not quite as touristy as Cancun. The resort is absolutely beautiful...the pics on their website don't lie. The pics I took could be postcards. The property is immaculate and new. Rooms were very nice...we were in a standard 1 king room with courtyard view. Kind of an obstructed ocean view. The mattress is a little hard, but slept fine. Loved the drinks in the fridge and the bathroom is well-appointed. The beach is fabulous...they planted at least a hundred palm trees right on the beach. This is great if you want some shade, or you can move your chair into the sun too. Water was clear and warm. The pool is great too...large and clean. Lots of chairs with umbrellas, and the swimup bar is fun. Our only (minor) complaint was the food...it wasn't great, but from what I understand, it was on par for food in Mexico. There is plenty of food, but it is just so-so. Our dinner at the Brazilian steakhouse was okay, and the Gourmet restaurant didn't really blow us away either. My best meal was breakfast...a huge buffet with lots of yummy breakfast-type stuff: bacon, eggs, french toast, breakfast potatoes, etc. The staff is GREAT! There is not a moment that someone is not cleaning, organizing, fixing, etc. The grounds are so clean, and the staff is quick to help you with questions, requests, etc. We loved our quick getaway, and are planning to visit another Riu property in Aruba next year. Would highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacay”
Reviews.Author: kachoo517
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel from July 20-27. The place was beautiful. The food was average what do you expect for all inclusive I mean really. The rooms were nice and clean the bartenders were nice and attentive. I went their with my boyfriend we had a great time. The best is 5th avenue is walking distance. If you like to party it's perfect. The restaurants are good and the clubs are on the beach. This place was the best. Enjoy yourself go snorkeling, swim with dolphins. The whole area is beautiful. You will enjoy your stay at this hotel. Were from New York and it met our expectations. So please don't listen to negative reviews those people have no idea what they are talking about. Will def go back. Viv and Manny

Reviews.Title: “Very good vacation”
Reviews.Author: gjarc
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great service. Plenty of chairs around the pool and beach. Could have more organized activities. Scuba program is first rate and reasonably priced. Food better than most all inclusives--the buffet is better than any of the specialty restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Earth”
Reviews.Author: tristaz
Reviews.Content: This resort is outrageous! I do not think there are words to describe how the Palace Riviera Maya is, honsetly! We stayed for 8 days in December--the weather was great, staff was great, and the atmosphere was very, very comfortable! I was disappointed about the beach-- It was mostly hard coral, which the pictures from the website show a complete sandy beach..very decieving. However, that did not change my excitement and view of this property! Muy bueno! I advise everyone who even visits the Playa Del Carmen area to go to the town. It is a beautiful walk, so do not take a taxi! The poeple are extremely nice and eeryone is so down to earth! Planning to return! Do not let the price of the resort scare you away... it is worth every penny! <3 it!

Reviews.Title: “Good Resort Here Are The Details”
Reviews.Author: TXVacationGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife, son, daughter and I recently stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Our stay was for 5 nights. I booked the hotel thru an on-line airline/travel company. I requested that the two rooms be adjoining, with 1 room having a king size bed and the 2nd room having queen size beds. We arrived at the hotel a couple of hours earlier than the standard check-in. We were greeted with a tasty, cold grapefruit like drink and were encouraged to go eat lunch on the property as the rooms were not yet ready. We ate our first lunch at Chili's...an on site restaurant not associated in any way with the chain. The lunch was served buffet style and was acceptable. Lots of choices, fresh fruits, ice cream, hamburgers, chicken, pizza, salad bar. After lunch, we waited another hour and then were able to check in to the rooms. The rooms were located on the 1st floor and were very clean, nice sized and comfortable. The refrigerators were stocked with Corona beer, Pepsi, 7-Up, water and orange drink. Above the refrigerator, were 4 types of liquor ready to dispense. The refrigerators in both rooms worked great and kept the beverages very cold. The beverages were included in the price and were re-stocked on a daily basis. The shower/jacuzzi tub combination was nice. I did not try the jacuzzi but the shower head was on a flexible metal hose and could be hand held. The shower water pressure was quite good. The a/c units were quiet and worked very well. The room was cleaned on a daily basis usually by lunchtime. The pool and beach area had plenty of chairs and places to lay out/relax. As you got closer to the beach area, there were a few topless bathers. But around the pool area the dress code was swimsuits on. The bar at the pool was nice and service was okay. Occasionally , the bar was quite crowded and you would have to wait 5 minutes for a drink. However, waiters would also come by your lounge chair periodically and take drink orders and return in a timely manner with your drink. The swimming pool was nice and huge. It never felt over crowded. Service: The staff was always friendly and helpful. Service was always very good. We had absolutely no complaints at any time regarding the staff and the service. Teresa coordinated the games/activities at the pool area and was very top-notch, friendly and professional. The waiters/waitresses were always helpful and friendly. Drinks were refilled in a timely manner at all restaurant locations. Plates were removed from the table in a very timely manner. With regard to the restaurants, please see below for a brief review: Breakfast at Don Manulo: 7:00-10:30 Each morning I went to breakfast while the rest of the family slept in. Breakfast has always been my favorite meal. The restaurant had an omelet station that was very good. The coffee was served hot. The bacon was excellent. The fried eggs were great. The fresh fruits and juices were very good. The french toast was not good as it was prepared using bread that had rye seeds in it. The rest of the breakfast was great. Lunch: Don Manulo: 1:00 This restaurant was one of two that served lunch. It was the better of the two as it was more of structured lunch. It was also a buffet, but some of the menu items would change from day to day. The lunch at this restaurant and at Chili's were, after the first two days, getting pretty old quick. It was the same stuff day after day. Yes, there was a large selection but, except for the fresh fruits and salad, most of the food just was not that great. The soup each day was hit and miss. One day the soup would be great and the next it would be dreadful. The fresh fish (white fish) was decent but the tuna tasted very fishy. No shrimp at lunch. Chilis: 12:00-3:00 This restaurant was located closer to the pool area and allowed you to come straight from the pool to the buffet line. The food was marginal. Cheese pizza tasted like the frozen boxed variety. The guacamole was outstanding. Hamburgers were the 70% lean variety and looked very greasy. Chicken was okay. This was not my favorite lunch time restaurant. It was average. Dinners: You had to make a reservation at least the day before to get a "seating" at one of the five Specialty restaurants. In order to make reservations, you had to meet with a lady near the lobby at 12:00 or shortly thereafter. The lady had a spreadsheet for each restaurant where she would sign you up for a particular seating time. There is a limited number of seats for each restaurant. However, it should be noted that at no time were any of the restaurants near full capacity. So I never completely understood why she indicated some were not available at a particular time. Seatings were at 6:30 or 8:30. The first day we arrived on site, we met with the representative at about 12:45. When we met her that 1st day the only restaurant available for reservations was the Agave "Mexicana" restaurant. So, we reserved this the 1st night and reserved the japanese restaurant the 2nd night and the brazilian restaurant the 3rd night. She would not let us reserve any more restaurant further than 2 days out. 1st night Agave Mexicana: This was a very good restaurant. Probably our 2nd favorite. The tortilla soup was fantastic. The appetizer bar was great and the entrees were pretty darn good. Not much to complain about at this restaurant. The head waiter went out of his way to make my wife feel special as it was her birthday. They brought out a cake and sang Happy Birthday in Spanish. Then they brought out a fresh bottle of champagne. I think the head waiter and staff were excellent. Chilis Steakhouse: The rib eye steak was excellent as was the baked potato. The salad bar was very good and the desserts were also good. This was probably our favorite restaurant (at dinner time) on the property. Yashima "Japonesa": The sushi was very good. The soup was horrible. The saki was not very good. The steak was just okay, and the chicken was average. The dessert was good. This was our least favorite restaurant. I guess we were spoiled by staying at the Royal Hideaway Playacar the summer before. The japanase restaurant at Royal Hideaway was fantastic. The Yashima restaurant at Riu paled in comparison. Botafogo "Rodizio": This Brazilian restaurant was okay. The salad bar was good. The waiters brought out 5 different types of meats. Some were good (steak, chicken, turkey). Some meats were not so good (pork and sausage). The soup was terrible..some type of weak bean soup. The desserts were served buffet style and were fairly good. This was our 3rd favorite restaurant. Don Manulo: This restaurant required no reservation. Dinner was served buffet style each night. A different dinner theme was in effect each night. The night we went the theme was oriental. It was terrible. The duck was okay. The soups were horrible. The egg rolls were greasy. It was our least favorite meal of the trip. Maybe a different theme night would yield better results. But I recommend you avoid oriental night. Off site: The kids (21 and 17) went one afternoon to swim with the dolphins. They had an outstanding time and loved it. Summary: Overall, the resort was very nice and clean. The staff were outstanding. Pools/beach were very nice. Food was hit and miss. Drinks were good. It was a great family vacation spot. I'd probably go back again, but would like to see some improvements in the food area.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay - Even Better”
Reviews.Author: tykris
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya - our stay was from 6/30 to 7/7. Airport - Flight We left O'Hare early 6/30 on USA 3000 and was a pleasant on-time flight and arrived at the NEW terminal and was escorted by bus straight to immigration with a fairly quick immigration entry We booked through Apple and met the flower power dudes and went on a small van straight to the hotel ( this was nice considering in the past with Apple we have been on huge charter buses that stopped at every hotel on the Riviera) Quick early check in - just after noon - we had booked a fountain view superior suite , but upon verifying that this was our second trip to the hotel they moved us to the suites right up front - wow Beach / Sea Lets get this out of the way - BIG change since last September. The sandy beach area is still large, the shade is much better than our last trip and view is still excellent Water was like warm milk - but if your looking for that long romantic walk - forget this beach- head further down south of Playa ( actually , in the many years we have been visiting the various islands and coast-lines - long romantic walks are overrated in the tropics) - We are happy with the view, sound, smell and relaxation! Rooms Excellent - everything worked perfect - left around $5 US on alternating days and the room was done by 2pm daily with some really cool towel art each day including a rabbit with " sticker" eyes , nose and mouth ( have not seen that before) Mini Bar This was interesting - on the 4th day we ran out of Rum - I called the front desk and requested a new bottle - in about 30 minutes a man brought a new bottle and left - then 30 minutes later another man showed up with another bottle of Rum - I tried to explain that w e were fine, but he did not speak English - he looked at the newly stocked rum bottle - played with the spout and smiled and left - then came back - replaced the spout ( which worked perfectly in the first place) - satisfied he had done his job he left with a small tip Food Better than average AI food Specialty Restaurants We dined at the Asian and Brazilian - both OK Room Service Only breakfast once, and it was good Pool - Bars Great service - nice pools Remember to TIP Night life - entertainment Never saw - Iberostar has better ( although really cheesy) fun entertainment after a day at the beach and drinking Diving Used Scuba Caribe - great staff - good diving ( a few of the reefs were as good as Cayman ) - went to the Cenotes for the first time and WOW If you do not dive - do the discover scuba - best I have seen at any resort ( they actually take you for two tanks and RE AL reefs) Spa My wife said the first time they were too rough - this trip too soft I don't know what she is talking about?? Overall We will go back Have fun -

Reviews.Title: “The only review you will need”
Reviews.Author: fatic11
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (adult children 24 and 21) stayed for a week, June 30 to July 7, and all loved it. We have been to different areas in Mexico 7 times previously and will return to this hotel. The rooms were spacious, the pool was huge (very clean) and overall the entire property is very well maintained. We did bring our $1.00 bills to tip with and were more than pleased with the service. The staff not only remembered our names but also what we liked to drink and could not have been any more accommodating. Marvin and Rene at the pool bar were very entertaining and great at their job. The property offers 6 restaurants so there is variety and we were able to find something that everyone liked at each, the food is good. You do need to make reservations for dinner and that was a little bit inconvenient but it also avoided any lines at dinner time. The beach is not the best we've been to but was fine for a daily swim. It is small and there is seaweed. The entertainment was amusing. For $5 you can catch a cab into Playa del Carmen which is close. The shopping was fun and it is a nice little town. Overall we rate this property highly and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Vacation”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from June 30-July 6. From the moment we arrived, we were treated extremely well. From the lobby, which was absolutely beautiful, to the landscaped gardens, everything was exceptionaly clean and manicured. They were constantly taking care of the property. You really felt as if you were living in a palace. We were catered to the entire vacation. The servers were always coming around asking if we wanted a drink and they were always pleasant. Our dinners at the restaurants were absolutely delicious and never had a problem getting a reservation. The buffets for breakfast and lunch were incredible. They had a wonderful variety of food and plenty of it. There was always something fun to do whether at the pool playing Bingo or riding on the Bobcat in the ocean. The shows at night were a lot of fun as well. We had a wonderful time and we will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Charlie99Chicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a beautiful destination wedding. If you're considering this as an option I highly reccomend it. The hotel has beautiful grounds and the staff is fantastic. When you schedule the wedding you receive the service of the wedding coordinator who is fantastic. She took care of everything, including the priest, photographer, location, music, cake, reception dinner etc. We were able to plan our whole wedding with 7 guests for under $6,000 including our room for 7 nights and airfare from Chicago. I recommend taking a day trip to Chichen Itza. Their is also a great bar in town, if you walk into town and start walking away from the touristy area you will come upon a a bar with chairs that are bascially rope swings that hang from the ceiling. You can't miss it, the bartender keeps you entertained with simple bar riddles, it's fun. We were very happy with our decision and we think you will be as well!

Reviews.Title: “Muy Bueno!”
Reviews.Author: brs0956
Reviews.Content: Apologize for the tardiness in my review. Booked a 3-night stay with Robert at TravelByBob with non-stop air from Pittsburgh thru USA 3000. The staff at this resort is incredible. Islas the bartender in the lobby bar is an incredible person and an amazing bartender. The sportsbar there was great as well. We were privileged enough to be there when Chivas played America (equivalent to Red Sox vs. Yankees) & had a good time watching the game with a lot of the staff. I highly recommend the Brazilian Restaurant. The meat is so tender & just keeps coming at you. Incredible!! I highly recommend this resort to all, families, couples, honeymooners, etc. Great resort with a great location (5 minute walk to PdC)

Reviews.Title: “Great Memories of Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: KT22193
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from our 25th wedding anniversary celebration and we are very happy with our choice of the RIU Palace Rivera Maya. We were there from June 22nd – June 29th 2007 and our experience was great. I’m going to break things down into categories. Staff - From the moment we arrived until we left for the airport the staff was excellent. They went out of there way to make sure we were having a great time. We didn't walk past a staff person without being greeted with a warm smile and a Hola! The entertainment staff was engaging and energetic. They made us feel like this was more than just a job to them. They seemed to sincerely care that we were having a good time. Rooms – The room was very nice, clean and we had a wonderful courtyard view. If I had to knock anything it would be the concrete beds. These beds were beyond firm however, if you ask they will provide a foam (egg crate) cover over it which makes it bearable. We had a little trouble with our card key, but they immediately sent someone to fix it for us. The housekeeping staff did a great job personalizing there work with towels folded into animal characters. If you’re a light sleeper you may want to bring ear plugs. You may hear a few doors slamming as people come in late. The doors are solid wood and all the floors are tile so it tends to echo down the halls a bit. Restaurants – We ate at every restaurant on the property and enjoyed all of them. They have five and you need to make reservations in advance for all but the buffet. The buffet has a different theme each night so I recommend if you check the schedule and factor that in when you’re making your reservations. Take this for what it’s worth, but we found that the fillet mignon was a bit tough and not very flavorful. On the other hand the rib-eye was just the opposite. Pools - I walked through every RIU property and in my opinion the Palace Riviera Maya was laid out the best. I like the size and the unobstructed view of the entire pool area. The entertainment staff sets up water volleyball on one end of the large pool and holds daily exercise sessions in the center which was very popular. They also offered free diving lessons in the pool twice a day. The pool area was clean and had plenty of cushioned beach chairs available. They also provide you with a towel card which you exchange for a clean beach towel when you need it. You simply return the towel and get your card back. So save the packing space you won’t need towels. Beach – While it’s true the beach erosion is significant there is still a nice swim able beach area and the beaches on the other properties are available and very nice. One half of the Palace beach area is rocky and the other is beautiful. I’m posting two beach pictures that illustrate what I mean. One picture was taken from center property looking left and the other center right. Chichen Itza Tour – I know this has nothing to do with the Hotel, but I wanted to mention this tour. It was a full twelve hours with much of it being travel time, but it was well worth it. I highly recommend it. However, be warned that the tour bus will stop at a gift store on the way and while it’s true they will barter and you’ll walk away feeling like you got a good deal you will find better deals inside Chichen Itza. Chichen Itza has several flee market vendors on the park streets, and they have excellent prices. Airport - Again I know this has nothing to do with the Hotel, but be warned that when you arrive in the Cancun airport lobby you will be greeted by men warring Hawaiian shirts that seem to be like a welcoming committee. In fact they are trying to get you to visit client resorts and I’m told even though they claim otherwise you will be hit up for time shares. Use your own discretion, but beware! The bottom line is we absolutely loved the resort and would definitely go there again in the future. I might consider packing a light air mattress next time, but I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great and relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: dswrlh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the resort and feel completely reviatilized. The staff was very helpful and kind. They always greeted us with a smile and remembered our favorite drinks. We loved the pool and thought the food was above average to exceptional for an all-inclusive. There are five restaurants to choose from for dinner so you're bound to find at least one you love. The only thing we didn't like about our visit was the lack of a beach. We couldn't walk along the beach because the ocean came up so far (it didn't matter what time of day). The sandy area leading up to the beach is beautiful with palm trees, white sand and even hammocks to relax in. Our room and balcony were spacious. The bed was hard but you can request a foam "egg crates" to make it softer. Although there were a few things we'd like to change, the resort is beautiful and the staff amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Shasta24
Reviews.Content: We took our 2 adult children (21 & 18) and my husbands parents for a 1 week stay at the Riu and had a great time. This was my husband and my 5th trip to an all-inclusive in the Playa area ( we stayed at Secrets, Riu Palace and the Moon Palace) and this was great for all ages. When we were there in mid June there was a lot of children of all ages which surpried us because last year at the Riu Palace there was no children the whole week we were there. I will not write the same things others have already told you but i would ignore the negative reviews because those people must have had a negative view on every little thing that might not be perfect. Sure the beds were hard but after a day in the sun and a couple drinks I slept like a baby. Maybe you won't like all the food they prepare, believe me there is always something you will find to eat. The place is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. Your on vacation, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “"Don't Hesitate, Book It"”
Reviews.Author: WhoDey1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our 10 year wedding anniversary at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya June 11-15. The Riu property was recommended to us by a friend who stays at a Riu property in the Doninican Republic. I'm not going to tell you how great is was in a lengthy review because many others are already doing so, but it was wonderful. We had NO complaints with anything during our stay, everything was first class we felt. A few points or hints for people to consider who are around our age of 35 or younger. 1. You won't find much to do on property in the evenings. There is a Sports bar and a Lobby bar, both were pretty lame. A good place for a drink buth not much more. 2. Take the $5 cab to Playa del Carmen and go to the shopping district at night. There is a Senor Frogs and a Carlos -n- Charlies which were lots of fun at night to hang out, drink, and listen to music. 3. The Riu was not in my opinion a place for a honeymoon if you are in your 20's. It wasn't the party atmosphere that Sandals offers to the younger couples. 4. If you want first class treatment and like to relax you will not be dissapointed by the Riu and what it offers. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: kristini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for our honeymoon from June 24 - June 30. It was great! The hotel is beautiful! The beds are a little hard, but we asked for a matress pad (which was sent to us within 10 minutes) and all was good. The Japanese restuarant is the best! The other restuarants were pretty good. I was hoping for more authentic Mexican food at the Mexican restaurant. I had garlic shrimp and my husband had the beef tenderloin, which was served with mashed potatoes. It was good food, just not what I was expecting. The pool is awesome! We would go down to the pool around 10:30 or 11:00 each morning and never had a problem getting a lounge chair right next to the pool. The pool loungers are great! As most reviews have stated, you can't walk the beach. But there is a beach and a lot of lounge chairs. I had no problem getting in the water and jumping waves for most the day. The only complaint I had is with the water sports. It says online and in the brochures that sea kayaks, hobbie cats, wind surfers, etc. are available for the hotel guests to use. Well, that is true, but they aren't at OUR hotel. The water sports are at the Riu Playacar. This is a 10 minute walk down the street (you can't walk down the beach) to get to the Riu Playacar. I know it is because of the lack of beach at the Palace, but there were people at our hotel renting out water sports. So, if a company can come in and charge you, why couldn't they just have the equipment for us at our hotel? The town of Playa Del Carmen is a little expensive. You can find good silver there though. Buy silver in town, NOT at the hotel! I really liked a silver bangle at the hotel and it was $168 USD. I found one very similar in a shop for $60 USD. Over all, we had a great time and loved the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place and would definitely return!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachTraveler34
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great place to stay in Playa del Carmen, and this place was everything we were looking for! We stayed for one week in late June. To start, the service was amazing. The employees at the resort all spoke excellent English, communication was easy. The resort was full when were were there, and there were plenty of hotel employees-- even at full capacity, the service was amazing! We really enjoyed the food. Believe it or not, the food at the buffet was (in our opinion) better than the restaurants. Fresh fish, scallops, crab claws, etc... every night there was something different-- not like other buffets where they fix the exact same thing every day. Go fishing and bring back some of your catch. They will cook it for you and make ceviche (BEST meal of the trip). The diving is incredible... we went with the dive group that is on site (scuba caribe) and they were very professional. We dove twice off playa and twice in cozumel. Playa is nice for diving, but if you are a diver, you are so close to cozumel ...you really should check it out!! I read the reviews on TA, and they were all correct about the hard bed. We requested a mattress pad on the first night, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The only issue we had... the air conditioner in the room stopped working properly. We reported it and it was fixed immediately. The front desk even called later that day to make sure it was corrected to our satisfaction. The hotel was very clean and had the best ocean breeze... it was great! This was not a place for kids. We hardly saw any when were were there (which we enjoyed!). There was a very small play area... but no kids were ever there. If you are going with your family, you might want to consider another place. We would both recommend this resort to others...we've even discussed returning next year to the same resort. We absolutely loved it and had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation; Tough on veggies...”
Reviews.Author: utpsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel June 20-27. We were a bit concerned by a few of the negative reviews on this site, but we did not experience any of the problems that they mentioned. The grounds are well kept up. The pool was wonderful. The beach is a bit rocky, but there are lots of palm trees on the beach and plenty of beach chairs. The service was excellent. It was nice to be able to order a drink at the bar and not worry about paying for it. The margaritas at the nightclub were pretty weak, so I took to ordering one and an extra shot of tequila that I put in myself...People were not drinking heavily, though, which was nice, so the guests were all well-behaved. My only complaint is that my wife and I are vegetarians. It is always hard to find food to eat in any resort location, so we were not that surprised, but the hotel was not great at making sure that we had enough to eat. Other hotels and cruise ships have been much more willing to go the extra mile to make sure that we had plenty of food. This hotel did do some special things, and we're grateful for that, but it was really hard to find the right person to talk to when we wanted to arrange that. Still, overall, it was a great vacation, and I would highly recommend the Riu properties in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good with a little bad”
Reviews.Author: michelleh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace June 20-June 24, 2007. A friend was getting married so 30 of her closest friends and family booked rooms there. The resort environment is low-key and relatively quiet. Don't expect to find a rowdy, party scene, which is great for couples and families. The grounds and rooms are clean and the staff is friendly enough. The pool area is very nice but does get relatively warm in the afternoon. We used that time to jump in the ocean instead. By the way, Islas was the only bartender we found who could make a good mojito. I thought the food was pretty good and I've stayed at 4 other all-inclusives before so I am able to benchmark. Only a couple of bad things: 1) Beds are hard but you can request a mattress foam. 2) If you visit any other Riu resort, they absolutely will not give you a towel so bring one from your own hotel. 3) I called the front desk at 11:20pm to set up a wake-up call. After ringing for 2 minutes, someone answered and said, "No service now" and hung up on me!! 4) Don't expect to use the kayaks or catamarans from the hotel. They make you walk down to Riu Playacar because apparently you can't launch them from our beach, but can be sailed in or out. Yeah, makes perfect sense. 5) This is the worst one - the bride and groom were in discussions over the tuxedo being cleaned and pressed from the minute they arrived at the hotel. Apparently housekeeping put it up in their closet instead of taking it and the couple didn't realize it until the night before. Thankfully they got it back in time. Then on the day of checkout, the cleaners insisted they cleaned and pressed the wedding dress although the bride did not request it nor was the service done! The hotel manager argued with my friends for an HOUR over 270 pesos (approx. $25)!!! They kept insisting they should pay for the service. There was no invoice to prove this either. I said to my friend in front of the manager to stop arguing with them, just don't pay it. You brought 32 people to their hotel spending approx. $25,000, tipped their waiters and bartenders and they want to argue with you over $25! The RIU should just eat the cost and pay those stupid cleaners. Absolutely unbelievable. What a way to end their wedding weekend. Just an FYI that my friend's co-worker got married here and said she had problems. Seems like all the employees are new around there and don't know what's going on. Overall we had a nice time despite these little things. If you are looking for a place that's not too big or small, quiet, and relaxing then this is a great place for it!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best place ever!”
Reviews.Author: graphics82
Reviews.Content: i just returned from a stay at the riu palace (jun 17 - 23), after reading many of the not so good reviews i was a little worried, but let me clear the air here. this place is truly amazing. if you have traveled at all you will know that your stay is all that you make it and if you go looking for a bad time, chances are you might find a bad time no matter how nice or well equipped the facility might be first off we arrived three hours in advance of the check-in time, the staff at the desk were courteous, welcomed us and secured our bags, and then we were handed the most glorious thing of all the wristband that allows you to partake in all the things that are laid out in front of you. i along with my fellow travelers were told to wait about an hour and half and then check back to see if our rooms might be ready. as we were simply glad to be on vacation the wait was not viewed as inconvienent, mearly the reality of arriving early. we walked around the facility and found ourselves in the sports bar where we were greeted with the first of our many helpings of nachos and beverages. we arrived back later to the front desk to be told that our rooms were indeed ready. we received our keys and went to our rooms. it was great, viewed the courtyard and was very clean. as for the smell mentioned elsewhere in reviews let me remind you are in a tropical, humid place located steps from the beach. the smell you say you experience is the ocean. it was by no means overwhelming or obnoxious. we ate at the agrave mexican resturant (amazing tapas), chilis steakhouse (great rib-eye and bacon wrapped plantains), brazilian resturant (lots of meat), and sir oliver's gourmet resturant (crepe suzette is amazing). all resturants were great food, service and appeared very nice. reservations were easy to make as long as you remembered to stop by the reservationist in the lobby between 12 - 4 pm. resturant staff was great, professional, and always willing to get you anything you needed. the pools are truly great here, the swim up bar and the tables located in the pool near the bar are great. the wait staff in the pool area are top notch as well! i have to give a shout to our best bartender arturo, if he's working you will be in good hands! the activites directors who work in the pool area are great too! crazy "i love my job!" george alone is worth visiting this place! you can choose to participate in the activities or just watch, your choice, but either way, very dedicated individuals who obviously love what they do and it shows! our beds were not hard, simply firm, i was pleasantly happy with the bed! the shows at night are a fun distraction while enjoying the night air with friends a few beverages. the beach was sufficent to enter the ocean, and yes there are some rocks but overall they are trying to rebuild as much as possible, but still a very beautiful site. the sandy area for the loungers is quite expansive and is pure white sand. the water is amazingly clear and depending on the weather can be extrememly calm or have some serious waves. there is another riu palace that you have reciprocity with, that has a great beach if you are looking for more space. we found it to be fine for our tastes, plenty of loungers both on the beach and the pool area. towels were readily available most days, just remember to either bring your towel card or your towels to exchange. all in all our trip to the riu is one that we will surely repeat in the future, if you are looking for a beautiful, well-equipped all-inclusive do not hesistate to visit the riu!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Galanti1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night vacation at this amazing resort.This resort is truly a palace.It was more than we expected.Marble and tile everywhere, along with dark wood. The lobby was absolutely breath taking. The pool was very large and extremely warm.(just the way i like it) As far as the food goes,it was awesome! Our favorite meal was at Sir Oliver's restaurant.Please make sure as soon as you arrive you make your reservations as they do tend to fill up fast.I found all the specialty restaurants to be very good.The Brazalian serves up alot of different meats on skewers,but it was delicious. The buffet was wonderful for lunch and dinner.A huge selection every day. They mixed it up somewhat.We also found the buffet to be much better for lunch than chilis.But over all, it doesn't matter where you eat you will be satisified. The people at this resort were extremely friendly and always wearing a big smile.The cleaning crew was absolutely on the ball.
