There was not a speck a dirt anywhere to be found inside or outside this resort, I kid you not.It was the most beautiful resort I have ever seen. The drinks were incredible.Claudia at the sports bar made the best pina colada's. The service at the pool could not be beat. Every time you turned around someone was asking you if you needed anything. The best part was the little cart they pushed around and stopped right in front of you and asked if you would like a drink.I loved it!!! The rooms were very nice.tile floors,double sinks and a nice balcony. Our refrigerator was always full of bottled water, corona and soda. It helps to leave a little something for the maid everyday. Also, please tip these poor people. they work so hard and they really deserve it and appreciate it very much. To sum this all up, it was the best vacation ever! If i have to complain about something, it would have to be the keys sticking, and having a little trouble getting into our room. Some times it would take as many as 10-12 tries to get in. But, we always got in without any assistance. Also, the entertainment could use a little work. Grease was good, we enjoyed that very much. I would definitely recommend this resort to friends. I can't wait to go back, it was a dream come true vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bettter than expected”
Reviews.Author: TexasHouston_Texas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week stay with 2 children. (12 and 15). Hotel and food were much nicer than I expected based on prior all inclusive experiences. Hotel is definately upscale and staff were very helpful. This hotel doesn't cater to teenagers or children so they may find it a little boring. Whole experience was kind of like an upscale cruise vacation. Positives: Food at specialty restaurants was on the whole very good. Japanesse was excellant. Brazialian very good. Staff was very helpful and I never felt pressured to tip. I did tip often however and it was much appreciated and graciously accepted. Did intro. scuba at Scuba Carribe which is in the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful although diving off the beach in Playa isn't that great of an experience. Pool was nice and frankly sedate. Negatives: Beach is small and rocky although I don't like to hangout in the sand anyway. Booking specialy restaurants: Why is this such a hasstle? Will someone please explain to me why you must go stand in line (between noon and 3 I think) to book a reservation at this type of resort? This was a hasstle because we had tours/activities scheduled most days and couldn't make the times. They do allow you to go to the buffett hostess and book for the next night, but she is unfriendly and acts like she is doing you a big favor. Overall, I would stay here again athough I doubt I will since we usually prefer to do somewhere new.

Reviews.Title: “this is a super vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: sunburn07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from June 9-15 for our 25th anniversary. It was our second time to the area and our first time at this wonderful resort. From the first moment we arrived, we felt special. we were greeted with mimosas, fresh fruit, and great service. Our room was nice (we had a garden view, but I'd suggest a courtyard view for next time) with a king bed. We asked for an egg carton topper for more comfort and the staff was quick to oblige. the food here is outstanding and the buffets had a great variety. The pool is outstanding and there are numerous chairs, umbrellas, etc. We took several walks to the local markets, and especially enjoyed the 20 minute walk to playa del carmen and the 5thave shopping area. We really went to unwind, enjoy the sun, get away from work, etc. This was the perfect spot for us and we look forward to returning. If you choose this for your vacation, you will LOVE it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay home - you are better off......”
Reviews.Author: VacationsVacations
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete horror. Terrible service, the food is horrible and it is impossible to get assistance from the hotel staff with any type of request.. The beach has been washed out. The only good thing about this place is it has a nice pool. My family booked 2 rooms (six months in advance) and we were promised in writing and over the phone that both rooms would be near each other, as I have young and teenage children who need supervision. When we arrived the hotel refused to move our rooms to be close together, as they had originally promised and we were forced to have rooms that several buildings apart or pay $50.00 addl per night, after prepaying over $10K for this entire package. My husband fell down in the pool and no one came to help or document that he fell, until several calls and many hours later. Thank god he was not hurt badly, but if he had been we would have been on our own. This place is a complete "horror" do not even consider staying here. You are better off staying home!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is amazing, but not the beach”
Reviews.Author: Elleanor
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day trip to Mexico and it was amazing! The hotel is really like a big castle. Everything inside looks really new, beautiful and expensive. The swimming pool is big and great. You really feel like a royalty when you stay in this resort. The service is really great. The workers speak english, always smile to you, usually remember who you are. The food and the drinks were simply amazing. I don't remember trying a single thing and not liking it. They have 5 a la carte restaurants which u can book every single day, but even if u don't the buffet is just as good if not better. Buffet also sometimes has theme dinners. Now the downside........the beach! I was really dissapointed to find out that the beach is so rocky that you can't go into the water or do any sort of sports there. You either have to stay by the pool or go to a different RIU resort for the beach. We went 3 times to riu palace mexico which was 10-15 minute walk. The beach there is still ruined from the hurricane of 2 years ago but at least u can swim there. About entertainment........they do have shows every night, but they are not interactive and fun. They are just beautiful shows to see and relax. There weren't a lot of people in the resort either. For young people who like to party there is a disco in riu tequila which me and friends thought that it kinda sucked, so no real partying every night. We took a club hoping tour to cancun and that was really amazing. The clubs are wild there if u like to party lke we do :) So I would recomend this hotel to older people or couples, not so much to younge people who want to party. And for the adventure loving people.......i really suggest taking the Coba adventure tour. You walk through a rainforest, zip line across a lagune, climb ancient mayan temples, and swim in a cenote(an underground cave)....its a lot of fun! If you like snorkelling, take a tour to Xel-Ha, you won't regret it! Overall I really loved my Mexican experience, because we did get to see and do a lot of things combined with a stay in a greatest hotel I've been to so far.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back from Pradise”
Reviews.Author: canadianlimey
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and it was Paradise. Having read the previous negative reviews, I can only assume that these reviews were written about another resort and not the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Maybe those people should revisit their reviews and edit them for content. The resort lives up to its name and is indeed a palace. From the moment we walked into the resort we were greeted by Alex who guided us to the lobby bar and arranged for drinks for us all. All of the resort employees were helpful,greeted us with an Ola and a smile and were only too happy to meet our every request. The food was the best, the room was stunning and the lobby.... well you will have to book and go see it. Chrystal chandeliers, marble everywhere. The resort is kept clean and tidy... there are always people cleaning, sweeping etc. The pool area was a favourite of ours and the swim up bar was fun and not crowded. We took the time to visit the other Riu properties and while they were nice they were not as grand as this resort. It was well worht the money we spent. I would return to this resort in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “What a great time at Riu Palace Riveria Maya!”
Reviews.Author: jessz1
Reviews.Content: My husband, his sister, along with myself, stayed at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya from May 20-26th. We had a great time, and wish that we'd stayed for at most 10 days instead of six. I read many reviews before leaving so was a little worried about what to expect. Once I arrived, however, I found it hard to find anything to complain about, and was very impressed. To start out, the service is impeccable. The waitstaff is very courteous and out to please. The first day we arrived, we were each greeted with a cold glass of corona, which went down smoothly. We visited the buffet that night and couldn't believe how attentive the servers were. A fork was dropped and two-seconds later they already had given my sister-in-law a new one. I took literally three sips of my wine and they were already refilling the glass! Our maid did a great job, too, at cleaning our room. Everyday we left her $2 on the bed and she always had fresh towels for us, some of which were made into cute towel-animals. I also was impressed with the service that the bartenders provided - at the lobby bar, sports bar, and daquiri bar. These people definately deserve a tip every now and then from guests because they are always hustling to serve everyone (with a smile). We expecially enjoyed how Islas at the Havana bar called everyone "captain" in his spanish accent. As for the atmosphere and food. We found the hotel to be very clean. The grounds are well-kept, the beach area with chairs (which there are plenty of) is clean, the pool is very clean (which wasn't the case for the Riu Tequilla when we were there), and our hotel room was clean. We also enjoyed the food. The buffet for breakfast, dinner and lunch always had a wide selection to choose from. Anyone who claims to be sick of the buffet should quit getting the same thing or try one of the many restaurants. It was easy to get reservations for the restaurants. You can only make two at a time, but we always stopped in the lobby around noon and got what we wanted. Our favorites were the gourmet and japanese restaurants; try not to miss these. My sister-in-law, who has never really had sushi before, nor liked the idea of trying it, loved it. None of us got sick from any of the food either, even after consuming salads and raw fruits and vegetables. What would we complain about? I guess I can offer some complaints, but they are really minor. One, we had some trouble getting our room key to work the first couple of nights. We heard that we weren't the only ones. Whenever we told the front desk they always immediately had someone up to help us. Eventually, we were able to get our key to work regularly. Two, we called prior to coming to make sure that they had our reservation. Unfortunatly, they don't have a toll free number so we had to purchase a calling card. It would be nice if they, like some other resorts in Mexico, had a toll free number. When we called, we also requested to have two double-beds and mattress toppers since we had heard that the beds are very hard. When we arrived, we found our room to have, instead of two separate double-beds, two beds pushed together with a gigantic headboard. My husband and I just slept on one side and his sister on the other, it really didn't seem worth complaining about since we got a room with such a large balcony. We also never received mattress toppers, even after making another request to the front desk when we arrived. The first night we didn't sleep well because of how hard the beds were, but evenutally you get used to it. Overall, we had a great time at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. The activities people work really hard, and even though the nightly entertainment can be a little cheesy and the daily activities can be redundant, we had fun watching the shows and playing volleyball during the day. One day we also went to the Riu Palace Mexico and discovered that we liked our place more. Although they have a larger beach area, we did not like the set-up of their pool and agreed that some areas like the blue-faded tiles that form a wall on the sides of the pool could be replaced or repainted, since they made the place look old. For three people in their late twenties, we had a great time. I would say that there were a lot of honeymooners and older couples at the Palace Riveria Maya, so if your single and looking for a mate, its probably not going to happen here. However, you will have a great time and many wonderful memories to treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Terrible Food”
Reviews.Author: bigsexynlv
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Playa Del Carmen and was less than impressed. The hotel itself was very nice and the staff was very good. However the food was terrible and the beds were so hard it was impossible to rest. We were led to believe there was room service but its a very limited menu 8 items I believe and most of it very poor. We ate at the restaurants and were expecting ala carte only to find out there are only two or three selections at each. Overall and sadly the buffet is your best bet. Don't go here for the beach it's almost non existent, very rocky and many days the red flag is up. I wish I could recommend this hotel but I can't you would be better to find a smaller local place and dine in Playa Del Carmen then to eat and stay at the Riu.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: scottbehrens
Reviews.Content: Hands down this is the nicest resort that we have stayed at. We stayed at the Riu Mexico last year, and that was great as well, but this resort was even better. Food was great, and the service was incredible. We could not smell any mold in the rooms like so many people have claimed. Clearly these people take pride in what they do. We have but a few complaints, very minor, but I'll list them anyway. 1) Yes the fridge does get loud at time. It's just a vibration issue, when you close the fridge just lift upward on the door. 2) The staff is great, but almost overbearing. If you take one sip of wine/water, they're there refilling your glass. 3) The morning we left we did not get a wake up call even though we scheduled it. We were up already so it wasn't a big deal, but clearly this could be an issue. LIke I said, overall this was an excellent experience and we will visit this resort again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: GARO50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Riu Palace-Riviera Maya from May 24 through May 27. We were somewhat concerned because of the seveal bad reviews that were posted a few weeks before we left. Since we had stayed at the Riu Palace-Las Americas in Cancun, we wanted to stay at this new Riu hotel in Playa del Carmen. There was no need to worry and it was our best vacation ever. A very clean and beautiful hotel! There is plenty of beach area with lots of chairs and palm trees available. There is plenty of beach area away from the rocks to get in the water. It seemed that there were plenty of chairs around the pool as well. The pool scene was a lot of fun. Everyone was very friendly and not stuffy. All ages were represented and everyone was having a good time. There were very few kids which we appreciated. Bar service was excellent here as well as all the other bar areas. We asked for a room with a nice view (garden view was booked which is on the outside of the hotel) and was given a suite on the end overlooking the pool. It had easy access to the pool area and the Chilis restaurant/Steak house at night. Even though we were on the end of the hotel, it did not seem like a bad walk up to the main lobby area. We did not notice excess noise or slamming of doors when we were there. The food was wonderful at the Buffet, the Steak House, and Sir Oliver's restaurant. We did not go to any other "reservation" restaurants but several said that the Japanese restaurant was good as well. Be sure to try the coconut ice cream every chance you get. There is no ice cream like it in the States. It is the very best. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Be sure to say "Hi!" to Alex the doorman. We had first met him in Cancun and it was a pleasure to see him again. Anything that you need to be replenished in your room refrigerator---just call the front desk and it will be taken care of. If you stay here at the Riu Palace-Riviera Maya then you can go visit all of the other Riu resorts that are located close by. Everything but dinner at night is all inclusive at the other resorts.. We started walking to the other resorts but it is further than you think. A taxi only costs $5 between resorts or $5 to go from this resort to 5th avenue. A pretty good deal in the sun and humidity. Again it was the best vacation ever and we can't wait to go back next year!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great food, service. and overall experience!”
Reviews.Author: CMH_ITGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 7-night stay and the experience was excellent. The room and wait staff were very friendly and responsive to our needs exhibiting an amazing memory for food/drinks preferences. Having read many reviews before arriving, I was concerned about comments concerning the hardness of the beds and potential mold/smell but fortunately I experienced none of that. I had a jr suite facing the ocean with a rather large balcony and great view. Went to the buffet nearly every night mainly because I like the flexibility of showing up when I like. The food was excellent...particularly the ice cream, butter, and beef...with a different general theme every night. Other members of the group had good experiences at the restaurants but preferred the buffet. The only significant complaint was the hall noise due to the granite and tile flooring. Heels, doors, and loud talking really reverberated. It wasn't a big issue since everything got pretty quiet by midnight. This might be an issue for those looking for all night excitement. To that end, Playa del Carmen had some fun spots recommended by a couple of staff. Overall great experience and intend to return next spring.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Coastin
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay the hotel last week. It matched our expectations. What impressed us the most was the staff and how friendly and hard they work. As mentioned, there is plenty of upper beach where we lounged and the lower beach which was better than the reviews we had read. We, and the other guests had no problems swimming everyday. Our group also took the para sailing and wave runners. You can negotiate the price. The buffet worked out great for us everyday for breakfast, lunch and snacks. We dined at the Japanese (Yashima?) and Sir Olivers and had a nice meal at both, although we thought the best part of the Japanese was the assorted sushi at the beginning of the meal. Don't be afraid to order some wine and sake... We stayed in a jacuzzi suite (there are eight), and a couple of jr. suites with balconys' and courtyard views. All very nice. The jacuzzi suite would have been better with two sinks, but still worked well for us. They are 700 sq. ft +. The problem was the beautiful wooden doors on all the rooms in the hotel. Unless you stop and hold them until they close, which we did, they make a very very large bang, which will disturb most people. The pools were fun, and not too cold this time of year. We walked down to the Riu Yucatan by beach/ocean (not recommended) and walked partially back by road as there is beach erosion in between. We had the same experience with the beach towels, but just dried out in the sun, put our shirts and sandals on and had a nice buffet lunch there and swam in the ocean. Victor in the lobby bar is very friendly and makes wonderful drinks. We gathered there before dinner in the evening. We ejoyed the fact that that there were so many people from different countrys'. We made many new friends during our stay, staff among them. The sports bar was fun for a few games of pool. We played people from other countries and made it sort of a junior olympic's, great fun. We played for free drinks of your choice. The shuttle service that the hotel uses needs to streamline their process of booking. We emailed all of our information, arrivals and departures, and still had to go to the lobby the next morning for the obilgatory tour sales pitch, not necessay, and still had to check back the day before our departure. We had two different departures and they totally messed it up. Fortunately, we were available and ready to depart, but we spend 5 hours in the Cancun airport because of their mis cue. We feel that a hotel of this caliber should automatically have concierge serive available for the guests. After all, it is a different country and situations come up. We had two, where we just needed some telephone numbers to either make dinner reservations, or contact other services. The telphone operators could not assist, and did not call back, and there are no telephone books in the rooms. It was explained to us the yellow pages in Mexico are different. Finally one of the hotel front desk staff were able to call a relative and get one of the telephone numbers for us. A concierge would have been easier for everyone and taken a lot less time for everyone. Thank you Sara and Martha. Those negatives were out weighed by the positives and we felt like we received a fair value for the price. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: dachst1432
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Mexico,but this resort was absolutely georgous. From the moment we arrived everyone treated us like royalty. We never had to wait for service. Our room was wonderful,except for the hard bed,but you can ask for a mattress pad that helps a bit. Victor is the best bartender at the pianp bar and we miss him already. He makes a strong drink,so beware! The food was very good. We ate at all of the ala carte restaurants with the exception of the Mexican. We really liked the Japanese. The buffet was always good and you could find just about anything. I would recommend this resort to anyone that wants to be pampered. We are planning our next visit for 2008!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, The Best”
Reviews.Author: nobrokenu
Reviews.Content: Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a beautiful, stunning hotel with fabulous suites (sunken living room, bedroom w/2 double beds or king, large bathroom, foyer, bar in your room w/4 liquors available, frig stocked w/water & beer. Service excellent. Clean Clean Clean. Location is wonderful, the food is out of this world, many different restaurants to choose from, all good but our favorites were the main buffet, lunch buffet & steakhouse. Chocolate fountain became a favorite stop of mine. I liked the pina coladas better from the Rui Palace Playa del Carmen a few years ago, but plenty of drinks to choose from. A dream vacation. Will definitely go back. local attractions all were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chicagosauce
Reviews.Content: I was first a little skeptical about this hotel after reading all of the negative reviews, but this place was great! I went with my mom and my 21 yr-old brother from May 8-14. We have stayed at the Iberostar Lindo twice before, and opted for the Riu this time around. It was a great change! I feel that the Riu was a smaller hotel than the Iberostar, and everything was close at hand. The entertainment staff at the Riu wasn’t as annoying as the Iberostar staff, either. If you didn't feel like doing something, they would just go around to the next person, and would leave you be. At the Iberostar, they sit there and beg you until you finally give in, and therefore, you aren't enthused to be doing what you want to be doing. The pool was excellent, and the temperature was just right. The sun chairs in the pool were a great asset. Be careful when you go to sit down @ the pool bar- if you have any momentum, you will go sliding across the stool, due to everyone's sunscreen rubbing off. However, there was a huge lack of music. It seemed that they would only play it from 11-noon, then again from 3-5ish. If you have a small battery operated speaker system (like for an ipod), BRING IT! Another gripe of the pool- there seemed to be quite the amount of smokers around, and sometimes even smoking in the pool. Also, if you have non-potty trained kids, please make sure that they are in diapers! There really isn't much of a beach, so if that is what you are looking for... The food was good and there was always something around to grab a bite of. However, if you are making reservations for dinner, there are only 2 times you can go- 6:30 or 8:45. There wasn't much night life at all. There is a show every night, but there isn't a disco or anything (but the sports bar). Luckily, town is pretty close and you can go hang out there. Overall, I really liked this hotel better than the Iberostar. It was a great place for sitting around the pool and relaxing, and having some fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for getaway”
Reviews.Author: tata4now
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this resort! Facilities- very clean, except for the sloppy smokers who throw their butts everywhere- probably the only bad thing I can say is that there we so many smokers. I guess all those who can't smoke at home lived in up while in Mexico Food- We dined at all the ala carte places and found the food to be good. Be very hungry when you go the Brazilian one, otherwise it's a waste. The buffets for breakfast and lunch had choices for everyone. Service- we bring $100 x 1 dollar bills for a week's stay so between the maid daily, luggage, dinner tips at the alacarte places and drinks, it works out fine. $1 does go a long way there. My husband;s birthday was while we were there and we came back in the evening to a festive decorated room and some chocalate dipped strawberries. Tours- we opted not to take a tour and rented a car to drive to Coba to tour the ruins there. We hired a guide while we were there for $30. If you're up to Mexican drving, you can save quite a bit doing it this way, plus no sales pitch or souvenir stops that are always included in the tours.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Joanyg
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before leaving and was a little nervous. I am glad to say that I was very happy with the resort. I have been to other all-inclusives and by far this place has better food. The staff was quite friendly and helpful. Our check-in was briefly held up, but who cares--we sat by the pool and had a snack and drinks. No yucky smells, the beach was decent enough-quite beautiful, and our fridge did not keep us up at night. We selected this hotel because we were there for a wedding, but I would definetly return on my own and recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Magnificant Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: hahah
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that this was by far the best vacation that I have ever been on!!!! We have stayed at the Riu Bambu in Punta Cana previously, and I can say withot hesitation that is an excellent company!!!!! Highly recomended!!! From the second that you walk in the lobby, you can see that it is definately a step above many other resorts! The lobby was incredible, along with the lobby bar (they make the best drinks there, and have an even better view)!! The people at the front desk were very helpful, and friendly. The check in was a breeze.We gave the guy $20, and he gave us a fountain view room (overlooking the fountains, and pool with the ocean in the distance), when we had only payed for a garden view one. The pool was incredible- the water was refreshing and there are these chairs that are half in the water, that I enjoyed laying on.There were mini jacuzis in the pool as well as a good sized swim-up bar (always good to have). On the other side of the swim-up bar , there was a pool bar. The pool was beautiful-exactly how the look in pictures. No complaints what-so-ever!! As for the food- it was also fabulous. There was an average selection for breakfast (I mean it was just breakfast - how fancy can you get???). They had the same selection everyday, but it was great tasting.The lunch buffet was also great. There was a wide variety of lunch and snack items, and a few guys making custom orders of pasta, which was satisfying. I recommend going upstairs at the lunch/snack place for a spectacular view and breeze:) And for dinner.. dinner was amazing!!! There were a wide variety of a la carte resturants (mexican, japanese, gormet, brazillian, and the streakhouse) which are all wonderful- try all of them, just make sure to make reservations in the lobby. There was also a main buffet that was pretty average by my standards. I much enjoyed the other resturants!!! The overall taste of the food was great. It was always hot, and no one i was with experienced any problems due to food. Now, the beach is the only place that wasn't as great as i thought it would be. DONT GET ME WRONG- the beach WAS beautiful so dont read this thinking that the beach was bad:D The only things that i didn't like was the large amount of coral floating in the water (ewwww) , there was a little bit of rocks in the most shallow parts of the water, and the beach itself was a little too narrow for my likings. But on the plus side, there was an addition to the beach, between the pool, and the stairs that you go down to get to the lower part of the beach (that probably sounds confusing, but once you see it you'll see what i mean). There weren't as many palm trees as i would have liked( i think they were hurt by a hurricane a while back), but i'm a bit of a palm tree lover soo.... but like i said the beach OVERALL was great!! The bars were also incredible- there is imported brand name alchohol, which believe me, makes all the difference. The drinks were always nicely made!!! Loved it!! The rooms were nicely decorated, the beds were what you expect( not horrible, not great) and the bathroom was finished nicely as well. There were no problems with the toilet, shower, etc. The overall look of this resort was very glamorus, and filled with detail. Beautiful gardens, fountains,etc. It is impossible not to fall in love with this resort!! I was there for 2 weeks, and enjoyed every second of it!!! I would go back there in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Traveling with Children, no zero entry pool”
Reviews.Author: claudia7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from RIU RM and LOVED it, but feel compelled to tell others with small children that there is no zero entry pool. This was uneasy for my husband and I as the kids played in the pool by the built-in lounge chairs, but we had to worry about them falling into the deep water constantly (which did happen once). There is a kids club with a little wading pool but truly, I can't trust complete strangers to watch my kids around water. The pool is not sectioned off from the play area, so it wasn't even a consideration for us. The place is awesome and we loved it, but bring lots of floaties with you and your own sand toys as they get expensive in the gift shop (which I didn't assume).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Doyle273
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews, I was a little worried about this hotel! Hard beds, bad food, terrible beach, no english speaking personnel etc. Not to worry!!! This place is a dream come true!! The hotel itself is wonderful. It is definately a 5 star hotel. Right from the time you walk in the lobby to the time you leave, the staff can not do enough for you. If there is ANYTHING you need, they are happy to provide. First, the hard beds - My husband and I both said that they beds were slightly firm, but did not stop you from getting a good nights sleep. If the beds are hard, they will provide an egg crate cushion for you. The sheets were clean, crisp and did not have an odor. Now the food - First let me tell you that my husband does not eat much. VERY PICKY eater!! My husband thought the food was wonderful. With the buffet, you can have anything you want, as much as you want and all food that we tried was very good. We only went to the steak house, Chilis, the first night. The steak was very tender and delicious. Breakfast was wonderful also. All types of foods, eggs prepared anyway you would like, bacon, sausage, hashbrowns, cereals, yogurt and all types of toppings, breads and rolls (fantastic) bagels, meats and cheeses for sandwiches, etc. Coffee was very good!!!! Beach - if you like the beach and the water, it was a little hard to get to the water when you go past the wall. We swam in the ocean once and decided that we liked the pool much, much better. No salt water in the pool!!! Although if you just like the feel of the sand and laying out, there is an enormous area of beach that you can lay out at. Pool - Very large!! They have water activites every day. The sun loungers in the pool are a bit hard to lay on, but great for getting a wonderful tan!! The swim up pool bar is great. Sit in the water and have a few ice cold beverages to cool you down. In regards to the staff not speaking English - You are in a different country!!!!!!!!! If you want English then stay in the states. The staff knew enough english to get by. Besides - learn a little spanish before you go. Everyone says Hola to you so get used to it. Be friendly and respond with Hola!! Also take along $1.00 bills to tip the staff. They work long hard hours and greatly appreciate the tips. The activites staff work from 9:00 AM until 2:00 AM!!!!!!! They are wonderful and always try and get you involved in activities. The shows at night, put on by the activities staff are not professional, but good. They work very hard at these and deserve great applause. As you can tell by my review, my husband and I would go back tomorrow if we could!!!!!!! The only down side, and this is not the hotels fault, is the people who are ignorant and leave cigarette butts all over, on the concrete walks by the pool, all over the grounds etc. The staff does a great job cleaning, and is ALWAYS CLEANING, but the guests need to be a bit more tidy themselves!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our 2 weeks at the Riu Palace (9th - 23rd April) and cannot fault the Hotel, or the staff, or the food - it was all 5*. It was a beautiful hotel, well laid out and very attractive with an amazing lobby. The bedroom was big - with a large bathroom with twin basins and whirlpool bath. The food was excellent and offered almost anything you wanted to eat - including Mexican food even for breakfast (not just tortillas)! Booking a table for the specialist restaurants was easy and not the big hassle it is made out to be - try smiling and being courteous to the Reservations lady! The staff were genuinely friendly, and when treated with respect, they went out of their way to help. The only negatives were inconsiderate people shouting/talking loudly in the corridors, not dressing for dinner, and yes the fridge was very noisy!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation - RUI palace not worth the price though”
Reviews.Author: T_O_boise
Reviews.Content: Will keep this brief. This is not meant to be a negative review, but I just want to reinforce what others have stated about the not so positive aspects of the RUI Palace. Final opinion: Had a great vacation (always do), beautiful resort, not worth the price, nor does it yet deserve the 5 star + rating. (Opinions based on extensive travel experience, staying in all kinds of hotels and resorts and having been to many all-inclusives in Mexico and the Carribean). Yes, the beach is not great (no fault of the resort, result of the 2005 Hurricane), but still had the opportunity to spend a whole morning swimming. The restaurant and bar staff work very hard and provide excellent service - no complaints. Food better than most all-inclusives and comparible to many cruises we have been on. The rooms (which are important to many) are not condusive to relaxing and sleeping soundly - very noisey as the halls are enclosed and the walls are thin so every small noise (I mean every noise!) echos in the room from the hall and between rooms (many people would leave their room door slam shut which would boom down the hallways). We have never experience this anywhere we have stayed - seemed to be the result of a bad design and cheap construction. Maid service inconsistent - and yes the towels were frayed and stained! It sounded trivial when I read the reviews before leaving about the running toilets, but we were travelling with my in-laws and they had one of these noisey toilets, and it was an annoyance - expected more from a relatively new resort. Front desk staff not very helpful and responsive - as someone said everything based on congeniality, but no action taken when something brought to their attention. Example: we were locked out of our room for about an hour on our last night because the our lock malfunctioned (even though Maid Service reported it at 11:00, maintenance staff didn't show up until 5:30 when we just arrived back from a day at the pool and discovered we couldn't get in our room at the same time). It subsequently took several calls and visits to the front desk, who seem oblivious and indiffernet to the whole matter to get access to our room, and then to get maid service to come to make up our room after 6:00 p.m. Also, we had three maintenace men in our room taking our lock apart and discussing the problem as we tried to pack and get ready for our last dinner, while the maid staff made up our room. Even though a vist during all of this from the Hospitality Manager, Stephanie, seemed like responsive action it was more smoke and mirrors about acknowleging the problem rather that taking action and trurly understanding the issue about why it took nearly 6 hours for maintenance to show up after the problem was reported, which in my opinion deserved all little more serious attention. My final piece of advice is if you are planning at staying at the RUI Palace you will have most likely have a good vacation. You would really have to try not to. If you are expecting an excellent vacation based on price and reputation you maybe a little disappointed, so don't base you decision soley on these factors.

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed”
Reviews.Author: TxSouthernbelle1
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is beautiful the service and some other issues would keep me from staying or recommending this place to anyone. First, the level of customer service is not in-line with the cost associated with this hotel. Second, there were plumbing issues several days during our stay. Myself and a number of other guests experienced stopped up or overflowing toilets-gross! Also, one morning we awoke to a hallway that was flooded from a toilet overflow-again I say gross. Lastly, the food we had was not memorable at all! There were 15 other couples staying at this hotel and I can honestly say not one was pleased with the service or food considering price.

Reviews.Title: “Where's Mexico?”
Reviews.Author: blahblahblurp
Reviews.Content: Did I seriously even leave the states? This place is like a great big elaborately frosted cake that tastes like absolutely nothing. To be fair, apparently I'm just not a resort kind of girl, so it's very possible that the Riviera Maya really is the cherry on top when it comes to these sorts of travel destinations. But I have to wonder why anyone would go through all the bother of leaving their own country just to end up somewhere so nondescript? Let's begin with the food since so many people seem to think it's great. First of all, good luck getting any regional dishes on the buffet line. Oh yeah, except for the nacho chips with stadium-grade cheese sauce. Fortunately, if you do actually find yourself in the mood for something bordering on Mexican food, the Mexican restaurant usually has reservations available. Ironically, most people seem more interested in dining at the Japanese or Brazilian spots during their trip to Mexico. ??? If your culinary standards rest on the availability of all-you-can-eat buffets and convenience, you'll probably love the food. Don't forget to grab a stale Little Debbie croissant with your coffee. Or twelve. And now the hotel. The bed IS rock hard, but they stock your in-room fridge with Corona and water so it's pretty easy to overlook this minor detail. The rooms themselves are very nice and while you'll probably have an ant or two roaming the floors, step back and remember you are at the beach in Mexico. Those musty smells? Result of being at the beach in Mexico. You want everything sterile, take a trip to Disneyland. The service. Awesome but you get the feeling they're trained during orientation to say "hola" everytime a guest walks by in order to add to the "cultural authenticity" of the place. I realize that sounds incredibly pessimistic, but you'll see what I'm saying if you go. Nonetheless, everyone we came across was very helpful and sweet. (But the "gratuity included" claim is false unless you like being the jerk.) In closing, quantity vs. quality. What do you prefer? And do you really want to visit Mexico? Because anything on 5th Avenue would be way more fun, way more interesting, a lot less expensive, and a million times more Mexican than Riu Palace Riviera Maya. (Not that Playa del Carmen isn't by definition going to be "touristy" to a certain degree--but at least you'll know you're somewhere other than L.A.) P.S. If you do still decide to go, walking on the beach doesn't exist. You'll always find a lounger on the beach because most people were more interested in the pool than the crystal clear ocean 10 ft in front of them (???), but a stretch of sand doesn't exist. And walk to town. It takes all of 10 minutes. Straight out the front door and to the right. That's where the monkey is. P.P.S. They seem to have a problem with keys. We were greeted one morning by a lady who mistook our room for hers and used her key to walk right in (poor thing was very embarassed, but not her fault!). Take the safe to heart. P.P.P.S. You'll have fun regardless of all of this if you've got good traveling companions. There are Corona taps all over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place - Terrible Beach”
Reviews.Author: LoonSong
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an awesome week at Riu Palace Riviera Maya and have spent a week editing several hundred photos. The weather was beautiful and the resort absolutely gorgeous and the food and service were great. The beach was large and plentiful for the first two days of our stay but by day three the wind and surf had changed direction causing the beach to totally disappear overnight down to sandbags. According to people at the sailing signup hut - this is an ongoing problem and is totally at the mercy of the wind direction , when the wind comes in from the north east for several days straight, the beach erodes when the wind begins pushing the tides from the other direction the beach rebuilds itself. The resort also lost it's boat launching area thus cancelling all catamaran and wind surfer use for the remainder of our stay. If you are a beach lover or a boating / sailing enthusiast, this is not the resort for you. At all times, the resort is cut off from any length of beach to walk on due to the sea walls of neighboring resorts running out into the water. I'm including a link to my website which includes a photo of the beach after the erosion had occurred. Enjoy the photos at http://loonsong.smugmug.com/ and click on the Mayan Riviera Album.

Reviews.Title: “Just not a palace”
Reviews.Author: Happytravels77
Reviews.Content: I booked the Riu Palace Riviera Maya because the original Riu Palace Mexico was full. Having read the reviews from other Tripadvisor readers I kind of knew what to expect. Advice for those going. This hotel is not to the same standards of other Riu Palaces. The beach is virtually non existant due to the hurracane. The resort is specially created with hotel after hotel, all very nice but does not feel like "real mexico" The food is ok, again not like the other Riu Palace Hotels we have been in in the past. WARNING : Book an interior room. If you do not your room will overlook another hotel. The interior rooms have a 50 dollar per night charge but are much much nicer. POSITIVE Playa del Carmen is lovely with some great shops, the staff are excellent, you can use the other Riu Hotels on the strip apart from evening mela. THE RIU PALACE MEXICO is far superior and the beach great. Overall we had a really nice holiday and met some great people, it just was not the Riu Palace promise as we have had at other hotels in this group.

Reviews.Title: “You'd better love the Americans or they'll drive you mad!”
Reviews.Author: Stilljetlagged
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a two week stay at this hotel. Had visited the resort twice before and stayed in Riu properties but this was our first stay at a Palace hotel. On reflection I wish we'd opted for the Riu Palace Mexico. The Palace Riviera Maya is a beautiful hotel, we had no problems with our room and, contrary to many reports on this site, I found the bed very comfortable. The food, particularly in the buffet, was excellent and despite the negative feedback, we had no problems with the booking process for the a la carte restaurants. My main issue was the fact that the whole resort was overrun by American tourists. Don't get me wrong I'm not anti American by any means, but they were absolutely overwhelming - so loud, so rude and so totally inconsiderate of everybody else around them. Every spare space on the beach was taken up by groups throwing a football, throwing a baseball, throwing a frisbee with no concern if it hit relaxing tourists and why did they need to keep up a running commentary all the time??!! Having spoken to fellow Brits, it appears that this was also the case in the pool area, despite the fact that the pool guidelines stated that no ballgames were permitted. If you complained you were laughed at and told to move in no uncertain terms. We were also very disappointed that the dress standards had been dropped in the restaurants to accommodate the fact that the American tourists were incapable of dressing smartly - they don't seem to understand the difference between smart and expensive. If you want to visit a hotel with high levels of customer service, high standards from its staff and the hotel guidelines strictly adhered to then go to the Riu Palace Mexico down the road. We went there on a couple of occasions during our stay and found it a much more pleasant environment.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with loud refrigerators”
Reviews.Author: TXPlaya2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace the firt week of April for a wedding. I read several of the reviews of the hotel prior to departure and for the most part I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is gorgeous and the grounds are impeccable. The staff was very friendly and attentive. The beaches leave a little to be desired. I came to Playa in 2003 and the change in the coast line is dramatic!! It rained the first night of our stay and the next morning a huge chunk of beach was gone! Not really the hotels doing but unfortunate nonetheless. The food was pretty good overall, nothing spectacular, and it was very fresh. We ate at the Brazillian and Mexican restaurant and both were quite tasty. My only real complaint was the very loud refrigerator in the room. It seemed to rumble and wheeze at 4:00am every night!!! I didn't make that sound at any other time. My boyfriend hated the bed and made me promise to make note of it in my review. I thought it was ok but it was definately on the firm side. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “beware, if you go for nice food and service Ill give it a 5, - beach is 1....”
Reviews.Author: schlumbeb
Reviews.Content: great hotel and food- two main compaints, do not go there for the beach, because there is none-- second noise level is huge-- if y ou want peace and quiet, do not go there or as a matter of fact do not go anywhere an hour before that hotel of after that hotel--- third complaint , setting lacks of natural surrounding and you could be in the south of France or anywhere where palms trees are planted-- no tropical garden at all,,, 5th avenue in playa Carmen is a pain-- expensive and too busy-- on the positive note, service is great, food is great and hotel staff very helpfull-- mostly disappointed with the lack of beach --

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lmwOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Place Riviera Maya on Mar 24-29. Although the hotel is beautiful, I feel this place way way overpriced and not up to par with Apple's 6 Golden Apple rating. For all-inclusives, we have stayed in a Sandals in St. Lucia and the Iberostar Bavaro (also 6 Golden apples) in the Domican Republic. Both of those places were much nicer and more comfortable. The beaches in the Dominican are amazing. Food in the Brazilian restaurant was awful. The Buffet nightly was better. The buffet in the morning at at lunch were very nice. Some difficulties getting our room cleaned. The toilet ran and ran. The fridge made wierd noises (kept us awake) and we asked for fixes -they didn't happen. The walls were paper-thin. We could hear everything in the halls - lots of crying babies and kids running around screaming through the halls. The bed was like a slab of concrete. I typically stay in high-end inns & hotels with comfortable accomodations - this is *supposed* to be high-end and was not comfortable. Towels were stained and frayed. Sink was smashed. Shampoo dispenser broken. I was surprised since this place has only been open a year. Overall, the wait staff really try to please and always have a smile on their faces. They are really good about coming around with drinks in the pool area. We took an Apple excursion to Chichen-Itza - highly recommended. It was an all-day affair, but worth it. Included lunch, a swim in a Cenote and a movie on the bus on the way back. A bit of culture shock for me --- Mexican police (in Playa Del Carmen) and army guys (at a checkpoint on the way to Chichen-Itza) wear automatic weapons! They must have a need to use them??? We took the ferry to Cozumel - a waste of time. The city where the ferry leaves you is a dump. The ride on the ferry is very rough - I guess it's always that way. They handed out vomit bags. If you are going to snorkel or dive, I guess Cozumel is the place to go for that ... but no point in going there if you're not going to dive. Playa Del Carmen is fun to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Travelled with Children (honest review)”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravel7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya the first week of April. We have been to 3 other Riu properties in Mexico but this was our first Palace. I would say that the hotels are very similar but the service is better at the palace. Waiters are always coming up to you to see if you need a drink or anything else. If you are travelling with kids, you may want to consider another Riu Property. There is NO childrens pool and we basically spent the week "on guard" making sure the kids didn't fall into the deep end. The only place for them to swim was the shallow area where the lounge chairs are built into the pool and there was always someone who didn't want to get splashed while laying in the pool - give me a break (there was a baby pool, but I've seen bigger puddles on the street). This brings me to another quick point, if you don't want to hear or be bothered by children on your holiday, book an adults only resort - there are so many 5 star resorts to choose from. Don't go to one with children and then look bothered by them. Children pay almost as much as an Adult rate and they are entitled to everything available to them, including the pool bar - they don't just serve alcohol there (by the way the drinks are great). The food was great and we found the buffet was the best place to eat simply because of the variety, you could always find something you liked. We only had one bad dining experience and that was at the Mexican specialty restaurant . My husband and I orderd the steak and it tasted alive. Our room was lovely, but there was quite a few ants crawling around. We were on the ground floor so I'm thinking that's prbably the reason. The cleaning lady was good, though I have no idea if it was the same lady everyday or not. Sometimes she would leave "towel puppets" on the bed for the kids and sometimes she wouldn't ( we left a tip for her everyday). The grounds are spotless and the pool is huge. There is room for everyone, but you have to get up early to reserve a lounge chair with a towel or you probably won't get one by the pool. They go fast. While we were there, there was a huge group of about 12 or 15 people that travelled together. Every morning they would take up that many lounge chairs and they would only use about four the entire day because they'd either be at the bar or just wandering around , very inconsiderate to other guests. The beach- if you are a beach person ( I am) , YOU WILL BE very dissapointed. The shore is covered with HUGE rocks. You can hardly get in for a swim. We watched a man try to do it and he fell and hurt his leg. We had to walk a few minutes to the next hotel for a safe swim. If you decide to walk over, don't bring anything with you because they will not let you put anything on their lounge chairs. Just go for your swim and come back. I guess this sort of sounds like a negative review but we really did have a good time. I've pointed out what I believe to be the flaws of the hotel but everything else was fantastic and I probably would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Please! Please! Please! pay attention to the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: wishwehadadoover
Reviews.Content: Please pay attention to the negative reviews!! My husband and I have been to several all-inclusive resorts in both Jamaica and Mexico and have never been so disappointed! I, like many others was just thrilled to be getting to go on vacation, so I very much wanted to believe that this resort was going to be wonderful like all of the rest that we have been too. (However, we had never been to any RIU properties) I read the reviews and did not want to believe any of the bad reviews!! I did not even want to look at them because reservations were made and we were looking forward to our trip. However, in hindsight now, how I wish I would have paid more attention to those negative comments. I thought to myself, how could anyone be soooo picky, I mean just look at the pictures! Well, that is just it, this resort is all about CONGENIALITY! The resort is gorgeous, but everything else is very disappointing. I would write more about my personal experience, but the negative reviews that have already been written are right on!! I couldn't have said most of them better myself. It is too late for my husband and I but maybe not for you, so please pay attention and read all of the negative ones, even if you think the people are being picky and even if you see all of the 4 and 5 reviews. This resort is way too expensive not to! (and it is too late after you return) :(

Reviews.Title: “Family in our 30's, traveling with children, and our experience”
Reviews.Author: Shell3332
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Riu Palace Mayan Riviera. Food at the buffet was excellent including all you could eat stone crab claws one evening, a Chinese Buffet evening with everything you could imagine, and if you are not a foodie than there is always pasta, salads and fruit. This resort gets a lot of negative reviews about the food, but I have to say if you are only eating hamburgers every day, then you're probably going to give it negative reviews. We saw countless adults eating hot dogs and pizza, never experimenting with local cuisine or with even the German Cuisine (as this is a German Hotel Chain). The beach in Playacar is having very bad erosion issues. If you are a beach family, I would suggest traveling to other areas such as North of Playa Del Carmen to the Iberostar or to the Mayakoba area. The staff was hard working and helpful throughout our stay. Our children enjoyed attending the children's camp which runs from 10 to 12:30 and from 3 to 4:30 each day. Then they have a kids disco at night for 45 minutes, so it allows the parents to have some downtime throughout their stay. These children's activities are all included in price (they played soccer, ping pong, swimming, art classes, dancing, volleyball). Drinks could of been more interesting and not as watered down as I'd like. The Margarita's were not good at all, and the only beer in the complex is Corona. Would of been nice to have a selection! We would definitely stay again if the beach situation improves, but it doesn't appear that the hotel chains (Occidental, Riu, Wyndam) are doing anything about it, and the government isn't fixing it. We will head much further south next time or north.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time!!”
Reviews.Author: ColdinPgh
Reviews.Content: After reading the past reviews we had a few hesitations about going to the resort. Luckily we had a wonderful time. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, very formal. If you are looking for a hotel with open plaza's and lots of foliage, this is not the place. If you are looking for air conditioning and gorgeous tile and chandaliers, this is the place. The hotel is still relativly new, so everything is not fully grown. The pool bar is great. We loved the tables in the pool in front of the bar. Very fun!! The Mojito's are great. I think the food was great!! Everything from pasta, pizza, fresh fish, paella, croissants, breads, meats, huge salad bar, all the guacamole you can eat, chips, and so on.... I could go on and on. I loved the mimosas for breakfast. The rooms were great, very clean, our mini bar was filled with water every day. The beds were a little hard as noted earlier, all we did was ask the front desk for egg cushions for the beds, much better. Definately go into Playa Del Carmen and try the bar with the swings. So much fun!! The stores can be talked down with price, never accept the first price they tell you. The best part of the trip was the day trip scheduled through [--]. Eddie, one of the owners was wonderful. It may seem a little shady at first, he cannot pick you up at the entrance of your hotel, but it is completly safe. We went with only 3 women and felt completly safe. Eddie is wonderful, he is so knowledgable about the area and the people. He took us to an underground river to snorkel, then showed us a wonderful beach that is reserved for sea turtles, gorgeous, then off to a bay to snorkel with Sea Turtles. In the past the tour guides always assure us we will see Turtles, we never believe them, but Eddie did not lie. We got to swim with about 8 or 9 turtles, they were beautiful!! So fun!! After that, we did not think he could top the day, until he took us to the cutest beach bar for lunch. Authentic Mexican food, gorgeous views, and of course cold beers. The beach bar had swings at the bar instead of chairs, so fun. Only a local knows of the great hidden places. The afternoon was more snorkeling at a lagoon, nothing could compare to the Sea Turtles though. We had a wonderful time, Eddie is the best. Go to the web site and you can see pictures and info about the day trips. I would suggest this trip over the big ones scheduled at the hotels. We had individual attention, he answered all of our questions, he was great!! If you have any questions please email me and I can answer them. carolinatwin2000@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding, lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: DaveNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. The hotel is beautiful and Stephanie Weffer (Assistant Manager) and her staff did all they could to ensure our stay and the wedding that we were attending at the hotel went well. The wedding was held in the gazebo near the pool and in front of the beach. The staff had everything set up perfectly. The hairdresser at the spa was amazing and did a fabulous job on our daughter's hair. The mariachi band added some extra ambiance to the wedding. We truly thank the hotel staff for all they did to make this a special day for our family. Now, some overall comments about the resort: The food was surprisingly good. There was always an excellent variety both at the specialty restaurants and at the buffet. It was always fresh and plentiful. Serving staff were well trained and even pulled out your chairs at the buffet. The upper beach is lovely and no difficulty finding chairs there or at the pool despite the hotel being full. One thing we really noticed was the lack of annoying beach vendors. This was greatly appreciated. The lower beach at the hotel was almost non existent but you could still get in the water easily. If you do want to walk on the beach you can walk 10 minutes down the road to the Riu Palace Mexico and walk on their beach to your heart's content. (enroute you pass a great little shopping area too) The hotel animation staff worked hard all day at activities on the beach and at the pool and it seemed all night too at the theatre area. We appreciated their friendliness and their energy. Although not a late night place (go into town for night life) they always had some children's entertainment each evening followed by a band and some evening show. Unfortunately the bands did not inspire us to dance and we did miss that opportunity. We did not see all the shows but the couple of shows we did get to were very good. The hotel is ideally situated to walk into town. It was only a 15 minute walk and you pass some small ruins on the way. If you prefer a taxi is only a $5 US cab ride. We truly enjoyed our trip and would go back to this area and a Riu again. Dave and Sue Nova Scotia, Canada

Reviews.Title: “First Class And Much Fun!”
Reviews.Author: wolfie555
Reviews.Content: Hello, I hope you find my review and suggestions helpful. In one word I can some it up, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is "Outstanding!" From the moment you enter this grand hotel, to the time you leave, RPRM will satisfy the most demanding traveler. My fiance and I began our week's vacation departing Dallas/Ft. Worth on American Airlines 9:30 am, arrived about 12:30 pm in Cancun. We had booked private transportation through Getdita. They were waiting for us as we walked out the doors of the airport. Getdita has a website and their rates are fractionally more than shared transportation, I highly recommend them. I like that I do not have have to waste time waiting for people and stopping at many other hotels to let them off. Most importantly, I book my return flights as late in the day as possible and having the private transportation will allow you to enjoy more time at your resort with out having to leave hours early. Please beware at he airport in Cancun, of the timeshare people in the baggage claim area, they will ask you what hotel you are going to and lie telling you that they are your transportation. Just respectfully say no thank you and continue outside. Riu Palace Riviera Maya is located in Playacar, a private subdivision just south of Playa Del Carmen, It is a beautiful area with private homes and other hotels. As I arrived to RPRM the first words out of my mouth was "wow!" It has a majestic look. Marble and wood everywhere. Beautifully decorated. We were greeted handed a beverage and lead to the front desk where our check in was done with in 10 minutes. I asked if there were any rooms on the top floor available and sure enough my request was granted. As a Riu Class member, I knew from previous experience to ask for a mattress topper when I had made my reservations. Yes the beds are firm, known as European standard,I prefer it a little softer, however, once the foam egg crate mattress pad is on, I would sleep very well. The room was clean and nicely appointed and had a great view of the courtyard and the Caribbean Sea, I could see Cozumel in the distance. One quick story to begin, our first night we came back to our room about midnight, I opened the door and immediately saw the closet open and safe open. I left the safe open! The safe is in direct view as you open the main door having the closet open. Nothing was taken! We had our passports, bundles of cash in plain sight as well as our jewelry. The maid was most definitely in our room for the beds were turned down and the extra towels were brought as per my request. We were very fortunate to have someone with such integrity. Yes, I rewarded her for her kindness, but none the less, we were fortunate. The food at RPRM was great! I eat well and as my close friends would tell you that my brain is in my appetite. I can't be live from reading some of the reviews that one could not find and enjoy something in this wonderful place. Breakfast is a breakfast lovers dream, fresh fruit smoothies, eggs prepared to order with all the compliments, waffles/pancakes,fresh fruit etc... Lunch was served in the Grill and Steakhouse, close to the pool and beach area, every day, having different main dishes from which to choose. I found fresh fish, paellas, veal, pastas, too much in a good way. Dinner in the alacarte restaurants is a must. First of all the reservation complaints from some of the reviews is ludicrous. It is as simple as can be, all you need to do is go to the lobby bar between noon and 4pm and make reservations for 2 of the following nights. If one place is booked go to another and ask kindly to dine at that restaurant on another evening during your stay. It will take all of 5-10 minutes. (enjoy a cup of coffee or a frozen cocktail while waiting, you are on vacation) Find out which nights are the themed nights at the Don Manolo, the main dining room, and schedule your dining around it. The Don Manolo had a chef's night which was awesome. I am critical when it comes to buffets, this place will not disappoint. They have several cooking stations and are constantly replenishing other buffet stations keeping the food fresh and hot. Save room for desert! Some people were complaining that the desserts were not sweet enough, I actually prefer it this way not to over power the true taste instead of having a spoonful of sugar. Sir Oliver, the gourmet restaurant, is as good as the description states. As you walk in you are served a glass of champagne. I was also impressed that they served Chilean wines. Service, first class. Brazilian Rodizio was a meat lovers dream. You will start at the soup and salad bar, so don't fill up too much, then the waiters come to your table with skewers and slice off several types of meats, chicken and sausage accompanied by fresh vegetables. Again very good. We have eaten at the Japanese restaurants in other Rius so we passed this time. As for my past experience it is great if you are into fresh sushi and sashimi as well as some of your other Japanese favorites. Others at RPRM spoke highly of Yashima. We ate at the Agave which is their Mexican restaurant, and the Grill/Steakhouse, both very good. In the early evening, there is some live music in the courtyard and a pianist in the lobby bar. Every morning we worked out in an air-conditioned gym with plenty of equipment for a well rounded exercise program. Please do yourselves a favor and schedule a massage at the Renova Spa. Kristen and I had a couples massage and we came out feeling like a wet noodles. They were really good. Let me explain that there is plenty of beach and chairs but there were a lot of rocks in the water, apparently mother nature took the sand away by the shore. Not to worry, facing the ocean, go to the right, cutting through the Lupita's beach and grill area, and you will be able to swim. The other option which we did on several occasions was to go out of the main entrance of the hotel, make a left, and take a short 5 minute walk to the other Riu properties. There is also a shopping pavilion on the way, a great place for the souvenirs. We had lunch at Riu Palace Mexico and swam at their beach. You will also enjoy the beach at the Riu Yucatan. The pool at RPRM was great, there are built in sun loungers in the pool. Pool bar friendly and poured stout drinks. Make sure you ask for the call brands. I took advantage of the frozen drinks made with Havana Club rum. Entertainment was very good, not what you would expect from an all inclusive package. These kids are very talented. We would find out what shows are playing at the different Rius and go to which ever one caught our interest. Playa Del Carmen is with in safe walking distance, however, we opted for a cab, only $5us. We walked up 5th avenue and back on the beach, had lunch at The Blue Lobster. Ordered the lobster bisque and of course, a 3.5lb lobster! Playa was nice but a little too commercialized. Back at the RPRM, through out the day you will see the workers constantly cleaning the property and they seem to take the time to say "hola" as you pass by them. The staff and service was excellent. I noticed some people being rude to the staff, if you speak to them kindly and respectfully, they will treat you like royalty. Please bring some change to tip, these people work so hard, they deserve a little extra. I was so spoiled by the service we received, that it will be difficult to top. I have been fortunate to be well traveled and have stayed in the more known world class hotels, you will not be disappointed here. As you can tell, I am a Riu fan. With in a year's time we have stayed at the Riu Ocho Rios, Jamaica, Riu Palace Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, Riu Palace Punta Cana,Dominican Republic, and next month, Riu Palace Las Americas. Our experience at their other properties have been so good that we have recommended our friends. Kristen and I were engaged at the Riu Palace Cabo San Lucas and have booked our up coming wedding there as well. I do not know of any higher recommendation I can give to this hotel or any of the Rius we have visited. Thank you for reading my review and I am quite sure you will have a wonderful time staying at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a 5 Star!”
Reviews.Author: HGeorges
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. If it wasn't for the sunny and warm weather, the holiday would have been miserable. The property has a beautiful facade and the interior courtyard is striking with a European flair. Long narrow fountain pools lead to a large pool area with close proximity to the beach. The resort is large but everything is easily accessible. Unfortunately, those were the only positives. I was surprised that previous reviews didn't mention that the hotel has very dark interior (almost gloomy) hallways - not what one would expect in Mexico in a brand new resort. The front desk staff said that this is typical of Riu "Palaces." Many lightbulbs in the hallways were burnt out and not changed throughout our 10 day stay. Security was minimal - there is someone standing on the driveway to the property but anyone can wander into the resort. The hotel is situated within the Playacar Village which is a highly travelled residential and resort area adjacent to Playa del Carmen. Doors to hotel rooms do not have peepholes/viewers. Although warned about it, the mustiness and mold smell in the lobby and rooms was overpowering. You get use to it while you're there but it lingers with you and your belongings when you return home. Front desk staff were not accommodating in many instances. It took over 2 hours to have someone repair a toilet despite repeated calls to the front desk (there is no dedicated housekeeping line). In general, housekeeping was poor. Rooms weren't cleaned until very late in the day. Towels in room and pool area were frayed and stained. Again, not acceptable for a brand new, "5" star resort. Food was OK and varied but not outstanding. Reservation restaurants were poor except Japanese which was good. Reviews are all relative to what you're accustomed to. Perhaps for those who have never been to an all-inclusive resort, this would have been a positive experience. However, this property is way overpriced for what you are getting. We stayed at the Iberostar Paraiso Lindo for 2 years prior and it is way nicer with much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Like Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: lilrachie7
Reviews.Content: To keep this short & sweet. The Riu Palace Riviera Maya, is a great resort. The location is perfect not to far away from the airport and about 10-15 minute walk into Playa Del Carmen, which I recommend everyone do atleast once. Playa Del Carmen is a great town. If you have a change to go eat at La Parrilla... GOOD mexican good! The Mayan resort is unbelievable as well. My boyfriend and I stayed at the resort from Feb. 5th-12th. The food was average for all-inclusive though the restaurants that make reservations for are good. THE BEACH IS STILL BEAUTIFUL REGARDLESS OF THE PROBLEMS WITH THE BEACH EROADING. THERE ARE PARTS YOU CAN GO IN THE WATER AND THE WATER IS CLEAR AND VERY WARM. ALL IN ALL, WONDERFUL PEOPLE & PLACE. WOULD STAY AGAIN IN A HEART BEAT....

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: stroutmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 3/7-3/13. Had to call for small little room problems such as running toilets and tvs not working....We had to switch one of our rooms as the ceiling above the tub started leaking. Also had a blackberry stolen from one of our other rooms even though it occured in a one hour span that only the housekeeper was in the room. The hotel people were less than helpful. We were a group of 7 and 1 of us did not get her luggage, still does not have it. (although this is no fault of the hotel). TNT travel did not make themselves available for assistance as I was told they would be. The reviews here are basically very accurate from the musty smell, to the lack of nightlife. There is a beach and a place to swim in the water. The workers work very hard and aim to please. I have been to the Iberostar Paraiso maya so I have something to compare to and Im afraid this was a definite second in that department.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Kitcatatwork
Reviews.Content: We along with another couple stayed at the Rui Palace Maya Feb 25 - Mar 11. We found the hotel to be very accomodating when possible right from the moment we checked in to when we checked out. We were encouraged once a week during dinner to fill out surveys and any complaint and/or suggestion we had was applied the following day. The food at the buffet for breakfast and dinner was superb! We did Chilis buffet for lunch only. We did do the Japanese, Brazilian and Gourmet and found them to all be very good. Our rooms were nice, beds are hard, but we have slept on worse. The housekeeping generally did a very good job with the odd day here and there of us having to request towels as they seemed to be overlooked at times. The beds were always turned down at night and additional towels placed in the bathroom when needed. The rooms were clean. The bar fridge in your room is replenished every morning and you only have to ask for your preference and it is met with no objection. The pool area gets a little crowded and yes, you do have to head out early in the morning usually 6:00 am to reserve your loungers, but should you not be successful, there are plently of loungers on the beach and the new palms have grown enough now to offer plently of shade when needed. We had an inicident which required the services of the hotel doctor. When contacted he arrived within 15 minutes and had a great "bedside manner" and everything was taken care of and we were able to enjoy the rest of our trip. The staff of this hotel is very congenial, professional and try to help you enjoy and make the most of your holiday. The entertainment staff is small, but they are very energetic and sociable and want you to have fun. Teresa is the team supervisor and ensures that Edna, Roman, Ely, etc. are doing their jobs.....in fact they do them so well, you can't help, but to laugh! The Lobby lounge is a nice place to meet when meeting up with someone or just waiting for your dinner reservation. The piano can get a bit loud and makes talking difficult. The Sports Bar is open 24 hrs should you feel yourself in need of a midnight snack or not want your evening to end you may continue drinking while you play pool (you have to pay to play the game). There are also internet services and games you can pay to use as well. It does get a bit smokey in here. It was great for us since some of the kids came in for spring break and tended to stay in this room which left the rest of the hotel much quieter! Staying at the Palace Maya allows you to use all 6 of their other resorts. The disco, which is at the Riu Tequilla tends to be very smokey and the young people tend to frequent this place. We found it easier to walk (or a $5.00 US taxi ride) to Play del Carmen to enjoy some of the night clubs there. Fifth Avenue is the strip to be on. Should you also care to dine outside the restaurant once in awhile, a restaurant called "Limons" is very good. Good Salso dancing can be found at Mombo Cafe, or should you care for the old disco music - the Blue Parrot is a fun hang our as well. The only way to know is to go and see! We did a couple day excursions - one to Excaret which took up most of the day viewing wildlife, swimming, eating and ending with a 1-1/2 show in the evening in their temple which is performed by 250 - 300 people and is phenominal! We also spent an afternoon in Peurto Aventuras which has a wonderful dolphin participation and viewing show. These mammals have been hurt at one time out in the ocean and can not go back as they will be killed by other sea creatures and live in this complex. They presently have three baby dolphins that will be introduded back to nature in a couple years once weaned from the mothers. The staff is very professional and the dolphins are adorable to see and it's free to watch. We did tip at every meal, room service, and any activity that required a service at our request, and they worked hard for us making sure that we did not need/or want for anything. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't improve upon perfection!”
Reviews.Author: piscescpl
Reviews.Content: What can I say.... this place is incredible. We stayed 12 nights from Feb 19th through March 3rd. My fiance and I got married here, and all was a complete sucess. I loved it. I loved the way the entire staff made my lady feel on her special day. I loved the way the elegance of the Palace catapulted us to another level. She truly was made to feel like a princess on this day, aside from the fact that she already was, of course. To start, the curb appeal at this resort is amazing. The entire resort is impeccable. We did not notice any mildew, moldy smell, or see any grime whatsoever. Food was incredible, and take note that the food accessible all day long near the pool at Chills was in buffet form and totally incredible for that.
