Basically every option available you could ask for. Pastas, fruit, and all meats. Ice cream too. Specialty restaurants are run so efficiently. I loved them. At Sandals which we stayed at last year, a dinner could consume 2 hours, here, make it more like 45 minutes if you desired to leave right after your meal. Even at the evening buffet, they would treat it as though you were at a fine dining restaurant, and always pull out, and push in the chairs for the ladies. Room service was surprisingly quick. Anytime we'd call for a bottle of Champagne or other, they'd have it to our room within 10 minutes. We'd leave some money in the fridge, but they wouldn't take it unless we directly placed it in their hands. Quality of this resort in regards to cleanliness was much better than Sandals Ocho Rios which we stayed at last year. Gardens and plant life were manicured incredibly. Once again, the Wedding was so nice. As this was a palace, the whole ordeal made of feel very "royal", and they made my now wife truly feel like a princess. We were the only people to get married during our stay. We felt that they may have catered to us a bit more than others because of the wedding, but not completely sure. We did get a free room upgrade to Courtyard view even though we did not purchase the higher level wedding package. They also threw in a couple extra bottles of champagne at no charge. Resort could be considered small by some, but we thought of it more as convenient. Everything easy and quick to get to. No rain but a bit of wind. Great weather, 85 every day. Some kids around, but they mostly stayed away and were well mannered. If you have any questions, run them past me at ranalloj@msn.com. I've attached a few wedding pics. Jason

Reviews.Title: “Very Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mommyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIU Palace Riviera Maya March 7-11, 2007. The hotel is beautiful, and very elegant. I chose this hotel because this was my mother's first trip to the caribbean, and thought she should stay somewhere special. First of all, the food at this resort is fantastic. The service is excellent. The drinks flow constantly - I had champagne with breakfast, and dinner. Super. The employees work extremely hard, and are very friendly and attentive. Beautiful presentations at all meals. We didn't eat at any of the specialty restaurants because we could not get a decent time. Who wants to eat at 10 p.m. The pools are freezing cold, and didn't warm up much because there was NO SUN until our last day so that was the only day we swam. Sad. We had so much rain - we were so very disappointed. The beach is nonexistent. If you like to walk the beach, don't go here. Only a small swimming area too. Our room was beautiful, but we had no view and couldn't get it changed. Large bathroom with double sinks, big shower and jacuzzi tub. Great central air, and a ceiling fan. Beds were terribly hard (which I have encountered at other resorts), but these were made of granite, I believe. Good thing we were tired! Fully stocked liquor cabinet, and mixers, beer (Corona), pepsi products restocked every day. Do not take children of any age to this resort. There aren't many other activities for them, as it isn't a family style resort. We were also told there was a no spring breaker policy at this hotel - WRONG. About 20 big kids and their parents came in and the kids took over the pool and pool bar area. I am assuming there were a great deal of complaints (as the resort is full of 30-70 yr. old people), and the hotel management had parents get their newly drinking children under control. A five minute five dollar cab ride (or 20 minute walk) to Playa del Carmen, and you are in shopping utopia. You can shop for hours for all things Mexican and non-Mexican. Great nighlife too. Felt very safe - lots of police (also lots of military with rifles - don't be shocked). Overall, I would recommend this hotel to singles travelling together, married couples, or couples looking to have some nice romantic time together. The Cancun airport, however, had made my mind up to not return, and this was my 7th time to this part of the world. I purchased an expensive bottle of fine tequila for my husband, and was told to hand carry it through the airport because it would get taken out of my checked luggage. This was the advice of not just the hotel personnel, but several people who had traveled through the Cancun airport in the last year. I went through three security checks (yes three) at the Cancun airport. I made sure they checked in the bag, and in the box, and okayed it with them again and was told it was fine and passed on through. When I gave them my boarding pass at the door, they went through my stuff again (for the fourth time), and told me that since I didn't buy this tequila in the duty free shops there at the airport, they wouldn't let me take it on the plane. They wouldn't even bag it like the others because it hadn't come from the airport. They confiscated my gift for my husband, and let all the other people who purchased their stuff in the duty free shops take theirs on the plane. I didn't even have time to go to the shop afterward - I had to get on the bus to go out to the plane. I have gotten home many times and found my stuff had been rifled through, and had been missing even a bottle of Amaretto once. We should be able to lock our luggage!!! Enough is enough. Adios Cancun. Please be careful out there, and good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Palace Rivieria Maya”
Reviews.Author: spicegirl83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya from March 5-10, just returning yesterday - I did not want to come home! We had stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico two years ago and loved it, but thought we would try the new hotel this time. I booked the trip then became concerned after reading some negative reviews here, but they were all for naught. The hotel is absolutely spectacular and the service was outstanding. We got there at 12noon and they already had our room ready - we had requested a courtyard or ocean view via emailing the hotel, and we got a room with both courtyard and ocean views so we were very happy! I was concerned about the beach being small but no problem - always plenty of chairs and very enjoyable. My only complaint is there is no beach bar, just the pool bar which does not open until 10am. For someone who hits the beach at 8am, this was kind of a pain but not too bad. We took our big insulated mugs as we did before and they filled them right up. I did find that if you tip the bartender and ask for extra rum in your fozen drinks they wil be quite generous! Well worth it. We always take $100 in one-dollar bills for tips and such, and they are always well appreciated. I did not see anyone else tipping the wait staff and was rather surprised by this, considering the level of service. My husband couldn't even drain his glass, sit it down and count to five before someone was refilling it - not the usual service you see here in the States for sure! The room was a little smaller than at the Riu Palace Mexico. and the beds were very firm, but we like a firm mattress and who needs a huge room anyway? We didn't go to Mexico to sit around the room all the time - it was plenty of room for our needs. Loved the massage tub too! The buffet was certainly the best place to eat - the food was wonderful except for the desserts - they looked great but never seemed to have much flavor, but the ice cream was delicious so that can make up for any other dessert lapses. The weather turned cloudy and rainy during our last day-and-a-half there, but can't blame the hotel for that - we just went into Playa del Carmen and shopped instead of going to the beach. All in all it was a fabulous hotel and we would go there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for adults!”
Reviews.Author: Gwib
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 glorious weeks at the RIU . This was not our first choice for a property as we travelled with our 7 year old daughter and we knew before we left that it was not kid friendly. However, that is the beauty of kids, she always managed to find a friend to play with. The beach as mentioned many many times before was devastated by the hurricane. That said we knew that before we travelled so no sense complainng. The food was fantastic, absolutely zero comlaints and we never had a moment of illness. We did all the ala carte restaurants with the Japanese our favourite! The days I felt under the weather was mostly likely self-inflicted---I love tequila! The staff were incredible and bent over backwards trying to insure that everyone's stay was perfect. A real nice touch I thought was that every night at the dinner buffet the "head big wigs" would make their presence known and circulated the room talking to the guests to see if any had concerns. During a previous RIU stay we had had some problems with our reservation, that info was brought forward this trip and the staff went out of their way making it up to us. My thanks and appreciation go out to Oswald, Stephanie and Sandra for all that you did! I would definetly go back to this resort but would not take our daughter, definetly more an "adults only" resort. If you are looking for a kid friendly resort than I would highly recommend Sunscape the beach in Punta cana. We have travelled extensively and this place "rocks' for kids!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Time”
Reviews.Author: gaeotter
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed 7 nights 2/22/07 to 3/1/07. We for the most part loved the hotel, our room and the staff. It is a Palace and you do feel like Royalty. I agree with other reviews, the buffet is the best place to eat. We did like Sir Oliver's but we did not enjoy the other speciality restaurants. The Buffets are Excellent. Our room faced the court yard and we could see the ocean - Beautiful. The pool is nice but the actual "pool floor" should be cleaned more often. It is one "drunken pool party"; we had a good time but if you have children stay away from the Bar. We enjoyed the pool and Pool Barourselves. The beach is not a walking beach but clean and nice. If you shop for jewerly at "Lapis" put the jewerly on before you leave the store and I would do this anywhere you go. I do not recommend that you purchase items in the Courtyard, "over priced"; you can do better in town. But all in all we did not really find any deals on merchandise - better off at home. The beds are firm but we like that. The lack of elevators for us was "ok" because how else are you going to lose the pounds that you put on at the buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: alexchicago
Reviews.Content: Great trip. Hotel very nice and clean. Staff very kind, helpful. Food was very good. No one got sick (but we stayed away from cold cuts, salads, etc.). The specialty restaurants were above average in my opinion. The Mexican (Agave) was fantastic-we ate there twice during our 5 night stay. Pools very nice, lively beach bar area. The only downfall to this hotel is it's lack of beach. Apparently, the hurricane that tore through the area a couple of years ago did a lot of damage to the beach areas (not only this hotel, but others as well). There is really no way to walk up and down a long stretch of beach at this resort. Much of the beach area is very rocky as well, but there is a small patch of beach (maybe 100ft. or so) that is perfect for swimming. We are big beach lovers so we were concerned about the beach situation, but it turned out to be fine. Didn't even bother us. When we felt like taking a walk on the beach we would walk over to the Riu Palace/Mexico (within easy walking distance from this resort) and walk along that beach. This was a very good vacation and we plan on returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: kb0127
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace from February 24th to March 3rd and had a fantastic time. I agree with most everything that has been said in this forum so I won't rehash. Here's a couple of additional things I thought it might be good for people going there to know: .If you like to sit on your room's patio in shade on the afternoon then you need to be on the right side (if you are in the lobby facing towards pool) of the hotel. The left side gets all the afternoon sun rendering the patios unusable if you have had your fill of sun for the day. .We enjoyed the restaurants that we dined in (did not eat at the Brazilian). They have two seatings a night for each. The meals take longer because they basically serve a course to the entire restaurant before moving on to the next course. So if you are the first one in the door you will get your first course super fast but then wait a while until everyone else (including the stragglers who didn't respect the seating time) get their course served. No biggie, especially if you know. .The chair reserving is out of control. The staff gently let everyone know on Sunday that this practice was not allowed but it did not help. So, if you want a good chair, get down to the pool early. We did not reserve and usually got to the pool around 10:30 and always found a couple of chairs, but they were in the last row which is where we wanted to be anyway! .I do feel that I must rehash that the ice cream is just outstanding! We were eating it twice a day...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: KM001
Reviews.Content: New, well laid out, and great location. Built in 2006 the property is still in excellent condition. Grounds are impecable. Great pool area and sandy area by the sea. Within walking distance to Playa del Carmen (20 minutes or so). Excellent meals at the buffet or specialty restaurants. Beverage service / selection was also good. The people really work hard at providing good service with a smile. Rooms were well laid out and clean. Only downside was no real beach (try the Riu Palace Mexico down the street if this is important) and the walls were a bit thin. After many cruises, this was our first all inclusive and we would definitely stay at a Riu in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as expected, and better”
Reviews.Author: battgirl
Reviews.Content: I am just back from a six-night stay at the RPRM. My best friend from high-school and I met there to enjoy a girlfriend get-a-way (sans husband, kids, job and dog) celebrating our 40th birthdays together. I researched the hotel extensively, on this site and others. After reading mostly positive reviews of Playa del Carmen and the RPRM we booked this trip through Expedia. The hotel and experience were just as I expected (from the positive reviews) and even better. I worked in the hotel industry for 12 years and am very particular. The hotel was amazingly beautiful (almost over the top) and spotless. I am an early waker and was usually on my very large balcony at 6am watching no less than 15 men literally scrub the sidewalks. The room, grounds, staff, pool, and food were all amazingly wonderful. Read through other reviews that mention many of these features positively. The staff, especially Alex and Victor, aim to please. Several things that I will share are details that I was curious about but didn't get much information on in other posts: 1. The food. I am a healthy eater and was pleasantly surprised by the amount of fresh and healthy offerings. From the breakfast bar with tons of toppings for yogurt (plain or flavored) or cereal (including flax seed, almonds, bran, etc.) to the fresh juice bar (try the one made of pineapple, parsley and spinach - you'll be surprised how good it is!). The breads were all so fresh and lots of whole grain choices at every meal. The fish was fabulous - don't miss the grouper in the Gourmet restaurant. This is not a health spa by any means, however. If you are looking forward to eating yourself silly, there is plenty of opportunity. But you won't find fat and preservative laden food that is so prevelant at "all-inclusives". The only negative that I could find was that the meats in Mexico are quite different than I am used to. The steaks were very good, but things like hamburger, hot dogs and sliced ham all had a funny, very strong taste. All in all, the meals were fabulous. Our favorite meal was in the Brazilian restaurant. 2. The musty order. Yes, it is noticible when you first arrive. But, you do get used to it. It didn't seem dirty or unhealthy however. It was definitely more noticable in the lobby. Now that I am home I can still smell it on my some of the clothing items that I haven't had time to wash. From what I understand this smell is present at most hotels in Cancun/Playa. Heck, I remember the same smell at a Walt Disney resort. I think it is from the humidity and can't really be helped - just covered up by chemicals - I would rather put up with the musty order. 3. The beach. At the time I was there (2/23-3/1) there was some beach available below the retainig wall, enough for approx. 30-40 lounge chairs. I swam several times. The waves were very strong, however. We spent an afternoon at the Riu Palace Mexico which has more of a beach. I still liked RPRM better for that overall beachy feeling. 4. The beds. Yep, they are hard. I called the front desk and asked for a pad. They delivered a very nice quality egg-crate mattress and completely remade each bed within 20 minutes of my call. 5. The drinks! They were large, good quality and you never had to wait to get one. In fact, they really pushed them on you - in a fun way. When we visited Riu Palace Mexico the drinks were served in much smaller glasses and were watered down. 6. I booked this through Expedia who did not offer transportation to/from the airport. It was easy to find a "colectivo" from the airport to the hotel but terribly hard to get one from the hotel back to the airport. Most people in the hotel were on package deals (mostly Apple and FunJet) and had everything taken care of. I felt a little left out in the cold with Expedia ( I even called them for help and they offered none) Eventually I booked my ride back through one of the above representatives at the hotel. I'm not sure they were supposed to really do this, however. All in all, it was a great, relaxing vacation. I can not wait to go back with my husband!

Reviews.Title: “Who stole the elevators?”
Reviews.Author: JackBAtlanta
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at The Riu Palace Riviera Maya with our daughter and teen age grandchildren in February. We found the experience to be average at best. Pluses: Overall decor is elaborate and grounds quite impressive. We upgraded to a Courtyard room and were given a room on the 2nd floor at the ocean end of the building with magnificent views of the ocean. Upgrade definitely worth the price--our daughter's room was smelly and looked out on service court and next-door hotel a few feet away. The rooms are nice. The staff were always friendly and our room was immaculately clean. The food was good, especially the breakfasts and dinner in Sir Olivers, but certainly not outstanding. Japanese restaurant--bad food and only poor service of our stay. Spa, though not especially beautiful, provided excellent staff and services. Negatives: Who stole the elevators? The hotel is "U" shaped with arms at least a city block long. The only (tiny and banged up) elevators are in the corners of the closed (lobby) end of the "U". We had a choice of walking a block and a half each way to use the elevator and back to our room when going from beach to room or a two and a half flight walk-up. At these prices not acceptable. There was really no gathering place for our teenage grandkids in the evenings--or for adults except for the lobby bar. There was a "show" each night--staff amateur lip synch. We went in to the charming town of Playa del Carmen two nights--lots of music and lively entertainment. Extras such as spa and sundries shop cannot be charged to room--why? In summary: Unless you are interested in drinking all day at pool bar or paying dearly for outside excursions--this place is boring and not well planned.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: ~trip_for_one~
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is beautiful. many candid photos are posted and it is even better in person. with the resort as large as it was, i was so pleased to find that the walk to the beach or to the buffets was very short and never tiring. if you wanted to go to the room from the beach it was just a short walk. no problem. i have stayed at a few that if you forgot something in your room you would really think twice about going after it. the layout was done wonderfully. the beach entrance is ruined. if you read the current info you know this, so knowing ahead of time, you shouldn't be disappointed in what you find. we enjoyed. we sat to the right side by the stairs, although we like to walk the beach, we knew that wasn't going to happen. it was still wonderful! you could easily enter for a nice dip to cool off. the usual chair hogs were here, i expected no less. the chairs at poolside were towel covered by 6 am each day. but there were many chairs. the few times we went to the pool, we found seats. one day the wind was just too much at the beach. after a nice sandblasting, i had had enough and we decided to try the pool area. it was lovely. they were bringing out many extra chairs and setting them up ~ i think the beach wasn't very popular that day. the management was on it ~ they were setting up for it as we entered. that was nice to see. they were always around pleasing everyone. it wasn't like they got you there and already had your money so you get what you get...... the management was always about spotting things and being flexible to meet the needs. these managers were everywhere.... one day i think i saw the young woman ten times!! always asking people if there was anything she could make better. i couldn't think of anything, but if i had wanted something i assure you it would have been taken care of. the food was great. we all gained weight. if you have a weakness for ice cream, plan to gain a few pounds. it was some of the best ice cream i have ever had. we did the steak house one evening. it was good food, not great..... kind of the same food from the main buffet, just served the main course on a plate to us. the salad and dessert was still buffet... oh well. reservations were easy. between noon and four, go to the piano bar and sign up for up to four nites. it wasn't hard and we had no problem with our request. men were welcomed to wear shorts in the main dinner buffet. dress/cargo shorts and a sleeved shirt. Wim informed us at the check-in that shorts were fine here. ladies can wear anything dressy. i went casual dressy, but if you like to really look nice ~ the woman are dressed very nice here. very nice dresses, heels and beautiful jewelry ~hair and make-up done. very nice looking couples. i never felt out of place, but i didn't do the heels. i have two teen girls. they found very little to do. the sports bar got old for them. after dinner it was dead other than to sit in one of the bars. we were so full we didn't want any further drink. we walked down to the shopping area a couple nites after dinner. we went to 5th ave for dinner one nite, Wim from the front desk gave us a place to try per our request and he did great. shopping down there is best done a bit later in the day. it was just way too hot the one day we went down, we took a taxi back and returned for an evening shopping trip. i was under the impression that the other riu's were side by side. not the case. it is in a community of many resorts. we did not go to any of the other riu's. we loved ours and didn't want to leave the beach. we weren't looking for much nite life on this trip, so the other bars/disco didn't appeal to us. we did the parasailling from the guy on the beach. it was fun for the girls. one great thing is no one is on the beach selling stuff. the guy for parasailing etc walks up and down once in a while. he is available to you but i didn't really ever see him approaching people. no one is selling braids!! my girls have outgrown that and it was so nice to have a place that left them alone. i had booked a day with edventures, the large group trips are not for us. they were able to come right to our door. the family of four was able to spend a wonderful day in tulum snorkling, zip lining etc. ~ highly recommended!!!!!!! we wanted a very quiet, very relaxing vacation. this is the place for it. everyone was well behaved. a few days before we left a large group of 30ish singles showed up. they were very out of place. no partying to speak of here. they seemed to be having a good time, but again that group really seemed like they booked the wrong place. the mold ~ yes it was quite bad. the ceiling in the shower was covered black with it. yuk. but i fixed that by not looking up! we didn't run the air while in the room as i really dislike airconditioned air.... the mold smell seemed less when it wasn't on! the bathroom was very nice, the shower pressure was great. the room was ck'ed and cleaned several times a day. the cleaning staff does not speak english. they will smile at you when you ask a question. the meal staff can speak english and will make sure you leave with a little more knowledge of spanish! i enjoyed that. it took me a few days to get basic phrases down. one last thing. the tv sets are equipped for a dvd player(three colored holes in front) not that i wanted one, but i know how children enjoy their cartoons and movies. the cartoon station i saw was in spanish. if a kid is use to a few hours of tv a day, and you take them here, to long hot days and no tv to set them in front of for a quiet time..... well, good luck with that!! :) you do get cnn, espn, abc, nbc and some movie stations. i enjoy the tv on at bed time and was pleased to have a few stations to view. all in all a great beach/sun vacation.if you have any questions about the resort, airport, transportation etc, i would gladly reply from bluewaters3200 at yahoo dot com

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "Wow"”
Reviews.Author: iminlovewithmexico
Reviews.Content: My family and I ( a group of 6 adults and 1 child) arrived on Feb 17 and I was amazed as soon as I walked in the door. Not once did I see a staff member with out a smile on their face. I have travelled to Hawaii, Cuba and have been to numerous resorts in California and this one by far has been the best experience. There was something for everyone to do. The only complaint I have is being talked into going to the Silver Factory where I was under the impression that i would see how the people working there worked the silver to make fine jewlery. Instead it was just a really expensive store with only about 10% silver and the rest was gold an diamonds. If you do go to this resort please consider going on a day tour to the mayan ruins. We all went and it was a fantasic tour. Our tour included the ruins, zip lining, repelling into an underground pool and canoeing. Lunch is included and you get to go into a mayan village and meet people who are amazing and friendly. I definately will be comming back here and am even considering getting married here. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was great, and the food and drinks were fantastic. Thank you Riu Palace for giving me and my family a vacation we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Allmost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Fast_Eddy_be
Reviews.Content: We are Mark and Rita from Belgium. We stayed one week in the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for our Honeymoon. Once we arrived, the lobby is overwelming. The doorkeeper Alex was very helpfull and friendly. Now and then he checks the all-niclusive bracelet. First we were surprised, but it gave us a safe feeling. Staff at the reception is more than friendly. For instance Wim at the frontdesk speeks 5 languages and jumps everywhere to help. Food was excellent !! Beverages, cocktails are OK. Waiters are running to serve you. Never had any problem. In the main restaurant: Very fine cooking. It's a pitty that there are a lot of birds stealing the food of the tables during lunch. This was for us the only minus point. After a while, staff saw that my wife's affraid of birds, and they did everything to scare the birds away. So at the end: good service. The manager is a great guy ! You see him everywhere talking to the guests and looking if everything is allright. Seems like he is working 25 hours a day .... He's there in the morning, at noon and in the evening. Unfortunatly, the little islands in the swimming pool were every day taken by the same annoying people, but this is not a hotel problem. Speciality Restaurants fist shift is at 18h45. We went to the Brasillian restaurant, and first you have to go the salad bar, because the rest of the dinner is served at the table. just look at the foto. The waiter goes differtent times from table to table with a sword with meat, and every guest is served with e.g. first beef, than porc, than chicken. So if you are late, the whole planning is wrong, and they can't serve you anymore. They never were rude. Food was excellent ! Gourmet restaurant Sir Oliver was great, they even have "Crêpe Suzette" as dessert. Very surprising to find this speciality in Mexico ! Amazing !! Japanese restaurant: OK, no show cooking, but food was good, and Pedro is one of the best waiters I've seen. He knows how to serve people, and he knows about the "etiquette" which goes with wine tasting. This was for us an unforgettable honeymoon !! I travel a lot, all over the world, for business and pleasure. This is one of the best hotels I've ever visited. At home, we stil have a lot of good memories.

Reviews.Title: “Riu is Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Yankfanactic2
Reviews.Content: My Family and I recently returned from our stay at the Riu Palce Riviera Maya. The service was outstanding with an amazing staff. The rooms were beautifully decorated with magnificent woodwork and colors. It is true the beds are firm, but it never became an issue. The food at this resort was outstanding. Breakfast, lunch, and dinner were all prepared with perfection. Our only problem with the food at this resort was the restaurants. They were mediocre. Every night the buffet served food that was unbelievable. Your better off as a guest eating at the buffet every night, its worth it. The only restaurant that should be reserved was the Japanese, even though the hotel had an asian night at the buffet. Also making reservations was no problem at all. But if your looking for a great dinner every single night, stick to the buffet. It is true that the beach has eroded, not entirely. There is still a huge amount of beach left. It definatley seemed to be a man made beach though. We approved of this beach, but have seen alot better. If you like taking long walks on the beach, this is not the palce to go. Also,the pool is smaller and cold,but does the job. Overal, the Riu Palce riviera maya is a perfect relaxation resort. Activites are always going on and the hotel itself is magnificent. You really believe your in a palace and are treated as if you are royalty. Though the beach and restaurants are a disapointment, this resort is still excellenet. The riu palace riviera maya is definatly the palce to be. Its also a 10 minute walk from Playa del Carmen. So if you looking for a great week away from reality,book the Riu Palce Riviera Maya.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time........”
Reviews.Author: Javaloversr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, more formal than the Iberostar I stayed at 2 years ago. FOOD- Food is great, the buffet at dinner is outstanding. Thursday night, all the lobster you can eat! Great variety, we loved it here. Breakfast is wonderful. The Japanese is not hibachi, which I had hoped, but the food was good. The service is great, you no sooner finish a dish and they are taking it away. The staff works very hard. POOL - very nice, good temperature,relaxing, pool bar is wonderful. Not many little kids at all at this resort. More of an adult atmosphere. Music- they do need a few new CD's, please. Once again, staff works very hard. BEACH - Easy to get chairs, beach very eroded due to Hurricaine. If you want to walk stretches of beach, this resort is not for you. There is no place to walk. We loved the hammocks and my daugheter got a massage on the beach. Tip those waiters on the beach, they work so hard and are so appreciative for anything!! I personally was really annoyed that folks from the resort to the left, kept coming to the RUI beach with boat loads of kids and using the beach and Rui chairs.(Look at their blue wristbands). There are no that many charts down on the beach section. I told mgmt, they told the intruders, but they never left. No one kept an eye on this and there is a whole hut of RUI employees right near where they walk over. I think RUI needs security to monitor this all day long. I would never just use another resorts facilities. RUi was definately a nicer resort they did not pay to stay here. Some people are just the rude. Rooms - although we had it in writing we wanted a courtyard view, we did not get one until day 3. The front desk did not budge.I sort of lost it when we checked in. They said it was $50 more a night and they were sold out. Tons of folks we met at the pool got upgraded to the courtyard with no fee. We did find out that they overbooked at the other RUI's and upgrade alot of people to this RESORT free. So, the hotel had no rooms. That bothers me a little because I paid full price and fought to get the view I wanted. The room was great, air conditioning was fine. Need to call several times for beverages for frig. Slept great. I did not notice the mold when we were there. But when we got home we reaked and never knew it. Everything had to be washed and my suitcase sat out in freezing weather to air and still smells musty. But I still had a great time! I would go back, but they need to check that issue out. We love Play del Carmen. What a town!! Great shops and restaurants. Only a $5.00 cab ride.Went in every night. Carlos and Charlies really made us laugh. Stop in for drinks at these cool restaurants along 5th avenue. Some have little grottos, swings. Very cool. ADVENTURES- did a Mayan village excursion with 3 zip lines, swimming in beautiful cenotes, cool platform to jump off in cenote( I did it, wow, I was scared), a Shaaman ceremony in a cenote with candles and insense ( felt like I was going to Tribal Council), lunch made by Mayan folks. Very exciting. Horse back riding was great at Loma Bonita. You actually ride into the deep water at one point. Great tour guide. Light soft drinks and lunch included. Trip to Cozemel to snorkle was ok. I was not impressed at the locations we went to. We were in 40-70 feet of water and saw just some fish. The crew was fun, there are 20-30 tour booths for snorkling when you get off the ferry. I don't know how to recommend a good one. Overall, I love playa del carmen. I would go back to this RUI. It is 99% newer than the other RUI's in Playa(I went to see them). I think they need to work on the musty smell, otherwise, we had a wonderful time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff Fantastic, Management Isn't”
Reviews.Author: elsamidwest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reserved a garden view room through out travel agent and when we arrived, management agrued that the top floor, view of the roof was the best he could do unless we were willing to slip him another $50 bucks a day. On the last day we had to catch our ride to the airport at 7:00 am, so we asked if we could get room service prior to leaving. The kitchen staff said "no problem." Unfortunately, an hour later they called to apologize that they would not be able to accommodate us. It seems that management told them they wouldn't allow room service until 7:00 am which is when we had to leave. Although this is an all-inclusive resort which offers room service at no extra charge and a large breakfast buffet at 7:00 am, there was no way they would provide breafast to us before we had to leave. The staff, however, were excellent in every way. If only the management were as customer friendly and accommodating as the staff we would have had a much better time. I think we will try a different resort next year.

Reviews.Title: “On the whole a good holiday”
Reviews.Author: holidayfever
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 weeks at the hotel. On the whole it was really pleasant and relaxing but there are still a few teething problems. We are used to staying at 5 star hotels and do where possible stay at a Riu. ROOMS Spacious junior suites which are clean and very comfortable. If you haven't booked a courtyard room I would recommend asking for an upgrade. I E.Mailed the hotel about 3 weeks before we went ( E.Mail address is on their website) and our request was honoured. I know a lot has been said about the hard beds but they did not give us any problems.The mini bar is well stocked when you arrive but ours was only restocked twice in the whole 2 weeks. You just need to contact reception though and they will send anything to your room you want. FOOD Lots of it and on the whole very good. Sometimes it was only lukewarm though particularly at lunch time. We had lunch twice at the Riu Palace Mexico (where we have stayed before) and the difference was unbelievable. The same food but hot! At dinner on one occasion we were seated for dinner and were ignored for over 10 minutes before eventually a waiter came and asked us what we would like to drink. They were too busy resetting tables. Once you had got a glass of wine it was often difficult to get a refill. We ate at 2 of the other restaurants Chilis and the Gourmet restaurant but on the whole the buffet was our favourite. POOL Excellent and plenty of loungers. Waiters are around all day getting drinks. BEACH A lot has been said about this but it's ok and on 2 occasions we went to the Riu Palace. The sea is wonderful and warm. BARS Good service but on a night if you want the branded alcohol make sure you ask for it by name. As in all the other Riu Hotels we have stayed in the Manager is very high profile and mixes with all the guests. So if there are any problems she would hopefully rectify them quickly. The staff are also very friendly and most are efficient. We only tipped at the end of our 2 weeks and to those staff who we felt deserved it. We don't believe in tipping just to ensure we get a good service and it certainly never felt like that.

Reviews.Title: “THe Cadalac of Playacar”
Reviews.Author: DrNorm111
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 day quick trip to Playa Del Carmen. The Riviera Maya was certainly the Cadalac of all the resorts we looked at there. The resort was spread out enough to give an uncrowded feel even though it was totally booked. The food and service was excellent. The beach was roomy and had plenty of chairs. We thought that the value was superb. We are already planning a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBetty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the Riu Palace Mayan on Feb 6/07. We had a fantastic vacation, right from th minute we walked in the door and Alex the concierge greeted us. The rooms very very nice, the beds were firm but we like them firm. The turn down service was a nice touch. There was not any smell in our room. The food was great, a very big selection. My only problem would be like someone else said that not a lot of the food was labelled. The specialty restaurants were great especially the japanese, if you like sushi and other japanese foods. The service at this resort was the best we have experienced. Never is your drink empty and someone is always there to remove your plate. All of the staff were friendly and always said hello. We never had a problem getting a lounge chair by the pool or on the man made beach. Yes the beach by the ocean was a little rough but we swam no problem and the ocean was sandy once you got in. I would recommend this resort to anyone. We did an excursion to tulim and xel-ha and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: SC509
Reviews.Content: My wife and another couple stayed at the RPRM for five days and were a little nervous while reading the reviews before our trip. When we arrived at 1pm, our rooms were ready and waiting for us. The weather was a little suspect (Turned out great for the other 4 days) but nothing that would keep us from the pool. The pool areas was fantastic, plenty of room (Although you do need to get up early to reserve lounges). The drinks were flowing so you never went thirsty. The beach area for lounging was good, but the waterfront area of the beach was subpar due to the erosion of beachfront. You could get in the ocean just south of the RPRM (In front of the Riu Lupita), but it wasn't a huge area. The breakfast and lunch buffets were above average (The main buffet a little better than the one at Chili's poolside) and offerred many choices. The Brazilian Steakhouse was not bad, but it was our least favorite of the ala cartes. The Japanese Restaurant was very good, Sir Olivers was good and Agave was good (The appetizer buffet was great, a lot of authentic Mexican fare-better than the entrees). We'd agree with previous reviews that the desserts were a little bland, except for the ice cream which was very good. All and all, the food was good and the service was great. The rooms were OK, maybe a just a little musty, but our A/C's worked fine (It automatically turns off when you open your sliding glass door to the balcony). The in room safe worked well and the bed, while hard, didn't bother us a bit. The actual property is impressive looking and the bars were nice (Lounge bar for pre-dinner drinks, the outdoor bar for post dinner drinks while watching the entertainment and the Sports bar for late night drinking-Never crowded at all after 11pm). All of the employees were helpful and nice-Front desk, wait staff, bartenders, maids, and entertainment. Overall, an enjoyable trip and we would go back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “OK but could have been better”
Reviews.Author: tmw16
Reviews.Content: Just returned last week from a 5 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Let me start off by saying that the guests at this hotel are an older age group. My husband and I are in our late 30's and we felt like we were some of the youngest at the resort. At least it made the resort quiet....not a lot of roudy people running around. As many other people have posted, the beds are incredibly firm. If you ask the front desk for a foam mattress pad they will put one on the bed for you - no problem. The rooms are clean although there is a bad musty smell. We have been to other Caribbean islands before and realize that musty smells are common, but have never returned home and had to wash every piece of clothing (even things not worn) to get the musty smell out. Even the luggage reaked of mustiness........Not good. Also, there were a few little ant like bugs coming out of the sink drain. We had already unpacked and I didn't feel like moving around, so I just kept the drain plugs in to keep the bugs at bay.....it worked. Oh yeah, don't drink the water from the sink faucet. There is a little sticker on the mirror stating the water isn't potable but I heard some people saying they didn't see the sticker, had been drinking the water and were a little on the sick side. The pool is icy cold, but there are plenty of lounge chairs and we never had a problem finding a good spot, even in the sun. I did not notice a lot of early morning chair saving. By the way, the only jacuzzi's are located in the spa (not really outside). And like most others have noted, there is no beach with water access. The hotels to the right and left do have water access but the beach is rocky and the surf is rough. Just be careful around those rocks. I would consider the food only average......better than most all inclusive buffets, but an all inclusive buffet nonetheless. We ate at one of the reservation restaurants only once, and it didn't turn out well. We got a reservation at the steak restaurant for 7:00. Showed up around 6:50 and they seated us right away. The problem was that we didn't get our meals for 1 hour and 15 minutes after we sat down. The place was far from crowded, but from what we could see, they only had one chef cooking. My husband's steak was good but the pork loin I ordered was only a little more tender than the sandals I was wearing. If you like to eat dinner around 5:30-6:00 this is not the place for you. Dinner doesn't get going until 6:45. All in all, our vacation was good but I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, nor would I recommend it to anyone, friend or foe. Try staying at one of the boutique hotels in Playa and eating at the many great restaurants that are in town. Whatever you choose to do, I hope you have an absolutely wonderful vacation experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful group vacation!”
Reviews.Author: NCarolinaTarheel
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip from RIU Palace Riviera Maya with a group of 10 coworkers (yes, I have great bosses!). We really enjoyed our trip and I wanted to add some of my thoughts about the resort. First of all, the staff was wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating and a few members of the staff became part of our rowdy group at times! When our air conditioning needed to be fixed, maintenance was there very quickly. The maids were very helpful and even ordered a Mexican hangover cure for me when I was moving a little slow one day. I thought the food was great and I am a notoriously picky eater. Everyone in my group enjoyed their entrees at each meal. The breakfast buffett was fabulous, with lots of fresh fruit and juices I had never tried before (Honeydew juice?). The only negative I would say about the food would be the fact that nothing was labeled. I'm not one to just try something and see if I like it. An adventurous eater, I am not. I have to at least know the basics. This is probably more a fault of my own than the resort's, though. The sports bar always had refrigerated sandwiches and late night snack food, which I thought was a nice touch. The drinks were very good and were served to us right on the beach. While lying on the beach or pool, you have to make sure you don't lose your towel. They have a "towel card" policy, of which we lived in fear. Lose your card or your towel, it'll cost $20! However, I lost my towel the third day and they gave me a new one. I don't think they are extremely strict about this policy. When deciding to call this resort a palace, they were not kidding! The lobby is very grande, marble everywhere, grounds immaculate, and everything is just very big. If you are looking for a quaint, small resort, this may not be for you. We enjoyed it and are very glad to have had the opportunity to experience this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for this place”
Reviews.Author: Danpaloyan
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at previous Riu hotels in Riviera May (mexico) and have had a good experience. This time when we walked into our room there was a little odor, but we did not think much of this until later, when we wer about to leave after one week, all of our cloth materials had an odor, and the dampness was significant. Some of the other guests had the same complaint. I believe that their air conditioning system is faulty (built 1.5 years ago) and is responsible for this problem. I believe that we were subjected to mildew and mold, as our stuff (clothes, you name it) was noticeably smelly by the time we got back home. The restaurants were good, but the beach was bad. No sand, hardly, after the hurricane. This whole experience turned us off on the RIU as I believe that they short changed on the air conditioning, and we would most definetely not go back to that hotel. I would not recommend it except for any enemies that we may have.

Reviews.Title: “Convinced me to NEVER go all-inclusive again!”
Reviews.Author: Forca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico 5 years ago and had a wonderful time, so we decided to try this newer addition to the Riu family due to the reviews and descriptions online. Big mistake. First, I can say this resort is very clean and such--it looks a lot like the old Riu Palace, but when you look closer, it doesn't even compare. It was like they decided to try and improve the wheel and realized that when they made it bigger, it was more expensive than before. So, shortcuts were taken--the tile walkways were made with cheaper tile, they left out the bidets from the bathrooms (I was so bummed about that! Bad pun!), and forgot to insulate the walls. I was appalled at how LOUD the rooms were. If the A/C wasn't on (and if you have the room above 65, it shuts off for long periods), you could clearly hear conversations in the other rooms. And we were put right next to a family who was up at all hours, their kids banging on the door and yelling at 2-3 AM, running through the halls (which echo like crazy and amplify every sound), and yelling while in the room watching loud TV with the door open. My husband asked the father to quiet them down, but as he was in another room down the hall with family, it was still unbearable. The older Riu Palace has inner doors that block out most sound and made the rooms very quiet and private--again--they must've run out of money b/c the doors at this newer place kept out very little sound. When the family left, they were replaced with friends from Ohio who settled in the rooms on either side and yelled to each other from the balconies, and talked loudly. Again, if you FART in these rooms, I'm sure the neighbor could accurately rank you from 1-10. And don't waste your money and 'upgrade' to a courtyard room--you then get to hear the pounding pool music by day (we were at the beach, so it wasn't that big a deal) and drunk Americans yelling to each other from the walkways to the balconies by night, along with the night club pounding to 12 AM. Fine if you like to party and get drunk, but if you like to sleep and have peace in the evenings, well, check out Ikal del Mar--MUCH more peaceful and relaxing. Bed was very hard, but just ask for a pad--they gave us a lovely foam pad that made the bed quite comfortable. The service was great--everyone was friendly and helpful; the room was kept very clean and the tub was nice and deep for a good soak. I have no complaints about the staff, just the guests. The beach was okay--we walked over to the other Riu Palace to use their beach b/c it was a bit bigger and had no rocks. Not the resorts fault, the hurricane last year wiped out a lot of beaches. Food, I guess our tastes have changed a lot. If you like Applebees and see that as fine dining, the food will be very satisfying. I would rank the food as less than Applebees, more like Old Country Buffet. Edible, but nothing to write home about. Plenty of it to eat, and it's nice to just get something and not base it on price, but I found the salads really poor and not a lot of choices, so we stuck to stuff that is hard to mess up like the Mexican food. I wish these resorts would stop trying to please American palates and make authentic local cuisine; pizza in Mexico is not a really great culinary find. This visit has pretty much convinced us that all-inclusive is just not a good idea; free booze never makes for a restful time and bigger is definitely NOT better. If you love food, look at smaller places like Esencia and Ikal del Mar, or Meroma. The service, accommodations and food is unsurpassed at these smaller places, and you don't get the drunk idiots.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, definelty would go back”
Reviews.Author: SparkyStAlbert
Reviews.Content: My trip notes: My boyfriend and I returned from Mayan Riviera, staying at the Mayan Riviera RIU Palace Maya on Jan 23.2007. I was a little worried about going to this resort after reading the reviews but I found people were hunting and looking for the negative things and nit picking about little thingss. Getting to the hotel on Jan 16 we were greeted by staff and checked into our room without a problem. POOL - the pool is beautiful. The pool was kept clean. The waitresses were very friendly and always coming around taking drink orders. If you want a good spot by the pool you need to be up by 6:30am to reserve a spot. BEACH - The beach isn't as bad as people made it out to be. There was alot of lounge chairs on the beach but the water was rough. There were rocks but you could take a 2 min walk then go in the water. We went parasailing which was alot of fun. I would recommend it. FOOD - The food was really good. Always a good variety and everyday was different. We ate at the restaurants and the buffet. Never had a problem with finding something we liked. If you love ice cream they have the best ice cream. Gotta Try it. RESORT - The resort was very clean and very beautiful. The lobby was big and everyone was very friendly. ROOMS - We never had a problem with our safe and the beds weren't too bad. My only complaint would be the rooms didn't meet up to standards with the hotel being a 5 Star plus. We were on the 3rd floor facing the court yard. We could hear the music but it shut off my midnight so it wasn't a problem. I have a ton of pictures that I have not posted but if you are interested in seeing them or have any questions please feel free to email me. lorettahannah@shaw.ca

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: bceagles1
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short and sweet...Riu Palace was awesome! The room, grounds and pool were fantastic. Surprisingly, the food was out of this world...especially the dinner buffet and lunch buffet. So many great choices...I went back 2x at both sittings and I do not have a big appetite. If there was a downside it would be that there were no outdoor HOT tubs. The pictures make it look like there are two by the pool but although they do bubble, they are actually the same temp. as the pool. This was a bummer around 4-5pm when the sun had gone down. Also, the language barrier was greater than I had expected. There were a lot of service people (although, extremely nice) that only knew a word or two of english. One afternoon it was a challenge just to ask for ice. All in all a great resort and a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Coldtraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week's stay at this wonderful resort. We had made reservations at the Riu Playacar, but when we arrived, the girl at the desk offered us a free upgrade at the Palace Riviera Maya. They even paid for the cab ride (1/4 mile). We accepted and we were pleasantly surprised! We liked the looks of the Riu Playacar, but the Palace is very impressive. From the air conditioned lobby, beautiful grounds, impressive room, and great restaurants. We had heard that the Riu resorts were known for their great service, with which we agree. The only negative is the beach, which was greatly affected by hurricane Katrina. This would apply to the beaches at all the resorts from the Riviera Maya up through Cancun. We heard that the reef was also affected. There was always something going on at the pool area all day. Even though all inclusive, the wait staff came by often, regardless where we were: beach, pool, lounge, etc. They seemed disappointed when we didn't order. It would have been nice, though, if they could have brought up some muffins to the Sport Bar for breakfast (early departures before the regular buffet opens). It was hard to find anything to complain about. We would definitely recommend this resort for those visiting the Playa del Carmen area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: LjCo
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Playa del Carmen with my significant other on 01/11/07. We arrived late on a Thursday were greeted by exceptional staff and even given an upgraded room with a view of the ocean when we asked. The room was huge and everything we had hoped for when we arrived including a fully stocked refrigerator. The pools were amazing, huge with chairs in the water for sunbathing, pool bar, 2 jacuzzis and a negative edge pool that spilled over into the pool below it, even the water was a great temperature. Food (especially the Steakhouse which you need to make a reservation for 24hrs in advance) and entertainment was good and the service was exceptional. The couple complaints I had were the T.V. reception (but whos there to watch T.V. anyhow), the fact you had to be up early to get a great chair at the pool which is almost to be expected if you take your sunbathing seriously and the fact that the beach is rocky and is better at other Rius which we had already known, however it is windy this time of year and you do have access to all the Riu resorts staying here including Yucatan and Mexico if you find it necessary to sunbathe on the beach vs. the pool. Anyhow we loved this place and are planning to return!

Reviews.Title: “nicest people”
Reviews.Author: proudlycanadian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Mayan Riviera fron Jan. 8 - Jan. 15. 07. Getting off the airplane and geting met by a bunch of strangers that don't speak very good english, trying to get you to talk to them was kind of scary. We were warned about this on the plane and told these people are working for timeshares, just ignore them (not easy for us polite canadians). It was a little confusing trying to find our ride. Just look for someone holding your travel arrangers sign e.g. Sunquest. That was our only complaint. The resort is beautiful and the food was awesome. The beach was washed away and it was very windy the whole week we were there, so all the beaches are eroding very quickly. The staff were very nice and helpful (love ya Jose!) Make sure to ask Victor for his special drink of the day at the swim up bar. The people that complain about this resort must be royalty expecting rose petals, and bowing because this resort is nothing short of amazing. I would highly recommend it and will definitely be back. The pictures of the resort you see are real except they could update pictures of the beach. You don't have to travel far to the nice beach(10 minute walk).

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: traveller888Ontario
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a beach holiday beside the sea, this isn't it. This hotel is a 3 dressed as a nine. Big, noisy and loud. The beach is fake, since the hurricane washed out the original beach, so yes you are on a beach, BUT not beside the sea. We used the neighboring hotel's beach on the sea. So if you are looking for a pool holiday this is it. If you want beach by the sea don't stay here. Beds are hard, and the place is not as friendly as the Paradisus where we stayed in March,06. Paradisus is a 9 out of 10. Like I said the Palace looks beautiful but with no real sea, the kids (all under ten ) and I were disappointed. No internet unless you paid big bucks at the sports bar cafe. Work out gym is a shame, so I ran into town (approx 15 mins) where they have a starbucks and worked out for 15 dollars US at AREA fitness which is great. For the amount of $ the value isn't here. The hotel web site pics look great but is really overpriced. Stay at the paradisus and you will be happier. Pools and beaches are better. No real complaints about the food. That made it livable, I would never go back to a RIU again. (This was our second attempt after RIU in Nassau which was worse.) We loved the Paradisus in the Mayan and wished we had booked there over Xmas 06 instead. Good luck! (PS I placed my daughter in the kids club for one afternoon and they had a 24 inch TV on a wobbly stand. I asked the lady who ran it if I could move the TV off the plastic stand onto the floor where it would be safe, I was worried that if a kid fell into the stand (as they ran around there) that the the TV might topple onto a kid, and she said "TRUST ME, it won't fall off! I took my daughter out immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Experience”
Reviews.Author: mreide2
Reviews.Content: The Riu Palace Riviera Maya is absolutely gorgeous!!! I'll divide everything into categories: -Check in: painful! although we originally requested a room with a good view, they booked us a room with a view of some big wall. When we asked for them to upgrade us, it took them THREE HOURS because they were "cleaning the room", which does not take three hours. After that, they apologized and we went to our room. -The rooms: very nice. mini bar was restocked daily with beer and sodas. also, above the minibar fridge are 4 kinds of liquors you can drink for free- there was bacardi, rum, brandy, and whiskey (i think). Those were also restocked whenever they were getting empty. The bathrooms came with shower caps, sewing kits, etc. The only problem with the room was the airconditioning and the fridge. The fridge was not cold and the airconditioning went on and off throughout the night so the temperature in the room was inconsistent all night. the TV has some good channels like fox and national geographic in english. -room service: i tried everything! the only good things were the CAESER SALAD it was SO good! also, the nachos of coarse. the deserts were not tasty at all. the cheesecake and chocolate cake were dry and bad. The food was always there witihin 15 minutes and they bring it into your room and put it down on the table for you. When you're done, leave it outside your door. Bars: VERY GOOD! drinks are delicious but unfortunately fattening. i gained five pounds in 1 week and it would have been more if i didnt smoke a pack a day. the bartenders are very nice and funny. all of them were very social and willing to help. the best drinks were the margaritas, mojitos, pina coladas, and the ernest hemingway. the mudslide and cosmopolitan are not as good as they are in the states. -Service: impecable! they wait on you hand and foot. they replace your ashtray after every cigarette, offer more drinks every few minutes, and are always smiling. on the first day, the employees called us twice to make sure everything was alright. tipping them makes them very happy so bring lots of singles! -Towel cards and keys: not fun to carry around! we were terrified ours would get stolen but they didnt. the safe key was safe enough hiding in my sock drawer but everything else we would have to carry around. it is best to take the key off of the plastic thing indicating the room number in case someone steals it and breaks into your room. maybe thats a little paranoid, i'm not sure, but it worked for me! -Beach: rocks everywhere! bring beach shoes for the water because otherwise you'll be saying "ouch" with every few steps. fish swim around by the shore and are not afraid of people. the beaches get really crowded in the mornings and the sun is strong. i'd suggest wearing SPF 30 on the first day. our first day on the beach, we saw a monkey in one of the trees! all the women are topless so if you dont want your young kids to see that, go somewhere else. also, the people are mostly russian, polish, swedish. not many americans at all. -Shopping: if you exit the riu palace and go to your right, theres a little shopping mall 2 minutes away. they do henna tattoos, sell a lot of cigars, shoes, clothes, etc. Its perfect for buying your friends and family little presents. To your left, there are a few shops but are nothing special. i would say go to the mall. there is something there for everyone. also, that is where you can go to get lighters, sunblock, and bathing suits instead of the resort store where everything is expensive. -Food: buffet was great!!! even the pizza there was great. i never got bored of it because there is so much variety. the lunch buffet is by the beach and breakfast and lunch buffets are by the lobby. all meals are great, especially lunch and dinner. unfortunately, the desserts were a little dissappointing. many of them just didnt have a taste to them at all, but everything else was great. The a la carte restaurants are impossible to get a reservation for the same night. reserve them the day you get to the resort. i went to the japanese one on the 4th day there when i was already used to buffets. we waited 30 minutes for them to take our order and another 30 for them to bring us our food. the room where we ate was tiny, hot, and noisy. the food wasnt great either. -Everything else: overall, it was a great experience. the entertainment at night sometimes went on for a long time and it was very noisy for those that were in their rooms. but the entertainment is pretty funny most of the time, especially if you're a little tipsy. towels are changed every day, bathtub is small but nice. there are only 2 ashtrays in the room. i dont know what else to say! -Be careful: with our keys! i did hear some stories of theft so just hold on to your stuff. also, dont leave your screen door open at all. a wasp got into our room and it just did not want to leave!!! the doors are wooden and heavy, very annoying to open when you're tired. I hope this was helpful! if you have any questions, e-mail me at radiohead495@hotmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Riu Riviera Maya or Riu Palace?”
Reviews.Author: Donna A
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I have seen most of the Riu's in the Caribbean and this Palace is in line with the other Palace signature resorts. Although this is newer than the Riu Palace Mexico, I prefer the Riu Palace and here is my reason: The original Riu Palace does not have a kids club. Any Palace Resorts with Riu is NOT kid friendly and families should really look to the Iberostars for the perfect family vacation. We sat at dinner at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya next to a family of 6 (kids were approx. 5, 9, 13) and when the food was presented by lifting the silver domes, the kids all complained and collectively said YUK and Eew! This was disturbing to us and other guests. You will not find kid friendly food on the menu, this is for a reason. Elegant dining, quiet pool areas to me says adult. I had a talk with the manager of the Riu Palace Riviera Maya and he told me there were trying the kids club to increase business. The beach at the Riu Palace Mexico is larger and better but the pools at the new Riu Riviera Maya are better. Just me opinion!! Email me with questions: dalkarmi@Yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Good Potential, Great Staff, Needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: rviolett
Reviews.Content: Great Buffet Great Service Staff Good Facility Plenty of Drinks No Beach Poor information Fitness Center Inadequate and poorly maintained Spa Massage below average Poor availability of Food after 11PM Halls noisy Hot Tubs not Hot Buffet Food better than Specialty Restaurants Evening Entertainment limited

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: used2xray
Reviews.Content: This year's family trip was teriffic. A little hectic at the Cancun airport, lots of people trying to help you with your bags, it's best if you find the company (i.e. Apple Travel) you made your travel plans with. The ride to the hotel was uneventful and lasted about 45 minutes to an hour. Upon arriving at the hotel we went straight the reception desk, a gentleman took our bags to the side and found someone to help us, unfortunately the man at the reception desk didn't speak English very well, but we got our point across and so did he. My dad and stepmom made reservations at 2 of the restaurants while my husband ,6 year old daughter, brother, sister and sisters boyfriend went to go check out the lunch buffet at Chiles. Lots to choose from, pizza, hamburgers, french fries, salads, pastas and other more exotic choices. You MUST have the ice cream!!! After lunch which was running late around 4 p.m. we went to sit by the pool, chairs were available but at that time they had run out of towels, this did NOT happen for the rest of the trip, towels, drinks, and food were all plentiful and service was exceptional, people come around all day long asking if they can get you anything. We ate all our breakfasts at the main dining room buffet, wonderful! Eggs, rolls, fruit, juices, meats,made to order omlettes, you can even have a bloody mary with bkfast! Lunches at Chiles everyday, cervezas were flowing freely. We tried two of the specialty restaurants. The Brazilean restaurnat was not that great. Meat on skewers desert, not as good as in the main dining room. The gourmet restaurant was FABULOUS. We took our 6 year old who behaved very well, If you have a child or children who can't sit for a while this would not be the restaurant of choice, it is very quiet and your meal takes a while to be served. We had mussels as an appetizer, scallops and shrimp for a main, some of us had the beef, it was all wonderful and the champagne glasses were refilled often. Desert was also DELICIOUS! The beach is very small at the hotel but you can use the beach at the other RIU palace hotel which is a 5 minute walk, there we went parasailing, jet skiing, each activity is 55 US dollars. I only used the fitness room once, there are only 2 treadmills 1 bike, one recumbant bike and some weight machines, no free weights or other equipment. The weather was perfect each day, we only had rain 1 night and for 15 minutes one afternoon. Our room was cleaned daily and they did a fantastic job, my daughter loved all the towel animals they made and the fridge was always stocked with water and other soft drinks and beer, there is also a separate liquor cabinet above the fridge. The pool area is lovely, swim up bar, lots of chairs, towel shack, infinity pool stationary chaise lounges in a shallow area of the main pool. Umbrellas and shade can be found as well. At night you will find singers, bands, shows and lots of people coming around to offer to get you drinks. We also spent some time in the sports bar, air hockey, pool tables, t.v. some video games and a fridge with snacks. The lobby had plenty of couches and chairs where we also spent some time playing cards and catch phrase. At night there was turn down service with Hershey Kisses left on the bed. The safe in our room was our only issue, very frustrating trying to get it unlocked, no one else had this problem. Another plus..........this is the only time I have traveled outside the US and not had a problem with my stomach, We were all sad to go home, the ride back to the airport was again ,uneventful. The airport was hectic once again, the lines to check our luggage were VERY long but moved fairly quickly. Don't buy any type of drink to bring on the plane, we had to toss out our unopened water and bottle of soda. All and all we had a great time together, lots of laughs, lots of food, lots of sunshine. I think all 8 of us would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Beach”
Reviews.Author: Beach-lover-LA
Reviews.Content: My family (me, wife, 2 kids under the age of 2) spent Dec. 15-23 at this hotel. It’s truly a beautiful hotel, food was good and service great. There is a large area to lie down at the beach to tan…but very little shade since you have to rely only on the palm trees. There are no umbrellas on the beach, so we found ourselves having to move every few minutes to avoid the sun. Finally, I just grabbed an umbrella from the pool area and took it to the beach. I was very, very disappointed in the lack of a swimming beach area (see pictures!). Apparently, the high tide came in within the past 2 months and washed away all the sandy area to walk into the beach. There were huge algae covered rocks in front of the hotel. They were putting up hundreds of sandbags to prevent the ocean from eroding the beach wall in front of the hotel. There is a small (about 25 yards) area in front of the neighboring hotel to the right of this hotel (about 2 minute walk) where you can swim…of course, this area also was surrounded by humongous sand bags the size of cars. There is also nowhere to stroll along the beach...you are surrounded by hotels and homes whose beaches have also been completely eroded. Also, the water was not as warm as I expected…neither in the ocean nor in the (unheated) pool…you get used to it after a while, but it was a bit cold for the kids. I would not go back to this hotel in the winter…maybe it is better with a lower tide and warmer water in the summer, but if you like swimming in the ocean, this is definitely not the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, a few problems needs sorting out”
Reviews.Author: montydogStAlbans
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel from 18 Dec-31 December with my husband and 3 year old little girl. We had a fantastic holiday at this hotel, many of the visitors were Canadians or Americans and only a few of us Europeans. We were very impressed by the level of service in the Restaurants and the housekeeping. We did leave however with a sour taste in our mouth after a few pesos that we had left lying around was taken from our room. We spoke to the General Manager and was told that they would look into the situation. A bottle of wine (which was already part of the package) was left in our room with no explanation at all. It was more the principal of someone taking something rather than the amount. All the staff treated our little girl very well and she was treated like a little princess, which she is of course in our eyes. If you want to go shopping, there is Playa de Carmen (15 min walk or 5 dollars in taxi), there is the usual souvenir tat and trinkets and some other little boutiques. They also have Starbucks, which is a godsend - you can also get the ferry from here to Cozumel. With the pound being very strong against the dollar, I would advise you to go to Cancun for the day to go shopping. The journey time is only an hour from the bus terminal at Playa de Carmen, take a taxi to La Isla Shopping. It is a shopping village with bar and restaurants, Aquarium (swim with dolphins) and some designer shops. Now here are the bad points: Was told incorrect information regarding booking the Christmas Eve Dinner by reception and hence did not book a table for dinner - was passed from waiter to waiter to see if we could have a table, in the end my husband just sat down and we went to get our meal. The dining room where dinner was served (Don Manolo) could not cope with the amount of people wanting to eat, it was like being in a sardine can. By the time you sat down to have your meal your food was cold. In the end, we could not be bothered to go up again. Management should arrange for the staff to have English lessons as some could not cope with even the basic stuff. I would recommend this hotel and would certainly go back but after a couple of years after they have sorted some the problems out. This is far the best of the Rui Hotels in the Playacar enclosure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: palmtreenut-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace December 9-16th. Upon arriving at the hotel we were given the customary welcome drink and were surprised to learn that our rooms were ready at 11:00am. The rooms are beautiful and well maintained. the mini-bar was always well stocked and the room was always cleaned and fresh towels left. We received a call on our first day inquiring as to wether we were happy with our room. A very nice touch I must say and it is true that the beds are hard as rocks but you get used to it after a couple of nights We have travelled to the DR several times and this was our first time to Mexico and also to a RIU. The resort is beautiful and always perfectly maintained. The food was excellent at the main buffet. They had two theme dinners while we were there, one was Caribbean and one was Mexican. They make extra efforts with the theme nights such as ice, butter and watermellon sculptures. We only went to one a-la carte dinner which was the Rodizio. They keep the platter warm at your table with a candle that smells a lot like Citronella which was giving me a head ache so we kept blowing it out. Many people that we talked to loved this restaurant so maybe it was just not for us. After that we prefered to eat outside on the terrace at the main buffet and enjoyed ourselves. The service is wonderful at this resort. When you sit down there are waiters waiting to push your chair in for you and every request no matter how small or large is attended to quickly and with a smile. The one thing I noticed was that not many people were tipping. I thought this was odd as these people work very hard and very long hours. We tipped quite frequently and were thanked every time. Plaza Playacar is a five minute walk up the road for shopping etc or you can walk 25 mins in the other direction (or a $5 cab ride) to Playa del Carmen. If you can manage to beat off the time share sales people it is quite enjoyable to do a little shopping there as well. The ferry to Cozumel is $11.00 and about 40 minutes to get across. Signor Frogs is also on the pier and always looked busy. We went on one tour which was the Fat Cat. A 50ft Catamaran that cruises for an hour and then snorkeling for an hour and then time on a beautiful beach and then another hours cruise back. There was also deep sea fishing off the back so there was something for everyone. It was $85 US for four hours and well worth it. They also provided all snacks, fruit and all the beer and rum punch that you could drink. They were a lot of fun and I would totally recommend it. After seeing the beaches in the DR I must say that the beaches in Mexico are sadly lacking. The storms have eroded the beaches to the point where they are almost non-existant. There are two levels of beach at this resort......the upper and the lower. The upper is beautiul with plenty of room and lots of palm trees for shade. The lower is two steps down and there is not any ocean access as it is all rocks and coral. You can walk about three minutes to The Reef which is the resort next door and swim in at their beach access. Not sure if that is really allowed but we all did it anyway. All in all it was a fabulous vacation and we would return again. RIU Palace is definately a palace and they treat you like royalty. If you want a nice relaxing vacation then this is the place for you. P.S. Say Hi to Zavier in the lobby bar at night. He makes the best white russians and always remembered what we liked. I miss him!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great resort, but not for beach lovers”
Reviews.Author: GerryUSA
Reviews.Content: Review RIU Palace Riviera Maya We just came back from a great 7 day vacation there (Dec. 14-21, 2006). In order not to repeat too much of what others have written, just the points that stuck out to us: This resort is much more subdued than others, probably due to the fact that it is a RIU Palace, also we found that the AGES were very mixed, there seemed to be quite a lot of people our age (late twenties to mid- thirties), maybe also due to the fact that at least 3 weddings took place while we were there … GUESTS were international; majority seemed US American, but also lots of Europeans (the weak Dollar = strong Euro buys them a lot over here nowadays.) You’ll see quite some Speedos but not very many top-less women … ;-) The whole resort feels more HOTEL-LIKE than any other resort we have been to (Paradisus Punta Cana & Coral Marien Puerta Plata, both Dom.
