All the servers in the dining rooms were excellent always someone around to help you. The food was delicious, especially the fish. We met a lot of wonderful people there. Earl & Stacey, Enriekay & Marilyn, and nonofit. We loved the fountains we had a race in one after the show one night. (it was one of my favorite vacations ever)

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: dignplant
Reviews.Content: First, I'm a RIU Gold Card member because we love RIU resorts. Have been to 7 different RIUs, a couple of them multiple times. RIU is the best value for the money, period! We stayed at the Palace Riviera Maya from Oct 7-13, 2006. RIU Palace Riviera Maya is beautiful. Its almost new, and is as clean and friendly as any of them. We even got upgraded to one of the 8 "super" suites with the spiral staircase to an upper floor with a jaccuzi tub (never used it) and several chairs. One of the very few "Ocean View" rooms we've ever had at a RIU. In fact, many rooms at the R.P.R.M. have ocean views, and thats a plus. Surprise, we give the room a 9 out of 10. Only problem is that it seems the resort shuts off all air cond. between about 2:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m. Maybe not, but it sure seemed that way. No light or fan in the shower area. But my, it was beautiful...and very clean! Food was pretty good, even though this was not a peak period and the resort was far from full, meaning that you had only one choice for breakfast, the main buffet. It was good, but during peak periods I believe you have more choices. We went to Sir Oliver and it was very good. Also did the Mexican and it was very good. Lunch was always at "Chili's" by the beach and it was always good. Can't beat the self serve Corona tap! Excellent soups, breads, salads and a good variety of entree's. O.K., not gourmet but more than satisfactory. Give it 8 out of 10. Beach/Pool. We are beach people. Spent one afternoon in the pool over-indulging in mudslides by the pool bar. Absolutely the friendliest bartenders, better than most RIUs. The pool was not crowded and was very inviting. No obnoxious drunks to be found. The beach was...better than o.k. Rocky on the left as you face the ocean but fine to the right. We parked our chaises to the left and walked a few yards to the right to enter the ocean. The water was a little rough, cloudy with sand, and more green than blue for the first few days, but soon cleared and became more "caribbean blue".. It was always caribbean blue after the first 30 ft. Don't pay any attention whatsoever to complaints about the "wall". There is a section of "seawall" between some of the chaises and the lower beach. It goes from zero inches to about four feet at most, and there are stairs in several spots. Our daily walk to the beach included a three step stairway to "our spot". Never a problem getting loungers, never. Hobie Cats, kayaks and paddle boats always available. Beach/pool 9 out of 10. Riu has started a new position, a "Public Relations" person. Judith was the main one we dealt with. Judith was everywhere, met just about everyone and wanted to know what she could do to make our stay more enjoyable. We asked for champaign in our room...and it was done! Next day we asked for two bottles since the first went too quickly. Judith came back apologetically, saying that they were delivering one bottle right away but tht they had run out of champaign, but that by noon the next day a new shipment was due to arrive and she would have it delivered. She was off that next day but guess what....it was delivered that next afternoon. Definately utilize the "P.R." resource. We give this a 12 out of 10! Now, as a comparison, I'd rank the R.P.R.M. just below the Riu Palace Mexico, a couple hundred yards south. I'd rank the Riu Palace Macao in the Dominican Republic between the two, and the Riu Club Hotel Ocho Rios (Jamaica) right up there as well. Sandals resorts may (do) offer a bit more but they cost a LOT more. We do Sandals for the "special" trips, 20 yr anniversary, etc., but we go to RIU every other chance we get! I'm a scuba diver and Scuba Caribe is right on property. With five or six Riu's in proximity, they do a good job of filling dive boats. One day I had to take a jet ski from the Palace R.M. to the Palace Mexico to meet the boat (Sunday), but other days the boat left directly from the R.M. Great bunch of staff at the R.M. Never more than five divers to the dive master.

Reviews.Title: “4 STAR RESORT”
Reviews.Author: iv2go
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rui for 4 days. We go to Playa about 4 times a year and decided to try a different resort. Check-in was ok. No one greeted us. No one got our bags. After check-in we were told about the resort and then let go to find our rooms on our own. We first went to make dinner reservations. Only one restaurant was available for the next 2 days and the only time was at 6:30. I find this really not a good system. On to the room. Our room was clean and our bed was comfortable. I didn't notice the bed being to hard. Our frig was not stocked. I had to stop the man in the hall and give him a tip to get him to come stock us. We never were stocked again. Off to the pool and beach. Very very nice. Pool is great. Service was ok but again we have stayed where the service is great. Enjoyed the pool area a bunch. There are plenty of bars at night to go to. Service is good except in the sports bar. On to food. This is where the Rui really fails. All of the restaurnats are not good. The Chilis for lunch is the pits. It is ok for one day but it never changes. The other restaurants are just not up to par. I rate them 3 star. The buffet is ok. But it is a buffet. We however had a wonderful time. You learn when traveling to make do with what you have and have a blast. If you worry about all the details it will ruin your trip. I love this board and read it to try and gain info on where to stay. I will try the Palace next before I return here.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: Hadam
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Palace Riviera Maya on Oct 7th... stayed 2 weeks.... The hotel is absolutely beautiful... the service was excellent... there is nothing bad to say. The staff are so friendly and very willing to help you. There is nothing they will not do for you. They serve you on the beach.... The beach is beautiful even with the seawall.... The resturants were all very good and the service was excellent. The buffet was very good and they was lots of selection. The best is the chocolate fountain. This is our fifth Riu and we loved this one. S0 if you are looking for a beautiful hotel, great service and good food this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: ammm
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Mexico (and to an all inclusive for that matter) and while we had a very nice, relaxing vacation and thought the hotel had many positive features, I do not feel that it deserves it's 6 Golden Apple rating. This is based on two things. First is the hotel site itself which is crammed in with a bunch of other hotels. If you want someplace secluded then this is not it! Second are the restaurants/food which are passable but not very good. We ate at the Mexican restaurant our first night and the Gourmet restaurant the second night. Both meals were just so so and the atmosphere was pretty but lifeless. They don't even play music which makes for a VERY quiet evening. They also allow children in all of the restaurants and while I have children of my own, I do not think it's appropriate in the more upscale establishments at the resort. One couple actually had a portable TV so that their son could watch "Dora" while they ate. For our last two nights we gave up and did the buffet. We actually preferred this even though everyone warned us that the buffets are bad. We loved not needing a reservation and having the option to sit outside which none of the other places have. The food in the buffet was pretty much the same as what was offered in the restaurants but at least you could see for yourself and find other options if you didn't like what you got. On the positive side, the grounds inside the hotel, including the courtyard, pool area and beach, were lovely. It is IMPERATIVE that you get a courtyard/ocean view so you don't have to look at all of the crap that surrounds the hotel. Our view was great. The service was also extremely good in almost every area of the hotel. VERY friendly. The only people who were not nice were the guys renting the boats. They just couldn't be bothered. The rooms were also nice and clean. The beds were firm but fine. The fridge was always well stocked. The only thing I did not like were the thin walls/doors but we turned on our cieling fan and that "white noise" helped enough that it wasn't a big problem. Bottom line, if you're into food, skip the all inclusive route all together and find a place where you can find legitimate fine dining. If you're just out to relax and hang by the pool, the all inclusive concept works just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Riu!”
Reviews.Author: dukeshmook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for 6 nights. I have been to Mexico 7x and this by far was one of my best experiences. I want to thank Yak, Ailene and Nehaib (the animation team) for creating wonderful memories for both me and my friends. They took us out every night to various clubs in Playa, made us feel welcomed and comfortable. They are very responsible, smart and an amazing team, I must admit I'm not sure the Riu would be the same without them. They are the entertainment by the pool playing bingo, teaching us to dance salsa, playing volleyball, beach parties and laughing, laughing, laughing... I can go on and on about these 3 fabulous employees. They made our vacation and I can't thank them enough. The hotel was wonderful in every way imaginable except for the buffet and I contribute that to the fact that we were there off season. I've been to the other Riu Palace twice and their buffet was fantastic but it was prime season, therefore I am sure if you go during the prime season you would be perfectly satisfied. They have many exceptional restaurants so it didn't have much of an impact on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “wheel chair traveller”
Reviews.Author: eddy6
Reviews.Content: My husband and 22 year old daughter and I went to this wonderful resort on Sept. 29/2006. I have MS and use a wheelchair. This hotel has wheelchair accessible rooms and 2 proper accessible washrooms, one conviently located by the pool/lunch restaurant and the other near the reception area. There is not one close to the buffet restaurant. This resort was everything we hoped for, the staff was wonderful, the pool, beach and grounds were beautiful. We visited the other Riu sites which were included in our stay. The Yucatan pool was the nicest, although not as nice as the Palace Riviera. The Mexico hotel seemed to be the second best. The beach was fabulous and went on for miles! Staff brought you drinks right down to the beach and of course around the pool. Capacity at the hotel was only 40% so there was no waiting for drinks and plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas to go around. Room service was excellent in the morning. We did have one rainy afternoon and then room service was about an hour but I am sure they were very busy. There is shopping within a 5 minute walking distance but we also went to Playa de Carmen which was a $5 cab ride away. If you want to use the beach at Playa de Carmen walk at least 10 min down the beach. Before this they want to charge you $20 to use a lounge chair for the day. But further down if you just buy drinks there is no hassle. My husband and daughter did the trip to Xacaret which they loved. The hotel even brought them back for lunch to the hotel. The hotel had great evening shows, early bands and a piano bar. I would definitly recommend this hotel for anyone with a disablility. They helped us in every way possible and staff would stop us many times to ask if we needed any help.

Reviews.Title: “11 days at this Riu”
Reviews.Author: cgreen1902
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were only going to stay 8 days and 7 nites. We added three more nites to our stay. The beaches were fabulous- the water/ocean was warm and very easy to go into will only small waves. The Hotel was like Cabo San Lucas only about 1/3 the size. Very nice...The pool was a little disappointing because we had the Riu/Cabo to compare. It was smaller, only one swim up bar, the infinite pool was behind the main pool and did not overlook the ocean. The entertainment poolside was fun. Alena- a girl from Brazil very fun. The bartenders were great and remembered you. The food was very much the same as other Riu's. We dined in town several nites for dinner. We could relax here---the stroll along the beaches to other Riu's was nice. The topless scenery was good for my husband!;)..Meet a lot of great folks from all over the world. Visiting here in Sept. the occupacy was 35%.

Reviews.Title: “Was an amazing New Hotel.. Great features and great people”
Reviews.Author: GregAnita
Reviews.Content: This was our anniversary trip which we go somewhere new every year. We took some friends with us and had a great time. The Trip started out a little bad but turned out really well on our part. To begin with, We had originally scheduled ourselves at the Riu Cancun hotel but with a week to go, our travel agent called and said that the Riu Cancun had overbooked their hotel. That was a bad sign, Then they called and Said that the Riu palace resorts wanted to make us an offer. They said if we would go to the Riu Palace Riviera Maya in Playa Del Carmen they would not only upgrade us to the 5 star hotel from the 4 star, they would also give us a free 7 day vacation next year for free at any Riu resort that is 4 star or lower. That was our first obstacle that we overcame. Then we took our flight out of St. Louis non stop to Cancun. Their was a little mix up on our transportation to the hotel which was an hour south of Cancun. They ended up putting all four of us in a Dodge Stratus ( Good thing we were all close friends) haha..!!! That was the second obstacle that we overcame. Then came "our" first room ! The first room was ok but had an odor that was really bad. They tried to take care of it but they allowed us to move after day 2. Then everything became great. The people were so helpful and friendly. The kept everything stocked in our room and also kept it very clean. Made some really good friends while we were there. Would recommend to couples and families. Not a really big party place, which was ok by me. But did have soom good points. I recommend taking the Mayan Ruins tour!! Thanks RIU

Reviews.Title: “Not quite up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal619
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I stayed for 3 nights here from 22 Sept to 25 Sept. We are travel agents and were there to inspect several resorts in the area. I have stayed at Riu properties in Playacar before, as well as in Punta Cana, Cancun, and Jamaica. RPRM was the same classic design as the Riu Palace Punta Cana, meaning absolutely gorgeous. Resort was impeccably spotless. Beds are the same as other Riu properties. They are firmer than most, but I was able to sleep with no problem, and my bed at home is MUCH softer. The beach on the left side was VERY rocky. If you want your feet to stay in one piece, swim on the right side, lots of soft sand. Rooms were spotless. They were cleaned and restocked daily with nightly turndown service. Restaurants- Agave- Mexican restaurant: the food was tasty and well prepared here. The buffett for appetizers was very good and the service was very good. Sergio is a sweetie who will go above and beyond to accomodate you, including pouring double shots of Cuervo during dinner. Since we were there during the off season, the steak house was also located in Agave. Again, food was tasty, seafood was very tasty. Sir Oliver- Gourmet- I have eaten in Sir Oscars in PUJ and the gourmet restaurant in Negril in Jamaica so I was looking forward to an excellent meal. I was dissapointed in both the food and the service. My partner had to go to the bar himself in order to get a beer twice. The food took an incredibly long time to arrive, and they forgot one of the appetizers we ordered. The appetizers were very good, but the main course was so dissapointing. Filet mignon were actually medallions of beef. Good, but not what I ordered. The shrimp were ok, overcooked, but the scallops were tasteless and bland, like they had been thawed and refrozen several times. Desert was ok. Main buffett- Again I was a little disappointed. I usually look forward to the breakfast buffett, but it was very limited, warm juices, stale pastries, and lukewarm coffee. DON"T do breakfast at Chilis on the beach, not good at all. Lunch was better at Chilis. Room service was quick and good. Pool was great, nice and big and the drinks were plentiful. Laura at the front desk is a wonderful help with anything you may need. I hope with a little time, this Riu will become as wonderful as the rest I have stayed at. But for right now, I would stick with the Riu Palace Mexico for Playacar.

Reviews.Title: “Riu- Maya Riviera is Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELER0078
Reviews.Content: RIU- MAYA RIVIERA is ABSOLUTELY amazing! Its the newest and most appealing. Let me start off by the FIRST CLASS SERVICE. The staff go out of thier way to make you feel welcome and are very friendly. The rooms are amazing and very posh. The food at the different restaurants was unbelievable... esp Sir Oliver and Agave. This is a beautiful place. We would go for walk on thier beach, go swimming in the vast pool, or jsut hang out at all the different bars drinking our favorite frozen cocktail.. The Mohitos, blue coral, pina coladas, etc drinks were soo refreshing! And as an added bonus, they had entertainment every night. We walked downtown to buy a few souvenirs and went to the other RIU resorts (but of course Maya is the BEST on out of them). There is plenty of good food and tons of choices for even the pickiest eater. Overall, we loved it and we would go there again and again..... VIVA RIU!!! :):):):)

Reviews.Title: “Nice time, but could work on a couple of things”
Reviews.Author: castx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RPRM on a Funjet package from 9/14-9/17/06. We found the front desk, bell and wait staff to be courteous and helpful upon our arrival and throughout our stay. The lobby architecture is breathtaking. There is always someone cleaning everything, so the entire resort is spotless. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay there again. There are some glitches they still need to work on, but nothing that can't be overcome. ROOMS - THE GOOD: Spotlessly clean, nicely decorated. THE NOT SO GOOD: We were taken to our first room and two male members of the housekeeping staff were in the room - which wouldn't have been a problem except for the fact that they were in the process of tossing back a Corona from the refrigerator in the room. It was a first floor room with a view directly into the hotel next door - which seems to be normal procedure for this hotel from what I've read and heard from other guests while we were there. (One guest we spoke to had taken a poll of the other guests, and every single one had been put into a room on that side. If you spoke to the manager, you were upgraded to a courtyard room, if you spoke to the girl at the front desk, you did not get a room change.) Then the toilet didn't work. Initially they told us they would put in a work order, but when I pointed out we had just arrived and hadn't even unpacked, , they immediately moved us to a different room on the second floor. I do have to admit being disappointed in the beds - they were very hard with only a thin mattress pad. If you are short, or have any joint issues you may have trouble getting into the shower - I'm only 5' tall and the tub wall was well above my knees. Sound carries in very clearly from the hallways - including screaming children at 2 a.m. FOOD - THE GOOD: Arriving on a Thursday, the hotel was quiet and we were able to get into the gourmet restaurant without reservations. The service was impeccable and the food delicious. We had bruschetta, pasta with shrimp and mussels, mussels Rockefeller, duck, filet, and crepes suzette with vanilla ice cream. Absolutely fabulous. I enjoyed the breakfast buffet. It contained a variety of breads, pastries, smoothies and juices, mimosas, granolas and cereal bases to create your own, omelette chef, a hot line with bacon, sausage, hash browns, poached and scrambled eggs, sopapillas, and a fruit and cheese buffet as well. THE NOT SO GOOD: Definitely skip the Agave and Japanese restaurants. While the appetizer buffet at the Agave is decent, the main courses and desserts are inedible - varying from under to overcooked. We heard that the Brazilian restaurant there was "okay" though we didn't try it ourselves. Chilis was okay for lunch, but nothing to get excited about. BARS - the swim up bar is nice with the separate little table and seating areas in the pool as well. The bartenders could use a bit more training as they seem to do fine with the hotel specialties, but had difficulty with layered drinks such as a B52, and didn't have a good knowledge of how to prepare many basic bar drinks. Watch out for bartender Hilario - he is definitely on the prowl and we had difficulty keeping him off one of our group members. Definitely try the Batida de Coco! POOL/BEACH: THE GOOD: chairs/lounges were always available, lots of umbrellas for shade, beach sand was soft and clean, the people who did the water aerobics really seemed to enjoy it. THE NOT SO GOOD: wait staff minimal to nonexistent. MISC: On Thursday night vendors were allowed to set up in the courtyard. If you want a hammock, haggle and buy it from the guy there - best price we saw in Playa. There's also a guy who sets up and makes cigars (he was there Thursday and Saturday) - my boss enjoyed the one we brought back for him. We give the divemasters and scuba concession there five stars - very friendly and knowledgeable. The shopping plaza that is within walking distance isn't bad, just make sure you negotiate - the leather shop came down on their price by 60%. And if you want a henna tatoo there are a couple of carts that do them for $8-20 depending on the complexity and size of the design. Our one off resort excursion was a snorkeling trip from Maroma. We were taken out on a catamaran to two different sites on the reef - one hour each time in the water. Both were excellent sites for viewing marine life. And we discovered that the fish love jalapeno cheetos (provided by the crew) - with patience, you can get them to eat from your hand. Even though I'm not a strong swimmer, it was still a nice excursion. The catamaran ran on motor the whole time which was fine, it made for a very nice ride. Take small bills because the swing bar has trouble making change over 20 pesos. Beware when you get back, you may get stuck at the on-site restaurant for an hour or more while you wait for your shuttle back to your hotel - chips, beer, soda, and water are free - everything else is not. And no one seemed particularly thrilled with the food they were served. OVERALL: We really enjoyed ourselves and the RPRM as did everyone we met while there. Admittedly, its not perfect, but few places are, especially when they are as new as this one is. Just keep your sense of humor and you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Riu Palace standards; chef needs a kick in the butt!”
Reviews.Author: thevagabond
Reviews.Content: Was eager to see this new Riu Palace based on very enjoyable stays at their sister properties, but was very disappointed in the level of staff training, their helpfulness, and particularly in the poor food quality during my stay. On arrival, I was put in a room with a view to the bowels of the budget hotel next door - a room that shouldn't be rented to the public, in my view. After complaining to the front desk I was moved to something on the ground level with a view of the lovely courtyard, and the hotel was far from full, so I don't know why they didn't offer this room from the outset. Strangely, the front desk clerk told me the first room was an oceanview room, but you couldn't see water from anywhere in the room or the deck. Food quality at the restaurants was particularly disappointing. I've stayed in several Riu Palace properties and always found a great selection of high-quality food at the dinner buffet. This time, I found nothing but cheap ingredients carelessly prepared; no chocolate fountain (which I understood to be a Riu Palace signature item) or paella. Breakfast buffet had only cheap, greasy cold cuts instead of the smoked salmon that I usually find. The courteous wait staff found me some smoked salmon in the back, but it was a lengthy wait each morning. Rooms were pleasant, seemed a little smaller than other Riu Palace properties, and were quite noisy when the neighbors came and went. My advice to management is to invest in some soundproofing for the room doors, and to tell the chef to stop cutting so many corners in food quality. This property is not up to Riu Palace standards.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel So Far”
Reviews.Author: jodiNebraska
Reviews.Content: Hotel was Grand. Food was Great and service was fantastic!! Don't let anyone tell you it is bad. It was GREAT! It is more of a couples place than singles, but it is still a great time. I would come back again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Forget the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Lucianne
Reviews.Content: Unless you expect hotel staff to be at your every beck and call and take joy out of treating people like your personal servants, the RIU Riveria Palace is definitely one of the best hotels I have been to. Forget the reviews that suggest that the service here is terrible. I recently went for a wedding from August 20-27 and I found the people who worked to be more than accomodating, the rooms extremely clean, the food excellent, the amenenties clean and accessible and on and on.... People who had complained about the hotel need to take into account cultural differences and not expect to be treated in the White North-American fashion as one would be in the likes of chain hotels (Marriot, Hyatt), One of the only troubles we ran into was on the first day when my friend wanted our room changed because our balcony was facing a loud fan from another property and she couldn't enjoy her cigarette. While a manager did sound as if he was rude to her, the room otherwise was a complete luxury. People have to expect that when they complain about luxury, you are bound to get some attitude. Anyhow, the RIU Palace was phenomenal. To all visitors: don't be discouraged by negative reviews!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Place”
Reviews.Author: smiley22
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from August 10th to the 17th and we had a blast. Just some background info....we are both in our mid to late 20s and like to enjoy some of the finer things when it comes to food etc. We both found the hotel to be immaculately clean and the service to be excellent. The employees of the hotel are some of the hardest workers I have ever seen, and I really appreciated how the waiters and waitresses..( the ones who you saw on a daily basis) remebered your drink. We did have a problem with our door on the first day but it was fixed within 10 min. of us getting there. We weren't expecting the food to be great but we were always pleased with the buffet. We tried the steakhouse and the mexican resturants, but we both agreed that the buffet had better if not at least a fresher and of course a bigger variety of food. We never had difficulty trying to get a chair at the pool or beach, and I didn't see any kind of wall at the beach from the hurricae season last year. We enjoyed the included kayaks and pool volleyball. The night shows were good....not too much to do at night but if you wanted a great night life you should stay in cancun. Our room was beautiful and spotless...and definatly the coolest place in playa del carmen....just have to remember to keep the balcony door closed if you are going to have it on...it automatically shuts off if the door is open. The jets in the bathtub in the room were great....and the one time we called to get more water/soda for the minifridge it was there in no time. The town is only a 5 min $5.00 cab ride away and it is filled with shops, resturants, and bars....very fun and cute if you want to get away from the hotel for a little bit....and I definately felt very safe walking around there. We tried 2 resturants there...aqua and ( i can't remeber the name of the other one )....aqua was ok...definatly one of the most expensive ones there and not worth the money..... While in playa del carmen we parasailed, jet skiied , went semi-scuba diving ( B.O.B ) which I highly recommend for those who cannot scuba....and got a massage at the spa....all four things were wonderful and highly recommended.... All in all we loved this place and had a wonderful time.....

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Johnswilk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a 2 week hoilday to RIU Palace Las Americas in Cancun to celebrate our honeymoon. We absolutely loved this hotel. Everything about it was amazing. The food, hotel, service etc. As part of a hotel promotion we were offered the chance to go to the RIU Palace Riveria Maya in Playa Del Carmen for 3 nights. As this hotel only opened in February 2006 we were expecting it to be just as good as the Las Americas hotel if not better. We were hugely disappointed. We were intially given a room that faced a stone wall! We complained and was given another room. This had a slight better view but it wasn't great. The room was small for a junior suite. Service in the restaurants were poor. As you walked into the restaurant you were basically ignored by the waiters. We found our own table which hadn't been set and had to pratically hassle the waiter to get a drink. The next day we went to the pool. There is only one pool which had murky water in it. I could see wasps and various other dead insects floating on the top of the water. The pool area had music blaring out of the speakers. It was impossible to relax. i was very surprised that this was a five star hotel. i would only rate it as being 3 star. We were very disappointed and wished we had stayed at the other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: SPF50
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Maya Riviera for 7 days August 26th – Sept. 2nd. We had 2 adjoining rooms as we have 2 children 13 (picky eater) & 17. Let me start off by saying that it is truly a beautiful hotel. Very clean and spacious. The rooms are well appointed with a step down area to view the TV. Our room overlooked the property next door – nothing to look at. Rooms were very quiet. The rooms (with separate entrances) are adjoined by a small hallway with a communal door. This door did not close the 1st day. We brought it to the staff’s attention and it was fixed the next day. We too experienced problems with the doors locking one day. One of the kids had gone back to the room and noticed that it did not lock after leaving. There was someone there fixing it later that day. Pool - There is not enough shade on the beach or near the pool. The tiles around the pool are dark and of course absorb all the heat so you should wear your shoes to the pools edge or risk searing your feet off. The umbrellas are just the cloth/wooden garden variety and do not provide enough shade protection. There were plenty of broken arms on the umbrellas as well, considering the hotel just opened this year. Beach – there is a rocky area that is good for snorkeling – kids saw plenty of fish. To the right of that the water was crystal clear most days, fairly deep though, not suitable for little ones. Again, there is absolutely no shade. With our fair Canadian skin, 95 degree weather with lots of sunshine and no rain, our SPF 50 didn’t do a great job from making us walking tomatoes! Activities – They were always scheduled for a certain time. For example, rifle shooting @ 10:00, Bingo @ 4:00, Bocci @ 3:00. You cannot do them when you want to. My kids are used to playing Ping Pong whenever they want at a resort and then joining a tournament at a specific time. There is not a lot for teenagers to do activity wise. Mine didn’t complain at all though. They were quite happy between the pool and the ocean. Also they only play music at the pools during certain times of the day. The beach party was a bit of a disappointment. They did have a live band for an hour and some dancing on the beach but that was it. They served up some fresh fruit as well. A bbq or paella would have been nice to have on the beach – we have seen this at other resorts less than 5 stars. Entertainment – You must see the Mayan show. It was spectacular. It is an insight to the Mayan culture and very professionally performed. Other dance shows are put on by the Riu dancers. It is nice to see a performing group at night rather than the staff who work during the day in other jobs as in the case of other resorts that we have stayed at. It’s not Las Vegas quality but entertaining nonetheless. Food – Here goes. This is where we have a difference of opinion. Last year we stayed at the Palladium in Puerto Vallerta. I didn’t mind the food, neither did my picky 13 year old. At the Riu we found the buffet food not hot enough on numerous occasions, it was barely warm. There were no chafing dishes, just heat lamps over brick tiles. The salads on the other hand were not chilled enough. Most of the time they were room temperature and that room was outside (Chili’s) and about 90 degrees. There were lots of creamy salads and I didn’t want to take any chances. Beef was served very rare. I tried to stay away from that sort of food but I still managed to Montazuma’s revenge. That didn’t happen last year in PV. My husband & daughter were struck with it when we got home. The picky eater was fine of course! The buffet food didn’t have much variety from day to day. Very greasy and covered in sauces. There is only hot milk for your coffee. Sometimes it was curdled. The coffee was terrible and not very hot. The 17 year old says we are too picky, we say we paid twice as much for this palace as we did for the Palladium in PV – it should be better. We ate twice @ Sir Oliver’s. Service was excellent. Food wasn’t bad. The duck was excellent according to those who ate it, as was the beef and the seafood skewers. Again, not very hot. We had dinner @ the Steakhouse another night. The chicken breast was too dry. Myself and the picky eater had the rib eye steak. Reminiscent of Ponderosa = very fatty. Picky eater thought it was great. Husband had the tenderloin – far too small for his appetite. Again, served lukewarm. We were scheduled to eat there again, but a Manager had tracked us down one night @ Sir Oliver’s at told us that there was a wedding reception booked for that specific night and that we could eat elsewhere if we wanted other reservations. I didn’t understand how they can take reservations for something that’s not available. It really didn’t matter as the food there wasn’t that great anyway. We weren’t missing anything! Service – Service was very inconsistent and in our opinion not of 5 star quality. The first couple of days we had turn down service and then it stopped completely. Some days we had hand towels, some days the bath mats were in the place of hand towels. (Hotel was at approx. 42% occupancy so there is no excuse). Some days the blanket was put on the bed and made up other days it was up in the closet. We did tip everyday and even gave some gifts of makeup & toiletries but that didn’t seem too matter. The waiters in the restaurants are constantly re-filling your glasses with your beverage (opening the Pepsi bottles) or pouring water for you. It’s nice but it gets to be annoying after 4 or 5 times. It seems like they are always around, yet they are nowhere to be found when you’d like a coffee or tea after dinner. Or when the plates need to be picked up. The nightclub/theatre is another story. It seems only men take your drink orders and the women bring them to you. Service is great for the 1st ½ hour or so and then you can barely get a drink. It’s feast or famine. Three waiters will ask you if you want something and you’ve already ordered. Also, they are obsessed about changing the drink coasters. It’s like they change them every 15 minutes. Enough already! We are trying to watch the show and there they are changing the coasters for the 5th time. We ordered room service at night a few times, nachos & cheese for the most part were ok except the last night there, completely soggy. The club sandwich is soaked with mayo. The selection is very limited on the menu but we were surprised to see food that wasn’t on the menu on trays outside other rooms. Guess you have to ask. One night when we were leaving to go to the show we found a tray of chocolate covered strawberries outside our communal door. We didn’t touch it as God knows how long it was there and besides the hallway is about 90 degrees. We spoke with our Sunquest rep and expressed our thoughts on how this could be rated as a 5 star resort. I think she has heard similar concerns from others and mentioned how the staff doesn’t appear to try as hard when it’s a such a low occupancy (42%). This vacation wasn’t cheap even though it was discounted, but I don’t think it was worth anywhere near the money that we paid. It’s a beautiful place but not enough bang for your buck On the plus side – no bugs, crabs or lizards!!! Close to town – which is terrific. Went to Xcaret for 1 day. Pretty pricey but very interesting. Kids enjoyed themselves. All in all a very restful vacation in a beautiful location. – but we’re not going back

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place but won,t go back.”
Reviews.Author: carona#9
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that this resort is very beautiful. The grounds and the buildings are awsome. Sorry to say , that was the highlite of this resort. My wife and myself have vacationed the last three years in the Riviera Maya area. I'm 31 and she is 34. We made the mistake of trying a different resort this year, the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. This was our honeymoon trip. We were told that we would have champane and fruit basket in our room. We discovered no champane and 5 chocolate strawberries in our room. I requested some champane, even offered to pay for it, but it never showed up. The managment as well as the front desk were not really rude but more like snobish, as if we were not important enough to worry about. The buffet was excellent, even though it was basically the same for every meal. We never got to eat at one of the restarunts because of the extremly long lines for the reservations. The beach was ok, the ocean ok to swim but not snorkle. The pool was very nice but it closed at 8 every night. The shows were ok but after the show was over, (11:00) that was it. The only bar open was the sports bar. O yes, room service stops at 11:00 , so if you want a midnight snack your only option is a frozen hamburger or hotdog in the sportsbar. Our room was nice, but then again it is a brand new resort. Our patio view was nice if you like to look at the rooftop of the kitchen next door. I did request to exchange the tequlia for a bottle of gin but they said they could not do that. We arrived on sat night and by mon morning we were done with it. We went to our funjet rep and requested a transfer to our normal resort, Barcelo. He was not very happy, and to make a long story short we basically had to arrange our own transfer. Interestingly enough as soon as the front desk found out we were transfering the guy who stocks the wet bar came to our room and put a 12 pack of Carona in the fridge and offered to get my gin for me complete with some bottles of tonic water. Any way we spent the rest of our nine day honeymoon at a 4 star resort with an awesome ocean view room and had a blast. The Riu Palace is a wonderful motel but it is not what I would call a "Resort".

Reviews.Title: “very nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrgberp
Reviews.Content: my husbend and i toock our daughter and grandson f or a short trp for some r&r this hotel is very nice clean, and the staff very efishiant. the food was exelent my daughter was recently in the hospital and needet a rest and she loved every min. off our stay.Andshe was very rested when we got back home rita

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: StuGrunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Aug 6 - 13. We were two parties with two rooms near each other. I am a spoiled traveler who stays at the finest resorts when I vacation. I would stay here again, and recommend this hotel without hesitation. A comment to me from one of my group upon entering the lobby was "wow, you certainly know how to pick‘em.”. In truth, the comments from others about misc. problems are true, but in my opinion not worthy of mention as they had no impact on my vacation, nor do I consider them to be factors that should appear in a “where do I stay” decision. I say this with the exception of the beds. I too was surprised by how firm they were, but had no issue sleeping, nor did anyone in my group. I say this because I realize that for some, this really could be an issue that could have an effect on your experience. In the end, you should first decide what type of trip you are seeking. If you are looking for a good restful vacation in a beautiful modern setting, this place will meet your needs. If you are looking for a quaint and authentic hideaway, this is the wrong place. In other words, when you think of this resort, do not think of thatched roofs, cabanas, and flip flops, think rather of a marble palace, water fountains, and sandals. Of the guests, the typical age seemed to be around 25-50. Perhaps 10% or so where kids under 18, and they were all well behaved. This place was fun, but not a party place. Food was good, though certainly not five-star, but I would not expect that at an all-inclusive. The staff in the restaurants was at least four-star and clearly are striving to be five-star. Unless you are indeed "high maintenance", if you stay here, I cannot imagine how you would be dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: flyinforfun
Reviews.Content: Particulars" Family ( 2 adults, 2 teenage girls 15 & 17 Southern NH stay: Jul 31-5 Aug First floor rrom facing outside hotel property The hotel review I would write in detail is GLOWING. The property is spectacular, posh and very clean. The staff is overall well mannered, polite, and to a person extremely hardworking. The food was outstanding ( we are foodies- we had some meals bordering on extraordinary- a couple of duds but these were exceptions- good food variety and quality is the norm) Repatative info here: beds are harder than usual, ok for me not for others you do have to reserve a spot by the pool if you desire one exercise area is small layout of Riu Palace Mexico is similar- Riv Maya newer, Mexico Pal has more established beach otherwise no difference walk to downtown PDC is safe, easy, & recommended Stuff I have read here that I cannot believe: That people could make an issue over the insignificant seawall is just amazing to me That a coral/limestone rock causes folks to stay away from a fantastic beatufil beach We are faily active and did some excusions that I would recoomend: Scubacaribe on site: they have snorkel/parasail/and banaboat combo that we found to be unbelievable- banaboat was the most fun we had ever had- parasail great- snorkel was down the coast past Xcaret park surprisingly good Scubacaribe: Cozumel snorkel toup- great snorkeling in 3 different sites off Cozumel- some of the best snorkeling we have seen Highlight trip: Alltournative off track expedition: Jungle crossing- this was a hoot - travel down to Point Solimon & neighboring ranch in a Mercedes Benz Unamog- some off road beast machine. Multi events in this one excurison- paddle & sorkel at coreal reef(saltwater) , go to rach for lunch and cenote snorkeling- very memorable trip highly recommended. Summary: Riu XRM is highly recommended. If you are not a super high maintaince person, you will have a blast

Reviews.Title: “Great food, drinks, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Calm_Waters
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 5 night stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (returned Aug. 5th). I traveled with my husband and our 19 year old son and 2 of his friends. We have stayed at many 5 star resorts and base this review on what we have experienced at other 5 star resorts (one being the Moon Palace in Riviera Maya). What was the most important to me was a good beach with clear blue water (Moon Palace's beach was horrible and the water wasn't blue or clear), a pool with pool bar, and day and night-time activites. I loved the beach and the water. Looking at pictures on this sight I thought that I would be disppointed because of the sea wall, but there is plenty of beach and I was very happy with the beach. The pool was adequate, however if you don't get a lounge chair in the morning you won't get one until evening and the pool bar closes at 5:00 which was very disappointing, the daytime activities were good but the eveing shows were not great (no where near as good as the shows on a cruise ship). We ate at the buffets every night except for one night at the steak restaurant (Chili's). The food was very good. There was a great variety and lots of it. All of us that ate steak at Chili's thought the steak was fabulous. The two that got pork tenderloin were very disappointed, as the pork was very dry. They compared it to eating a hockey puck. The drinks are great, the best we have had at an all inclusive resort. The rooms are average to above average. The hair dryer is tiny and would shut off when I tried to straighten my hair. For children, the elderly, or handicapped traveler, the tub will be a problem. The wall to get into the tub/shower is over 2' high. The beds are hard; I don't like hard beds but had no problem being comfortable while sleeping. We had problems often with the card entry to our room. Many times the room would not lock. Our son's room didn't get made up one day. There are a lot of tiny ants on the balconies and in the buffet restaurant. Don't sit near the windows as this is where we saw ants climbing up the curtains, walls, and on our table. The restaurant is huge so you will have no problem sitting away from the windows where we had no problems with ants. The desk staff was great. I was disappointed with the rest of the staff, many were not very friendly and seemed to expect to be tipped. Ian, who works for Olympus for excursions, was very friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and honest. I would highly recommend using him to book any excursions. He will be in the lobby in an orange shirt. I loved the location of the resort, it is within walking distance to a small shopping mall and close to Playa de Carmen. The streets and sidewalks are constructed with pavers. It seems much safer than other areas we have stayed. I would have had no problem walking to the mall by myself. Just be careful if you walk the beach. One morning, 6:30am, I walked the beach with one of my son's friends. We walked as far as we could. When we were almost to the end we saw 5 armed policemen a few yards in front of us. Not knowing if they were really police was very scary. We knew we couldn't run so decided to walk past them and hope for the best. Luckily they really were police. A traveler we meet told us that he walked the beach every morning and ran into them in the same area. He said they go to this specific area to nap. My son and his friend's had a great time. The played beach volleyball every day. They went to the disco and were very disappointed. They also said that the worker at the sport's bar was very unfriendly. All in all we had a great time. I do not think I will return to this resort, primarily because I wanted more night life and the pool bar closed too early. I thought the resort promoted more then they actually provided in that department.

Reviews.Title: “all-inclusive in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: badtrips1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the RIU Riviera Maya Palace Hotel, located in Playa Del Carmen, Mexico, approximately one hour south of Cancun. The hotel is new and stands out among the adjoining properties. The staff is excellent, as they cater to every need. The language barrier is not an issue, as guests can be assured of receiving quality service. The food is way above average for an all-inclusive. The Gourmet restaurant is actually quite good. There are also restaurants catering to Japanese, Brazilian, and Mexican cuisines, as well as a Steak house on the premisies. The pool and beach areas are great. The staff has various activites planned throughout the day, for adults, teens, and kids. The rooms are quite nice: junior suite has a bedroom with a (two step down) sitting/entertainment area, as well as a balcony. The only negative experience we had was that our room card key had to be reprogrammed a few times.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Long, Positive Review”
Reviews.Author: MissyKout
Reviews.Content: This was our first vacation without our kids (ages 11 & 6), the first time to Mexico, and the first time to an all-inclusive. When we arrived at the airport in Cancun we were a little overwhelmed by all the people trying to sell you something. When I booked the resort online directly through the Riu website, our stay included ground transportation. The communication from Riu on the ground transfer was very good and descriptive. A man greeted us inside the terminal (looked official - was wearing a photo id badge) and asked us where we were going and who our transportation was lined up with and that he would direct us where we needed to go. He said there was a lot of construction going on at the airport and his job was to help us. Okay, we bought that explanation. He led us to a guy at a desk still inside the terminal and we figured he was with "Hotel Beds" which was the company transferring us to Riu. It took us a few minutes chatting to figure out this guy was trying to get us to go listen to a presentation at the Aventure Spa Palace on their "Palace Premier Club" which they point out is not a timeshare. They offered lots of goodies: cab fare to/from Riu to Aventura Palace, breakfast, 2 tickets to Tulum tour, 2 tickets to Chichen Itza tour, 2 tickets to Paradise Snorkeling Tour, 2 tickets to ATV/Speedboat tour, and $200 spa credit at Aventura Palace. I wanted to see their property anyway (I plan incentive trips for a living), we wanted to do some tours, and figured it couldn't be that bad. So that's what we did the next morning. It wasn't too bad. The sales rep was pleasant, we had a nice conversation at breakfast, and got a thorough tour of the property. Their vacation club offer was interesting if you're people who vacation regularly but we're not those kind of people. They really put the pressure on (bringing in her manager, then her manager's manager) for about an hour, but all in all it was painless and we walked away with all the stuff they promised. We didn't even have enough time take advantage of all the stuff. If you don't like sales pressure, don't do it. Moving onto Riu... The property is new & clean & beautiful. The first guy we talked to at the front desk had to get someone else because he didn't speak English. We were a little surprised at that but it was okay. The guy explained how everything at the resort works, took our credit card for payment, gave us our room keys and safe key, and we were on our way. All the rooms are suites, meaning they have a sleeping area and sitting area. It's all in one big room but it's a nice size. All rooms have balconies, too. We had a view of the resort next door but it was okay because we weren't in the room much anyway. If we had a view of the pool and/or courtyard we may have spent time on the balcony. The people-watching was great. The room was pretty but seemed very humid. Even cranking the air conditioning didn't pull out the humidity. We're from Houston so we are used to humidity and we still felt it. The bed was hard. Really hard. Really really hard. Amazingly, though, we slept okay. The shower in our bathroom had problems draining. It would take hours to drain after we showered. We called the Front Desk about this once, they apologized for the inconvenience and said they would send someone to fix it. We don't know if anyone ever came to look at it, but it certainly didn't get fixed. All the floors were tile - lobby, hallways, rooms. This was a good idea because carpets & humidity aren't a good combination. There were always people cleaning the floors, too. Everything was very, very clean. We got up early most mornings either to watch the sunrise or leave on a tour. And each morning there were swarms of resort staff cleaning the grounds getting ready for the day. All of the resort staff were pleasant. From the Front Desk to the restaurant staff to the cleaning staff to the bartenders. Smiling & friendly always. The pool area was always pretty crowded and it may have been difficult to find a lounge chair, but we always went to the beach. We never had a problem getting lounge chairs there. The swim-up bar was fun and always very lively. They had high-energy music playing, but it seemed like the same song over & over, day after day. The only restaurants we ate at were Don Manolo's & Chili's. We never ate at the reservations-only places for dinner. We were happy with the enormous buffets. They had food for every taste, lots of bread, and fantastic desserts. The waitstaff was on top of everything. When your water glass was empty (and they were small and we drink alot of water), they filled it before you had to ask. When you finished your 1st plate and left to go back to the buffet for dessert, you're 1st plate had been cleared by the time you returned. There were white linens on the tables and once you were finished with your meal, there was someone there to quickly change the linen and re-set the table. They were amazing. And, of course, very friendly. The first night we weren't sure if we were supposed to tip them and so we watched a few other people who were finishing their meals and saw no tipping. On the last night, though, we left a tip. We left the maid $2-3 each night with a little thank you note. We don't know if that made a difference in service or not. One night she left a towel snail that was really cute. There was a stocked refrigerator in the room with bottled water, beer, and soft drinks. The town of Playa del Carmen is a 10-15 minute walk down the road. The other direction is Plaza Playacar which is about a 5 min walk. It's a very small shopping plaza but it basically had the same stuff you found in town. Once you've seen one shop, you've seen them all. Mostly tourist junk. We took advantage of the kayaks available on the beach as part of the all-inclusive. Snorkeling equipment was available, too, but we had brought our own. There was a little bit to see when you're snorkeling, but not too much. We wanted to do the paddleboats but the water was too choppy. They also had windsurfing equipment (big boards w/small sails - for beginners) & small sailboats (Hobie Cats) - they recommend making reservations for these the day before you want them. Scuba Caribe is the name of the water sports place on property - again, very nice & friendly. The non-motorized sports are included, but scuba diving & parasailing are not. They don't rent waverunners but the resort next door did. We parasailed ($70 for two people). It was fun because they pick you up on the beach in a waverunner & drive you out to the boat. We ended up being on the boat about 45 min before it was our turn to parasail. As soon as you're done parasailing, the waverunner picks you up and takes you back to the beach. You end up being up in the air for 8-10 min. Later when were were on the beach watching all of the different parasailing boats, we noticed one that gave you a much longer ride and seemed to go higher. There were guys walking up & down the beach selling parasailing and we didn't know which ones were giving the long rides. I'm sure it was more expensive but you sure got a great ride. Each night at 9:45pm there was a show. It was different every night we were there, but we only stayed for the beginning of one of the shows. Our days were so full that we were too tired to stick around. Two of the nights the resort had vendors come in and set-up their merchandise around one of the fountains. It was right outside the restaurants where there was a bar, live music, and lots of outdoor seating. Generally, you could buy anything there that you could buy in town and then some. It was a nice arrangement. Maybe it was more expensive, maybe not. It was great atmosphere, though. Each evening after dinner we parked ourselves on a couch next to the cigar-roller lady (because it had the best view of the plaza) and people-watched. Loads of fun. There were lots of Europeans & South Americans which made for a fun variety of languages being spoken & swimsuit fashions being worn. There were some topless ladies which was probably thrilling for the American teenage boys. I guess that's it. We had a nice time and would go back. I hope this helps! We read many reviews on TripAdvisor before we booked the resort. The one that was really negative and mentioned the toilet brush in brown water next to the toilet was pretty funny. It was cleaning fluid. Those people must not have traveled much and/or are incredibly spoiled. The resort is new, beautiful, and has excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: legalstar
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow travelers! Decided to return the favor and write the review. Stayed in RIU PALACE Riviera Maya the end of July for 8 days. WE are from New YOrk and I am 41 and my husband is 51. Overall, not bad. SERVICE: At the bars and by the pool expect a delay, its normal for Mexico everywhere. BEDS: Extremely HARD - it hurt so bad that I got black and blues on my sides and the posterior - not kidding. Asked the maid 2 days in a row for a pad, but until my husband and I went to the reception - nothing got done, and he speaks spanish. The rest of the vacation slept OK, except for the bruises. FOOD: Not bad for an all inclusive. Not great either. Monday night buffet is the best. Tried Sir Oliver twice and both times it was decent (have the fish and the shrimp, skip the steak.) yes, it's true, you can go to any restaurant and usually get in on the nights when some people don't show up. POOL: Beautiful with plenty of shade. BEACH: Whould have been beautiful if they cleaned the seaweed more often. Almost no shade at all - brign your own beach umbrella. ENTERTAINMENT: So-so. After 11:30 go across the street to the disco. SPA: Excellent - Claudia gives the best massage - try the $110 one, will not be disappointed. Sauna and jacuzzi are very clean. Overall, not bad. It helps a lot if you speak spanish, but not always. Some of the staff made believe they don't understand you even if you speak spanish (because they don't want to do something.) My husband had to repeat himself a few times and even ask them if there is any other language he can speak so that they understand. Finally if all else fails, speak to the manager. Oh, buy the way, the wines are cheap, don't expect top shelf. The liquor selection is OK, must always request either Bacardi or Absolut, otherwise they will pour substandard stuff. Mimosa's for breakfast is a nice touch. While we were there, there were a lot of families with kids, so not a lot of drunk people. Please tip, they do work hard.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: jml6010
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this resort July 20-27.While there are many amenities,much needs to be improved.Upon arrival,no bellman greeted our bus.We found it odd that no staff responded at 3pm.We took our luggage to check-in.After a long day of travel,we wanted to hit the pool.After being informed that it would take at least 30 minutes for our luggage to be sent to our room,we took our luggage to our room.The rooms are lovely,however the beds are hard and no mattress pads are available to the guests.The rooms utilize an electronic key.We returned from dinner one evening to find a drunken person passed out in our bed.The hotel assured us that nothing was wrong with the door and that we must not have closed the door properly.We accepted that explanation .However,on each of the next 3 days,we called management to inform them no key was necessary to enter our rooms.It appears that humidity causes the system to malfunction.This is a giant security issue.The room safes are not electronic,requiring use of a key and lock that is burdensome and truly inadequte in a new resort.As to the pool and service at the pools,we found the facility to be first-rate and the staff to be attentive and energetic.There is some foolishness with guests reserving chairs early in the morning .The beach is well kept ,although seaweed appears to accumulate at this end of the beach.The staff rake and bury the seaweed daily.As to the restaurants,reservations must be made in person for the specialty spots.Only 2 reservations may be made at a time ,requiring multiple trips to the lobby.This is a ridiculous and inefficient system.Three of us got the mexican flu during our stay.In conclusion,we previously stayed at the Royal Hideaway.We booked this hotel at the last minute as the RH was full.The difference in service,food and comfort are as marked as the difference between the Ritz and a Red Roof Inn.I wont be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zb
Reviews.Content: We travel to cancun often and usually stay at Riu Hotels. This was a fantastic place to stay. We have already made reservations to return. All other guests seemed to be having a great time. The property is new and the staff is on top of any needs as well as keeping the place clean. The food was very good...much better than the other Rius that we have visited. We only ate at buffets due to our children so I cannot comment on the specialty restaurants. We have children ages 2 and 4 and they had a great time. The pool has a large shallow area which was great for the 2yr old and the 4 year old loved jumping from the upper pool to the lower pool. We did see a mixture of people of all ages. Our kids loved the mini-disco. I would recommend requesting a room with a courtyard view so that you can watch the happenings during the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: nicole3320
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our Honeymoon. It was perfect, 5 days wasn't long enough. For starters the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are great and the service was icing on the cake!! The food was good, we really enjoyed the Japaneese resturaunt, the breakfast buffet was huge. All the bars were completely stocked with anything you could imagine. Even the mini bar in room contained large bottles of alcohol and a full fridge of Corona, soda and water. Everybody we encountered there loved the hotel. It was very quiet, mostly honeymooners, couples, and small families. We were afraid children might get on our nerves but this was not the case at all. We can't wait to stay at this hotel again. If you are honeymooning make sure to tell them that when you check in so you can get upgraded. BUY ALL OF YOUR DAY TRIPS IN THE HOTEL, DO NOT BUY IN THE LITTLE SHOPS NEAR TOWN, THEY ARE TIMESHARES!! We almost learned this the hard way. They will take you to a time share meeting before they take you to your destination!!! loved it Brett and Nicole

Reviews.Title: “Impressive - Great place, great service - Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ninamencha
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two kids (3 and 7 yrs old) at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from 7/6 to 7/12. It was a SUPER vacation! The place is beautiful. Lobby is impressive. The entire grounds are very clean: hotel staff takes good care of everything. I even saw guys cleaning up the tiled floor with brushes. The pool is very nice and had an interesting design: there was a place for everyone. The hotel was 95% capacity, but we managed to get chairs every day. Chairs and the beach were plenty! The pool bar was never too crowded and the stuff worked pretty hard pleasing everyone. The beach was beautiful. The water sports were available but couple of days were too windy to go in the kayaks. The place in general is beautiful, new and very very clean! The rooms are very comfortable. I loved the ‘optics’, being able to have a drink in the room. The refrigerator was always full. We only called room service once (fruit platter) and it arrived within 5 minutes. The room was quite big, and the terrace was very nice. We were not facing the ocean but could see it from our window. There was a very useful rack to dry clothes in the balcony. Food was fine and we always found plenty of food with great variety. We did not get sick during our stay. The reservation for the restaurants was very easy. THANK YOU SERGIO!!! He is the captain of the Mexican restaurant who took care of the restaurant reservations and always did his best to comply with our requests. We particularly enjoyed dinning at the Sir Oliver (gourmet) and, off course, the Ogave (Mexican) restaurant. The Steak house was pretty good too, and it was great to have a nice dinner with ocean view. We did not eat at the Japanese restaurant. During our dinner at Ogave, my 3 year old wanted to eat some strawberries and although it was not on the menu, one waiter brought him a plate with some big strawberries. Sergio came over and asked my son if he wanted some whipped cream. He brought him a plate of nicely decorated strawberries with the cream in the middle and when my daughter requested some, he gladly complied. Sergio was great and almost everyone else had the same kind attitude of pleasing the guests. The Brazilian Restaurant was the only one that we did not enjoy. Not only the food was not that good, but the staff was very grumpy and nasty. One of the waiters even made a personal comment to me that I did not enjoy at all. The entertainment staff was GREAT. These guys work so hard to get everyone to participate in the different activities. We enjoyed the beach party, the aerobics, volleyball, and ping pong. Our kids enjoyed the daily activities but particularly the mini-disco. We planned the day knowing that after dinner we will go to the mini-disco. Thank you Pepe, Frankie, Freddy, Jet and Jack. You guys are A-W-E-S-O-M-E!!! We did not go into any excursion. We just took a taxi to the Tequila and the shopping mall at Playacar. T-shirts were good price ($5 each) but jewelry was expensive. It was a very nice area, very safe to walk around with many nice hotels and beautiful houses. My husband found a motorcycle rental in the Tequila and he took the kids around. Rates were around $40 per day, with hourly rates too. We all enjoyed our vacation and are definitely planning on returning soon. For all those people who did negative reviews… I wonder if they stayed at the same place we did!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Riu Palace”
Reviews.Author: georgeandweezie
Reviews.Content: This resort is fantastic. The staff are very hard workers and make sure that you are taken care of. The rooms are large and completely cleaned every day. Yes, the beds are hard--just bring your favorite pillow (you'll be glad you did). All in all, this is a great place for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort (long review)”
Reviews.Author: kaymtl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera from July 2-9. We booked through Sunquest and were very satisfied with the service (shuttles to and from airport, check-in, very helpful reps at hotel). This was my first experience at an all-inclusive. Generally when I travel I like to get a real "feel" for the local culture-you won't get that at the Riu Palace. But if you're looking for the kind of vacation where everything is taken care of and you can just flop on the beach or by the pool, then this is the place for you. ROOM: When we first checked in, I was a little weary about staying on the first floor facing the outside garden. But we figured that before we complained for a better room, we should give the one we were in a chance and ended up being very happy. The room was quiet, very clean and the AC worked great (almost too well- we woke up some nights freezing!). We didn't use the mini bar very much, but every two evenings someone would come to our door asking if we needed anything. My only complaint was the lack of towels- we were lucky if we got two fresh ones, despite leaving used towels in the tub (if you don't do that they won't replace them, BTW). FOOD: was OK. I wasn't expecting very much, and it ended up being better than I thought. You definitely won't starve. We went to Chili's and Sir Olivers for our " a la carte" meals", neither of them were great. The reservation process was really annoying, so we didn't bother after the first two days. Breakfast buffet was the best, lunch and dinner were mediocre. The best meal we had was in Playa Del Carmen at Yaxche (calle 8 and av 5). Be sure to have a Mayan coffee if you go- quite the production with all the fire! BEACH: very beautiful, nice soft sand, clear water. No shade at all though, so be careful and use lots of sun screen! POOL: Impossible to get a chair after 10. Lots of Americans by the pool, the Europeans and Latin Americans tended to hang out at the beach. Totally different atmospheres- we preferred the beach. Go into Playa del Carmen- great shopping and has a very "Mexican" feel. Tulum was interesting, but very very hot! Also, you can't climb anything anymore- a bit of a drag because you can't get a good look at the frescoes. All in all, a very nice, relaxing vacation. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway!”
Reviews.Author: LWeiss
Reviews.Content: Reading everyone else's great posts about this trip helped us decide to book ours here, so I wanted to return the favor. We just got back from a fantastic 4 night trip to this brand new Riu. It was incredibly beautiful (ornate, actually) and the staff were constantly cleaning, polishing, etc. It is located right next to the town of Playa Del Carmen, which was fun, since it was a nice walk (or short $5 cab ride) into town to shop. Also, it was too far from the airport, compared to some other hotels. We had asked for an ocean front suite, since it was our anniversary, and were given one of the gorgeous rooms on the end, overlooking the sea. It was the closest to the pools, too. We took the advice of other posts here, and left a tip (although they tell you not to) for the maid, and in return did recieve adorable towel sculptures! The grounds of the hotel were beautifully manicured - not a huge place to walk around, but beautiful. Plenty of space at the beach, although I'd reserve your pool chairs early since everyone else does! We ate at 3 of the restaurants, including Mexican (EXCELLENT food), steak house (better than we expected) and the gourmet one. You can only make reservations at a certain time, for only 2 at a time, and can't do it until you arrive, so we had some issue with that. We actually waited to see if we could get an empty table at that gourmet place, and we were lucky to get that our last night. That's probably my only complaint about the whole trip! One off task comment - we did an excursion through Apple vacations, called "Mayan Adventure" - if you like to snorkel, this was great b/c it took you to three snorkeling spots, a lagoon, an underground cave (very cool!) and a "cenote", where you could jump in off a 10-15 foot cliff (I took the steps!). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family was at the Riu Palace RM June 24 – July 1. We had a wonderful time and have recommended it highly to friends. We had a major complication at the beginning of the stay, but the management resolved the problem to our complete satisfaction. The whole facility is beautiful. We liked the fact that all of the restaurants, bars, and lobby were air conditioned with the exception of the pool area. Everything was kept immaculately with constant cleaning by the staff. The resort can be as active as you would like (plenty of activity for our 17 year old son) or as relaxing as you’d like (hammocks on the beach for my husband & I). The rooms are gorgeous and very spacious. We found the bed to be very comfortable. I would classify it as firm, but not hard. The food was the best we have found at an all-inclusive resort. They had smoked salmon on the lunch buffet, large varieties of fruits and vegetables, and Mimosa’s for breakfast. We ate in all of the ala carte restaurants and were pleased with them all. We found the Mexican and Sir Oliver’s to be the best. Service on a whole was very good. There were a few meals in which we had to solicit service from the servers, but that was the exception rather than the rule. The reservation system is the biggest down side. By allowing reservations to be made only during the afternoon, it eliminates anyone who is off site for an excursion. We found it difficult to get into Sir Oliver’s, but finally just arrived and waited for a “no show” spot. It worked for us and we were pleased that we were able to eat there. The beach is lovely. It is by far the best along that strip. We snorkeled off the beach on days that the water was calm and saw some good fish. When the wind was up and the water choppy, the visibility was very cloudy. Rig two chairs for shade as other writers have suggested. We checked out the other Riu facilities in Playacar and realized that ours was by far the best. The Riu Palace Mexico is very nice, but the pool leaves a lot to be desired. Over all, we were very pleased and will likely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alpeca
Reviews.Content: Just to say to anyone thinking of visiting this hotel, dont be put off by any negative reports because the are totally unfounded. travelling from England we were the only two off the coach for this hotel and were treat like royalty from the word go. We had requested a low level room as my husband has slight breathing problems and the room we had was the best location we could have wished for. The staff are amazing and we got quite paranoid towards the end of our holiday as someone was always asking if we needed anything more.I even joked with management and said there was a cloud over the sun and could they do something about it. Reception called our room on numerous occasions to see if we required anything.Room service was excellant with different arrangements of towels every day. The food is awesome, always different theme nights and several different stations cooking anything from paella, mexican or international dishes plus all the usual buffet style food.Tip the chefs as well as the waiters, they certainly dont forget you.Booking for the other restraunts was very easy and the waiter service was excellent. Sir Olivers was our favourite.Finding a seat by the pool was never a problem and there are plenty of loungers by the beach. There is a retaining wall but this is not a problem as people took loungers down next to the beach if required. it is a short walk to other Riu hotels which we were free to visit but I rate this hotel as the best location.Ok it did rain occasionally, but just get in the pool, it soon passes. Entertainment staff were to die for. Being in our 60`s we felt no age barrier and met some lovely people. My only complaint is with the airline Thomson Fly. We booked premium seating but compared to other airlines it was not worth it apart from priority check in at Cancun. This airport as everybody knows suffered hurricane damage so things do get a bit busy during check in. Its a pity Thomson cant dish up the luxury on their airlines because their hotels are first class.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: raiderot1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Riu Palace Riviera Maya 2Jul-7Jul. The hotel and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. The staff and service are awesome. They are definitely there to serve their guests. The pool is nice, although we didn't get in one time. There are plenty of chairs and shade umbrellas at the pool. It looked like you should get to the pool early in order to get a chair. We have been to Playa Del Carmen many times. We love this area and we go beacause we love the beach and the ocean. Their beach was nice, plenty of chairs, but no shade. This was a huge disappointment to us. There were palm trees, but they aren't large enough yet to give good shade. If you plan to stay on the beach all day like we do, shade is absolutely neccessary. Most people on the beach were turning chairs upside down to make shade structures around them. We joked and said that it looked like people were setting up forts. I hope the resort gets the hint and decides to purchase umbrellas or cabannas for the beach. The food is average. The best specialty restaraunts are the Gourmet Restaraunt and the Mexican Restaraunt. They were both very good. It is a pain to eat at these restaraunts because you have to make a reservation. The only way to do that is to go the day before and stand in a long line. The rooms were nice. Fully equipped with all you need (iron, ironing board, hair dryer, frig with drinks and a liquor dispenser). When we arrived to our room, the water that was in the frig was opened and half gone, but they brought fresh bottles of water. The bed was extremely hard and very uncomfortable. I had read this in previous reviews and wondered how hard could it be. Well, it's true. I got a massage one day at the spa (it's extra, but well worth the money). I did the Renova Combo Massage. It was 80 minutes for $110.00 usd. It was so awesome. The only complaint that I had at the spa is that you can hear the outside noise while in your massage room so at times it was a little distracting. They have nightly entertainment, but we did not enjoy it at all. I wish that they had other entertainment for the evenings because if you do not enjoy their shows (and we did not), there is nothing else availble. Overall, it's a nice resort and if they provided shade on the beach, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation of Our Lives”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and too much fun! I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera from June 24-July 1st with my boyfriend and two of our friends. I was absolutely blown away by this resort, it was like nothing I had ever seen before. Right from the beginning I was impressed; the check in was done for us, while we were served cocktails...unbelievable! We did get a room we didn't like and it was changed immediately. The service was excellent, the food was delicious, (we found the buffets better than the restaurants) the rooms were gorgeous and very clean, always neat and nicely decorated with swan towels and chocolates.
