Any requests I had were taken care of right away. The grounds were breathtaking, keep in mind the resort is very big, so there is a lot of walking. The pool and the beach were beautiful. I truly cannot complain about one thing! We are all in our 20's/early 30's and take it from us anyone can have a great time there. The shows at night time at the resort were always good, there are bars everywhere, and if you want to party go to Playa Del Carmen (we did every night) and go to the Blue Parrott and the Mambo Cafe. Obviously you have to pay but it is cheap and well worth it....we had the time of our lives at these two places. The Riu Tequila disco was average....but not worth going to everynight! We also met some amazing people on our trip from Texas (Shawn, Austin, Cody, Junior) most people in general were from Texas and we made some great friends, the guests were all very friendly! We also made friends with some staff members and they were all a lot of fun. I will never go to another resort again because it was perfect! P.S. If you are drinking at the Lobby Bar get a Renee Red Special from Renee (MMMMMMMM) and also a Riviera Maya! The drinks were all good! I suggest everyone should go see this place....you will have an amazing time!!!! Enjoy! Martyna From Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from June 24, 2006 - July 1, 2006 and loved it. The grounds are beautiful! Extremely clean and well kept. The hotel decor is just like that in it's name... fit for a palace. To start off we had our room changed. Although our first room was gorgeous, it was facing the hotel next door. We went down to the front desk and asked for a pool facing room. Karla helped us out and was able to put us in a pool/fountain facing room at no extra charge. Beautiful (Karla rocks!!). Food: Ok. We mostly ate at the buffet, and the selection is pretty good. It's aimed to please American taste buds, so you're not going to find any ridiculously exotic items. We tried only two of the theme restaurants: Chili's, a beach-front restaurant, and Oliver's. Both had good food. We never got sick...Honestly though, who goes to Mexico for a gourmet experience? Beach & pool: Amazing! Pool lounge chairs aren't that hard to find... the beach is much nicer to lay on anyways, and there were always chairs on the beach. I read about the lack of shade on the beach, but some guests propped the extra chairs up creating a pretty decent umbrella effect. The water is awesome! Shopping: Ok. If you're into shopping, "5th Ave." is a 5 minute taxi ride for $5 US, or it could be a 30 minute walk - all the way through a nice privately owned neighborhood. There are plenty of shops, all offering the same sorts of mechandise. Prices are competitive and there are shops where you can bargain for some deals. Finicky eaters rejoice: you can find a McDonald's, Subway, and other American restaurants in this area. Entertainment: As three 20something girls, we found there was always something going on. During the day, the staff host activities (water aerobics, soccer, dancing, darts, etc.). There are shows every night at 9:45 following a kids show. Some shows were really good. A few were not as polished. One show had a bit with fire breathing... very impressive & well done!! Another was a Circus theme; again, very impressive! ...and there are things to do afterwards (for those who claim there is nothing to do). The entertainment staff invited us to go clubbing with them after the shows and offered up plenty of opportunities to check out the night life. Service: Amazing! Always friendly staff - saying hello in passing. Eager to please and ridiculously helpful. Very happy people at the Riu. Please be nice to these people - chances are, they will be nice back to you. Overall great experience & would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent...Don't Hesitate to Stay There...”
Reviews.Author: BA_Rock_Star
Reviews.Content: Not much I can add to all the other reviews found here...it's an amazing place with friendly staff and excellent service. The grounds are Beautiiful! I did find that the drinks were better inside the lounges and restaurants than out by the pool, Could be the heat... on a side note..watch for the moving steps after a day at the pool...they seem to keep making my feet miss! :*) The food was "good" not "great"...the Japanese and the Mexican were our favorites. Chilis was too hot and humid..try the others first. The buffet was IMHO very good compared to other buffets that I have been to. The only other thing that I can say on a down side was that we had no ice for our room as the ice machine on our floor..1st..was not working...had to go to the pool bar and fill up before 6:00pm. Would I go back? Definetly! Had a great time..met lots of fun folks and the staff is great..Rene in La Bahana is always a treat...we'd meet at 8:00 for drinks before dinner.. javier at the pool bar is cool too.. We did go to 5th St. for a day before it got too hot...kinda like Nassau and the Straw Market there...vendors and stores are everywhere..some deals...some not..be careful with younger ages for the t-shirts can get vulgar. RIU is a 6 Star facility, well worth every dollar spent and we are looking forward to enjoying other RIU's in the future. Any questions...feel free to ask..

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu from 6/21-6/26 with my fiance and his family. We had a wonderful vacation overall, but here are some more specific bits of information: Food: If you keep in mind that you are not there for the food, you will not be disappointed. The breakfast buffet was great, plenty of choices (healthy and not-so-healthy) but everything was delicious. Lunch buffet was decent, I survived on a lot of salads, fruit, chicken, french fries, and ice cream (was to die for!!!) but there is much for the more adventurous as well. Only hit the dinner buffet once, it was decent. The a la carte restaurants: Chili's Steakhouse was okay, not great. Agave, the Mexican, was pretty good. Sir Oliver's, the gourmet, was FANTASTIC!! Go right at noon to make reservations for the next two nights or you will wait in line. Never got to the Japanese or Brazilian (heard many say the Brazilian was not very good.) Pool: Beautiful, big, great water temps. Never had trouble getting lounge chairs, but my fiances uncle went out at 8:30 every morning and got 4 chairs for us. Didn't seem like it would be too bad even if you didn't get outside until 9 or 10. Bring a high SPF. I am Cuban and tan very easily but I had to constantly reapply my SPF 30 (mostly because it was sweating off.) The weather was very humid but at least it was sunny, with the occasional afternoon sprinkle. Beach: Very pretty, good size, beautiful water, calm and clear. Definitley take advantage of the free kayaking, paddle boats, snorkels, etc... (although most who snorkeled saw almost nothing, but at least its free!) Rooms: very pretty, beds were hard but not too bad. We left 2 dollars each day for maids and got cute towel animals and lots of extra water in our mini-fridge. My only real complaint is the NOISE. The floors in the hall and rooms are all marble and the walls are thin, so you can hear EVERYTHING! Hopefully you wil not be staying next to a screaming baby or "active" couple... you can hear it all! Bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper. Be very nice and polite at check-in (Which was a breeze by the way) and you might get upgraded, we did! Be nice and polite in general, the staff is very kind and sweet and polite, no need to be rude and demanding. Fitness Center was pretty decent but got really hot so its hard to stay in there for too long. If you go into town, a great restaurant is "The Glass Bar" and "Media Luna" both excellent. THe best bar is the Blue Parrot, tons of fun, very beachy and cool with swings instead of bar stools. 5th avenue, the main drag in Playa is well worth the 5 dollar, 3 minute cab ride. Overall, it was a great vacation, as long as you are not there for 5 star food and don't mind nnoisy hallways. Truly a beautiful hotel, beach, and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from the RIU Palace Rivera Maya on Sunday June 25. We had a nice time but our trip to Mexico last time 2 years ago was much better! Last time we stayed at Moon Palace and had a great time. The RIU Palace RM is very beautiful, CLEAN and the beach and pool area were amazing!! Now for the negatives of our stay, the beds are very HARD. My husband and finally after 3 nights of restless sleep, even after having a few drinks, took the pads off the chairs on the balcony and put them under the bottom sheet, which helped but was still not comfortable. The system they have for making reservations to the resturants is extremely bad. You can only make 2 reservations at a time and then the resturants we full. They only have 2 seatings each night, but even though we told they were full, there we empty tables. Can't quite figure that out. The Brazillian resturant was terrible. The steak tasted gamey to me. The Buffet was good but the food was often cold. Food was a disappointing at best. The pool area and pool bar was fun!!!! Javier(HBK) can be a little grumpy but he likes to be humored!! Ask for a Scooby Doo shot!! They go down real smooth for those of you who don't like Tequila. The reception we received was less than friendly. Cool cloth and glass of champagne would have been Nice. One last warning, TAKE IMMODIUM, just in case. I needed it, the water from brushing my teeth or the lettuce at buffets or the ice, not sure, but I did get sick

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic vacation at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: emtlady
Reviews.Content: We just returned and we absolutely loved the Riu! Besides the beautiful buildings, extremely clean rooms, beautiful grounds, beach and pool - the service was unbelievable! Every single employee we met was friendly and had a smile. We were treated like a king and a queen at the Palace. Thanks to Carlos who always has a smile and brought my husband an entire bowl of olives when our waiter did not understand English for olive and went to ask Carlos for help. Room/check-in: At first, we had a room on the 3rd floor with a balcony that was enclosed. When you sat down, you could not see out. We asked at the front desk and were told that we could switch the next day. Sure enough, by 12 they were already moving our luggage into a beautiful courtyard view room with an open railing balcony - room 2096. (the prior room was 3070). This side of the hotel which is to the right if the beach is at your back has shade on the balcony most of the day. The beds are extremely hard, and I don't usually complain about that - it is my ONLY complaint about this hotel. They did try to make it softer for us by adding some blankets under the sheets which helped a little. If your toilet backs up, remember Mexican resorts cannot handle paper in the toilet system. They ask that you dispose of the paper in the waste basket, that is why you may have heard of toilets not flushing. The other review with the toilet brush is total bogus - that is toilet santizer that they use when they clean the bathroom. Food: This place blows away any other AI we have been to. The food ranged from the ordinary salads and hamburgers to frog legs and brussel sprouts! The food art was stunning and the presentation of the food was as pretty as a picture. Please take my word for it that anyone who says there is not enough to eat here is loco! There was always guacamole and some of the usuals, but every single meal had different entrees and something new to try. I am still having guacamole withdrawals! The French restaurant Sir Oliver's was romantic and beautiful - they had rose petals on our table for our anniversary. During our first meal after just arriving, we were in the buffet and Stephanie - one of the hostesses, came up to us and asked which al a carte restaraunts we wanted to book (amazing, she knew we were new). Since my husband loves buffets, we only chose the French. A few of the entrees were not labeled and you did not know what it was, but we just asked. Never got sick for 9 days, ate our Pepto before every meal. Drinks: They will make them as strong as you like - sometimes they even handed my husband the bottle of rum! We did bring our bubba keg and saw others with them - no problem for them to fill them. The liquor dispensers in the room are nice to have too, but we were not in the room much to use them. Every night in the courtyard, the hotel had a champagne station set up with various types of champagne to try. One night it was champagne and melon liquor mixed, very tasty. Beach/pool: The pool was large, very warm and clean. The pool bar was a fun place to hang out and the daily water activities were a blast. The guy who does the water aerobics gets the crowd going and anyone who has seen him will know why ;-) I had concerns about the beach due to the erosion pictures I saw. NOT A PROBLEM! There is a huge beach on top of the concrete retaining wall and then another beach below right by the water. The water is the most incredible blue and was very calm to swim in. Many people were using the watersports and it was fun to watch them. We did snorkel near the beach and saw some small fish. NEVER a problem to get a chair on the beach, but not much shade so be careful. It is a new place, trees are still growing in. The pool chairs were always available, though you may not have had a "prime" location near the pool or by the water view, in 9 days we never had a problem getting a chair. The moms with their babies in the pool were very happy, the pool was very warm. We have been to some places were the pool was so cold we could not even enjoy it - not the case here. Grounds: The gardens and flowers are very nice and like you have heard before, there was not a bug or piece of garbage lying anywhere. The only time we saw garbage was when the local birds stole sugar packets and then were eating them, fun to watch! There is a very small pool - about 5 feet across and a small play area near the Chili's grill by the pool for the littlest guests. Inside & outside: Will take your breath away. The beautiful chandeliers, marble floors, huge oil paintings and luxurious furniture is truly a treat. There is a gift shop inside the lobby and also a jewelry store. Outside, below the front entrance is a "pharmacy" which has basic medicines and also souveniers (I don't think a lot of people know it is there), it is located next to the medical office. Local vendors will come to the courtyard, they were much nicer and not as pushy as what we have had in the past at other resorts and we enjoyed watching and talking with them. Xel-Ha was like swimming in a giant aquarium and well worth every penny. We will go back there again next time we visit. We would not go to Playa again during the day - it was just too hot. We think that a trip later in the day when the sun starts to go down would be far more enjoyable. One final tip, print a picture of the local currency and become familiar with what the exchange rate is before you go. This threw us off a few times the first couple of days. I can honestly say this was as close to the "perfect trip" as it gets. What made it so outstanding for us was the quality of the people that work at this resort and the pride they have in the food and services they provide. We tipped well and often and were happy to do it! If you choose this hotel, you WILL have a trip of a lifetime. I would be happy to answer any questions or share further pics if anyone is interested. We tried to take pictures of stuff that others do not to share a different perspective. HAVE FUN! We will be going back...

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, I agree with Chicago Girl... Ignore the Bad Review...”
Reviews.Author: fieldsfam
Reviews.Content: It was amazing, as I expected. We had stayed at the other RIU Palace just down the street, the last two time we visited... in 2002 and in 2005. We loved that one as well, but decided last year, when we saw this one being built... that we'd try it the next time we visited. So that we did. We were delayed an hour due to our flight was detoured around Alberto, but when we arrived, all was perfect the rest of the trip. The staff are so service oriented, and they obviously love their jobs. Our room was spotless, and I swear they cleaned our room a few times a day, without our ever putting the 'Clean The Room' sign on the door. They would also stock our fridge without our asking. One evening we were getting dressed to go to dinner, and my husband accidentally knocked off a corona bottle (i.e. broken glass) on the tile floor in the bathroom. As it was late, we simply brushed it aside temporarily and continued to get dressed, and went to dinner. When we came back from dinner... it had been cleaned up for us, again without us informing them of the broken glass. (how DO they know???)... and also every night when we returned from dinner, our sheets had been turned down, and chocolate kisses had been left. Needless to say, we left they a huge tip. It was more than we expected. We stayed from June 11th - 15th, which wasn't long enough, but alas we had to get home to our children. They are too young to enjoy that place just yet. Next time they will definitely be going with us. Beside of Chilis, in the resort... is a small area for smaller kids, a small kiddie pool and playground. The other RIU didn't have that, or I didn't see it. This one was decorated much the same, but seemed to have more marble and tile ornate decor. Everytime I walked down the corridors, I was amazed at how much detailed hand work went into that place. Also, the last morning we were there, we had went down to the beach and noticed that there was a bunch of brown seaweed on the white sand (normally not there, must have washed up after Alberto had passed), and they had a few of their groundskeepers RAKING this stuff up and digging holes and burying it. Why???? when it would be washed back out once the tides changed... our guess was simply to keep the guests happy that the beaches were so clean. Heck, they even raked the sand before we got up each morning. What I like about the RIUs there is that you can never really figure out how in the world they keep everything so coordinated, you never see the workers coming to work or leaving, yet there are hundreds of them. They are always perfectly dressed. We have yet to figure out how they do it all. One night we ate at the International Buffet. They had carved ornate designs in watermellons, and had even created a bouquet of what appeared to be real roses. Upon a closer look... the roses were also carved out of watermellon. It's the attention to detail that you have to just sit back and take in, and that makes the whole trip just filled with wonder. And I just have to point out that I had read a review on here, before we left... that was all about this toilet bowl thing beside the toilet, and how it had this colored water in it, and how that person was just so upset over this... that the minute we checked into our room, I immediately went into the bathroom to check that out. I laughed my butt off!!! My toiltet as well had this. And so did our friends, staying in a different room... HELLOOOOO.... it is a cleaner/disinfectant that is supposed to be that color! Good lord people, if you are going to complain about something, make sure you know what you are complaining about. I noticed that in all of the public bath facilities at the resort, the same cleaner was in that toilet brush holder, so anyone who read that... ignore it, and go and enjoy your nice clean sanitied toiltets. The ONLY thing that was a negative for me... being fair skinned, is that shade was at a minimal. The transplanted palm trees haven't had time to grow good large fronds yet I guess... so each morning I would find a spot of shade, put my chair in it and follow it as the sun shifted. At high noon, I was pretty much considered a 'tree hugger', literally. But I slathered on my 60 sunscreen and somehow managed to avoid getting burned the entire trip.... so all is well. The food was amazing, the drinks even better. Staff very friendly. We had no complaints at all other than we wished we had more time there. Next time we will. 'Carolina Girl'

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Riu Palace Riveria Maya (Long Review)”
Reviews.Author: We_Love_Vacation
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that before my husband and I left we checked Trip Advisor religiously. Please ignore the bad reviews. My husband and I (in our late 20's) went here for our anniversary. We had a blast. The hotel is beautiful; they really put a lot of thought into this place. The staff is very friendly and go out of there way to please you! The guests are also friendly. Our favorite staffers were Eduardo at reception, Renee at the bar near the reception desk (I think the name of the bar is La Habana), and Paco at Sir Oliver’s. Ask Renee to make you Tequila Boom Boom shots. Renee is one of the best bartenders on the resort! We received chocolate covered strawberries our 1st night for our anniversary. If your celebrating anything be sure to notify reception they will make it special. Food - The buffet was good our favorite night was the International night. Our favorite restaurants were Sir Oliver’s and the Japanese. I also enjoyed Agave (Mexican restaurant) we did not eat at the Brazilian restaurant. The steak house was good, but least favorite of the 4 restaurants that we ate, but nothing bad about it just preferred the others. Housekeeping - Housekeeping was Average. Pool - very nice the infinity pool was neat. It is a big pool so there is plenty of room to swim. Everyone mentions about the loungers. We never had a problem and if you are unable to find a lounger you can get one off the beach and bring to the pool area, but we never had a problem finding a chair. I enjoyed laying on the beach as well. Tipping - I would definitely bring USD$100 - USD$150 for tipping, if you can go to the bank before you leave and get all singles that is your best bet. The staff doesn’t expect it but they very much appreciate the tips. The staff really bust there butts and do deserve it. We saw a party of 6 at the Mexican Restaurant and the waiter was taking pictures of the group and really making sure they had a good time and they left him nothing, when they left he looked on the table to see if they had left a tip and looked so disappointed that they did not. At the gourmet restaurants we usually left between USD$5-$7 and the buffet USD$3-$4. For lunch usually USD$2. Housekeeping we usually left USD$3-$5 depending how well the room was cleaned the day before. We had the same 2 housekeepers. Also left 20 pesos for the person who turns the bed down. And last but certainly not least TIP THE BARTENDERS. Honestly these people work long hard days and deserve anything you can give them!! Also an added perk is you are staying at a Palace resort so you can go to any of the other Riu's that are in Playacar there are 5 others. One of the couples we met suggested we go on a Riu Bar Hop, and we did that one night. That was a lot of fun! You can also walk to 5th Avenue in Playa Del Carmen within 20 minutes or take a cab for USD$5. Souvenirs are MUCH cheaper there, and definitely bargain with them. We did 2 excursions while we were there. We swam with the dolphins at Delphinus, which was amazing! You are in the water with them for about 1 hour and 45 minutes. We also did Xel-Ha snorkeling, this was also a lot of fun, you see some incredible fish! Side not if you plan on doing Xel-Ha be sure to purchase Bio-Degradable sun screen. We had a wonderful time at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya and we can't wait to return!! We met some really great people and just had blast! You will love this place, unless your really picky and like to complain!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya for a much needed getaway. We were very pleased with our trip. We found the service at the hotel to be outstanding for the most part. I will begin with a few things we were not pleased with. The first night we were there we had a problem with the drain in our bathtub. We called the front desk and reported the problem three times before they sent a maintenance person (on our third day) to fix the problem. The beds have the most uncomfortable mattresses I have ever slept on. After several drinks it really didn't matter though! The room was also very hot and humid. Aside from those minor inconveniences the trip was terrific. We found the staff to be very friendly. The pool is gorgeous. We walked to the other Riu properties and found that the Riu Palace had the best grounds. The beach and water are absolutely beautiful. Be sure to specify the liquor that you want in your drinks. They have everything you just have to ask for it. Be sure to make reservations for the specialty restaurants. The food at the dinner buffet is not very good. Try Agave and Sir Oliver's. This was a fantastic resort. I believe that we received a great vacation for the price. You can't beat the all inclusive package. We plan on returning to another Riu in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “When can I go back!!! Loved it!! From, Chicago Girl!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ignore the bad reviews! I am the pickiest person there is and I absolutely loved this report. I have visited Riu Palace Mexico about 2 years ago and loved that resort and this one is even nicer! I have been to several AI reports before and nothing beats the Riu. The staff is extremely friendly, food and drinks are plentiful and the hotel is the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in. For bugs freaks out there……make a note because I did not see one bug or flying insect at this hotel. You could lie on the beach, by the pool, etc and nothing would be flying or landing on you. I was amazed. We went on a few excursions: ATV in the Jungle (very cool), Deep Sea Fishing (not for the see sick prone) and Parasailing (very nice). I would rate our vacation as one of our bests and I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Careful with valuables”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went there to celebrate my cousin's wedding. Our room was damp and smelled of mold even with less than a year since opening. My earrings were stolen from my hotel room. And management was unhelpful. The food was alright and the attendants uninviting. All in all it was a good celebration but I would suggest a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, Playacar is an amazing place to go. The beaches are beautiful and the resorts and homes all look picturesque. We booked the Rui Palace based on the great reviews for this hotel. My husband is in his early 30s and I am in my late 20s. I would definitely suggest this hotel for couples and families. I would not suggest it for young single people who love to go out and have a good time. We loved almost everything about the hotel. The food was great. We ate at the buffet every morning and it had a great variety of fruits and good food. The buffet also offered a variety of good food at night. The best part was being able to sit outside in a cafe table by the courtyard. We did not care so much for Sir Olivers. It was supposedly the best restaurant and the hardest to get reservations to. The Japanese restaurant was great and the Brazilian and Chilis were okay. Overall, for an all-inclusive, the food was great! The service was decent. The people were all pretty friendly. Make sure you bring money to tip, they do work hard and do deserve tips. We had no problems with the service except for the reservations to restaurants. It was always a long wait to reserve your seat and hardly any of the restaurants supposedly had availabilities. When we would go to the restaurants, some tables were empty. I feel like they need a better system with the restaurants. I wanted to feel relaxed, not looking at my watch to rush and try to reserve restaurants. The pool and beach were amazing. You would go out of the hotel and step onto the courtyard. I absolutely loved the courtyard. It reminded me of Mediterranean cities. You walk past beautiful fountains onto the pool. The beach was right next to the pool and it was breathtaking! Overall, our experience was wonderful. We met some amazing people on our trip and had a great experience with our new friends. We laughed, swam, played sports, drank, and ate. You really can't beat that for a long and relaxing experience. I would definitely return to this chaming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I want to go to Riu again”
Reviews.Author: mflo77
Reviews.Content: went to mayan with my girlfriend...i am 27, she is 26..... Stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera from June 3 to June 10, 2006. When we arrived at this hotel we were given an option. For some reason they over booked certain suites, etc. They gave us the option of staying in the best suite at a resort (Riu Yucatan) which was located about 3-5 min away from the Riu palace riviera maya and also presented us with $200 to stay at the Yucatan for one night. When we were to return the next day to Riu Palace R. Maya they would upgrade us to an ocean view suite. Since i wanted to experience a different resort to compare, I agreed to stay for ONE night at the Yucatan. Once Again, THIS WAS MY DECISION. The hotel was extremely polite and let me make the decision. Had i decided against this deal, somebody else would have been offered it. So we spent a night at the Yucatan. Yucatan had an amazing beach, great food, but room stunk like mold. I shouldnt say the entire room, but mainly our living room. The couch had a horrific scent. It was at times unberable. No big deal to me, since i only wanted to use the room to sleep. The guy at the front desk "Alex Rios" ( i think that was his name) was the ruddest person in the entire world. But regardless, i didnt let him ruin my day. Next day at the Riu Palace R. Maya, i was welcomed like a king. Great suite, full fridge, clean rooms, no mold scent, great bed, amazing view, phenomenol bathroom, etc, etc. I cant even explain how great our room and service was. I am surprised i wasnt greeted by a gorgeous mexican feeding me strawberries and fanning me down. It was just perfect.. The pool is one of the best i have been to. Plenty of space, tons of chairs, clean towels, lots of drinks, lots of sexy people, lots of couple, hardly any kids. Activities throughout the day were plentiful...soccer, beach volleyball, pool volleyball, ping pong, etc, etc, etc, etc, etc...i cant recall all the activites..there were plenty. i was concerned about the beach after reading the reviews. I was worried about the white fence and all the other negative things i read. People are crazy. The beach was outstanding. Sand was like walking on a cloud. Water at times rough with waves, but for the most part, amazing. I walked up and down the coast line every night. It was one of the better beaches compared to the resorts within a 3-4 mile stretch. The rui palace mexico and the riu yucatan do have a slight edge on palace r. maya for there length of beach. Food was good, not great. But personally, i dont vacation for food. I vacation for sun, beach, and pool. Dont want to have a full belly with the shirt off. Quick run down, brazilian was the worst. Buffet was good. Steak house was mediocre. Sir Oliver great. Didnt eat at the other ones, because i enjoyed playa de carmen's restaurants two of the nights. Simply an incredible vacation. Bartenders especially Rene (evening lounge bartender) are superb, staff friendly, riu animacion (entertainment staff) fun to be around, cleaner then one can possibly imagine, comfortable and relaxing... Oh, and playa de carmen is great. If you are single visit playa de carmen. Women gorgeous and fun to socialize with. No comment about the men, because well i love women. hehe.. When i go back to the Riviera Maya, this is the only place worth staying....I want to go to Riu Palace Riviera Maya....... Email me with any questions: mflo77@hotmail.com

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Ontario-Bruce
Reviews.Content: We just came back from the Riu Palace R.M., it was everything we had hoped for and more! I had high expectations but they were all exceeded by the staff and the resort! The resort is nothing less then beautiful, and the staff went out of there way to make sure we were having a great time. The rooms are all great, we had our room upgraded after the first night for free just because we wanted to be closer to the beach, and the food was great no matter where we ate ( the Japanese was awsome!). No matter what you read on here know that everyone cant be pleased all the time, but if you go to this resort you will have a great time! BL & KL

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous, extremely relaxing...WOW...Need I say more...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Since I read every single review written since this gorgeous place opened in February before we went on our trip – I thought I would write one to help those of you who are still trying to decide where to stay on your next vacation. Look no further – the Riu Palace Riveria Maya is paradise…you will not be disappointed!! Let me start of by saying anyone who has noteworthy complaints about this resort has to be insane! You are put upon a pedestal as soon as you walk through the front doors and absolutely spoiled rotten with people waiting on you hand and foot – and always with a huge smile on their face. My husband and I vacationed at the Palace for seven nights at the end of May along with another couple and had an absolute blast! CHECK IN: Quick and easy – the front desk staff were super friendly and eager to meet all our requests. We were on vacation celebrating our wedding anniversary and mentioned that to the front desk and were given a ‘complimentary’ upgrade overlooking the courtyard fountains. We also requested we be close to our friends room- and they upgraded them and put us directly side by side. {keep in mind we checked in on a Wed – there was a noticeable difference between the amount of people staying through the week –vs.- the weekend…so the availability of free upgrades and rooms side by side ‘may’ have been harder to score if we checked in on Fri/Sat/Sun}. HOTEL: From the moment you walk in you will be blown away by the Palace’s beauty. This place was for sure designed with elegance in mind – there is marble, ceramic tile, etc. everywhere you turn. The detail that was put into the Palace gives it a definite WOW factor. When you step out into the courtyard it is absolutely breathtaking with all the stunning fountains, pools and palm trees. This place was immaculate. There were constantly people cleaning – every corner of this resort sparkles. ROOMS: The rooms are big and spacious. There is a his/hers sink in the bathroom along with a hydro jet tub – which is very relaxing and romantic. Granted the beds are firm – but one quick call to the front desk and they will bring down some padding to help ensure a restful nights sleep. There is a sitting area in each room – which my husband found useful since he could relax, watch ESPN and drink a Corona while he waited for me to get ready for the evening. The mini bar was always stocked with beer, soda and plenty of bottled water. There is also that awesome liquor dispenser in the room and if you would like a bottle of something else…again, just ask and you will receive. POOL: WOW! Where do I start…the Riu Palace Riveria Maya added a special touch when designing their pool area: ohh my favorite –the chase loungers built into the pool for your basking in the sun enjoyment, there are also tables built into the pool to sit, relax and drink with your friends! The infinity pool was dazzling with the water spilling over its sides and into the pool below. Oh yeah, I cannot forget to mention the pool bar that kept us supplied with any kind of refreshing beverage you like…ask for an extra shot (or two) on top of your drink and you got it! BEACH: Breath taking, stunning, gorgeous…take a look at the pictures I posted – they speak for themselves. As far as walking on the beach-- we walked a good half hour down the beach with no problems (…and still no problems- just got tired and needed a drink refill so turned around and headed back to the Palace.) ACTIVITIES: There always was something going on at the Palace – volley ball to water aerobics and bingo in the pool. Dance lessons, darts and horse shoes on the beach. They also have free non- motorized water sports {wind-surfing, sailing, boogie boards and snorkeling}. You can rent jet ski’s, go scuba diving, and more for a minimal charge. At night there is always a show in the courtyard – plus if you need the club scene you can venture down the road to the sister Riu’s nightclub. FOOD: Was excellent. I am an extremely picky eater and I continuously found plenty to eat. I always started my day with a mimosa at the delicious breakfast bar (more like a feast than a bar I guess) – with made to order omelets, french toast, fresh fruit, croissants…hungry yet? All of the ala-cart restaurants where excellent …ok so we were not big fans of the Brazilian one- but the rest were top notch – especially the gourmet restaurant. We celebrated our anniversary night there and they hooked us up with a special cake and bottles of wine to take back to the room. There is also the buffet which serves up different selections every night – the food was beyond plentiful and picky eaters can surely find several things to their likings here. Also, if you are like me – I am a huge fresh-salsa fan- it’s excellent here and can be found at all times of the day.  OVERVIEW: This has to be one of the most gorgeous places to stay and was worth every cent. I certainly hope my review has helped with your vacation decision. Do not waste your time listening to the people who complain about all the ‘petty’ things. This place will not let you down…just remember ... you are in Mexico, on a beautiful beach with all the food and drinks you could ask for! Rain or shine keep in mind you are not at work- so relax and enjoy!!!!!! (and book your trip to the Riu Palace Riveria Maya NOW!)

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: drschultz
Reviews.Content: I am an extremely tough customer. My girlfriend and i agonized over which resort to visit on our vacation this month, and used trip advisor extensively to come to a decision. Initially we were leaning towards the Riu in Los Cabos, because of the consistent weather - but i'm glad we didn't. So we came across a ridiculously good deal for the Riu Maya and after checking some feedback on this site - decided to take the plunge. So here goes my review: Food: Overall very good. The best was breakfast and the mexican restaurant. The lunch gets repetive by about day 3. Personally i find alot of the desserts kind of strange - i'd prefer to see more familiar stuff. I would have liked to have seen an Italian restaurant instead of the brazilian. The Gourmet restaurant was really good as well. Now - this is where the 'almost' perfect comes in. On the last night of our trip (thankfully!), i got a vicious stomach bug that seemed to creep on almost immediately after the sunday night buffet. My girlfriend and i ate almost the same stuff, except i had some of the calamari and mahi mahi - i can't say for certain but be careful! Room: Awesome awesome awesome. Great view, extremely comfortable - the jacuzzi tubs was great - used it a few times. The only thing is because in Playa Del Carmen there is a law that you can't build higher than 3 stories, resorts end up being very spread out horizontally speaking. So in our case, that equalled a fairly lengthy walk each day to the pool / beach. Not really a big deal, just a minor annoyance if you have to sneak back to the room for something. Service: Awesome awesome awesome. No question. However i read that if you leave tips in your room expect a 'notch up' for the rest of the week. So on the first day i left a $5 tip in the room, but we didn't get any towel animals or anything the rest of the week. I guess it totally depends. Also, it seemed that there were 2 groups of people working the room - there was housekeeping, and then a seperate team handling the minibars. Pool: The pool was great for lounging and enjoying a pina colada. It was always very clean. The only thing i thought would have been neat would be some sort of lazy river... Beach: The beach was extremely good as well. They have an area roped off that is primo for swimming. The water is turquoise and the bottom is a soft white sand. Nightlife: We spent most nights relaxing in the Lirico bar watching the show of the evening. The first thing i would comment on is the house band. The band was ok but the singer had a bit of a shrill voice that got tiring on the ears. They are also at a bit of a disadvantage as the way the room is constructed they are perched up on very high loft above the stage - very strange. Following a few songs, a surprisingly funny host would come out and then present the daily awards to the guests (for activities like bingo etc...). The shows tended to be a bit on the campy side but there were some good ones - in particular the Mayan Show and the Magic show. Weather: This was one of my biggest concerns, going at the beginning of hurricane and rainy season i was worried that we would have 7 glorious days of rain and clouds. To further my concern as our trip neared the weather.com 10 day forecast was looking grim with thunderstorms almost every day. Not the case at all - and i know you've probably read this before in other reviews but i don't recall hearing one rumble of thunder the whole trip. There were 2 days that had rain, but it was off & on one day, and very brief the other. One word of warning for the fair skinned - be VERY CAREFUL. Even with your standard SPF 30 sun tan lotion a sunburn creeps up on you, and they don't protect against UVA very well - just UVB - and not to get into a science lesson but UVA rays are the ones that do the most damage. The best you can do is bring lots of lotion (don't buy down there - it's pricey) and reapply every 2 hours. Feel free to email me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kimzimm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Playa del Carmen June 2-8, celebrating our 5 year anniversary. We're both in our mid 30s and travel extensively. I, like most people, read the reviews before going and was a little apprehensive due to the negative reviews. However, I'm not sure which resort they're reviewing because we thought the resort was fabulous. Check in was smooth; we were even upgraded to a courtyard junior suite for free! I thought the room was very clean, plenty of towels. The toiletries left something to be desired but I usually bring my own, anyways. And yes, the bed was hard but since we have bad backs, we had the best nights sleep in a long time. The food was surprisingly good at the buffet restaurants. My husband is highly suspicious of buffets and even he thought it was good. We ate at three specialty restaurants (Chili's, Yashima, and Agave) and thought they were good except for Yashima. If you are a real sushi eater, don't waste your time. The drinks were all good. We were even given bottles of champagne and wine upon request with no problems. Mini bar was well stocked with drinks we requested. The beach was terrific. It's tiered and there were no bad spots to be in. The upper tier was never occupied but you could take loungers down to the lower area. The pool was great too. I was a little worried about the reviews where people talked about no loungers being available but that was a never a problem. We usually didn't make it to the pool until around 11 and there were always loungers available. They weren't always directly at pool side, but by the end of day, we could always move up as people left for the day. Didn't see any instances where people had claimed the lounger and didn't return all day. We also had a couples massage in the spa which was terrific. The prices were comparable with what we'd normally pay for a massage and it felt great. The only thing I didn't care for was the nightly entertainment. I thought it was a little cheesy and could have done without. I would have preferred a nightclub. Regardless, the plaza was a nice place to hang out in the evenings. Overall, the resort was terrific and we'd definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: liz prescott
Reviews.Content: My husband & I (Both in our early 50'S) have just returned from 14 nights at the R M. This was our 1st trip to MEXICO but we are regulay holidaymakers mainly in Europe. This place was the best ever. I do not know how anybody can find any fault at all. This resort is mainly couple oriantated so suited us well. We got a courtyard view at no extra cost. Absolutly loved the food, both the buffet & A la Carte. Nothing is too much trouble. WILL MOST CERTAINLY BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: lougirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from seven days at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We had a wonderful time. Since I read all the reviews for two weeks before we went, I thought I would add my two cents! We booked our trip through a travel agent and Vacation Express. If I had any complaints, it would be that no one told us we would only get a bag of pretzels to eat. Our flight left at about 8:50 a.m. and we didn't arrive at our hotel until about 2:00 p.m. Our room was not ready when we arrived. We had to wait about a half hour to get our information and bracelets. We were then able to go about the hotel and get something to eat. At that time the only restaurant open is Chili's by the pool. The Sports Bar is open 24 hours and has hamburgers, hot dogs and sandwiches that you can heat in the microwave. After we ate something, we went back to the front desk to see if our room was ready. I think it was about 3:30 at that point. It took at least another 15 minutes to get our room. Some of the people at the front desk are not very friendly. Most people that are checking in are very tired, hungry and have been travelling all day. It would be nice if they were a little friendlier, but oh well, not a big deal. I will say that this is one of the cleanest hotels that I have ever stayed at. These people are always cleaning. Inside and out. Our room was always cleaned usually by 12:00 noon. We usually had a little towel animal which made us smile when we came in from the pool. Every night our bed was turned down with a chocolate kiss on the pillow. We always had plenty of towels and someone was either knocking on our door or calling from the front desk to see if we needed more. They even brought chocolate covered strawberries the first night we were there. The beds are hard and I did ask the front desk for a "mattress pad" but was told there weren't any in the hotel. No problem, the lounge chairs at the pool are very comfortable and I caught up on my sleep there. Food: The food for the most part was good. They try to have a wide variety. I am sure it is not easy to please everyone, but they do a good job. We ate at the Mexican (Agave), Chili's and Sir Oliver's for the ala carte. Sir Oliver's was very good, the other two were just okay. The rest of the time we ate at the buffet. They have a different theme every night and we always found something we liked. The pool and the beach are excellent. The sand on the beach is like walking on baby powder so soft. Again, everything is very clean and well-maintained. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Riu is Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: tblack1919
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that for the past 5 years I have been going to different top of the line hotels in the cancun and playa del carmen areas and by far the riu palace is the best. Check in: quick and easy, We were told before that we would not get into our room until 3 but were in by 12 only minuted after arriving. Rooms: Very neat, beds were a little hard but if you call and ask the maids will put down pads and soft blankets to make them softer. The mini bar is always stocked(because it's not like you don't drink by the pool all day anyway). The is also liquor in the room: bicardi, vodka, jose quervo and a brandy. I call and requested a bottle of baileys be brought and it was in the room in 5 minutes. The bath room are all marble with a high pressure shower head and a jaccuzi bath. The Pool: Nice, swim up bar, the only complaint is they don't play music outside of water aerobics. But for the majority of the crowd there no music was a good thing. There are alot of things to do at the hotel during the day from beach volley ball to bingo by the pool. The also have free no motorized water sports. Snorkeling is offer for free at the scuba center on the beach. Food: For a All-inclusive resort the food was amazing, much better then all the other hotels, I am a very picky eater and I found something to eat at every meal, not only did I find something I really enjoyed the food. They have several resturaunts: Brazillian, Japanese(dont let the sushi scare you there is plenty of other food to eat), Steak house, Mexican, French Gourmet( my Favorite) and a buffet that changes themes every night. Night life: We tryed a little bit of everything, if you want to just dance and drink for free go over to the RIU Tequilla there is a club and it is open until 2, its fun and its FREE. Its a 5 minute walk or a 2-3 dollar cab ride. There is also several clubs in Playa del carmen. My favorite was the blue parrot, for 6dollars you got in and got 2 beers. the mixed drinks however are not so good of deal. There is also a Carlos and Charlies, Senior Frogs, Mambo Cafe, and several others, -if you want to go to Cancun for the bar hoppers tours it is 74 dollars for all you can drink and transportation to and from cancun, cover for three clubs and transportaion to the clubs. ALOT of fun but it is Hour+ drive each way to Cancun and you dont get home until about 5 A.M. Well I hope my Review has helped and don't listen to all the people who complain about all the smallest little things. you are on a beautiful beach with all the drinks you can every want, besides your not at work, relax it's VACATION!!!!!!! I WILL DEFINATELY BE RETURNING TO THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all the people who rate this hotel negatively have some major issues!! I've stayed at several All inclusive resorts in mexico, and this was by far the best! The food was incredible. Usually I'm pretty dissappointed with the food in Mexico, but every restaurant i went to at the Riu had somethin i enjoyed! The only thing that might have been a little dissappointing was the lack of music during the day at the pool, but i was entertained in other ways so it wasnt too big of a deal. The beach was AMAZING!! we walked down to other hotels and their beach wasn't half as good as the one at the Riu. All in all the hotel was extremely fun, and everyone was very nice. Give a few good tips and you will never have to wait for any service while you're there. I would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best Resort Period!”
Reviews.Author: btaylor62000
Reviews.Content: First of all...anyone who has significant complaints about this resort has to be crazy! I am 29 and my wife is 31. We went with a group of friends and had the best time ever. The rooms where very clean, I never heard the mini fridge run once. The toilet brush beside the toilet was NOT sitting in brow water...It is sitting in pink disinfectant and is not even noticed. The fron desk staff was very friendly. My bags where brought to my room immediately, The service was second to none. We must have went through 25 bottles of champagne as a group. Don Julio Tequila, all top shelf liquor. All of the alacart resteraunts where great except for aguava (the mexican resteraunt). The buffet was great with something for everyone. I had champagne mimosa for breakfast every morning. room service was great (except for the nachos). This resort is amazingly clean! I tipped well ($3 to $7 per day) and received great service. All rooms have hydro jet tubs and the beds are firm but very comfortable. I have been to playacar twice, puerto plata once, punta cana once, etc... and this was the best resort I have every stayed at. The beach was beautiful. I walked down the beach and the riu palace riviera maya had the best beach of ANY of the resorts on the strip. There is one picture posted on this sight that shows metal bars sticking up between the sand and the barrier wall and that picture is VERY misleading! The metal bars are about 400 yards down (about 3 resorts down) that is being built/repaired. You can not even see what the picture is of without walking 15 minutes. I simply do not see how anyone can complain about the beach here. the 2 tiered beach is great and does not cause any issues especialy since it is the best beach in the area...The best in luxury and service! I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: randodi
Reviews.Content: Since I read every single review before going on this trip, it is only fair to write my own review to help others. I will make it short and sweet and hopefully helpful... Background: I traveled with a group of 4 people (couples) who are all in their 20s. Hotel: Beautiful, have no idea what anybody could complain about. Rooms: Yes, the beds are hard, but I still managed to get a great nights sleep the entire trip (my friends however did not). Maid service wasn't the best, only got one towel animal, but who cares. Food: I loved the breakfast and dinner buffet. Lunch buffet was really bad, but that would be my only complaint about the food. Excursions: Here is how this works. When you get to the airport and find where to take the van to the hotel a man will give you a card with a name of someone to meet the next morning who will help you choose your excursions and book your van for the way home. Great I thought. The next morning at 9am I received a call from Mario (he calls himself Super Mario) to remind me to come down and meet him. That was annoying, but fine. Anyway, we met with Mario and we signed up for the ATV Jungle Tour and Scuba diving. The Scuba diving was really bad, but please note that I have been diving for 10 years and the reefs have been destroyed by the hurricane. I talked to other divers and they said they had been on much better dives than the one I went on, so that is good! The ATV Jungle Tour is a must!!! It was so much fun. Tip: Where sneakers if you plan on driving the ATV. Mario failed to mention this to us and we were the only ones in flip flops. So I highly recommend that. The only other problem I had was never recieving the phone call to let me know what time the van to pick us up was. Mario never followed through and when we approached him he really did very little to try and fix it (until the hotel got involved). After a very frustrating 45 min. it all worked out. Overview: This was honestly the most beautiful place I have ever stayed. My complaints have nothing to do with the hotel, I just wanted to make sure people had some extra advice when dealing with Mario and his staff of workers. The hotel staff was wonderful and I enjoyed my vacation so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: rebel2232
Reviews.Content: We were planning a wedding in the Mayan Riviera in May 2006. We tried booking with various travel agents and were not happy with the services, so I decided to booked my own hotels, airfare, etc. The first week we stayed at the Barcelo (May 14 to 21, 2006) and loved it, for the second week we were to stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya (a 5+ resort) (May 21 to 28, 2006) for our official honeymoon week. Our stay at the Riu was the worst experience ever! 1. At check in the reception staff member was rude. We indicated that we were honeymooners (had all the paperwork) and the staff member said "we are full" turned her back to us and left us hanging. We didn't get a room upgrade or even a gift as stated in the books. The room that we got --! Riu claims that they “love” honeymoons….we’ll these honeymoons do not like the Riu. 2. Bed is hard as a rock. 3. Rooms are noisy - at 12:30 AM our neighbors alarm clock was going off for 45 minutes till the hotel turned it off. Then at 1:30 AM our neighbors came into their room yelling and screaming. Then at 8:00 AM another alarm clock was going off for 1/2 hour till the hotel turned it off. The walls are very thin! 4. There is a toilet brush sitting in brown water next to your toilet (gross! See the photo) 5. There was only one towel in our room at check in. 6. The hotel safe --. First, you need a key that you have to keep with you all the time and the safe is located at the bottom of the closet so it is hard to get into. 7. The al-la cart restaurants have a very limited menu. 8. The pool is very small along with the swim up bar. 9. The beach is ok, other resorts have much larger beaches. 10. The theatre is very small (well it really isn’t a theatre but a bar)….some guest have to sit out side so if the weather if crummy then you won’t be staying for the show. 11. Merchants sell stuff at night in the court yard….and the vendors are a little too pushy for me. 12. There is no soap dish in the washroom so we used the ashtray. 13. The hallways are very dark and gloomy. 14. No snorkeling at this resort. 15. No phone directory on the telephone so there is no easy reference on even how to call front desk. I tried calling front desk by pressing 0….no luck…turned out you dial 9. 16. There is no phone book in the room. 17. Fire alarm was going off 5 times as we tried to have a siesta 18. First plate that I picked up at the buffet was completely dirty underneath. 19. We had to put our own stickers on our luggage at check in. 20. Ashtrays throughout the complex are dirty with butts. 21. The bar fridge in your room is very noisy 22. Did I mention that you can hear other guests going to the washroom while in your room. 23. The maids are very loud as they talk to each other while cleaning the rooms. Hard when you want to sleep in. This all in one night at the Riu. The next morning we complained to our Funjet representative and ask that we be transferred back to the Barcelo Tropical Beach. Our wish was granted and we enjoyed our honeymoon back in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “All Inclusive Resorts”
Reviews.Author: tabbylsmith
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I LOVE Playa Del Carmen and have been going there for 6 years. I must say as beautiful as the resort itself is that my experience was not so good. The service is terrible at this place. As two single cute girls we could not even get a drink without basically begging for one. I guess they figure once they have your money than they don't have to provide as good as service. I STRONGLY advise if you are looking to party and have a good time you should stay in town in one of the smaller hotels. We ate one meal a day here (breakfast) and went to town the rest of the time. The restaurants in Playa are FABULOUS and you should enjoy the culture while you are there! Also, another word to the wise is DO NOT travel American Airlines on a weekend holiday. They were TERRIBLE and I cannot express what a miserable experience I had with them. They have completely down sized and do not have the common sense on how to run things in the states and especially in Cancun airport. I spent 5 hours in the airport with the A/C out and it was mass confusion for everyone. If you are young and single and looking to enjoy a vacation on the beach please stay in town and not an an all inclusive....especially not this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for humidity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one memorable trip for our family. My parents, brother, and I checked in on May 29 and checked out on May 30th. Why so soon, you ask? My mother has been diagnosed few years ago with a heart problem which makes her blood pressure fluctuate irregularly. I knew the weather was hot there but I thought and she thought that she could handle it. But she couldn't handle the humidity. It was hard on us but it was unbearable for my mother. The hotel does NOT have any humidity control device so the room was very damp. It's surprising that 4 star hotel doesn't have any devices that controls humidity in the hotel. The bed sheets felt wet. Also the rooms didn't have much noise isolation. We could hear everything in the halls and rooms adjacent to us. The walls are thin and since the hotel doesn't have any carpeting, noise travels very well. If you are sensitive sleeper, DO NOT go to his hotel. If you have trouble with humidity, DO NOT go to this hotel. But everything else (food, decor, beach, pool) is good. Because my mother couldn't take it anymore and we couldn't risk her health we checked out in less than a day. Do Not use American Airlines!!! I explained my mother's health situation and asked them to change our flight back home to the next day, but they asked us to pay over $900 per person (cancun-new york)for economy class. They had open seats but didn't make any accomodations or waivers for the sick, even though we could document her medical condition. We already paid for the round trip tickets but they asked us to pay that money to change our flight even though it was a medical emergency. They knew we were desperate for a flight the next day so they tried to make much money as possible. So I shouted at them over the phone and book with a different airline for less than a third of that price.

Reviews.Title: “Beuatiful Hotel and GTreat Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the RIU Palace Riviera Maya and we had a great time. The facility is great and the service was wonderfuk by every staff member. The weather was terrible for the first four days we were there so we staued close to the bars and restarants. The pool bar was a lot of fun and the bartender Leonel was the man. Might I say way too much top shelf "Don Julio" Please tip him when you go. He does not ask or even suggest for a tip but he is a great bartender. As far as the restaurants: Sir Oliver was our ultimate favorite. Very small and limited seats so make your reservations for this one as soon as you arrive and you might make it in there your 3rd-4th night. AGAVE (Mexican) was very good and it was ourt second favorite. Lots of food and many choices fro appetizers. The Brazilan Restaurant was very good as well. Lots of Meats. The Japanese was alright but I am not a big Sushi fan. Chili's was our least favorite. This was the restuarant we went to our first night, so we had everything else afterward to comapre it to. Only Complaint: Geez the beds are hard as rocks. It seems they could have much better matresses for a 5 star resort. Every other person we talked to there we asked them the same question about the beds and the response was the same. "Hard Beds" * By the way the beach was not too bad at all. RIU Palace Mexico has a n=much better beach but it is just a short walk down the beach. Anyway, I would love to go back again and we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: beachbum00121
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from May 18th - 25th with my finance. Our ages are 25 and 27 and have traveled frequently to Mexico over the years. Some all-inclusives I have stayed at in the past include Moon Palace, Riu Cancun, Sandals and some of the Occidental Resorts. Check in was a breeze with the great customer service of Carlos. We arrived in the mid afternoon on our shuttle bus with 5 other couples and were greeted immediately when entering the hotel. We were upgraded to a beautiful room with a spectacular view and did not pay anything extra. From my observation it pays to be respectful and have a great attitude because the other couples around us were quite crabby and rude which probably was due to long travel times but don't take this out on the front desk. Our luggage was taken care of right when we walked through the lobby doors and we received it about five minutes after getting to our suite. The hotel lobby is beautiful and makes a great impression when you first walk in. The hotel grounds are immaculate and are always being maintained through out the day. We did not have any musty smells in our room except for when we left the air conditioning off for most the day in our room and when we turned it back on. Fare warning keep the air running and you probably can avoid that problem! The maid service was not excellent but not bad by any means. We always had our room cleaned everyday no matter what time we ended up leaving the room (anywhere from 8:00 am – 2:00 pm). We did have to ask for more towels a few times but it was probably more of our faults because we did not leave the dirty towels in the bath tub, ooops! Our dirty towels were still taken every time but they did not leave us new ones. No big deal – we just left some money and asked for more and problem solved! Refrigerator was stocked daily with no issues. Yes we did have an issue with the room keys not working at times but we would go down to the front desk and it would be corrected immediately. This problem did not occur all the time but only when you had to get in the room to use the bathroom because of too much rum :-) !! The pool is outstanding!! There is plenty of room in the pool for the entire resort. Probably Saturday was the busiest day because of two conventions being held but the pool never seemed overcrowded. We did walk down to the Riu Palace Mexico and thought the pool at our resort was much, much better! This was one of my worries when booking at this resort - it would be overcrowded in the pool especially the pool bar area.Yes the bar stools were usually taken but there was plenty of room to lounge around at the other pool tables and seats. People would come and go and there is always a chance to jump in. Now if you don’t want to be around the pool bar then you will have absolutely no problem at all! We always found loungers around the pool most of the time and if there was none to be seen then we would just grab a lounger from the beach or also there were tables and chairs around the pool bar if it was not too busy. The beach was the most amazing blues as they always are in Playa. The retaining wall should not be an issue at all because you can always bring your loungers next to the water with no hassle. If you look at all the other resorts, Royal Hideaway, Riu Cancun, Le Blanc and most Cancun Resorts for example, always have some sort of wall. Even when the tide came up during the early evening there was still plenty of room down by the ocean. The tide was probably high when the resort first opened in March but now has receded leaving enough room to walk the beach all the way to the Riu Palace Mexico. I did swim in the ocean but always towards the right side and had no issue with coral just soft white sand on the feet. Food was very good but not excellent which was to be expected at this all-inclusive. There was always plenty to choose from and did not have any complaints about the food but I am not a picky eater. Sorry I will not be much help on the specialty restaurants because we missed most our reservation times. Because of people like me you could probably show up 10-15 minutes after the seating and get in the restaurant. The only one we made was the Mexican Restaurant, which was good but just like eating at the buffet better because of selection. I did make reservations for a couple of the restaurants and only had to wait for about 10-15 minutes which just meant grabbing a drink at the lobby bar watching for the line to be gone then jumping in. Drinks were great, no complaints! I tried a little bit of everything and the bartenders will definitely go out of their way for you. We did bring singles down before hand and did tip our bartenders and always received excellent service from all. Overall this was an excellent resort for a relaxing vacation and the customer service was exceptional thanks to Alex, Frito, Carlos, Rene, Enrique and Alfredo. Thanks for everything!!

Reviews.Title: “Riu Palace Riviera Maya: What you need to know!”
Reviews.Author: Stra
Reviews.Content: For two months before I went on my vacation, I checked tripadvisor almost religiously to read reviews on Riu Palace Riviera Maya. Hence, now that I am back from my stay there, I thought it only be fitting that I write one. First of all, I'll give a little background about myself. I am 20 years old and stayed at the Riu Place with my parents (who are both 43 years old) and my younger brother. Riu Palace Riveira Maya is a great place to stay if you are a couple. Having come on the vacation with my family, it was nice, but if you are looking for a fun time drinking and socializing by the pool, I suggest you go with a group of friends or with your significant other. This is a very couple oriented resort. However, during our stay there were quite a few young infants and young children accompanying their parents. Checking in and out: The check in was okay. Not terrible. The girl we got at the front desk was very straight forward, laying out everything we needed to know. For instance ,she told us upfront about the cost of internet was $4/ 15 minutes and where we could eat that night, what was covered and anything that was at an additional cost. She wasn't super friendly, but not exactly rude. Let just say out of all our experiences with the staff. I'd rate the front desk the worst. *Don't let the front desk affect your overall impression of the resort though. The nice point abot the check in was while we were talking with the front desk, we were served drinks (a fresh juice with pineapple, mango, and orange!) We were only in the resort for about 3 minutes and were already recieving such treatment ( I did say that this reosrt was very guest oriented!) When we checked out, the front desk was not that great. The lady seemed rushed. Just taking our room access and towel cards and saying see you! I wasn't expecting much, maybe just a thanks and maybe asking how was our stay. My dad asked her whether the shuttles were going to pick us up at the front of the hotel and she was like I don't know (as if it was not in her job description) go call your tour provider. For those who read past reviews about tipping the front desk, I don't think it is necessary, save your tipping money for your servers and bartenders) The Rooms: The room was nice, clean and spacious. The interconnecting rooms were great. Unlike other places I stayed, The interconnecting rooms are not partition by a door through a wall. The rooms are facing one another with an additional wall on the outiside that connects the two rooms. I really liked the towel animals (we got 4 different animals during our 7 day stay). I found that housekeeping came by the room quite late in the day. Our family woke up at around 9:00 each day and had breakfast and went to the pool and beach. By our siesta time (2:00-2:30), the rooms were not made. This is the time the housekeeping staff came to do our rooms which was kind of awkward. But they were always courteous by knocking first and asking whether we wanted our room cleaned. Although, on the days we felt it was unecessary for them to do our rooms (because we wanted to nap). The came in after we left and did our beds (one day they left a hershey kiss on each of my brother and my double bed!) I thought that was a nice touch. The housekeeping staff also did other surprises like carve flowers our of the bar soap we opened (interesting but i loved their effort to try and make things special) Pool: As you can see from past reviews. Riu Palace Riveria Maya has a beautiful pool. Its two tiered and had places to sit and drink and the swim up bar was a favorite. The Food: This was the most important thing about the resort. My family are quite picky eaters so we wanted a resort that would be catering to our tastebuds. The breakfast and lunch buffets were good, a nice variety. To be honest after the third day, we got kind of tried of eating the same stuff. But the food was good. The dinner buffet: We ate there the first and last nite. They try and switch up the menu. Our server the first night was excellent ( we had to give him a nice tip!) He was friendlly and fun and was so efficent. Our plates were cleared off the table and he was ready to refill our beverages at all times! The rest of the servers were also good but I couldn't help compare them to Nicholas ( i think that was his name!) I suggest that everyone book the theme restaurants ( you can do that by the tables near the main bar in the lobby between 12-4) Come early as they do get booked up. My family was very impressed by the Japanese Restaurant (Yashima) and the Gourmet (Sir Olivers). Our server at Sir olivers was sooo good! The mexican was also quite good (I liked the shrimp and the margaritas). The Brazilian ( great soup, good is you like eating lots of meat ) and Chilis (steakhouse) was also okay. Overall i enjoyed all of the restaurants, some more than others but it was fun having a different place to eat each night. Entertainment: Pool side dancing, beach party on fridays. The theme shows every night were okay (some not that bad, some nights kind of lame). They have a small stage so the things they can do is limited. The live band that plays every night were excellent. The entertaniment crew (the animation group?) they were really energetic and their dancing was fun to watch (I don't think you can ask for more, and no they were not as terrible as some other reviews said.) Beach: Beautiful. Plenty of chairs (you don't need to wake up early to get one) The only thing that that was not that convenient is getting the equipment. Where the equipment is located opposite of where the we had to fill out this long waiver form asknowledging the risks (by chilis). Overall we had a great stay at the Riu Palace Riveria Maya. Despite having a few days of rain we still ended up having a nice time at the resort. I hope that you will find my review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Gives Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: carlsontravelagent
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the Riu Riviera Maya. As a travel agent I try to imagine what my clients will expect. The food was very good in all the restaurants, no line waiting! Same day reservations. The drinks were excellent and plentiful. As with all the Riu's I have stayed at, the service is outstanding. Since the Riu Palace Riviera Maya is a new resort, expect a few kinks in their armor. For instance, the long hallways have a dampened musty smell, what you would expect from the tropics. However, the structure is a bit different than the Riu Palace Cabo which had rooms on one side and open air on the other. I often sat on my balcony which faced the water early morning and could see people running to put towels out at 6am. Then later I would see them in the lobby leaving for a bus trip for the day not even using the saved lounge chairs! I hate that part. But we (a party of four) never had a problem getting a good seat. The piano bar after dinner is a wonderful place to unwind, and the nightly shows are very entertaining. The courtyard is a great place to sit and enjoy a cocktail while you listen to Mariachis or other nightly entertainment as well. The Renova Spa was worth every penny. They were wonderful. The animation staff is also as much fun. This is one resort you will not regret doing the all-inclusive package on. (They do not offer European Plan) The drinks are premium, the food delicious with variety and the staff hard working and plentiful. Room service is great for late night lazy snackers.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from May 11th- May18th 2006. It was absolutely amazing. For anyone who posted a bad review-YOU DONT KNOW WHAT YOUR TALKING ABOUT!!!! The check-in was 5 minutes...and within that time the bellboy already had our bags to our room. There was one slight problem-we didnt have a room with a view as requested. All we had to do was notify the bellboy-he called right up to reception and within 2 minutes we were upgraded to a courtyard view for no additional charge. The room was gorgeous. Everything is marble and tile. We had a king size bed...yes, it was hard but SO COMFORTABLE-we slept like babies every night. The room was always made up so nicely...towel art, chocolate kisses, fresh flowers, and balloons. Our fridge and mini bar were restocked everyday. The food was great too. We ate a buffet breakfast everyday and never had something we didn't like. We ate lunch at Chile's every afternoon and loved everything we tried. The Mexican place was really really good too. The pool was AMAZING! It has a swim up bar, tables, benches, and stools built right into the pool. We never once had any trouble getting a lounge chair--there are plenty! Everyday the staff has different activities--yoga, water aerobics, beach volleyball, water volleyball, dance lessons, bingo, etc. The beach was just as nice. AGAIN, I DONT KNOW HOW ANYONE COULD SAY ANYTHING BAD! The man made beach is HUGE with tons of chairs and the real beach is perfect. The water was crystal clear...we went snorkeling right there! We saw coral and a bunch of tropical fish. We cannot say enough about the staff...everyone was SOOOOO NICE. They're always smiling and you can tell that they want you to have the best vacation possible. You can take a 15 minute walk or a 5 dollar taxi ride to 5th avenue. It has A TON of bars, restaurants, and shops. It's such a nice area...and safe too. We would recommend this hotel to anyone! We can't say one bad thing about it. It will take your breath away! :-)

Reviews.Title: “The Real Truth About This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort from May 10th until May 15th. We waited in no lines, for food, drinks or to get a chair by the pool and sunshine every day (apparently May is the month with the least amount of rain for Playa Del Carmen). I think timing is key, the people who worked at the resort told us that this was their “slow” time, which suited us just fine. Rooms – Very nice, mini-bar with Corona, water, sparkling water, assorted sodas. Liquor dispenser with Bacardi Rum, Smirnoff Vodka, Jose Quervo and some sort of whiskey. Pool – Always found a chair at anytime of the morning or day. Drinks are brought right to you, no need to go up to the bar. Gratuity is included but if you tip a dollar, they definitely come back to you faster and more often!! Always something going on, fun to watch or join if you like. Aerobics, water volley ball, salsa lessons, bingo and fashion shows (bathing suits and wraps) really cool for any women who are reading this. Beach – Beautiful!
