Never too packed, pull a chair down to wherever you want to sit, it is quiet and wonderful! Hammocks on the beach and drinks are brought to you there as well. Locals come up to you selling conch shells, starfish and jewelry. None of the ones that came up to us were pushy at all. Snorkel/Scuba – We went snorkeling on the all day trip to Cozumel and it was all day. A little too long for me and I think scuba diving would have been more fun. The reefs were not that colorful, but the fish, sting rays and barracuda were amazing to see. The water was really cold, so bring a drink change of clothes or bathing suit and a towel!! Food – The food was ok, some of it was not good at all, but there are a lot of options at the buffet. If you want a vacation all about food, go to France or Italy, not Mexico. Make reservations the first night you are there, if you book the late dinner you pretty much have the restaurant to yourself. Japanese I thought was really good, Brazilian was filling, the best part is the grilled pineapple. The Mexican was so so, not like the Mexican food we are used to. Drinks - They never skimped on alcohol when I had a drink. Bring some sort ot cup that keeps drinks cold, because it is hot and the drinks get hot fast on the beach or at the pool! Playa Del Carmen – You can walk into town, lots of shops, the vendors on the street can be really aggressive so be ready. You can take a five dollar cab ride into town as well. My favorite bars/club were Carlos and Charlie’s, Senor Frogs, Mambo Café (salsa dancing) and the Blue Parrot (can get crowded but it is on the beach, in sand and all) This was more of a couples place, but just me and girlfriend went and we still had a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation”
Reviews.Author: GoodeBoy
Reviews.Content: Our fantastic vacation started with the warm greeting by Alex. He is the nicest person you will ever meet. We joked with him that he was there 24/7. The hotel like everyone else has indicated was wonderful. The food at the resteraunts was exceptional. The buffet on the other hand was not our favorite. They did not rotate the foods in the buffet and we got tired of breakfast there. The rooms were fantastic, just a word of warning, if you choose a room with double beds, The room is the same size as one with a king bed, the headboard is the same but the beds are side by side (touching) so that it kind of looks like a king bed. We were accidently given a room with double beds the first night and quickly changed it for the next. Tours - Find the Tulum express tour with Jorge. The company is based in Playa del Carmen and they are cheaper with smaller sized groups. If you go to Chizen itza with Cancun lines, you will ride a bus and spend two and a half hours morning and night just picking up and dropping people off. We left at 7am and returned at 7pm. Jorge claimes that he only takes 8 people in a van (one tour) and only charges $45. Not the $80 you will spend with Cancun lines. Jorge is a really great tour guide. If you want to go deep sea fishing and snorkling off the coast you have to go to Puerto Morales. Take the first road to the city on the south end. Take the road all the way to the park in front of the beach. You will see a small building on the left hand side of the road with a sea picture painted on the building. Go there for your snorkeling. $25 for two hours and well worth it. The fishing trip was average price, but the guides really work hard to give you a great time. STAY AWAY FROM THE TIME SHARE HOTEL ON THE SOUTH END OF PUERTO MORALES. It is an RCI affiliated location and the service was aweful. We got sucked into their presentation and then they could not make good on their free gift. The did nothing to try and resolve our situation. They waisted 2 hours of our day, and then did not compensate us for our time. In fact they told us that all they wanted was for us to see their hotel and help spread the word about them and their service. So here I am spreading the word, STAY AWAY!!!!!. Playa Del Carmen is a wonderful place to vacation, we have already gotten family members to look into going. It is well worth the time and money

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay at a Riu Palace - would go again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from a 5 night stay at this new Riu Palace. We also stayed at the Riu Palace Mexico (RPM) in May of 2000. We had a very nice, relaxing time. Food - really good for Mexico. We ate at the gourmet restaurant, the steakhouse, the Japanese restaurant, the Brazilian steakhouse, the daily lunch buffet and the breakfast buffet. We loved all the restaurants with the exception of the Brazilian - wouldn't recommend. I feel like we have reasonable expectations for the food in Mexico, but the Brazilian fell far short of what we're used to at Brazilian steakhouses here. If you like breakfast, they really do have a wonderful daily breakfast buffet. Rooms - nice. Similar to the RPM except these have a single king bed vs. two fulls pushed together and no bedet. The room was fine - but a bit noisy for naps - the entire floor in room and hallways is tile, and this creates quite a bit of loud echoing during the day. No problems with noise at night. Note that not many rooms have ocean views, and if a fantastic room view is important to you this may not be your hotel. Pool - AWESOME. I think this is one of the best resort pools I've seen. Loved the "in-water"tables around the pool bar and the "in-water" loungers. Liked the infinity pool and the daily water aerobics. NOTE: pool chairs go early - we got up one day at 7 AM to go and claim our chairs, and still did not get the ones we wanted. All the other days we got our choice. Beach - decent. Not much shade in beach area (the palm trees are still growing), and the surrounding hotels are having issues with erosion, and have these large, ugly exposed sandbags, which makes long beach walks less enjoyable. If beach is important to you, another hotel/ area may be better. We went to town one night for dinner - great little downtown shopping and dining district! Kids - we left ours at home, but we did see quite a few. The "kids" area is underwhelming in my opinion - a small wading pool and a small plastic swingset/climber. When we do decide to take our kid(s) to Mexico, we'll probably choose a more kid focused resort. For a couples' vacation this resort was perfect, but I wouldn't recommend for singles. Spa - we both got massages and really enjoyed. Activity directors/entertainment - not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had the best time of my life!!!! Staff was so friendly and accomodating! Room was amazing, view spectacular! Beach great, further down the beach was too many topless women who really should have reconsidered that decision!!! But out beach was perfect, no traffic and white sand! Blue Parrot bar and Mambo Cafe were the best!! You will love it

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back (5/12) and had a great time. The main reason is the service. Everyone was extremely friendly and dedicated to us having a great time. So we obliged! Thanks Riu!! Beautiful pool and courtyard. Plenty of beach to enjoy. One bit of advice. Do not do the catamaran snorkle trip on a rough sea. Not much to see and the wife got seasick for the first time ever. All in all a very nice trip. We'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!! Relaxing!! The best ever!!”
Reviews.Author: kidsinnc
Reviews.Content: Hi Everybody! We Honeymooned here 5/3 - 5/8. We are 29 and 30 and both love luxury and have high expectations. Every expectation we had was met 100%. Hotel: Beautiful, top of the line in class and style. Rooms: Spacious, tastefully decorated. We had a courtyard view closer to the pool area and the view was absolutely breathtaking. My hubby loved the Jacuzzi tub! Food: Make reservations your first day for Sir Oliver’s (you can make them in advance and make 2 reservations at a time) we unfortunately did not get in but everybody talked of how delicious it was. Steakhouse - Had Ribeye, very delicious. Japanese - Love Sushi, very good and fresh! Brazilian - Thought it was delicious too! The lunch buffet was good, big variety something for every taste. The breakfast buffet was to die for! Everything you could possibly want was on it... Yummy! Pool: WONDERFUL!! The pool lounges are great; I was next to Heaven there! I tan well and I got sun poison on my face so be careful bring higher SPF than you would normally use. Claudia at the pool is so sweet and wonderful server, she will keep your drinks coming (we tipped her well and I am sure that helped, VERY well worth it) Beach: Nice! We only went to the beach for parasailing and the banana boat (which both were so much fun) I hope you have a wonderful vacation if you go here, & if you are like us, you will be planning your next vacation back to RIU Palace RM as soon as you get home.

Reviews.Title: “A day in the life of my vaca at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya.....”
Reviews.Author: taln
Reviews.Content: Ok, first of all....WoW. Let me preface all this by saying I've traveled throughout my life to all high-end locales. And, the Riu Palace R. Maya can definitely hold its own! For those of you thinking of going...or already booked and keep checking for reviews (as I did everyday prior to departure) rest assured, you will LOVE it! I'm so sad to already be back. My friend and I were there for a week 4/26 - 5/3. (Yes, we were the two crazy girls from Michigan! haha) Let's start from the top: The hotel grounds: beautiful! I swear, you couldn't find a speck of dust if you tried. They keep the place in great condition. Granted, how run down can a 3 month hotel look? But, still, it is immaculate. The rooms: Spacious and lovely. Tip your cleaning person a few bucks here and there and you will never have a need for anything. I was impressed with how particular they are in making sure everything is to perfection. The pool: Large and inviting. I was a bit hesitant about the pool bar at first. Worried it might get kind of loud and overly obnoxious (and worried there would be spilled daiquirees all over the place)....but not at all. fun fun fun! Be sure to try the fruity blue colored drink. To die for. LOL. The beach: Beautiful. I was a bit worried (seeing the initial reviews about the beach). But they must have perfected it since, because I couldn't complain. The only thing that was a bit of a pain was walking back to the pool from the beach....a bit of an uphill walk (granted, not far) But, hey, if that's all I have to complain about...then no worries. Besides, we could all use the exercise after eating and drinking all day! Anyways, the water is turqoise and clean. Usually calm, but a bit wavy when the wind picks up in the afternoon. And that "retaining wall" = a total nonissue. The food: Very good. Not great...but no complaints. You MUST eat at Sir Olivers. My friend and I managed to get in twice and it was absolutely delicious. The Brazilian was okay, the Japanese not so good, the Mexican was good and we skipped the Steak House when we realized it was pretty much the same restaurant as Chilis (decent outdoor lunch restaurant). Oh, the buffets: Not bad at all. A lot of variety. The fruit was great (so were the darn hot dogs that I kept eating!) Entertainment: They have a really fun crew that kept the tourists well entertained throughout the night. Great outdoor music every evening and they had nice little outdoor events. IE - one night was a Mexican theme party...you walk through the plaza area and they serve you margaritas, tequila, etc all night long. You can stroll around, listening to the live beats of Mexican music, etc....all while being under the stars/ocean breaze, etc. It's rather intoxicating (and I'm not just talking about the liquorl!) hah Be sure to get out for a night or two. Karen's has great food down in Playa. Also, Mambo cafe is a lot of fun for dancing through the night. Anywhere on 5th Ave is fun. I was really happy to feel safe and secure in all the areas we went. They are really good about keeping others out of the hotel, unless they have a Riu wrist bracelet on. Few other helpful tips: Be sure to have a few drinks in the lobby bar. They make them delicious in there. If you want the high end liquor - just ask for it, they will provide. Tip your staff here and there and you'll be surprised how they remember everything. I'm talking to the details of the brand of tequila you like...to how many towels & bottles of water you need in the room, etc. OH - and be careful in the sun. I usually tan extremely well, but found the sun to be unbelievably potent. Bring a high number SPF - I promise, you will need it. Last but not least, we ended up taking a cab straight to the airport (vs. taking the shuttle) it was faster, and worth the $40. So, if you don't want to deal with a shuttle, the cab ride is great. That's about it for my review. Would I go back? Absolutely. Would I stay at the same place?For sure. It was the nicest RIU there, in my opinion. ps - for those of you travelling with kids, or if you're single - the majority at this resort were couples. However, my friend and I (both single and in our early 30's) managed to have a blast. We met a lot of great couples and partied with a lot of them. Not to mention, go into 5th Ave - and you will find all sorts.... Have fun!! T & M, from Mich.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: sdaj1993
Reviews.Content: Our party of 6 were are the new Riu from April 24th to May 1st. We covered all age groups. Myself and my husband in our early 40's, our twin boys aged 10 and my parents, 69 and 73. All of us had a wonderful week at the Riu. This was our first trip to Mexico and it won't be our last! Check-in was a breeze. They were ready for our arrival and rooms were ready even though we arrived before noon. The food was fantastic. Between the 6 of us we managed to each at all 5 ala carte restaurants and the buffet. The only downfall with the ala carte restaurants is that they don't really cater to children. One of my guys is a picky eater so he preferred the buffet, which had something for everyone, every night. Breakfast was excellent! Rooms were good. Could have used a little more space for the 4 of us but we were unable to upgrade as bigger rooms were booked. One tip when booking your stay at the Riu, pay the extra and get the courtyard view. It would definitely by worth it. Our balcony faced generator of the hotel next door so not much of a view and alot of noise if your wanted to sit out on the balcony. (Couldn't hear it with the doors closed). Staff all over the hotel were incredible. Excellent entertainment/activity staff around the pool. They are very funny! Beach was great! Always a chair to be had. There no longer seems to be an issue about walking along the beach. You can walk to your hearts content. Sports bar is fun! Got to see some of the hockey playoffs! The town of Playa del Carmen was a 5 minute cab ride. Easy to walk but in the heat, much easier. $5.00 u.s. each way. Great spots for lunch and lots of shopping! All in all we had a great vacation. No rain! Will definitely go back to PDC and definitely use the Riu chain again. Top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2006”
Reviews.Author: mauibound
Reviews.Content: We,six females, fell in love with our resort, and the area. Two of our group were 8 and 10. They certainly enjoyed everything. They performed nightly with the group of activities directors. They really enjoyed our girls, and even asked them to dance. We have great pictures! Thank-you to Mildred and Octavio. The majority of our meals were quite good. We especially liked Sir Olivers. The Monday night buffet rocked! We had seafood galore,plus anything else you can imagine. The atmoshpere was lovely. Be sure to request the wines with your meals. They are nice, especially the whites! We are already discussing our trip for next year. We felt so comfortable and relaxed. It was everything we wanted. Hurry Spring Break 2007!

Reviews.Title: “You gotta Go!”
Reviews.Author: Stogaboy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend to the brand new just opened in Feb '06 Riu. This is a 5 Star resort. I took 6 couples who won a business incentive trip. The hotel itself is gorgeous, The pool area spectacular and the scenary marvelous. Once they finish nailing down some very minor service issues, this will be able to compete with the Ritz's and Four Seasons of the hotel world. (I took this same group to the Ritz in Key Biscayne last year) and this was NOT a step down! The food was excellent on its own, but when you compare it to all-inclusives - it KILLS THEM hands down. Endless food and drinks on a white sandy clean beach was wonderful. NOTE to Parents: There was certainly toplessness around. Nothing that was out of control and not IN YOUR FACE, but something to consider. We WILL be back!!

Reviews.Title: “What are they complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I (32 &36) stayed at this resort hesitantly after reading some of its previous reviews. We had a great time and can assume that some of the other reviewers just don't know how to relax. To get an idea of where our perspective comes from, we have been to 7 or 8 all inclusives in Mexico and the Caribean over the last few years, I enjoy the activities and she's a sun worshiper. The resort is beautiful, immaculatly cleaned daily by the hardest working staff you'll ever see. Rooms are spacious, ours faced south towards the neighbouring resort but considering we didn't spend a whole lot of time in the room it was no big deal. As mentioned in other reviews the beds are hard, but ask for extra pillows if it's that important. The first day we tipped the maid and mini bar guy a few bucks and got plenty of nice extras for the whole trip...towel animals, flowers on the bed and more beer and water than we could drink. Called for shampoo one day and it was at our door in 8 minutes. The food is good overall with enough variety to keep any normal human happy for a week. Plenty of fresh fruits, vegetables and meat. The specialty joints were OK, Mexican was excellent. Service was fantastic. We walked the beach to find exactly how hard some of the resorts had been hit by the hurricanes. It was bad. Some resorts seemed to have no more than 10 ft of beach left, making our beach seem even better. If you're looking for a beautiful resort with a nice mix of quiet and activites, good food and over the top service from everyone, this is your place. To all the peolple that write complaining about the little things...relax you're on vacation. Close your eyes and remember, your in Mexico, the waters blue the air is hot and the endless supply of drinks are cold. It's a great place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Average Mass Production Resort”
Reviews.Author: Macdad80
Reviews.Content: We visited this resort 4/17 to 4/23 with another couple and came to the conclusion that nothing "wowed" us about the resort. There were several nice features but nothing that screamed this place is exceptional. We picked it due to proximity to cinco avenado and Playa's nightlife. This resort is for families and couples that want a slower paced vacation. This is a huge resort- 664 rooms and suites! Grounds and common areas were clean and very nice. Rooms- large and clean. Bed and pillows were brick hard. My wife loved that and I hated it. Overall, Nice. Food- Very mediocre but ample amounts of mediocre. The breakfast buffet was good with the secret to getting an egg or omelette in arriving by 8:15am. After that, wait in line for up to 15 minutes. Very large and good selection of fruit, juices, entrees. You should be happy. Lunch was good but not great. We only ate lunch on 2 of 7 days. Dinner- Buffet was ehhh. Agave was the best restuarant. The Shrimp entree was very good everything else was okay. Botofogo- I would not go again. All of the meet was overcooked and very chewy with the exception of the chicken- very good. Chili's- the strip was good. I like my meat MR and sometimes rare. My steak was cold in the center. I still ate it but I have an iron gut and enjoy a little blood in my meat. I think that would freak out everyone else- especially my wife, which is why I never told them that my strip was not cooked. We skipped the rest of the restuarants (Sir Oliver and Yahsima). We heard the Japanese was horrible- rice and sushi "had the consistency of putty". And we skipped our reservation for Sir Oliver's. We were just tired of the food and went into town for a superior dinner. By the way, Yaxche, La Parilla, Karen's, Casa Del Agua had far superior food to Riu. Go into Playa and treat yourself to a real experience at the locally owned and operated restuarants and then enjoy the superior nightlife of Cinco Avenado. We stayed away from the pool and easily found lounges at the beach. I just don't like to swim in a pool with a pool bar patronized by people that drink for 8 hours and never leave the pool- nasty, very nasty! Beach was nice, quiet, relaxing and in better shape than surrounding resorts. Overall, this resort is just a cattle processing plant shuffling in the tourists that experience the "typical 5 nights" and never leave the resort. It has no character and looks inferior to the original Palace down the street. Playacar is now more if a mini Cancun with the herds of people and congestion. This is why we don't go to Cancun and is why we will not return to Riu and never use a Riu property again. For the price, you get ten times the experience/value and Secrets Capri. I guess we just like smaller, higher quality, more personal service that cannot be matched at these mega resorts. By the way, this resort is not even close to a Ritz or Four Seasons in quality but it shares the distinction of being overpriced. This review is negative but you will have a good time. You just will not be wowed and to me a vacation should never be ordinary, it should be extraordinary. I can stay in the states for ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have used this website many times and I felt that it was time that I start to post my results. My wife and I have been to Mexico seven times, mostly "high end" AI's, so I have a pretty good idea what goes on down at some of these resorts. I will try to list some of the objections/concerns that I seem to see on this website. Check In: Went fine and the staff was great. Staff: NEVER once did I ever encounter a rude person who worked for the hotel, in fact most of the staff go out of their way to accomodate you. The only rude people I encountered were other guests at the resort. Pool/Chairs: The pool is great. Everyone is correct about the chair situation around the pool and how the chairs are confiscated by people who go out early and secure their "spot". Honestly though, I have been to multiple "5 Star" resorts in Mexico, and this seems to be more the norm. RIU at least has a policy where if you just have a towel on the chair and you are n ot there for about 30 min, the towel is stripped away and the chair is fair game, unless of course you have a "personal" item on the chair. This does create some interesting dynamics between those who "had" the chair and then those who actually "have" the chair. Many open chairs on the beach and chairs are constantly opening up in the pool area so don't sweat it. Beach: If you want to take long walks on a huge beach then you may be disappointed. The beach is broken up by but once you get past the "bad" part, you can walk for a long time. Many people have complained about the beach and the dreaded "retaining wall". Come on....it is all but two feet high and if you stay to the left while looking at the ocean, you can walk right down. In fact the way the beach is set up is great, you can have the both of bith worlds. The beach does have some "rocks" (it is coral) and trust me, you can avoid this fairly easily. If you want to see what a crowded beach looks like, just go down to the other RIU's and you will see for yourself, chairs are everywhere and people are laying right up to the waters edge. Drinks: Fine, but make sure you call your liquor or you will get "well" liquor. Sent some drinks back that were a tad too strong, but that can be a good problem. The bartenders are great and really try to please you. People were complaining about getting drinks at the pool, or lack there of. Simple solution, get up off your chair and go the bar which is no more than 30 yards away, and then you will be ensured that there will be at least some slush left in your frozen drinks. I got tired of the same old line, "I spent thousands and I can not even get noticed for a drink." Food: My wife and I do eat at many nice restaurants, especially with clients. The food is good. Really, no AI's food is great or "5 Star". The dinner buffet is consistently good if you have to go there, and trust me you will have to go there. Chili's, the lunch area, always has something decent to eat and stays open for most of the afternoon and is close to the pool. Went to Sir Oliver which was good but very small, the Mexican place, OK, and the Brazilian Steak House. That place was terrible(my opinion) and does not stack up to those "real" Brazilian places in most of your larger cities. Would have liked to try the Japanese place but good luck trying to get in. Reservations: Thank God for Elizabeth, she is great but I do not envy her job. She has to explain to every PO'd guest why they can not eat at the a la carte restaurant. Problem is that they have two seatings and the places are pretty small. This is very frustrating but this happens at most of the AI's that we have been to, just accept it. Not sure how these places get filled up so fast, but they do and you are dead in the water. Rooms: Beds are fine but hard. The TV stinks, but who is there to watch the TV? Full bar, never had to ask for H2O or anything. Leave a few bucks for Room Service and you will never have to ask for towels, aqua or anything. Location: Downtown Playa is a little over a mile away. Easy walk and if you do not want to walk back I heard cabs were $5 US. One other note.....the floors are slippery, and I mean slippery. The tile has a sheen or a polish on it that makes the floors feel like they are always wet. I am being serious, be careful, especially if you have had a few too many drinks and your walking down the hall back to your room. I saw a parent actually pulling their kid along the floor like they were on ice. One last note, special thank you to the folks that really made our stay a lot more fun: Damian, Mika, Rene, Enrique, Islas, Fito, Octavio. We would definitely go back as we were not disappointed. Great place and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but rooms very noisy”
Reviews.Author: cinrph
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with good food and a good pool/beach. If you are a sound sleeper you will love this hotel, but if you can't sleep with a lot of noise then you may want to stay elsewhere or bring a white noise maker with you on your trip. My husband would rate this hotel excellent because he can sleep through anything. The rooms are very nice, but you can hear every conversation or cart coming down the hall. If it weren't for the lack of sleep I had on this trip, I would have given this hotel a 5 star rating. C/R from Arlington, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Peens
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went in late January to the Riu Palace. We stayed in a Twin Room. Put it this way, I have NOTHING bad to say, really. The place was nothing short of spectacular. The staff was friendly and helpful, the lobby, grounds, dining rooms, bar areas were always super clean and inviting. Our room was large and comfortable, had a fully stocked bar, had a nice balcony with chairs, cable TV, phone, safe, even an umbrella, etc, etc. The food, great choices, theme nights, etc, etc, you can't go hungry, believe me! The pool, nice fresh fluffy towels ever morning and plenty, I mean plenty of pool chairs everywhere. The beach, nice, plenty of chairs, but hardly any shade (palms are thinned out due to past hurricanes). Check in and check out was a breeze. Transportation to and from the airport was fine and well organized. Go to Playa (town) at night, it's fun and energetic. Go to Tulum and Cobà, not to be missed! And lastely, say a few words in Spanish, and tip away...it goes a long way!! Would MOST DEFINATELY recommend this hotel. We LOVED it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days at this hotel and it was absolutely first class. It was not the Mexico I remember! Serivce was great, rooms were very nice, pool was incredible and beach was best in area! I walked the beach around this area and it was by far the best beach of any of the hotels in walking distance. By far the nicest of any of the Riu hotels - only open for 2 months! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Food a Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Cavalier9915
Reviews.Content: Food: If a vacation means for you eating better food than you do at home (and you don't only eat McDonald's at home), you will likely be disappointed here. I am puzzled by the reviews that give Dining 5 stars--have these people ever eaten at a 4-star restaurant? If all it takes to make you happy are tons of food in an all-you-can-eat-buffet, then I guess you'll be fine; however, I'd rather have fewer choices, done well. The a la carte restaurants are VERY MEDIOCRE. I admit I'm a bit of a food snob (and a good cook), but if I'm eating at the hotel's pretentious French restaurant (Sir Oliver's), then I expect the food to be at least as good as at my local IHOP. It was not. (Note to tourists: A great chef once said, "People who order a filet mignon well-done get what they deserve.") Beach, Rooms, Service, Hotel Decor: Great, great, great. All the raves about these in other reviews are deserved. Note to other "cosmopolitan" travelers without kids: I'm 33 and my partner is 34. We are college-educated (one a PhD), liberal Democrats from the Northeast. If that makes us elitist or snobs, then you can ignore this post. To be honest, the worst thing about this resort were the other guests. I got sick of being around so many fat, spoiled, rude Americans (and their spoiled kids) who bark at the Mexican staff members (who are themselves working 12-hour days for the equivalent of $5 a day). The hotel clearly asks guests to "dress" for dinner at the restaurants (i.e. no shorts, dinner jacket for men), yet many people came in dirty shorts, sandals, hawaiian shirts, etc.--attacking the food like it was their last meal on earth. At times, it was like eating in the food court at Disney World. If you're looking for a "classy" vacation spot, then look elsewhere (or go to Europe).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpidyOR
Reviews.Content: Hello All, We just returned yesterday from an AMAZING week long stay at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. A little background on us, I am 32 and my girlfriend is 23. I am the President/C.E.O. of a major NYC company and my girlfriend is a designer for a major shoe manufacturer. Our time is precious so when we travel we have enormous expectations. My girlfriend had previously traveled to the Riu Paradise Island and was raved about the experience, so we decided to give the Riu Palace Riviera Maya a shot... and to say the least they hit a grand slam. The rooms were wonderful. King size bed, Jacuzzi Tub, beautiful balcony, full refrigerator of beverages (Corona, Pepsi, H2O, Bacardi, Jose Cuervo, Vodka and Brandy). More than enough to drink!!! The grounds were immaculate. Absolutely impeccable! The fountains were gorgeous, the pool was wonderful and the beach was magnificent! I have heard people complain about the beach, I find those complaints unfounded. We walked down the beach from our hotel past 5 or 6 other resorts... The Food was tremendous... Eat until your heart is content. Breakfast was amazing, omelet station was a staple, freshly made pancakes, my girlfriend loved the yogurt station and the fresh juices, but that stuff is just too healthy for me : ) Lunch was a standard buffet of hamburgers, hotdogs, pizza and salad... noting to write home about, however sufficient. Dinner had a plethora of choices. You have 6 options, (standard buffet, Mexican Restaurant, Steak House, Japanese Restaurant, Brazilian BBQ and the Sir Olivers (Fine Dining experience). We ate in the following in all with the exception of the Japanese Restaurant. I would say they were equally tremendous. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food, especially a fantastic Rib Eye at the Steak House (and this coming from a regular at Sparks, Del Frisco's and Lugars). We decided to go on one excursion and I have to say it was incredible. I have traveled to Cancun twice in the past and did the excursion to Chichen Itza and Xcaret, both were excellent... however I wanted to try something new. We decided to go on a special tour to Coba (Mayan Ruins), the tour incorporated a zip line tour through the jungle also known as canopy tours, repelling 35 feet into a sinkhole landing in a beautiful fresh water well, kayaking through a river, eating lunch in a Mayan Village and climbing the highest pyramid in the Yucatan. This trip was money so well spent, I strongly suggest you try this if you are up for fun and adventure!!! Good for men, women and even children. The Spa services were excellent. We did a 50 min and an 80 min couples massage on the beach and was both left with major smiles on our faces and no tension in our bodies. I could use one right now!!! Here are a few tips that I picked up along the way. 1. The trip from the airport takes about 45 minutes. The cost of a taxi is approx. $62 dollars US. There is a line for the taxi stand, however if you tip the guy on line $5 dollars, you can skip the line! 2. If you want to sit at the pool, you will have to get there early!!! There are plenty of seats at the beach, however I am convinced people wake up at 6am, go to the pool, put there towel on a chair and go back to bed... if you get to the pool at 9am, you are fresh out of luck for a chair... and you are dreaming if you think you are going to get 2 or more together! : ) This maybe the only negative thing I have to say about the entire experience. 3. Bring lots of single dollar bills... tipping the bartender, maid and wait staff always goes a long way. Plus these people are working very hard and it is nice to share your gratitude with others. Trust me, you will receive extra special attention. 4. Request a room with a fountain view... it was breath taking!!! We were on the third floor (top floor) and that was just perfect. I think the 1st floor is fine, however if you can get the second or third floor, the view is well worth the extra cost. 5. Diner reservations are between 12-4pm. You can book for 2 nights at a time. I would suggest you book Sir Oliver (fine dining) ASAP, this is the smallest of the dining rooms and also a meal you don't want to miss on vacation. 6. Make sure you go to the town of Playa Del Carmen. 5th Street in Playa has excellent shopping, from traditional American standards (Diesel, Lactose, Harley Davidson, etc.), and traditional shops with great silver and other local treats. 7. The night life in Playa is great! Go to the Blue Parrot! The bar is on the beach and the music and drinks flow until the wee hours of the morning! Also the Tequila Barrel was a cool drinking spot. Try the Kaluha Daiquiri!!! 8. Request the King Size Bed! 9. If you are lucky enough to get a seat by the pool... the next step is securing a beach umbrella. If you do get an umbrella, I suggest tying it up to your beach chair... people are courteous enough not to take your towel off your seat, however they will take your umbrella if you leave it for an extended period of time. 10. Join a gym near your house before you book.. because you are going to need one when you get home. I think I put on 3-lbs.! LOL I know this message is long winded and I went into great detail here, however the opinions on this site helped me tremendously and I am in debt to the wonderful posters before me, who gave me tremendous insight to the hotel and helped assist me in choosing this spectacular vacation. We came to our decision to go to the Riu by using tripadvisor, deciding this was the vacation we wanted... and I have to say it exceeded our lofty expectations. I just got off the phone with my girlfriend moments ago and we can't wait to book to go again. I give this experience 5 stars and would easily put this up there with stays at the Four Season and Ritz Carlton's of the world for 1/3 the cost. I was completely impressed and overly satisfied. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved the RIU! Amazing vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tkme2thebeach
Reviews.Content: Amazing time! A little background on our group- 12 people, ranging in age from 13-50's…extended family of both couples, singles, and a teenager, many of us live in NYC, the rest in NJ. This was our first trip to a RIU, stayed for 10 days-and we ALL had a fantastic time! We are a well travelled group, but haven't visited many all inclusive resorts (though of the ones we have this was the best!) Grounds- The hotel grounds are truly like a palace and they are beautiful & immaculate in every way! The staff all work so hard to ensure everything is perfect, every time we turned around we saw someone cleaning or scrubbing something, always with a smile and an "Hola!" as we passed. From the moment we stepped into the gorgeous lobby & were greeted with a welcome drink they treated us like special guests and accommodated every request we had, including adjoining rooms etc. Rooms- The rooms were big and spacious, everyone with a balcony, fully stocked mini fridge & liquor dispenser (with Bacardi, Cuervo, Vodka & Brandy), and a spa tub. Some of our group had standard views (overlooking outside the hotel onto other resorts) and some had fountain views which were very nice views, but not worth the $$ if you ask me. The rooms are identical except for the view from the balcony, and there is so much going on at any time of the day/night, that we were never in our rooms except to sleep! I recommend higher rooms than the ground floor (only bc the views are better). The maids left new towel animals everyday- and came around again each night to ensure you had fresh towels and a stocked fridge. The "Animacion Staff" (Entertainment team) was awesome! They ran all kinds of activities every day and night perfect for all ages, from Merengue lessons at the pool, to water aerobics, water & beach volleyball, Bingo, horseshoes, rifle shooting tournaments, soccer on the beach, beach parties with dancing & sangria during the day, face painting & musical chairs for kids, Spanish lessons, different shows every night, evening dancing with the guests in the plaza, coordinating group bar trips to the town bars at night, and so much more. They try their best to have activities for everyone and to have everyone join in… they really are an amazing group of people, they were so full of energy and so nice, I don't know how they do it but sure glad that they do! Hola Octavio, Mildred, Miguel, Josie, & Adriana!! Each late night after they got off work you could also find them in town at any of the local bars- we made some great friends in them! They are also huge sources of information for excursions, shopping, and life outside the resorts. Pool- HUGE! Love the built in tables near the bar, and the built in lounge chairs! So pretty and just steps from the beach… YES the towel game is definitely played here, but it's been played at every resort I've ever been to so this is no exception- just be ready to play. Even if you got down to the pool late & no loungers were available, the staff was happy to pull extra loungers up from the beach area for you. It was really only an issue when the resort was at capacity (only part of the time we were there). They make strong great drinks at "Daiquiris" (the swim up pool bar) and they are fun bartenders, happy to make you anything you ask for- and they are not at all stingy with using top shelf liquors or making your drinks strong- and they keep the rounds coming as long as your ready! The also have waitress service at the loungers and in pool tables which was a nice touch! Beach- it's great, beautiful, lots of lounge chairs, palm trees, hammocks, it was wonderful. I don't know WHY people on this board could have one complaint about the area- the retaining wall is no big deal, it just ensures that the RPRM has a private beach area, and the white fence was pretty and a nice touch…. We all liked it and we grew up on the beaches in NJ and have travelled to many all over the country/world so we are no beach novices. The water is a gorgeous clear blue, so clean, and warm! They had catamarans, kayaks, parasailing, banana boats, jet skis, snorkelling, scuba trips, paddle boats, etc. all that you could use on the beach. The motorized sports were an additional fee but everything else was included, and they allow you a lot of freedom with the water toys- we kayaked down passed all of the resorts in the area to open beach (quite a ways from our hotel) and no one tried to have us stay closer. Food- Great! As I said some of us live in NYC and dine at all types of restaurants and enjoy going out for a good meal- everyone had an easy time finding things they liked. The breakfast buffet was grand and included anything you wanted (stops serving at 1030am). Lunch at Chili's was also good- mix of hot and cold buffet foods, lots of variety every day. Everything from Pizza to Sandwiches, Burgers, fries, Salads, fruits, fajitas, even calamari were available- and the BEST ice cream ever. Seriously I don't know what they put in it but it was amazing. Dinner- specialty restaurants were great!!! Even picky eaters in my family enjoyed the food, particularly the Japanese and Sir Olivers Gourmet, though they were all good! They took reservations in the lobby from 12-4 for the restaurants (best to book at least a day ahead of time to ensure you get what you want!) but they were able to accommodate our party of 12 so we could try each restaurant on the property. No one got sick from eating anything, though they recommend using bottled water to brush your teeth, everything else is purified (ice in drinks, salads, etc all perfectly fine!) Nightlife- we are late diners, and enjoy staying up late for drinks/dancing. Each night we had dinner around 9 and then headed out to "La Plaza" to catch the end of the show and enjoy the live music playing from the gazebo. They also brought vendors in on 3 nights that were were there to sell jewelry and souveniers in the plaza at night- nice touch but compared to town they were expensive. They have waiter service at all the tables (with the sweetest servers!) and the Animacion staff came out each night to dance & chat with the guests. Last call is midnight when the music stops, but they never pushed you out if you wanted to enjoy sitting in the plaza while you finished your drinks or just relaxed (they'd also give you a bottle of wine if you wanted to stay & enjoy or take it up to your room). Lots of nights we were still ready to party so we headed into town (a $5 USD cab fare) or a walk of about 10-15 minutes and went to places like Blue Parrot, Mambo Café, Santanera, Bali, etc. All of 5th avenue is full of lounges, bars, etc. that have nightlife going till 4am and are a lot of fun!! A great mix of tourists and locals alike and not expensive (example Blue Parrot charges a $10USD cover but that includes 2 beers!) and drinks inside were all reasonable. There was also the club at the Riu Tequila property that we ventured over to, they played great music and we had fun, but it was mainly a young crowd (teenagers) on the dance floor so if you are looking for a lot of nightlife after midnight- take the short trip into town to 5th avenue- where there was NO shortage of partying, dancing, and hanging out and you won't be sorry! Overall a great family friendly resort- our young teenager had no problem making tons of friends, and we always felt that they were supervised well by the staff running the activities. It's definitely not a "singles" scene, but the bars in town definitely were if that’s what you were looking for. There were families and couples there from all over the world, and only speaking "un poco espanol" we had no problems communicating anything, all activities, menus, staff etc. were in a number of languages. It was an amazing vacation and I can't wait to go back as soon as possible. Reading over this review I don't think it can even convey how pleased we were with every aspect of the vacation... it was fantastic- Thank you RIU, we will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palace Riviera Maya the week of April 2-9. This was our first time to an all inclusive resort as well as our first trip to Playa del Carmen. We found the entire experience to be terrific. The Palace Riveira Maya, as expected, was immaculate because it is brand new. Well designed and very beautiful. The food was very good, especially in the restaurants where reservations were required (hint: go early to get your dinner reservations, they fill up quickly). We found the buffets to be very good as well; lots of healthy choices as well as the standard fare. The service was outstanding, particularly at the bars. Kudos to Daniel, Islas and Alfredo for taking care of us! The Beach was VERY nice! Everything around the pool area was conveniently located; the beach was within a short distance to the pool bar, restrooms were close to the pool and the outdoor Grill was very handy for snacks. Overall, a very romantic and charming place. A good value as well. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay with children was excellent, but one complaint”
Reviews.Author: jwrenArkansas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and of course the food was a little different tasting, but good. Our children stayed with us the entire time..they are not the type to venture out with others that they do not know. We had a great time and the pool was beautiful. my only complaint was that at 1:00 one morning my son got sick in the bed!!! We called for clean sheets and the front desk called us back and said they had NONE. That was a pretty sleepless night. other than that experience, we all 4 had a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Most Wonderful Hotel around”
Reviews.Author: dbyanski
Reviews.Content: First off, I would like to address the person that was comparing the food and other amenities to American cuisine. THIS IS NOT AMERICA. It is Mexico. The food is different. You can’t compare Outback and Morton’s to this resort. I have stayed at many hotels and many Riu’s around the world and this one gets first place in my book. Hotel- The design and architecture is for the most part the same as the Riu Palace Mexico. Just updated! It is definitely the nicest hotel in the Playacar area. There was a wow factor from the minute we drove up to it for the first time. We went Parasailing and got to see all of the hotels from a birds-eye view. The hotel stands out among them all. Food- Chilis- Soup and salad were great; service was attentive and most excellent. You are allowed to order as much as you want; you just have to do it before hand, not after you have finished eating and want more. If you feel like you need more, hit the buffet. Buffet- Food was great. One needs to remember what region of the country you are in. The buffet offers many choices each night. They have theme nights. We stayed for a week, and there was something different offered each night. They offered plenty of vegetable dishes, meat dishes and pasta choices every night on the buffet. Everything was very fresh and healthy. We had incredible service at the buffet. They wait on you and ask several times if you need anything else. Nightlife- We visited all of the bars. They have regular bartenders that are eager to make you a special of the night of their choice. Daniel was our favorite bartender. He was in the lobby bar. Beach & Ocean- BEAUTIFUL!!!! There is nothing, I repeat nothing wrong with the beach here. It was a very large area with palm trees and lots of chairs not being utilized. The retaining wall is not a big deal. You have to go down about 7 steps on one end to get to the beach, and on the other end, you just have to walk up a small incline to get back to the chairs. The retaining wall is a big plus in my view; it will save the resort in the event of a rise in the ocean, or a big storm. They must know what they are doing when they engineer these things. If you are into water sports, you will love the beach here. They offer sailing, windsurfing, kayaks, paddleboats, and boogie boards. All of these are Free and a lot of fun. All you have to do is sign a piece of paper saying you will take care of the equipment. Pool- Amazing!!! Very Spacious and offers a swim up bar for your drinking needs. The area in front of the bar has 2 jetted tubs and about 6 lounge style tables and seats to enjoy. Chairs were not a problem during our stay, there was plenty available everywhere. Be sure to wear lots of Sunscreen. The sun is very powerful and you will get burnt FAST! We used 15 and 30 and still managed to get slightly burnt. A thermal mug was a plus if you want to enjoy your day without having to go to the bar all the time to get a drink. The pool waiters/waitresses were very friendly and loved filling up my large Bubba Mug. They also had great memories for what you have been drinking during your visit. I was sure to tip them well. Bring some Washington’s. Rooms- We initially were given a room near the theatre, but asked to move the next day because it was very loud in the room at night. We had traveled all day and wanted to get some sleep the first night, but had a hard time sleeping with the music pumping through the closed door and echoing into the room. We explained our situation to Roberto, a manager at the front desk, and he found us a new room the next day that was closer to the pool and it was very nice. The mattresses are very firm, but they will bring a mattress pad and as many pillows as you would like. They stocked the fridge in the room daily, which was really nice, because we drank a lot of the small waters. Playa Del Carmen - Much more relaxed atmosphere than Cancun. Shopping was easier and friendlier. A lot less pushy than Cancun. Shops are willing to bargain with you. A cab to 5th Ave was a flat fee of $5.00 USD. Each way. Bars and nightlife ends around 12:00 AM. Tequila Barrel was a great bar for adults over 30. They have a live band and a dance floor. I also want to mention that they have 2 computers with free internet available. Most of the other bars we saw were mainly for teens and young 20’s. Ferry to Cozumel-- Cost was about $22.00 USD Round trip per person. Shopping was about the same as PDC. They did seem to have higher prices there, as they cater to the wealthy cruise ships in the area. Transfer to/from Cancun Airport- We hired a private car for $95.00 USD round trip. The driver was waiting for us at the Airport with our last name on a sign. We searched for the best deal and found that ----/cancun was the best deal. Alfredo was our driver and he got us to the Riu in about 40 minutes. He was right on time to pick us up as well. They take paypal as payment, so rest assure your getting a good deal for the private car.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned - EXCEPTIONAL”
Reviews.Author: raysun
Reviews.Content: Just returned Spring Break Apr 6 from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. For those of you who have been reading previous reviews to try to get a perspective of this resort and want to know what to expect, pay NO attention to the negativity. My husband and I have been to Mexico (Riviera Maya) several times with and w/o our children (ages 4 & 9). This has been the best vacation thus far. We plan to return early summer with the kids. Let me give you some honest feedback regarding this resort. You must know, I am 34 years old, my husband 36 - I am probably the most meticulous person one could meet. I do extensive research and can honestly say, after reading several of the reviews, we almost cancelled our trip all together. GLAD we didn't! We tried several times to add our photo's to this site however, were unsuccessful. To give you some comparison - we've stayed at resorts such as the Iberostar Lindo, Del-Mar and the Barcelo -These resorts do not even compare! WEATHER: Called for partly cloudy to cloudy skies each day- HA! Not a cloud in the sky and upper 80s ALL week! HOTEL: Immaculate! For those who said the resort was "stuffy" - hmmmm, not quite sure where that came from. The staff (particularly - bar tender Daniel from the lobby) will go out of their way to please. When we arrived - yes tired, we 'chose' our attitude and it was to be pleasant! Guess what? we received a free up-grade to a fountain view room w/o even asking. They appreciate kindness from us- not arrogance! They work way to hard (for pennies) to have to listen to snippy people. I know, we experienced it while checking in. The women next to me marched right in and was very demanding - I can't imagine she received a free up-grade like we did. How embarrassing (for her). ROOMS: Absolutely no complaints. We didn't feel the need to have maid service everyday - if we needed to exchange our towels we just did it before going down to the pool/beach for the day as the maid staff was already working. I did however, bring my own foam matress pad (which fit nicely in our suitcase) and was glad I did. Oh, ahem... I also brought my own sheets - did I mention that I was meticulous? :) Alchohol dispensers right in the room with premium brands. My husband liked that. POOL: exceptional, perfect temp, never crowded (even during prime time). Chairs? Yes, you may have to get up a little early however, we were down to the pool everyday by 9:00 am and never had trouble getting chairs. Sure, if you want 'prime pool front chairs' then ok, get up at 6 or 7 and head down before breakfast. Not really a huge deal at all. Pool bar was fantastic. Again, staff was eager to please. They had entertainment such as poolside dancing lessons and bingo (late in the day with prizes - HA you may have to dance "sexy" to get a t-shirt - all good fun). Great drinks, you just ask for what you want and they will oblige. BEACH: HUGE! For those who complained of rocks... I have to laugh, those are not rocks - that is called CORAL! The Yuchatan has the second longest coral reef in the world. So don't be surprised to find coral... divers LOVE IT!! Plenty of beach and its getting better every week. We tried each day to figure out where other reviewers have said there is "No Beach". Actually, from the pool area to the shoreline there is a stretch of about 50 yards by 80 yards of nothing but pure white crushed coral and shells- perfect for walking on as it is cool to the touch from the limestone content. The only thing which seperates the Riu from other resorts is a wall which will save the resort's beachfront from further wind erosion- smart move on their part. By far the best all along the strip! Plenty beach chairs too - no need to towel save them! FOOD: I am not a huge fan of the food regardless of the resort however, I did have more of a variety to choose from at this resort compared to the others. They are getting better and better in Mexico to try to compare to our taste. Hamburgers, chicken, pizza, salad, fruit, etc... all good. Chili's restaurant (lunch and dinner) by far the best! I did bring my own syrup for breakfast and used it everday - but they had excellent omelets, hashbrown wedges (YUM!), lots of fruit, and other wonderful items. The buffet was good, always something different. Again, if you like seafood and all that stuff that I couldn't recognize, you will be just fine! Even if you are not a fan of the food, you will be find something to suit your fancy. I brought quite a bit of my own snacks and never even ate them! Entertainment: We tripped up the road a mile or two to Playa Del Carmen/5th Avenue - Plenty to do there. They did have organized shows everynight. Not a huge "party/get drunk" kind of scene - which was fine with us. If you wanted to do that - you could walk two minutes across the street to one of the other Riu's and go to the disco. Too young for us. We did check it out though. We recommend the Tequila Barrel in PDC. More our age. Plenty dancing. KIDS: Perfect for all ages. Small children, they have a kids club - I tried to pay attention as we'll probably bring our kids back and they seem to be very active with the kids. Always doing some sort of structered activity. Even if you choose not to entertain that kind of thing, the pool is an excellent source of entertainment for the kids. Not to mention the beach. Kids seemed to have loved the infinity pool - jumping over the side into the larger pool -my kids would have loved it! Self serve kiddie cocktails and chips and cheese were a hit with the little ones near the pool! TEENAGERS: Goodness, plenty of those at the other Riu's and they can visit those resorts for free (and even w/i walking distance either by beach or street front)! They will love the disco at the Riu Tequila (I think that is the one) right down the road. Great for teens and because the strip is all secured it is perfectly safe for them to walk! This resort is PERFECT for everyone! It sits along a PDC strip all secured within it's own little area with security guards at the "main enterance" you can walk up and down and to all the different resorts and feel secure! We will be going back with the kids!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Riu Palace Riveria Maya on April 5th. The resort is absolutely beautiful. We booked an apple package and as you know you drop people off at their respective resorts all along the gulf. What a thrill to pull up the this resort! My wife and I have vacationed in Cancun and Playa Del Carmen several times and this is by far the most attractive resort in either of these two towns. It is striking! For those of you who have been following this resort's reviews you already know about the debate about the beach. Breath easier. The beach itself is about 200 yards wide. Yes, there is a section which is rocky. that section makes up approximately 50 yards. Walk around it. The actual beach for swimming was quite nice. Yes, there is a retaining wall for about 100 yards but much of the beach goes right to the water. Never an issue. A note on the beach. I love to walk the beach for miles, as many of you do. There has been a good deal of erosion of the beaches and there are places where it is difficult to walk around a home or retaining wall to continue your walk. If you choose to go right or south there is one place in particular which is a bit trecherous (but not impossible). If you want to go left, toward town, it is almost impossible without going into the playacar residental community. I did this one time and no one gave me any trouble. The resort is breathtaking. Our room was unbeleaveably beautiful, and the common areas are stunning. The service was good and the employees always found a way to say hola before you had a chance to. There have been complaints about sound levels. This is an area where there could be some improvement. The halls are tiled with marble and yes at 7:30 every morning you can start to hear the maids carts echo down the hall. I started to wear ear plugs because I sleep so lightly. It never bothered my wife. The food was good, I would not say great. My experience was that the lunch buffet and breakfasts were quite good. The dinner buffet was so so and we found ourselves going into Playa to eat several nights. No big deal. My only real complaint. Yes, it is the "making reservations" at the premium restaraunts. This can only take place between 12:00 and 4:00 PM. So you have to walk back to the resort and get in line for 20 minutes to talk to a rather snooty woman to get your times for the specialty restaurants. I am a doctor and this somehow got caught in my craw. I don't have a problem with signing up for the specialty restaurants, that is how it is done in the all inclusives. It is more the timing and the attitude of the person taking the reservations. Perhaps some tweeking is in order. The specialty restaraunts were only slightly better than the buffet. The exception to this was the French restaraunt "Sir Oliver's". The service and food were quite good. The Mexican and Steakhouse were average at best. Per other reviews, my wife and I tried out the dance club at the Riu Tequila. This club does not open until 11:00. As my wife and I were waiting for the club to open and watching a rather good magician, my wife screamed and pointed to the ground. There was a 4 inch scorpion heading for a table of ladies ten feet from us. I ran to them and informed them that we had a visitor and then stomped on it several times until it was dead. Yes, my wife was pretty freaked. People came around and took pictures of it. Makes you wonder about first floor rooms, does it not? The Riu Tequila is a 4 on a scale of 1-10, with the Place being a 9.5. The club by the way was pretty lame and was mostly 15 and 16 year olds (yes, they were drinking). Just as an aside. My wife and I went to Cozumel for a day of shopping and snorkeling. What a disappointment. The reef is gone folks! The fish are there and the water is just as clear, but the fish have no place to hide due to the coral being destroyed in the hurricane.

Reviews.Title: “nice time”
Reviews.Author: Simonandfamily
Reviews.Content: My wife (47), our son (13) and friend (12) and I (49) stayed Mar 31 - April 6. First, don't pay extra for courtyard views. No privacy. Better to just settle for outside view. Second, get room closer to beach. Its a long haul otherwise. Third, don't worry about the food - its fine and plentiful. The non-buffet restaurants are ok, but you get the same thing at the buffets. Anybody who complains about the food is just too picky, or nuts. There is so much to choose from, and its all decent. Breakfast is the best. Fourth, the help loves tips, so bring ones. Fifth, if you are a serious beach person, this is not the best hotel. Beach is ok, but can't really walk very far, and the water is a bit rough. Might consider Palace Mexico instead if you must have a long beach. But the RM pool is better than Mexico. Sixth, don't stay on the property the whole time. Go to Playa Del Carmen for dinner and shopping. Go to Xcaret. Both are fun. Seventh, don't be an ugly American. I can't tell you how many times I heard people say insensitive things to the locals working at the resort. Some may have been drunk, but no excuse. Be respectful. Eighth, the AIRPORT SUCKS. I hate it every single time I go down to Cancun/Riviera Maya. Long lines, chaos, etc.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and grounds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great family vacation we were there for spring break so kids were in abundance but still the grounds, service, food all top notch. Will try with just the wife at different time of year for a more romantic stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved riu palace riviera maya”
Reviews.Author: tazconni
Reviews.Content: just stayed at riu palace r.m. for one week for spring break. we have three children age 8, 12, 14 and all three had an awesome time. the service is incredible and all workers are eager to help you. The resort is immaculate and they clean all day long. the buffet restaurants are average but a huge variety. the japanese restaurant is by far the best specialty restaurant they have. i would definately avoid the steak house near the beach. Not edible if you are use to eating usda choice meats. The beach is beautiful spent most our time here, the water is incredible the sand is white and soft. the children loved the water sports kayaking was tough some days due to the waves, but loved boogie boarding. They also went parasailing which we went next door for because the resorts people would not allow an adult to go on the boat to watch. the pools are beautiful with a great swim up bar. the problem is people keep there towels over night and wake up early to hog the pool chairs. you have to get up early to sit by the pool. the pool person gets ther by 7 A.M. and the chairs have been taken by then. they should remove all towels if they are there prior to 7 A.M. there is a lot to do with your children during the day and in the evening they put on a great show. we did not use the kids club at all so i can not let you know about that, but who goes on a family vacation and dumps the kids anyways. the town is also worth going to, its adorable and there is a great restaurant on 5th and 6th street called CHICAGO great usda steaks. also to the left of the resort 4 min. walk there is a cute little shopping center. all in all this was a great vacation would def. reccomend this resort. it was are first all inclusive and i would def. go back to riu palace riviera maya

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMexico4
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that I cannot understand at all where some of these reviews are coming from. We're from Canada and went with another couple early March and we have to say that everything was wonderful. Rooms were beautiful (we were upgraded twice!). The food was terrific, pool and beach was beautiful (remember people the beach is Natural) and the staff couldn't do enough for us. They even called our room a couple of times to see if we were happy and if we needed anything! This is not the place if you want to party hardy - but it is very relaxing and very upscale. We had a wonderful time. It is very safe, as you could walk around outside of the resort and feel comfortable with the locals as well as the other tourists. We would definitely go back. If someone has complaints about this resort - I'd say "lighten up" you're not a celebrity!

Reviews.Title: “WOW !! What a place!!!”
Reviews.Author: SueTO61
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the Riu Palace Riviera Maya. We were there for a week from March 18 to the 25th. It was smooth sailing from the moment they checked us in. We arrived at the hotel and were taken to the lovely lobby bar and given a welcome drink. We signed in while being seated. We sat by the window, which overlooked the courtyard and the pool. What an amazing view! I was travelling with my husband and 11 year old daughter. A group of 14 other people were also on our flight. They were all doctors and their families. They thought the hotel was spectacular too! The room: Once we got to our room after 3pm, we were pleasantly surprised. We had a lovely king size bed, small sitting area with a sofa and tv and a hydro massage tub in the bathroom. The balcony faced the Viva Wyndham Azteca next door and was nice and quiet. The maid: We left a tip from day one and the maid service was great! She turned down our bed one night with chocolates on the pillow. Other times she made swans or people out of the towels. A nice touch. The pool: There were 2 pools. One raised pool and the main pool. There were built in loungers on both sides of the main pool. There was a swim up bar in the main pool also.There was a waitress around the pool daily to take your drink order. We are pool people, so this is where we hung out everyday. The beach: There was some damage to the beach after the hurricane, but it is coming back. The beach just beyond the pool is beautiful white sand and private. There are always a lot of chairs to sit on at the beach, so if you get up after 6:30am and don't get a chair at the pool, you won't have a problem at the beach. The beach directly in front by the water is a bit rocky and not great, but when the wind is calm you can walk all the way down the beach to the other Riu hotels. The hotel: The design and architecture is amazing! It is definitely the nicest hotel in the Playacar area. There is a wow factor from the minute you walk into the front lobby. Even nicer than the Riu Palace Mexico. The food: The buffet for breakfast daily had anything that you could possibly want for breakfast. Eggs, bacon, sausages, pancakes and I especially liked the variety they had of yogurt and fresh fruit. If you are into champagne and orange juice, it was served daily.The coffee was also very good! For lunch, we ate at Chili's by the pool. It had typical lunch food such as burgers, fries, pizza, salads and more. For dinner, we usually went to the buffet restaurant as there was a different theme every night. We did enjoy the Mexican A la carte. The shrimp and chicken were great! We ate at the Japanese restaurant as well and my daughter really enjoyed the chicken terriyake. The drinks: The pina coladas and margaritas were great! So was a cold corona after a nice walk to the Playacar shopping mall, which was only a 7 minute walk. The entertainment: They had a mini disco kids show at 8pm each night. Then, the main show was at 10pm. After that, there was the house band which was from Cuba. They played salsa, merengue and more. They were really good. Location: This hotel was in the best location in the Playacar area. You were 5 minutes by cab, which cost only 5.00USD each way. You could walk there in 15minutes. We walked during the day and also at night to Playa del Carmen. A lovely little town with lots of shopping.Don't forget to bargain with the vendors! Overall: We had a wonderful time! I would go back again tomorrow. I have been travelling for over 26 years to the Caribbean, Bahamas, Mexico and Hawaii and this hotel is one of the best hotels that I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 7 days from 3/24 - 3/31. the staff at the RIU I was very impressed. Not counting the Four Seasons at Nevis (which is at a different class), the service here was fantastic. Although I speak Spanish, my wife does not and she did not have any problems communicating with the staff who were friendly and helpful. Bartenders and waiters were attentive and friendly. More importantly, when there were minor problems or requests, the staff was quick to respond. For example, one day the air conditioning was not working well. There was someone to fix the AC within 5 minutes. And then rectified the problem within another 5 minutes. The hotel and the grounds were extremely clean and impeccable. As far as the food, I thought the breakfast buffet and the lunch buffet at Chili's were good and better than I thought it would be. For dinner, I ate at the steakhouse (Fair), Japanese (Fair) and the Mexican (good). The wine was not good but the I loved the Corona on tap that kept flowing. We are in our late thirties and at night there is not much to do. But, the great thing is that you are only minutes away from 5th Ave in Playa. Some good bars and restaraunts there. Make sure you check out a couple especially La Casa de Agua. There are also places to go dancing and stay out until the early morning hours. Daniel, Tito and Fito at the bar in the hotel can fill you in on the hot spots. Minor complaints is that the sand on the beach had too much cement rocks in it. Also, you do need to swim on the right side of the beach because the left side of the beach has too many rocks on it. I also did not like making reservations and standing in line for 10 minutes. The only major complaint was that the gym was woefully inadequate. It had one each of a treadmill, stepper, eliptical and bike. Also it only had four other machines. That was my one big dissappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: adventurer55
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Riu Palace Riviera Maya. My wife and I traveled with my teenage son. The Hotel was great in almost all categories, the room was spacious, well appointed and very clean, housekeeping did a great job during our stay. The minibar staff forgot our room one day of the trip, but it wasn't a big deal. Service everywhere was excellent except the front desk didn't answer the phone when called, best bet is to go see them. Getting a lounger at the pool was a task, you need to go early and put out your towels to get one anywhere close, I saw people headed to the pool with towels as early as 6:00 in the morning. The service at the spa was excellent, my wife and I both had a massage while there and they were some of the best we have had at resorts. The food was okay, not excellent but we could always find something we liked. We ate at the Brazilian and Mexican restaurants and while the food was good at both you still felt like you were in a buffet and presentation was uninspired. They will not take reservations for the table service restaurants on the same day, even though there were always empty tables so make your reservations the day you get there. The beach is better than earlier photos and appears to have repaired itself somewhat from the hurricane. The bottom in the swimming area was clean sand. We got a ground floor room which we normally hate but we had a very nice view of the pool, ocean and courtyard. Overall we would go back again as it was a very nice experience. All the staff except housekeeping can speak some english, so language was not a barrier. For an all inclusive this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place, but had a few dissapointments”
Reviews.Author: MOZ2006
Reviews.Content: The new RIU Palace RM is just as nice as the RIU Palace Mexico that I remembered from staying there 5 years aga. Only, I assume nicer, since it's brand new. Reasons it's excellent: Great Service, Great food and drinks, nice rooms with stocked minibar. View of ocean is spectacular in Playacar. The pools are nicer than what I remember of the RIU Palace Mexico. They have an infinity pool that empties into larger pools and swim up bar area. Really nice! We ate at the buffet all week with the exception of one night, we ate at the Japanese place. The Japanese Restaurant was excellent. I wanted to go to other Ala Carte's, but we didn't because it was hard to schedule, and we were a bit burned and didn't want to dress up too much with our daughter with us, etc. I heard the others were great from people that went. Some dissapointments: I do agree about the eggs and some other food at the buffets that should probably been cooked a bit better, but it's not as bad as the previous post makes it out. I think there is something for everybody at the buffet and the Ala Carte place is great. The beach is nice, but there's no umbrellas and the trees aren't big enough to provide shade. Also, the beach doesn't roll into the ocean as it did at other Playacar hotels - it is held up by a retaining wall since there is some reef on a portion of the beach near the hotel. There is some swimmable beach area, but it's pretty small and not as inviting as the resorts down the road. I see this is the most common complaint with people. The process for scheduling meals in the restaurants was a bit frustrating. You have to meet with a lady in the lobby at least one day prior to going, and she is only there from 12-4. She provides you a booking. I was told the hotel was half occupied, and some of the restaurants were booked full 2 days in advance. There were limited chairs around the pool, and people were a bit rude by claiming their chair for the whole stay by leaving their stuff out on the chair or coming out at 5am to claim chairs for their family. By 10am, it was virtually impossible to find a set of chairs around the pool area. Again, they were 50% occupied according to the front desk, so I could envision fights breaking out at the pool area at 100% occupation! :) I heard lots of people talking about this around us in the morning. The sports bar is cloudy with smoke. You would normally expect it at a bar, but since this is the place to go for Internet access and out-of-schedule eating (snack bar, sandwiches, etc), they really need to put in some serious ventilation or expand it. The rooms were all Smoking (or at least our area was), and the Smoke carried through the hallways and into the room through the AC venting. The RIU Palace is not kid oriented. There are kids there of all ages, but they get extremely bored during the day. We knew this going into it, but was our first major vacation with our daughter, we didn't know how she'd react. The kids club was open from 10-12, and from 3-5. We felt comfortable with our 4 year old hanging out with the guy working the club, since he was a nice enough guy and knew where we were sitting,.. but, because of the varying ages, I think he had trouble catering to 4-6 year olds, when the 7-12 year olds would want to do something more interesting. I know some places have 2 kids clubs, to keep the little ones more interested in playing at the pool, coloring, etc. Where the older kids want to play soccer on the beach or do something more for their age group. Overall, it was a great Resort, and deserves it's excellent ratings, as long as people aren't expecting entertainment for their kids. And, of course, they aren't expecting a 5-star buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: The brand new Riu Palace Riviera Maya was beautifully decorated. Very ornate and spotlessly clean. It is impressive to walk into the lobby. Rooms: comfortable and spacious. Have adaquate storage for all your luggage. Bed- hard. In room safe has a key you have to keep track of. It should be digital. Bathroom- very nice, bathtub and shower. Large vanity. double sinks. Our room was above the theatre, not the place to be if you want any quiet evenings. THe noise in our room was excessive from the shows. Ask for a room away from the theatre. Food- Very good buffet. Service was very good most of the time. Large variety of food to chose from. The buffet food was very tasty and well prepared. Ala carte restaurants- Sir Oliver was outstanding. Highly recommend it. Mexican ala carte and Steakhouse- Limited menu selections is the big downfall. I prefered the buffet over either of these. Pool- big improvement over the Riu Palace Mexico's pool (for comparison) Larger, more child friendly, large infinity pool, sun loungers and tables and chairs built into the water. Beach- NO SHADE. No palapas, palm trees are too immature to provide any shade at all. If you are a "beach person" this is not a good set up. We spent the day at the RPM to use their beach, which is far superior. ($5.00 taxi ride, or 15 minute walk) Front desk-They know what customer service means. Thank you to Hugo for tracking down my husband's lost luggage. He left his carry on in the airport shuttle van, which contained his medicine. Hugo contacted the van driver and had our bag delivered to our room within hours. They made a huge effort to help us and I'm sure they would do it for you too. It is service that makes a difference. The"not so good": Our room key never worked after the maid had been in our room.
