Every day for 5 days we had to have a new set of keys. The key problem should have been corrected, it never was. Ice- hard to come by. The breakfast buffet did not have an ice dispenser. (I wanted ice tea). Note to Riu- Please put an ice dispenser in the breakfast buffet. Every place has it's faults, but the Riu Palace RM is an excellent choice. We have stayed at both Palaces, and I prefer the new one. I would certainly stay here again and recommend it. A little about us- middle age couple, travel frequently, usually stay in 4-5 star places. Like good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect resort in Riviera Maya”
Reviews.Author: furmanchikIL
Reviews.Content: The four of us stayed at Riu Palace for a week, just got back, and had had the time of our lives. We all had been to different resorts nice in Mexico before; however, This Riu, is by far, the BEST ever place we stayed at, this was the most perfect vacation. Everything was wounderful. The service was perfect, the rooms were beautiful, clean, fresh, dry, spacious with awesome bathrooms. The food and drinks were outstanding, except for the steak house (it was so-so), but overall great food. Beautiful sandy beach, one little problem no tents, and the palm trees are not wide enough yet to give enough shade; however, withe nough sun block it was still great. Wounderful pool, activities, entertainment ... Overall, the best place you can even spend your 1 week vacation at. We all want to go back there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if.....”
Reviews.Author: JHLAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Ok so I've been reading reviews off tripadvisor for a long time and I think the major flaw is that it's hard to get a perspective on who the people are that are writing the article and if you share some common ground on what's important and what you consider to be good, bad, etc. I've seen far more positive reviews on this resort then negative and I wish I would have listened to the negative. So let me tell you about who we are. I was traveling with my wife, we're 32 and 31 years old looking for a nice laid back escape. We're both professionals earning over six figures and typically go on a nice vacation twice a year. We stayed at the Fairmont in Maui and the Grand Hyatt in Kauai last summer. That was the most expensive trip either of us has ever taken. Usually we go to nice 4 star resorts. Westins or others in that class. The places we eat at home are what I would call fairly average. Good but not 5 star. You'll find us eating at places like Outback, Houstons, On The Boarder, and Maggianos to name a few of our favorites. Nothing too fancy. Once maybe twice a month tops we'll eat at a 5 star restaurant. For the sake of this article (places that people from all cities will know) I'll use Ruths Chris or a Mortons as an example. We like good food but it doesn't have to been high end. We love Mellow Mushroom (the local pizza join around the corner). So here's my review of the resort. I'll preface this by saying we were there less then 24 hours as we were extremely unhappy. Grounds: The resort itself is nice. The lobby was made to impress. Once the landscaping grows in the resort should look even better. Pool: Seemed really great! Beach: What beach? It was pathetic! If you like the beach don't go here. If you're fine by the pool it won't matter. Rooms: Rooms looked very nice too. I will say this. It was obvious to me that the idea is to make the resort look fancy and expensive as possible but the materials used were for the most part fake. For instance you walk into your room and you're wow'd cause it looks like wall to wall marble and wood but when you look closer it's all fake. I call this the supermodel effect. Dress it up to appear it's something it's not. All in all this didn't really bother me I just thought it was funny as we didn't really expect 5 star luxury. Here's where the first problem came in. The beds are PATHETIC!!! I've stayed at Best Westerns with better beds. The mattress was extremely hard which ok, I understand that some people like hard mattresses but it didn't even feel like a mattress. It was very very very weird to me. The sheets were like sleeping on sandpaper covered by more sandpaper. I got two hours sleep tops and my wife got less then that. Food: Like I said above we like food. And it doesn't have to be 5 star. I'd call Outback 3 to 3 1/2 star and it's one of our favorite places. We had breakfast lunch and dinner at this resort and all of the meals were terrible!!!!! I take that back, breakfast was so so. It's pretty hard to F up an egg. My original thought was as long as we can get a good dinner we'll be ok. This was not the case. People HEAR THIS WARNING!!!!!! If you think you're going to get average to good food you're wrong. Not to be rude or disrespectful to others but anyone who posted on this site and said the food was good has no clue what a decent meal is. If we call Outback a 3.5 star restaurant for the sake of example I'd have to call Sir Olivers the "gourmet restaurant" (all the staff members said it was the best at the resort) a 2 star at best. People, it's like eating is something you do in order to survive not because you enjoy it. Covering everything in butter in order to make it taste better is not what I call cooking. THE FOOD WAS HORRIBLE!!!! Let me add this...my wife doesn't even eat meat, fish, or chicken. She's a vegetarian. She hated everything she had. We're talking vegetables here people. They can't even cook veggies well here. Overall: I would never go back and would never recommend to any of my friends or family. Like I said we checked out after a day. Bottom line is when I'm on vacation I want to feel sad when it's time to have to leave. I was ready to leave after one day! It's sad because they did a nice job with the resort itself. It's a nice looking place and the people working there all seemed very nice and attentive. One other note. We paid $370ish a night for the two of us and I understand that this was 50% off the regular rate. I felt it wasn't worth the price but if I had paid double I would have been going crazy! Don't stay here if..... you care at all about what you eat.

Reviews.Title: “Not one complaint.....”
Reviews.Author: NONNIENy
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th 'all-inclusive' resort we have stayed in Mexico and I must admit it is absolutely beautiful. There are different things at each one that have make each one unique and if we could put them all together as one 'mega-resort' it still would not please each and every personality. I would have trouble saying or reviewing anything different than has already been said, however, if you have plans to stay there.......you will not regret your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: doverbay
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, nice pool and work out facilities, kids had a blast, rooms were excellent and staff very friendly. The food was good for hotel food but not gourmet by any means. This is our 3rd trip to Mexico (all have been at very nice all inclusive resorts) and this property was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KG47
Reviews.Content: Spent a week (3/6-3/13) at the new Riu Palace Riviera Maya and have read all the reviews to date. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is beautiful, the people friendly and eager to help, service is prompt, check in is a breeze, check out even easier. The place is clean enough to see your reflection in the floor. The buffet was spectacular, breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Ala Cartes were also good, we preferred the Brazilian, but opted for the buffet at least twice for dinner. The bars had top shelf liquors and very friendly and accomodating bar tenders. Mini bar and fridge always stocked. The controversy about the beach surprises me. There is plenty of beach and the area behind the retaining wall is huge and the palm trees provide some shade. That will get better. I do see that they need to come up with a way to have more loungers around the pool as those who chose to sleep late did not get loungers and complained ad nauseum. This was complicated by days of strong wind which meant many people avoided the beach and wanted to be around the pool. The hotel is exquisite, chandeliers, carpets and art all from Spain. A most enjoyable trip and we will be back. Milw. Wi

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Will NEVER go back!”
Reviews.Author: JessandScotty
Reviews.Content: Okay, First let me give a little insight on who we are. We are 26 and 21 Couple. (Not looking for a party scene, but a romantic vacation with the option of a fun time, if wanted) Not traveled much. But Tons of research. We were here March 8-15 2006. The Resort: The hotel is gorgeous, marble and granite everywhere. Exquisite chandeliers as you enter the lobby, red velvet chairs, top dollar decorations can be seen at every angle. The exterior is the same, very fancy, granite outside, nice patio sets and fountains everywhere (all of which could not be ran while we were there due to it being too windy.) Check In: Was a breeze, no problems at all. Although the front desk was not at all informative, I knew more from reading this site, than from information given to us. We were brought a pretty orange non-alcoholic welcome drink. Appreciated after 15 hours of travel. The Room: We were first given a “run of the house room” which means the crappiest they have available, and it was. (Room 1017) Our room was looking at the Viva Azteca’s Air conditioning system, and it was SOO loud. You could hear it even with the door closed. We called front desk to ask to be moved as we did not pay good money to be stuck in this type of room, and they said sorry, no. So we went 2 days, then went to the front desk , and made a serious complaint and were pressured to buy a more expensive room, after much rejection on our part, they gave us a room on the 3rd floor with an enclosed balcony (no view thru it, it is made of concrete) but it was facing inward towards the courtyard, so we were pleased. (room 3074) Pool: The pools are very nice, one is a very large pool, with built in sun loungers on both ends, the other is an infinity pool, set above the main pool. Water is WAY too cold… wow! The ocean water is SO much warmer. The last 3 days we were there, it was a bit warmer with absolutely no breeze, and the water felt ok then. (I know this is not just a personal opinion, as NO ONE was is the pool the first 3 days, Not even one person) The Pool Loungers: This is one of the most ridiculous parts of this resort, but we were prepared for it ahead of time. You are given towel cards, and trade them in when needed. Everyone uses their towels to SAVE the pool loungers. EVERY SINGLE lounger is reserved by 8:00 AM at the latest, umbrella or not. I actually stumbled out of bed one day at 6:30AM to try to get a better chair for the day, and 70% of them were already reserved. Unbelievable We knew this, and woke up early every day and were fine, but many that did not, were VERY angry to come to the pool at 9:00 am and see no chair in sight! The Beach: This is a very well discussed topic, so I will not go into it in detail. Yes, the beach at this resort is ridiculous, on the verge of un-usable. No one laid on the beach loungers our first days, as it was so windy sand went everywhere. (not the hotels fault obviously) We played in the water out front a few days, and there are tons of rocks and big things you cannot see all the time in the water. (I fell one day, and hit my head on a rock, producing blood. Again, my fault for being out there, but be careful) The Food: 3 Star at best. The buffets are only so-so. The breakfast buffet: Good in my opinion, my other half HATED it. I had pancakes, hash browns and fruit everyday, so I was happy. But he likes eggs and meat, both of which were not good at all. Lunch Buffet: My boyfriend liked this one, and I did not. He liked the chicken fajitas, but grew sick of them by the 7th day. The hamburgers are still bloody, and DO NOT TRY The hot dog, I’m pre warning you. Same good fresh fruit as breakfast, also a GREAT ice-cream bar, delicious ice cream. Everyday for lunch, I ate French fries, fruit and ice cream. L Dinner Buffet: We only tried it twice and all I can say is No Thank You. Specialty Places: Brazilian: It is all different kinds of meats grilled on skewers. The pork was the only meat done. The turkey and chicken were so undercooked they were still pinky/purple. The Filet of steak was bright red/bluish. (no Joke) Okay for some, not me. Mexican: Good. Not traditional Mexican. My boyfriend ordered the Steak filet, and thought is was good. Ordered it well done and got it about med-well. So order one step above what you like. I got the bean burritos, very good. My boyfriend actually asked if he could also get some of these, they said no, but still good. The Steak House: Good. We both ordered Filet Mignon, well done. His was right, mine cam out, medium at most, I asked them to re-cook it, and they graciously did. Good soup at the buffet in this restaurant too. Only served at this dinner. The Japanese : Neither one of us liked this at all. (but we don’t eat sushi) We were recommended the chicken teriyaki, so we both ordered that. NOT GOOD. But some people that we met while there, did like sushi and liked it, so it is all preference I would say. Overall: Not good food, we ate a lot in town. My boyfriend actually got sick from the food here, which made us decide it was time to start eating in town. The Drinks: Were much worse than we expected. They serve the weakest drinks, and if you ask them to make them stronger they just dump a bunch of liquor on top. They dont really know how to make mixed drinks. They do have top shelf liquors available. But they are a little stingy with the amount. Ok, but you dont need a bid mug, like alot of people say. Trust me. Oh, and they do not serve tequila boom booms at this resort. The Staff: Is excellent. HOLA Alex!! He works as the butler? By the front door, he hailed a cab for us into town quite a few times. And he went out of his way to say hi, every time he saw us. So overall we had a EXCELLENT vacation. We will NOT return to this resort again. Not near as impressed as we thought. This was the consensus of most we talked to. Not even sure if I will try a RIU again. Please feel free to ask me any questions. Jessica

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: Britcan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 nights at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya from March 6th - March 12th and would return tomorrow if we could! Our first impressions: Architecture was amazing from the lobby to the plaza to the pools...one word describes it best "GRAND". To view this 'Palace' go to (--) website as the photo's on this website depict the true visual impression. Check-In: Went very smoothly and we were in our room within a half hour of arriving. We were very pleased that the first room we were assigned was perfect for us (inside room, opposite fountains and plaza, 2nd floor, and could actually see the ocean from our balcony). Luggage came up to our room a few hours later but not a big deal. Food: The Buffet restaurant and all the a la carte restaurants were very good, lots of choice, fresh produce, good cuts of meat. Only disappointment was the desserts they look great but taste of nothing, however there is always ice cream for those with a sweet tooth or the fresh fruit and chocolate fountain. Also, don't forget you can go to any of the other 4 Riu properties (within 10 minutes walk) and eat and drink at their buffet restaurant and bars...we ate and drank at Riu Palace Mexico a few times and it was very good. Bars: Service at all the bars was always A+, very friendly and helpful staff such as Carlos and Laurena. We found the best drinks were made at the Sports Bar from scratch (no pre-made mixes or slushy fountains)...I certainly can recommend the Pina Colada's and husband enjoyed Caesars (bloody marys made with clamato juice) made at the Sports Bar. Corona's always tasted great but we did find that the liquors i.e. Kahlua, Baileys, triple sec, etc. tasted weak or different to what we are used to. Housekeeping: Maid service was excellent. Room was always made up in the mornings usually while we were at breakfast, fresh towels each morning and evening, turn-down service every night with chocolates as well as three different 'towel animals'...what more could you ask for. One complaint from my husband who is a light sleeper...change the housekeeping cart wheels from plastic to rubber, currently the cart sounds like a freight train coming down the tiled hallway early in the mornings! Pools/Beach: Lovely pools and surrounding areas, lots of lounge chairs although scarce at times...we did not mind as we preferred to sunbathe on the beach which must have at least 500 loungers. Drinks service at the pool bar, around the pool and on the beach was excellent...I would recommend you take your own 'sippy cups' then drinks stay nice and cool - have them filled at the pool bar. The beach beyond the iron railing leading to the ocean is very small and rocky in areas...however a few minutes walk away is all the beach you can handle. Entertainment: Live music could be heard in the Plaza in the early evenings followed by live Riu Shows i.e. Grease, Mexican dancers, Michael Jackson, etc. at 10:00 pm each night. Local vendors came in and set-up stalls and were selling jewellery, pottery, local crafts twice while we were there. Location: Perfect central location in Playacar...just 7 minutes walk from the Playacar Shopping Plaza and telephones and a 15 minute walk from Playa Del Carmen. Final Comments: As a travel agent this hotel is definitely top drawer and I will be recommending it to all my clients planning a vacation in this lovely part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: ab0000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the new Riu the 1st week March. The resort has recently opened and all of the facilties are complete and working. We have been to several AI 5 star resorts and this one still has room for improvements. I will not waste time and comment on areas that are already well documented, but will simply highlight certain areas that were important to us. Check-in was a breeze. Overall, the staff was very helpful and always had a smile. The buffets were the best part of the dining experience at this resort(never thought i'd ever say that). The Japanese restaurant was horrible...do not go. The French was ok but the lighting was too bright, so not very romantic. The beach area definitely is less than desirable as noted by several other writers. The lack of shade is a major problem for people who need some relief from the blazing sun. This seems to be the norm for Riu resorts, but I'm sure if the Riu family had to sit in the sun all day long, they would make a change immediately. They should come come up with a system to eliminate lounge hogging. Shouldn't have to get up early just to get a lounge with an umbrella. Although this problem exists at many other resorts, it should not be the norm at a truly 5 star resort. If you like to sleep in, you will have a problem. You will be woken up by carts that echo terribly travelling over the tile floors in the hallways . The same problem with the housekeeping staff that seem to yell to each other in the halls. The housekeeping was spotty, half the time with no turn down service and one day with the room not made up until 5pm. While the resort is beautiful, improvements need to be made to bring it up to a true 5 star resort. Simply having a beautiful structure just isn't enough.

Reviews.Title: “I stayed there the week of March 5-13 - Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: canada_doug
Reviews.Content: Hi, My wife and I stayed there last week. We are 29 and 28 years old. We travel a lot and have stayed at 4 and 5 star resorts all around the world. Before leaving, I was hesitant based on the reviews coming out of Trip Advisor and Riubambu(-) Let me assure everyone that this is first class hotel. We have a fantastic time! Everything was great. As always, no resort ever has a perfect everything, but this came pretty close. Let me summarize... Food: Excellent! There are 5 restaurants. We ate at 4 of them. All except Japanese since we didn't go to Mexico to eat Japanese (we didn't eat Mexican when we were in Japan either). The steak, Sir Olivers and the Brazilian were all excellent. The steak restaurant actually surprised me. We weren't going to go as we questioned the quality of the meat. It was one of the best (and biggest) rib eyes I've ever had. The Mexican restaurant was just ok. The buffets for breakfast, lunch and dinner were all excellent with a wide variety that changed daily. Nice bonus...an ice cream freezer at the buffets with 6 flavours. I made creamsicle floats for lunch (vanilla ice cream and orange soda). Try it. The reservation system has been resolved. It works great. You can reserve for the whole week at once. There is a woman in the lobby bar from 10am until 4pm taking reservations. You can only reserve 2 restaurants per day. Or you can just come back 3 hours later and have your wife reserve the other 2 restaurants like we did later that day. The only suggestion I would have is that you can reserve for any number of people that you like. I would prefer it if you could reserve any number of restaurants, but one person from each room had to be there to reserve it (not one person reserving for 8 people). The bars were also great with tons of choices and premium booze. Service: Very good, going to be excellent soon. Everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Staff at the bars and restaurants were constantly asking for suggestions and wanted to know how they were doing. The supervisors of each place ran a tight ship. I was impressed by how well the service was doing in such a short amount of time. The hotel director and public relations woman were always around, always. They watched everything. Rooms: Great. Stocked mini bar filled every second day. This was fine since they stocked it with about 10 soft drinks and 8 beers. Plus a liquor dispenser with top shelf brands like Cuervo and Bacardi. We had an ocean view room, 1045. The view was great and very close to the beach and pool. Entertainment: They had some pool animation, but not much. We liked this since we hate the noise at the pool all day long like at some other resorts. They played great music at the pool. We took a quick look at some of the shows at night. They were better than most other resorts, but still like a summer camp performance. My wife and I have a running joke that there is always a Michael Jackson impersonator at every resort in Mexico, Central America and the Caribbean. On the last night, guess what? A whole Michael Jackson show! They are going to flip out when they find out he is a pedophile. I guess they haven't gotten that news yet. Activities: Pretty good. We went sailing. I also went scuba diving with them one day. It was a operation. The last few days, there was too much wind for the water sports. They also target shooting every morning with an air rifle. It was pretty fun. Pool: Excellent. Huge with an infinity pool built into it about 6 feet higher. There are loungers built into the pool on either side. At the bar area (shallower) there are whirlpools and booths with tables to hang out at. The towel game is in full effect here. Let it be known that if you are the guy who travels in a group that wakes up at 6 am and reserves every chair at the pool for everyone in your large group, you are going to hell. As the week when one, the chair reserving got worse. My wife went down on the last day at 8am and there were 4 chairs left. The upside was, all you have to do is ask one of the staff and they'll grab a chair from the beach and bring it up for you. There were also a lot of umbrellas at the pool. They had staff that walked around and took drink orders. Nice touch! Beach: This is probably the biggest debate on the boards today. First, there IS shade on the beach. They have a ton of palm trees that are growing in. They each provide shade for at least one person. When it was really sunny, I moved over to another tree (about 10 feet away). They will grow in fully in the next couple of months and will provide a lot of shade. The second issue is the wall. For those of you that don't know, they built a retaining wall about 8 feet high. The beach is on top and then you walk down some steps to the water. Although this was different, it turned out to be great. The beach is private. No one can come up to sell you things. It is also quite large and immaculate. The hurricane moved the water line back up the whole coast. This wall will insure that the RPRM will have a great beach for years to come. We walked along the beach, down to the other Rius and other resorts. Our beach was by far the nicest. Others were now on steep angles or had large sand bags holding them together. There is an area on the north side on the beach to bring a lounger down closer to the water, but there are some rocks in that area (also good, since they are protecting the beach there). Best plans. Hit the beach in the AM. Eat lunch, and then hit the pool after 2 or 3 when the chair hogs clear out and there is plenty of space. Walking on the beach. You can do it when the weather is calm. There is a retaining wall down south a couple of resorts away that you can easily walk around when there is no wind. We did it and we could access all of the others Rius there. When the winds pick up (last couple of days for us) the beach is very windy and water gets rough. We had the same happen 6 years ago when we stayed at Barcelo in the Mayan Riviera as well. Nightlife: There is a night club at another Riu, we didn't go. We did walk to town a few times (10 minutes). It has developed a LOT in the last 6 years. There is a street about 30 blocks long with shopping, restaurants and bars. There is something for everyone. Kids: We don't have any and don't really want to hang out other people's kids on vacation. There were a good number of kids, but they didn't really bother us. The "screaming when jumping in the pool" routine that many kids have to do, was kept to a minimum. Overall, not bad. If you have kids, they'll have fun. Just remember, everyone is on vacation. If you kid is screaming for a half hour and you can't get them to stop, bring them to your room. Don't just ignore them (you know who you are). Excursions: We did the Coba tour with AllTourNative (google it). They have small groups. It was a great day. We also did Xcaret. Fantastic. There is a lot to see. The show at the end of the day was excellent. We visited Xel-Ha last time. The decision is easy to make. If you want to snorkel and see fish, go to Xel-Ha. If you want to see a lot of animals and stay later to see the show, go to Xcaret. That pretty much sums it up. If you have any questions, ask em.

HotelInfo.Name: Riu Palace Riviera Maya
HotelInfo.Address: Av Xaman-Ha Mza 9 y 10 Lote 1 Int. Fracc. Fase II Solidaridad, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
